128.transliteration: wa-yawma yaḥshuruhum jamīʿan yā-maʿshara l-jinni qadi stakthartum mina l-ʾinsi wa-qāla ʾawliyāʾuhum mina l-ʾinsi rabbanā stamtaʿa baʿḍunā bi-baʿḍin wa-balaghnā ʾajalanā lladhī ʾajjalta lanā qāla n-nāru mathwākum khālidīna fīhā ʾillā mā shāʾa llāhu ʾinna rabbaka ḥakīmun ʿalīmun

129.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ نُوَلّي بَعضَ الظّالِمينَ بَعضًا بِما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
129.translation_eng: That is how We make the wrongdoers one another’s friends because of what they used to earn.
129.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika nuwallī baʿḍa ẓ-ẓālimīna baʿḍan bi-mā kānū yaksibūna

130.content: يا مَعشَرَ الجِنِّ وَالإِنسِ أَلَم يَأتِكُم رُسُلٌ مِنكُم يَقُصّونَ عَلَيكُم آياتي وَيُنذِرونَكُم لِقاءَ يَومِكُم هٰذا ۚ قالوا شَهِدنا عَلىٰ أَنفُسِنا ۖ وَغَرَّتهُمُ الحَياةُ الدُّنيا وَشَهِدوا عَلىٰ أَنفُسِهِم أَنَّهُم كانوا كافِرينَ
130.translation_eng: ‘O company of jinn and humans! Did there not come to you apostles from yourselves, recounting to you My signs and warning you of the encounter of this Day?’ They will say, ‘We testify against ourselves.’ The life of this world had deceived them, and they will testify against themselves that they had been faithless.
130.transliteration: yā-maʿshara l-jinni wa-l-ʾinsi ʾa-lam yaʾtikum rusulun minkum yaquṣṣūna ʿalaykum ʾāyātī wa-yundhirūnakum liqāʾa yawmikum hādhā qālū shahidnā ʿalā ʾanfusinā wa-gharrathumu l-ḥayātu d-dunyā wa-shahidū ʿalā ʾanfusihim ʾannahum kānū kāfirīna

131.content: ذٰلِكَ أَن لَم يَكُن رَبُّكَ مُهلِكَ القُرىٰ بِظُلمٍ وَأَهلُها غافِلونَ
131.translation_eng: This is because your Lord would never destroy the towns unjustly while their people were unaware.
131.transliteration: dhālika ʾan lam yakun rabbuka muhlika l-qurā bi-ẓulmin wa-ʾahluhā ghāfilūna

132.content: وَلِكُلٍّ دَرَجاتٌ مِمّا عَمِلوا ۚ وَما رَبُّكَ بِغافِلٍ عَمّا يَعمَلونَ
132.translation_eng: For everyone there are ranks in accordance with what they have done; and your Lord is not oblivious of what they do.
132.transliteration: wa-li-kullin darajātun mimmā ʿamilū wa-mā rabbuka bi-ghāfilin ʿammā yaʿmalūna

133.content: وَرَبُّكَ الغَنِيُّ ذُو الرَّحمَةِ ۚ إِن يَشَأ يُذهِبكُم وَيَستَخلِف مِن بَعدِكُم ما يَشاءُ كَما أَنشَأَكُم مِن ذُرِّيَّةِ قَومٍ آخَرينَ
133.translation_eng: Your Lord is the All-sufficient dispenser of mercy. If He wishes, He will take you away, and make whomever He wishes succeed you, just as He produced you from the descendants of another people.
133.transliteration: wa-rabbuka l-ghaniyyu dhū r-raḥmati ʾin yashaʾ yudhhibkum wa-yastakhlif min baʿdikum mā yashāʾu ka-mā ʾanshaʾakum min dhurriyyati qawmin ʾākharīna

134.content: إِنَّ ما توعَدونَ لَآتٍ ۖ وَما أَنتُم بِمُعجِزينَ
134.translation_eng: Indeed what you are promised will surely come, and you will not be able to thwart it.
134.transliteration: ʾinna mā tūʿadūna la-ʾātin wa-mā ʾantum bi-muʿjizīna

135.content: قُل يا قَومِ اعمَلوا عَلىٰ مَكانَتِكُم إِنّي عامِلٌ ۖ فَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ مَن تَكونُ لَهُ عاقِبَةُ الدّارِ ۗ إِنَّهُ لا يُفلِحُ الظّالِمونَ
135.translation_eng: Say, ‘O my people, Act according to your ability; I too am acting. Soon you will know in whose favour the outcome of that abode will be. Indeed the wrongdoers will not be felicitous.’
135.transliteration: qul yā-qawmi ʿmalū ʿalā makānatikum ʾinnī ʿāmilun fa-sawfa taʿlamūna man takūnu lahū ʿāqibatu d-dāri ʾinnahū lā yufliḥu ẓ-ẓālimūna

136.content: وَجَعَلوا لِلَّهِ مِمّا ذَرَأَ مِنَ الحَرثِ وَالأَنعامِ نَصيبًا فَقالوا هٰذا لِلَّهِ بِزَعمِهِم وَهٰذا لِشُرَكائِنا ۖ فَما كانَ لِشُرَكائِهِم فَلا يَصِلُ إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ وَما كانَ لِلَّهِ فَهُوَ يَصِلُ إِلىٰ شُرَكائِهِم ۗ ساءَ ما يَحكُمونَ
136.translation_eng: They dedicate to Allah out of what He has created of the crops and cattle a portion, and say, ‘This is for Allah,’ so do they maintain, ‘and this is for our partners.’ But what is for their partners does not reach Allah, and what is for Allah reaches their partners. Evil is the judgement that they make.
136.transliteration: wa-jaʿalū li-llāhi mimmā dharaʾa mina l-ḥarthi wa-l-ʾanʿāmi naṣīban fa-qālū hādhā li-llāhi bi-zaʿmihim wa-hādhā li-shurakāʾinā fa-mā kāna li-shurakāʾihim fa-lā yaṣilu ʾilā llāhi wa-mā kāna li-llāhi fa-huwa yaṣilu ʾilā shurakāʾihim sāʾa mā yaḥkumūna

137.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ زَيَّنَ لِكَثيرٍ مِنَ المُشرِكينَ قَتلَ أَولادِهِم شُرَكاؤُهُم لِيُردوهُم وَلِيَلبِسوا عَلَيهِم دينَهُم ۖ وَلَو شاءَ اللَّهُ ما فَعَلوهُ ۖ فَذَرهُم وَما يَفتَرونَ
137.translation_eng: That is how to most of the polytheists is presented as decorous the slaying of their children by those whom they ascribe as partners [to Allah], that they may ruin them and confound their religion for them. Had Allah wished, they would not have done it. So leave them with what they fabricate.
137.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika zayyana li-kathīrin mina l-mushrikīna qatla ʾawlādihim shurakāʾuhum li-yurdūhum wa-li-yalbisū ʿalayhim dīnahum wa-law shāʾa llāhu mā faʿalūhu fa-dharhum wa-mā yaftarūna

138.content: وَقالوا هٰذِهِ أَنعامٌ وَحَرثٌ حِجرٌ لا يَطعَمُها إِلّا مَن نَشاءُ بِزَعمِهِم وَأَنعامٌ حُرِّمَت ظُهورُها وَأَنعامٌ لا يَذكُرونَ اسمَ اللَّهِ عَلَيهَا افتِراءً عَلَيهِ ۚ سَيَجزيهِم بِما كانوا يَفتَرونَ
138.translation_eng: And they say, ‘These cattle and tillage are a taboo: none may eat them except whom we please,’ so they maintain, and there are cattle whose backs are forbidden and cattle over which they do not mention Allah’s Name, fabricating a lie against Him. Soon He will requite them for what they used to fabricate.
138.transliteration: wa-qālū hādhihī ʾanʿāmun wa-ḥarthun ḥijrun lā yaṭʿamuhā ʾillā man nashāʾu bi-zaʿmihim wa-ʾanʿāmun ḥurrimat ẓuhūruhā wa-ʾanʿāmun lā yadhkurūna sma llāhi ʿalayhā ftirāʾan ʿalayhi sa-yajzīhim bi-mā kānū yaftarūna

139.content: وَقالوا ما في بُطونِ هٰذِهِ الأَنعامِ خالِصَةٌ لِذُكورِنا وَمُحَرَّمٌ عَلىٰ أَزواجِنا ۖ وَإِن يَكُن مَيتَةً فَهُم فيهِ شُرَكاءُ ۚ سَيَجزيهِم وَصفَهُم ۚ إِنَّهُ حَكيمٌ عَليمٌ
139.translation_eng: And they say, ‘That which is in the bellies of these cattle is exclusively for our males and forbidden to our wives. But if it be still-born, they will all share it.’ Soon He will requite them for their allegations. Indeed He is all-wise, all-knowing.
139.transliteration: wa-qālū mā fī buṭūni hādhihi l-ʾanʿāmi khāliṣatun li-dhukūrinā wa-muḥarramun ʿalā ʾazwājinā wa-ʾin yakun maytatan fa-hum fīhi shurakāʾu sa-yajzīhim waṣfahum ʾinnahū ḥakīmun ʿalīmun

140.content: قَد خَسِرَ الَّذينَ قَتَلوا أَولادَهُم سَفَهًا بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ وَحَرَّموا ما رَزَقَهُمُ اللَّهُ افتِراءً عَلَى اللَّهِ ۚ قَد ضَلّوا وَما كانوا مُهتَدينَ
140.translation_eng: They are certainly losers who slay their children foolishly without knowledge, and forbid what Allah has provided them, fabricating a lie against Allah. Certainly, they have gone astray and are not guided.
140.transliteration: qad khasira lladhīna qatalū ʾawlādahum safahan bi-ghayri ʿilmin wa-ḥarramū mā razaqahumu llāhu ftirāʾan ʿalā llāhi qad ḍallū wa-mā kānū muhtadīna

141.content: ۞ وَهُوَ الَّذي أَنشَأَ جَنّاتٍ مَعروشاتٍ وَغَيرَ مَعروشاتٍ وَالنَّخلَ وَالزَّرعَ مُختَلِفًا أُكُلُهُ وَالزَّيتونَ وَالرُّمّانَ مُتَشابِهًا وَغَيرَ مُتَشابِهٍ ۚ كُلوا مِن ثَمَرِهِ إِذا أَثمَرَ وَآتوا حَقَّهُ يَومَ حَصادِهِ ۖ وَلا تُسرِفوا ۚ إِنَّهُ لا يُحِبُّ المُسرِفينَ
141.translation_eng: It is He who produces gardens trellised and without trellises, and palm-trees and crops of diverse produce, olives and pomegranates, similar and dissimilar. Eat of its fruits when it fructifies, and give its due on the day of harvest, and do not be wasteful; indeed He does not like the wasteful.
141.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī ʾanshaʾa jannātin maʿrūshātin wa-ghayra maʿrūshātin wa-n-nakhla wa-z-zarʿa mukhtalifan ʾukuluhū wa-z-zaytūna wa-r-rummāna mutashābihan wa-ghayra mutashābihin kulū min thamarihī ʾidhā ʾathmara wa-ʾātū ḥaqqahū yawma ḥaṣādihī wa-lā tusrifū ʾinnahū lā yuḥibbu l-musrifīna

142.content: وَمِنَ الأَنعامِ حَمولَةً وَفَرشًا ۚ كُلوا مِمّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ وَلا تَتَّبِعوا خُطُواتِ الشَّيطانِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لَكُم عَدُوٌّ مُبينٌ
142.translation_eng: Of the cattle [some] are for burden and [some] for slaughter. Eat of what Allah has provided you and do not follow in Satan’s footsteps; he is indeed your manifest enemy.
142.transliteration: wa-mina l-ʾanʿāmi ḥamūlatan wa-farshan kulū mimmā razaqakumu llāhu wa-lā tattabiʿū khuṭuwāti sh-shayṭāni ʾinnahū lakum ʿaduwwun mubīnun

143.content: ثَمانِيَةَ أَزواجٍ ۖ مِنَ الضَّأنِ اثنَينِ وَمِنَ المَعزِ اثنَينِ ۗ قُل آلذَّكَرَينِ حَرَّمَ أَمِ الأُنثَيَينِ أَمَّا اشتَمَلَت عَلَيهِ أَرحامُ الأُنثَيَينِ ۖ نَبِّئوني بِعِلمٍ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
143.translation_eng: Eight mates:1 two of sheep, and two of goats. Say, ‘Is it the two males that He has forbidden or the two females, or what is contained in the wombs of the two females? Inform me with knowledge, should you be truthful.’Cf. 39:6.
143.transliteration: thamāniyata ʾazwājin mina ḍ-ḍaʾni thnayni wa-mina l-maʿzi thnayni qul ʾādh-dhakarayni ḥarrama ʾami l-ʾunthayayni ʾammā shtamalat ʿalayhi ʾarḥāmu l-ʾunthayayni nabbiʾūnī bi-ʿilmin ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

144.content: وَمِنَ الإِبِلِ اثنَينِ وَمِنَ البَقَرِ اثنَينِ ۗ قُل آلذَّكَرَينِ حَرَّمَ أَمِ الأُنثَيَينِ أَمَّا اشتَمَلَت عَلَيهِ أَرحامُ الأُنثَيَينِ ۖ أَم كُنتُم شُهَداءَ إِذ وَصّاكُمُ اللَّهُ بِهٰذا ۚ فَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّنِ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا لِيُضِلَّ النّاسَ بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدِي القَومَ الظّالِمينَ
144.translation_eng: And two of camels and two of oxen. Say, ‘Is it the two males that He has forbidden or the two females, or what is contained in the wombs of the two females? Were you witnesses when Allah enjoined this upon you?’ So who is a greater wrongdoer than him who fabricates a lie against Allah to mislead the people without any knowledge? Indeed Allah does not guide the wrongdoing lot.
144.transliteration: wa-mina l-ʾibili thnayni wa-mina l-baqari thnayni qul ʾādh-dhakarayni ḥarrama ʾami l-ʾunthayayni ʾammā shtamalat ʿalayhi ʾarḥāmu l-ʾunthayayni ʾam kuntum shuhadāʾa ʾidh waṣṣākumu llāhu bi-hādhā fa-man ʾaẓlamu mimmani ftarā ʿalā llāhi kadhiban li-yuḍilla n-nāsa bi-ghayri ʿilmin ʾinna llāha lā yahdī l-qawma ẓ-ẓālimīna

145.content: قُل لا أَجِدُ في ما أوحِيَ إِلَيَّ مُحَرَّمًا عَلىٰ طاعِمٍ يَطعَمُهُ إِلّا أَن يَكونَ مَيتَةً أَو دَمًا مَسفوحًا أَو لَحمَ خِنزيرٍ فَإِنَّهُ رِجسٌ أَو فِسقًا أُهِلَّ لِغَيرِ اللَّهِ بِهِ ۚ فَمَنِ اضطُرَّ غَيرَ باغٍ وَلا عادٍ فَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
145.translation_eng: Say, ‘I do not find in what has been revealed to me that anyone be forbidden to eat anything except carrion or spilt blood, or the flesh of swine —for that is indeed unclean— or an impiety offered to other than Allah.’ But should someone be compelled, without being rebellious or aggressive, indeed your Lord is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
145.transliteration: qul lā ʾajidu fī mā ʾūḥiya ʾilayya muḥarraman ʿalā ṭāʿimin yaṭʿamuhū ʾillā ʾan yakūna maytatan ʾaw daman masfūḥan ʾaw laḥma khinzīrin fa-ʾinnahū rijsun ʾaw fisqan ʾuhilla li-ghayri llāhi bihī fa-mani ḍṭurra ghayra bāghin wa-lā ʿādin fa-ʾinna rabbaka ghafūrun raḥīmun

146.content: وَعَلَى الَّذينَ هادوا حَرَّمنا كُلَّ ذي ظُفُرٍ ۖ وَمِنَ البَقَرِ وَالغَنَمِ حَرَّمنا عَلَيهِم شُحومَهُما إِلّا ما حَمَلَت ظُهورُهُما أَوِ الحَوايا أَو مَا اختَلَطَ بِعَظمٍ ۚ ذٰلِكَ جَزَيناهُم بِبَغيِهِم ۖ وَإِنّا لَصادِقونَ
146.translation_eng: To the Jews We forbade every animal having an undivided hoof, and of oxen and sheep We forbade them their fat, except what is borne by their backs or the entrails or what is attached to the bones. We requited them with that for their rebelliousness, and We indeed speak the truth.
146.transliteration: wa-ʿalā lladhīna hādū ḥarramnā kulla dhī ẓufurin wa-mina l-baqari wa-l-ghanami ḥarramnā ʿalayhim shuḥūmahumā ʾillā mā ḥamalat ẓuhūruhumā ʾawi l-ḥawāyā ʾaw mā khtalaṭa bi-ʿaẓmin dhālika jazaynāhum bi-baghyihim wa-ʾinnā la-ṣādiqūna

147.content: فَإِن كَذَّبوكَ فَقُل رَبُّكُم ذو رَحمَةٍ واسِعَةٍ وَلا يُرَدُّ بَأسُهُ عَنِ القَومِ المُجرِمينَ
147.translation_eng: But if they deny you, say, ‘Your Lord is dispenser of an all-embracing mercy, but His punishment will not be averted from the guilty lot.’
147.transliteration: fa-ʾin kadhdhabūka fa-qul rabbukum dhū raḥmatin wāsiʿatin wa-lā yuraddu baʾsuhū ʿani l-qawmi l-mujrimīna

148.content: سَيَقولُ الَّذينَ أَشرَكوا لَو شاءَ اللَّهُ ما أَشرَكنا وَلا آباؤُنا وَلا حَرَّمنا مِن شَيءٍ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ كَذَّبَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم حَتّىٰ ذاقوا بَأسَنا ۗ قُل هَل عِندَكُم مِن عِلمٍ فَتُخرِجوهُ لَنا ۖ إِن تَتَّبِعونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَإِن أَنتُم إِلّا تَخرُصونَ
148.translation_eng: The polytheists will say, ‘Had Allah wished we would not have ascribed any partner [to Him], nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything.’ Those who were before them had denied1 likewise until they tasted Our punishment. Say, ‘Do you have any [revealed] knowledge that you can produce before us? You follow nothing but conjectures, and you do nothing but surmise.’Or ‘those who were before them had lied likewise,’ in accordance with an alternate reading. (see al-Zamakhsharī, al-Rāzī, and al-Ṭabrisī)
148.transliteration: sa-yaqūlu lladhīna ʾashrakū law shāʾa llāhu mā ʾashraknā wa-lā ʾābāʾunā wa-lā ḥarramnā min shayʾin ka-dhālika kadhdhaba lladhīna min qablihim ḥattā dhāqū baʾsanā qul hal ʿindakum min ʿilmin fa-tukhrijūhu lanā ʾin tattabiʿūna ʾillā ẓ-ẓanna wa-ʾin ʾantum ʾillā takhruṣūna

149.content: قُل فَلِلَّهِ الحُجَّةُ البالِغَةُ ۖ فَلَو شاءَ لَهَداكُم أَجمَعينَ
149.translation_eng: Say, ‘To Allah belongs the conclusive argument. Had He wished, He would have surely guided you all.’
149.transliteration: qul fa-li-llāhi l-ḥujjatu l-bālighatu fa-law shāʾa la-hadākum ʾajmaʿīna

150.content: قُل هَلُمَّ شُهَداءَكُمُ الَّذينَ يَشهَدونَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ حَرَّمَ هٰذا ۖ فَإِن شَهِدوا فَلا تَشهَد مَعَهُم ۚ وَلا تَتَّبِع أَهواءَ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا وَالَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالآخِرَةِ وَهُم بِرَبِّهِم يَعدِلونَ
150.translation_eng: Say, ‘Bring your witnesses who may testify that Allah has forbidden this.’ So if they testify, do not testify with them, and do not follow the desires of those who deny Our signs, and those who do not believe in the Hereafter and equate [others] with their Lord.
150.transliteration: qul halumma shuhadāʾakumu lladhīna yashhadūna ʾanna llāha ḥarrama hādhā fa-ʾin shahidū fa-lā tashhad maʿahum wa-lā tattabiʿ ʾahwāʾa lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā wa-lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-l-ʾākhirati wa-hum bi-rabbihim yaʿdilūna

151.content: ۞ قُل تَعالَوا أَتلُ ما حَرَّمَ رَبُّكُم عَلَيكُم ۖ أَلّا تُشرِكوا بِهِ شَيئًا ۖ وَبِالوالِدَينِ إِحسانًا ۖ وَلا تَقتُلوا أَولادَكُم مِن إِملاقٍ ۖ نَحنُ نَرزُقُكُم وَإِيّاهُم ۖ وَلا تَقرَبُوا الفَواحِشَ ما ظَهَرَ مِنها وَما بَطَنَ ۖ وَلا تَقتُلُوا النَّفسَ الَّتي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلّا بِالحَقِّ ۚ ذٰلِكُم وَصّاكُم بِهِ لَعَلَّكُم تَعقِلونَ
151.translation_eng: Say, ‘Come, I will recount what your Lord has forbidden you from. That you shall not ascribe any partners to Him, and you shall be good to the parents, you shall not kill your children due to penury —We will provide for you and for them— you shall not approach indecencies, the outward among them and the inward ones, and you shall not kill a soul [whose life] Allah has made inviolable, except with due cause. This is what He has enjoined upon you so that you may apply reason.
151.transliteration: qul taʿālaw ʾatlu mā ḥarrama rabbukum ʿalaykum ʾallā tushrikū bihī shayʾan wa-bi-l-wālidayni ʾiḥsānan wa-lā taqtulū ʾawlādakum min ʾimlāqin naḥnu narzuqukum wa-ʾiyyāhum wa-lā taqrabū l-fawāḥisha mā ẓahara minhā wa-mā baṭana wa-lā taqtulū n-nafsa llatī ḥarrama llāhu ʾillā bi-l-ḥaqqi dhālikum waṣṣākum bihī laʿallakum taʿqilūna

152.content: وَلا تَقرَبوا مالَ اليَتيمِ إِلّا بِالَّتي هِيَ أَحسَنُ حَتّىٰ يَبلُغَ أَشُدَّهُ ۖ وَأَوفُوا الكَيلَ وَالميزانَ بِالقِسطِ ۖ لا نُكَلِّفُ نَفسًا إِلّا وُسعَها ۖ وَإِذا قُلتُم فَاعدِلوا وَلَو كانَ ذا قُربىٰ ۖ وَبِعَهدِ اللَّهِ أَوفوا ۚ ذٰلِكُم وَصّاكُم بِهِ لَعَلَّكُم تَذَكَّرونَ
152.translation_eng: Do not approach the orphan’s property, except in the best [possible] manner, until he comes of age. And observe fully the measure and the balance1 with justice.’ We task no soul except according to its capacity. ‘And when you speak, be fair, even if it were a relative; and fulfill Allah’s covenant. This is what He enjoins upon you so that you may take admonition.’That is, weights and measures.
152.transliteration: wa-lā taqrabū māla l-yatīmi ʾillā bi-llatī hiya ʾaḥsanu ḥattā yablugha ʾashuddahū wa-ʾawfū l-kayla wa-l-mīzāna bi-l-qisṭi lā nukallifu nafsan ʾillā wusʿahā wa-ʾidhā qultum fa-ʿdilū wa-law kāna dhā qurbā wa-bi-ʿahdi llāhi ʾawfū dhālikum waṣṣākum bihī laʿallakum tadhakkarūna

153.content: وَأَنَّ هٰذا صِراطي مُستَقيمًا فَاتَّبِعوهُ ۖ وَلا تَتَّبِعُوا السُّبُلَ فَتَفَرَّقَ بِكُم عَن سَبيلِهِ ۚ ذٰلِكُم وَصّاكُم بِهِ لَعَلَّكُم تَتَّقونَ
153.translation_eng: ‘This indeed is my straight path, so follow it, and do not follow [other] ways, for they will separate you from His way. This is what He enjoins upon you so that you may be Godwary.’
153.transliteration: wa-ʾanna hādhā ṣirāṭī mustaqīman fa-ttabiʿūhu wa-lā tattabiʿū s-subula fa-tafarraqa bikum ʿan sabīlihī dhālikum waṣṣākum bihī laʿallakum tattaqūna

154.content: ثُمَّ آتَينا موسَى الكِتابَ تَمامًا عَلَى الَّذي أَحسَنَ وَتَفصيلًا لِكُلِّ شَيءٍ وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةً لَعَلَّهُم بِلِقاءِ رَبِّهِم يُؤمِنونَ
154.translation_eng: Then We gave Moses the Book, completing [Our blessing] on him who is virtuous, and as an elaboration1 of all things, and as a guidance and mercy, so that they may believe in the encounter with their Lord.Or ‘articulation.’
154.transliteration: thumma ʾātaynā mūsā l-kitāba tamāman ʿalā lladhī ʾaḥsana wa-tafṣīlan li-kulli shayʾin wa-hudan wa-raḥmatan laʿallahum bi-liqāʾi rabbihim yuʾminūna

155.content: وَهٰذا كِتابٌ أَنزَلناهُ مُبارَكٌ فَاتَّبِعوهُ وَاتَّقوا لَعَلَّكُم تُرحَمونَ
155.translation_eng: And this Book that We have sent down is a blessed one; so follow it, and be Godwary so that you may receive [His] mercy.
155.transliteration: wa-hādhā kitābun ʾanzalnāhu mubārakun fa-ttabiʿūhu wa-ttaqū laʿallakum turḥamūna

156.content: أَن تَقولوا إِنَّما أُنزِلَ الكِتابُ عَلىٰ طائِفَتَينِ مِن قَبلِنا وَإِن كُنّا عَن دِراسَتِهِم لَغافِلينَ
156.translation_eng: Lest you should say, ‘The Book was sent down only to two communities before us,1 and we were indeed unaware of their studies,’That is, Jews and Christians.
156.transliteration: ʾan taqūlū ʾinnamā ʾunzila l-kitābu ʿalā ṭāʾifatayni min qablinā wa-ʾin kunnā ʿan dirāsatihim la-ghāfilīna

157.content: أَو تَقولوا لَو أَنّا أُنزِلَ عَلَينَا الكِتابُ لَكُنّا أَهدىٰ مِنهُم ۚ فَقَد جاءَكُم بَيِّنَةٌ مِن رَبِّكُم وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةٌ ۚ فَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّن كَذَّبَ بِآياتِ اللَّهِ وَصَدَفَ عَنها ۗ سَنَجزِي الَّذينَ يَصدِفونَ عَن آياتِنا سوءَ العَذابِ بِما كانوا يَصدِفونَ
157.translation_eng: or [lest] you should say, ‘If the Book had been sent down to us, surely we would have been better-guided than them.’ There has already come to you a manifest proof from your Lord and a guidance and mercy. So who is a greater wrongdoer than him who denies the signs of Allah, and turns away from them? Soon We shall requite those who turn away from Our signs with a terrible punishment because of what they used to evade.
157.transliteration: ʾaw taqūlū law ʾannā ʾunzila ʿalaynā l-kitābu la-kunnā ʾahdā minhum fa-qad jāʾakum bayyinatun min rabbikum wa-hudan wa-raḥmatun fa-man ʾaẓlamu mimman kadhdhaba bi-ʾāyāti llāhi wa-ṣadafa ʿanhā sa-najzī lladhīna yaṣdifūna ʿan ʾāyātinā sūʾa l-ʿadhābi bi-mā kānū yaṣdifūna

158.content: هَل يَنظُرونَ إِلّا أَن تَأتِيَهُمُ المَلائِكَةُ أَو يَأتِيَ رَبُّكَ أَو يَأتِيَ بَعضُ آياتِ رَبِّكَ ۗ يَومَ يَأتي بَعضُ آياتِ رَبِّكَ لا يَنفَعُ نَفسًا إيمانُها لَم تَكُن آمَنَت مِن قَبلُ أَو كَسَبَت في إيمانِها خَيرًا ۗ قُلِ انتَظِروا إِنّا مُنتَظِرونَ
158.translation_eng: Do they await anything but that the angels should come to them, or your Lord should come, or some of your Lord’s signs should come? The day when some of your Lord’s signs do come, faith shall not benefit any soul that had not believed beforehand and had not earned some goodness in its faith. Say, ‘Wait! We too are waiting!’
158.transliteration: hal yanẓurūna ʾillā ʾan taʾtiyahumu l-malāʾikatu ʾaw yaʾtiya rabbuka ʾaw yaʾtiya baʿḍu ʾāyāti rabbika yawma yaʾtī baʿḍu ʾāyāti rabbika lā yanfaʿu nafsan ʾīmānuhā lam takun ʾāmanat min qablu ʾaw kasabat fī ʾīmānihā khayran quli ntaẓirū ʾinnā muntaẓirūna

159.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ فَرَّقوا دينَهُم وَكانوا شِيَعًا لَستَ مِنهُم في شَيءٍ ۚ إِنَّما أَمرُهُم إِلَى اللَّهِ ثُمَّ يُنَبِّئُهُم بِما كانوا يَفعَلونَ
159.translation_eng: Indeed those who split up their religion and became sects, you will not have anything to do with them. Their matter rests only with Allah; then He will inform them concerning what they used to do.
159.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna farraqū dīnahum wa-kānū shiyaʿan lasta minhum fī shayʾin ʾinnamā ʾamruhum ʾilā llāhi thumma yunabbiʾuhum bi-mā kānū yafʿalūna

160.content: مَن جاءَ بِالحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُ عَشرُ أَمثالِها ۖ وَمَن جاءَ بِالسَّيِّئَةِ فَلا يُجزىٰ إِلّا مِثلَها وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
160.translation_eng: Whoever brings virtue shall receive ten times its like; but whoever brings vice shall not be requited except with its like, and they will not be wronged.1Cf. 27:89; 28:84.
160.transliteration: man jāʾa bi-l-ḥasanati fa-lahū ʿashru ʾamthālihā wa-man jāʾa bi-s-sayyiʾati fa-lā yujzā ʾillā mithlahā wa-hum lā yuẓlamūna

161.content: قُل إِنَّني هَداني رَبّي إِلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ دينًا قِيَمًا مِلَّةَ إِبراهيمَ حَنيفًا ۚ وَما كانَ مِنَ المُشرِكينَ
161.translation_eng: Say, ‘Indeed my Lord has guided me to a straight path, the upright religion, the creed of Abraham, a ḥanīf, and he was not one of the polytheists.’
161.transliteration: qul ʾinnanī hadānī rabbī ʾilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin dīnan qiyaman millata ʾibrāhīma ḥanīfan wa-mā kāna mina l-mushrikīna

162.content: قُل إِنَّ صَلاتي وَنُسُكي وَمَحيايَ وَمَماتي لِلَّهِ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
162.translation_eng: Say, ‘Indeed my prayer and my worship, my life and my death are for the sake of Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.
162.transliteration: qul ʾinna ṣalātī wa-nusukī wa-maḥyāya wa-mamātī li-llāhi rabbi l-ʿālamīna

163.content: لا شَريكَ لَهُ ۖ وَبِذٰلِكَ أُمِرتُ وَأَنا أَوَّلُ المُسلِمينَ
163.translation_eng: He has no partner, and this [creed] I have been commanded [to follow], and I am the first of those who submit [to Allah].’
163.transliteration: lā sharīka lahū wa-bi-dhālika ʾumirtu wa-ʾana ʾawwalu l-muslimīna

164.content: قُل أَغَيرَ اللَّهِ أَبغي رَبًّا وَهُوَ رَبُّ كُلِّ شَيءٍ ۚ وَلا تَكسِبُ كُلُّ نَفسٍ إِلّا عَلَيها ۚ وَلا تَزِرُ وازِرَةٌ وِزرَ أُخرىٰ ۚ ثُمَّ إِلىٰ رَبِّكُم مَرجِعُكُم فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِما كُنتُم فيهِ تَختَلِفونَ
164.translation_eng: Say, ‘Shall I seek a Lord other than Allah, while He is the Lord of all things?’ No soul does evil except against itself, and no bearer shall bear another’s burden; then to your Lord will be your return, whereat He will inform you concerning that about which you used to differ.
164.transliteration: qul ʾa-ghayra llāhi ʾabghī rabban wa-huwa rabbu kulli shayʾin wa-lā taksibu kullu nafsin ʾillā ʿalayhā wa-lā taziru wāziratun wizra ʾukhrā thumma ʾilā rabbikum marjiʿukum fa-yunabbiʾukum bi-mā kuntum fīhi takhtalifūna

165.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي جَعَلَكُم خَلائِفَ الأَرضِ وَرَفَعَ بَعضَكُم فَوقَ بَعضٍ دَرَجاتٍ لِيَبلُوَكُم في ما آتاكُم ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ سَريعُ العِقابِ وَإِنَّهُ لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
165.translation_eng: It is He who has made you successors on the earth, and raised some of you in rank above others so that He may test you in respect to what He has given you. Indeed your Lord is swift in retribution, and indeed He is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
165.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī jaʿalakum khalāʾifa l-ʾarḍi wa-rafaʿa baʿḍakum fawqa baʿḍin darajātin li-yabluwakum fī mā ʾātākum ʾinna rabbaka sarīʿu l-ʿiqābi wa-ʾinnahū la-ghafūrun raḥīmun

7.description: The surah that depicts the final separation of the believers and unbelievers on the Day of Judgment by an unscalable edifice called The Elevations that veils them from one another; but upon it stand men and women who can see both the people destined for Paradise and those fated for Hell, while their own harrowing verdict remains as yet undeclared by God. It is named after “the Elevations” (al-Aʿrāf) mentioned in verse 46 . The surah begins by addressing the Prophet Muḥammad, reassuring him about his revelations, and closes emphasizing the fact that he merely repeats what is revealed to him. It warns the disbelievers of their fate via numerous stories of disobedient communities of the past, in the hope that they may take heed and repent before it is too late. Both subjects also serve to give encouragement to the Prophet and the believers.The surah is also known as: The Battlements, The Faculty of Discernment, The Heights, The Ramparts, Wall Between Heaven and Hell.

1.translation_eng: Alif, Lām, Mīm, Ṣād.

2.content: كِتابٌ أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ فَلا يَكُن في صَدرِكَ حَرَجٌ مِنهُ لِتُنذِرَ بِهِ وَذِكرىٰ لِلمُؤمِنينَ
2.translation_eng: [This is] a Book that has been sent down to you —so let there be no disquiet in your heart on its account that you may warn thereby— and as an admonition for the faithful.
2.transliteration: kitābun ʾunzila ʾilayka fa-lā yakun fī ṣadrika ḥarajun minhu li-tundhira bihī wa-dhikrā li-l-muʾminīna

3.content: اتَّبِعوا ما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكُم مِن رَبِّكُم وَلا تَتَّبِعوا مِن دونِهِ أَولِياءَ ۗ قَليلًا ما تَذَكَّرونَ
3.translation_eng: Follow what has been sent down to you from your Lord, and do not follow any masters besides Him. Little is the admonition that you take!
3.transliteration: ittabiʿū mā ʾunzila ʾilaykum min rabbikum wa-lā tattabiʿū min dūnihī ʾawliyāʾa qalīlan mā tadhakkarūna

4.content: وَكَم مِن قَريَةٍ أَهلَكناها فَجاءَها بَأسُنا بَياتًا أَو هُم قائِلونَ
4.translation_eng: How many a town We have destroyed! Our punishment came to it at night, or while they were taking a midday nap.
4.transliteration: wa-kam min qaryatin ʾahlaknāhā fa-jāʾahā baʾsunā bayātan ʾaw hum qāʾilūna

5.content: فَما كانَ دَعواهُم إِذ جاءَهُم بَأسُنا إِلّا أَن قالوا إِنّا كُنّا ظالِمينَ
5.translation_eng: Then their cry, when Our punishment overtook them, was only that they said, ‘We have indeed been wrongdoers!’
5.transliteration: fa-mā kāna daʿwāhum ʾidh jāʾahum baʾsunā ʾillā ʾan qālū ʾinnā kunnā ẓālimīna

6.content: فَلَنَسأَلَنَّ الَّذينَ أُرسِلَ إِلَيهِم وَلَنَسأَلَنَّ المُرسَلينَ
6.translation_eng: We will surely question those to whom the apostles were sent, and We will surely question the apostles.
6.transliteration: fa-la-nasʾalanna lladhīna ʾursila ʾilayhim wa-la-nasʾalanna l-mursalīna

7.content: فَلَنَقُصَّنَّ عَلَيهِم بِعِلمٍ ۖ وَما كُنّا غائِبينَ
7.translation_eng: Then We will surely recount to them with knowledge, for We had not been absent.
7.transliteration: fa-la-naquṣṣanna ʿalayhim bi-ʿilmin wa-mā kunnā ghāʾibīna

8.content: وَالوَزنُ يَومَئِذٍ الحَقُّ ۚ فَمَن ثَقُلَت مَوازينُهُ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُفلِحونَ
8.translation_eng: The weighing [of deeds] on that Day is a truth. As for those whose deeds weigh heavy in the scales —it is they who are the felicitous.
8.transliteration: wa-l-waznu yawmaʾidhin-i l-ḥaqqu fa-man thaqulat mawāzīnuhū fa-ʾulāʾika humu l-mufliḥūna

9.content: وَمَن خَفَّت مَوازينُهُ فَأُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ خَسِروا أَنفُسَهُم بِما كانوا بِآياتِنا يَظلِمونَ
9.translation_eng: As for those whose deeds weigh light in the scales, —it is they who have ruined their souls, because they used to wrong Our signs.
9.transliteration: wa-man khaffat mawāzīnuhū fa-ʾulāʾika lladhīna khasirū ʾanfusahum bi-mā kānū bi-ʾāyātinā yaẓlimūna

10.content: وَلَقَد مَكَّنّاكُم فِي الأَرضِ وَجَعَلنا لَكُم فيها مَعايِشَ ۗ قَليلًا ما تَشكُرونَ
10.translation_eng: Certainly We have established you on the earth, and made in it [various] means of livelihood for you. Little do you thank.
10.transliteration: wa-la-qad makkannākum fī l-ʾarḍi wa-jaʿalnā lakum fīhā maʿāyisha qalīlan mā tashkurūna

11.content: وَلَقَد خَلَقناكُم ثُمَّ صَوَّرناكُم ثُمَّ قُلنا لِلمَلائِكَةِ اسجُدوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدوا إِلّا إِبليسَ لَم يَكُن مِنَ السّاجِدينَ
11.translation_eng: Certainly We created you, then We formed you, then We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam.’ So they [all] prostrated, but not Iblis: he was not among those who prostrated.
11.transliteration: wa-la-qad khalaqnākum thumma ṣawwarnākum thumma qulnā li-l-malāʾikati sjudū li-ʾādama fa-sajadū ʾillā ʾiblīsa lam yakun mina s-sājidīna

12.content: قالَ ما مَنَعَكَ أَلّا تَسجُدَ إِذ أَمَرتُكَ ۖ قالَ أَنا خَيرٌ مِنهُ خَلَقتَني مِن نارٍ وَخَلَقتَهُ مِن طينٍ
12.translation_eng: Said He, ‘What prevented you from prostrating, when I commanded you?’ ‘I am better than him,’ he said. ‘You created me from fire and You created him from clay.’
12.transliteration: qāla mā manaʿaka ʾallā tasjuda ʾidh ʾamartuka qāla ʾana khayrun minhu khalaqtanī min nārin wa-khalaqtahū min ṭīnin

13.content: قالَ فَاهبِط مِنها فَما يَكونُ لَكَ أَن تَتَكَبَّرَ فيها فَاخرُج إِنَّكَ مِنَ الصّاغِرينَ
13.translation_eng: ‘Get down from it!’ He said. ‘It is not for you to be arrogant therein. Begone! You are indeed among the degraded ones.’
13.transliteration: qāla fa-hbiṭ minhā fa-mā yakūnu laka ʾan tatakabbara fīhā fa-khruj ʾinnaka mina ṣ-ṣāghirīna

14.content: قالَ أَنظِرني إِلىٰ يَومِ يُبعَثونَ
14.translation_eng: He said, ‘Respite me till the day they will be resurrected.’
14.transliteration: qāla ʾanẓirnī ʾilā yawmi yubʿathūna

15.content: قالَ إِنَّكَ مِنَ المُنظَرينَ
15.translation_eng: Said He, ‘You are indeed among the reprieved.’
15.transliteration: qāla ʾinnaka mina l-munẓarīna

16.content: قالَ فَبِما أَغوَيتَني لَأَقعُدَنَّ لَهُم صِراطَكَ المُستَقيمَ
16.translation_eng: ‘As You have consigned me to perversity,’ he said, ‘I will surely lie in wait for them on Your straight path.
16.transliteration: qāla fa-bi-mā ʾaghwaytanī la-ʾaqʿudanna lahum ṣirāṭaka l-mustaqīma

17.content: ثُمَّ لَآتِيَنَّهُم مِن بَينِ أَيديهِم وَمِن خَلفِهِم وَعَن أَيمانِهِم وَعَن شَمائِلِهِم ۖ وَلا تَجِدُ أَكثَرَهُم شاكِرينَ
17.translation_eng: Then I will come at them from their front and from their rear, and from their right and their left, and You will not find most of them to be grateful.’
17.transliteration: thumma la-ʾātiyannahum min bayni ʾaydīhim wa-min khalfihim wa-ʿan ʾaymānihim wa-ʿan shamāʾilihim wa-lā tajidu ʾaktharahum shākirīna

18.content: قالَ اخرُج مِنها مَذءومًا مَدحورًا ۖ لَمَن تَبِعَكَ مِنهُم لَأَملَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكُم أَجمَعينَ
18.translation_eng: Said He, ‘Begone hence, blameful, banished! Whoever of them follows you, I will surely fill hell with you all.’
18.transliteration: qāla khruj minhā madhʾūman madḥūran la-man tabiʿaka minhum la-ʾamlaʾanna jahannama minkum ʾajmaʿīna

19.content: وَيا آدَمُ اسكُن أَنتَ وَزَوجُكَ الجَنَّةَ فَكُلا مِن حَيثُ شِئتُما وَلا تَقرَبا هٰذِهِ الشَّجَرَةَ فَتَكونا مِنَ الظّالِمينَ
19.translation_eng: [Then He said to Adam,] ‘O Adam, dwell with your mate in paradise, and eat thereof whence you wish; but do not approach this tree, lest you should be among the wrongdoers.’
19.transliteration: wa-yā-ʾādamu skun ʾanta wa-zawjuka l-jannata fa-kulā min ḥaythu shiʾtumā wa-lā taqrabā hādhihi sh-shajarata fa-takūnā mina ẓ-ẓālimīna

20.content: فَوَسوَسَ لَهُمَا الشَّيطانُ لِيُبدِيَ لَهُما ما وورِيَ عَنهُما مِن سَوآتِهِما وَقالَ ما نَهاكُما رَبُّكُما عَن هٰذِهِ الشَّجَرَةِ إِلّا أَن تَكونا مَلَكَينِ أَو تَكونا مِنَ الخالِدينَ
20.translation_eng: Then Satan tempted them, to expose to them what was hidden from them of their nakedness, and he said, ‘Your Lord has only forbidden you from this tree lest you should become angels, or lest you become immortal.’
20.transliteration: fa-waswasa lahumā sh-shayṭānu li-yubdiya lahumā mā wūriya ʿanhumā min sawʾātihimā wa-qāla mā nahākumā rabbukumā ʿan hādhihi sh-shajarati ʾillā ʾan takūnā malakayni ʾaw takūnā mina l-khālidīna

21.content: وَقاسَمَهُما إِنّي لَكُما لَمِنَ النّاصِحينَ
21.translation_eng: And he swore to them, ‘I am indeed your well-wisher.’
21.transliteration: wa-qāsamahumā ʾinnī lakumā la-mina n-nāṣiḥīna

22.content: فَدَلّاهُما بِغُرورٍ ۚ فَلَمّا ذاقَا الشَّجَرَةَ بَدَت لَهُما سَوآتُهُما وَطَفِقا يَخصِفانِ عَلَيهِما مِن وَرَقِ الجَنَّةِ ۖ وَناداهُما رَبُّهُما أَلَم أَنهَكُما عَن تِلكُمَا الشَّجَرَةِ وَأَقُل لَكُما إِنَّ الشَّيطانَ لَكُما عَدُوٌّ مُبينٌ
22.translation_eng: Thus he brought about their fall by deception. So when they tasted of the tree, their nakedness became exposed to them, and they began to stitch over themselves with the leaves of paradise. Their Lord called out to them, ‘Did I not forbid you from that tree, and tell you, “Satan is indeed your manifest enemy?” ’
22.transliteration: fa-dallāhumā bi-ghurūrin fa-lammā dhāqā sh-shajarata badat lahumā sawʾātuhumā wa-ṭafiqā yakhṣifāni ʿalayhimā min waraqi l-jannati wa-nādāhumā rabbuhumā ʾa-lam ʾanhakumā ʿan tilkumā sh-shajarati wa-ʾaqul lakumā ʾinna sh-shayṭāna lakumā ʿaduwwun mubīnun

23.content: قالا رَبَّنا ظَلَمنا أَنفُسَنا وَإِن لَم تَغفِر لَنا وَتَرحَمنا لَنَكونَنَّ مِنَ الخاسِرينَ
23.translation_eng: They said, ‘Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves! If You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers.’
23.transliteration: qālā rabbanā ẓalamnā ʾanfusanā wa-ʾin lam taghfir lanā wa-tarḥamnā la-nakūnanna mina l-khāsirīna

24.content: قالَ اهبِطوا بَعضُكُم لِبَعضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ وَلَكُم فِي الأَرضِ مُستَقَرٌّ وَمَتاعٌ إِلىٰ حينٍ
24.translation_eng: He said, ‘Get down, being enemies of one another! On the earth shall be your abode and sustenance for a time.’
24.transliteration: qāla hbiṭū baʿḍukum li-baʿḍin ʿaduwwun wa-lakum fī l-ʾarḍi mustaqarrun wa-matāʿun ʾilā ḥīnin

25.content: قالَ فيها تَحيَونَ وَفيها تَموتونَ وَمِنها تُخرَجونَ
25.translation_eng: He said, ‘In it you will live, and in it you will die; and from it you will be raised [from the dead].’
25.transliteration: qāla fīhā taḥyawna wa-fīhā tamūtūna wa-minhā tukhrajūna

26.content: يا بَني آدَمَ قَد أَنزَلنا عَلَيكُم لِباسًا يُواري سَوآتِكُم وَريشًا ۖ وَلِباسُ التَّقوىٰ ذٰلِكَ خَيرٌ ۚ ذٰلِكَ مِن آياتِ اللَّهِ لَعَلَّهُم يَذَّكَّرونَ
26.translation_eng: ‘O Children of Adam! We have certainly sent down to you garments to cover your nakedness, and for adornment. Yet the garment of Godwariness—that is the best.’ That is [one] of Allah’s signs, so that they may take admonition.
26.transliteration: yā-banī ʾādama qad ʾanzalnā ʿalaykum libāsan yuwārī sawʾātikum wa-rīshan wa-libāsu t-taqwā dhālika khayrun dhālika min ʾāyāti llāhi laʿallahum yadhdhakkarūna

27.content: يا بَني آدَمَ لا يَفتِنَنَّكُمُ الشَّيطانُ كَما أَخرَجَ أَبَوَيكُم مِنَ الجَنَّةِ يَنزِعُ عَنهُما لِباسَهُما لِيُرِيَهُما سَوآتِهِما ۗ إِنَّهُ يَراكُم هُوَ وَقَبيلُهُ مِن حَيثُ لا تَرَونَهُم ۗ إِنّا جَعَلنَا الشَّياطينَ أَولِياءَ لِلَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ
27.translation_eng: ‘O Children of Adam! Do not let Satan tempt you, like he expelled your parents from paradise, stripping them of their garments to expose to them their nakedness. Indeed he sees you—he and his hosts— whence you do not see them. We have indeed made the devils friends of those who have no faith.’
27.transliteration: yā-banī ʾādama lā yaftinannakumu sh-shayṭānu ka-mā ʾakhraja ʾabawaykum mina l-jannati yanziʿu ʿanhumā libāsahumā li-yuriyahumā sawʾātihimā ʾinnahū yarākum huwa wa-qabīluhū min ḥaythu lā tarawnahum ʾinnā jaʿalnā sh-shayāṭīna ʾawliyāʾa li-lladhīna lā yuʾminūna

28.content: وَإِذا فَعَلوا فاحِشَةً قالوا وَجَدنا عَلَيها آباءَنا وَاللَّهُ أَمَرَنا بِها ۗ قُل إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَأمُرُ بِالفَحشاءِ ۖ أَتَقولونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ ما لا تَعلَمونَ
28.translation_eng: When they commit an indecency, they say, ‘We found our fathers practising it, and Allah has enjoined it upon us.’ Say, ‘Indeed Allah does not enjoin indecencies. Do you attribute to Allah what you do not know?’
28.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā faʿalū fāḥishatan qālū wajadnā ʿalayhā ʾābāʾanā wa-llāhu ʾamaranā bihā qul ʾinna llāha lā yaʾmuru bi-l-faḥshāʾi ʾa-taqūlūna ʿalā llāhi mā lā taʿlamūna

29.content: قُل أَمَرَ رَبّي بِالقِسطِ ۖ وَأَقيموا وُجوهَكُم عِندَ كُلِّ مَسجِدٍ وَادعوهُ مُخلِصينَ لَهُ الدّينَ ۚ كَما بَدَأَكُم تَعودونَ
29.translation_eng: Say, ‘My Lord has enjoined justice,’ and [He has enjoined,] ‘Set your heart [on Him] at every occasion of prayer, and invoke Him, putting your exclusive faith in Him. Even as He brought you forth in the beginning, so will you return.’
29.transliteration: qul ʾamara rabbī bi-l-qisṭi wa-ʾaqīmū wujūhakum ʿinda kulli masjidin wa-dʿūhu mukhliṣīna lahu d-dīna ka-mā badaʾakum taʿūdūna

30.content: فَريقًا هَدىٰ وَفَريقًا حَقَّ عَلَيهِمُ الضَّلالَةُ ۗ إِنَّهُمُ اتَّخَذُوا الشَّياطينَ أَولِياءَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَيَحسَبونَ أَنَّهُم مُهتَدونَ
30.translation_eng: A part [of mankind] He has guided and a part has deserved [to be consigned to] error, for they took devils for guardians instead of Allah, and supposed they were guided.
30.transliteration: farīqan hadā wa-farīqan ḥaqqa ʿalayhimu ḍ-ḍalālatu ʾinnahumu ttakhadhū sh-shayāṭīna ʾawliyāʾa min dūni llāhi wa-yaḥsabūna ʾannahum muhtadūna

31.content: ۞ يا بَني آدَمَ خُذوا زينَتَكُم عِندَ كُلِّ مَسجِدٍ وَكُلوا وَاشرَبوا وَلا تُسرِفوا ۚ إِنَّهُ لا يُحِبُّ المُسرِفينَ
31.translation_eng: O Children of Adam! Put on your adornment on every occasion of prayer, and eat and drink, but do not waste; indeed He does not like the wasteful.
31.transliteration: yā-banī ʾādama khudhū zīnatakum ʿinda kulli masjidin wa-kulū wa-shrabū wa-lā tusrifū ʾinnahū lā yuḥibbu l-musrifīna

32.content: قُل مَن حَرَّمَ زينَةَ اللَّهِ الَّتي أَخرَجَ لِعِبادِهِ وَالطَّيِّباتِ مِنَ الرِّزقِ ۚ قُل هِيَ لِلَّذينَ آمَنوا فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا خالِصَةً يَومَ القِيامَةِ ۗ كَذٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ الآياتِ لِقَومٍ يَعلَمونَ
32.translation_eng: Say, ‘Who has forbidden the adornment of Allah which He has brought forth for His servants, and the good things of [His] provision?’ Say, ‘These are for the faithful in the life of this world, and exclusively for them on the Day of Resurrection.’ Thus do We elaborate the signs for a people who have knowledge.
32.transliteration: qul man ḥarrama zīnata llāhi llatī ʾakhraja li-ʿibādihī wa-ṭ-ṭayyibāti mina r-rizqi qul hiya li-lladhīna ʾāmanū fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā khāliṣatan yawma l-qiyāmati ka-dhālika nufaṣṣilu l-ʾāyāti li-qawmin yaʿlamūna

33.content: قُل إِنَّما حَرَّمَ رَبِّيَ الفَواحِشَ ما ظَهَرَ مِنها وَما بَطَنَ وَالإِثمَ وَالبَغيَ بِغَيرِ الحَقِّ وَأَن تُشرِكوا بِاللَّهِ ما لَم يُنَزِّل بِهِ سُلطانًا وَأَن تَقولوا عَلَى اللَّهِ ما لا تَعلَمونَ
33.translation_eng: Say, ‘My Lord has only forbidden indecencies, the outward among them and the inward ones, and sin and undue aggression, and that you should ascribe to Allah partners for which He has not sent down any authority, and that you should attribute to Allah what you do not know.
33.transliteration: qul ʾinnamā ḥarrama rabbiya l-fawāḥisha mā ẓahara minhā wa-mā baṭana wa-l-ʾithma wa-l-baghya bi-ghayri l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾan tushrikū bi-llāhi mā lam yunazzil bihī sulṭānan wa-ʾan taqūlū ʿalā llāhi mā lā taʿlamūna

34.content: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلٌ ۖ فَإِذا جاءَ أَجَلُهُم لا يَستَأخِرونَ ساعَةً ۖ وَلا يَستَقدِمونَ
34.translation_eng: There is a [preordained] time for every nation: when their time comes, they shall not defer it by a single hour nor shall they advance it.
34.transliteration: wa-li-kulli ʾummatin ʾajalun fa-ʾidhā jāʾa ʾajaluhum lā yastaʾkhirūna sāʿatan wa-lā yastaqdimūna

35.content: يا بَني آدَمَ إِمّا يَأتِيَنَّكُم رُسُلٌ مِنكُم يَقُصّونَ عَلَيكُم آياتي ۙ فَمَنِ اتَّقىٰ وَأَصلَحَ فَلا خَوفٌ عَلَيهِم وَلا هُم يَحزَنونَ
35.translation_eng: O Children of Adam! If there come to you apostles from among yourselves, recounting to you My signs, then those who are Godwary and righteous will have no fear, nor will they grieve.
35.transliteration: yā-banī ʾādama ʾimmā yaʾtiyannakum rusulun minkum yaquṣṣūna ʿalaykum ʾāyātī fa-mani ttaqā wa-ʾaṣlaḥa fa-lā khawfun ʿalayhim wa-lā hum yaḥzanūna

36.content: وَالَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا وَاستَكبَروا عَنها أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ النّارِ ۖ هُم فيها خالِدونَ
36.translation_eng: But those who deny Our signs and are disdainful of them, they shall be the inmates of the Fire and they shall remain in it [forever].
36.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā wa-stakbarū ʿanhā ʾulāʾika ʾaṣḥābu n-nāri hum fīhā khālidūna

37.content: فَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّنِ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَو كَذَّبَ بِآياتِهِ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ يَنالُهُم نَصيبُهُم مِنَ الكِتابِ ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءَتهُم رُسُلُنا يَتَوَفَّونَهُم قالوا أَينَ ما كُنتُم تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ۖ قالوا ضَلّوا عَنّا وَشَهِدوا عَلىٰ أَنفُسِهِم أَنَّهُم كانوا كافِرينَ
37.translation_eng: So who is a greater wrongdoer than him who fabricates a lie against Allah, or denies His signs? Their share, as decreed in the Book, shall reach them. When Our messengers1 come to take them away, they will say, ‘Where is that which you used to invoke besides Allah?’ They will say, ‘They have forsaken us,’ and they will testify against themselves that they were faithless.That is, the angels of death.
37.transliteration: fa-man ʾaẓlamu mimmani ftarā ʿalā llāhi kadhiban ʾaw kadhdhaba bi-ʾāyātihī ʾulāʾika yanāluhum naṣībuhum mina l-kitābi ḥattā ʾidhā jāʾathum rusulunā yatawaffawnahum qālū ʾayna mā kuntum tadʿūna min dūni llāhi qālū ḍallū ʿannā wa-shahidū ʿalā ʾanfusihim ʾannahum kānū kāfirīna

38.content: قالَ ادخُلوا في أُمَمٍ قَد خَلَت مِن قَبلِكُم مِنَ الجِنِّ وَالإِنسِ فِي النّارِ ۖ كُلَّما دَخَلَت أُمَّةٌ لَعَنَت أُختَها ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذَا ادّارَكوا فيها جَميعًا قالَت أُخراهُم لِأولاهُم رَبَّنا هٰؤُلاءِ أَضَلّونا فَآتِهِم عَذابًا ضِعفًا مِنَ النّارِ ۖ قالَ لِكُلٍّ ضِعفٌ وَلٰكِن لا تَعلَمونَ
38.translation_eng: He will say, ‘Enter, along with the nations who passed before you of jinn and humans, into the Fire!’ Every time that a nation enters [hell], it will curse its sister [nation]. When they all rejoin in it, the last of them will say about the first of them, ‘Our Lord, it was they who led us astray; so give them a double punishment of the Fire.’ He will say, ‘It is double for each [of you], but you do not know.’
38.transliteration: qāla dkhulū fī ʾumamin qad khalat min qablikum mina l-jinni wa-l-ʾinsi fī n-nāri kullamā dakhalat ʾummatun laʿanat ʾukhtahā ḥattā ʾidhā ddārakū fīhā jamīʿan qālat ʾukhrāhum li-ʾūlāhum rabbanā hāʾulāʾi ʾaḍallūnā fa-ʾātihim ʿadhāban ḍiʿfan mina n-nāri qāla li-kullin ḍiʿfun wa-lākin lā taʿlamūna

39.content: وَقالَت أولاهُم لِأُخراهُم فَما كانَ لَكُم عَلَينا مِن فَضلٍ فَذوقُوا العَذابَ بِما كُنتُم تَكسِبونَ
39.translation_eng: And the first of them will say to the last of them, ‘You have no advantage over us! So taste the punishment because of what you used to earn.’
39.transliteration: wa-qālat ʾūlāhum li-ʾukhrāhum fa-mā kāna lakum ʿalaynā min faḍlin fa-dhūqū l-ʿadhāba bi-mā kuntum taksibūna

40.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا وَاستَكبَروا عَنها لا تُفَتَّحُ لَهُم أَبوابُ السَّماءِ وَلا يَدخُلونَ الجَنَّةَ حَتّىٰ يَلِجَ الجَمَلُ في سَمِّ الخِياطِ ۚ وَكَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي المُجرِمينَ
40.translation_eng: Indeed, those who deny Our signs and are disdainful of them— the gates of the heaven will not be opened for them, nor shall they enter paradise until the camel passes through the needle’s eye,1 and thus do We requite the guilty.Or, ‘until the cable passes through the needle’s eye.’
40.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā wa-stakbarū ʿanhā lā tufattaḥu lahum ʾabwābu s-samāʾi wa-lā yadkhulūna l-jannata ḥattā yalija l-jamalu fī sammi l-khiyāṭi wa-ka-dhālika najzī l-mujrimīna

41.content: لَهُم مِن جَهَنَّمَ مِهادٌ وَمِن فَوقِهِم غَواشٍ ۚ وَكَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي الظّالِمينَ
41.translation_eng: They shall have hell for their resting place, and over them shall be sheets [of fire], and thus do We requite the wrongdoers.
41.transliteration: lahum min jahannama mihādun wa-min fawqihim ghawāshin wa-ka-dhālika najzī ẓ-ẓālimīna

42.content: وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ لا نُكَلِّفُ نَفسًا إِلّا وُسعَها أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ الجَنَّةِ ۖ هُم فيها خالِدونَ
42.translation_eng: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds —We task no soul except according to its capacity— they shall be the inhabitants of paradise, and they shall remain in it [forever].
42.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti lā nukallifu nafsan ʾillā wusʿahā ʾulāʾika ʾaṣḥābu l-jannati hum fīhā khālidūna

43.content: وَنَزَعنا ما في صُدورِهِم مِن غِلٍّ تَجري مِن تَحتِهِمُ الأَنهارُ ۖ وَقالُوا الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذي هَدانا لِهٰذا وَما كُنّا لِنَهتَدِيَ لَولا أَن هَدانَا اللَّهُ ۖ لَقَد جاءَت رُسُلُ رَبِّنا بِالحَقِّ ۖ وَنودوا أَن تِلكُمُ الجَنَّةُ أورِثتُموها بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
43.translation_eng: We will remove whatever rancour there is in their breasts, and streams will run for them. They will say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah, who guided us to this. We would have never been guided had not Allah guided us. Our Lord’s apostles had certainly brought the truth.’ And the call would be made to them: ‘This is paradise, which you have been given to inherit because of what you used to do!’
43.transliteration: wa-nazaʿnā mā fī ṣudūrihim min ghillin tajrī min taḥtihimu l-ʾanhāru wa-qālū l-ḥamdu li-llāhi lladhī hadānā li-hādhā wa-mā kunnā li-nahtadiya law-lā ʾan hadānā llāhu la-qad jāʾat rusulu rabbinā bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-nūdū ʾan tilkumu l-jannatu ʾūrithtumūhā bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna

44.content: وَنادىٰ أَصحابُ الجَنَّةِ أَصحابَ النّارِ أَن قَد وَجَدنا ما وَعَدَنا رَبُّنا حَقًّا فَهَل وَجَدتُم ما وَعَدَ رَبُّكُم حَقًّا ۖ قالوا نَعَم ۚ فَأَذَّنَ مُؤَذِّنٌ بَينَهُم أَن لَعنَةُ اللَّهِ عَلَى الظّالِمينَ
44.translation_eng: The inhabitants of paradise will call out to the inmates of the Fire, ‘We found what our Lord promised us to be true; did you find what your Lord promised you to be true?’ ‘Yes,’ they will say. Then a caller will announce in their midst, ‘May Allah’s curse be on the wrongdoers!’
44.transliteration: wa-nādā ʾaṣḥābu l-jannati ʾaṣḥāba n-nāri ʾan qad wajadnā mā waʿadanā rabbunā ḥaqqan fa-hal wajadtum mā waʿada rabbukum ḥaqqan qālū naʿam fa-ʾadhdhana muʾadhdhinun baynahum ʾan laʿnatu llāhi ʿalā ẓ-ẓālimīna

45.content: الَّذينَ يَصُدّونَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَيَبغونَها عِوَجًا وَهُم بِالآخِرَةِ كافِرونَ
45.translation_eng: —Those who bar [others] from the way of Allah, and seek to make it crooked, and disbelieve in the Hereafter.
45.transliteration: alladhīna yaṣuddūna ʿan sabīli llāhi wa-yabghūnahā ʿiwajan wa-hum bi-l-ʾākhirati kāfirūna

46.content: وَبَينَهُما حِجابٌ ۚ وَعَلَى الأَعرافِ رِجالٌ يَعرِفونَ كُلًّا بِسيماهُم ۚ وَنادَوا أَصحابَ الجَنَّةِ أَن سَلامٌ عَلَيكُم ۚ لَم يَدخُلوها وَهُم يَطمَعونَ
46.translation_eng: And there will be a veil between them. And on the Elevations will be certain men who recognize each of them by their mark. They will call out to the inhabitants of paradise, ‘Peace be to you!’ (They1 will not have entered it, though they would be eager to do so.That is, the people of paradise.
46.transliteration: wa-baynahumā ḥijābun wa-ʿalā l-ʾaʿrāfi rijālun yaʿrifūna kullan bi-sīmāhum wa-nādaw ʾaṣḥāba l-jannati ʾan salāmun ʿalaykum lam yadkhulūhā wa-hum yaṭmaʿūna

47.content: ۞ وَإِذا صُرِفَت أَبصارُهُم تِلقاءَ أَصحابِ النّارِ قالوا رَبَّنا لا تَجعَلنا مَعَ القَومِ الظّالِمينَ
47.translation_eng: And when their look is turned toward the inmates of the Fire, they will say, ‘Our Lord, do not put us among the wrongdoing lot!’)
47.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā ṣurifat ʾabṣāruhum tilqāʾa ʾaṣhābi n-nāri qālū rabbanā lā tajʿalnā maʿa l-qawmi ẓ-ẓālimīna

48.content: وَنادىٰ أَصحابُ الأَعرافِ رِجالًا يَعرِفونَهُم بِسيماهُم قالوا ما أَغنىٰ عَنكُم جَمعُكُم وَما كُنتُم تَستَكبِرونَ
48.translation_eng: And the occupants of the Elevations will call out to certain men whom they recognize by their marks, ‘Your rallying1 did not avail you, nor what you used to disdain.Or ‘your amassing.’
48.transliteration: wa-nādā ʾaṣḥābu l-ʾaʿrāfi rijālan yaʿrifūnahum bi-sīmāhum qālū mā ʾaghnā ʿankum jamʿukum wa-mā kuntum tastakbirūna

49.content: أَهٰؤُلاءِ الَّذينَ أَقسَمتُم لا يَنالُهُمُ اللَّهُ بِرَحمَةٍ ۚ ادخُلُوا الجَنَّةَ لا خَوفٌ عَلَيكُم وَلا أَنتُم تَحزَنونَ
49.translation_eng: Are these1 the ones concerning whom you swore that Allah will not extend them any mercy?’ ‘Enter paradise!2 You shall have no fear, nor shall you grieve.’That is, the people who will be about to enter paradise.Addressed to the people about to enter paradise.
49.transliteration: ʾa-hāʾulāʾi lladhīna ʾaqsamtum lā yanāluhumu llāhu bi-raḥmatin ʾudkhulū l-jannata lā khawfun ʿalaykum wa-lā ʾantum taḥzanūna

50.content: وَنادىٰ أَصحابُ النّارِ أَصحابَ الجَنَّةِ أَن أَفيضوا عَلَينا مِنَ الماءِ أَو مِمّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ ۚ قالوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ حَرَّمَهُما عَلَى الكافِرينَ
50.translation_eng: The inmates of the Fire will call out to the inhabitants of paradise, ‘Pour on us some water, or something of what Allah has provided you.’ They will say, ‘Allah has indeed forbidden these two to the faithless!’
50.transliteration: wa-nādā ʾaṣḥābu n-nāri ʾaṣḥāba l-jannati ʾan ʾafīḍū ʿalaynā mina l-māʾi ʾaw mimmā razaqakumu llāhu qālū ʾinna llāha ḥarramahumā ʿalā l-kāfirīna

51.content: الَّذينَ اتَّخَذوا دينَهُم لَهوًا وَلَعِبًا وَغَرَّتهُمُ الحَياةُ الدُّنيا ۚ فَاليَومَ نَنساهُم كَما نَسوا لِقاءَ يَومِهِم هٰذا وَما كانوا بِآياتِنا يَجحَدونَ
51.translation_eng: Those who took their religion for diversion and play and whom the life of the world had deceived. So today We will forget them as they forgot the encounter of this day of theirs, and as they used to impugn Our signs.
51.transliteration: alladhīna ttakhadhū dīnahum lahwan wa-laʿiban wa-gharrathumu l-ḥayātu d-dunyā fa-l-yawma nansāhum ka-mā nasū liqāʾa yawmihim hādhā wa-mā kānū bi-ʾāyātinā yajḥadūna

52.content: وَلَقَد جِئناهُم بِكِتابٍ فَصَّلناهُ عَلىٰ عِلمٍ هُدًى وَرَحمَةً لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
52.translation_eng: Certainly We have brought them a Book, which We have elaborated with knowledge, as a guidance and mercy for a people who have faith.
52.transliteration: wa-la-qad jiʾnāhum bi-kitābin faṣṣalnāhu ʿalā ʿilmin hudan wa-raḥmatan li-qawmin yuʾminūna

53.content: هَل يَنظُرونَ إِلّا تَأويلَهُ ۚ يَومَ يَأتي تَأويلُهُ يَقولُ الَّذينَ نَسوهُ مِن قَبلُ قَد جاءَت رُسُلُ رَبِّنا بِالحَقِّ فَهَل لَنا مِن شُفَعاءَ فَيَشفَعوا لَنا أَو نُرَدُّ فَنَعمَلَ غَيرَ الَّذي كُنّا نَعمَلُ ۚ قَد خَسِروا أَنفُسَهُم وَضَلَّ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَفتَرونَ
53.translation_eng: Do they await anything but its fulfillment? The day when its fulfillment comes, those who had forgotten it before will say, ‘Our Lord’s apostles had certainly brought the truth. If only we had some intercessors to intercede for us, or we would be returned, so that we may do differently from what we did!’ They have certainly ruined their souls, and what they used to fabricate has forsaken them.
53.transliteration: hal yanẓurūna ʾillā taʾwīlahū yawma yaʾtī taʾwīluhū yaqūlu lladhīna nasūhu min qablu qad jāʾat rusulu rabbinā bi-l-ḥaqqi fa-hal lanā min shufaʿāʾa fa-yashfaʿū lanā ʾaw nuraddu fa-naʿmala ghayra lladhī kunnā naʿmalu qad khasirū ʾanfusahum wa-ḍalla ʿanhum mā kānū yaftarūna

54.content: إِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ اللَّهُ الَّذي خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ في سِتَّةِ أَيّامٍ ثُمَّ استَوىٰ عَلَى العَرشِ يُغشِي اللَّيلَ النَّهارَ يَطلُبُهُ حَثيثًا وَالشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ وَالنُّجومَ مُسَخَّراتٍ بِأَمرِهِ ۗ أَلا لَهُ الخَلقُ وَالأَمرُ ۗ تَبارَكَ اللَّهُ رَبُّ العالَمينَ
54.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and then settled on the Throne. He draws the night’s cover over the day, which pursues it swiftly, and [He created] the sun, the moon, and the stars, [all of them] disposed by His command. Look! All creation and command belong to Him. Blessed is Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.
54.transliteration: ʾinna rabbakumu llāhu lladhī khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa fī sittati ʾayyāmin thumma stawā ʿalā l-ʿarshi yughshī l-layla n-nahāra yaṭlubuhū ḥathīthan wa-sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara wa-n-nujūma musakhkharātin bi-ʾamrihī ʾa-lā lahu l-khalqu wa-l-ʾamru tabāraka llāhu rabbu l-ʿālamīna

55.content: ادعوا رَبَّكُم تَضَرُّعًا وَخُفيَةً ۚ إِنَّهُ لا يُحِبُّ المُعتَدينَ
55.translation_eng: Supplicate your Lord, beseechingly and secretly. Indeed He does not like the transgressors.
55.transliteration: udʿū rabbakum taḍarruʿan wa-khufyatan ʾinnahū lā yuḥibbu l-muʿtadīna

56.content: وَلا تُفسِدوا فِي الأَرضِ بَعدَ إِصلاحِها وَادعوهُ خَوفًا وَطَمَعًا ۚ إِنَّ رَحمَتَ اللَّهِ قَريبٌ مِنَ المُحسِنينَ
56.translation_eng: And do not cause corruption on the earth after its restoration, and supplicate Him with fear and hope: indeed Allah’s mercy is close to the virtuous.
56.transliteration: wa-lā tufsidū fī l-ʾarḍi baʿda ʾiṣlāḥihā wa-dʿūhu khawfan wa-ṭamaʿan ʾinna raḥmata llāhi qarībun mina l-muḥsinīna

57.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي يُرسِلُ الرِّياحَ بُشرًا بَينَ يَدَي رَحمَتِهِ ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذا أَقَلَّت سَحابًا ثِقالًا سُقناهُ لِبَلَدٍ مَيِّتٍ فَأَنزَلنا بِهِ الماءَ فَأَخرَجنا بِهِ مِن كُلِّ الثَّمَراتِ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نُخرِجُ المَوتىٰ لَعَلَّكُم تَذَكَّرونَ
57.translation_eng: It is He who sends forth the winds as harbingers of His mercy. When they bear [rain-]laden clouds, We drive them toward a dead land and send down water on it, and with it We bring forth all kinds of crops. Thus shall We raise the dead; maybe you will take admonition.
57.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī yursilu r-riyāḥa bushran bayna yaday raḥmatihī ḥattā ʾidhā ʾaqallat saḥāban thiqālan suqnāhu li-baladin mayyitin fa-ʾanzalnā bihi l-māʾa fa-ʾakhrajnā bihī min kulli th-thamarāti ka-dhālika nukhriju l-mawtā laʿallakum tadhakkarūna

58.content: وَالبَلَدُ الطَّيِّبُ يَخرُجُ نَباتُهُ بِإِذنِ رَبِّهِ ۖ وَالَّذي خَبُثَ لا يَخرُجُ إِلّا نَكِدًا ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نُصَرِّفُ الآياتِ لِقَومٍ يَشكُرونَ
58.translation_eng: The good land—its vegetation comes out by the permission of its Lord, and as for that which is bad, it does not come out except sparsely. Thus do We paraphrase the signs variously for a people who give thanks.
58.transliteration: wa-l-baladu ṭ-ṭayyibu yakhruju nabātuhū bi-ʾidhni rabbihī wa-lladhī khabutha lā yakhruju ʾillā nakidan ka-dhālika nuṣarrifu l-ʾāyāti li-qawmin yashkurūna

59.content: لَقَد أَرسَلنا نوحًا إِلىٰ قَومِهِ فَقالَ يا قَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ إِنّي أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
59.translation_eng: Certainly We sent Noah to his people. He said, ‘O my people, worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. Indeed I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous day.’
59.transliteration: la-qad ʾarsalnā nūḥan ʾilā qawmihī fa-qāla yā-qawmi ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʿalaykum ʿadhāba yawmin ʿaẓīmin

60.content: قالَ المَلَأُ مِن قَومِهِ إِنّا لَنَراكَ في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
60.translation_eng: The elite of his people said, ‘Indeed we see you in manifest error.’
60.transliteration: qāla l-malaʾu min qawmihī ʾinnā la-narāka fī ḍalālin mubīnin

61.content: قالَ يا قَومِ لَيسَ بي ضَلالَةٌ وَلٰكِنّي رَسولٌ مِن رَبِّ العالَمينَ
61.translation_eng: He said, ‘O my people, I am not in error. Rather I am an apostle from the Lord of all the worlds.
61.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi laysa bī ḍalālatun wa-lākinnī rasūlun min rabbi l-ʿālamīna

62.content: أُبَلِّغُكُم رِسالاتِ رَبّي وَأَنصَحُ لَكُم وَأَعلَمُ مِنَ اللَّهِ ما لا تَعلَمونَ
62.translation_eng: I communicate to you the messages of my Lord, and I am your well-wisher, and I know from Allah what you do not know.
62.transliteration: ʾuballighukum risālāti rabbī wa-ʾanṣaḥu lakum wa-ʾaʿlamu mina llāhi mā lā taʿlamūna

63.content: أَوَعَجِبتُم أَن جاءَكُم ذِكرٌ مِن رَبِّكُم عَلىٰ رَجُلٍ مِنكُم لِيُنذِرَكُم وَلِتَتَّقوا وَلَعَلَّكُم تُرحَمونَ
63.translation_eng: Do you consider it odd that a reminder from your Lord should come to you through a man from among yourselves, to warn you so that you may be Godwary and so that you may receive His mercy?’
63.transliteration: ʾa-wa-ʿajibtum ʾan jāʾakum dhikrun min rabbikum ʿalā rajulin minkum li-yundhirakum wa-li-tattaqū wa-laʿallakum turḥamūna

64.content: فَكَذَّبوهُ فَأَنجَيناهُ وَالَّذينَ مَعَهُ فِي الفُلكِ وَأَغرَقنَا الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا ۚ إِنَّهُم كانوا قَومًا عَمينَ
64.translation_eng: But they denied him. So We delivered him and those who were with him in the ark, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. Indeed they were a blind lot.
64.transliteration: fa-kadhdhabūhu fa-ʾanjaynāhu wa-lladhīna maʿahū fī l-fulki wa-ʾaghraqnā lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā ʾinnahum kānū qawman ʿamīna

65.content: ۞ وَإِلىٰ عادٍ أَخاهُم هودًا ۗ قالَ يا قَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ ۚ أَفَلا تَتَّقونَ
65.translation_eng: And to [the people of] ʿĀd, Hūd, their brother. He said, ‘O my people, worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. Will you not then be wary [of Him]?’
65.transliteration: wa-ʾilā ʿādin ʾakhāhum hūdan qāla yā-qawmi ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū ʾa-fa-lā tattaqūna

66.content: قالَ المَلَأُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن قَومِهِ إِنّا لَنَراكَ في سَفاهَةٍ وَإِنّا لَنَظُنُّكَ مِنَ الكاذِبينَ
66.translation_eng: The elite of his people who were faithless said, ‘Indeed we see you to be in folly, and indeed we consider you to be a liar.’
66.transliteration: qāla l-malaʾu lladhīna kafarū min qawmihī ʾinnā la-narāka fī safāhatin wa-ʾinnā la-naẓunnuka mina l-kādhibīna

67.content: قالَ يا قَومِ لَيسَ بي سَفاهَةٌ وَلٰكِنّي رَسولٌ مِن رَبِّ العالَمينَ
67.translation_eng: He said, ‘O my people, I am not in folly. Rather I am an apostle from the Lord of all the worlds.
67.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi laysa bī safāhatun wa-lākinnī rasūlun min rabbi l-ʿālamīna

68.content: أُبَلِّغُكُم رِسالاتِ رَبّي وَأَنا لَكُم ناصِحٌ أَمينٌ
68.translation_eng: I communicate to you the messages of my Lord and I am a trustworthy well-wisher for you.
68.transliteration: ʾuballighukum risālāti rabbī wa-ʾana lakum nāṣiḥun ʾamīnun

69.content: أَوَعَجِبتُم أَن جاءَكُم ذِكرٌ مِن رَبِّكُم عَلىٰ رَجُلٍ مِنكُم لِيُنذِرَكُم ۚ وَاذكُروا إِذ جَعَلَكُم خُلَفاءَ مِن بَعدِ قَومِ نوحٍ وَزادَكُم فِي الخَلقِ بَسطَةً ۖ فَاذكُروا آلاءَ اللَّهِ لَعَلَّكُم تُفلِحونَ
69.translation_eng: Do you consider it odd that there should come to you a reminder from your Lord through a man from among yourselves, so that he may warn you? Remember when He made you successors after the people of Noah, and increased you vastly in creation. So remember Allah’s bounties so that you may be felicitous.’
69.transliteration: ʾa-wa-ʿajibtum ʾan jāʾakum dhikrun min rabbikum ʿalā rajulin minkum li-yundhirakum wa-dhkurū ʾidh jaʿalakum khulafāʾa min baʿdi qawmi nūḥin wa-zādakum fī l-khalqi basṭatan fa-dhkurū ʾālāʾa llāhi laʿallakum tufliḥūna

70.content: قالوا أَجِئتَنا لِنَعبُدَ اللَّهَ وَحدَهُ وَنَذَرَ ما كانَ يَعبُدُ آباؤُنا ۖ فَأتِنا بِما تَعِدُنا إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
70.translation_eng: They said, ‘Have you come to [tell] us that we should worship Allah alone and abandon what our fathers have been worshiping? Then bring us what you threaten us with, should you be truthful.’
70.transliteration: qālū ʾa-jiʾtanā li-naʿbuda llāha waḥdahū wa-nadhara mā kāna yaʿbudu ʾābāʾunā fa-ʾtinā bi-mā taʿidunā ʾin kunta mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

71.content: قالَ قَد وَقَعَ عَلَيكُم مِن رَبِّكُم رِجسٌ وَغَضَبٌ ۖ أَتُجادِلونَني في أَسماءٍ سَمَّيتُموها أَنتُم وَآباؤُكُم ما نَزَّلَ اللَّهُ بِها مِن سُلطانٍ ۚ فَانتَظِروا إِنّي مَعَكُم مِنَ المُنتَظِرينَ
71.translation_eng: He said, ‘There has become due against you a punishment and wrath from your Lord. Do you dispute with me regarding names which you have named —you and your fathers— for which Allah has not sent down any authority? So wait! I too am waiting along with you.’
71.transliteration: qāla qad waqaʿa ʿalaykum min rabbikum rijsun wa-ghaḍabun ʾa-tujādilūnanī fī ʾasmāʾin sammaytumūhā ʾantum wa-ʾābāʾukum mā nazzala llāhu bihā min sulṭānin fa-ntaẓirū ʾinnī maʿakum mina l-muntaẓirīna

72.content: فَأَنجَيناهُ وَالَّذينَ مَعَهُ بِرَحمَةٍ مِنّا وَقَطَعنا دابِرَ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا ۖ وَما كانوا مُؤمِنينَ
72.translation_eng: Then We delivered him and those who were with him by a mercy from Us, and We rooted out those who denied Our signs and were not faithful.
72.transliteration: fa-ʾanjaynāhu wa-lladhīna maʿahū bi-raḥmatin minnā wa-qaṭaʿnā dābira lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā wa-mā kānū muʾminīna

73.content: وَإِلىٰ ثَمودَ أَخاهُم صالِحًا ۗ قالَ يا قَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ ۖ قَد جاءَتكُم بَيِّنَةٌ مِن رَبِّكُم ۖ هٰذِهِ ناقَةُ اللَّهِ لَكُم آيَةً ۖ فَذَروها تَأكُل في أَرضِ اللَّهِ ۖ وَلا تَمَسّوها بِسوءٍ فَيَأخُذَكُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
73.translation_eng: And to [the people of] Thamūd, Ṣāliḥ, their brother. He said, ‘O my people, worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. There has certainly come to you a manifest proof from your Lord. This she-camel of Allah is a sign for you. Let her alone to graze [freely] in Allah’s land, and do not cause her any harm,1 for then you shall be seized by a painful punishment.Or ‘do not touch her with malice.’
73.transliteration: wa-ʾilā thamūda ʾakhāhum ṣāliḥan qāla yā-qawmi ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū qad jāʾatkum bayyinatun min rabbikum hādhihī nāqatu llāhi lakum ʾāyatan fa-dharūhā taʾkul fī ʾarḍi llāhi wa-lā tamassūhā bi-sūʾin fa-yaʾkhudhakum ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

74.content: وَاذكُروا إِذ جَعَلَكُم خُلَفاءَ مِن بَعدِ عادٍ وَبَوَّأَكُم فِي الأَرضِ تَتَّخِذونَ مِن سُهولِها قُصورًا وَتَنحِتونَ الجِبالَ بُيوتًا ۖ فَاذكُروا آلاءَ اللَّهِ وَلا تَعثَوا فِي الأَرضِ مُفسِدينَ
74.translation_eng: Remember when He made you successors after [the people of] ʿĀd, and settled you in the land: you build palaces in its plains, and hew houses out of the mountains. So remember Allah’s bounties, and do not act wickedly on the earth, causing corruption.’
74.transliteration: wa-dhkurū ʾidh jaʿalakum khulafāʾa min baʿdi ʿādin wa-bawwaʾakum fī l-ʾarḍi tattakhidhūna min suhūlihā quṣūran wa-tanḥitūna l-jibāla buyūtan fa-dhkurū ʾālāʾa llāhi wa-lā taʿthaw fī l-ʾarḍi mufsidīna

75.content: قالَ المَلَأُ الَّذينَ استَكبَروا مِن قَومِهِ لِلَّذينَ استُضعِفوا لِمَن آمَنَ مِنهُم أَتَعلَمونَ أَنَّ صالِحًا مُرسَلٌ مِن رَبِّهِ ۚ قالوا إِنّا بِما أُرسِلَ بِهِ مُؤمِنونَ
75.translation_eng: The elite of his people who were arrogant said to those who were abased —to those among them who had faith— ‘Do you know that Ṣāliḥ has been sent by his Lord?’ They said, ‘We indeed believe in what he has been sent with.’
75.transliteration: qāla l-malaʾu lladhīna stakbarū min qawmihī li-lladhīna stuḍʿifū li-man ʾāmana minhum ʾa-taʿlamūna ʾanna ṣāliḥan mursalun min rabbihī qālū ʾinnā bi-mā ʾursila bihī muʾminūna

76.content: قالَ الَّذينَ استَكبَروا إِنّا بِالَّذي آمَنتُم بِهِ كافِرونَ
76.translation_eng: Those who were arrogant said, ‘We indeed disbelieve in what you have believed.’
76.transliteration: qāla lladhīna stakbarū ʾinnā bi-lladhī ʾāmantum bihī kāfirūna

77.content: فَعَقَرُوا النّاقَةَ وَعَتَوا عَن أَمرِ رَبِّهِم وَقالوا يا صالِحُ ائتِنا بِما تَعِدُنا إِن كُنتَ مِنَ المُرسَلينَ
77.translation_eng: So they hamstrung the She-camel and defied the command of their Lord, and they said, ‘O Ṣāliḥ, bring us what you threaten us with, if you are one of the apostles.’
77.transliteration: fa-ʿaqarū n-nāqata wa-ʿataw ʿan ʾamri rabbihim wa-qālū yā-ṣāliḥu ʾtinā bi-mā taʿidunā ʾin kunta mina l-mursalīna

78.content: فَأَخَذَتهُمُ الرَّجفَةُ فَأَصبَحوا في دارِهِم جاثِمينَ
78.translation_eng: So the earthquake seized them, and they lay lifeless prostrate in their homes.
78.transliteration: fa-ʾakhadhathumu r-rajfatu fa-ʾaṣbaḥū fī dārihim jāthimīna

79.content: فَتَوَلّىٰ عَنهُم وَقالَ يا قَومِ لَقَد أَبلَغتُكُم رِسالَةَ رَبّي وَنَصَحتُ لَكُم وَلٰكِن لا تُحِبّونَ النّاصِحينَ
79.translation_eng: So he abandoned them [to their fate], and said, ‘O my people! Certainly I communicated to you the message of my Lord, and I was your well-wisher, but you did not like well-wishers.’
79.transliteration: fa-tawallā ʿanhum wa-qāla yā-qawmi la-qad ʾablaghtukum risālata rabbī wa-naṣaḥtu lakum wa-lākin lā tuḥibbūna n-nāṣiḥīna

80.content: وَلوطًا إِذ قالَ لِقَومِهِ أَتَأتونَ الفاحِشَةَ ما سَبَقَكُم بِها مِن أَحَدٍ مِنَ العالَمينَ
80.translation_eng: And Lot, when he said to his people, ‘What! Do you commit an outrage none in the world ever committed before you?!
80.transliteration: wa-lūṭan ʾidh qāla li-qawmihī ʾa-taʾtūna l-fāḥishata mā sabaqakum bihā min ʾaḥadin mina l-ʿālamīna

81.content: إِنَّكُم لَتَأتونَ الرِّجالَ شَهوَةً مِن دونِ النِّساءِ ۚ بَل أَنتُم قَومٌ مُسرِفونَ
81.translation_eng: Indeed you come to men with desire1 instead of women! Rather you are a profligate lot.’Desire: sexual appetite or a sexual urge.
81.transliteration: ʾinnakum la-taʾtūna r-rijāla shahwatan min dūni n-nisāʾi bal ʾantum qawmun musrifūna

82.content: وَما كانَ جَوابَ قَومِهِ إِلّا أَن قالوا أَخرِجوهُم مِن قَريَتِكُم ۖ إِنَّهُم أُناسٌ يَتَطَهَّرونَ
82.translation_eng: But the only answer of his people was that they said, ‘Expel them from your town! They are indeed a puritanical lot.’
82.transliteration: wa-mā kāna jawāba qawmihī ʾillā ʾan qālū ʾakhrijūhum min qaryatikum ʾinnahum ʾunāsun yataṭahharūna

83.content: فَأَنجَيناهُ وَأَهلَهُ إِلَّا امرَأَتَهُ كانَت مِنَ الغابِرينَ
83.translation_eng: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife; she was one of those who remained behind.
83.transliteration: fa-ʾanjaynāhu wa-ʾahlahū ʾillā mraʾatahū kānat mina l-ghābirīna

84.content: وَأَمطَرنا عَلَيهِم مَطَرًا ۖ فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ المُجرِمينَ
84.translation_eng: Then We poured down upon them a rain [of stones]. So observe how was the fate of the guilty!
84.transliteration: wa-ʾamṭarnā ʿalayhim maṭaran fa-nẓur kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu l-mujrimīna

85.content: وَإِلىٰ مَديَنَ أَخاهُم شُعَيبًا ۗ قالَ يا قَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ ۖ قَد جاءَتكُم بَيِّنَةٌ مِن رَبِّكُم ۖ فَأَوفُوا الكَيلَ وَالميزانَ وَلا تَبخَسُوا النّاسَ أَشياءَهُم وَلا تُفسِدوا فِي الأَرضِ بَعدَ إِصلاحِها ۚ ذٰلِكُم خَيرٌ لَكُم إِن كُنتُم مُؤمِنينَ
85.translation_eng: And to [the people of] Midian, Shuʿayb, their brother. He said, ‘O my people, worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. There has certainly come to you a manifest proof from your Lord. Observe fully the measure and the balance, and do not cheat the people of their goods,1 and do not cause corruption on the earth after its restoration. That is better for you, if you are faithful.That is, by employing short weights and measures.
85.transliteration: wa-ʾilā madyana ʾakhāhum shuʿayban qāla yā-qawmi ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū qad jāʾatkum bayyinatun min rabbikum fa-ʾawfū l-kayla wa-l-mīzāna wa-lā tabkhasū n-nāsa ʾashyāʾahum wa-lā tufsidū fī l-ʾarḍi baʿda ʾiṣlāḥihā dhālikum khayrun lakum ʾin kuntum muʾminīna

86.content: وَلا تَقعُدوا بِكُلِّ صِراطٍ توعِدونَ وَتَصُدّونَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ مَن آمَنَ بِهِ وَتَبغونَها عِوَجًا ۚ وَاذكُروا إِذ كُنتُم قَليلًا فَكَثَّرَكُم ۖ وَانظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ المُفسِدينَ
86.translation_eng: And do not lie in wait on every road to threaten and bar from the way of Allah those who have faith in Him, seeking to make it crooked. And remember when you were few, and He multiplied you, and observe how was the fate of the agents of corruption.
86.transliteration: wa-lā taqʿudū bi-kulli ṣirāṭin tūʿidūna wa-taṣuddūna ʿan sabīli llāhi man ʾāmana bihī wa-tabghūnahā ʿiwajan wa-dhkurū ʾidh kuntum qalīlan fa-kaththarakum wa-nẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu l-mufsidīna

87.content: وَإِن كانَ طائِفَةٌ مِنكُم آمَنوا بِالَّذي أُرسِلتُ بِهِ وَطائِفَةٌ لَم يُؤمِنوا فَاصبِروا حَتّىٰ يَحكُمَ اللَّهُ بَينَنا ۚ وَهُوَ خَيرُ الحاكِمينَ
87.translation_eng: If a group of you have believed in what I have been sent with, and a group have not believed, be patient until Allah judges between us, and He is the best of judges.’
87.transliteration: wa-ʾin kāna ṭāʾifatun minkum ʾāmanū bi-lladhī ʾursiltu bihī wa-ṭāʾifatun lam yuʾminū fa-ṣbirū ḥattā yaḥkuma llāhu baynanā wa-huwa khayru l-ḥākimīna

88.content: ۞ قالَ المَلَأُ الَّذينَ استَكبَروا مِن قَومِهِ لَنُخرِجَنَّكَ يا شُعَيبُ وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا مَعَكَ مِن قَريَتِنا أَو لَتَعودُنَّ في مِلَّتِنا ۚ قالَ أَوَلَو كُنّا كارِهينَ
88.translation_eng: The elite of his people who were arrogant said, ‘O Shuʿayb, we will surely expel you and the faithful who are with you from our town, or else you shall revert to our creed.’ He said, ‘What! Even if we should be unwilling?!
88.transliteration: qāla l-malaʾu lladhīna stakbarū min qawmihī la-nukhrijannaka yā-shuʿaybu wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū maʿaka min qaryatinā ʾaw la-taʿūdunna fī millatinā qāla ʾa-wa-law kunnā kārihīna

89.content: قَدِ افتَرَينا عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا إِن عُدنا في مِلَّتِكُم بَعدَ إِذ نَجّانَا اللَّهُ مِنها ۚ وَما يَكونُ لَنا أَن نَعودَ فيها إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ رَبُّنا ۚ وَسِعَ رَبُّنا كُلَّ شَيءٍ عِلمًا ۚ عَلَى اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلنا ۚ رَبَّنَا افتَح بَينَنا وَبَينَ قَومِنا بِالحَقِّ وَأَنتَ خَيرُ الفاتِحينَ
89.translation_eng: We would be fabricating a lie against Allah should we revert to your creed after Allah had delivered us from it. It does not behoove us to return to it, unless Allah, our Lord, should wish so. Our Lord embraces all things in [His] knowledge. In Allah we have put our trust.’ ‘Our Lord! Judge justly between us and our people, and You are the best of judges!’
89.transliteration: qadi ftaraynā ʿalā llāhi kadhiban ʾin ʿudnā fī millatikum baʿda ʾidh najjānā llāhu minhā wa-mā yakūnu lanā ʾan naʿūda fīhā ʾillā ʾan yashāʾa llāhu rabbunā wasiʿa rabbunā kulla shayʾin ʿilman ʿalā llāhi tawakkalnā rabbanā ftaḥ baynanā wa-bayna qawminā bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾanta khayru l-fātiḥīna

90.content: وَقالَ المَلَأُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن قَومِهِ لَئِنِ اتَّبَعتُم شُعَيبًا إِنَّكُم إِذًا لَخاسِرونَ
90.translation_eng: The elite of his people who were faithless said, ‘If you follow Shuʿayb, you will indeed be losers.’
90.transliteration: wa-qāla l-malaʾu lladhīna kafarū min qawmihī la-ʾini ttabaʿtum shuʿayban ʾinnakum ʾidhan la-khāsirūna

91.content: فَأَخَذَتهُمُ الرَّجفَةُ فَأَصبَحوا في دارِهِم جاثِمينَ
91.translation_eng: So the earthquake seized them, and they lay lifeless prostrate in their homes.
91.transliteration: fa-ʾakhadhathumu r-rajfatu fa-ʾaṣbaḥū fī dārihim jāthimīna

92.content: الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا شُعَيبًا كَأَن لَم يَغنَوا فيهَا ۚ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا شُعَيبًا كانوا هُمُ الخاسِرينَ
92.translation_eng: Those who impugned Shuʿayb became as if they had never lived there. Those who impugned Shuʿayb were themselves the losers.
92.transliteration: alladhīna kadhdhabū shuʿayban ka-ʾan lam yaghnaw fīhā lladhīna kadhdhabū shuʿayban kānū humu l-khāsirīna

93.content: فَتَوَلّىٰ عَنهُم وَقالَ يا قَومِ لَقَد أَبلَغتُكُم رِسالاتِ رَبّي وَنَصَحتُ لَكُم ۖ فَكَيفَ آسىٰ عَلىٰ قَومٍ كافِرينَ
93.translation_eng: So he abandoned them [to their fate] and said, ‘O my people! Certainly I communicated to you the messages of my Lord, and I was your well-wisher. So how should I grieve for a faithless lot?’
93.transliteration: fa-tawallā ʿanhum wa-qāla yā-qawmi la-qad ʾablaghtukum risālāti rabbī wa-naṣaḥtu lakum fa-kayfa ʾāsā ʿalā qawmin kāfirīna

94.content: وَما أَرسَلنا في قَريَةٍ مِن نَبِيٍّ إِلّا أَخَذنا أَهلَها بِالبَأساءِ وَالضَّرّاءِ لَعَلَّهُم يَضَّرَّعونَ
94.translation_eng: We did not send a prophet to any town without visiting its people with stress and distress so that they might entreat [for Allah’s forgiveness].
94.transliteration: wa-mā ʾarsalnā fī qaryatin min nabiyyin ʾillā ʾakhadhnā ʾahlahā bi-l-baʾsāʾi wa-ḍ-ḍarrāʾi laʿallahum yaḍḍarraʿūna

95.content: ثُمَّ بَدَّلنا مَكانَ السَّيِّئَةِ الحَسَنَةَ حَتّىٰ عَفَوا وَقالوا قَد مَسَّ آباءَنَا الضَّرّاءُ وَالسَّرّاءُ فَأَخَذناهُم بَغتَةً وَهُم لا يَشعُرونَ
95.translation_eng: Then We changed the ill [conditions] to good until they multiplied [in numbers] and said, ‘Adversity and ease befell our fathers [too].’ Then We seized them suddenly while they were unaware.
95.transliteration: thumma baddalnā makāna s-sayyiʾati l-ḥasanata ḥattā ʿafaw wa-qālū qad massa ʾābāʾanā ḍ-ḍarrāʾu wa-s-sarrāʾu fa-ʾakhadhnāhum baghtatan wa-hum lā yashʿurūna

96.content: وَلَو أَنَّ أَهلَ القُرىٰ آمَنوا وَاتَّقَوا لَفَتَحنا عَلَيهِم بَرَكاتٍ مِنَ السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ وَلٰكِن كَذَّبوا فَأَخَذناهُم بِما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
96.translation_eng: If the people of the towns had been faithful and Godwary, We would have opened to them blessings from the heaven and the earth. But they denied; so We seized them because of what they used to earn.
96.transliteration: wa-law ʾanna ʾahla l-qurā ʾāmanū wa-ttaqaw la-fataḥnā ʿalayhim barakātin mina s-samāʾi wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-lākin kadhdhabū fa-ʾakhadhnāhum bi-mā kānū yaksibūna

97.content: أَفَأَمِنَ أَهلُ القُرىٰ أَن يَأتِيَهُم بَأسُنا بَياتًا وَهُم نائِمونَ
97.translation_eng: Do the people of the towns feel secure from Our punishment overtaking them at night while they are asleep?
97.transliteration: ʾa-fa-ʾamina ʾahlu l-qurā ʾan yaʾtiyahum baʾsunā bayātan wa-hum nāʾimūna

98.content: أَوَأَمِنَ أَهلُ القُرىٰ أَن يَأتِيَهُم بَأسُنا ضُحًى وَهُم يَلعَبونَ
98.translation_eng: Do the people of the towns feel secure from Our punishment overtaking them at midday while they are playing around?
98.transliteration: ʾawa ʾamina ʾahlu l-qurā ʾan yaʾtiyahum baʾsunā ḍuḥan wa-hum yalʿabūna

99.content: أَفَأَمِنوا مَكرَ اللَّهِ ۚ فَلا يَأمَنُ مَكرَ اللَّهِ إِلَّا القَومُ الخاسِرونَ
99.translation_eng: Do they feel secure from Allah’s devising? No one feels secure from Allah’s devising except the people who are losers.
99.transliteration: ʾa-fa-ʾaminū makra llāhi fa-lā yaʾmanu makra llāhi ʾillā l-qawmu l-khāsirūna

100.content: أَوَلَم يَهدِ لِلَّذينَ يَرِثونَ الأَرضَ مِن بَعدِ أَهلِها أَن لَو نَشاءُ أَصَبناهُم بِذُنوبِهِم ۚ وَنَطبَعُ عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم فَهُم لا يَسمَعونَ
100.translation_eng: Does it not dawn upon those who inherited the earth after its [former] inhabitants that if We wish We will punish them for their sins, and set a seal on their hearts so they would not hear?
100.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yahdi li-lladhīna yarithūna l-ʾarḍa min baʿdi ʾahlihā ʾan law nashāʾu ʾaṣabnāhum bi-dhunūbihim wa-naṭbaʿu ʿalā qulūbihim fa-hum lā yasmaʿūna

101.content: تِلكَ القُرىٰ نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ مِن أَنبائِها ۚ وَلَقَد جاءَتهُم رُسُلُهُم بِالبَيِّناتِ فَما كانوا لِيُؤمِنوا بِما كَذَّبوا مِن قَبلُ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يَطبَعُ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ قُلوبِ الكافِرينَ
101.translation_eng: These are the towns some of whose accounts We recount to you. Their apostles certainly brought them manifest proofs, but they were not the ones to believe in what they had denied earlier. Thus does Allah put a seal on the hearts of the faithless.
101.transliteration: tilka l-qurā naquṣṣu ʿalayka min ʾanbāʾihā wa-la-qad jāʾathum rusuluhum bi-l-bayyināti fa-mā kānū li-yuʾminū bi-mā kadhdhabū min qablu ka-dhālika yaṭbaʿu llāhu ʿalā qulūbi l-kāfirīna

102.content: وَما وَجَدنا لِأَكثَرِهِم مِن عَهدٍ ۖ وَإِن وَجَدنا أَكثَرَهُم لَفاسِقينَ
102.translation_eng: We did not find in most of them any [loyalty to] covenants. Indeed We found most of them to be transgressors.
102.transliteration: wa-mā wajadnā li-ʾaktharihim min ʿahdin wa-ʾin wajadnā ʾaktharahum la-fāsiqīna

103.content: ثُمَّ بَعَثنا مِن بَعدِهِم موسىٰ بِآياتِنا إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَمَلَئِهِ فَظَلَموا بِها ۖ فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ المُفسِدينَ
103.translation_eng: Then after them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his elite, but they wronged them. So observe how was the fate of the agents of corruption!
103.transliteration: thumma baʿathnā min baʿdihim mūsā bi-ʾāyātinā ʾilā firʿawna wa-malaʾihī fa-ẓalamū bihā fa-nẓur kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu l-mufsidīna

104.content: وَقالَ موسىٰ يا فِرعَونُ إِنّي رَسولٌ مِن رَبِّ العالَمينَ
104.translation_eng: And Moses said, ‘O Pharaoh, I am indeed an apostle from the Lord of all the worlds.
104.transliteration: wa-qāla mūsā yā-firʿawnu ʾinnī rasūlun min rabbi l-ʿālamīna

105.content: حَقيقٌ عَلىٰ أَن لا أَقولَ عَلَى اللَّهِ إِلَّا الحَقَّ ۚ قَد جِئتُكُم بِبَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبِّكُم فَأَرسِل مَعِيَ بَني إِسرائيلَ
105.translation_eng: It behooves me to say nothing about Allah except the truth. I certainly bring you a manifest proof from your Lord. So let the Children of Israel go with me.’
105.transliteration: ḥaqīqun ʿalā ʾan lā ʾaqūla ʿalā llāhi ʾillā l-ḥaqqa qad jiʾtukum bi-bayyinatin min rabbikum fa-ʾarsil maʿiya banī ʾisrāʾīla

106.content: قالَ إِن كُنتَ جِئتَ بِآيَةٍ فَأتِ بِها إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
106.translation_eng: He said, ‘If you have brought a sign, produce it, should you be truthful.’
106.transliteration: qāla ʾin kunta jiʾta bi-ʾāyatin fa-ʾti bihā ʾin kunta mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

107.content: فَأَلقىٰ عَصاهُ فَإِذا هِيَ ثُعبانٌ مُبينٌ
107.translation_eng: Thereat he threw down his staff, and behold, it became a manifest python.
107.transliteration: fa-ʾalqā ʿaṣāhu fa-ʾidhā hiya thuʿbānun mubīnun

108.content: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذا هِيَ بَيضاءُ لِلنّاظِرينَ
108.translation_eng: Then he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to the onlookers.
108.transliteration: wa-nazaʿa yadahū fa-ʾidhā hiya bayḍāʾu li-n-nāẓirīna

109.content: قالَ المَلَأُ مِن قَومِ فِرعَونَ إِنَّ هٰذا لَساحِرٌ عَليمٌ
109.translation_eng: The elite of Pharaoh’s people said, ‘This is indeed an expert magician;
109.transliteration: qāla l-malaʾu min qawmi firʿawna ʾinna hādhā la-sāḥirun ʿalīmun

110.content: يُريدُ أَن يُخرِجَكُم مِن أَرضِكُم ۖ فَماذا تَأمُرونَ
110.translation_eng: he seeks to expel you from your land.’ ‘So what do you advise?’
110.transliteration: yurīdu ʾan yukhrijakum min ʾarḍikum fa-mādhā taʾmurūna

111.content: قالوا أَرجِه وَأَخاهُ وَأَرسِل فِي المَدائِنِ حاشِرينَ
111.translation_eng: They said, ‘Put him and his brother off for a while, and send heralds to the cities,
111.transliteration: qālū ʾarjih wa-ʾakhāhu wa-ʾarsil fī l-madāʾini ḥāshirīna

112.translation_eng: to bring you every expert magician.’

113.content: وَجاءَ السَّحَرَةُ فِرعَونَ قالوا إِنَّ لَنا لَأَجرًا إِن كُنّا نَحنُ الغالِبينَ
113.translation_eng: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, ‘We shall indeed have a reward if we were to be the victors?’1This is in accordance with the reading of Ḥafṣ and that of the Ḥijāzī qārīs. However, in accordance with an alternate reading (with an interrogative hamzah before inna, exactly as in 26:41, a parallel verse) the translation will be, ‘Shall we indeed have a reward if we were to be the victors?’ (see Muʿjam al-Qirāʾāt al-Qurʾāniyyah, ii, pp. 388-389).
113.transliteration: wa-jāʾa s-saḥaratu firʿawna qālū ʾinna lanā la-ʾajran ʾin kunnā naḥnu l-ghālibīna

114.translation_eng: He said, ‘Of course! And indeed you shall be among those near [to me].’

115.content: قالوا يا موسىٰ إِمّا أَن تُلقِيَ وَإِمّا أَن نَكونَ نَحنُ المُلقينَ
115.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Moses, will you throw [first], or shall we throw?’
115.transliteration: qālū yā-mūsā ʾimmā ʾan tulqiya wa-ʾimmā ʾan nakūna naḥnu l-mulqīna

116.content: قالَ أَلقوا ۖ فَلَمّا أَلقَوا سَحَروا أَعيُنَ النّاسِ وَاستَرهَبوهُم وَجاءوا بِسِحرٍ عَظيمٍ
116.translation_eng: He said, ‘Throw [yours].’ So when they threw, they bewitched the people’s eyes and overawed them, producing a tremendous magic.
116.transliteration: qāla ʾalqū fa-lammā ʾalqaw saḥarū ʾaʿyuna n-nāsi wa-starhabūhum wa-jāʾū bi-siḥrin ʿaẓīmin

117.content: ۞ وَأَوحَينا إِلىٰ موسىٰ أَن أَلقِ عَصاكَ ۖ فَإِذا هِيَ تَلقَفُ ما يَأفِكونَ
117.translation_eng: And We signalled to Moses: ‘Throw down your staff.’ And behold, it was swallowing what they had faked.
117.transliteration: wa-ʾawḥaynā ʾilā mūsā ʾan ʾalqi ʿaṣāka fa-ʾidhā hiya talqafu mā yaʾfikūna

118.content: فَوَقَعَ الحَقُّ وَبَطَلَ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
118.translation_eng: So the truth came out, and what they had wrought was reduced to naught.
118.transliteration: fa-waqaʿa l-ḥaqqu wa-baṭala mā kānū yaʿmalūna

119.translation_eng: Thereat they were vanquished, and they retreated, humiliated.

120.translation_eng: And the magicians fell down in prostration.

121.translation_eng: They said, ‘We have believed in the Lord of all the worlds,

122.translation_eng: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.’

123.content: قالَ فِرعَونُ آمَنتُم بِهِ قَبلَ أَن آذَنَ لَكُم ۖ إِنَّ هٰذا لَمَكرٌ مَكَرتُموهُ فِي المَدينَةِ لِتُخرِجوا مِنها أَهلَها ۖ فَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ
123.translation_eng: Pharaoh said, ‘Do you profess faith in Him before I may permit you? It is indeed a plot you have devised in the city to expel its people from it. Soon you will know [the consequences]!
