123.transliteration: qāla firʿawnu ʾāmantum bihī qabla ʾan ʾādhana lakum ʾinna hādhā la-makrun makartumūhu fī l-madīnati li-tukhrijū minhā ʾahlahā fa-sawfa taʿlamūna

124.content: لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيدِيَكُم وَأَرجُلَكُم مِن خِلافٍ ثُمَّ لَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُم أَجمَعينَ
124.translation_eng: Surely I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and then I will surely crucify all of you.’
124.transliteration: la-ʾuqaṭṭiʿanna ʾaydiyakum wa-ʾarjulakum min khilāfin thumma la-ʾuṣallibannakum ʾajmaʿīna

125.translation_eng: They said, ‘Indeed we shall return to our Lord.

126.content: وَما تَنقِمُ مِنّا إِلّا أَن آمَنّا بِآياتِ رَبِّنا لَمّا جاءَتنا ۚ رَبَّنا أَفرِغ عَلَينا صَبرًا وَتَوَفَّنا مُسلِمينَ
126.translation_eng: You are vindictive toward us only because we have believed in the signs of our Lord, when they came to us.’ ‘Our Lord! Pour patience upon us, and grant us to die as muslims.’
126.transliteration: wa-mā tanqimu minnā ʾillā ʾan ʾāmannā bi-ʾāyāti rabbinā lammā jāʾatnā rabbanā ʾafrigh ʿalaynā ṣabran wa-tawaffanā muslimīna

127.content: وَقالَ المَلَأُ مِن قَومِ فِرعَونَ أَتَذَرُ موسىٰ وَقَومَهُ لِيُفسِدوا فِي الأَرضِ وَيَذَرَكَ وَآلِهَتَكَ ۚ قالَ سَنُقَتِّلُ أَبناءَهُم وَنَستَحيي نِساءَهُم وَإِنّا فَوقَهُم قاهِرونَ
127.translation_eng: The elite of Pharaoh’s people said, ‘Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land, and to abandon you and your gods?’ He said, ‘We will kill their sons and spare their women, and indeed we are dominant over them.’
127.transliteration: wa-qāla l-malaʾu min qawmi firʿawna ʾa-tadharu mūsā wa-qawmahū li-yufsidū fī l-ʾarḍi wa-yadharaka wa-ʾālihataka qāla sa-nuqattilu ʾabnāʾahum wa-nastaḥyī nisāʾahum wa-ʾinnā fawqahum qāhirūna

128.content: قالَ موسىٰ لِقَومِهِ استَعينوا بِاللَّهِ وَاصبِروا ۖ إِنَّ الأَرضَ لِلَّهِ يورِثُها مَن يَشاءُ مِن عِبادِهِ ۖ وَالعاقِبَةُ لِلمُتَّقينَ
128.translation_eng: Moses said to his people, ‘Turn to Allah for help and be patient. The earth indeed belongs to Allah, and He gives its inheritance to whomever He wishes of His servants, and the outcome will be in favour of the Godwary.’
128.transliteration: qāla mūsā li-qawmihi staʿīnū bi-llāhi wa-ṣbirū ʾinna l-ʾarḍa li-llāhi yūrithuhā man yashāʾu min ʿibādihī wa-l-ʿāqibatu li-l-muttaqīna

129.content: قالوا أوذينا مِن قَبلِ أَن تَأتِيَنا وَمِن بَعدِ ما جِئتَنا ۚ قالَ عَسىٰ رَبُّكُم أَن يُهلِكَ عَدُوَّكُم وَيَستَخلِفَكُم فِي الأَرضِ فَيَنظُرَ كَيفَ تَعمَلونَ
129.translation_eng: They said, ‘We were tormented before you came to us and [also] after you came to us.’ He said, ‘Maybe your Lord will destroy your enemy and make you successors in the land, and then He will see how you act.’
129.transliteration: qālū ʾūdhīnā min qabli ʾan taʾtiyanā wa-min baʿdi mā jiʾtanā qāla ʿasā rabbukum ʾan yuhlika ʿaduwwakum wa-yastakhlifakum fī l-ʾarḍi fa-yanẓura kayfa taʿmalūna

130.content: وَلَقَد أَخَذنا آلَ فِرعَونَ بِالسِّنينَ وَنَقصٍ مِنَ الثَّمَراتِ لَعَلَّهُم يَذَّكَّرونَ
130.translation_eng: Certainly We afflicted Pharaoh’s clan with droughts and loss of produce, so that they may take admonition.
130.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾakhadhnā ʾāla firʿawna bi-s-sinīna wa-naqṣin mina th-thamarāti laʿallahum yadhdhakkarūna

131.content: فَإِذا جاءَتهُمُ الحَسَنَةُ قالوا لَنا هٰذِهِ ۖ وَإِن تُصِبهُم سَيِّئَةٌ يَطَّيَّروا بِموسىٰ وَمَن مَعَهُ ۗ أَلا إِنَّما طائِرُهُم عِندَ اللَّهِ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
131.translation_eng: But whenever any good came to them, they would say, ‘This is our due.’ And if any ill visited them, they took it for ill omens attending Moses and those who were with him. (Look! Indeed the cause of their ill omens is with Allah, but most of them do not know.)
131.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā jāʾathumu l-ḥasanatu qālū lanā hādhihī wa-ʾin tuṣibhum sayyiʾatun yaṭṭayyarū bi-mūsā wa-man maʿahū ʾa-lā ʾinnamā ṭāʾiruhum ʿinda llāhi wa-lākinna ʾaktharahum lā yaʿlamūna

132.content: وَقالوا مَهما تَأتِنا بِهِ مِن آيَةٍ لِتَسحَرَنا بِها فَما نَحنُ لَكَ بِمُؤمِنينَ
132.translation_eng: And they said, ‘Whatever sign you may bring us to bewitch us, we are not going to believe you.’
132.transliteration: wa-qālū mahmā taʾtinā bihī min ʾāyatin li-tasḥaranā bihā fa-mā naḥnu laka bi-muʾminīna

133.content: فَأَرسَلنا عَلَيهِمُ الطّوفانَ وَالجَرادَ وَالقُمَّلَ وَالضَّفادِعَ وَالدَّمَ آياتٍ مُفَصَّلاتٍ فَاستَكبَروا وَكانوا قَومًا مُجرِمينَ
133.translation_eng: So We sent against them a flood and locusts, lice, frogs and blood, as distinct signs. But they acted arrogantly, and they were a guilty lot.
133.transliteration: fa-ʾarsalnā ʿalayhimu ṭ-ṭūfāna wa-l-jarāda wa-l-qummala wa-ḍ-ḍafādiʿa wa-d-dama ʾāyātin mufaṣṣalātin fa-stakbarū wa-kānū qawman mujrimīna

134.content: وَلَمّا وَقَعَ عَلَيهِمُ الرِّجزُ قالوا يا موسَى ادعُ لَنا رَبَّكَ بِما عَهِدَ عِندَكَ ۖ لَئِن كَشَفتَ عَنَّا الرِّجزَ لَنُؤمِنَنَّ لَكَ وَلَنُرسِلَنَّ مَعَكَ بَني إِسرائيلَ
134.translation_eng: Whenever a plague fell upon them, they would say, ‘O Moses, invoke your Lord for us by the covenant He has made with you. If you remove the plague from us, we will certainly believe in you and let the Children of Israel go along with you.’
134.transliteration: wa-lammā waqaʿa ʿalayhimu r-rijzu qālū yā-mūsā dʿu lanā rabbaka bi-mā ʿahida ʿindaka la-ʾin kashafta ʿannā r-rijza la-nuʾminanna laka wa-la-nursilanna maʿaka banī ʾisrāʾīla

135.content: فَلَمّا كَشَفنا عَنهُمُ الرِّجزَ إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ هُم بالِغوهُ إِذا هُم يَنكُثونَ
135.translation_eng: But when We had removed the plague from them until a term that they should have completed, behold, they broke their promise.
135.transliteration: fa-lammā kashafnā ʿanhumu r-rijza ʾilā ʾajalin hum bālighūhu ʾidhā hum yankuthūna

136.content: فَانتَقَمنا مِنهُم فَأَغرَقناهُم فِي اليَمِّ بِأَنَّهُم كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا وَكانوا عَنها غافِلينَ
136.translation_eng: So We took vengeance on them and drowned them in the sea, for they denied Our signs and were oblivious to them.
136.transliteration: fa-ntaqamnā minhum fa-ʾaghraqnāhum fī l-yammi bi-ʾannahum kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā wa-kānū ʿanhā ghāfilīna

137.content: وَأَورَثنَا القَومَ الَّذينَ كانوا يُستَضعَفونَ مَشارِقَ الأَرضِ وَمَغارِبَهَا الَّتي بارَكنا فيها ۖ وَتَمَّت كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ الحُسنىٰ عَلىٰ بَني إِسرائيلَ بِما صَبَروا ۖ وَدَمَّرنا ما كانَ يَصنَعُ فِرعَونُ وَقَومُهُ وَما كانوا يَعرِشونَ
137.translation_eng: We made the people who were abased the heirs to the east and west of the land which We had blessed, and your Lord’s best word [of promise] was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of their patience, and We destroyed what Pharaoh and his people had built and what they used to erect.
137.transliteration: wa-ʾawrathnā l-qawma lladhīna kānū yustaḍʿafūna mashāriqa l-ʾarḍi wa-maghāribahā llatī bāraknā fīhā wa-tammat kalimatu rabbika l-ḥusnā ʿalā banī ʾisrāʾīla bi-mā ṣabarū wa-dammarnā mā kāna yaṣnaʿu firʿawnu wa-qawmuhū wa-mā kānū yaʿrishūna

138.content: وَجاوَزنا بِبَني إِسرائيلَ البَحرَ فَأَتَوا عَلىٰ قَومٍ يَعكُفونَ عَلىٰ أَصنامٍ لَهُم ۚ قالوا يا موسَى اجعَل لَنا إِلٰهًا كَما لَهُم آلِهَةٌ ۚ قالَ إِنَّكُم قَومٌ تَجهَلونَ
138.translation_eng: We carried the Children of Israel across the sea, whereat they came upon a people cleaving to certain idols that they had. They said, ‘O Moses, make for us a god like the gods that they have.’ He said, ‘You are indeed an ignorant lot.
138.transliteration: wa-jāwaznā bi-banī ʾisrāʾīla l-baḥra fa-ʾataw ʿalā qawmin yaʿkufūna ʿalā ʾaṣnāmin lahum qālū yā-mūsā jʿal lanā ʾilāhan ka-mā lahum ʾālihatun qāla ʾinnakum qawmun tajhalūna

139.content: إِنَّ هٰؤُلاءِ مُتَبَّرٌ ما هُم فيهِ وَباطِلٌ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
139.translation_eng: What they are engaged in is indeed bound to perish, and what they have been doing shall come to naught.’
139.transliteration: ʾinna hāʾulāʾi mutabbarun mā hum fīhi wa-bāṭilun mā kānū yaʿmalūna

140.content: قالَ أَغَيرَ اللَّهِ أَبغيكُم إِلٰهًا وَهُوَ فَضَّلَكُم عَلَى العالَمينَ
140.translation_eng: He said, ‘Shall I find you a god other than Allah, while He has graced you over all the nations?’
140.transliteration: qāla ʾa-ghayra llāhi ʾabghīkum ʾilāhan wa-huwa faḍḍalakum ʿalā l-ʿālamīna

141.content: وَإِذ أَنجَيناكُم مِن آلِ فِرعَونَ يَسومونَكُم سوءَ العَذابِ ۖ يُقَتِّلونَ أَبناءَكُم وَيَستَحيونَ نِساءَكُم ۚ وَفي ذٰلِكُم بَلاءٌ مِن رَبِّكُم عَظيمٌ
141.translation_eng: And when We delivered you from Pharaoh’s clan who inflicted on you a terrible torment, slaughtering your sons and sparing your women, and there was a great test in that from your Lord.
141.transliteration: wa-ʾidh ʾanjaynākum min ʾāli firʿawna yasūmūnakum sūʾa l-ʿadhābi yuqattilūna ʾabnāʾakum wa-yastaḥyūna nisāʾakum wa-fī dhālikum balāʾun min rabbikum ʿaẓīmun

142.content: ۞ وَواعَدنا موسىٰ ثَلاثينَ لَيلَةً وَأَتمَمناها بِعَشرٍ فَتَمَّ ميقاتُ رَبِّهِ أَربَعينَ لَيلَةً ۚ وَقالَ موسىٰ لِأَخيهِ هارونَ اخلُفني في قَومي وَأَصلِح وَلا تَتَّبِع سَبيلَ المُفسِدينَ
142.translation_eng: And We made an appointment with Moses for thirty nights, and completed them with ten [more]; thus the tryst of his Lord was completed in forty nights. And Moses said to Aaron, his brother, ‘Be my successor among my people, and set things right and do not follow the way of the agents of corruption.’
142.transliteration: wa-wāʿadnā mūsā thalāthīna laylatan wa-ʾatmamnāhā bi-ʿashrin fa-tamma mīqātu rabbihī ʾarbaʿīna laylatan wa-qāla mūsā li-ʾakhīhi hārūna khlufnī fī qawmī wa-ʾaṣliḥ wa-lā tattabiʿ sabīla l-mufsidīna

143.content: وَلَمّا جاءَ موسىٰ لِميقاتِنا وَكَلَّمَهُ رَبُّهُ قالَ رَبِّ أَرِني أَنظُر إِلَيكَ ۚ قالَ لَن تَراني وَلٰكِنِ انظُر إِلَى الجَبَلِ فَإِنِ استَقَرَّ مَكانَهُ فَسَوفَ تَراني ۚ فَلَمّا تَجَلّىٰ رَبُّهُ لِلجَبَلِ جَعَلَهُ دَكًّا وَخَرَّ موسىٰ صَعِقًا ۚ فَلَمّا أَفاقَ قالَ سُبحانَكَ تُبتُ إِلَيكَ وَأَنا أَوَّلُ المُؤمِنينَ
143.translation_eng: When Moses arrived at Our tryst and his Lord spoke to him, he said, ‘My Lord, show [Yourself] to me, that I may look at You!’ He said, ‘You shall not see Me. But look at the mountain: if it abides in its place, then you will see Me.’ So when his Lord disclosed Himself to the mountain, He levelled it, and Moses1 fell down swooning. And when he recovered, he said, ‘Immaculate are You! I turn to You in penitence, and I am the first of the faithful.’Or ‘He made it crumble.’
143.transliteration: wa-lammā jāʾa mūsā li-mīqātinā wa-kallamahū rabbuhū qāla rabbi ʾarinī ʾanẓur ʾilayka qāla lan tarānī wa-lākini nẓur ʾilā l-jabali fa-ʾini staqarra makānahū fa-sawfa tarānī fa-lammā tajallā rabbuhū li-l-jabali jaʿalahū dakkan wa-kharra mūsā ṣaʿiqan fa-lammā ʾafāqa qāla subḥānaka tubtu ʾilayka wa-ʾana ʾawwalu l-muʾminīna

144.content: قالَ يا موسىٰ إِنِّي اصطَفَيتُكَ عَلَى النّاسِ بِرِسالاتي وَبِكَلامي فَخُذ ما آتَيتُكَ وَكُن مِنَ الشّاكِرينَ
144.translation_eng: He said, ‘O Moses, I have chosen you over the people with My messages and My speech. So take what I give you, and be among the grateful.’
144.transliteration: qāla yā-mūsā ʾinnī ṣṭafaytuka ʿalā n-nāsi bi-risālātī wa-bi-kalāmī fa-khudh mā ʾātaytuka wa-kun mina sh-shākirīna

145.content: وَكَتَبنا لَهُ فِي الأَلواحِ مِن كُلِّ شَيءٍ مَوعِظَةً وَتَفصيلًا لِكُلِّ شَيءٍ فَخُذها بِقُوَّةٍ وَأمُر قَومَكَ يَأخُذوا بِأَحسَنِها ۚ سَأُريكُم دارَ الفاسِقينَ
145.translation_eng: And We wrote for him in the Tablets advice concerning all things and an elaboration of all things, [and We said], ‘Hold on to them with power, and bid your people to hold on to the best of [what is in] them. Soon I shall show you the abode of the transgressors.
145.transliteration: wa-katabnā lahū fī l-ʾalwāḥi min kulli shayʾin mawʿiẓatan wa-tafṣīlan li-kulli shayʾin fa-khudhhā bi-quwwatin wa-ʾmur qawmaka yaʾkhudhū bi-ʾaḥsanihā sa-ʾurīkum dāra l-fāsiqīna

146.content: سَأَصرِفُ عَن آياتِيَ الَّذينَ يَتَكَبَّرونَ فِي الأَرضِ بِغَيرِ الحَقِّ وَإِن يَرَوا كُلَّ آيَةٍ لا يُؤمِنوا بِها وَإِن يَرَوا سَبيلَ الرُّشدِ لا يَتَّخِذوهُ سَبيلًا وَإِن يَرَوا سَبيلَ الغَيِّ يَتَّخِذوهُ سَبيلًا ۚ ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُم كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا وَكانوا عَنها غافِلينَ
146.translation_eng: Soon I shall turn away from My signs those who are unduly arrogant in the earth: [even] though they should see every sign, they will not believe in it, and if they see the way of rectitude they will not take it as [their] way, and if they see the way of error they will take it as [their] way. That is because they deny Our signs and are oblivious to them.’
146.transliteration: sa-ʾaṣrifu ʿan ʾāyātiya lladhīna yatakabbarūna fī l-ʾarḍi bi-ghayri l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾin yaraw kulla ʾāyatin lā yuʾminū bihā wa-ʾin yaraw sabīla r-rushdi lā yattakhidhūhu sabīlan wa-ʾin yaraw sabīla l-ghayyi yattakhidhūhu sabīlan dhālika bi-ʾannahum kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā wa-kānū ʿanhā ghāfilīna

147.content: وَالَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا وَلِقاءِ الآخِرَةِ حَبِطَت أَعمالُهُم ۚ هَل يُجزَونَ إِلّا ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
147.translation_eng: Those who deny Our signs and the encounter of the Hereafter, their works have failed. Shall they be requited except for what they used to do?
147.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā wa-liqāʾi l-ʾākhirati ḥabiṭat ʾaʿmāluhum hal yujzawna ʾillā mā kānū yaʿmalūna

148.content: وَاتَّخَذَ قَومُ موسىٰ مِن بَعدِهِ مِن حُلِيِّهِم عِجلًا جَسَدًا لَهُ خُوارٌ ۚ أَلَم يَرَوا أَنَّهُ لا يُكَلِّمُهُم وَلا يَهديهِم سَبيلًا ۘ اتَّخَذوهُ وَكانوا ظالِمينَ
148.translation_eng: The people of Moses took up in his absence a calf [cast] from their ornaments —a body that gave out a lowing sound. Did they not regard that it did not speak to them, nor did it guide them to any way? They took it up [for worship] and they were wrongdoers.
148.transliteration: wa-ttakhadha qawmu mūsā min baʿdihī min ḥuliyyihim ʿijlan jasadan lahū khuwārun ʾa-lam yaraw ʾannahū lā yukallimuhum wa-lā yahdīhim sabīlan-i ittakhadhūhu wa-kānū ẓālimīna

149.content: وَلَمّا سُقِطَ في أَيديهِم وَرَأَوا أَنَّهُم قَد ضَلّوا قالوا لَئِن لَم يَرحَمنا رَبُّنا وَيَغفِر لَنا لَنَكونَنَّ مِنَ الخاسِرينَ
149.translation_eng: But when they became remorseful and realised they had gone astray, they said, ‘Should our Lord have no mercy on us, and forgive us, we will be surely among the losers.’
149.transliteration: wa-lammā suqiṭa fī ʾaydīhim wa-raʾaw ʾannahum qad ḍallū qālū la-ʾin lam yarḥamnā rabbunā wa-yaghfir lanā la-nakūnanna mina l-khāsirīna

150.content: وَلَمّا رَجَعَ موسىٰ إِلىٰ قَومِهِ غَضبانَ أَسِفًا قالَ بِئسَما خَلَفتُموني مِن بَعدي ۖ أَعَجِلتُم أَمرَ رَبِّكُم ۖ وَأَلقَى الأَلواحَ وَأَخَذَ بِرَأسِ أَخيهِ يَجُرُّهُ إِلَيهِ ۚ قالَ ابنَ أُمَّ إِنَّ القَومَ استَضعَفوني وَكادوا يَقتُلونَني فَلا تُشمِت بِيَ الأَعداءَ وَلا تَجعَلني مَعَ القَومِ الظّالِمينَ
150.translation_eng: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and indignant, he said, ‘Evil has been your conduct in my absence! Would you hasten on the edict of your Lord?’ He threw down the tablets and seized his brother by the head, pulling him towards himself. He said, ‘Son of my mother, indeed this people thought me to be weak, and they were about to kill me. So do not let the enemies gloat over me, and do not take me with the wrongdoing lot.’
150.transliteration: wa-lammā rajaʿa mūsā ʾilā qawmihī ghaḍbāna ʾasifan qāla biʾsamā khalaftumūnī min baʿdī ʾa-ʿajiltum ʾamra rabbikum wa-ʾalqā l-ʾalwāḥa wa-ʾakhadha bi-raʾsi ʾakhīhi yajurruhū ʾilayhi qāla bna ʾumma ʾinna l-qawma staḍʿafūnī wa-kādū yaqtulūnanī fa-lā tushmit biya l-ʾaʿdāʾa wa-lā tajʿalnī maʿa l-qawmi ẓ-ẓālimīna

151.content: قالَ رَبِّ اغفِر لي وَلِأَخي وَأَدخِلنا في رَحمَتِكَ ۖ وَأَنتَ أَرحَمُ الرّاحِمينَ
151.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord, forgive me and my brother, and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the most merciful of the merciful.
151.transliteration: qāla rabbi ghfir lī wa-li-ʾakhī wa-ʾadkhilnā fī raḥmatika wa-ʾanta ʾarḥamu r-rāḥimīna

152.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ اتَّخَذُوا العِجلَ سَيَنالُهُم غَضَبٌ مِن رَبِّهِم وَذِلَّةٌ فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۚ وَكَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي المُفتَرينَ
152.translation_eng: Indeed those who took up the calf [for worship] shall be overtaken by their Lord’s wrath and abasement in the life of the world.’ Thus do We requite the fabricators [of lies].
152.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ttakhadhū l-ʿijla sa-yanāluhum ghaḍabun min rabbihim wa-dhillatun fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-ka-dhālika najzī l-muftarīna

153.content: وَالَّذينَ عَمِلُوا السَّيِّئَاتِ ثُمَّ تابوا مِن بَعدِها وَآمَنوا إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِن بَعدِها لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
153.translation_eng: Yet [to] those who commit misdeeds but repent after that, and believe, —indeed, after that, your Lord shall surely be all-forgiving, all-merciful.
153.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ʿamilū s-sayyiʾāti thumma tābū min baʿdihā wa-ʾāmanū ʾinna rabbaka min baʿdihā la-ghafūrun raḥīmun

154.content: وَلَمّا سَكَتَ عَن موسَى الغَضَبُ أَخَذَ الأَلواحَ ۖ وَفي نُسخَتِها هُدًى وَرَحمَةٌ لِلَّذينَ هُم لِرَبِّهِم يَرهَبونَ
154.translation_eng: And when Moses’ indignation abated, he picked up the tablets whose inscriptions contained guidance and mercy for those who are in awe of their Lord.
154.transliteration: wa-lammā sakata ʿan mūsā l-ghaḍabu ʾakhadha l-ʾalwāḥa wa-fī nuskhatihā hudan wa-raḥmatun li-lladhīna hum li-rabbihim yarhabūna

155.content: وَاختارَ موسىٰ قَومَهُ سَبعينَ رَجُلًا لِميقاتِنا ۖ فَلَمّا أَخَذَتهُمُ الرَّجفَةُ قالَ رَبِّ لَو شِئتَ أَهلَكتَهُم مِن قَبلُ وَإِيّايَ ۖ أَتُهلِكُنا بِما فَعَلَ السُّفَهاءُ مِنّا ۖ إِن هِيَ إِلّا فِتنَتُكَ تُضِلُّ بِها مَن تَشاءُ وَتَهدي مَن تَشاءُ ۖ أَنتَ وَلِيُّنا فَاغفِر لَنا وَارحَمنا ۖ وَأَنتَ خَيرُ الغافِرينَ
155.translation_eng: Moses chose seventy men from his people for Our tryst, and when the earthquake seized them, he said, ‘My Lord, had You wished, You would have destroyed them and me before. Will You destroy us because of what the fools amongst us have done? It is only Your test by which You lead astray whomever You wish and guide whomever You wish. You are our master, so forgive us and have mercy on us, for You are the best of those who forgive.
155.transliteration: wa-khtāra mūsā qawmahū sabʿīna rajulan li-mīqātinā fa-lammā ʾakhadhathumu r-rajfatu qāla rabbi law shiʾta ʾahlaktahum min qablu wa-ʾiyyāya ʾa-tuhlikunā bi-mā faʿala s-sufahāʾu minnā ʾin hiya ʾillā fitnatuka tuḍillu bihā man tashāʾu wa-tahdī man tashāʾu ʾanta waliyyunā fa-ghfir lanā wa-rḥamnā wa-ʾanta khayru l-ghāfirīna

156.content: ۞ وَاكتُب لَنا في هٰذِهِ الدُّنيا حَسَنَةً وَفِي الآخِرَةِ إِنّا هُدنا إِلَيكَ ۚ قالَ عَذابي أُصيبُ بِهِ مَن أَشاءُ ۖ وَرَحمَتي وَسِعَت كُلَّ شَيءٍ ۚ فَسَأَكتُبُها لِلَّذينَ يَتَّقونَ وَيُؤتونَ الزَّكاةَ وَالَّذينَ هُم بِآياتِنا يُؤمِنونَ
156.translation_eng: And appoint goodness for us in this world and the Hereafter, for indeed we have come back to You.’ Said He, ‘I visit My punishment on whomever I wish, but My mercy embraces all things.1 Soon I shall appoint it for those who are Godwary and give the zakāt and those who believe in Our signsCf. 6:12.
156.transliteration: wa-ktub lanā fī hādhihi d-dunyā ḥasanatan wa-fī l-ʾākhirati ʾinnā hudnā ʾilayka qāla ʿadhābī ʾuṣību bihī man ʾashāʾu wa-raḥmatī wasiʿat kulla shayʾin fa-sa-ʾaktubuhā li-lladhīna yattaqūna wa-yuʾtūna z-zakāta wa-lladhīna hum bi-ʾāyātinā yuʾminūna

157.content: الَّذينَ يَتَّبِعونَ الرَّسولَ النَّبِيَّ الأُمِّيَّ الَّذي يَجِدونَهُ مَكتوبًا عِندَهُم فِي التَّوراةِ وَالإِنجيلِ يَأمُرُهُم بِالمَعروفِ وَيَنهاهُم عَنِ المُنكَرِ وَيُحِلُّ لَهُمُ الطَّيِّباتِ وَيُحَرِّمُ عَلَيهِمُ الخَبائِثَ وَيَضَعُ عَنهُم إِصرَهُم وَالأَغلالَ الَّتي كانَت عَلَيهِم ۚ فَالَّذينَ آمَنوا بِهِ وَعَزَّروهُ وَنَصَروهُ وَاتَّبَعُوا النّورَ الَّذي أُنزِلَ مَعَهُ ۙ أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُفلِحونَ
157.translation_eng: —those who follow the Apostle, the uninstructed prophet, whose mention they find written with them in the Torah and the Evangel, who bids them to do what is right and forbids them from what is wrong, makes lawful to them all the good things and forbids them from all vicious things, and relieves them of their burdens and the shackles that were upon them —those who believe in him, honour him, and help him and follow the light that has been sent down with him,1 they are the felicitous.’Cf. 4:174.
157.transliteration: alladhīna yattabiʿūna r-rasūla n-nabiyya l-ʾummiyya lladhī yajidūnahū maktūban ʿindahum fī t-tawrāti wa-l-ʾinjīli yaʾmuruhum bi-l-maʿrūfi wa-yanhāhum ʿani l-munkari wa-yuḥillu lahumu ṭ-ṭayyibāti wa-yuḥarrimu ʿalayhimu l-khabāʾitha wa-yaḍaʿu ʿanhum ʾiṣrahum wa-l-ʾaghlāla llatī kānat ʿalayhim fa-lladhīna ʾāmanū bihī wa-ʿazzarūhu wa-naṣarūhu wa-ttabaʿū n-nūra lladhī ʾunzila maʿahū ʾulāʾika humu l-mufliḥūna

158.content: قُل يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ إِنّي رَسولُ اللَّهِ إِلَيكُم جَميعًا الَّذي لَهُ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ يُحيي وَيُميتُ ۖ فَآمِنوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ النَّبِيِّ الأُمِّيِّ الَّذي يُؤمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَكَلِماتِهِ وَاتَّبِعوهُ لَعَلَّكُم تَهتَدونَ
158.translation_eng: Say, ‘O mankind! I am the Apostle of Allah to you all, [of Him] to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. There is no god except Him. He gives life and brings death.’ So have faith in Allah and His Apostle, the uninstructed prophet, who has faith in Allah and His words, and follow him so that you may be guided.
158.transliteration: qul yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ʾinnī rasūlu llāhi ʾilaykum jamīʿan-i lladhī lahū mulku s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa yuḥyī wa-yumītu fa-ʾāminū bi-llāhi wa-rasūlihi n-nabiyyi l-ʾummiyyi lladhī yuʾminu bi-llāhi wa-kalimātihī wa-ttabiʿūhu laʿallakum tahtadūna

159.content: وَمِن قَومِ موسىٰ أُمَّةٌ يَهدونَ بِالحَقِّ وَبِهِ يَعدِلونَ
159.translation_eng: Among the people of Moses is a nation who guide [the people] by the truth and do justice thereby.
159.transliteration: wa-min qawmi mūsā ʾummatun yahdūna bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-bihī yaʿdilūna

160.content: وَقَطَّعناهُمُ اثنَتَي عَشرَةَ أَسباطًا أُمَمًا ۚ وَأَوحَينا إِلىٰ موسىٰ إِذِ استَسقاهُ قَومُهُ أَنِ اضرِب بِعَصاكَ الحَجَرَ ۖ فَانبَجَسَت مِنهُ اثنَتا عَشرَةَ عَينًا ۖ قَد عَلِمَ كُلُّ أُناسٍ مَشرَبَهُم ۚ وَظَلَّلنا عَلَيهِمُ الغَمامَ وَأَنزَلنا عَلَيهِمُ المَنَّ وَالسَّلوىٰ ۖ كُلوا مِن طَيِّباتِ ما رَزَقناكُم ۚ وَما ظَلَمونا وَلٰكِن كانوا أَنفُسَهُم يَظلِمونَ
160.translation_eng: We split them up into twelve tribal communities, and We revealed to Moses, when his people asked him for water, [saying], ‘Strike the rock with your staff,’ whereat twelve fountains gushed forth from it. Every tribe came to know its drinking-place. And We shaded them with clouds, and We sent down to them manna and quails: ‘Eat of the good things We have provided you.’ And they did not wrong Us, but they used to wrong [only] themselves.
160.transliteration: wa-qaṭṭaʿnāhumu thnatay ʿashrata ʾasbāṭan ʾumaman wa-ʾawḥaynā ʾilā mūsā ʾidhi stasqāhu qawmuhū ʾani ḍrib bi-ʿaṣāka l-ḥajara fa-nbajasat minhu thnatā ʿashrata ʿaynan qad ʿalima kullu ʾunāsin mashrabahum wa-ẓallalnā ʿalayhimu l-ghamāma wa-ʾanzalnā ʿalayhimu l-manna wa-s-salwā kulū min ṭayyibāti mā razaqnākum wa-mā ẓalamūnā wa-lākin kānū ʾanfusahum yaẓlimūna

161.content: وَإِذ قيلَ لَهُمُ اسكُنوا هٰذِهِ القَريَةَ وَكُلوا مِنها حَيثُ شِئتُم وَقولوا حِطَّةٌ وَادخُلُوا البابَ سُجَّدًا نَغفِر لَكُم خَطيئَاتِكُم ۚ سَنَزيدُ المُحسِنينَ
161.translation_eng: And when they were told, ‘Settle in this town and eat thereof whence you wish; and say, “Relieve [us of the burden of our sins],” and enter prostrating at the gate, that We may forgive your iniquities, and soon We shall enhance the virtuous.’1Cf. 2:58.
161.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qīla lahumu skunū hādhihi l-qaryata wa-kulū minhā ḥaythu shiʾtum wa-qūlū ḥiṭṭatun wa-dkhulū l-bāba sujjadan naghfir lakum khaṭīʾātikum sa-nazīdu l-muḥsinīna

162.content: فَبَدَّلَ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا مِنهُم قَولًا غَيرَ الَّذي قيلَ لَهُم فَأَرسَلنا عَلَيهِم رِجزًا مِنَ السَّماءِ بِما كانوا يَظلِمونَ
162.translation_eng: But the wrongdoers changed the saying with other than what they had been told. So We sent against them a plague from the sky because of the wrongs they used to commit.
162.transliteration: fa-baddala lladhīna ẓalamū minhum qawlan ghayra lladhī qīla lahum fa-ʾarsalnā ʿalayhim rijzan mina s-samāʾi bi-mā kānū yaẓlimūna

163.content: وَاسأَلهُم عَنِ القَريَةِ الَّتي كانَت حاضِرَةَ البَحرِ إِذ يَعدونَ فِي السَّبتِ إِذ تَأتيهِم حيتانُهُم يَومَ سَبتِهِم شُرَّعًا وَيَومَ لا يَسبِتونَ ۙ لا تَأتيهِم ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نَبلوهُم بِما كانوا يَفسُقونَ
163.translation_eng: Ask them1 about the town that was situated on the seaside, when they violated the Sabbath, when their fish would come to them on the Sabbath day, visibly on the shore, but on days when they were not keeping Sabbath they would not come to them. Thus did We test them because of the transgressions they used to commit.That is, the Jews, to whom the following passages relate, up to verse 171.
163.transliteration: wa-sʾalhum ʿani l-qaryati llatī kānat ḥāḍirata l-baḥri ʾidh yaʿdūna fī s-sabti ʾidh taʾtīhim ḥītānuhum yawma sabtihim shurraʿan wa-yawma lā yasbitūna lā taʾtīhim ka-dhālika nablūhum bi-mā kānū yafsuqūna

164.content: وَإِذ قالَت أُمَّةٌ مِنهُم لِمَ تَعِظونَ قَومًا ۙ اللَّهُ مُهلِكُهُم أَو مُعَذِّبُهُم عَذابًا شَديدًا ۖ قالوا مَعذِرَةً إِلىٰ رَبِّكُم وَلَعَلَّهُم يَتَّقونَ
164.translation_eng: When a group of them said, ‘Why do you advise a people whom Allah will destroy or punish with a severe punishment?’ They said, ‘As an excuse before your Lord, and [with the hope] that they may be Godwary.’
164.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qālat ʾummatun minhum li-ma taʿiẓūna qawman-i llāhu muhlikuhum ʾaw muʿadhdhibuhum ʿadhāban shadīdan qālū maʿdhiratan ʾilā rabbikum wa-laʿallahum yattaqūna

165.content: فَلَمّا نَسوا ما ذُكِّروا بِهِ أَنجَينَا الَّذينَ يَنهَونَ عَنِ السّوءِ وَأَخَذنَا الَّذينَ ظَلَموا بِعَذابٍ بَئيسٍ بِما كانوا يَفسُقونَ
165.translation_eng: So when they forgot what they had been reminded of We delivered those who forbade evil [conduct] and seized the wrongdoers with a terrible punishment because of the transgressions they used to commit.
165.transliteration: fa-lammā nasū mā dhukkirū bihī ʾanjaynā lladhīna yanhawna ʿani s-sūʾi wa-ʾakhadhnā lladhīna ẓalamū bi-ʿadhābin baʾīsin bi-mā kānū yafsuqūna

166.content: فَلَمّا عَتَوا عَن ما نُهوا عَنهُ قُلنا لَهُم كونوا قِرَدَةً خاسِئينَ
166.translation_eng: When they defied [the command pertaining to] what they were forbidden from, We said to them, ‘Be you spurned apes.’1Cf. 2:65.
166.transliteration: fa-lammā ʿataw ʿan mā nuhū ʿanhu qulnā lahum kūnū qiradatan khāsiʾīna

167.content: وَإِذ تَأَذَّنَ رَبُّكَ لَيَبعَثَنَّ عَلَيهِم إِلىٰ يَومِ القِيامَةِ مَن يَسومُهُم سوءَ العَذابِ ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَسَريعُ العِقابِ ۖ وَإِنَّهُ لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
167.translation_eng: And when your Lord proclaimed that He would surely send against them,1 until the Day of Resurrection, those who would inflict on them a terrible punishment. Indeed your Lord is swift in retribution, and indeed He is all-forgiving, all-merciful.That is, the Jews.
167.transliteration: wa-ʾidh taʾadhdhana rabbuka la-yabʿathanna ʿalayhim ʾilā yawmi l-qiyāmati man yasūmuhum sūʾa l-ʿadhābi ʾinna rabbaka la-sarīʿu l-ʿiqābi wa-ʾinnahū la-ghafūrun raḥīmun

168.content: وَقَطَّعناهُم فِي الأَرضِ أُمَمًا ۖ مِنهُمُ الصّالِحونَ وَمِنهُم دونَ ذٰلِكَ ۖ وَبَلَوناهُم بِالحَسَناتِ وَالسَّيِّئَاتِ لَعَلَّهُم يَرجِعونَ
168.translation_eng: We dispersed them into communities around the earth: some of them were righteous, and some of them otherwise, and We tested them with good and bad [times] so that they may come back.
168.transliteration: wa-qaṭṭaʿnāhum fī l-ʾarḍi ʾumaman minhumu ṣ-ṣāliḥūna wa-minhum dūna dhālika wa-balawnāhum bi-l-ḥasanāti wa-s-sayyiʾāti laʿallahum yarjiʿūna

169.content: فَخَلَفَ مِن بَعدِهِم خَلفٌ وَرِثُوا الكِتابَ يَأخُذونَ عَرَضَ هٰذَا الأَدنىٰ وَيَقولونَ سَيُغفَرُ لَنا وَإِن يَأتِهِم عَرَضٌ مِثلُهُ يَأخُذوهُ ۚ أَلَم يُؤخَذ عَلَيهِم ميثاقُ الكِتابِ أَن لا يَقولوا عَلَى اللَّهِ إِلَّا الحَقَّ وَدَرَسوا ما فيهِ ۗ وَالدّارُ الآخِرَةُ خَيرٌ لِلَّذينَ يَتَّقونَ ۗ أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
169.translation_eng: Then they were succeeded by an evil posterity which inherited the Book: they grab the transitory gains of this lower world,1 and say, ‘It will be forgiven us.’ And if similar transitory gains were to come their way, they would grab them too. Was not the covenant of the Book taken with them that they shall not attribute anything to Allah except the truth? They have studied what is in it, and [know that] the abode of the Hereafter is better for those who are Godwary. Do you not apply reason?That is, in return for sinful actions.
169.transliteration: fa-khalafa min baʿdihim khalfun warithū l-kitāba yaʾkhudhūna ʿaraḍa hādhā l-ʾadnā wa-yaqūlūna sa-yughfaru lanā wa-ʾin yaʾtihim ʿaraḍun mithluhū yaʾkhudhūhu ʾa-lam yuʾkhadh ʿalayhim mīthāqu l-kitābi ʾan lā yaqūlū ʿalā llāhi ʾillā l-ḥaqqa wa-darasū mā fīhi wa-d-dāru l-ʾākhiratu khayrun li-lladhīna yattaqūna ʾa-fa-lā taʿqilūna

170.content: وَالَّذينَ يُمَسِّكونَ بِالكِتابِ وَأَقامُوا الصَّلاةَ إِنّا لا نُضيعُ أَجرَ المُصلِحينَ
170.translation_eng: As for those who hold fast to the Book and maintain the prayer —indeed We do not waste the reward of those who bring about reform.
170.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yumassikūna bi-l-kitābi wa-ʾaqāmū ṣ-ṣalāta ʾinnā lā nuḍīʿu ʾajra l-muṣliḥīna

171.content: ۞ وَإِذ نَتَقنَا الجَبَلَ فَوقَهُم كَأَنَّهُ ظُلَّةٌ وَظَنّوا أَنَّهُ واقِعٌ بِهِم خُذوا ما آتَيناكُم بِقُوَّةٍ وَاذكُروا ما فيهِ لَعَلَّكُم تَتَّقونَ
171.translation_eng: When We plucked the mountain [and held it]above them as if it were a canopy (and they thought it was about to fall on them): ‘Hold on with power to what We have given you and remember that which is in it, so that you may be Godwary.’
171.transliteration: wa-ʾidh nataqnā l-jabala fawqahum ka-ʾannahū ẓullatun wa-ẓannū ʾannahū wāqiʿun bihim khudhū mā ʾātaynākum bi-quwwatin wa-dhkurū mā fīhi laʿallakum tattaqūna

172.content: وَإِذ أَخَذَ رَبُّكَ مِن بَني آدَمَ مِن ظُهورِهِم ذُرِّيَّتَهُم وَأَشهَدَهُم عَلىٰ أَنفُسِهِم أَلَستُ بِرَبِّكُم ۖ قالوا بَلىٰ ۛ شَهِدنا ۛ أَن تَقولوا يَومَ القِيامَةِ إِنّا كُنّا عَن هٰذا غافِلينَ
172.translation_eng: When your Lord took from the Children of Adam, from their loins, their descendants and made them bear witness over themselves, [He said to them,] ‘Am I not your Lord?’ They said, ‘Yes indeed! We bear witness.’ [This,] lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection, ‘Indeed we were unaware of this,’
172.transliteration: wa-ʾidh ʾakhadha rabbuka min banī ʾādama min ẓuhūrihim dhurriyyatahum wa-ʾashhadahum ʿalā ʾanfusihim ʾa-lastu bi-rabbikum qālū balā shahidnā ʾan taqūlū yawma l-qiyāmati ʾinnā kunnā ʿan hādhā ghāfilīna

173.content: أَو تَقولوا إِنَّما أَشرَكَ آباؤُنا مِن قَبلُ وَكُنّا ذُرِّيَّةً مِن بَعدِهِم ۖ أَفَتُهلِكُنا بِما فَعَلَ المُبطِلونَ
173.translation_eng: or lest you should say, ‘Our fathers ascribed partners [to Allah] before [us] and we were descendants after them. Will You then destroy us because of what the falsifiers have done?’
173.transliteration: ʾaw taqūlū ʾinnamā ʾashraka ʾābāʾunā min qablu wa-kunnā dhurriyyatan min baʿdihim ʾa-fa-tuhlikunā bi-mā faʿala l-mubṭilūna

174.translation_eng: Thus do We elaborate the signs, so that they may come back.

175.content: وَاتلُ عَلَيهِم نَبَأَ الَّذي آتَيناهُ آياتِنا فَانسَلَخَ مِنها فَأَتبَعَهُ الشَّيطانُ فَكانَ مِنَ الغاوينَ
175.translation_eng: Relate to them an account of him to whom We gave Our signs, but he cast them off. Thereupon Satan pursued him, and he became one of the perverse.
175.transliteration: wa-tlu ʿalayhim nabaʾa lladhī ʾātaynāhu ʾāyātinā fa-nsalakha minhā fa-ʾatbaʿahu sh-shayṭānu fa-kāna mina l-ghāwīna

176.content: وَلَو شِئنا لَرَفَعناهُ بِها وَلٰكِنَّهُ أَخلَدَ إِلَى الأَرضِ وَاتَّبَعَ هَواهُ ۚ فَمَثَلُهُ كَمَثَلِ الكَلبِ إِن تَحمِل عَلَيهِ يَلهَث أَو تَترُكهُ يَلهَث ۚ ذٰلِكَ مَثَلُ القَومِ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا ۚ فَاقصُصِ القَصَصَ لَعَلَّهُم يَتَفَكَّرونَ
176.translation_eng: Had We wished, We would have surely raised him by their means, but he clung to the earth and followed his [base] desires. So his parable is that of a dog: if you make for it, it lolls out its tongue, and if you let it alone, it lolls out its tongue. Such is the parable of the people who deny Our signs. So recount these narratives, so that they may reflect.
176.transliteration: wa-law shiʾnā la-rafaʿnāhu bihā wa-lākinnahū ʾakhlada ʾilā l-ʾarḍi wa-ttabaʿa hawāhu fa-mathaluhū ka-mathali l-kalbi ʾin taḥmil ʿalayhi yalhath ʾaw tatrukhu yalhath dhālika mathalu l-qawmi lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā fa-qṣuṣi l-qaṣaṣa laʿallahum yatafakkarūna

177.content: ساءَ مَثَلًا القَومُ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا وَأَنفُسَهُم كانوا يَظلِمونَ
177.translation_eng: Evil is the parable of the people who deny Our signs and wrong themselves.
177.transliteration: sāʾa mathalan-i l-qawmu lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā wa-ʾanfusahum kānū yaẓlimūna

178.content: مَن يَهدِ اللَّهُ فَهُوَ المُهتَدي ۖ وَمَن يُضلِل فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الخاسِرونَ
178.translation_eng: Whomever Allah guides is rightly guided, and whomever He leads astray —it is they who are the losers.
178.transliteration: man yahdi llāhu fa-huwa l-muhtadī wa-man yuḍlil fa-ʾulāʾika humu l-khāsirūna

179.content: وَلَقَد ذَرَأنا لِجَهَنَّمَ كَثيرًا مِنَ الجِنِّ وَالإِنسِ ۖ لَهُم قُلوبٌ لا يَفقَهونَ بِها وَلَهُم أَعيُنٌ لا يُبصِرونَ بِها وَلَهُم آذانٌ لا يَسمَعونَ بِها ۚ أُولٰئِكَ كَالأَنعامِ بَل هُم أَضَلُّ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الغافِلونَ
179.translation_eng: Certainly We have created for hell many of the jinn and humans: they have hearts with which they do not understand, they have eyes with which they do not see, they have ears with which they do not hear. They are like cattle; rather they are more astray. It is they who are the heedless.1Cf. 8:21-24, 55; 25:44.
179.transliteration: wa-la-qad dharaʾnā li-jahannama kathīran mina l-jinni wa-l-ʾinsi lahum qulūbun lā yafqahūna bihā wa-lahum ʾaʿyunun lā yubṣirūna bihā wa-lahum ʾādhānun lā yasmaʿūna bihā ʾulāʾika ka-l-ʾanʿāmi bal hum ʾaḍallu ʾulāʾika humu l-ghāfilūna

180.content: وَلِلَّهِ الأَسماءُ الحُسنىٰ فَادعوهُ بِها ۖ وَذَرُوا الَّذينَ يُلحِدونَ في أَسمائِهِ ۚ سَيُجزَونَ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
180.translation_eng: To Allah belong the Best Names, so supplicate Him by them, and abandon those who commit sacrilege in His names. Soon they shall be requited for what they used to do.
180.transliteration: wa-li-llāhi l-ʾasmāʾu l-ḥusnā fa-dʿūhu bihā wa-dharū lladhīna yulḥidūna fī ʾasmāʾihī sa-yujzawna mā kānū yaʿmalūna

181.content: وَمِمَّن خَلَقنا أُمَّةٌ يَهدونَ بِالحَقِّ وَبِهِ يَعدِلونَ
181.translation_eng: Among those We have created are a nation who guide by the truth and do justice thereby.
181.transliteration: wa-mimman khalaqnā ʾummatun yahdūna bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-bihī yaʿdilūna

182.content: وَالَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا سَنَستَدرِجُهُم مِن حَيثُ لا يَعلَمونَ
182.translation_eng: As for those who deny Our signs, We will draw them imperceptibly [into ruin], whence they do not know.
182.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā sa-nastadrijuhum min haythu lā yaʿlamūna

183.translation_eng: And I will grant them respite, for My devising is indeed sure.

184.content: أَوَلَم يَتَفَكَّروا ۗ ما بِصاحِبِهِم مِن جِنَّةٍ ۚ إِن هُوَ إِلّا نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
184.translation_eng: Have they not reflected that there is no madness in their companion,1 [and that] he is just a manifest warner?That is, the Prophet.
184.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yatafakkarū mā bi-ṣāḥibihim min jinnatin ʾin huwa ʾillā nadhīrun mubīnun

185.content: أَوَلَم يَنظُروا في مَلَكوتِ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما خَلَقَ اللَّهُ مِن شَيءٍ وَأَن عَسىٰ أَن يَكونَ قَدِ اقتَرَبَ أَجَلُهُم ۖ فَبِأَيِّ حَديثٍ بَعدَهُ يُؤمِنونَ
185.translation_eng: Have they not contemplated the dominions of the heavens and the earth, and whatever things Allah has created, and that maybe their time1 has already drawn near? So what discourse will they believe after this?!2That is, death.That is, the Qurʾān.
185.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yanẓurū fī malakūti s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā khalaqa llāhu min shayʾin wa-ʾan ʿasā ʾan yakūna qadi qtaraba ʾajaluhum fa-bi-ʾayyi ḥadīthin baʿdahū yuʾminūna

186.content: مَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَلا هادِيَ لَهُ ۚ وَيَذَرُهُم في طُغيانِهِم يَعمَهونَ
186.translation_eng: Whomever Allah leads astray has no guide, and He leaves them bewildered in their rebellion.
186.transliteration: man yuḍlili llāhu fa-lā hādiya lahū wa-yadharuhum fī ṭughyānihim yaʿmahūna

187.content: يَسأَلونَكَ عَنِ السّاعَةِ أَيّانَ مُرساها ۖ قُل إِنَّما عِلمُها عِندَ رَبّي ۖ لا يُجَلّيها لِوَقتِها إِلّا هُوَ ۚ ثَقُلَت فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ لا تَأتيكُم إِلّا بَغتَةً ۗ يَسأَلونَكَ كَأَنَّكَ حَفِيٌّ عَنها ۖ قُل إِنَّما عِلمُها عِندَ اللَّهِ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
187.translation_eng: They question you concerning the Hour, when will it set in? Say, ‘Its knowledge is only with my Lord: none except Him shall manifest it at its time. It will weigh heavy on the heavens and the earth. It will not overtake you but suddenly.’ They ask you as if you were in the know of it. Say, ‘Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most people do not know.’
187.transliteration: yasʾalūnaka ʿani s-sāʿati ʾayyāna mursāhā qul ʾinnamā ʿilmuhā ʿinda rabbī lā yujallīhā li-waqtihā ʾillā huwa thaqulat fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi lā taʾtīkum ʾillā baghtatan yasʾalūnaka ka-ʾannaka ḥafiyyun ʿanhā qul ʾinnamā ʿilmuhā ʿinda llāhi wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūna

188.content: قُل لا أَملِكُ لِنَفسي نَفعًا وَلا ضَرًّا إِلّا ما شاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ وَلَو كُنتُ أَعلَمُ الغَيبَ لَاستَكثَرتُ مِنَ الخَيرِ وَما مَسَّنِيَ السّوءُ ۚ إِن أَنا إِلّا نَذيرٌ وَبَشيرٌ لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
188.translation_eng: Say, ‘I have no control over any benefit for myself nor [over] any harm except what Allah may wish. Had I known the Unseen, I would have acquired much good, and no ill would have befallen me. I am only a warner and a bearer of good news to a people who have faith.’
188.transliteration: qul lā ʾamliku li-nafsī nafʿan wa-lā ḍarran ʾillā mā shāʾa llāhu wa-law kuntu ʾaʿlamu l-ghayba la-stakthartu mina l-khayri wa-mā massaniya s-sūʾu ʾin ʾana ʾillā nadhīrun wa-bashīrun li-qawmin yuʾminūna

189.content: ۞ هُوَ الَّذي خَلَقَكُم مِن نَفسٍ واحِدَةٍ وَجَعَلَ مِنها زَوجَها لِيَسكُنَ إِلَيها ۖ فَلَمّا تَغَشّاها حَمَلَت حَملًا خَفيفًا فَمَرَّت بِهِ ۖ فَلَمّا أَثقَلَت دَعَوَا اللَّهَ رَبَّهُما لَئِن آتَيتَنا صالِحًا لَنَكونَنَّ مِنَ الشّاكِرينَ
189.translation_eng: It is He who created you from a single soul, and made from it its mate, that he might find comfort with her. So when he had covered1 her, she bore a light burden and passed [some time] with it. When she had grown heavy, they both invoked Allah, their Lord: ‘If You give us a healthy [child], we will be surely grateful.’Cover: to copulate with.
189.transliteration: huwa lladhī khalaqakum min nafsin wāḥidatin wa-jaʿala minhā zawjahā li-yaskuna ʾilayhā fa-lammā taghashshāhā ḥamalat ḥamlan khafīfan fa-marrat bihī fa-lammā ʾathqalat daʿawā llāha rabbahumā la-ʾin ʾātaytanā ṣāliḥan la-nakūnanna mina sh-shākirīna

190.content: فَلَمّا آتاهُما صالِحًا جَعَلا لَهُ شُرَكاءَ فيما آتاهُما ۚ فَتَعالَى اللَّهُ عَمّا يُشرِكونَ
190.translation_eng: Then when He gave them a healthy [child], they ascribed partners to Him in what He had given them. Exalted is Allah above [having] any partners that they ascribe [to Him]!
190.transliteration: fa-lammā ʾātāhumā ṣāliḥan jaʿalā lahū shurakāʾa fī-mā ʾātāhumā fa-taʿālā llāhu ʿammā yushrikūna

191.content: أَيُشرِكونَ ما لا يَخلُقُ شَيئًا وَهُم يُخلَقونَ
191.translation_eng: Do they ascribe [to Him] partners that create nothing and have been created themselves,
191.transliteration: ʾa-yushrikūna mā lā yakhluqu shayʾan wa-hum yukhlaqūna

192.content: وَلا يَستَطيعونَ لَهُم نَصرًا وَلا أَنفُسَهُم يَنصُرونَ
192.translation_eng: and can neither help them, nor help themselves?
192.transliteration: wa-lā yastaṭīʿūna lahum naṣran wa-lā ʾanfusahum yanṣurūna

193.content: وَإِن تَدعوهُم إِلَى الهُدىٰ لا يَتَّبِعوكُم ۚ سَواءٌ عَلَيكُم أَدَعَوتُموهُم أَم أَنتُم صامِتونَ
193.translation_eng: And if you call them to guidance, they will not follow you: it is the same to you whether you call them or whether you are silent.
193.transliteration: wa-ʾin tadʿūhum ʾilā l-hudā lā yattabiʿūkum sawāʾun ʿalaykum ʾa-daʿawtumūhum ʾam ʾantum ṣāmitūna

194.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ عِبادٌ أَمثالُكُم ۖ فَادعوهُم فَليَستَجيبوا لَكُم إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
194.translation_eng: Indeed those whom you invoke besides Allah are creatures like you. So invoke them: they should answer you, if you are truthful.
194.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna tadʿūna min dūni llāhi ʿibādun ʾamthālukum fa-dʿūhum fa-l-yastajībū lakum ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

195.content: أَلَهُم أَرجُلٌ يَمشونَ بِها ۖ أَم لَهُم أَيدٍ يَبطِشونَ بِها ۖ أَم لَهُم أَعيُنٌ يُبصِرونَ بِها ۖ أَم لَهُم آذانٌ يَسمَعونَ بِها ۗ قُلِ ادعوا شُرَكاءَكُم ثُمَّ كيدونِ فَلا تُنظِرونِ
195.translation_eng: Do they have any feet to walk with? Do they have any hands to grasp with? Do they have any eyes to see with? Do they have any ears to hear with? Say, ‘Invoke your partners [that you ascribe to Allah] and try out your stratagems1 against me without granting me any respite.Or ‘try out your guile against me.’ Cf. 11:55.
195.transliteration: ʾa-lahum ʾarjulun yamshūna bihā ʾam lahum ʾaydin yabṭishūna bihā ʾam lahum ʾaʿyunun yubṣirūna bihā ʾam lahum ʾādhānun yasmaʿūna bihā quli dʿū shurakāʾakum thumma kīdūni fa-lā tunẓirūni

196.content: إِنَّ وَلِيِّيَ اللَّهُ الَّذي نَزَّلَ الكِتابَ ۖ وَهُوَ يَتَوَلَّى الصّالِحينَ
196.translation_eng: My guardian is indeed Allah who sent down the Book, and He takes care of the righteous.
196.transliteration: ʾinna waliyyiya llāhu lladhī nazzala l-kitāba wa-huwa yatawallā ṣ-ṣāliḥīna

197.content: وَالَّذينَ تَدعونَ مِن دونِهِ لا يَستَطيعونَ نَصرَكُم وَلا أَنفُسَهُم يَنصُرونَ
197.translation_eng: Those whom you invoke besides Him can neither help you, nor help themselves.’
197.transliteration: wa-lladhīna tadʿūna min dūnihī lā yastaṭīʿūna naṣrakum wa-lā ʾanfusahum yanṣurūna

198.content: وَإِن تَدعوهُم إِلَى الهُدىٰ لا يَسمَعوا ۖ وَتَراهُم يَنظُرونَ إِلَيكَ وَهُم لا يُبصِرونَ
198.translation_eng: If you call them to guidance, they will not hear. You see them observing you, but they do not perceive.
198.transliteration: wa-ʾin tadʿūhum ʾilā l-hudā lā yasmaʿū wa-tarāhum yanẓurūna ʾilayka wa-hum lā yubṣirūna

199.content: خُذِ العَفوَ وَأمُر بِالعُرفِ وَأَعرِض عَنِ الجاهِلينَ
199.translation_eng: Adopt [a policy of] excusing [the faults of people], bid what is right, and turn away from the ignorant.
199.transliteration: khudhi l-ʿafwa wa-ʾmur bi-l-ʿurfi wa-ʾaʿriḍ ʿani l-jāhilīna

200.content: وَإِمّا يَنزَغَنَّكَ مِنَ الشَّيطانِ نَزغٌ فَاستَعِذ بِاللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ سَميعٌ عَليمٌ
200.translation_eng: Should a temptation from Satan disturb you, invoke the protection of Allah; indeed He is all-hearing, all-knowing.
200.transliteration: wa-ʾimmā yanzaghannaka mina sh-shayṭāni nazghun fa-staʿidh bi-llāhi ʾinnahū samīʿun ʿalīmun

201.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا إِذا مَسَّهُم طائِفٌ مِنَ الشَّيطانِ تَذَكَّروا فَإِذا هُم مُبصِرونَ
201.translation_eng: When those who are Godwary are touched by a visitation1 of Satan, they remember [Allah] and, behold, they perceive.Or ‘insinuation.’
201.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ttaqaw ʾidhā massahum ṭāʾifun mina sh-shayṭāni tadhakkarū fa-ʾidhā hum mubṣirūna

202.content: وَإِخوانُهُم يَمُدّونَهُم فِي الغَيِّ ثُمَّ لا يُقصِرونَ
202.translation_eng: But their brethren,1 they draw them into error, and then they do not spare [any harm].That is, the polytheists, who are referred to as brethren of Satans.
202.transliteration: wa-ʾikhwānuhum yamuddūnahum fī l-ghayyi thumma lā yuqṣirūna

203.content: وَإِذا لَم تَأتِهِم بِآيَةٍ قالوا لَولَا اجتَبَيتَها ۚ قُل إِنَّما أَتَّبِعُ ما يوحىٰ إِلَيَّ مِن رَبّي ۚ هٰذا بَصائِرُ مِن رَبِّكُم وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةٌ لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
203.translation_eng: When you do not bring them a sign, they say, ‘Why do you not improvise one?’ Say, ‘I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord; these are insights from your Lord, and a guidance and mercy for a people who have faith.’
203.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā lam taʾtihim bi-ʾāyatin qālū law-lā jtabaytahā qul ʾinnamā ʾattabiʿu mā yūḥā ʾilayya min rabbī hādhā baṣāʾiru min rabbikum wa-hudan wa-raḥmatun li-qawmin yuʾminūna

204.content: وَإِذا قُرِئَ القُرآنُ فَاستَمِعوا لَهُ وَأَنصِتوا لَعَلَّكُم تُرحَمونَ
204.translation_eng: When the Qurʾān is recited, listen to it and be silent, maybe you will receive [Allah’s] mercy.
204.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā quriʾa l-qurʾānu fa-stamiʿū lahū wa-ʾanṣitū laʿallakum turḥamūna

205.content: وَاذكُر رَبَّكَ في نَفسِكَ تَضَرُّعًا وَخيفَةً وَدونَ الجَهرِ مِنَ القَولِ بِالغُدُوِّ وَالآصالِ وَلا تَكُن مِنَ الغافِلينَ
205.translation_eng: And remember your Lord within your heart beseechingly and reverentially, without being loud, morning and evening, and do not be among the heedless.
205.transliteration: wa-dhkur rabbaka fī nafsika taḍarruʿan wa-khīfatan wa-dūna l-jahri mina l-qawli bi-l-ghuduwwi wa-l-ʾāṣāli wa-lā takun mina l-ghāfilīna

206.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ عِندَ رَبِّكَ لا يَستَكبِرونَ عَن عِبادَتِهِ وَيُسَبِّحونَهُ وَلَهُ يَسجُدونَ ۩
206.translation_eng: Indeed those who are [stationed] near your Lord do not disdain to worship Him. They glorify Him and prostrate to Him.
206.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʿinda rabbika lā yastakbirūna ʿan ʿibādatihī wa-yusabbiḥūnahū wa-lahū yasjudūna

8.description: The surah that answers the question that the believers put to the Prophet regarding how God and His Messenger would have them distribute The spoils, after the believers had diered among themselves about its disbursement. It takes its name from the term “spoils” (al-anfāl) mentioned in verse 1. The main part of this surah is a comment on the Battle of Badr (year 2/624), the first fought between the Muslims and their Meccan opponents. The Muslims, some of whom were at first reluctant to fight, won in spite of being vastly outnumbered, and began to question the distribution of the gains (spoils of war). The surah reminds them that it was God who brought about the victory. verse 41 shows how the gains were to be distributed. It advises Muslims and comments on the role of the hypocrites and on those who always break their treaties (verse 56), ending with a statement about loyalties and alliances.The surah is also known as: Battle Gains, Booty, The Spoils of War.

1.content: يَسأَلونَكَ عَنِ الأَنفالِ ۖ قُلِ الأَنفالُ لِلَّهِ وَالرَّسولِ ۖ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَصلِحوا ذاتَ بَينِكُم ۖ وَأَطيعُوا اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ إِن كُنتُم مُؤمِنينَ
1.translation_eng: They ask you concerning the anfāl.1 Say, ‘The anfāl belong to Allah and the Apostle.’ So be wary of Allah and settle your differences, and obey Allah and His Apostle, should you be faithful.Or, ‘They ask you for the anfāl,’ according to an alternate reading (yasʾalūnaka al-anfāl). In the present Qurʿānic context, the term anfāl refers to the spoils of war.
1.transliteration: yasʾalūnaka ʿani l-ʾanfāli quli l-ʾanfālu li-llāhi wa-r-rasūli fa-ttaqū llāha wa-ʾaṣliḥū dhāta baynikum wa-ʾaṭīʿū llāha wa-rasūlahū ʾin kuntum muʾminīna

2.content: إِنَّمَا المُؤمِنونَ الَّذينَ إِذا ذُكِرَ اللَّهُ وَجِلَت قُلوبُهُم وَإِذا تُلِيَت عَلَيهِم آياتُهُ زادَتهُم إيمانًا وَعَلىٰ رَبِّهِم يَتَوَكَّلونَ
2.translation_eng: The faithful are only those whose hearts tremble [with awe] when Allah is mentioned, and when His signs are recited to them, they1 increase their faith, and who put their trust in their Lord,That is, the signs of Allah, when they are recited to the faithful.
2.transliteration: ʾinnamā l-muʾminūna lladhīna ʾidhā dhukira llāhu wajilat qulūbuhum wa-ʾidhā tuliyat ʿalayhim ʾāyātuhū zādathum ʾīmānan wa-ʿalā rabbihim yatawakkalūna

3.content: الَّذينَ يُقيمونَ الصَّلاةَ وَمِمّا رَزَقناهُم يُنفِقونَ
3.translation_eng: maintain the prayer and spend out of what We have provided them.
3.transliteration: alladhīna yuqīmūna ṣ-ṣalāta wa-mimmā razaqnāhum yunfiqūna

4.content: أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُؤمِنونَ حَقًّا ۚ لَهُم دَرَجاتٌ عِندَ رَبِّهِم وَمَغفِرَةٌ وَرِزقٌ كَريمٌ
4.translation_eng: It is they who are truly the faithful. They shall have ranks near their Lord, forgiveness and a noble provision.
4.transliteration: ʾulāʾika humu l-muʾminūna ḥaqqan lahum darajātun ʿinda rabbihim wa-maghfiratun wa-rizqun karīmun

5.content: كَما أَخرَجَكَ رَبُّكَ مِن بَيتِكَ بِالحَقِّ وَإِنَّ فَريقًا مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ لَكارِهونَ
5.translation_eng: As your Lord brought you out from your home with a just cause, a part of the faithful were indeed reluctant.
5.transliteration: ka-mā ʾakhrajaka rabbuka min baytika bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾinna farīqan mina l-muʾminīna la-kārihūna

6.content: يُجادِلونَكَ فِي الحَقِّ بَعدَما تَبَيَّنَ كَأَنَّما يُساقونَ إِلَى المَوتِ وَهُم يَنظُرونَ
6.translation_eng: They disputed with you concerning the truth after it had become clear, as if they were being driven towards death as they looked on.
6.transliteration: yujādilūnaka fī l-ḥaqqi baʿda mā tabayyana ka-ʾannamā yusāqūna ʾilā l-mawti wa-hum yanẓurūna

7.content: وَإِذ يَعِدُكُمُ اللَّهُ إِحدَى الطّائِفَتَينِ أَنَّها لَكُم وَتَوَدّونَ أَنَّ غَيرَ ذاتِ الشَّوكَةِ تَكونُ لَكُم وَيُريدُ اللَّهُ أَن يُحِقَّ الحَقَّ بِكَلِماتِهِ وَيَقطَعَ دابِرَ الكافِرينَ
7.translation_eng: When Allah promised you [victory over] one of the two companies, [saying], ‘It is for you,’ you were eager that it should be the one that was unarmed.1 But Allah desires to confirm the truth with His words, and to root out the faithless,Literally, ‘one that was free of thorns.’ That is, one which was unarmed and, therefore, easy to encounter.
7.transliteration: wa-ʾidh yaʿidukumu llāhu ʾiḥdā ṭ-ṭāʾifatayni ʾannahā lakum wa-tawaddūna ʾanna ghayra dhāti sh-shawkati takūnu lakum wa-yurīdu llāhu ʾan yuḥiqqa l-ḥaqqa bi-kalimātihī wa-yaqṭaʿa dābira l-kāfirīna

8.content: لِيُحِقَّ الحَقَّ وَيُبطِلَ الباطِلَ وَلَو كَرِهَ المُجرِمونَ
8.translation_eng: so that He may confirm the truth and bring falsehood to naught, though the guilty should be averse.
8.transliteration: li-yuḥiqqa l-ḥaqqa wa-yubṭila l-bāṭila wa-law kariha l-mujrimūna

9.content: إِذ تَستَغيثونَ رَبَّكُم فَاستَجابَ لَكُم أَنّي مُمِدُّكُم بِأَلفٍ مِنَ المَلائِكَةِ مُردِفينَ
9.translation_eng: When you appealed to your Lord for help, He answered you: ‘I will aid you with a thousand angels in a file.’
9.transliteration: ʾidh tastaghīthūna rabbakum fa-stajāba lakum ʾannī mumiddukum bi-ʾalfin mina l-malāʾikati murdifīna

10.content: وَما جَعَلَهُ اللَّهُ إِلّا بُشرىٰ وَلِتَطمَئِنَّ بِهِ قُلوبُكُم ۚ وَمَا النَّصرُ إِلّا مِن عِندِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزيزٌ حَكيمٌ
10.translation_eng: Allah did not appoint it but as a good news, and to reassure your hearts. Victory1 comes only from Allah. Indeed Allah is all-mighty, all-wise.Or ‘help.’
10.transliteration: wa-mā jaʿalahu llāhu ʾillā bushrā wa-li-taṭmaʾinna bihī qulūbukum wa-mā n-naṣru ʾillā min ʿindi llāhi ʾinna llāha ʿazīzun ḥakīmun

11.content: إِذ يُغَشّيكُمُ النُّعاسَ أَمَنَةً مِنهُ وَيُنَزِّلُ عَلَيكُم مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً لِيُطَهِّرَكُم بِهِ وَيُذهِبَ عَنكُم رِجزَ الشَّيطانِ وَلِيَربِطَ عَلىٰ قُلوبِكُم وَيُثَبِّتَ بِهِ الأَقدامَ
11.translation_eng: When He covered you with a trance as a [sense of] security from Him, and He sent down water from the sky to purify you with it, and to repel from you the defilement of Satan, and to fortify your hearts, and to make [your] feet steady with it.
11.transliteration: ʾidh yughashshīkumu n-nuʿāsa ʾamanatan minhu wa-yunazzilu ʿalaykum mina s-samāʾi māʾan li-yuṭahhirakum bihī wa-yudhhiba ʿankum rijza sh-shayṭāni wa-li-yarbiṭa ʿalā qulūbikum wa-yuthabbita bihi l-ʾaqdāma

12.content: إِذ يوحي رَبُّكَ إِلَى المَلائِكَةِ أَنّي مَعَكُم فَثَبِّتُوا الَّذينَ آمَنوا ۚ سَأُلقي في قُلوبِ الَّذينَ كَفَرُوا الرُّعبَ فَاضرِبوا فَوقَ الأَعناقِ وَاضرِبوا مِنهُم كُلَّ بَنانٍ
12.translation_eng: Then your Lord signaled to the angels: ‘I am indeed with you; so steady the faithful. I will cast terror into the hearts of the faithless. So strike their necks, and strike each of their fingertips!’
12.transliteration: ʾidh yūḥī rabbuka ʾilā l-malāʾikati ʾannī maʿakum fa-thabbitū lladhīna ʾāmanū sa-ʾulqī fī qulūbi lladhīna kafarū r-ruʿba fa-ḍribū fawqa l-ʾaʿnāqi wa-ḍribū minhum kulla banānin

13.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُم شاقُّوا اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ ۚ وَمَن يُشاقِقِ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ شَديدُ العِقابِ
13.translation_eng: That, because they defied Allah and His Apostle. And whoever defies Allah and His Apostle, Allah is indeed severe in retribution.
13.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahum shāqqū llāha wa-rasūlahū wa-man yushāqiqi llāha wa-rasūlahū fa-ʾinna llāha shadīdu l-ʿiqābi

14.content: ذٰلِكُم فَذوقوهُ وَأَنَّ لِلكافِرينَ عَذابَ النّارِ
14.translation_eng: ‘Taste this, and [know] that for the faithless is the punishment of the Fire.’
14.transliteration: dhālikum fa-dhūqūhu wa-ʾanna li-l-kāfirīna ʿadhāba n-nāri

15.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِذا لَقيتُمُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا زَحفًا فَلا تُوَلّوهُمُ الأَدبارَ
15.translation_eng: O you who have faith! When you encounter the faithless advancing [for battle], do not turn your backs [to flee] from them.
15.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾidhā laqītumu lladhīna kafarū zaḥfan fa-lā tuwallūhumu l-ʾadbāra

16.content: وَمَن يُوَلِّهِم يَومَئِذٍ دُبُرَهُ إِلّا مُتَحَرِّفًا لِقِتالٍ أَو مُتَحَيِّزًا إِلىٰ فِئَةٍ فَقَد باءَ بِغَضَبٍ مِنَ اللَّهِ وَمَأواهُ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئسَ المَصيرُ
16.translation_eng: Whoever turns his back [to flee] from them that day —unless [he is] diverting to fight or retiring towards another troop— shall certainly earn Allah’s wrath, and his refuge shall be hell, an evil destination.
16.transliteration: wa-man yuwallihim yawmaʾidhin duburahū ʾillā mutaḥarrifan li-qitālin ʾaw mutaḥayyizan ʾilā fiʾatin fa-qad bāʾa bi-ghaḍabin mina llāhi wa-maʾwāhu jahannamu wa-biʾsa l-maṣīru

17.content: فَلَم تَقتُلوهُم وَلٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ قَتَلَهُم ۚ وَما رَمَيتَ إِذ رَمَيتَ وَلٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ رَمىٰ ۚ وَلِيُبلِيَ المُؤمِنينَ مِنهُ بَلاءً حَسَنًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَميعٌ عَليمٌ
17.translation_eng: You did not kill them; rather it was Allah who killed them; and you did not throw when you threw,1 rather it was Allah who threw, that He might test the faithful with a good test from Himself.2 Indeed Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing.According to tradition, at the outset of the battle of Badr, the Prophet (ṣ) took a handful of dust, containing sand and pebbles, and threw it at the enemy troops. It struck in the face every warrior of the enemy, entering their eyes, noses and mouths, disconcerting them, resulting ultimately in their being routed by the small Muslim force.Or ‘that He might grant the faithful a splendid award from Himself.’
17.transliteration: fa-lam taqtulūhum wa-lākinna llāha qatalahum wa-mā ramayta ʾidh ramayta wa-lākinna llāha ramā wa-li-yubliya l-muʾminīna minhu balāʾan ḥasanan ʾinna llāha samīʿun ʿalīmun

18.content: ذٰلِكُم وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ موهِنُ كَيدِ الكافِرينَ
18.translation_eng: Such is the case, and [know] that Allah undermines the stratagems of the faithless.
18.transliteration: dhālikum wa-ʾanna llāha mūhinu kaydi l-kāfirīna

19.content: إِن تَستَفتِحوا فَقَد جاءَكُمُ الفَتحُ ۖ وَإِن تَنتَهوا فَهُوَ خَيرٌ لَكُم ۖ وَإِن تَعودوا نَعُد وَلَن تُغنِيَ عَنكُم فِئَتُكُم شَيئًا وَلَو كَثُرَت وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ مَعَ المُؤمِنينَ
19.translation_eng: If you sought a verdict, the verdict has certainly come to you;1 and if you relinquish [faithlessness], it is better for you, but if you revert, We [too] shall return and your troops will never avail you though they should be ever so many, and [know] that Allah is with the faithful.Addressed to the faithless.
19.transliteration: ʾin tastaftiḥū fa-qad jāʾakumu l-fatḥu wa-ʾin tantahū fa-huwa khayrun lakum wa-ʾin taʿūdū naʿud wa-lan tughniya ʿankum fiʾatukum shayʾan wa-law kathurat wa-ʾanna llāha maʿa l-muʾminīna

20.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا أَطيعُوا اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ وَلا تَوَلَّوا عَنهُ وَأَنتُم تَسمَعونَ
20.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Obey Allah and His Apostle, and do not turn away from him while you hear [him].
20.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾaṭīʿū llāha wa-rasūlahū wa-lā tawallaw ʿanhu wa-ʾantum tasmaʿūna

21.content: وَلا تَكونوا كَالَّذينَ قالوا سَمِعنا وَهُم لا يَسمَعونَ
21.translation_eng: Do not be like those who say, ‘We hear,’ though they do not hear.
21.transliteration: wa-lā takūnū ka-lladhīna qālū samiʿnā wa-hum lā yasmaʿūna

22.content: ۞ إِنَّ شَرَّ الدَّوابِّ عِندَ اللَّهِ الصُّمُّ البُكمُ الَّذينَ لا يَعقِلونَ
22.translation_eng: Indeed the worst of beasts in Allah’s sight are the deaf and the dumb who do not apply reason.
22.transliteration: ʾinna sharra d-dawābbi ʿinda llāhi ṣ-ṣummu l-bukmu lladhīna lā yaʿqilūna

23.content: وَلَو عَلِمَ اللَّهُ فيهِم خَيرًا لَأَسمَعَهُم ۖ وَلَو أَسمَعَهُم لَتَوَلَّوا وَهُم مُعرِضونَ
23.translation_eng: Had Allah known any good in them, surely He would have made them hear, and were He to make them hear, surely they would turn away, being disregardful.
23.transliteration: wa-law ʿalima llāhu fīhim khayran la-ʾasmaʿahum wa-law ʾasmaʿahum la-tawallaw wa-hum muʿriḍūna

24.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا استَجيبوا لِلَّهِ وَلِلرَّسولِ إِذا دَعاكُم لِما يُحييكُم ۖ وَاعلَموا أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَحولُ بَينَ المَرءِ وَقَلبِهِ وَأَنَّهُ إِلَيهِ تُحشَرونَ
24.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Answer Allah and the Apostle when he summons you to that which will give you life. Know that Allah intervenes between a man and his heart and that toward Him you will be mustered.
24.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū stajībū li-llāhi wa-li-r-rasūli ʾidhā daʿākum li-mā yuḥyīkum wa-ʿlamū ʾanna llāha yaḥūlu bayna l-marʾi wa-qalbihī wa-ʾannahū ʾilayhi tuḥsharūna

25.content: وَاتَّقوا فِتنَةً لا تُصيبَنَّ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا مِنكُم خاصَّةً ۖ وَاعلَموا أَنَّ اللَّهَ شَديدُ العِقابِ
25.translation_eng: And beware of a punishment which shall not visit the wrongdoers among you exclusively, and know that Allah is severe in retribution.
25.transliteration: wa-ttaqū fitnatan lā tuṣībanna lladhīna ẓalamū minkum khāṣṣatan wa-ʿlamū ʾanna llāha shadīdu l-ʿiqābi

26.content: وَاذكُروا إِذ أَنتُم قَليلٌ مُستَضعَفونَ فِي الأَرضِ تَخافونَ أَن يَتَخَطَّفَكُمُ النّاسُ فَآواكُم وَأَيَّدَكُم بِنَصرِهِ وَرَزَقَكُم مِنَ الطَّيِّباتِ لَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
26.translation_eng: Remember when you were few, abased in the land, and feared lest the people should despoil you, and He gave you refuge, and strengthened you with His help, and provided you with all the good things so that you may give thanks.
26.transliteration: wa-dhkurū ʾidh ʾantum qalīlun mustaḍʿafūna fī l-ʾarḍi takhāfūna ʾan yatakhaṭṭafakumu n-nāsu fa-ʾāwākum wa-ʾayyadakum bi-naṣrihī wa-razaqakum mina ṭ-ṭayyibāti laʿallakum tashkurūna

27.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تَخونُوا اللَّهَ وَالرَّسولَ وَتَخونوا أَماناتِكُم وَأَنتُم تَعلَمونَ
27.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Do not betray Allah and the Apostle, and do not betray your trusts knowingly.
27.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū lā takhūnū llāha wa-r-rasūla wa-takhūnū ʾamānātikum wa-ʾantum taʿlamūna

28.content: وَاعلَموا أَنَّما أَموالُكُم وَأَولادُكُم فِتنَةٌ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ عِندَهُ أَجرٌ عَظيمٌ
28.translation_eng: Know that your possessions and children are only a test, and that Allah—with Him is a great reward.
28.transliteration: wa-ʿlamū ʾannamā ʾamwālukum wa-ʾawlādukum fitnatun wa-ʾanna llāha ʿindahū ʾajrun ʿaẓīmun

29.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِن تَتَّقُوا اللَّهَ يَجعَل لَكُم فُرقانًا وَيُكَفِّر عَنكُم سَيِّئَاتِكُم وَيَغفِر لَكُم ۗ وَاللَّهُ ذُو الفَضلِ العَظيمِ
29.translation_eng: O you who have faith! If you are wary of Allah, He shall appoint a criterion1 for you, and absolve you of your misdeeds, and forgive you, for Allah is dispenser of a great grace.That is, a knowledge which will enable you to distinguish between truth and falsehood.
29.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾin tattaqū llāha yajʿal lakum furqānan wa-yukaffir ʿankum sayyiʾātikum wa-yaghfir lakum wa-llāhu dhū l-faḍli l-ʿaẓīmi

30.content: وَإِذ يَمكُرُ بِكَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لِيُثبِتوكَ أَو يَقتُلوكَ أَو يُخرِجوكَ ۚ وَيَمكُرونَ وَيَمكُرُ اللَّهُ ۖ وَاللَّهُ خَيرُ الماكِرينَ
30.translation_eng: When the faithless plotted against you to take you captive, or to kill or expel you. They plotted and Allah devised, and Allah is the best of devisers.
30.transliteration: wa-ʾidh yamkuru bika lladhīna kafarū li-yuthbitūka ʾaw yaqtulūka ʾaw yukhrijūka wa-yamkurūna wa-yamkuru llāhu wa-llāhu khayru l-mākirīna

31.content: وَإِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم آياتُنا قالوا قَد سَمِعنا لَو نَشاءُ لَقُلنا مِثلَ هٰذا ۙ إِن هٰذا إِلّا أَساطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ
31.translation_eng: When Our signs are recited to them, they say, ‘We have heard already. If we want, we [too] can say like this. These are nothing but myths of the ancients.’
31.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhim ʾāyātunā qālū qad samiʿnā law nashāʾu la-qulnā mithla hādhā ʾin hādhā ʾillā ʾasāṭīru l-ʾawwalīna

32.content: وَإِذ قالُوا اللَّهُمَّ إِن كانَ هٰذا هُوَ الحَقَّ مِن عِندِكَ فَأَمطِر عَلَينا حِجارَةً مِنَ السَّماءِ أَوِ ائتِنا بِعَذابٍ أَليمٍ
32.translation_eng: And when they said, ‘O Allah, if this be the truth from You, rain down upon us stones from the sky, or bring us a painful punishment.’
32.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qālū llāhumma ʾin kāna hādhā huwa l-ḥaqqa min ʿindika fa-ʾamṭir ʿalaynā ḥijāratan mina s-samāʾi ʾawi ʾtinā bi-ʿadhābin ʾalīmin

33.content: وَما كانَ اللَّهُ لِيُعَذِّبَهُم وَأَنتَ فيهِم ۚ وَما كانَ اللَّهُ مُعَذِّبَهُم وَهُم يَستَغفِرونَ
33.translation_eng: But Allah will not punish them while you are in their midst, nor will Allah punish them while they plead for forgiveness.
33.transliteration: wa-mā kāna llāhu li-yuʿadhdhibahum wa-ʾanta fīhim wa-mā kāna llāhu muʿadhdhibahum wa-hum yastaghfirūna

34.content: وَما لَهُم أَلّا يُعَذِّبَهُمُ اللَّهُ وَهُم يَصُدّونَ عَنِ المَسجِدِ الحَرامِ وَما كانوا أَولِياءَهُ ۚ إِن أَولِياؤُهُ إِلَّا المُتَّقونَ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
34.translation_eng: What [excuse] have they that Allah should not punish them, when they bar [the faithful] from the Holy Mosque, and they are not its custodians? Its custodians are only the Godwary, but most of them do not know.
34.transliteration: wa-mā lahum ʾallā yuʿadhdhibahumu llāhu wa-hum yaṣuddūna ʿani l-masjidi l-ḥarāmi wa-mā kānū ʾawliyāʾahū ʾin ʾawliyāʾuhū ʾillā l-muttaqūna wa-lākinna ʾaktharahum lā yaʿlamūna

35.content: وَما كانَ صَلاتُهُم عِندَ البَيتِ إِلّا مُكاءً وَتَصدِيَةً ۚ فَذوقُوا العَذابَ بِما كُنتُم تَكفُرونَ
35.translation_eng: Their prayer at the House is nothing but whistling and clapping. So taste the punishment because of what you used to defy.
35.transliteration: wa-mā kāna ṣalātuhum ʿinda l-bayti ʾillā mukāʾan wa-taṣdiyatan fa-dhūqū l-ʿadhāba bi-mā kuntum takfurūna

36.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا يُنفِقونَ أَموالَهُم لِيَصُدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ فَسَيُنفِقونَها ثُمَّ تَكونُ عَلَيهِم حَسرَةً ثُمَّ يُغلَبونَ ۗ وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا إِلىٰ جَهَنَّمَ يُحشَرونَ
36.translation_eng: Indeed the faithless spend their wealth to bar from the way of Allah. Soon they will have spent it, then it will be a cause of regret to them, then they will be overcome, and the faithless will be gathered toward Hell,
36.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna kafarū yunfiqūna ʾamwālahum li-yaṣuddū ʿan sabīli llāhi fa-sa-yunfiqūnahā thūmma takūnu ʿalayhim ḥasratan thumma yughlabūna wa-lladhīna kafarū ʾilā jahannama yuḥsharūna

37.content: لِيَميزَ اللَّهُ الخَبيثَ مِنَ الطَّيِّبِ وَيَجعَلَ الخَبيثَ بَعضَهُ عَلىٰ بَعضٍ فَيَركُمَهُ جَميعًا فَيَجعَلَهُ في جَهَنَّمَ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الخاسِرونَ
37.translation_eng: so that Allah may separate the bad ones from the good, and place the bad on one another, and pile them up together, and cast them into hell. It is they who are the losers.
37.transliteration: li-yamīza llāhu l-khabītha mina ṭ-ṭayyibi wa-yajʿala l-khabītha baʿḍahū ʿalā baʿḍin fa-yarkumahū jamīʿan fa-yajʿalahū fī jahannama ʾulāʾika humu l-khāsirūna

38.content: قُل لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا إِن يَنتَهوا يُغفَر لَهُم ما قَد سَلَفَ وَإِن يَعودوا فَقَد مَضَت سُنَّتُ الأَوَّلينَ
38.translation_eng: Say to the faithless, if they relinquish [faithlessness], what is already past shall be forgiven them. But if they revert [to faithlessness], then the precedent of the ancients has already passed.
38.transliteration: qul li-lladhīna kafarū ʾin yantahū yughfar lahum mā qad salafa wa-ʾin yaʿūdū fa-qad maḍat sunnatu l-ʾawwalīna

39.content: وَقاتِلوهُم حَتّىٰ لا تَكونَ فِتنَةٌ وَيَكونَ الدّينُ كُلُّهُ لِلَّهِ ۚ فَإِنِ انتَهَوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ بِما يَعمَلونَ بَصيرٌ
39.translation_eng: Fight them until faithlessness1 is no more, and religion becomes exclusively for Allah. But if they relinquish, Allah indeed sees best what they do.Or ‘polytheism.’ Cf. 2:193.
39.transliteration: wa-qātilūhum ḥattā lā takūna fitnatun wa-yakūna d-dīnu kulluhū li-llāhi fa-ʾini ntahaw fa-ʾinna llāha bi-mā yaʿmalūna baṣīrun

40.content: وَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَاعلَموا أَنَّ اللَّهَ مَولاكُم ۚ نِعمَ المَولىٰ وَنِعمَ النَّصيرُ
40.translation_eng: And if they turn away, then know that Allah is your master: an excellent master and an excellent helper!
40.transliteration: wa-ʾin tawallaw fa-ʿlamū ʾanna llāha mawlākum niʿma l-mawlā wa-niʿma n-naṣīru

41.content: ۞ وَاعلَموا أَنَّما غَنِمتُم مِن شَيءٍ فَأَنَّ لِلَّهِ خُمُسَهُ وَلِلرَّسولِ وَلِذِي القُربىٰ وَاليَتامىٰ وَالمَساكينِ وَابنِ السَّبيلِ إِن كُنتُم آمَنتُم بِاللَّهِ وَما أَنزَلنا عَلىٰ عَبدِنا يَومَ الفُرقانِ يَومَ التَقَى الجَمعانِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
41.translation_eng: Know that whatever thing you may come by, a fifth of it is for Allah and the Apostle, for the relatives and the orphans, for the needy and the traveller, if you have faith in Allah and what We sent down to Our servant on the Day of Separation,1 the day when the two hosts met; and Allah has power over all things.That is, the day on which the Battle of Badr took place.
41.transliteration: wa-ʿlamū ʾannamā ghanimtum min shayʾin fa-ʾanna li-llāhi khumusahū wa-li-r-rasūli wa-li-dhī l-qurbā wa-l-yatāmā wa-l-masākīni wa-bni s-sabīli ʾin kuntum ʾāmantum bi-llāhi wa-mā ʾanzalnā ʿalā ʿabdinā yawma l-furqāni yawma ltaqā l-jamʿāni wa-llāhu ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

42.content: إِذ أَنتُم بِالعُدوَةِ الدُّنيا وَهُم بِالعُدوَةِ القُصوىٰ وَالرَّكبُ أَسفَلَ مِنكُم ۚ وَلَو تَواعَدتُم لَاختَلَفتُم فِي الميعادِ ۙ وَلٰكِن لِيَقضِيَ اللَّهُ أَمرًا كانَ مَفعولًا لِيَهلِكَ مَن هَلَكَ عَن بَيِّنَةٍ وَيَحيىٰ مَن حَيَّ عَن بَيِّنَةٍ ۗ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَسَميعٌ عَليمٌ
42.translation_eng: When you were on the nearer side,1 and they2 on the farther side, while the caravan was below you, and had you agreed together on an encounter, you would have certainly failed to keep the tryst,3 but in order that Allah may carry through a matter that was bound to be fulfilled, so that he who perishes might perish by a manifest proof, and he who lives may live on by a manifest proof, and Allah is indeed all-hearing, all-knowing.That is, on the side of the valley nearer to Madinah.That is, the army of the polytheists of Makkah.Or ‘you would not have kept the tryst.’
42.transliteration: ʾidh ʾantum bi-l-ʿudwati d-dunyā wa-hum bi-l-ʿudwati l-quṣwā wa-r-rakbu ʾasfala minkum wa-law tawāʿadtum la-khtalaftum fī l-mīʿādi wa-lākin li-yaqḍiya llāhu ʾamran kāna mafʿūlan li-yahlika man halaka ʿan bayyinatin wa-yaḥyā man ḥayya ʿan bayyinatin wa-ʾinna llāha la-samīʿun ʿalīmun

43.content: إِذ يُريكَهُمُ اللَّهُ في مَنامِكَ قَليلًا ۖ وَلَو أَراكَهُم كَثيرًا لَفَشِلتُم وَلَتَنازَعتُم فِي الأَمرِ وَلٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ سَلَّمَ ۗ إِنَّهُ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
43.translation_eng: When Allah showed them1 to you as few in your dream, and had He shown them as many, you would have lost heart, and disputed about the matter. But Allah spared you. Indeed He knows well what is in the breasts.That is, the enemy troops.
43.transliteration: ʾidh yurīkahumu llāhu fī manāmika qalīlan wa-law ʾarākahum kathīran la-fashiltum wa-la-tanāzaʿtum fī l-ʾamri wa-lākinna llāha sallama ʾinnahū ʿalīmun bi-dhāti ṣ-ṣudūri

44.content: وَإِذ يُريكُموهُم إِذِ التَقَيتُم في أَعيُنِكُم قَليلًا وَيُقَلِّلُكُم في أَعيُنِهِم لِيَقضِيَ اللَّهُ أَمرًا كانَ مَفعولًا ۗ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ تُرجَعُ الأُمورُ
44.translation_eng: And when He showed them to you —when you met them [on the battlefield]— as few in your eyes, and He made you [appear] few in their eyes in order that Allah may carry through a matter that was bound to be fulfilled, and to Allah all matters are returned.
44.transliteration: wa-ʾidh yurīkumūhum ʾidhi ltaqaytum fī ʾaʿyunikum qalīlan wa-yuqallilukum fī ʾaʿyunihim li-yaqḍiya llāhu ʾamran kāna mafʿūlan wa-ʾilā llāhi turjaʿu l-ʾumūru

45.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِذا لَقيتُم فِئَةً فَاثبُتوا وَاذكُرُوا اللَّهَ كَثيرًا لَعَلَّكُم تُفلِحونَ
45.translation_eng: O you who have faith! When you meet a host [in battle], then stand firm, and remember Allah greatly so that you may be felicitous.
45.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾidhā laqītum fiʾatan fa-thbutū wa-dhkurū llāha kathīran laʿallakum tufliḥūna

46.content: وَأَطيعُوا اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ وَلا تَنازَعوا فَتَفشَلوا وَتَذهَبَ ريحُكُم ۖ وَاصبِروا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ مَعَ الصّابِرينَ
46.translation_eng: And obey Allah and His Apostle, and do not dispute, or you will lose heart and your power will be gone. And be patient; indeed Allah is with the patient.
46.transliteration: wa-ʾaṭīʿū llāha wa-rasūlahū wa-lā tanāzaʿū fa-tafshalū wa-tadhhaba rīḥukum wa-ṣbirū ʾinna llāha maʿa ṣ-ṣābirīna

47.content: وَلا تَكونوا كَالَّذينَ خَرَجوا مِن دِيارِهِم بَطَرًا وَرِئَاءَ النّاسِ وَيَصُدّونَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِما يَعمَلونَ مُحيطٌ
47.translation_eng: Do not be like those who left their homes vainly and to show off to the people, and to bar [other people] from the way of Allah, and Allah comprehends what they do.
47.transliteration: wa-lā takūnū ka-lladhīna kharajū min diyārihim baṭaran wa-riʾāʾa n-nāsi wa-yaṣuddūna ʿan sabīli llāhi wa-llāhu bi-mā yaʿmalūna muḥīṭun

48.content: وَإِذ زَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيطانُ أَعمالَهُم وَقالَ لا غالِبَ لَكُمُ اليَومَ مِنَ النّاسِ وَإِنّي جارٌ لَكُم ۖ فَلَمّا تَراءَتِ الفِئَتانِ نَكَصَ عَلىٰ عَقِبَيهِ وَقالَ إِنّي بَريءٌ مِنكُم إِنّي أَرىٰ ما لا تَرَونَ إِنّي أَخافُ اللَّهَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ شَديدُ العِقابِ
48.translation_eng: When Satan made their deeds seem decorous to them, and said, ‘No one shall overcome you today from among all mankind, and I will stand by you.’ But when the two hosts sighted each other, he took to his heels, saying, ‘Indeed I am quit of you. I see what you do not see. Indeed I fear Allah, and Allah is severe in retribution.’
48.transliteration: wa-ʾidh zayyana lahumu sh-shayṭānu ʾaʿmālahum wa-qāla lā ghāliba lakumu l-yawma mina n-nāsi wa-ʾinnī jārun lakum fa-lammā tarāʾati l-fiʾatāni nakaṣa ʿalā ʿaqibayhi wa-qāla ʾinnī barīʾun minkum ʾinnī ʾarā mā lā tarawna ʾinnī ʾakhāfu llāha wa-llāhu shadīdu l-ʿiqābi

49.content: إِذ يَقولُ المُنافِقونَ وَالَّذينَ في قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ غَرَّ هٰؤُلاءِ دينُهُم ۗ وَمَن يَتَوَكَّل عَلَى اللَّهِ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزيزٌ حَكيمٌ
49.translation_eng: When the hypocrites said, and [also] those in whose hearts is a sickness, ‘Their religion has deceived them.’ But whoever puts his trust in Allah, then Allah is indeed all-mighty, all-wise.
49.transliteration: ʾidh yaqūlu l-munāfiqūna wa-lladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun gharra hāʾulāʾi dīnuhum wa-man yatawakkal ʿalā llāhi fa-ʾinna llāha ʿazīzun ḥakīmun

50.content: وَلَو تَرىٰ إِذ يَتَوَفَّى الَّذينَ كَفَرُوا ۙ المَلائِكَةُ يَضرِبونَ وُجوهَهُم وَأَدبارَهُم وَذوقوا عَذابَ الحَريقِ
50.translation_eng: Were you to see when the angels take away the faithless, striking their faces and their backs, [saying], ‘Taste the punishment of the burning.
50.transliteration: wa-law tarā ʾidh yatawaffā lladhīna kafarū l-malāʾikatu yaḍribūna wujūhahum wa-ʾadbārahum wa-dhūqū ʿadhāba l-ḥarīqi

51.content: ذٰلِكَ بِما قَدَّمَت أَيديكُم وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ لَيسَ بِظَلّامٍ لِلعَبيدِ
51.translation_eng: That is because of what your hands have sent ahead, and because Allah is not tyrannical to the servants.’
51.transliteration: dhālika bi-mā qaddamat ʾaydīkum wa-ʾanna llāha laysa bi-ẓallāmin li-l-ʿabīdi

52.content: كَدَأبِ آلِ فِرعَونَ ۙ وَالَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ كَفَروا بِآياتِ اللَّهِ فَأَخَذَهُمُ اللَّهُ بِذُنوبِهِم ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ قَوِيٌّ شَديدُ العِقابِ
52.translation_eng: Like the precedent of Pharaoh’s clan and those who were before them, who defied Allah’s signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. Indeed Allah is all-strong, severe in retribution.
52.transliteration: ka-daʾbi ʾāli firʿawna wa-lladhīna min qablihim kafarū bi-ʾāyāti llāhi fa-ʾakhadhahumu llāhu bi-dhunūbihim ʾinna llāha qawiyyun shadīdu l-ʿiqābi

53.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ لَم يَكُ مُغَيِّرًا نِعمَةً أَنعَمَها عَلىٰ قَومٍ حَتّىٰ يُغَيِّروا ما بِأَنفُسِهِم ۙ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ سَميعٌ عَليمٌ
53.translation_eng: That is because Allah never changes a blessing that He has bestowed on a people unless they change what is in their own souls, and Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing:
53.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾanna llāha lam yaku mughayyiran niʿmatan ʾanʿamahā ʿalā qawmin ḥattā yughayyirū mā bi-ʾanfusihim wa-ʾanna llāha samīʿun ʿalīmun

54.content: كَدَأبِ آلِ فِرعَونَ ۙ وَالَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِ رَبِّهِم فَأَهلَكناهُم بِذُنوبِهِم وَأَغرَقنا آلَ فِرعَونَ ۚ وَكُلٌّ كانوا ظالِمينَ
54.translation_eng: Like the precedent of Pharaoh’s clan and those who were before them, who denied the signs of their Lord; so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned Pharaoh’s clan; and they were all wrongdoers.
54.transliteration: ka-daʾbi ʾāli firʿawna wa-lladhīna min qablihim kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyāti rabbihim fa-ʾahlaknāhum bi-dhunūbihim wa-ʾaghraqnā ʾāla firʿawna wa-kullun kānū ẓālimīna

55.content: إِنَّ شَرَّ الدَّوابِّ عِندَ اللَّهِ الَّذينَ كَفَروا فَهُم لا يُؤمِنونَ
55.translation_eng: Indeed the worst of beasts in Allah’s sight are those who are faithless; so they will not have faith.
55.transliteration: ʾinna sharra d-dawābbi ʿinda llāhi lladhīna kafarū fa-hum lā yuʾminūna

56.content: الَّذينَ عاهَدتَ مِنهُم ثُمَّ يَنقُضونَ عَهدَهُم في كُلِّ مَرَّةٍ وَهُم لا يَتَّقونَ
56.translation_eng: —Those with whom you made a treaty, and who violated their treaty every time, and who are not Godwary.
56.transliteration: alladhīna ʿāhadta minhum thumma yanquḍūna ʿahdahum fī kulli marratin wa-hum lā yattaqūna

57.content: فَإِمّا تَثقَفَنَّهُم فِي الحَربِ فَشَرِّد بِهِم مَن خَلفَهُم لَعَلَّهُم يَذَّكَّرونَ
57.translation_eng: So if you confront them in battle, treat them [in such a wise] as to disperse those who are behind them, so that they may take admonition.
57.transliteration: fa-ʾimmā tathqafannahum fī l-ḥarbi fa-sharrid bihim man khalfahum laʿallahum yadhdhakkarūna

58.content: وَإِمّا تَخافَنَّ مِن قَومٍ خِيانَةً فَانبِذ إِلَيهِم عَلىٰ سَواءٍ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُحِبُّ الخائِنينَ
58.translation_eng: And if you fear treachery from a people, break off [the treaty] with them in a like manner. Indeed Allah does not like the treacherous.
58.transliteration: wa-ʾimmā takhāfanna min qawmin khiyānatan fa-nbidh ʾilayhim ʿalā sawāʾin ʾinna llāha lā yuḥibbu l-khāʾinīna

59.content: وَلا يَحسَبَنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا سَبَقوا ۚ إِنَّهُم لا يُعجِزونَ
59.translation_eng: Let the faithless not suppose that they have outmaneuvered [Allah]. Indeed they cannot thwart [His power].
59.transliteration: wa-lā yaḥsabanna lladhīna kafarū sabaqū ʾinnahum lā yuʿjizūna

60.content: وَأَعِدّوا لَهُم مَا استَطَعتُم مِن قُوَّةٍ وَمِن رِباطِ الخَيلِ تُرهِبونَ بِهِ عَدُوَّ اللَّهِ وَعَدُوَّكُم وَآخَرينَ مِن دونِهِم لا تَعلَمونَهُمُ اللَّهُ يَعلَمُهُم ۚ وَما تُنفِقوا مِن شَيءٍ في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ يُوَفَّ إِلَيكُم وَأَنتُم لا تُظلَمونَ
60.translation_eng: Prepare against them whatever you can of [military] power and war-horses, awing thereby the enemy of Allah, and your enemy, and others besides them, whom you do not know, but Allah knows them. And whatever you spend in the way of Allah will be repaid to you in full, and you will not be wronged.
60.transliteration: wa-ʾaʿiddū lahum mā staṭaʿtum min quwwatin wa-min ribāṭi l-khayli turhibūna bihī ʿaduwwa llāhi wa-ʿaduwwakum wa-ʾākharīna min dūnihim lā taʿlamūnahumu llāhu yaʿlamuhum wa-mā tunfiqū min shayʾin fī sabīli llāhi yuwaffa ʾilaykum wa-ʾantum lā tuẓlamūna

61.content: ۞ وَإِن جَنَحوا لِلسَّلمِ فَاجنَح لَها وَتَوَكَّل عَلَى اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
61.translation_eng: And if they incline toward peace, then you [too] incline toward it, and put your trust in Allah. Indeed He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
61.transliteration: wa-ʾin janaḥū li-s-salmi fa-jnaḥ lahā wa-tawakkal ʿalā llāhi ʾinnahū huwa s-samīʿu l-ʿalīmu

62.content: وَإِن يُريدوا أَن يَخدَعوكَ فَإِنَّ حَسبَكَ اللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ الَّذي أَيَّدَكَ بِنَصرِهِ وَبِالمُؤمِنينَ
62.translation_eng: But if they desire to deceive you, Allah is indeed sufficient for you. It is He who strengthened you with His help and with the means of the faithful,
62.transliteration: wa-ʾin yurīdū ʾan yakhdaʿūka fa-ʾinna ḥasbaka llāhu huwa lladhī ʾayyadaka bi-naṣrihī wa-bi-l-muʾminīna

63.content: وَأَلَّفَ بَينَ قُلوبِهِم ۚ لَو أَنفَقتَ ما فِي الأَرضِ جَميعًا ما أَلَّفتَ بَينَ قُلوبِهِم وَلٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ أَلَّفَ بَينَهُم ۚ إِنَّهُ عَزيزٌ حَكيمٌ
63.translation_eng: and united their hearts. Had you spent all that is in the earth, you could not have united their hearts, but Allah united them together. Indeed He is all-mighty, all-wise.
63.transliteration: wa-ʾallafa bayna qulūbihim law ʾanfaqta mā fī l-ʾarḍi jamīʿan mā ʾallafta bayna qulūbihim wa-lākinna llāha ʾallafa baynahum ʾinnahū ʿazīzun ḥakīmun

64.content: يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ حَسبُكَ اللَّهُ وَمَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
64.translation_eng: O Prophet! Sufficient for you is Allah and those of the faithful who follow you.
64.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nabiyyu ḥasbuka llāhu wa-mani ttabaʿaka mina l-muʾminīna

65.content: يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ حَرِّضِ المُؤمِنينَ عَلَى القِتالِ ۚ إِن يَكُن مِنكُم عِشرونَ صابِرونَ يَغلِبوا مِائَتَينِ ۚ وَإِن يَكُن مِنكُم مِائَةٌ يَغلِبوا أَلفًا مِنَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِأَنَّهُم قَومٌ لا يَفقَهونَ
65.translation_eng: O Prophet! Urge on the faithful to fight: If there be twenty patient men among you, they shall overcome two hundred; and if there be a hundred of you, they shall overcome a thousand of the faithless, for they are a lot who do not understand.
65.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nabiyyu ḥarriḍi l-muʾminīna ʿalā l-qitāli ʾin yakun minkum ʿishrūna ṣābirūna yaghlibū miʾatayni wa-ʾin yakun minkum miʾatun yaghlibū ʾalfan mina lladhīna kafarū bi-ʾannahum qawmun lā yafqahūna

66.content: الآنَ خَفَّفَ اللَّهُ عَنكُم وَعَلِمَ أَنَّ فيكُم ضَعفًا ۚ فَإِن يَكُن مِنكُم مِائَةٌ صابِرَةٌ يَغلِبوا مِائَتَينِ ۚ وَإِن يَكُن مِنكُم أَلفٌ يَغلِبوا أَلفَينِ بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ مَعَ الصّابِرينَ
66.translation_eng: Now Allah has lightened your burden, knowing that there is weakness in you. So if there be a hundred patient men among you, they shall overcome two hundred; and if there be a thousand, they shall overcome two thousand, by Allah’s leave; and Allah is with the patient.
66.transliteration: al-ʾāna khaffafa llāhu ʿankum wa-ʿalima ʾanna fīkum ḍaʿfan fa-ʾin yakun minkum miʾatun ṣābiratun yaghlibū miʾatayni wa-ʾin yakun minkum ʾalfun yaghlibū ʾalfayni bi-ʾidhni llāhi wa-llāhu maʿa ṣ-ṣābirīna

67.content: ما كانَ لِنَبِيٍّ أَن يَكونَ لَهُ أَسرىٰ حَتّىٰ يُثخِنَ فِي الأَرضِ ۚ تُريدونَ عَرَضَ الدُّنيا وَاللَّهُ يُريدُ الآخِرَةَ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَزيزٌ حَكيمٌ
67.translation_eng: A prophet may not take captives until he has thoroughly decimated [the enemy] in the land. You desire the transitory gains of this world, while Allah desires [for you] [the reward of] the Hereafter, and Allah is all-mighty, all-wise.
67.transliteration: mā kāna li-nabiyyin ʾan yakūna lahū ʾasrā ḥattā yuthkhina fī l-ʾarḍi turīdūna ʿaraḍa d-dunyā wa-llāhu yurīdu l-ʾākhirata wa-llāhu ʿazīzun ḥakīmun

68.content: لَولا كِتابٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ سَبَقَ لَمَسَّكُم فيما أَخَذتُم عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
68.translation_eng: Had it not been for a prior decree of Allah, surely there would have befallen you a great punishment for what you took.
68.transliteration: law-lā kitābun mina llāhi sabaqa la-massakum fī-mā ʾakhadhtum ʿadhābun ʿaẓīmun

69.content: فَكُلوا مِمّا غَنِمتُم حَلالًا طَيِّبًا ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
