127.content: وَإِذا ما أُنزِلَت سورَةٌ نَظَرَ بَعضُهُم إِلىٰ بَعضٍ هَل يَراكُم مِن أَحَدٍ ثُمَّ انصَرَفوا ۚ صَرَفَ اللَّهُ قُلوبَهُم بِأَنَّهُم قَومٌ لا يَفقَهونَ
127.translation_eng: And whenever a sūrah is sent down, they look at one another: ‘Is anybody observing you?’ Then they slip away. Allah has turned aside their hearts, for they are a people who do not understand.
127.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā mā ʾunzilat sūratun naẓara baʿḍuhum ʾilā baʿḍin hal yarākum min ʾaḥadin thumma nṣarafū ṣarafa llāhu qulūbahum bi-ʾannahum qawmun lā yafqahūna

128.content: لَقَد جاءَكُم رَسولٌ مِن أَنفُسِكُم عَزيزٌ عَلَيهِ ما عَنِتُّم حَريصٌ عَلَيكُم بِالمُؤمِنينَ رَءوفٌ رَحيمٌ
128.translation_eng: There has certainly come to you an apostle from among yourselves. Grievous to him is your distress; he has deep concern for you, and is most kind and merciful to the faithful.
128.transliteration: la-qad jāʾakum rasūlun min ʾanfusikum ʿazīzun ʿalayhi mā ʿanittum ḥarīṣun ʿalaykum bi-l-muʾminīna raʾūfun raḥīmun

129.content: فَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَقُل حَسبِيَ اللَّهُ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ ۖ عَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلتُ ۖ وَهُوَ رَبُّ العَرشِ العَظيمِ
129.translation_eng: But if they turn their backs [on you], say, ‘Allah is sufficient for me. There is no god except Him. In Him I have put my trust and He is the Lord of the Great Throne.’
129.transliteration: fa-ʾin tawallaw fa-qul ḥasbiya llāhu lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa ʿalayhi tawakkaltu wa-huwa rabbu l-ʿarshi l-ʿaẓīmi

10.description: The surah that mentions the repentance of the people of the Prophet Jonah as an exception among the communities to whom the prophets came. They heeded Jonah’s call. Thus, God shed His grace upon them and exempted them from ruin. “Yūnus” is the Arabic for “Jonah”, the prophet whose account appears in this surah (verse 98). It stresses God’s power, the authenticity of the Quran, and the fate of evildoers. God’s anger at those who consistently deny the truth of His revelations and signs is made clear, as is the fact that, were it not for His decision to await the Day of Resurrection, His judgement would already have fallen upon them. The Prophet is encouraged to be patient and reminded of the fact that he cannot force people to believe.

1.translation_eng: Alif, Lām, Rā. These are the signs of the Wise1 Book.Or ‘Definitive.’
1.transliteration: a-l-r (ʾalif lām rā) tilka ʾāyātu l-kitābi l-ḥakīmi

2.content: أَكانَ لِلنّاسِ عَجَبًا أَن أَوحَينا إِلىٰ رَجُلٍ مِنهُم أَن أَنذِرِ النّاسَ وَبَشِّرِ الَّذينَ آمَنوا أَنَّ لَهُم قَدَمَ صِدقٍ عِندَ رَبِّهِم ۗ قالَ الكافِرونَ إِنَّ هٰذا لَساحِرٌ مُبينٌ
2.translation_eng: Does it seem odd to these people that We have revealed to a man from among themselves, [declaring], ‘Warn mankind, and give good news to the faithful that they are in good standing with their Lord’? The faithless say, ‘This is indeed a plain magician.’
2.transliteration: ʾa-kāna li-n-nāsi ʿajaban ʾan ʾawḥaynā ʾilā rajulin minhum ʾan ʾandhiri n-nāsa wa-bashshiri lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾanna lahum qadama ṣidqin ʿinda rabbihim qāla l-kāfirūna ʾinna hādhā la-sāḥirun mubīnun

3.content: إِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ اللَّهُ الَّذي خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ في سِتَّةِ أَيّامٍ ثُمَّ استَوىٰ عَلَى العَرشِ ۖ يُدَبِّرُ الأَمرَ ۖ ما مِن شَفيعٍ إِلّا مِن بَعدِ إِذنِهِ ۚ ذٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُم فَاعبُدوهُ ۚ أَفَلا تَذَكَّرونَ
3.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and then settled on the Throne, directing the command.1 There is no intercessor, except by His leave. That is Allah, your Lord! So worship Him. Will you not then take admonition?Cf. 13:2; 32:5.
3.transliteration: ʾinna rabbakumu llāhu lladhī khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa fī sittati ʾayyāmin thumma stawā ʿalā l-ʿarshi yudabbiru l-ʾamra mā min shafīʿin ʾillā min baʿdi ʾidhnihī dhālikumu llāhu rabbukum fa-ʿbudūhu ʾa-fa-lā tadhakkarūna

4.content: إِلَيهِ مَرجِعُكُم جَميعًا ۖ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقًّا ۚ إِنَّهُ يَبدَأُ الخَلقَ ثُمَّ يُعيدُهُ لِيَجزِيَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ بِالقِسطِ ۚ وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا لَهُم شَرابٌ مِن حَميمٍ وَعَذابٌ أَليمٌ بِما كانوا يَكفُرونَ
4.translation_eng: To Him will be the return of you all —[that is] Allah’s true promise. Indeed He originates the creation, then He will bring it back that He may reward those who have faith and do righteous deeds with justice. As for the faithless, they shall have boiling water for drink, and a painful punishment because of what they used to defy.
4.transliteration: ʾilayhi marjiʿukum jamīʿan waʿda llāhi ḥaqqan ʾinnahū yabdaʾu l-khalqa thumma yuʿīduhū li-yajziya lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti bi-l-qisṭi wa-lladhīna kafarū lahum sharābun min ḥamīmin wa-ʿadhābun ʾalīmun bi-mā kānū yakfurūna

5.content: هُوَ الَّذي جَعَلَ الشَّمسَ ضِياءً وَالقَمَرَ نورًا وَقَدَّرَهُ مَنازِلَ لِتَعلَموا عَدَدَ السِّنينَ وَالحِسابَ ۚ ما خَلَقَ اللَّهُ ذٰلِكَ إِلّا بِالحَقِّ ۚ يُفَصِّلُ الآياتِ لِقَومٍ يَعلَمونَ
5.translation_eng: It is He who made the sun a radiance and the moon a light, and ordained its phases that you might know the number of years and the calculation [of time]. Allah did not create all that except with reason. He elaborates the signs for a people who have knowledge.
5.transliteration: huwa lladhī jaʿala sh-shamsa ḍiyāʾan wa-l-qamara nūran wa-qaddarahū manāzila li-taʿlamū ʿadada s-sinīna wa-l-ḥisāba mā khalaqa llāhu dhālika ʾillā bi-l-ḥaqqi yufaṣṣilu l-ʾāyāti li-qawmin yaʿlamūna

6.content: إِنَّ فِي اختِلافِ اللَّيلِ وَالنَّهارِ وَما خَلَقَ اللَّهُ فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَتَّقونَ
6.translation_eng: Indeed in the alternation of night and day, and whatever Allah has created in the heavens and the earth, there are surely signs for a people who are Godwary.
6.transliteration: ʾinna fī khtilāfi l-layli wa-n-nahāri wa-mā khalaqa llāhu fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yattaqūna

7.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ لا يَرجونَ لِقاءَنا وَرَضوا بِالحَياةِ الدُّنيا وَاطمَأَنّوا بِها وَالَّذينَ هُم عَن آياتِنا غافِلونَ
7.translation_eng: Indeed those who do not expect to encounter Us and who are pleased with the life of this world and satisfied with it, and those who are oblivious of Our signs
7.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna lā yarjūna liqāʾanā wa-raḍū bi-l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-ṭmaʾannū bihā wa-lladhīna hum ʿan ʾāyātinā ghāfilūna

8.content: أُولٰئِكَ مَأواهُمُ النّارُ بِما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
8.translation_eng: —it is they whose refuge shall be the Fire because of what they used to earn.
8.transliteration: ʾulāʾika maʾwāhumu n-nāru bi-mā kānū yaksibūna

9.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ يَهديهِم رَبُّهُم بِإيمانِهِم ۖ تَجري مِن تَحتِهِمُ الأَنهارُ في جَنّاتِ النَّعيمِ
9.translation_eng: Indeed those who have faith and do righteous deeds, their Lord guides them by the means of their faith. Streams will run for them in gardens of bliss.
9.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti yahdīhim rabbuhum bi-ʾīmānihim tajrī min taḥtihimu l-ʾanhāru fī jannāti n-naʿīmi

10.content: دَعواهُم فيها سُبحانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ وَتَحِيَّتُهُم فيها سَلامٌ ۚ وَآخِرُ دَعواهُم أَنِ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
10.translation_eng: Their call therein will be, ‘O Allah! Immaculate are You!’ and their greeting therein will be, ‘Peace!’ and their concluding call, ‘All praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.’
10.transliteration: daʿwāhum fīhā subḥānaka llāhumma wa-taḥiyyatuhum fīhā salāmun wa-ʾākhiru daʿwāhum ʾani l-ḥamdu li-llāhi rabbi l-ʿālamīna

11.content: ۞ وَلَو يُعَجِّلُ اللَّهُ لِلنّاسِ الشَّرَّ استِعجالَهُم بِالخَيرِ لَقُضِيَ إِلَيهِم أَجَلُهُم ۖ فَنَذَرُ الَّذينَ لا يَرجونَ لِقاءَنا في طُغيانِهِم يَعمَهونَ
11.translation_eng: Were Allah to hasten ill1 for mankind with their haste for good, their term would have been over. But We leave those who do not expect to encounter Us bewildered in their rebellion.That is, punishment.
11.transliteration: wa-law yuʿajjilu llāhu li-n-nāsi sh-sharra stiʿjālahum bi-l-khayri la-quḍiya ʾilayhim ʾajaluhum fa-nadharu lladhīna lā yarjūna liqāʾanā fī ṭughyānihim yaʿmahūna

12.content: وَإِذا مَسَّ الإِنسانَ الضُّرُّ دَعانا لِجَنبِهِ أَو قاعِدًا أَو قائِمًا فَلَمّا كَشَفنا عَنهُ ضُرَّهُ مَرَّ كَأَن لَم يَدعُنا إِلىٰ ضُرٍّ مَسَّهُ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ زُيِّنَ لِلمُسرِفينَ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
12.translation_eng: When distress befalls man, he supplicates Us, [lying] on his side, sitting, or standing; but when We remove his distress, he passes on as if he had never supplicated Us concerning the distress that had befallen him. To the profligate is thus presented as decorous what they have been doing.
12.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā massa l-ʾinsāna ḍ-ḍurru daʿānā li-janbihī ʾaw qāʿidan ʾaw qāʾiman fa-lammā kashafnā ʿanhu ḍurrahū marra ka-ʾan lam yadʿunā ʾilā ḍurrin massahū ka-dhālika zuyyina li-l-musrifīna mā kānū yaʿmalūna

13.content: وَلَقَد أَهلَكنَا القُرونَ مِن قَبلِكُم لَمّا ظَلَموا ۙ وَجاءَتهُم رُسُلُهُم بِالبَيِّناتِ وَما كانوا لِيُؤمِنوا ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي القَومَ المُجرِمينَ
13.translation_eng: Certainly We destroyed [several] generations before you when they perpetrated wrongs: their apostles brought them manifest proofs, but they would not have faith. Thus do We requite the guilty lot.
13.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾahlaknā l-qurūna min qablikum lammā ẓalamū wa-jāʾathum rusuluhum bi-l-bayyināti wa-mā kānū li-yuʾminū ka-dhālika najzī l-qawma l-mujrimīna

14.content: ثُمَّ جَعَلناكُم خَلائِفَ فِي الأَرضِ مِن بَعدِهِم لِنَنظُرَ كَيفَ تَعمَلونَ
14.translation_eng: Then We made you successors on the earth after them that We may observe how you will act.
14.transliteration: thumma jaʿalnākum khalāʾifa fī l-ʾarḍi min baʿdihim li-nanẓura kayfa taʿmalūna

15.content: وَإِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم آياتُنا بَيِّناتٍ ۙ قالَ الَّذينَ لا يَرجونَ لِقاءَنَا ائتِ بِقُرآنٍ غَيرِ هٰذا أَو بَدِّلهُ ۚ قُل ما يَكونُ لي أَن أُبَدِّلَهُ مِن تِلقاءِ نَفسي ۖ إِن أَتَّبِعُ إِلّا ما يوحىٰ إِلَيَّ ۖ إِنّي أَخافُ إِن عَصَيتُ رَبّي عَذابَ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
15.translation_eng: When Our manifest signs are recited to them, those who do not expect to encounter Us say, ‘Bring a Qurʾān other than this, or alter it.’ Say, ‘I may not alter it of my own accord. I follow only what is revealed to me. Indeed should I disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a tremendous day.’
15.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhim ʾāyātunā bayyinātin qāla lladhīna lā yarjūna liqāʾanā ʾti bi-qurʾānin ghayri hādhā ʾaw baddilhu qul mā yakūnu lī ʾan ʾubaddilahū min tilqāʾī nafsī ʾin ʾattabiʿu ʾillā mā yūḥā ʾilayya ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʾin ʿaṣaytu rabbī ʿadhāba yawmin ʿaẓīmin

16.content: قُل لَو شاءَ اللَّهُ ما تَلَوتُهُ عَلَيكُم وَلا أَدراكُم بِهِ ۖ فَقَد لَبِثتُ فيكُم عُمُرًا مِن قَبلِهِ ۚ أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
16.translation_eng: Say, ‘Had Allah [so] wished, I would not have recited it to you, nor would He have made it known to you, for I have dwelled among you for a lifetime before it. Do you not apply reason?’
16.transliteration: qul law shāʾa llāhu mā talawtuhū ʿalaykum wa-lā ʾadrākum bihī fa-qad labithtu fīkum ʿumuran min qablihī ʾa-fa-lā taʿqilūna

17.content: فَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّنِ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَو كَذَّبَ بِآياتِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لا يُفلِحُ المُجرِمونَ
17.translation_eng: So who is a greater wrongdoer than him who fabricates a lie against Allah, or denies His signs? Indeed the guilty will not be felicitous.
17.transliteration: fa-man ʾaẓlamu mimmani ftarā ʿalā llāhi kadhiban ʾaw kadhdhaba bi-ʾāyātihī ʾinnahū lā yufliḥu l-mujrimūna

18.content: وَيَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَضُرُّهُم وَلا يَنفَعُهُم وَيَقولونَ هٰؤُلاءِ شُفَعاؤُنا عِندَ اللَّهِ ۚ قُل أَتُنَبِّئونَ اللَّهَ بِما لا يَعلَمُ فِي السَّماواتِ وَلا فِي الأَرضِ ۚ سُبحانَهُ وَتَعالىٰ عَمّا يُشرِكونَ
18.translation_eng: They worship besides Allah that which neither causes them any harm, nor brings them any benefit, and they say, ‘These are our intercessors with Allah.’ Say, ‘Will you inform Allah about something He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?’ Immaculate is He and exalted above [having] any partners that they ascribe [to Him]!
18.transliteration: wa-yaʿbudūna min dūni llāhi mā lā yaḍurruhum wa-lā yanfaʿuhum wa-yaqūlūna hāʾulāʾi shufaʿāʾunā ʿinda llāhi qul ʾa-tunabbiʾūna llāha bi-mā lā yaʿlamu fī s-samāwāti wa-lā fī l-ʾarḍi subḥānahū wa-taʿālā ʿammā yushrikūna

19.content: وَما كانَ النّاسُ إِلّا أُمَّةً واحِدَةً فَاختَلَفوا ۚ وَلَولا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَت مِن رَبِّكَ لَقُضِيَ بَينَهُم فيما فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
19.translation_eng: Mankind were but a single [religious] community; then they differed. And were it not for a prior decree of your Lord, decision would have been made between them concerning that about which they differ.
19.transliteration: wa-mā kāna n-nāsu ʾillā ʾummatan wāḥidatan fa-khtalafū wa-law-lā kalimatun sabaqat min rabbika la-quḍiya baynahum fī-mā fīhi yakhtalifūna

20.content: وَيَقولونَ لَولا أُنزِلَ عَلَيهِ آيَةٌ مِن رَبِّهِ ۖ فَقُل إِنَّمَا الغَيبُ لِلَّهِ فَانتَظِروا إِنّي مَعَكُم مِنَ المُنتَظِرينَ
20.translation_eng: They say, ‘Why has not some sign1 been sent down to him from his Lord?’ Say, ‘[The knowledge of] the Unseen belongs only to Allah. So wait. I too am waiting along with you.’That is, miracle.
20.transliteration: wa-yaqūlūna law-lā ʾunzila ʿalayhi ʾāyatun min rabbihī fa-qul ʾinnamā l-ghaybu li-llāhi fa-ntaẓirū ʾinnī maʿakum mina l-muntaẓirīna

21.content: وَإِذا أَذَقنَا النّاسَ رَحمَةً مِن بَعدِ ضَرّاءَ مَسَّتهُم إِذا لَهُم مَكرٌ في آياتِنا ۚ قُلِ اللَّهُ أَسرَعُ مَكرًا ۚ إِنَّ رُسُلَنا يَكتُبونَ ما تَمكُرونَ
21.translation_eng: When We let people taste [Our] mercy after a distress that has befallen them, behold, they scheme against Our signs! Say, ‘Allah is more swift at devising.’ Indeed Our messengers write down what you scheme.
21.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā ʾadhaqnā n-nāsa raḥmatan min baʿdi ḍarrāʾa massathum ʾidhā lahum makrun fī ʾāyātinā quli llāhu ʾasraʿu makran ʾinna rusulanā yaktubūna mā tamkurūna

22.content: هُوَ الَّذي يُسَيِّرُكُم فِي البَرِّ وَالبَحرِ ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذا كُنتُم فِي الفُلكِ وَجَرَينَ بِهِم بِريحٍ طَيِّبَةٍ وَفَرِحوا بِها جاءَتها ريحٌ عاصِفٌ وَجاءَهُمُ المَوجُ مِن كُلِّ مَكانٍ وَظَنّوا أَنَّهُم أُحيطَ بِهِم ۙ دَعَوُا اللَّهَ مُخلِصينَ لَهُ الدّينَ لَئِن أَنجَيتَنا مِن هٰذِهِ لَنَكونَنَّ مِنَ الشّاكِرينَ
22.translation_eng: It is He who carries you across land and sea. When you are in the ships, and they sail with them with a favourable wind, rejoicing in it, there comes upon them a tempestuous wind and waves assail them from every side, and they think that they are besieged, they invoke Allah putting exclusive faith in Him, ‘If You deliver us from this, we will surely be among the grateful.’
22.transliteration: huwa lladhī yusayyirukum fī l-barri wa-l-baḥri ḥattā ʾidhā kuntum fī l-fulki wa-jarayna bihim bi-rīḥin ṭayyibatin wa-fariḥū bihā jāʾathā rīḥun ʿāṣifun wa-jāʾahumu l-mawju min kulli makānin wa-ẓannū ʾannahum ʾuḥīṭa bihim daʿawu llāha mukhliṣīna lahu d-dīna la-ʾin ʾanjaytanā min hādhihī la-nakūnanna mina sh-shākirīna

23.content: فَلَمّا أَنجاهُم إِذا هُم يَبغونَ فِي الأَرضِ بِغَيرِ الحَقِّ ۗ يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ إِنَّما بَغيُكُم عَلىٰ أَنفُسِكُم ۖ مَتاعَ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَينا مَرجِعُكُم فَنُنَبِّئُكُم بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
23.translation_eng: But when He delivers them, behold, they commit violations on the earth unduly! O mankind! Your violations are only to your own detriment. [These are] the wares of the life of this world; then to Us will be your return, whereat We will inform you concerning what you used to do.
23.transliteration: fa-lammā ʾanjāhum ʾidhā hum yabghūna fī l-ʾarḍi bi-ghayri l-ḥaqqi yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ʾinnamā baghyukum ʿalā ʾanfusikum matāʿa l-ḥayāti d-dunyā thumma ʾilaynā marjiʿukum fa-nunabbiʾukum bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna

24.content: إِنَّما مَثَلُ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا كَماءٍ أَنزَلناهُ مِنَ السَّماءِ فَاختَلَطَ بِهِ نَباتُ الأَرضِ مِمّا يَأكُلُ النّاسُ وَالأَنعامُ حَتّىٰ إِذا أَخَذَتِ الأَرضُ زُخرُفَها وَازَّيَّنَت وَظَنَّ أَهلُها أَنَّهُم قادِرونَ عَلَيها أَتاها أَمرُنا لَيلًا أَو نَهارًا فَجَعَلناها حَصيدًا كَأَن لَم تَغنَ بِالأَمسِ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ الآياتِ لِقَومٍ يَتَفَكَّرونَ
24.translation_eng: The parable of the life of this world is that of water which We send down from the sky. It mingles with the earth’s vegetation from which humans and cattle eat. When the earth puts on its luster and is adorned, and its inhabitants think they have power over it, Our edict comes to it, by night or day, whereat We turn it into a mown field, as if it did not flourish the day before. Thus do We elaborate the signs for a people who reflect.
24.transliteration: ʾinnamā mathalu l-ḥayāti d-dunyā ka-māʾin ʾanzalnāhu mina s-samāʾi fa-khtalaṭa bihī nabātu l-ʾarḍi mimmā yaʾkulu n-nāsu wa-l-ʾanʿāmu ḥattā ʾidhā ʾakhadhati l-ʾarḍu zukhrufahā wa-zzayyanat wa-ẓanna ʾahluhā ʾannahum qādirūna ʿalayhā ʾatāhā ʾamrunā laylan ʾaw nahāran fa-jaʿalnāhā ḥaṣīdan ka-ʾan lam taghna bi-l-ʾamsi ka-dhālika nufaṣṣilu l-ʾāyāti li-qawmin yatafakkarūna

25.content: وَاللَّهُ يَدعو إِلىٰ دارِ السَّلامِ وَيَهدي مَن يَشاءُ إِلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
25.translation_eng: Allah invites to the abode of peace, and He guides whomever He wishes to a straight path.
25.transliteration: wa-llāhu yadʿū ʾilā dāri s-salāmi wa-yahdī man yashāʾu ʾilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

26.content: ۞ لِلَّذينَ أَحسَنُوا الحُسنىٰ وَزِيادَةٌ ۖ وَلا يَرهَقُ وُجوهَهُم قَتَرٌ وَلا ذِلَّةٌ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ الجَنَّةِ ۖ هُم فيها خالِدونَ
26.translation_eng: Those who are virtuous shall receive the best reward and an enhancement. Neither dust nor abasement shall overcast their faces. They shall be the inhabitants of paradise, and they shall remain in it [forever].
26.transliteration: li-lladhīna ʾaḥsanū l-ḥusnā wa-ziyādatun wa-lā yarhaqu wujūhahum qatarun wa-lā dhillatun ʾulāʾika ʾaṣḥābu l-jannati hum fīhā khālidūna

27.content: وَالَّذينَ كَسَبُوا السَّيِّئَاتِ جَزاءُ سَيِّئَةٍ بِمِثلِها وَتَرهَقُهُم ذِلَّةٌ ۖ ما لَهُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن عاصِمٍ ۖ كَأَنَّما أُغشِيَت وُجوهُهُم قِطَعًا مِنَ اللَّيلِ مُظلِمًا ۚ أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ النّارِ ۖ هُم فيها خالِدونَ
27.translation_eng: For those who have committed misdeeds, the requital of a misdeed shall be its like, and they shall be overcast by abasement. They shall have no one to protect [them] from Allah. [They will be] as if their faces were covered with dark patches of the night. They shall be the inmates of the Fire, and they shall remain in it [forever].
27.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kasabū s-sayyiʾāti jazāʾu sayyiʾatin bi-mithlihā wa-tarhaquhum dhillatun mā lahum mina llāhi min ʿāṣimin ka-ʾannamā ʾughshiyat wujūhuhum qiṭaʿan mina l-layli muẓliman ʾulāʾika ʾaṣḥābu n-nāri hum fīhā khālidūna

28.content: وَيَومَ نَحشُرُهُم جَميعًا ثُمَّ نَقولُ لِلَّذينَ أَشرَكوا مَكانَكُم أَنتُم وَشُرَكاؤُكُم ۚ فَزَيَّلنا بَينَهُم ۖ وَقالَ شُرَكاؤُهُم ما كُنتُم إِيّانا تَعبُدونَ
28.translation_eng: On the day when We gather them all together, We shall say to those who ascribe partners [to Allah], ‘Stay where you are —you and your partners!’ Then We shall set them apart from one another, and their partners1 will say, ‘It was not us that you worshipped.That is, the false gods whom the polytheists associated with Allah.
28.transliteration: wa-yawma naḥshuruhum jamīʿan thumma naqūlu li-lladhīna ʾashrakū makānakum ʾantum wa-shurakāʾukum fa-zayyalnā baynahum wa-qāla shurakāʾuhum mā kuntum ʾiyyānā taʿbudūna

29.content: فَكَفىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهيدًا بَينَنا وَبَينَكُم إِن كُنّا عَن عِبادَتِكُم لَغافِلينَ
29.translation_eng: Allah suffices as a witness between you and us. We were indeed unaware of your worship.’
29.transliteration: fa-kafā bi-llāhi shahīdan baynanā wa-baynakum ʾin kunnā ʿan ʿibādatikum la-ghāfilīna

30.content: هُنالِكَ تَبلو كُلُّ نَفسٍ ما أَسلَفَت ۚ وَرُدّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ مَولاهُمُ الحَقِّ ۖ وَضَلَّ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَفتَرونَ
30.translation_eng: There every soul will examine what it has sent in advance, and they will be returned to Allah, their real master, and what they used to fabricate will forsake them.
30.transliteration: hunālika tablū kullu nafsin mā ʾaslafat wa-ruddū ʾilā llāhi mawlāhumu l-ḥaqqi wa-ḍalla ʿanhum mā kānū yaftarūna

31.content: قُل مَن يَرزُقُكُم مِنَ السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ أَمَّن يَملِكُ السَّمعَ وَالأَبصارَ وَمَن يُخرِجُ الحَيَّ مِنَ المَيِّتِ وَيُخرِجُ المَيِّتَ مِنَ الحَيِّ وَمَن يُدَبِّرُ الأَمرَ ۚ فَسَيَقولونَ اللَّهُ ۚ فَقُل أَفَلا تَتَّقونَ
31.translation_eng: Say, ‘Who provides for you out of the sky and the earth? Who controls [your] hearing and sight, and who brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living, and who directs the command?’ They will say, ‘Allah.’ Say, ‘Will you not then be wary [of Him]?’
31.transliteration: qul man yarzuqukum mina s-samāʾi wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾam-man yamliku s-samʿa wa-l-ʾabṣāra wa-man yukhriju l-ḥayya mina l-mayyiti wa-yukhriju l-mayyita mina l-ḥayyi wa-man yudabbiru l-ʾamra fa-sa-yaqūlūna llāhu fa-qul ʾa-fa-lā tattaqūna

32.content: فَذٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُمُ الحَقُّ ۖ فَماذا بَعدَ الحَقِّ إِلَّا الضَّلالُ ۖ فَأَنّىٰ تُصرَفونَ
32.translation_eng: That, then, is Allah, your true Lord. So what is there after the truth except error? Then where are you being led away?
32.transliteration: fa-dhālikumu llāhu rabbukumu l-ḥaqqu fa-mādhā baʿda l-ḥaqqi ʾillā ḍ-ḍalālu fa-ʾannā tuṣrafūna

33.content: كَذٰلِكَ حَقَّت كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ عَلَى الَّذينَ فَسَقوا أَنَّهُم لا يُؤمِنونَ
33.translation_eng: Thus the word of your Lord became due against those who transgress that they shall not have faith.
33.transliteration: ka-dhālika ḥaqqat kalimatu rabbika ʿalā lladhīna fasaqū ʾannahum lā yuʾminūna

34.content: قُل هَل مِن شُرَكائِكُم مَن يَبدَأُ الخَلقَ ثُمَّ يُعيدُهُ ۚ قُلِ اللَّهُ يَبدَأُ الخَلقَ ثُمَّ يُعيدُهُ ۖ فَأَنّىٰ تُؤفَكونَ
34.translation_eng: Say, ‘Is there anyone among your partners who originates the creation and then brings it back?’ Say, ‘Allah originates the creation, then He will bring it back.’ Then where do you stray?
34.transliteration: qul hal min shurakāʾikum man yabdaʾu l-khalqa thumma yuʿīduhū quli llāhu yabdaʾu l-khalqa thumma yuʿīduhū fa-ʾannā tuʾfakūna

35.content: قُل هَل مِن شُرَكائِكُم مَن يَهدي إِلَى الحَقِّ ۚ قُلِ اللَّهُ يَهدي لِلحَقِّ ۗ أَفَمَن يَهدي إِلَى الحَقِّ أَحَقُّ أَن يُتَّبَعَ أَمَّن لا يَهِدّي إِلّا أَن يُهدىٰ ۖ فَما لَكُم كَيفَ تَحكُمونَ
35.translation_eng: Say, ‘Is there anyone among your partners who may guide to the truth?’ Say, ‘Allah guides to the truth. Is He who guides to the truth worthier to be followed, or he who is not guided unless he is shown the way? What is the matter with you? How do you judge?’
35.transliteration: qul hal min shurakāʾikum man yahdī ʾilā l-ḥaqqi quli llāhu yahdī li-l-ḥaqqi ʾa-fa-man yahdī ʾilā l-ḥaqqi ʾaḥaqqu ʾan yuttabaʿa ʾam-man lā yahiddī ʾillā ʾan yuhdā fa-mā lakum kayfa taḥkumūna

36.content: وَما يَتَّبِعُ أَكثَرُهُم إِلّا ظَنًّا ۚ إِنَّ الظَّنَّ لا يُغني مِنَ الحَقِّ شَيئًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَليمٌ بِما يَفعَلونَ
36.translation_eng: Most of them just follow conjecture; indeed conjecture is no substitute for the truth. Indeed Allah knows best what they do.
36.transliteration: wa-mā yattabiʿu ʾaktharuhum ʾillā ẓannan ʾinna ẓ-ẓanna lā yughnī mina l-ḥaqqi shayʾan ʾinna llāha ʿalīmun bi-mā yafʿalūna

37.content: وَما كانَ هٰذَا القُرآنُ أَن يُفتَرىٰ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَلٰكِن تَصديقَ الَّذي بَينَ يَدَيهِ وَتَفصيلَ الكِتابِ لا رَيبَ فيهِ مِن رَبِّ العالَمينَ
37.translation_eng: This Qurʾān could not have been fabricated by anyone besides Allah; rather it is a confirmation of what was [revealed] before it, and an elaboration of the Book, there is no doubt in it, from the Lord of all the worlds.
37.transliteration: wa-mā kāna hādhā l-qurʾānu ʾan yuftarā min dūni llāhi wa-lākin taṣdīqa llādhī bayna yadayhi wa-tafṣīla l-kitābi lā rayba fīhi min rabbi l-ʿālamīna

38.content: أَم يَقولونَ افتَراهُ ۖ قُل فَأتوا بِسورَةٍ مِثلِهِ وَادعوا مَنِ استَطَعتُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
38.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘He has fabricated it?’ Say, ‘Then bring a sūrah like it, and invoke whomever you can, besides Allah, should you be truthful.’
38.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna ftarāhu qul fa-ʾtū bi-sūratin mithlihī wa-dʿū mani staṭaʿtum min dūni llāhi ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

39.content: بَل كَذَّبوا بِما لَم يُحيطوا بِعِلمِهِ وَلَمّا يَأتِهِم تَأويلُهُ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ كَذَّبَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۖ فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ الظّالِمينَ
39.translation_eng: Rather, they deny that whose knowledge they do not comprehend, and whose explanation has not yet come to them. Those who were before them denied likewise. So observe how was the fate of the wrongdoers!
39.transliteration: bal kadhdhabū bi-mā lam yuḥīṭū bi-ʿilmihī wa-lammā yaʾtihim taʾwīluhū ka-dhālika kadhdhaba lladhīna min qablihim fa-nẓur kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu ẓ-ẓālimīna

40.content: وَمِنهُم مَن يُؤمِنُ بِهِ وَمِنهُم مَن لا يُؤمِنُ بِهِ ۚ وَرَبُّكَ أَعلَمُ بِالمُفسِدينَ
40.translation_eng: Some of them believe in it, and some of them do not believe in it, and your Lord best knows the agents of corruption.
40.transliteration: wa-minhum man yuʾminu bihī wa-minhum man lā yuʾminu bihī wa-rabbuka ʾaʿlamu bi-l-mufsidīna

41.content: وَإِن كَذَّبوكَ فَقُل لي عَمَلي وَلَكُم عَمَلُكُم ۖ أَنتُم بَريئونَ مِمّا أَعمَلُ وَأَنا بَريءٌ مِمّا تَعمَلونَ
41.translation_eng: If they deny you, say, ‘My deeds belong to me and your deeds belong to you: you are absolved of what I do and I am absolved of what you do.’
41.transliteration: wa-ʾin kadhdhabūka fa-qul lī ʿamalī wa-lakum ʿamalukum ʾantum barīʾūna mimmā ʾaʿmalu wa-ʾana barīʾun mimmā taʿmalūna

42.content: وَمِنهُم مَن يَستَمِعونَ إِلَيكَ ۚ أَفَأَنتَ تُسمِعُ الصُّمَّ وَلَو كانوا لا يَعقِلونَ
42.translation_eng: There are some of them who prick up their ears at you. But can you make the deaf hear even if they do not apply reason?
42.transliteration: wa-minhum man yastamiʿūna ʾilayka ʾa-fa-ʾanta tusmiʿu ṣ-ṣumma wa-law kānū lā yaʿqilūna

43.content: وَمِنهُم مَن يَنظُرُ إِلَيكَ ۚ أَفَأَنتَ تَهدِي العُميَ وَلَو كانوا لا يُبصِرونَ
43.translation_eng: And there are some of them who observe you. But can you guide the blind even if they do not perceive?
43.transliteration: wa-minhum man yanẓuru ʾilayka ʾa-fa-ʾanta tahdī l-ʿumya wa-law kānū lā yubṣirūna

44.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَظلِمُ النّاسَ شَيئًا وَلٰكِنَّ النّاسَ أَنفُسَهُم يَظلِمونَ
44.translation_eng: Indeed Allah does not wrong people in the least; rather it is people who wrong themselves.
44.transliteration: ʾinna llāha lā yaẓlimu n-nāsa shayʾan wa-lākinna n-nāsa ʾanfusahum yaẓlimūna

45.content: وَيَومَ يَحشُرُهُم كَأَن لَم يَلبَثوا إِلّا ساعَةً مِنَ النَّهارِ يَتَعارَفونَ بَينَهُم ۚ قَد خَسِرَ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِلِقاءِ اللَّهِ وَما كانوا مُهتَدينَ
45.translation_eng: On the day He will gather them [it will be] as if they had not remained [in the world] except for an hour of the day getting acquainted with one another. They are certainly losers who deny the encounter with Allah, and they are not guided.
45.transliteration: wa-yawma yaḥshuruhum ka-ʾan lam yalbathū ʾillā sāʿatan mina n-nahāri yataʿārafūna baynahum qad khasira lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-liqāʾi llāhi wa-mā kānū muhtadīna

46.content: وَإِمّا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعضَ الَّذي نَعِدُهُم أَو نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِلَينا مَرجِعُهُم ثُمَّ اللَّهُ شَهيدٌ عَلىٰ ما يَفعَلونَ
46.translation_eng: Whether We show you a part of what We promise them, or take you away [before that], [in any case] their return will be to Us. Then Allah will be witness to what they do.
46.transliteration: wa-ʾimmā nuriyannaka baʿḍa lladhī naʿiduhum ʾaw natawaffayannaka fa-ʾilaynā marjiʿuhum thumma llāhu shahīdun ʿalā mā yafʿalūna

47.content: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ رَسولٌ ۖ فَإِذا جاءَ رَسولُهُم قُضِيَ بَينَهُم بِالقِسطِ وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
47.translation_eng: There is an apostle1 for every nation; so when their apostle comes, judgement is made between them with justice, and they are not wronged.Or ‘There is a messenger.’
47.transliteration: wa-li-kulli ʾummatin rasūlun fa-ʾidhā jāʾa rasūluhum quḍiya baynahum bi-l-qisṭi wa-hum lā yuẓlamūna

48.content: وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هٰذَا الوَعدُ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
48.translation_eng: They say, ‘When will this promise be fulfilled, should you be truthful?’
48.transliteration: wa-yaqūlūna matā hādhā l-waʿdu ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

49.content: قُل لا أَملِكُ لِنَفسي ضَرًّا وَلا نَفعًا إِلّا ما شاءَ اللَّهُ ۗ لِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلٌ ۚ إِذا جاءَ أَجَلُهُم فَلا يَستَأخِرونَ ساعَةً ۖ وَلا يَستَقدِمونَ
49.translation_eng: Say, ‘I have no control over any benefit for myself nor [over] any harm except what Allah may wish. There is a time for every nation: when their time comes, they shall not defer it by a single hour nor shall they advance it.’
49.transliteration: qul lā ʾamliku li-nafsī ḍarran wa-lā nafʿan ʾillā mā shāʾa llāhu li-kulli ʾummatin ʾajalun ʾidhā jāʾa ʾajaluhum fa-lā yastaʾkhirūna sāʿatan wa-lā yastaqdimūna

50.content: قُل أَرَأَيتُم إِن أَتاكُم عَذابُهُ بَياتًا أَو نَهارًا ماذا يَستَعجِلُ مِنهُ المُجرِمونَ
50.translation_eng: Say, ‘Tell me, should His punishment overtake you by night or day, [you will not be able to avert it]; so what part of it do the guilty seek to hasten?’
50.transliteration: qul ʾa-raʾaytum ʾin ʾatākum ʿadhābuhū bayātan ʾaw nahāran mādhā yastaʿjilu minhu l-mujrimūna

51.content: أَثُمَّ إِذا ما وَقَعَ آمَنتُم بِهِ ۚ آلآنَ وَقَد كُنتُم بِهِ تَستَعجِلونَ
51.translation_eng: ‘What! Do you believe it when it has befallen? Now? While you would seek to hasten it [earlier]?!’
51.transliteration: ʾa-thumma ʾidhā mā waqaʿa ʾāmantum bihī ʾāl-ʾāna wa-qad kuntum bihī tastaʿjilūna

52.content: ثُمَّ قيلَ لِلَّذينَ ظَلَموا ذوقوا عَذابَ الخُلدِ هَل تُجزَونَ إِلّا بِما كُنتُم تَكسِبونَ
52.translation_eng: Then it will be said to those who were wrongdoers, ‘Taste the everlasting punishment. Shall you be requited except for what you used to earn?’
52.transliteration: thumma qīla li-lladhīna ẓalamū dhūqū ʿadhāba l-khuldi hal tujzawna ʾillā bi-mā kuntum taksibūna

53.content: ۞ وَيَستَنبِئونَكَ أَحَقٌّ هُوَ ۖ قُل إي وَرَبّي إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ ۖ وَما أَنتُم بِمُعجِزينَ
53.translation_eng: They inquire of you, ‘Is it true?’ Say, ‘Yes! By my Lord, it is true, and you cannot thwart [Him].’
53.transliteration: wa-yastanbiʾūnaka ʾa-ḥaqqun huwa qul ʾī wa-rabbī ʾinnahū la-ḥaqqun wa-mā ʾantum bi-muʿjizīna

54.content: وَلَو أَنَّ لِكُلِّ نَفسٍ ظَلَمَت ما فِي الأَرضِ لَافتَدَت بِهِ ۗ وَأَسَرُّوا النَّدامَةَ لَمّا رَأَوُا العَذابَ ۖ وَقُضِيَ بَينَهُم بِالقِسطِ ۚ وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
54.translation_eng: Were any soul that has done wrong to possess whatever there is on the earth, it would surely offer it for ransom. They will hide their remorse when they sight the punishment; and judgement will be made between them with justice and they will not be wronged.
54.transliteration: wa-law ʾanna li-kulli nafsin ẓalamat mā fī l-ʾarḍi la-ftadat bihī wa-ʾasarrū n-nadāmata lammā raʾawu l-ʿadhāba wa-quḍiya baynahum bi-l-qisṭi wa-hum lā yuẓlamūna

55.content: أَلا إِنَّ لِلَّهِ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۗ أَلا إِنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
55.translation_eng: Look! To Allah indeed belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Look! Allah’s promise is indeed true; but most of them do not know.
55.transliteration: ʾa-lā ʾinna li-llāhi mā fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾa-lā ʾinna waʿda llāhi ḥaqqun wa-lākinna ʾaktharahum lā yaʿlamūna

56.content: هُوَ يُحيي وَيُميتُ وَإِلَيهِ تُرجَعونَ
56.translation_eng: It is He who gives life and brings death, and to Him you shall be brought back.
56.transliteration: huwa yuḥyī wa-yumītu wa-ʾilayhi turjaʿūna

57.content: يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ قَد جاءَتكُم مَوعِظَةٌ مِن رَبِّكُم وَشِفاءٌ لِما فِي الصُّدورِ وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةٌ لِلمُؤمِنينَ
57.translation_eng: O mankind! There has certainly come to you an advice from your Lord, and a cure for what is in the breasts, and a guidance and mercy for the faithful.
57.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu qad jāʾatkum mawʿiẓatun min rabbikum wa-shifāʾun li-mā fī ṣ-ṣudūri wa-hudan wa-raḥmatun li-l-muʾminīna

58.content: قُل بِفَضلِ اللَّهِ وَبِرَحمَتِهِ فَبِذٰلِكَ فَليَفرَحوا هُوَ خَيرٌ مِمّا يَجمَعونَ
58.translation_eng: Say, ‘In Allah’s grace and His mercy— let them rejoice in that! It is better than what they amass.’
58.transliteration: qul bi-faḍli llāhi wa-bi-raḥmatihī fa-bi-dhālika fa-l-yafraḥū huwa khayrun mimmā yajmaʿūna

59.content: قُل أَرَأَيتُم ما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ لَكُم مِن رِزقٍ فَجَعَلتُم مِنهُ حَرامًا وَحَلالًا قُل آللَّهُ أَذِنَ لَكُم ۖ أَم عَلَى اللَّهِ تَفتَرونَ
59.translation_eng: Say, ‘Have you regarded what Allah has sent down for you of [His] provision, whereupon you made some of it unlawful and [some] lawful?’ Say, ‘Did Allah give you the sanction [to do so], or do you fabricate a lie against Allah?’
59.transliteration: qul ʾa-raʾaytum mā ʾanzala llāhu lakum min rizqin fa-jaʿaltum minhu ḥarāman wa-ḥalālan qul ʾāllāhu ʾadhina lakum ʾam ʿalā llāhi taftarūna

60.content: وَما ظَنُّ الَّذينَ يَفتَرونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ الكَذِبَ يَومَ القِيامَةِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَذو فَضلٍ عَلَى النّاسِ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَهُم لا يَشكُرونَ
60.translation_eng: What is the idea of those who fabricate lies against Allah [concerning their situation] on the Day of Resurrection? Indeed Allah is gracious to mankind, but most of them do not give thanks.
60.transliteration: wa-mā ẓannu lladhīna yaftarūna ʿalā llāhi l-kadhiba yawma l-qiyāmati ʾinna llāha la-dhū faḍlin ʿalā n-nāsi wa-lākinna ʾaktharahum lā yashkurūna

61.content: وَما تَكونُ في شَأنٍ وَما تَتلو مِنهُ مِن قُرآنٍ وَلا تَعمَلونَ مِن عَمَلٍ إِلّا كُنّا عَلَيكُم شُهودًا إِذ تُفيضونَ فيهِ ۚ وَما يَعزُبُ عَن رَبِّكَ مِن مِثقالِ ذَرَّةٍ فِي الأَرضِ وَلا فِي السَّماءِ وَلا أَصغَرَ مِن ذٰلِكَ وَلا أَكبَرَ إِلّا في كِتابٍ مُبينٍ
61.translation_eng: You do not engage in any work, neither do you recite any part of the Qurʾān, nor do you perform any deed without Our being witness over you when you are engaged therein. Not an atom’s weight escapes your Lord in the earth or in the sky, nor [is there] anything smaller than that nor bigger, but it is in a manifest Book.
61.transliteration: wa-mā takūnu fī shaʾnin wa-mā tatlū minhu min qurʾānin wa-lā taʿmalūna min ʿamalin ʾillā kunnā ʿalaykum shuhūdan ʾidh tufīḍūna fīhi wa-mā yaʿzubu ʿan rabbika min mithqāli dharratin fī l-ʾarḍi wa-lā fī s-samāʾi wa-lā ʾaṣghara min dhālika wa-lā ʾakbara ʾillā fī kitābin mubīnin

62.content: أَلا إِنَّ أَولِياءَ اللَّهِ لا خَوفٌ عَلَيهِم وَلا هُم يَحزَنونَ
62.translation_eng: Look! The friends of Allah will indeed have no fear nor will they grieve.
62.transliteration: ʾa-lā ʾinna ʾawliyāʾa llāhi lā khawfun ʿalayhim wa-lā hum yaḥzanūna

63.content: الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَكانوا يَتَّقونَ
63.translation_eng: —Those who have faith, and are Godwary.
63.transliteration: alladhīna ʾāmanū wa-kānū yattaqūna

64.content: لَهُمُ البُشرىٰ فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا وَفِي الآخِرَةِ ۚ لا تَبديلَ لِكَلِماتِ اللَّهِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الفَوزُ العَظيمُ
64.translation_eng: For them is good news in the life of this world and in the Hereafter. (There is no altering the words of Allah.) That is the great success.
64.transliteration: lahumu l-bushrā fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-fī l-ʾākhirati lā tabdīla li-kalimāti llāhi dhālika huwa l-fawzu l-ʿaẓīmu

65.content: وَلا يَحزُنكَ قَولُهُم ۘ إِنَّ العِزَّةَ لِلَّهِ جَميعًا ۚ هُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
65.translation_eng: Do not grieve at their remarks; indeed all might belongs to Allah; He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
65.transliteration: wa-lā yaḥzunka qawluhum ʾinna l-ʿizzata li-llāhi jamīʿan huwa s-samīʿu l-ʿalīmu

66.content: أَلا إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَن فِي السَّماواتِ وَمَن فِي الأَرضِ ۗ وَما يَتَّبِعُ الَّذينَ يَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ شُرَكاءَ ۚ إِن يَتَّبِعونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَإِن هُم إِلّا يَخرُصونَ
66.translation_eng: Look! To Allah indeed belongs whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth. And what do they pursue who invoke partners besides Allah? They merely follow conjectures and they just make surmises.
66.transliteration: ʾa-lā ʾinna li-llāhi man fī s-samāwāti wa-man fī l-ʾarḍi wa-mā yattabiʿu lladhīna yadʿūna min dūni llāhi shurakāʾa ʾin yattabiʿūna ʾillā ẓ-ẓanna wa-ʾin hum ʾillā yakhruṣūna

67.content: هُوَ الَّذي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ اللَّيلَ لِتَسكُنوا فيهِ وَالنَّهارَ مُبصِرًا ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَسمَعونَ
67.translation_eng: It is He who made the night for you, that you may rest in it, and the day to provide visibility. There are indeed signs in that for people who listen.
67.transliteration: huwa lladhī jaʿala lakumu l-layla li-taskunū fīhi wa-n-nahāra mubṣiran ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yasmaʿūna

68.content: قالُوا اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ وَلَدًا ۗ سُبحانَهُ ۖ هُوَ الغَنِيُّ ۖ لَهُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ ۚ إِن عِندَكُم مِن سُلطانٍ بِهٰذا ۚ أَتَقولونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ ما لا تَعلَمونَ
68.translation_eng: They say, ‘Allah has taken a son!’ Immaculate is He! He is the All-sufficient. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. You have no authority for this [statement]. Do you attribute to Allah what you do not know?
68.transliteration: qālū ttakhadha llāhu waladan subḥānahū huwa l-ghaniyyu lahū mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi ʾin ʿindakum min sulṭānin bi-hādhā ʾa-taqūlūna ʿalā llāhi mā lā taʿlamūna

69.content: قُل إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَفتَرونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ الكَذِبَ لا يُفلِحونَ
69.translation_eng: Say, ‘Indeed those who fabricate lies against Allah will not be felicitous.’
69.transliteration: qul ʾinna lladhīna yaftarūna ʿalā llāhi l-kadhiba lā yufliḥūna

70.content: مَتاعٌ فِي الدُّنيا ثُمَّ إِلَينا مَرجِعُهُم ثُمَّ نُذيقُهُمُ العَذابَ الشَّديدَ بِما كانوا يَكفُرونَ
70.translation_eng: An enjoyment in this world; then to Us shall be their return, then We shall make them taste the severe punishment because of what they used to defy.
70.transliteration: matāʿun fī d-dunyā thumma ʾilaynā marjiʿuhum thumma nudhīquhumu l-ʿadhāba sh-shadīda bi-mā kānū yakfurūna

71.content: ۞ وَاتلُ عَلَيهِم نَبَأَ نوحٍ إِذ قالَ لِقَومِهِ يا قَومِ إِن كانَ كَبُرَ عَلَيكُم مَقامي وَتَذكيري بِآياتِ اللَّهِ فَعَلَى اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلتُ فَأَجمِعوا أَمرَكُم وَشُرَكاءَكُم ثُمَّ لا يَكُن أَمرُكُم عَلَيكُم غُمَّةً ثُمَّ اقضوا إِلَيَّ وَلا تُنظِرونِ
71.translation_eng: Relate to them the account of Noah when he said to his people, ‘O my people! If my stay [among you] be hard on you and [also] my reminding you of Allah’s signs, [for my part] I have put my trust in Allah. So conspire together, along with your partners,1 leaving nothing vague in your plan, then carry it out against me without giving me any respite.That is, the false deities whom you worship besides Allah.
71.transliteration: wa-tlu ʿalayhim nabaʾa nūḥin ʾidh qāla li-qawmihī yā-qawmi ʾin kāna kabura ʿalaykum maqāmī wa-tadhkīrī bi-ʾāyāti llāhi fa-ʿalā llāhi tawakkaltu fa-ʾajmiʿū ʾamrakum wa-shurakāʾakum thumma lā yakun ʾamrukum ʿalaykum ghummatan thumma qḍū ʾilayya wa-lā tunẓirūni

72.content: فَإِن تَوَلَّيتُم فَما سَأَلتُكُم مِن أَجرٍ ۖ إِن أَجرِيَ إِلّا عَلَى اللَّهِ ۖ وَأُمِرتُ أَن أَكونَ مِنَ المُسلِمينَ
72.translation_eng: If you turn your back [on me], I do not ask any reward from you; my reward lies only with Allah and I have been commanded to be of those who submit [to Allah].’
72.transliteration: fa-ʾin tawallaytum fa-mā saʾaltukum min ʾajrin ʾin ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā llāhi wa-ʾumirtu ʾan ʾakūna mina l-muslimīna

73.content: فَكَذَّبوهُ فَنَجَّيناهُ وَمَن مَعَهُ فِي الفُلكِ وَجَعَلناهُم خَلائِفَ وَأَغرَقنَا الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا ۖ فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ المُنذَرينَ
73.translation_eng: But they impugned him. So We delivered him and those who were with him in the ark and We made them the successors,1 and We drowned those who denied Our signs. So observe how was the fate of those who were warned!That is, of those who perished in the Flood, and heirs to all that belonged to them.
73.transliteration: fa-kadhdhabūhu fa-najjaynāhu wa-man maʿahū fī l-fulki wa-jaʿalnāhum khalāʾifa wa-ʾaghraqnā lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā fa-nẓur kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu l-mundharīna

74.content: ثُمَّ بَعَثنا مِن بَعدِهِ رُسُلًا إِلىٰ قَومِهِم فَجاءوهُم بِالبَيِّناتِ فَما كانوا لِيُؤمِنوا بِما كَذَّبوا بِهِ مِن قَبلُ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نَطبَعُ عَلىٰ قُلوبِ المُعتَدينَ
74.translation_eng: Then after him We sent [other] apostles to their people. They brought them manifest proofs, but they would not believe something they had denied before. Thus do We seal the hearts of the transgressors.
74.transliteration: thumma baʿathnā min baʿdihī rusulan ʾilā qawmihim fa-jāʾūhum bi-l-bayyināti fa-mā kānū li-yuʾminū bi-mā kadhdhabū bihī min qablu ka-dhālika naṭbaʿu ʿalā qulūbi l-muʿtadīna

75.content: ثُمَّ بَعَثنا مِن بَعدِهِم موسىٰ وَهارونَ إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَمَلَئِهِ بِآياتِنا فَاستَكبَروا وَكانوا قَومًا مُجرِمينَ
75.translation_eng: Then, after them, We sent Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his elite with Our signs, but they acted arrogantly and they were a guilty lot.
75.transliteration: thumma baʿathnā min baʿdihim mūsā wa-hārūna ʾilā firʿawna wa-malaʾihī bi-ʾāyātinā fa-stakbarū wa-kānū qawman mujrimīna

76.content: فَلَمّا جاءَهُمُ الحَقُّ مِن عِندِنا قالوا إِنَّ هٰذا لَسِحرٌ مُبينٌ
76.translation_eng: When the truth from Us came to them, they said, ‘This is indeed plain magic!’
76.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾahumu l-ḥaqqu min ʿindinā qālū ʾinna hādhā la-siḥrun mubīnun

77.content: قالَ موسىٰ أَتَقولونَ لِلحَقِّ لَمّا جاءَكُم ۖ أَسِحرٌ هٰذا وَلا يُفلِحُ السّاحِرونَ
77.translation_eng: Moses said, ‘Do you say of the truth when it comes to you [that it is magic]? Is this magic? Magicians do not find salvation.’
77.transliteration: qāla mūsā ʾa-taqūlūna li-l-ḥaqqi lammā jāʾakum ʾa-siḥrun hādhā wa-lā yufliḥu s-sāḥirūna

78.content: قالوا أَجِئتَنا لِتَلفِتَنا عَمّا وَجَدنا عَلَيهِ آباءَنا وَتَكونَ لَكُمَا الكِبرِياءُ فِي الأَرضِ وَما نَحنُ لَكُما بِمُؤمِنينَ
78.translation_eng: They said, ‘Have you come to us to turn us away from what we found our fathers following, so that supremacy may be yours in the land? We will not believe in the two of you.’1That is, Moses and Aaron (ʿa).
78.transliteration: qālū ʾa-jiʾtanā li-talfitanā ʿammā wajadnā ʿalayhi ʾābāʾanā wa-takūna lakumā l-kibriyāʾu fī l-ʾarḍi wa-mā naḥnu lakumā bi-muʾminīna

79.content: وَقالَ فِرعَونُ ائتوني بِكُلِّ ساحِرٍ عَليمٍ
79.translation_eng: Pharaoh said, ‘Bring me every expert magician.’
79.transliteration: wa-qāla firʿawnu ʾtūnī bi-kulli sāḥirin ʿalīmin

80.content: فَلَمّا جاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قالَ لَهُم موسىٰ أَلقوا ما أَنتُم مُلقونَ
80.translation_eng: So when the magicians came, Moses said to them, ‘Throw down what you have to throw.’
80.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾa s-saḥaratu qāla lahum mūsā ʾalqū mā ʾantum mulqūna

81.content: فَلَمّا أَلقَوا قالَ موسىٰ ما جِئتُم بِهِ السِّحرُ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَيُبطِلُهُ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُصلِحُ عَمَلَ المُفسِدينَ
81.translation_eng: So when they threw down [their sticks and ropes], Moses said, ‘What you have produced is magic. Indeed Allah will bring it to naught presently. Indeed Allah does not foster the efforts of those who cause corruption.
81.transliteration: fa-lammā ʾalqaw qāla mūsā mā jiʾtum bihī s-siḥru ʾinna llāha sa-yubṭiluhū ʾinna llāha lā yuṣliḥu ʿamala l-mufsidīna

82.content: وَيُحِقُّ اللَّهُ الحَقَّ بِكَلِماتِهِ وَلَو كَرِهَ المُجرِمونَ
82.translation_eng: Allah will confirm the truth with His words, though the guilty should be averse.’
82.transliteration: wa-yuḥiqqu llāhu l-ḥaqqa bi-kalimātihī wa-law kariha l-mujrimūna

83.content: فَما آمَنَ لِموسىٰ إِلّا ذُرِّيَّةٌ مِن قَومِهِ عَلىٰ خَوفٍ مِن فِرعَونَ وَمَلَئِهِم أَن يَفتِنَهُم ۚ وَإِنَّ فِرعَونَ لَعالٍ فِي الأَرضِ وَإِنَّهُ لَمِنَ المُسرِفينَ
83.translation_eng: But none believed in Moses except some youths from among his people, for the fear of Pharaoh and his elite that he would persecute them. For Pharaoh was indeed a tyrant in the land, and indeed he was an unrestrained [despot].
83.transliteration: fa-mā ʾāmana li-mūsā ʾillā dhurriyyatun min qawmihī ʿalā khawfin min firʿawna wa-malaʾihim ʾan yaftinahum wa-ʾinna firʿawna la-ʿālin fī l-ʾarḍi wa-ʾinnahū la-mina l-musrifīna

84.content: وَقالَ موسىٰ يا قَومِ إِن كُنتُم آمَنتُم بِاللَّهِ فَعَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلوا إِن كُنتُم مُسلِمينَ
84.translation_eng: And Moses said, ‘O my people! If you have faith in Allah, put your trust in Him, if you have submitted [to Him].’
84.transliteration: wa-qāla mūsā yā-qawmi ʾin kuntum ʾāmantum bi-llāhi fa-ʿalayhi tawakkalū ʾin kuntum muslimīna

85.content: فَقالوا عَلَى اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلنا رَبَّنا لا تَجعَلنا فِتنَةً لِلقَومِ الظّالِمينَ
85.translation_eng: Whereat they said, ‘In Allah we have put our trust.’ ‘Our Lord! Do not make us a [means of] test for the wrongdoing lot,
85.transliteration: fa-qālū ʿalā llāhi tawakkalnā rabbanā lā tajʿalnā fitnatan li-l-qawmi ẓ-ẓālimīna

86.content: وَنَجِّنا بِرَحمَتِكَ مِنَ القَومِ الكافِرينَ
86.translation_eng: and deliver us by Your mercy from the faithless lot.’
86.transliteration: wa-najjinā bi-raḥmatika mina l-qawmi l-kāfirīna

87.content: وَأَوحَينا إِلىٰ موسىٰ وَأَخيهِ أَن تَبَوَّآ لِقَومِكُما بِمِصرَ بُيوتًا وَاجعَلوا بُيوتَكُم قِبلَةً وَأَقيمُوا الصَّلاةَ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ المُؤمِنينَ
87.translation_eng: We revealed to Moses and his brother [saying], ‘Settle your people in the city,1 and let your houses face each other,2 and maintain the prayer, and give good news to the faithful.’That is, Bayt al-Maqdis, in accordance with a tradition of Imam al-Ṣādiq (ʿa) (Tafsīr al-Qummī). Alternatively, ‘Provide houses for your people in Egypt.’Or ‘Make your homes places of worship.’
87.transliteration: wa-ʾawḥaynā ʾilā mūsā wa-ʾakhīhi ʾan tabawwaʾā li-qawmikumā bi-miṣra buyūtan wa-jʿalū buyūtakum qiblatan wa-ʾaqīmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-bashshiri l-muʾminīna

88.content: وَقالَ موسىٰ رَبَّنا إِنَّكَ آتَيتَ فِرعَونَ وَمَلَأَهُ زينَةً وَأَموالًا فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا رَبَّنا لِيُضِلّوا عَن سَبيلِكَ ۖ رَبَّنَا اطمِس عَلىٰ أَموالِهِم وَاشدُد عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم فَلا يُؤمِنوا حَتّىٰ يَرَوُا العَذابَ الأَليمَ
88.translation_eng: Moses said, ‘Our Lord! You have given Pharaoh and his elite glamour and wealth in the life of this world, our Lord, that they may lead [people] astray from Your way! Our Lord! Blot out their wealth and harden their hearts so that they do not believe until they sight the painful punishment.’
88.transliteration: wa-qāla mūsā rabbanā ʾinnaka ʾātayta firʿawna wa-malaʾahū zīnatan wa-ʾamwālan fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā rabbanā li-yuḍillū ʿan sabīlika rabbanā ṭmis ʿalā ʾamwālihim wa-shdud ʿalā qulūbihim fa-lā yuʾminū ḥattā yarawu l-ʿadhāba l-ʾalīma

89.content: قالَ قَد أُجيبَت دَعوَتُكُما فَاستَقيما وَلا تَتَّبِعانِّ سَبيلَ الَّذينَ لا يَعلَمونَ
89.translation_eng: Said He, ‘Your1 supplication has already been granted. So be steadfast, and do not follow the way of those who do not know.’That is, of Moses and Aaron (ʿa).
89.transliteration: qāla qad ʾujībat daʿwatukumā fa-staqīmā wa-lā tattabiʿānni sabīla lladhīna lā yaʿlamūna

90.content: ۞ وَجاوَزنا بِبَني إِسرائيلَ البَحرَ فَأَتبَعَهُم فِرعَونُ وَجُنودُهُ بَغيًا وَعَدوًا ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذا أَدرَكَهُ الغَرَقُ قالَ آمَنتُ أَنَّهُ لا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا الَّذي آمَنَت بِهِ بَنو إِسرائيلَ وَأَنا مِنَ المُسلِمينَ
90.translation_eng: We carried the Children of Israel across the sea, whereat Pharaoh and his troops pursued them out of defiance and aggression. When overtaken by drowning, he called out, ‘I believe that there is no god except Him in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am one of those who submit [to Him]!’
90.transliteration: wa-jāwaznā bi-banī ʾisrāʾīla l-baḥra fa-ʾatbaʿahum firʿawnu wa-junūduhū baghyan wa-ʿadwan ḥattā ʾidhā ʾadrakahu l-gharaqu qāla ʾāmantu ʾannahū lā ʾilāha ʾillā lladhī ʾāmanat bihī banū ʾisrāʾīla wa-ʾana mina l-muslimīna

91.content: آلآنَ وَقَد عَصَيتَ قَبلُ وَكُنتَ مِنَ المُفسِدينَ
91.translation_eng: [He was told,] ‘What! Now? When you have been disobedient heretofore and were among the agents of corruption?!
91.transliteration: ʾāl-ʾāna wa-qad ʿaṣayta qablu wa-kunta mina l-mufsidīna

92.content: فَاليَومَ نُنَجّيكَ بِبَدَنِكَ لِتَكونَ لِمَن خَلفَكَ آيَةً ۚ وَإِنَّ كَثيرًا مِنَ النّاسِ عَن آياتِنا لَغافِلونَ
92.translation_eng: So today We shall deliver your body so that you may be a sign for those who come after you.’ Indeed many of the people are oblivious to Our signs.
92.transliteration: fa-l-yawma nunajjīka bi-badanika li-takūna li-man khalfaka ʾāyatan wa-ʾinna kathīran mina n-nāsi ʿan ʾāyātinā la-ghāfilūna

93.content: وَلَقَد بَوَّأنا بَني إِسرائيلَ مُبَوَّأَ صِدقٍ وَرَزَقناهُم مِنَ الطَّيِّباتِ فَمَا اختَلَفوا حَتّىٰ جاءَهُمُ العِلمُ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقضي بَينَهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ فيما كانوا فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
93.translation_eng: Certainly We settled the Children of Israel in a worthy settlement and We provided them with all the good things, and they did not differ until [after] the knowledge had come to them. Your Lord will indeed judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that about which they used to differ.
93.transliteration: wa-la-qad bawwaʾnā banī ʾisrāʾīla mubawwaʾa ṣidqin wa-razaqnāhum mina ṭ-ṭayyibāti fa-mā khtalafū ḥattā jāʾahumu l-ʿilmu ʾinna rabbaka yaqḍī baynahum yawma l-qiyāmati fī-mā kānū fīhi yakhtalifūna

94.content: فَإِن كُنتَ في شَكٍّ مِمّا أَنزَلنا إِلَيكَ فَاسأَلِ الَّذينَ يَقرَءونَ الكِتابَ مِن قَبلِكَ ۚ لَقَد جاءَكَ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكَ فَلا تَكونَنَّ مِنَ المُمتَرينَ
94.translation_eng: So if you are in doubt about what We have sent down to you, ask those who read the Book [revealed] before you. The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord; so do not be among the skeptics.
94.transliteration: fa-ʾin kunta fī shakkin mimmā ʾanzalnā ʾilayka fa-sʾali lladhīna yaqraʾūna l-kitāba min qablika la-qad jāʾaka l-ḥaqqu min rabbika fa-lā takūnanna mina l-mumtarīna

95.content: وَلا تَكونَنَّ مِنَ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِ اللَّهِ فَتَكونَ مِنَ الخاسِرينَ
95.translation_eng: And do not be of those who deny the signs of Allah, [for] then you shall be among the losers.
95.transliteration: wa-lā takūnanna mina lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyāti llāhi fa-takūna mina l-khāsirīna

96.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ حَقَّت عَلَيهِم كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ لا يُؤمِنونَ
96.translation_eng: Indeed those against whom your Lord’s judgement has become due will not have faith,
96.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ḥaqqat ʿalayhim kalimatu rabbika lā yuʾminūna

97.content: وَلَو جاءَتهُم كُلُّ آيَةٍ حَتّىٰ يَرَوُا العَذابَ الأَليمَ
97.translation_eng: even though every sign were to come to them, until they sight the painful punishment.
97.transliteration: wa-law jāʾathum kullu ʾāyatin ḥattā yarawu l-ʿadhāba l-ʾalīma

98.content: فَلَولا كانَت قَريَةٌ آمَنَت فَنَفَعَها إيمانُها إِلّا قَومَ يونُسَ لَمّا آمَنوا كَشَفنا عَنهُم عَذابَ الخِزيِ فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا وَمَتَّعناهُم إِلىٰ حينٍ
98.translation_eng: Why has there not been any town that might believe, so that its belief might benefit it, except the people of Jonah? When they believed, We removed from them the punishment of disgrace in the life of this world, and We provided for them for a while.
98.transliteration: fa-law-lā kānat qaryatun ʾāmanat fa-nafaʿahā ʾīmānuhā ʾillā qawma yūnusa lammā ʾāmanū kashafnā ʿanhum ʿadhāba l-khizyi fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-mattaʿnāhum ʾilā ḥīnin

99.content: وَلَو شاءَ رَبُّكَ لَآمَنَ مَن فِي الأَرضِ كُلُّهُم جَميعًا ۚ أَفَأَنتَ تُكرِهُ النّاسَ حَتّىٰ يَكونوا مُؤمِنينَ
99.translation_eng: And had your Lord wished, all those who are on earth would have believed. Would you then force people until they become faithful?
99.transliteration: wa-law shāʾa rabbuka la-ʾāmana man fī l-ʾarḍi kulluhum jamīʿan ʾa-fa-ʾanta tukrihu n-nāsa ḥattā yakūnū muʾminīna

100.content: وَما كانَ لِنَفسٍ أَن تُؤمِنَ إِلّا بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَيَجعَلُ الرِّجسَ عَلَى الَّذينَ لا يَعقِلونَ
100.translation_eng: No soul may have faith except by Allah’s leave, and He lays defilement on those who do not apply reason.
100.transliteration: wa-mā kāna li-nafsin ʾan tuʾmina ʾillā bi-ʾidhni llāhi wa-yajʿalu r-rijsa ʿalā lladhīna lā yaʿqilūna

101.content: قُلِ انظُروا ماذا فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ وَما تُغنِي الآياتُ وَالنُّذُرُ عَن قَومٍ لا يُؤمِنونَ
101.translation_eng: Say, ‘Observe what is in the heavens and the earth.’ But neither signs nor warnings avail a people who have no faith.
101.transliteration: quli nẓurū mādhā fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā tughnī l-ʾāyātu wa-n-nudhuru ʿan qawmin lā yuʾminūna

102.content: فَهَل يَنتَظِرونَ إِلّا مِثلَ أَيّامِ الَّذينَ خَلَوا مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ قُل فَانتَظِروا إِنّي مَعَكُم مِنَ المُنتَظِرينَ
102.translation_eng: Do they await anything except the like of the days of those who passed away before them? Say, ‘Then wait! I too am waiting along with you.’
102.transliteration: fa-hal yantaẓirūna ʾillā mithla ʾayyāmi lladhīna khalaw min qablihim qul fa-ntaẓirū ʾinnī maʿakum mina l-muntaẓirīna

103.content: ثُمَّ نُنَجّي رُسُلَنا وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا ۚ كَذٰلِكَ حَقًّا عَلَينا نُنجِ المُؤمِنينَ
103.translation_eng: Then We shall deliver Our apostles and those who have faith. Thus it is a must for Us to deliver the faithful.
103.transliteration: thumma nunajjī rusulanā wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū ka-dhālika ḥaqqan ʿalaynā nunji l-muʾminīna

104.content: قُل يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ إِن كُنتُم في شَكٍّ مِن ديني فَلا أَعبُدُ الَّذينَ تَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَلٰكِن أَعبُدُ اللَّهَ الَّذي يَتَوَفّاكُم ۖ وَأُمِرتُ أَن أَكونَ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
104.translation_eng: Say, ‘O people! if you are in doubt about my religion, then [know that] I do not worship those whom you worship besides Allah. Rather I worship only Allah, who causes you to die, and I have been commanded to be among the faithful,
104.transliteration: qul yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ʾin kuntum fī shakkin min dīnī fa-lā ʾaʿbudu lladhīna taʿbudūna min dūni llāhi wa-lākin ʾaʿbudu llāha lladhī yatawaffākum wa-ʾumirtu ʾan ʾakūna mina l-muʾminīna

105.content: وَأَن أَقِم وَجهَكَ لِلدّينِ حَنيفًا وَلا تَكونَنَّ مِنَ المُشرِكينَ
105.translation_eng: and that: “Dedicate yourself to the religion, as a ḥanīf, and never be one of the polytheists.
105.transliteration: wa-ʾan ʾaqim wajhaka li-d-dīni ḥanīfan wa-lā takūnanna mina l-mushrikīna

106.content: وَلا تَدعُ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَنفَعُكَ وَلا يَضُرُّكَ ۖ فَإِن فَعَلتَ فَإِنَّكَ إِذًا مِنَ الظّالِمينَ
106.translation_eng: Nor invoke besides Allah that which neither benefits you nor can do you any harm. For if you do so, then you will indeed be among the wrongdoers.” ’
106.transliteration: wa-lā tadʿu min dūni llāhi mā lā yanfaʿuka wa-lā yaḍurruka fa-ʾin faʿalta fa-ʾinnaka ʾidhan mina ẓ-ẓālimīna

107.content: وَإِن يَمسَسكَ اللَّهُ بِضُرٍّ فَلا كاشِفَ لَهُ إِلّا هُوَ ۖ وَإِن يُرِدكَ بِخَيرٍ فَلا رادَّ لِفَضلِهِ ۚ يُصيبُ بِهِ مَن يَشاءُ مِن عِبادِهِ ۚ وَهُوَ الغَفورُ الرَّحيمُ
107.translation_eng: Should Allah visit you with some distress, there is no one to remove it except Him; and should He desire any good for you, none can stand in the way of His grace: He grants it to whomever He wishes of His servants, and He is the All-forgiving, the All-merciful.
107.transliteration: wa-ʾin yamsaska llāhu bi-ḍurrin fa-lā kāshifa lahū ʾillā huwa wa-ʾin yuridka bi-khayrin fa-lā rādda li-faḍlihī yuṣību bihī man yashāʾu min ʿibādihī wa-huwa l-ghafūru r-raḥīmu

108.content: قُل يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ قَد جاءَكُمُ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكُم ۖ فَمَنِ اهتَدىٰ فَإِنَّما يَهتَدي لِنَفسِهِ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّما يَضِلُّ عَلَيها ۖ وَما أَنا عَلَيكُم بِوَكيلٍ
108.translation_eng: Say, ‘O mankind! The truth has already come to you from your Lord. Whoever is guided, is guided only for [the good of] his own soul, and whoever goes astray, goes astray only to its detriment, and it is not my business to watch over you.’
108.transliteration: qul yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu qad jāʾakumu l-ḥaqqu min rabbikum fa-mani htadā fa-ʾinnamā yahtadī li-nafsihī wa-man ḍalla fa-ʾinnamā yaḍillu ʿalayhā wa-mā ʾana ʿalaykum bi-wakīlin

109.content: وَاتَّبِع ما يوحىٰ إِلَيكَ وَاصبِر حَتّىٰ يَحكُمَ اللَّهُ ۚ وَهُوَ خَيرُ الحاكِمينَ
109.translation_eng: And follow that which is revealed to you, and be patient until Allah issues [His] judgement, and He is the best of judges.
109.transliteration: wa-ttabiʿ mā yūḥā ʾilayka wa-ṣbir ḥattā yaḥkuma llāhu wa-huwa khayru l-ḥākimīna

11.description: The surah that mentions an ancient prophet after Noah named Hūd, whom God sent to the mighty people of ʿĀd, the dwellers of a great pillared city called Iram. It is named after Hūd, whose account is given in verse 50 . The surah begins by announcing that the Prophet is sent both to warn and to give good news, and the body of the surah focuses on the warning aspect: God watches over everything and is aware of all that people do (verse 5 ., verse 111 . and verse 123). The many stories of past prophets, which serve to warn the disbelievers, also strengthen the heart of the Prophet (verse 120).The surah is also known as: Hood, Hud (The Messenger), The Prophet Hud.

1.content: الر ۚ كِتابٌ أُحكِمَت آياتُهُ ثُمَّ فُصِّلَت مِن لَدُن حَكيمٍ خَبيرٍ
1.translation_eng: Alif, Lām, Rā. [This is] a Book, whose signs have been made definitive1 and the elaborated2 from One [who is] all-wise, all-aware,Cf. 3:7.Or ‘articulated.’
1.transliteration: a-l-r (ʾalif lām rā) kitābun ʾuḥkimat ʾāyātuhū thumma fuṣṣilat min ladun ḥakīmin khabīrin

2.content: أَلّا تَعبُدوا إِلَّا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّني لَكُم مِنهُ نَذيرٌ وَبَشيرٌ
2.translation_eng: declaring: ‘Worship no one but Allah. I am indeed a warner from Him to you and a bearer of good news.
2.transliteration: ʾallā taʿbudū ʾillā llāha ʾinnanī lakum minhu nadhīrun wa-bashīrun

3.content: وَأَنِ استَغفِروا رَبَّكُم ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ يُمَتِّعكُم مَتاعًا حَسَنًا إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى وَيُؤتِ كُلَّ ذي فَضلٍ فَضلَهُ ۖ وَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَإِنّي أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ كَبيرٍ
3.translation_eng: Plead with your Lord for forgiveness, then turn to Him penitently. He will provide you with a good provision for a specified term and grant His grace to every meritorious person. But if you turn your backs [on Him], indeed I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day.
3.transliteration: wa-ʾani staghfirū rabbakum thumma tūbū ʾilayhi yumattiʿkum matāʿan ḥasanan ʾilā ʾajalin musamman wa-yuʾti kulla dhī faḍlin faḍlahū wa-ʾin tawallaw fa-ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʿalaykum ʿadhāba yawmin kabīrin

4.content: إِلَى اللَّهِ مَرجِعُكُم ۖ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
4.translation_eng: To Allah will be your return, and He has power over all things.’
4.transliteration: ʾilā llāhi marjiʿukum wa-huwa ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

5.content: أَلا إِنَّهُم يَثنونَ صُدورَهُم لِيَستَخفوا مِنهُ ۚ أَلا حينَ يَستَغشونَ ثِيابَهُم يَعلَمُ ما يُسِرّونَ وَما يُعلِنونَ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
5.translation_eng: Look! They fold up their breasts1 to hide [their secret feelings] from Him. Look! When they draw their cloaks over their heads,2 He knows whatever they keep secret and whatever they disclose. Indeed He knows best whatever is in the breasts.‘To fold up one’s breast’ is an idiomatic phrase, meaning to conceal one’s spite within one’s heart.So that they may not be recognized. Cf. 71:7.
5.transliteration: ʾa-lā ʾinnahum yathnūna ṣudūrahum li-yastakhfū minhu ʾa-lā ḥīna yastaghshūna thiyābahum yaʿlamu mā yusirrūna wa-mā yuʿlinūna ʾinnahū ʿalīmun bi-dhāti ṣ-ṣudūri

6.content: ۞ وَما مِن دابَّةٍ فِي الأَرضِ إِلّا عَلَى اللَّهِ رِزقُها وَيَعلَمُ مُستَقَرَّها وَمُستَودَعَها ۚ كُلٌّ في كِتابٍ مُبينٍ
6.translation_eng: There is no animal on the earth, but that its sustenance lies with Allah, and He knows its [enduring] abode and its temporary place of lodging. Everything is in a manifest Book.
6.transliteration: wa-mā min dābbatin fī l-ʾarḍi ʾillā ʿalā llāhi rizquhā wa-yaʿlamu mustaqarrahā wa-mustawdaʿahā kullun fī kitābin mubīnin

7.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ في سِتَّةِ أَيّامٍ وَكانَ عَرشُهُ عَلَى الماءِ لِيَبلُوَكُم أَيُّكُم أَحسَنُ عَمَلًا ۗ وَلَئِن قُلتَ إِنَّكُم مَبعوثونَ مِن بَعدِ المَوتِ لَيَقولَنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إِن هٰذا إِلّا سِحرٌ مُبينٌ
7.translation_eng: It is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days —and His Throne was [then] upon the waters— that He may test you [to see] which of you is best in conduct. Yet if you say, ‘You will indeed be raised up after death,’ the faithless will surely say, ‘This is nothing but plain magic.’
7.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa fī sittati ʾayyāmin wa-kāna ʿarshuhū ʿalā l-māʾi li-yabluwakum ʾayyukum ʾaḥsanu ʿamalan wa-la-ʾin qulta ʾinnakum mabʿūthūna min baʿdi l-mawti la-yaqūlanna lladhīna kafarū ʾin hādhā ʾillā siḥrun mubīnun

8.content: وَلَئِن أَخَّرنا عَنهُمُ العَذابَ إِلىٰ أُمَّةٍ مَعدودَةٍ لَيَقولُنَّ ما يَحبِسُهُ ۗ أَلا يَومَ يَأتيهِم لَيسَ مَصروفًا عَنهُم وَحاقَ بِهِم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
8.translation_eng: And if We defer their punishment until a certain time, they will surely say, ‘What holds it back?’ Look! On the day it overtakes them it shall not be turned away from them, and they will be besieged by what they used to deride.
8.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin ʾakhkharnā ʿanhumu l-ʿadhāba ʾilā ʾummatin maʿdūdatin la-yaqūlunna mā yaḥbisuhū ʾa-lā yawma yaʾtīhim laysa maṣrūfan ʿanhum wa-ḥāqa bihim mā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

9.content: وَلَئِن أَذَقنَا الإِنسانَ مِنّا رَحمَةً ثُمَّ نَزَعناها مِنهُ إِنَّهُ لَيَئوسٌ كَفورٌ
9.translation_eng: If We let man taste a mercy from Us, and then withdraw it from him, he becomes despondent, ungrateful.
9.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin ʾadhaqnā l-ʾinsāna minnā raḥmatan thumma nazaʿnāhā minhu ʾinnahū la-yaʾūsun kafūrun

10.content: وَلَئِن أَذَقناهُ نَعماءَ بَعدَ ضَرّاءَ مَسَّتهُ لَيَقولَنَّ ذَهَبَ السَّيِّئَاتُ عَنّي ۚ إِنَّهُ لَفَرِحٌ فَخورٌ
10.translation_eng: And if We let him have a taste of Our blessings after adversities have befallen him, he will surely say, ‘All ills have left me.’ Indeed he becomes an exultant braggart,
10.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin ʾadhaqnāhu naʿmāʾa baʿda ḍarrāʾa massathu la-yaqūlanna dhahaba s-sayyiʾātu ʿannī ʾinnahū la-fariḥun fakhūrun

11.content: إِلَّا الَّذينَ صَبَروا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَأَجرٌ كَبيرٌ
11.translation_eng: excepting those who are patient and do righteous deeds. For such there will be forgiveness and a great reward.
11.transliteration: ʾillā lladhīna ṣabarū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti ʾulāʾika lahum maghfiratun wa-ʾajrun kabīrun

12.content: فَلَعَلَّكَ تارِكٌ بَعضَ ما يوحىٰ إِلَيكَ وَضائِقٌ بِهِ صَدرُكَ أَن يَقولوا لَولا أُنزِلَ عَلَيهِ كَنزٌ أَو جاءَ مَعَهُ مَلَكٌ ۚ إِنَّما أَنتَ نَذيرٌ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ وَكيلٌ
12.translation_eng: [Look out] lest you should disregard aught of what has been revealed to you, and be upset because they say, ‘Why has not a treasure been sent down to him, or [why does] not an angel accompany him?’ You are only a warner, and Allah watches over all things.
12.transliteration: fa-laʿallaka tārikun baʿḍa mā yūḥā ʾilayka wa-ḍāʾiqun bihī ṣadruka ʾan yaqūlū law-lā ʾunzila ʿalayhi kanzun ʾaw jāʾa maʿahū malakun ʾinnamā ʾanta nadhīrun wa-llāhu ʿalā kulli shayʾin wakīlun

13.content: أَم يَقولونَ افتَراهُ ۖ قُل فَأتوا بِعَشرِ سُوَرٍ مِثلِهِ مُفتَرَياتٍ وَادعوا مَنِ استَطَعتُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
13.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘He has fabricated it?’ Say, ‘Then bring ten sūrahs like it, fabricated, and invoke whomever you can, besides Allah, should you be truthful.’
13.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna ftarāhu qul fa-ʾtū bi-ʿashri suwarin mithlihī muftarayātin wa-dʿū mani staṭaʿtum min dūni llāhi ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

14.content: فَإِلَّم يَستَجيبوا لَكُم فَاعلَموا أَنَّما أُنزِلَ بِعِلمِ اللَّهِ وَأَن لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ ۖ فَهَل أَنتُم مُسلِمونَ
14.translation_eng: But if they do not respond to you, know that it has been sent down by Allah’s knowledge, and that there is no god except Him. Will you, then, submit [to Allah]?
14.transliteration: fa-ʾillam yastajībū lakum fa-ʿlamū ʾannamā ʾunzila bi-ʿilmi llāhi wa-ʾan lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa fa-hal ʾantum muslimūna

15.content: مَن كانَ يُريدُ الحَياةَ الدُّنيا وَزينَتَها نُوَفِّ إِلَيهِم أَعمالَهُم فيها وَهُم فيها لا يُبخَسونَ
15.translation_eng: As for those who desire the life of this world and its glitter, We will recompense them fully for their works therein, and they shall not be underpaid in it.
15.transliteration: man kāna yurīdu l-ḥayāta d-dunyā wa-zīnatahā nuwaffi ʾilayhim ʾaʿmālahum fīhā wa-hum fīhā lā yubkhasūna

16.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ لَيسَ لَهُم فِي الآخِرَةِ إِلَّا النّارُ ۖ وَحَبِطَ ما صَنَعوا فيها وَباطِلٌ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
16.translation_eng: They are the ones for whom there shall be nothing in the Hereafter but Fire: what they had accomplished in the world has failed, and their works have come to naught.
16.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna laysa lahum fī l-ʾākhirati ʾillā n-nāru wa-ḥabiṭa mā ṣanaʿū fīhā wa-bāṭilun mā kānū yaʿmalūna

17.content: أَفَمَن كانَ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبِّهِ وَيَتلوهُ شاهِدٌ مِنهُ وَمِن قَبلِهِ كِتابُ موسىٰ إِمامًا وَرَحمَةً ۚ أُولٰئِكَ يُؤمِنونَ بِهِ ۚ وَمَن يَكفُر بِهِ مِنَ الأَحزابِ فَالنّارُ مَوعِدُهُ ۚ فَلا تَكُ في مِريَةٍ مِنهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكَ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يُؤمِنونَ
17.translation_eng: Is he who stands on a manifest proof from his Lord, and whom a witness of his own [family] follows?1 And before him2 there was the Book of Moses, a guide and mercy. It is they who have faith in it, and whoever defies him from among the factions, the Fire is their tryst. So do not be in doubt about it; it is the truth from your Lord, but most people do not have faith.Ellipsis. That is, is such a person like someone who is not such? Or, can such a one be deterred by the denial of the ignorant?Or ‘before it,’ that is, the Qurʾān.
17.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man kāna ʿalā bayyinatin min rabbihī wa-yatlūhu shāhidun minhu wa-min qablihī kitābu mūsā ʾimāman wa-raḥmatan ʾulāʾika yuʾminūna bihī wa-man yakfur bihī mina l-ʾaḥzābi fa-n-nāru mawʿiduhū fa-lā taku fī miryatin minhu ʾinnahu l-ḥaqqu min rabbika wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yuʾminūna

18.content: وَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّنِ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا ۚ أُولٰئِكَ يُعرَضونَ عَلىٰ رَبِّهِم وَيَقولُ الأَشهادُ هٰؤُلاءِ الَّذينَ كَذَبوا عَلىٰ رَبِّهِم ۚ أَلا لَعنَةُ اللَّهِ عَلَى الظّالِمينَ
18.translation_eng: And who is a greater wrongdoer than him who fabricates a lie against Allah? They shall be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, ‘It is these who lied against their Lord.’ Look! The curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers
18.transliteration: wa-man ʾaẓlamu mimmani ftarā ʿalā llāhi kadhiban ʾulāʾika yuʿraḍūna ʿalā rabbihim wa-yaqūlu l-ʾashhādu hāʾulāʾi lladhīna kadhabū ʿalā rabbihim ʾa-lā laʿnatu llāhi ʿalā ẓ-ẓālimīna

19.content: الَّذينَ يَصُدّونَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَيَبغونَها عِوَجًا وَهُم بِالآخِرَةِ هُم كافِرونَ
19.translation_eng: —those who bar [others] from the way of Allah, and seek to make it crooked, and disbelieve in the Hereafter.
19.transliteration: alladhīna yaṣuddūna ʿan sabīli llāhi wa-yabghūnahā ʿiwajan wa-hum bi-l-ʾākhirati hum kāfirūna

20.content: أُولٰئِكَ لَم يَكونوا مُعجِزينَ فِي الأَرضِ وَما كانَ لَهُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن أَولِياءَ ۘ يُضاعَفُ لَهُمُ العَذابُ ۚ ما كانوا يَستَطيعونَ السَّمعَ وَما كانوا يُبصِرونَ
20.translation_eng: They cannot thwart [Allah] on the earth, nor do they have besides Allah any guardian. For them the punishment shall be doubled, for they could neither listen, nor did they use to see.
20.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lam yakūnū muʿjizīna fī l-ʾarḍi wa-mā kāna lahum min dūni llāhi min ʾawliyāʾa yuḍāʿafu lahumu l-ʿadhābu mā kānū yastaṭīʿūna s-samʿa wa-mā kānū yubṣirūna

21.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ خَسِروا أَنفُسَهُم وَضَلَّ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَفتَرونَ
21.translation_eng: They are the ones who have ruined their souls, and what they used to fabricate has forsaken them.
21.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna khasirū ʾanfusahum wa-ḍalla ʿanhum mā kānū yaftarūna

22.content: لا جَرَمَ أَنَّهُم فِي الآخِرَةِ هُمُ الأَخسَرونَ
22.translation_eng: Undoubtedly, they are the ones who will be the biggest losers in the Hereafter.
22.transliteration: lā jarama ʾannahum fī l-ʾākhirati humu l-ʾakhsarūna

23.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ وَأَخبَتوا إِلىٰ رَبِّهِم أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ الجَنَّةِ ۖ هُم فيها خالِدونَ
23.translation_eng: Indeed those who have faith and do righteous deeds and are humble before their Lord —they shall be the inhabitants of paradise, and they shall remain in it [forever].
23.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa-ʾakhbatū ʾilā rabbihim ʾulāʾika ʾaṣḥābu l-jannati hum fīhā khālidūna

24.content: ۞ مَثَلُ الفَريقَينِ كَالأَعمىٰ وَالأَصَمِّ وَالبَصيرِ وَالسَّميعِ ۚ هَل يَستَوِيانِ مَثَلًا ۚ أَفَلا تَذَكَّرونَ
24.translation_eng: The parable of the two parties is that of one who is blind and deaf and one who sees and hears. Are they equal in comparison? Will you not then take admonition?
24.transliteration: mathalu l-farīqayni ka-l-ʾaʿmā wa-l-ʾaṣammi wa-l-baṣīri wa-s-samīʿi hal yastawiyāni mathalan ʾa-fa-lā tadhakkarūna

25.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا نوحًا إِلىٰ قَومِهِ إِنّي لَكُم نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
25.translation_eng: Certainly We sent Noah to his people [to declare]: ‘Indeed I am a manifest warner to you,
25.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā nūḥan ʾilā qawmihī ʾinnī lakum nadhīrun mubīnun

26.content: أَن لا تَعبُدوا إِلَّا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنّي أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ أَليمٍ
26.translation_eng: Worship none but Allah. Indeed I fear for you the punishment of a painful day.’
26.transliteration: ʾan lā taʿbudū ʾillā llāha ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʿalaykum ʿadhāba yawmin ʾalīmin

27.content: فَقالَ المَلَأُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن قَومِهِ ما نَراكَ إِلّا بَشَرًا مِثلَنا وَما نَراكَ اتَّبَعَكَ إِلَّا الَّذينَ هُم أَراذِلُنا بادِيَ الرَّأيِ وَما نَرىٰ لَكُم عَلَينا مِن فَضلٍ بَل نَظُنُّكُم كاذِبينَ
27.translation_eng: But the elite of the faithless from among his people said, ‘We do not see you to be anything but a human being like ourselves, and we do not see anyone following you except those who are simpleminded riffraff from our midst. Nor do we see that you have any merit over us. Rather we consider you to be liars.’
27.transliteration: fa-qāla l-malaʾu lladhīna kafarū min qawmihī mā narāka ʾillā basharan mithlanā wa-mā narāka ttabaʿaka ʾillā lladhīna hum ʾarādhilunā bādiya r-raʾyi wa-mā narā lakum ʿalaynā min faḍlin bal naẓunnukum kādhibīna

28.content: قالَ يا قَومِ أَرَأَيتُم إِن كُنتُ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبّي وَآتاني رَحمَةً مِن عِندِهِ فَعُمِّيَت عَلَيكُم أَنُلزِمُكُموها وَأَنتُم لَها كارِهونَ
28.translation_eng: He said, ‘O my people! Tell me, should I stand on a manifest proof from my Lord, and He has granted me His own mercy —though it should be invisible to you— shall we force it upon you while you are averse to it?
28.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi ʾa-raʾaytum ʾin kuntu ʿalā bayyinatin min rabbī wa-ʾātānī raḥmatan min ʿindihī fa-ʿummiyat ʿalaykum ʾa-nulzimukumūhā wa-ʾantum lahā kārihūna

29.content: وَيا قَومِ لا أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ مالًا ۖ إِن أَجرِيَ إِلّا عَلَى اللَّهِ ۚ وَما أَنا بِطارِدِ الَّذينَ آمَنوا ۚ إِنَّهُم مُلاقو رَبِّهِم وَلٰكِنّي أَراكُم قَومًا تَجهَلونَ
29.translation_eng: O my people! I do not ask you any material reward for it. My reward lies only with Allah. But I will not drive away those who have faith. Indeed they will encounter their Lord. But I see that you are an ignorant lot.
29.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi lā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi mālan ʾin ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā llāhi wa-mā ʾana bi-ṭāridi lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾinnahum mulāqū rabbihim wa-lākinnī ʾarākum qawman tajhalūna

30.content: وَيا قَومِ مَن يَنصُرُني مِنَ اللَّهِ إِن طَرَدتُهُم ۚ أَفَلا تَذَكَّرونَ
30.translation_eng: O my people! Who would come to my help against Allah were I to drive them away? Will you not then take admonition?
30.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi man yanṣurunī mina llāhi ʾin ṭaradtuhum ʾa-fa-lā tadhakkarūna

31.content: وَلا أَقولُ لَكُم عِندي خَزائِنُ اللَّهِ وَلا أَعلَمُ الغَيبَ وَلا أَقولُ إِنّي مَلَكٌ وَلا أَقولُ لِلَّذينَ تَزدَري أَعيُنُكُم لَن يُؤتِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ خَيرًا ۖ اللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما في أَنفُسِهِم ۖ إِنّي إِذًا لَمِنَ الظّالِمينَ
31.translation_eng: I do not say to you that I possess the treasuries of Allah, neither do I know the Unseen. I do not claim to be an angel, neither do I say of those who are despicable in your eyes that Allah will not grant them any good —Allah knows best what is in their hearts— for then I would indeed be a wrongdoer.’
31.transliteration: wa-lā ʾaqūlu lakum ʿindī khazāʾinu llāhi wa-lā ʾaʿlamu l-ghayba wa-lā ʾaqūlu ʾinnī malakun wa-lā ʾaqūlu li-lladhīna tazdarī ʾaʿyunukum lan yuʾtiyahumu llāhu khayran-i llāhu ʾaʿlamu bi-mā fī ʾanfusihim ʾinnī ʾidhan la-mina ẓ-ẓālimīna

32.content: قالوا يا نوحُ قَد جادَلتَنا فَأَكثَرتَ جِدالَنا فَأتِنا بِما تَعِدُنا إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
32.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Noah, you have disputed with us already, and you have disputed with us exceedingly. Now bring us what you threaten us with should you be truthful.
32.transliteration: qālū yā-nūḥu qad jādaltanā fa-ʾaktharta jidālanā fa-ʾtinā bi-mā taʿidunā ʾin kunta mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

33.content: قالَ إِنَّما يَأتيكُم بِهِ اللَّهُ إِن شاءَ وَما أَنتُم بِمُعجِزينَ
33.translation_eng: He said, ‘Allah will indeed bring it on you if He wishes, and you cannot thwart [Him].
33.transliteration: qāla ʾinnamā yaʾtīkum bihi llāhu ʾin shāʾa wa-mā ʾantum bi-muʿjizīna

34.content: وَلا يَنفَعُكُم نُصحي إِن أَرَدتُ أَن أَنصَحَ لَكُم إِن كانَ اللَّهُ يُريدُ أَن يُغوِيَكُم ۚ هُوَ رَبُّكُم وَإِلَيهِ تُرجَعونَ
34.translation_eng: My exhorting will not benefit you, much as I may seek to exhort you, if Allah desires to consign you to perversity. He is your Lord, and to Him you shall be brought back.’
34.transliteration: wa-lā yanfaʿukum nuṣḥī ʾin ʾaradtu ʾan ʾanṣaḥa lakum ʾin kāna llāhu yurīdu ʾan yughwiyakum huwa rabbukum wa-ʾilayhi turjaʿūna

35.content: أَم يَقولونَ افتَراهُ ۖ قُل إِنِ افتَرَيتُهُ فَعَلَيَّ إِجرامي وَأَنا بَريءٌ مِمّا تُجرِمونَ
35.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘He has fabricated it?’ Say, ‘Should I have fabricated it, then my guilt will be upon me, and I am absolved of your guilty conduct.’
35.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna ftarāhu qul ʾini ftaraytuhū fa-ʿalayya ʾijrāmī wa-ʾana barīʾun mimmā tujrimūna

36.content: وَأوحِيَ إِلىٰ نوحٍ أَنَّهُ لَن يُؤمِنَ مِن قَومِكَ إِلّا مَن قَد آمَنَ فَلا تَبتَئِس بِما كانوا يَفعَلونَ
36.translation_eng: It was revealed to Noah: ‘None of your people will believe except those who already have faith; so do not sorrow for what they used to do.
36.transliteration: wa-ʾūḥiya ʾilā nūḥin ʾannahū lan yuʾmina min qawmika ʾillā man qad ʾāmana fa-lā tabtaʾis bi-mā kānū yafʿalūna

37.content: وَاصنَعِ الفُلكَ بِأَعيُنِنا وَوَحيِنا وَلا تُخاطِبني فِي الَّذينَ ظَلَموا ۚ إِنَّهُم مُغرَقونَ
37.translation_eng: Build the ark before Our eyes and by Our revelation, and do not plead with Me for those who are wrongdoers: they shall indeed be drowned.’
37.transliteration: wa-ṣnaʿi l-fulka bi-ʾaʿyuninā wa-waḥyinā wa-lā tukhāṭibnī fī lladhīna ẓalamū ʾinnahum mughraqūna

38.content: وَيَصنَعُ الفُلكَ وَكُلَّما مَرَّ عَلَيهِ مَلَأٌ مِن قَومِهِ سَخِروا مِنهُ ۚ قالَ إِن تَسخَروا مِنّا فَإِنّا نَسخَرُ مِنكُم كَما تَسخَرونَ
38.translation_eng: As he was building the ark, whenever the elders of his people passed by him, they would ridicule him. He said, ‘If you ridicule us [today], we shall ridicule you [tomorrow] just as you ridicule us [now].
38.transliteration: wa-yaṣnaʿu l-fulka wa-kullamā marra ʿalayhi malaʾun min qawmihī sakhirū minhu qāla ʾin taskharū minnā fa-ʾinnā naskharu minkum ka-mā taskharūna

39.content: فَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ مَن يَأتيهِ عَذابٌ يُخزيهِ وَيَحِلُّ عَلَيهِ عَذابٌ مُقيمٌ
39.translation_eng: Soon you will know whom a disgraceful punishment will overtake and on whom a lasting punishment will descend.’
39.transliteration: fa-sawfa taʿlamūna man yaʾtīhi ʿadhābun yukhzīhi wa-yaḥillu ʿalayhi ʿadhābun muqīmun

40.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءَ أَمرُنا وَفارَ التَّنّورُ قُلنَا احمِل فيها مِن كُلٍّ زَوجَينِ اثنَينِ وَأَهلَكَ إِلّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيهِ القَولُ وَمَن آمَنَ ۚ وَما آمَنَ مَعَهُ إِلّا قَليلٌ
40.translation_eng: When Our edict came and the oven gushed [a stream of water], We said, ‘Carry in it a pair1 of every kind [of animal], along with your family —except those [of them] against whom the edict has already been given— and those who have faith.’ And none believed with him except a few.That is, male and female. Cf. 23:27.
40.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā jāʾa ʾamrunā wa-fāra t-tannūru qulnā ḥmil fīhā min kullin zawjayni thnayni wa-ʾahlaka ʾillā man sabaqa ʿalayhi l-qawlu wa-man ʾāmana wa-mā ʾāmana maʿahū ʾillā qalīlun

41.content: ۞ وَقالَ اركَبوا فيها بِسمِ اللَّهِ مَجراها وَمُرساها ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
41.translation_eng: He said, ‘Board it: In the Name of Allah it shall set sail and cast anchor. Indeed my Lord is all-forgiving, all-merciful.’
41.transliteration: wa-qāla rkabū fīhā bi-smi llāhi majrāhā wa-mursāhā ʾinna rabbī la-ghafūrun raḥīmun

42.content: وَهِيَ تَجري بِهِم في مَوجٍ كَالجِبالِ وَنادىٰ نوحٌ ابنَهُ وَكانَ في مَعزِلٍ يا بُنَيَّ اركَب مَعَنا وَلا تَكُن مَعَ الكافِرينَ
42.translation_eng: And it sailed along with them amid waves [rising] like mountains. Noah called out to his son, who stood aloof, ‘O my son! ‘Board with us, and do not be with the faithless!’
42.transliteration: wa-hiya tajrī bihim fī mawjin ka-l-jibāli wa-nādā nūḥun-i bnahū wa-kāna fī maʿzilin yā-bunayya rkab maʿanā wa-lā takun maʿa l-kāfirīna

43.content: قالَ سَآوي إِلىٰ جَبَلٍ يَعصِمُني مِنَ الماءِ ۚ قالَ لا عاصِمَ اليَومَ مِن أَمرِ اللَّهِ إِلّا مَن رَحِمَ ۚ وَحالَ بَينَهُمَا المَوجُ فَكانَ مِنَ المُغرَقينَ
43.translation_eng: He said, ‘I shall take refuge on a mountain; it will protect me from the flood.’ He said, ‘There is none today who can protect from Allah’s edict, except someone upon whom He has mercy.’ Then the waves came between them, and he was among those who were drowned.
43.transliteration: qāla sa-ʾāwī ʾilā jabalin yaʿṣimunī mina l-māʾi qāla lā ʿāṣima l-yawma min ʾamri llāhi ʾillā man raḥima wa-ḥāla baynahumā l-mawju fa-kāna mina l-mughraqīna

44.content: وَقيلَ يا أَرضُ ابلَعي ماءَكِ وَيا سَماءُ أَقلِعي وَغيضَ الماءُ وَقُضِيَ الأَمرُ وَاستَوَت عَلَى الجودِيِّ ۖ وَقيلَ بُعدًا لِلقَومِ الظّالِمينَ
44.translation_eng: Then it was said, ‘O earth, swallow your water! O sky, leave off!’ The waters receded; the edict was carried out, and it1 settled on [Mount] Judi. Then it was said, ‘Away with the wrongdoing lot!’That is, the Ark of Noah.
44.transliteration: wa-qīla yā-ʾarḍu blaʿī māʾaki wa-yā-samāʾu ʾaqliʿī wa-ghīḍa l-māʾu wa-quḍiya l-ʾamru wa-stawat ʿalā l-jūdiyyi wa-qīla buʿdan li-l-qawmi ẓ-ẓālimīna

45.content: وَنادىٰ نوحٌ رَبَّهُ فَقالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ ابني مِن أَهلي وَإِنَّ وَعدَكَ الحَقُّ وَأَنتَ أَحكَمُ الحاكِمينَ
45.translation_eng: Noah called out to his Lord, and said, ‘My Lord! My son is indeed from my family. Your promise is indeed true, and You are the fairest of all judges.’
45.transliteration: wa-nādā nūḥun rabbahū fa-qāla rabbi ʾinna bnī min ʾahlī wa-ʾinna waʿdaka l-ḥaqqu wa-ʾanta ʾaḥkamu l-ḥākimīna

46.content: قالَ يا نوحُ إِنَّهُ لَيسَ مِن أَهلِكَ ۖ إِنَّهُ عَمَلٌ غَيرُ صالِحٍ ۖ فَلا تَسأَلنِ ما لَيسَ لَكَ بِهِ عِلمٌ ۖ إِنّي أَعِظُكَ أَن تَكونَ مِنَ الجاهِلينَ
46.translation_eng: Said He, ‘O Noah! Indeed He is not of your family. Indeed he is [personification of] unrighteous conduct. So do not ask Me [something] of which you have no knowledge. I advise you lest you should be among the ignorant.’
46.transliteration: qāla yā-nūḥu ʾinnahū laysa min ʾahlika ʾinnahū ʿamalun ghayru ṣāliḥin fa-lā tasʾalni mā laysa laka bihī ʿilmun ʾinnī ʾaʿiẓuka ʾan takūna mina l-jāhilīna

47.content: قالَ رَبِّ إِنّي أَعوذُ بِكَ أَن أَسأَلَكَ ما لَيسَ لي بِهِ عِلمٌ ۖ وَإِلّا تَغفِر لي وَتَرحَمني أَكُن مِنَ الخاسِرينَ
47.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! I seek Your protection lest I should ask You something of which I have no knowledge. If You do not forgive me and have mercy upon me I shall be among the losers.’
47.transliteration: qāla rabbi ʾinnī ʾaʿūdhu bika ʾan ʾasʾalaka mā laysa lī bihī ʿilmun wa-ʾillā taghfir lī wa-tarḥamnī ʾakun mina l-khāsirīna

48.content: قيلَ يا نوحُ اهبِط بِسَلامٍ مِنّا وَبَرَكاتٍ عَلَيكَ وَعَلىٰ أُمَمٍ مِمَّن مَعَكَ ۚ وَأُمَمٌ سَنُمَتِّعُهُم ثُمَّ يَمَسُّهُم مِنّا عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
48.translation_eng: It was said, ‘O Noah! Disembark in peace from Us and with [Our] blessings upon you and upon nations [to descend] from those who are with you, and nations whom We shall provide for, then a painful punishment from Us shall befall them.’
