48.transliteration: qīla yā-nūḥu hbiṭ bi-salāmin minnā wa-barakātin ʿalayka wa-ʿalā ʾumamin mimman maʿaka wa-ʾumamun sa-numattiʿuhum thumma yamassuhum minnā ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

49.content: تِلكَ مِن أَنباءِ الغَيبِ نوحيها إِلَيكَ ۖ ما كُنتَ تَعلَمُها أَنتَ وَلا قَومُكَ مِن قَبلِ هٰذا ۖ فَاصبِر ۖ إِنَّ العاقِبَةَ لِلمُتَّقينَ
49.translation_eng: These are accounts of the Unseen which We reveal to you. Neither you nor your people used to know them before this. So be patient. Indeed the outcome will be in favour of the Godwary.
49.transliteration: tilka min ʾanbāʾi l-ghaybi nūḥīhā ʾilayka mā kunta taʿlamuhā ʾanta wa-lā qawmuka min qabli hādhā fa-ṣbir ʾinna l-ʿāqibata li-l-muttaqīna

50.content: وَإِلىٰ عادٍ أَخاهُم هودًا ۚ قالَ يا قَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ ۖ إِن أَنتُم إِلّا مُفتَرونَ
50.translation_eng: And to ʿĀd [We sent] Hūd, their brother. He said, ‘O my people! Worship Allah. You have no other god besides Him: you merely fabricate [the deities that you worship].
50.transliteration: wa-ʾilā ʿādin ʾakhāhum hūdan qāla yā-qawmi ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū ʾin ʾantum ʾillā muftarūna

51.content: يا قَومِ لا أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ أَجرًا ۖ إِن أَجرِيَ إِلّا عَلَى الَّذي فَطَرَني ۚ أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
51.translation_eng: ‘O my people! I do not ask you any reward for it. My reward lies only with Him who originated me. Do you not apply reason?
51.transliteration: yā-qawmi lā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi ʾajran ʾin ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā lladhī faṭaranī ʾa-fa-lā taʿqilūna

52.content: وَيا قَومِ استَغفِروا رَبَّكُم ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ يُرسِلِ السَّماءَ عَلَيكُم مِدرارًا وَيَزِدكُم قُوَّةً إِلىٰ قُوَّتِكُم وَلا تَتَوَلَّوا مُجرِمينَ
52.translation_eng: ‘O my people! Plead with your Lord for forgiveness, then turn to Him penitently: He will send copious rains for you from the sky, and add power to your [present] power. So do not turn your backs [on Him] as guilty ones.’
52.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi staghfirū rabbakum thumma tūbū ʾilayhi yursili s-samāʾa ʿalaykum midrāran wa-yazidkum quwwatan ʾilā quwwatikum wa-lā tatawallaw mujrimīna

53.content: قالوا يا هودُ ما جِئتَنا بِبَيِّنَةٍ وَما نَحنُ بِتارِكي آلِهَتِنا عَن قَولِكَ وَما نَحنُ لَكَ بِمُؤمِنينَ
53.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Hūd, you have not brought us any manifest proof. We are not going to abandon our gods for what you say, and we are not going to believe you.
53.transliteration: qālū yā-hūdu mā jiʾtanā bi-bayyinatin wa-mā naḥnu bi-tārikī ʾālihatinā ʿan qawlika wa-mā naḥnu laka bi-muʾminīna

54.content: إِن نَقولُ إِلَّا اعتَراكَ بَعضُ آلِهَتِنا بِسوءٍ ۗ قالَ إِنّي أُشهِدُ اللَّهَ وَاشهَدوا أَنّي بَريءٌ مِمّا تُشرِكونَ
54.translation_eng: All we say is that some of our gods have visited you with some evil.’ He said, ‘I call Allah to witness —and you too be [my] witnesses— that I repudiate what you take as [His] partners
54.transliteration: ʾin naqūlu ʾillā ʿtarāka baʿḍu ʾālihatinā bi-sūʾin qāla ʾinnī ʾushhidu llāha wa-shhadū ʾannī barīʾun mimmā tushrikūna

55.content: مِن دونِهِ ۖ فَكيدوني جَميعًا ثُمَّ لا تُنظِرونِ
55.translation_eng: besides Him. Now try out your stratagems against me, together, without granting me any respite.
55.transliteration: min dūnihī fa-kīdūnī jamīʿan thumma lā tunẓirūni

56.content: إِنّي تَوَكَّلتُ عَلَى اللَّهِ رَبّي وَرَبِّكُم ۚ ما مِن دابَّةٍ إِلّا هُوَ آخِذٌ بِناصِيَتِها ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي عَلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
56.translation_eng: Indeed I have put my trust in Allah, my Lord and your Lord. There is no living being but He holds it by its forelock. Indeed my Lord is on a straight path.
56.transliteration: ʾinnī tawakkaltu ʿalā llāhi rabbī wa-rabbikum mā min dābbatin ʾillā huwa ʾākhidhun bi-nāṣiyatihā ʾinna rabbī ʿalā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

57.content: فَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَقَد أَبلَغتُكُم ما أُرسِلتُ بِهِ إِلَيكُم ۚ وَيَستَخلِفُ رَبّي قَومًا غَيرَكُم وَلا تَضُرّونَهُ شَيئًا ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ حَفيظٌ
57.translation_eng: But if you turn your backs [on me], then [know that] I have communicated to you whatever I was sent to you with. My Lord will make another people succeed you, and you will not hurt Allah in the least. Indeed my Lord is watchful over all things.’
57.transliteration: fa-ʾin tawallaw fa-qad ʾablaghtukum mā ʾursiltu bihī ʾilaykum wa-yastakhlifu rabbī qawman ghayrakum wa-lā taḍurrūnahū shayʾan ʾinna rabbī ʿalā kulli shayʾin ḥafīẓun

58.content: وَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا نَجَّينا هودًا وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا مَعَهُ بِرَحمَةٍ مِنّا وَنَجَّيناهُم مِن عَذابٍ غَليظٍ
58.translation_eng: And when Our edict came, We delivered Hūd and the faithful who were with him, by a mercy from Us, and We delivered them from a harsh punishment.
58.transliteration: wa-lammā jāʾa ʾamrunā najjaynā hūdan wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū maʿahū bi-raḥmatin minnā wa-najjaynāhum min ʿadhābin ghalīẓin

59.content: وَتِلكَ عادٌ ۖ جَحَدوا بِآياتِ رَبِّهِم وَعَصَوا رُسُلَهُ وَاتَّبَعوا أَمرَ كُلِّ جَبّارٍ عَنيدٍ
59.translation_eng: Such were [the people of] ʿĀd: they impugned the signs of their Lord and disobeyed His apostles, and followed the dictates of every obdurate tyrant.
59.transliteration: wa-tilka ʿādun jaḥadū bi-ʾāyāti rabbihim wa-ʿaṣaw rusulahū wa-ttabaʿū ʾamra kulli jabbārin ʿanīdin

60.content: وَأُتبِعوا في هٰذِهِ الدُّنيا لَعنَةً وَيَومَ القِيامَةِ ۗ أَلا إِنَّ عادًا كَفَروا رَبَّهُم ۗ أَلا بُعدًا لِعادٍ قَومِ هودٍ
60.translation_eng: So they were pursued by a curse in this world and on the Day of Resurrection. Look! Indeed ʿĀd defied their Lord. Look! Away with ʿĀd, the people of Hud!
60.transliteration: wa-ʾutbiʿū fī hādhihi d-dunyā laʿnatan wa-yawma l-qiyāmati ʾa-lā ʾinna ʿādan kafarū rabbahum ʾa-lā buʿdan li-ʾādin qawmi hūdin

61.content: ۞ وَإِلىٰ ثَمودَ أَخاهُم صالِحًا ۚ قالَ يا قَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ ۖ هُوَ أَنشَأَكُم مِنَ الأَرضِ وَاستَعمَرَكُم فيها فَاستَغفِروهُ ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي قَريبٌ مُجيبٌ
61.translation_eng: And to Thamūd [We sent] Ṣāliḥ, their brother. He said, ‘O my people! Worship Allah. You have no other god besides Him. He brought you forth from the earth and made it your habitation. So plead with Him for forgiveness, then turn to Him penitently. My Lord is indeed nearmost [and] responsive.’
61.transliteration: wa-ʾilā thamūda ʾakhāhum ṣāliḥan qāla yā-qawmi ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū huwa ʾanshaʾakum mina l-ʾarḍi wa-staʿmarakum fīhā fa-staghfirūhu thumma tūbū ʾilayhi ʾinna rabbī qarībun mujībun

62.content: قالوا يا صالِحُ قَد كُنتَ فينا مَرجُوًّا قَبلَ هٰذا ۖ أَتَنهانا أَن نَعبُدَ ما يَعبُدُ آباؤُنا وَإِنَّنا لَفي شَكٍّ مِمّا تَدعونا إِلَيهِ مُريبٍ
62.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Ṣāliḥ! You were a source of hope to us before this. Do you forbid us to worship what our fathers have been worshiping? Indeed we have grave doubts concerning that to which you invite us.’
62.transliteration: qālū yā-ṣāliḥu qad kunta fīnā marjuwwan qabla hādhā ʾa-tanhānā ʾan naʿbuda mā yaʿbudu ʾābāʾunā wa-ʾinnanā la-fī shakkin mimmā tadʿūnā ʾilayhi murībin

63.content: قالَ يا قَومِ أَرَأَيتُم إِن كُنتُ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبّي وَآتاني مِنهُ رَحمَةً فَمَن يَنصُرُني مِنَ اللَّهِ إِن عَصَيتُهُ ۖ فَما تَزيدونَني غَيرَ تَخسيرٍ
63.translation_eng: He said, ‘O my people! Tell me, should I stand on a manifest proof from my Lord, and He has granted me His own mercy, who will protect me from Allah should I disobey Him? For then you will increase me in nothing but loss.
63.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi ʾa-raʾaytum ʾin kuntu ʿalā bayyinatin min rabbī wa-ʾātānī minhu raḥmatan fa-man yanṣurunī mina llāhi ʾin ʿaṣaytuhū fa-mā tazīdūnanī ghayra takhsīrin

64.content: وَيا قَومِ هٰذِهِ ناقَةُ اللَّهِ لَكُم آيَةً فَذَروها تَأكُل في أَرضِ اللَّهِ وَلا تَمَسّوها بِسوءٍ فَيَأخُذَكُم عَذابٌ قَريبٌ
64.translation_eng: O my people! This she-camel of Allah is a sign for you. Let her graze [freely] in Allah’s land, and do not cause her any harm, for then you shall be seized by a prompt punishment.’
64.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi hādhihī nāqatu llāhi lakum ʾāyatan fa-dharūhā taʾkul fī ʾarḍi llāhi wa-lā tamassūhā bi-sūʾin fa-yaʾkhudhakum ʿadhābun qarībun

65.content: فَعَقَروها فَقالَ تَمَتَّعوا في دارِكُم ثَلاثَةَ أَيّامٍ ۖ ذٰلِكَ وَعدٌ غَيرُ مَكذوبٍ
65.translation_eng: But they hamstrung her, whereupon he said, ‘Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days: that is a promise not to be belied!’
65.transliteration: fa-ʿaqarūhā fa-qāla tamattaʿū fī dārikum thalāthata ʾayyāmin dhālika waʿdun ghayru makdhūbin

66.content: فَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا نَجَّينا صالِحًا وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا مَعَهُ بِرَحمَةٍ مِنّا وَمِن خِزيِ يَومِئِذٍ ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ القَوِيُّ العَزيزُ
66.translation_eng: So when Our edict came, We delivered Ṣāliḥ and the faithful who were with him by a mercy from Us, and from the [punishment and] disgrace of that day. Your Lord is indeed the All-strong, the All-mighty.
66.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾa ʾamrunā najjaynā ṣāliḥan wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū maʿahū bi-raḥmatin minnā wa-min khizyi yawmiʾidhin ʾinna rabbaka huwa l-qawiyyu l-ʿazīzu

67.content: وَأَخَذَ الَّذينَ ظَلَمُوا الصَّيحَةُ فَأَصبَحوا في دِيارِهِم جاثِمينَ
67.translation_eng: The Cry seized those who were wrongdoers, and they lay lifeless prostrate in their homes,
67.transliteration: wa-ʾakhadha lladhīna ẓalamū ṣ-ṣayḥatu fa-ʾaṣbaḥū fī diyārihim jāthimīna

68.content: كَأَن لَم يَغنَوا فيها ۗ أَلا إِنَّ ثَمودَ كَفَروا رَبَّهُم ۗ أَلا بُعدًا لِثَمودَ
68.translation_eng: as if they had never lived there. Look! Indeed Thamūd defied their Lord. Look! Away with Thamūd!
68.transliteration: ka-ʾan lam yaghnaw fīhā ʾa-lā ʾinna thamūda kafarū rabbahum ʾa-lā buʿdan li-thamūda

69.content: وَلَقَد جاءَت رُسُلُنا إِبراهيمَ بِالبُشرىٰ قالوا سَلامًا ۖ قالَ سَلامٌ ۖ فَما لَبِثَ أَن جاءَ بِعِجلٍ حَنيذٍ
69.translation_eng: Certainly Our messengers came to Abraham with the good news, and said, ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’ He replied. Presently he brought [for them] a roasted calf.
69.transliteration: wa-la-qad jāʾat rusulunā ʾibrāhīma bi-l-bushrā qālū salāman qāla salāmun fa-mā labitha ʾan jāʾa bi-ʿijlin ḥanīdhin

70.content: فَلَمّا رَأىٰ أَيدِيَهُم لا تَصِلُ إِلَيهِ نَكِرَهُم وَأَوجَسَ مِنهُم خيفَةً ۚ قالوا لا تَخَف إِنّا أُرسِلنا إِلىٰ قَومِ لوطٍ
70.translation_eng: But when he saw their hands not reaching for it, he took them amiss and felt a fear of them. They said, ‘Do not be afraid. We have been sent to the people of Lot.’
70.transliteration: fa-lammā raʾā ʾaydiyahum lā taṣilu ʾilayhi nakirahum wa-ʾawjasa minhum khīfatan qālū lā takhaf ʾinnā ʾursilnā ʾilā qawmi lūṭin

71.content: وَامرَأَتُهُ قائِمَةٌ فَضَحِكَت فَبَشَّرناها بِإِسحاقَ وَمِن وَراءِ إِسحاقَ يَعقوبَ
71.translation_eng: His wife, standing by, laughed as We gave her the good news of [the birth of] Isaac, and of Jacob, after Isaac.
71.transliteration: wa-mraʾatuhū qāʾimatun fa-ḍaḥikat fa-bashsharnāhā bi-ʾisḥāqa wa-min warāʾi ʾisḥāqa yaʿqūba

72.content: قالَت يا وَيلَتىٰ أَأَلِدُ وَأَنا عَجوزٌ وَهٰذا بَعلي شَيخًا ۖ إِنَّ هٰذا لَشَيءٌ عَجيبٌ
72.translation_eng: She said, ‘Oh, my! Shall I, an old woman, bear [children], and [while] this husband of mine is an old man?! That is indeed an odd thing!’
72.transliteration: qālat yā-waylatā ʾa-ʾalidu wa-ʾana ʿajūzun wa-hādhā baʿlī shaykhan ʾinna hādhā la-shayʾun ʿajībun

73.content: قالوا أَتَعجَبينَ مِن أَمرِ اللَّهِ ۖ رَحمَتُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ عَلَيكُم أَهلَ البَيتِ ۚ إِنَّهُ حَميدٌ مَجيدٌ
73.translation_eng: They said, ‘Are you amazed at Allah’s dispensation? [That is] Allah’s mercy and His blessings upon you, members of the household. Indeed He is all-laudable, all-glorious.’
73.transliteration: qālū ʾa-taʿjabīna min ʾamri llāhi raḥmatu llāhi wa-barakātuhū ʿalaykum ʾahla l-bayti ʾinnahū ḥamīdun majīdun

74.content: فَلَمّا ذَهَبَ عَن إِبراهيمَ الرَّوعُ وَجاءَتهُ البُشرىٰ يُجادِلُنا في قَومِ لوطٍ
74.translation_eng: So when the awe had left Abraham and the good news had reached him, he pleaded with Us concerning the people of Lot.
74.transliteration: fa-lammā dhahaba ʿan ʾibrāhīma r-rawʿu wa-jāʾathu l-bushrā yujādilunā fī qawmi lūṭin

75.content: إِنَّ إِبراهيمَ لَحَليمٌ أَوّاهٌ مُنيبٌ
75.translation_eng: Abraham was indeed most forbearing, plaintive, [and] penitent.
75.transliteration: ʾinna ʾibrāhīma la-ḥalīmun ʾawwāhun munībun

76.content: يا إِبراهيمُ أَعرِض عَن هٰذا ۖ إِنَّهُ قَد جاءَ أَمرُ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَإِنَّهُم آتيهِم عَذابٌ غَيرُ مَردودٍ
76.translation_eng: ‘O Abraham, let this matter alone! Your Lord’s edict has certainly come, and an irrevocable punishment shall overtake them.’
76.transliteration: yā-ʾibrāhīmu ʾaʿriḍ ʿan hādhā ʾinnahū qad jāʾa ʾamru rabbika wa-ʾinnahum ʾātīhim ʿadhābun ghayru mardūdin

77.content: وَلَمّا جاءَت رُسُلُنا لوطًا سيءَ بِهِم وَضاقَ بِهِم ذَرعًا وَقالَ هٰذا يَومٌ عَصيبٌ
77.translation_eng: When Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed on their account and in a predicament for their sake, and he said, ‘This is a terrible day!’
77.transliteration: wa-lammā jāʾat rusulunā lūṭan sīʾa bihim wa-ḍāqa bihim dharʿan wa-qāla hādhā yawmun ʿaṣībun

78.content: وَجاءَهُ قَومُهُ يُهرَعونَ إِلَيهِ وَمِن قَبلُ كانوا يَعمَلونَ السَّيِّئَاتِ ۚ قالَ يا قَومِ هٰؤُلاءِ بَناتي هُنَّ أَطهَرُ لَكُم ۖ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَلا تُخزونِ في ضَيفي ۖ أَلَيسَ مِنكُم رَجُلٌ رَشيدٌ
78.translation_eng: Then his people came running toward him, and they had been committing vices aforetime. He said, ‘O my people, these are my daughters: they are purer for you.1 Be wary of Allah and do not humiliate me with regard to my guests. Is there not a right-minded man among you?’That is, it would be purer for you to get married to them.
78.transliteration: wa-jāʾahū qawmuhū yuhraʿūna ʾilayhi wa-min qablu kānū yaʿmalūna s-sayyiʾāti qāla yā-qawmi hāʾulāʾi banātī hunna ʾaṭharu lakum fa-ttaqū llāha wa-lā tukhzūni fī ḍayfī ʾa-laysa minkum rajulun rashīdun

79.content: قالوا لَقَد عَلِمتَ ما لَنا في بَناتِكَ مِن حَقٍّ وَإِنَّكَ لَتَعلَمُ ما نُريدُ
79.translation_eng: They said, ‘You certainly know that we have no interest in your daughters, and indeed you know what we want.’
79.transliteration: qālū la-qad ʿalimta mā lanā fī banātika min ḥaqqin wa-ʾinnaka la-taʿlamu mā nurīdu

80.content: قالَ لَو أَنَّ لي بِكُم قُوَّةً أَو آوي إِلىٰ رُكنٍ شَديدٍ
80.translation_eng: He said, ‘If only I had the power to deter you, or could take refuge in a mighty support!’
80.transliteration: qāla law ʾanna lī bikum quwwatan ʾaw ʾāwī ʾilā ruknin shadīdin

81.content: قالوا يا لوطُ إِنّا رُسُلُ رَبِّكَ لَن يَصِلوا إِلَيكَ ۖ فَأَسرِ بِأَهلِكَ بِقِطعٍ مِنَ اللَّيلِ وَلا يَلتَفِت مِنكُم أَحَدٌ إِلَّا امرَأَتَكَ ۖ إِنَّهُ مُصيبُها ما أَصابَهُم ۚ إِنَّ مَوعِدَهُمُ الصُّبحُ ۚ أَلَيسَ الصُّبحُ بِقَريبٍ
81.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Lot, we are messengers of your Lord. They will never get at you. Set out with your family in a watch of the night; and none of you shall turn round, except your wife; indeed she will be struck by what strikes them. Indeed their tryst is the dawn. Is not the dawn [already] near?’
81.transliteration: qālū yā-lūṭu ʾinnā rusulu rabbika lan yaṣilū ʾilayka fa-ʾasri bi-ʾahlika bi-qiṭʿin mina l-layli wa-lā yaltafit minkum ʾaḥadun ʾillā mraʾataka ʾinnahū muṣībuhā mā ʾaṣābahum ʾinna mawʿidahumu ṣ-ṣubḥu ʾa-laysa ṣ-ṣubḥu bi-qarībin

82.content: فَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا جَعَلنا عالِيَها سافِلَها وَأَمطَرنا عَلَيها حِجارَةً مِن سِجّيلٍ مَنضودٍ
82.translation_eng: So when Our edict came, We made its1 topmost part its nethermost, and We rained on it stones of laminar shale,That is, of the city of Sodom.
82.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾa ʾamrunā jaʿalnā ʿāliyahā sāfilahā wa-ʾamṭarnā ʿalayhā ḥijāratan min sijjīlin manḍūdin

83.content: مُسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَما هِيَ مِنَ الظّالِمينَ بِبَعيدٍ
83.translation_eng: marked1 with your Lord [for the profligate],2 never far from the wrongdoers.Or ‘targeted.’Cf. 51:34.
83.transliteration: musawwamatan ʿinda rabbika wa-mā hiya mina ẓ-ẓālimīna bi-baʿīdin

84.content: ۞ وَإِلىٰ مَديَنَ أَخاهُم شُعَيبًا ۚ قالَ يا قَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ ۖ وَلا تَنقُصُوا المِكيالَ وَالميزانَ ۚ إِنّي أَراكُم بِخَيرٍ وَإِنّي أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ مُحيطٍ
84.translation_eng: And to Midian [We sent] Shuʿayb, their brother. He said, ‘O my people! Worship Allah. You have no other god besides Him. Do not diminish the measure or the balance. Indeed I see that you are faring well, but I fear for you the punishment of an all-embracing day.’
84.transliteration: wa-ʾilā madyana ʾakhāhum shuʿayban qāla yā-qawmi ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū wa-lā tanquṣū l-mikyāla wa-l-mīzāna ʾinnī ʾarākum bi-khayrin wa-ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʿalaykum ʿadhāba yawmin muḥīṭin

85.content: وَيا قَومِ أَوفُوا المِكيالَ وَالميزانَ بِالقِسطِ ۖ وَلا تَبخَسُوا النّاسَ أَشياءَهُم وَلا تَعثَوا فِي الأَرضِ مُفسِدينَ
85.translation_eng: ‘O my people! Observe fully the measure and the balance, with justice, and do not cheat the people of their goods,1 and do not act wickedly on the earth, causing corruption.’That is, by employing short weights and measures.
85.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi ʾawfū l-mikyāla wa-l-mīzāna bi-l-qisṭi wa-lā tabkhasū n-nāsa ʾashyāʾahum wa-lā taʿthaw fī l-ʾarḍi mufsidīna

86.content: بَقِيَّتُ اللَّهِ خَيرٌ لَكُم إِن كُنتُم مُؤمِنينَ ۚ وَما أَنا عَلَيكُم بِحَفيظٍ
86.translation_eng: ‘What remains of Allah’s provision1 is better for you, should you be faithful, and I am not a keeper over you.’That is, of your lawful earnings.
86.transliteration: baqiyyatu llāhi khayrun lakum ʾin kuntum muʾminīna wa-mā ʾana ʿalaykum bi-ḥafīẓin

87.content: قالوا يا شُعَيبُ أَصَلاتُكَ تَأمُرُكَ أَن نَترُكَ ما يَعبُدُ آباؤُنا أَو أَن نَفعَلَ في أَموالِنا ما نَشاءُ ۖ إِنَّكَ لَأَنتَ الحَليمُ الرَّشيدُ
87.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Shuʿayb, does your worship require that we abandon what our fathers have been worshiping, or that we should not do with our wealth whatever we wish? You are indeed [a] gentle and sensible [person].’
87.transliteration: qālū yā-shuʿaybu ʾa-ṣalātuka taʾmuruka ʾan natruka mā yaʿbudu ʾābāʾunā ʾaw ʾan nafʿala fī ʾamwālinā mā nashāʾu ʾinnaka la-ʾanta l-ḥalīmu r-rashīdu

88.content: قالَ يا قَومِ أَرَأَيتُم إِن كُنتُ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبّي وَرَزَقَني مِنهُ رِزقًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَما أُريدُ أَن أُخالِفَكُم إِلىٰ ما أَنهاكُم عَنهُ ۚ إِن أُريدُ إِلَّا الإِصلاحَ مَا استَطَعتُ ۚ وَما تَوفيقي إِلّا بِاللَّهِ ۚ عَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلتُ وَإِلَيهِ أُنيبُ
88.translation_eng: He said, ‘O my people! Have you considered, should I stand on a manifest proof from my Lord, who has provided me a good provision from Himself?1 I do not wish to oppose you by what I forbid you. I only desire to put things in order, as far as I can, and my success lies only with Allah: in Him I have put my trust, and to Him I turn penitently.That is, ‘If I stand on a clear proof from my Lord, who has provided me with lawful means of livelihood, is it a right thing for you to reject my call to faith in Allah and fair dealing?’
88.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi ʾa-raʾaytum ʾin kuntu ʿalā bayyinatin min rabbī wa-razaqanī minhu rizqan ḥasanan wa-mā ʾurīdu ʾan ʾukhālifakum ʾilā mā ʾanhākum ʿanhu ʾin ʾurīdu ʾillā l-ʾiṣlāḥa mā staṭaʿtu wa-mā tawfīqī ʾillā bi-llāhi ʿalayhi tawakkaltu wa-ʾilayhi ʾunību

89.content: وَيا قَومِ لا يَجرِمَنَّكُم شِقاقي أَن يُصيبَكُم مِثلُ ما أَصابَ قَومَ نوحٍ أَو قَومَ هودٍ أَو قَومَ صالِحٍ ۚ وَما قَومُ لوطٍ مِنكُم بِبَعيدٍ
89.translation_eng: O my people, do not let your defiance toward me lead you to be visited by the like of what was visited on the people of Noah, or the people of Hūd, or the people of Ṣāliḥ, and the people of Lot are not distant from you.
89.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi lā yajrimannakum shiqāqī ʾan yuṣībakum mithlu mā ʾaṣāba qawma nūḥin ʾaw qawma hūdin ʾaw qawma ṣāliḥin wa-mā qawmu lūṭin minkum bi-baʿīdin

90.content: وَاستَغفِروا رَبَّكُم ثُمَّ توبوا إِلَيهِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي رَحيمٌ وَدودٌ
90.translation_eng: Plead with your Lord for forgiveness, then turn to Him penitently. My Lord is indeed all-merciful, all-affectionate.’
90.transliteration: wa-staghfirū rabbakum thumma tūbū ʾilāyhi ʾinna rabbī raḥīmun wadūdun

91.content: قالوا يا شُعَيبُ ما نَفقَهُ كَثيرًا مِمّا تَقولُ وَإِنّا لَنَراكَ فينا ضَعيفًا ۖ وَلَولا رَهطُكَ لَرَجَمناكَ ۖ وَما أَنتَ عَلَينا بِعَزيزٍ
91.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Shuʿayb, we do not understand much of what you say. Indeed we see you are weak amongst us, and were it not for your tribe, we would have stoned you, and you are not venerable to us.’
91.transliteration: qālū yā-shuʿaybu mā nafqahu kathīran mimmā taqūlu wa-ʾinnā la-narāka fīnā ḍaʿīfan wa-law-lā rahṭuka la-rajamnāka wa-mā ʾanta ʿalaynā bi-ʿazīzin

92.content: قالَ يا قَومِ أَرَهطي أَعَزُّ عَلَيكُم مِنَ اللَّهِ وَاتَّخَذتُموهُ وَراءَكُم ظِهرِيًّا ۖ إِنَّ رَبّي بِما تَعمَلونَ مُحيطٌ
92.translation_eng: He said, ‘O my people! Is my tribe more venerable in your sight than Allah, to whom you pay no regard? Indeed my Lord comprehends whatever you do.
92.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi ʾa-rahṭī ʾaʿazzu ʿalaykum mina llāhi wa-ttakhadhtumūhu warāʾakum ẓihriyyan ʾinna rabbī bi-mā taʿmalūna muḥīṭun

93.content: وَيا قَومِ اعمَلوا عَلىٰ مَكانَتِكُم إِنّي عامِلٌ ۖ سَوفَ تَعلَمونَ مَن يَأتيهِ عَذابٌ يُخزيهِ وَمَن هُوَ كاذِبٌ ۖ وَارتَقِبوا إِنّي مَعَكُم رَقيبٌ
93.translation_eng: O my people! Act according to your ability; I too am acting. Soon you will know who will be overtaken by a punishment that will disgrace him, and who is a liar. So be on the watch; I too will be watching along with you.’
93.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi ʿmalū ʿalā makānatikum ʾinnī ʿāmilun sawfa taʿlamūna man yaʾtīhi ʿadhābun yukhzīhi wa-man huwa kādhibun wa-rtaqibū ʾinnī maʿakum raqībun

94.content: وَلَمّا جاءَ أَمرُنا نَجَّينا شُعَيبًا وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا مَعَهُ بِرَحمَةٍ مِنّا وَأَخَذَتِ الَّذينَ ظَلَمُوا الصَّيحَةُ فَأَصبَحوا في دِيارِهِم جاثِمينَ
94.translation_eng: And when Our edict came, We delivered Shuʿayb and the faithful who were with him by a mercy from Us. And the Cry seized those who were wrongdoers, whereat they lay lifeless prostrate in their homes,
94.transliteration: wa-lammā jāʾa ʾamrunā najjaynā shuʿayban wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū maʿahū bi-raḥmatin minnā wa-ʾakhadhati lladhīna ẓalamū ṣ-ṣayḥatu fa-ʾaṣbaḥū fī diyārihim jāthimīna

95.content: كَأَن لَم يَغنَوا فيها ۗ أَلا بُعدًا لِمَديَنَ كَما بَعِدَت ثَمودُ
95.translation_eng: as if they had never lived there. Look! Away with Midian! —just as Thamūd was done away with!
95.transliteration: ka-ʾan lam yaghnaw fīhā ʾa-lā buʿdan li-madyana ka-mā baʿidat thamūdu

96.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا موسىٰ بِآياتِنا وَسُلطانٍ مُبينٍ
96.translation_eng: Certainly We sent Moses with Our signs and a manifest authority
96.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā mūsā bi-ʾāyātinā wa-sulṭānin mubīnin

97.content: إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَمَلَئِهِ فَاتَّبَعوا أَمرَ فِرعَونَ ۖ وَما أَمرُ فِرعَونَ بِرَشيدٍ
97.translation_eng: to Pharaoh and his elite, but they followed Pharaoh’s dictates, and Pharaoh’s dictates were not right-minded.
97.transliteration: ʾilā firʿawna wa-malaʾihī fa-ttabaʿū ʾamra firʿawna wa-mā ʾamru firʿawna bi-rashīdin

98.content: يَقدُمُ قَومَهُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ فَأَورَدَهُمُ النّارَ ۖ وَبِئسَ الوِردُ المَورودُ
98.translation_eng: On the Day of Resurrection he will lead his people and conduct them into the Fire: an evil goal for the incoming!1Or ‘an evil watering place for the thirsty.’
98.transliteration: yaqdumu qawmahū yawma l-qiyāmati fa-ʾawradahumu n-nāra wa-biʾsa l-wirdu l-mawrūdu

99.content: وَأُتبِعوا في هٰذِهِ لَعنَةً وَيَومَ القِيامَةِ ۚ بِئسَ الرِّفدُ المَرفودُ
99.translation_eng: They were pursued by a curse in this [world], as well as on the Day of Resurrection; evil is the award conferred [upon them]!
99.transliteration: wa-ʾutbiʿū fī hādhihī laʿnatan wa-yawma l-qiyāmati biʾsa r-rifdu l-marfūdu

100.content: ذٰلِكَ مِن أَنباءِ القُرىٰ نَقُصُّهُ عَلَيكَ ۖ مِنها قائِمٌ وَحَصيدٌ
100.translation_eng: These are from the accounts of the townships which We recount to you. Of them there are some that still stand, and some that have been mown down.
100.transliteration: dhālika min ʾanbāʾi l-qurā naquṣṣuhū ʿalayka minhā qāʾimun wa-ḥaṣīdun

101.content: وَما ظَلَمناهُم وَلٰكِن ظَلَموا أَنفُسَهُم ۖ فَما أَغنَت عَنهُم آلِهَتُهُمُ الَّتي يَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن شَيءٍ لَمّا جاءَ أَمرُ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَما زادوهُم غَيرَ تَتبيبٍ
101.translation_eng: We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves. Of no avail to them were their gods whom they would invoke besides Allah, in any wise, when your Lord’s edict came, and they1 did not increase them in anything but ruin.That is, their false gods.
101.transliteration: wa-mā ẓalamnāhum wa-lākin ẓalamū ʾanfusahum fa-mā ʾaghnat ʿanhum ʾālihatuhumu llatī yadʿūna min dūni llāhi min shayʾin lammā jāʾa ʾamru rabbika wa-mā zādūhum ghayra tatbībin

102.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَخذُ رَبِّكَ إِذا أَخَذَ القُرىٰ وَهِيَ ظالِمَةٌ ۚ إِنَّ أَخذَهُ أَليمٌ شَديدٌ
102.translation_eng: Such is the seizing of your Lord when He seizes the townships that are wrongdoing. Indeed His seizing is painful, severe.
102.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika ʾakhdhu rabbika ʾidhā ʾakhadha l-qurā wa-hiya ẓālimatun ʾinna ʾakhdhahū ʾalīmun shadīdun

103.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِمَن خافَ عَذابَ الآخِرَةِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ يَومٌ مَجموعٌ لَهُ النّاسُ وَذٰلِكَ يَومٌ مَشهودٌ
103.translation_eng: There is indeed a sign in that for him who fears the punishment of the Hereafter. That is a day on which all mankind will be gathered, and it is a day witnessed [by all creatures].
103.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan li-man khāfa ʿadhāba l-ʾākhirati dhālika yawmun majmūʿun lahu n-nāsu wa-dhālika yawmun mashhūdun

104.translation_eng: And We do not defer it but for a determinate term.

105.content: يَومَ يَأتِ لا تَكَلَّمُ نَفسٌ إِلّا بِإِذنِهِ ۚ فَمِنهُم شَقِيٌّ وَسَعيدٌ
105.translation_eng: The day it comes, no one shall speak except by His leave. [On that day,] some of them will be wretched and [some] felicitous.
105.transliteration: yawma yaʾti lā takallamu nafsun ʾillā bi-ʾidhnihī fa-minhum shaqiyyun wa-saʿīdun

106.content: فَأَمَّا الَّذينَ شَقوا فَفِي النّارِ لَهُم فيها زَفيرٌ وَشَهيقٌ
106.translation_eng: As for the wretched, they shall be in the Fire: their lot therein will be groaning and wailing.
106.transliteration: fa-ʾammā lladhīna shaqū fa-fī n-nāri lahum fīhā zafīrun wa-shahīqun

107.content: خالِدينَ فيها ما دامَتِ السَّماواتُ وَالأَرضُ إِلّا ما شاءَ رَبُّكَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ فَعّالٌ لِما يُريدُ
107.translation_eng: They shall remain in it for as long as the heavens and the earth endure —except what your Lord may wish; indeed your Lord does whatever He desires.
107.transliteration: khālidīna fīhā mā dāmati s-samāwātu wa-l-ʾarḍu ʾillā mā shāʾa rabbuka ʾinna rabbaka faʿʿālun li-mā yurīdu

108.content: ۞ وَأَمَّا الَّذينَ سُعِدوا فَفِي الجَنَّةِ خالِدينَ فيها ما دامَتِ السَّماواتُ وَالأَرضُ إِلّا ما شاءَ رَبُّكَ ۖ عَطاءً غَيرَ مَجذوذٍ
108.translation_eng: As for the felicitous, they will be in paradise. They will remain in it for as long as the heavens and the earth endure —except what your Lord may wish— an endless bounty.
108.transliteration: wa-ʾammā lladhīna suʿidū fa-fī l-jannati khālidīna fīhā mā dāmati s-samāwātu wa-l-ʾarḍu ʾillā mā shāʾa rabbuka ʿaṭāʾan ghayra majdhūdhin

109.content: فَلا تَكُ في مِريَةٍ مِمّا يَعبُدُ هٰؤُلاءِ ۚ ما يَعبُدونَ إِلّا كَما يَعبُدُ آباؤُهُم مِن قَبلُ ۚ وَإِنّا لَمُوَفّوهُم نَصيبَهُم غَيرَ مَنقوصٍ
109.translation_eng: So do not be in doubt about what these1 worship: they worship just as their fathers worshiped before, and We shall surely pay them their full share, undiminished.That is, the idolaters of Arabia.
109.transliteration: fa-lā taku fī miryatin mimmā yaʿbudu hāʾulāʾi mā yaʿbudūna ʾillā ka-mā yaʿbudu ʾābāʾuhum min qablu wa-ʾinnā la-muwaffūhum naṣībahum ghayra manqūṣin

110.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسَى الكِتابَ فَاختُلِفَ فيهِ ۚ وَلَولا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَت مِن رَبِّكَ لَقُضِيَ بَينَهُم ۚ وَإِنَّهُم لَفي شَكٍّ مِنهُ مُريبٍ
110.translation_eng: Certainly We gave Moses the Book, but differences arose about it, and were it not for a prior decree of your Lord, a decision would have been made between them; indeed they are in grave doubt concerning it.
110.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā mūsā l-kitāba fa-khtulifa fīhi wa-law-lā kalimatun sabaqat min rabbika la-quḍiya baynahum wa-ʾinnahum la-fī shakkin minhu murībin

111.content: وَإِنَّ كُلًّا لَمّا لَيُوَفِّيَنَّهُم رَبُّكَ أَعمالَهُم ۚ إِنَّهُ بِما يَعمَلونَ خَبيرٌ
111.translation_eng: Your Lord will indeed recompense everyone fully for their works. Indeed He is well aware of what they do.
111.transliteration: wa-ʾinna kullan lammā la-yuwaffiyannahum rabbuka ʾaʿmālahum ʾinnahū bi-mā yaʿmalūna khabīrun

112.content: فَاستَقِم كَما أُمِرتَ وَمَن تابَ مَعَكَ وَلا تَطغَوا ۚ إِنَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ بَصيرٌ
112.translation_eng: So be steadfast, just as you have been commanded— [you] and whoever has turned [to Allah] with you— and do not overstep the bounds. Indeed He sees best what you do.
112.transliteration: fa-staqim ka-mā ʾumirta wa-man tāba maʿaka wa-lā taṭghaw ʾinnahū bi-mā taʿmalūna baṣīrun

113.content: وَلا تَركَنوا إِلَى الَّذينَ ظَلَموا فَتَمَسَّكُمُ النّارُ وَما لَكُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن أَولِياءَ ثُمَّ لا تُنصَرونَ
113.translation_eng: And do not incline toward the wrongdoers, lest the Fire should touch you, and you will not have any friend besides Allah, then you will not be helped.
113.transliteration: wa-lā tarkanū ʾilā lladhīna ẓalamū fa-tamassakumu n-nāru wa-mā lakum min dūni llāhi min ʾawliyāʾa thumma lā tunṣarūna

114.content: وَأَقِمِ الصَّلاةَ طَرَفَيِ النَّهارِ وَزُلَفًا مِنَ اللَّيلِ ۚ إِنَّ الحَسَناتِ يُذهِبنَ السَّيِّئَاتِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ ذِكرىٰ لِلذّاكِرينَ
114.translation_eng: Maintain the prayer at the two ends of the day,1 and during the early hours of the night. Indeed good deeds efface misdeeds.2 That is an admonition for the mindful.That is, at dawn and sunset.Or ‘Indeed good deeds remove ills,’ or ‘Indeed virtues efface vices.’
114.transliteration: wa-ʾaqimi ṣ-ṣalāta ṭarafayi n-nahāri wa-zulafan mina l-layli ʾinna l-ḥasanāti yudhhibna s-sayyiʾāti dhālika dhikrā li-dh-dhākirīna

115.content: وَاصبِر فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُضيعُ أَجرَ المُحسِنينَ
115.translation_eng: And be patient; indeed Allah does not waste the reward of the virtuous.
115.transliteration: wa-ṣbir fa-ʾinna llāha lā yuḍīʿu ʾajra l-muḥsinīna

116.content: فَلَولا كانَ مِنَ القُرونِ مِن قَبلِكُم أُولو بَقِيَّةٍ يَنهَونَ عَنِ الفَسادِ فِي الأَرضِ إِلّا قَليلًا مِمَّن أَنجَينا مِنهُم ۗ وَاتَّبَعَ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا ما أُترِفوا فيهِ وَكانوا مُجرِمينَ
116.translation_eng: Why were there not among the generations before you a remnant [of the wise] who might forbid corruption in the earth, except a few of those whom We delivered from among them? Those who were wrongdoers pursued that in which they had been granted affluence, and they were a guilty lot.
116.transliteration: fa-law-lā kāna mina l-qurūni min qablikum ʾulū baqiyyatin yanhawna ʿani l-fasādi fī l-ʾarḍi ʾillā qalīlan mimman ʾanjaynā minhum wa-ttabaʿa lladhīna ẓalamū mā ʾutrifū fīhi wa-kānū mujrimīna

117.content: وَما كانَ رَبُّكَ لِيُهلِكَ القُرىٰ بِظُلمٍ وَأَهلُها مُصلِحونَ
117.translation_eng: Your Lord would never destroy the townships unjustly while their inhabitants were bringing about reform.
117.transliteration: wa-mā kāna rabbuka li-yuhlika l-qurā bi-ẓulmin wa-ʾahluhā muṣliḥūna

118.content: وَلَو شاءَ رَبُّكَ لَجَعَلَ النّاسَ أُمَّةً واحِدَةً ۖ وَلا يَزالونَ مُختَلِفينَ
118.translation_eng: Had your Lord wished, He would have made mankind one community; but they continue to differ,
118.transliteration: wa-law shāʾa rabbuka la-jaʿala n-nāsa ʾummatan wāḥidatan wa-lā yazālūna mukhtalifīna

119.content: إِلّا مَن رَحِمَ رَبُّكَ ۚ وَلِذٰلِكَ خَلَقَهُم ۗ وَتَمَّت كَلِمَةُ رَبِّكَ لَأَملَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنَ الجِنَّةِ وَالنّاسِ أَجمَعينَ
119.translation_eng: except those on whom your Lord has mercy —and that is why He created them— and the word of your Lord has been fulfilled: ‘I will surely fill hell with jinn and humans, all together!’1That is, all of those who are followers of Satan. See 38:85.
119.transliteration: ʾillā man raḥima rabbuka wa-li-dhālika khalaqahum wa-tammat kalimatu rabbika la-ʾamlaʾanna jahannama mina l-jinnati wa-n-nāsi ʾajmaʿīna

120.content: وَكُلًّا نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ مِن أَنباءِ الرُّسُلِ ما نُثَبِّتُ بِهِ فُؤادَكَ ۚ وَجاءَكَ في هٰذِهِ الحَقُّ وَمَوعِظَةٌ وَذِكرىٰ لِلمُؤمِنينَ
120.translation_eng: Whatever We relate to you of the accounts of the apostles are those by which We strengthen your heart, and there has come to you in this [sūrah] the truth and an advice and admonition for the faithful.
120.transliteration: wa-kullan naquṣṣu ʿalayka min ʾanbāʾi r-rusuli mā nuthabbitu bihī fuʾādaka wa-jāʾaka fī hādhihi l-ḥaqqu wa-mawʿiẓatun wa-dhikrā li-l-muʾminīna

121.content: وَقُل لِلَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ اعمَلوا عَلىٰ مَكانَتِكُم إِنّا عامِلونَ
121.translation_eng: And say to those who do not have faith, ‘Act according to your ability; we too are acting.
121.transliteration: wa-qul li-lladhīna lā yuʾminūna ʿmalū ʿalā makānatikum ʾinnā ʿāmilūna

122.translation_eng: And wait! We too are waiting.’

123.content: وَلِلَّهِ غَيبُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَإِلَيهِ يُرجَعُ الأَمرُ كُلُّهُ فَاعبُدهُ وَتَوَكَّل عَلَيهِ ۚ وَما رَبُّكَ بِغافِلٍ عَمّا تَعمَلونَ
123.translation_eng: To Allah belongs the Unseen of the heavens and the earth, and to Him all matters are returned. So worship Him and trust in Him. Your Lord is not oblivious of what you do.
123.transliteration: wa-li-llāhi ghaybu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-ʾilayhi yurjaʿu l-ʾamru kulluhū fa-ʿbudhu wa-tawakkal ʿalayhi wa-mā rabbuka bi-ghāfilin ʿammā taʿmalūna

12.description: The surah that narrates the edifying and enthralling life experience of the noble prophet and interpreter of dreams, Joseph—son of Jacob, son of Isaac, son of Abraham—calling it “the fairest of stories,” an inspirational triumph of morality and faith. “Yūsuf” is the Arabic for “Joseph”, whose well-known story is told in this surah. Even though the surah primarily deals with the story of Joseph, it is framed by a three-verse introduction about the Quran and a ten-verse epilogue about the Meccans” response, the punishment met by earlier disbelievers, and encouragement for the Prophet.

1.translation_eng: Alif, Lām, Rā. These are the signs of the Manifest Book.
1.transliteration: a-l-r (ʾalif lām rā) tilka ʾāyātu l-kitābi l-mubīni

2.content: إِنّا أَنزَلناهُ قُرآنًا عَرَبِيًّا لَعَلَّكُم تَعقِلونَ
2.translation_eng: Indeed We have sent it down as an Arabic Qurʾān so that you may apply reason.
2.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾanzalnāhu qurʾānan ʿarabiyyan laʿallakum taʿqilūna

3.content: نَحنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ أَحسَنَ القَصَصِ بِما أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ هٰذَا القُرآنَ وَإِن كُنتَ مِن قَبلِهِ لَمِنَ الغافِلينَ
3.translation_eng: We will recount to you the best of narratives1 in what We have revealed to you of this Qurʾān, and indeed prior to it you were among those who are unaware [of it].Or ‘We will tell you a story in the best style of narration.’
3.transliteration: naḥnu naquṣṣu ʿalayka ʾaḥsana l-qaṣaṣi bi-mā ʾawḥaynā ʾilayka hādhā l-qurʾāna wa-ʾin kunta min qablihī la-mina l-ghāfilīna

4.content: إِذ قالَ يوسُفُ لِأَبيهِ يا أَبَتِ إِنّي رَأَيتُ أَحَدَ عَشَرَ كَوكَبًا وَالشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ رَأَيتُهُم لي ساجِدينَ
4.translation_eng: When Joseph said to his father, ‘Father! I saw eleven planets,1 and the sun and the moon: I saw them prostrating themselves before me.’Or ‘stars.’
4.transliteration: ʾidh qāla yūsufu li-ʾabīhi yā-ʾabati ʾinnī raʾaytu ʾaḥada ʿashara kawkaban wa-sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara raʾaytuhum lī sājidīna

5.content: قالَ يا بُنَيَّ لا تَقصُص رُؤياكَ عَلىٰ إِخوَتِكَ فَيَكيدوا لَكَ كَيدًا ۖ إِنَّ الشَّيطانَ لِلإِنسانِ عَدُوٌّ مُبينٌ
5.translation_eng: He said, ‘My son, do not recount your dream to your brothers, lest they should devise schemes against you. Satan is indeed man’s manifest enemy.
5.transliteration: qāla yā-bunayya lā taqṣuṣ ruʾyāka ʿalā ʾikhwatika fa-yakīdū laka kaydan ʾinna sh-shayṭāna li-l-ʾinsāni ʿaduwwun mubīnun

6.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ يَجتَبيكَ رَبُّكَ وَيُعَلِّمُكَ مِن تَأويلِ الأَحاديثِ وَيُتِمُّ نِعمَتَهُ عَلَيكَ وَعَلىٰ آلِ يَعقوبَ كَما أَتَمَّها عَلىٰ أَبَوَيكَ مِن قَبلُ إِبراهيمَ وَإِسحاقَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
6.translation_eng: That is how your Lord will choose you, and teach you the interpretation of dreams,1 and complete His blessing upon you and upon the house of Jacob, just as He completed it earlier for your fathers, Abraham and Isaac. Your Lord is indeed all-knowing, all-wise.’Or ‘the interpretation of visions.’
6.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika yajtabīka rabbuka wa-yuʿallimuka min taʾwīli l-ʾaḥādīthi wa-yutimmu niʿmatahū ʿalayka wa-ʿalā ʾāli yaʿqūba ka-mā ʾatammahā ʿalā ʾabawayka min qablu ʾibrāhīma wa-ʾisḥāqa ʾinna rabbaka ʿalīmun ḥakīmun

7.content: ۞ لَقَد كانَ في يوسُفَ وَإِخوَتِهِ آياتٌ لِلسّائِلينَ
7.translation_eng: In Joseph and his brothers there are certainly signs for the seekers.
7.transliteration: la-qad kāna fī yūsufa wa-ʾikhwatihī ʾāyātun li-s-sāʾilīna

8.content: إِذ قالوا لَيوسُفُ وَأَخوهُ أَحَبُّ إِلىٰ أَبينا مِنّا وَنَحنُ عُصبَةٌ إِنَّ أَبانا لَفي ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
8.translation_eng: When they1 said, ‘Surely Joseph and his brother2 are dearer to our father than [the rest of] us, though we are a hardy group. Our father is indeed in manifest error.’That is, the brothers of Joseph (ʿa).That is, Benjamin.
8.transliteration: ʾidh qālū la-yūsufu wa-ʾakhūhu ʾaḥabbu ʾilā ʾabīnā minnā wa-naḥnu ʿuṣbatun ʾinna ʾabānā la-fī ḍalālin mubīnin-i

9.content: اقتُلوا يوسُفَ أَوِ اطرَحوهُ أَرضًا يَخلُ لَكُم وَجهُ أَبيكُم وَتَكونوا مِن بَعدِهِ قَومًا صالِحينَ
9.translation_eng: ‘Kill Joseph or cast him away into some [distant] land, so that your father’s love may be exclusively yours, and that you may become a righteous lot after that.’
9.transliteration: uqtulū yūsufa ʾawi ṭraḥūhu ʾarḍan yakhlu lakum wajhu ʾabīkum wa-takūnū min baʿdihī qawman ṣāliḥīna

10.content: قالَ قائِلٌ مِنهُم لا تَقتُلوا يوسُفَ وَأَلقوهُ في غَيابَتِ الجُبِّ يَلتَقِطهُ بَعضُ السَّيّارَةِ إِن كُنتُم فاعِلينَ
10.translation_eng: One of them said, ‘Do not kill Joseph, but throw him into the recess of some well so that some caravan may pick him up, if you are to do [anything].’
10.transliteration: qāla qāʾilun minhum lā taqtulū yūsufa wa-ʾalqūhu fī ghayābati l-jubbi yaltaqiṭhu baʿḍu s-sayyārati ʾin kuntum fāʿilīna

11.content: قالوا يا أَبانا ما لَكَ لا تَأمَنّا عَلىٰ يوسُفَ وَإِنّا لَهُ لَناصِحونَ
11.translation_eng: They said, ‘Father! Why is it that you do not trust us with Joseph? We are indeed his well-wishers.
11.transliteration: qālū yā-ʾabānā mā laka lā taʾmannā ʿalā yūsufa wa-ʾinnā lahū la-nāṣiḥūna

12.content: أَرسِلهُ مَعَنا غَدًا يَرتَع وَيَلعَب وَإِنّا لَهُ لَحافِظونَ
12.translation_eng: Let him go with us tomorrow so that he may eat lots of fruits and play, and we will indeed take [good] care of him.’
12.transliteration: ʾarsilhu maʿanā ghadan yartaʿ wa-yalʿab wa-ʾinnā lahū la-ḥāfiẓūna

13.content: قالَ إِنّي لَيَحزُنُني أَن تَذهَبوا بِهِ وَأَخافُ أَن يَأكُلَهُ الذِّئبُ وَأَنتُم عَنهُ غافِلونَ
13.translation_eng: He said, ‘It really upsets me that you should take him away, and I fear the wolf may eat him while you are oblivious of him.’
13.transliteration: qāla ʾinnī la-yaḥzununī ʾan tadhhabū bihī wa-ʾakhāfu ʾan yaʾkulahu dh-dhiʾbu wa-ʾantum ʿanhu ghāfilūna

14.content: قالوا لَئِن أَكَلَهُ الذِّئبُ وَنَحنُ عُصبَةٌ إِنّا إِذًا لَخاسِرونَ
14.translation_eng: They said, ‘Should the wolf eat him while we are a hardy group, then we will indeed be losers!’
14.transliteration: qālū la-ʾin ʾakalahu dh-dhiʾbu wa-naḥnu ʿuṣbatun ʾinnā ʾidhan la-khāsirūna

15.content: فَلَمّا ذَهَبوا بِهِ وَأَجمَعوا أَن يَجعَلوهُ في غَيابَتِ الجُبِّ ۚ وَأَوحَينا إِلَيهِ لَتُنَبِّئَنَّهُم بِأَمرِهِم هٰذا وَهُم لا يَشعُرونَ
15.translation_eng: So when they took him away and conspired to put him into the recess of a well, We revealed to him, ‘[A day will come when] you will surely inform them about this affair of theirs while they are not aware [of your identity].’
15.transliteration: fa-lammā dhahabū bihī wa-ʾajmaʿū ʾan yajʿalūhu fī ghayābati l-jubbi wa-ʾawḥaynā ʾilayhi la-tunabbiʾannahum bi-ʾamrihim hādhā wa-hum lā yashʿurūna

16.content: وَجاءوا أَباهُم عِشاءً يَبكونَ
16.translation_eng: In the evening, they came weeping to their father.
16.transliteration: wa-jāʾū ʾabāhum ʿishāʾan yabkūna

17.content: قالوا يا أَبانا إِنّا ذَهَبنا نَستَبِقُ وَتَرَكنا يوسُفَ عِندَ مَتاعِنا فَأَكَلَهُ الذِّئبُ ۖ وَما أَنتَ بِمُؤمِنٍ لَنا وَلَو كُنّا صادِقينَ
17.translation_eng: They said, ‘Father! We had gone racing and left Joseph with our things, whereat the wolf ate him. But you will not believe us even if we spoke truly.’
17.transliteration: qālū yā-ʾabānā ʾinnā dhahabnā nastabiqu wa-taraknā yūsufa ʿinda matāʿinā fa-ʾakalahu dh-dhiʾbu wa-mā ʾanta bi-muʾminin lanā wa-law kunnā ṣādiqīna

18.content: وَجاءوا عَلىٰ قَميصِهِ بِدَمٍ كَذِبٍ ۚ قالَ بَل سَوَّلَت لَكُم أَنفُسُكُم أَمرًا ۖ فَصَبرٌ جَميلٌ ۖ وَاللَّهُ المُستَعانُ عَلىٰ ما تَصِفونَ
18.translation_eng: And they produced sham blood on his shirt. He said, ‘Rather your souls have made a matter seem decorous to you. Yet patience is graceful, and Allah is my resort against what you allege.’
18.transliteration: wa-jāʾū ʿalā qamīṣihī bi-damin kadhibin qāla bal sawwalat lakum ʾanfusukum ʾamran fa-ṣabrun jamīlun wa-llāhu l-mustaʿānu ʿalā mā taṣifūna

19.content: وَجاءَت سَيّارَةٌ فَأَرسَلوا وارِدَهُم فَأَدلىٰ دَلوَهُ ۖ قالَ يا بُشرىٰ هٰذا غُلامٌ ۚ وَأَسَرّوهُ بِضاعَةً ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ بِما يَعمَلونَ
19.translation_eng: And there came a caravan, and they sent their water-drawer, who let down his bucket. ‘Good news!’ he said. ‘This is a young boy!’ So they hid him as [a piece of] merchandise, and Allah knew best what they were doing.
19.transliteration: wa-jāʾat sayyāratun fa-ʾarsalū wāridahum fa-ʾadlā dalwahū qāla yā-bushrā hādhā ghulāmun wa-ʾasarrūhu biḍāʿatan wa-llāhu ʿalīmun bi-mā yaʿmalūna

20.content: وَشَرَوهُ بِثَمَنٍ بَخسٍ دَراهِمَ مَعدودَةٍ وَكانوا فيهِ مِنَ الزّاهِدينَ
20.translation_eng: And they sold him for a cheap price, a few dirhams, for they set small store by him.
20.transliteration: wa-sharawhu bi-thamanin bakhsin darāhima maʿdūdatin wa-kānū fīhi mina z-zāhidīna

21.content: وَقالَ الَّذِي اشتَراهُ مِن مِصرَ لِامرَأَتِهِ أَكرِمي مَثواهُ عَسىٰ أَن يَنفَعَنا أَو نَتَّخِذَهُ وَلَدًا ۚ وَكَذٰلِكَ مَكَّنّا لِيوسُفَ فِي الأَرضِ وَلِنُعَلِّمَهُ مِن تَأويلِ الأَحاديثِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غالِبٌ عَلىٰ أَمرِهِ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
21.translation_eng: The man from Egypt who had bought him said to his wife, ‘Give him an honourable place [in the household].1 Maybe he will be useful to us, or we may adopt him as a son.’Thus We established Joseph in the land and that We might teach him the interpretation of dreams. Allah has [full] command of His affairs, but most people do not know.Or ‘Keep him in a respectable manner.’
21.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhī shtarāhu min miṣra li-mraʾatihī ʾakrimī mathwāhu ʿasā ʾan yanfaʿanā ʾaw nattakhidhahū waladan wa-ka-dhālika makkannā li-yūsufa fī l-ʾarḍi wa-li-nuʿallimahū min taʾwīli l-ʾaḥādīthi wa-llāhu ghālibun ʿalā ʾamrihī wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūna

22.content: وَلَمّا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ آتَيناهُ حُكمًا وَعِلمًا ۚ وَكَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي المُحسِنينَ
22.translation_eng: When he came of age, We gave him judgement and [sacred] knowledge, and thus do We reward the virtuous.
22.transliteration: wa-lammā balagha ʾashuddahū ʾātaynāhu ḥukman wa-ʿilman wa-ka-dhālika najzī l-muḥsinīna

23.content: وَراوَدَتهُ الَّتي هُوَ في بَيتِها عَن نَفسِهِ وَغَلَّقَتِ الأَبوابَ وَقالَت هَيتَ لَكَ ۚ قالَ مَعاذَ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ رَبّي أَحسَنَ مَثوايَ ۖ إِنَّهُ لا يُفلِحُ الظّالِمونَ
23.translation_eng: The woman in whose house he was solicited him. She closed the doors and said, ‘Come!!’ He said, ‘God forbid! Indeed He is my Lord; He has given me a good abode.1 Indeed the wrongdoers are not felicitous.’Or ‘Indeed he is my master; he has kept me in a nice manner.’
23.transliteration: wa-rāwadathu llatī huwa fī baytihā ʿan nafsihī wa-ghallaqati l-ʾabwāba wa-qālat hayta laka qāla maʿādha llāhi ʾinnahū rabbī ʾaḥsana mathwāya ʾinnahū lā yufliḥu ẓ-ẓālimūna

24.content: وَلَقَد هَمَّت بِهِ ۖ وَهَمَّ بِها لَولا أَن رَأىٰ بُرهانَ رَبِّهِ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ لِنَصرِفَ عَنهُ السّوءَ وَالفَحشاءَ ۚ إِنَّهُ مِن عِبادِنَا المُخلَصينَ
24.translation_eng: She certainly made for him; and he would have made for her [too] had he not beheld the proof of his Lord. So it was, that We might turn away from him all evil and indecency. He was indeed one of Our dedicated servants.
24.transliteration: wa-la-qad hammat bihī wa-hamma bihā law-lā ʾan raʾā burhāna rabbihī ka-dhālika li-naṣrifa ʿanhu s-sūʾa wa-l-faḥshāʾa ʾinnahū min ʿibādinā l-mukhlaṣīna

25.content: وَاستَبَقَا البابَ وَقَدَّت قَميصَهُ مِن دُبُرٍ وَأَلفَيا سَيِّدَها لَدَى البابِ ۚ قالَت ما جَزاءُ مَن أَرادَ بِأَهلِكَ سوءًا إِلّا أَن يُسجَنَ أَو عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
25.translation_eng: They raced to the door, and she tore his shirt from behind, and they ran into her husband at the door. She said, ‘What is to be the requital of him who has evil intentions for your wife except imprisonment or a painful punishment?’
25.transliteration: wa-stabaqā l-bāba wa-qaddat qamīṣahū min duburin wa-ʾalfayā s-sayyidahā ladā l-bābi qālat mā jazāʾu man ʾarāda bi-ʾahlika sūʾan ʾillā ʾan yusjana ʾaw ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

26.content: قالَ هِيَ راوَدَتني عَن نَفسي ۚ وَشَهِدَ شاهِدٌ مِن أَهلِها إِن كانَ قَميصُهُ قُدَّ مِن قُبُلٍ فَصَدَقَت وَهُوَ مِنَ الكاذِبينَ
26.translation_eng: He said, ‘It was she who solicited me.’ A witness of her own household testified: ‘If his shirt is torn from the front, she tells the truth and he lies.
26.transliteration: qāla hiya rāwadatnī ʿan nafsī wa-shahida shāhidun min ʾahlihā ʾin kāna qamīṣuhū qudda min qubulin fa-ṣadaqat wa-huwa mina l-kādhibīna

27.content: وَإِن كانَ قَميصُهُ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍ فَكَذَبَت وَهُوَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
27.translation_eng: But if his shirt is torn from behind, then she lies and he tells the truth.’
27.transliteration: wa-ʾin kāna qamīṣuhū qudda min duburin fa-kadhabat wa-huwa mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

28.content: فَلَمّا رَأىٰ قَميصَهُ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍ قالَ إِنَّهُ مِن كَيدِكُنَّ ۖ إِنَّ كَيدَكُنَّ عَظيمٌ
28.translation_eng: So when he saw that his shirt was torn from behind, he said, ‘This is [a case] of you women’s guile! Your guile is great indeed!
28.transliteration: fa-lammā raʾā qamīṣahū qudda min duburin qāla ʾinnahū min kaydikunna ʾinna kaydakunna ʿaẓīmun

29.content: يوسُفُ أَعرِض عَن هٰذا ۚ وَاستَغفِري لِذَنبِكِ ۖ إِنَّكِ كُنتِ مِنَ الخاطِئينَ
29.translation_eng: Joseph, let this matter alone, and you, woman, plead for forgiveness for your sin, for you have indeed been erring.’
29.transliteration: yūsufu ʾaʿriḍ ʿan hādhā wa-staghfirī li-dhanbiki ʾinnaki kunti mina l-khāṭiʾīna

30.content: ۞ وَقالَ نِسوَةٌ فِي المَدينَةِ امرَأَتُ العَزيزِ تُراوِدُ فَتاها عَن نَفسِهِ ۖ قَد شَغَفَها حُبًّا ۖ إِنّا لَنَراها في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
30.translation_eng: Some of the townswomen said, ‘The chieftain’s wife has solicited her slave boy! He has captivated her love. Indeed we see her to be in manifest error.’
30.transliteration: wa-qāla niswatun fī l-madīnati mraʾatu l-ʿazīzi turāwidu fatāhā ʿan nafsihī qad shaghafahā ḥubban ʾinnā la-narāhā fī ḍalālin mubīnin

31.content: فَلَمّا سَمِعَت بِمَكرِهِنَّ أَرسَلَت إِلَيهِنَّ وَأَعتَدَت لَهُنَّ مُتَّكَأً وَآتَت كُلَّ واحِدَةٍ مِنهُنَّ سِكّينًا وَقالَتِ اخرُج عَلَيهِنَّ ۖ فَلَمّا رَأَينَهُ أَكبَرنَهُ وَقَطَّعنَ أَيدِيَهُنَّ وَقُلنَ حاشَ لِلَّهِ ما هٰذا بَشَرًا إِن هٰذا إِلّا مَلَكٌ كَريمٌ
31.translation_eng: When she heard of their machinations, she sent for them and arranged a repast, and gave each of them a knife, and said [to Joseph], ‘Come out before them.’ So when they saw him, they marveled at him and cut their hands [absent-mindedly], and they said, ‘Good heavens! This is not a human being! This is but a noble angel!’
31.transliteration: fa-lammā samiʿat bi-makrihinna ʾarsalat ʾilayhinna wa-ʾaʿtadat lahunna muttakaʾan wa-ʾātat kulla wāḥidatin minhunna sikkīnan wa-qālati khruj ʿalayhinna fa-lammā raʾaynahū ʾakbarnahū wa-qaṭṭaʿna ʾaydiyahunna wa-qulna ḥāsha li-llāhi mā hādhā basharan ʾin hādhā ʾillā malakun karīmun

32.content: قالَت فَذٰلِكُنَّ الَّذي لُمتُنَّني فيهِ ۖ وَلَقَد راوَدتُهُ عَن نَفسِهِ فَاستَعصَمَ ۖ وَلَئِن لَم يَفعَل ما آمُرُهُ لَيُسجَنَنَّ وَلَيَكونًا مِنَ الصّاغِرينَ
32.translation_eng: She said, ‘He is the one on whose account you blamed me. Certainly I did solicit him, but he was continent, and if he does not do what I bid him, surely he shall be imprisoned and be among the abased.’
32.transliteration: qālat fa-dhālikunna lladhī lumtunnanī fīhi wa-la-qad rāwadtuhū ʿan nafsihī fa-staʿṣama wa-la-ʾin lam yafʿal mā ʾāmuruhū la-yusjananna wa-la-yakūnan mina ṣ-ṣāghirīna

33.content: قالَ رَبِّ السِّجنُ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِمّا يَدعونَني إِلَيهِ ۖ وَإِلّا تَصرِف عَنّي كَيدَهُنَّ أَصبُ إِلَيهِنَّ وَأَكُن مِنَ الجاهِلينَ
33.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! The prison is dearer to me than to what they invite me. If You do not turn away their schemes from me, then I will incline towards them and become one of the senseless.’
33.transliteration: qāla rabbi s-sijnu ʾaḥabbu ʾilayya mimmā yadʿūnanī ʾilayhi wa-ʾillā taṣrif ʿannī kaydahunna ʾaṣbu ʾilayhinna wa-ʾakun mina l-jāhilīna

34.content: فَاستَجابَ لَهُ رَبُّهُ فَصَرَفَ عَنهُ كَيدَهُنَّ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
34.translation_eng: So his Lord answered him and turned away their stratagems from him. Indeed He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
34.transliteration: fa-stajāba lahū rabbuhū fa-ṣarafa ʿanhu kaydahunna ʾinnahū huwa s-samīʿu l-ʿalīmu

35.content: ثُمَّ بَدا لَهُم مِن بَعدِ ما رَأَوُا الآياتِ لَيَسجُنُنَّهُ حَتّىٰ حينٍ
35.translation_eng: Then it appeared to them,1 after they had seen all the signs [of his innocence], that they should confine him for some time.That is, the menfolk.
35.transliteration: thumma badā lahum min baʿdi mā raʾawu l-ʾāyāti la-yasjununnahū ḥattā ḥīnin

36.content: وَدَخَلَ مَعَهُ السِّجنَ فَتَيانِ ۖ قالَ أَحَدُهُما إِنّي أَراني أَعصِرُ خَمرًا ۖ وَقالَ الآخَرُ إِنّي أَراني أَحمِلُ فَوقَ رَأسي خُبزًا تَأكُلُ الطَّيرُ مِنهُ ۖ نَبِّئنا بِتَأويلِهِ ۖ إِنّا نَراكَ مِنَ المُحسِنينَ
36.translation_eng: There entered the prison two youths along with him. One of them said, ‘I dreamt that I am pressing grapes.’ The other said, ‘I dreamt that I am carrying bread on my head from which the birds are eating.’ ‘Inform us of its interpretation,’ [they said], ‘for indeed we see you to be a virtuous man.’
36.transliteration: wa-dakhala maʿahu s-sijna fatayāni qāla ʾaḥaduhumā ʾinnī ʾarānī ʾaʿṣiru khamran wa-qāla l-ʾākharu ʾinnī ʾarānī ʾaḥmilu fawqa raʾsī khubzan taʾkulu ṭ-ṭayru minhu nabbiʾnā bi-taʾwīlihī ʾinnā narāka mina l-muḥsinīna

37.content: قالَ لا يَأتيكُما طَعامٌ تُرزَقانِهِ إِلّا نَبَّأتُكُما بِتَأويلِهِ قَبلَ أَن يَأتِيَكُما ۚ ذٰلِكُما مِمّا عَلَّمَني رَبّي ۚ إِنّي تَرَكتُ مِلَّةَ قَومٍ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِاللَّهِ وَهُم بِالآخِرَةِ هُم كافِرونَ
37.translation_eng: He said, ‘Before the meals you are served come to you I will inform you of its interpretation. That is among things my Lord has taught me. Indeed I renounce the creed of the people who have no faith in Allah and who [also] disbelieve in the Hereafter.
37.transliteration: qāla lā yaʾtīkumā ṭaʿāmun turzaqānihī ʾillā nabbaʾtukumā bi-taʾwīlihī qabla ʾan yaʾtiyakumā dhālikumā mimmā ʿallamanī rabbī ʾinnī taraktu millata qawmin lā yuʾminūna bi-llāhi wa-hum bi-l-ʾākhirati hum kāfirūna

38.content: وَاتَّبَعتُ مِلَّةَ آبائي إِبراهيمَ وَإِسحاقَ وَيَعقوبَ ۚ ما كانَ لَنا أَن نُشرِكَ بِاللَّهِ مِن شَيءٍ ۚ ذٰلِكَ مِن فَضلِ اللَّهِ عَلَينا وَعَلَى النّاسِ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَشكُرونَ
38.translation_eng: I follow the creed of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. It is not for us to ascribe any partner to Allah. That is by virtue of Allah’s grace upon us and upon all mankind, but most people do not give thanks.
38.transliteration: wa-ttabaʿtu millata ʾābāʾī ʾibrāhīma wa-ʾisḥāqa wa-yaʿqūba mā kāna lanā ʾan nushrika bi-llāhi min shayʾin dhālika min faḍli llāhi ʿalaynā wa-ʿalā n-nāsi wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yashkurūna

39.content: يا صاحِبَيِ السِّجنِ أَأَربابٌ مُتَفَرِّقونَ خَيرٌ أَمِ اللَّهُ الواحِدُ القَهّارُ
39.translation_eng: O my prison mates! Are different masters better, or Allah, the One, the All-paramount?
39.transliteration: yā-ṣāḥibayi s-sijni ʾa-ʾarbābun mutafarriqūna khayrun ʾami llāhu l-wāḥidu l-qahhāru

40.content: ما تَعبُدونَ مِن دونِهِ إِلّا أَسماءً سَمَّيتُموها أَنتُم وَآباؤُكُم ما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ بِها مِن سُلطانٍ ۚ إِنِ الحُكمُ إِلّا لِلَّهِ ۚ أَمَرَ أَلّا تَعبُدوا إِلّا إِيّاهُ ۚ ذٰلِكَ الدّينُ القَيِّمُ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
40.translation_eng: You do not worship besides Him but [mere] names that you and your fathers have coined, for which Allah has not sent down any authority. Sovereignty belongs only to Allah. He has commanded you to worship none except Him. That is the upright religion, but most people do not know.
40.transliteration: mā taʿbudūna min dūnihī ʾillā ʾasmāʾan sammaytumūhā ʾantum wa-ʾābāʾukum mā ʾanzala llāhu bihā min sulṭānin ʾini l-ḥukmu ʾillā li-llāhi ʾamara ʾallā taʿbudū ʾillā ʾiyyāhu dhālika d-dīnu l-qayyimu wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūna

41.content: يا صاحِبَيِ السِّجنِ أَمّا أَحَدُكُما فَيَسقي رَبَّهُ خَمرًا ۖ وَأَمَّا الآخَرُ فَيُصلَبُ فَتَأكُلُ الطَّيرُ مِن رَأسِهِ ۚ قُضِيَ الأَمرُ الَّذي فيهِ تَستَفتِيانِ
41.translation_eng: O my prison mates! As for one of you, he will serve wine to his master, and as for the other, he will be crucified, and vultures will eat from his head. The matter about which you inquire has been decided.’
41.transliteration: yā-ṣāḥibayi s-sijni ʾammā ʾaḥadukumā fa-yasqī rabbahū khamran wa-ʾammā l-ʾākharu fa-yuṣlabu fa-taʾkulu ṭ-ṭayru min raʾsihī quḍiya l-ʾamru lladhī fīhi tastaftiyāni

42.content: وَقالَ لِلَّذي ظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ناجٍ مِنهُمَا اذكُرني عِندَ رَبِّكَ فَأَنساهُ الشَّيطانُ ذِكرَ رَبِّهِ فَلَبِثَ فِي السِّجنِ بِضعَ سِنينَ
42.translation_eng: Then he said to the one whom he knew would be delivered from among the two: ‘Mention me to your master.’ But Satan caused him to forget mentioning [it] to his master. So he remained in the prison for several years.
42.transliteration: wa-qāla li-lladhī ẓanna ʾannahū nājin minhumā dhkurnī ʿinda rabbika fa-ʾansāhu sh-shayṭānu dhikra rabbihī fa-labitha fī s-sijni biḍʿa sinīna

43.content: وَقالَ المَلِكُ إِنّي أَرىٰ سَبعَ بَقَراتٍ سِمانٍ يَأكُلُهُنَّ سَبعٌ عِجافٌ وَسَبعَ سُنبُلاتٍ خُضرٍ وَأُخَرَ يابِساتٍ ۖ يا أَيُّهَا المَلَأُ أَفتوني في رُؤيايَ إِن كُنتُم لِلرُّؤيا تَعبُرونَ
43.translation_eng: [One day] the king said, ‘I saw [in a dream] seven fat cows being devoured by seven lean ones, and seven green ears and [seven] others [that were] dry. O courtiers, give me your opinion about my dream, if you can interpret dreams.’
43.transliteration: wa-qāla l-maliku ʾinnī ʾarā sabʿa baqarātin simānin yaʾkuluhunna sabʿun ʿijāfun wa-sabʿa sunbulātin khuḍrin wa-ʾukhara yābisātin yā-ʾayyuhā l-malaʾu ʾaftūnī fī ruʾyāya ʾin kuntum li-r-ruʾyā taʿburūna

44.content: قالوا أَضغاثُ أَحلامٍ ۖ وَما نَحنُ بِتَأويلِ الأَحلامِ بِعالِمينَ
44.translation_eng: They said, ‘[These are] confused nightmares, and we do not know the interpretation of nightmares.’
44.transliteration: qālū ʾaḍghāthu ʾaḥlāmin wa-mā naḥnu bi-taʾwīli l-ʾaḥlāmi bi-ʿālimīna

45.content: وَقالَ الَّذي نَجا مِنهُما وَادَّكَرَ بَعدَ أُمَّةٍ أَنا أُنَبِّئُكُم بِتَأويلِهِ فَأَرسِلونِ
45.translation_eng: Said the one of the two who had been delivered, remembering [Joseph] after a long time: ‘I will inform you of its interpretation; so let me go [to meet Joseph in the prison].’
45.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhī najā minhumā wa-ddakara baʿda ʾummatin ʾana ʾunabbiʾukum bi-taʾwīlihī fa-ʾarsilūni

46.content: يوسُفُ أَيُّهَا الصِّدّيقُ أَفتِنا في سَبعِ بَقَراتٍ سِمانٍ يَأكُلُهُنَّ سَبعٌ عِجافٌ وَسَبعِ سُنبُلاتٍ خُضرٍ وَأُخَرَ يابِساتٍ لَعَلّي أَرجِعُ إِلَى النّاسِ لَعَلَّهُم يَعلَمونَ
46.translation_eng: ‘Joseph,’ [he said], ‘O truthful one, give us your opinion concerning seven fat cows who are eaten by seven lean ones, and seven green ears and [seven] others dry, that I may return to the people so that they may know [the truth of the matter].’
46.transliteration: yūsufu ʾayyuhā ṣ-ṣiddīqu ʾaftinā fī sabʿi baqarātin simānin yaʾkuluhunna sabʿun ʿijāfun wa-sabʿi sunbulātin khuḍrin wa-ʾukhara yābisātin laʿallī ʾarjiʿu ʾilā n-nāsi laʿallahum yaʿlamūna

47.content: قالَ تَزرَعونَ سَبعَ سِنينَ دَأَبًا فَما حَصَدتُم فَذَروهُ في سُنبُلِهِ إِلّا قَليلًا مِمّا تَأكُلونَ
47.translation_eng: He said, ‘You will sow for seven consecutive years. Then leave in the ear whatever [grain] you harvest, except a little that you eat.
47.transliteration: qāla tazraʿūna sabʿa sinīna daʾaban fa-mā ḥaṣadtum fa-dharūhu fī sunbulihī ʾillā qalīlan mimmā taʾkulūna

48.content: ثُمَّ يَأتي مِن بَعدِ ذٰلِكَ سَبعٌ شِدادٌ يَأكُلنَ ما قَدَّمتُم لَهُنَّ إِلّا قَليلًا مِمّا تُحصِنونَ
48.translation_eng: Then after that there will come seven hard years which will eat up whatever you have set aside for them —all except a little which you preserve [for seed].
48.transliteration: thumma yaʾtī min baʿdi dhālika sabʿun shidādun yaʾkulna mā qaddamtum lahunna ʾillā qalīlan mimmā tuḥṣinūna

49.content: ثُمَّ يَأتي مِن بَعدِ ذٰلِكَ عامٌ فيهِ يُغاثُ النّاسُ وَفيهِ يَعصِرونَ
49.translation_eng: Then after that there will come a year wherein the people will be granted relief and provided with rains therein.1The translation given here is in accordance with the reading yuʿṣarūn narrated from al-Imam al-Ṣādiq; see Majmaʿ al-Bayān and Tafsīr al-Qummī; see also Lisān al-ʿArab, under ʿaṣr. The same reading is attributed to al-Aʿraj and ʿĪsā al-Baṣrī (Muʿjam al-Qirāʾāt al-Qurʾāniyyah). However, in accordance with the reading yaʿṣirūn, the meaning will be ‘they will press [i.e. grapes or oil seeds, for juice and oil] therein.’
49.transliteration: thumma yaʾtī min baʿdi dhālika ʿāmun fīhi yughāthu n-nāsu wa-fīhi yaʿṣirūna

50.content: وَقالَ المَلِكُ ائتوني بِهِ ۖ فَلَمّا جاءَهُ الرَّسولُ قالَ ارجِع إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ فَاسأَلهُ ما بالُ النِّسوَةِ اللّاتي قَطَّعنَ أَيدِيَهُنَّ ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي بِكَيدِهِنَّ عَليمٌ
50.translation_eng: The king said, ‘Bring him to me!’ When the messenger came to him,1 he said, ‘Go back to your master, and ask him about the affair of women who cut their hands. My Lord is indeed well aware of their stratagems.’That is, to Joseph (ʿa).
50.transliteration: wa-qāla l-maliku ʾtūnī bihī fa-lammā jāʾahu r-rasūlu qāla rjiʿ ʾilā rabbika fa-sʾalhu mā bālu n-niswati llātī qaṭṭaʿna ʾaydiyahunna ʾinna rabbī bi-kaydihinna ʿalīmun

51.content: قالَ ما خَطبُكُنَّ إِذ راوَدتُنَّ يوسُفَ عَن نَفسِهِ ۚ قُلنَ حاشَ لِلَّهِ ما عَلِمنا عَلَيهِ مِن سوءٍ ۚ قالَتِ امرَأَتُ العَزيزِ الآنَ حَصحَصَ الحَقُّ أَنا راوَدتُهُ عَن نَفسِهِ وَإِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الصّادِقينَ
51.translation_eng: The king said, ‘What was your business, women, when you solicited Joseph?’ They said, ‘Heaven be praised! We know of no evil in him.’ The prince’s wife said, ‘Now the truth has come to light! It was I who solicited him, and he is indeed telling the truth.’
51.transliteration: qāla mā khaṭbukunna ʾidh rāwadtunna yūsufa ʿan nafsihī qulna ḥāsha li-llāhi mā ʿalimnā ʿalayhi min sūʾin qālati mraʾatu l-ʿazīzi l-ʾāna ḥaṣḥaṣa l-ḥaqqu ʾana rāwadtuhū ʿan nafsihī wa-ʾinnahū la-mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

52.content: ذٰلِكَ لِيَعلَمَ أَنّي لَم أَخُنهُ بِالغَيبِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدي كَيدَ الخائِنينَ
52.translation_eng: [Joseph said], [I initiated] this [inquiry], that he1 may know that I did not betray him in his absence, and that Allah does not further the schemes of the treacherous.That is, the Egyptian nobleman in whose house Joseph (ʿa) was living.
52.transliteration: dhālika li-yaʿlama ʾannī lam ʾakhunhu bi-l-ghaybi wa-ʾanna llāha lā yahdī kayda l-khāʾinīna

53.content: ۞ وَما أُبَرِّئُ نَفسي ۚ إِنَّ النَّفسَ لَأَمّارَةٌ بِالسّوءِ إِلّا ما رَحِمَ رَبّي ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
53.translation_eng: Yet I do not absolve my [own carnal] soul, for the [carnal] soul indeed prompts [men] to evil, except inasmuch as my Lord has mercy. Indeed my Lord is all-forgiving, all-merciful.’
53.transliteration: wa-mā ʾubarriʾu nafsī ʾinna n-nafsa la-ʾammāratun bi-s-sūʾi ʾillā mā raḥima rabbī ʾinna rabbī ghafūrun raḥīmun

54.content: وَقالَ المَلِكُ ائتوني بِهِ أَستَخلِصهُ لِنَفسي ۖ فَلَمّا كَلَّمَهُ قالَ إِنَّكَ اليَومَ لَدَينا مَكينٌ أَمينٌ
54.translation_eng: The king said, ‘Bring him to me, I will make him my favourite.’ Then, when he had spoken with him, he said, ‘Indeed today [onwards] you will be honoured and trustworthy with us.’
54.transliteration: wa-qāla l-maliku ʾtūnī bihī ʾastakhliṣhu li-nafsī fa-lammā kallamahū qāla ʾinnaka l-yawma ladaynā makīnun ʾamīnun

55.content: قالَ اجعَلني عَلىٰ خَزائِنِ الأَرضِ ۖ إِنّي حَفيظٌ عَليمٌ
55.translation_eng: He said, ‘Put me in charge of the country’s granaries. I am indeed fastidious [and] well-informed.’
55.transliteration: qāla jʿalnī ʿalā khazāʾini l-ʾarḍi ʾinnī ḥafīẓun ʿalīmun

56.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ مَكَّنّا لِيوسُفَ فِي الأَرضِ يَتَبَوَّأُ مِنها حَيثُ يَشاءُ ۚ نُصيبُ بِرَحمَتِنا مَن نَشاءُ ۖ وَلا نُضيعُ أَجرَ المُحسِنينَ
56.translation_eng: That is how We established Joseph in the land that he may settle in it wherever he wished. We confer Our mercy on whomever We wish, and We do not waste the reward of the virtuous.
56.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika makkannā li-yūsufa fī l-ʾarḍi yatabawwaʾu minhā ḥaythu yashāʾu nuṣību bi-raḥmatinā man nashāʾu wa-lā nuḍīʿu ʾajra l-muḥsinīna

57.content: وَلَأَجرُ الآخِرَةِ خَيرٌ لِلَّذينَ آمَنوا وَكانوا يَتَّقونَ
57.translation_eng: And the reward of the Hereafter is surely better for those who have faith and are Godwary.
57.transliteration: wa-la-ʾajru l-ʾākhirati khayrun li-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-kānū yattaqūna

58.content: وَجاءَ إِخوَةُ يوسُفَ فَدَخَلوا عَلَيهِ فَعَرَفَهُم وَهُم لَهُ مُنكِرونَ
58.translation_eng: [After some years] the brothers of Joseph came and entered his presence. He recognized them, but they did not recognize him.
58.transliteration: wa-jāʾa ʾikhwatu yūsufa fa-dakhalū ʿalayhi fa-ʿarafahum wa-hum lahū munkirūna

59.content: وَلَمّا جَهَّزَهُم بِجَهازِهِم قالَ ائتوني بِأَخٍ لَكُم مِن أَبيكُم ۚ أَلا تَرَونَ أَنّي أوفِي الكَيلَ وَأَنا خَيرُ المُنزِلينَ
59.translation_eng: When he had furnished them with their provision, he said, ‘Bring me a brother that you have through your father. Do you not see that I give the full measure and that I am the best of hosts?
59.transliteration: wa-lammā jahhazahum bi-jahāzihim qāla ʾtūnī bi-ʾakhin lakum min ʾabīkum ʾa-lā tarawna ʾannī ʾūfī l-kayla wa-ʾana khayru l-munzilīna

60.content: فَإِن لَم تَأتوني بِهِ فَلا كَيلَ لَكُم عِندي وَلا تَقرَبونِ
60.translation_eng: But if you do not bring him to me, then there will be no rations for you with me, and don’t [ever] come near me.’
60.transliteration: fa-ʾin lam taʾtūnī bihī fa-lā kayla lakum ʿindī wa-lā taqrabūni

61.content: قالوا سَنُراوِدُ عَنهُ أَباهُ وَإِنّا لَفاعِلونَ
61.translation_eng: They said, ‘We will solicit him from his father. [That] we will surely do.’
61.transliteration: qālū sa-nurāwidu ʿanhu ʾabāhu wa-ʾinnā la-fāʿilūna

62.content: وَقالَ لِفِتيانِهِ اجعَلوا بِضاعَتَهُم في رِحالِهِم لَعَلَّهُم يَعرِفونَها إِذَا انقَلَبوا إِلىٰ أَهلِهِم لَعَلَّهُم يَرجِعونَ
62.translation_eng: He said to his servants, ‘Put their money in their saddlebags. Maybe they will recognize it when they return to their folks, and maybe they will come back [again].’
62.transliteration: wa-qāla li-fityānihi jʿalū biḍāʿatahum fī riḥālihim laʿallahum yaʿrifūnahā ʾidhā nqalabū ʾilā ʾahlihim laʿallahum yarjiʿūna

63.content: فَلَمّا رَجَعوا إِلىٰ أَبيهِم قالوا يا أَبانا مُنِعَ مِنَّا الكَيلُ فَأَرسِل مَعَنا أَخانا نَكتَل وَإِنّا لَهُ لَحافِظونَ
63.translation_eng: So when they returned to their father, they said, ‘Father, the measure has been withheld from us, so let our brother go with us so that we may obtain the measure, and we will indeed take [good] care of him.’
63.transliteration: fa-lammā rajaʿū ʾilā ʾabīhim qālū yā-ʾabānā muniʿa minnā l-kaylu fa-ʾarsil maʿanā ʾakhānā naktal wa-ʾinnā lahū la-ḥāfiẓūna

64.content: قالَ هَل آمَنُكُم عَلَيهِ إِلّا كَما أَمِنتُكُم عَلىٰ أَخيهِ مِن قَبلُ ۖ فَاللَّهُ خَيرٌ حافِظًا ۖ وَهُوَ أَرحَمُ الرّاحِمينَ
64.translation_eng: He said, ‘Should I trust you with him just as I trusted you with his brother before? Yet Allah is the best of protectors, and He is the most merciful of merciful ones.’
64.transliteration: qāla hal ʾāmanukum ʿalayhi ʾillā ka-mā ʾamintukum ʿalā ʾakhīhi min qablu fa-llāhu khayrun ḥāfiẓan wa-huwa ʾarḥamu r-rāḥimīna

65.content: وَلَمّا فَتَحوا مَتاعَهُم وَجَدوا بِضاعَتَهُم رُدَّت إِلَيهِم ۖ قالوا يا أَبانا ما نَبغي ۖ هٰذِهِ بِضاعَتُنا رُدَّت إِلَينا ۖ وَنَميرُ أَهلَنا وَنَحفَظُ أَخانا وَنَزدادُ كَيلَ بَعيرٍ ۖ ذٰلِكَ كَيلٌ يَسيرٌ
65.translation_eng: And when they opened their baggage, they found their money restored to them. They said, ‘Father, what [more] do we want?! This is our money, restored to us! We will get provisions for our family and take care of our brother, and add another camel-load of rations. These are meagre rations.’
65.transliteration: wa-lammā fataḥū matāʿahum wajadū biḍāʿatahum ruddat ʾilayhim qālū yā-ʾabānā mā nabghī hādhihī biḍāʿatunā ruddat ʾilaynā wa-namīru ʾahlanā wa-naḥfaẓu ʾakhānā wa-nazdādu kayla baʿīrin dhālika kaylun yasīrun

66.content: قالَ لَن أُرسِلَهُ مَعَكُم حَتّىٰ تُؤتونِ مَوثِقًا مِنَ اللَّهِ لَتَأتُنَّني بِهِ إِلّا أَن يُحاطَ بِكُم ۖ فَلَمّا آتَوهُ مَوثِقَهُم قالَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ ما نَقولُ وَكيلٌ
66.translation_eng: He said, ‘I will not let him go with you until you give me a [solemn] pledge by Allah that you will surely bring him back to me, unless you are made to perish.’ When they had given him their [solemn] pledge, he said, ‘Allah is witness over what we say.’
66.transliteration: qāla lan ʾursilahū maʿakum ḥattā tuʾtūni mawthiqan mina llāhi la-taʾtunnanī bihī ʾillā ʾan yuḥāṭa bikum fa-lammā ʾātawhu mawthiqahum qāla llāhu ʿalā mā naqūlu wakīlun

67.content: وَقالَ يا بَنِيَّ لا تَدخُلوا مِن بابٍ واحِدٍ وَادخُلوا مِن أَبوابٍ مُتَفَرِّقَةٍ ۖ وَما أُغني عَنكُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن شَيءٍ ۖ إِنِ الحُكمُ إِلّا لِلَّهِ ۖ عَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلتُ ۖ وَعَلَيهِ فَليَتَوَكَّلِ المُتَوَكِّلونَ
67.translation_eng: And he said, ‘My sons, do not enter by one gate, but enter by separate gates, though I cannot avail you anything against Allah. Sovereignty belongs only to Allah. In Him I have put my trust; and in Him let all the trusting put their trust.’
67.transliteration: wa-qāla yā-baniyya lā tadkhulū min bābin wāḥidin wa-dkhulū min ʾabwābin mutafarriqatin wa-mā ʾughnī ʿankum mina llāhi min shayʾin ʾini l-ḥukmu ʾillā li-llāhi ʿalayhi tawakkaltu wa-ʿalayhi fa-l-yatawakkali l-mutawakkilūna

68.content: وَلَمّا دَخَلوا مِن حَيثُ أَمَرَهُم أَبوهُم ما كانَ يُغني عَنهُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن شَيءٍ إِلّا حاجَةً في نَفسِ يَعقوبَ قَضاها ۚ وَإِنَّهُ لَذو عِلمٍ لِما عَلَّمناهُ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
68.translation_eng: When they entered whence their father had bidden them, it did not avail them anything against Allah, but only fulfilled a wish in Jacob’s heart. Indeed he had the knowledge of what We had taught him, but most people do not know.
68.transliteration: wa-lammā dakhalū min ḥaythu ʾamarahum ʾabūhum mā kāna yughnī ʿanhum mina llāhi min shayʾin ʾillā ḥājatan fī nafsi yaʿqūba qaḍāhā wa-ʾinnahū la-dhū ʿilmin li-mā ʿallamnāhu wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūna

69.content: وَلَمّا دَخَلوا عَلىٰ يوسُفَ آوىٰ إِلَيهِ أَخاهُ ۖ قالَ إِنّي أَنا أَخوكَ فَلا تَبتَئِس بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
69.translation_eng: And when they entered into the presence of Joseph, he set his brother close to himself, and said, ‘Indeed I am your brother, so do not sorrow for what they used to do.’
69.transliteration: wa-lammā dakhalū ʿalā yūsufa ʾāwā ʾilayhi ʾakhāhu qāla ʾinnī ʾana ʾakhūka fa-lā tabtaʾis bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūna

70.content: فَلَمّا جَهَّزَهُم بِجَهازِهِم جَعَلَ السِّقايَةَ في رَحلِ أَخيهِ ثُمَّ أَذَّنَ مُؤَذِّنٌ أَيَّتُهَا العيرُ إِنَّكُم لَسارِقونَ
70.translation_eng: When he had furnished them with their provision, he put the drinking-cup into his brother’s saddlebag. Then a herald shouted: ‘O [men of the] caravan! You are indeed thieves!’
70.transliteration: fa-lammā jahhazahum bi-jahāzihim jaʿala s-siqāyata fī raḥli ʾakhīhi thumma ʾadhdhana muʾadhdhinun ʾayyatuhā l-ʿīru ʾinnakum la-sāriqūna

71.content: قالوا وَأَقبَلوا عَلَيهِم ماذا تَفقِدونَ
71.translation_eng: They said, as they turned towards them, ‘What are you missing?’
71.transliteration: qālū wa-ʾaqbalū ʿalayhim mādhā tafqidūna

72.content: قالوا نَفقِدُ صُواعَ المَلِكِ وَلِمَن جاءَ بِهِ حِملُ بَعيرٍ وَأَنا بِهِ زَعيمٌ
72.translation_eng: They said, ‘We miss the king’s goblet.’ ‘Whoever brings it shall have a camel-load [of grain],’ [said the steward], ‘I will guarantee that.’
72.transliteration: qālū nafqidu ṣuwāʿa l-maliki wa-li-man jāʾa bihī ḥimlu baʿīrin wa-ʾana bihī zaʿīmun

73.content: قالوا تَاللَّهِ لَقَد عَلِمتُم ما جِئنا لِنُفسِدَ فِي الأَرضِ وَما كُنّا سارِقينَ
73.translation_eng: They said, ‘By Allah! You certainly know that we did not come to make trouble in this country, and we are not thieves.’
73.transliteration: qālū ta-llāhi la-qad ʿalimtum mā jiʾnā li-nufsida fī l-ʾarḍi wa-mā kunnā sāriqīna

74.content: قالوا فَما جَزاؤُهُ إِن كُنتُم كاذِبينَ
74.translation_eng: They said, ‘What shall be its requital if you [prove to] be lying?’
74.transliteration: qālū fa-mā jazāʾuhū ʾin kuntum kādhibīna

75.content: قالوا جَزاؤُهُ مَن وُجِدَ في رَحلِهِ فَهُوَ جَزاؤُهُ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي الظّالِمينَ
75.translation_eng: They said, ‘The requital for it shall be that he in whose saddlebag it is found shall give himself over as its requital. Thus do we requite the wrongdoers.’
75.transliteration: qālū jazāʾuhū man wujida fī raḥlihī fa-huwa jazāʾuhū ka-dhālika najzī ẓ-ẓālimīna

76.content: فَبَدَأَ بِأَوعِيَتِهِم قَبلَ وِعاءِ أَخيهِ ثُمَّ استَخرَجَها مِن وِعاءِ أَخيهِ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ كِدنا لِيوسُفَ ۖ ما كانَ لِيَأخُذَ أَخاهُ في دينِ المَلِكِ إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ نَرفَعُ دَرَجاتٍ مَن نَشاءُ ۗ وَفَوقَ كُلِّ ذي عِلمٍ عَليمٌ
76.translation_eng: Then he began with their sacks, before [opening] his brother’s sack. Then he took it out from his brother’s sack. Thus did We devise for Joseph’s sake. He could not have held his brother under the king’s law unless Allah willed [otherwise]. We raise in rank whomever We please, and above every man of knowledge is One who knows best.1Or ‘above every man of knowledge is one who knows better.’
76.transliteration: fa-badaʾa bi-ʾawʿiyatihim qabla wiʿāʾi ʾakhīhi thumma stakhrajahā min wiʿāʾi ʾakhīhi ka-dhālika kidnā li-yūsufa mā kāna li-yaʾkhudha ʾakhāhu fī dīni l-maliki ʾillā ʾan yashāʾa llāhu narfaʿu darajātin man nashāʾu wa-fawqa kulli dhī ʿilmin ʿalīmun

77.content: ۞ قالوا إِن يَسرِق فَقَد سَرَقَ أَخٌ لَهُ مِن قَبلُ ۚ فَأَسَرَّها يوسُفُ في نَفسِهِ وَلَم يُبدِها لَهُم ۚ قالَ أَنتُم شَرٌّ مَكانًا ۖ وَاللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما تَصِفونَ
77.translation_eng: They said, ‘If he has stolen [there is no wonder]; a brother of his had stolen before.’ Thereupon Joseph kept the matter to himself and he did not disclose it to them. He said, ‘You are in a worse state! And Allah knows best what you allege.’
77.transliteration: qālū ʾin yasriq fa-qad saraqa ʾakhun lahū min qablu fa-ʾasarrahā yūsufu fī nafsihī wa-lam yubdihā lahum qāla ʾantum sharrun makānan wa-llāhu ʾaʿlamu bi-mā taṣifūna

78.content: قالوا يا أَيُّهَا العَزيزُ إِنَّ لَهُ أَبًا شَيخًا كَبيرًا فَخُذ أَحَدَنا مَكانَهُ ۖ إِنّا نَراكَ مِنَ المُحسِنينَ
78.translation_eng: They said, ‘O emir! Indeed he has a father, a very old man; so take one of us in his place. Indeed we see that you are a virtuous man.’
78.transliteration: qālū yā-ʾayyuhā l-ʿazīzu ʾinna lahū ʾaban shaykhan kabīran fa-khudh ʾaḥadanā makānahū ʾinnā narāka mina l-muḥsinīna

79.content: قالَ مَعاذَ اللَّهِ أَن نَأخُذَ إِلّا مَن وَجَدنا مَتاعَنا عِندَهُ إِنّا إِذًا لَظالِمونَ
79.translation_eng: He said, ‘God forbid that we should take anyone except him with whom we found our wares, for then we would indeed be wrongdoers.’
79.transliteration: qāla maʿādha llāhi ʾan naʾkhudha ʾillā man wajadnā matāʿanā ʿindahū ʾinnā ʾidhan la-ẓālimūna

80.content: فَلَمَّا استَيأَسوا مِنهُ خَلَصوا نَجِيًّا ۖ قالَ كَبيرُهُم أَلَم تَعلَموا أَنَّ أَباكُم قَد أَخَذَ عَلَيكُم مَوثِقًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَمِن قَبلُ ما فَرَّطتُم في يوسُفَ ۖ فَلَن أَبرَحَ الأَرضَ حَتّىٰ يَأذَنَ لي أَبي أَو يَحكُمَ اللَّهُ لي ۖ وَهُوَ خَيرُ الحاكِمينَ
80.translation_eng: When they had despaired of [moving] him, they withdrew to confer privately. The eldest of them said, ‘Don’t you know that your father has taken a [solemn] pledge from you by Allah, and earlier you have neglected your duty in regard to Joseph? So I will never leave this land until my father permits me, or Allah passes a judgement for me, and He is the best of judges.
80.transliteration: fa-lammā stayʾasū minhu khalaṣū najiyyan qāla kabīruhum ʾa-lam taʿlamū ʾanna ʾabākum qad ʾakhadha ʿalaykum mawthiqan mina llāhi wa-min qablu mā farraṭtum fī yūsufa fa-lan ʾabraḥa l-ʾarḍa ḥattā yaʾdhana lī ʾabī ʾaw yaḥkuma llāhu lī wa-huwa khāyru l-ḥākimīna

81.content: ارجِعوا إِلىٰ أَبيكُم فَقولوا يا أَبانا إِنَّ ابنَكَ سَرَقَ وَما شَهِدنا إِلّا بِما عَلِمنا وَما كُنّا لِلغَيبِ حافِظينَ
81.translation_eng: Go back to your father, and say, “Father! Your son has indeed committed theft, and we testified only to what we knew,1 and we could not have forestalled the unseen.That is, concerning the penalty for theft according to the custom of the Canaanites.
81.transliteration: irjiʿū ʾilā ʾabīkum fa-qūlū yā-ʾabānā ʾinna bnaka saraqa wa-mā shahidnā ʾillā bi-mā ʿalimnā wa-mā kunnā li-l-ghaybi ḥāfiẓīna

82.content: وَاسأَلِ القَريَةَ الَّتي كُنّا فيها وَالعيرَ الَّتي أَقبَلنا فيها ۖ وَإِنّا لَصادِقونَ
82.translation_eng: Ask [the people of] the town we were in, and the caravan with which we came. We indeed speak the truth.” ’
82.transliteration: wa-sʾali l-qaryata llatī kunnā fīhā wa-l-ʿīra llatī ʾaqbalnā fīhā wa-ʾinnā la-ṣādiqūna

83.content: قالَ بَل سَوَّلَت لَكُم أَنفُسُكُم أَمرًا ۖ فَصَبرٌ جَميلٌ ۖ عَسَى اللَّهُ أَن يَأتِيَني بِهِم جَميعًا ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ العَليمُ الحَكيمُ
83.translation_eng: He1 said, ‘Rather your souls have made a matter seem decorous to you. Yet patience is graceful. Maybe Allah will bring them all [back] to me. Indeed He is the All-knowing, the All-wise.’That is, Jacob (ʿa), after hearing what his sons had told him.
83.transliteration: qāla bal sawwalat lakum ʾanfusukum ʾamran fa-ṣabrun jamīlun ʿasā llāhu ʾan yaʾtiyanī bihim jamīʿan ʾinnahū huwa l-ʿalīmu l-ḥakīmu

84.content: وَتَوَلّىٰ عَنهُم وَقالَ يا أَسَفىٰ عَلىٰ يوسُفَ وَابيَضَّت عَيناهُ مِنَ الحُزنِ فَهُوَ كَظيمٌ
84.translation_eng: And he turned away from them and said, ‘Alas for Joseph!’ His eyes had turned white with grief, and he choked with suppressed agony.
84.transliteration: wa-tawallā ʿanhum wa-qāla yā-ʾasafā ʿalā yūsufa wa-byaḍḍat ʿaynāhu mina l-ḥuzni fa-huwa kaẓīmun

85.content: قالوا تَاللَّهِ تَفتَأُ تَذكُرُ يوسُفَ حَتّىٰ تَكونَ حَرَضًا أَو تَكونَ مِنَ الهالِكينَ
85.translation_eng: They said, ‘By Allah! You will go on remembering Joseph until you wreck your health or perish.’
85.transliteration: qālū ta-llāhi taftaʾu tadhkuru yūsufa ḥattā takūna ḥaraḍan ʾaw takūna mina l-hālikīna

86.content: قالَ إِنَّما أَشكو بَثّي وَحُزني إِلَى اللَّهِ وَأَعلَمُ مِنَ اللَّهِ ما لا تَعلَمونَ
86.translation_eng: He said, ‘I complain of my anguish and grief only to Allah. I know from Allah what you do not know.’
86.transliteration: qāla ʾinnamā ʾashkū baththī wa-ḥuznī ʾilā llāhi wa-ʾaʿlamu mina llāhi mā lā taʿlamūna

87.content: يا بَنِيَّ اذهَبوا فَتَحَسَّسوا مِن يوسُفَ وَأَخيهِ وَلا تَيأَسوا مِن رَوحِ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ لا يَيأَسُ مِن رَوحِ اللَّهِ إِلَّا القَومُ الكافِرونَ
87.translation_eng: ‘Go, my sons, and look for Joseph and his brother, and do not despair of Allah’s mercy. Indeed no one despairs of Allah’s mercy except the faithless lot.’
87.transliteration: yā-baniyya dhhabū fa-taḥassasū min yūsufa wa-ʾakhīhi wa-lā tayʾasū min rawḥi llāhi ʾinnahū lā yayʾasu min rawḥi llāhi ʾillā l-qawmu l-kāfirūna

88.content: فَلَمّا دَخَلوا عَلَيهِ قالوا يا أَيُّهَا العَزيزُ مَسَّنا وَأَهلَنَا الضُّرُّ وَجِئنا بِبِضاعَةٍ مُزجاةٍ فَأَوفِ لَنَا الكَيلَ وَتَصَدَّق عَلَينا ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَجزِي المُتَصَدِّقينَ
88.translation_eng: Then, when they entered into his presence, they said, ‘O emir! Distress has befallen our family, and us, and we have brought [just] a meager sum. Yet grant us the full measure, and be charitable to us! Indeed Allah rewards the charitable.’
88.transliteration: fa-lammā dakhalū ʿalayhi qālū yā-ʾayyuhā l-ʿazīzu massanā wa-ʾahlanā ḍ-ḍurru wa-jiʾnā bi-biḍāʿatin muzjātin fa-ʾawfi lanā l-kayla wa-taṣaddaq ʿalaynā ʾinna llāha yajzī l-mutaṣaddiqīna

89.content: قالَ هَل عَلِمتُم ما فَعَلتُم بِيوسُفَ وَأَخيهِ إِذ أَنتُم جاهِلونَ
89.translation_eng: He said, ‘Have you realized what you did to Joseph and his brother, when you were senseless?’
89.transliteration: qāla hal ʿalimtum mā faʿaltum bi-yūsufa wa-ʾakhīhi ʾidh ʾantum jāhilūna

90.content: قالوا أَإِنَّكَ لَأَنتَ يوسُفُ ۖ قالَ أَنا يوسُفُ وَهٰذا أَخي ۖ قَد مَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَينا ۖ إِنَّهُ مَن يَتَّقِ وَيَصبِر فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُضيعُ أَجرَ المُحسِنينَ
90.translation_eng: They said, ‘Are you really Joseph?!’ He said, ‘I am Joseph, and this is my brother. Certainly Allah has shown us favour. Indeed if one is Godwary and patient Allah does not waste the reward of the virtuous.’
90.transliteration: qālū ʾa-ʾinnaka la-ʾanta yūsufu qāla ʾana yūsufu wa-hādhā ʾakhī qad manna llāhu ʿalaynā ʾinnahū man yattaqi wa-yaṣbir fa-ʾinna llāha lā yuḍīʿu ʾajra l-muḥsinīna

91.content: قالوا تَاللَّهِ لَقَد آثَرَكَ اللَّهُ عَلَينا وَإِن كُنّا لَخاطِئينَ
91.translation_eng: They said, ‘By Allah, Allah has certainly preferred you over us, and we have indeed been erring.’
91.transliteration: qālū ta-llāhi la-qad ʾātharaka llāhu ʿalaynā wa-ʾin kunnā la-khāṭiʾīna

92.content: قالَ لا تَثريبَ عَلَيكُمُ اليَومَ ۖ يَغفِرُ اللَّهُ لَكُم ۖ وَهُوَ أَرحَمُ الرّاحِمينَ
92.translation_eng: He said, ‘There shall be no reproach on you today. Allah will forgive you, and He is the most merciful of the merciful.
92.transliteration: qāla lā tathrība ʿalaykumu l-yawma yaghfiru llāhu lakum wa-huwa ʾarḥamu r-rāḥimīna

93.content: اذهَبوا بِقَميصي هٰذا فَأَلقوهُ عَلىٰ وَجهِ أَبي يَأتِ بَصيرًا وَأتوني بِأَهلِكُم أَجمَعينَ
93.translation_eng: Take this shirt of mine, and cast it upon my father’s face; he will regain his sight, and bring me all your folks.’
93.transliteration: idhhabū bi-qamīṣī hādhā fa-ʾalqūhu ʿalā wajhi ʾabī yaʾti baṣīran wa-ʾtūnī bi-ʾahlikum ʾajmaʿīna

94.content: وَلَمّا فَصَلَتِ العيرُ قالَ أَبوهُم إِنّي لَأَجِدُ ريحَ يوسُفَ ۖ لَولا أَن تُفَنِّدونِ
94.translation_eng: As the caravan set off, their father said, ‘I sense the scent of Joseph, if you will not consider me a dotard.’
94.transliteration: wa-lammā faṣalati l-ʿīru qāla ʾabūhum ʾinnī la-ʾajidu rīḥa yūsufa law-lā ʾan tufannidūni

95.content: قالوا تَاللَّهِ إِنَّكَ لَفي ضَلالِكَ القَديمِ
95.translation_eng: They said, ‘By God, you persist in your inveterate error.’
95.transliteration: qālū ta-llāhi ʾinnaka la-fī ḍalālika l-qadīmi

96.content: فَلَمّا أَن جاءَ البَشيرُ أَلقاهُ عَلىٰ وَجهِهِ فَارتَدَّ بَصيرًا ۖ قالَ أَلَم أَقُل لَكُم إِنّي أَعلَمُ مِنَ اللَّهِ ما لا تَعلَمونَ
96.translation_eng: When the bearer of good news arrived, he cast it1 on his face, and he regained his sight. He said, ‘Did I not tell you, “I know from Allah what you do not know?” ’That is, the shirt of Joseph (ʿa).
96.transliteration: fa-lammā ʾan jāʾa l-bashīru ʾalqāhu ʿalā wajhihī fa-rtadda baṣīran qāla ʾa-lam ʾaqul lakum ʾinnī ʾaʿlamu mina llāhi mā lā taʿlamūna

97.content: قالوا يا أَبانَا استَغفِر لَنا ذُنوبَنا إِنّا كُنّا خاطِئينَ
97.translation_eng: They said, ‘Father! Plead [with Allah] for forgiveness of our sins! We have indeed been erring.’
97.transliteration: qālū yā-ʾabānā staghfir lanā dhunūbanā ʾinnā kunnā khāṭiʾīna

98.content: قالَ سَوفَ أَستَغفِرُ لَكُم رَبّي ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الغَفورُ الرَّحيمُ
98.translation_eng: He said, ‘I shall plead with my Lord to forgive you; indeed He is the All-forgiving, the All-merciful.’
98.transliteration: qāla sawfa ʾastaghfiru lakum rabbī ʾinnahū huwa l-ghafūru r-raḥīmu
