99.content: فَلَمّا دَخَلوا عَلىٰ يوسُفَ آوىٰ إِلَيهِ أَبَوَيهِ وَقالَ ادخُلوا مِصرَ إِن شاءَ اللَّهُ آمِنينَ
99.translation_eng: When they entered into the presence of Joseph, he set his parents close to himself, and said, ‘Welcome to Egypt, in safety, God willing!’
99.transliteration: fa-lammā dakhalū ʿalā yūsufa ʾāwā ʾilayhi ʾabawayhi wa-qāla dkhulū miṣra ʾin shāʾa llāhu ʾāminīna

100.content: وَرَفَعَ أَبَوَيهِ عَلَى العَرشِ وَخَرّوا لَهُ سُجَّدًا ۖ وَقالَ يا أَبَتِ هٰذا تَأويلُ رُؤيايَ مِن قَبلُ قَد جَعَلَها رَبّي حَقًّا ۖ وَقَد أَحسَنَ بي إِذ أَخرَجَني مِنَ السِّجنِ وَجاءَ بِكُم مِنَ البَدوِ مِن بَعدِ أَن نَزَغَ الشَّيطانُ بَيني وَبَينَ إِخوَتي ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي لَطيفٌ لِما يَشاءُ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ العَليمُ الحَكيمُ
100.translation_eng: And he seated his parents high upon the throne, and they fell down prostrate before him. He said, ‘Father! This is the fulfillment of my dream of long ago, which my Lord has made come true. He was certainly gracious to me when He brought me out of the prison and brought you over from the desert after that Satan had incited ill feeling between me and my brothers. Indeed my Lord is all-attentive in bringing about what He wishes. Indeed He is the All-knowing, the All-wise.’
100.transliteration: wa-rafaʿa ʾabawayhi ʿalā l-ʿarshi wa-kharrū lahū sujjadan wa-qāla yā-ʾabati hādhā taʾwīlu ruʾyāya min qablu qad jaʿalahā rabbī ḥaqqan wa-qad ʾaḥsana bī ʾidh ʾakhrajanī mina s-sijni wa-jāʾa bikum mina l-badwi min baʿdi ʾan nazagha sh-shayṭānu baynī wa-bayna ʾikhwatī ʾinna rabbī laṭīfun li-mā yashāʾu ʾinnahū huwa l-ʿalīmu l-ḥakīmu

101.content: ۞ رَبِّ قَد آتَيتَني مِنَ المُلكِ وَعَلَّمتَني مِن تَأويلِ الأَحاديثِ ۚ فاطِرَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ أَنتَ وَلِيّي فِي الدُّنيا وَالآخِرَةِ ۖ تَوَفَّني مُسلِمًا وَأَلحِقني بِالصّالِحينَ
101.translation_eng: ‘My Lord! You have granted me a share in the kingdom, and taught me the interpretation of dreams. Originator of the heavens and earth! You are my guardian in this world and the Hereafter! Let my death be in submission [to You], and unite me with the Righteous.’
101.transliteration: rabbi qad ʾātaytanī mina l-mulki wa-ʿallamtanī min taʾwīli l-ʾaḥādīthi fāṭira s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾanta waliyyī fī d-dunyā wa-l-ʾākhirati tawaffanī musliman wa-ʾalḥiqnī bi-ṣ-ṣāliḥīna

102.content: ذٰلِكَ مِن أَنباءِ الغَيبِ نوحيهِ إِلَيكَ ۖ وَما كُنتَ لَدَيهِم إِذ أَجمَعوا أَمرَهُم وَهُم يَمكُرونَ
102.translation_eng: These are accounts of the Unseen which We reveal to you, and you were not with them when they conspired together and schemed.
102.transliteration: dhālika min ʾanbāʾi l-ghaybi nūḥīhi ʾilayka wa-mā kunta ladayhim ʾidh ʾajmaʿū ʾamrahum wa-hum yamkurūna

103.content: وَما أَكثَرُ النّاسِ وَلَو حَرَصتَ بِمُؤمِنينَ
103.translation_eng: Yet most people will not have faith, however eager you should be.
103.transliteration: wa-mā ʾaktharu n-nāsi wa-law ḥaraṣta bi-muʾminīna

104.content: وَما تَسأَلُهُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ ۚ إِن هُوَ إِلّا ذِكرٌ لِلعالَمينَ
104.translation_eng: You do not ask them any reward for it: it1 is just a reminder for all the nations.That is, the Qurʾān.
104.transliteration: wa-mā tasʾaluhum ʿalayhi min ʾajrin ʾin huwa ʾillā dhikrun li-l-ʿālamīna

105.content: وَكَأَيِّن مِن آيَةٍ فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ يَمُرّونَ عَلَيها وَهُم عَنها مُعرِضونَ
105.translation_eng: How many a sign there is in the heavens and the earth that they pass by while they are disregardful of it!
105.transliteration: wa-ka-ʾayyin min ʾāyatin fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi yamurrūna ʿalayhā wa-hum ʿanhā muʿriḍūna

106.content: وَما يُؤمِنُ أَكثَرُهُم بِاللَّهِ إِلّا وَهُم مُشرِكونَ
106.translation_eng: And most of them do not believe in Allah without ascribing partners to Him.
106.transliteration: wa-mā yuʾminu ʾaktharuhum bi-llāhi ʾillā wa-hum mushrikūna

107.content: أَفَأَمِنوا أَن تَأتِيَهُم غاشِيَةٌ مِن عَذابِ اللَّهِ أَو تَأتِيَهُمُ السّاعَةُ بَغتَةً وَهُم لا يَشعُرونَ
107.translation_eng: Do they feel secure from being overtaken by a blanket punishment from Allah, or being overtaken by the Hour, suddenly, while they are unaware?
107.transliteration: ʾa-fa-ʾaminū ʾan taʾtiyahum ghāshiyatun min ʿadhābi llāhi ʾaw taʾtiyahumu s-sāʿatu baghtatan wa-hum lā yashʿurūna

108.content: قُل هٰذِهِ سَبيلي أَدعو إِلَى اللَّهِ ۚ عَلىٰ بَصيرَةٍ أَنا وَمَنِ اتَّبَعَني ۖ وَسُبحانَ اللَّهِ وَما أَنا مِنَ المُشرِكينَ
108.translation_eng: Say, ‘This is my way. I summon to Allah with insight —I and he who follows me. Immaculate is Allah, and I am not one of the polytheists.’
108.transliteration: qul hādhihī sabīlī ʾadʿū ʾilā llāhi ʿalā baṣīratin ʾana wa-mani ttabaʿanī wa-subḥāna llāhi wa-mā ʾana mina l-mushrikīna

109.content: وَما أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ إِلّا رِجالًا نوحي إِلَيهِم مِن أَهلِ القُرىٰ ۗ أَفَلَم يَسيروا فِي الأَرضِ فَيَنظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۗ وَلَدارُ الآخِرَةِ خَيرٌ لِلَّذينَ اتَّقَوا ۗ أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
109.translation_eng: We did not send [any apostles] before you except as men to whom We revealed from among the people of the towns. Have they not traveled over the land so that they may observe how was the fate of those who were before them? And the abode of the Hereafter is surely better for those who are Godwary. Do you not apply reason?
109.transliteration: wa-mā ʾarsalnā min qablika ʾillā rijālan nūḥī ʾilayhim min ʾahli l-qurā ʾa-fa-lam yasīrū fī l-ʾarḍi fa-yanẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu lladhīna min qablihim wa-la-dāru l-ʾākhirati khayrun li-lladhīna ttaqaw ʾa-fa-lā taʿqilūna

110.content: حَتّىٰ إِذَا استَيأَسَ الرُّسُلُ وَظَنّوا أَنَّهُم قَد كُذِبوا جاءَهُم نَصرُنا فَنُجِّيَ مَن نَشاءُ ۖ وَلا يُرَدُّ بَأسُنا عَنِ القَومِ المُجرِمينَ
110.translation_eng: When the apostles lost hope1 and they thought that they had been told lies,2 Our help came to them, and We delivered whomever We wished, and Our punishment will not be averted from the guilty lot.That is, when the apostles lost hopes of bringing their people to the right path.That is, the people to whom the apostles had been sent thought that the apostles had been told lies concerning the impending punishment of the infidels.
110.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā stayʾasa r-rusulu wa-ẓannū ʾannahum qad kudhibū jāʾahum naṣrunā fa-nujjiya man nashāʾu wa-lā yuraddu baʾsunā ʿani l-qawmi l-mujrimīna

111.content: لَقَد كانَ في قَصَصِهِم عِبرَةٌ لِأُولِي الأَلبابِ ۗ ما كانَ حَديثًا يُفتَرىٰ وَلٰكِن تَصديقَ الَّذي بَينَ يَدَيهِ وَتَفصيلَ كُلِّ شَيءٍ وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةً لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
111.translation_eng: There is certainly a moral in their accounts for those who possess intellect. This [Qurʾān] is not a fabricated discourse; rather it is a confirmation of what was [revealed] before it, and an elaboration1 of all things, and a guidance and mercy for a people who have faith.Or ‘unravelling.’
111.transliteration: la-qad kāna fī qaṣaṣihim ʿibratun li-ʾulī l-ʾalbābi mā kāna ḥadīthan yuftarā wa-lākin taṣdīqa lladhī bayna yadayhi wa-tafṣīla kulli shayʾin wa-hudan wa-raḥmatan li-qawmin yuʾminūna

13.description: The surah that translates into human experience the overpowering meaning of what Thunder says when it resounds through the sky and God sends bolts to the earth. It takes its name from thunder (al-raʿd), mentioned in verse 13. The surah is distinguished by its moving description of God’s power and knowledge. Muḥammad’s place in a long tradition of prophets, none of whom could produce miracles on request, is stressed, and his role emphasized: it is only to deliver the message. God is the One who will call people to account for their deeds, and He is the witness for the truth of the message.

1.content: المر ۚ تِلكَ آياتُ الكِتابِ ۗ وَالَّذي أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ مِن رَبِّكَ الحَقُّ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يُؤمِنونَ
1.translation_eng: Alif, Lām, Mīm, Rā. These are the signs of the Book. That which has been sent down to you from your Lord is the truth, but most people do not believe [in it].
1.transliteration: a-l-m-r (ʾalif lām mīm rā) tilka ʾāyātu l-kitābi wa-lladhī ʾunzila ʾilayka min rabbika l-ḥaqqu wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yuʾminūna

2.content: اللَّهُ الَّذي رَفَعَ السَّماواتِ بِغَيرِ عَمَدٍ تَرَونَها ۖ ثُمَّ استَوىٰ عَلَى العَرشِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ يَجري لِأَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۚ يُدَبِّرُ الأَمرَ يُفَصِّلُ الآياتِ لَعَلَّكُم بِلِقاءِ رَبِّكُم توقِنونَ
2.translation_eng: It is Allah who raised the heavens without any pillars that you see, and then presided over the Throne. He disposed the sun and the moon, each moving for a specified term.1 He directs the command, [and] elaborates2 the signs that you may be certain of encountering your Lord.Or ‘until a specified time.’Or ‘unravels.’
2.transliteration: allāhu lladhī rafaʿa s-samāwāti bi-ghayri ʿamadin tarawnahā thumma stawā ʿalā l-ʿarshi wa-sakhkhara sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara kullun yajrī li-ʾajalin musamman yudabbiru l-ʾamra yufaṣṣilu l-ʾāyāti laʿallakum bi-liqāʾi rabbikum tūqinūna

3.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي مَدَّ الأَرضَ وَجَعَلَ فيها رَواسِيَ وَأَنهارًا ۖ وَمِن كُلِّ الثَّمَراتِ جَعَلَ فيها زَوجَينِ اثنَينِ ۖ يُغشِي اللَّيلَ النَّهارَ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَتَفَكَّرونَ
3.translation_eng: It is He who has spread out the earth and set in it firm mountains and streams, and of every fruit He has made in it two kinds.1 He draws the night’s cover over the day. There are indeed signs in that for a people who reflect.Or ‘a pair,’ or ‘two mates.’
3.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī madda l-ʾarḍa wa-jaʿala fīhā rawāsiya wa-ʾanhāran wa-min kulli th-thamarāti jaʿala fīhā zawjayni thnayni yughshī l-layla n-nahāra ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yatafakkarūna

4.content: وَفِي الأَرضِ قِطَعٌ مُتَجاوِراتٌ وَجَنّاتٌ مِن أَعنابٍ وَزَرعٌ وَنَخيلٌ صِنوانٌ وَغَيرُ صِنوانٍ يُسقىٰ بِماءٍ واحِدٍ وَنُفَضِّلُ بَعضَها عَلىٰ بَعضٍ فِي الأُكُلِ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَعقِلونَ
4.translation_eng: In the earth are neighbouring terrains [of diverse kinds] and vineyards, farms, and date palms growing from the same root and from diverse roots, [all] irrigated by the same water, and We give some of them an advantage over others in flavour. There are indeed signs in that for a people who apply reason.
4.transliteration: wa-fī l-ʾarḍi qiṭaʿun mutajāwirātun wa-jannātun min ʾaʿnābin wa-zarʿun wa-nakhīlun ṣinwānun wa-ghayru ṣinwānin yusqā bi-māʾin wāḥidin wa-nufaḍḍilu baʿḍahā ʿalā baʿḍin fī l-ʾukuli ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yaʿqilūna

5.content: ۞ وَإِن تَعجَب فَعَجَبٌ قَولُهُم أَإِذا كُنّا تُرابًا أَإِنّا لَفي خَلقٍ جَديدٍ ۗ أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِرَبِّهِم ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ الأَغلالُ في أَعناقِهِم ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ النّارِ ۖ هُم فيها خالِدونَ
5.translation_eng: If you are to wonder [at anything], then wonderful1 is their remark, ‘When we have become dust, shall we be [ushered] into a new creation?’ They are the ones who defy their Lord; they shall have iron collars around their necks, they shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, and they shall remain in it [forever].That is, odd, astonishing.
5.transliteration: wa-ʾin taʿjab fa-ʿajabun qawluhum ʾa-ʾidhā kunnā turāban ʾa-ʾinnā la-fī khalqin jadīdin ʾulāʾika lladhīna kafarū bi-rabbihim wa-ʾulāʾika l-ʾaghlālu fī ʾaʿnāqihim wa-ʾulāʾika ʾaṣḥābu n-nāri hum fīhā khālidūna

6.content: وَيَستَعجِلونَكَ بِالسَّيِّئَةِ قَبلَ الحَسَنَةِ وَقَد خَلَت مِن قَبلِهِمُ المَثُلاتُ ۗ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذو مَغفِرَةٍ لِلنّاسِ عَلىٰ ظُلمِهِم ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَشَديدُ العِقابِ
6.translation_eng: They would press you for evil sooner than for good,1 though there have already gone by before them exemplary punishments. Indeed your Lord is forgiving to mankind despite their wrongdoing, and indeed your Lord is severe in retribution.That is, they ask you to bring about the Divine punishment with which you have threatened them, instead of pleading for Divine mercy and forgiveness.
6.transliteration: wa-yastaʿjilūnaka bi-s-sayyiʾati qabla l-ḥasanati wa-qad khalat min qablihimu l-mathulātu wa-ʾinna rabbaka la-dhū maghfiratin li-n-nāsi ʿalā ẓulmihim wa-ʾinna rabbaka la-shadīdu l-ʿiqābi

7.content: وَيَقولُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَولا أُنزِلَ عَلَيهِ آيَةٌ مِن رَبِّهِ ۗ إِنَّما أَنتَ مُنذِرٌ ۖ وَلِكُلِّ قَومٍ هادٍ
7.translation_eng: The faithless say, ‘Why has not some sign been sent down to him from his Lord?’ You are only a warner, and there is a guide for every people.
7.transliteration: wa-yaqūlu lladhīna kafarū law-lā ʾunzila ʿalayhi ʾāyatun min rabbihī ʾinnamā ʾanta mundhirun wa-li-kulli qawmin hādin-i

8.content: اللَّهُ يَعلَمُ ما تَحمِلُ كُلُّ أُنثىٰ وَما تَغيضُ الأَرحامُ وَما تَزدادُ ۖ وَكُلُّ شَيءٍ عِندَهُ بِمِقدارٍ
8.translation_eng: Allah knows what every female carries [in her womb], and what the wombs reduce and what they increase,1 and everything is by [precise] measure with Him,That is, what the wombs reduce or increase of the embryo or the foetus or the time of gestation.
8.transliteration: allāhu yaʿlamu mā taḥmilu kullu ʾunthā wa-mā taghīḍu l-ʾarḥāmu wa-mā tazdādu wa-kullu shayʾin ʿindahū bi-miqdārin

9.content: عالِمُ الغَيبِ وَالشَّهادَةِ الكَبيرُ المُتَعالِ
9.translation_eng: the Knower of the sensible and the Unseen, the All-great, the All-sublime.
9.transliteration: ʿālimu l-ghaybi wa-sh-shahādati l-kabīru l-mutaʿāli

10.content: سَواءٌ مِنكُم مَن أَسَرَّ القَولَ وَمَن جَهَرَ بِهِ وَمَن هُوَ مُستَخفٍ بِاللَّيلِ وَسارِبٌ بِالنَّهارِ
10.translation_eng: It is the same [to Him] whether any of you speaks secretly, or does so loudly, or whether he lurks in the night, or is open to view in daytime.1Or ‘marches in daytime.’
10.transliteration: sawāʾun minkum man ʾasarra l-qawla wa-man jahara bihī wa-man huwa mustakhfin bi-l-layli wa-sāribun bi-n-nahāri

11.content: لَهُ مُعَقِّباتٌ مِن بَينِ يَدَيهِ وَمِن خَلفِهِ يَحفَظونَهُ مِن أَمرِ اللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُغَيِّرُ ما بِقَومٍ حَتّىٰ يُغَيِّروا ما بِأَنفُسِهِم ۗ وَإِذا أَرادَ اللَّهُ بِقَومٍ سوءًا فَلا مَرَدَّ لَهُ ۚ وَما لَهُم مِن دونِهِ مِن والٍ
11.translation_eng: He has guardian angels, to his front and his rear, who guard him by Allah’s command. Indeed Allah does not change a people’s lot, unless they change what is in their souls. And when Allah wishes to visit ill on a people, there is nothing that can avert it, and they have no protector besides Him.
11.transliteration: lahū muʿaqqibātun min bayni yadayhi wa-min khalfihī yaḥfaẓūnahū min ʾamri llāhi ʾinna llāha lā yughayyiru mā bi-qawmin ḥattā yughayyirū mā bi-ʾanfusihim wa-ʾidhā ʾarāda llāhu bi-qawmin sūʾan fa-lā maradda lahū wa-mā lahum min dūnihī min wālin

12.content: هُوَ الَّذي يُريكُمُ البَرقَ خَوفًا وَطَمَعًا وَيُنشِئُ السَّحابَ الثِّقالَ
12.translation_eng: It is He who shows you the lightning, inspiring fear and hope, and He produces the clouds heavy [with rain].
12.transliteration: huwa lladhī yurīkumu l-barqa khawfan wa-ṭamaʿan wa-yunshiʾu s-saḥāba th-thiqāla

13.content: وَيُسَبِّحُ الرَّعدُ بِحَمدِهِ وَالمَلائِكَةُ مِن خيفَتِهِ وَيُرسِلُ الصَّواعِقَ فَيُصيبُ بِها مَن يَشاءُ وَهُم يُجادِلونَ فِي اللَّهِ وَهُوَ شَديدُ المِحالِ
13.translation_eng: The Thunder celebrates His praise, and the angels [too], in awe of Him, and He releases the thunderbolts and strikes with them whomever He wishes. Yet they dispute concerning Allah, though He is great in might.1Or ‘though He is severe in punishment.’
13.transliteration: wa-yusabbiḥu r-raʿdu bi-ḥamdihī wa-l-malāʾikatu min khīfatihī wa-yursilu ṣ-ṣawāʿiqa fa-yuṣību bihā man yashāʾu wa-hum yujādilūna fī llāhi wa-huwa shadīdu l-miḥāli

14.content: لَهُ دَعوَةُ الحَقِّ ۖ وَالَّذينَ يَدعونَ مِن دونِهِ لا يَستَجيبونَ لَهُم بِشَيءٍ إِلّا كَباسِطِ كَفَّيهِ إِلَى الماءِ لِيَبلُغَ فاهُ وَما هُوَ بِبالِغِهِ ۚ وَما دُعاءُ الكافِرينَ إِلّا في ضَلالٍ
14.translation_eng: [Only] to Him belongs the true invocation;1 and those whom they invoke besides Him do not answer them in any wise— like someone who stretches his hands towards water [desiring] that it should reach his mouth, but it does not reach it— and the invocations of the faithless only go awry.Or ‘His is the invitation to the truth,’ or ‘His is the true invitation.’
14.transliteration: lahū daʿwatu l-ḥaqqi wa-lladhīna yadʿūna min dūnihī lā yastajībūna lahum bi-shayʾin ʾillā ka-bāsiṭi kaffayhi ʾilā l-māʾi li-yablugha fāhu wa-mā huwa bi-bālighihī wa-mā duʿāʾu l-kāfirīna ʾillā fī ḍalālin

15.content: وَلِلَّهِ يَسجُدُ مَن فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ طَوعًا وَكَرهًا وَظِلالُهُم بِالغُدُوِّ وَالآصالِ ۩
15.translation_eng: To Allah prostrates whoever there is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and their shadows at sunrise and sunset.
15.transliteration: wa-li-llāhi yasjudu man fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi ṭawʿan wa-karhan wa-ẓilāluhum bi-l-ghuduwwi wa-l-ʾāṣāli

16.content: قُل مَن رَبُّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ قُلِ اللَّهُ ۚ قُل أَفَاتَّخَذتُم مِن دونِهِ أَولِياءَ لا يَملِكونَ لِأَنفُسِهِم نَفعًا وَلا ضَرًّا ۚ قُل هَل يَستَوِي الأَعمىٰ وَالبَصيرُ أَم هَل تَستَوِي الظُّلُماتُ وَالنّورُ ۗ أَم جَعَلوا لِلَّهِ شُرَكاءَ خَلَقوا كَخَلقِهِ فَتَشابَهَ الخَلقُ عَلَيهِم ۚ قُلِ اللَّهُ خالِقُ كُلِّ شَيءٍ وَهُوَ الواحِدُ القَهّارُ
16.translation_eng: Say, ‘Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?’ Say, ‘Allah!’ Say, ‘Have you then taken others besides Him for guardians, who have no control over their own benefit or harm?’ Say, ‘Are the blind one and the seer equal? Or are the darkness and the light equal?’ Have they set up for Allah partners who have created like His creation, so that the creations seemed confusable to them? Say, ‘Allah is the creator of all things, and He is the One, the All-paramount.’
16.transliteration: qul man rabbu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi quli llāhu qul ʾa-fa-ttakhadhtum min dūnihī ʾawliyāʾa lā yamlikūna li-ʾanfusihim nafʿan wa-lā ḍarran qul hal yastawī l-ʾaʿmā wa-l-baṣīru ʾam hal tastawī ẓ-ẓulumātu wa-n-nūru ʾam jaʿalū li-llāhi shurakāʾa khalaqū ka-khalqihī fa-tashābaha l-khalqu ʿalayhim quli llāhu khāliqu kulli shayʾin wa-huwa l-wāḥidu l-qahhāru

17.content: أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَسالَت أَودِيَةٌ بِقَدَرِها فَاحتَمَلَ السَّيلُ زَبَدًا رابِيًا ۚ وَمِمّا يوقِدونَ عَلَيهِ فِي النّارِ ابتِغاءَ حِليَةٍ أَو مَتاعٍ زَبَدٌ مِثلُهُ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يَضرِبُ اللَّهُ الحَقَّ وَالباطِلَ ۚ فَأَمَّا الزَّبَدُ فَيَذهَبُ جُفاءً ۖ وَأَمّا ما يَنفَعُ النّاسَ فَيَمكُثُ فِي الأَرضِ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يَضرِبُ اللَّهُ الأَمثالَ
17.translation_eng: He sends down water from the sky whereat the valleys are flooded to [the extent of] their capacity, and the flood carries along a swelling scum. And from what they smelt in the fire for the purpose of [making] ornaments or wares, [there arises] a similar scum. That is how Allah compares the truth and falsehood. As for the scum, it leaves as dross, and that which profits the people remains in the earth. That is how Allah draws comparisons.
17.transliteration: ʾanzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-sālat ʾawdiyatun bi-qadarihā fa-ḥtamala s-saylu zabadan rābiyan wa-mimmā yūqidūna ʿalayhi fī n-nāri btighāʾa ḥilyatin ʾaw matāʿin zabadun mithluhū ka-dhālika yaḍribu llāhu l-ḥaqqa wa-l-bāṭila fa-ʾammā z-zabadu fa-yadhhabu jufāʾan wa-ʾammā mā yanfaʿu n-nāsa fa-yamkuthu fī l-ʾarḍi ka-dhālika yaḍribu llāhu l-ʾamthāla

18.content: لِلَّذينَ استَجابوا لِرَبِّهِمُ الحُسنىٰ ۚ وَالَّذينَ لَم يَستَجيبوا لَهُ لَو أَنَّ لَهُم ما فِي الأَرضِ جَميعًا وَمِثلَهُ مَعَهُ لَافتَدَوا بِهِ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم سوءُ الحِسابِ وَمَأواهُم جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئسَ المِهادُ
18.translation_eng: For those who answer [the summons of] their Lord there shall be the best [of rewards]. But those who do not answer Him, even if they possessed all that is on the earth and as much of it besides, they would surely offer it to redeem themselves with it.1 For such there shall be an adverse reckoning, and their refuge shall be hell, and it is an evil resting place.Cf. 5:36 & 39:47.
18.transliteration: li-lladhīna stajābū li-rabbihimu l-ḥusnā wa-lladhīna lam yastajībū lahū law ʾanna lahum mā fī l-ʾarḍi jamīʿan wa-mithlahū maʿahū la-ftadaw bihī ʾulāʾika lahum sūʾu l-ḥisābi wa-maʾwāhum jahannamu wa-biʾsa l-mihādu

19.content: ۞ أَفَمَن يَعلَمُ أَنَّما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ مِن رَبِّكَ الحَقُّ كَمَن هُوَ أَعمىٰ ۚ إِنَّما يَتَذَكَّرُ أُولُو الأَلبابِ
19.translation_eng: Is someone who knows that what has been sent down to you from your Lord is the truth, like someone who is blind? Only those who possess intellect take admonition
19.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man yaʿlamu ʾannamā ʾunzila ʾilayka min rabbika l-ḥaqqu ka-man huwa ʾaʿmā ʾinnamā yatadhakkaru ʾulū l-ʾalbābi

20.content: الَّذينَ يوفونَ بِعَهدِ اللَّهِ وَلا يَنقُضونَ الميثاقَ
20.translation_eng: —those who fulfill Allah’s covenant and do not break the pledge solemnly made,
20.transliteration: alladhīna yūfūna bi-ʿahdi llāhi wa-lā yanquḍūna l-mīthāqa

21.content: وَالَّذينَ يَصِلونَ ما أَمَرَ اللَّهُ بِهِ أَن يوصَلَ وَيَخشَونَ رَبَّهُم وَيَخافونَ سوءَ الحِسابِ
21.translation_eng: and those who join what Allah has commanded to be joined, and fear their Lord, and are afraid of an adverse reckoning
21.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yaṣilūna mā ʾamara llāhu bihī ʾan yūṣala wa-yakhshawna rabbahum wa-yakhāfūna sūʾa l-ḥisābi

22.content: وَالَّذينَ صَبَرُوا ابتِغاءَ وَجهِ رَبِّهِم وَأَقامُوا الصَّلاةَ وَأَنفَقوا مِمّا رَزَقناهُم سِرًّا وَعَلانِيَةً وَيَدرَءونَ بِالحَسَنَةِ السَّيِّئَةَ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم عُقبَى الدّارِ
22.translation_eng: —those who are patient for the sake of their Lord’s pleasure, maintain the prayer, and spend out of what We have provided them, secretly and openly, and repel evil [conduct] with good. For such will be the reward of the [ultimate] abode:
22.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ṣabarū btighāʾa wajhi rabbihim wa-ʾaqāmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-ʾanfaqū mimmā razaqnāhum sirran wa-ʿalāniyatan wa-yadraʾūna bi-l-ḥasanati s-sayyiʾata ʾulāʾika lahum ʿuqbā d-dāri

23.content: جَنّاتُ عَدنٍ يَدخُلونَها وَمَن صَلَحَ مِن آبائِهِم وَأَزواجِهِم وَذُرِّيّاتِهِم ۖ وَالمَلائِكَةُ يَدخُلونَ عَلَيهِم مِن كُلِّ بابٍ
23.translation_eng: the Gardens of Eden, which they will enter along with whoever is righteous from among their forebears, their spouses, and their descendants, and the angels will call on them from every door:
23.transliteration: jannātu ʿadnin yadkhulūnahā wa-man ṣalaḥa min ʾābāʾihim wa-ʾazwājihim wa-dhurriyyātihim wa-l-malāʾikatu yadkhulūna ʿalayhim min kulli bābin

24.content: سَلامٌ عَلَيكُم بِما صَبَرتُم ۚ فَنِعمَ عُقبَى الدّارِ
24.translation_eng: ‘Peace be to you, for your patience.’ How excellent is the reward of the [ultimate] abode!
24.transliteration: salāmun ʿalaykum bi-mā ṣabartum fa-niʿma ʿuqbā d-dāri

25.content: وَالَّذينَ يَنقُضونَ عَهدَ اللَّهِ مِن بَعدِ ميثاقِهِ وَيَقطَعونَ ما أَمَرَ اللَّهُ بِهِ أَن يوصَلَ وَيُفسِدونَ فِي الأَرضِ ۙ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُمُ اللَّعنَةُ وَلَهُم سوءُ الدّارِ
25.translation_eng: But as for those who break Allah’s compact after having pledged it solemnly, and sever what Allah has commanded to be joined, and cause corruption in the earth —it is such on whom the curse will lie, and for them will be the ills of the [ultimate] abode.
25.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yanquḍūna ʿahda llāhi min baʿdi mīthāqihī wa-yaqṭaʿūna mā ʾamara llāhu bihī ʾan yūṣala wa-yufsidūna fī l-ʾarḍi ʾulāʾika lahumu l-laʿnatu wa-lahum sūʾu d-dāri

26.content: اللَّهُ يَبسُطُ الرِّزقَ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيَقدِرُ ۚ وَفَرِحوا بِالحَياةِ الدُّنيا وَمَا الحَياةُ الدُّنيا فِي الآخِرَةِ إِلّا مَتاعٌ
26.translation_eng: Allah expands the provision for whomever He wishes, and tightens it. They exult in the life of this world, but compared with the Hereafter the life of this world is but a [trifling] enjoyment.
26.transliteration: allāhu yabsuṭu r-rizqa li-man yashāʾu wa-yaqdiru wa-fariḥū bi-l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-mā l-ḥayātu d-dunyā fī l-ʾākhirati ʾillā matāʿun

27.content: وَيَقولُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَولا أُنزِلَ عَلَيهِ آيَةٌ مِن رَبِّهِ ۗ قُل إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُضِلُّ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَهدي إِلَيهِ مَن أَنابَ
27.translation_eng: The faithless say, ‘Why has not some sign been sent down to him from his Lord?’ Say, ‘Indeed Allah leads astray whomever He wishes, and guides to Himself those who turn penitently [to Him]
27.transliteration: wa-yaqūlu lladhīna kafarū law-lā ʾunzila ʿalayhi ʾāyatun min rabbihī qul ʾinna llāha yuḍillu man yashāʾu wa-yahdī ʾilayhi man ʾanāba

28.content: الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَتَطمَئِنُّ قُلوبُهُم بِذِكرِ اللَّهِ ۗ أَلا بِذِكرِ اللَّهِ تَطمَئِنُّ القُلوبُ
28.translation_eng: —those who have faith, and whose hearts find rest in the remembrance of Allah.’ Look! The hearts find rest in Allah’s remembrance!
28.transliteration: alladhīna ʾāmanū wa-taṭmaʾinnu qulūbuhum bi-dhikri llāhi ʾa-lā bi-dhikri llāhi taṭmaʾinnu l-qulūbu

29.content: الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ طوبىٰ لَهُم وَحُسنُ مَآبٍ
29.translation_eng: Those who have faith and do righteous deeds —happy are they and good is their [ultimate] destination.
29.transliteration: alladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti ṭūbā lahum wa-ḥusnu maʾābin

30.content: كَذٰلِكَ أَرسَلناكَ في أُمَّةٍ قَد خَلَت مِن قَبلِها أُمَمٌ لِتَتلُوَ عَلَيهِمُ الَّذي أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ وَهُم يَكفُرونَ بِالرَّحمٰنِ ۚ قُل هُوَ رَبّي لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ عَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلتُ وَإِلَيهِ مَتابِ
30.translation_eng: Thus have We sent you to a nation before which many nations have passed away, that you may recite to them what We have revealed to you. Yet they defy the All-beneficent. Say, ‘He is my Lord; there is no god except Him; in Him I have put my trust, and to Him will be my return.’
30.transliteration: ka-dhālika ʾarsalnāka fī ʾummatin qad khalat min qablihā ʾumamun li-tatluwa ʿalayhimu lladhī ʾawḥaynā ʾilayka wa-hum yakfurūna bi-r-raḥmāni qul huwa rabbī lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa ʿalayhi tawakkaltu wa-ʾilayhi matābi

31.content: وَلَو أَنَّ قُرآنًا سُيِّرَت بِهِ الجِبالُ أَو قُطِّعَت بِهِ الأَرضُ أَو كُلِّمَ بِهِ المَوتىٰ ۗ بَل لِلَّهِ الأَمرُ جَميعًا ۗ أَفَلَم يَيأَسِ الَّذينَ آمَنوا أَن لَو يَشاءُ اللَّهُ لَهَدَى النّاسَ جَميعًا ۗ وَلا يَزالُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا تُصيبُهُم بِما صَنَعوا قارِعَةٌ أَو تَحُلُّ قَريبًا مِن دارِهِم حَتّىٰ يَأتِيَ وَعدُ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُخلِفُ الميعادَ
31.translation_eng: If only it were a Qurʾān1 whereby the mountains could be moved, or the earth could be toured,2 or the dead could be spoken to … .3 Rather all dispensation belongs to Allah. Have not the faithful yet realised that had Allah wished He would have guided mankind all together? The faithless will continue to be visited by catastrophes because of their doings —or they4 will land near their habitations— until Allah’s promise comes to pass. Indeed Allah does not break His promise.Or ‘Even if it were a Qurʾān.’Or ‘the ground could be split,’ i.e., for making springs and wells.Ellipsis. The phrase omitted is ‘all unbelievers would have embraced the faith.’ Or ‘still they would not have embraced the faith.’ Cf. 6:111.That is, the disasters.
31.transliteration: wa-law ʾanna qurʾānan suyyirat bihi l-jibālu ʾaw quṭṭiʿat bihi l-ʾarḍu ʾaw kullima bihi l-mawtā bal li-llāhi l-ʾamru jamīʿan ʾa-fa-lam yayʾasi lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾan law yashāʾu llāhu la-hadā n-nāsa jamīʿan wa-lā yazālu lladhīna kafarū tuṣībuhum bi-mā ṣanaʿū qāriʿatun ʾaw taḥullu qarīban min dārihim ḥattā yaʾtiya waʿdu llāhi ʾinna llāha lā yukhlifu l-mīʿāda

32.content: وَلَقَدِ استُهزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِن قَبلِكَ فَأَملَيتُ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا ثُمَّ أَخَذتُهُم ۖ فَكَيفَ كانَ عِقابِ
32.translation_eng: Apostles were certainly derided before you. But then I gave respite to those who were faithless, then I seized them; so how was My retribution?
32.transliteration: wa-la-qadi stuhziʾa bi-rusulin min qablika fa-ʾamlaytu li-lladhīna kafarū thumma ʾakhadhtuhum fa-kayfa kāna ʿiqābi

33.content: أَفَمَن هُوَ قائِمٌ عَلىٰ كُلِّ نَفسٍ بِما كَسَبَت ۗ وَجَعَلوا لِلَّهِ شُرَكاءَ قُل سَمّوهُم ۚ أَم تُنَبِّئونَهُ بِما لا يَعلَمُ فِي الأَرضِ أَم بِظاهِرٍ مِنَ القَولِ ۗ بَل زُيِّنَ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا مَكرُهُم وَصُدّوا عَنِ السَّبيلِ ۗ وَمَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن هادٍ
33.translation_eng: Is He who sustains every soul1 in spite of what it earns [comparable to the idols]? And yet they ascribe partners to Allah! Say, ‘Name them!’ Will you inform Him of something He does not know about on the earth, or of [what are] mere words? Rather their scheming is presented as decorous to the faithless, and they have been barred from the [right] way; and whomever Allah leads astray, has no guide.Or ‘Is He who maintains every soul in spite of what it earns.’ Or ‘Is He who is vigilant over every soul as to what it earns.’ See 9:25, where bimā is used in the sense of ‘in spite of.’
33.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man huwa qāʾimun ʿalā kulli nafsin bi-mā kasabat wa-jaʿalū li-llāhi shurakāʾa qul sammūhum ʾam tunabbiʾūnahū bi-mā lā yaʿlamu fī l-ʾarḍi ʾam bi-ẓāhirin mina l-qawli bal zuyyina li-lladhīna kafarū makruhum wa-ṣuddū ʿani s-sabīli wa-man yuḍlili llāhu fa-mā lahū min hādin

34.content: لَهُم عَذابٌ فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۖ وَلَعَذابُ الآخِرَةِ أَشَقُّ ۖ وَما لَهُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن واقٍ
34.translation_eng: There is a punishment for them in the life of this world, and the punishment of the Hereafter will surely be harder, and they have no defender against Allah.
34.transliteration: lahum ʿadhābun fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-la-ʿadhābu l-ʾākhirati ʾashaqqu wa-mā lahum mina llāhi min wāqin

35.content: ۞ مَثَلُ الجَنَّةِ الَّتي وُعِدَ المُتَّقونَ ۖ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ ۖ أُكُلُها دائِمٌ وَظِلُّها ۚ تِلكَ عُقبَى الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا ۖ وَعُقبَى الكافِرينَ النّارُ
35.translation_eng: A description of the paradise promised to the Godwary: streams run in it, its fruits and shade are everlasting. Such is the requital of those who are Godwary; and the requital of the faithless is the Fire.
35.transliteration: mathalu l-jannati llatī wuʿida l-muttaqūna tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru ʾukuluhā dāʾimun wa-ẓilluhā tilka ʿuqbā lladhīna ttaqaw wa-ʿuqbā l-kāfirīna n-nāru

36.content: وَالَّذينَ آتَيناهُمُ الكِتابَ يَفرَحونَ بِما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ ۖ وَمِنَ الأَحزابِ مَن يُنكِرُ بَعضَهُ ۚ قُل إِنَّما أُمِرتُ أَن أَعبُدَ اللَّهَ وَلا أُشرِكَ بِهِ ۚ إِلَيهِ أَدعو وَإِلَيهِ مَآبِ
36.translation_eng: Those whom We have given the Book1 rejoice in what has been sent down to you. Among the factions2 are those who deny a part of it. Say, ‘Indeed I have been commanded to worship Allah and not to ascribe any partner to Him. To Him do I summon [all mankind] and to Him will be my return.’That is, the Jews and the Christians, or the faithful who followed the Prophet (ṣ).That is, from among those belonging to Jewish and Christian sects, or the Arab polytheists.
36.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ʾātaynāhumu l-kitāba yafraḥūna bi-mā ʾunzila ʾilayka wa-mina l-ʾaḥzābi man yunkiru baʿḍahū qul ʾinnamā ʾumirtu ʾan ʾaʿbuda llāha wa-lā ʾushrika bihī ʾilayhi ʾadʿū wa-ʾilayhi maʾābi

37.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَنزَلناهُ حُكمًا عَرَبِيًّا ۚ وَلَئِنِ اتَّبَعتَ أَهواءَهُم بَعدَما جاءَكَ مِنَ العِلمِ ما لَكَ مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلا واقٍ
37.translation_eng: Thus We have sent it down as a dispensation in Arabic; and should you follow their desires after the knowledge that has come to you, you shall have against Allah neither any guardian nor any defender.1Cf. 2:120, 145; 5:48, 49; 23:71; 42:15.
37.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika ʾanzalnāhu ḥukman ʿarabiyyan wa-la-ʾini ttabaʿta ʾahwāʾahum baʿda mā jāʾaka mina l-ʿilmi mā laka mina llāhi min waliyyin wa-lā wāqin

38.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا رُسُلًا مِن قَبلِكَ وَجَعَلنا لَهُم أَزواجًا وَذُرِّيَّةً ۚ وَما كانَ لِرَسولٍ أَن يَأتِيَ بِآيَةٍ إِلّا بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ ۗ لِكُلِّ أَجَلٍ كِتابٌ
38.translation_eng: Certainly We have sent apostles before you, and We appointed for them wives and descendants; and an apostle may not bring a sign except by Allah’s leave. There is a written [schedule] for every term:
38.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā rusulan min qablika wa-jaʿalnā lahum ʾazwājan wa-dhurriyyatan wa-mā kāna li-rasūlin ʾan yaʾtiya bi-ʾāyatin ʾillā bi-ʾidhni llāhi li-kulli ʾajalin kitābun

39.content: يَمحُو اللَّهُ ما يَشاءُ وَيُثبِتُ ۖ وَعِندَهُ أُمُّ الكِتابِ
39.translation_eng: Allah effaces and confirms whatever He wishes and with Him is the Mother Book.1Cf. 43:4.
39.transliteration: yamḥū llāhu mā yashāʾu wa-yuthbitu wa-ʿindahū ʾummu l-kitābi

40.content: وَإِن ما نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعضَ الَّذي نَعِدُهُم أَو نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِنَّما عَلَيكَ البَلاغُ وَعَلَينَا الحِسابُ
40.translation_eng: Whether We show you a part of what We promise them,1 or take you away [before that], your duty is only to communicate, and it is for Us to do the reckoning.That is, the punishment.
40.transliteration: wa-ʾin mā nuriyannaka baʿḍa lladhī naʿiduhum ʾaw natawaffayannaka fa-ʾinnamā ʿalayka l-balāghu wa-ʿalaynā l-ḥisābu

41.content: أَوَلَم يَرَوا أَنّا نَأتِي الأَرضَ نَنقُصُها مِن أَطرافِها ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَحكُمُ لا مُعَقِّبَ لِحُكمِهِ ۚ وَهُوَ سَريعُ الحِسابِ
41.translation_eng: Have they not seen how We visit the land diminishing it at its edges? Allah judges, and there is none who may repeal His judgement, and He is swift at reckoning.
41.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾannā naʾtī l-ʾarḍa nanquṣuhā min ʾaṭrāfihā wa-llāhu yaḥkumu lā muʿaqqiba li-ḥukmihī wa-huwa sarīʿu l-ḥisābi

42.content: وَقَد مَكَرَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم فَلِلَّهِ المَكرُ جَميعًا ۖ يَعلَمُ ما تَكسِبُ كُلُّ نَفسٍ ۗ وَسَيَعلَمُ الكُفّارُ لِمَن عُقبَى الدّارِ
42.translation_eng: Those who were before them [also] schemed;1 yet all devising belongs to Allah. He knows what every soul earns. Soon the faithless will know in whose favour the outcome of that abode will be.Ellipsis. The omitted phrase is ‘but their plotting was of no avail to them.’
42.transliteration: wa-qad makara lladhīna min qablihim fa-li-llāhi l-makru jamīʿan yaʿlamu mā taksibu kullu nafsin wa-sa-yaʿlamu l-kuffāru li-man ʿuqbā d-dāri

43.content: وَيَقولُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَستَ مُرسَلًا ۚ قُل كَفىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهيدًا بَيني وَبَينَكُم وَمَن عِندَهُ عِلمُ الكِتابِ
43.translation_eng: The faithless say, ‘You have not been sent [by Allah].’ Say, ‘Allah suffices as a witness between me and you, and he who possesses the knowledge of the Book.’
43.transliteration: wa-yaqūlu lladhīna kafarū lasta mursalan qul kafā bi-llāhi shahīdan baynī wa-baynakum wa-man ʿindahū ʿilmu l-kitābi

14.description: The surah that records the prayer of Abraham for the security and perpetual godliness of the barren valley of Mecca, when, at God’s command, he settled his beloved wife Hagar and first son Ishmael there, in order to establish the perennial rites of the prayer, as well as other forms of worship, for all time on earth. It is named after Abraham, whose prayer appears in verse 35 . Throughout the surah the ungrateful are condemned, and the grateful commended. Abraham also asks that he and his descendants may be protected from idol-worship. This serves to remind the Meccans that they should shun the worship of idols.

1.content: الر ۚ كِتابٌ أَنزَلناهُ إِلَيكَ لِتُخرِجَ النّاسَ مِنَ الظُّلُماتِ إِلَى النّورِ بِإِذنِ رَبِّهِم إِلىٰ صِراطِ العَزيزِ الحَميدِ
1.translation_eng: Alif, Lām, Rā. [This is] a Book We have sent down to you that you may bring mankind out from darkness into light, by the command of their Lord, to the path of the All-mighty, the All-laudable
1.transliteration: a-l-r (ʾalif lām rā) kitābun ʾanzalnāhu ʾilayka li-tukhrija n-nāsa mina ẓ-ẓulumāti ʾilā n-nūri bi-ʾidhni rabbihim ʾilā ṣirāṭi l-ʿazīzi l-ḥamīdi

2.content: اللَّهِ الَّذي لَهُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ ۗ وَوَيلٌ لِلكافِرينَ مِن عَذابٍ شَديدٍ
2.translation_eng: —Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And woe to the faithless for a severe punishment
2.transliteration: allāhi lladhī lahū mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi wa-waylun li-l-kāfirīna min ʿadhābin shadīdin-i

3.content: الَّذينَ يَستَحِبّونَ الحَياةَ الدُّنيا عَلَى الآخِرَةِ وَيَصُدّونَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَيَبغونَها عِوَجًا ۚ أُولٰئِكَ في ضَلالٍ بَعيدٍ
3.translation_eng: —those who prefer the life of this world to the Hereafter, and bar [others] from the way of Allah, and seek to make it crooked. They are in extreme error.
3.transliteration: alladhīna yastaḥibbūna l-ḥayāta d-dunyā ʿalā l-ʾākhirati wa-yaṣuddūna ʿan sabīli llāhi wa-yabghūnahā ʿiwajan ʾulāʾika fī ḍalālin baʿīdin

4.content: وَما أَرسَلنا مِن رَسولٍ إِلّا بِلِسانِ قَومِهِ لِيُبَيِّنَ لَهُم ۖ فَيُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَهدي مَن يَشاءُ ۚ وَهُوَ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
4.translation_eng: We did not send any apostle except with the language of his people, so that he might make [Our messages] clear to them. Then Allah leads astray whomever He wishes, and He guides whomsoever He wishes, and He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.
4.transliteration: wa-mā ʾarsalnā min rasūlin ʾillā bi-lisāni qawmihī li-yubayyina lahum fa-yuḍillu llāhu man yashāʾu wa-yahdī man yashāʾu wa-huwa l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

5.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا موسىٰ بِآياتِنا أَن أَخرِج قَومَكَ مِنَ الظُّلُماتِ إِلَى النّورِ وَذَكِّرهُم بِأَيّامِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِكُلِّ صَبّارٍ شَكورٍ
5.translation_eng: Certainly We sent Moses with Our signs: ‘Bring your people out from darkness into light and remind them of Allah’s [holy] days. There are indeed signs in that for every patient and grateful [servant].’
5.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā mūsā bi-ʾāyātinā ʾan ʾakhrij qawmaka mina ẓ-ẓulumāti ʾilā n-nūri wa-dhakkirhum bi-ʾayyāmi llāhi ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-kulli ṣabbārin shakūrin

6.content: وَإِذ قالَ موسىٰ لِقَومِهِ اذكُروا نِعمَةَ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم إِذ أَنجاكُم مِن آلِ فِرعَونَ يَسومونَكُم سوءَ العَذابِ وَيُذَبِّحونَ أَبناءَكُم وَيَستَحيونَ نِساءَكُم ۚ وَفي ذٰلِكُم بَلاءٌ مِن رَبِّكُم عَظيمٌ
6.translation_eng: When Moses said to his people, ‘Remember Allah’s blessing upon you when He delivered you from Pharaoh’s clan who inflicted a terrible torment on you, and slaughtered your sons and spared your women, and in that there was a great test from your Lord.’
6.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qāla mūsā li-qawmihi dhkurū niʿmata llāhi ʿalaykum ʾidh ʾanjākum min ʾāli firʿawna yasūmūnakum sūʾa l-ʿadhābi wa-yudhabbiḥūna ʾabnāʾakum wa-yastaḥyūna nisāʾakum wa-fī dhālikum balāʾun min rabbikum ʿaẓīmun

7.content: وَإِذ تَأَذَّنَ رَبُّكُم لَئِن شَكَرتُم لَأَزيدَنَّكُم ۖ وَلَئِن كَفَرتُم إِنَّ عَذابي لَشَديدٌ
7.translation_eng: And when your Lord proclaimed, ‘If you are grateful, I will surely enhance you [in blessing], but if you are ungrateful, My punishment is indeed severe.’
7.transliteration: wa-ʾidh taʾadhdhana rabbukum la-ʾin shakartum la-ʾazīdannakum wa-la-ʾin kafartum ʾinna ʿadhābī la-shadīdun

8.content: وَقالَ موسىٰ إِن تَكفُروا أَنتُم وَمَن فِي الأَرضِ جَميعًا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَغَنِيٌّ حَميدٌ
8.translation_eng: And Moses said, ‘Should you be faithless —you and everyone on the earth, all together— indeed Allah is all-sufficient, all-laudable.’
8.transliteration: wa-qāla mūsā ʾin takfurū ʾantum wa-man fī l-ʾarḍi jamīʿan fa-ʾinna llāha la-ghaniyyun ḥamīdun

9.content: أَلَم يَأتِكُم نَبَأُ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِكُم قَومِ نوحٍ وَعادٍ وَثَمودَ ۛ وَالَّذينَ مِن بَعدِهِم ۛ لا يَعلَمُهُم إِلَّا اللَّهُ ۚ جاءَتهُم رُسُلُهُم بِالبَيِّناتِ فَرَدّوا أَيدِيَهُم في أَفواهِهِم وَقالوا إِنّا كَفَرنا بِما أُرسِلتُم بِهِ وَإِنّا لَفي شَكٍّ مِمّا تَدعونَنا إِلَيهِ مُريبٍ
9.translation_eng: Has there not come to you the account of those who were before you —the people of Noah, ʿĀd and Thamūd, and those who were after them, whom no one knows [well] except Allah? Their apostles brought them manifest proofs, but they did not respond to them,1 and said, ‘We disbelieve in what you have been sent with. Indeed we have grave doubts concerning that to which you invite us.’Literally, ‘they put their hands into their mouths,’ an idiomatic expression that has been interpreted variously. See Ṭabrisī and Ṭabarī.
9.transliteration: ʾa-lam yaʾtikum nabaʾu lladhīna min qablikum qawmi nūḥin wa-ʿādin wa-thamūda wa-lladhīna min baʿdihim lā yaʿlamuhum ʾillā llāhu jāʾathum rusuluhum bi-l-bayyināti fa-raddū ʾaydiyahum fī ʾafwāhihim wa-qālū ʾinnā kafarnā bi-mā ʾursiltum bihī wa-ʾinnā la-fī shakkin mimmā tadʿūnanā ʾilayhi murībin

10.content: ۞ قالَت رُسُلُهُم أَفِي اللَّهِ شَكٌّ فاطِرِ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ يَدعوكُم لِيَغفِرَ لَكُم مِن ذُنوبِكُم وَيُؤَخِّرَكُم إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۚ قالوا إِن أَنتُم إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُنا تُريدونَ أَن تَصُدّونا عَمّا كانَ يَعبُدُ آباؤُنا فَأتونا بِسُلطانٍ مُبينٍ
10.translation_eng: Their apostles said, ‘Is there any doubt about Allah, the originator of the heavens and the earth?! He calls you to forgive you a part of your sins, and grants you respite until a specified time.’1 They said, ‘You are nothing but humans like us who desire to bar us from what our fathers used to worship. So bring us a manifest authority.’Or ‘for a specified term.’
10.transliteration: qālat rusuluhum ʾa-fī llāhi shakkun fāṭiri s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi yadʿūkum li-yaghfira lakum min dhunūbikum wa-yuʾakhkhirakum ʾilā ʾajalin musamman qālū ʾin ʾantum ʾillā basharun mithlunā turīdūna ʾan taṣuddūnā ʿammā kāna yaʿbudu ʾābāʾunā fa-ʾtūnā bi-sulṭānin mubīnin

11.content: قالَت لَهُم رُسُلُهُم إِن نَحنُ إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُكُم وَلٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ يَمُنُّ عَلىٰ مَن يَشاءُ مِن عِبادِهِ ۖ وَما كانَ لَنا أَن نَأتِيَكُم بِسُلطانٍ إِلّا بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَليَتَوَكَّلِ المُؤمِنونَ
11.translation_eng: Their apostles said to them, ‘Indeed we are just human beings like yourselves; but Allah favours whomever of His servants that He wishes. We may not bring you an authority except by Allah’s leave, and in Allah let all the faithful put their trust.
11.transliteration: qālat lahum rusuluhum ʾin naḥnu ʾillā basharun mithlukum wa-lākinna llāha yamunnu ʿalā man yashāʾu min ʿibādihī wa-mā kāna lanā ʾan naʾtiyakum bi-sulṭānin ʾillā bi-ʾidhni llāhi wa-ʿalā llāhi fa-l-yatawakkali l-muʾminūna

12.content: وَما لَنا أَلّا نَتَوَكَّلَ عَلَى اللَّهِ وَقَد هَدانا سُبُلَنا ۚ وَلَنَصبِرَنَّ عَلىٰ ما آذَيتُمونا ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَليَتَوَكَّلِ المُتَوَكِّلونَ
12.translation_eng: And why should we not put our trust in Allah, seeing that He has guided us in our ways? Surely, we will put up patiently with whatever torment you may inflict upon us, and in Allah let all the trusting put their trust.’
12.transliteration: wa-mā lanā ʾallā natawakkala ʿalā llāhi wa-qad hadānā subulanā wa-la-naṣbiranna ʿalā mā ʾādhaytumūnā wa-ʿalā llāhi fa-l-yatawakkali l-mutawakkilūna

13.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لِرُسُلِهِم لَنُخرِجَنَّكُم مِن أَرضِنا أَو لَتَعودُنَّ في مِلَّتِنا ۖ فَأَوحىٰ إِلَيهِم رَبُّهُم لَنُهلِكَنَّ الظّالِمينَ
13.translation_eng: But the faithless said to their apostles, ‘Surely we will expel you from our land, or you should revert to our creed.’ Thereat their Lord revealed to them: ‘We will surely destroy the wrongdoers,
13.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna kafarū li-rusulihim la-nukhrijannakum min ʾarḍinā ʾaw la-taʿūdunna fī millatinā fa-ʾawḥā ʾilayhim rabbuhum la-nuhlikanna ẓ-ẓālimīna

14.content: وَلَنُسكِنَنَّكُمُ الأَرضَ مِن بَعدِهِم ۚ ذٰلِكَ لِمَن خافَ مَقامي وَخافَ وَعيدِ
14.translation_eng: and surely We will settle you in the land after them. This [promise] is for someone who is awed to stand before Me and fears My threat.’
14.transliteration: wa-la-nuskinannakumu l-ʾarḍa min baʿdihim dhālika li-man khāfa maqāmī wa-khāfa waʿīdi

15.content: وَاستَفتَحوا وَخابَ كُلُّ جَبّارٍ عَنيدٍ
15.translation_eng: They1 prayed for victory2 [against the infidels], and every obdurate tyrant has failed,That is, the apostles.Or ‘verdict;’ that is, the verdict of Allah against the unbelievers.
15.transliteration: wa-staftaḥū wa-khāba kullu jabbārin ʿanīdin

16.content: مِن وَرائِهِ جَهَنَّمُ وَيُسقىٰ مِن ماءٍ صَديدٍ
16.translation_eng: with hell lying ahead of him,1 [where] he shall be given to drink of a purulent fluid,That is, with hell waiting for him.
16.transliteration: min warāʾihī jahannamu wa-yusqā min māʾin ṣadīdin

17.content: يَتَجَرَّعُهُ وَلا يَكادُ يُسيغُهُ وَيَأتيهِ المَوتُ مِن كُلِّ مَكانٍ وَما هُوَ بِمَيِّتٍ ۖ وَمِن وَرائِهِ عَذابٌ غَليظٌ
17.translation_eng: gulping it down, but hardly swallowing it: death will assail him from every side, but he will not die, and there is [yet] a harsh punishment ahead of him.
17.transliteration: yatajarraʿuhū wa-lā yakādu yusīghuhū wa-yaʾtīhi l-mawtu min kulli makānin wa-mā huwa bi-mayyitin wa-min warāʾihī ʿadhābun ghalīẓun

18.content: مَثَلُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِرَبِّهِم ۖ أَعمالُهُم كَرَمادٍ اشتَدَّت بِهِ الرّيحُ في يَومٍ عاصِفٍ ۖ لا يَقدِرونَ مِمّا كَسَبوا عَلىٰ شَيءٍ ۚ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الضَّلالُ البَعيدُ
18.translation_eng: A parable of those who defy their Lord: their deeds are like ashes over which the wind blows hard on a tempestuous day: they have no power over anything they have earned. That is extreme error.
18.transliteration: mathalu lladhīna kafarū bi-rabbihim ʾaʿmāluhum ka-ramādin-i shtaddat bihi r-rīhu fī yawmin ʿāṣifin lā yaqdirūna mimmā kasabū ʿalā shayʾin dhālika huwa ḍ-ḍalālu l-baʿīdu

19.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ بِالحَقِّ ۚ إِن يَشَأ يُذهِبكُم وَيَأتِ بِخَلقٍ جَديدٍ
19.translation_eng: Have you not regarded that Allah created the heavens and the earth with reason? If He wishes, He will take you away, and bring about a new creation,
19.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾanna llāha khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa bi-l-ḥaqqi ʾin yashaʾ yudhhibkum wa-yaʾti bi-khalqin jadīdin

20.content: وَما ذٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ بِعَزيزٍ
20.translation_eng: and that is not a hard thing for Allah.
20.transliteration: wa-mā dhālika ʿalā llāhi bi-ʿazīzin

21.content: وَبَرَزوا لِلَّهِ جَميعًا فَقالَ الضُّعَفاءُ لِلَّذينَ استَكبَروا إِنّا كُنّا لَكُم تَبَعًا فَهَل أَنتُم مُغنونَ عَنّا مِن عَذابِ اللَّهِ مِن شَيءٍ ۚ قالوا لَو هَدانَا اللَّهُ لَهَدَيناكُم ۖ سَواءٌ عَلَينا أَجَزِعنا أَم صَبَرنا ما لَنا مِن مَحيصٍ
21.translation_eng: Together they will be presented before Allah. Then those who were weak will say to those who were arrogant, ‘Indeed we were your followers. So will you avail us against Allah’s punishment in any wise?’ They will say, ‘Had Allah guided us, surely we would have guided you. It is the same to us whether we are restless or patient: there is no escape for us.’
21.transliteration: wa-barazū li-llāhi jamīʿan fa-qāla ḍ-ḍuʿafāʾu li-lladhīna stakbarū ʾinnā kunnā lakum tabaʿan fa-hal ʾantum mughnūna ʿannā min ʿadhābi llāhi min shayʾin qālū law hadānā llāhu la-hadaynākum sawāʾun ʿalaynā ʾa-jaziʿnā ʾam ṣabarnā mā lanā min maḥīṣin

22.content: وَقالَ الشَّيطانُ لَمّا قُضِيَ الأَمرُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ وَعَدَكُم وَعدَ الحَقِّ وَوَعَدتُكُم فَأَخلَفتُكُم ۖ وَما كانَ لِيَ عَلَيكُم مِن سُلطانٍ إِلّا أَن دَعَوتُكُم فَاستَجَبتُم لي ۖ فَلا تَلوموني وَلوموا أَنفُسَكُم ۖ ما أَنا بِمُصرِخِكُم وَما أَنتُم بِمُصرِخِيَّ ۖ إِنّي كَفَرتُ بِما أَشرَكتُمونِ مِن قَبلُ ۗ إِنَّ الظّالِمينَ لَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
22.translation_eng: When the matter is all over, Satan will say, ‘Indeed Allah made you a promise that was true and I [too] made you a promise, but I failed you. I had no authority over you, except that I called you and you responded to me. So do not blame me, but blame yourselves. I cannot respond to your distress calls, neither can you respond to my distress calls. Indeed I disavow your taking me for [Allah’s] partner aforetime. There is indeed a painful punishment for the wrongdoers.’
22.transliteration: wa-qāla sh-shayṭānu lammā quḍiya l-ʾamru ʾinna llāha waʿadakum waʿda l-ḥaqqi wa-waʿadtukum fa-ʾakhlaftukum wa-mā kāna liya ʿalaykum min sulṭānin ʾillā ʾan daʿawtukum fa-stajabtum lī fa-lā talūmūnī wa-lūmū ʾanfusakum mā ʾana bi-muṣrikhikum wa-mā ʾantum bi-muṣrikhiyya ʾinnī kafartu bi-mā ʾashraktumūni min qablu ʾinna ẓ-ẓālimīna lahum ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

23.content: وَأُدخِلَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ خالِدينَ فيها بِإِذنِ رَبِّهِم ۖ تَحِيَّتُهُم فيها سَلامٌ
23.translation_eng: Those who have faith and do righteous deeds will be admitted into gardens with streams running in them, to remain in them [forever], by the leave of their Lord. Their greeting therein will be ‘Peace!’
23.transliteration: wa-ʾudkhila lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru khālidīna fīhā bi-ʾidhni rabbihim taḥiyyatuhum fīhā salāmun

24.content: أَلَم تَرَ كَيفَ ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا كَلِمَةً طَيِّبَةً كَشَجَرَةٍ طَيِّبَةٍ أَصلُها ثابِتٌ وَفَرعُها فِي السَّماءِ
24.translation_eng: Have you not regarded how Allah has drawn a parable? A good word is like a good tree: its roots are steady and its branches are in the sky.
24.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara kayfa ḍaraba llāhu mathalan kalimatan ṭayyibatan ka-shajaratin ṭayyibatin ʾaṣluhā thābitun wa-farʿuhā fī s-samāʾi

25.content: تُؤتي أُكُلَها كُلَّ حينٍ بِإِذنِ رَبِّها ۗ وَيَضرِبُ اللَّهُ الأَمثالَ لِلنّاسِ لَعَلَّهُم يَتَذَكَّرونَ
25.translation_eng: It gives its fruit every season by the leave of its Lord. Allah draws these parables for mankind so that they may take admonition.
25.transliteration: tuʾtī ʾukulahā kulla ḥīnin bi-ʾidhni rabbihā wa-yaḍribu llāhu l-ʾamthāla li-n-nāsi laʿallahum yatadhakkarūna

26.content: وَمَثَلُ كَلِمَةٍ خَبيثَةٍ كَشَجَرَةٍ خَبيثَةٍ اجتُثَّت مِن فَوقِ الأَرضِ ما لَها مِن قَرارٍ
26.translation_eng: And the parable of a bad word is that of a bad tree: uprooted from the ground, it has no stability.
26.transliteration: wa-mathalu kalimatin khabīthatin ka-shajaratin khabīthatin-i jtuththat min fawqi l-ʾarḍi mā lahā min qarārin

27.content: يُثَبِّتُ اللَّهُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا بِالقَولِ الثّابِتِ فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا وَفِي الآخِرَةِ ۖ وَيُضِلُّ اللَّهُ الظّالِمينَ ۚ وَيَفعَلُ اللَّهُ ما يَشاءُ
27.translation_eng: Allah fortifies those who have faith with an immutable word in the life of this world and in the Hereafter, and Allah leads astray the wrongdoers, and Allah does whatever He wishes.
27.transliteration: yuthabbitu llāhu lladhīna ʾāmanū bi-l-qawli th-thābiti fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-fī l-ʾākhirati wa-yuḍillu llāhu ẓ-ẓālimīna wa-yafʿalu llāhu mā yashāʾu

28.content: ۞ أَلَم تَرَ إِلَى الَّذينَ بَدَّلوا نِعمَتَ اللَّهِ كُفرًا وَأَحَلّوا قَومَهُم دارَ البَوارِ
28.translation_eng: Have you not regarded those who have changed Allah’s blessing with ingratitude, and landed their people in the house of ruin?
28.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾilā lladhīna baddalū niʿmata llāhi kufran wa-ʾaḥallū qawmahum dāra l-bawāri

29.content: جَهَنَّمَ يَصلَونَها ۖ وَبِئسَ القَرارُ
29.translation_eng: —hell, which they shall enter, and it is an evil abode!
29.transliteration: jahannama yaṣlawnahā wa-biʾsa l-qarāru

30.content: وَجَعَلوا لِلَّهِ أَندادًا لِيُضِلّوا عَن سَبيلِهِ ۗ قُل تَمَتَّعوا فَإِنَّ مَصيرَكُم إِلَى النّارِ
30.translation_eng: They have set up equals to Allah, to lead [people] astray from His way. Say, ‘Enjoy [for a while], for indeed your destination is hellfire!’
30.transliteration: wa-jaʿalū li-llāhi ʾandādan li-yuḍillū ʿan sabīlihī qul tamattaʿū fa-ʾinna maṣīrakum ʾilā n-nāri

31.content: قُل لِعِبادِيَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا يُقيمُوا الصَّلاةَ وَيُنفِقوا مِمّا رَزَقناهُم سِرًّا وَعَلانِيَةً مِن قَبلِ أَن يَأتِيَ يَومٌ لا بَيعٌ فيهِ وَلا خِلالٌ
31.translation_eng: Tell My servants who have faith to maintain the prayer and to spend out of what We have provided them with, secretly and openly, before there comes a day on which there will be neither any bargaining nor friendship.
31.transliteration: qul li-ʿibādiya lladhīna ʾāmanū yuqīmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-yunfiqū mimmā razaqnāhum sirran wa-ʿalāniyatan min qabli ʾan yaʾtiya yawmun lā bayʿun fīhi wa-lā khilālun-i

32.content: اللَّهُ الَّذي خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَخرَجَ بِهِ مِنَ الثَّمَراتِ رِزقًا لَكُم ۖ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ الفُلكَ لِتَجرِيَ فِي البَحرِ بِأَمرِهِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ الأَنهارَ
32.translation_eng: It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth, and He sends down water from the sky and with it He brings forth crops for your sustenance. And He disposed the ships for you[r benefit] so that they may sail at sea by His command, and He disposed the rivers for you.
32.transliteration: allāhu lladhī khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-ʾanzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-ʾakhraja bihī mina th-thamarāti rizqan lakum wa-sakhkhara lakumu l-fulka li-tajriya fī l-baḥri bi-ʾamrihī wa-sakhkhara lakumu l-ʾanhāra

33.content: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ الشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ دائِبَينِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ اللَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ
33.translation_eng: He disposed the sun and the moon for you, constant [in their courses], and He disposed the night and the day,
33.transliteration: wa-sakhkhara lakumu sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara dāʾibayni wa-sakhkhara lakumu l-layla wa-n-nahāra

34.content: وَآتاكُم مِن كُلِّ ما سَأَلتُموهُ ۚ وَإِن تَعُدّوا نِعمَتَ اللَّهِ لا تُحصوها ۗ إِنَّ الإِنسانَ لَظَلومٌ كَفّارٌ
34.translation_eng: and He gave you all that you had asked Him.1 If you enumerate Allah’s blessings, you will not be able to count them. Indeed man is most unfair and ungrateful!That is, He provided you with everything demanded by your nature and your original capacities.
34.transliteration: wa-ʾatākum min kulli mā saʾaltumūhu wa-ʾin taʿuddū niʿmata llāhi lā tuḥṣūhā ʾinna l-ʾinsāna la-ẓalūmun kaffārun

35.content: وَإِذ قالَ إِبراهيمُ رَبِّ اجعَل هٰذَا البَلَدَ آمِنًا وَاجنُبني وَبَنِيَّ أَن نَعبُدَ الأَصنامَ
35.translation_eng: When Abraham said, ‘My Lord! Make this city a sanctuary, and save me and my children from worshiping idols.
35.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qāla ʾibrāhīmu rabbi jʿal hādhā l-balada ʾāminan wa-jnubnī wa-baniyya ʾan naʿbuda l-ʾaṣnāma

36.content: رَبِّ إِنَّهُنَّ أَضلَلنَ كَثيرًا مِنَ النّاسِ ۖ فَمَن تَبِعَني فَإِنَّهُ مِنّي ۖ وَمَن عَصاني فَإِنَّكَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
36.translation_eng: My Lord! Indeed they have misled many people. So whoever follows me indeed belongs to me, and as for someone who disobeys me, well, You are indeed all-forgiving, all-merciful.
36.transliteration: rabbi ʾinnahunna ʾaḍlalna kathīran mina n-nāsi fa-man tabiʿanī fa-ʾinnahū minnī wa-man ʿaṣānī fa-ʾinnaka ghafūrun raḥīmun

37.content: رَبَّنا إِنّي أَسكَنتُ مِن ذُرِّيَّتي بِوادٍ غَيرِ ذي زَرعٍ عِندَ بَيتِكَ المُحَرَّمِ رَبَّنا لِيُقيمُوا الصَّلاةَ فَاجعَل أَفئِدَةً مِنَ النّاسِ تَهوي إِلَيهِم وَارزُقهُم مِنَ الثَّمَراتِ لَعَلَّهُم يَشكُرونَ
37.translation_eng: Our Lord! I have settled part of my descendants in a barren valley, by Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may maintain the prayer. So make the hearts of a part of the people fond of them, and provide them with fruits, so that they may give thanks.
37.transliteration: rabbanā ʾinnī ʾaskantu min dhurriyyatī bi-wādin ghayri dhī zarʿin ʿinda baytika l-muḥarrami rabbanā li-yuqīmū ṣ-ṣalāta fa-jʿal ʾafʾidatan mina n-nāsi tahwī ʾilayhim wa-rzuqhum mina th-thamarāti laʿallahum yashkurūna

38.content: رَبَّنا إِنَّكَ تَعلَمُ ما نُخفي وَما نُعلِنُ ۗ وَما يَخفىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ مِن شَيءٍ فِي الأَرضِ وَلا فِي السَّماءِ
38.translation_eng: Our Lord! Indeed You know whatever we hide and whatever we disclose, and nothing is hidden from Allah on the earth or in the sky.
38.transliteration: rabbanā ʾinnaka taʿlamu mā nukhfī wa-mā nuʿlinu wa-mā yakhfā ʿalā llāhi min shayʾin fī l-ʾarḍi wa-lā fī s-samāʾi

39.content: الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذي وَهَبَ لي عَلَى الكِبَرِ إِسماعيلَ وَإِسحاقَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبّي لَسَميعُ الدُّعاءِ
39.translation_eng: All praise belongs to Allah, who, despite [my] old age, gave me Ishmael and Isaac. Indeed my Lord hears all supplications.
39.transliteration: al-ḥamdu li-llāhi lladhī wahaba lī ʿalā l-kibari ʾismāʿīla wa-ʾisḥāqa ʾinna rabbī la-samīʿu d-duʿāʾi

40.content: رَبِّ اجعَلني مُقيمَ الصَّلاةِ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتي ۚ رَبَّنا وَتَقَبَّل دُعاءِ
40.translation_eng: My Lord! Make me a maintainer of the prayer, and my descendants [too]. Our Lord, accept my supplication.
40.transliteration: rabbi jʿalnī muqīma ṣ-ṣalāti wa-min dhurriyyatī rabbanā wa-taqabbal duʿāʾi

41.content: رَبَّنَا اغفِر لي وَلِوالِدَيَّ وَلِلمُؤمِنينَ يَومَ يَقومُ الحِسابُ
41.translation_eng: Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents, and all the faithful, on the day when the reckoning is held.’
41.transliteration: rabbanā ghfir lī wa-li-wālidayya wa-li-l-muʾminīna yawma yaqūmu l-ḥisābu

42.content: وَلا تَحسَبَنَّ اللَّهَ غافِلًا عَمّا يَعمَلُ الظّالِمونَ ۚ إِنَّما يُؤَخِّرُهُم لِيَومٍ تَشخَصُ فيهِ الأَبصارُ
42.translation_eng: Do not suppose that Allah is oblivious to what the wrongdoers are doing. He is only granting them respite until the day when the eyes will be glazed.
42.transliteration: wa-lā taḥsabanna llāha ghāfilan ʿammā yaʿmalu ẓ-ẓālimūna ʾinnamā yuʾakhkhiruhum li-yawmin tashkhaṣu fīhi l-ʾabṣāru

43.content: مُهطِعينَ مُقنِعي رُءوسِهِم لا يَرتَدُّ إِلَيهِم طَرفُهُم ۖ وَأَفئِدَتُهُم هَواءٌ
43.translation_eng: Scrambling with their heads upturned, there will be a fixed gaze in their eyes and their hearts will be vacant.
43.transliteration: muhṭiʿīna muqniʿī ruʾūsihim lā yartaddu ʾilayhim ṭarfuhum wa-ʾafʾidatuhum hawāʾun

44.content: وَأَنذِرِ النّاسَ يَومَ يَأتيهِمُ العَذابُ فَيَقولُ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا رَبَّنا أَخِّرنا إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ قَريبٍ نُجِب دَعوَتَكَ وَنَتَّبِعِ الرُّسُلَ ۗ أَوَلَم تَكونوا أَقسَمتُم مِن قَبلُ ما لَكُم مِن زَوالٍ
44.translation_eng: Warn the people of the day when the punishment will overtake them, whereat the wrongdoers will say, ‘Our Lord! Respite us for a brief while so that we may respond to Your call, and follow the apostles.’1 [They will be told,] ‘Did you not use to swear earlier that there would be no reverse for you,The appeal for respite made by the wrongdoers indicates that the punishment mentioned here is one that will befall them in the life of this world.
44.transliteration: wa-ʾandhiri n-nāsa yawma yaʾtīhimu l-ʿadhābu fa-yaqūlu lladhīna ẓalamū rabbanā ʾakhkhirnā ʾilā ʾajalin qarībin nujib daʿwataka wa-nattabiʿi r-rusula ʾa-wa-lam takūnū ʾaqsamtum min qablu mā lakum min zawālin

45.content: وَسَكَنتُم في مَساكِنِ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا أَنفُسَهُم وَتَبَيَّنَ لَكُم كَيفَ فَعَلنا بِهِم وَضَرَبنا لَكُمُ الأَمثالَ
45.translation_eng: while you dwelt in the dwellings of those who had wronged themselves [before], and it had been made clear to you how We had dealt with them [before you], and We had [also] cited examples for you?’
45.transliteration: wa-sakantum fī masākini lladhīna ẓalamū ʾanfusahum wa-tabayyana lakum kayfa faʿalnā bihim wa-ḍarabnā lakumu l-ʾamthāla

46.content: وَقَد مَكَروا مَكرَهُم وَعِندَ اللَّهِ مَكرُهُم وَإِن كانَ مَكرُهُم لِتَزولَ مِنهُ الجِبالُ
46.translation_eng: They certainly devised their schemes, but their schemes are known to Allah, and their schemes are not such as to dislodge the mountains.1According to an alternate reading (with la-tazūlu), the meaning will be ‘their schemes are indeed such as to dislodge (or annihilate) [even] the mountains.’
46.transliteration: wa-qad makarū makrahum wa-ʿinda llāhi makruhum wa-ʾin kāna makruhum li-tazūla minhu l-jibālu

47.content: فَلا تَحسَبَنَّ اللَّهَ مُخلِفَ وَعدِهِ رُسُلَهُ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزيزٌ ذُو انتِقامٍ
47.translation_eng: So do not suppose that Allah will break His promise to His apostles. Indeed Allah is all-mighty, avenger.
47.transliteration: fa-lā taḥsabanna llāha mukhlifa waʿdihī rusulahū ʾinna llāha ʿazīzun dhū ntiqāmin

48.content: يَومَ تُبَدَّلُ الأَرضُ غَيرَ الأَرضِ وَالسَّماواتُ ۖ وَبَرَزوا لِلَّهِ الواحِدِ القَهّارِ
48.translation_eng: The day the earth is transformed into another earth and the heavens [as well], and they are presented before Allah, the One, the All-paramount.
48.transliteration: yawma tubaddalu l-ʾarḍu ghayra l-ʾarḍi wa-s-samāwātu wa-barazū li-llāhi l-wāḥidi l-qahhāri

49.content: وَتَرَى المُجرِمينَ يَومَئِذٍ مُقَرَّنينَ فِي الأَصفادِ
49.translation_eng: On that day you will see the guilty bound together in chains,
49.transliteration: wa-tarā l-mujrimīna yawmaʾidhin muqarranīna fī l-ʾaṣfādi

50.content: سَرابيلُهُم مِن قَطِرانٍ وَتَغشىٰ وُجوهَهُمُ النّارُ
50.translation_eng: their garments made of pitch,1 and the Fire covering their faces,Or ‘of molten copper.’
50.transliteration: sarābīluhum min qaṭirānin wa-taghshā wujūhahumu n-nāru

51.content: لِيَجزِيَ اللَّهُ كُلَّ نَفسٍ ما كَسَبَت ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَريعُ الحِسابِ
51.translation_eng: so that Allah may reward every soul for what it has earned.1 Indeed Allah is swift at reckoning.Or, perhaps preferably, ‘so that Allah may requite every soul with what it has earned,’ which implies that deeds are identical with their recompense, or that deeds are their own recompense.
51.transliteration: li-yajziya llāhu kulla nafsin mā kasabat ʾinna llāha sarīʿu l-ḥisābi

52.content: هٰذا بَلاغٌ لِلنّاسِ وَلِيُنذَروا بِهِ وَلِيَعلَموا أَنَّما هُوَ إِلٰهٌ واحِدٌ وَلِيَذَّكَّرَ أُولُو الأَلبابِ
52.translation_eng: This is a proclamation for mankind, so that they may be warned thereby and know that He is indeed the One God, and those who possess intellect may take admonition.
52.transliteration: hādhā balāghun li-n-nāsi wa-li-yundharū bihī wa-li-yaʿlamū ʾannamā huwa ʾilāhun wāḥidun wa-li-yadhdhakkara ʾulū l-ʾalbābi

15.description: The surah that mentions the ancient and might people of Thamūd that lived in a place or region named Ḥijr, and whom God destroyed because they belied with extreme prejudice His miraculous signs and messengers. It takes its name from Ḥijr (mentioned in verse 80). The people of Thamūd are an example of the many who disbelieved and rejected their prophets. Each has its own time for punishment so the Prophet should bear patiently, not grieve over what the disbelievers say, and continue with his worship.The surah is also known as: Stoneland, The Rocky Tract, The Stone Valley.

1.content: الر ۚ تِلكَ آياتُ الكِتابِ وَقُرآنٍ مُبينٍ
1.translation_eng: Alif, Lām, Rā. These are the signs of the Book and a manifest Qurʾān.
1.transliteration: a-l-r (ʾalif lām rā) tilka ʾāyātu l-kitābi wa-qurʾānin mubīnin

2.content: رُبَما يَوَدُّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَو كانوا مُسلِمينَ
2.translation_eng: Much will the faithless wish that they had been muslims.
2.transliteration: rubamā yawaddu lladhīna kafarū law kānū muslimīna

3.content: ذَرهُم يَأكُلوا وَيَتَمَتَّعوا وَيُلهِهِمُ الأَمَلُ ۖ فَسَوفَ يَعلَمونَ
3.translation_eng: Leave them to eat and enjoy and to be diverted by longings. Soon they will know.
3.transliteration: dharhum yaʾkulū wa-yatamattaʿū wa-yulhihimu l-ʿamalu fa-sawfa yaʿlamūna

4.content: وَما أَهلَكنا مِن قَريَةٍ إِلّا وَلَها كِتابٌ مَعلومٌ
4.translation_eng: We did not destroy any town but that it had a known term.
4.transliteration: wa-mā ʾahlaknā min qaryatin ʾillā wa-lahā kitābun maʿlūmun

5.content: ما تَسبِقُ مِن أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَها وَما يَستَأخِرونَ
5.translation_eng: No nation can advance its time nor can it defer it.
5.transliteration: mā tasbiqu min ʾummatin ʾajalahā wa-mā yastaʾkhirūna

6.content: وَقالوا يا أَيُّهَا الَّذي نُزِّلَ عَلَيهِ الذِّكرُ إِنَّكَ لَمَجنونٌ
6.translation_eng: They said, ‘O you, to whom the Reminder has been sent down, you are indeed crazy.
6.transliteration: wa-qālū yā-ʾayyuhā lladhī nuzzila ʿalayhi dh-dhikru ʾinnaka la-majnūnun

7.content: لَو ما تَأتينا بِالمَلائِكَةِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
7.translation_eng: Why do you not bring us the angels should you be truthful?!’
7.transliteration: law mā taʾtīnā bi-l-malāʾikati ʾin kunta mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

8.content: ما نُنَزِّلُ المَلائِكَةَ إِلّا بِالحَقِّ وَما كانوا إِذًا مُنظَرينَ
8.translation_eng: We do not send down the angels except with due reason, and then they will not be granted any respite.
8.transliteration: mā nunazzilu l-malāʾikata ʾillā bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-mā kānū ʾidhan munẓarīna

9.content: إِنّا نَحنُ نَزَّلنَا الذِّكرَ وَإِنّا لَهُ لَحافِظونَ
9.translation_eng: Indeed We have sent down the Reminder,1 and indeed We will preserve it.That is, the Qurʾān.
9.transliteration: ʾinnā naḥnu nazzalnā dh-dhikra wa-ʾinnā lahū la-ḥāfiẓūna

10.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ في شِيَعِ الأَوَّلينَ
10.translation_eng: Certainly We sent [apostles] before you to former communities,
10.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā min qablika fī shiyaʿi l-ʾawwalīna

11.content: وَما يَأتيهِم مِن رَسولٍ إِلّا كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
11.translation_eng: and there did not come to them any apostle but that they used to deride him.
11.transliteration: wa-mā yaʾtīhim min rasūlin ʾillā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

12.content: كَذٰلِكَ نَسلُكُهُ في قُلوبِ المُجرِمينَ
12.translation_eng: That is how We let it pass through the hearts of the guilty:
12.transliteration: ka-dhālika naslukuhū fī qulūbi l-mujrimīna

13.content: لا يُؤمِنونَ بِهِ ۖ وَقَد خَلَت سُنَّةُ الأَوَّلينَ
13.translation_eng: they do not believe in it, and the precedent of the ancients has already passed.
13.transliteration: lā yuʾminūna bihī wa-qad khalat sunnatu l-ʾawwalīna

14.content: وَلَو فَتَحنا عَلَيهِم بابًا مِنَ السَّماءِ فَظَلّوا فيهِ يَعرُجونَ
14.translation_eng: Were We to open for them a gate of the sky, so that they could go on ascending through it,
14.transliteration: wa-law fataḥnā ʿalayhim bāban mina s-samāʾi fa-ẓallū fīhi yaʿrujūna

15.content: لَقالوا إِنَّما سُكِّرَت أَبصارُنا بَل نَحنُ قَومٌ مَسحورونَ
15.translation_eng: they would surely say, ‘Indeed a spell has been cast on our eyes; rather we are a bewitched lot.’
15.transliteration: la-qālū ʾinnamā sukkirat ʾabṣārunā bal naḥnu qawmun masḥūrūna

16.content: وَلَقَد جَعَلنا فِي السَّماءِ بُروجًا وَزَيَّنّاها لِلنّاظِرينَ
16.translation_eng: Certainly We have appointed houses1 in the sky and adorned them for the onlookers,House: One of the 12 parts into which the heavens are divided in astrology. Cf. 25:61; 85:1.
16.transliteration: wa-la-qad jaʿalnā fī s-samāʾi burūjan wa-zayyannāhā li-n-nāẓirīna

17.content: وَحَفِظناها مِن كُلِّ شَيطانٍ رَجيمٍ
17.translation_eng: and We have guarded them from every outcast Satan,
17.transliteration: wa-ḥafiẓnāhā min kulli shayṭānin rajīmin

18.content: إِلّا مَنِ استَرَقَ السَّمعَ فَأَتبَعَهُ شِهابٌ مُبينٌ
18.translation_eng: except someone who may eavesdrop, whereat there pursues him a manifest flame.1Or ‘meteor.’
18.transliteration: ʾillā mani staraqa s-samʿa fa-ʾatbaʿahū shihābun mubīnun

19.content: وَالأَرضَ مَدَدناها وَأَلقَينا فيها رَواسِيَ وَأَنبَتنا فيها مِن كُلِّ شَيءٍ مَوزونٍ
19.translation_eng: And We spread out the earth, and cast in it firm mountains, and We grew in it every kind of balanced thing,
19.transliteration: wa-l-ʾarḍa madadnāhā wa-ʾalqaynā fīhā rawāsiya wa-ʾanbatnā fīhā min kulli shayʾin mawzūnin

20.content: وَجَعَلنا لَكُم فيها مَعايِشَ وَمَن لَستُم لَهُ بِرازِقينَ
20.translation_eng: and made in it [various] means of livelihood for you and for those whom you do not provide for.
20.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā lakum fīhā maʿāyisha wa-man lastum lahū bi-rāziqīna

21.content: وَإِن مِن شَيءٍ إِلّا عِندَنا خَزائِنُهُ وَما نُنَزِّلُهُ إِلّا بِقَدَرٍ مَعلومٍ
21.translation_eng: There is not a thing but that its sources are with Us, and We do not send it down except in a known measure.
21.transliteration: wa-ʾin min shayʾin ʾillā ʿindanā khazāʾinuhū wa-mā nunazziluhū ʾillā bi-qadarin maʿlūmin

22.content: وَأَرسَلنَا الرِّياحَ لَواقِحَ فَأَنزَلنا مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَسقَيناكُموهُ وَما أَنتُم لَهُ بِخازِنينَ
22.translation_eng: And We send the fertilizing winds and send down water from the sky providing it for you to drink and you are not maintainers of its resources.
22.transliteration: wa-ʾarsalnā r-riyāḥa lawāqiḥa fa-ʾanzalnā mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-ʾasqaynākumūhu wa-mā ʾantum lahū bi-khāzinīna

23.content: وَإِنّا لَنَحنُ نُحيي وَنُميتُ وَنَحنُ الوارِثونَ
23.translation_eng: Indeed it is We who give life and bring death and We are the inheritors.
23.transliteration: wa-ʾinnā la-naḥnu nuḥyī wa-numītu wa-naḥnu l-wārithūna

24.content: وَلَقَد عَلِمنَا المُستَقدِمينَ مِنكُم وَلَقَد عَلِمنَا المُستَأخِرينَ
24.translation_eng: Certainly We know the predecessors among you and certainly We know the successors,
24.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʿalimnā l-mustaqdimīna minkum wa-la-qad ʿalimnā l-mustaʾkhirīna

25.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَحشُرُهُم ۚ إِنَّهُ حَكيمٌ عَليمٌ
25.translation_eng: and indeed it is your Lord who will resurrect them. Indeed He is all-wise, all-knowing.
25.transliteration: wa-ʾinna rabbaka huwa yaḥshuruhum ʾinnahū ḥakīmun ʿalīmun

26.content: وَلَقَد خَلَقنَا الإِنسانَ مِن صَلصالٍ مِن حَمَإٍ مَسنونٍ
26.translation_eng: Certainly We created man out of a dry clay1 [drawn] from an aging mud,Or ‘clinking clay,’ that is, giving a clinking sound due to being hard and dry. Cf. 15:28.
26.transliteration: wa-la-qad khalaqnā l-ʾinsāna min ṣalṣālin min ḥamaʾin masnūnin

27.content: وَالجانَّ خَلَقناهُ مِن قَبلُ مِن نارِ السَّمومِ
27.translation_eng: and We created the jinn earlier out of a piercing fire.
27.transliteration: wa-l-jānna khalaqnāhu min qablu min nāri s-samūmi

28.content: وَإِذ قالَ رَبُّكَ لِلمَلائِكَةِ إِنّي خالِقٌ بَشَرًا مِن صَلصالٍ مِن حَمَإٍ مَسنونٍ
28.translation_eng: When your Lord said to the angels, ‘Indeed I am going to create a human out of a dry clay [drawn] from an aging mud.
28.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qāla rabbuka li-l-malāʾikati ʾinnī khāliqun basharan min ṣalṣālin min ḥamaʾin masnūnin

29.content: فَإِذا سَوَّيتُهُ وَنَفَختُ فيهِ مِن روحي فَقَعوا لَهُ ساجِدينَ
29.translation_eng: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My spirit, then fall down in prostration before him.’
29.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā sawwaytuhū wa-nafakhtu fīhi min rūḥī fa-qaʿū lahū sājidīna

30.content: فَسَجَدَ المَلائِكَةُ كُلُّهُم أَجمَعونَ
30.translation_eng: Thereat the angels prostrated, all of them together,
30.transliteration: fa-sajada l-malāʾikatu kulluhum ʾajmaʿūna

31.content: إِلّا إِبليسَ أَبىٰ أَن يَكونَ مَعَ السّاجِدينَ
31.translation_eng: but not Iblis: he refused to be among those who prostrated.
31.transliteration: ʾillā ʾiblīsa ʾabā ʾan yakūna maʿa s-sājidīna

32.content: قالَ يا إِبليسُ ما لَكَ أَلّا تَكونَ مَعَ السّاجِدينَ
32.translation_eng: He said, ‘O Iblis! What kept you from being among those who have prostrated?’
32.transliteration: qāla yā-ʾiblīsu mā laka ʾallā takūna maʿa s-sājidīna

33.content: قالَ لَم أَكُن لِأَسجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقتَهُ مِن صَلصالٍ مِن حَمَإٍ مَسنونٍ
33.translation_eng: Said he, ‘I will not prostrate before a human whom You have created out of a dry clay [drawn] from an aging mud.’
33.transliteration: qāla lam ʾakun li-ʾasjuda li-basharin khalaqtahū min ṣalṣālin min ḥamaʾin masnūnin

34.content: قالَ فَاخرُج مِنها فَإِنَّكَ رَجيمٌ
34.translation_eng: He said, ‘Begone hence, for you are indeed an outcast,
34.transliteration: qāla fa-khruj minhā fa-ʾinnaka rajīmun

35.content: وَإِنَّ عَلَيكَ اللَّعنَةَ إِلىٰ يَومِ الدّينِ
35.translation_eng: and indeed the curse shall lie on you until the Day of Retribution.’1Or ‘the Day of Judgement.’
35.transliteration: wa-ʾinna ʿalayka l-laʿnata ʾilā yawmi d-dīni

36.content: قالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرني إِلىٰ يَومِ يُبعَثونَ
36.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! Respite me till the day they will be resurrected.’
36.transliteration: qāla rabbi fa-ʾanẓirnī ʾilā yawmi yubʿathūna

37.content: قالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ المُنظَرينَ
37.translation_eng: Said He, ‘You are indeed among the reprieved
37.transliteration: qāla fa-ʾinnaka mina l-munẓarīna

38.content: إِلىٰ يَومِ الوَقتِ المَعلومِ
38.translation_eng: until the day of the known time.’
38.transliteration: ʾilā yawmi l-waqti l-maʿlūmi

39.content: قالَ رَبِّ بِما أَغوَيتَني لَأُزَيِّنَنَّ لَهُم فِي الأَرضِ وَلَأُغوِيَنَّهُم أَجمَعينَ
39.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! As You have consigned me to perversity, I will surely glamorize [evil] for them on the earth, and I will surely pervert them, all
39.transliteration: qāla rabbi bi-mā ʾaghwaytanī la-ʾuzayyinanna lahum fī l-ʾarḍi wa-la-ʾughwiyannahum ʾajmaʿīna

40.content: إِلّا عِبادَكَ مِنهُمُ المُخلَصينَ
40.translation_eng: except Your exclusive servants among them.’
40.transliteration: ʾillā ʿibādaka minhumu l-mukhlaṣīna

41.content: قالَ هٰذا صِراطٌ عَلَيَّ مُستَقيمٌ
41.translation_eng: He said, ‘This is the path [leading] straight to Me.1Read alternatively as hādhā ṣirāṭun ʿalīyyun mustaqīm, meaning ‘this is an exalted straight path.’ This reading is narrated from al-Imam al-Ṣādiq (Majmaʿ al-Bayān) and from thirteen other authorities, among them Yaʿqūb, al-Ḍaḥḥāk, Mujāhid, Qatādah, and Ibn Sīrīn. (See Muʿjam al-Qirāʾāt al-Qurʾāniyyah).
41.transliteration: qāla hādhā ṣirāṭun ʿalayya mustaqīmun

42.content: إِنَّ عِبادي لَيسَ لَكَ عَلَيهِم سُلطانٌ إِلّا مَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الغاوينَ
42.translation_eng: Indeed as for My servants you do not have any authority over them, except the perverse who follow you,
42.transliteration: ʾinna ʿibādī laysa laka ʿalayhim sulṭānun ʾillā mani ttabaʿaka mina l-ghāwīna

43.content: وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمَوعِدُهُم أَجمَعينَ
43.translation_eng: and indeed hell is the tryst of them all.
43.transliteration: wa-ʾinna jahannama la-mawʿiduhum ʾajmaʿīna

44.content: لَها سَبعَةُ أَبوابٍ لِكُلِّ بابٍ مِنهُم جُزءٌ مَقسومٌ
44.translation_eng: It has seven gates, and to each gate belongs a separate portion of them.’
44.transliteration: lahā sabʿatu ʾabwābin li-kulli bābin minhum juzʾun maqsūmun

45.content: إِنَّ المُتَّقينَ في جَنّاتٍ وَعُيونٍ
45.translation_eng: Indeed the Godwary will be amid gardens and springs.
45.transliteration: ʾinna l-muttaqīna fī jannātin wa-ʿuyūnin-i

46.content: ادخُلوها بِسَلامٍ آمِنينَ
46.translation_eng: “Enter it in peace and safety!”
46.transliteration: udkhulūhā bi-salāmin ʾāminīna

47.content: وَنَزَعنا ما في صُدورِهِم مِن غِلٍّ إِخوانًا عَلىٰ سُرُرٍ مُتَقابِلينَ
47.translation_eng: We will remove whatever rancour there is in their breasts; [intimate like] brothers, [they will be reclining] on couches, facing one another.
47.transliteration: wa-nazaʿnā mā fī ṣudūrihim min ghillin ʾikhwānan ʿalā sururin mutaqābilīna

48.content: لا يَمَسُّهُم فيها نَصَبٌ وَما هُم مِنها بِمُخرَجينَ
48.translation_eng: Therein neither weariness shall touch them, nor will they [ever] be expelled from it.
48.transliteration: lā yamassuhum fīhā naṣabun wa-mā hum minhā bi-mukhrajīna

49.content: ۞ نَبِّئ عِبادي أَنّي أَنَا الغَفورُ الرَّحيمُ
49.translation_eng: Inform my servants that I am indeed the All-forgiving, the All-merciful,
49.transliteration: nabbiʾ ʿibādī ʾannī ʾana l-ghafūru r-raḥīmu

50.content: وَأَنَّ عَذابي هُوَ العَذابُ الأَليمُ
50.translation_eng: and that My punishment is a painful punishment.
50.transliteration: wa-ʾanna ʿadhābī huwa l-ʿadhābu l-ʾalīmu

51.content: وَنَبِّئهُم عَن ضَيفِ إِبراهيمَ
51.translation_eng: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,
51.transliteration: wa-nabbiʾhum ʿan ḍayfi ʾibrāhīma

52.content: إِذ دَخَلوا عَلَيهِ فَقالوا سَلامًا قالَ إِنّا مِنكُم وَجِلونَ
52.translation_eng: when they entered into his presence and said, ‘Peace!’ He said, ‘We are indeed afraid of you.’
52.transliteration: ʾidh dakhalū ʿalayhi fa-qālū salāman qāla ʾinnā minkum wajilūna

53.content: قالوا لا تَوجَل إِنّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلامٍ عَليمٍ
53.translation_eng: They said, ‘Do not be afraid. Indeed we give you the good news of a wise son.’
53.transliteration: qālū lā tawjal ʾinnā nubashshiruka bi-ghulāmin ʿalīmin

54.content: قالَ أَبَشَّرتُموني عَلىٰ أَن مَسَّنِيَ الكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرونَ
54.translation_eng: He said, ‘Do you give me good news though old age has befallen me? What is the good news that you bring me?’
54.transliteration: qāla ʾa-bashshartumūnī ʿalā ʾan massaniya l-kibaru fa-bi-ma tubashshirūna

55.content: قالوا بَشَّرناكَ بِالحَقِّ فَلا تَكُن مِنَ القانِطينَ
55.translation_eng: They said, ‘We bring you good news in truth; so do not be among the despondent.’
55.transliteration: qālū bashsharnāka bi-l-ḥaqqi fa-lā takun mina l-qāniṭīna

56.content: قالَ وَمَن يَقنَطُ مِن رَحمَةِ رَبِّهِ إِلَّا الضّالّونَ
56.translation_eng: He said, ‘Who despairs of his Lord’s mercy except those who are astray?!’
56.transliteration: qāla wa-man yaqnaṭu min raḥmati rabbihī ʾillā ḍ-ḍāllūna

57.content: قالَ فَما خَطبُكُم أَيُّهَا المُرسَلونَ
57.translation_eng: He said, ‘O messengers, what is now your errand?’
57.transliteration: qāla fa-mā khaṭbukum ʾayyuhā l-mursalūna

58.content: قالوا إِنّا أُرسِلنا إِلىٰ قَومٍ مُجرِمينَ
58.translation_eng: They said, ‘We have been sent toward a guilty people,
58.transliteration: qālū ʾinnā ʾursilnā ʾilā qawmin mujrimīna

59.content: إِلّا آلَ لوطٍ إِنّا لَمُنَجّوهُم أَجمَعينَ
59.translation_eng: [who shall perish] except the family of Lot. We will indeed deliver all of them,
59.transliteration: ʾillā ʾāla lūṭin ʾinnā la-munajjūhum ʾajmaʿīna

60.content: إِلَّا امرَأَتَهُ قَدَّرنا ۙ إِنَّها لَمِنَ الغابِرينَ
60.translation_eng: except his wife, [who], We have ordained, will indeed be among those who remain behind.’
60.transliteration: ʾillā mraʾatahū qaddarnā ʾinnahā la-mina l-ghābirīna

61.content: فَلَمّا جاءَ آلَ لوطٍ المُرسَلونَ
61.translation_eng: So when the messengers came to Lot’s family,
61.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾa ʾāla lūṭin-i l-mursalūna

62.content: قالَ إِنَّكُم قَومٌ مُنكَرونَ
62.translation_eng: he said, ‘You are indeed strangers [to me].’
62.transliteration: qāla ʾinnakum qawmun munkarūna

63.content: قالوا بَل جِئناكَ بِما كانوا فيهِ يَمتَرونَ
63.translation_eng: They said, ‘Rather we bring you what they used to doubt.
63.transliteration: qālū bal jiʾnāka bi-mā kānū fīhi yamtarūna

64.content: وَأَتَيناكَ بِالحَقِّ وَإِنّا لَصادِقونَ
64.translation_eng: We bring you the truth, and indeed we speak truly.
64.transliteration: wa-ʾataynāka bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾinnā la-ṣādiqūna

65.content: فَأَسرِ بِأَهلِكَ بِقِطعٍ مِنَ اللَّيلِ وَاتَّبِع أَدبارَهُم وَلا يَلتَفِت مِنكُم أَحَدٌ وَامضوا حَيثُ تُؤمَرونَ
65.translation_eng: Take your family in a watch of the night; and follow in their rear, and none of you should turn round, and proceed as you are bidden.’
65.transliteration: fa-ʾasri bi-ʾahlika bi-qiṭʿin mina l-layli wa-ttabiʿ ʾadbārahum wa-lā yaltafit minkum ʾaḥadun wa-mḍū ḥaythu tuʾmarūna

66.content: وَقَضَينا إِلَيهِ ذٰلِكَ الأَمرَ أَنَّ دابِرَ هٰؤُلاءِ مَقطوعٌ مُصبِحينَ
66.translation_eng: We apprised him of the matter that these1 will be rooted out by dawn.That is, the people of Sodom.
66.transliteration: wa-qaḍaynā ʾilayhi dhālika l-ʾamra ʾanna dābira hāʾulāʾi maqṭūʿun muṣbiḥīna

67.content: وَجاءَ أَهلُ المَدينَةِ يَستَبشِرونَ
67.translation_eng: The people of the city came, rejoicing.
67.transliteration: wa-jāʾa ʾahlu l-madīnati yastabshirūna

68.content: قالَ إِنَّ هٰؤُلاءِ ضَيفي فَلا تَفضَحونِ
68.translation_eng: He said, ‘These are indeed my guests. Do not bring dishonour on me.
68.transliteration: qāla ʾinna hāʾulāʾi ḍayfī fa-lā tafḍaḥūni

69.content: وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَلا تُخزونِ
69.translation_eng: Be wary of Allah and do not humiliate me.’
69.transliteration: wa-ttaqū llāha wa-lā tukhzūni

70.content: قالوا أَوَلَم نَنهَكَ عَنِ العالَمينَ
70.translation_eng: They said, ‘Did we not forbid you from [defending1] strangers?’Or, from entertaining.
70.transliteration: qālū ʾa-wa-lam nanhaka ʿani l-ʿālamīna

71.content: قالَ هٰؤُلاءِ بَناتي إِن كُنتُم فاعِلينَ
71.translation_eng: He said, ‘These are my daughters, [marry them] if you should do anything.’
71.transliteration: qāla hāʾulāʾi banātī ʾin kuntum fāʿilīna

72.content: لَعَمرُكَ إِنَّهُم لَفي سَكرَتِهِم يَعمَهونَ
72.translation_eng: By your life, they were bewildered in their drunkenness.
72.transliteration: la-ʿamruka ʾinnahum la-fī sakratihim yaʿmahūna

73.content: فَأَخَذَتهُمُ الصَّيحَةُ مُشرِقينَ
73.translation_eng: So the Cry seized them at sunrise,
73.transliteration: fa-ʾakhadhathumu ṣ-ṣayḥatu mushriqīna

74.content: فَجَعَلنا عالِيَها سافِلَها وَأَمطَرنا عَلَيهِم حِجارَةً مِن سِجّيلٍ
74.translation_eng: and We made its1 topmost part its nethermost, and rained on them stones of shale.That is, of the city of Sodom.
74.transliteration: fa-jaʿalnā ʿāliyahā sāfilahā wa-ʾamṭarnā ʿalayhim ḥijāratan min sijjīlin

75.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِلمُتَوَسِّمينَ
75.translation_eng: There are indeed signs in that for the percipient.
75.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-l-mutawassimīna

76.content: وَإِنَّها لَبِسَبيلٍ مُقيمٍ
76.translation_eng: Indeed it is on a standing road,
76.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahā la-bi-sabīlin muqīmin

77.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِلمُؤمِنينَ
77.translation_eng: and there is indeed a sign in that for the faithful.
77.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan li-l-muʾminīna

78.content: وَإِن كانَ أَصحابُ الأَيكَةِ لَظالِمينَ
78.translation_eng: Indeed the inhabitants of Aykah1 were wrongdoers.Apparently, one of the towns to which the prophet Shuʿayb (ʿa) was sent. Cf. 26:176; 38:13; 50:14.
78.transliteration: wa-ʾin kāna ʾaṣḥābu l-ʾaykati la-ẓālimīna

79.content: فَانتَقَمنا مِنهُم وَإِنَّهُما لَبِإِمامٍ مُبينٍ
79.translation_eng: So We took vengeance on them, and indeed the two of them1 are on an open highway.That is, Sodom and Aykah.
