79.transliteration: fa-ntaqamnā minhum wa-ʾinnahumā la-bi-ʾimāmin mubīnin

80.content: وَلَقَد كَذَّبَ أَصحابُ الحِجرِ المُرسَلينَ
80.translation_eng: Certainly the inhabitants of Ḥijr denied the apostles.
80.transliteration: wa-la-qad kadhdhaba ʾaṣḥābu l-ḥijri l-mursalīna

81.content: وَآتَيناهُم آياتِنا فَكانوا عَنها مُعرِضينَ
81.translation_eng: We had given them Our signs but they disregarded them.
81.transliteration: wa-ʾātaynāhum ʾāyātinā fa-kānū ʿanhā muʿriḍīna

82.content: وَكانوا يَنحِتونَ مِنَ الجِبالِ بُيوتًا آمِنينَ
82.translation_eng: They used to hew out dwellings from mountains feeling secure.
82.transliteration: wa-kānū yanḥitūna mina l-jibāli buyūtan ʾāminīna

83.content: فَأَخَذَتهُمُ الصَّيحَةُ مُصبِحينَ
83.translation_eng: So the Cry seized them at dawn,
83.transliteration: fa-ʾakhadhathumu ṣ-ṣayḥatu muṣbiḥīna

84.content: فَما أَغنىٰ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
84.translation_eng: and what they used to earn did not avail them.
84.transliteration: fa-mā ʾaghnā ʿanhum mā kānū yaksibūna

85.content: وَما خَلَقنَا السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما إِلّا بِالحَقِّ ۗ وَإِنَّ السّاعَةَ لَآتِيَةٌ ۖ فَاصفَحِ الصَّفحَ الجَميلَ
85.translation_eng: We did not create the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them except with reason, and indeed the Hour is bound to come. So forbear with a graceful forbearance.
85.transliteration: wa-mā khalaqnā s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-mā baynahumā ʾillā bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾinna s-sāʿata la-ʾātiyatun fa-ṣfaḥi ṣ-ṣafḥa l-jamīla

86.content: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ الخَلّاقُ العَليمُ
86.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is the All-creator, the All-knowing.
86.transliteration: ʾinna rabbaka huwa l-khallāqu l-ʿalīmu

87.content: وَلَقَد آتَيناكَ سَبعًا مِنَ المَثاني وَالقُرآنَ العَظيمَ
87.translation_eng: Certainly We have given you [the sūrah of] the seven oft-repeated verses1 and the great Qurʾān.That is, the Sūrat al-Fātiḥah, the opening sūrah of the Qurʾān.
87.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynāka sabʿan mina l-mathānī wa-l-qurʾāna l-ʿaẓīma

88.content: لا تَمُدَّنَّ عَينَيكَ إِلىٰ ما مَتَّعنا بِهِ أَزواجًا مِنهُم وَلا تَحزَن عَلَيهِم وَاخفِض جَناحَكَ لِلمُؤمِنينَ
88.translation_eng: Do not extend your glance toward what We have provided to certain groups of them, and do not grieve for them, and lower your wing to the faithful,1That is, be humble and gracious towards them. Cf. 17:24; 26:215.
88.transliteration: lā tamuddanna ʿaynayka ʾilā mā mattaʿnā bihī ʾazwājan minhum wa-lā taḥzan ʿalayhim wa-khfiḍ janāḥaka li-l-muʾminīna

89.content: وَقُل إِنّي أَنَا النَّذيرُ المُبينُ
89.translation_eng: and say, ‘I am indeed a manifest warner.’
89.transliteration: wa-qul ʾinnī ʾana n-nadhīru l-mubīnu

90.content: كَما أَنزَلنا عَلَى المُقتَسِمينَ
90.translation_eng: Even as We sent down on the dividers,1Or ‘swearers.’
90.transliteration: ka-mā ʾanzalnā ʿalā l-muqtasimīna

91.content: الَّذينَ جَعَلُوا القُرآنَ عِضينَ
91.translation_eng: who reduced the Qurʾān into pieces,
91.transliteration: alladhīna jaʿalū l-qurʿāna ʿiḍīna

92.content: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَسأَلَنَّهُم أَجمَعينَ
92.translation_eng: by your Lord, We will question them all
92.transliteration: fa-wa-rabbika la-nasʾalannahum ʾajmaʿīna

93.content: عَمّا كانوا يَعمَلونَ
93.translation_eng: concerning what they used to do.
93.transliteration: ʿammā kānū yaʿmalūna

94.content: فَاصدَع بِما تُؤمَرُ وَأَعرِض عَنِ المُشرِكينَ
94.translation_eng: So proclaim what you have been commanded, and turn away from the polytheists.
94.transliteration: fa-ṣdaʿ bi-mā tuʾmaru wa-ʾaʿriḍ ʿani l-mushrikīna

95.content: إِنّا كَفَيناكَ المُستَهزِئينَ
95.translation_eng: Indeed We will suffice you against the deriders
95.transliteration: ʾinnā kafaynāka l-mustahziʾīna

96.content: الَّذينَ يَجعَلونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلٰهًا آخَرَ ۚ فَسَوفَ يَعلَمونَ
96.translation_eng: —those who set up besides Allah another god. Soon they will know!
96.transliteration: alladhīna yajʿalūna maʿa llāhi ʾilāhan ʾākhara fa-sawfa yaʿlamūna

97.content: وَلَقَد نَعلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضيقُ صَدرُكَ بِما يَقولونَ
97.translation_eng: Certainly We know that you become upset because of what they say.
97.transliteration: wa-la-qad naʿlamu ʾannaka yaḍīqu ṣadruka bi-mā yaqūlūna

98.content: فَسَبِّح بِحَمدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُن مِنَ السّاجِدينَ
98.translation_eng: So celebrate the praise of your Lord and be among those who prostrate,
98.transliteration: fa-sabbiḥ bi-ḥamdi rabbika wa-kun mina s-sājidīna

99.translation_eng: and worship your Lord until certainty1 comes to you.Or ‘death.’

16.description: The surah that mentions the bees—dwelling in mountains, trees, and man-made hives; eating freely of fruited plants; and giving forth variously coloured honeys that hold both healthful delight and healing qualities—as a clear sign of the wondrous bounty of God’s creation. It takes its name from the honey bee (al-naḥl) mentioned in verse 68 . This is just one of the numerous examples given in this surah of God’s grace and the many things man should be grateful for. The surah condemns the idolaters who attribute God’s bounty to other powers and worship false deities. Abraham is given at the end as an example for the Muslim community to follow. Until verse 88, the surah is directed at the polytheists; from verse go onwards it teaches the Muslims in various ways; verse 89 connects the two parts by naming the Prophet as witness to the believers and disbelievers of his community.

1.content: أَتىٰ أَمرُ اللَّهِ فَلا تَستَعجِلوهُ ۚ سُبحانَهُ وَتَعالىٰ عَمّا يُشرِكونَ
1.translation_eng: Allah’s edict is coming! So do not seek to hasten it. Immaculate is He and exalted above [having] any partners that they ascribe [to Him].
1.transliteration: ʾatā ʾamru llāhi fa-lā tastaʿjilūhu subḥānahū wa-taʿālā ʿammā yushrikūna

2.content: يُنَزِّلُ المَلائِكَةَ بِالرّوحِ مِن أَمرِهِ عَلىٰ مَن يَشاءُ مِن عِبادِهِ أَن أَنذِروا أَنَّهُ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا أَنا فَاتَّقونِ
2.translation_eng: He sends down the angels with the Spirit of His command1 to whomever He wishes of His servants: ‘Warn [the people] that there is no god except Me; so be wary of Me.’Or ‘Law.’
2.transliteration: yunazzilu l-malāʾikata bi-r-rūḥi min ʾamrihī ʿalā man yashāʾu min ʿibādihī ʾan ʾandhirū ʾannahū lā ʾilāha ʾillā ʾana fa-ttaqūni

3.content: خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ بِالحَقِّ ۚ تَعالىٰ عَمّا يُشرِكونَ
3.translation_eng: He created the heavens and the earth with reason. He is above having any partners that they ascribe [to Him].
3.transliteration: khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa bi-l-ḥaqqi taʿālā ʿammā yushrikūna

4.content: خَلَقَ الإِنسانَ مِن نُطفَةٍ فَإِذا هُوَ خَصيمٌ مُبينٌ
4.translation_eng: He created man from a drop of [seminal] fluid,1 and, behold, he is an open contender!2Or ‘from a drop of semen;’ cf. 18:37; 22:5; 23:13-14; 35:11; 36:77; 40:67; 53:46; 75:37; 76:2; 80:19.Or ‘a lucid debater,’ or ‘an open adversary;’ cf. 36:77.
4.transliteration: khalaqa l-ʾinsāna min nuṭfatin fa-ʾidhā huwa khaṣīmun mubīnun

5.content: وَالأَنعامَ خَلَقَها ۗ لَكُم فيها دِفءٌ وَمَنافِعُ وَمِنها تَأكُلونَ
5.translation_eng: He created the cattle, in which there is warmth1 for you and [other] uses and some of them you eat.That is, in the garments made from wool and leather.
5.transliteration: wa-l-ʾanʿāma khalaqahā lakum fīhā difʾun wa-manāfiʿu wa-minhā taʾkulūna

6.content: وَلَكُم فيها جَمالٌ حينَ تُريحونَ وَحينَ تَسرَحونَ
6.translation_eng: There is in them a beauty for you when you bring them home for rest and when you drive them forth to pasture.
6.transliteration: wa-lakum fīhā jamālun ḥīna turīḥūna wa-ḥīna tasraḥūna

7.content: وَتَحمِلُ أَثقالَكُم إِلىٰ بَلَدٍ لَم تَكونوا بالِغيهِ إِلّا بِشِقِّ الأَنفُسِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكُم لَرَءوفٌ رَحيمٌ
7.translation_eng: And they bear your burdens to towns which you could not reach except by straining yourselves. Indeed your Lord is most kind and merciful.
7.transliteration: wa-taḥmilu ʾathqālakum ʾilā baladin lam takūnū bālighīhi ʾillā bi-shiqqi l-ʾanfusi ʾinna rabbakum la-raʾūfun raḥīmun

8.content: وَالخَيلَ وَالبِغالَ وَالحَميرَ لِتَركَبوها وَزينَةً ۚ وَيَخلُقُ ما لا تَعلَمونَ
8.translation_eng: And horses, mules and asses, for you to ride them, and for adornment, and He creates what you do not know.
8.transliteration: wa-l-khayla wa-l-bighāla wa-l-ḥamīra li-tarkabūhā wa-zīnatan wa-yakhluqu mā lā taʿlamūna

9.content: وَعَلَى اللَّهِ قَصدُ السَّبيلِ وَمِنها جائِرٌ ۚ وَلَو شاءَ لَهَداكُم أَجمَعينَ
9.translation_eng: With Allah rests guidance to the straight path,1 and some of them2 are devious, and had He wished He would have guided you all.Cf. 20:50; 76:3; 92:12.That is, some of the paths. Cf. 6:153.
9.transliteration: wa-ʿalā llāhi qaṣdu s-sabīli wa-minhā jāʾirun wa-law shāʾa la-hadākum ʾajmaʿīna

10.content: هُوَ الَّذي أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً ۖ لَكُم مِنهُ شَرابٌ وَمِنهُ شَجَرٌ فيهِ تُسيمونَ
10.translation_eng: It is He who sends down water from the sky: from it you get your drink and from it are [sustained] the plants wherein you pasture your herds.
10.transliteration: huwa lladhī ʾanzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan lakum minhu sharābun wa-minhu shajarun fīhi tusīmūna

11.content: يُنبِتُ لَكُم بِهِ الزَّرعَ وَالزَّيتونَ وَالنَّخيلَ وَالأَعنابَ وَمِن كُلِّ الثَّمَراتِ ۗ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِقَومٍ يَتَفَكَّرونَ
11.translation_eng: With it He makes the crops grow for you and olives, date palms, vines, and fruits of all kinds. There is indeed a sign in that for a people who reflect.
11.transliteration: yunbitu lakum bihi z-zarʿa wa-z-zaytūna wa-n-nakhīla wa-l-ʾaʿnāba wa-min kulli th-thamarāti ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan li-qawmin yatafakkarūna

12.content: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ اللَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ وَالشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ ۖ وَالنُّجومُ مُسَخَّراتٌ بِأَمرِهِ ۗ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَعقِلونَ
12.translation_eng: He disposed the night and the day for you, and the sun, the moon and the stars are disposed by His command. There are indeed signs in that for a people who apply reason.
12.transliteration: wa-sakhkhara lakumu l-layla wa-n-nahāra wa-sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara wa-n-nujūmu musakhkharātun bi-ʾamrihī ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yaʿqilūna

13.content: وَما ذَرَأَ لَكُم فِي الأَرضِ مُختَلِفًا أَلوانُهُ ۗ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِقَومٍ يَذَّكَّرونَ
13.translation_eng: And whatever He has created for you in the earth of diverse hues —there is indeed a sign in that for a people who take admonition.
13.transliteration: wa-mā dharaʾa lakum fī l-ʾarḍi mukhtalifan ʾalwānuhū ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan li-qawmin yadhdhakkarūna

14.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي سَخَّرَ البَحرَ لِتَأكُلوا مِنهُ لَحمًا طَرِيًّا وَتَستَخرِجوا مِنهُ حِليَةً تَلبَسونَها وَتَرَى الفُلكَ مَواخِرَ فيهِ وَلِتَبتَغوا مِن فَضلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
14.translation_eng: It is He who disposed the sea [for your benefit] that you may eat from it fresh meat, and obtain from it ornaments, which you wear —and you see the ships plowing through it— and that you may seek of His grace, and that you may give thanks.
14.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī sakhkhara l-baḥra li-taʾkulū minhu laḥman ṭariyyan wa-tastakhrijū minhu ḥilyatan talbasūnahā wa-tarā l-fulka mawākhira fīhi wa-li-tabtaghū min faḍlihī wa-laʿallakum tashkurūna

15.content: وَأَلقىٰ فِي الأَرضِ رَواسِيَ أَن تَميدَ بِكُم وَأَنهارًا وَسُبُلًا لَعَلَّكُم تَهتَدونَ
15.translation_eng: He cast in the earth firm mountains lest it should shake with you, and [made] streams and ways, so that you may be guided
15.transliteration: wa-ʾalqā fī l-ʾarḍi rawāsiya ʾan tamīda bikum wa-ʾanhāran wa-subulan laʿallakum tahtadūna

16.content: وَعَلاماتٍ ۚ وَبِالنَّجمِ هُم يَهتَدونَ
16.translation_eng: —and the landmarks [as well], and by the stars they are guided.
16.transliteration: wa-ʿalāmātin wa-bi-n-najmi hum yahtadūna

17.content: أَفَمَن يَخلُقُ كَمَن لا يَخلُقُ ۗ أَفَلا تَذَكَّرونَ
17.translation_eng: Is He who creates like one who does not create? Will you not then take admonition?
17.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man yakhluqu ka-man lā yakhluqu ʾa-fa-lā tadhakkarūna

18.content: وَإِن تَعُدّوا نِعمَةَ اللَّهِ لا تُحصوها ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
18.translation_eng: If you enumerate Allah’s blessings, you will not be able to count them. Indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
18.transliteration: wa-ʾin taʿuddū niʿmata llāhi lā tuḥṣūhā ʾinna llāha la-ghafūrun raḥīmun

19.content: وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ ما تُسِرّونَ وَما تُعلِنونَ
19.translation_eng: Allah knows whatever you hide and whatever you disclose.
19.transliteration: wa-llāhu yaʿlamu mā tusirrūna wa-mā tuʿlinūna

20.content: وَالَّذينَ يَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ لا يَخلُقونَ شَيئًا وَهُم يُخلَقونَ
20.translation_eng: Those whom they invoke besides Allah do not create anything and are themselves created.
20.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yadʿūna min dūni llāhi lā yakhluqūna shayʾan wa-hum yukhlaqūna

21.content: أَمواتٌ غَيرُ أَحياءٍ ۖ وَما يَشعُرونَ أَيّانَ يُبعَثونَ
21.translation_eng: They are dead, not living, and are not aware when they will be resurrected.
21.transliteration: ʾamwātun ghayru ʾaḥyāʾin wa-mā yashʿurūna ʾayyāna yubʿathūna

22.content: إِلٰهُكُم إِلٰهٌ واحِدٌ ۚ فَالَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالآخِرَةِ قُلوبُهُم مُنكِرَةٌ وَهُم مُستَكبِرونَ
22.translation_eng: Your God is the One God. Those who do not believe in the Hereafter, their hearts are amiss,1 and they are arrogant.Or ‘their hearts are disbelieving.’
22.transliteration: ʾilāhukum ʾilāhun wāḥidun fa-lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-l-ʾākhirati qulūbuhum munkiratun wa-hum mustakbirūna

23.content: لا جَرَمَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَعلَمُ ما يُسِرّونَ وَما يُعلِنونَ ۚ إِنَّهُ لا يُحِبُّ المُستَكبِرينَ
23.translation_eng: Undoubtedly, Allah knows whatever they hide and whatever they disclose. Indeed He does not like the arrogant.
23.transliteration: lā jarama ʾanna llāha yaʿlamu mā yusirrūna wa-mā yuʿlinūna ʾinnahū lā yuḥibbu l-mustakbirīna

24.content: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُم ماذا أَنزَلَ رَبُّكُم ۙ قالوا أَساطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ
24.translation_eng: When they are told, ‘What is it that your Lord has sent down?’ They say, ‘Myths of the ancients,’
24.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā qīla lahum mādhā ʾanzala rabbukum qālū ʾasāṭīru l-ʾawwalīna

25.content: لِيَحمِلوا أَوزارَهُم كامِلَةً يَومَ القِيامَةِ ۙ وَمِن أَوزارِ الَّذينَ يُضِلّونَهُم بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ ۗ أَلا ساءَ ما يَزِرونَ
25.translation_eng: that they may bear their entire burdens on the Day of Resurrection, along with some of the burdens of those whom they lead astray without any knowledge. Look! Evil is what they bear!
25.transliteration: li-yaḥmilū ʾawzārahum kāmilatan yawma l-qiyāmati wa-min ʾawzāri lladhīna yuḍillūnahum bi-ghayri ʿilmin ʾa-lā sāʾa mā yazirūna

26.content: قَد مَكَرَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم فَأَتَى اللَّهُ بُنيانَهُم مِنَ القَواعِدِ فَخَرَّ عَلَيهِمُ السَّقفُ مِن فَوقِهِم وَأَتاهُمُ العَذابُ مِن حَيثُ لا يَشعُرونَ
26.translation_eng: Those who were before them [had also] schemed. Then Allah razed their edifice from the foundations and the roof collapsed upon them from above and the punishment overtook them whence they were not aware.
26.transliteration: qad makara lladhīna min qablihim fa-ʾatā llāhu bunyānahum mina l-qawāʿidi fa-kharra ʿalayhimu s-saqfu min fawqihim wa-ʾatāhumu l-ʿadhābu min ḥaythu lā yashʿurūna

27.content: ثُمَّ يَومَ القِيامَةِ يُخزيهِم وَيَقولُ أَينَ شُرَكائِيَ الَّذينَ كُنتُم تُشاقّونَ فيهِم ۚ قالَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا العِلمَ إِنَّ الخِزيَ اليَومَ وَالسّوءَ عَلَى الكافِرينَ
27.translation_eng: Then He will disgrace them on the Day of Resurrection, and say, ‘Where are My partners for whose sake you used to defy [Allah]?’ Those who were given knowledge will say, ‘Indeed today disgrace and distress pursue the faithless.’
27.transliteration: thumma yawma l-qiyāmati yukhzīhim wa-yaqūlu ʾayna shurakāʾiya lladhīna kuntum tushāqqūna fīhim qāla lladhīna ʾūtū l-ʿilma ʾinna l-khizya l-yawma wa-s-sūʾa ʿalā l-kāfirīna

28.content: الَّذينَ تَتَوَفّاهُمُ المَلائِكَةُ ظالِمي أَنفُسِهِم ۖ فَأَلقَوُا السَّلَمَ ما كُنّا نَعمَلُ مِن سوءٍ ۚ بَلىٰ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَليمٌ بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
28.translation_eng: —Those whom the angels take away while they are wronging themselves. Thereat they submit: ‘We were not doing any evil!’ ‘Yes, indeed Allah knows best what you used to do!
28.transliteration: alladhīna tatawaffāhumu l-malāʾikatu ẓālimī ʾanfusihim fa-ʾalqawu s-salama mā kunnā naʿmalu min sūʾin balā ʾinna llāha ʿalīmun bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna

29.content: فَادخُلوا أَبوابَ جَهَنَّمَ خالِدينَ فيها ۖ فَلَبِئسَ مَثوَى المُتَكَبِّرينَ
29.translation_eng: Enter the gates of hell to remain in it [forever]. Evil is the [final] abode of the arrogant.’
29.transliteration: fa-dkhulū ʾabwāba jahannama khālidīna fīhā fa-la-biʾsa mathwā l-mutakabbirīna

30.content: ۞ وَقيلَ لِلَّذينَ اتَّقَوا ماذا أَنزَلَ رَبُّكُم ۚ قالوا خَيرًا ۗ لِلَّذينَ أَحسَنوا في هٰذِهِ الدُّنيا حَسَنَةٌ ۚ وَلَدارُ الآخِرَةِ خَيرٌ ۚ وَلَنِعمَ دارُ المُتَّقينَ
30.translation_eng: But to those who were Godwary it will be said, ‘What is it that your Lord has sent down?’ They will say, ‘Good.’ For those who do good in this world there will be a good [reward], and the abode of the Hereafter is better, and the abode of the Godwary is surely excellent:
30.transliteration: wa-qīla li-lladhīna ttaqaw mādhā ʾanzala rabbukum qālū khayran li-lladhīna ʾaḥsanū fī hādhihi d-dunyā ḥasanatun wa-la-dāru l-ʾākhirati khayrun wa-la-niʿma dāru l-muttaqīna

31.content: جَنّاتُ عَدنٍ يَدخُلونَها تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ ۖ لَهُم فيها ما يَشاءونَ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يَجزِي اللَّهُ المُتَّقينَ
31.translation_eng: the Gardens of Eden, which they will enter, with streams running in them. There they will have whatever they wish, and thus does Allah reward the Godwary
31.transliteration: jannātu ʿadnin yadkhulūnahā tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru lahum fīhā mā yashāʾūna ka-dhālika yajzī llāhu l-muttaqīna

32.content: الَّذينَ تَتَوَفّاهُمُ المَلائِكَةُ طَيِّبينَ ۙ يَقولونَ سَلامٌ عَلَيكُمُ ادخُلُوا الجَنَّةَ بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
32.translation_eng: —those whom the angels take away while they are pure. They say [to them], ‘Peace be to you! Enter paradise because of what you used to do.’
32.transliteration: alladhīna tatawaffāhumu l-malāʾikatu ṭayyibīna yaqūlūna salāmun ʿalaykumu dkhulū l-jannata bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna

33.content: هَل يَنظُرونَ إِلّا أَن تَأتِيَهُمُ المَلائِكَةُ أَو يَأتِيَ أَمرُ رَبِّكَ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ فَعَلَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ وَما ظَلَمَهُمُ اللَّهُ وَلٰكِن كانوا أَنفُسَهُم يَظلِمونَ
33.translation_eng: Do they await anything but that the angels should come to them, or your Lord’s edict should come? Those who were before them had acted likewise; Allah did not wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.
33.transliteration: hal yanẓurūna ʾillā ʾan taʾtiyahumu l-malāʾikatu ʾaw yaʾtiya ʾamru rabbika ka-dhālika faʿala lladhīna min qablihim wa-mā ẓalamahumu llāhu wa-lākin kānū ʾanfusahum yaẓlimūna

34.content: فَأَصابَهُم سَيِّئَاتُ ما عَمِلوا وَحاقَ بِهِم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
34.translation_eng: So the evils of what they had earned visited them, and they were besieged by what they used to deride.
34.transliteration: fa-ʾaṣābahum sayyiʾātu mā ʿamilū wa-ḥāqa bihim mā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

35.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ أَشرَكوا لَو شاءَ اللَّهُ ما عَبَدنا مِن دونِهِ مِن شَيءٍ نَحنُ وَلا آباؤُنا وَلا حَرَّمنا مِن دونِهِ مِن شَيءٍ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ فَعَلَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ فَهَل عَلَى الرُّسُلِ إِلَّا البَلاغُ المُبينُ
35.translation_eng: The polytheists say, ‘Had Allah wished, we would not have worshiped anything besides Him —neither we, nor our fathers— nor would we have held anything holy besides Him.’1 Those who were before them had acted likewise. Is the apostles’ duty anything but to communicate in clear terms?Or ‘nor we would have forbidden anything without Him (that is, without His permission).’ Cf. 6:148.
35.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna ʾashrakū law shāʾa llāhu mā ʿabadnā min dūnihī min shayʾin naḥnu wa-lā ʾābāʾunā wa-lā ḥarramnā min dūnihī min shayʾin ka-dhālika faʿala lladhīna min qablihim fa-hal ʿalā r-rusuli ʾillā l-balāghu l-mubīnu

36.content: وَلَقَد بَعَثنا في كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ رَسولًا أَنِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَاجتَنِبُوا الطّاغوتَ ۖ فَمِنهُم مَن هَدَى اللَّهُ وَمِنهُم مَن حَقَّت عَلَيهِ الضَّلالَةُ ۚ فَسيروا فِي الأَرضِ فَانظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ المُكَذِّبينَ
36.translation_eng: Certainly We raised an apostle in every nation [to preach:] ‘Worship Allah, and keep away from the Rebels.’ Then among them were some whom Allah guided, and among them were some who deserved to be in error. So travel over the land and then observe how was the fate of the deniers.
36.transliteration: wa-la-qad baʿathnā fī kulli ʾummatin rasūlan ʾani ʿbudū llāha wa-jtanibū ṭ-ṭāghūta fa-minhum man hadā llāhu wa-minhum man ḥaqqat ʿalayhi ḍ-ḍalālatu fa-sīrū fī l-ʾarḍi fa-nẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu l-mukadhdhibīna

37.content: إِن تَحرِص عَلىٰ هُداهُم فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدي مَن يُضِلُّ ۖ وَما لَهُم مِن ناصِرينَ
37.translation_eng: If you are eager for them to be guided, indeed Allah does not guide those who mislead [others], and they will have no helpers.
37.transliteration: ʾin taḥriṣ ʿalā hudāhum fa-ʾinna llāha lā yahdī man yuḍillu wa-mā lahum min nāṣirīna

38.content: وَأَقسَموا بِاللَّهِ جَهدَ أَيمانِهِم ۙ لا يَبعَثُ اللَّهُ مَن يَموتُ ۚ بَلىٰ وَعدًا عَلَيهِ حَقًّا وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
38.translation_eng: They swear by Allah with solemn oaths that Allah will not resurrect those who die. Yes indeed, it is a promise binding upon Him, but most people do not know.
38.transliteration: wa-ʾaqsamū bi-llāhi jahda ʾaymānihim lā yabʿathu llāhu man yamūtu balā waʿdan ʿalayhi ḥaqqan wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūna

39.content: لِيُبَيِّنَ لَهُمُ الَّذي يَختَلِفونَ فيهِ وَلِيَعلَمَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَنَّهُم كانوا كاذِبينَ
39.translation_eng: That He may clarify for them what they differ about, and that the faithless may know that they were liars.
39.transliteration: li-yubayyina lahumu lladhī yakhtalifūna fīhi wa-li-yaʿlama lladhīna kafarū ʾannahum kānū kādhibīna

40.content: إِنَّما قَولُنا لِشَيءٍ إِذا أَرَدناهُ أَن نَقولَ لَهُ كُن فَيَكونُ
40.translation_eng: All that We say to a thing, when We will it, is to say to it ‘Be!’ and it is.
40.transliteration: ʾinnamā qawlunā li-shayʾin ʾidhā ʾaradnāhu ʾan naqūla lahū kun fa-yakūnu

41.content: وَالَّذينَ هاجَروا فِي اللَّهِ مِن بَعدِ ما ظُلِموا لَنُبَوِّئَنَّهُم فِي الدُّنيا حَسَنَةً ۖ وَلَأَجرُ الآخِرَةِ أَكبَرُ ۚ لَو كانوا يَعلَمونَ
41.translation_eng: Those who migrate for the sake of Allah after they have been wronged, We will surely settle them in a good place in the world, and the reward of the Hereafter is surely greater, had they known.
41.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hājarū fī llāhi min baʿdi mā ẓulimū la-nubawwiʾannahum fī d-dunyā ḥasanatan wa-la-ʾajru l-ʾākhirati ʾakbaru law kānū yaʿlamūna

42.content: الَّذينَ صَبَروا وَعَلىٰ رَبِّهِم يَتَوَكَّلونَ
42.translation_eng: —Those who are patient and put their trust in their Lord.
42.transliteration: alladhīna ṣabarū wa-ʿalā rabbihim yatawakkalūna

43.content: وَما أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ إِلّا رِجالًا نوحي إِلَيهِم ۚ فَاسأَلوا أَهلَ الذِّكرِ إِن كُنتُم لا تَعلَمونَ
43.translation_eng: We did not send [any apostles] before you except as men to whom We revealed —ask the People of the Reminder if you do not know—
43.transliteration: wa-mā ʾarsalnā min qablika ʾillā rijālan nūḥī ʾilayhim fa-sʾalū ʾahla dh-dhikri ʾin kuntum lā taʿlamūna

44.content: بِالبَيِّناتِ وَالزُّبُرِ ۗ وَأَنزَلنا إِلَيكَ الذِّكرَ لِتُبَيِّنَ لِلنّاسِ ما نُزِّلَ إِلَيهِم وَلَعَلَّهُم يَتَفَكَّرونَ
44.translation_eng: [and sent them] with manifest proofs and scriptures. We have sent down the reminder to you so that you may clarify for the people that which has been sent down to them, so that they may reflect.
44.transliteration: bi-l-bayyināti wa-z-zuburi wa-ʾanzalnā ʾilayka dh-dhikra li-tubayyina li-n-nāsi mā nuzzila ʾilayhim wa-laʿallahum yatafakkarūna

45.content: أَفَأَمِنَ الَّذينَ مَكَرُوا السَّيِّئَاتِ أَن يَخسِفَ اللَّهُ بِهِمُ الأَرضَ أَو يَأتِيَهُمُ العَذابُ مِن حَيثُ لا يَشعُرونَ
45.translation_eng: Do those who make evil schemes feel secure that Allah will not make the earth swallow them, or the punishment will not overtake them whence they are not aware?
45.transliteration: ʾa-fa-ʾamina lladhīna makarū s-sayyiʾāti ʾan yakhsifa llāhu bihimu l-ʾarḍa ʾaw yaʾtiyahumu l-ʿadhābu min ḥaythu lā yashʿurūna

46.content: أَو يَأخُذَهُم في تَقَلُّبِهِم فَما هُم بِمُعجِزينَ
46.translation_eng: Or that He will not seize them in the midst of their bustle, whereupon they will not be able to thwart [Him]?
46.transliteration: ʾaw yaʾkhudhahum fī taqallubihim fa-mā hum bi-muʿjizīna

47.content: أَو يَأخُذَهُم عَلىٰ تَخَوُّفٍ فَإِنَّ رَبَّكُم لَرَءوفٌ رَحيمٌ
47.translation_eng: Or that He will not visit them with attrition?1 Indeed your Lord is most kind and merciful.Or ‘that He will not seize them amid panic.’
47.transliteration: ʾaw yaʾkhudhahum ʿalā takhawwufin fa-ʾinna rabbakum la-raʾūfun raḥīmun

48.content: أَوَلَم يَرَوا إِلىٰ ما خَلَقَ اللَّهُ مِن شَيءٍ يَتَفَيَّأُ ظِلالُهُ عَنِ اليَمينِ وَالشَّمائِلِ سُجَّدًا لِلَّهِ وَهُم داخِرونَ
48.translation_eng: Have they not regarded that whatever thing Allah has created casts its shadow to the right and to the left, prostrating to Allah in utter humility?
48.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾilā mā khalaqa llāhu min shayʾin yatafayyaʾu ẓilāluhū ʿani l-yamīni wa-sh-shamāʾili sujjadan li-llāhi wa-hum dākhirūna

49.content: وَلِلَّهِ يَسجُدُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ مِن دابَّةٍ وَالمَلائِكَةُ وَهُم لا يَستَكبِرونَ
49.translation_eng: To Allah prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, including animals and angels, and they are not arrogant.
49.transliteration: wa-li-llāhi yasjudu mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi min dābbatin wa-l-malāʾikatu wa-hum lā yastakbirūna

50.content: يَخافونَ رَبَّهُم مِن فَوقِهِم وَيَفعَلونَ ما يُؤمَرونَ ۩
50.translation_eng: They fear their Lord above them, and do what they are commanded.
50.transliteration: yakhāfūna rabbahum min fawqihim wa-yafʿalūna mā yuʾmarūna

51.content: ۞ وَقالَ اللَّهُ لا تَتَّخِذوا إِلٰهَينِ اثنَينِ ۖ إِنَّما هُوَ إِلٰهٌ واحِدٌ ۖ فَإِيّايَ فَارهَبونِ
51.translation_eng: And Allah has said, ‘Do not worship two gods. Indeed He is the One God, so be in awe of Me [alone].’
51.transliteration: wa-qāla llāhu lā tattakhidhū ʾilāhayni thnayni ʾinnamā huwa ʾilāhun wāḥidun fa-ʾiyyāya fa-rhabūni

52.content: وَلَهُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَلَهُ الدّينُ واصِبًا ۚ أَفَغَيرَ اللَّهِ تَتَّقونَ
52.translation_eng: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him belongs the enduring religion. Will you, then, be wary of other than Allah?
52.transliteration: wa-lahū mā fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-lahu d-dīnu wāṣiban ʾa-fa-ghayra llāhi tattaqūna

53.content: وَما بِكُم مِن نِعمَةٍ فَمِنَ اللَّهِ ۖ ثُمَّ إِذا مَسَّكُمُ الضُّرُّ فَإِلَيهِ تَجأَرونَ
53.translation_eng: Whatever blessing you have is from Allah, then when a distress befalls you, you make entreaties to Him.
53.transliteration: wa-mā bikum min niʿmatin fa-mina llāhi thumma ʾidhā massakumu ḍ-ḍurru fa-ʾilayhi tajʾarūna

54.content: ثُمَّ إِذا كَشَفَ الضُّرَّ عَنكُم إِذا فَريقٌ مِنكُم بِرَبِّهِم يُشرِكونَ
54.translation_eng: Then when He removes the distress from you, behold, a part of them ascribe partners to their Lord,
54.transliteration: thumma ʾidhā kashafa ḍ-ḍurra ʿankum ʾidhā farīqun minkum bi-rabbihim yushrikūna

55.content: لِيَكفُروا بِما آتَيناهُم ۚ فَتَمَتَّعوا ۖ فَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ
55.translation_eng: being unthankful for what We have given them. So let them enjoy. Soon they shall know!
55.transliteration: li-yakfurū bi-mā ʾātaynāhum fa-tamattaʿū fa-sawfa taʿlamūna

56.content: وَيَجعَلونَ لِما لا يَعلَمونَ نَصيبًا مِمّا رَزَقناهُم ۗ تَاللَّهِ لَتُسأَلُنَّ عَمّا كُنتُم تَفتَرونَ
56.translation_eng: To what they do not know, they attribute a share of what We have provided them. By Allah, you will surely be questioned concerning what you used to fabricate.
56.transliteration: wa-yajʿalūna li-mā lā yaʿlamūna naṣīban mimmā razaqnāhum ta-llāhi la-tusʾalunna ʿammā kuntum taftarūna

57.content: وَيَجعَلونَ لِلَّهِ البَناتِ سُبحانَهُ ۙ وَلَهُم ما يَشتَهونَ
57.translation_eng: And they attribute daughters to Allah —immaculate is He— while they will have what they desire!
57.transliteration: wa-yajʿalūna li-llāhi l-banāti subḥānahū wa-lahum mā yashtahūna

58.content: وَإِذا بُشِّرَ أَحَدُهُم بِالأُنثىٰ ظَلَّ وَجهُهُ مُسوَدًّا وَهُوَ كَظيمٌ
58.translation_eng: When one of them is brought the news of a female [newborn], his face becomes darkened and he chokes with suppressed agony.
58.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā bushshira ʾaḥaduhum bi-l-ʾunthā ẓalla wajhuhū muswaddan wa-huwa kaẓīmun

59.content: يَتَوارىٰ مِنَ القَومِ مِن سوءِ ما بُشِّرَ بِهِ ۚ أَيُمسِكُهُ عَلىٰ هونٍ أَم يَدُسُّهُ فِي التُّرابِ ۗ أَلا ساءَ ما يَحكُمونَ
59.translation_eng: He hides from the people out of distress at the news he has been brought: shall he retain it in humiliation, or bury it in the ground!1 Look! Evil is the judgement that they make.This refers to the practice of pre-Islamic Arabs of burying their newborn daughters alive.
59.transliteration: yatawārā mina l-qawmi min sūʾi mā bushshira bihī ʾa-yumsikuhū ʿalā hūnin ʾam yadussuhū fī t-turābi ʾa-lā sāʾa mā yaḥkumūna

60.content: لِلَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالآخِرَةِ مَثَلُ السَّوءِ ۖ وَلِلَّهِ المَثَلُ الأَعلىٰ ۚ وَهُوَ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
60.translation_eng: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter there is an evil description, and the loftiest description belongs to Allah, and He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.
60.transliteration: li-lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-l-ʾākhirati mathalu s-sawʾi wa-li-llāhi l-mathalu l-ʾaʿlā wa-huwa l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

61.content: وَلَو يُؤاخِذُ اللَّهُ النّاسَ بِظُلمِهِم ما تَرَكَ عَلَيها مِن دابَّةٍ وَلٰكِن يُؤَخِّرُهُم إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۖ فَإِذا جاءَ أَجَلُهُم لا يَستَأخِرونَ ساعَةً ۖ وَلا يَستَقدِمونَ
61.translation_eng: Were Allah to take mankind to task for their wrongdoing, He would not leave any living being upon it.1 But He respites them until a specified time; so when their time comes they shall not defer it by a single hour nor shall they advance it.That is, on the surface of the earth.
61.transliteration: wa-law yuʾākhidhu llāhu n-nāsa bi-ẓulmihim mā taraka ʿalayhā min dābbatin wa-lākin yuʾakhkhiruhum ʾilā ʾajalin musamman fa-ʾidhā jāʾa ʾajaluhum lā yastaʾkhirūna sāʿatan wa-lā yastaqdimūna

62.content: وَيَجعَلونَ لِلَّهِ ما يَكرَهونَ وَتَصِفُ أَلسِنَتُهُمُ الكَذِبَ أَنَّ لَهُمُ الحُسنىٰ ۖ لا جَرَمَ أَنَّ لَهُمُ النّارَ وَأَنَّهُم مُفرَطونَ
62.translation_eng: They attribute to Allah what they dislike [for themselves], and their tongues assert the lie that the best reward will be theirs. Undoubtedly, the Fire shall be their lot and they will be foremost [in entering it].1Or ‘they will be left to languish in it.’
62.transliteration: wa-yajʿalūna li-llāhi mā yakrahūna wa-taṣifu ʾalsinatuhumu l-kadhiba ʾanna lahumu l-ḥusnā lā jarama ʾanna lahumu n-nāra wa-ʾannahum mufraṭūna

63.content: تَاللَّهِ لَقَد أَرسَلنا إِلىٰ أُمَمٍ مِن قَبلِكَ فَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيطانُ أَعمالَهُم فَهُوَ وَلِيُّهُمُ اليَومَ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
63.translation_eng: By Allah, We have certainly sent [apostles] to nations before you. But Satan made their deeds seem decorous to them. So he is their master1 today and there is a painful punishment for them.Or ‘guardian,’ ‘patron,’ or ‘friend.’
63.transliteration: ta-llāhi la-qad ʾarsalnā ʾilā ʾumamin min qablika fa-zayyana lahumu sh-shayṭānu ʾaʿmālahum fa-huwa waliyyuhumu l-yawma wa-lahum ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

64.content: وَما أَنزَلنا عَلَيكَ الكِتابَ إِلّا لِتُبَيِّنَ لَهُمُ الَّذِي اختَلَفوا فيهِ ۙ وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةً لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
64.translation_eng: We did not send down the Book to you except [for the purpose] that you may clarify for them what they differ about, and as a guidance and mercy for a people who have faith.
64.transliteration: wa-mā ʾanzalnā ʿalayka l-kitāba ʾillā li-tubayyina lahumu lladhī khtalafū fīhi wa-hudan wa-raḥmatan li-qawmin yuʾminūna

65.content: وَاللَّهُ أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَحيا بِهِ الأَرضَ بَعدَ مَوتِها ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِقَومٍ يَسمَعونَ
65.translation_eng: Allah sends down water from the sky with which He revives the earth after its death. There is indeed a sign in that for a people who listen.
65.transliteration: wa-llāhu ʾanzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-ʾaḥyā bihi l-ʾarḍa baʿda mawtihā ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan li-qawmin yasmaʿūna

66.content: وَإِنَّ لَكُم فِي الأَنعامِ لَعِبرَةً ۖ نُسقيكُم مِمّا في بُطونِهِ مِن بَينِ فَرثٍ وَدَمٍ لَبَنًا خالِصًا سائِغًا لِلشّارِبينَ
66.translation_eng: There is indeed a moral for you in the cattle: We give you to drink of that which is in their bellies from between [intestinal] waste and blood, as pure milk, pleasant to those who drink.
66.transliteration: wa-ʾinna lakum fī l-ʾanʿāmi la-ʿibratan nusqīkum mimmā fī buṭūnihī min bayni farthin wa-damin labanan khāliṣan sāʾighan li-sh-shāribīna

67.content: وَمِن ثَمَراتِ النَّخيلِ وَالأَعنابِ تَتَّخِذونَ مِنهُ سَكَرًا وَرِزقًا حَسَنًا ۗ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِقَومٍ يَعقِلونَ
67.translation_eng: And of the fruits of date palms and vines, from which you draw wine and goodly provision. There are indeed signs in that for a people who apply reason.
67.transliteration: wa-min thamarāti n-nakhīli wa-l-ʾaʿnābi tattakhidhūna minhu sakaran wa-rizqan ḥasanan ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan li-qawmin yaʿqilūna

68.content: وَأَوحىٰ رَبُّكَ إِلَى النَّحلِ أَنِ اتَّخِذي مِنَ الجِبالِ بُيوتًا وَمِنَ الشَّجَرِ وَمِمّا يَعرِشونَ
68.translation_eng: And your Lord inspired the bee [saying]: ‘Make your home in the mountains, and on the trees and the trellises that they erect.
68.transliteration: wa-ʾawḥā rabbuka ʾilā n-naḥli ʾani ttakhidhī mina l-jibāli buyūtan wa-mina sh-shajari wa-mimmā yaʿrishūna

69.content: ثُمَّ كُلي مِن كُلِّ الثَّمَراتِ فَاسلُكي سُبُلَ رَبِّكِ ذُلُلًا ۚ يَخرُجُ مِن بُطونِها شَرابٌ مُختَلِفٌ أَلوانُهُ فيهِ شِفاءٌ لِلنّاسِ ۗ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِقَومٍ يَتَفَكَّرونَ
69.translation_eng: Then eat from every [kind of] fruit and follow meekly the ways of your Lord.’ There issues from its belly a juice of diverse hues in which there is a cure for the people. There is indeed a sign in that for a people who reflect.
69.transliteration: thumma kulī min kulli th-thamarāti fa-slukī subula rabbiki dhululan yakhruju min buṭūnihā sharābun mukhtalifun ʾalwānuhū fīhi shifāʾun li-n-nāsi ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan li-qawmin yatafakkarūna

70.content: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَكُم ثُمَّ يَتَوَفّاكُم ۚ وَمِنكُم مَن يُرَدُّ إِلىٰ أَرذَلِ العُمُرِ لِكَي لا يَعلَمَ بَعدَ عِلمٍ شَيئًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَليمٌ قَديرٌ
70.translation_eng: Allah has created you, then He takes you away, and there are some among you who are relegated to the nethermost age so that he knows nothing after [having possessed] some knowledge. Indeed Allah is all-knowing, all-powerful.
70.transliteration: wa-llāhu khalaqakum thumma yatawaffākum wa-minkum man yuraddu ʾilā ʾardhali l-ʿumuri li-kay lā yaʿlama baʿda ʿilmin shayʾan ʾinna llāha ʿalīmun qadīrun

71.content: وَاللَّهُ فَضَّلَ بَعضَكُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ فِي الرِّزقِ ۚ فَمَا الَّذينَ فُضِّلوا بِرادّي رِزقِهِم عَلىٰ ما مَلَكَت أَيمانُهُم فَهُم فيهِ سَواءٌ ۚ أَفَبِنِعمَةِ اللَّهِ يَجحَدونَ
71.translation_eng: Allah has granted some of you an advantage over others in [respect of] provision. Those who have been granted an advantage do not give over their provision to their slaves so that they become equal in its respect. What, will they dispute the blessing of Allah?
71.transliteration: wa-llāhu faḍḍala baʿḍakum ʿalā baʿḍin fī r-rizqi fa-mā lladhīna fuḍḍilū bi-rāddī rizqihim ʿalā mā malakat ʾaymānuhum fa-hum fīhi sawāʾun ʾa-fa-bi-niʿmati llāhi yajḥadūna

72.content: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِن أَنفُسِكُم أَزواجًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِن أَزواجِكُم بَنينَ وَحَفَدَةً وَرَزَقَكُم مِنَ الطَّيِّباتِ ۚ أَفَبِالباطِلِ يُؤمِنونَ وَبِنِعمَتِ اللَّهِ هُم يَكفُرونَ
72.translation_eng: Allah made for you mates from your own selves and appointed for you, from your mates, children and grandchildren, and We provided you with all the good things. What, will they believe in falsehood while they deny the blessing of Allah?
72.transliteration: wa-llāhu jaʿala lakum min ʾanfusikum ʾazwājan wa-jaʿala lakum min ʾazwājikum banīna wa-ḥafadatan wa-razaqakum mina ṭ-ṭayyibāti ʾa-fa-bi-l-bāṭili yuʾminūna wa-bi-niʿmati llāhi hum yakfurūna

73.content: وَيَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَملِكُ لَهُم رِزقًا مِنَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ شَيئًا وَلا يَستَطيعونَ
73.translation_eng: They worship besides Allah what has no power to provide them with anything from the heavens and the earth, nor are they capable [of doing that].
73.transliteration: wa-yaʿbudūna min dūni llāhi mā lā yamliku lahum rizqan mina s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi shayʾan wa-lā yastaṭīʿūna

74.content: فَلا تَضرِبوا لِلَّهِ الأَمثالَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعلَمُ وَأَنتُم لا تَعلَمونَ
74.translation_eng: So do not draw comparisons for Allah: indeed Allah knows and you do not know.
74.transliteration: fa-lā taḍribū li-llāhi l-ʾamthāla ʾinna llāha yaʿlamu wa-ʾantum lā taʿlamūna

75.content: ۞ ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا عَبدًا مَملوكًا لا يَقدِرُ عَلىٰ شَيءٍ وَمَن رَزَقناهُ مِنّا رِزقًا حَسَنًا فَهُوَ يُنفِقُ مِنهُ سِرًّا وَجَهرًا ۖ هَل يَستَوونَ ۚ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
75.translation_eng: Allah draws a parable: a chattel who has no power over anything, and one whom We have provided a goodly provision and who spends out of it secretly and openly. Are they equal? All praise belongs to Allah. But most of them do not know.
75.transliteration: ḍaraba llāhu mathalan ʿabdan mamlūkan lā yaqdiru ʿalā shayʾin wa-man razaqnāhu minnā rizqan ḥasanan fa-huwa yunfiqu minhu sirran wa-jahran hal yastawūna l-ḥamdu li-llāhi bal ʾaktharuhum lā yaʿlamūna

76.content: وَضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا رَجُلَينِ أَحَدُهُما أَبكَمُ لا يَقدِرُ عَلىٰ شَيءٍ وَهُوَ كَلٌّ عَلىٰ مَولاهُ أَينَما يُوَجِّههُ لا يَأتِ بِخَيرٍ ۖ هَل يَستَوي هُوَ وَمَن يَأمُرُ بِالعَدلِ ۙ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
76.translation_eng: Allah draws [another] parable: Two men, one of whom is dumb, having no power over anything and who is a liability to his master: wherever he directs him he does not bring any good. Is he equal to someone who enjoins justice and is [steady] on a straight path?
76.transliteration: wa-ḍaraba llāhu mathalan rajulayni ʾaḥaduhumā ʾabkamu lā yaqdiru ʿalā shayʾin wa-huwa kallun ʿalā mawlāhu ʾaynamā yuwajjihhu lā yaʾti bi-khayrin hal yastawī huwa wa-man yaʾmuru bi-l-ʿadli wa-huwa ʿalā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

77.content: وَلِلَّهِ غَيبُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ وَما أَمرُ السّاعَةِ إِلّا كَلَمحِ البَصَرِ أَو هُوَ أَقرَبُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
77.translation_eng: To Allah belongs the Unseen of the heavens and the earth. The matter of the Hour1 is just like the twinkling of an eye, or [even] swifter. Indeed Allah has power over all things.Or ‘The command of the Hour.’
77.transliteration: wa-li-llāhi ghaybu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā ʾamru s-sāʿati ʾillā ka-lamḥi l-baṣari ʾaw huwa ʾaqrabu ʾinna llāha ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

78.content: وَاللَّهُ أَخرَجَكُم مِن بُطونِ أُمَّهاتِكُم لا تَعلَمونَ شَيئًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمعَ وَالأَبصارَ وَالأَفئِدَةَ ۙ لَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
78.translation_eng: Allah has brought you forth from the bellies of your mothers while you did not know anything. He made for you hearing, eyesight, and hearts so that you may give thanks.
78.transliteration: wa-llāhu ʾakhrajakum min buṭūni ʾummahātikum lā taʿlamūna shayʾan wa-jaʿala lakumu s-samʿa wa-l-ʾabṣāra wa-l-ʾafʾidata laʿallakum tashkurūna

79.content: أَلَم يَرَوا إِلَى الطَّيرِ مُسَخَّراتٍ في جَوِّ السَّماءِ ما يُمسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا اللَّهُ ۗ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
79.translation_eng: Have they not regarded the birds disposed in the air of the sky: no one sustains them except Allah. There are indeed signs in that for a people who have faith.
79.transliteration: ʾa-lam yaraw ʾilā ṭ-ṭayri musakhkharātin fī jawwi s-samāʾi mā yumsikuhunna ʾillā llāhu ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yuʾminūna

80.content: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِن بُيوتِكُم سَكَنًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِن جُلودِ الأَنعامِ بُيوتًا تَستَخِفّونَها يَومَ ظَعنِكُم وَيَومَ إِقامَتِكُم ۙ وَمِن أَصوافِها وَأَوبارِها وَأَشعارِها أَثاثًا وَمَتاعًا إِلىٰ حينٍ
80.translation_eng: It is Allah who has made for you your homes as a place of rest and He made for you homes out of the skins of the cattle which you find portable on the day of your shifting and on the day of your halt, and out of their wool, their fur and hair furniture and wares [enduring] for a while.
80.transliteration: wa-llāhu jaʿala lakum min buyūtikum sakanan wa-jaʿala lakum min julūdi l-ʾanʿāmi buyūtan tastakhiffūnahā yawma ẓaʿnikum wa-yawma ʾiqāmatikum wa-min ʾaṣwāfihā wa-ʾawbārihā wa-ʾashʿārihā ʾathāthan wa-matāʿan ʾilā ḥīnin

81.content: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِمّا خَلَقَ ظِلالًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِنَ الجِبالِ أَكنانًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم سَرابيلَ تَقيكُمُ الحَرَّ وَسَرابيلَ تَقيكُم بَأسَكُم ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يُتِمُّ نِعمَتَهُ عَلَيكُم لَعَلَّكُم تُسلِمونَ
81.translation_eng: It is Allah who has made for you shade from what He created, and made for you retreats in the mountains, and made for you garments that protect you from heat and garments that protect you from your [mutual] violence. That is how He completes His blessing upon you so that you may submit [to Him].
81.transliteration: wa-llāhu jaʿala lakum mimmā khalaqa ẓilālan wa-jaʿala lakum mina l-jibāli ʾaknānan wa-jaʿala lakum sarābīla taqīkumu l-ḥarra wa-sarābīla taqīkum baʾsakum ka-dhālika yutimmu niʿmatahū ʿalaykum laʿallakum tuslimūna

82.content: فَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَإِنَّما عَلَيكَ البَلاغُ المُبينُ
82.translation_eng: But if they turn their backs [on you], your duty is only to communicate in clear terms.
82.transliteration: fa-ʾin tawallaw fa-ʾinnamā ʿalayka l-balāghu l-mubīnu

83.content: يَعرِفونَ نِعمَتَ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ يُنكِرونَها وَأَكثَرُهُمُ الكافِرونَ
83.translation_eng: They recognize the blessing of Allah and then deny it, and most of them are faithless.
83.transliteration: yaʿrifūna niʿmata llāhi thumma yunkirūnahā wa-ʾaktharuhumu l-kāfirūna

84.content: وَيَومَ نَبعَثُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ شَهيدًا ثُمَّ لا يُؤذَنُ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا وَلا هُم يُستَعتَبونَ
84.translation_eng: The day We shall raise a witness from every nation, then the faithless will not be permitted [to speak],1 nor will they be asked to propitiate [Allah].Cf. 11:105; 23:108; 36:65; 78:38.
84.transliteration: wa-yawma nabʿathu min kulli ʾummatin shahīdan thumma lā yuʾdhanu li-lladhīna kafarū wa-lā hum yustaʿtabūna

85.content: وَإِذا رَأَى الَّذينَ ظَلَمُوا العَذابَ فَلا يُخَفَّفُ عَنهُم وَلا هُم يُنظَرونَ
85.translation_eng: And when the wrongdoers sight the punishment, it shall not be lightened for them, nor will they be granted any respite.
85.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā raʾā lladhīna ẓalamū l-ʿadhāba fa-lā yukhaffafu ʿanhum wa-lā hum yunẓarūna

86.content: وَإِذا رَأَى الَّذينَ أَشرَكوا شُرَكاءَهُم قالوا رَبَّنا هٰؤُلاءِ شُرَكاؤُنَا الَّذينَ كُنّا نَدعو مِن دونِكَ ۖ فَأَلقَوا إِلَيهِمُ القَولَ إِنَّكُم لَكاذِبونَ
86.translation_eng: When the polytheists sight their partners, they will say, ‘Our Lord! These are our partners whom we used to invoke besides You.’ But they will retort to them, ‘You are indeed liars!’
86.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā raʾā lladhīna ʾashrakū shurakāʾahum qālū rabbanā hāʾulāʾi shurakāʾunā lladhīna kunnā nadʿū min dūnika fa-ʾalqaw ʾilayhimu l-qawla ʾinnakum la-kādhibūna

87.content: وَأَلقَوا إِلَى اللَّهِ يَومَئِذٍ السَّلَمَ ۖ وَضَلَّ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَفتَرونَ
87.translation_eng: They will submit to Allah on that day, and what they used to fabricate will forsake them.
87.transliteration: wa-ʾalqaw ʾilā llāhi yawmaʾidhin-i s-salama wa-ḍalla ʿanhum mā kānū yaftarūna

88.content: الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَصَدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ زِدناهُم عَذابًا فَوقَ العَذابِ بِما كانوا يُفسِدونَ
88.translation_eng: Those who are faithless and bar from the way of Allah —We shall add punishment to their punishment because of the corruption they used to cause.
88.transliteration: alladhīna kafarū wa-ṣaddū ʿan sabīli llāhi zidnāhum ʿadhāban fawqa l-ʿadhābi bi-mā kānū yufsidūna

89.content: وَيَومَ نَبعَثُ في كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ شَهيدًا عَلَيهِم مِن أَنفُسِهِم ۖ وَجِئنا بِكَ شَهيدًا عَلىٰ هٰؤُلاءِ ۚ وَنَزَّلنا عَلَيكَ الكِتابَ تِبيانًا لِكُلِّ شَيءٍ وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةً وَبُشرىٰ لِلمُسلِمينَ
89.translation_eng: The day We raise in every nation a witness against them from among themselves, We shall bring you as a witness against these. We have sent down the Book to you as a clarification of all things and as a guidance and mercy and good news for the muslims.
89.transliteration: wa-yawma nabʿathu fī kulli ʾummatin shahīdan ʿalayhim min ʾanfusihim wa-jiʾnā bika shahīdan ʿalā hāʾulāʾi wa-nazzalnā ʿalayka l-kitāba tibyānan li-kulli shayʾin wa-hudan wa-raḥmatan wa-bushrā li-l-muslimīna

90.content: ۞ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَأمُرُ بِالعَدلِ وَالإِحسانِ وَإيتاءِ ذِي القُربىٰ وَيَنهىٰ عَنِ الفَحشاءِ وَالمُنكَرِ وَالبَغيِ ۚ يَعِظُكُم لَعَلَّكُم تَذَكَّرونَ
90.translation_eng: Indeed Allah enjoins justice and kindness and generosity towards relatives, and He forbids indecency, wrong, and aggression. He advises you, so that you may take admonition.
90.transliteration: ʾinna llāha yaʾmuru bi-l-ʿadli wa-l-ʾiḥsāni wa-ʾītāʾi dhī l-qurbā wa-yanhā ʿani l-faḥshāʾi wa-l-munkari wa-l-baghyi yaʿiẓukum laʿallakum tadhakkarūna

91.content: وَأَوفوا بِعَهدِ اللَّهِ إِذا عاهَدتُم وَلا تَنقُضُوا الأَيمانَ بَعدَ تَوكيدِها وَقَد جَعَلتُمُ اللَّهَ عَلَيكُم كَفيلًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعلَمُ ما تَفعَلونَ
91.translation_eng: Fulfill Allah’s covenant when you pledge, and do not break [your] oaths after pledging them solemnly and having made Allah a witness over yourselves. Indeed Allah knows what you do.
91.transliteration: wa-ʾawfū bi-ʿahdi llāhi ʾidhā ʿāhadtum wa-lā tanquḍū l-ʾaymāna baʿda tawkīdihā wa-qad jaʿaltumu llāha ʿalaykum kafīlan ʾinna llāha yaʿlamu mā tafʿalūna

92.content: وَلا تَكونوا كَالَّتي نَقَضَت غَزلَها مِن بَعدِ قُوَّةٍ أَنكاثًا تَتَّخِذونَ أَيمانَكُم دَخَلًا بَينَكُم أَن تَكونَ أُمَّةٌ هِيَ أَربىٰ مِن أُمَّةٍ ۚ إِنَّما يَبلوكُمُ اللَّهُ بِهِ ۚ وَلَيُبَيِّنَنَّ لَكُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ ما كُنتُم فيهِ تَختَلِفونَ
92.translation_eng: Do not be like her who would undo her yarn, breaking it up after [spinning it to] strength, by making your oaths a means of [mutual] deceit among yourselves, so that one community may become more affluent than another community.1 Allah only tests you thereby, and He will surely clarify for you on the Day of Resurrection what you used to differ about.Or ‘for one community may be more numerous (or more affluent) than another community.’
92.transliteration: wa-lā takūnū ka-llatī naqaḍat ghazlahā min baʿdi quwwatin ʾankāthan tattakhidhūna ʾaymānakum dakhalan baynakum ʾan takūna ʾummatun hiya ʾarbā min ʾummatin ʾinnamā yablūkumu llāhu bihī wa-la-yubayyinanna lakum yawma l-qiyāmati mā kuntum fīhi takhtalifūna

93.content: وَلَو شاءَ اللَّهُ لَجَعَلَكُم أُمَّةً واحِدَةً وَلٰكِن يُضِلُّ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَهدي مَن يَشاءُ ۚ وَلَتُسأَلُنَّ عَمّا كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
93.translation_eng: Had Allah wished, He would have made you one community, but He leads astray whomever He wishes and guides whomever He wishes, and you will surely be questioned concerning what you used to do.
93.transliteration: wa-law-shāʾa llāhu la-jaʿalakum ʾummatan wāḥidatan wa-lākin yuḍillu man yashāʾu wa-yahdī man yashāʾu wa-la-tusʾalunna ʿammā kuntum taʿmalūna

94.content: وَلا تَتَّخِذوا أَيمانَكُم دَخَلًا بَينَكُم فَتَزِلَّ قَدَمٌ بَعدَ ثُبوتِها وَتَذوقُوا السّوءَ بِما صَدَدتُم عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ وَلَكُم عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
94.translation_eng: Do not make your oaths a means of [mutual] deceit among yourselves lest feet should stumble after being steady and [lest] you suffer ill for barring from the way of Allah and there be a great punishment for you.
94.transliteration: wa-lā tattakhidhū ʾaymānakum dakhalan baynakum fa-tazilla qadamun baʿda thubūtihā wa-tadhūqū s-sūʾa bi-mā ṣadadtum ʿan sabīli llāhi wa-lakum ʿadhābun ʿaẓīmun

95.content: وَلا تَشتَروا بِعَهدِ اللَّهِ ثَمَنًا قَليلًا ۚ إِنَّما عِندَ اللَّهِ هُوَ خَيرٌ لَكُم إِن كُنتُم تَعلَمونَ
95.translation_eng: Do not sell Allah’s covenant for a paltry gain. Indeed what is with Allah is better for you, should you know.
95.transliteration: wa-lā tashtarū bi-ʿahdi llāhi thamanan qalīlan ʾinnamā ʿinda llāhi huwa khayrun lakum ʾin kuntum taʿlamūna

96.content: ما عِندَكُم يَنفَدُ ۖ وَما عِندَ اللَّهِ باقٍ ۗ وَلَنَجزِيَنَّ الَّذينَ صَبَروا أَجرَهُم بِأَحسَنِ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
96.translation_eng: That which is with you will be spent but what is with Allah shall last, and We will surely pay the patient their reward by the best of what they used to do.
96.transliteration: mā ʿindakum yanfadu wa-mā ʿinda llāhi bāqin wa-la-najziyanna lladhīna ṣabarū ʾajrahum bi-ʾaḥsani mā kānū yaʿmalūna

97.content: مَن عَمِلَ صالِحًا مِن ذَكَرٍ أَو أُنثىٰ وَهُوَ مُؤمِنٌ فَلَنُحيِيَنَّهُ حَياةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ وَلَنَجزِيَنَّهُم أَجرَهُم بِأَحسَنِ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
97.translation_eng: Whoever acts righteously, [whether] male or female, should he be faithful, —We shall revive him with a good life and pay them their reward by the best of what they used to do.
97.transliteration: man ʿamila ṣāliḥan min dhakarin ʾaw ʾunthā wa-huwa muʾminun fa-la-nuḥyiyannahū ḥayātan ṭayyibatan wa-la-najziyannahum ʾajrahum bi-ʾaḥsani mā kānū yaʿmalūna

98.content: فَإِذا قَرَأتَ القُرآنَ فَاستَعِذ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيطانِ الرَّجيمِ
98.translation_eng: When you recite the Qurʾān, seek the protection of Allah against the outcast Satan.
98.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā qaraʾta l-qurʿāna fa-staʿidh bi-llāhi mina sh-shayṭāni r-rajīmi

99.content: إِنَّهُ لَيسَ لَهُ سُلطانٌ عَلَى الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَلىٰ رَبِّهِم يَتَوَكَّلونَ
99.translation_eng: Indeed he does not have any authority over those who have faith and put their trust in their Lord.
99.transliteration: ʾinnahū laysa lahū sulṭānun ʿalā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿalā rabbihim yatawakkalūna

100.content: إِنَّما سُلطانُهُ عَلَى الَّذينَ يَتَوَلَّونَهُ وَالَّذينَ هُم بِهِ مُشرِكونَ
100.translation_eng: His authority is only over those who befriend him and those who make him a partner [of Allah].
100.transliteration: ʾinnamā sulṭānuhū ʿalā lladhīna yatawallawnahū wa-lladhīna hum bihī mushrikūna

101.content: وَإِذا بَدَّلنا آيَةً مَكانَ آيَةٍ ۙ وَاللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما يُنَزِّلُ قالوا إِنَّما أَنتَ مُفتَرٍ ۚ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
101.translation_eng: When We change a sign with another in its place —and Allah knows best what He sends down— they say, ‘You are just a fabricator.’ Rather most of them do not know.
101.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā baddalnā ʾāyatan makāna ʾāyatin wa-llāhu ʾaʿlamu bi-mā yunazzilu qālū ʾinnamā ʾanta muftarin bal ʾaktharuhum lā yaʿlamūna

102.content: قُل نَزَّلَهُ روحُ القُدُسِ مِن رَبِّكَ بِالحَقِّ لِيُثَبِّتَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَهُدًى وَبُشرىٰ لِلمُسلِمينَ
102.translation_eng: Say, the Holy Spirit has brought it down duly from your Lord to fortify those who have faith and as a guidance and good news for the muslims.
102.transliteration: qul nazzalahū rūḥu l-qudusi min rabbika bi-l-ḥaqqi li-yuthabbita lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-hudan wa-bushrā li-l-muslimīna

103.content: وَلَقَد نَعلَمُ أَنَّهُم يَقولونَ إِنَّما يُعَلِّمُهُ بَشَرٌ ۗ لِسانُ الَّذي يُلحِدونَ إِلَيهِ أَعجَمِيٌّ وَهٰذا لِسانٌ عَرَبِيٌّ مُبينٌ
103.translation_eng: We certainly know that they say, ‘It is only a human that instructs him.’ The language of him to whom they refer is non-Arabic, while this is a clear Arabic language.
103.transliteration: wa-la-qad naʿlamu ʾannahum yaqūlūna ʾinnamā yuʿallimuhū basharun lisānu lladhī yulḥidūna ʾilayhi ʾaʿjamiyyun wa-hādhā lisānun ʿarabiyyun mubīnun

104.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِآياتِ اللَّهِ لا يَهديهِمُ اللَّهُ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
104.translation_eng: Indeed those who do not believe in the signs of Allah —Allah shall not guide them and there is a painful punishment for them.
104.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-ʾāyāti llāhi lā yahdīhimu llāhu wa-lahum ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

105.content: إِنَّما يَفتَرِي الكَذِبَ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِآياتِ اللَّهِ ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الكاذِبونَ
105.translation_eng: Only those fabricate lies who do not believe in the signs of Allah, and it is they who are the liars.
105.transliteration: ʾinnamā yaftarī l-kadhiba lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-ʾāyāti llāhi wa-ʾulāʾika humu l-kādhibūna

106.content: مَن كَفَرَ بِاللَّهِ مِن بَعدِ إيمانِهِ إِلّا مَن أُكرِهَ وَقَلبُهُ مُطمَئِنٌّ بِالإيمانِ وَلٰكِن مَن شَرَحَ بِالكُفرِ صَدرًا فَعَلَيهِم غَضَبٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
106.translation_eng: Whoever renounces faith in Allah after [affirming] his faith —barring someone who is compelled while his heart is at rest in faith— but those who open up their breasts to unfaith, upon such shall be Allah’s wrath, and there is a great punishment for them.
106.transliteration: man kafara bi-llāhi min baʿdi ʾīmānihī ʾillā man ʾukriha wa-qalbuhū muṭmaʾinnun bi-l-ʾīmāni wa-lākin man sharaḥa bi-l-kufri ṣadran fa-ʿalayhim ghaḍabun mina llāhi wa-lahum ʿadhābun ʿaẓīmun

107.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمُ استَحَبُّوا الحَياةَ الدُّنيا عَلَى الآخِرَةِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدِي القَومَ الكافِرينَ
107.translation_eng: That, because they preferred the life of the world to the Hereafter and that Allah does not guide the faithless lot.
107.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahumu staḥabbū l-ḥayāta d-dunyā ʿalā l-ʾākhirati wa-ʾanna llāha lā yahdī l-qawma l-kāfirīna

108.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ طَبَعَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم وَسَمعِهِم وَأَبصارِهِم ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الغافِلونَ
108.translation_eng: They are the ones on whose hearts Allah has set a seal, and on their hearing and their sight [as well], and it is they who are the heedless.
108.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna ṭabaʿa llāhu ʿalā qulūbihim wa-samʿihim wa-ʾabṣārihim wa-ʾulāʾika humu l-ghāfilūna

109.content: لا جَرَمَ أَنَّهُم فِي الآخِرَةِ هُمُ الخاسِرونَ
109.translation_eng: Undoubtedly, they are the ones who will be the losers in the Hereafter.
109.transliteration: lā jarama ʾannahum fī l-ʾākhirati humu l-khāsirūna

110.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لِلَّذينَ هاجَروا مِن بَعدِ ما فُتِنوا ثُمَّ جاهَدوا وَصَبَروا إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِن بَعدِها لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
110.translation_eng: Then indeed your Lord, to those who migrated, after they were persecuted, and waged jihād and were patient —indeed, after that, your Lord will surely be all-forgiving, all-merciful.
110.transliteration: thumma ʾinna rabbaka li-lladhīna hājarū min baʿdi mā futinū thumma jāhadū wa-ṣabarū ʾinna rabbaka min baʿdihā la-ghafūrun raḥīmun

111.content: ۞ يَومَ تَأتي كُلُّ نَفسٍ تُجادِلُ عَن نَفسِها وَتُوَفّىٰ كُلُّ نَفسٍ ما عَمِلَت وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
111.translation_eng: The day when every soul will come pleading for itself and every soul will be recompensed fully for what it has done, and they will not be wronged.
111.transliteration: yawma taʾtī kullu nafsin tujādilu ʿan nafsihā wa-tuwaffā kullu nafsin mā ʿamilat wa-hum lā yuẓlamūna

112.content: وَضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا قَريَةً كانَت آمِنَةً مُطمَئِنَّةً يَأتيها رِزقُها رَغَدًا مِن كُلِّ مَكانٍ فَكَفَرَت بِأَنعُمِ اللَّهِ فَأَذاقَهَا اللَّهُ لِباسَ الجوعِ وَالخَوفِ بِما كانوا يَصنَعونَ
112.translation_eng: Allah draws a parable: A town secure and peaceful. Its provision came abundantly from every place. But it was ungrateful toward Allah’s blessings. So Allah made it taste hunger and fear because of what they used to do.
112.transliteration: wa-ḍaraba llāhu mathalan qaryatan kānat ʾāminatan muṭmaʾinnatan yaʾtīhā rizquhā raghadan min kulli makānin fa-kafarat bi-ʾanʿumi llāhi fa-ʾadhāqahā llāhu libāsa l-jūʿi wa-l-khawfi bi-mā kānū yaṣnaʿūna

113.content: وَلَقَد جاءَهُم رَسولٌ مِنهُم فَكَذَّبوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمُ العَذابُ وَهُم ظالِمونَ
113.translation_eng: There had certainly come to them an apostle from among themselves, but they impugned him, so the punishment seized them while they were wrongdoers.
113.transliteration: wa-la-qad jāʾahum rasūlun minhum fa-kadhdhabūhu fa-ʾakhadhahumu l-ʿadhābu wa-hum ẓālimūna

114.content: فَكُلوا مِمّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ حَلالًا طَيِّبًا وَاشكُروا نِعمَتَ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتُم إِيّاهُ تَعبُدونَ
114.translation_eng: So eat out of what Allah has provided you as lawful and good, and give thanks for Allah’s blessing, if it is Him that you worship.
114.transliteration: fa-kulū mimmā razaqakumu llāhu ḥalālan ṭayyiban wa-shkurū niʿmata llāhi ʾin kuntum ʾiyyāhu taʿbudūna

115.content: إِنَّما حَرَّمَ عَلَيكُمُ المَيتَةَ وَالدَّمَ وَلَحمَ الخِنزيرِ وَما أُهِلَّ لِغَيرِ اللَّهِ بِهِ ۖ فَمَنِ اضطُرَّ غَيرَ باغٍ وَلا عادٍ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
115.translation_eng: He has forbidden you only carrion, blood, the flesh of the swine, and that which has been offered to other than Allah. But should someone be compelled, without being rebellious or aggressive, indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.1Cf. 2:173; 5:3; 6:145.
115.transliteration: ʾinnamā ḥarrama ʿalaykumu l-maytata wa-d-dama wa-laḥma l-khinzīri wa-mā ʾuhilla li-ghayri llāhi bihī fa-mani ḍṭurra ghayra bāghin wa-lā ʿādin fa-ʾinna llāha ghafūrun raḥīmun

116.content: وَلا تَقولوا لِما تَصِفُ أَلسِنَتُكُمُ الكَذِبَ هٰذا حَلالٌ وَهٰذا حَرامٌ لِتَفتَروا عَلَى اللَّهِ الكَذِبَ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَفتَرونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ الكَذِبَ لا يُفلِحونَ
116.translation_eng: Do not say, asserting falsely with your tongues, ‘This is lawful, and this is unlawful,’ to fabricate lies against Allah. Indeed those who fabricate lies against Allah will not be felicitous.
116.transliteration: wa-lā taqūlū li-mā taṣifu ʾalsinatukumu l-kadhiba hādhā ḥalālun wa-hādhā ḥarāmun li-taftarū ʿalā llāhi l-kadhiba ʾinna lladhīna yaftarūna ʿalā llāhi l-kadhiba lā yufliḥūna

117.translation_eng: A trifling enjoyment, and there will be a painful punishment for them.

118.content: وَعَلَى الَّذينَ هادوا حَرَّمنا ما قَصَصنا عَلَيكَ مِن قَبلُ ۖ وَما ظَلَمناهُم وَلٰكِن كانوا أَنفُسَهُم يَظلِمونَ
118.translation_eng: We forbade to the Jews what We have recounted to you earlier, and We did not wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.
118.transliteration: wa-ʿalā lladhīna hādū ḥarramnā mā qaṣaṣnā ʿalayka min qablu wa-mā ẓalamnāhum wa-lākin kānū ʾanfusahum yaẓlimūna

119.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لِلَّذينَ عَمِلُوا السّوءَ بِجَهالَةٍ ثُمَّ تابوا مِن بَعدِ ذٰلِكَ وَأَصلَحوا إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِن بَعدِها لَغَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
119.translation_eng: Then indeed your Lord, to those who commit evil out of ignorance and then repent after that, and reform —indeed, after that, your Lord will surely be all-forgiving, all-merciful.
119.transliteration: thumma ʾinna rabbaka li-lladhīna ʿamilū s-sūʾa bi-jahālatin thumma tābū min baʿdi dhālika wa-ʾaṣlaḥū ʾinna rabbaka min baʿdihā la-ghafūrun raḥīmun

120.content: إِنَّ إِبراهيمَ كانَ أُمَّةً قانِتًا لِلَّهِ حَنيفًا وَلَم يَكُ مِنَ المُشرِكينَ
120.translation_eng: Indeed Abraham was a nation obedient to Allah, a ḥanīf, and he was not one of the polytheists.
120.transliteration: ʾinna ʾibrāhīma kāna ʾummatan qānitan li-llāhi ḥanīfan wa-lam yaku mina l-mushrikīna

121.content: شاكِرًا لِأَنعُمِهِ ۚ اجتَباهُ وَهَداهُ إِلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
121.translation_eng: Grateful [as he was] for His blessings, He chose him and guided him to a straight path.
121.transliteration: shākiran li-ʾanʿumihi jtabāhu wa-hadāhu ʾilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

122.content: وَآتَيناهُ فِي الدُّنيا حَسَنَةً ۖ وَإِنَّهُ فِي الآخِرَةِ لَمِنَ الصّالِحينَ
122.translation_eng: We gave him good in this world, and in the Hereafter he will indeed be among the Righteous.
122.transliteration: wa-ʾātaynāhu fī d-dunyā ḥasanatan wa-ʾinnahū fī l-ʾākhirati la-mina ṣ-ṣāliḥīna

123.content: ثُمَّ أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ أَنِ اتَّبِع مِلَّةَ إِبراهيمَ حَنيفًا ۖ وَما كانَ مِنَ المُشرِكينَ
123.translation_eng: Then We revealed to you [saying], ‘Follow the creed of Abraham, a ḥanīf, and he was not one of the polytheists.’
123.transliteration: thumma ʾawḥaynā ʾilayka ʾani ttabiʿ millata ʾibrāhīma ḥanīfan wa-mā kāna mina l-mushrikīna

124.content: إِنَّما جُعِلَ السَّبتُ عَلَى الَّذينَ اختَلَفوا فيهِ ۚ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَحكُمُ بَينَهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ فيما كانوا فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
124.translation_eng: The Sabbath was only prescribed for those who differed about it. Your Lord will indeed judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that about which they used to differ.
124.transliteration: ʾinnamā juʿila s-sabtu ʿalā lladhīna khtalafū fīhi wa-ʾinna rabbaka la-yaḥkumu baynahum yawma l-qiyāmati fī-mā kānū fīhi yakhtalifūna

125.content: ادعُ إِلىٰ سَبيلِ رَبِّكَ بِالحِكمَةِ وَالمَوعِظَةِ الحَسَنَةِ ۖ وَجادِلهُم بِالَّتي هِيَ أَحسَنُ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبيلِهِ ۖ وَهُوَ أَعلَمُ بِالمُهتَدينَ
125.translation_eng: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good advice and dispute with them in a manner that is best. Indeed your Lord knows best those who stray from His way, and He knows best those who are guided.
125.transliteration: udʿu ʾilā sabīli rabbika bi-l-ḥikmati wa-l-mawʿiẓati l-ḥasanati wa-jādilhum bi-llatī hiya ʾaḥsanu ʾinna rabbaka huwa ʾaʿlamu bi-man ḍalla ʿan sabīlihī wa-huwa ʾaʿlamu bi-l-muhtadīna

126.content: وَإِن عاقَبتُم فَعاقِبوا بِمِثلِ ما عوقِبتُم بِهِ ۖ وَلَئِن صَبَرتُم لَهُوَ خَيرٌ لِلصّابِرينَ
126.translation_eng: And if you retaliate, retaliate with the like of what you have been made to suffer, but if you are patient that is surely better for the patient.
126.transliteration: wa-ʾin ʿāqabtum fa-ʿāqibū bi-mithli mā ʿūqibtum bihī wa-la-ʾin ṣabartum la-huwa khayrun li-ṣ-ṣābirīna

127.content: وَاصبِر وَما صَبرُكَ إِلّا بِاللَّهِ ۚ وَلا تَحزَن عَلَيهِم وَلا تَكُ في ضَيقٍ مِمّا يَمكُرونَ
127.translation_eng: So be patient, and you cannot be patient except with Allah[’s help]. And do not grieve for them, nor be upset by their guile.
127.transliteration: wa-ṣbir wa-mā ṣabruka ʾillā bi-llāhi wa-lā taḥzan ʿalayhim wa-lā taku fī ḍayqin mimmā yamkurūna

128.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ مَعَ الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا وَالَّذينَ هُم مُحسِنونَ
128.translation_eng: Indeed Allah is with those who are Godwary and those who are virtuous.
128.transliteration: ʾinna llāha maʿa lladhīna ttaqaw wa-lladhīna hum muḥsinūna

17.description: The surah that mentions the miracle of The Night Journey, wherein God transported His servant Muḥammad in a single night from the Sacred Mosque of Mecca to al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem, to show him some of His most wondrous signs. God caused Muhammad, in the space of a single night, to journey from Mecca to Jerusalem and from there to heaven and back again. It takes its name from this subject, as relating to the celestial journey (miʿrāj) of the Prophet, mentioned in verse 1 and again in verse 60. The surah is framed by references to the Children of Israel at the beginning, and to Pharaoh at the end. The bulk of the surah deals with the Quran as guidance and warning, Muḥammad, and the nature of prophecy, especially the fact that he is a human being and incapable himself of producing miracles. It also warns of Iblis’s promise to tempt mankind and of the fate of the disbelievers, and it gives a series of commandments (verse 22 .).The surah is also known as: Glory, The Children of Israel.

1.content: سُبحانَ الَّذي أَسرىٰ بِعَبدِهِ لَيلًا مِنَ المَسجِدِ الحَرامِ إِلَى المَسجِدِ الأَقصَى الَّذي بارَكنا حَولَهُ لِنُرِيَهُ مِن آياتِنا ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّميعُ البَصيرُ
1.translation_eng: Immaculate is He who carried His servant on a journey by night from the Sacred Mosque to the Farthest Mosque whose environs We have blessed, that We might show him some of Our signs. Indeed He is the All-hearing, the All-seeing.
1.transliteration: subḥāna lladhī ʾasrā bi-ʿabdihī laylan mina l-masjidi l-ḥarāmi ʾilā l-masjidi l-ʾaqṣā lladhī bāraknā ḥawlahū li-nuriyahū min ʾāyātinā ʾinnahū huwa s-samīʿu l-baṣīru

2.content: وَآتَينا موسَى الكِتابَ وَجَعَلناهُ هُدًى لِبَني إِسرائيلَ أَلّا تَتَّخِذوا مِن دوني وَكيلًا
2.translation_eng: We gave Moses the Book, and made it a guide for the Children of Israel —[saying,] ‘Do not take any trustee besides Me’—
2.transliteration: wa-ʾātaynā mūsā l-kitāba wa-jaʿalnāhu hudan li-banī ʾisrāʾīla ʾallā tattakhidhū min dūnī wakīlan

3.content: ذُرِّيَّةَ مَن حَمَلنا مَعَ نوحٍ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ عَبدًا شَكورًا
3.translation_eng: descendants of those whom We carried [in the ark] with Noah. Indeed he was a grateful servant.
3.transliteration: dhurriyyata man ḥamalnā maʿa nūḥin ʾinnahū kāna ʿabdan shakūran

4.content: وَقَضَينا إِلىٰ بَني إِسرائيلَ فِي الكِتابِ لَتُفسِدُنَّ فِي الأَرضِ مَرَّتَينِ وَلَتَعلُنَّ عُلُوًّا كَبيرًا
4.translation_eng: We revealed to the Children of Israel in the Book: ‘Twice you will cause corruption on the earth, and you will perpetrate great tyranny.’
4.transliteration: wa-qaḍaynā ʾilā banī ʾisrāʾīla fī l-kitābi la-tufsidunna fī l-ʾarḍi marratayni wa-la-taʿlunna ʿuluwwan kabīran

5.content: فَإِذا جاءَ وَعدُ أولاهُما بَعَثنا عَلَيكُم عِبادًا لَنا أُولي بَأسٍ شَديدٍ فَجاسوا خِلالَ الدِّيارِ ۚ وَكانَ وَعدًا مَفعولًا
5.translation_eng: So when the first occasion of the two [prophecies] came, We aroused against you Our servants possessing great might, and they ransacked [your] habitations, and the promise was bound to be fulfilled.
5.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā jāʾa waʿdu ʾūlāhumā baʿathnā ʿalaykum ʿibādan lanā ʾulī baʾsin shadīdin fa-jāsū khilāla d-diyāri wa-kāna waʿdan mafʿūlan

6.content: ثُمَّ رَدَدنا لَكُمُ الكَرَّةَ عَلَيهِم وَأَمدَدناكُم بِأَموالٍ وَبَنينَ وَجَعَلناكُم أَكثَرَ نَفيرًا
6.translation_eng: Then We gave you back the turn [to prevail] over them, and We aided you with children and wealth, and made you greater in number,
6.transliteration: thumma radadnā lakumu l-karrata ʿalayhim wa-ʾamdadnākum bi-ʾamwālin wa-banīna wa-jaʿalnākum ʾakthara nafīran

7.content: إِن أَحسَنتُم أَحسَنتُم لِأَنفُسِكُم ۖ وَإِن أَسَأتُم فَلَها ۚ فَإِذا جاءَ وَعدُ الآخِرَةِ لِيَسوءوا وُجوهَكُم وَلِيَدخُلُوا المَسجِدَ كَما دَخَلوهُ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ وَلِيُتَبِّروا ما عَلَوا تَتبيرًا
7.translation_eng: [saying,] ‘If you do good, you will do good to your [own] souls, and if you do evil, it will be [evil] for them.’ So when the occasion for the other [prophecy] comes, they will make your faces1 wretched, and enter the Temple just as they entered it the first time, and utterly destroy whatever they come upon.Or ‘notables.’
7.transliteration: ʾin ʾaḥsantum ʾaḥsantum li-ʾanfusikum wa-ʾin ʾasaʾtum fa-lahā fa-ʾidhā jāʾa waʿdu l-ʾākhirati li-yasūʾū wujūhakum wa-li-yadkhulū l-masjida ka-mā dakhalūhu ʾawwala marratin wa-li-yutabbirū mā ʿalaw tatbīran

8.content: عَسىٰ رَبُّكُم أَن يَرحَمَكُم ۚ وَإِن عُدتُم عُدنا ۘ وَجَعَلنا جَهَنَّمَ لِلكافِرينَ حَصيرًا
8.translation_eng: Maybe your Lord will have mercy on you, but if you revert, We [too] will revert, and We have made hell a prison for the faithless.
8.transliteration: ʿasā rabbukum ʾan yarḥamakum wa-ʾin ʿudtum ʿudnā wa-jaʿalnā jahannama li-l-kāfirīna ḥaṣīran

9.content: إِنَّ هٰذَا القُرآنَ يَهدي لِلَّتي هِيَ أَقوَمُ وَيُبَشِّرُ المُؤمِنينَ الَّذينَ يَعمَلونَ الصّالِحاتِ أَنَّ لَهُم أَجرًا كَبيرًا
9.translation_eng: Indeed this Qurʾān guides to what is most upright, and gives the good news to the faithful who do righteous deeds that there is a great reward for them.
9.transliteration: ʾinna hādhā l-qurʾāna yahdī li-llatī hiya ʾaqwamu wa-yubashshiru l-muʾminīna lladhīna yaʿmalūna ṣ-ṣāliḥāti ʾanna lahum ʾajran kabīran

10.content: وَأَنَّ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالآخِرَةِ أَعتَدنا لَهُم عَذابًا أَليمًا
10.translation_eng: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have prepared a painful punishment for them.
10.transliteration: wa-ʾanna lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-l-ʾākhirati ʾaʿtadnā lahum ʿadhāban ʾalīman

11.content: وَيَدعُ الإِنسانُ بِالشَّرِّ دُعاءَهُ بِالخَيرِ ۖ وَكانَ الإِنسانُ عَجولًا
11.translation_eng: Man prays for ill as [avidly as] he prays for good, and man is overhasty.
11.transliteration: wa-yadʿu l-ʾinsānu bi-sh-sharri duʿāʾahū bi-l-khayri wa-kāna l-ʾinsānu ʿajūlan

12.content: وَجَعَلنَا اللَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ آيَتَينِ ۖ فَمَحَونا آيَةَ اللَّيلِ وَجَعَلنا آيَةَ النَّهارِ مُبصِرَةً لِتَبتَغوا فَضلًا مِن رَبِّكُم وَلِتَعلَموا عَدَدَ السِّنينَ وَالحِسابَ ۚ وَكُلَّ شَيءٍ فَصَّلناهُ تَفصيلًا
12.translation_eng: We made the night and the day two signs. Then We effaced the sign of the night, and made the sign of the day lightsome that you may seek grace from your Lord and that you may know the number of years and the calculation [of time], and We have elaborated everything in detail.1Or ‘articulated everything distinctly.’
12.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā l-layla wa-n-nahāra ʾāyatayni fa-maḥawnā ʾāyata l-layli wa-jaʿalnā ʾāyata n-nahāri mubṣiratan li-tabtaghū faḍlan min rabbikum wa-li-taʿlamū ʿadada s-sinīna wa-l-ḥisāba wa-kulla shayʾin faṣṣalnāhu tafṣīlan

13.content: وَكُلَّ إِنسانٍ أَلزَمناهُ طائِرَهُ في عُنُقِهِ ۖ وَنُخرِجُ لَهُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ كِتابًا يَلقاهُ مَنشورًا
13.translation_eng: We have attached every person’s omen to his neck, and We shall bring it out for him on the Day of Resurrection as a wide open book that he will encounter.
13.transliteration: wa-kulla ʾinsānin ʾalzamnāhu ṭāʾirahū fī ʿunuqihī wa-nukhriju lahū yawma l-qiyāmati kitāban yalqāhu manshūran-i

14.content: اقرَأ كِتابَكَ كَفىٰ بِنَفسِكَ اليَومَ عَلَيكَ حَسيبًا
14.translation_eng: ‘Read your book! Today your soul suffices as your own reckoner.’1Or ‘today you suffice as your own reckoner.’
14.transliteration: iqraʾ kitābaka kafā bi-nafsika l-yawma ʿalayka ḥasīban

15.content: مَنِ اهتَدىٰ فَإِنَّما يَهتَدي لِنَفسِهِ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّما يَضِلُّ عَلَيها ۚ وَلا تَزِرُ وازِرَةٌ وِزرَ أُخرىٰ ۗ وَما كُنّا مُعَذِّبينَ حَتّىٰ نَبعَثَ رَسولًا
15.translation_eng: Whoever is guided is guided only for [the good of] his own soul, and whoever goes astray, goes astray only to its detriment. No bearer shall bear another’s burden. We do not punish [any community] until We have sent [it] an apostle.
15.transliteration: mani htadā fa-ʾinnamā yahtadī li-nafsihī wa-man ḍalla fa-ʾinnamā yaḍillu ʿalayhā wa-lā taziru wāziratun wizra ʾukhrā wa-mā kunnā muʿadhdhibīna ḥattā nabʿatha rasūlan

16.content: وَإِذا أَرَدنا أَن نُهلِكَ قَريَةً أَمَرنا مُترَفيها فَفَسَقوا فيها فَحَقَّ عَلَيهَا القَولُ فَدَمَّرناها تَدميرًا
16.translation_eng: And when We desire to destroy a town We command its affluent ones [to obey Allah]. But they commit transgression in it, and so the word becomes due against it, and We destroy it utterly.
16.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā ʾaradnā ʾan nuhlika qaryatan ʾamarnā mutrafīhā fa-fasaqū fīhā fa-ḥaqqa ʿalayhā l-qawlu fa-dammarnāhā tadmīran

17.content: وَكَم أَهلَكنا مِنَ القُرونِ مِن بَعدِ نوحٍ ۗ وَكَفىٰ بِرَبِّكَ بِذُنوبِ عِبادِهِ خَبيرًا بَصيرًا
17.translation_eng: How many generations We have destroyed since Noah! Your Lord suffices as one well aware and percipient of His servants’ sins.
17.transliteration: wa-kam ʾahlaknā mina l-qurūni min baʿdi nūḥin wa-kafā bi-rabbika bi-dhunūbi ʿibādihī khabīran baṣīran

18.content: مَن كانَ يُريدُ العاجِلَةَ عَجَّلنا لَهُ فيها ما نَشاءُ لِمَن نُريدُ ثُمَّ جَعَلنا لَهُ جَهَنَّمَ يَصلاها مَذمومًا مَدحورًا
18.translation_eng: Whoever desires this transitory life, We expedite for him therein whatever We wish, for whomever We desire. Then We appoint hell for him, to enter it, blameful and spurned.
18.transliteration: man kāna yurīdu l-ʿājilata ʿajjalnā lahū fīhā mā nashāʾu li-man nurīdu thumma jaʿalnā lahū jahannama yaṣlāhā madhmūman madḥūran

19.content: وَمَن أَرادَ الآخِرَةَ وَسَعىٰ لَها سَعيَها وَهُوَ مُؤمِنٌ فَأُولٰئِكَ كانَ سَعيُهُم مَشكورًا
19.translation_eng: Whoever desires the Hereafter and strives for it with an endeavour worthy of it, should he be faithful —the endeavour of such will be well-appreciated.
19.transliteration: wa-man ʾarāda l-ʾākhirata wa-saʿā lahā saʿyahā wa-huwa muʾminun fa-ʾulāʾika kāna saʿyuhum mashkūran

20.content: كُلًّا نُمِدُّ هٰؤُلاءِ وَهٰؤُلاءِ مِن عَطاءِ رَبِّكَ ۚ وَما كانَ عَطاءُ رَبِّكَ مَحظورًا
20.translation_eng: To these and to those—to all We extend the bounty of your Lord, and the bounty of your Lord is not confined.
20.transliteration: kullan numiddu hāʾulāʾi wa-hāʾulāʾi min ʿaṭāʾi rabbika wa-mā kāna ʿaṭāʾu rabbika maḥẓūran-i

21.content: انظُر كَيفَ فَضَّلنا بَعضَهُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ ۚ وَلَلآخِرَةُ أَكبَرُ دَرَجاتٍ وَأَكبَرُ تَفضيلًا
21.translation_eng: Observe how We have given some of them an advantage over some others; yet the Hereafter is surely greater in respect of ranks and greater in respect of relative merit.1Or ‘greater in respect of preferment.’
21.transliteration: unẓur kayfa faḍḍalnā baʿḍahum ʿalā baʿḍin wa-la-l-ʾākhiratu ʾakbaru darajātin wa-ʾakbaru tafḍīlan

22.content: لا تَجعَل مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلٰهًا آخَرَ فَتَقعُدَ مَذمومًا مَخذولًا
22.translation_eng: Do not set up another god besides Allah, or you will sit blameworthy, forsaken.
22.transliteration: lā tajʿal maʿa llāhi ʾilāhan ʾākhara fa-taqʿuda madhmūman makhdhūlan

23.content: ۞ وَقَضىٰ رَبُّكَ أَلّا تَعبُدوا إِلّا إِيّاهُ وَبِالوالِدَينِ إِحسانًا ۚ إِمّا يَبلُغَنَّ عِندَكَ الكِبَرَ أَحَدُهُما أَو كِلاهُما فَلا تَقُل لَهُما أُفٍّ وَلا تَنهَرهُما وَقُل لَهُما قَولًا كَريمًا
23.translation_eng: Your Lord has decreed that you shall not worship anyone except Him, and [He has enjoined] kindness to parents. Should they reach old age at your side —one of them or both— do not say to them, ‘Fie!’1 And do not chide them, but speak to them noble words.That is, do not grumble or speak to them in an ill-tempered manner. Uff is an interjection expressing displeasure and exasperation, indicating that one has been put out of patience.
23.transliteration: wa-qaḍā rabbuka ʾallā taʿbudū ʾillā ʾiyyāhu wa-bi-l-wālidayni ʾiḥsānan ʾimmā yablughanna ʿindaka l-kibara ʾaḥaduhumā ʾaw kilāhumā fa-lā taqul lahumā ʾuffin wa-lā tanharhumā wa-qul lahumā qawlan karīman

24.content: وَاخفِض لَهُما جَناحَ الذُّلِّ مِنَ الرَّحمَةِ وَقُل رَبِّ ارحَمهُما كَما رَبَّياني صَغيرًا
24.translation_eng: Lower the wing of humility to them, out of mercy, and say, ‘My Lord! Have mercy on them, just as they reared me when I was [a] small [child]!’
24.transliteration: wa-khfiḍ lahumā janāḥa dh-dhulli mina r-raḥmati wa-qul rabbi rḥamhumā ka-mā rabbayānī ṣaghīran

25.content: رَبُّكُم أَعلَمُ بِما في نُفوسِكُم ۚ إِن تَكونوا صالِحينَ فَإِنَّهُ كانَ لِلأَوّابينَ غَفورًا
25.translation_eng: Your Lord knows best what is in your hearts. Should you be righteous, He is indeed most forgiving toward penitents.
25.transliteration: rabbukum ʾaʿlamu bi-mā fī nufūsikum ʾin takūnū ṣāliḥīna fa-ʾinnahū kāna li-l-ʾawwābīna ghafūran

26.content: وَآتِ ذَا القُربىٰ حَقَّهُ وَالمِسكينَ وَابنَ السَّبيلِ وَلا تُبَذِّر تَبذيرًا
26.translation_eng: Give the relatives their [due] right, and the needy and the traveller [as well], but do not squander wastefully.
26.transliteration: wa-ʾāti dhā l-qurbā ḥaqqahū wa-l-miskīna wa-bna s-sabīli wa-lā tubadhdhir tabdhīran

27.content: إِنَّ المُبَذِّرينَ كانوا إِخوانَ الشَّياطينِ ۖ وَكانَ الشَّيطانُ لِرَبِّهِ كَفورًا
27.translation_eng: Indeed the wasteful are brothers of satans, and Satan is ungrateful to his Lord.
27.transliteration: ʾinna l-mubadhdhirīna kānū ʾikhwāna sh-shayāṭīni wa-kāna sh-shayṭānu li-rabbihī kafūran

28.content: وَإِمّا تُعرِضَنَّ عَنهُمُ ابتِغاءَ رَحمَةٍ مِن رَبِّكَ تَرجوها فَقُل لَهُم قَولًا مَيسورًا
28.translation_eng: And if you have to overlook them [for now], seeking the mercy of your Lord which you expect [in the future], speak to them gentle words.
28.transliteration: wa-ʾimmā tuʿriḍanna ʿanhumu btighāʾa raḥmatin min rabbika tarjūhā fa-qul lahum qawlan maysūran

29.content: وَلا تَجعَل يَدَكَ مَغلولَةً إِلىٰ عُنُقِكَ وَلا تَبسُطها كُلَّ البَسطِ فَتَقعُدَ مَلومًا مَحسورًا
29.translation_eng: Do not keep your hand chained to your neck, nor open it altogether,1 or you will sit blameworthy, regretful.That is, neither be miserly nor be a spendthrift.
29.transliteration: wa-lā tajʿal yadaka maghlūlatan ʾilā ʿunuqika wa-lā tabsuṭhā kulla l-basṭi fa-taqʿuda malūman maḥsūran

30.content: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَبسُطُ الرِّزقَ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيَقدِرُ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ بِعِبادِهِ خَبيرًا بَصيرًا
30.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord expands the provision for whomever He wishes, and tightens it. Indeed He is well aware and percipient of His servants.
30.transliteration: ʾinna rabbaka yabsuṭu r-rizqa li-man yashāʾu wa-yaqdiru ʾinnahū kāna bi-ʿibādihī khabīran baṣīran

31.content: وَلا تَقتُلوا أَولادَكُم خَشيَةَ إِملاقٍ ۖ نَحنُ نَرزُقُهُم وَإِيّاكُم ۚ إِنَّ قَتلَهُم كانَ خِطئًا كَبيرًا
31.translation_eng: Do not kill your children for the fear of penury: We will provide for them and for you. Killing them is indeed a great iniquity.
31.transliteration: wa-lā taqtulū ʾawlādakum khashyata ʾimlāqin naḥnu narzuquhum wa-ʾiyyākum ʾinna qatlahum kāna khiṭʾan kabīran

32.content: وَلا تَقرَبُوا الزِّنا ۖ إِنَّهُ كانَ فاحِشَةً وَساءَ سَبيلًا
32.translation_eng: Do not approach fornication. It is indeed an indecency and an evil way.
32.transliteration: wa-lā taqrabū z-zinā ʾinnahū kāna fāḥishatan wa-sāʾa sabīlan

33.content: وَلا تَقتُلُوا النَّفسَ الَّتي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلّا بِالحَقِّ ۗ وَمَن قُتِلَ مَظلومًا فَقَد جَعَلنا لِوَلِيِّهِ سُلطانًا فَلا يُسرِف فِي القَتلِ ۖ إِنَّهُ كانَ مَنصورًا
33.translation_eng: Do not kill a soul [whose life] Allah has made inviolable, except with due cause, and whoever is killed wrongfully, We have certainly given his heir an authority. But let him not commit any excess in killing,1 for he enjoys the support [of law].Such as mutilating the body of the murderer, or killing someone other than the guilty person for the sake of vengeance.
33.transliteration: wa-lā taqtulū n-nafsa llatī ḥarrama llāhu ʾillā bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-man qutila maẓlūman fa-qad jaʿalnā li-waliyyihī sulṭānan fa-lā yusrif fī l-qatli ʾinnahū kāna manṣūran

34.content: وَلا تَقرَبوا مالَ اليَتيمِ إِلّا بِالَّتي هِيَ أَحسَنُ حَتّىٰ يَبلُغَ أَشُدَّهُ ۚ وَأَوفوا بِالعَهدِ ۖ إِنَّ العَهدَ كانَ مَسئولًا
34.translation_eng: Do not approach the orphan’s property except in the best manner until he comes of age. And fulfill the covenants; indeed all covenants are accountable.
34.transliteration: wa-lā taqrabū māla l-yatīmi ʾillā bi-llatī hiya ʾaḥsanu ḥattā yablugha ʾashuddahū wa-ʾawfū bi-l-ʿahdi ʾinna l-ʿahda kāna masʾūlan

35.content: وَأَوفُوا الكَيلَ إِذا كِلتُم وَزِنوا بِالقِسطاسِ المُستَقيمِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ خَيرٌ وَأَحسَنُ تَأويلًا
35.translation_eng: When you measure, observe fully the measure, [and] weigh with an even balance. That is better and fairer in outcome.
35.transliteration: wa-ʾawfū l-kayla ʾidhā kiltum wa-zinū bi-l-qisṭāsi l-mustaqīmi dhālika khayrun wa-ʾaḥsanu taʾwīlan

36.content: وَلا تَقفُ ما لَيسَ لَكَ بِهِ عِلمٌ ۚ إِنَّ السَّمعَ وَالبَصَرَ وَالفُؤادَ كُلُّ أُولٰئِكَ كانَ عَنهُ مَسئولًا
36.translation_eng: Do not follow that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed the hearing, the eyesight, and the heart —all of these are accountable.
36.transliteration: wa-lā taqfu mā laysa laka bihī ʿilmun ʾinna s-samʿa wa-l-baṣara wa-l-fuʾāda kullu ʾulāʾika kāna ʿanhu masʾūlan

37.content: وَلا تَمشِ فِي الأَرضِ مَرَحًا ۖ إِنَّكَ لَن تَخرِقَ الأَرضَ وَلَن تَبلُغَ الجِبالَ طولًا
37.translation_eng: Do not walk exultantly on the earth. Indeed you will neither pierce the earth, nor reach the mountains in height.
37.transliteration: wa-lā tamshi fī l-ʾarḍi maraḥan ʾinnaka lan takhriqa l-ʾarḍa wa-lan tablugha l-jibāla ṭūlan

38.content: كُلُّ ذٰلِكَ كانَ سَيِّئُهُ عِندَ رَبِّكَ مَكروهًا
38.translation_eng: The evil of all these is detestable to your Lord.
38.transliteration: kullu dhālika kāna sayyiʾuhū ʿinda rabbika makrūhan

39.content: ذٰلِكَ مِمّا أَوحىٰ إِلَيكَ رَبُّكَ مِنَ الحِكمَةِ ۗ وَلا تَجعَل مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلٰهًا آخَرَ فَتُلقىٰ في جَهَنَّمَ مَلومًا مَدحورًا
39.translation_eng: These are among [precepts] that your Lord has revealed to you of wisdom. Do not set up another god besides Allah, or you will be cast into hell, blameworthy, banished.
39.transliteration: dhālika mimmā ʾawḥā ʾilayka rabbuka mina l-ḥikmati wa-lā tajʿal maʿa llāhi ʾilāhan ʾākhara fa-tulqā fī jahannama malūman madḥūran

40.content: أَفَأَصفاكُم رَبُّكُم بِالبَنينَ وَاتَّخَذَ مِنَ المَلائِكَةِ إِناثًا ۚ إِنَّكُم لَتَقولونَ قَولًا عَظيمًا
40.translation_eng: Did your Lord prefer you for sons, and [Himself] adopt females from among the angels?1 Indeed you say a monstrous word!Cf. 4:117; 37:150; 43:19; 53:21, 27.
