40.transliteration: ʾa-fa-ʾaṣfākum rabbukum bi-l-banīna wa-ttakhadha mina l-malāʾikati ʾināthan ʾinnakum la-taqūlūna qawlan ʿaẓīman

41.content: وَلَقَد صَرَّفنا في هٰذَا القُرآنِ لِيَذَّكَّروا وَما يَزيدُهُم إِلّا نُفورًا
41.translation_eng: Certainly We have paraphrased [the principles of guidance] in this Qurʾān so that they may take admonition, but it increases them only in aversion.
41.transliteration: wa-la-qad ṣarrafnā fī hādhā l-qurʾāni li-yadhdhakkarū wa-mā yazīduhum ʾillā nufūran

42.content: قُل لَو كانَ مَعَهُ آلِهَةٌ كَما يَقولونَ إِذًا لَابتَغَوا إِلىٰ ذِي العَرشِ سَبيلًا
42.translation_eng: Say, ‘Were there [other] gods besides Him, as they say, they would surely encroach on the Lord of the Throne.
42.transliteration: qul law kāna maʿahū ʾālihatun ka-mā yaqūlūna ʾidhan la-btaghaw ʾilā dhī l-ʿarshi sabīlan

43.content: سُبحانَهُ وَتَعالىٰ عَمّا يَقولونَ عُلُوًّا كَبيرًا
43.translation_eng: Immaculate is He, and greatly exalted above what they say!’
43.transliteration: subḥānahū wa-taʿālā ʿammā yaqūlūna ʿuluwwan kabīran

44.content: تُسَبِّحُ لَهُ السَّماواتُ السَّبعُ وَالأَرضُ وَمَن فيهِنَّ ۚ وَإِن مِن شَيءٍ إِلّا يُسَبِّحُ بِحَمدِهِ وَلٰكِن لا تَفقَهونَ تَسبيحَهُم ۗ إِنَّهُ كانَ حَليمًا غَفورًا
44.translation_eng: The seven heavens glorify Him, and the earth [too], and whoever is in them. There is not a thing but celebrates His praise, but you do not understand their glorification. Indeed He is all-forbearing, all-forgiving.
44.transliteration: tusabbiḥu lahu s-samāwātu s-sabʿu wa-l-ʾarḍu wa-man fīhinna wa-ʾin min shayʾin ʾillā yusabbiḥu bi-ḥamdihī wa-lākin lā tafqahūna tasbīḥahum ʾinnahū kāna ḥalīman ghafūran

45.content: وَإِذا قَرَأتَ القُرآنَ جَعَلنا بَينَكَ وَبَينَ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالآخِرَةِ حِجابًا مَستورًا
45.translation_eng: When you recite the Qurʾān, We draw between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a hidden curtain,
45.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā qaraʾta l-qurʾāna jaʿalnā baynaka wa-bayna lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-l-ʾākhirati ḥijāban mastūran

46.content: وَجَعَلنا عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفقَهوهُ وَفي آذانِهِم وَقرًا ۚ وَإِذا ذَكَرتَ رَبَّكَ فِي القُرآنِ وَحدَهُ وَلَّوا عَلىٰ أَدبارِهِم نُفورًا
46.translation_eng: and We cast veils on their hearts, lest they should understand it, and a deafness into their ears. When you mention your Lord alone in the Qurʾān, they turn their backs in aversion.
46.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā ʿalā qulūbihim ʾakinnatan ʾan yafqahūhu wa-fī ʾādhānihim waqran wa-ʾidhā dhakarta rabbaka fī l-qurʾāni waḥdahū wallaw ʿalā ʾadbārihim nufūran

47.content: نَحنُ أَعلَمُ بِما يَستَمِعونَ بِهِ إِذ يَستَمِعونَ إِلَيكَ وَإِذ هُم نَجوىٰ إِذ يَقولُ الظّالِمونَ إِن تَتَّبِعونَ إِلّا رَجُلًا مَسحورًا
47.translation_eng: We know best what they listen for, when they listen to you, and when they hold secret talks, when the wrongdoers say, ‘[If you follow him] You will be following just a bewitched man.’
47.transliteration: naḥnu ʾaʿlamu bi-mā yastamiʿūna bihī ʾidh yastamiʿūna ʾilayka wa-ʾidh hum najwā ʾidh yaqūlū ẓ-ẓālimūna ʾin tattabiʿūna ʾillā rajulan masḥūran-i

48.content: انظُر كَيفَ ضَرَبوا لَكَ الأَمثالَ فَضَلّوا فَلا يَستَطيعونَ سَبيلًا
48.translation_eng: Look, how they coin epithets for you; so they go astray, and cannot find a way.
48.transliteration: unẓur kayfa ḍarabū laka l-ʾamthāla fa-ḍallū fa-lā yastaṭīʿūna sabīlan

49.content: وَقالوا أَإِذا كُنّا عِظامًا وَرُفاتًا أَإِنّا لَمَبعوثونَ خَلقًا جَديدًا
49.translation_eng: They say, ‘What, when we have become bones and dust, shall we really be raised in a new creation?’
49.transliteration: wa-qālū ʾa-ʾidhā kunnā ʿiẓāman wa-rufātan ʾa-ʾinnā la-mabʿūthūna khalqan jadīdan

50.content: ۞ قُل كونوا حِجارَةً أَو حَديدًا
50.translation_eng: Say, ‘Should you be stones, or iron,
50.transliteration: qul kūnū ḥijāratan ʾaw ḥadīdan

51.content: أَو خَلقًا مِمّا يَكبُرُ في صُدورِكُم ۚ فَسَيَقولونَ مَن يُعيدُنا ۖ قُلِ الَّذي فَطَرَكُم أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ ۚ فَسَيُنغِضونَ إِلَيكَ رُءوسَهُم وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هُوَ ۖ قُل عَسىٰ أَن يَكونَ قَريبًا
51.translation_eng: or a creature more fantastic to your minds!’ They will say, ‘Who will bring us back?’ Say, ‘He who originated you the first time.’ They will nod their heads at you, and say, ‘When will that be?’ Say, ‘Maybe it is near!
51.transliteration: ʾaw khalqan mimmā yakburu fī ṣudūrikum fa-sa-yaqūlūna man yuʿīdunā quli lladhī faṭarakum ʾawwala marratin fa-sa-yunghiḍūna ʾilayka ruʾūsahum wa-yaqūlūna matā huwa qul ʿasā ʾan yakūna qarīban

52.content: يَومَ يَدعوكُم فَتَستَجيبونَ بِحَمدِهِ وَتَظُنّونَ إِن لَبِثتُم إِلّا قَليلًا
52.translation_eng: The day He calls you, you will respond to Him, praising Him, and you will think you remained only a little.’
52.transliteration: yawma yadʿūkum fa-tastajībūna bi-ḥamdihī wa-taẓunnūna ʾin labithtum ʾillā qalīlan

53.content: وَقُل لِعِبادي يَقولُوا الَّتي هِيَ أَحسَنُ ۚ إِنَّ الشَّيطانَ يَنزَغُ بَينَهُم ۚ إِنَّ الشَّيطانَ كانَ لِلإِنسانِ عَدُوًّا مُبينًا
53.translation_eng: Tell My servants to speak in a manner which is the best. Indeed Satan incites ill feeling between them, and Satan is indeed man’s manifest enemy.
53.transliteration: wa-qul li-ʿibādī yaqūlū llatī hiya ʾaḥsanu ʾinna sh-shayṭāna yanzaghu baynahum ʾinna sh-shayṭāna kāna li-l-ʾinsāni ʿaduwwan mubīnan

54.content: رَبُّكُم أَعلَمُ بِكُم ۖ إِن يَشَأ يَرحَمكُم أَو إِن يَشَأ يُعَذِّبكُم ۚ وَما أَرسَلناكَ عَلَيهِم وَكيلًا
54.translation_eng: Your Lord knows you best. He will have mercy on you, if He wishes, or punish you, if He wishes, and We did not send you to watch over them.
54.transliteration: rabbukum ʾaʿlamu bikum ʾin yashaʾ yarḥamkum ʾaw ʾin yashaʾ yuʿadhdhibkum wa-mā ʾarsalnāka ʿalayhim wakīlan

55.content: وَرَبُّكَ أَعلَمُ بِمَن فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۗ وَلَقَد فَضَّلنا بَعضَ النَّبِيّينَ عَلىٰ بَعضٍ ۖ وَآتَينا داوودَ زَبورًا
55.translation_eng: Your Lord knows best whoever is in the heavens and the earth. Certainly We gave some prophets an advantage over others, and We gave David the Psalms.
55.transliteration: wa-rabbuka ʾaʿlamu bi-man fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-la-qad faḍḍalnā baʿḍa n-nabiyyīna ʿalā baʿḍin wa-ʾātaynā dāwūda zabūran

56.content: قُلِ ادعُوا الَّذينَ زَعَمتُم مِن دونِهِ فَلا يَملِكونَ كَشفَ الضُّرِّ عَنكُم وَلا تَحويلًا
56.translation_eng: Say, ‘Invoke those whom you claim [to be gods] besides Him. They have no power to remove your distress nor to bring about any change [in your state].
56.transliteration: quli dʿū lladhīna zaʿamtum min dūnihī fa-lā yamlikūna kashfa ḍ-ḍurri ʿankum wa-lā taḥwīlan

57.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ يَدعونَ يَبتَغونَ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِمُ الوَسيلَةَ أَيُّهُم أَقرَبُ وَيَرجونَ رَحمَتَهُ وَيَخافونَ عَذابَهُ ۚ إِنَّ عَذابَ رَبِّكَ كانَ مَحذورًا
57.translation_eng: They [themselves] are the ones who supplicate, seeking a recourse to their Lord,1 whoever is nearer [to Him], expecting His mercy and fearing His punishment.’ Indeed your Lord’s punishment is a thing to beware of.Or ‘Those whom they (i.e., the polytheists) invoke, themselves seek a recourse to their Lord… .’
57.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna yadʿūna yabtaghūna ʾilā rabbihimu l-wasīlata ʾayyuhum ʾaqrabu wa-yarjūna raḥmatahū wa-yakhāfūna ʿadhābahū ʾinna ʿadhāba rabbika kāna maḥdhūran

58.content: وَإِن مِن قَريَةٍ إِلّا نَحنُ مُهلِكوها قَبلَ يَومِ القِيامَةِ أَو مُعَذِّبوها عَذابًا شَديدًا ۚ كانَ ذٰلِكَ فِي الكِتابِ مَسطورًا
58.translation_eng: There is not a town but We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection, or punish it with a severe punishment. That has been written in the Book.
58.transliteration: wa-ʾin min qaryatin ʾillā naḥnu muhlikūhā qabla yawmi l-qiyāmati ʾaw muʿadhdhibūhā ʿadhāban shadīdan kāna dhālika fī l-kitābi masṭūran

59.content: وَما مَنَعَنا أَن نُرسِلَ بِالآياتِ إِلّا أَن كَذَّبَ بِهَا الأَوَّلونَ ۚ وَآتَينا ثَمودَ النّاقَةَ مُبصِرَةً فَظَلَموا بِها ۚ وَما نُرسِلُ بِالآياتِ إِلّا تَخويفًا
59.translation_eng: Nothing keeps Us from sending signs except that the ancients denied them. We gave Thamūd the she-camel as an eye-opener, but they wronged her. We do not send the signs except for deterrence.
59.transliteration: wa-mā manaʿanā ʾan nursila bi-l-ʾāyāti ʾillā ʾan kadhdhaba bihā l-ʾawwalūna wa-ʾātaynā thamūda n-nāqata mubṣiratan fa-ẓalamū bihā wa-mā nursilu bi-l-ʾāyāti ʾillā takhwīfan

60.content: وَإِذ قُلنا لَكَ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ أَحاطَ بِالنّاسِ ۚ وَما جَعَلنَا الرُّؤيَا الَّتي أَرَيناكَ إِلّا فِتنَةً لِلنّاسِ وَالشَّجَرَةَ المَلعونَةَ فِي القُرآنِ ۚ وَنُخَوِّفُهُم فَما يَزيدُهُم إِلّا طُغيانًا كَبيرًا
60.translation_eng: When We said to you, ‘Indeed your Lord comprehends all mankind,’ We did not appoint the vision that We showed you except as a test for the people and the tree cursed in the Qurʾān. We deter them, but it only increases them in great rebellion.
60.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qulnā laka ʾinna rabbaka ʾaḥāṭa bi-n-nāsi wa-mā jaʿalnā r-ruʾyā llatī ʾaraynāka ʾillā fitnatan li-n-nāsi wa-sh-shajarata l-malʿūnata fī l-qurʾāni wa-nukhawwifuhum fa-mā yazīduhum ʾillā ṭughyānan kabīran

61.content: وَإِذ قُلنا لِلمَلائِكَةِ اسجُدوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدوا إِلّا إِبليسَ قالَ أَأَسجُدُ لِمَن خَلَقتَ طينًا
61.translation_eng: When We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam,’ they [all] prostrated, but not Iblis: he said, ‘Shall I prostrate before someone whom You have created from clay?’
61.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qulnā li-l-malāʾikati sjudū li-ʾādama fa-sajadū ʾillā ʾiblīsa qāla ʾa-ʾasjudu li-man khalaqta ṭīnan

62.content: قالَ أَرَأَيتَكَ هٰذَا الَّذي كَرَّمتَ عَلَيَّ لَئِن أَخَّرتَنِ إِلىٰ يَومِ القِيامَةِ لَأَحتَنِكَنَّ ذُرِّيَّتَهُ إِلّا قَليلًا
62.translation_eng: Said he, ‘Do You see this one whom You have honoured above me? If You respite me until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely destroy his progeny, [all] except a few.’
62.transliteration: qāla ʾa-raʾaytaka hādhā lladhī karramta ʿalayya la-ʾin ʾakhkhartani ʾilā yawmi l-qiyāmati la-ʾaḥtanikanna dhurriyyatahū ʾillā qalīlan

63.content: قالَ اذهَب فَمَن تَبِعَكَ مِنهُم فَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ جَزاؤُكُم جَزاءً مَوفورًا
63.translation_eng: Said He, ‘Begone! Whoever of them follows you, indeed the hell shall be your requital, an ample reward.
63.transliteration: qāla dhhab fa-man tabiʿaka minhum fa-ʾinna jahannama jazāʾukum jazāʾan mawfūran

64.content: وَاستَفزِز مَنِ استَطَعتَ مِنهُم بِصَوتِكَ وَأَجلِب عَلَيهِم بِخَيلِكَ وَرَجِلِكَ وَشارِكهُم فِي الأَموالِ وَالأَولادِ وَعِدهُم ۚ وَما يَعِدُهُمُ الشَّيطانُ إِلّا غُرورًا
64.translation_eng: Instigate whomever of them you can with your voice;1 and rally against them your cavalry and your infantry, and share with them in wealth and children, and make promises to them!’ But Satan promises them nothing but delusion.Or ‘Tempt whomever … .’
64.transliteration: wa-stafziz mani staṭaʿta minhum bi-ṣawtika wa-ʾajlib ʿalayhim bi-khaylika wa-rajilika wa-shārikhum fī l-ʾamwāli wa-l-ʾawlādi wa-ʿidhum wa-mā yaʿiduhumu sh-shayṭānu ʾillā ghurūran

65.content: إِنَّ عِبادي لَيسَ لَكَ عَلَيهِم سُلطانٌ ۚ وَكَفىٰ بِرَبِّكَ وَكيلًا
65.translation_eng: ‘As for My servants, you shall have no authority over them.’ And your Lord suffices as trustee.
65.transliteration: ʾinna ʿibādī laysa laka ʿalayhim sulṭānun wa-kafā bi-rabbika wakīlan

66.content: رَبُّكُمُ الَّذي يُزجي لَكُمُ الفُلكَ فِي البَحرِ لِتَبتَغوا مِن فَضلِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ بِكُم رَحيمًا
66.translation_eng: Your Lord is He who drives for you the ships in the sea, that you may seek His grace. Indeed He is most merciful to you.
66.transliteration: rabbukumu lladhī yuzjī lakumu l-fulka fī l-baḥri li-tabtaghū min faḍlihī ʾinnahū kāna bikum raḥīman

67.content: وَإِذا مَسَّكُمُ الضُّرُّ فِي البَحرِ ضَلَّ مَن تَدعونَ إِلّا إِيّاهُ ۖ فَلَمّا نَجّاكُم إِلَى البَرِّ أَعرَضتُم ۚ وَكانَ الإِنسانُ كَفورًا
67.translation_eng: And when distress befalls you at sea, those whom you invoke besides Him are forsaken. But when He delivers you to land, you are disregardful [of Him]. And man is very ungrateful.
67.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā massakumu ḍ-ḍurru fī l-baḥri ḍalla man tadʿūna ʾillā ʾiyyāhu fa-lammā najjākum ʾilā l-barri ʾaʿraḍtum wa-kāna l-ʾinsānu kafūran

68.content: أَفَأَمِنتُم أَن يَخسِفَ بِكُم جانِبَ البَرِّ أَو يُرسِلَ عَلَيكُم حاصِبًا ثُمَّ لا تَجِدوا لَكُم وَكيلًا
68.translation_eng: Do you feel secure that He will not make the coastland swallow you, or He will not unleash upon you a rain of stones? Then you will not find any defender for yourselves.
68.transliteration: ʾa-fa-ʾamintum ʾan yakhsifa bikum jāniba l-barri ʾaw yursila ʿalaykum ḥāṣiban thumma lā tajidū lakum wakīlan

69.content: أَم أَمِنتُم أَن يُعيدَكُم فيهِ تارَةً أُخرىٰ فَيُرسِلَ عَلَيكُم قاصِفًا مِنَ الرّيحِ فَيُغرِقَكُم بِما كَفَرتُم ۙ ثُمَّ لا تَجِدوا لَكُم عَلَينا بِهِ تَبيعًا
69.translation_eng: Do you feel secure that He will not send you back into it another time and unleash against you a shattering gale and drown you because of your unfaith? Then you will not find for yourselves any redresser against Us.
69.transliteration: ʾam ʾamintum ʾan yuʿīdakum fīhi tāratan ʾukhrā fa-yursila ʿalaykum qāṣifan mina r-rīḥi fa-yughriqakum bi-mā kafartum thumma lā tajidū lakum ʿalaynā bihī tabīʿan

70.content: ۞ وَلَقَد كَرَّمنا بَني آدَمَ وَحَمَلناهُم فِي البَرِّ وَالبَحرِ وَرَزَقناهُم مِنَ الطَّيِّباتِ وَفَضَّلناهُم عَلىٰ كَثيرٍ مِمَّن خَلَقنا تَفضيلًا
70.translation_eng: Certainly We have honoured the Children of Adam, and carried them over land and sea, and provided them with all the good things, and given them an advantage over many of those We have created with a complete preference.
70.transliteration: wa-la-qad karramnā banī ʾādama wa-ḥamalnāhum fī l-barri wa-l-baḥri wa-razaqnāhum mina ṭ-ṭayyibāti wa-faḍḍalnāhum ʿalā kathīrin mimman khalaqnā tafḍīlan

71.content: يَومَ نَدعو كُلَّ أُناسٍ بِإِمامِهِم ۖ فَمَن أوتِيَ كِتابَهُ بِيَمينِهِ فَأُولٰئِكَ يَقرَءونَ كِتابَهُم وَلا يُظلَمونَ فَتيلًا
71.translation_eng: The day We shall summon every group of people with their imam,1 then whoever is given his book in his right hand —they will read it, and they will not be wronged so much as a single date-thread.That is, leader.
71.transliteration: yawma nadʿū kulla ʾunāsin bi-ʾimāmihim fa-man ʾūtiya kitābahū bi-yamīnihī fa-ʾulāʾika yaqraʾūna kitābahum wa-lā yuẓlamūna fatīlan

72.content: وَمَن كانَ في هٰذِهِ أَعمىٰ فَهُوَ فِي الآخِرَةِ أَعمىٰ وَأَضَلُّ سَبيلًا
72.translation_eng: But whoever has been blind in this [world], will be blind in the Hereafter, and [even] more astray from the [right] way.
72.transliteration: wa-man kāna fī hādhihī ʾaʿmā fa-huwa fī l-ʾākhirati ʾaʿmā wa-ʾaḍallu sabīlan

73.content: وَإِن كادوا لَيَفتِنونَكَ عَنِ الَّذي أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ لِتَفتَرِيَ عَلَينا غَيرَهُ ۖ وَإِذًا لَاتَّخَذوكَ خَليلًا
73.translation_eng: They were about to beguile you from what Allah has revealed to you so that you may fabricate against Us something other than that, whereat they would have befriended you.
73.transliteration: wa-ʾin kādū la-yaftinūnaka ʿani lladhī ʾawḥaynā ʾilayka li-taftariya ʿalaynā ghayrahū wa-ʾidhan la-ttakhadhūka khalīlan

74.content: وَلَولا أَن ثَبَّتناكَ لَقَد كِدتَ تَركَنُ إِلَيهِم شَيئًا قَليلًا
74.translation_eng: Had We not fortified you, certainly you might have inclined toward them a bit.
74.transliteration: wa-law-lā ʾan thabbatnāka la-qad kidta tarkanu ʾilayhim shayʾan qalīlan

75.content: إِذًا لَأَذَقناكَ ضِعفَ الحَياةِ وَضِعفَ المَماتِ ثُمَّ لا تَجِدُ لَكَ عَلَينا نَصيرًا
75.translation_eng: Then We would have surely made you taste a double [punishment] in this life and a double [punishment] after death, and then you would have not found for yourself any helper against Us.
75.transliteration: ʾidhan la-ʾadhaqnāka ḍiʿfa l-ḥayāti wa-ḍiʿfa l-mamāti thumma lā tajidu laka ʿalaynā naṣīran

76.content: وَإِن كادوا لَيَستَفِزّونَكَ مِنَ الأَرضِ لِيُخرِجوكَ مِنها ۖ وَإِذًا لا يَلبَثونَ خِلافَكَ إِلّا قَليلًا
76.translation_eng: They were about to hound you out of the land, to expel you from it, but then they would not have stayed after you but a little.
76.transliteration: wa-ʾin kādū la-yastafizzūnaka mina l-ʾarḍi li-yukhrijūka minhā wa-ʾidhan lā yalbathūna khilāfaka ʾillā qalīlan

77.content: سُنَّةَ مَن قَد أَرسَلنا قَبلَكَ مِن رُسُلِنا ۖ وَلا تَجِدُ لِسُنَّتِنا تَحويلًا
77.translation_eng: A precedent of those We have sent from among Our apostles before you, and you will not find any change in Our precedent.
77.transliteration: sunnata man qad ʾarsalnā qablaka min rusulinā wa-lā tajidu li-sunnatinā taḥwīlan

78.content: أَقِمِ الصَّلاةَ لِدُلوكِ الشَّمسِ إِلىٰ غَسَقِ اللَّيلِ وَقُرآنَ الفَجرِ ۖ إِنَّ قُرآنَ الفَجرِ كانَ مَشهودًا
78.translation_eng: Maintain the prayer from the sun’s decline1 till the darkness of the night, and [observe particularly] the dawn recital. Indeed the dawn recital is attended [by angels].That is, from noon onwards, when the sun crosses the meridian.
78.transliteration: ʾaqimi ṣ-ṣalāta li-dulūki sh-shamsi ʾilā ghasaqi l-layli wa-qurʾāna l-fajri ʾinna qurʾāna l-fajri kāna mashhūdan

79.content: وَمِنَ اللَّيلِ فَتَهَجَّد بِهِ نافِلَةً لَكَ عَسىٰ أَن يَبعَثَكَ رَبُّكَ مَقامًا مَحمودًا
79.translation_eng: And keep vigil for a part of the night, as a supererogatory [devotion] for you. It may be that your Lord will raise you to a praiseworthy station.
79.transliteration: wa-mina l-layli fa-tahajjad bihī nāfilatan laka ʿasā ʾan yabʿathaka rabbuka maqāman maḥmūdan

80.content: وَقُل رَبِّ أَدخِلني مُدخَلَ صِدقٍ وَأَخرِجني مُخرَجَ صِدقٍ وَاجعَل لي مِن لَدُنكَ سُلطانًا نَصيرًا
80.translation_eng: And say, ‘My Lord! ‘Admit me with a worthy entrance, and bring me out with a worthy departure, and render me a favourable authority from Yourself.’
80.transliteration: wa-qul rabbi ʾadkhilnī mudkhala ṣidqin wa-ʾakhrijnī mukhraja ṣidqin wa-jʿal lī min ladunka sulṭānan naṣīran

81.content: وَقُل جاءَ الحَقُّ وَزَهَقَ الباطِلُ ۚ إِنَّ الباطِلَ كانَ زَهوقًا
81.translation_eng: And say, ‘The truth has come, and falsehood has vanished. Indeed falsehood is bound to vanish.’
81.transliteration: wa-qul jāʾa l-ḥaqqu wa-zahaqa l-bāṭilu ʾinna l-bāṭila kāna zahūqan

82.content: وَنُنَزِّلُ مِنَ القُرآنِ ما هُوَ شِفاءٌ وَرَحمَةٌ لِلمُؤمِنينَ ۙ وَلا يَزيدُ الظّالِمينَ إِلّا خَسارًا
82.translation_eng: We send down in the Qurʾān that which is a cure and mercy for the faithful; and it increases the wrongdoers only in loss.
82.transliteration: wa-nunazzilu mina l-qurʾāni mā huwa shifāʾun wa-raḥmatun li-l-muʾminīna wa-lā yazīdu ẓ-ẓālimīna ʾillā khasāran

83.content: وَإِذا أَنعَمنا عَلَى الإِنسانِ أَعرَضَ وَنَأىٰ بِجانِبِهِ ۖ وَإِذا مَسَّهُ الشَّرُّ كانَ يَئوسًا
83.translation_eng: When We bless man, he is disregardful and turns aside; but when an ill befalls him, he is despondent.
83.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā ʾanʿamnā ʿalā l-ʾinsāni ʾaʿraḍa wa-naʾā bi-jānibihī wa-ʾidhā massahu sh-sharru kāna yaʾūsan

84.content: قُل كُلٌّ يَعمَلُ عَلىٰ شاكِلَتِهِ فَرَبُّكُم أَعلَمُ بِمَن هُوَ أَهدىٰ سَبيلًا
84.translation_eng: Say, ‘Everyone acts according to his character. Your Lord knows best who is better guided with regard to the way.’
84.transliteration: qul kullun yaʿmalu ʿalā shākilatihī fa-rabbukum ʾaʿlamu bi-man huwa ʾahdā sabīlan

85.content: وَيَسأَلونَكَ عَنِ الرّوحِ ۖ قُلِ الرّوحُ مِن أَمرِ رَبّي وَما أوتيتُم مِنَ العِلمِ إِلّا قَليلًا
85.translation_eng: They question you concerning the Spirit. Say, ‘The Spirit is of the command of my Lord,1 and you have not been given of the knowledge except a few [of you].’2Or ‘the Spirit relates to the command of my Lord.’ Or ‘the Spirit proceeds from the command of my Lord.’Or ‘you have not been given of the knowledge except a little.’
85.transliteration: wa-yasʾalūnaka ʾani r-rūḥi quli r-rūḥu min ʾamri rabbī wa-mā ʾūtītum mina l-ʿilmi ʾillā qalīlan

86.content: وَلَئِن شِئنا لَنَذهَبَنَّ بِالَّذي أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ ثُمَّ لا تَجِدُ لَكَ بِهِ عَلَينا وَكيلًا
86.translation_eng: If We wish, We would take away what We have revealed to you. Then you would not find for yourself any defender against Us,
86.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin shiʾnā la-nadhhabanna bi-lladhī ʾawḥaynā ʾilayka thumma lā tajidu laka bihī ʿalaynā wakīlan

87.content: إِلّا رَحمَةً مِن رَبِّكَ ۚ إِنَّ فَضلَهُ كانَ عَلَيكَ كَبيرًا
87.translation_eng: except a mercy from your Lord. Indeed His grace has been great upon you.
87.transliteration: ʾillā raḥmatan min rabbika ʾinna faḍlahū kāna ʿalayka kabīran

88.content: قُل لَئِنِ اجتَمَعَتِ الإِنسُ وَالجِنُّ عَلىٰ أَن يَأتوا بِمِثلِ هٰذَا القُرآنِ لا يَأتونَ بِمِثلِهِ وَلَو كانَ بَعضُهُم لِبَعضٍ ظَهيرًا
88.translation_eng: Say, ‘Should all humans and jinn rally to bring the like of this Qurʾān, they will not bring the like of it, even if they assisted one another.’
88.transliteration: qul la-ʾini jtamaʿati l-ʾinsu wa-l-jinnu ʿalā ʾan yaʾtū bi-mithli hādhā l-qurʾāni lā yaʾtūna bi-mithlihī wa-law kāna baʿḍuhum li-baʿḍin ẓahīran

89.content: وَلَقَد صَرَّفنا لِلنّاسِ في هٰذَا القُرآنِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ فَأَبىٰ أَكثَرُ النّاسِ إِلّا كُفورًا
89.translation_eng: We have certainly interspersed for the people this Qurʾān with every [kind of] parable, but most people are only intent on ingratitude.1Or ‘faithlessness.’ Cf. 17:99 below and 25:50.
89.transliteration: wa-la-qad ṣarrafnā li-n-nāsi fī hādhā l-qurʾāni min kulli mathalin fa-ʾabā ʾaktharu n-nāsi ʾillā kufūran

90.content: وَقالوا لَن نُؤمِنَ لَكَ حَتّىٰ تَفجُرَ لَنا مِنَ الأَرضِ يَنبوعًا
90.translation_eng: They say, ‘We will not believe you until you make a spring gush forth for us from the ground.
90.transliteration: wa-qālū lan nuʾmina laka ḥattā tafjura lanā mina l-ʾarḍi yanbūʿan

91.content: أَو تَكونَ لَكَ جَنَّةٌ مِن نَخيلٍ وَعِنَبٍ فَتُفَجِّرَ الأَنهارَ خِلالَها تَفجيرًا
91.translation_eng: Or until you have a garden of date palms and vines and you make streams gush through it.
91.transliteration: ʾaw takūna laka jannatun min nakhīlin wa-ʿinabin fa-tufajjira l-ʾanhāra khilālahā tafjīran

92.content: أَو تُسقِطَ السَّماءَ كَما زَعَمتَ عَلَينا كِسَفًا أَو تَأتِيَ بِاللَّهِ وَالمَلائِكَةِ قَبيلًا
92.translation_eng: Or until you cause the sky to fall in fragments upon us, just as you would aver. Or until you bring Allah and the angels [right] in front of us.
92.transliteration: ʾaw tusqiṭa s-samāʾa ka-mā zaʿamta ʿalaynā kisafan ʾaw taʾtiya bi-llāhi wa-l-malāʾikati qabīlan

93.content: أَو يَكونَ لَكَ بَيتٌ مِن زُخرُفٍ أَو تَرقىٰ فِي السَّماءِ وَلَن نُؤمِنَ لِرُقِيِّكَ حَتّىٰ تُنَزِّلَ عَلَينا كِتابًا نَقرَؤُهُ ۗ قُل سُبحانَ رَبّي هَل كُنتُ إِلّا بَشَرًا رَسولًا
93.translation_eng: Or until you have a house of gold, or you ascend into the sky. And we will not believe your ascension until you bring down for us a book that we may read.’ Say, ‘Immaculate is my Lord! Am I anything but a human, an apostle?!’
93.transliteration: ʾaw yakūna laka baytun min zukhrufin ʾaw tarqā fī s-samāʾi wa-lan nuʾmina li-ruqiyyika ḥattā tunazzila ʿalaynā kitāban naqraʾuhū qul subḥāna rabbī hal kuntu ʾillā basharan rasūlan

94.content: وَما مَنَعَ النّاسَ أَن يُؤمِنوا إِذ جاءَهُمُ الهُدىٰ إِلّا أَن قالوا أَبَعَثَ اللَّهُ بَشَرًا رَسولًا
94.translation_eng: Nothing kept the people from believing when guidance came to them, but their saying, ‘Has Allah sent a human as an apostle?!’
94.transliteration: wa-mā manaʿa n-nāsa ʾan yuʾminū ʾidh jāʾahumu l-hudā ʾillā ʾan qālū ʾa-baʿatha llāhu basharan rasūlan

95.content: قُل لَو كانَ فِي الأَرضِ مَلائِكَةٌ يَمشونَ مُطمَئِنّينَ لَنَزَّلنا عَلَيهِم مِنَ السَّماءِ مَلَكًا رَسولًا
95.translation_eng: Say, ‘Had there been angels in the earth, walking around and residing [in it like humans do], We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel as apostle.’
95.transliteration: qul law kāna fī l-ʾarḍi malāʾikatun yamshūna muṭmaʾinnīna la-nazzalnā ʿalayhim mina s-samāʾi malakan rasūlan

96.content: قُل كَفىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهيدًا بَيني وَبَينَكُم ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ بِعِبادِهِ خَبيرًا بَصيرًا
96.translation_eng: Say, ‘Allah suffices as a witness between me and you. Indeed He is well aware and percipient of His servants.’
96.transliteration: qul kafā bi-llāhi shahīdan baynī wa-baynakum ʾinnahū kāna bi-ʿibādihī khabīran baṣīran

97.content: وَمَن يَهدِ اللَّهُ فَهُوَ المُهتَدِ ۖ وَمَن يُضلِل فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُم أَولِياءَ مِن دونِهِ ۖ وَنَحشُرُهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ عَلىٰ وُجوهِهِم عُميًا وَبُكمًا وَصُمًّا ۖ مَأواهُم جَهَنَّمُ ۖ كُلَّما خَبَت زِدناهُم سَعيرًا
97.translation_eng: Whomever Allah guides is rightly guided, and whomever He leads astray you will never find them any guardians besides Him. On the Day of Resurrection, We shall muster them [scrambling] on their faces,1 blind, dumb, and deaf. Their refuge shall be hell. Whenever it subsides, We shall intensify the blaze for them.Cf. 25:34; 54:48.
97.transliteration: wa-man yahdī llāhu fa-huwa l-muhtadi wa-man yuḍlil fa-lan tajida lahum ʾawliyāʾa min dūnihī wa-naḥshuruhum yawma l-qiyāmati ʿalā wujūhihim ʿumyan wa-bukman wa-ṣumman maʾwāhum jahannamu kullamā khabat zidnāhum saʿīran

98.content: ذٰلِكَ جَزاؤُهُم بِأَنَّهُم كَفَروا بِآياتِنا وَقالوا أَإِذا كُنّا عِظامًا وَرُفاتًا أَإِنّا لَمَبعوثونَ خَلقًا جَديدًا
98.translation_eng: That is their requital because they defied Our signs and said, ‘What, when we have become bones and dust, shall we really be raised in a new creation?’
98.transliteration: dhālika jazāʾuhum bi-ʾannahum kafarū bi-ʾāyātinā wa-qālū ʾa-ʾidhā kunnā ʿiẓāman wa-rufātan ʾa-ʾinnā la-mabʿūthūna khalqan jadīdan

99.content: ۞ أَوَلَم يَرَوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ الَّذي خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ قادِرٌ عَلىٰ أَن يَخلُقَ مِثلَهُم وَجَعَلَ لَهُم أَجَلًا لا رَيبَ فيهِ فَأَبَى الظّالِمونَ إِلّا كُفورًا
99.translation_eng: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and the earth, is able to create the like of them? He has appointed for them a term, in which there is no doubt; yet the wrongdoers are only intent on ingratitude.1Or ‘faithlessness.’
99.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾanna llāha lladhī khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa qādirun ʿalā ʾan yakhluqa mithlahum wa-jaʿala lahum ʾajalan lā rayba fīhi fa-ʾabā ẓ-ẓālimūna ʾillā kufūran

100.content: قُل لَو أَنتُم تَملِكونَ خَزائِنَ رَحمَةِ رَبّي إِذًا لَأَمسَكتُم خَشيَةَ الإِنفاقِ ۚ وَكانَ الإِنسانُ قَتورًا
100.translation_eng: Say, ‘Even if you possessed the treasuries of my Lord’s mercy, you would withhold them for the fear of being spent, and man is very niggardly.’
100.transliteration: qul law ʾantum tamlikūna khazāʾina raḥmati rabbī ʾidhan la-ʾamsaktum khashyata l-ʾinfāqi wa-kāna l-ʾinsānu qatūran

101.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسىٰ تِسعَ آياتٍ بَيِّناتٍ ۖ فَاسأَل بَني إِسرائيلَ إِذ جاءَهُم فَقالَ لَهُ فِرعَونُ إِنّي لَأَظُنُّكَ يا موسىٰ مَسحورًا
101.translation_eng: Certainly We gave Moses nine manifest signs. So ask the Children of Israel. When he came to them, Pharaoh said to him, ‘O Moses, indeed I think you are bewitched.’
101.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā mūsā tisʿa ʾāyātin bayyinātin fa-sʾal banī ʾisrāʾīla ʾidh jāʾahum fa-qāla lahū firʿawnu ʾinnī la-ʾaẓunnuka yā-mūsā masḥūran

102.content: قالَ لَقَد عَلِمتَ ما أَنزَلَ هٰؤُلاءِ إِلّا رَبُّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ بَصائِرَ وَإِنّي لَأَظُنُّكَ يا فِرعَونُ مَثبورًا
102.translation_eng: He said, ‘You certainly know that no one has sent these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as eye-openers, and I, O Pharaoh, indeed think you are doomed.’
102.transliteration: qāla la-qad ʿalimta mā ʾanzala hāʾulāʾi ʾillā rabbu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi baṣāʾira wa-ʾinnī la-ʾaẓunnuka yā-firʿawnu mathbūran

103.content: فَأَرادَ أَن يَستَفِزَّهُم مِنَ الأَرضِ فَأَغرَقناهُ وَمَن مَعَهُ جَميعًا
103.translation_eng: He desired to exterminate them from the land, so We drowned him and all those who were with him.
103.transliteration: fa-ʾarāda ʾan yastafizzahum mina l-ʾarḍi fa-ʾaghraqnāhu wa-man maʿahū jamīʿan

104.content: وَقُلنا مِن بَعدِهِ لِبَني إِسرائيلَ اسكُنُوا الأَرضَ فَإِذا جاءَ وَعدُ الآخِرَةِ جِئنا بِكُم لَفيفًا
104.translation_eng: After him We said to the Children of Israel, ‘Take up residence in the land, and when the occasion of the other [promise] comes,1 We shall gather you in mixed company.’2Or ‘when the promise of the Hereafter comes.’Or ‘We shall bring you all together.’ Or ‘We shall bring you from all places.’
104.transliteration: wa-qulnā min baʿdihī li-banī ʾisrāʾīla skunū l-ʾarḍa fa-ʾidhā jāʾa waʿdu l-ʾākhirati jiʾnā bikum lafīfan

105.content: وَبِالحَقِّ أَنزَلناهُ وَبِالحَقِّ نَزَلَ ۗ وَما أَرسَلناكَ إِلّا مُبَشِّرًا وَنَذيرًا
105.translation_eng: With the truth did We send it down, and with the truth did it descend, and We did not send you except as a bearer of good news and as a warner.
105.transliteration: wa-bi-l-ḥaqqi ʾanzalnāhu wa-bi-l-ḥaqqi nazala wa-mā ʾarsalnāka ʾillā mubashshiran wa-nadhīran

106.content: وَقُرآنًا فَرَقناهُ لِتَقرَأَهُ عَلَى النّاسِ عَلىٰ مُكثٍ وَنَزَّلناهُ تَنزيلًا
106.translation_eng: We have sent the Qurʾān in [discrete] parts so that you may read it to the people a little at a time, and We have sent it down piecemeal.
106.transliteration: wa-qurʾānan faraqnāhu li-taqraʾahū ʿalā n-nāsi ʿalā mukthin wa-nazzalnāhu tanzīlan

107.content: قُل آمِنوا بِهِ أَو لا تُؤمِنوا ۚ إِنَّ الَّذينَ أوتُوا العِلمَ مِن قَبلِهِ إِذا يُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم يَخِرّونَ لِلأَذقانِ سُجَّدًا
107.translation_eng: Say, ‘Whether you believe in it, or do not believe in it, indeed those who were given knowledge before it when it is recited to them, fall down in prostration on their faces,
107.transliteration: qul ʾāminū bihī ʾaw lā tuʾminū ʾinna lladhīna ʾūtū l-ʿilma min qablihī ʾidhā yutlā ʿalayhim yakhirrūna li-l-ʾadhqāni sujjadan

108.content: وَيَقولونَ سُبحانَ رَبِّنا إِن كانَ وَعدُ رَبِّنا لَمَفعولًا
108.translation_eng: and say, “Immaculate is our Lord! Indeed Our Lord’s promise is bound to be fulfilled.”
108.transliteration: wa-yaqūlūna subḥāna rabbinā ʾin kāna waʿdu rabbinā la-mafʿūlan

109.translation_eng: Weeping, they fall down on their faces, and it increases them in humility.’

110.content: قُلِ ادعُوا اللَّهَ أَوِ ادعُوا الرَّحمٰنَ ۖ أَيًّا ما تَدعوا فَلَهُ الأَسماءُ الحُسنىٰ ۚ وَلا تَجهَر بِصَلاتِكَ وَلا تُخافِت بِها وَابتَغِ بَينَ ذٰلِكَ سَبيلًا
110.translation_eng: Say, ‘Invoke “Allah” or invoke “the All-beneficent.” Whichever [of His Names] you may invoke, to Him belong the Best Names.’ Be neither loud in your prayer, nor murmur it, but follow a middle course between these,
110.transliteration: quli dʿū llāha ʾawi dʿū r-raḥmāna ʾayyan mā tadʿū fa-lahu l-ʾasmāʾu l-ḥusnā wa-lā tajhar bi-ṣalātika wa-lā tukhāfit bihā wa-btaghi bayna dhālika sabīlan

111.content: وَقُلِ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذي لَم يَتَّخِذ وَلَدًا وَلَم يَكُن لَهُ شَريكٌ فِي المُلكِ وَلَم يَكُن لَهُ وَلِيٌّ مِنَ الذُّلِّ ۖ وَكَبِّرهُ تَكبيرًا
111.translation_eng: and say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah, who has neither taken any son, nor has He any partner in sovereignty, nor has He [taken] any ally out of weakness,’ and magnify Him with a magnification [worthy of Him].
111.transliteration: wa-quli l-ḥamdu li-llāhi lladhī lam yattakhidh waladan wa-lam yakun lahū sharīkun fī l-mulki wa-lam yakun lahū waliyyun mina dh-dhulli wa-kabbirhu takbīran

18.description: The surah that mentions the wondrous story of a group of youthful believers who retreated from their unbelieving people to the hills and the seclusion of The Cave wherein God caused them to sleep for three hundred and nine lunar years as a sign to their people that God shall, indeed, raise the dead—and that also mentions the narratives of other marvels beyond ordinary human conception. Its name is derived from the story of the “Companions of the Cave” (aṣḥāb al-kahf) told at its beginning. This surah also deals with two other stories: Moses’ meeting with an unidentified figure (verse 60 .), and the story of Dhuʾl-Qarnayn (verse 83). A parable is put forward for the people of Mecca: the parable of the luscious gardens belonging to an arrogant and ungrateful man, which God reduces to dust. The surah opens and closes with references to the Quran itself.

1.content: الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذي أَنزَلَ عَلىٰ عَبدِهِ الكِتابَ وَلَم يَجعَل لَهُ عِوَجًا ۜ
1.translation_eng: All praise belongs to Allah, who has sent down the Book to His servant and did not let any crookedness be in it,
1.transliteration: al-ḥamdu li-llāhi lladhī ʾanzala ʿalā ʿabdihi l-kitāba wa-lam yajʿal lahū ʿiwajā

2.content: قَيِّمًا لِيُنذِرَ بَأسًا شَديدًا مِن لَدُنهُ وَيُبَشِّرَ المُؤمِنينَ الَّذينَ يَعمَلونَ الصّالِحاتِ أَنَّ لَهُم أَجرًا حَسَنًا
2.translation_eng: [a Book] upright, to warn of a severe punishment from Him, and to give good news to the faithful who do righteous deeds, that there shall be for them a good reward,
2.transliteration: qayyiman li-yundhira baʾsan shadīdan min ladunhu wa-yubashshira l-muʾminīna lladhīna yaʿmalūna ṣ-ṣāliḥāti ʾanna lahum ʾajran ḥasanan

3.content: ماكِثينَ فيهِ أَبَدًا
3.translation_eng: to abide in it forever,
3.transliteration: mākithīna fīhi ʾabadan

4.content: وَيُنذِرَ الَّذينَ قالُوا اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ وَلَدًا
4.translation_eng: and to warn those who say, ‘Allah has taken a son.’
4.transliteration: wa-yundhira lladhīna qālū ttakhadha llāhu waladan

5.content: ما لَهُم بِهِ مِن عِلمٍ وَلا لِآبائِهِم ۚ كَبُرَت كَلِمَةً تَخرُجُ مِن أَفواهِهِم ۚ إِن يَقولونَ إِلّا كَذِبًا
5.translation_eng: They do not have any knowledge of that, nor did their fathers. Monstrous is the utterance that comes out of their mouths, and they say nothing but a lie.
5.transliteration: mā lahum bihī min ʿilmin wa-lā li-ʾābāʾihim kaburat kalimatan takhruju min ʾafwāhihim ʾin yaqūlūna ʾillā kadhiban

6.content: فَلَعَلَّكَ باخِعٌ نَفسَكَ عَلىٰ آثارِهِم إِن لَم يُؤمِنوا بِهٰذَا الحَديثِ أَسَفًا
6.translation_eng: You are liable to imperil your life for their sake, if they should not believe this discourse,1 out of grief.That is, the Qurʾān.
6.transliteration: fa-laʿallaka bākhiʿun nafsaka ʿalā ʾāthārihim ʾin lam yuʾminū bi-hādhā l-ḥadīthi ʾasafan

7.content: إِنّا جَعَلنا ما عَلَى الأَرضِ زينَةً لَها لِنَبلُوَهُم أَيُّهُم أَحسَنُ عَمَلًا
7.translation_eng: Indeed We have made whatever is on the earth an adornment for it that We may test them [to see] which of them is best in conduct.
7.transliteration: ʾinnā jaʿalnā mā ʿalā l-ʾarḍi zīnatan lahā li-nabluwahum ʾayyuhum ʾaḥsanu ʿamalan

8.content: وَإِنّا لَجاعِلونَ ما عَلَيها صَعيدًا جُرُزًا
8.translation_eng: And indeed We will turn whatever is on it into a barren plain.
8.transliteration: wa-ʾinnā la-jāʿilūna mā ʿalayhā ṣaʿīdan juruzan

9.content: أَم حَسِبتَ أَنَّ أَصحابَ الكَهفِ وَالرَّقيمِ كانوا مِن آياتِنا عَجَبًا
9.translation_eng: Do you suppose that the Companions of the Cave and the Inscription were among Our wonderful signs?
9.transliteration: ʾam ḥasibta ʾanna ʾaṣḥāba l-kahfi wa-r-raqīmi kānū min ʾāyātinā ʿajaban

10.content: إِذ أَوَى الفِتيَةُ إِلَى الكَهفِ فَقالوا رَبَّنا آتِنا مِن لَدُنكَ رَحمَةً وَهَيِّئ لَنا مِن أَمرِنا رَشَدًا
10.translation_eng: When the youths took refuge in the Cave, they said, ‘Our Lord! Grant us a mercy from Yourself, and help us on to rectitude in our affair.’
10.transliteration: ʾidh ʾawā l-fityatu ʾilā l-kahfi fa-qālū rabbanā ʾātinā min ladunka raḥmatan wa-hayyiʾ lanā min ʾamrinā rashadan

11.content: فَضَرَبنا عَلىٰ آذانِهِم فِي الكَهفِ سِنينَ عَدَدًا
11.translation_eng: So We put them to sleep1 in the Cave for several years.Literally: ‘struck on their ears,’ or ‘drew a curtain (or veil) on their ears.’
11.transliteration: fa-ḍarabnā ʿalā ʾādhānihim fī l-kahfi sinīna ʿadadan

12.content: ثُمَّ بَعَثناهُم لِنَعلَمَ أَيُّ الحِزبَينِ أَحصىٰ لِما لَبِثوا أَمَدًا
12.translation_eng: Then We aroused them that We might know which of the two groups better reckoned the period they had stayed.
12.transliteration: thumma baʿathnāhum li-naʿlama ʾayyu l-ḥizbayni ʾaḥṣā li-mā labithū ʾamadan

13.content: نَحنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ نَبَأَهُم بِالحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّهُم فِتيَةٌ آمَنوا بِرَبِّهِم وَزِدناهُم هُدًى
13.translation_eng: We relate to you their account in truth. They were indeed youths who had faith in their Lord, and We had enhanced them in guidance,
13.transliteration: naḥnu naquṣṣu ʿalayka nabaʾahum bi-l-ḥaqqi ʾinnahum fityatun ʾāmanū bi-rabbihim wa-zidnāhum hudan

14.content: وَرَبَطنا عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم إِذ قاموا فَقالوا رَبُّنا رَبُّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ لَن نَدعُوَ مِن دونِهِ إِلٰهًا ۖ لَقَد قُلنا إِذًا شَطَطًا
14.translation_eng: and fortified their hearts, when they stood up and said, ‘Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We will never invoke any god besides Him, for then we shall certainly have said an atrocious lie.
14.transliteration: wa-rabaṭnā ʿalā qulūbihim ʾidh qāmū fa-qālū rabbunā rabbu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi lan nadʿuwa min dūnihī ʾilāhan la-qad qulnā ʾidhan shaṭaṭan

15.content: هٰؤُلاءِ قَومُنَا اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِهِ آلِهَةً ۖ لَولا يَأتونَ عَلَيهِم بِسُلطانٍ بَيِّنٍ ۖ فَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّنِ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا
15.translation_eng: These—our people— have taken gods besides Him. Why do they not bring any clear authority touching them? So who is a greater wrongdoer than he who fabricates a lie against Allah?
15.transliteration: hāʾulāʾi qawmunā ttakhadhū min dūnihī ʾālihatan law-lā yaʾtūna ʿalayhim bi-sulṭānin bayyinin fa-man ʾaẓlamu mimmani ftarā ʿalā llāhi kadhiban

16.content: وَإِذِ اعتَزَلتُموهُم وَما يَعبُدونَ إِلَّا اللَّهَ فَأووا إِلَى الكَهفِ يَنشُر لَكُم رَبُّكُم مِن رَحمَتِهِ وَيُهَيِّئ لَكُم مِن أَمرِكُم مِرفَقًا
16.translation_eng: When you have dissociated yourselves from them and from what they worship except Allah, then take refuge in the Cave. Your Lord will unfold His mercy for you, and He will help you on to ease in your affair.’
16.transliteration: wa-ʾidhi ʿtazaltumūhum wa-mā yaʿbudūna ʾillā llāha fa-ʾwū ʾilā l-kahfi yanshur lakum rabbukum min raḥmatihī wa-yuhayyiʾ lakum min ʾamrikum mirfaqan

17.content: ۞ وَتَرَى الشَّمسَ إِذا طَلَعَت تَزاوَرُ عَن كَهفِهِم ذاتَ اليَمينِ وَإِذا غَرَبَت تَقرِضُهُم ذاتَ الشِّمالِ وَهُم في فَجوَةٍ مِنهُ ۚ ذٰلِكَ مِن آياتِ اللَّهِ ۗ مَن يَهدِ اللَّهُ فَهُوَ المُهتَدِ ۖ وَمَن يُضلِل فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُ وَلِيًّا مُرشِدًا
17.translation_eng: You may see the sun, when it rises, slanting toward the right of their cave, and, when it sets, cut across them towards the left, while they are in a cavern within it. That is one of Allah’s signs. Whomever Allah guides is rightly guided, and whomever He leads astray, you will never find for him any guardian or guide.
17.transliteration: wa-tarā sh-shamsa ʾidhā ṭalaʿat tazāwaru ʿan kahfihim dhāta l-yamīni wa-ʾidhā gharabat taqriḍuhum dhāta sh-shimāli wa-hum fī fajwatin minhu dhālika min ʾāyāti llāhi man yahdi llāhu fa-huwa l-muhtadi wa-man yuḍlil fa-lan tajida lahū waliyyan murshidan

18.content: وَتَحسَبُهُم أَيقاظًا وَهُم رُقودٌ ۚ وَنُقَلِّبُهُم ذاتَ اليَمينِ وَذاتَ الشِّمالِ ۖ وَكَلبُهُم باسِطٌ ذِراعَيهِ بِالوَصيدِ ۚ لَوِ اطَّلَعتَ عَلَيهِم لَوَلَّيتَ مِنهُم فِرارًا وَلَمُلِئتَ مِنهُم رُعبًا
18.translation_eng: You will suppose them to be awake, although they are asleep. We turn them to the right and to the left, and their dog [lies] stretching its forelegs at the threshold. If you come upon them, you will surely turn to flee from them, and you will surely be filled with a terror of them.
18.transliteration: wa-taḥsabuhum ʾayqāẓan wa-hum ruqūdun wa-nuqallibuhum dhāta l-yamīni wa-dhāta sh-shimāli wa-kalbuhum bāsiṭun dhirāʿayhi bi-l-waṣīdi lawi ṭṭalaʿta ʿalayhim la-wallayta minhum firāran wa-la-muliʾta minhum ruʿban

19.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ بَعَثناهُم لِيَتَساءَلوا بَينَهُم ۚ قالَ قائِلٌ مِنهُم كَم لَبِثتُم ۖ قالوا لَبِثنا يَومًا أَو بَعضَ يَومٍ ۚ قالوا رَبُّكُم أَعلَمُ بِما لَبِثتُم فَابعَثوا أَحَدَكُم بِوَرِقِكُم هٰذِهِ إِلَى المَدينَةِ فَليَنظُر أَيُّها أَزكىٰ طَعامًا فَليَأتِكُم بِرِزقٍ مِنهُ وَليَتَلَطَّف وَلا يُشعِرَنَّ بِكُم أَحَدًا
19.translation_eng: So it was that We aroused them [from sleep] so that they might question one another. One of them said, ‘How long have you stayed [here]?’ They said, ‘We have stayed a day, or part of a day.’ They said, ‘Your Lord knows best how long you have stayed. Send one of you to the city with this money. Let him observe which of them has the purest food, and bring you provisions from there. Let him be attentive,1 and let him not make anyone aware of you.Or ‘careful.’
19.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika baʿathnāhum li-yatasāʾalū baynahum qāla qāʾilun minhum kam labithtum qālū labithnā yawman ʾaw baʿḍa yawmin qālū rabbukum ʾaʿlamu bi-mā labithtum fa-bʿathū ʾaḥadakum bi-wariqikum hādhihī ʾilā l-madīnati fa-l-yanẓur ʾayyuhā ʾazkā ṭaʿāman fa-l-yaʾtikum bi-rizqin minhu wa-l-yatalaṭṭaf wa-lā yushʿiranna bikum ʾaḥadan

20.content: إِنَّهُم إِن يَظهَروا عَلَيكُم يَرجُموكُم أَو يُعيدوكُم في مِلَّتِهِم وَلَن تُفلِحوا إِذًا أَبَدًا
20.translation_eng: Indeed should they prevail over you, they will [either] stone you [to death], or force you back into their creed, and then you will never be saved.’
20.transliteration: ʾinnahum ʾin yaẓharū ʿalaykum yarjumūkum ʾaw yuʿīdūkum fī millatihim wa-lan tufliḥū ʾidhan ʾabadan

21.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَعثَرنا عَلَيهِم لِيَعلَموا أَنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَأَنَّ السّاعَةَ لا رَيبَ فيها إِذ يَتَنازَعونَ بَينَهُم أَمرَهُم ۖ فَقالُوا ابنوا عَلَيهِم بُنيانًا ۖ رَبُّهُم أَعلَمُ بِهِم ۚ قالَ الَّذينَ غَلَبوا عَلىٰ أَمرِهِم لَنَتَّخِذَنَّ عَلَيهِم مَسجِدًا
21.translation_eng: So it was that We let them come upon them,1 that they might know that Allah’s promise is true, and that there is no doubt in the Hour. As they were disputing among themselves about their matter, they said, ‘Build a building over them. Their Lord knows them best.’ Those who had the say in their matter said, ‘We will set up a place of worship over them.’That is, We let the people discover the cave where the Men of the Cave were.
21.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika ʾaʿtharnā ʿalayhim li-yaʿlamū ʾanna waʿda llāhi ḥaqqun wa-ʾanna s-sāʿata lā rayba fīhā ʾidh yatanāzaʿūna baynahum ʾamrahum fa-qālū bnū ʿalayhim bunyānan rabbuhum ʾaʿlamu bihim qāla lladhīna ghalabū ʿalā ʾamrihim la-nattakhidhanna ʿalayhim masjidan

22.content: سَيَقولونَ ثَلاثَةٌ رابِعُهُم كَلبُهُم وَيَقولونَ خَمسَةٌ سادِسُهُم كَلبُهُم رَجمًا بِالغَيبِ ۖ وَيَقولونَ سَبعَةٌ وَثامِنُهُم كَلبُهُم ۚ قُل رَبّي أَعلَمُ بِعِدَّتِهِم ما يَعلَمُهُم إِلّا قَليلٌ ۗ فَلا تُمارِ فيهِم إِلّا مِراءً ظاهِرًا وَلا تَستَفتِ فيهِم مِنهُم أَحَدًا
22.translation_eng: They will say, ‘[They are] three; their dog is the fourth of them. They will say, ‘[They are] five, their dog is the sixth of them,’ taking a shot at the invisible.1 They will say, ‘[They are] seven, their dog is the eighth of them.’ Say, ‘My Lord knows best their number, and none knows them except a few.’ So do not dispute concerning them, except for a seeming dispute, and do not question about them any of them.That is, making a wild guess.
22.transliteration: sa-yaqūlūna thalāthatun rābiʿuhum kalbuhum wa-yaqūlūna khamsatun sādisuhum kalbuhum rajman bi-l-ghaybi wa-yaqūlūna sabʿatun wa-thāminuhum kalbuhum qul rabbī ʾaʿlamu bi-ʿiddatihim mā yaʿlamuhum ʾillā qalīlun fa-lā tumāri fīhim ʾillā mirāʾan ẓāhiran wa-lā tastafti fīhim minhum ʾaḥadan

23.content: وَلا تَقولَنَّ لِشَيءٍ إِنّي فاعِلٌ ذٰلِكَ غَدًا
23.translation_eng: Do not say about anything, ‘I will indeed do it tomorrow,’
23.transliteration: wa-lā taqūlanna li-shayʾin ʾinnī fāʿilun dhālika ghadan

24.content: إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ وَاذكُر رَبَّكَ إِذا نَسيتَ وَقُل عَسىٰ أَن يَهدِيَنِ رَبّي لِأَقرَبَ مِن هٰذا رَشَدًا
24.translation_eng: without [adding], ‘if Allah wishes.’ And when you forget, remember your Lord, and say, ‘Maybe my Lord will guide me to [something] more akin to rectitude than this.’
24.transliteration: ʾillā ʾan yashāʾa llāhu wa-dhkur rabbaka ʾidhā nasīta wa-qul ʿasā ʾan yahdiyani rabbī li-ʾaqraba min hādhā rashadan

25.content: وَلَبِثوا في كَهفِهِم ثَلاثَ مِائَةٍ سِنينَ وَازدادوا تِسعًا
25.translation_eng: They remained in the Cave for three hundred years, and added nine more [to that number].
25.transliteration: wa-labithū fī kahfihim thalātha miʾatin sinīna wa-zdādū tisʿan

26.content: قُلِ اللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما لَبِثوا ۖ لَهُ غَيبُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ أَبصِر بِهِ وَأَسمِع ۚ ما لَهُم مِن دونِهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلا يُشرِكُ في حُكمِهِ أَحَدًا
26.translation_eng: Say, ‘Allah knows best how long they remained. To Him belongs the Unseen of the heavens and the earth. How well does He see! How well does He hear! They have no guardian besides Him, and none shares with Him in His judgement.’
26.transliteration: quli llāhu ʾaʿlamu bi-mā labithū lahū ghaybu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾabṣir bihī wa-ʾasmiʿ mā lahum min dūnihī min waliyyin wa-lā yushriku fī ḥukmihī ʾaḥadan

27.content: وَاتلُ ما أوحِيَ إِلَيكَ مِن كِتابِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لا مُبَدِّلَ لِكَلِماتِهِ وَلَن تَجِدَ مِن دونِهِ مُلتَحَدًا
27.translation_eng: Recite what has been revealed to you from your Lord’s Book. Nothing can change His words, and you will never find any refuge besides Him.
27.transliteration: wa-tlu mā ʾūḥiya ʾilayka min kitābi rabbika lā mubaddila li-kalimātihī wa-lan tajida min dūnihī multaḥadan

28.content: وَاصبِر نَفسَكَ مَعَ الَّذينَ يَدعونَ رَبَّهُم بِالغَداةِ وَالعَشِيِّ يُريدونَ وَجهَهُ ۖ وَلا تَعدُ عَيناكَ عَنهُم تُريدُ زينَةَ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۖ وَلا تُطِع مَن أَغفَلنا قَلبَهُ عَن ذِكرِنا وَاتَّبَعَ هَواهُ وَكانَ أَمرُهُ فُرُطًا
28.translation_eng: Content yourself with the company of those who supplicate their Lord morning and evening, desiring His Face, and do not loose sight of them, desiring the glitter of the life of this world.1 And Do not obey him whose heart We have made oblivious to Our remembrance, and who follows his own desires, and whose conduct is [mere] profligacy.Cf. 6:52.
28.transliteration: wa-ṣbir nafsaka maʿa lladhīna yadʿūna rabbahum bi-l-ghadāti wa-l-ʿashiyyi yurīdūna wajhahū wa-lā taʿdu ʿaynāka ʿanhum turīdu zīnata l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-lā tuṭiʿ man ʾaghfalnā qalbahū ʿan dhikrinā wa-ttabaʿa hawāhu wa-kāna ʾamruhū furuṭan

29.content: وَقُلِ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكُم ۖ فَمَن شاءَ فَليُؤمِن وَمَن شاءَ فَليَكفُر ۚ إِنّا أَعتَدنا لِلظّالِمينَ نارًا أَحاطَ بِهِم سُرادِقُها ۚ وَإِن يَستَغيثوا يُغاثوا بِماءٍ كَالمُهلِ يَشوِي الوُجوهَ ۚ بِئسَ الشَّرابُ وَساءَت مُرتَفَقًا
29.translation_eng: And say, ‘[This is] the truth from your Lord: let anyone who wishes believe it, and let anyone who wishes disbelieve it.’ Indeed We have prepared for the wrongdoers a Fire whose curtains will surround them [on all sides]. If they cry out for help, they will be helped with a water like molten copper which will scald the faces. What an evil drink, and how ill a resting place!
29.transliteration: wa-quli l-ḥaqqu min rabbikum fa-man shāʾa fa-l-yuʾmin wa-man shāʾa fa-l-yakfur ʾinnā ʾaʿtadnā li-ẓ-ẓālimīna nāran ʾaḥāṭa bihim surādiquhā wa-ʾin yastaghīthū yughāthū bi-māʾin ka-l-muhli yashwī l-wujūha biʾsa sh-sharābu wa-sāʾat murtafaqan

30.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ إِنّا لا نُضيعُ أَجرَ مَن أَحسَنَ عَمَلًا
30.translation_eng: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds —indeed We do not waste the reward of those who are good in deeds.
30.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti ʾinnā lā nuḍīʿu ʾajra man ʾaḥsana ʿamalan

31.content: أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم جَنّاتُ عَدنٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهِمُ الأَنهارُ يُحَلَّونَ فيها مِن أَساوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍ وَيَلبَسونَ ثِيابًا خُضرًا مِن سُندُسٍ وَإِستَبرَقٍ مُتَّكِئينَ فيها عَلَى الأَرائِكِ ۚ نِعمَ الثَّوابُ وَحَسُنَت مُرتَفَقًا
31.translation_eng: For such there will be the Gardens of Eden with streams running in them. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and wear green garments of silk and brocade, reclining therein on couches. How excellent a reward, and how good a resting place!
31.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lahum jannātu ʿadnin tajrī min taḥtihimu l-ʾanhāru yuḥallawna fīhā min ʾasāwira min dhahabin wa-yalbasūna thiyāban khuḍran min sundusin wa-ʾistabraqin muttakiʾīna fīhā ʿalā l-ʾarāʾiki niʿma th-thawābu wa-ḥasunat murtafaqan

32.content: ۞ وَاضرِب لَهُم مَثَلًا رَجُلَينِ جَعَلنا لِأَحَدِهِما جَنَّتَينِ مِن أَعنابٍ وَحَفَفناهُما بِنَخلٍ وَجَعَلنا بَينَهُما زَرعًا
32.translation_eng: Draw for them the parable of two men for each of whom We had made two gardens of vines, and We had surrounded them with date palms, and placed crops between them.
32.transliteration: wa-ḍrib lahum mathalan rajulayni jaʿalnā li-ʾaḥadihimā jannatayni min ʾaʿnābin wa-ḥafafnāhumā bi-nakhlin wa-jaʿalnā baynahumā zarʿan

33.content: كِلتَا الجَنَّتَينِ آتَت أُكُلَها وَلَم تَظلِم مِنهُ شَيئًا ۚ وَفَجَّرنا خِلالَهُما نَهَرًا
33.translation_eng: Both gardens yielded their produce without stinting anything of it. And We had set a stream gushing through them.
33.transliteration: kiltā l-jannatayni ʾātat ʾukulahā wa-lam taẓlim minhu shayʾan wa-fajjarnā khilālahumā naharan

34.content: وَكانَ لَهُ ثَمَرٌ فَقالَ لِصاحِبِهِ وَهُوَ يُحاوِرُهُ أَنا أَكثَرُ مِنكَ مالًا وَأَعَزُّ نَفَرًا
34.translation_eng: He had abundant fruits, so he said to his companion, as he conversed with him: ‘I have more wealth than you, and am stronger with respect to numbers.’1That is, with respect to the number of servants and attendants and the size of family and clan.
34.transliteration: wa-kāna lahū thamarun fa-qāla li-ṣāḥibihī wa-huwa yuḥāwiruhū ʾana ʾaktharu minka mālan wa-ʾaʿazzu nafaran

35.content: وَدَخَلَ جَنَّتَهُ وَهُوَ ظالِمٌ لِنَفسِهِ قالَ ما أَظُنُّ أَن تَبيدَ هٰذِهِ أَبَدًا
35.translation_eng: He entered his garden while he wronged himself. He said, ‘I do not think that this will ever perish,
35.transliteration: wa-dakhala jannatahū wa-huwa ẓālimun li-nafsihī qāla mā ʾaẓunnu ʾan tabīda hādhihī ʾabadan

36.content: وَما أَظُنُّ السّاعَةَ قائِمَةً وَلَئِن رُدِدتُ إِلىٰ رَبّي لَأَجِدَنَّ خَيرًا مِنها مُنقَلَبًا
36.translation_eng: and I do not think that the Hour will ever set in. And even if I am returned to my Lord I will surely find a resort better than this.’
36.transliteration: wa-mā ʾaẓunnu s-sāʿata qāʾimatan wa-la-ʾin rudidtu ʾilā rabbī la-ʾajidanna khayran minhā munqalaban

37.content: قالَ لَهُ صاحِبُهُ وَهُوَ يُحاوِرُهُ أَكَفَرتَ بِالَّذي خَلَقَكَ مِن تُرابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُطفَةٍ ثُمَّ سَوّاكَ رَجُلًا
37.translation_eng: His companion said to him, as he conversed with him: ‘Do you disbelieve in Him who created you from dust, then from a drop of [seminal] fluid, then fashioned you as a man?
37.transliteration: qāla lahū ṣāḥibuhū wa-huwa yuḥāwiruhū ʾa-kafarta bi-lladhī khalaqaka min turābin thumma min nuṭfatin thumma sawwāka rajulan

38.content: لٰكِنّا هُوَ اللَّهُ رَبّي وَلا أُشرِكُ بِرَبّي أَحَدًا
38.translation_eng: But I [say], “He is Allah, my Lord,” and I do not ascribe any partner to my Lord.
38.transliteration: lākinna huwa llāhu rabbī wa-lā ʾushriku bi-rabbī ʾaḥadan

39.content: وَلَولا إِذ دَخَلتَ جَنَّتَكَ قُلتَ ما شاءَ اللَّهُ لا قُوَّةَ إِلّا بِاللَّهِ ۚ إِن تَرَنِ أَنا أَقَلَّ مِنكَ مالًا وَوَلَدًا
39.translation_eng: Why did you not say, when you entered your garden, “[This is] as Allah has wished! There is no power except by Allah!” If you see that I have lesser wealth than you and children,
39.transliteration: wa-law-lā ʾidh dakhalta jannataka qulta mā shāʾa llāhu lā quwwata ʾillā bi-llāhi ʾin tarani ʾana ʾaqalla minka mālan wa-waladan

40.content: فَعَسىٰ رَبّي أَن يُؤتِيَنِ خَيرًا مِن جَنَّتِكَ وَيُرسِلَ عَلَيها حُسبانًا مِنَ السَّماءِ فَتُصبِحَ صَعيدًا زَلَقًا
40.translation_eng: maybe my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden, and He will unleash upon it bolts from the sky, so that it becomes a bare plain.
40.transliteration: fa-ʿasā rabbī ʾan yuʾtiyani khayran min jannatika wa-yursila ʿalayhā ḥusbānan mina s-samāʾi fa-tuṣbiḥa ṣaʿīdan zalaqan

41.content: أَو يُصبِحَ ماؤُها غَورًا فَلَن تَستَطيعَ لَهُ طَلَبًا
41.translation_eng: Or its water will sink down, so that you cannot obtain it.’
41.transliteration: ʾaw yuṣbiḥa māʾuhā ghawran fa-lan tastaṭīʿa lahū ṭalaban

42.content: وَأُحيطَ بِثَمَرِهِ فَأَصبَحَ يُقَلِّبُ كَفَّيهِ عَلىٰ ما أَنفَقَ فيها وَهِيَ خاوِيَةٌ عَلىٰ عُروشِها وَيَقولُ يا لَيتَني لَم أُشرِك بِرَبّي أَحَدًا
42.translation_eng: And ruin closed in on his produce, and he began to wring his hands for what he had spent on it, as it lay fallen on its trellises. He was saying, ‘I wish I had not ascribed any partner to my Lord.’
42.transliteration: wa-ʾuḥīṭa bi-thamarihī fa-ʾaṣbaḥa yuqallibu kaffayhi ʿalā mā ʾanfaqa fīhā wa-hiya khāwiyatun ʿalā ʿurūshihā wa-yaqūlu yā-laytanī lam ʾushrik bi-rabbī ʾaḥadan

43.content: وَلَم تَكُن لَهُ فِئَةٌ يَنصُرونَهُ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَما كانَ مُنتَصِرًا
43.translation_eng: He had no party to help him, besides Allah, nor could he help himself.
43.transliteration: wa-lam takun lahū fiʾatun yanṣurūnahū min dūni llāhi wa-mā kāna muntaṣiran

44.content: هُنالِكَ الوَلايَةُ لِلَّهِ الحَقِّ ۚ هُوَ خَيرٌ ثَوابًا وَخَيرٌ عُقبًا
44.translation_eng: There, all authority belongs to Allah, the Real. He is best in rewarding, and best in requiting.
44.transliteration: hunālika l-walāyatu li-llāhi l-ḥaqqi huwa khayrun thawāban wa-khayrun ʿuqban

45.content: وَاضرِب لَهُم مَثَلَ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا كَماءٍ أَنزَلناهُ مِنَ السَّماءِ فَاختَلَطَ بِهِ نَباتُ الأَرضِ فَأَصبَحَ هَشيمًا تَذروهُ الرِّياحُ ۗ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ مُقتَدِرًا
45.translation_eng: Draw for them the parable of the life of this world: [It is] like the water We send down from the sky. Then the earth’s vegetation mingles with it. Then it becomes chaff, scattered by the wind. And Allah is omnipotent over all things.
45.transliteration: wa-ḍrib lahum mathala l-ḥayāti d-dunyā ka-māʾin ʾanzalnāhu mina s-samāʾi fa-khtalaṭa bihī nabātu l-ʾarḍi fa-ʾaṣbaḥa hashīman tadhrūhu r-riyāḥu wa-kāna llāhu ʿalā kulli shayʾin muqtadiran-i

46.content: المالُ وَالبَنونَ زينَةُ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۖ وَالباقِياتُ الصّالِحاتُ خَيرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوابًا وَخَيرٌ أَمَلًا
46.translation_eng: Wealth and children are an adornment of the life of the world, but lasting righteous deeds are better with your Lord in reward and better in hope.
46.transliteration: al-mālu wa-l-banūna zīnatu l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-l-bāqiyātu ṣ-ṣāliḥātu khayrun ʿinda rabbika thawāban wa-khayrun ʾamalan

47.content: وَيَومَ نُسَيِّرُ الجِبالَ وَتَرَى الأَرضَ بارِزَةً وَحَشَرناهُم فَلَم نُغادِر مِنهُم أَحَدًا
47.translation_eng: The day We shall set the mountains moving and you will see the earth in full view, We shall muster them, and We will not leave out anyone of them.
47.transliteration: wa-yawma nusayyiru l-jibāla wa-tarā l-ʾarḍa bārizatan wa-ḥasharnāhum fa-lam nughādir minhum ʾaḥadan

48.content: وَعُرِضوا عَلىٰ رَبِّكَ صَفًّا لَقَد جِئتُمونا كَما خَلَقناكُم أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ ۚ بَل زَعَمتُم أَلَّن نَجعَلَ لَكُم مَوعِدًا
48.translation_eng: They will be presented before your Lord in ranks: ‘Certainly you have come to Us just as We created you the first time. Rather you maintained that We shall not appoint a tryst for you.’
48.transliteration: wa-ʿuriḍū ʿalā rabbika ṣaffan la-qad jiʾtumūnā ka-mā khalaqnākum ʾawwala marratin bal zaʿamtum ʾal-lan najʿala lakum mawʿidan

49.content: وَوُضِعَ الكِتابُ فَتَرَى المُجرِمينَ مُشفِقينَ مِمّا فيهِ وَيَقولونَ يا وَيلَتَنا مالِ هٰذَا الكِتابِ لا يُغادِرُ صَغيرَةً وَلا كَبيرَةً إِلّا أَحصاها ۚ وَوَجَدوا ما عَمِلوا حاضِرًا ۗ وَلا يَظلِمُ رَبُّكَ أَحَدًا
49.translation_eng: The Book will be set up. Then you will see the guilty apprehensive of what is in it. They will say, ‘Woe to us! What a book is this! It omits nothing, big or small, without enumerating it.’ They will find present whatever they had done, and your Lord does not wrong anyone.
49.transliteration: wa-wuḍiʿa l-kitābu fa-tarā l-mujrimīna mushfiqīna mimmā fīhi wa-yaqūlūna yā-waylatanā mā-li hādhā l-kitābi lā yughādiru ṣaghīratan wa-lā kabīratan ʾillā ʾaḥṣāhā wa-wajadū mā ʿamilū ḥāḍiran wa-lā yaẓlimu rabbuka ʾaḥadan

50.content: وَإِذ قُلنا لِلمَلائِكَةِ اسجُدوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدوا إِلّا إِبليسَ كانَ مِنَ الجِنِّ فَفَسَقَ عَن أَمرِ رَبِّهِ ۗ أَفَتَتَّخِذونَهُ وَذُرِّيَّتَهُ أَولِياءَ مِن دوني وَهُم لَكُم عَدُوٌّ ۚ بِئسَ لِلظّالِمينَ بَدَلًا
50.translation_eng: When We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam,’ they prostrated, but not Iblis. He was one of the jinn, so he transgressed against his Lord’s command. Will you then take him and his offspring for guardians in My stead, though they are your enemies? How evil a substitute for the wrongdoers!
50.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qulnā li-l-malāʾikati sjudū li-ʾādama fa-sajadū ʾillā ʾiblīsa kāna mina l-jinni fa-fasaqa ʿan ʾamri rabbihī ʾa-fa-tattakhidhūnahū wa-dhurriyyatahū ʾawliyāʾa min dūnī wa-hum lakum ʿaduwwun biʾsa li-ẓ-ẓālimīna badalan

51.content: ۞ ما أَشهَدتُهُم خَلقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَلا خَلقَ أَنفُسِهِم وَما كُنتُ مُتَّخِذَ المُضِلّينَ عَضُدًا
51.translation_eng: I did not make them a witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor to their own creation, nor do I take those who mislead as assistants.
51.transliteration: mā ʾashhadtuhum khalqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-lā khalqa ʾanfusihim wa-mā kuntu muttakhidha l-muḍillīna ʿaḍudan

52.content: وَيَومَ يَقولُ نادوا شُرَكائِيَ الَّذينَ زَعَمتُم فَدَعَوهُم فَلَم يَستَجيبوا لَهُم وَجَعَلنا بَينَهُم مَوبِقًا
52.translation_eng: The day He will say, ‘Call those whom you maintained to be My partners,’ they will call them, but they will not respond to them, for We shall place an abyss between them.
52.transliteration: wa-yawma yaqūlu nādū shurakāʾiya lladhīna zaʿamtum fa-daʿawhum fa-lam yastajībū lahum wa-jaʿalnā baynahum mawbiqan

53.content: وَرَأَى المُجرِمونَ النّارَ فَظَنّوا أَنَّهُم مُواقِعوها وَلَم يَجِدوا عَنها مَصرِفًا
53.translation_eng: The guilty will sight the Fire and know that they will fall into it, for they will find no means to circumvent it.
53.transliteration: wa-raʾā l-mujrimūna n-nāra fa-ẓannū ʾannahum muwāqiʿūhā wa-lam yajidū ʿanhā maṣrifan

54.content: وَلَقَد صَرَّفنا في هٰذَا القُرآنِ لِلنّاسِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ ۚ وَكانَ الإِنسانُ أَكثَرَ شَيءٍ جَدَلًا
54.translation_eng: Certainly We have made this Qurʾān interspersed with every kind of parable for mankind. But man is the most disputatious of creatures.
54.transliteration: wa-la-qad ṣarrafnā fī hādhā l-qurʾāni li-n-nāsi min kulli mathalin wa-kāna l-ʾinsānu ʾakthara shayʾin jadalan

55.content: وَما مَنَعَ النّاسَ أَن يُؤمِنوا إِذ جاءَهُمُ الهُدىٰ وَيَستَغفِروا رَبَّهُم إِلّا أَن تَأتِيَهُم سُنَّةُ الأَوَّلينَ أَو يَأتِيَهُمُ العَذابُ قُبُلًا
55.translation_eng: People do not refuse to have faith when guidance comes to them and to plead to their Lord for forgiveness, without being overtaken by the precedent of the ancients, or confronting the punishment.1Or, ‘being overtaken by diverse punishments.’
55.transliteration: wa-mā manaʿa n-nāsa ʾan yuʾminū ʾidh jāʾahumu l-hudā wa-yastaghfirū rabbahum ʾillā ʾan taʾtiyahum sunnatu l-ʾawwalīna ʾaw yaʾtiyahumu l-ʿadhābu qubulan

56.content: وَما نُرسِلُ المُرسَلينَ إِلّا مُبَشِّرينَ وَمُنذِرينَ ۚ وَيُجادِلُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِالباطِلِ لِيُدحِضوا بِهِ الحَقَّ ۖ وَاتَّخَذوا آياتي وَما أُنذِروا هُزُوًا
56.translation_eng: We do not send the apostles except as bearers of good news and as warners, but those who are faithless dispute fallaciously to refute thereby the truth, having taken My signs and what they are warned of in derision.
56.transliteration: wa-mā nursilu l-mursalīna ʾillā mubashshirīna wa-mundhirīna wa-yujādilu lladhīna kafarū bi-l-bāṭili li-yudḥiḍū bihi l-ḥaqqa wa-ttakhadhū ʾāyātī wa-mā ʾundhirū huzuwan

57.content: وَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِآياتِ رَبِّهِ فَأَعرَضَ عَنها وَنَسِيَ ما قَدَّمَت يَداهُ ۚ إِنّا جَعَلنا عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفقَهوهُ وَفي آذانِهِم وَقرًا ۖ وَإِن تَدعُهُم إِلَى الهُدىٰ فَلَن يَهتَدوا إِذًا أَبَدًا
57.translation_eng: Who is a greater wrongdoer than he who is reminded of the signs of his Lord, whereat he disregards them and forgets what his hands have sent ahead? Indeed We have cast veils on their hearts lest they should understand it, and a deafness into their ears; and if you invite them to guidance they will never [let themselves] be guided.
57.transliteration: wa-man ʾaẓlamu mimman dhukkira bi-ʾāyāti rabbihī fa-ʾaʿraḍa ʿanhā wa-nasiya mā qaddamat yadāhu ʾinnā jaʿalnā ʿalā qulūbihim ʾakinnatan ʾan yafqahūhu wa-fī ʾādhānihim waqran wa-ʾin tadʿuhum ʾilā l-hudā fa-lan yahtadū ʾidhan ʾabadan

58.content: وَرَبُّكَ الغَفورُ ذُو الرَّحمَةِ ۖ لَو يُؤاخِذُهُم بِما كَسَبوا لَعَجَّلَ لَهُمُ العَذابَ ۚ بَل لَهُم مَوعِدٌ لَن يَجِدوا مِن دونِهِ مَوئِلًا
58.translation_eng: Your Lord is the All-forgiving dispenser of mercy. Were He to take them to task because of what they have committed, He would have surely hastened their punishment. But they have a tryst, [when] they will not find a refuge besides Him.1Or ‘from which they will not find any refuge.’
58.transliteration: wa-rabbuka l-ghafūru dhū r-raḥmati law yuʾākhidhuhum bi-mā kasabū la-ʿajjala lahumu l-ʿadhāba bal lahum mawʿidun lan yajidū min dūnihī mawʾilan

59.content: وَتِلكَ القُرىٰ أَهلَكناهُم لَمّا ظَلَموا وَجَعَلنا لِمَهلِكِهِم مَوعِدًا
59.translation_eng: Those are the towns that We destroyed when they were wrongdoers, and We appointed a tryst for their destruction.
59.transliteration: wa-tilka l-qurā ʾahlaknāhum lammā ẓalamū wa-jaʿalnā li-mahlikihim mawʿidan

60.content: وَإِذ قالَ موسىٰ لِفَتاهُ لا أَبرَحُ حَتّىٰ أَبلُغَ مَجمَعَ البَحرَينِ أَو أَمضِيَ حُقُبًا
60.translation_eng: When Moses said to his lad, ‘I will go on [journeying] until I have reached the confluence of the two seas, or have spent a long time [travelling].’
60.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qāla mūsā li-fatāhu lā ʾabraḥu ḥattā ʾablugha majmaʿa l-baḥrayni ʾaw ʾamḍiya ḥuquban

61.content: فَلَمّا بَلَغا مَجمَعَ بَينِهِما نَسِيا حوتَهُما فَاتَّخَذَ سَبيلَهُ فِي البَحرِ سَرَبًا
61.translation_eng: So when they reached the confluence between them, they forgot their fish, which found its way into the sea, sneaking away.
61.transliteration: fa-lammā balaghā majmaʿa baynihimā nasiyā ḥūtahumā fa-ttakhadha sabīlahū fī l-baḥri saraban

62.content: فَلَمّا جاوَزا قالَ لِفَتاهُ آتِنا غَداءَنا لَقَد لَقينا مِن سَفَرِنا هٰذا نَصَبًا
62.translation_eng: So when they had passed on, he said to his lad, ‘Bring us our meal. We have certainly encountered much fatigue on this journey of ours.’
62.transliteration: fa-lammā jāwazā qāla li-fatāhu ʾātinā ghadāʾanā la-qad laqīnā min safarinā hādhā naṣaban

63.content: قالَ أَرَأَيتَ إِذ أَوَينا إِلَى الصَّخرَةِ فَإِنّي نَسيتُ الحوتَ وَما أَنسانيهُ إِلَّا الشَّيطانُ أَن أَذكُرَهُ ۚ وَاتَّخَذَ سَبيلَهُ فِي البَحرِ عَجَبًا
63.translation_eng: He said, ‘Did you see?! When we took shelter at the rock, indeed I forgot about the fish —and none but Satan made me forget to mention it!— and it made its way into the sea in an amazing manner!’
63.transliteration: qāla ʾa-raʾayta ʾidh ʾawaynā ʾilā ṣ-ṣakhrati fa-ʾinnī nasītu l-ḥūta wa-mā ʾansānīhu ʾillā sh-shayṭānu ʾan ʾadhkurahū wa-ttakhadha sabīlahū fī l-baḥri ʿajaban

64.content: قالَ ذٰلِكَ ما كُنّا نَبغِ ۚ فَارتَدّا عَلىٰ آثارِهِما قَصَصًا
64.translation_eng: He said, ‘That is what we were after!’ So they returned, retracing their footsteps.
64.transliteration: qāla dhālika mā kunnā nabghi fa-rtaddā ʿalā ʾāthārihimā qaṣaṣan

65.content: فَوَجَدا عَبدًا مِن عِبادِنا آتَيناهُ رَحمَةً مِن عِندِنا وَعَلَّمناهُ مِن لَدُنّا عِلمًا
65.translation_eng: [There] they found one of Our servants whom We had granted a mercy from Ourselves, and taught him a knowledge from Our own.
65.transliteration: fa-wajadā ʿabdan min ʿibādinā ʾātaynāhu raḥmatan min ʿindinā wa-ʿallamnāhu min ladunnā ʿilman

66.content: قالَ لَهُ موسىٰ هَل أَتَّبِعُكَ عَلىٰ أَن تُعَلِّمَنِ مِمّا عُلِّمتَ رُشدًا
66.translation_eng: Moses said to him, ‘May I follow you for the purpose that you teach me some of the probity you have been taught?’
66.transliteration: qāla lahū mūsā hal ʾattabiʿuka ʿalā ʾan tuʿallimani mimmā ʿullimta rushdan

67.content: قالَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَستَطيعَ مَعِيَ صَبرًا
67.translation_eng: He said, ‘Indeed you cannot have patience with me!
67.transliteration: qāla ʾinnaka lan tastaṭīʿa maʿiya ṣabran

68.content: وَكَيفَ تَصبِرُ عَلىٰ ما لَم تُحِط بِهِ خُبرًا
68.translation_eng: And how can you have patience about something you are not in the know of?’
68.transliteration: wa-kayfa taṣbiru ʿalā mā lam tuḥiṭ bihī khubran

69.content: قالَ سَتَجِدُني إِن شاءَ اللَّهُ صابِرًا وَلا أَعصي لَكَ أَمرًا
69.translation_eng: He said, ‘You will find me, God willing, to be patient, and I will not disobey you in any matter.’
69.transliteration: qāla sa-tajidunī ʾin shāʾa llāhu ṣābiran wa-lā ʾaʿṣī laka ʾamran

70.content: قالَ فَإِنِ اتَّبَعتَني فَلا تَسأَلني عَن شَيءٍ حَتّىٰ أُحدِثَ لَكَ مِنهُ ذِكرًا
70.translation_eng: He said, ‘If you follow me, do not question me concerning anything until I [myself] make a mention of it to you.’
70.transliteration: qāla fa-ʾini ttabaʿtanī fa-lā tasʾalnī ʿan shayʾin ḥattā ʾuḥditha laka minhu dhikran

71.content: فَانطَلَقا حَتّىٰ إِذا رَكِبا فِي السَّفينَةِ خَرَقَها ۖ قالَ أَخَرَقتَها لِتُغرِقَ أَهلَها لَقَد جِئتَ شَيئًا إِمرًا
71.translation_eng: So they went on. When they boarded the boat, he made a hole in it. He said, ‘Did you make a hole in it to drown its people? You have certainly done a monstrous thing!’
71.transliteration: fa-nṭalaqā ḥattā ʾidhā rakibā fī s-safīnati kharaqahā qāla ʾa-kharaqtahā li-tughriqa ʾahlahā la-qad jiʾta shayʾan ʾimran

72.content: قالَ أَلَم أَقُل إِنَّكَ لَن تَستَطيعَ مَعِيَ صَبرًا
72.translation_eng: He said, ‘Did I not say, indeed you cannot have patience with me?’
72.transliteration: qāla ʾa-lam ʾaqul ʾinnaka lan tastaṭīʿa maʿiya ṣabran

73.content: قالَ لا تُؤاخِذني بِما نَسيتُ وَلا تُرهِقني مِن أَمري عُسرًا
73.translation_eng: He said, ‘Do not take me to task for my forgetting, and do not be hard upon me.’
73.transliteration: qāla lā tuʾākhidhnī bi-mā nasītu wa-lā turhiqnī min ʾamrī ʿusran

74.content: فَانطَلَقا حَتّىٰ إِذا لَقِيا غُلامًا فَقَتَلَهُ قالَ أَقَتَلتَ نَفسًا زَكِيَّةً بِغَيرِ نَفسٍ لَقَد جِئتَ شَيئًا نُكرًا
74.translation_eng: So they went on. When they encountered a boy, he slew him. He said, ‘Did you slay an innocent soul, without [his having slain] anyone? You have certainly done a dire thing!’
74.transliteration: fa-nṭalaqā ḥattā ʾidhā laqiyā ghulāman fa-qatalahū qāla ʾa-qatalta nafsan zakiyyatan bi-ghayri nafsin la-qad jiʾta shayʾan nukran

75.content: ۞ قالَ أَلَم أَقُل لَكَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَستَطيعَ مَعِيَ صَبرًا
75.translation_eng: He said, ‘Did I not tell you, indeed you cannot have patience with me?’
75.transliteration: qāla ʾa-lam ʾaqul laka ʾinnaka lan tastaṭīʿa maʿiya ṣabran

76.content: قالَ إِن سَأَلتُكَ عَن شَيءٍ بَعدَها فَلا تُصاحِبني ۖ قَد بَلَغتَ مِن لَدُنّي عُذرًا
76.translation_eng: He said, ‘If I question you about anything after this, do not keep me in your company. You have already got sufficient excuse on my part.’
76.transliteration: qāla ʾin saʾaltuka ʿan shayʾin baʿdahā fa-lā tuṣāḥibnī qad balaghta min ladunnī ʿudhran

77.content: فَانطَلَقا حَتّىٰ إِذا أَتَيا أَهلَ قَريَةٍ استَطعَما أَهلَها فَأَبَوا أَن يُضَيِّفوهُما فَوَجَدا فيها جِدارًا يُريدُ أَن يَنقَضَّ فَأَقامَهُ ۖ قالَ لَو شِئتَ لَاتَّخَذتَ عَلَيهِ أَجرًا
77.translation_eng: So they went on. When they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to extend them any hospitality. There they found a wall which was about to collapse, so he erected it. He said, ‘Had you wished, you could have taken a wage for it.’
77.transliteration: fa-nṭalaqā ḥattā ʾidhā ʾatayā ʾahla qaryatin-i staṭʿamā ʾahlahā fa-ʾabaw ʾan yuḍayyifūhumā fa-wajadā fīhā jidāran yurīdu ʾan yanqaḍḍa fa-ʾaqāmahū qāla law shiʾta la-ttakhadhta ʿalayhi ʾajran

78.content: قالَ هٰذا فِراقُ بَيني وَبَينِكَ ۚ سَأُنَبِّئُكَ بِتَأويلِ ما لَم تَستَطِع عَلَيهِ صَبرًا
78.translation_eng: He said, ‘This is where you and I shall part. I will inform you about the interpretation of that over which you could not maintain patience.
78.transliteration: qāla hādhā firāqu baynī wa-baynika sa-ʾunabbiʾuka bi-taʾwīli mā lam tastaṭiʿ ʿalayhi ṣabran

79.content: أَمَّا السَّفينَةُ فَكانَت لِمَساكينَ يَعمَلونَ فِي البَحرِ فَأَرَدتُ أَن أَعيبَها وَكانَ وَراءَهُم مَلِكٌ يَأخُذُ كُلَّ سَفينَةٍ غَصبًا
79.translation_eng: As for the boat, it belonged to some poor people who work on the sea. I wanted to make it defective, for behind them was a king seizing every ship usurpingly.
79.transliteration: ʾammā s-safīnatu fa-kānat li-masākīna yaʿmalūna fī l-baḥri fa-ʾaradtu ʾan ʾaʿībahā wa-kāna warāʾahum malikun yaʾkhudhu kulla safīnatin ghaṣban

80.content: وَأَمَّا الغُلامُ فَكانَ أَبَواهُ مُؤمِنَينِ فَخَشينا أَن يُرهِقَهُما طُغيانًا وَكُفرًا
80.translation_eng: As for the boy, his parents were faithful [persons], and We feared he would overwhelm them with rebellion and unfaith.
80.transliteration: wa-ʾammā l-ghulāmu fa-kānā ʾabawāhu muʾminayni fa-khashīnā ʾan yurhiqahumā ṭughyānan wa-kufran

81.content: فَأَرَدنا أَن يُبدِلَهُما رَبُّهُما خَيرًا مِنهُ زَكاةً وَأَقرَبَ رُحمًا
81.translation_eng: So We desired that their Lord should give them in exchange one better than him in respect of purity and closer in mercy.
81.transliteration: fa-ʾaradnā ʾan yubdilahumā rabbuhumā khayran minhu zakātan wa-ʾaqraba ruḥman

82.content: وَأَمَّا الجِدارُ فَكانَ لِغُلامَينِ يَتيمَينِ فِي المَدينَةِ وَكانَ تَحتَهُ كَنزٌ لَهُما وَكانَ أَبوهُما صالِحًا فَأَرادَ رَبُّكَ أَن يَبلُغا أَشُدَّهُما وَيَستَخرِجا كَنزَهُما رَحمَةً مِن رَبِّكَ ۚ وَما فَعَلتُهُ عَن أَمري ۚ ذٰلِكَ تَأويلُ ما لَم تَسطِع عَلَيهِ صَبرًا
82.translation_eng: As for the wall, it belonged to two boy orphans in the city. Under it there was a treasure belonging to them. Their father had been a righteous man. So your Lord desired that they should come of age and take out their treasure —as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do that out of my own accord. This is the interpretation of that over which you could not maintain patience.’
82.transliteration: wa-ʾammā l-jidāru fa-kāna li-ghulāmayni yatīmayni fī l-madīnati wa-kāna taḥtahū kanzun lahumā wa-kāna ʾabūhumā ṣāliḥan fa-ʾarāda rabbuka ʾan yablughā ʾashuddahumā wa-yastakhrijā kanzahumā raḥmatan min rabbika wa-mā faʿaltuhū ʿan ʾamrī dhālika taʾwīlu mā lam tasṭiʿ ʿalayhi ṣabran

83.content: وَيَسأَلونَكَ عَن ذِي القَرنَينِ ۖ قُل سَأَتلو عَلَيكُم مِنهُ ذِكرًا
83.translation_eng: They question you concerning Dhul Qarnayn. Say, ‘I will relate to you an account of him.’
83.transliteration: wa-yasʾalūnaka ʿan dhī l-qarnayni qul sa-ʾatlū ʿalaykum minhu dhikran

84.content: إِنّا مَكَّنّا لَهُ فِي الأَرضِ وَآتَيناهُ مِن كُلِّ شَيءٍ سَبَبًا
84.translation_eng: Indeed We had granted him power in the land and given him the means to all things.
84.transliteration: ʾinnā makkannā lahū fī l-ʾarḍi wa-ʾātaynāhu min kulli shayʾin sababan

85.content: فَأَتبَعَ سَبَبًا
85.translation_eng: So he followed a means.
85.transliteration: fa-ʾatbaʿa sababan

86.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا بَلَغَ مَغرِبَ الشَّمسِ وَجَدَها تَغرُبُ في عَينٍ حَمِئَةٍ وَوَجَدَ عِندَها قَومًا ۗ قُلنا يا ذَا القَرنَينِ إِمّا أَن تُعَذِّبَ وَإِمّا أَن تَتَّخِذَ فيهِم حُسنًا
86.translation_eng: When he reached the place where the sun sets, he found it setting in a muddy spring, and by it he found a people. We said, ‘O Dhul Qarnayn! You may either punish them, or treat them with kindness.’
86.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā balagha maghriba sh-shamsi wajadahā taghrubu fī ʿaynin ḥamiʾatin wa-wajada ʿindahā qawman qulnā yā-dhā l-qarnayni ʾimmā ʾan tuʿadhdhiba wa-ʾimmā ʾan tattakhidha fīhim ḥusnan

87.content: قالَ أَمّا مَن ظَلَمَ فَسَوفَ نُعَذِّبُهُ ثُمَّ يُرَدُّ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِ فَيُعَذِّبُهُ عَذابًا نُكرًا
87.translation_eng: He said, ‘As for him who is a wrongdoer, we will punish him. Then he shall be returned to his Lord and He will punish him with a dire punishment.
87.transliteration: qāla ʾammā man ẓalama fa-sawfa nuʿadhdhibuhū thumma yuraddu ʾilā rabbihī fa-yuʿadhdhibuhū ʿadhāban nukran

88.content: وَأَمّا مَن آمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صالِحًا فَلَهُ جَزاءً الحُسنىٰ ۖ وَسَنَقولُ لَهُ مِن أَمرِنا يُسرًا
88.translation_eng: But as for him who has faith and acts righteously, he shall have the best reward, and we will speak to him gently of our command.’
88.transliteration: wa-ʾammā man ʾāmana wa-ʿamila ṣāliḥan fa-lahū jazāʾan-i l-ḥusnā wa-sa-naqūlu lahū min ʾamrinā yusran

89.content: ثُمَّ أَتبَعَ سَبَبًا
89.translation_eng: Then he followed a means.
89.transliteration: thumma ʾatbaʿa sababan

90.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا بَلَغَ مَطلِعَ الشَّمسِ وَجَدَها تَطلُعُ عَلىٰ قَومٍ لَم نَجعَل لَهُم مِن دونِها سِترًا
90.translation_eng: When he reached the place where the sun rises, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not provided any shield against it.
90.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā balagha maṭliʿa sh-shamsi wajadahā taṭluʿu ʿalā qawmin lam najʿal lahum min dūnihā sitran

91.content: كَذٰلِكَ وَقَد أَحَطنا بِما لَدَيهِ خُبرًا
91.translation_eng: So it was, and We comprehended whatever pertained to him.
91.transliteration: ka-dhālika wa-qad ʾaḥaṭnā bi-mā ladayhi khubran

92.content: ثُمَّ أَتبَعَ سَبَبًا
92.translation_eng: Then he followed a means.
92.transliteration: thumma ʾatbaʿa sababan

93.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا بَلَغَ بَينَ السَّدَّينِ وَجَدَ مِن دونِهِما قَومًا لا يَكادونَ يَفقَهونَ قَولًا
93.translation_eng: When he reached [the place] between the two barriers, he found between them a people who could hardly understand a word.
93.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā balagha bayna s-saddayni wajada min dūnihimā qawman lā yakādūna yafqahūna qawlan

94.content: قالوا يا ذَا القَرنَينِ إِنَّ يَأجوجَ وَمَأجوجَ مُفسِدونَ فِي الأَرضِ فَهَل نَجعَلُ لَكَ خَرجًا عَلىٰ أَن تَجعَلَ بَينَنا وَبَينَهُم سَدًّا
94.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Dhul Qarnayn! Indeed Gog and Magog are causing corruption in the land. Shall we pay you a tribute on condition that you build a barrier between them and us?’
94.transliteration: qālū yā-dhā l-qarnayni ʾinna yaʾjūja wa-maʾjūja mufsidūna fī l-ʾarḍi fa-hal najʿalu laka kharjan ʿalā ʾan tajʿala baynanā wa-baynahum saddan

95.content: قالَ ما مَكَّنّي فيهِ رَبّي خَيرٌ فَأَعينوني بِقُوَّةٍ أَجعَل بَينَكُم وَبَينَهُم رَدمًا
95.translation_eng: He said, ‘What my Lord has furnished me is better. Yet help me with some power, and I will make a bulwark between you and them.
95.transliteration: qāla mā makkannī fīhi rabbī khayrun fa-ʾaʿīnūnī bi-quwwatin ʾajʿal baynakum wa-baynahum radman

96.content: آتوني زُبَرَ الحَديدِ ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذا ساوىٰ بَينَ الصَّدَفَينِ قالَ انفُخوا ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذا جَعَلَهُ نارًا قالَ آتوني أُفرِغ عَلَيهِ قِطرًا
96.translation_eng: Bring me pieces of iron!’ When he had levelled up between the flanks, he said, ‘Blow!’ When he had turned it into fire, he said, ‘Bring me molten copper to pour over it.’
96.transliteration: ʾātūnī zubara l-ḥadīdi ḥattā ʾidhā sāwā bayna ṣ-ṣadafayni qāla nfukhū ḥattā ʾidhā jaʿalahū nāran qāla ʾātūnī ʾufrigh ʿalayhi qiṭran

97.content: فَمَا اسطاعوا أَن يَظهَروهُ وَمَا استَطاعوا لَهُ نَقبًا
97.translation_eng: So they could neither scale it, nor could they make a hole in it.
97.transliteration: fa-mā sṭāʿū ʾan yaẓharūhu wa-mā staṭāʿū lahū naqban

98.content: قالَ هٰذا رَحمَةٌ مِن رَبّي ۖ فَإِذا جاءَ وَعدُ رَبّي جَعَلَهُ دَكّاءَ ۖ وَكانَ وَعدُ رَبّي حَقًّا
98.translation_eng: He said, ‘This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord is fulfilled, He will level it;1 and my Lord’s promise is true.’Or, ‘He will make it crumble.’
98.transliteration: qāla hādhā raḥmatun min rabbī fa-ʾidhā jāʾa waʿdu rabbī jaʿalahū dakkāʾa wa-kāna waʿdu rabbī ḥaqqan

99.content: ۞ وَتَرَكنا بَعضَهُم يَومَئِذٍ يَموجُ في بَعضٍ ۖ وَنُفِخَ فِي الصّورِ فَجَمَعناهُم جَمعًا
99.translation_eng: That day We shall let them surge over one another, and the Trumpet will be blown, and We shall gather them all,
99.transliteration: wa-taraknā baʿḍahum yawmaʾidhin yamūju fī baʿḍin wa-nufikha fī ṣ-ṣūri fa-jamaʿnāhum jamʿan

100.translation_eng: and that day We shall bring hell into view visibly for the faithless.

101.content: الَّذينَ كانَت أَعيُنُهُم في غِطاءٍ عَن ذِكري وَكانوا لا يَستَطيعونَ سَمعًا
101.translation_eng: —Those whose eyes were blindfolded to My remembrance and who could not hear.
101.transliteration: alladhīna kānat ʾaʿyunuhum fī ghiṭāʾin ʿan dhikrī wa-kānū lā yastaṭīʿūna samʿan

102.content: أَفَحَسِبَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَن يَتَّخِذوا عِبادي مِن دوني أَولِياءَ ۚ إِنّا أَعتَدنا جَهَنَّمَ لِلكافِرينَ نُزُلًا
102.translation_eng: Do the faithless suppose that they have taken My servants for guardians in My stead? Indeed We have prepared hell for the hospitality of the faithless.
102.transliteration: ʾa-fa-ḥasiba lladhīna kafarū ʾan yattakhidhū ʿibādī min dūnī ʾawliyāʾa ʾinnā ʾaʿtadnā jahannama li-l-kāfirīna nuzulan

103.translation_eng: Say, ‘Shall we inform you about the biggest losers in regard to works?

104.content: الَّذينَ ضَلَّ سَعيُهُم فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا وَهُم يَحسَبونَ أَنَّهُم يُحسِنونَ صُنعًا
104.translation_eng: Those whose endeavour goes awry in the life of the world, while they suppose they are doing good.’
104.transliteration: alladhīna ḍalla saʿyuhum fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-hum yaḥsabūna ʾannahum yuḥsinūna ṣunʿan

105.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِآياتِ رَبِّهِم وَلِقائِهِ فَحَبِطَت أَعمالُهُم فَلا نُقيمُ لَهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ وَزنًا
105.translation_eng: They are the ones who deny the signs of their Lord and the encounter with Him. So their works have failed. On the Day of Resurrection We will not set for them any weight.
105.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna kafarū bi-ʾāyāti rabbihim wa-liqāʾihī fa-ḥabiṭat ʾaʿmāluhum fa-lā nuqīmu lahum yawma l-qiyāmati waznan

106.content: ذٰلِكَ جَزاؤُهُم جَهَنَّمُ بِما كَفَروا وَاتَّخَذوا آياتي وَرُسُلي هُزُوًا
106.translation_eng: That is their requital—hell— because of their faithlessness and taking My signs and My apostles in derision.
106.transliteration: dhālika jazāʾuhum jahannamu bi-mā kafarū wa-ttakhadhū ʾāyātī wa-rusulī huzuwan

107.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ كانَت لَهُم جَنّاتُ الفِردَوسِ نُزُلًا
107.translation_eng: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds they shall have the gardens of Firdaws1 for abode,2Said to be the highest and choicest part of paradise. See Ṭabarī, Baḥrānī and Qummī.Or ‘hospitality.’
107.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti kānat lahum jannātu l-firdawsi nuzulan

108.content: خالِدينَ فيها لا يَبغونَ عَنها حِوَلًا
108.translation_eng: to remain [forever]in them, from where they will not seek to shift.
108.transliteration: khālidīna fīhā lā yabghūna ʿanhā ḥiwalan

109.content: قُل لَو كانَ البَحرُ مِدادًا لِكَلِماتِ رَبّي لَنَفِدَ البَحرُ قَبلَ أَن تَنفَدَ كَلِماتُ رَبّي وَلَو جِئنا بِمِثلِهِ مَدَدًا
109.translation_eng: Say, ‘If the sea were ink for the words of my Lord, the sea would be spent before the words of my Lord are spent, though We brought another like it for replenishment.’
109.transliteration: qul law kāna l-baḥru midādan li-kalimāti rabbī la-nafida l-baḥru qabla ʾan tanfada kalimātu rabbī wa-law jiʾnā bi-mithlihī madadan

110.content: قُل إِنَّما أَنا بَشَرٌ مِثلُكُم يوحىٰ إِلَيَّ أَنَّما إِلٰهُكُم إِلٰهٌ واحِدٌ ۖ فَمَن كانَ يَرجو لِقاءَ رَبِّهِ فَليَعمَل عَمَلًا صالِحًا وَلا يُشرِك بِعِبادَةِ رَبِّهِ أَحَدًا
110.translation_eng: Say, ‘I am just a human being like you. It has been revealed to me that your God is the One God. So whoever expects to encounter his Lord —let him act righteously, and not associate anyone with the worship of his Lord.’
110.transliteration: qul ʾinnamā ʾana basharun mithlukum yūḥā ʾilayya ʾannamā ʾilāhukum ʾilāhun wāḥidun fa-man kāna yarjū liqāʾa rabbihī fa-l-yaʿmal ʿamalan ṣāliḥan wa-lā yushrik bi-ʿibādati rabbihī ʾaḥadan

19.description: The surah that mentions the miracle-filled story of Mary and how, though an untouched virgin, she gave birth to Jesus, the true Messiah and a human messenger of God to the Children of Israel. It takes its names from the story of Mary told in verse 16 . It recounts the grace given by God to a number of prophets and tells aspects of their stories. The claim that Jesus is the son of God is firmly denied, as is the assertion of the pagans of Mecca that the angels are God’s daughters. From verse 66 . the surah discusses the arrogant assertions of the disbelievers of Mecca. The Prophet is told that God’s punishment is coming to them and exhorted not to be impatient for it to arrive or to receive the revelation (verse 64).

1.translation_eng: Kāf, Hā, Yā, ʿAyn, Ṣād.

2.translation_eng: [This is] an account1 of your Lord’s mercy on His servant, Zechariah,Or ‘a mention,’ ‘a reminder,’ or ‘a recollection.’

3.content: إِذ نادىٰ رَبَّهُ نِداءً خَفِيًّا
3.translation_eng: when he called out to his Lord with a secret cry.
