3.transliteration: ʾidh nādā rabbahū nidāʾan khafiyyan

4.content: قالَ رَبِّ إِنّي وَهَنَ العَظمُ مِنّي وَاشتَعَلَ الرَّأسُ شَيبًا وَلَم أَكُن بِدُعائِكَ رَبِّ شَقِيًّا
4.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! Indeed my bones have become feeble, and my head has turned white with age, yet never have I, my Lord, been disappointed in supplicating You!
4.transliteration: qāla rabbi ʾinnī wahana l-ʿaẓmu minnī wa-shtaʿala r-raʾsu shayban wa-lam ʾakun bi-duʿāʾika rabbi shaqiyyan

5.content: وَإِنّي خِفتُ المَوالِيَ مِن وَرائي وَكانَتِ امرَأَتي عاقِرًا فَهَب لي مِن لَدُنكَ وَلِيًّا
5.translation_eng: Indeed I fear my kinsmen, after me, and my wife is barren. So grant me from Yourself an heir
5.transliteration: wa-ʾinnī khiftu l-mawāliya min warāʾī wa-kānati mraʾatī ʿāqiran fa-hab lī min ladunka waliyyan

6.content: يَرِثُني وَيَرِثُ مِن آلِ يَعقوبَ ۖ وَاجعَلهُ رَبِّ رَضِيًّا
6.translation_eng: who may inherit from me and inherit from the House of Jacob, and make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]!’
6.transliteration: yarithunī wa-yarithu min ʾāli yaʿqūba wa-jʿalhu rabbi raḍiyyan

7.content: يا زَكَرِيّا إِنّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلامٍ اسمُهُ يَحيىٰ لَم نَجعَل لَهُ مِن قَبلُ سَمِيًّا
7.translation_eng: ‘O Zechariah! Indeed We give you the good news of a son, whose name is “John.” Never before have We made anyone his namesake.’
7.transliteration: yā-zakariyyā ʾinnā nubashshiruka bi-ghulāmin-i smuhū yaḥyā lam najʿal lahū min qablu samiyyan

8.content: قالَ رَبِّ أَنّىٰ يَكونُ لي غُلامٌ وَكانَتِ امرَأَتي عاقِرًا وَقَد بَلَغتُ مِنَ الكِبَرِ عِتِيًّا
8.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! How shall I have a son, when my wife is barren, and I am already advanced in age?’
8.transliteration: qāla rabbi ʾannā yakūnu lī ghulāmun wa-kānati mraʾatī ʿāqiran wa-qad balaghtu mina l-kibari ʿitiyyan

9.content: قالَ كَذٰلِكَ قالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٌ وَقَد خَلَقتُكَ مِن قَبلُ وَلَم تَكُ شَيئًا
9.translation_eng: He said, ‘So shall it be. Your Lord has said, “It is simple for Me.” Certainly I created you before when you were nothing.’
9.transliteration: qāla ka-dhālika qāla rabbuka huwa ʿalayya hayyinun wa-qad khalaqtuka min qablu wa-lam taku shayʾan

10.content: قالَ رَبِّ اجعَل لي آيَةً ۚ قالَ آيَتُكَ أَلّا تُكَلِّمَ النّاسَ ثَلاثَ لَيالٍ سَوِيًّا
10.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! Appoint a sign for me.’ He said, ‘Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three complete nights.’
10.transliteration: qāla rabbi jʿal lī ʾāyatan qāla ʾāyatuka ʾallā tukallima n-nāsa thalātha layālin sawiyyan

11.content: فَخَرَجَ عَلىٰ قَومِهِ مِنَ المِحرابِ فَأَوحىٰ إِلَيهِم أَن سَبِّحوا بُكرَةً وَعَشِيًّا
11.translation_eng: So he emerged before his people from the Temple, and signaled to them that they should glorify [Allah] morning and evening.
11.transliteration: fa-kharaja ʿalā qawmihī mina l-miḥrābi fa-ʾawḥā ʾilayhim ʾan sabbiḥū bukratan wa-ʿashiyyan

12.content: يا يَحيىٰ خُذِ الكِتابَ بِقُوَّةٍ ۖ وَآتَيناهُ الحُكمَ صَبِيًّا
12.translation_eng: ‘O John!’ [We said,] ‘Hold on with power to the Book!’ And We gave him judgement while still a child,
12.transliteration: yā-yaḥyā khudhi l-kitāba bi-quwwatin wa-ʾātaynāhu l-ḥukma ṣabiyyan

13.content: وَحَنانًا مِن لَدُنّا وَزَكاةً ۖ وَكانَ تَقِيًّا
13.translation_eng: and a compassion and purity from Us. He was Godwary,
13.transliteration: wa-ḥanānan min ladunnā wa-zakātan wa-kāna taqiyyan

14.content: وَبَرًّا بِوالِدَيهِ وَلَم يَكُن جَبّارًا عَصِيًّا
14.translation_eng: and good to his parents, and was not self-willed or disobedient.
14.transliteration: wa-barran bi-wālidayhi wa-lam yakun jabbāran ʿaṣiyyan

15.content: وَسَلامٌ عَلَيهِ يَومَ وُلِدَ وَيَومَ يَموتُ وَيَومَ يُبعَثُ حَيًّا
15.translation_eng: Peace be to him, the day he was born, and the day he dies, and the day he is raised alive!
15.transliteration: wa-salāmun ʿalayhi yawma wulida wa-yawma yamūtu wa-yawma yubʿathu ḥayyan

16.content: وَاذكُر فِي الكِتابِ مَريَمَ إِذِ انتَبَذَت مِن أَهلِها مَكانًا شَرقِيًّا
16.translation_eng: And mention in the Book Mary, when she withdrew from her family to an easterly place.
16.transliteration: wa-dhkur fī l-kitābi maryama ʾidhi ntabadhat min ʾahlihā makānan sharqiyyan

17.content: فَاتَّخَذَت مِن دونِهِم حِجابًا فَأَرسَلنا إِلَيها روحَنا فَتَمَثَّلَ لَها بَشَرًا سَوِيًّا
17.translation_eng: Thus did she seclude herself from them, whereupon We sent to her Our Spirit1 and he became incarnate for her as a well-proportioned human.That is, Gabriel (ʿa).
17.transliteration: fa-ttakhadhat min dūnihim ḥijāban fa-ʾarsalnā ʾilayhā rūḥanā fa-tamaththala lahā basharan sawiyyan

18.content: قالَت إِنّي أَعوذُ بِالرَّحمٰنِ مِنكَ إِن كُنتَ تَقِيًّا
18.translation_eng: She said, ‘I seek the protection of the All-beneficent from you, should you be Godwary!’
18.transliteration: qālat ʾinnī ʾaʿūdhu bi-r-raḥmāni minka ʾin kunta taqiyyan

19.content: قالَ إِنَّما أَنا رَسولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلامًا زَكِيًّا
19.translation_eng: He said, ‘I am only a messenger of your Lord that I may give you a pure son.’
19.transliteration: qāla ʾinnamā ʾana rasūlu rabbiki li-ʾahaba laki ghulāman zakiyyan

20.content: قالَت أَنّىٰ يَكونُ لي غُلامٌ وَلَم يَمسَسني بَشَرٌ وَلَم أَكُ بَغِيًّا
20.translation_eng: She said, ‘How shall I have a child seeing that no human being has ever touched me, nor have I been unchaste?’
20.transliteration: qālat ʾannā yakūnu lī ghulāmun wa-lam yamsasnī basharun wa-lam ʾaku baghiyyan

21.content: قالَ كَذٰلِكِ قالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَيَّ هَيِّنٌ ۖ وَلِنَجعَلَهُ آيَةً لِلنّاسِ وَرَحمَةً مِنّا ۚ وَكانَ أَمرًا مَقضِيًّا
21.translation_eng: He said, ‘So shall it be. Your Lord says, “It is simple for Me.” And so that We may make him a sign for mankind and a mercy from Us, and it is a matter [already] decided.’
21.transliteration: qāla ka-dhāliki qāla rabbuki huwa ʿalayya hayyinun wa-li-najʿalahū ʾāyatan li-n-nāsi wa-raḥmatan minnā wa-kāna ʾamran maqḍiyyan

22.content: ۞ فَحَمَلَتهُ فَانتَبَذَت بِهِ مَكانًا قَصِيًّا
22.translation_eng: Thus she conceived him, then withdrew with him to a distant place.
22.transliteration: fa-ḥamalathu fa-ntabadhat bihī makānan qaṣiyyan

23.content: فَأَجاءَهَا المَخاضُ إِلىٰ جِذعِ النَّخلَةِ قالَت يا لَيتَني مِتُّ قَبلَ هٰذا وَكُنتُ نَسيًا مَنسِيًّا
23.translation_eng: The birth pangs brought her to the trunk of a date palm. She said, ‘I wish I had died before this and become a forgotten thing, beyond recall.’
23.transliteration: fa-ʾajāʾahā l-makhāḍu ʾilā jidhʿi n-nakhlati qālat yā-laytanī mittu qabla hādhā wa-kuntu nasyan mansiyyan

24.content: فَناداها مِن تَحتِها أَلّا تَحزَني قَد جَعَلَ رَبُّكِ تَحتَكِ سَرِيًّا
24.translation_eng: Thereupon he1 called her from below her [saying,] ‘Do not grieve! Your Lord has made a spring to flow at your feet.That is, the angel Gabriel, or the baby Jesus, whom she was carrying in her belly.
24.transliteration: fa-nādāhā min taḥtihā ʾallā taḥzanī qad jaʿala rabbuki taḥtaki sariyyan

25.content: وَهُزّي إِلَيكِ بِجِذعِ النَّخلَةِ تُساقِط عَلَيكِ رُطَبًا جَنِيًّا
25.translation_eng: Shake the trunk of the palm tree, freshly picked dates will drop upon you.
25.transliteration: wa-huzzī ʾilayki bi-jidhʿi n-nakhlati tusāqiṭ ʿalayki ruṭaban janiyyan

26.content: فَكُلي وَاشرَبي وَقَرّي عَينًا ۖ فَإِمّا تَرَيِنَّ مِنَ البَشَرِ أَحَدًا فَقولي إِنّي نَذَرتُ لِلرَّحمٰنِ صَومًا فَلَن أُكَلِّمَ اليَومَ إِنسِيًّا
26.translation_eng: Eat, drink, and be comforted. Then if you see any human, say, “Indeed I have vowed a fast to the All-beneficent, so I will not speak to any human today.” ’
26.transliteration: fa-kulī wa-shrabī wa-qarrī ʿaynan fa-ʾimmā tarayinna mina l-bashari ʾaḥadan fa-qūlī ʾinnī nadhartu li-r-raḥmāni ṣawman fa-lan ʾukallima l-yawma ʾinsiyyan

27.content: فَأَتَت بِهِ قَومَها تَحمِلُهُ ۖ قالوا يا مَريَمُ لَقَد جِئتِ شَيئًا فَرِيًّا
27.translation_eng: Then carrying him she brought him to her people. They said, ‘O Mary, you have certainly come up with an odd thing!
27.transliteration: fa-ʾatat bihī qawmahā taḥmiluhū qālū yā-maryamu la-qad jiʾti shayʾan fariyyan

28.content: يا أُختَ هارونَ ما كانَ أَبوكِ امرَأَ سَوءٍ وَما كانَت أُمُّكِ بَغِيًّا
28.translation_eng: O sister of Aaron[’s lineage]! Your father was not an evil man, nor was your mother unchaste.’
28.transliteration: yā-ʾukhta hārūna mā kāna ʾabūki mraʾa sawʾin wa-mā kānat ʾummuki baghiyyan

29.content: فَأَشارَت إِلَيهِ ۖ قالوا كَيفَ نُكَلِّمُ مَن كانَ فِي المَهدِ صَبِيًّا
29.translation_eng: Thereat she pointed to him. They said, ‘How can we speak to one who is yet a baby in the cradle?’
29.transliteration: fa-ʾashārat ʾilayhi qālū kayfa nukallimu man kāna fī l-mahdi ṣabiyyan

30.content: قالَ إِنّي عَبدُ اللَّهِ آتانِيَ الكِتابَ وَجَعَلَني نَبِيًّا
30.translation_eng: He said, ‘Indeed I am a servant of Allah! He has given me the Book and made me a prophet.
30.transliteration: qāla ʾinnī ʿabdu llāhi ʾātāniya l-kitāba wa-jaʿalanī nabiyyan

31.content: وَجَعَلَني مُبارَكًا أَينَ ما كُنتُ وَأَوصاني بِالصَّلاةِ وَالزَّكاةِ ما دُمتُ حَيًّا
31.translation_eng: He has made me blessed, wherever I may be, and He has enjoined me to [maintain] the prayer and to [pay] the zakāt as long as I live,
31.transliteration: wa-jaʿalanī mubārakan ʾayna mā kuntu wa-ʾawṣānī bi-ṣ-ṣalāti wa-z-zakāti mā dumtu ḥayyan

32.content: وَبَرًّا بِوالِدَتي وَلَم يَجعَلني جَبّارًا شَقِيًّا
32.translation_eng: and to be good to my mother, and He has not made me self-willed and wretched.
32.transliteration: wa-barran bi-wālidatī wa-lam yajʿalnī jabbāran shaqiyyan

33.content: وَالسَّلامُ عَلَيَّ يَومَ وُلِدتُ وَيَومَ أَموتُ وَيَومَ أُبعَثُ حَيًّا
33.translation_eng: Peace is to me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I am raised alive.’
33.transliteration: wa-s-salāmu ʿalayya yawma wulidtu wa-yawma ʾamūtu wa-yawma ʾubʿathu ḥayyan

34.content: ذٰلِكَ عيسَى ابنُ مَريَمَ ۚ قَولَ الحَقِّ الَّذي فيهِ يَمتَرونَ
34.translation_eng: That is Jesus, son of Mary, a Word of the Real concerning whom they are in doubt.
34.transliteration: dhālika ʿīsā bnu maryama qawla l-ḥaqqi lladhī fīhi yamtarūna

35.content: ما كانَ لِلَّهِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ مِن وَلَدٍ ۖ سُبحانَهُ ۚ إِذا قَضىٰ أَمرًا فَإِنَّما يَقولُ لَهُ كُن فَيَكونُ
35.translation_eng: It is not for Allah to take a son. Immaculate is He! When He decides on a matter, He just says to it, ‘Be!’ and it is.
35.transliteration: mā kāna li-llāhi ʾan yattakhidha min waladin subḥānahū ʾidhā qaḍā ʾamran fa-ʾinnamā yaqūlu lahū kun fa-yakūnu

36.content: وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ رَبّي وَرَبُّكُم فَاعبُدوهُ ۚ هٰذا صِراطٌ مُستَقيمٌ
36.translation_eng: ‘Indeed Allah is my Lord and your Lord. So worship Him. This is a straight path.’
36.transliteration: wa-ʾinna llāha rabbī wa-rabbukum fa-ʿbudūhu hādhā ṣirāṭun mustaqīmun

37.content: فَاختَلَفَ الأَحزابُ مِن بَينِهِم ۖ فَوَيلٌ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن مَشهَدِ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
37.translation_eng: But the factions differed among themselves. So woe to the faithless at the scene of a tremendous day.
37.transliteration: fa-khtalafa l-ʾaḥzābu min baynihim fa-waylun li-lladhīna kafarū min mashhadi yawmin ʿaẓīmin

38.content: أَسمِع بِهِم وَأَبصِر يَومَ يَأتونَنا ۖ لٰكِنِ الظّالِمونَ اليَومَ في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
38.translation_eng: How well they will hear and how well they will see on the day when they come to Us! But today the wrongdoers are in manifest error.
38.transliteration: ʾasmiʿ bihim wa-ʾabṣir yawma yaʾtūnanā lākini ẓ-ẓālimūna l-yawma fī ḍalālin mubīnin

39.content: وَأَنذِرهُم يَومَ الحَسرَةِ إِذ قُضِيَ الأَمرُ وَهُم في غَفلَةٍ وَهُم لا يُؤمِنونَ
39.translation_eng: Warn them of the Day of Regret,1 when the matter will be decided, while they are [yet] heedless and do not have faith.Another name for the Day of Judgement.
39.transliteration: wa-ʾandhirhum yawma l-ḥasrati ʾidh quḍiya l-ʾamru wa-hum fī ghaflatin wa-hum lā yuʾminūna

40.content: إِنّا نَحنُ نَرِثُ الأَرضَ وَمَن عَلَيها وَإِلَينا يُرجَعونَ
40.translation_eng: Indeed We shall inherit the earth and whoever there is on it, and to Us they shall be brought back.
40.transliteration: ʾinnā naḥnu narithu l-ʾarḍa wa-man ʿalayhā wa-ʾilaynā yurjaʿūna

41.content: وَاذكُر فِي الكِتابِ إِبراهيمَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ صِدّيقًا نَبِيًّا
41.translation_eng: And mention in the Book Abraham. Indeed he was a truthful one, a prophet.
41.transliteration: wa-dhkur fī l-kitābi ʾibrāhīma ʾinnahū kāna ṣiddīqan nabiyyan

42.content: إِذ قالَ لِأَبيهِ يا أَبَتِ لِمَ تَعبُدُ ما لا يَسمَعُ وَلا يُبصِرُ وَلا يُغني عَنكَ شَيئًا
42.translation_eng: When he said to his father, ‘Father! Why do you worship that which neither hears nor sees, and is of no avail to you in any way?
42.transliteration: ʾidh qāla li-ʾabīhi yā-ʾabati li-ma taʿbudu mā lā yasmaʿu wa-lā yubṣiru wa-lā yughnī ʿanka shayʾan

43.content: يا أَبَتِ إِنّي قَد جاءَني مِنَ العِلمِ ما لَم يَأتِكَ فَاتَّبِعني أَهدِكَ صِراطًا سَوِيًّا
43.translation_eng: Father! Indeed a knowledge has already come to me which has not come to you. So follow me that I may guide you to a right path.
43.transliteration: yā-ʾabati ʾinnī qad jāʾanī mina l-ʿilmi mā lam yaʾtika fa-ttabiʿnī ʾahdika ṣirāṭan sawiyyan

44.content: يا أَبَتِ لا تَعبُدِ الشَّيطانَ ۖ إِنَّ الشَّيطانَ كانَ لِلرَّحمٰنِ عَصِيًّا
44.translation_eng: Father! Do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan is disobedient to the All-beneficent.
44.transliteration: yā-ʾabati lā taʿbudi sh-shayṭāna ʾinna sh-shayṭāna kāna li-r-raḥmāni ʿaṣiyyan

45.content: يا أَبَتِ إِنّي أَخافُ أَن يَمَسَّكَ عَذابٌ مِنَ الرَّحمٰنِ فَتَكونَ لِلشَّيطانِ وَلِيًّا
45.translation_eng: Father! I am indeed afraid that a punishment from the All-beneficent will befall you, and you will become Satan’s accomplice.’
45.transliteration: yā-ʾabati ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʾan yamassaka ʿadhābun mina r-raḥmāni fa-takūna li-sh-shayṭāni waliyyan

46.content: قالَ أَراغِبٌ أَنتَ عَن آلِهَتي يا إِبراهيمُ ۖ لَئِن لَم تَنتَهِ لَأَرجُمَنَّكَ ۖ وَاهجُرني مَلِيًّا
46.translation_eng: He said, ‘Abraham! Are you renouncing my gods? If you do not relinquish, I will stone you. Keep away from me for a long while.’1That is, ‘Go away. Stop annoying me.’
46.transliteration: qāla ʾa-rāghibun ʾanta ʿan ʾālihatī yā-ʾibrāhīmu la-ʾin lam tantahi la-ʾarjumannaka wa-hjurnī maliyyan

47.content: قالَ سَلامٌ عَلَيكَ ۖ سَأَستَغفِرُ لَكَ رَبّي ۖ إِنَّهُ كانَ بي حَفِيًّا
47.translation_eng: He said, ‘Peace be to you! I shall plead with my Lord to forgive you. Indeed He is gracious to me.
47.transliteration: qāla salāmun ʿalayka sa-ʾastaghfiru laka rabbī ʾinnahū kāna bī ḥafiyyan

48.content: وَأَعتَزِلُكُم وَما تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَأَدعو رَبّي عَسىٰ أَلّا أَكونَ بِدُعاءِ رَبّي شَقِيًّا
48.translation_eng: I dissociate myself from you and whatever you invoke besides Allah. I will supplicate my Lord. Hopefully, I will not be disappointed in supplicating my Lord.’
48.transliteration: wa-ʾaʿtazilukum wa-mā tadʿūna min dūni llāhi wa-ʾadʿū rabbī ʿasā ʾallā ʾakūna bi-duʿāʾi rabbī shaqiyyan

49.content: فَلَمَّا اعتَزَلَهُم وَما يَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَهَبنا لَهُ إِسحاقَ وَيَعقوبَ ۖ وَكُلًّا جَعَلنا نَبِيًّا
49.translation_eng: So when he had left them and what they worshipped besides Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each We made a prophet.
49.transliteration: fa-lammā ʿtazalahum wa-mā yaʿbudūna min dūni llāhi wahabnā lahū ʾisḥāqa wa-yaʿqūba wa-kullan jaʿalnā nabiyyan

50.content: وَوَهَبنا لَهُم مِن رَحمَتِنا وَجَعَلنا لَهُم لِسانَ صِدقٍ عَلِيًّا
50.translation_eng: And We gave them out of Our mercy, and conferred on them a worthy and lofty repute.
50.transliteration: wa-wahabnā lahum min raḥmatinā wa-jaʿalnā lahum lisāna ṣidqin ʿaliyyan

51.content: وَاذكُر فِي الكِتابِ موسىٰ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ مُخلَصًا وَكانَ رَسولًا نَبِيًّا
51.translation_eng: And mention in the Book Moses. Indeed he was exclusively dedicated [to Allah], and an apostle and a prophet.
51.transliteration: wa-dhkur fī l-kitābi mūsā ʾinnahū kāna mukhlaṣan wa-kāna rasūlan nabiyyan

52.content: وَنادَيناهُ مِن جانِبِ الطّورِ الأَيمَنِ وَقَرَّبناهُ نَجِيًّا
52.translation_eng: We called him from the right side of the Mount and We drew him near for confidential discourse.
52.transliteration: wa-nādaynāhu min jānibi ṭ-ṭūri l-ʾaymani wa-qarrabnāhu najiyyan

53.content: وَوَهَبنا لَهُ مِن رَحمَتِنا أَخاهُ هارونَ نَبِيًّا
53.translation_eng: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron, a prophet.
53.transliteration: wa-wahabnā lahū min raḥmatinā ʾakhāhu hārūna nabiyyan

54.content: وَاذكُر فِي الكِتابِ إِسماعيلَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ صادِقَ الوَعدِ وَكانَ رَسولًا نَبِيًّا
54.translation_eng: And mention in the Book Ishmael. Indeed he was true to his promise, and an apostle and a prophet.
54.transliteration: wa-dhkur fī l-kitābi ʾismāʿīla ʾinnahū kāna ṣādiqa l-waʿdi wa-kāna rasūlan nabiyyan

55.content: وَكانَ يَأمُرُ أَهلَهُ بِالصَّلاةِ وَالزَّكاةِ وَكانَ عِندَ رَبِّهِ مَرضِيًّا
55.translation_eng: He used to bid his family to [maintain] the prayer and to [pay] the zakāt, and was pleasing to his Lord.
55.transliteration: wa-kāna yaʾmuru ʾahlahū bi-ṣ-ṣalāti wa-z-zakāti wa-kāna ʿinda rabbihī marḍiyyan

56.content: وَاذكُر فِي الكِتابِ إِدريسَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ صِدّيقًا نَبِيًّا
56.translation_eng: And mention in the Book Idrīs. Indeed he was a truthful one, a prophet,
56.transliteration: wa-dhkur fī l-kitābi ʾidrīsa ʾinnahū kāna ṣiddīqan nabiyyan

57.content: وَرَفَعناهُ مَكانًا عَلِيًّا
57.translation_eng: and We raised him to a station exalted.
57.transliteration: wa-rafaʿnāhu makānan ʿaliyyan

58.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ أَنعَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِم مِنَ النَّبِيّينَ مِن ذُرِّيَّةِ آدَمَ وَمِمَّن حَمَلنا مَعَ نوحٍ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّةِ إِبراهيمَ وَإِسرائيلَ وَمِمَّن هَدَينا وَاجتَبَينا ۚ إِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم آياتُ الرَّحمٰنِ خَرّوا سُجَّدًا وَبُكِيًّا ۩
58.translation_eng: They are the ones whom Allah has blessed from among the prophets of Adam’s progeny, and from [the progeny of] those We carried with Noah, and from among the progeny of Abraham and Israel, and from among those We guided and chose. When the signs of the All-beneficent were recited to them, they would fall down weeping in prostration.
58.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna ʾanʿama llāhu ʿalayhim mina n-nabiyyīna min dhurriyyati ʾādama wa-mimman ḥamalnā maʿa nūḥin wa-min dhurriyyati ʾibrāhīma wa-ʾisrāʾīla wa-mimman hadaynā wa-jtabaynā ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhim ʾāyātu r-raḥmāni kharrū sujjadan wa-bukiyyan

59.content: ۞ فَخَلَفَ مِن بَعدِهِم خَلفٌ أَضاعُوا الصَّلاةَ وَاتَّبَعُوا الشَّهَواتِ ۖ فَسَوفَ يَلقَونَ غَيًّا
59.translation_eng: But they were succeeded by an evil posterity who neglected the prayer, and followed [their base] appetites. So they will soon encounter [the reward of] perversity,
59.transliteration: fa-khalafa min baʿdihim khalfun ʾaḍāʿū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-ttabaʿū sh-shahawāti fa-sawfa yalqawna ghayyan

60.content: إِلّا مَن تابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صالِحًا فَأُولٰئِكَ يَدخُلونَ الجَنَّةَ وَلا يُظلَمونَ شَيئًا
60.translation_eng: barring those who repent, believe, and act righteously. Such will enter paradise, and they will not be wronged in the least.
60.transliteration: ʾillā man tāba wa-ʾāmana wa-ʿamila ṣāliḥan fa-ʾulāʾika yadkhulūna l-jannata wa-lā yuẓlamūna shayʾan

61.content: جَنّاتِ عَدنٍ الَّتي وَعَدَ الرَّحمٰنُ عِبادَهُ بِالغَيبِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ وَعدُهُ مَأتِيًّا
61.translation_eng: Gardens of Eden promised by the All-beneficent to His servants, [while they were still] unseen. Indeed His promise is bound to come to pass.
61.transliteration: jannāti ʿadnin-i llatī waʿada r-raḥmānu ʿibādahū bi-l-ghaybi ʾinnahū kāna waʿduhū maʾtiyyan

62.content: لا يَسمَعونَ فيها لَغوًا إِلّا سَلامًا ۖ وَلَهُم رِزقُهُم فيها بُكرَةً وَعَشِيًّا
62.translation_eng: Therein they will not hear vain talk, but only ‘Peace!’ And therein they will have their provision morning and evening.
62.transliteration: lā yasmaʿūna fīhā laghwan ʾillā salāman wa-lahum rizquhum fīhā bukratan wa-ʿashiyyan

63.content: تِلكَ الجَنَّةُ الَّتي نورِثُ مِن عِبادِنا مَن كانَ تَقِيًّا
63.translation_eng: This is the paradise We will give as inheritance to those of Our servants who are Godwary.
63.transliteration: tilka l-jannatu llatī nūrithu min ʿibādinā man kāna taqiyyan

64.content: وَما نَتَنَزَّلُ إِلّا بِأَمرِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لَهُ ما بَينَ أَيدينا وَما خَلفَنا وَما بَينَ ذٰلِكَ ۚ وَما كانَ رَبُّكَ نَسِيًّا
64.translation_eng: ‘We do not descend except by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs whatever is before us and whatever is behind us and whatever is in between that, and your Lord is not forgetful.
64.transliteration: wa-mā natanazzalu ʾillā bi-ʾamri rabbika lahū mā bayna ʾaydīnā wa-mā khalfanā wa-mā bayna dhālika wa-mā kāna rabbuka nasiyyan

65.content: رَبُّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما فَاعبُدهُ وَاصطَبِر لِعِبادَتِهِ ۚ هَل تَعلَمُ لَهُ سَمِيًّا
65.translation_eng: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them. So worship Him and be steadfast in His worship. Do you know anyone who could be His namesake?’
65.transliteration: rabbu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā baynahumā fa-ʿbudhu wa-ṣṭabir li-ʿibādatihī hal taʿlamu lahū samiyyan

66.content: وَيَقولُ الإِنسانُ أَإِذا ما مِتُّ لَسَوفَ أُخرَجُ حَيًّا
66.translation_eng: Man says, ‘Shall I, when I have died, be brought forth alive?’
66.transliteration: wa-yaqūlu l-ʾinsānu ʾa-ʾidhā mā mittu la-sawfa ʾukhraju ḥayyan

67.content: أَوَلا يَذكُرُ الإِنسانُ أَنّا خَلَقناهُ مِن قَبلُ وَلَم يَكُ شَيئًا
67.translation_eng: Does not man remember that We created him before when he was nothing?
67.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lā yadhkuru l-ʾinsānu ʾannā khalaqnāhu min qablu wa-lam yaku shayʾan

68.content: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَحشُرَنَّهُم وَالشَّياطينَ ثُمَّ لَنُحضِرَنَّهُم حَولَ جَهَنَّمَ جِثِيًّا
68.translation_eng: By your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will surely bring them up around hell [scrambling] on their knees.1Or ‘in groups.’
68.transliteration: fa-wa-rabbika la-naḥshurannahum wa-sh-shayāṭīna thumma la-nuḥḍirannahum ḥawla jahannama jithiyyan

69.content: ثُمَّ لَنَنزِعَنَّ مِن كُلِّ شيعَةٍ أَيُّهُم أَشَدُّ عَلَى الرَّحمٰنِ عِتِيًّا
69.translation_eng: Then from every group We shall draw whichever of them was more defiant to the All-beneficent.
69.transliteration: thumma la-nanziʿanna min kulli shīʿatin ʾayyuhum ʾashaddu ʿalā r-raḥmāni ʿitiyyan

70.content: ثُمَّ لَنَحنُ أَعلَمُ بِالَّذينَ هُم أَولىٰ بِها صِلِيًّا
70.translation_eng: Then surely We will know best those who deserve most to enter it.
70.transliteration: thumma la-naḥnu ʾaʿlamu bi-lladhīna hum ʾawlā bihā ṣiliyyan

71.content: وَإِن مِنكُم إِلّا وارِدُها ۚ كانَ عَلىٰ رَبِّكَ حَتمًا مَقضِيًّا
71.translation_eng: There is none of you but will come to it:1 a [matter that is a] decided certainty with your Lord.That is, they will approach it, without entering it.
71.transliteration: wa-ʾin minkum ʾillā wāriduhā kāna ʿalā rabbika ḥatman maqḍiyyan

72.content: ثُمَّ نُنَجِّي الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا وَنَذَرُ الظّالِمينَ فيها جِثِيًّا
72.translation_eng: Then We will deliver those who are Godwary, and leave the wrongdoers in it, fallen on their knees.
72.transliteration: thumma nunajjī lladhīna ttaqaw wa-nadharu ẓ-ẓālimīna fīhā jithiyyan

73.content: وَإِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم آياتُنا بَيِّناتٍ قالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لِلَّذينَ آمَنوا أَيُّ الفَريقَينِ خَيرٌ مَقامًا وَأَحسَنُ نَدِيًّا
73.translation_eng: When Our manifest signs are recited to them, the faithless say to the faithful, ‘Which of the two sides is superior in station1 and better with respect to company?’2Or ‘superior with respect to dwelling.’Or ‘better with respect to gatherings.’
73.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhim ʾāyātunā bayyinātin qāla lladhīna kafarū li-lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾayyu l-farīqayni khayrun maqāman wa-ʾaḥsanu nadiyyan

74.content: وَكَم أَهلَكنا قَبلَهُم مِن قَرنٍ هُم أَحسَنُ أَثاثًا وَرِئيًا
74.translation_eng: How many a generation We have destroyed before them, who were superior in furnishings and appearance!
74.transliteration: wa-kam ʾahlaknā qablahum min qarnin hum ʾaḥsanu ʾathāthan wa-riʾyan

75.content: قُل مَن كانَ فِي الضَّلالَةِ فَليَمدُد لَهُ الرَّحمٰنُ مَدًّا ۚ حَتّىٰ إِذا رَأَوا ما يوعَدونَ إِمَّا العَذابَ وَإِمَّا السّاعَةَ فَسَيَعلَمونَ مَن هُوَ شَرٌّ مَكانًا وَأَضعَفُ جُندًا
75.translation_eng: Say, ‘Whoever abides in error, the All-beneficent shall prolong his respite until they sight what they have been promised: either punishment, or the Hour.’ Then they will know whose position is worse, and whose host is weaker.
75.transliteration: qul man kāna fī ḍ-ḍalālati fa-l-yamdud lahu r-raḥmānu maddan ḥattā ʾidhā raʾaw mā yūʿadūna ʾimmā l-ʿadhāba wa-ʾimmā s-sāʿata fa-sa-yaʿlamūna man huwa sharrun makānan wa-ʾaḍʿafu jundan

76.content: وَيَزيدُ اللَّهُ الَّذينَ اهتَدَوا هُدًى ۗ وَالباقِياتُ الصّالِحاتُ خَيرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوابًا وَخَيرٌ مَرَدًّا
76.translation_eng: Allah enhances in guidance those who are [rightly] guided, and lasting righteous deeds are better with your Lord in reward, and better at the return [to Allah].
76.transliteration: wa-yazīdu llāhu lladhīna htadaw hudan wa-l-bāqiyātu ṣ-ṣāliḥātu khayrun ʿinda rabbika thawāban wa-khayrun maraddan

77.content: أَفَرَأَيتَ الَّذي كَفَرَ بِآياتِنا وَقالَ لَأوتَيَنَّ مالًا وَوَلَدًا
77.translation_eng: Have you not regarded him who defies Our signs, and says, ‘I will surely be given wealth and children’?
77.transliteration: ʾa-fa-raʾayta lladhī kafara bi-ʾāyātinā wa-qāla la-ʾūtayanna mālan wa-waladan

78.content: أَطَّلَعَ الغَيبَ أَمِ اتَّخَذَ عِندَ الرَّحمٰنِ عَهدًا
78.translation_eng: Has he come to know the Unseen, or taken a promise from the All-beneficent?
78.transliteration: ʾa-ṭṭalaʿa l-ghayba ʾami ttakhadha ʿinda r-raḥmāni ʿahdan

79.content: كَلّا ۚ سَنَكتُبُ ما يَقولُ وَنَمُدُّ لَهُ مِنَ العَذابِ مَدًّا
79.translation_eng: No indeed! We will write down what he says, and We will prolong his punishment endlessly.
79.transliteration: kallā sa-naktubu mā yaqūlu wa-namuddu lahū mina l-ʿadhābi maddan

80.content: وَنَرِثُهُ ما يَقولُ وَيَأتينا فَردًا
80.translation_eng: We shall take over from him what he talks about,1 and he will come to Us alone.That is, ‘He will depart unaccompanied from the world, leaving in Our possession the wealth and children that he talks about.’
80.transliteration: wa-narithuhū mā yaqūlu wa-yaʾtīnā fardan

81.content: وَاتَّخَذوا مِن دونِ اللَّهِ آلِهَةً لِيَكونوا لَهُم عِزًّا
81.translation_eng: They have taken gods besides Allah that they may be a [source of] might to them:
81.transliteration: wa-ttakhadhū min dūni llāhi ʾālihatan li-yakūnū lahum ʿizzan

82.content: كَلّا ۚ سَيَكفُرونَ بِعِبادَتِهِم وَيَكونونَ عَلَيهِم ضِدًّا
82.translation_eng: No Indeed! Soon they will disown their worship, and they will be their opponents.
82.transliteration: kallā sa-yakfurūna bi-ʿibādatihim wa-yakūnūna ʿalayhim ḍiddan

83.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنّا أَرسَلنَا الشَّياطينَ عَلَى الكافِرينَ تَؤُزُّهُم أَزًّا
83.translation_eng: Have you not regarded that We unleash the devils upon the faithless to urge them impetuously?
83.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾannā ʾarsalnā sh-shayāṭīna ʿalā l-kāfirīna taʾuzzuhum ʾazzan

84.content: فَلا تَعجَل عَلَيهِم ۖ إِنَّما نَعُدُّ لَهُم عَدًّا
84.translation_eng: So do not make haste against them; indeed We are counting1 for them, a counting [down].That is, the number of their breaths.
84.transliteration: fa-lā taʿjal ʿalayhim ʾinnamā naʿuddu lahum ʿaddan

85.content: يَومَ نَحشُرُ المُتَّقينَ إِلَى الرَّحمٰنِ وَفدًا
85.translation_eng: The day We shall gather the Godwary toward the All-beneficent, on mounts,1Or ‘as incoming guests.
85.transliteration: yawma naḥshuru l-muttaqīna ʾilā r-raḥmāni wafdan

86.content: وَنَسوقُ المُجرِمينَ إِلىٰ جَهَنَّمَ وِردًا
86.translation_eng: and drive the guilty as a thirsty herd towards hell.
86.transliteration: wa-nasūqu l-mujrimīna ʾilā jahannama wirdan

87.content: لا يَملِكونَ الشَّفاعَةَ إِلّا مَنِ اتَّخَذَ عِندَ الرَّحمٰنِ عَهدًا
87.translation_eng: No one will have the power to intercede [with Allah], except for him who has taken a covenant with the All-beneficent.
87.transliteration: lā yamlikūna sh-shafāʿata ʾillā mani ttakhadha ʿinda r-raḥmāni ʿahdan

88.content: وَقالُوا اتَّخَذَ الرَّحمٰنُ وَلَدًا
88.translation_eng: They say, ‘The All-beneficent has taken a son!’
88.transliteration: wa-qālū ttakhadha r-raḥmānu waladan

89.content: لَقَد جِئتُم شَيئًا إِدًّا
89.translation_eng: You have certainly advanced something hideous!
89.transliteration: la-qad jiʾtum shayʾan ʾiddan

90.content: تَكادُ السَّماواتُ يَتَفَطَّرنَ مِنهُ وَتَنشَقُّ الأَرضُ وَتَخِرُّ الجِبالُ هَدًّا
90.translation_eng: The heavens are about to be rent apart at it, the earth to split open, and the mountains to collapse into bits,
90.transliteration: takādu s-samāwātu yatafaṭṭarna minhu wa-tanshaqqu l-ʾarḍu wa-takhirru l-jibālu haddan

91.content: أَن دَعَوا لِلرَّحمٰنِ وَلَدًا
91.translation_eng: that they should ascribe a son to the All-beneficent!
91.transliteration: ʾan daʿaw li-r-raḥmāni waladan

92.content: وَما يَنبَغي لِلرَّحمٰنِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا
92.translation_eng: It does not behoove the All-beneficent to take a son.
92.transliteration: wa-mā yanbaghī li-r-raḥmāni ʾan yattakhidha waladan

93.content: إِن كُلُّ مَن فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ إِلّا آتِي الرَّحمٰنِ عَبدًا
93.translation_eng: There is none in the heavens and the earth but he comes to the All-beneficent as a servant.
93.transliteration: ʾin kullu man fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾillā ʾātī r-raḥmāni ʿabdan

94.content: لَقَد أَحصاهُم وَعَدَّهُم عَدًّا
94.translation_eng: Certainly He has counted them [all] and numbered them precisely,
94.transliteration: la-qad ʾaḥṣāhum wa-ʿaddahum ʿaddan

95.content: وَكُلُّهُم آتيهِ يَومَ القِيامَةِ فَردًا
95.translation_eng: and each of them will come to Him alone on the Day of Resurrection.
95.transliteration: wa-kulluhum ʾātīhi yawma l-qiyāmati fardan

96.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ سَيَجعَلُ لَهُمُ الرَّحمٰنُ وُدًّا
96.translation_eng: Indeed those who have faith and do righteous deeds —the All-beneficent will endear them [to His creation].
96.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti sa-yajʿalu lahumu r-raḥmānu wuddan

97.content: فَإِنَّما يَسَّرناهُ بِلِسانِكَ لِتُبَشِّرَ بِهِ المُتَّقينَ وَتُنذِرَ بِهِ قَومًا لُدًّا
97.translation_eng: Indeed We have made it simple in your language so that you may give good news thereby to the Godwary and warn with it a disputatious lot.
97.transliteration: fa-ʾinnamā yassarnāhu bi-lisānika li-tubashshira bihi l-muttaqīna wa-tundhira bihī qawman luddan

98.content: وَكَم أَهلَكنا قَبلَهُم مِن قَرنٍ هَل تُحِسُّ مِنهُم مِن أَحَدٍ أَو تَسمَعُ لَهُم رِكزًا
98.translation_eng: How many a generation We have destroyed before them! Can you descry any one of them, or hear from them so much as a murmur?
98.transliteration: wa-kam ʾahlaknā qablahum min qarnin hal tuḥissu minhum min ʾaḥadin ʾaw tasmaʿu lahum rikzan

20.description: The surah that opens with the discrete Arabic letters Ṭā Hā. Like “Yā Sīn” (surah 36), “Ṭā Hā” is said to be one of the names of the Prophet Muḥammad. The surah both begins and ends with mention of the Quran: it was not sent to the Prophet to cause him grief but is a clear proof from his Lord. The example of Moses is given as a lengthy account in order to encourage the Prophet and show the end of the disbelievers. The destruction of earlier generations is cited as a lesson from which the disbelievers should learn. The Prophet is ordered to be patient and to persevere with his worship.The surah is also known as: Ta-Ha, Taa Haa.

1.translation_eng: Ṭā Hā!1Like Yā Sīn, Ṭā Hā is said to be one of the names of the Prophet (ṣ). Maʿānī al-akhbār, p. 22.

2.translation_eng: We did not send down to you the Qurʾān that you should be miserable,

3.content: إِلّا تَذكِرَةً لِمَن يَخشىٰ
3.translation_eng: but only as an admonition to him who fears [his Lord].
3.transliteration: ʾillā tadhkiratan li-man yakhshā

4.content: تَنزيلًا مِمَّن خَلَقَ الأَرضَ وَالسَّماواتِ العُلَى
4.translation_eng: A sending down [of the Revelation] from Him who created the earth and the lofty heavens
4.transliteration: tanzīlan mimman khalaqa l-ʾarḍa wa-s-samāwāti l-ʿulā

5.content: الرَّحمٰنُ عَلَى العَرشِ استَوىٰ
5.translation_eng: —the All-beneficent, settled on the Throne.
5.transliteration: ar-raḥmānu ʿalā l-ʿarshi stawā

6.content: لَهُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما وَما تَحتَ الثَّرىٰ
6.translation_eng: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and whatever is between them, and whatever is under the ground.
6.transliteration: lahū mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi wa-mā baynahumā wa-mā taḥta th-tharā

7.content: وَإِن تَجهَر بِالقَولِ فَإِنَّهُ يَعلَمُ السِّرَّ وَأَخفَى
7.translation_eng: Whether you speak loudly [or in secret tones] He indeed knows the secret and what is still more hidden.
7.transliteration: wa-ʾin tajhar bi-l-qawli fa-ʾinnahū yaʿlamu s-sirra wa-ʾakhfā

8.content: اللَّهُ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ ۖ لَهُ الأَسماءُ الحُسنىٰ
8.translation_eng: Allah—there is no god except Him— to Him belong the Best Names.
8.transliteration: allāhu lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa lahu l-ʾasmāʾu l-ḥusnā

9.content: وَهَل أَتاكَ حَديثُ موسىٰ
9.translation_eng: Did the story of Moses come to you,
9.transliteration: wa-hal ʾatāka ḥadīthu mūsā

10.content: إِذ رَأىٰ نارًا فَقالَ لِأَهلِهِ امكُثوا إِنّي آنَستُ نارًا لَعَلّي آتيكُم مِنها بِقَبَسٍ أَو أَجِدُ عَلَى النّارِ هُدًى
10.translation_eng: when he sighted a fire, and said to his family, ‘Wait! Indeed I descry a fire! Maybe I will bring you a brand from it, or find some guidance at the fire.’
10.transliteration: ʾidh raʾā nāran fa-qāla li-ʾahlihi mkuthū ʾinnī ʾānastu nāran laʿallī ʾātīkum minhā bi-qabasin ʾaw ʾajidu ʿalā n-nāri hudan

11.content: فَلَمّا أَتاها نودِيَ يا موسىٰ
11.translation_eng: So when he came to it, he was called, ‘O Moses!
11.transliteration: fa-lammā ʾatāhā nūdiya yā-mūsā

12.content: إِنّي أَنا رَبُّكَ فَاخلَع نَعلَيكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ بِالوادِ المُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
12.translation_eng: Indeed I am your Lord! So take off your sandals. You are indeed in the sacred valley of Ṭuwā.
12.transliteration: ʾinnī ʾana rabbuka fa-khlaʿ naʿlayka ʾinnaka bi-l-wādi l-muqaddasi ṭuwan

13.content: وَأَنَا اختَرتُكَ فَاستَمِع لِما يوحىٰ
13.translation_eng: I have chosen you; so listen to what is revealed.
13.transliteration: wa-ʾana khtartuka fa-stamiʿ li-mā yūḥā

14.content: إِنَّني أَنَا اللَّهُ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا أَنا فَاعبُدني وَأَقِمِ الصَّلاةَ لِذِكري
14.translation_eng: Indeed I am Allah —there is no god except Me. So worship Me, and maintain the prayer for My remembrance.
14.transliteration: ʾinnanī ʾana llāhu lā ʾilāha ʾillā ʾana fa-ʿbudnī wa-ʾaqimi ṣ-ṣalāta li-dhikrī

15.content: إِنَّ السّاعَةَ آتِيَةٌ أَكادُ أُخفيها لِتُجزىٰ كُلُّ نَفسٍ بِما تَسعىٰ
15.translation_eng: Indeed the Hour is bound to come: I will have it hidden, so that every soul may be rewarded for what it strives for.
15.transliteration: ʾinna s-sāʿata ʾātiyatun ʾakādu ʾukhfīhā li-tujzā kullu nafsin bi-mā tasʿā

16.content: فَلا يَصُدَّنَّكَ عَنها مَن لا يُؤمِنُ بِها وَاتَّبَعَ هَواهُ فَتَردىٰ
16.translation_eng: So do not let yourself be distracted from it by those who do not believe in it and who follow their desires, lest you should perish.’
16.transliteration: fa-lā yaṣuddannaka ʿanhā man lā yuʾminu bihā wa-ttabaʿa hawāhu fa-tardā

17.content: وَما تِلكَ بِيَمينِكَ يا موسىٰ
17.translation_eng: ‘Moses, what is that in your right hand?’
17.transliteration: wa-mā tilka bi-yamīnika yā-mūsā

18.content: قالَ هِيَ عَصايَ أَتَوَكَّأُ عَلَيها وَأَهُشُّ بِها عَلىٰ غَنَمي وَلِيَ فيها مَآرِبُ أُخرىٰ
18.translation_eng: He said, ‘It is my staff. I lean upon it, and with it I beat down leaves for my sheep; and I have other uses for it.’
18.transliteration: qāla hiya ʿaṣāya ʾatawakkaʾu ʿalayhā wa-ʾahushshu bihā ʿalā ghanamī wa-liya fīhā maʾāribu ʾukhrā

19.content: قالَ أَلقِها يا موسىٰ
19.translation_eng: He said, ‘Moses, throw it down.’
19.transliteration: qāla ʾalqihā yā-mūsā

20.content: فَأَلقاها فَإِذا هِيَ حَيَّةٌ تَسعىٰ
20.translation_eng: So he threw it down, and behold, it was a snake, moving swiftly.
20.transliteration: fa-ʾalqāhā fa-ʾidhā hiya ḥayyatun tasʿā

21.content: قالَ خُذها وَلا تَخَف ۖ سَنُعيدُها سيرَتَهَا الأولىٰ
21.translation_eng: He said, ‘Take hold of it, and do not fear. We will restore it to its former state.
21.transliteration: qāla khudhhā wa-lā takhaf sa-nuʿīduhā sīratahā l-ʾūlā

22.content: وَاضمُم يَدَكَ إِلىٰ جَناحِكَ تَخرُج بَيضاءَ مِن غَيرِ سوءٍ آيَةً أُخرىٰ
22.translation_eng: Now clasp your hand to your armpit: it will emerge white, without any fault. [This is yet] another sign,
22.transliteration: wa-ḍmum yadaka ʾilā janāḥika takhruj bayḍāʾa min ghayri sūʾin ʾāyatan ʾukhrā

23.content: لِنُرِيَكَ مِن آياتِنَا الكُبرَى
23.translation_eng: that We may show you some of Our great signs.
23.transliteration: li-nuriyaka min ʾāyātinā l-kubrā

24.content: اذهَب إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ إِنَّهُ طَغىٰ
24.translation_eng: Go to Pharaoh. He has indeed rebelled.’
24.transliteration: idhhab ʾilā firʿawna ʾinnahū ṭaghā

25.content: قالَ رَبِّ اشرَح لي صَدري
25.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! Open my breast for me.
25.transliteration: qāla rabbi shraḥ lī ṣadrī

26.content: وَيَسِّر لي أَمري
26.translation_eng: Make my affair easy for me.
26.transliteration: wa-yassir lī ʾamrī

27.content: وَاحلُل عُقدَةً مِن لِساني
27.translation_eng: Remove the hitch from my tongue,1That is, ‘Grant me clarity of speech.’
27.transliteration: wa-ḥlul ʿuqdatan min lisānī

28.content: يَفقَهوا قَولي
28.translation_eng: [so that] they may understand my discourse.
28.transliteration: yafqahū qawlī

29.content: وَاجعَل لي وَزيرًا مِن أَهلي
29.translation_eng: Appoint for me a minister from my family,
29.transliteration: wa-jʿal lī wazīran min ʾahlī

30.content: هارونَ أَخِي
30.translation_eng: Aaron, my brother.
30.transliteration: harūna ʾakhī

31.content: اشدُد بِهِ أَزري
31.translation_eng: Strengthen my back through him,1That is, ‘reinforce my strength through him.’
31.transliteration: ushdud bihī ʾazrī

32.content: وَأَشرِكهُ في أَمري
32.translation_eng: and make him my associate in my affair,
32.transliteration: wa-ʾashrikhu fī ʾamrī

33.content: كَي نُسَبِّحَكَ كَثيرًا
33.translation_eng: so that we may glorify You greatly,
33.transliteration: kay nusabbiḥaka kathīran

34.content: وَنَذكُرَكَ كَثيرًا
34.translation_eng: and remember You greatly.
34.transliteration: wa-nadhkuraka kathīran

35.content: إِنَّكَ كُنتَ بِنا بَصيرًا
35.translation_eng: Indeed You see us best.’
35.transliteration: ʾinnaka kunta binā baṣīran

36.content: قالَ قَد أوتيتَ سُؤلَكَ يا موسىٰ
36.translation_eng: He said, ‘Moses, your request has been granted!
36.transliteration: qāla qad ʾūtīta suʾlaka yā-mūsā

37.content: وَلَقَد مَنَنّا عَلَيكَ مَرَّةً أُخرىٰ
37.translation_eng: Certainly, We have done you a favour another time,
37.transliteration: wa-la-qad manannā ʿalayka marratan ʾukhrā

38.content: إِذ أَوحَينا إِلىٰ أُمِّكَ ما يوحىٰ
38.translation_eng: when We revealed to your mother whatever was revealed:
38.transliteration: ʾidh ʾawḥaynā ʾilā ʾummika mā yūḥā

39.content: أَنِ اقذِفيهِ فِي التّابوتِ فَاقذِفيهِ فِي اليَمِّ فَليُلقِهِ اليَمُّ بِالسّاحِلِ يَأخُذهُ عَدُوٌّ لي وَعَدُوٌّ لَهُ ۚ وَأَلقَيتُ عَلَيكَ مَحَبَّةً مِنّي وَلِتُصنَعَ عَلىٰ عَيني
39.translation_eng: “Put him in the casket, and cast it into the river. Then the river will cast it on the bank, and he shall be picked up by an enemy of Mine and an enemy of his.” And I cast upon you a love from Me,1 and that you might be reared under My eyes.That is, ‘I made you endearing’ (to people, or to Allah).
39.transliteration: ʾani qdhifīhi fī t-tābūti fa-qdhifīhi fī l-yammi fa-l-yulqihi l-yammu bi-s-sāḥili yaʾkhudhhu ʿaduwwun lī wa-ʿaduwwun lahū wa-ʾalqaytu ʿalayka maḥabbatan minnī wa-li-tuṣnaʿa ʿalā ʿaynī

40.content: إِذ تَمشي أُختُكَ فَتَقولُ هَل أَدُلُّكُم عَلىٰ مَن يَكفُلُهُ ۖ فَرَجَعناكَ إِلىٰ أُمِّكَ كَي تَقَرَّ عَينُها وَلا تَحزَنَ ۚ وَقَتَلتَ نَفسًا فَنَجَّيناكَ مِنَ الغَمِّ وَفَتَنّاكَ فُتونًا ۚ فَلَبِثتَ سِنينَ في أَهلِ مَديَنَ ثُمَّ جِئتَ عَلىٰ قَدَرٍ يا موسىٰ
40.translation_eng: When your sister walked up [to Pharaoh’s palace] saying, “Shall I show you someone who will take care of him?” Then We restored you to your mother, that she might be comforted and not grieve. Then you slew a soul, whereupon We delivered you from anguish, and We tried you with various ordeals. Then you stayed for several years among the people of Midian. Then you turned up as ordained, O Moses!
40.transliteration: ʾidh tamshī ʾukhtuka fa-taqūlu hal ʾadullukum ʿalā man yakfuluhū fa-rajaʿnāka ʾilā ʾummika kay taqarra ʿaynuhā wa-lā taḥzana wa-qatalta nafsan fa-najjaynāka mina l-ghammi wa-fatannāka futūnan fa-labithta sinīna fī ʾahli madyana thumma jiʾta ʿalā qadarin yā-mūsā

41.content: وَاصطَنَعتُكَ لِنَفسِي
41.translation_eng: And I chose you for Myself.
41.transliteration: wa-ṣṭanaʿtuka li-nafsī

42.content: اذهَب أَنتَ وَأَخوكَ بِآياتي وَلا تَنِيا في ذِكرِي
42.translation_eng: Go ahead, you and your brother, with My signs and do not flag in My remembrance.
42.transliteration: idhhab ʾanta wa-ʾakhūka bi-ʾāyātī wa-lā taniyā fī dhikrī

43.content: اذهَبا إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ إِنَّهُ طَغىٰ
43.translation_eng: Let the two of you go to Pharaoh. Indeed he has rebelled.
43.transliteration: idhhabā ʾilā firʿawna ʾinnahū ṭaghā

44.content: فَقولا لَهُ قَولًا لَيِّنًا لَعَلَّهُ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَو يَخشىٰ
44.translation_eng: Speak to him in a soft manner; maybe he will take admonition or fear.’
44.transliteration: fa-qūlā lahū qawlan layyinan laʿallahū yatadhakkaru ʾaw yakhshā

45.content: قالا رَبَّنا إِنَّنا نَخافُ أَن يَفرُطَ عَلَينا أَو أَن يَطغىٰ
45.translation_eng: The two of them said, ‘Our Lord! We are indeed afraid that he will forestall us or will overstep the bounds.’
45.transliteration: qālā rabbanā ʾinnanā nakhāfu ʾan yafruṭa ʿalaynā ʾaw ʾan yaṭghā

46.content: قالَ لا تَخافا ۖ إِنَّني مَعَكُما أَسمَعُ وَأَرىٰ
46.translation_eng: He said, ‘Do not be afraid, for I will be with the two of you, hearing and seeing [whatever happens].
46.transliteration: qāla lā takhāfā ʾinnanī maʿakumā ʾasmaʿu wa-ʾarā

47.content: فَأتِياهُ فَقولا إِنّا رَسولا رَبِّكَ فَأَرسِل مَعَنا بَني إِسرائيلَ وَلا تُعَذِّبهُم ۖ قَد جِئناكَ بِآيَةٍ مِن رَبِّكَ ۖ وَالسَّلامُ عَلىٰ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ الهُدىٰ
47.translation_eng: So approach him and say, “We are the apostles of your Lord. Let the Children of Israel go with us, and do not torture them! We certainly bring you a sign from your Lord, and may peace be upon him who follows guidance!
47.transliteration: fa-ʾtiyāhu fa-qūlā ʾinnā rasūlā rabbika fa-ʾarsil maʿanā banī ʾisrāʾīla wa-lā tuʿadhdhibhum qad jiʾnāka bi-ʾāyatin min rabbika wa-s-salāmu ʿalā mani ttabaʿa l-hudā

48.content: إِنّا قَد أوحِيَ إِلَينا أَنَّ العَذابَ عَلىٰ مَن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلّىٰ
48.translation_eng: Indeed it has been revealed to us that the punishment shall befall those who deny and turn their backs [on us].” ’
48.transliteration: ʾinnā qad ʾūḥiya ʾilaynā ʾanna l-ʿadhāba ʿalā man kadhdhaba wa-tawallā

49.content: قالَ فَمَن رَبُّكُما يا موسىٰ
49.translation_eng: He said, ‘Who is your Lord, Moses?’
49.transliteration: qāla fa-man rabbukumā yā-mūsā

50.content: قالَ رَبُّنَا الَّذي أَعطىٰ كُلَّ شَيءٍ خَلقَهُ ثُمَّ هَدىٰ
50.translation_eng: He said, ‘Our Lord is He who gave everything its creation and then guided it.’
50.transliteration: qāla rabbunā lladhī ʾaʿṭā kulla shayʾin khalqahū thumma hadā

51.content: قالَ فَما بالُ القُرونِ الأولىٰ
51.translation_eng: He said, ‘What about the former generations?’
51.transliteration: qāla fa-mā bālu l-qurūni l-ʾūlā

52.content: قالَ عِلمُها عِندَ رَبّي في كِتابٍ ۖ لا يَضِلُّ رَبّي وَلا يَنسَى
52.translation_eng: He said, ‘Their knowledge is with my Lord, in a Book. My Lord neither makes any error nor forgets.’
52.transliteration: qāla ʿilmuhā ʿinda rabbī fī kitābin lā yaḍillu rabbī wa-lā yansā

53.content: الَّذي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الأَرضَ مَهدًا وَسَلَكَ لَكُم فيها سُبُلًا وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَخرَجنا بِهِ أَزواجًا مِن نَباتٍ شَتّىٰ
53.translation_eng: He who made the earth for you a cradle, and in it threaded for you ways, and sent down water from the sky, and with it We brought forth various kinds of vegetation.
53.transliteration: alladhī jaʿala lakumu l-ʾarḍa mahdan wa-salaka lakum fīhā subulan wa-ʾanzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-ʾakhrajnā bihī ʾazwājan min nabātin shattā

54.content: كُلوا وَارعَوا أَنعامَكُم ۗ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِأُولِي النُّهىٰ
54.translation_eng: ‘Eat and pasture your cattle.’ There are indeed signs in that for those who have sense.
54.transliteration: kulū wa-rʿaw ʾanʿāmakum ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-ʾulī n-nuhā

55.content: ۞ مِنها خَلَقناكُم وَفيها نُعيدُكُم وَمِنها نُخرِجُكُم تارَةً أُخرىٰ
55.translation_eng: From it did We create you, into it shall We return you, and from it shall We bring you forth another time.
55.transliteration: minhā khalaqnākum wa-fīhā nuʿīdukum wa-minhā nukhrijukum tāratan ʾukhrā

56.content: وَلَقَد أَرَيناهُ آياتِنا كُلَّها فَكَذَّبَ وَأَبىٰ
56.translation_eng: Certainly We showed him all Our signs. But he denied [them] and refused [to believe them].
56.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾāraynāhu ʾāyātinā kullahā fa-kadhdhaba wa-ʾabā

57.content: قالَ أَجِئتَنا لِتُخرِجَنا مِن أَرضِنا بِسِحرِكَ يا موسىٰ
57.translation_eng: He said, ‘Have you come to us, Moses, to expel us from our land with your magic?
57.transliteration: qāla ʾa-jiʾtanā li-tukhrijanā min ʾarḍinā bi-siḥrika yā-mūsā

58.content: فَلَنَأتِيَنَّكَ بِسِحرٍ مِثلِهِ فَاجعَل بَينَنا وَبَينَكَ مَوعِدًا لا نُخلِفُهُ نَحنُ وَلا أَنتَ مَكانًا سُوًى
58.translation_eng: Yet we [too] will bring you a magic like it! So fix a tryst between us and you, which neither we shall fail nor you, at a middle place.’1Or ‘at a neutral location,’ or ‘on a level ground.’
58.transliteration: fa-la-naʾtiyannaka bi-siḥrin mithlihī fa-jʿal baynanā wa-baynaka mawʿidan lā nukhlifuhū naḥnu wa-lā ʾanta makānan suwan

59.content: قالَ مَوعِدُكُم يَومُ الزّينَةِ وَأَن يُحشَرَ النّاسُ ضُحًى
59.translation_eng: He said, ‘Your tryst shall be the Day of Adornment, and let the people be assembled in early forenoon.’
59.transliteration: qāla mawʿidukum yawmu z-zīnati wa-ʾan yuḥshara n-nāsu ḍuḥan

60.content: فَتَوَلّىٰ فِرعَونُ فَجَمَعَ كَيدَهُ ثُمَّ أَتىٰ
60.translation_eng: Then Pharaoh withdrew [to consult privately], summoned up his guile, and then arrived [at the scene of the contest].
60.transliteration: fa-tawallā firʿawnu fa-jamaʿa kaydahū thumma ʾatā

61.content: قالَ لَهُم موسىٰ وَيلَكُم لا تَفتَروا عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا فَيُسحِتَكُم بِعَذابٍ ۖ وَقَد خابَ مَنِ افتَرىٰ
61.translation_eng: Moses said to them, ‘Woe to you! Do not fabricate a lie against Allah, lest He should annihilate you with a punishment. Whoever fabricates lies certainly fails.’
61.transliteration: qāla lahum mūsā waylakum lā taftarū ʿalā llāhi kadhiban fa-yusḥitakum bi-ʿadhābin wa-qad khāba mani ftarā

62.content: فَتَنازَعوا أَمرَهُم بَينَهُم وَأَسَرُّوا النَّجوىٰ
62.translation_eng: So they disputed their matter among themselves, and kept their confidential talks secret.
62.transliteration: fa-tanāzaʿū ʾamrahum baynahum wa-ʾasarrū n-najwā

63.content: قالوا إِن هٰذانِ لَساحِرانِ يُريدانِ أَن يُخرِجاكُم مِن أَرضِكُم بِسِحرِهِما وَيَذهَبا بِطَريقَتِكُمُ المُثلىٰ
63.translation_eng: They said, ‘These two are indeed magicians who intend to expel you from your land with their magic, and to abolish your excellent tradition!1Cf. 40:26.
63.transliteration: qālū ʾin hādhāni la-sāḥirāni yurīdāni ʾan yukhrijākum min ʾarḍikum bi-siḥrihimā wa-yadhhabā bi-ṭarīqatikumu l-muthlā

64.content: فَأَجمِعوا كَيدَكُم ثُمَّ ائتوا صَفًّا ۚ وَقَد أَفلَحَ اليَومَ مَنِ استَعلىٰ
64.translation_eng: So summon up your ingenuity, then come in ranks. Today he who has the upper hand will be saved!’
64.transliteration: fa-ʾajmiʿū kaydakum thumma ʾtū ṣaffan wa-qad ʾaflaḥa l-yawma mani staʿlā

65.content: قالوا يا موسىٰ إِمّا أَن تُلقِيَ وَإِمّا أَن نَكونَ أَوَّلَ مَن أَلقىٰ
65.translation_eng: They said, ‘O Moses! Either you will throw down, or we shall be the first to throw.’
65.transliteration: qālū yā-mūsā ʾimmā ʾan tulqiya wa-ʾimmā ʾan nakūna ʾawwala man ʾalqā

66.content: قالَ بَل أَلقوا ۖ فَإِذا حِبالُهُم وَعِصِيُّهُم يُخَيَّلُ إِلَيهِ مِن سِحرِهِم أَنَّها تَسعىٰ
66.translation_eng: He said, ‘Rather you throw down first.’ Behold, their ropes and staffs appeared to him by their magic to wriggle swiftly.
66.transliteration: qāla bal ʾalqū fa-ʾidhā ḥibāluhum wa-ʿiṣiyyuhum yukhayyalu ʾilayhi min siḥrihim ʾannahā tasʿā

67.content: فَأَوجَسَ في نَفسِهِ خيفَةً موسىٰ
67.translation_eng: Then Moses felt a fear within his heart.
67.transliteration: fa-ʾawjasa fī nafsihī khīfatan mūsā

68.content: قُلنا لا تَخَف إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الأَعلىٰ
68.translation_eng: We said, ‘Do not be afraid. Indeed you will have the upper hand.
68.transliteration: qulnā lā takhaf ʾinnaka ʾanta l-ʾaʿlā

69.content: وَأَلقِ ما في يَمينِكَ تَلقَف ما صَنَعوا ۖ إِنَّما صَنَعوا كَيدُ ساحِرٍ ۖ وَلا يُفلِحُ السّاحِرُ حَيثُ أَتىٰ
69.translation_eng: Throw down what is in your right hand, and it will swallow what they have conjured. What they have conjured is only a magician’s trick, and the magician does not fare well wherever he may show up.’
69.transliteration: wa-ʾalqi mā fī yamīnika talqaf mā ṣanaʿū ʾinnamā ṣanaʿū kaydu sāḥirin wa-lā yufliḥu s-sāḥiru ḥaythu ʾatā

70.content: فَأُلقِيَ السَّحَرَةُ سُجَّدًا قالوا آمَنّا بِرَبِّ هارونَ وَموسىٰ
70.translation_eng: Thereat the magicians fell down prostrating. They said, ‘We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses!’
70.transliteration: fa-ʾulqiya s-saḥaratu sujjadan qālū ʾāmannā bi-rabbi hārūna wa-mūsā

71.content: قالَ آمَنتُم لَهُ قَبلَ أَن آذَنَ لَكُم ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبيرُكُمُ الَّذي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحرَ ۖ فَلَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيدِيَكُم وَأَرجُلَكُم مِن خِلافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُم في جُذوعِ النَّخلِ وَلَتَعلَمُنَّ أَيُّنا أَشَدُّ عَذابًا وَأَبقىٰ
71.translation_eng: He said, ‘Do you profess faith in Him before I may permit you? He is indeed your chief who has taught you magic! Surely I will cut off your hands and feet from opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees. So you will know which of us can inflict a punishment severer and more lasting.’
71.transliteration: qāla ʾāmantum lahū qabla ʾan ʾādhana lakum ʾinnahū la-kabīrukumu lladhī ʿallamakumu s-siḥra fa-la-ʾuqaṭṭiʿanna ʾaydiyakum wa-ʾarjulakum min khilāfin wa-la-ʾuṣallibannakum fī judhūʿi n-nakhli wa-la-taʿlamunna ʾayyunā ʾashaddu ʿadhāban wa-ʾabqā

72.content: قالوا لَن نُؤثِرَكَ عَلىٰ ما جاءَنا مِنَ البَيِّناتِ وَالَّذي فَطَرَنا ۖ فَاقضِ ما أَنتَ قاضٍ ۖ إِنَّما تَقضي هٰذِهِ الحَياةَ الدُّنيا
72.translation_eng: They said, ‘We will never prefer you to the manifest proofs which have come to us and [to] Him who originated us. Decide whatever you may. You can only decide about the life of this world.
72.transliteration: qālū lan nuʾthiraka ʿalā mā jāʾanā mina l-bayyināti wa-lladhī faṭaranā fa-qḍi mā ʾanta qāḍin ʾinnamā taqḍī hādhihi l-ḥayāta d-dunyā

73.content: إِنّا آمَنّا بِرَبِّنا لِيَغفِرَ لَنا خَطايانا وَما أَكرَهتَنا عَلَيهِ مِنَ السِّحرِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ خَيرٌ وَأَبقىٰ
73.translation_eng: We have indeed believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our iniquities and the magic you compelled us to perform. Allah is better and more lasting.’
73.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾāmannā bi-rabbinā li-yaghfira lanā khaṭāyānā wa-mā ʾakrahtanā ʿalayhi mina s-siḥri wa-llāhu khayrun wa-ʾabqā

74.content: إِنَّهُ مَن يَأتِ رَبَّهُ مُجرِمًا فَإِنَّ لَهُ جَهَنَّمَ لا يَموتُ فيها وَلا يَحيىٰ
74.translation_eng: Whoever comes to his Lord laden with guilt, indeed for him shall be hell where he will neither live nor die.
74.transliteration: ʾinnahū man yaʾti rabbahū mujriman fa-ʾinna lahū jahannama lā yamūtu fīhā wa-lā yaḥyā

75.content: وَمَن يَأتِهِ مُؤمِنًا قَد عَمِلَ الصّالِحاتِ فَأُولٰئِكَ لَهُمُ الدَّرَجاتُ العُلىٰ
75.translation_eng: But whoever comes to Him with faith and he has done righteous deeds, for such shall be the highest ranks
75.transliteration: wa-man yaʾtihī muʾminan qad ʿamila ṣ-ṣāliḥāti fa-ʾulāʾika lahumu d-darajātu l-ʿulā

76.content: جَنّاتُ عَدنٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ خالِدينَ فيها ۚ وَذٰلِكَ جَزاءُ مَن تَزَكّىٰ
76.translation_eng: —the Gardens of Eden, with streams running in them, to abide in them [forever], and that is the reward of him who keeps pure.
76.transliteration: jannātu ʿadnin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru khālidīna fīhā wa-dhālika jazāʾu man tazakkā

77.content: وَلَقَد أَوحَينا إِلىٰ موسىٰ أَن أَسرِ بِعِبادي فَاضرِب لَهُم طَريقًا فِي البَحرِ يَبَسًا لا تَخافُ دَرَكًا وَلا تَخشىٰ
77.translation_eng: Certainly We revealed to Moses, [saying], ‘Take My servants on a journey by night. Then strike out for them a dry path through the sea. Do not be afraid of being overtaken, and have no fear [of getting drowned].
77.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾawḥaynā ʾilā mūsā ʾan ʾasri bi-ʿibādī fa-ḍrib lahum ṭarīqan fī l-baḥri yabasan lā takhāfu darakan wa-lā takhshā

78.content: فَأَتبَعَهُم فِرعَونُ بِجُنودِهِ فَغَشِيَهُم مِنَ اليَمِّ ما غَشِيَهُم
78.translation_eng: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his troops, whereat they were engulfed by what engulfed them of the sea.
78.transliteration: fa-ʾatbaʿahum firʿawnu bi-junūdihī fa-ghashiyahum mina l-yammi mā ghashiyahum

79.content: وَأَضَلَّ فِرعَونُ قَومَهُ وَما هَدىٰ
79.translation_eng: Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide them.
79.transliteration: wa-ʾaḍalla firʿawnu qawmahū wa-mā hadā

80.content: يا بَني إِسرائيلَ قَد أَنجَيناكُم مِن عَدُوِّكُم وَواعَدناكُم جانِبَ الطّورِ الأَيمَنَ وَنَزَّلنا عَلَيكُمُ المَنَّ وَالسَّلوىٰ
80.translation_eng: O Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, and We appointed with you a tryst on the right side of the Mount and We sent down to you manna and quails:
80.transliteration: yā-banī ʾisrāʾīla qad ʾanjaynākum min ʿaduwwikum wa-wāʿadnākum jāniba ṭ-ṭūri l-ʾaymana wa-nazzalnā ʿalaykumu l-manna wa-s-salwā

81.content: كُلوا مِن طَيِّباتِ ما رَزَقناكُم وَلا تَطغَوا فيهِ فَيَحِلَّ عَلَيكُم غَضَبي ۖ وَمَن يَحلِل عَلَيهِ غَضَبي فَقَد هَوىٰ
81.translation_eng: ‘Eat of the good things We have provided you, but do not overstep the bounds therein, lest My wrath should descend on you. And he on whom My wrath descends certainly perishes.1Or ‘falls’ (that is, into hell).
81.transliteration: kulū min ṭayyibāti mā razaqnākum wa-lā taṭghaw fīhi fa-yaḥilla ʿalaykum ghaḍabī wa-man yaḥlil ʿalayhi ghaḍabī fa-qad hawā

82.content: وَإِنّي لَغَفّارٌ لِمَن تابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صالِحًا ثُمَّ اهتَدىٰ
82.translation_eng: Indeed I am all-forgiver toward him who repents, becomes faithful and acts righteously, and then follows guidance.’
82.transliteration: wa-ʾinnī la-ghaffārun li-man tāba wa-ʾāmana wa-ʿamila ṣāliḥan thumma htadā

83.content: ۞ وَما أَعجَلَكَ عَن قَومِكَ يا موسىٰ
83.translation_eng: ‘What has hurried you from your people, O Moses?’
83.transliteration: wa-mā ʾaʿjalaka ʿan qawmika yā-mūsā

84.content: قالَ هُم أُولاءِ عَلىٰ أَثَري وَعَجِلتُ إِلَيكَ رَبِّ لِتَرضىٰ
84.translation_eng: He said, ‘They are close upon my heels, and I hurried on to You, my Lord, that You may be pleased.’
84.transliteration: qāla hum ʾulāʾi ʿalā ʾatharī wa-ʿajiltu ʾilāyka rabbi li-tarḍā

85.content: قالَ فَإِنّا قَد فَتَنّا قَومَكَ مِن بَعدِكَ وَأَضَلَّهُمُ السّامِرِيُّ
85.translation_eng: He said, ‘Indeed We tried your people in your absence, and the Sāmirī1 has led them astray.’Apparently one of the Israelites accompanying Moses (ʿa).
85.transliteration: qāla fa-ʾinnā qad fatannā qawmaka min baʿdika wa-ʾaḍallahumu s-sāmiriyyu

86.content: فَرَجَعَ موسىٰ إِلىٰ قَومِهِ غَضبانَ أَسِفًا ۚ قالَ يا قَومِ أَلَم يَعِدكُم رَبُّكُم وَعدًا حَسَنًا ۚ أَفَطالَ عَلَيكُمُ العَهدُ أَم أَرَدتُم أَن يَحِلَّ عَلَيكُم غَضَبٌ مِن رَبِّكُم فَأَخلَفتُم مَوعِدي
86.translation_eng: Thereupon Moses returned to his people, indignant and grieved. He said, ‘O my people! Did not your Lord give you a true promise? Did the period [of my absence]seem too long to you? Or did you desire that your Lord’s wrath should descend on you and so you failed your tryst with me?’
86.transliteration: fa-rajaʿa mūsā ʾilā qawmihī ghaḍbāna ʾasifan qāla yā-qawmi ʾa-lam yaʿidkum rabbukum waʿdan ḥasanan ʾa-fa-ṭāla ʿalaykumu l-ʿahdu ʾam ʾaradtum ʾan yaḥilla ʿalaykum ghaḍabun min rabbikum fa-ʾakhlaftum mawʿidī

87.content: قالوا ما أَخلَفنا مَوعِدَكَ بِمَلكِنا وَلٰكِنّا حُمِّلنا أَوزارًا مِن زينَةِ القَومِ فَقَذَفناها فَكَذٰلِكَ أَلقَى السّامِرِيُّ
87.translation_eng: They said, ‘We did not fail our tryst with you of our own accord, but we were laden with the weight of the people’s ornaments, and we cast them [into the fire] and so did the Sāmirī throw.’
87.transliteration: qālū mā ʾakhlafnā mawʿidaka bi-malkinā wa-lākinnā ḥummilnā ʾawzāran min zīnati l-qawmi fa-qadhafnāhā fa-ka-dhālika ʾalqā s-sāmiriyyu

88.content: فَأَخرَجَ لَهُم عِجلًا جَسَدًا لَهُ خُوارٌ فَقالوا هٰذا إِلٰهُكُم وَإِلٰهُ موسىٰ فَنَسِيَ
88.translation_eng: Then he produced for them a calf —a [lifeless] body with a low— and they said, This is your god and the god of Moses, so he1 forgot!The pronoun may be taken to refer either to the Sāmirī, concerning whom Allah says that he forgot Moses’ teaching about the worship of the true God, or to Moses, who is said by the Sāmirī to have forgotten and left behind his god—the Golden Calf—and gone out in search of him.
88.transliteration: fa-ʾakhraja lahum ʿijlan jasadan lahū khuwārun fa-qālū hādhā ʾilāhukum wa-ʾilāhu mūsā fa-nasiya

89.content: أَفَلا يَرَونَ أَلّا يَرجِعُ إِلَيهِم قَولًا وَلا يَملِكُ لَهُم ضَرًّا وَلا نَفعًا
89.translation_eng: Did they not see that it did not answer them, nor could it bring them any benefit or harm?
89.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lā yarawna ʾallā yarjiʿu ʾilayhim qawlan wa-lā yamliku lahum ḍarran wa-lā nafʿan

90.content: وَلَقَد قالَ لَهُم هارونُ مِن قَبلُ يا قَومِ إِنَّما فُتِنتُم بِهِ ۖ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ الرَّحمٰنُ فَاتَّبِعوني وَأَطيعوا أَمري
90.translation_eng: Aaron had certainly told them earlier, ‘O my people! You are only being tested by it. Indeed your Lord is the All-beneficent. So follow me and obey my command!’
90.transliteration: wa-la-qad qāla lahum hārūnu min qablu yā-qawmi ʾinnamā futintum bihī wa-ʾinna rabbakumu r-raḥmānu fa-ttabiʿūnī wa-ʾaṭīʿū ʾamrī

91.content: قالوا لَن نَبرَحَ عَلَيهِ عاكِفينَ حَتّىٰ يَرجِعَ إِلَينا موسىٰ
91.translation_eng: They had said, ‘We will keep on clinging to it until Moses returns to us.’
91.transliteration: qālū lan nabraḥa ʿalayhi ʿākifīna ḥattā yarjiʿa ʾilaynā mūsā

92.content: قالَ يا هارونُ ما مَنَعَكَ إِذ رَأَيتَهُم ضَلّوا
92.translation_eng: He said, ‘O Aaron! What kept you, when you saw them going astray,
92.transliteration: qāla yā-hārūnu mā manaʿaka ʾidh raʾaytahum ḍallū

93.content: أَلّا تَتَّبِعَنِ ۖ أَفَعَصَيتَ أَمري
93.translation_eng: from following me? Did you disobey my command?’
93.transliteration: ʾallā tattabiʿani ʾa-fa-ʿaṣayta ʾamrī

94.content: قالَ يَا ابنَ أُمَّ لا تَأخُذ بِلِحيَتي وَلا بِرَأسي ۖ إِنّي خَشيتُ أَن تَقولَ فَرَّقتَ بَينَ بَني إِسرائيلَ وَلَم تَرقُب قَولي
94.translation_eng: He said, ‘O son of my mother! Do not hold my beard or my head! I feared lest you should say, “You have caused a rift among the Children of Israel, and did not heed my word [of advice].” ’
94.transliteration: qāla ya-bna-ʾumma lā taʾkhudh bi-liḥyatī wa-lā bi-raʾsī ʾinnī khashītu ʾan taqūla farraqta bayna banī ʾisrāʾīla wa-lam tarqub qawlī

95.content: قالَ فَما خَطبُكَ يا سامِرِيُّ
95.translation_eng: He said, ‘What is your business, O Sāmirī?’
95.transliteration: qāla fa-mā khaṭbuka yā-sāmiriyyu

96.content: قالَ بَصُرتُ بِما لَم يَبصُروا بِهِ فَقَبَضتُ قَبضَةً مِن أَثَرِ الرَّسولِ فَنَبَذتُها وَكَذٰلِكَ سَوَّلَت لي نَفسي
96.translation_eng: He said, ‘I saw what they did not see. I took a handful [of dust] from the messenger’s trail and threw it. That is how my soul prompted me.’
96.transliteration: qāla baṣurtu bi-mā lam yabṣurū bihī fa-qabaḍtu qabḍatan min ʾathari r-rasūli fa-nabadhtuhā wa-ka-dhālika sawwalat lī nafsī

97.content: قالَ فَاذهَب فَإِنَّ لَكَ فِي الحَياةِ أَن تَقولَ لا مِساسَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَكَ مَوعِدًا لَن تُخلَفَهُ ۖ وَانظُر إِلىٰ إِلٰهِكَ الَّذي ظَلتَ عَلَيهِ عاكِفًا ۖ لَنُحَرِّقَنَّهُ ثُمَّ لَنَنسِفَنَّهُ فِي اليَمِّ نَسفًا
97.translation_eng: He said, ‘Begone! It shall be your [lot] throughout life to say, “Do not touch me!” Indeed there is a tryst for you which you will not fail to keep! Now look at your god to whom you went on clinging. We will burn it down and then scatter it[s ashes] into the sea.
97.transliteration: qāla fa-dhhab fa-ʾinna laka fī l-ḥayāti ʾan taqūla lā misāsa wa-ʾinna laka mawʿidan lan tukhlafahū wa-nẓur ʾilā ʾilāhika lladhī ẓalta ʿalayhi ʿākifan la-nuḥarriqannahū thumma la-nansifannahū fī l-yammi nasfan

98.content: إِنَّما إِلٰهُكُمُ اللَّهُ الَّذي لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُلَّ شَيءٍ عِلمًا
98.translation_eng: Indeed your God is Allah. There is no god except Him. He embraces all things in [His] knowledge.’
98.transliteration: ʾinnamā ʾilāhukumu llāhu lladhī lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa wasiʿa kulla shayʾin ʿilman

99.content: كَذٰلِكَ نَقُصُّ عَلَيكَ مِن أَنباءِ ما قَد سَبَقَ ۚ وَقَد آتَيناكَ مِن لَدُنّا ذِكرًا
99.translation_eng: Thus do We relate to you some accounts of what is past. Certainly We have given you a Reminder from Ourselves.
99.transliteration: ka-dhālika naquṣṣu ʿalayka min ʾanbāʾi mā qad sabaqa wa-qad ʾātaynāka min ladunnā dhikran

100.content: مَن أَعرَضَ عَنهُ فَإِنَّهُ يَحمِلُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ وِزرًا
100.translation_eng: Whoever disregards it shall bear its onus on the Day of Resurrection,
100.transliteration: man ʾaʿraḍa ʿanhu fa-ʾinnahū yaḥmilu yawma l-qiyāmati wizran

101.content: خالِدينَ فيهِ ۖ وَساءَ لَهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ حِملًا
101.translation_eng: remaining in it [forever]. Evil is their burden on the Day of Resurrection
101.transliteration: khālidīna fīhi wa-sāʾa lahum yawma l-qiyāmati ḥimlan

102.content: يَومَ يُنفَخُ فِي الصّورِ ۚ وَنَحشُرُ المُجرِمينَ يَومَئِذٍ زُرقًا
102.translation_eng: —the day the Trumpet will be blown— on that day We shall muster the guilty with blind eyes.1Literally, ‘with blued eyes.’ Cf. 17:72, 97; 20:124-125.
102.transliteration: yawma yunfakhu fī ṣ-ṣūri wa-naḥshuru l-mujrimīna yawmaʾidhin zurqan

103.content: يَتَخافَتونَ بَينَهُم إِن لَبِثتُم إِلّا عَشرًا
103.translation_eng: They will whisper to one another: ‘You have stayed only for ten [days].’
103.transliteration: yatakhāfatūna baynahum ʾin labithtum ʾillā ʿashran

104.content: نَحنُ أَعلَمُ بِما يَقولونَ إِذ يَقولُ أَمثَلُهُم طَريقَةً إِن لَبِثتُم إِلّا يَومًا
104.translation_eng: We know best what they will say, when the best of them in conduct will say, ‘You stayed only a day!’
104.transliteration: naḥnu ʾaʿlamu bi-mā yaqūlūna ʾidh yaqūlu ʾamthaluhum ṭarīqatan ʾin labithtum ʾillā yawman

105.content: وَيَسأَلونَكَ عَنِ الجِبالِ فَقُل يَنسِفُها رَبّي نَسفًا
105.translation_eng: They question you concerning the mountains. Say, ‘My Lord will scatter them [like dust].’
105.transliteration: wa-yasʾalūnaka ʿani l-jibāli fa-qul yansifuhā rabbī nasfan

106.translation_eng: Then He will leave it1 a level plain.That is, the earth.

107.content: لا تَرىٰ فيها عِوَجًا وَلا أَمتًا
107.translation_eng: You will not see any crookedness or unevenness in it.
107.transliteration: lā tarā fīhā ʿiwajan wa-lā ʾamtan

108.content: يَومَئِذٍ يَتَّبِعونَ الدّاعِيَ لا عِوَجَ لَهُ ۖ وَخَشَعَتِ الأَصواتُ لِلرَّحمٰنِ فَلا تَسمَعُ إِلّا هَمسًا
108.translation_eng: On that day they will follow a summoner in whom there will be no deviousness. The voices will be muted before the All-beneficent, and you will hear nothing but a murmur.
108.transliteration: yawmaʾidhin yattabiʿūna d-dāʿiya lā ʿiwaja lahū wa-khashaʿati l-ʾaṣwātu li-r-raḥmāni fa-lā tasmaʿu ʾillā hamsan

109.content: يَومَئِذٍ لا تَنفَعُ الشَّفاعَةُ إِلّا مَن أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحمٰنُ وَرَضِيَ لَهُ قَولًا
109.translation_eng: Intercession will not avail that day except from him whom the All-beneficent allows and approves of his word.
109.transliteration: yawmaʾidhin lā tanfaʿu sh-shafāʿatu ʾillā man ʾadhina lahu r-raḥmānu wa-raḍiya lahū qawlan

110.content: يَعلَمُ ما بَينَ أَيديهِم وَما خَلفَهُم وَلا يُحيطونَ بِهِ عِلمًا
110.translation_eng: He knows that which is before them and that which is behind them, but they cannot comprehend Him in their knowledge.
110.transliteration: yaʿlamu mā bayna ʾaydīhim wa-mā khalfahum wa-lā yuḥīṭūna bihī ʿilman

111.content: ۞ وَعَنَتِ الوُجوهُ لِلحَيِّ القَيّومِ ۖ وَقَد خابَ مَن حَمَلَ ظُلمًا
111.translation_eng: All faces shall be humbled before the Living One, the All-sustainer, and he will fail who bears [the onus of] wrongdoing.
111.transliteration: wa-ʿanati l-wujūhu li-l-ḥayyi l-qayyūmi wa-qad khāba man ḥamala ẓulman

112.content: وَمَن يَعمَل مِنَ الصّالِحاتِ وَهُوَ مُؤمِنٌ فَلا يَخافُ ظُلمًا وَلا هَضمًا
112.translation_eng: But whoever does righteous deeds, should he be faithful, shall neither fear any wrong nor detraction.
112.transliteration: wa-man yaʿmal mina ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa-huwa muʾminun fa-lā yakhāfu ẓulman wa-lā haḍman

113.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَنزَلناهُ قُرآنًا عَرَبِيًّا وَصَرَّفنا فيهِ مِنَ الوَعيدِ لَعَلَّهُم يَتَّقونَ أَو يُحدِثُ لَهُم ذِكرًا
113.translation_eng: Thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qurʾān and We have paraphrased the threats in it so that they may be Godwary or it may evoke remembrance for them.
113.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika ʾanzalnāhu qurʾānan ʿarabiyyan wa-ṣarrafnā fīhi mina l-waʿīdi laʿallahum yattaqūna ʾaw yuḥdithu lahum dhikran

114.content: فَتَعالَى اللَّهُ المَلِكُ الحَقُّ ۗ وَلا تَعجَل بِالقُرآنِ مِن قَبلِ أَن يُقضىٰ إِلَيكَ وَحيُهُ ۖ وَقُل رَبِّ زِدني عِلمًا
114.translation_eng: So exalted is Allah, the True Sovereign. Do not hasten with the Qurʾān before its revelation is completed for you, and say, ‘My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.’
114.transliteration: fa-taʿālā llāhu l-maliku l-ḥaqqu wa-lā taʿjal bi-l-qurʾāni min qabli ʾan yuqḍā ʾilayka waḥyuhū wa-qul rabbi zidnī ʿilman

115.content: وَلَقَد عَهِدنا إِلىٰ آدَمَ مِن قَبلُ فَنَسِيَ وَلَم نَجِد لَهُ عَزمًا
115.translation_eng: Certainly We had enjoined Adam earlier; but he forgot, and We did not find any resoluteness in him.
115.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʿahidnā ʾilā ʾādama min qablu fa-nasiya wa-lam najid lahū ʿazman

116.content: وَإِذ قُلنا لِلمَلائِكَةِ اسجُدوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدوا إِلّا إِبليسَ أَبىٰ
116.translation_eng: When We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam,’ they prostrated, but not Iblis: he refused.
116.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qulnā li-l-malāʾikati sjudū li-ʾādama fa-sajadū ʾillā ʾiblīsa ʾabā

117.content: فَقُلنا يا آدَمُ إِنَّ هٰذا عَدُوٌّ لَكَ وَلِزَوجِكَ فَلا يُخرِجَنَّكُما مِنَ الجَنَّةِ فَتَشقىٰ
117.translation_eng: We said, ‘O Adam! This is indeed an enemy of yours and your mate’s. So do not let him expel you from paradise, or you will be miserable.
117.transliteration: fa-qulnā yā-ʾādamu ʾinna hādhā ʿaduwwun laka wa-li-zawjika fa-lā yukhrijannakumā mina l-jannati fa-tashqā

118.content: إِنَّ لَكَ أَلّا تَجوعَ فيها وَلا تَعرىٰ
118.translation_eng: Indeed you will neither be hungry in it nor naked.
118.transliteration: ʾinna laka ʾallā tajūʿa fīhā wa-lā taʿrā

119.content: وَأَنَّكَ لا تَظمَأُ فيها وَلا تَضحىٰ
119.translation_eng: Indeed you will neither be thirsty in it, nor suffer from the sun.’
119.transliteration: wa-ʾannaka lā taẓmaʿu fīhā wa-lā taḍḥā

120.content: فَوَسوَسَ إِلَيهِ الشَّيطانُ قالَ يا آدَمُ هَل أَدُلُّكَ عَلىٰ شَجَرَةِ الخُلدِ وَمُلكٍ لا يَبلىٰ
120.translation_eng: Then Satan tempted him. He said, ‘O Adam! Shall I show you the tree of immortality, and an imperishable kingdom?’
120.transliteration: fa-waswasa ʾilayhi sh-shayṭānu qāla yā-ʾādamu hal ʾadulluka ʿalā shajarati l-khuldi wa-mulkin lā yablā

121.content: فَأَكَلا مِنها فَبَدَت لَهُما سَوآتُهُما وَطَفِقا يَخصِفانِ عَلَيهِما مِن وَرَقِ الجَنَّةِ ۚ وَعَصىٰ آدَمُ رَبَّهُ فَغَوىٰ
121.translation_eng: So they both ate of it, and their nakedness became evident to them, and they began to stitch over themselves with the leaves of paradise. Adam disobeyed his Lord, and went amiss.
121.transliteration: fa-ʾakalā minhā fa-badat lahumā sawʾātuhumā wa-ṭafiqā yakhṣifāni ʿalayhimā min waraqi l-jannati wa-ʿaṣā ʾādamu rabbahū fa-ghawā

122.content: ثُمَّ اجتَباهُ رَبُّهُ فَتابَ عَلَيهِ وَهَدىٰ
122.translation_eng: Then his Lord chose him, and turned to him clemently, and guided him.
122.transliteration: thumma jtabāhu rabbuhū fa-tāba ʿalayhi wa-hadā

123.content: قالَ اهبِطا مِنها جَميعًا ۖ بَعضُكُم لِبَعضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ فَإِمّا يَأتِيَنَّكُم مِنّي هُدًى فَمَنِ اتَّبَعَ هُدايَ فَلا يَضِلُّ وَلا يَشقىٰ
123.translation_eng: He said, ‘Get down both of you1 from it, all together, being enemies of one another! Yet, should any guidance come to you from Me, those who follow My guidance will not go astray, nor will they be miserable.That is, Adam and Eve, or Adam and Iblīs.
123.transliteration: qāla hbiṭā minhā jamīʿan baʿḍukum li-baʿḍin ʿaduwwun fa-ʾimmā yaʾtiyannakum minnī hudan fa-mani ttabaʿa hudāya fa-lā yaḍillu wa-lā yashqā

124.content: وَمَن أَعرَضَ عَن ذِكري فَإِنَّ لَهُ مَعيشَةً ضَنكًا وَنَحشُرُهُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ أَعمىٰ
124.translation_eng: But whoever disregards My remembrance, his shall be a wretched life, and on the Day of Resurrection We shall raise him blind.’
124.transliteration: wa-man ʾaʿraḍa ʿan dhikrī fa-ʾinna lahū maʿīshatan ḍankan wa-naḥshuruhū yawma l-qiyāmati ʾaʿmā

125.content: قالَ رَبِّ لِمَ حَشَرتَني أَعمىٰ وَقَد كُنتُ بَصيرًا
125.translation_eng: He will say, ‘My Lord! Why have You raised me blind, though I used to see?’
125.transliteration: qāla rabbi li-ma ḥashartanī ʾaʿmā wa-qad kuntu baṣīran

126.content: قالَ كَذٰلِكَ أَتَتكَ آياتُنا فَنَسيتَها ۖ وَكَذٰلِكَ اليَومَ تُنسىٰ
126.translation_eng: He will say: ‘So it is. Our signs came to you, but you forgot them, and thus you will be forgotten today.’
126.transliteration: qāla ka-dhālika ʾatatka ʾāyātunā fa-nasītahā wa-ka-dhālika l-yawma tunsā

127.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ نَجزي مَن أَسرَفَ وَلَم يُؤمِن بِآياتِ رَبِّهِ ۚ وَلَعَذابُ الآخِرَةِ أَشَدُّ وَأَبقىٰ
127.translation_eng: Thus do We requite him who is a profligate and does not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is severer and more lasting.
127.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika najzī man ʾasrafa wa-lam yuʾmin bi-ʾāyāti rabbihī wa-la-ʿadhābu l-ʾākhirati ʾashaddu wa-ʾabqā

128.content: أَفَلَم يَهدِ لَهُم كَم أَهلَكنا قَبلَهُم مِنَ القُرونِ يَمشونَ في مَساكِنِهِم ۗ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِأُولِي النُّهىٰ
128.translation_eng: Does it not dawn upon them how many generations We have destroyed before them, amid [the ruins of] whose dwellings they walk? There are indeed signs in this for those who have reason.
128.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lam yahdi lahum kam ʾahlaknā qablahum mina l-qurūni yamshūna fī masākinihim ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-ʾulī n-nuhā

129.content: وَلَولا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَت مِن رَبِّكَ لَكانَ لِزامًا وَأَجَلٌ مُسَمًّى
129.translation_eng: And were it not for a prior decree of your Lord and a specified time, it was inevitable.
129.transliteration: wa-law-lā kalimatun sabaqat min rabbika la-kāna lizāman wa-ʾajalun musamman

130.content: فَاصبِر عَلىٰ ما يَقولونَ وَسَبِّح بِحَمدِ رَبِّكَ قَبلَ طُلوعِ الشَّمسِ وَقَبلَ غُروبِها ۖ وَمِن آناءِ اللَّيلِ فَسَبِّح وَأَطرافَ النَّهارِ لَعَلَّكَ تَرضىٰ
130.translation_eng: So be patient with what they say, and celebrate the praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before the sunset, and glorify Him in watches of the night and at the day’s ends, that you may be pleased.
130.transliteration: fa-ṣbir ʿalā mā yaqūlūna wa-sabbiḥ bi-ḥamdi rabbika qabla ṭulūʿi sh-shamsi wa-qabla ghurūbihā wa-min ʾānāʾi l-layli fa-sabbiḥ wa-ʾaṭrāfa n-nahāri laʿallaka tarḍā

131.content: وَلا تَمُدَّنَّ عَينَيكَ إِلىٰ ما مَتَّعنا بِهِ أَزواجًا مِنهُم زَهرَةَ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا لِنَفتِنَهُم فيهِ ۚ وَرِزقُ رَبِّكَ خَيرٌ وَأَبقىٰ
131.translation_eng: Do not extend your glance toward what We have provided certain groups of them as a glitter of the life of this world, so that We may test them thereby. And the provision of your Lord is better and more lasting.
131.transliteration: wa-lā tamuddanna ʿaynayka ʾilā mā mattaʿnā bihī ʾazwājan minhum zahrata l-ḥayāti d-dunyā li-naftinahum fīhi wa-rizqu rabbika khayrun wa-ʾabqā

132.content: وَأمُر أَهلَكَ بِالصَّلاةِ وَاصطَبِر عَلَيها ۖ لا نَسأَلُكَ رِزقًا ۖ نَحنُ نَرزُقُكَ ۗ وَالعاقِبَةُ لِلتَّقوىٰ
132.translation_eng: And bid your family to prayer and be steadfast in its maintenance. We do not ask any provision of you. It is We who provide for you, and the outcome will be in favour of Godwariness.
132.transliteration: wa-ʾmur ʾahlaka bi-ṣ-ṣalāti wa-ṣṭabir ʿalayhā lā nasʾaluka rizqan naḥnu narzuquka wa-l-ʿāqibatu li-t-taqwā

133.content: وَقالوا لَولا يَأتينا بِآيَةٍ مِن رَبِّهِ ۚ أَوَلَم تَأتِهِم بَيِّنَةُ ما فِي الصُّحُفِ الأولىٰ
133.translation_eng: They say, ‘Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?’ Has there not come to them a manifest proof in that which is in the former scriptures?
133.transliteration: wa-qālū law-lā yaʾtīnā bi-ʾāyatin min rabbihī ʾa-wa-lam taʾtihim bayyinatu mā fī ṣ-ṣuḥufi l-ʾūlā

134.content: وَلَو أَنّا أَهلَكناهُم بِعَذابٍ مِن قَبلِهِ لَقالوا رَبَّنا لَولا أَرسَلتَ إِلَينا رَسولًا فَنَتَّبِعَ آياتِكَ مِن قَبلِ أَن نَذِلَّ وَنَخزىٰ
134.translation_eng: Had We destroyed them with a punishment before it,1 they would have surely said, ‘Our Lord! Why did You not send us an apostle so that we might follow Your signs before we were abased and disgraced?’That is, before the revelation of the Qurʾān.
134.transliteration: wa-law ʾannā ʾahlaknāhum bi-ʿadhābin min qablihī la-qālū rabbanā law-lā ʾarsalta ʾilaynā rasūlan fa-nattabiʿa ʾāyātika min qabli ʾan nadhilla wa-nakhzā

135.content: قُل كُلٌّ مُتَرَبِّصٌ فَتَرَبَّصوا ۖ فَسَتَعلَمونَ مَن أَصحابُ الصِّراطِ السَّوِيِّ وَمَنِ اهتَدىٰ
135.translation_eng: Say, ‘Each [of us] is waiting. So wait! Soon you will know who are the people of the right path, and who is guided.’
135.transliteration: qul kullun mutarabbiṣun fa-tarabbaṣū fa-sa-taʿlamūna man ʾaṣḥābu ṣ-ṣirāṭi s-sawiyyi wa-mani htadā

21.description: The surah that mentions the names of sixteen of The Prophets and Mary, illustrating the unity of the divine message. Accounts of several prophets (anbiyāʾ) appear in this surah from verse 48 ., hence its name. The surah stresses that fact that Muḥammad is a man like earlier prophets, and has been given the same message to declare the unity of God. It warns the disbelievers of the approaching Judgement from which there is no escape.

1.content: اقتَرَبَ لِلنّاسِ حِسابُهُم وَهُم في غَفلَةٍ مُعرِضونَ
1.translation_eng: Mankind’s reckoning has drawn near to them, yet they are disregardful in [their] obliviousness.
1.transliteration: iqtaraba li-n-nāsi ḥisābuhum wa-hum fī ghaflatin muʿriḍūna

2.content: ما يَأتيهِم مِن ذِكرٍ مِن رَبِّهِم مُحدَثٍ إِلَّا استَمَعوهُ وَهُم يَلعَبونَ
2.translation_eng: There does not come to them any new reminder from their Lord but they listen to it as they play around,
2.transliteration: mā yaʾtīhim min dhikrin min rabbihim muḥdathin ʾillā stamaʿūhu wa-hum yalʿabūna

3.content: لاهِيَةً قُلوبُهُم ۗ وَأَسَرُّوا النَّجوَى الَّذينَ ظَلَموا هَل هٰذا إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُكُم ۖ أَفَتَأتونَ السِّحرَ وَأَنتُم تُبصِرونَ
3.translation_eng: their hearts set on diversions. The wrongdoers secretly whisper together, [saying], ‘Is not this [man] just a human being like yourselves? Will you give in to magic with open eyes?’
3.transliteration: lāhiyatan qulūbuhum wa-ʾasarrū n-najwā lladhīna ẓalamū hal hādhā ʾillā basharun mithlukum ʾa-fa-taʾtūna s-siḥra wa-ʾantum tubṣirūna

4.content: قالَ رَبّي يَعلَمُ القَولَ فِي السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ وَهُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
4.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord knows every word [spoken] in the sky and the earth, and He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.’
4.transliteration: qāla rabbī yaʿlamu l-qawla fī s-samāʾi wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-huwa s-samīʿu l-ʿalīmu

5.content: بَل قالوا أَضغاثُ أَحلامٍ بَلِ افتَراهُ بَل هُوَ شاعِرٌ فَليَأتِنا بِآيَةٍ كَما أُرسِلَ الأَوَّلونَ
5.translation_eng: Rather they said, ‘[They are] confused nightmares!’ ‘Rather he has fabricated it!’ ‘Rather he is a poet!’ ‘Let him bring us a sign, like those sent to the ancients.’
5.transliteration: bal qālū ʾaḍghāthu ʾaḥlāmin bali ftarāhu bal huwa shāʿirun fa-l-yaʾtinā bi-ʾāyatin ka-mā ʾursila l-ʾawwalūna

6.content: ما آمَنَت قَبلَهُم مِن قَريَةٍ أَهلَكناها ۖ أَفَهُم يُؤمِنونَ
6.translation_eng: No town that We destroyed before them believed.1 Will these then have faith [if they are sent signs]?That is, they did not believe even after miracles were shown to them.
6.transliteration: mā ʾāmanat qablahum min qaryatin ʾahlaknāhā ʾa-fa-hum yuʾminūna

7.content: وَما أَرسَلنا قَبلَكَ إِلّا رِجالًا نوحي إِلَيهِم ۖ فَاسأَلوا أَهلَ الذِّكرِ إِن كُنتُم لا تَعلَمونَ
7.translation_eng: We did not send [any apostles] before you except as men, to whom We revealed. Ask the People of the Reminder1 if you do not know.Cf. 16:43.
7.transliteration: wa-mā ʾarsalnā qablaka ʾillā rijālan nūḥī ʾilayhim fa-sʾalū ʾahla dh-dhikri ʾin kuntum lā taʿlamūna

8.content: وَما جَعَلناهُم جَسَدًا لا يَأكُلونَ الطَّعامَ وَما كانوا خالِدينَ
8.translation_eng: We did not make them bodies that did not eat food, and they were not immortal.
8.transliteration: wa-mā jaʿalnāhum jasadan lā yaʾkulūna ṭ-ṭaʿāma wa-mā kānū khālidīna

9.content: ثُمَّ صَدَقناهُمُ الوَعدَ فَأَنجَيناهُم وَمَن نَشاءُ وَأَهلَكنَا المُسرِفينَ
9.translation_eng: Then We fulfilled Our promise to them, and We delivered them and whomever We wished, and We destroyed the profligates.
9.transliteration: thumma ṣadaqnāhumu l-waʿda fa-ʾanjaynāhum wa-man nashāʾu wa-ʾahlaknā l-musrifīna

10.content: لَقَد أَنزَلنا إِلَيكُم كِتابًا فيهِ ذِكرُكُم ۖ أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
10.translation_eng: Certainly We have sent down to you a Book in which there is an admonition for you. Do you not apply reason?
10.transliteration: la-qad ʾanzalnā ʾilaykum kitāban fīhi dhikrukum ʾa-fa-lā taʿqilūna

11.content: وَكَم قَصَمنا مِن قَريَةٍ كانَت ظالِمَةً وَأَنشَأنا بَعدَها قَومًا آخَرينَ
11.translation_eng: How many a town We have smashed that had been wrongdoing, and We brought forth another people after it.
11.transliteration: wa-kam qaṣamnā min qaryatin kānat ẓālimatan wa-ʾanshaʾnā baʿdahā qawman ʾākharīna

12.content: فَلَمّا أَحَسّوا بَأسَنا إِذا هُم مِنها يَركُضونَ
12.translation_eng: So when they sighted Our punishment, behold, they ran away from it.
12.transliteration: fa-lammā ʾaḥassū baʾsanā ʾidhā hum minhā yarkuḍūna

13.content: لا تَركُضوا وَارجِعوا إِلىٰ ما أُترِفتُم فيهِ وَمَساكِنِكُم لَعَلَّكُم تُسأَلونَ
13.translation_eng: ‘Do not run away! Return to the opulence you were given to enjoy and to your dwellings so that you may be questioned!’
13.transliteration: lā tarkuḍū wa-rjiʿū ʾilā mā ʾutriftum fīhi wa-masākinikum laʿallakum tusʾalūna

14.content: قالوا يا وَيلَنا إِنّا كُنّا ظالِمينَ
14.translation_eng: They said, ‘Woe to us! We have indeed been wrongdoers!’
14.transliteration: qālū yā-waylanā ʾinnā kunnā ẓālimīna

15.content: فَما زالَت تِلكَ دَعواهُم حَتّىٰ جَعَلناهُم حَصيدًا خامِدينَ
15.translation_eng: That remained their cry until We turned them into a mown field, stilled [like burnt ashes].
15.transliteration: fa-mā zālat tilka daʿwāhum ḥattā jaʿalnāhum ḥaṣīdan khāmidīna

16.content: وَما خَلَقنَا السَّماءَ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما لاعِبينَ
16.translation_eng: We did not create the sky and the earth and whatever is between them for play.
16.transliteration: wa-mā khalaqnā s-samāʾa wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-mā baynahumā lāʿibīna

17.content: لَو أَرَدنا أَن نَتَّخِذَ لَهوًا لَاتَّخَذناهُ مِن لَدُنّا إِن كُنّا فاعِلينَ
17.translation_eng: Had We desired to take up some diversion We would have surely taken it up with Ourselves, were We to do [so].
17.transliteration: law ʾaradnā ʾan nattakhidha lahwan la-ttakhadhnāhu min ladunnā ʾin kunnā fāʿilīna

18.content: بَل نَقذِفُ بِالحَقِّ عَلَى الباطِلِ فَيَدمَغُهُ فَإِذا هُوَ زاهِقٌ ۚ وَلَكُمُ الوَيلُ مِمّا تَصِفونَ
18.translation_eng: Rather We hurl the truth against falsehood, and it crushes its head, and behold, falsehood vanishes! And woe to you for what you allege [about Allah].
18.transliteration: bal naqdhifu bi-l-ḥaqqi ʿalā l-bāṭili fa-yadmaghuhū fa-ʾidhā huwa zāhiqun wa-lakumu l-waylu mimmā taṣifūna
