19.content: وَلَهُ مَن فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ وَمَن عِندَهُ لا يَستَكبِرونَ عَن عِبادَتِهِ وَلا يَستَحسِرونَ
19.translation_eng: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and those who are near Him do not disdain to worship Him, nor do they become weary.
19.transliteration: wa-lahū man fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-man ʿindahū lā yastakbirūna ʿan ʿibādatihī wa-lā yastaḥsirūna

20.content: يُسَبِّحونَ اللَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ لا يَفتُرونَ
20.translation_eng: They glorify [Him] night and day, and they do not flag.
20.transliteration: yusabbiḥūna l-layla wa-n-nahāra lā yafturūna

21.content: أَمِ اتَّخَذوا آلِهَةً مِنَ الأَرضِ هُم يُنشِرونَ
21.translation_eng: Have they taken gods from the earth who raise [the dead]?
21.transliteration: ʾami ttakhadhū ʾālihatan mina l-ʾarḍi hum yunshirūna

22.content: لَو كانَ فيهِما آلِهَةٌ إِلَّا اللَّهُ لَفَسَدَتا ۚ فَسُبحانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ العَرشِ عَمّا يَصِفونَ
22.translation_eng: Had there been gods in them1 other than Allah, they would surely have fallen apart. Clear is Allah, the Lord of the Throne, of what they allege [concerning Him].That is, in the heavens and the earth.
22.transliteration: law kāna fīhimā ʾālihatun ʾillā llāhu la-fasadatā fa-subḥāna llāhi rabbi l-ʿarshi ʿammā yaṣifūna

23.content: لا يُسأَلُ عَمّا يَفعَلُ وَهُم يُسأَلونَ
23.translation_eng: He is not questioned concerning what He does, but they are questioned.
23.transliteration: lā yusʾalu ʿammā yafʿalu wa-hum yusʾalūna

24.content: أَمِ اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِهِ آلِهَةً ۖ قُل هاتوا بُرهانَكُم ۖ هٰذا ذِكرُ مَن مَعِيَ وَذِكرُ مَن قَبلي ۗ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعلَمونَ الحَقَّ ۖ فَهُم مُعرِضونَ
24.translation_eng: Have they taken gods besides Him? Say, ‘Produce your evidence! This is a precept of those who are with me, and a precept of those [who went] before me.’ Rather most of them do not know the truth, and so they are disregardful.
24.transliteration: ʾami ttakhadhū min dūnihī ʾālihatan qul hātū burhānakum hādhā dhikru man maʿiya wa-dhikru man qablī bal ʾaktharuhum lā yaʿlamūna l-ḥaqqa fa-hum muʿriḍūna

25.content: وَما أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ مِن رَسولٍ إِلّا نوحي إِلَيهِ أَنَّهُ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا أَنا فَاعبُدونِ
25.translation_eng: We did not send any apostle before you but We revealed to him that ‘There is no god except Me; so worship Me.’
25.transliteration: wa-mā ʾarsalnā min qablika min rasūlin ʾillā nūḥī ʾilayhi ʾannahū lā ʾilāha ʾillā ʾana fa-ʿbudūni

26.content: وَقالُوا اتَّخَذَ الرَّحمٰنُ وَلَدًا ۗ سُبحانَهُ ۚ بَل عِبادٌ مُكرَمونَ
26.translation_eng: They say, ‘The All-beneficent has taken offsprings.’ Immaculate is He! Rather they are [His] honoured servants.
26.transliteration: wa-qālū ttakhadha r-raḥmānu waladan subḥānahū bal ʿibādun mukramūna

27.content: لا يَسبِقونَهُ بِالقَولِ وَهُم بِأَمرِهِ يَعمَلونَ
27.translation_eng: They do not venture to speak ahead of Him, and they act by His command.
27.transliteration: lā yasbiqūnahū bi-l-qawli wa-hum bi-ʾamrihī yaʿmalūna

28.content: يَعلَمُ ما بَينَ أَيديهِم وَما خَلفَهُم وَلا يَشفَعونَ إِلّا لِمَنِ ارتَضىٰ وَهُم مِن خَشيَتِهِ مُشفِقونَ
28.translation_eng: He knows that which is before them and that which is behind them, and they do not intercede except for someone He approves of, and they are apprehensive for the fear of Him.
28.transliteration: yaʿlamu mā bayna ʾaydīhim wa-mā khalfahum wa-lā yashfaʿūna ʾillā li-mani rtaḍā wa-hum min khashyatihī mushfiqūna

29.content: ۞ وَمَن يَقُل مِنهُم إِنّي إِلٰهٌ مِن دونِهِ فَذٰلِكَ نَجزيهِ جَهَنَّمَ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي الظّالِمينَ
29.translation_eng: Should any of them say, ‘I am a god besides Him,’ We will requite him with hell. Thus do We requite the wrongdoers.
29.transliteration: wa-man yaqul minhum ʾinnī ʾilāhun min dūnihī fa-dhālika najzīhi jahannama ka-dhālika najzī ẓ-ẓālimīna

30.content: أَوَلَم يَرَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَنَّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ كانَتا رَتقًا فَفَتَقناهُما ۖ وَجَعَلنا مِنَ الماءِ كُلَّ شَيءٍ حَيٍّ ۖ أَفَلا يُؤمِنونَ
30.translation_eng: Have the faithless not regarded that the heavens and the earth were interwoven and We unravelled them, and We made every living thing out of water? Will they not then have faith?
30.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yara lladhīna kafarū ʾanna s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa kānatā ratqan fa-fataqnāhumā wa-jaʿalnā mina l-māʾi kulla shayʾin ḥayyin ʾa-fa-lā yuʾminūna

31.content: وَجَعَلنا فِي الأَرضِ رَواسِيَ أَن تَميدَ بِهِم وَجَعَلنا فيها فِجاجًا سُبُلًا لَعَلَّهُم يَهتَدونَ
31.translation_eng: We set firm mountains in the earth lest it should shake with them, and We made broad ways in them so that they may be guided [to their destinations].
31.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā fī l-ʾarḍi rawāsiya ʾan tamīda bihim wa-jaʿalnā fīhā fijājan subulan laʿallahum yahtadūna

32.content: وَجَعَلنَا السَّماءَ سَقفًا مَحفوظًا ۖ وَهُم عَن آياتِها مُعرِضونَ
32.translation_eng: We made the sky a preserved roof and yet they are disregardful of its signs.
32.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā s-samāʾa saqfan maḥfūẓan wa-hum ʿan ʾāyātihā muʿriḍūna

33.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي خَلَقَ اللَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ وَالشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ في فَلَكٍ يَسبَحونَ
33.translation_eng: It is He who created the night and the day, the sun and the moon, each swimming in an orbit.
33.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī khalaqa l-layla wa-n-nahāra wa-sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara kullun fī falakin yasbaḥūna

34.content: وَما جَعَلنا لِبَشَرٍ مِن قَبلِكَ الخُلدَ ۖ أَفَإِن مِتَّ فَهُمُ الخالِدونَ
34.translation_eng: We did not give immortality to any human before you. If you are fated to die, will they live on forever?
34.transliteration: wa-mā jaʿalnā li-basharin min qablika l-khulda ʾa-fa-ʾin mitta fa-humu l-khālidūna

35.content: كُلُّ نَفسٍ ذائِقَةُ المَوتِ ۗ وَنَبلوكُم بِالشَّرِّ وَالخَيرِ فِتنَةً ۖ وَإِلَينا تُرجَعونَ
35.translation_eng: Every soul shall taste death, and We will test you with good and ill by way of test, and to Us you will be brought back.
35.transliteration: kullu nafsin dhāʾiqatu l-mawti wa-nablūkum bi-sh-sharri wa-l-khayri fitnatan wa-ʾilaynā turjaʿūna

36.content: وَإِذا رَآكَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إِن يَتَّخِذونَكَ إِلّا هُزُوًا أَهٰذَا الَّذي يَذكُرُ آلِهَتَكُم وَهُم بِذِكرِ الرَّحمٰنِ هُم كافِرونَ
36.translation_eng: Whenever the faithless see you they only take you in derision: ‘Is this the one who speaks ill of your gods?’ And they defy the remembrance of the All-beneficent.
36.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā raʾāka lladhīna kafarū ʾin yattakhidhūnaka ʾillā huzuwan ʾa-hādhā lladhī yadhkuru ʾālihatakum wa-hum bi-dhikri r-raḥmāni hum kāfirūna

37.content: خُلِقَ الإِنسانُ مِن عَجَلٍ ۚ سَأُريكُم آياتي فَلا تَستَعجِلونِ
37.translation_eng: Man is a creature of haste. Soon I will show you My signs. So do not ask Me to hasten.
37.transliteration: khuliqa l-ʾinsānu min ʿajalin sa-ʾurīkum ʾāyātī fa-lā tastaʿjilūni

38.content: وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هٰذَا الوَعدُ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
38.translation_eng: And they say, ‘When will this promise be fulfilled, should you be truthful?’
38.transliteration: wa-yaqūlūna matā hādhā l-waʿdu ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

39.content: لَو يَعلَمُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا حينَ لا يَكُفّونَ عَن وُجوهِهِمُ النّارَ وَلا عَن ظُهورِهِم وَلا هُم يُنصَرونَ
39.translation_eng: If only the faithless knew of the time when they will not be able to keep the Fire off their faces and their backs, nor will they be helped!1That is, had the faithless known their state in hell, they would not ask for the punishment to be hastened.
39.transliteration: law yaʿlamu lladhīna kafarū ḥīna lā yakuffūna ʿan wujūhihimu n-nāra wa-lā ʿan ẓuhūrihim wa-lā hum yunṣarūna

40.content: بَل تَأتيهِم بَغتَةً فَتَبهَتُهُم فَلا يَستَطيعونَ رَدَّها وَلا هُم يُنظَرونَ
40.translation_eng: Rather it will overtake them suddenly, dumbfounding them. So neither will they be able to avert it, nor will they be granted any respite.
40.transliteration: bal taʾtīhim baghtatan fa-tabhatuhum fa-lā yastaṭīʿūna raddahā wa-lā hum yunẓarūna

41.content: وَلَقَدِ استُهزِئَ بِرُسُلٍ مِن قَبلِكَ فَحاقَ بِالَّذينَ سَخِروا مِنهُم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
41.translation_eng: Apostles were certainly derided before you; but those who ridiculed them were besieged by what they had been deriding.
41.transliteration: wa-la-qadi stuhziʾa bi-rusulin min qablika fa-ḥāqa bi-lladhīna sakhirū minhum mā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

42.content: قُل مَن يَكلَؤُكُم بِاللَّيلِ وَالنَّهارِ مِنَ الرَّحمٰنِ ۗ بَل هُم عَن ذِكرِ رَبِّهِم مُعرِضونَ
42.translation_eng: Say, ‘Who can guard you, day and night, from [the punishment of] the All-beneficent?’ Rather they are disregardful of their Lord’s remembrance.
42.transliteration: qul man yaklaʾukum bi-l-layli wa-n-nahāri mina r-raḥmāni bal hum ʿan dhikri rabbihim muʿriḍūna

43.content: أَم لَهُم آلِهَةٌ تَمنَعُهُم مِن دونِنا ۚ لا يَستَطيعونَ نَصرَ أَنفُسِهِم وَلا هُم مِنّا يُصحَبونَ
43.translation_eng: Do they have gods besides Us to defend them? Neither can they help themselves, nor can they provide them with an escort against Us.
43.transliteration: ʾam lahum ʾālihatun tamnaʿuhum min dūninā lā yastaṭīʿūna naṣra ʾanfusihim wa-lā hum minnā yuṣḥabūna

44.content: بَل مَتَّعنا هٰؤُلاءِ وَآباءَهُم حَتّىٰ طالَ عَلَيهِمُ العُمُرُ ۗ أَفَلا يَرَونَ أَنّا نَأتِي الأَرضَ نَنقُصُها مِن أَطرافِها ۚ أَفَهُمُ الغالِبونَ
44.translation_eng: Rather We have provided for them and their fathers until they lived on for long years. Do they not see how We visit the land diminishing it at its edges?1 Are they the ones who will prevail?Cf. 13:41.
44.transliteration: bal mattaʿnā hāʾulāʾi wa-ʾābāʾahum ḥattā ṭāla ʿalayhimu l-ʿumuru ʾa-fa-lā yarawna ʾannā naʾtī l-ʾarḍa nanquṣuhā min ʾaṭrāfihā ʾa-fa-humu l-ghālibūna

45.content: قُل إِنَّما أُنذِرُكُم بِالوَحيِ ۚ وَلا يَسمَعُ الصُّمُّ الدُّعاءَ إِذا ما يُنذَرونَ
45.translation_eng: Say, ‘I indeed warn you by the means of revelation.’ But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.
45.transliteration: qul ʾinnamā ʾundhirukum bi-l-waḥyi wa-lā yasmaʿu ṣ-ṣummu d-duʿāʾa ʾidhā mā yundharūna

46.content: وَلَئِن مَسَّتهُم نَفحَةٌ مِن عَذابِ رَبِّكَ لَيَقولُنَّ يا وَيلَنا إِنّا كُنّا ظالِمينَ
46.translation_eng: Should a whiff of your Lord’s punishment touch them, they will surely say, ‘Woe to us! We have indeed been wrongdoers!’
46.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin massathum nafḥatun min ʿadhābi rabbika la-yaqūlunna yā-waylanā ʾinnā kunnā ẓālimīna

47.content: وَنَضَعُ المَوازينَ القِسطَ لِيَومِ القِيامَةِ فَلا تُظلَمُ نَفسٌ شَيئًا ۖ وَإِن كانَ مِثقالَ حَبَّةٍ مِن خَردَلٍ أَتَينا بِها ۗ وَكَفىٰ بِنا حاسِبينَ
47.translation_eng: We shall set up the scales of justice on the Day of Resurrection, and no soul will be wronged in the least. Even if it be the weight of a mustard seed We shall produce it and We suffice as reckoners.
47.transliteration: wa-naḍaʿu l-mawāzīna l-qisṭa li-yawmi l-qiyāmati fa-lā tuẓlamu nafsun shayʾan wa-ʾin kāna mithqāla ḥabbatin min khardalin ʾataynā bihā wa-kafā binā ḥāsibīna

48.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسىٰ وَهارونَ الفُرقانَ وَضِياءً وَذِكرًا لِلمُتَّقينَ
48.translation_eng: Certainly We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, a light and reminder for the Godwary.
48.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā mūsā wa-hārūna l-furqāna wa-ḍiyāʾan wa-dhikran li-l-muttaqīna

49.content: الَّذينَ يَخشَونَ رَبَّهُم بِالغَيبِ وَهُم مِنَ السّاعَةِ مُشفِقونَ
49.translation_eng: Those who fear their Lord in secret, and who are apprehensive of the Hour.
49.transliteration: alladhīna yakhshawna rabbahum bi-l-ghaybi wa-hum mina s-sāʿati mushfiqūna

50.content: وَهٰذا ذِكرٌ مُبارَكٌ أَنزَلناهُ ۚ أَفَأَنتُم لَهُ مُنكِرونَ
50.translation_eng: This is a blessed reminder which We have sent down. Will you then deny it?
50.transliteration: wa-hādhā dhikrun mubārakun ʾanzalnāhu ʾa-fa-ʾantum lahū munkirūna

51.content: ۞ وَلَقَد آتَينا إِبراهيمَ رُشدَهُ مِن قَبلُ وَكُنّا بِهِ عالِمينَ
51.translation_eng: Certainly We had given Abraham his rectitude before, and We knew him
51.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā ʾibrāhīma rushdahū min qablu wa-kunnā bihī ʿālimīna

52.content: إِذ قالَ لِأَبيهِ وَقَومِهِ ما هٰذِهِ التَّماثيلُ الَّتي أَنتُم لَها عاكِفونَ
52.translation_eng: when he said to his father and his people, ‘What are these images to which you keep on clinging?’
52.transliteration: ʾidh qāla li-ʾabīhi wa-qawmihī mā hādhihi t-tamāthīlu llatī ʾantum lahā ʿākifūna

53.content: قالوا وَجَدنا آباءَنا لَها عابِدينَ
53.translation_eng: They said, ‘We found our fathers worshipping them.’
53.transliteration: qālū wajadnā ʾābāʾanā lahā ʿābidīna

54.content: قالَ لَقَد كُنتُم أَنتُم وَآباؤُكُم في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
54.translation_eng: He said, ‘Certainly you and your fathers have been in manifest error.’
54.transliteration: qāla la-qad kuntum ʾantum wa-ʾābāʾukum fī ḍalālin mubīnin

55.content: قالوا أَجِئتَنا بِالحَقِّ أَم أَنتَ مِنَ اللّاعِبينَ
55.translation_eng: They said, ‘Are you telling the truth,1 or are you [just] kidding?’Or ‘Are you speaking seriously.’
55.transliteration: qālū ʾa-jiʾtanā bi-l-ḥaqqi ʾam ʾanta mina l-lāʿibīna

56.content: قالَ بَل رَبُّكُم رَبُّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ الَّذي فَطَرَهُنَّ وَأَنا عَلىٰ ذٰلِكُم مِنَ الشّاهِدينَ
56.translation_eng: He said, ‘Rather your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who originated them, and I am a witness to this.
56.transliteration: qāla bal rabbukum rabbu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi lladhī faṭarahunna wa-ʾana ʿalā dhālikum mina sh-shāhidīna

57.content: وَتَاللَّهِ لَأَكيدَنَّ أَصنامَكُم بَعدَ أَن تُوَلّوا مُدبِرينَ
57.translation_eng: By Allah, I will devise a stratagem against your idols after you have gone away.’
57.transliteration: wa-ta-llāhi la-ʾakīdanna ʾaṣnāmakum baʿda ʾan tuwallū mudbirīna

58.content: فَجَعَلَهُم جُذاذًا إِلّا كَبيرًا لَهُم لَعَلَّهُم إِلَيهِ يَرجِعونَ
58.translation_eng: So he broke them into pieces, —all except the biggest of them— so that they might come back to it.
58.transliteration: fa-jaʿalahum judhādhan ʾillā kabīran lahum laʿallahum ʾilayhi yarjiʿūna

59.content: قالوا مَن فَعَلَ هٰذا بِآلِهَتِنا إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الظّالِمينَ
59.translation_eng: They said, ‘Whoever has done this to Our gods?! He is indeed a wrongdoer!’
59.transliteration: qālū man faʿala hādhā bi-ʾālihatinā ʾinnahū la-mina ẓ-ẓālimīna

60.content: قالوا سَمِعنا فَتًى يَذكُرُهُم يُقالُ لَهُ إِبراهيمُ
60.translation_eng: They said, ‘We heard a young man speaking ill of them. He is called “Abraham.” ’
60.transliteration: qālū samiʿnā fatan yadhkuruhum yuqālu lahū ʾibrāhīmu

61.content: قالوا فَأتوا بِهِ عَلىٰ أَعيُنِ النّاسِ لَعَلَّهُم يَشهَدونَ
61.translation_eng: They said, ‘Bring him before the people’s eyes so that they may bear witness [against him].’
61.transliteration: qālū fa-ʾtū bihī ʿalā ʾaʿyuni n-nāsi laʿallahum yashhadūna

62.content: قالوا أَأَنتَ فَعَلتَ هٰذا بِآلِهَتِنا يا إِبراهيمُ
62.translation_eng: They said, ‘Was it you who did this to our gods, O Abraham?’
62.transliteration: qālū ʾa-ʾanta faʿalta hādhā bi-ʾālihatinā yā-ʾibrāhīmu

63.content: قالَ بَل فَعَلَهُ كَبيرُهُم هٰذا فَاسأَلوهُم إِن كانوا يَنطِقونَ
63.translation_eng: He said, ‘Rather it was this biggest of them who did it! Ask them, if they can speak.’
63.transliteration: qāla bal faʿalahū kabīruhum hādhā fa-sʾalūhum ʾin kānū yanṭiqūna

64.content: فَرَجَعوا إِلىٰ أَنفُسِهِم فَقالوا إِنَّكُم أَنتُمُ الظّالِمونَ
64.translation_eng: Thereat they came to themselves and said [to one another], ‘Indeed it is you who are the wrongdoers!’
64.transliteration: fa-rajaʿū ʾilā ʾanfusihim fa-qālū ʾinnakum ʾantumu ẓ-ẓālimūna

65.content: ثُمَّ نُكِسوا عَلىٰ رُءوسِهِم لَقَد عَلِمتَ ما هٰؤُلاءِ يَنطِقونَ
65.translation_eng: Then they hung their heads. [They said], ‘You certainly know that they cannot speak.’
65.transliteration: thumma nukisū ʿalā ruʾūsihim la-qad ʿalimta mā hāʾulāʾi yanṭiqūna

66.content: قالَ أَفَتَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَنفَعُكُم شَيئًا وَلا يَضُرُّكُم
66.translation_eng: He said, ‘Do you then worship, besides Allah, that which cannot cause you any benefit or harm?
66.transliteration: qāla ʾa-fa-taʿbudūna min dūni llāhi mā lā yanfaʿukum shayʾan wa-lā yaḍurrukum

67.content: أُفٍّ لَكُم وَلِما تَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ۖ أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
67.translation_eng: Fie on you and what you worship besides Allah! Do you not apply reason?’
67.transliteration: ʾuffin lakum wa-li-mā taʿbudūna min dūni llāhi ʾa-fa-lā taʿqilūna

68.content: قالوا حَرِّقوهُ وَانصُروا آلِهَتَكُم إِن كُنتُم فاعِلينَ
68.translation_eng: They said, ‘Burn him, and help your gods, if you are to do anything!’
68.transliteration: qālū ḥarriqūhu wa-nṣurū ʾālihatakum ʾin kuntum fāʿilīna

69.content: قُلنا يا نارُ كوني بَردًا وَسَلامًا عَلىٰ إِبراهيمَ
69.translation_eng: We said, ‘O fire! Be cool and safe for Abraham!’
69.transliteration: qulnā yā-nāru kūnī bardan wa-salāman ʿalā ʾibrāhīma

70.content: وَأَرادوا بِهِ كَيدًا فَجَعَلناهُمُ الأَخسَرينَ
70.translation_eng: They sought to outmaneuver him, but We made them the biggest losers.
70.transliteration: wa-ʾarādū bihī kaydan fa-jaʿalnāhumu l-ʾakhsarīna

71.content: وَنَجَّيناهُ وَلوطًا إِلَى الأَرضِ الَّتي بارَكنا فيها لِلعالَمينَ
71.translation_eng: We delivered him and Lot toward the land which We have blessed for all nations.1That is, Canaan.
71.transliteration: wa-najjaynāhu wa-lūṭan ʾilā l-ʾarḍi llatī bāraknā fīhā li-l-ʿālamīna

72.content: وَوَهَبنا لَهُ إِسحاقَ وَيَعقوبَ نافِلَةً ۖ وَكُلًّا جَعَلنا صالِحينَ
72.translation_eng: And We gave him Isaac, and Jacob as well for a grandson,1 and each of them We made righteous.In a tradition of al-Imam al-Ṣādiq (ʿa), nāfilatan here is interpreted as meaning walad al-walad nāfilatan. Cf. Maʿānī al-akhbār, p. 225.
72.transliteration: wa-wahabnā lahū ʾisḥāqa wa-yaʿqūba nāfilatan wa-kullan jaʿalnā ṣāliḥīna

73.content: وَجَعَلناهُم أَئِمَّةً يَهدونَ بِأَمرِنا وَأَوحَينا إِلَيهِم فِعلَ الخَيراتِ وَإِقامَ الصَّلاةِ وَإيتاءَ الزَّكاةِ ۖ وَكانوا لَنا عابِدينَ
73.translation_eng: We made them imams, guiding by Our command, and We revealed to them the performance of good deeds, the maintenance of prayers, and the giving of zakāt, and they used to worship Us.
73.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnāhum ʾaʾimmatan yahdūna bi-ʾamrinā wa-ʾawḥaynā ʾilayhim fiʿla l-khayrāti wa-ʾiqāma ṣ-ṣalāti wa-ʾītāʾa z-zakāti wa-kānū lanā ʿābidīna

74.content: وَلوطًا آتَيناهُ حُكمًا وَعِلمًا وَنَجَّيناهُ مِنَ القَريَةِ الَّتي كانَت تَعمَلُ الخَبائِثَ ۗ إِنَّهُم كانوا قَومَ سَوءٍ فاسِقينَ
74.translation_eng: We gave judgement and knowledge to Lot, and We delivered him from the town which used to commit vicious acts. Indeed they were an evil and profligate lot.
74.transliteration: wa-lūṭan ʾātaynāhu ḥukman wa-ʿilman wa-najjaynāhu mina l-qaryati llatī kānat taʿmalu l-khabāʾitha ʾinnahum kānū qawma sawʾin fāsiqīna

75.content: وَأَدخَلناهُ في رَحمَتِنا ۖ إِنَّهُ مِنَ الصّالِحينَ
75.translation_eng: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed he was one of the righteous.
75.transliteration: wa-ʾadkhalnāhu fī raḥmatinā ʾinnahū mina ṣ-ṣāliḥīna

76.content: وَنوحًا إِذ نادىٰ مِن قَبلُ فَاستَجَبنا لَهُ فَنَجَّيناهُ وَأَهلَهُ مِنَ الكَربِ العَظيمِ
76.translation_eng: And before that Noah, when he called out, We responded to him and delivered him and his family from the great agony.
76.transliteration: wa-nūḥan ʾidh nādā min qablu fa-stajabnā lahū fa-najjaynāhu wa-ʾahlahū mina l-karbi l-ʿaẓīmi

77.content: وَنَصَرناهُ مِنَ القَومِ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا ۚ إِنَّهُم كانوا قَومَ سَوءٍ فَأَغرَقناهُم أَجمَعينَ
77.translation_eng: And We helped him against the people who denied Our signs. They were indeed an evil lot; so We drowned them all.
77.transliteration: wa-naṣarnāhu mina l-qawmi lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā ʾinnahum kānū qawma sawʾin fa-ʾaghraqnāhum ʾajmaʿīna

78.content: وَداوودَ وَسُلَيمانَ إِذ يَحكُمانِ فِي الحَرثِ إِذ نَفَشَت فيهِ غَنَمُ القَومِ وَكُنّا لِحُكمِهِم شاهِدينَ
78.translation_eng: And David and Solomon when they gave judgement concerning the tillage when the sheep of some people strayed into it by night, and We were witness to their judgement.
78.transliteration: wa-dāwūda wa-sulaymāna ʾidh yaḥkumāni fī l-ḥarthi ʾidh nafashat fīhi ghanamu l-qawmi wa-kunnā li-ḥukmihim shāhidīna

79.content: فَفَهَّمناها سُلَيمانَ ۚ وَكُلًّا آتَينا حُكمًا وَعِلمًا ۚ وَسَخَّرنا مَعَ داوودَ الجِبالَ يُسَبِّحنَ وَالطَّيرَ ۚ وَكُنّا فاعِلينَ
79.translation_eng: We gave its understanding to Solomon, and to each We gave judgement and knowledge. And We disposed the mountains and the birds to glorify [Us] with David, and We have been the doer [of such things].
79.transliteration: fa-fahhamnāhā sulaymāna wa-kullan ʾātaynā ḥukman wa-ʿilman wa-sakhkharnā maʿa dāwūda l-jibāla yusabbiḥna wa-ṭ-ṭayra wa-kunnā fāʿilīna

80.content: وَعَلَّمناهُ صَنعَةَ لَبوسٍ لَكُم لِتُحصِنَكُم مِن بَأسِكُم ۖ فَهَل أَنتُم شاكِرونَ
80.translation_eng: We taught him the making of coats of mail for you, to protect you from your [own] violence. Will you then be grateful?
80.transliteration: wa-ʿallamnāhu ṣanʿata labūsin lakum li-tuḥṣinakum min baʾsikum fa-hal ʾantum shākirūna

81.content: وَلِسُلَيمانَ الرّيحَ عاصِفَةً تَجري بِأَمرِهِ إِلَى الأَرضِ الَّتي بارَكنا فيها ۚ وَكُنّا بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عالِمينَ
81.translation_eng: And for Solomon [We disposed] the tempestuous wind which blew by his command toward the land which We have blessed, and We have knowledge of all things.
81.transliteration: wa-li-sulaymāna r-rīḥa ʿāṣifatan tajrī bi-ʾamrihī ʾilā l-ʾarḍi llatī bāraknā fīhā wa-kunnā bi-kulli shayʾin ʿālimīna

82.content: وَمِنَ الشَّياطينِ مَن يَغوصونَ لَهُ وَيَعمَلونَ عَمَلًا دونَ ذٰلِكَ ۖ وَكُنّا لَهُم حافِظينَ
82.translation_eng: Among the devils were some who dived for him and performed tasks other than that, and We were watchful over them.
82.transliteration: wa-mina sh-shayāṭīni man yaghūṣūna lahū wa-yaʿmalūna ʿamalan dūna dhālika wa-kunnā lahum ḥāfiẓīna

83.content: ۞ وَأَيّوبَ إِذ نادىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنّي مَسَّنِيَ الضُّرُّ وَأَنتَ أَرحَمُ الرّاحِمينَ
83.translation_eng: And Job, when he called out to his Lord, ‘Indeed distress has befallen me, and You are the most merciful of the merciful.’
83.transliteration: wa-ʾayyūba ʾidh nādā rabbahū ʾannī massaniya ḍ-ḍurru wa-ʾanta ʾarḥamu r-rāḥimīna

84.content: فَاستَجَبنا لَهُ فَكَشَفنا ما بِهِ مِن ضُرٍّ ۖ وَآتَيناهُ أَهلَهُ وَمِثلَهُم مَعَهُم رَحمَةً مِن عِندِنا وَذِكرىٰ لِلعابِدينَ
84.translation_eng: So We answered his prayer and removed his distress, and We gave him [back] his family along with others like them, as a mercy from Us, and an admonition for the devout.
84.transliteration: fa-stajabnā lahū fa-kashafnā mā bihī min ḍurrin wa-ʾātaynāhu ʾahlahū wa-mithlahum maʿahum raḥmatan min ʿindinā wa-dhikrā li-l-ʿābidīna

85.content: وَإِسماعيلَ وَإِدريسَ وَذَا الكِفلِ ۖ كُلٌّ مِنَ الصّابِرينَ
85.translation_eng: And Ishmael, Idris, and Dhul-Kifl —each of them was among the patient.
85.transliteration: wa-ʾismāʿīla wa-ʾidrīsa wa-dhā l-kifli kullun mina ṣ-ṣābirīna

86.content: وَأَدخَلناهُم في رَحمَتِنا ۖ إِنَّهُم مِنَ الصّالِحينَ
86.translation_eng: We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed they were among the righteous.
86.transliteration: wa-ʾadkhalnāhum fī raḥmatinā ʾinnahum mina ṣ-ṣāliḥīna

87.content: وَذَا النّونِ إِذ ذَهَبَ مُغاضِبًا فَظَنَّ أَن لَن نَقدِرَ عَلَيهِ فَنادىٰ فِي الظُّلُماتِ أَن لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا أَنتَ سُبحانَكَ إِنّي كُنتُ مِنَ الظّالِمينَ
87.translation_eng: And the Man of the Fish, when he left in a rage, thinking that We would not put him to hardship. Then he cried out in the darkness, ‘There is no god except You! You are immaculate! I have indeed been among the wrongdoers!’
87.transliteration: wa-dhā n-nūni ʾidh dhahaba mughāḍiban fa-ẓanna ʾan lan naqdira ʿalayhi fa-nādā fī ẓ-ẓulumāti ʾan lā ʾilāha ʾillā ʾanta subḥānaka ʾinnī kuntu mina ẓ-ẓālimīna

88.content: فَاستَجَبنا لَهُ وَنَجَّيناهُ مِنَ الغَمِّ ۚ وَكَذٰلِكَ نُنجِي المُؤمِنينَ
88.translation_eng: So We answered his prayer and delivered him from the agony; and thus do We deliver the faithful.
88.transliteration: fa-stajabnā lahū wa-najjaynāhu mina l-ghammi wa-ka-dhālika nunjī l-muʾminīna

89.content: وَزَكَرِيّا إِذ نادىٰ رَبَّهُ رَبِّ لا تَذَرني فَردًا وَأَنتَ خَيرُ الوارِثينَ
89.translation_eng: And Zechariah, when he cried out to his Lord, ‘My Lord! Do not leave me without an heir, and You are the best of inheritors.’
89.transliteration: wa-zakariyyā ʾidh nādā rabbahū rabbi lā tadharnī fardan wa-ʾanta khayru l-wārithīna

90.content: فَاستَجَبنا لَهُ وَوَهَبنا لَهُ يَحيىٰ وَأَصلَحنا لَهُ زَوجَهُ ۚ إِنَّهُم كانوا يُسارِعونَ فِي الخَيراتِ وَيَدعونَنا رَغَبًا وَرَهَبًا ۖ وَكانوا لَنا خاشِعينَ
90.translation_eng: So We answered his prayer, and gave him John, and remedied his wife[’s infertility] for him. Indeed they were active in [performing] good works, and they would supplicate Us with eagerness and awe and were humble before Us.
90.transliteration: fa-stajabnā lahū wa-wahabnā lahū yaḥyā wa-ʾaṣlaḥnā lahū zawjahū ʾinnahum kānū yusāriʿūna fī l-khayrāti wa-yadʿūnanā raghaban wa-rahaban wa-kānū lanā khāshiʿīna

91.content: وَالَّتي أَحصَنَت فَرجَها فَنَفَخنا فيها مِن روحِنا وَجَعَلناها وَابنَها آيَةً لِلعالَمينَ
91.translation_eng: And her who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her Our spirit,1 and made her and her son a sign for all the nations.Or ‘of Our spirit.’
91.transliteration: wa-llatī ʾaḥṣanat farjahā fa-nafakhnā fīhā min rūḥinā wa-jaʿalnāhā wa-bnahā ʾāyatan li-l-ʿālamīna

92.content: إِنَّ هٰذِهِ أُمَّتُكُم أُمَّةً واحِدَةً وَأَنا رَبُّكُم فَاعبُدونِ
92.translation_eng: Indeed this community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord. So worship Me.
92.transliteration: ʾinna hādhihī ʾummatukum ʾummatan wāḥidatan wa-ʾana rabbukum fa-ʿbudūni

93.content: وَتَقَطَّعوا أَمرَهُم بَينَهُم ۖ كُلٌّ إِلَينا راجِعونَ
93.translation_eng: They1 have fragmented their religion among themselves. Everyone of them will return to Us.That is, the earlier religious communities, such as Jews and Christians. Cf. 23:53.
93.transliteration: wa-taqaṭṭaʿū ʾamrahum baynahum kullun ʾilaynā rājiʿūna

94.content: فَمَن يَعمَل مِنَ الصّالِحاتِ وَهُوَ مُؤمِنٌ فَلا كُفرانَ لِسَعيِهِ وَإِنّا لَهُ كاتِبونَ
94.translation_eng: Whoever does righteous deeds, should he be faithful, his endeavour shall not go unappreciated, and We will indeed write it for him.
94.transliteration: fa-man yaʿmal mina ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa-huwa muʾminun fa-lā kufrāna li-saʿyihī wa-ʾinnā lahū kātibūna

95.content: وَحَرامٌ عَلىٰ قَريَةٍ أَهلَكناها أَنَّهُم لا يَرجِعونَ
95.translation_eng: It is forbidden for [the people of] any town that We have destroyed [to return to the world]: they shall not return.
95.transliteration: wa-ḥarāmun ʿalā qaryatin ʾahlaknāhā ʾannahum lā yarjiʿūna

96.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا فُتِحَت يَأجوجُ وَمَأجوجُ وَهُم مِن كُلِّ حَدَبٍ يَنسِلونَ
96.translation_eng: When Gog and Magog are let loose, and they race down from every slope,1Or, according to a less familiar reading (jadath, for ḥadab), ‘they will be scrambling out of every grave.’ Cf. 36:51.
96.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā futiḥat yaʾjūju wa-maʾjūju wa-hum min kulli ḥadabin yansilūna

97.content: وَاقتَرَبَ الوَعدُ الحَقُّ فَإِذا هِيَ شاخِصَةٌ أَبصارُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا يا وَيلَنا قَد كُنّا في غَفلَةٍ مِن هٰذا بَل كُنّا ظالِمينَ
97.translation_eng: and the true promise draws near [to its fulfillment], behold, the faithless will look on with a fixed gaze: ‘Woe to us! We have certainly been oblivious of this! Rather we have been wrongdoers!’
97.transliteration: wa-qtaraba l-waʿdu l-ḥaqqu fa-ʾidhā hiya shākhiṣatun ʾabṣāru lladhīna kafarū yā-waylanā qad kunnā fī ghaflatin min hādhā bal kunnā ẓālimīna

98.content: إِنَّكُم وَما تَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ حَصَبُ جَهَنَّمَ أَنتُم لَها وارِدونَ
98.translation_eng: Indeed you and what you worship besides Allah shall be fuel for hell, and you will come to it
98.transliteration: ʾinnakum wa-mā taʿbudūna min dūni llāhi ḥaṣabu jahannama ʾantum lahā wāridūna

99.content: لَو كانَ هٰؤُلاءِ آلِهَةً ما وَرَدوها ۖ وَكُلٌّ فيها خالِدونَ
99.translation_eng: —had they been gods, they would not have come to it— and they will all remain in it [forever].
99.transliteration: law kāna hāʾulāʾi ʾālihatan mā waradūhā wa-kullun fīhā khālidūna

100.content: لَهُم فيها زَفيرٌ وَهُم فيها لا يَسمَعونَ
100.translation_eng: Their lot therein will be groaning, and they will not hear anything in it.
100.transliteration: lahum fīhā zafīrun wa-hum fīhā lā yasmaʿūna

101.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ سَبَقَت لَهُم مِنَّا الحُسنىٰ أُولٰئِكَ عَنها مُبعَدونَ
101.translation_eng: Indeed those to whom there has gone beforehand [the promise of] the best reward from Us will be kept away from it.
101.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna sabaqat lahum minnā l-ḥusnā ʾulāʾika ʿanhā mubʿadūna

102.content: لا يَسمَعونَ حَسيسَها ۖ وَهُم في مَا اشتَهَت أَنفُسُهُم خالِدونَ
102.translation_eng: They will not hear even its faint sound and they will remain [forever] in what their souls desire.
102.transliteration: lā yasmaʿūna ḥasīsahā wa-hum fī mā shtahat ʾanfusuhum khālidūna

103.content: لا يَحزُنُهُمُ الفَزَعُ الأَكبَرُ وَتَتَلَقّاهُمُ المَلائِكَةُ هٰذا يَومُكُمُ الَّذي كُنتُم توعَدونَ
103.translation_eng: The Great Terror will not upset them, and the angels will receive them [saying]: ‘This is your day which you were promised.’
103.transliteration: lā yaḥzunuhumu l-fazaʿu l-ʾakbaru wa-tatalaqqāhumu l-malāʾikatu hādhā yawmukumu lladhī kuntum tūʿadūna

104.content: يَومَ نَطوِي السَّماءَ كَطَيِّ السِّجِلِّ لِلكُتُبِ ۚ كَما بَدَأنا أَوَّلَ خَلقٍ نُعيدُهُ ۚ وَعدًا عَلَينا ۚ إِنّا كُنّا فاعِلينَ
104.translation_eng: The day We shall roll up the sky, like the rolling of the scrolls for writings. We will bring it back as We began the first creation —a promise [binding] on Us. [That] indeed We will do.
104.transliteration: yawma naṭwī s-samāʾa ka-ṭayyi s-sijilli li-l-kutubi ka-mā badaʾnā ʾawwala khalqin nuʿīduhū waʿdan ʿalaynā ʾinnā kunnā fāʿilīna

105.content: وَلَقَد كَتَبنا فِي الزَّبورِ مِن بَعدِ الذِّكرِ أَنَّ الأَرضَ يَرِثُها عِبادِيَ الصّالِحونَ
105.translation_eng: Certainly We wrote in the Psalms, after the Torah: ‘Indeed My righteous servants shall inherit the earth.’
105.transliteration: wa-la-qad katabnā fī z-zabūri min baʿdi dh-dhikri ʾanna l-ʾarḍa yarithuhā ʿibādiya ṣ-ṣāliḥūna

106.content: إِنَّ في هٰذا لَبَلاغًا لِقَومٍ عابِدينَ
106.translation_eng: There is indeed in this a proclamation for a devout people.
106.transliteration: ʾinna fī hādhā la-balāghan li-qawmin ʿābidīna

107.translation_eng: We did not send you but as a mercy to all the nations.1Or ‘to all the worlds.’

108.content: قُل إِنَّما يوحىٰ إِلَيَّ أَنَّما إِلٰهُكُم إِلٰهٌ واحِدٌ ۖ فَهَل أَنتُم مُسلِمونَ
108.translation_eng: Say, ‘It has been revealed to me that your God is the One God. So will you submit?’
108.transliteration: qul ʾinnamā yūḥā ʾilayya ʾannamā ʾilāhukum ʾilāhun wāḥidun fa-hal ʾantum muslimūna

109.content: فَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَقُل آذَنتُكُم عَلىٰ سَواءٍ ۖ وَإِن أَدري أَقَريبٌ أَم بَعيدٌ ما توعَدونَ
109.translation_eng: But if they turn away, say, ‘I have proclaimed to you all alike, and I do not know whether what you have been promised is far or near.
109.transliteration: fa-ʾin tawallaw fa-qul ʾādhantukum ʿalā sawāʾin wa-ʾin ʾadrī ʾa-qarībun ʾam baʿīdun mā tūʿadūna

110.content: إِنَّهُ يَعلَمُ الجَهرَ مِنَ القَولِ وَيَعلَمُ ما تَكتُمونَ
110.translation_eng: Indeed He knows whatever is spoken aloud, and He knows whatever you conceal.
110.transliteration: ʾinnahū yaʿlamu l-jahra mina l-qawli wa-yaʿlamu mā taktumūna

111.content: وَإِن أَدري لَعَلَّهُ فِتنَةٌ لَكُم وَمَتاعٌ إِلىٰ حينٍ
111.translation_eng: I do not know —maybe it is a trial for you and an enjoyment for a while.’
111.transliteration: wa-ʾin ʾadrī laʿallahū fitnatun lakum wa-matāʿun ʾilā ḥīnin

112.content: قالَ رَبِّ احكُم بِالحَقِّ ۗ وَرَبُّنَا الرَّحمٰنُ المُستَعانُ عَلىٰ ما تَصِفونَ
112.translation_eng: He said,1 ‘My Lord! Judge with justice.’ ‘Our Lord is the All-beneficent; [He is our] resort against what you allege.’Or ‘Say,’ according to an alternate reading (qul instead of qāla).
112.transliteration: qāla rabbi ḥkum bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-rabbunā r-raḥmānu l-mustaʿānu ʿalā mā taṣifūna

22.description: The surah wherein God commands Abraham to proclaim to all humanity the obligation of The Pilgrimage to the Ancient House of God—The Kaʿbah—in Mecca. Verse 26 . of this surah relate the ḥajj pilgrimage, after which it is named. This theme is introduced by the condemnation of those who bar the believers from access to the Sacred Mosque and is followed by permission to fight when attacked. It begins with the Day of Judgement and castigates those who worship useless idols, describing them later as powerless to create even a fly. The surah ends by urging the Muslims to persevere in following the faith of Abraham.The surah is also known as: The Hajj-Pilgrimage, Tile Pilgrimage.

1.content: يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ اتَّقوا رَبَّكُم ۚ إِنَّ زَلزَلَةَ السّاعَةِ شَيءٌ عَظيمٌ
1.translation_eng: O mankind! Be wary of your Lord! Indeed the quake of the Hour is a terrible thing.
1.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ttaqū rabbakum ʾinna zalzalata s-sāʿati shayʾun ʿaẓīmun

2.content: يَومَ تَرَونَها تَذهَلُ كُلُّ مُرضِعَةٍ عَمّا أَرضَعَت وَتَضَعُ كُلُّ ذاتِ حَملٍ حَملَها وَتَرَى النّاسَ سُكارىٰ وَما هُم بِسُكارىٰ وَلٰكِنَّ عَذابَ اللَّهِ شَديدٌ
2.translation_eng: The day that you will see it, every suckling female will neglect what she suckled, and every pregnant female will deliver her burden, and you will see the people drunk, yet they will not be drunken, but Allah’s punishment is severe.
2.transliteration: yawma tarawnahā tadhhalu kullu murḍiʿatin ʿammā ʾarḍaʿat wa-taḍaʿu kullu dhāti ḥamlin ḥamlahā wa-tarā n-nāsa sukārā wa-mā hum bi-sukārā wa-lākinna ʿadhāba llāhi shadīdun

3.content: وَمِنَ النّاسِ مَن يُجادِلُ فِي اللَّهِ بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ وَيَتَّبِعُ كُلَّ شَيطانٍ مَريدٍ
3.translation_eng: Among the people are those who dispute about Allah without any knowledge, and follow every froward devil,
3.transliteration: wa-mina n-nāsi man yujādilu fī llāhi bi-ghayri ʿilmin wa-yattabiʿu kulla shayṭānin marīdin

4.content: كُتِبَ عَلَيهِ أَنَّهُ مَن تَوَلّاهُ فَأَنَّهُ يُضِلُّهُ وَيَهديهِ إِلىٰ عَذابِ السَّعيرِ
4.translation_eng: about whom it has been decreed that should anyone take him for a friend, he will lead him astray, and conduct him toward the punishment of the Blaze.
4.transliteration: kutiba ʿalayhi ʾannahū man tawallāhu fa-ʾannahū yuḍilluhū wa-yahdīhi ʾilā ʿadhābi s-saʿīri

5.content: يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ إِن كُنتُم في رَيبٍ مِنَ البَعثِ فَإِنّا خَلَقناكُم مِن تُرابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُطفَةٍ ثُمَّ مِن عَلَقَةٍ ثُمَّ مِن مُضغَةٍ مُخَلَّقَةٍ وَغَيرِ مُخَلَّقَةٍ لِنُبَيِّنَ لَكُم ۚ وَنُقِرُّ فِي الأَرحامِ ما نَشاءُ إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ثُمَّ نُخرِجُكُم طِفلًا ثُمَّ لِتَبلُغوا أَشُدَّكُم ۖ وَمِنكُم مَن يُتَوَفّىٰ وَمِنكُم مَن يُرَدُّ إِلىٰ أَرذَلِ العُمُرِ لِكَيلا يَعلَمَ مِن بَعدِ عِلمٍ شَيئًا ۚ وَتَرَى الأَرضَ هامِدَةً فَإِذا أَنزَلنا عَلَيهَا الماءَ اهتَزَّت وَرَبَت وَأَنبَتَت مِن كُلِّ زَوجٍ بَهيجٍ
5.translation_eng: O people! If you are in doubt about the resurrection, [consider that] We indeed created you from dust, then from a drop of [seminal] fluid, then from a clinging mass,1 then from a fleshy tissue,2 partly formed and partly unformed, so that We may manifest [Our power] to you. We establish in the wombs whatever We wish for a specified term, then We bring you forth as infants, then [We rear you] so that you may come of age. [Then] there are some of you who are taken away, and there are some of you who are relegated to the nethermost age, so that he knows nothing after [having possessed] some knowledge. And you see the earth torpid, yet when We send down water upon it, it stirs and swells, and grows every delightful kind [of plant].That is, an embryo; cf. 23:13-14; 40:67; 75:38.That is, the fetus in the early stages of its development; cf. 23:13.
5.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ʾin kuntum fī raybin mina l-baʿthi fa-ʾinnā khalaqnākum min turābin thumma min nuṭfatin thumma min ʿalaqatin thumma min muḍghatin mukhallaqatin wa-ghayri mukhallaqatin li-nubayyina lakum wa-nuqirru fī l-ʾarḥāmi mā nashāʾu ʾilā ʾajalin musamman thumma nukhrijukum ṭiflan thumma li-tablughū ʾashuddakum wa-minkum man yutawaffā wa-minkum man yuraddu ʾilā ʾardhali l-ʿumuri li-kay-lā yaʿlama min baʿdi ʿilmin shayʾan wa-tarā l-ʾarḍa hāmidatan fa-ʾidhā ʾanzalnā ʿalayhā l-māʾa htazzat wa-rabat wa-ʾanbatat min kulli zawjin bahījin

6.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الحَقُّ وَأَنَّهُ يُحيِي المَوتىٰ وَأَنَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
6.translation_eng: That is because Allah is the Reality and it is He who revives the dead, and He has power over all things,
6.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾanna llāha huwa l-ḥaqqu wa-ʾannahū yuḥyi l-mawtā wa-ʾannahū ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

7.content: وَأَنَّ السّاعَةَ آتِيَةٌ لا رَيبَ فيها وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَبعَثُ مَن فِي القُبورِ
7.translation_eng: and the Hour is bound to come, there is no doubt in it, and Allah will resurrect those who are in the graves.
7.transliteration: wa-ʾanna s-sāʿata ʾātiyatun lā rayba fīhā wa-ʾanna llāha yabʿathu man fī l-qubūri

8.content: وَمِنَ النّاسِ مَن يُجادِلُ فِي اللَّهِ بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ وَلا هُدًى وَلا كِتابٍ مُنيرٍ
8.translation_eng: Among the people are those who dispute concerning Allah without any knowledge or guidance, or an enlightening Book,
8.transliteration: wa-mina n-nāsi man yujādilu fī llāhi bi-ghayri ʿilmin wa-lā hudan wa-lā kitābin munīrin

9.content: ثانِيَ عِطفِهِ لِيُضِلَّ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ لَهُ فِي الدُّنيا خِزيٌ ۖ وَنُذيقُهُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ عَذابَ الحَريقِ
9.translation_eng: turning aside disdainfully to lead [others] astray from the way of Allah. For such there is disgrace in this world, and on the Day of Resurrection We will make him taste the punishment of the burning:
9.transliteration: thāniya ʿiṭfihī li-yuḍilla ʿan sabīli llāhi lahū fī d-dunyā khizyun wa-nudhīquhū yawma l-qiyāmati ʿadhāba l-ḥarīqi

10.content: ذٰلِكَ بِما قَدَّمَت يَداكَ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ لَيسَ بِظَلّامٍ لِلعَبيدِ
10.translation_eng: ‘That is because of what your hands have sent ahead,1 and because Allah is not tyrannical to the servants.’Or ‘prepared,’ or ‘committed.’
10.transliteration: dhālika bi-mā qaddamat yadāka wa-ʾanna llāha laysa bi-ẓallāmin li-l-ʿabīdi

11.content: وَمِنَ النّاسِ مَن يَعبُدُ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ حَرفٍ ۖ فَإِن أَصابَهُ خَيرٌ اطمَأَنَّ بِهِ ۖ وَإِن أَصابَتهُ فِتنَةٌ انقَلَبَ عَلىٰ وَجهِهِ خَسِرَ الدُّنيا وَالآخِرَةَ ۚ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الخُسرانُ المُبينُ
11.translation_eng: And among the people are those who worship Allah on the [very] fringe: if good fortune befalls him, he is content with it; but if an ordeal visits him he makes a turnabout, to become a loser in the world and the Hereafter. That is the manifest loss.
11.transliteration: wa-mina n-nāsi man yaʿbudu llāha ʿalā ḥarfin fa-ʾin ʾaṣābahū khayrun ʾiṭmaʾanna bihī wa-ʾin ʾaṣābathu fitnatun-i nqalaba ʿalā wajhihī khasira d-dunyā wa-l-ʾākhirata dhālika huwa l-khusrānu l-mubīnu

12.content: يَدعو مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَضُرُّهُ وَما لا يَنفَعُهُ ۚ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الضَّلالُ البَعيدُ
12.translation_eng: He invokes besides Allah that which can bring him neither benefit nor harm. That is extreme error.
12.transliteration: yadʿū min dūni llāhi mā lā yaḍurruhū wa-mā lā yanfaʿuhū dhālika huwa ḍ-ḍalālu l-baʿīdu

13.content: يَدعو لَمَن ضَرُّهُ أَقرَبُ مِن نَفعِهِ ۚ لَبِئسَ المَولىٰ وَلَبِئسَ العَشيرُ
13.translation_eng: He invokes someone whose harm is surely likelier than his benefit. Surely an evil ally and an evil companion!
13.transliteration: yadʿū la-man ḍarruhū ʾaqrabu min nafʿihī la-biʾsa l-mawlā wa-la-biʾsa l-ʿashīru

14.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدخِلُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَفعَلُ ما يُريدُ
14.translation_eng: Allah will indeed admit those who have faith and do righteous deeds into gardens with streams running in them. Indeed Allah does whatever He desires.
14.transliteration: ʾinna llāha yudkhilu lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru ʾinna llāha yafʿalu mā yurīdu

15.content: مَن كانَ يَظُنُّ أَن لَن يَنصُرَهُ اللَّهُ فِي الدُّنيا وَالآخِرَةِ فَليَمدُد بِسَبَبٍ إِلَى السَّماءِ ثُمَّ ليَقطَع فَليَنظُر هَل يُذهِبَنَّ كَيدُهُ ما يَغيظُ
15.translation_eng: Whoever thinks that Allah will not help him in this world and the Hereafter, let him extend a rope to the ceiling and hang himself, and see if his artifice would remove his rage.
15.transliteration: man kāna yaẓunnu ʾan lan yanṣurahu llāhu fī d-dunyā wa-l-ʾākhirati fa-l-yamdud bi-sababin ʾilā s-samāʾi thumma l-yaqṭaʿ fa-l-yanẓur hal yudhhibanna kayduhū mā yaghīẓu

16.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَنزَلناهُ آياتٍ بَيِّناتٍ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَهدي مَن يُريدُ
16.translation_eng: Thus have We sent it down as manifest signs, and indeed Allah guides whomever He desires.
16.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika ʾanzalnāhu ʾāyātin bayyinātin wa-ʾanna llāha yahdī man yurīdu

17.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَالَّذينَ هادوا وَالصّابِئينَ وَالنَّصارىٰ وَالمَجوسَ وَالَّذينَ أَشرَكوا إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَفصِلُ بَينَهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ شَهيدٌ
17.translation_eng: Indeed the faithful, the Jews, the Sabaeans, the Christians, the Magians and the polytheists —Allah will indeed judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is witness to all things.
17.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-lladhīna hādū wa-ṣ-ṣābiʾīna wa-n-naṣārā wa-l-majūsa wa-lladhīna ʾashrakū ʾinna llāha yafṣilu baynahum yawma l-qiyāmati ʾinna llāha ʿalā kulli shayʾin shahīdun

18.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَسجُدُ لَهُ مَن فِي السَّماواتِ وَمَن فِي الأَرضِ وَالشَّمسُ وَالقَمَرُ وَالنُّجومُ وَالجِبالُ وَالشَّجَرُ وَالدَّوابُّ وَكَثيرٌ مِنَ النّاسِ ۖ وَكَثيرٌ حَقَّ عَلَيهِ العَذابُ ۗ وَمَن يُهِنِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن مُكرِمٍ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَفعَلُ ما يَشاءُ ۩
18.translation_eng: Have you not regarded that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth, and the sun, the moon, and the stars, the mountains, the trees, and the animals and many of mankind? And for many the punishment has become due. Whomever Allah humiliates will find no one who may bring him honour. Indeed Allah does whatever He wishes.
18.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾanna llāha yasjudu lahū man fī s-samāwāti wa-man fī l-ʾarḍi wa-sh-shamsu wa-l-qamaru wa-n-nujūmu wa-l-jibālu wa-sh-shajaru wa-d-dawābbu wa-kathīrun mina n-nāsi wa-kathīrun ḥaqqa ʿalayhi l-ʿadhābu wa-man yuhini llāhu fa-mā lahū min mukrimin ʾinna llāha yafʿalu mā yashāʾu

19.content: ۞ هٰذانِ خَصمانِ اختَصَموا في رَبِّهِم ۖ فَالَّذينَ كَفَروا قُطِّعَت لَهُم ثِيابٌ مِن نارٍ يُصَبُّ مِن فَوقِ رُءوسِهِمُ الحَميمُ
19.translation_eng: These two contenders contend concerning their Lord. As for those who are faithless, cloaks of fire will be cut out for them, and boiling water will be poured over their heads,
19.transliteration: hādhāni khaṣmāni khtaṣamū fī rabbihim fa-lladhīna kafarū quṭṭiʿat lahum thiyābun min nārin yuṣabbu min fawqi ruʾūsihimu l-ḥamīmu

20.content: يُصهَرُ بِهِ ما في بُطونِهِم وَالجُلودُ
20.translation_eng: with which their skins and entrails will be fused,
20.transliteration: yuṣharu bihī mā fī buṭūnihim wa-l-julūdu

21.content: وَلَهُم مَقامِعُ مِن حَديدٍ
21.translation_eng: and there will be clubs of iron for them.
21.transliteration: wa-lahum maqāmiʿu min ḥadīdin

22.content: كُلَّما أَرادوا أَن يَخرُجوا مِنها مِن غَمٍّ أُعيدوا فيها وَذوقوا عَذابَ الحَريقِ
22.translation_eng: Whenever they desire to leave it out of anguish, they will be turned back into it [and told]: ‘Taste the punishment of the burning!’
22.transliteration: kullamā ʾarādū ʾan yakhrujū minhā min ghammin ʾuʿīdū fīhā wa-dhūqū ʿadhāba l-ḥarīqi

23.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدخِلُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ يُحَلَّونَ فيها مِن أَساوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍ وَلُؤلُؤًا ۖ وَلِباسُهُم فيها حَريرٌ
23.translation_eng: Indeed Allah will admit those who have faith and do righteous deeds into gardens with streams running in them, adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their dress therein will be silk.
23.transliteration: ʾinna llāha yudkhilu lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru yuḥallawna fīhā min ʾasāwira min dhahabin wa-luʾluʾan wa-libāsuhum fīhā ḥarīrun

24.content: وَهُدوا إِلَى الطَّيِّبِ مِنَ القَولِ وَهُدوا إِلىٰ صِراطِ الحَميدِ
24.translation_eng: They shall be guided to the purest speech, and guided to the path of the All-laudable.
24.transliteration: wa-hudū ʾilā ṭ-ṭayyibi mina l-qawli wa-hudū ʾilā ṣirāṭi l-ḥamīdi

25.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَيَصُدّونَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَالمَسجِدِ الحَرامِ الَّذي جَعَلناهُ لِلنّاسِ سَواءً العاكِفُ فيهِ وَالبادِ ۚ وَمَن يُرِد فيهِ بِإِلحادٍ بِظُلمٍ نُذِقهُ مِن عَذابٍ أَليمٍ
25.translation_eng: Indeed those who are faithless and who bar from the way of Allah and the Sacred Mosque, which We have assigned for all the people, the native and the visitor being equal therein —whoever seeks to commit therein sacrilege with the intent of wrongdoing, We shall make him taste a painful punishment.
25.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna kafarū wa-yaṣuddūna ʿan sabīli llāhi wa-l-masjidi l-ḥarāmi lladhī jaʿalnāhu li-n-nāsi sawāʾan-i l-ʿākifu fīhi wa-l-bādi wa-man yurid fīhi bi-ʾilḥādin bi-ẓulmin nudhiqhu min ʿadhābin ʾalīmin

26.content: وَإِذ بَوَّأنا لِإِبراهيمَ مَكانَ البَيتِ أَن لا تُشرِك بي شَيئًا وَطَهِّر بَيتِيَ لِلطّائِفينَ وَالقائِمينَ وَالرُّكَّعِ السُّجودِ
26.translation_eng: When We settled for Abraham the site of the House [saying], Do not ascribe any partners to Me, and purify My House for those who go around it, and those who stand [in it for prayer], and those who bow and prostrate.
26.transliteration: wa-ʾidh bawwaʾnā li-ʾibrāhīma makāna l-bayti ʾan lā tushrik bī shayʾan wa-ṭahhir baytiya li-ṭ-ṭāʾifīna wa-l-qāʾimīna wa-r-rukkaʿi s-sujūdi

27.content: وَأَذِّن فِي النّاسِ بِالحَجِّ يَأتوكَ رِجالًا وَعَلىٰ كُلِّ ضامِرٍ يَأتينَ مِن كُلِّ فَجٍّ عَميقٍ
27.translation_eng: And proclaim the ḥajj to people: they shall come to you on foot and on lean camels coming from distant places,
27.transliteration: wa-ʾadhdhin fī n-nāsi bi-l-ḥajji yaʾtūka rijālan wa-ʿalā kulli ḍāmirin yaʾtīna min kulli fajjin ʿamīqin

28.content: لِيَشهَدوا مَنافِعَ لَهُم وَيَذكُرُوا اسمَ اللَّهِ في أَيّامٍ مَعلوماتٍ عَلىٰ ما رَزَقَهُم مِن بَهيمَةِ الأَنعامِ ۖ فَكُلوا مِنها وَأَطعِمُوا البائِسَ الفَقيرَ
28.translation_eng: that they may witness the benefits for them, and mention Allah’s Name during the known days over the livestock He has provided them. So eat thereof, and feed the destitute.
28.transliteration: li-yashhadū manāfiʿa lahum wa-yadhkurū sma llāhi fī ʾayyāmin maʿlūmātin ʿalā mā razaqahum min bahīmati l-ʾanʿāmi fa-kulū minhā wa-ʾaṭʿimū l-bāʾisa l-faqīra

29.content: ثُمَّ ليَقضوا تَفَثَهُم وَليوفوا نُذورَهُم وَليَطَّوَّفوا بِالبَيتِ العَتيقِ
29.translation_eng: Then let them do away with their untidiness,1 and fulfill their vows, and go around the Ancient House.2According to the commentators, the phrase li yaqḍū tafathahum implies egress from the state of iḥrām (after the shortening of the hair or the nails, and the bath), and relief from its restrictions. Or it means ‘let them perform their rites.’Or, ‘the Free House,’ that is, free from bondage of anyone’s ownership.
29.transliteration: thumma l-yaqḍū tafathahum wa-l-yūfū nudhūrahum wa-l-yaṭṭawwafū bi-l-bayti l-ʿatīqi

30.content: ذٰلِكَ وَمَن يُعَظِّم حُرُماتِ اللَّهِ فَهُوَ خَيرٌ لَهُ عِندَ رَبِّهِ ۗ وَأُحِلَّت لَكُمُ الأَنعامُ إِلّا ما يُتلىٰ عَلَيكُم ۖ فَاجتَنِبُوا الرِّجسَ مِنَ الأَوثانِ وَاجتَنِبوا قَولَ الزّورِ
30.translation_eng: That. And whoever venerates the sacraments of Allah, that is better for him with his Lord. You are permitted [animals of] grazing livestock except for what will be recited to you. So avoid the abomination of idols, and avoid false speech,
30.transliteration: dhālika wa-man yuʿaẓẓim ḥurumāti llāhi fa-huwa khayrun lahū ʿinda rabbihī wa-ʾuḥillat lakumu l-ʾanʿāmu ʾillā mā yutlā ʿalaykum fa-jtanibū r-rijsa mina l-ʾawthāni wa-jtanibū qawla z-zūri

31.content: حُنَفاءَ لِلَّهِ غَيرَ مُشرِكينَ بِهِ ۚ وَمَن يُشرِك بِاللَّهِ فَكَأَنَّما خَرَّ مِنَ السَّماءِ فَتَخطَفُهُ الطَّيرُ أَو تَهوي بِهِ الرّيحُ في مَكانٍ سَحيقٍ
31.translation_eng: as persons having pure faith in Allah, not ascribing partners to Him. Whoever ascribes partners to Allah is as though he had fallen from a height to be devoured by vultures, or to be blown away by the wind far and wide.
31.transliteration: ḥunafāʾa li-llāhi ghayra mushrikīna bihī wa-man yushrik bi-llāhi fa-ka-ʾannamā kharra mina s-samāʾi fa-takhṭafuhu ṭ-ṭayru ʾaw tahwī bihi r-rīḥu fī makānin saḥīqin

32.content: ذٰلِكَ وَمَن يُعَظِّم شَعائِرَ اللَّهِ فَإِنَّها مِن تَقوَى القُلوبِ
32.translation_eng: That. And whoever venerates the sacraments of Allah —indeed that arises from the Godwariness of hearts.
32.transliteration: dhālika wa-man yuʿaẓẓim shaʿāʾira llāhi fa-ʾinnahā min taqwā l-qulūbi

33.content: لَكُم فيها مَنافِعُ إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ثُمَّ مَحِلُّها إِلَى البَيتِ العَتيقِ
33.translation_eng: You may benefit from them until a specified time.1 Then their place of sacrifice is by the Ancient House.That is, you may benefit from the sacrificial animals, such as by using them as mounts or milking them, until they arrive at the place where they are to be sacrificed.
33.transliteration: lakum fīhā manāfiʿu ʾilā ʾajalin musamman thumma maḥilluhā ʾilā l-bayti l-ʿatīqi

34.content: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ جَعَلنا مَنسَكًا لِيَذكُرُوا اسمَ اللَّهِ عَلىٰ ما رَزَقَهُم مِن بَهيمَةِ الأَنعامِ ۗ فَإِلٰهُكُم إِلٰهٌ واحِدٌ فَلَهُ أَسلِموا ۗ وَبَشِّرِ المُخبِتينَ
34.translation_eng: For every nation We have appointed a rite that they might mention Allah’s Name over the livestock He has provided them. Your God is the One God. So submit to Him. And give good news to the humble
34.transliteration: wa-li-kulli ʾummatin jaʿalnā mansakan li-yadhkurū sma llāhi ʿalā mā razaqahum min bahīmati l-ʾanʿāmi fa-ʾilāhukum ʾilāhun wāḥidun fa-lahū ʾaslimū wa-bashshiri l-mukhbitīna

35.content: الَّذينَ إِذا ذُكِرَ اللَّهُ وَجِلَت قُلوبُهُم وَالصّابِرينَ عَلىٰ ما أَصابَهُم وَالمُقيمِي الصَّلاةِ وَمِمّا رَزَقناهُم يُنفِقونَ
35.translation_eng: —those whose hearts tremble with awe when Allah is mentioned, and who are patient through whatever visits them, and who maintain the prayer and spend out of what We have provided them.
35.transliteration: alladhīna ʾidhā dhukira llāhu wajilat qulūbuhum wa-ṣ-ṣābirīna ʿalā mā ʾaṣābahum wa-l-muqīmī ṣ-ṣalāti wa-mimmā razaqnāhum yunfiqūna

36.content: وَالبُدنَ جَعَلناها لَكُم مِن شَعائِرِ اللَّهِ لَكُم فيها خَيرٌ ۖ فَاذكُرُوا اسمَ اللَّهِ عَلَيها صَوافَّ ۖ فَإِذا وَجَبَت جُنوبُها فَكُلوا مِنها وَأَطعِمُوا القانِعَ وَالمُعتَرَّ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ سَخَّرناها لَكُم لَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
36.translation_eng: We have appointed for you the [sacrificial] camels as one of Allah’s sacraments. There is good for you in them. So mention the Name of Allah over them as they stand. And when they have fallen on their flanks, eat from them, and feed the self-contained needy and the mendicant. Thus have We disposed them for your benefit so that you may give thanks.
36.transliteration: wa-l-budna jaʿalnāhā lakum min shaʿāʾiri llāhi lakum fīhā khayrun fa-dhkurū sma llāhi ʿalayhā ṣawāffa fa-ʾidhā wajabat junūbuhā fa-kulū minhā wa-ʾaṭʿimū l-qāniʿa wa-l-muʿtarra ka-dhālika sakhkharnāhā lakum laʿallakum tashkurūna

37.content: لَن يَنالَ اللَّهَ لُحومُها وَلا دِماؤُها وَلٰكِن يَنالُهُ التَّقوىٰ مِنكُم ۚ كَذٰلِكَ سَخَّرَها لَكُم لِتُكَبِّرُوا اللَّهَ عَلىٰ ما هَداكُم ۗ وَبَشِّرِ المُحسِنينَ
37.translation_eng: It is not their flesh or their blood that reaches Allah. Rather it is your Godwariness that reaches Him. Thus has He disposed them for your benefit so that you may magnify Allah for His guiding you. And give good news to the virtuous.
37.transliteration: lan yanāla llāha luḥūmuhā wa-lā dimāʾuhā wa-lākin yanāluhu t-taqwā minkum ka-dhālika sakhkharahā lakum li-tukabbirū llāha ʿalā mā hadākum wa-bashshiri l-muḥsinīna

38.content: ۞ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدافِعُ عَنِ الَّذينَ آمَنوا ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ خَوّانٍ كَفورٍ
38.translation_eng: Allah indeed defends those who have faith. Indeed Allah does not like any ingrate traitor.
38.transliteration: ʾinna llāha yudāfiʿu ʿani lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾinna llāha lā yuḥibbu kulla khawwānin kafūrin

39.content: أُذِنَ لِلَّذينَ يُقاتَلونَ بِأَنَّهُم ظُلِموا ۚ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ نَصرِهِم لَقَديرٌ
39.translation_eng: Those who are fought against are permitted [to fight] because they have been wronged, and Allah is indeed able to help them.
39.transliteration: ʾudhina li-lladhīna yuqātalūna bi-ʾannahum ẓulimū wa-ʾinna llāha ʿalā naṣrihim la-qadīrun-i

40.content: الَّذينَ أُخرِجوا مِن دِيارِهِم بِغَيرِ حَقٍّ إِلّا أَن يَقولوا رَبُّنَا اللَّهُ ۗ وَلَولا دَفعُ اللَّهِ النّاسَ بَعضَهُم بِبَعضٍ لَهُدِّمَت صَوامِعُ وَبِيَعٌ وَصَلَواتٌ وَمَساجِدُ يُذكَرُ فيهَا اسمُ اللَّهِ كَثيرًا ۗ وَلَيَنصُرَنَّ اللَّهُ مَن يَنصُرُهُ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَقَوِيٌّ عَزيزٌ
40.translation_eng: —Those who were expelled from their homes unjustly, only because they said, ‘Allah is our Lord.’ Had not Allah repulsed the people from one another, ruin would have befallen the monasteries, churches, synagogues and mosques in which Allah’s Name is mentioned greatly. Allah will surely help those who help Him. Indeed Allah is all-strong, all-mighty.
40.transliteration: alladhīna ʾukhrijū min diyārihim bi-ghayri ḥaqqin ʾillā ʾan yaqūlū rabbunā llāhu wa-law-lā dafʿu llāhi n-nāsa baʿḍahum bi-baʿḍin la-huddimat ṣawāmiʿu wa-biyaʿun wa-ṣalawātun wa-masājidu yudhkaru fīhā smu llāhi kathīran wa-la-yanṣuranna llāhu man yanṣuruhū ʾinna llāha la-qawiyyun ʿazīzun-i

41.content: الَّذينَ إِن مَكَّنّاهُم فِي الأَرضِ أَقامُوا الصَّلاةَ وَآتَوُا الزَّكاةَ وَأَمَروا بِالمَعروفِ وَنَهَوا عَنِ المُنكَرِ ۗ وَلِلَّهِ عاقِبَةُ الأُمورِ
41.translation_eng: Those who, if We granted them power in the land, maintain the prayer, give the zakāt, and bid what is right and forbid what is wrong. And with Allah rests the outcome of all matters.
41.transliteration: alladhīna ʾin makkannāhum fī l-ʾarḍi ʾaqāmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-ʾātawu z-zakāta wa-ʾamarū bi-l-maʿrūfi wa-nahaw ʿani l-munkari wa-li-llāhi ʿāqibatu l-ʾumūri

42.content: وَإِن يُكَذِّبوكَ فَقَد كَذَّبَت قَبلَهُم قَومُ نوحٍ وَعادٌ وَثَمودُ
42.translation_eng: If they impugn you, the people of Noah have impugned before them and ʿĀd and Thamūd
42.transliteration: wa-ʾin yukadhdhibūka fa-qad kadhdhabat qablahum qawmu nūḥin wa-ʿādun wa-thamūdu

43.content: وَقَومُ إِبراهيمَ وَقَومُ لوطٍ
43.translation_eng: [as well as] the people of Abraham and the people of Lot,
43.transliteration: wa-qawmu ʾibrāhīma wa-qawmu lūṭin

44.content: وَأَصحابُ مَديَنَ ۖ وَكُذِّبَ موسىٰ فَأَملَيتُ لِلكافِرينَ ثُمَّ أَخَذتُهُم ۖ فَكَيفَ كانَ نَكيرِ
44.translation_eng: and the inhabitants of Midian, and Moses was also impugned. But I gave the faithless a respite, then I seized them and how was My rebuttal!
44.transliteration: wa-ʾaṣḥābu madyana wa-kudhdhiba mūsā fa-ʾamlaytu li-l-kāfirīna thumma ʾakhadhtuhum fa-kayfa kāna nakīri

45.content: فَكَأَيِّن مِن قَريَةٍ أَهلَكناها وَهِيَ ظالِمَةٌ فَهِيَ خاوِيَةٌ عَلىٰ عُروشِها وَبِئرٍ مُعَطَّلَةٍ وَقَصرٍ مَشيدٍ
45.translation_eng: How many towns We have destroyed while they were wrongdoers! So they lie fallen on their trellises, their wells neglected and their lofty palaces [desolate]!
45.transliteration: fa-ka-ʾayyin min qaryatin ʾahlaknāhā wa-hiya ẓālimatun fa-hiya khāwiyatun ʿalā ʿurūshihā wa-biʾrin muʿaṭṭalatin wa-qaṣrin mashīdin

46.content: أَفَلَم يَسيروا فِي الأَرضِ فَتَكونَ لَهُم قُلوبٌ يَعقِلونَ بِها أَو آذانٌ يَسمَعونَ بِها ۖ فَإِنَّها لا تَعمَى الأَبصارُ وَلٰكِن تَعمَى القُلوبُ الَّتي فِي الصُّدورِ
46.translation_eng: Have they not traveled over the land so that they may have hearts by which they may apply reason, or ears by which they may hear? Indeed it is not the eyes that turn blind, but the hearts turn blind —those that are in the breasts!
46.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lam yasīrū fī l-ʾarḍi fa-takūna lahum qulūbun yaʿqilūna bihā ʾaw ʾādhānun yasmaʿūna bihā fa-ʾinnahā lā taʿmā l-ʾabṣāru wa-lākin taʿmā l-qulūbu llatī fī ṣ-ṣudūri

47.content: وَيَستَعجِلونَكَ بِالعَذابِ وَلَن يُخلِفَ اللَّهُ وَعدَهُ ۚ وَإِنَّ يَومًا عِندَ رَبِّكَ كَأَلفِ سَنَةٍ مِمّا تَعُدّونَ
47.translation_eng: They ask you to hasten the punishment, though Allah shall never break His promise. Indeed a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of your reckoning.
47.transliteration: wa-yastaʿjilūnaka bi-l-ʿadhābi wa-lan yukhlifa llāhu waʿdahū wa-ʾinna yawman ʿinda rabbika ka-ʾalfi sanatin mimmā taʿuddūna

48.content: وَكَأَيِّن مِن قَريَةٍ أَملَيتُ لَها وَهِيَ ظالِمَةٌ ثُمَّ أَخَذتُها وَإِلَيَّ المَصيرُ
48.translation_eng: To how many a town did I give respite while it was wrongdoing! Then I seized it, and toward Me is the destination.
48.transliteration: wa-ka-ʾayyin min qaryatin ʾamlaytu lahā wa-hiya ẓālimatun thumma ʾakhadhtuhā wa-ʾilayya l-maṣīru

49.content: قُل يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ إِنَّما أَنا لَكُم نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
49.translation_eng: Say, ‘O mankind! I am only a manifest warner to you!’
49.transliteration: qul yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ʾinnamā ʾana lakum nadhīrun mubīnun

50.content: فَالَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَرِزقٌ كَريمٌ
50.translation_eng: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds, for them is forgiveness and a noble provision.
50.transliteration: fa-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti lahum maghfiratun wa-rizqun karīmun

51.content: وَالَّذينَ سَعَوا في آياتِنا مُعاجِزينَ أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ الجَحيمِ
51.translation_eng: But as for those who contend with Our signs, seeking to thwart [their purpose], they shall be the inmates of hell.
51.transliteration: wa-lladhīna saʿaw fī ʾāyātinā muʿājizīna ʾulāʾika ʾaṣḥābu l-jaḥīmi

52.content: وَما أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ مِن رَسولٍ وَلا نَبِيٍّ إِلّا إِذا تَمَنّىٰ أَلقَى الشَّيطانُ في أُمنِيَّتِهِ فَيَنسَخُ اللَّهُ ما يُلقِي الشَّيطانُ ثُمَّ يُحكِمُ اللَّهُ آياتِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
52.translation_eng: We did not send before you any apostle or prophet but that when he recited [the scripture] Satan interjected [something] in his recitation. Thereat Allah nullifies whatever Satan has interjected, [and] then Allah confirms His signs, and Allah is All-knowing, All-wise.
52.transliteration: wa-mā ʾarsalnā min qablika min rasūlin wa-lā nabiyyin ʾillā ʾidhā tamannā ʾalqā sh-shayṭānu fī ʾumniyyatihī fa-yansakhu llāhu mā yulqī sh-shayṭānu thumma yuḥkimu llāhu ʾāyātihī wa-llāhu ʿalīmun ḥakīmun

53.content: لِيَجعَلَ ما يُلقِي الشَّيطانُ فِتنَةً لِلَّذينَ في قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ وَالقاسِيَةِ قُلوبُهُم ۗ وَإِنَّ الظّالِمينَ لَفي شِقاقٍ بَعيدٍ
53.translation_eng: That He may make what Satan has thrown in a trial for those in whose hearts is a sickness and those whose hearts have hardened. Indeed the wrongdoers are steeped in extreme defiance.
53.transliteration: li-yajʿala mā yulqī sh-shayṭānu fitnatan li-llādhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun wa-l-qāsiyati qulūbuhum wa-ʾinna ẓ-ẓālimīna la-fī shiqāqin baʿīdin

54.content: وَلِيَعلَمَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا العِلمَ أَنَّهُ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكَ فَيُؤمِنوا بِهِ فَتُخبِتَ لَهُ قُلوبُهُم ۗ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَهادِ الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
54.translation_eng: That those who have been given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and so they may have faith in it, and their hearts may be humbled before Him. Indeed Allah guides those who have faith to a straight path.
54.transliteration: wa-li-yaʿlama lladhīna ʾūtū l-ʿilma ʾannahu l-ḥaqqu min rabbika fa-yuʾminū bihī fa-tukhbita lahū qulūbuhum wa-ʾinna llāha la-hādi lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

55.content: وَلا يَزالُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا في مِريَةٍ مِنهُ حَتّىٰ تَأتِيَهُمُ السّاعَةُ بَغتَةً أَو يَأتِيَهُم عَذابُ يَومٍ عَقيمٍ
55.translation_eng: Those who are faithless persist in their doubt about it, until the Hour overtakes them suddenly, or they are overtaken by the punishment of an inauspicious day.
55.transliteration: wa-lā yazālu lladhīna kafarū fī miryatin minhu ḥattā taʾtiyahumu s-sāʿatu baghtatan ʾaw yaʾtiyahum ʿadhābu yawmin ʿaqīmin-i

56.content: المُلكُ يَومَئِذٍ لِلَّهِ يَحكُمُ بَينَهُم ۚ فَالَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ في جَنّاتِ النَّعيمِ
56.translation_eng: On that day all sovereignty will belong to Allah: He will judge between them. Then those who have faith and do righteous deeds will be in gardens of bliss,
56.transliteration: al-mulku yawmaʾidhin li-llāhi yaḥkumu baynahum fa-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti fī jannāti n-naʿīmi

57.content: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا وَكَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا فَأُولٰئِكَ لَهُم عَذابٌ مُهينٌ
57.translation_eng: and those who are faithless and who deny Our signs —for such there will be a humiliating punishment.
57.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kafarū wa-kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā fa-ʾulāʾika lahum ʿadhābun muhīnun

58.content: وَالَّذينَ هاجَروا في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ قُتِلوا أَو ماتوا لَيَرزُقَنَّهُمُ اللَّهُ رِزقًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُوَ خَيرُ الرّازِقينَ
58.translation_eng: Those who migrate in the way of Allah and then are slain, or die, Allah will surely provide them with a good provision. Allah is indeed the best of providers.
58.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hājarū fī sabīli llāhi thumma qutilū ʾaw mātū la-yarzuqannahumu llāhu rizqan ḥasanan wa-ʾinna llāha la-huwa khayru r-rāziqīna

59.content: لَيُدخِلَنَّهُم مُدخَلًا يَرضَونَهُ ۗ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَعَليمٌ حَليمٌ
59.translation_eng: He will admit them into an abode they are pleased with. Indeed Allah is all-knowing, all-forbearing.
59.transliteration: la-yudkhilannahum mudkhalan yarḍawnahū wa-ʾinna llāha la-ʿalīmun ḥalīmun

60.content: ۞ ذٰلِكَ وَمَن عاقَبَ بِمِثلِ ما عوقِبَ بِهِ ثُمَّ بُغِيَ عَلَيهِ لَيَنصُرَنَّهُ اللَّهُ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَعَفُوٌّ غَفورٌ
60.translation_eng: That; and whoever retaliates with the like of what he has been made to suffer, and then is [again] aggressed against, Allah will surely help him. Indeed Allah is all-excusing, all-forgiving.
60.transliteration: dhālika wa-man ʿāqaba bi-mithli mā ʿūqiba bihī thumma bughiya ʿalayhi la-yanṣurannahu llāhu ʾinna llāha la-ʿafuwwun ghafūrun

61.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ يولِجُ اللَّيلَ فِي النَّهارِ وَيولِجُ النَّهارَ فِي اللَّيلِ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ سَميعٌ بَصيرٌ
61.translation_eng: That is because Allah makes the night pass into the day and makes the day pass into the night, and because Allah is all-hearing, all-seeing.
61.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾanna llāha yūliju l-layla fī n-nahāri wa-yūliju n-nahāra fī l-layli wa-ʾanna llāha samīʿun baṣīrun

62.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الحَقُّ وَأَنَّ ما يَدعونَ مِن دونِهِ هُوَ الباطِلُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ العَلِيُّ الكَبيرُ
62.translation_eng: That is because Allah is the Reality, and what they invoke besides Him is nullity, and because Allah is the All-exalted, the All-great.
62.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾanna llāha huwa l-ḥaqqu wa-ʾanna mā yadʿūna min dūnihī huwa l-bāṭilu wa-ʾanna llāha huwa l-ʿaliyyu l-kabīru

63.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَتُصبِحُ الأَرضُ مُخضَرَّةً ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَطيفٌ خَبيرٌ
63.translation_eng: Have you not regarded that Allah sends down water from the sky, whereupon the earth turns green? Indeed Allah is all-attentive, all-aware.
63.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾanna llāha ʾanzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-tuṣbiḥu l-ʾarḍu mukhḍarratan ʾinna llāha laṭīfun khabīrun

64.content: لَهُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ ۗ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُوَ الغَنِيُّ الحَميدُ
64.translation_eng: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, Indeed Allah is the All-sufficient, the All-laudable.
64.transliteration: lahū mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi wa-ʾinna llāha la-huwa l-ghaniyyu l-ḥamīdu

65.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ سَخَّرَ لَكُم ما فِي الأَرضِ وَالفُلكَ تَجري فِي البَحرِ بِأَمرِهِ وَيُمسِكُ السَّماءَ أَن تَقَعَ عَلَى الأَرضِ إِلّا بِإِذنِهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِالنّاسِ لَرَءوفٌ رَحيمٌ
65.translation_eng: Have you not regarded that Allah has disposed for you[r benefit] whatever there is in the earth, and [that] the ships sail at sea by His command, and He sustains the sky lest it should fall on the earth, excepting [when it does so] by His leave? Indeed Allah is most kind and merciful to mankind.
65.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾanna llāha sakhkhara lakum mā fī l-ʾarḍi wa-l-fulka tajrī fī l-baḥri bi-ʾamrihī wa-yumsiku s-samāʾa ʾan taqaʿa ʿalā l-ʾarḍi ʾillā bi-ʾidhnihī ʾinna llāha bi-n-nāsi la-raʾūfun raḥīmun

66.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي أَحياكُم ثُمَّ يُميتُكُم ثُمَّ يُحييكُم ۗ إِنَّ الإِنسانَ لَكَفورٌ
66.translation_eng: It is He who gave you life then He makes you die, then He brings you to life. Indeed man is very ungrateful.
66.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī ʾaḥyākum thumma yumītukum thumma yuḥyīkum ʾinna l-ʾinsāna la-kafūrun

67.content: لِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ جَعَلنا مَنسَكًا هُم ناسِكوهُ ۖ فَلا يُنازِعُنَّكَ فِي الأَمرِ ۚ وَادعُ إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ لَعَلىٰ هُدًى مُستَقيمٍ
67.translation_eng: For every nation We had appointed a rite [of worship] which they used to observe; so let them not dispute with you about the matter.1 And invite to your Lord. Indeed you are on a straight guidance.Or ‘the Law.’
67.transliteration: li-kulli ʾummatin jaʿalnā mansakan hum nāsikūhu fa-lā yunāziʿunnaka fī l-ʾamri wa-dʿu ʾilā rabbika ʾinnaka la-ʿalā hudan mustaqīmin

68.content: وَإِن جادَلوكَ فَقُلِ اللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما تَعمَلونَ
68.translation_eng: And if they dispute with you, say, ‘Allah knows best what you are doing.
68.transliteration: wa-ʾin jādalūka fa-quli llāhu ʾaʿlamu bi-mā taʿmalūna

69.content: اللَّهُ يَحكُمُ بَينَكُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ فيما كُنتُم فيهِ تَختَلِفونَ
69.translation_eng: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that about which you used to differ.’
69.transliteration: allāhu yaḥkumu baynakum yawma l-qiyāmati fī-mā kuntum fīhi takhtalifūna

70.content: أَلَم تَعلَم أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَعلَمُ ما فِي السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ ۗ إِنَّ ذٰلِكَ في كِتابٍ ۚ إِنَّ ذٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسيرٌ
70.translation_eng: Do you not know that Allah knows whatever there is in the sky and the earth? That is indeed in a Book. That is indeed easy for Allah.
70.transliteration: ʾa-lam taʿlam ʾanna llāha yaʿlamu mā fī s-samāʾi wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾinna dhālika fī kitābin ʾinna dhālika ʿalā llāhi yasīrun

71.content: وَيَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لَم يُنَزِّل بِهِ سُلطانًا وَما لَيسَ لَهُم بِهِ عِلمٌ ۗ وَما لِلظّالِمينَ مِن نَصيرٍ
71.translation_eng: They worship besides Allah that for which He has not sent down any authority, and of which they have no knowledge. And the wrongdoers shall have no helper.
71.transliteration: wa-yaʿbudūna min dūni llāhi mā lam yunazzil bihī sulṭānan wa-mā laysa lahum bihī ʿilmun wa-mā li-ẓ-ẓālimīna min naṣīrin

72.content: وَإِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم آياتُنا بَيِّناتٍ تَعرِفُ في وُجوهِ الَّذينَ كَفَرُوا المُنكَرَ ۖ يَكادونَ يَسطونَ بِالَّذينَ يَتلونَ عَلَيهِم آياتِنا ۗ قُل أَفَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِشَرٍّ مِن ذٰلِكُمُ ۗ النّارُ وَعَدَهَا اللَّهُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا ۖ وَبِئسَ المَصيرُ
72.translation_eng: When Our manifest signs are recited to them, you perceive denial on the faces of the faithless: they would almost pounce upon those who recite Our signs to them. Say, ‘Shall I inform you about something worse than that? The Fire which Allah has promised the faithless. And it is an evil destination.’
72.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhim ʾāyātunā bayyinātin taʿrifu fī wujūhi lladhīna kafarū l-munkara yakādūna yasṭūna bi-lladhīna yatlūna ʿalayhim ʾāyātinā qul ʾa-fa-ʾunabbiʾukum bi-sharrin min dhālikumu n-nāru waʿadahā llāhu lladhīna kafarū wa-biʾsa l-maṣīru

73.content: يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ ضُرِبَ مَثَلٌ فَاستَمِعوا لَهُ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذينَ تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ لَن يَخلُقوا ذُبابًا وَلَوِ اجتَمَعوا لَهُ ۖ وَإِن يَسلُبهُمُ الذُّبابُ شَيئًا لا يَستَنقِذوهُ مِنهُ ۚ ضَعُفَ الطّالِبُ وَالمَطلوبُ
73.translation_eng: O mankind! Listen to a parable that is being drawn: Indeed those whom you invoke besides Allah will never create [even] a fly even if they all rallied to do so! And if a fly should take away something from them, they can not recover that from it. Feeble is the seeker and the sought!
73.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ḍuriba mathalun fa-stamiʿū lahū ʾinna lladhīna tadʿūna min dūni llāhi lan yakhluqū dhubāban wa-lawi jtamaʿū lahū wa-ʾin yaslubhumu dh-dhubābu shayʾan lā yastanqidhūhu minhu ḍaʿufa ṭ-ṭālibu wa-l-maṭlūbu

74.content: ما قَدَرُوا اللَّهَ حَقَّ قَدرِهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَقَوِيٌّ عَزيزٌ
74.translation_eng: They do not regard Allah with the regard due to Him. Indeed Allah is all-strong, all-mighty.
74.transliteration: mā qadarū llāha ḥaqqa qadrihī ʾinna llāha la-qawiyyun ʿazīzun-i

75.content: اللَّهُ يَصطَفي مِنَ المَلائِكَةِ رُسُلًا وَمِنَ النّاسِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَميعٌ بَصيرٌ
75.translation_eng: Allah chooses messengers from angels and from mankind. Indeed Allah is all-hearing, all-seeing.
75.transliteration: allāhu yaṣṭafī mina l-malāʾikati rusulan wa-mina n-nāsi ʾinna llāha samīʿun baṣīrun

76.content: يَعلَمُ ما بَينَ أَيديهِم وَما خَلفَهُم ۗ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ تُرجَعُ الأُمورُ
76.translation_eng: He knows that which is before them and that which is behind them, and to Allah all matters are returned.
76.transliteration: yaʿlamu mā bayna ʾaydīhim wa-mā khalfahum wa-ʾilā llāhi turjaʿu l-ʾumūru

77.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا اركَعوا وَاسجُدوا وَاعبُدوا رَبَّكُم وَافعَلُوا الخَيرَ لَعَلَّكُم تُفلِحونَ ۩
77.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Bow down and prostrate yourselves, and worship your Lord, and do good, so that you may be felicitous.
77.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū rkaʿū wa-sjudū wa-ʿbudū rabbakum wa-fʿalū l-khayra laʿallakkum tufliḥūna

78.content: وَجاهِدوا فِي اللَّهِ حَقَّ جِهادِهِ ۚ هُوَ اجتَباكُم وَما جَعَلَ عَلَيكُم فِي الدّينِ مِن حَرَجٍ ۚ مِلَّةَ أَبيكُم إِبراهيمَ ۚ هُوَ سَمّاكُمُ المُسلِمينَ مِن قَبلُ وَفي هٰذا لِيَكونَ الرَّسولُ شَهيدًا عَلَيكُم وَتَكونوا شُهَداءَ عَلَى النّاسِ ۚ فَأَقيمُوا الصَّلاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكاةَ وَاعتَصِموا بِاللَّهِ هُوَ مَولاكُم ۖ فَنِعمَ المَولىٰ وَنِعمَ النَّصيرُ
78.translation_eng: And wage jihād for the sake of Allah, a jihād which is worthy of Him. He has chosen you and has not placed for you any obstacle in the religion, the faith of your father, Abraham. He named you ‘muslims’ before, and in this,1 so that the Apostle may be a witness to you, and that you may be witnesses to mankind. So maintain the prayer, give the zakāt, and hold fast to Allah. He is your master —an excellent master and an excellent helper.That is, in the earlier scriptures and in the present one, that is, the Qurʾān.
78.transliteration: wa-jāhidū fī llāhi ḥaqqa jihādihī huwa jtabākum wa-mā jaʿala ʿalaykum fī d-dīni min ḥarajin millata ʾabīkum ʾibrāhīma huwa sammākumu l-muslimīna min qablu wa-fī hādhā li-yakūna r-rasūlu shahīdan ʿalaykum wa-takūnū shuhadāʾa ʿalā n-nāsi fa-ʾaqīmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-ʾātū z-zakāta wa-ʿtaṣimū bi-llāhi huwa mawlākum fa-niʿma l-mawlā wa-niʿma n-naṣīru

23.description: The surah that declares the ultimate success of the faithful - the believers in One God, without partner, and that describes the irreproachable of their spiritual and moral virtues. It takes its name from verse 1 which mentions the faithful (muʾminūn). The surah stresses that the believers are the ones who will succeed, whereas the disbelievers will be punished for their arrogance and derision. Several proofs are given of God’s Oneness and His power, and the inevitability of the Resurrection is emphasized.The surah is also known as: The Believers, The True Believers.

1.translation_eng: Certainly, the faithful have attained salvation

2.translation_eng: —those who are humble in their prayers,

3.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم عَنِ اللَّغوِ مُعرِضونَ
3.translation_eng: who avoid vain talk,
3.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum ʿani l-laghwi muʿriḍūna

4.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم لِلزَّكاةِ فاعِلونَ
4.translation_eng: who carry out their [duty of] zakāt,
4.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum li-z-zakāti fāʿilūna

5.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم لِفُروجِهِم حافِظونَ
5.translation_eng: who guard their private parts1That is, those who refrain from unlawful sexual relations and cover their private parts properly, except in the state of privacy with their spouses.
5.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum li-furūjihim ḥāfiẓūna

6.content: إِلّا عَلىٰ أَزواجِهِم أَو ما مَلَكَت أَيمانُهُم فَإِنَّهُم غَيرُ مَلومينَ
6.translation_eng: (except from their spouses or their slave women, for then they are not blameworthy;
6.transliteration: ʾillā ʿalā ʾazwājihim ʾaw mā malakat ʾaymānuhum fa-ʾinnahum ghayru malūmīna

7.content: فَمَنِ ابتَغىٰ وَراءَ ذٰلِكَ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ العادونَ
7.translation_eng: but whoever seeks [anything] beyond that —it is they who are transgressors)
7.transliteration: fa-mani btaghā warāʾa dhālika fa-ʾulāʾika humu l-ʿādūna

8.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم لِأَماناتِهِم وَعَهدِهِم راعونَ
8.translation_eng: and those who keep their trusts and covenants,
8.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum li-ʾamānātihim wa-ʿahdihim rāʿūna

9.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم عَلىٰ صَلَواتِهِم يُحافِظونَ
9.translation_eng: and who are watchful of their prayers.
9.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum ʿalā ṣalawātihim yuḥāfiẓūna

10.content: أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الوارِثونَ
10.translation_eng: It is they who will be the inheritors,
10.transliteration: ʾulāʾika humu l-wārithūna

11.content: الَّذينَ يَرِثونَ الفِردَوسَ هُم فيها خالِدونَ
11.translation_eng: who shall inherit paradise, and will remain in it [forever].1Cf. 70:22-35.
11.transliteration: alladhīna yarithūna l-firdawsa hum fīhā khālidūna

12.content: وَلَقَد خَلَقنَا الإِنسانَ مِن سُلالَةٍ مِن طينٍ
12.translation_eng: Certainly We created man from an extract of clay.
12.transliteration: wa-la-qad khalaqnā l-ʾinsāna min sulālatin min ṭīnin

13.content: ثُمَّ جَعَلناهُ نُطفَةً في قَرارٍ مَكينٍ
13.translation_eng: Then We made him a drop of [seminal] fluid [lodged] in a secure abode.
13.transliteration: thumma jaʿalnāhu nuṭfatan fī qarārin makīnin

14.content: ثُمَّ خَلَقنَا النُّطفَةَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقنَا العَلَقَةَ مُضغَةً فَخَلَقنَا المُضغَةَ عِظامًا فَكَسَونَا العِظامَ لَحمًا ثُمَّ أَنشَأناهُ خَلقًا آخَرَ ۚ فَتَبارَكَ اللَّهُ أَحسَنُ الخالِقينَ
14.translation_eng: Then We created the drop of fluid as a clinging mass. Then We created the clinging mass as a fleshy tissue. Then We created the fleshy tissue as bones. Then We clothed the bones with flesh. Then We produced him as [yet] another creature. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators!
14.transliteration: thumma khalaqnā n-nuṭfata ʿalaqatan fa-khalaqnā l-ʿalaqata muḍghatan fa-khalaqnā l-muḍghata ʿiẓāman fa-kasawnā l-ʿiẓāma laḥman thumma ʾanshaʾnāhu khalqan ʾākhara fa-tabāraka llāhu ʾaḥsanu l-khāliqīna

15.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُم بَعدَ ذٰلِكَ لَمَيِّتونَ
15.translation_eng: Then indeed you die after that.
15.transliteration: thumma ʾinnakum baʿda dhālika la-mayyitūna

16.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ تُبعَثونَ
16.translation_eng: Then you will indeed be raised up on the Day of Resurrection.
16.transliteration: thumma ʾinnakum yawma l-qiyāmati tubʿathūna

17.content: وَلَقَد خَلَقنا فَوقَكُم سَبعَ طَرائِقَ وَما كُنّا عَنِ الخَلقِ غافِلينَ
17.translation_eng: Certainly We created above you the seven tiers1 and We have not been oblivious of creation.Apparently, a reference to the seven heavens. Or, ‘seven tracks.’
17.transliteration: wa-la-qad khalaqnā fawqakum sabʿa ṭarāʾiqa wa-mā kunnā ʿani l-khalqi ghāfilīna

18.content: وَأَنزَلنا مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً بِقَدَرٍ فَأَسكَنّاهُ فِي الأَرضِ ۖ وَإِنّا عَلىٰ ذَهابٍ بِهِ لَقادِرونَ
18.translation_eng: We sent down water from the sky in a measured manner, and We lodged it within the ground, and We are indeed able to take it away.
18.transliteration: wa-ʾanzalnā mina s-samāʾi māʾan bi-qadarin fa-ʾaskannāhu fī l-ʾarḍi wa-ʾinnā ʿalā dhahābin bihī la-qādirūna

19.content: فَأَنشَأنا لَكُم بِهِ جَنّاتٍ مِن نَخيلٍ وَأَعنابٍ لَكُم فيها فَواكِهُ كَثيرَةٌ وَمِنها تَأكُلونَ
19.translation_eng: Then with it We produced for you gardens of date palms and vines. There are abundant fruits in them for you, and you eat from them.
19.transliteration: fa-ʾanshaʾnā lakum bihī jannātin min nakhīlin wa-ʾaʿnābin lakum fīhā fawākihu kathīratun wa-minhā taʾkulūna

20.content: وَشَجَرَةً تَخرُجُ مِن طورِ سَيناءَ تَنبُتُ بِالدُّهنِ وَصِبغٍ لِلآكِلينَ
20.translation_eng: And a tree that grows on Mount Sinai which produces oil and a seasoning for those who eat.
20.transliteration: wa-shajaratan takhruju min ṭūri saynāʾa tanbutu bi-d-duhni wa-ṣibghin li-l-ʾākilīna

21.content: وَإِنَّ لَكُم فِي الأَنعامِ لَعِبرَةً ۖ نُسقيكُم مِمّا في بُطونِها وَلَكُم فيها مَنافِعُ كَثيرَةٌ وَمِنها تَأكُلونَ
21.translation_eng: There is indeed a moral for you in the cattle: We give you to drink of that which is in their bellies, and you have many uses in them, and you eat some of them,
21.transliteration: wa-ʾinna lakum fī l-ʾanʿāmi la-ʿibratan nusqīkum mimmā fī buṭūnihā wa-lakum fīhā manāfiʿu kathīratun wa-minhā taʾkulūna

22.content: وَعَلَيها وَعَلَى الفُلكِ تُحمَلونَ
22.translation_eng: and you are carried on them and on ships.
22.transliteration: wa-ʿalayhā wa-ʿalā l-fulki tuḥmalūna

23.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا نوحًا إِلىٰ قَومِهِ فَقالَ يا قَومِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ ۖ أَفَلا تَتَّقونَ
23.translation_eng: Certainly We sent Noah to his people, and he said, ‘O my people! Worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. Will you not then be wary [of Him]?’
23.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā nūḥan ʾilā qawmihī fa-qāla yā-qawmi ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū ʾa-fa-lā tattaqūna

24.content: فَقالَ المَلَأُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن قَومِهِ ما هٰذا إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُكُم يُريدُ أَن يَتَفَضَّلَ عَلَيكُم وَلَو شاءَ اللَّهُ لَأَنزَلَ مَلائِكَةً ما سَمِعنا بِهٰذا في آبائِنَا الأَوَّلينَ
24.translation_eng: But the elite of the faithless from among his people said, ‘This is just a human being like you, who seeks to dominate you. Had Allah wished, He would have sent down angels. We never heard of such a thing among our forefathers.
24.transliteration: fa-qāla l-malaʾu lladhīna kafarū min qawmihī mā hādhā ʾillā basharun mithlukum yurīdu ʾan yatafaḍḍala ʿalaykum wa-law shāʾa llāhu la-ʾanzala malāʾikatan mā samiʿnā bi-hādhā fī ʾābāʾinā l-ʾawwalīna

25.content: إِن هُوَ إِلّا رَجُلٌ بِهِ جِنَّةٌ فَتَرَبَّصوا بِهِ حَتّىٰ حينٍ
25.translation_eng: He is just a man possessed by madness. So bear with him for a while.’
25.transliteration: ʾin huwa ʾillā rajulun bihī jinnatun fa-tarabbaṣū bihī ḥattā ḥīnin

26.content: قالَ رَبِّ انصُرني بِما كَذَّبونِ
26.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! Help me, as they impugn me.’
26.transliteration: qāla rabbi nṣurnī bi-mā kadhdhabūni

27.content: فَأَوحَينا إِلَيهِ أَنِ اصنَعِ الفُلكَ بِأَعيُنِنا وَوَحيِنا فَإِذا جاءَ أَمرُنا وَفارَ التَّنّورُ ۙ فَاسلُك فيها مِن كُلٍّ زَوجَينِ اثنَينِ وَأَهلَكَ إِلّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيهِ القَولُ مِنهُم ۖ وَلا تُخاطِبني فِي الَّذينَ ظَلَموا ۖ إِنَّهُم مُغرَقونَ
27.translation_eng: So We revealed to him: ‘Build the ark before Our eyes and by Our revelation. When Our edict comes and the oven gushes [a stream of water], bring into it a pair of every kind1 [of animal], and your family, except those of them against whom the decree has gone beforehand, and do not plead with Me for those who are wrongdoers: they shall indeed be drowned.’Or ‘bring into it, of every kind [of animal], two mates.’
27.transliteration: fa-ʾawḥaynā ʾilayhi ʾani ṣnaʿi l-fulka bi-ʾaʿyuninā wa-waḥyinā fa-ʾidhā jāʾa ʾamrunā wa-fāra t-tannūru fa-sluk fīhā min kullin zawjayni thnayni wa-ʾahlaka ʾillā man sabaqa ʿalayhi l-qawlu minhum wa-lā tukhāṭibnī fī lladhīna ẓalamū ʾinnahum mughraqūna

28.content: فَإِذَا استَوَيتَ أَنتَ وَمَن مَعَكَ عَلَى الفُلكِ فَقُلِ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذي نَجّانا مِنَ القَومِ الظّالِمينَ
28.translation_eng: ‘When you, and those who are with you, are settled in the ark, say, “All praise belongs to Allah, who has delivered us from the wrongdoing lot.”
28.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā stawayta ʾanta wa-man maʿaka ʿalā l-fulki fa-quli l-ḥamdu li-llāhi lladhī najjānā mina l-qawmi ẓ-ẓālimīna

29.content: وَقُل رَبِّ أَنزِلني مُنزَلًا مُبارَكًا وَأَنتَ خَيرُ المُنزِلينَ
29.translation_eng: And say, “My Lord! Land me with a blessed landing, for You are the best of those who bring ashore.” ’
29.transliteration: wa-qul rabbi ʾanzilnī munzalan mubārakan wa-ʾanta khayru l-munzilīna

30.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ وَإِن كُنّا لَمُبتَلينَ
