30.translation_eng: There are indeed signs in this; and indeed We have been testing.
30.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin wa-ʾin kunnā la-mubtalīna

31.content: ثُمَّ أَنشَأنا مِن بَعدِهِم قَرنًا آخَرينَ
31.translation_eng: Then after them We brought forth another generation,
31.transliteration: thumma ʾanshaʾnā min baʿdihim qarnan ʾākharīna

32.content: فَأَرسَلنا فيهِم رَسولًا مِنهُم أَنِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ ما لَكُم مِن إِلٰهٍ غَيرُهُ ۖ أَفَلا تَتَّقونَ
32.translation_eng: and We sent them an apostle from among themselves, saying, ‘Worship Allah! You have no other god besides Him. Will you not then be wary [of Him]?’
32.transliteration: fa-ʾarsalnā fīhim rasūlan minhum ʾani ʿbudū llāha mā lakum min ʾilāhin ghayruhū ʾa-fa-lā tattaqūna

33.content: وَقالَ المَلَأُ مِن قَومِهِ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَكَذَّبوا بِلِقاءِ الآخِرَةِ وَأَترَفناهُم فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ما هٰذا إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُكُم يَأكُلُ مِمّا تَأكُلونَ مِنهُ وَيَشرَبُ مِمّا تَشرَبونَ
33.translation_eng: Said the elite of his people, who were faithless and who denied the encounter of the Hereafter and whom We had given affluence in the life of the world: ‘This is just a human being like you: he eats what you eat, and drinks what you drink.
33.transliteration: wa-qāla l-malaʾu min qawmihi lladhīna kafarū wa-kadhdhabū bi-liqāʾi l-ʾākhirati wa-ʾatrafnāhum fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā mā hādhā ʾillā basharun mithlukum yaʾkulu mimmā taʾkulūna minhu wa-yashrabu mimmā tashrabūna

34.content: وَلَئِن أَطَعتُم بَشَرًا مِثلَكُم إِنَّكُم إِذًا لَخاسِرونَ
34.translation_eng: If you obey a human being like yourselves, you will indeed be losers.
34.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin ʾaṭaʿtum basharan mithlakum ʾinnakum ʾidhan la-khāsirūna

35.content: أَيَعِدُكُم أَنَّكُم إِذا مِتُّم وَكُنتُم تُرابًا وَعِظامًا أَنَّكُم مُخرَجونَ
35.translation_eng: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones you will indeed be raised [from the dead]?
35.transliteration: ʾa-yaʿidukum ʾannakum ʾidhā mittum wa-kuntum turāban wa-ʿiẓāman ʾannakum mukhrajūna

36.content: ۞ هَيهاتَ هَيهاتَ لِما توعَدونَ
36.translation_eng: Far-fetched, far-fetched is what you are promised!
36.transliteration: hayhāta hayhāta li-mā tūʿadūna

37.content: إِن هِيَ إِلّا حَياتُنَا الدُّنيا نَموتُ وَنَحيا وَما نَحنُ بِمَبعوثينَ
37.translation_eng: There is nothing but the life of this world: we live and we die, and we shall not be resurrected.
37.transliteration: ʾin hiya ʾillā ḥayātunā d-dunyā namūtu wa-naḥyā wa-mā naḥnu bi-mabʿūthīna

38.content: إِن هُوَ إِلّا رَجُلٌ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا وَما نَحنُ لَهُ بِمُؤمِنينَ
38.translation_eng: He is just a man who has fabricated a lie against Allah, and we will not believe in him.’
38.transliteration: ʾin huwa ʾillā rajulun-i ftarā ʿalā llāhi kadhiban wa-mā naḥnu lahū bi-muʾminīna

39.content: قالَ رَبِّ انصُرني بِما كَذَّبونِ
39.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! Help me, as they impugn me.’
39.transliteration: qāla rabbi nṣurnī bi-mā kadhdhabūni

40.content: قالَ عَمّا قَليلٍ لَيُصبِحُنَّ نادِمينَ
40.translation_eng: He said, ‘In a little while they will become regretful.’
40.transliteration: qāla ʿammā qalīlin la-yuṣbiḥunna nādimīna

41.content: فَأَخَذَتهُمُ الصَّيحَةُ بِالحَقِّ فَجَعَلناهُم غُثاءً ۚ فَبُعدًا لِلقَومِ الظّالِمينَ
41.translation_eng: So the Cry seized them justifiably and We turned them into a scum. So away with the wrongdoing lot!
41.transliteration: fa-ʾakhadhathumu ṣ-ṣayḥatu bi-l-ḥaqqi fa-jaʿalnāhum ghuthāʾan fa-buʿdan li-l-qawmi ẓ-ẓālimīna

42.content: ثُمَّ أَنشَأنا مِن بَعدِهِم قُرونًا آخَرينَ
42.translation_eng: Then after them We brought forth other generations.
42.transliteration: thumma ʾanshaʾnā min baʿdihim qurūnan ʾākharīna

43.content: ما تَسبِقُ مِن أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَها وَما يَستَأخِرونَ
43.translation_eng: No nation can advance its time nor can it defer it.
43.transliteration: mā tasbiqu min ʾummatin ʾajalahā wa-mā yastaʾkhirūna

44.content: ثُمَّ أَرسَلنا رُسُلَنا تَترىٰ ۖ كُلَّ ما جاءَ أُمَّةً رَسولُها كَذَّبوهُ ۚ فَأَتبَعنا بَعضَهُم بَعضًا وَجَعَلناهُم أَحاديثَ ۚ فَبُعدًا لِقَومٍ لا يُؤمِنونَ
44.translation_eng: Then We sent Our apostles successively. Whenever there came to a nation its apostle, they impugned him, so We made them follow one another [to extinction] and We turned them into folktales. So away with the faithless lot!
44.transliteration: thumma ʾarsalnā rusulanā tatrā kulla mā jāʾa ʾummatan rasūluhā kadhdhabūhu fa-ʾatbaʿnā baʿḍahum baʿḍan wa-jaʿalnāhum ʾaḥādītha fa-buʿdan li-qawmin lā yuʾminūna

45.content: ثُمَّ أَرسَلنا موسىٰ وَأَخاهُ هارونَ بِآياتِنا وَسُلطانٍ مُبينٍ
45.translation_eng: Then We sent Moses and Aaron, his brother, with Our signs and a manifest authority,
45.transliteration: thumma ʾarsalnā mūsā wa-ʾakhāhu hārūna bi-ʾāyātinā wa-sulṭānin mubīnin

46.content: إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَمَلَئِهِ فَاستَكبَروا وَكانوا قَومًا عالينَ
46.translation_eng: to Pharaoh and his elites; but they acted arrogantly and they were a tyrannical lot.
46.transliteration: ʾilā firʿawna wa-malaʾihī fa-stakbarū wa-kānū qawman ʿālīna

47.content: فَقالوا أَنُؤمِنُ لِبَشَرَينِ مِثلِنا وَقَومُهُما لَنا عابِدونَ
47.translation_eng: They said, ‘Shall we believe two humans like ourselves, while their people are our slaves?’
47.transliteration: fa-qālū ʾa-nuʾminu li-basharayni mithlinā wa-qawmuhumā lanā ʿābidūna

48.content: فَكَذَّبوهُما فَكانوا مِنَ المُهلَكينَ
48.translation_eng: So they impugned the two of them, whereat they were among those who were destroyed.
48.transliteration: fa-kadhdhabūhumā fa-kānū mina l-muhlakīna

49.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسَى الكِتابَ لَعَلَّهُم يَهتَدونَ
49.translation_eng: Certainly We gave Moses the Book so that they might be guided,
49.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā mūsā l-kitāba laʿallahum yahtadūna

50.content: وَجَعَلنَا ابنَ مَريَمَ وَأُمَّهُ آيَةً وَآوَيناهُما إِلىٰ رَبوَةٍ ذاتِ قَرارٍ وَمَعينٍ
50.translation_eng: and We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and sheltered them in a highland, level and watered by a stream.
50.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā bna maryama wa-ʾummahū ʾāyatan wa-ʾāwaynāhumā ʾilā rabwatin dhāti qarārin wa-maʿīnin

51.content: يا أَيُّهَا الرُّسُلُ كُلوا مِنَ الطَّيِّباتِ وَاعمَلوا صالِحًا ۖ إِنّي بِما تَعمَلونَ عَليمٌ
51.translation_eng: O apostles! Eat of the good things and act righteously. Indeed I know best what you do.
51.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā r-rusulu kulū mina ṭ-ṭayyibāti wa-ʿmalū ṣāliḥan ʾinnī bi-mā taʿmalūna ʿalīmun

52.content: وَإِنَّ هٰذِهِ أُمَّتُكُم أُمَّةً واحِدَةً وَأَنا رَبُّكُم فَاتَّقونِ
52.translation_eng: Indeed this community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord, so be wary of Me.
52.transliteration: wa-ʾinna hādhihī ʾummatukum ʾummatan wāḥidatan wa-ʾana rabbukum fa-ttaqūni

53.content: فَتَقَطَّعوا أَمرَهُم بَينَهُم زُبُرًا ۖ كُلُّ حِزبٍ بِما لَدَيهِم فَرِحونَ
53.translation_eng: But they fragmented their religion among themselves, each party exulting in what it had.
53.transliteration: fa-taqaṭṭaʿū ʾamrahum baynahum zuburan kullu ḥizbin bi-mā ladayhim fariḥūna

54.content: فَذَرهُم في غَمرَتِهِم حَتّىٰ حينٍ
54.translation_eng: So leave them in their stupor for a while.
54.transliteration: fa-dharhum fī ghamratihim ḥattā ḥīnin

55.content: أَيَحسَبونَ أَنَّما نُمِدُّهُم بِهِ مِن مالٍ وَبَنينَ
55.translation_eng: Do they suppose that whatever aid We provide them in regard to wealth and children [is because]
55.transliteration: ʾa-yaḥsabūna ʾannamā numidduhum bihī min mālin wa-banīna

56.content: نُسارِعُ لَهُم فِي الخَيراتِ ۚ بَل لا يَشعُرونَ
56.translation_eng: We are eager to bring them good? Rather they are not aware!
56.transliteration: nusāriʿu lahum fī l-khayrāti bal lā yashʿurūna

57.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ هُم مِن خَشيَةِ رَبِّهِم مُشفِقونَ
57.translation_eng: Indeed those who are apprehensive for the fear of their Lord,
57.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna hum min khashyati rabbihim mushfiqūna

58.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم بِآياتِ رَبِّهِم يُؤمِنونَ
58.translation_eng: and who believe in the signs of their Lord,
58.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum bi-ʾāyāti rabbihim yuʾminūna

59.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم بِرَبِّهِم لا يُشرِكونَ
59.translation_eng: and who do not ascribe partners to their Lord;
59.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum bi-rabbihim lā yushrikūna

60.content: وَالَّذينَ يُؤتونَ ما آتَوا وَقُلوبُهُم وَجِلَةٌ أَنَّهُم إِلىٰ رَبِّهِم راجِعونَ
60.translation_eng: and who give whatever they give while their hearts tremble with awe that they are going to return to their Lord
60.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yuʾtūna mā ʾātaw wa-qulūbuhum wajilatun ʾannahum ʾilā rabbihim rājiʿūna

61.content: أُولٰئِكَ يُسارِعونَ فِي الخَيراتِ وَهُم لَها سابِقونَ
61.translation_eng: —it is they who are zealous in [performing] good works, and take the lead in them.
61.transliteration: ʾulāʾika yusāriʿūna fī l-khayrāti wa-hum lahā sābiqūna

62.content: وَلا نُكَلِّفُ نَفسًا إِلّا وُسعَها ۖ وَلَدَينا كِتابٌ يَنطِقُ بِالحَقِّ ۚ وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
62.translation_eng: We task no soul except according to its capacity, and with Us is a book that speaks the truth, and they will not be wronged.
62.transliteration: wa-lā nukallifu nafsan ʾillā wusʿahā wa-ladaynā kitābun yanṭiqu bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-hum lā yuẓlamūna

63.content: بَل قُلوبُهُم في غَمرَةٍ مِن هٰذا وَلَهُم أَعمالٌ مِن دونِ ذٰلِكَ هُم لَها عامِلونَ
63.translation_eng: Rather their hearts are in a stupor in regard to this, and there are their other deeds besides which they perpetrate.
63.transliteration: bal qulūbuhum fī ghamratin min hādhā wa-lahum ʾaʿmālun min dūni dhālika hum lahā ʿāmilūna

64.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا أَخَذنا مُترَفيهِم بِالعَذابِ إِذا هُم يَجأَرونَ
64.translation_eng: When We seize their affluent ones with punishment, behold, they make entreaties [to Us].
64.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā ʾakhadhnā mutrafīhim bi-l-ʿadhābi ʾidhā hum yajʾarūna

65.content: لا تَجأَرُوا اليَومَ ۖ إِنَّكُم مِنّا لا تُنصَرونَ
65.translation_eng: ‘Do not make entreaties today! Indeed you will not receive any help from Us.
65.transliteration: lā tajʾarū l-yawma ʾinnakum minnā lā tunṣarūna

66.content: قَد كانَت آياتي تُتلىٰ عَلَيكُم فَكُنتُم عَلىٰ أَعقابِكُم تَنكِصونَ
66.translation_eng: Certainly My signs used to be recited to you, but you used to take to your heels,
66.transliteration: qad kānat ʾāyātī tutlā ʿalaykum fa-kuntum ʿalā ʾaʿqābikum tankiṣūna

67.content: مُستَكبِرينَ بِهِ سامِرًا تَهجُرونَ
67.translation_eng: being disdainful of it,1 talking nonsense in your nightly sessions.’That is, the Qurʾān. Or, ‘him,’ that is of the Prophet.
67.transliteration: mustakbirīna bihī sāmiran tahjurūna

68.content: أَفَلَم يَدَّبَّرُوا القَولَ أَم جاءَهُم ما لَم يَأتِ آباءَهُمُ الأَوَّلينَ
68.translation_eng: Have they not contemplated the discourse,1 or has anything come to them [in it] that did not come to their forefathers?That is, the Qurʾān. Cf. 4:82, 47:24.
68.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lam yaddabbarū l-qawla ʾam jāʾahum mā lam yaʾti ʾābāʾahumu l-ʾawwalīna

69.content: أَم لَم يَعرِفوا رَسولَهُم فَهُم لَهُ مُنكِرونَ
69.translation_eng: Is it that they do not recognize their apostle,1 and so they deny him?2That is, ‘Is the Apostle a stranger of an unknown background and a person unknown to them?’Or ‘and so they are not at home with him.’
69.transliteration: ʾam lam yaʿrifū rasūlahum fa-hum lahū munkirūna

70.content: أَم يَقولونَ بِهِ جِنَّةٌ ۚ بَل جاءَهُم بِالحَقِّ وَأَكثَرُهُم لِلحَقِّ كارِهونَ
70.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘There is madness in him’? Rather he has brought them the truth, and most of them are averse to the truth.
70.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna bihī jinnatun bal jāʾahum bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾaktharuhum li-l-ḥaqqi kārihūna

71.content: وَلَوِ اتَّبَعَ الحَقُّ أَهواءَهُم لَفَسَدَتِ السَّماواتُ وَالأَرضُ وَمَن فيهِنَّ ۚ بَل أَتَيناهُم بِذِكرِهِم فَهُم عَن ذِكرِهِم مُعرِضونَ
71.translation_eng: Had the Truth followed their desires, the heavens and the earth would have surely fallen apart [along] with those who are in them. Rather We have brought them their reminder, but they are disregardful of their reminder.
71.transliteration: wa-lawi ttabaʿa l-ḥaqqu ʾahwāʾahum la-fasadati s-samāwātu wa-l-ʾarḍu wa-man fīhinna bal ʾataynāhum bi-dhikrihim fa-hum ʿan dhikrihim muʿriḍūna

72.content: أَم تَسأَلُهُم خَرجًا فَخَراجُ رَبِّكَ خَيرٌ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيرُ الرّازِقينَ
72.translation_eng: Do you ask a recompense from them? Yet your Lord’s recompense is better, and He is the best of providers.
72.transliteration: ʾam tasʾaluhum kharjan fa-kharāju rabbika khayrun wa-huwa khayru r-rāziqīna

73.content: وَإِنَّكَ لَتَدعوهُم إِلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
73.translation_eng: Indeed you invite them to a straight path,
73.transliteration: wa-ʾinnaka la-tadʿūhum ʾilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

74.content: وَإِنَّ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالآخِرَةِ عَنِ الصِّراطِ لَناكِبونَ
74.translation_eng: and indeed those who do not believe in the Hereafter surely deviate from the path.
74.transliteration: wa-ʾinna lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-l-ʾākhirati ʿani ṣ-ṣirāṭi la-nākibūna

75.content: ۞ وَلَو رَحِمناهُم وَكَشَفنا ما بِهِم مِن ضُرٍّ لَلَجّوا في طُغيانِهِم يَعمَهونَ
75.translation_eng: Should We have mercy upon them and remove their distress from them, they would surely persist, bewildered in their rebellion.
75.transliteration: wa-law raḥimnāhum wa-kashafnā mā bihim min ḍurrin la-lajjū fī ṭughyānihim yaʿmahūna

76.content: وَلَقَد أَخَذناهُم بِالعَذابِ فَمَا استَكانوا لِرَبِّهِم وَما يَتَضَرَّعونَ
76.translation_eng: Certainly We have seized them with punishment, yet they neither humbled themselves to their Lord, nor did they entreat [Him for mercy].
76.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾakhadhnāhum bi-l-ʿadhābi fa-mā stakānū li-rabbihim wa-mā yataḍarraʿūna

77.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا فَتَحنا عَلَيهِم بابًا ذا عَذابٍ شَديدٍ إِذا هُم فيهِ مُبلِسونَ
77.translation_eng: When We opened on them the door of a severe punishment, behold, they are despondent in it.
77.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā fataḥnā ʿalayhim bāban dhā ʿadhābin shadīdin ʾidhā hum fīhi mublisūna

78.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي أَنشَأَ لَكُمُ السَّمعَ وَالأَبصارَ وَالأَفئِدَةَ ۚ قَليلًا ما تَشكُرونَ
78.translation_eng: It is He who made for you hearing, eyesight, and hearts. Little do you thank.
78.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī ʾanshaʾa lakumu s-samʿa wa-l-ʾabṣāra wa-l-ʾafʾidata qalīlan mā tashkurūna

79.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي ذَرَأَكُم فِي الأَرضِ وَإِلَيهِ تُحشَرونَ
79.translation_eng: It is He who created you on the earth, and you will be mustered toward Him.
79.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī dharaʾakum fī l-ʾarḍi wa-ʾilayhi tuḥsharūna

80.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي يُحيي وَيُميتُ وَلَهُ اختِلافُ اللَّيلِ وَالنَّهارِ ۚ أَفَلا تَعقِلونَ
80.translation_eng: And it is He who gives life and brings death and due to Him is the alternation of day and night. Do you not apply reason?
80.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī yuḥyī wa-yumītu wa-lahu khtilāfu l-layli wa-n-nahāri ʾa-fa-lā taʿqilūna

81.content: بَل قالوا مِثلَ ما قالَ الأَوَّلونَ
81.translation_eng: Rather they say just like what the ancients said.
81.transliteration: bal qālū mithla mā qāla l-ʾawwalūna

82.content: قالوا أَإِذا مِتنا وَكُنّا تُرابًا وَعِظامًا أَإِنّا لَمَبعوثونَ
82.translation_eng: They said, ‘What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we be resurrected?’
82.transliteration: qālū ʾa-ʾidhā mitnā wa-kunnā turāban wa-ʿiẓāman ʾa-ʾinnā la-mabʿūthūna

83.content: لَقَد وُعِدنا نَحنُ وَآباؤُنا هٰذا مِن قَبلُ إِن هٰذا إِلّا أَساطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ
83.translation_eng: Certainly we and our fathers were promised this before. [But] these are nothing but myths of the ancients.’
83.transliteration: la-qad wuʿidnā naḥnu wa-ʾābāʾunā hādhā min qablu ʾin hādhā ʾillā ʾasāṭīru l-ʾawwalīna

84.content: قُل لِمَنِ الأَرضُ وَمَن فيها إِن كُنتُم تَعلَمونَ
84.translation_eng: Say, ‘To whom does the earth belong and whoever it contains, if you know?’
84.transliteration: qul li-mani l-ʾarḍu wa-man fīhā ʾin kuntum taʿlamūna

85.content: سَيَقولونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُل أَفَلا تَذَكَّرونَ
85.translation_eng: They will say, ‘To Allah.’ Say, ‘Will you not then take admonition?’
85.transliteration: sa-yaqūlūna li-llāhi qul ʾa-fa-lā tadhakkarūna

86.content: قُل مَن رَبُّ السَّماواتِ السَّبعِ وَرَبُّ العَرشِ العَظيمِ
86.translation_eng: Say, ‘Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Great Throne?’
86.transliteration: qul man rabbu s-samāwāti s-sabʿi wa-rabbu l-ʿarshi l-ʿaẓīmi

87.content: سَيَقولونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُل أَفَلا تَتَّقونَ
87.translation_eng: They will say, ‘[They belong] to Allah.’ Say, ‘Will you not then be wary [of Him]?’
87.transliteration: sa-yaqūlūna li-llāhi qul ʾa-fa-lā tattaqūna

88.content: قُل مَن بِيَدِهِ مَلَكوتُ كُلِّ شَيءٍ وَهُوَ يُجيرُ وَلا يُجارُ عَلَيهِ إِن كُنتُم تَعلَمونَ
88.translation_eng: Say, ‘In whose hand is the dominion of all things, and who shelters and no shelter can be provided from Him, if you know?’
88.transliteration: qul man bi-yadihī malakūtu kulli shayʾin wa-huwa yujīru wa-lā yujāru ʿalayhi ʾin kuntum taʿlamūna

89.content: سَيَقولونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُل فَأَنّىٰ تُسحَرونَ
89.translation_eng: They will say, ‘[They all belong] to Allah.’ Say, ‘Then how are you being deluded?’1Or ‘How are you being misled,’ or ‘How are you being rendered blind.’
89.transliteration: sa-yaqūlūna li-llāhi qul fa-ʾannā tusḥarūna

90.content: بَل أَتَيناهُم بِالحَقِّ وَإِنَّهُم لَكاذِبونَ
90.translation_eng: Rather We have brought them the truth, and they are indeed liars.
90.transliteration: bal ʾataynāhum bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾinnahum la-kādhibūna

91.content: مَا اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ مِن وَلَدٍ وَما كانَ مَعَهُ مِن إِلٰهٍ ۚ إِذًا لَذَهَبَ كُلُّ إِلٰهٍ بِما خَلَقَ وَلَعَلا بَعضُهُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ ۚ سُبحانَ اللَّهِ عَمّا يَصِفونَ
91.translation_eng: Allah has not taken any offspring, neither is there any god besides Him, for then each god would take away what he created, and some of them would surely rise up against others. Clear is Allah of what they allege!
91.transliteration: mā ttakhadha llāhu min waladin wa-mā kāna maʿahū min ʾilāhin ʾidhan la-dhahaba kullu ʾilāhin bi-mā khalaqa wa-la-ʿalā baʿḍuhum ʿalā baʿḍin subḥāna llāhi ʿammā yaṣifūna

92.content: عالِمِ الغَيبِ وَالشَّهادَةِ فَتَعالىٰ عَمّا يُشرِكونَ
92.translation_eng: The Knower of the sensible and the Unseen, He is above having any partners that they ascribe [to Him].
92.transliteration: ʿālimi l-ghaybi wa-sh-shahādati fa-taʿālā ʿammā yushrikūna

93.content: قُل رَبِّ إِمّا تُرِيَنّي ما يوعَدونَ
93.translation_eng: Say, ‘My Lord! If You should show me what they are promised,
93.transliteration: qul rabbi ʾimmā turiyannī mā yūʿadūna

94.content: رَبِّ فَلا تَجعَلني فِي القَومِ الظّالِمينَ
94.translation_eng: then do not put me, my Lord, among the wrongdoing lot.’
94.transliteration: rabbi fa-lā tajʿalnī fī l-qawmi ẓ-ẓālimīna

95.content: وَإِنّا عَلىٰ أَن نُرِيَكَ ما نَعِدُهُم لَقادِرونَ
95.translation_eng: We are indeed able to show you what We promise them.
95.transliteration: wa-ʾinnā ʿalā ʾan nuriyaka mā naʿiduhum la-qādirūna

96.content: ادفَع بِالَّتي هِيَ أَحسَنُ السَّيِّئَةَ ۚ نَحنُ أَعلَمُ بِما يَصِفونَ
96.translation_eng: Repel ill [conduct] with that which is the best. We know best whatever they allege.
96.transliteration: idfaʿ bi-llatī hiya ʾaḥsanu s-sayyiʾata naḥnu ʾaʿlamu bi-mā yaṣifūna

97.content: وَقُل رَبِّ أَعوذُ بِكَ مِن هَمَزاتِ الشَّياطينِ
97.translation_eng: And say, ‘My Lord! I seek Your protection from the promptings of devils;
97.transliteration: wa-qul rabbi ʾaʿūdhu bika min hamazāti sh-shayāṭīni

98.content: وَأَعوذُ بِكَ رَبِّ أَن يَحضُرونِ
98.translation_eng: and I seek Your protection, my Lord, from their presence near me.’
98.transliteration: wa-ʾaʿūdhu bika rabbi ʾan yaḥḍurūni

99.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءَ أَحَدَهُمُ المَوتُ قالَ رَبِّ ارجِعونِ
99.translation_eng: When death comes to one of them, he says, ‘My Lord! Take me back,
99.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā jāʾa ʾaḥadahumu l-mawtu qāla rabbi rjiʿūni

100.content: لَعَلّي أَعمَلُ صالِحًا فيما تَرَكتُ ۚ كَلّا ۚ إِنَّها كَلِمَةٌ هُوَ قائِلُها ۖ وَمِن وَرائِهِم بَرزَخٌ إِلىٰ يَومِ يُبعَثونَ
100.translation_eng: that I may act righteously in what I have left behind.’ ‘By no means! These are mere words that he says.’ And ahead of them is a barrier until the day they will be resurrected
100.transliteration: laʿallī ʾaʿmalu ṣāliḥan fī-mā taraktu kallā ʾinnahā kalimatun huwa qāʾiluhā wa-min warāʾihim barzakhun ʾilā yawmi yubʿathūna

101.content: فَإِذا نُفِخَ فِي الصّورِ فَلا أَنسابَ بَينَهُم يَومَئِذٍ وَلا يَتَساءَلونَ
101.translation_eng: And when the Trumpet is blown, there will be no ties between them on that day, nor will they ask [about] each other.1Cf. 70:10.
101.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā nufikha fī ṣ-ṣūri fa-lā ʾansāba baynahum yawmaʾidhin wa-lā yatasāʾalūna

102.content: فَمَن ثَقُلَت مَوازينُهُ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُفلِحونَ
102.translation_eng: Then those whose deeds weigh heavy in the scales —it is they who are the felicitous.
102.transliteration: fa-man thaqulat mawāzīnuhū fa-ʾulāʾika humu l-mufliḥūna

103.content: وَمَن خَفَّت مَوازينُهُ فَأُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ خَسِروا أَنفُسَهُم في جَهَنَّمَ خالِدونَ
103.translation_eng: As for those whose deeds weigh light in the scales, —they will be the ones who have ruined their souls, [and] they will remain in hell [forever].
103.transliteration: wa-man khaffat mawāzīnuhū fa-ʾulāʾika lladhīna khasirū ʾanfusahum fī jahannama khālidūna

104.content: تَلفَحُ وُجوهَهُمُ النّارُ وَهُم فيها كالِحونَ
104.translation_eng: The Fire will scorch their faces, and they will be morose in it.
104.transliteration: talfaḥu wujūhahumu n-nāru wa-hum fīhā kāliḥūna

105.content: أَلَم تَكُن آياتي تُتلىٰ عَلَيكُم فَكُنتُم بِها تُكَذِّبونَ
105.translation_eng: ‘Was it not that My signs were recited to you but you would deny them?’
105.transliteration: ʾa-lam takun ʾāyātī tutlā ʿalaykum fa-kuntum bihā tukadhdhibūna

106.content: قالوا رَبَّنا غَلَبَت عَلَينا شِقوَتُنا وَكُنّا قَومًا ضالّينَ
106.translation_eng: They will say, ‘Our Lord! Our wretchedness overcame us, and we were an astray lot.
106.transliteration: qālū rabbanā ghalabat ʿalaynā shiqwatunā wa-kunnā qawman ḍāllīna

107.content: رَبَّنا أَخرِجنا مِنها فَإِن عُدنا فَإِنّا ظالِمونَ
107.translation_eng: Our Lord! Bring us out of this! Then, if we revert, we will indeed be wrongdoers.’
107.transliteration: rabbanā ʾakhrijnā minhā fa-ʾin ʿudnā fa-ʾinnā ẓālimūna

108.translation_eng: He will say, ‘Begone in it, and do not speak to Me!

109.content: إِنَّهُ كانَ فَريقٌ مِن عِبادي يَقولونَ رَبَّنا آمَنّا فَاغفِر لَنا وَارحَمنا وَأَنتَ خَيرُ الرّاحِمينَ
109.translation_eng: Indeed there was a part of My servants who would say, “Our Lord! We have believed. So forgive us, and have mercy on us, and You are the best of the merciful.”
109.transliteration: ʾinnahū kāna farīqun min ʿibādī yaqūlūna rabbanā ʾāmannā fa-ghfir lanā wa-rḥamnā wa-ʾanta khayru r-rāḥimīna

110.content: فَاتَّخَذتُموهُم سِخرِيًّا حَتّىٰ أَنسَوكُم ذِكري وَكُنتُم مِنهُم تَضحَكونَ
110.translation_eng: But then you took them by ridicule until they made you forget My remembrance,1 and you used to laugh at them.That is, ‘your contemptuous attitude towards them made you oblivious of Me and My reminders and warnings.’
110.transliteration: fa-ttakhadhtumūhum sikhriyyan ḥattā ʾansawkum dhikrī wa-kuntum minhum taḍḥakūna

111.content: إِنّي جَزَيتُهُمُ اليَومَ بِما صَبَروا أَنَّهُم هُمُ الفائِزونَ
111.translation_eng: Indeed I have rewarded them today for their patience. They are indeed the triumphant.’
111.transliteration: ʾinnī jazaytuhumu l-yawma bi-mā ṣabarū ʾannahum humu l-fāʾizūna

112.content: قالَ كَم لَبِثتُم فِي الأَرضِ عَدَدَ سِنينَ
112.translation_eng: He will say, ‘How many years did you remain on earth?’
112.transliteration: qāla kam labithtum fī l-ʾarḍi ʿadada sinīna

113.content: قالوا لَبِثنا يَومًا أَو بَعضَ يَومٍ فَاسأَلِ العادّينَ
113.translation_eng: They will say, ‘We remained for a day, or part of a day; yet ask those who keep the count.’
113.transliteration: qālū labithnā yawman ʾaw baʿḍa yawmin fa-sʾali l-ʿāddīna

114.content: قالَ إِن لَبِثتُم إِلّا قَليلًا ۖ لَو أَنَّكُم كُنتُم تَعلَمونَ
114.translation_eng: He will say, ‘You only remained a little; if only you had known.
114.transliteration: qāla ʾin labithtum ʾillā qalīlan law ʾannakum kuntum taʿlamūna

115.content: أَفَحَسِبتُم أَنَّما خَلَقناكُم عَبَثًا وَأَنَّكُم إِلَينا لا تُرجَعونَ
115.translation_eng: Did you suppose that We created you aimlessly, and that you will not be brought back to Us?’
115.transliteration: ʾa-fa-ḥasibtum ʾannamā khalaqnākum ʿabathan wa-ʾannakum ʾilaynā lā turjaʿūna

116.content: فَتَعالَى اللَّهُ المَلِكُ الحَقُّ ۖ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ رَبُّ العَرشِ الكَريمِ
116.translation_eng: So exalted is Allah, the True Sovereign, there is no god except Him, the Lord of the Noble Throne.
116.transliteration: fa-taʿālā llāhu l-maliku l-ḥaqqu lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa rabbu l-ʿarshi l-karīmi

117.content: وَمَن يَدعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلٰهًا آخَرَ لا بُرهانَ لَهُ بِهِ فَإِنَّما حِسابُهُ عِندَ رَبِّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لا يُفلِحُ الكافِرونَ
117.translation_eng: Whoever invokes besides Allah another god of which he has no proof, his reckoning will indeed rest with his Lord. Indeed the faithless will not be felicitous.
117.transliteration: wa-man yadʿu maʿa llāhi ʾilāhan ʾākhara lā burhāna lahū bihī fa-ʾinnamā ḥisābuhū ʿinda rabbihī ʾinnahū lā yufliḥu l-kāfirūna

118.content: وَقُل رَبِّ اغفِر وَارحَم وَأَنتَ خَيرُ الرّاحِمينَ
118.translation_eng: Say, ‘My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful.’
118.transliteration: wa-qul rabbi ghfir wa-rḥam wa-ʾanta khayru r-rāḥimīna

24.description: The surah that contains the inimitable verse that celebrates God as The Light of the heavens and earth, guiding to Himself whomever He so wills. It is named after the “Light Verse” which occurs at verse 35, where God’s light is contrasted to the darkness in which the disbelievers find themselves engulfed. The surah clarifies several regulations for the Muslim community, mainly to do with marriage, modesty, obedience to the Prophet, and appropriate behaviour in the household.

1.content: سورَةٌ أَنزَلناها وَفَرَضناها وَأَنزَلنا فيها آياتٍ بَيِّناتٍ لَعَلَّكُم تَذَكَّرونَ
1.translation_eng: [This is] a sūrah which We have sent down, and prescribed it, and We have sent down in it manifest signs so that you may take admonition.
1.transliteration: sūratun ʾanzalnāhā wa-faraḍnāhā wa-ʾanzalnā fīhā ʾāyātin bayyinātin laʿallakum tadhakkarūna

2.content: الزّانِيَةُ وَالزّاني فَاجلِدوا كُلَّ واحِدٍ مِنهُما مِائَةَ جَلدَةٍ ۖ وَلا تَأخُذكُم بِهِما رَأفَةٌ في دينِ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتُم تُؤمِنونَ بِاللَّهِ وَاليَومِ الآخِرِ ۖ وَليَشهَد عَذابَهُما طائِفَةٌ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
2.translation_eng: As for the fornicatress and the fornicator, strike each of them a hundred lashes, and let not pity for them overcome you in Allah’s law, if you believe in Allah and the Last Day, and let their punishment be witnessed by a group of the faithful.
2.transliteration: az-zāniyatu wa-z-zānī fa-jlidū kulla wāḥidin minhumā miʾata jaldatin wa-lā taʾkhudhkum bihimā raʾfatun fī dīni llāhi ʾin kuntum tuʾminūna bi-llāhi wa-l-yawmi l-ʾākhiri wa-l-yashhad ʿadhābahumā ṭāʾifatun mina l-muʾminīna

3.content: الزّاني لا يَنكِحُ إِلّا زانِيَةً أَو مُشرِكَةً وَالزّانِيَةُ لا يَنكِحُها إِلّا زانٍ أَو مُشرِكٌ ۚ وَحُرِّمَ ذٰلِكَ عَلَى المُؤمِنينَ
3.translation_eng: The fornicator shall not marry anyone but a fornicatress or an idolatress, and the fornicatress shall be married by none except a fornicator or an idolater, and that is forbidden to the faithful.
3.transliteration: az-zānī lā yankiḥu ʾillā zāniyatan ʾaw mushrikatan wa-z-zāniyatu lā yankiḥuhā ʾillā zānin ʾaw mushrikun wa-ḥurrima dhālika ʿalā l-muʾminīna

4.content: وَالَّذينَ يَرمونَ المُحصَناتِ ثُمَّ لَم يَأتوا بِأَربَعَةِ شُهَداءَ فَاجلِدوهُم ثَمانينَ جَلدَةً وَلا تَقبَلوا لَهُم شَهادَةً أَبَدًا ۚ وَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الفاسِقونَ
4.translation_eng: As for those who accuse honourable women and do not bring four witnesses, strike them eighty lashes, and never accept any testimony from them after that, and they are transgressors,
4.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yarmūna l-muḥṣanāti thumma lam yaʾtū bi-ʾarbaʿati shuhadāʾa fa-jlidūhum thamānīna jaldatan wa-lā taqbalū lahum shahādatan ʾabadan wa-ʾulāʾika humu l-fāsiqūna

5.content: إِلَّا الَّذينَ تابوا مِن بَعدِ ذٰلِكَ وَأَصلَحوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
5.translation_eng: excepting those who repent after that and reform, for Allah is indeed all-forgiving, all-merciful.
5.transliteration: ʾillā lladhīna tābū min baʿdi dhālika wa-ʾaṣlaḥū fa-ʾinna llāha ghafūrun raḥīmun

6.content: وَالَّذينَ يَرمونَ أَزواجَهُم وَلَم يَكُن لَهُم شُهَداءُ إِلّا أَنفُسُهُم فَشَهادَةُ أَحَدِهِم أَربَعُ شَهاداتٍ بِاللَّهِ ۙ إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الصّادِقينَ
6.translation_eng: As for those who accuse their wives, but have no witnesses except themselves, then the testimony of one of them shall be a fourfold testimony [sworn] by Allah that he is indeed stating the truth,
6.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yarmūna ʾazwājahum wa-lam yakun lahum shuhadāʾu ʾillā ʾanfusuhum fa-shahādatu ʾaḥadihim ʾarbaʿu shahādātin bi-llāhi ʾinnahū la-mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

7.content: وَالخامِسَةُ أَنَّ لَعنَتَ اللَّهِ عَلَيهِ إِن كانَ مِنَ الكاذِبينَ
7.translation_eng: and a fifth [oath] that Allah’s wrath shall be upon him if he were lying.
7.transliteration: wa-l-khāmisatu ʾanna laʿnata llāhi ʿalayhi ʾin kāna mina l-kādhibīna

8.content: وَيَدرَأُ عَنهَا العَذابَ أَن تَشهَدَ أَربَعَ شَهاداتٍ بِاللَّهِ ۙ إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الكاذِبينَ
8.translation_eng: The punishment shall be averted from her by her testifying with four oaths [sworn] by Allah that he is indeed lying,
8.transliteration: wa-yadraʾu ʿanhā l-ʿadhāba ʾan tashhada ʾarbaʿa shahādātin bi-llāhi ʾinnahū la-mina l-kādhibīna

9.content: وَالخامِسَةَ أَنَّ غَضَبَ اللَّهِ عَلَيها إِن كانَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
9.translation_eng: and a fifth [oath] that Allah’s wrath shall be upon her if he were stating the truth.
9.transliteration: wa-l-khāmisata ʾanna ghaḍaba llāhi ʿalayhā ʾin kāna mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

10.content: وَلَولا فَضلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم وَرَحمَتُهُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ تَوّابٌ حَكيمٌ
10.translation_eng: Were it not for Allah’s grace and His mercy upon you, and that Allah is all-clement, all-wise… .1Ellipsis. For the omitted part of the sentence see verses 14 & 21 below.
10.transliteration: wa-law-lā faḍlu llāhi ʿalaykum wa-raḥmatuhū wa-ʾanna llāha tawwābun ḥakīmun

11.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ جاءوا بِالإِفكِ عُصبَةٌ مِنكُم ۚ لا تَحسَبوهُ شَرًّا لَكُم ۖ بَل هُوَ خَيرٌ لَكُم ۚ لِكُلِّ امرِئٍ مِنهُم مَا اكتَسَبَ مِنَ الإِثمِ ۚ وَالَّذي تَوَلّىٰ كِبرَهُ مِنهُم لَهُ عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
11.translation_eng: Indeed those who initiated the calumny are a band from among yourselves. Do not suppose it is bad for you. Rather it is for your good. Each man among them bears [the onus for] his share in the sin, and as for him who assumed its major burden from among them there is a great punishment for him.
11.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna jāʾū bi-l-ʾifki ʿuṣbatun minkum lā taḥsabūhu sharran lakum bal huwa khayrun lakum li-kulli mriʾin minhum mā ktasaba mina l-ʾithmi wa-lladhī tawallā kibrahū minhum lahū ʿadhābun ʿaẓīmun

12.content: لَولا إِذ سَمِعتُموهُ ظَنَّ المُؤمِنونَ وَالمُؤمِناتُ بِأَنفُسِهِم خَيرًا وَقالوا هٰذا إِفكٌ مُبينٌ
12.translation_eng: When you [first] heard about it, why did not the faithful, men and women, think well of their folks, and say, ‘This is an obvious calumny’?
12.transliteration: law-lā ʾidh samiʿtumūhu ẓanna l-muʾminūna wa-l-muʾminātu bi-ʾanfusihim khayran wa-qālū hādhā ʾifkun mubīnun

13.content: لَولا جاءوا عَلَيهِ بِأَربَعَةِ شُهَداءَ ۚ فَإِذ لَم يَأتوا بِالشُّهَداءِ فَأُولٰئِكَ عِندَ اللَّهِ هُمُ الكاذِبونَ
13.translation_eng: Why did they1 not bring four witnesses to it? So when they could not bring the witnesses, they are liars in Allah’s sight.That is, those who had spread the slander accusing the Prophet’s wife and one of the Companions.
13.transliteration: law-lā jāʾū ʿalayhi bi-ʾarbaʿati shuhadāʾa fa-ʾidh lam yaʾtū bi-sh-shuhadāʾi fa-ʾulāʾika ʿinda llāhi humu l-kādhibūna

14.content: وَلَولا فَضلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم وَرَحمَتُهُ فِي الدُّنيا وَالآخِرَةِ لَمَسَّكُم في ما أَفَضتُم فيهِ عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
14.translation_eng: Were it not for Allah’s grace and His mercy upon you in this world and the Hereafter, there would have befallen you a great punishment for what you ventured into,
14.transliteration: wa-law-lā faḍlu llāhi ʿalaykum wa-raḥmatuhū fī d-dunyā wa-l-ʾākhirati la-massakum fī mā ʾafaḍtum fīhi ʿadhābun ʿaẓīmun

15.content: إِذ تَلَقَّونَهُ بِأَلسِنَتِكُم وَتَقولونَ بِأَفواهِكُم ما لَيسَ لَكُم بِهِ عِلمٌ وَتَحسَبونَهُ هَيِّنًا وَهُوَ عِندَ اللَّهِ عَظيمٌ
15.translation_eng: when you were receiving it on your tongues, and were mouthing something of which you had no knowledge, supposing it to be a light matter, while it was a grave [matter] with Allah.
15.transliteration: ʾidh talaqqawnahū bi-ʾalsinatikum wa-taqūlūna bi-ʾafwāhikum mā laysa lakum bihī ʿilmun wa-taḥsabūnahū hayyinan wa-huwa ʿinda llāhi ʿaẓīmun

16.content: وَلَولا إِذ سَمِعتُموهُ قُلتُم ما يَكونُ لَنا أَن نَتَكَلَّمَ بِهٰذا سُبحانَكَ هٰذا بُهتانٌ عَظيمٌ
16.translation_eng: And why did you not, when you heard it, say, ‘It is not for us to say such a thing. [O Allah!] You are immaculate! This is a monstrous calumny!’
16.transliteration: wa-law-lā ʾidh samiʿtumūhu qultum mā yakūnu lanā ʾan natakallama bi-hādhā subḥānaka hādhā buhtānun ʿaẓīmun

17.content: يَعِظُكُمُ اللَّهُ أَن تَعودوا لِمِثلِهِ أَبَدًا إِن كُنتُم مُؤمِنينَ
17.translation_eng: Allah advises you lest you should ever repeat the like of it, should you be faithful.
17.transliteration: yaʿiẓukumu llāhu ʾan taʿūdū li-mithlihī ʾabadan ʾin kuntum muʾminīna

18.content: وَيُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الآياتِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
18.translation_eng: Allah clarifies the signs for you, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
18.transliteration: wa-yubayyinu llāhu lakumu l-ʾāyāti wa-llāhu ʿalīmun ḥakīmun

19.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يُحِبّونَ أَن تَشيعَ الفاحِشَةُ فِي الَّذينَ آمَنوا لَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ فِي الدُّنيا وَالآخِرَةِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ وَأَنتُم لا تَعلَمونَ
19.translation_eng: Indeed those who want indecency to spread among the faithful —there is a painful punishment for them in the world and the Hereafter, and Allah knows and you do not know.
19.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna yuḥibbūna ʾan tashīʿa l-fāḥishatu fī lladhīna ʾāmanū lahum ʿadhābun ʾalīmun fī d-dunyā wa-l-ʾākhirati wa-llāhu yaʿlamu wa-ʾantum lā taʿlamūna

20.content: وَلَولا فَضلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم وَرَحمَتُهُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ رَءوفٌ رَحيمٌ
20.translation_eng: Were it not for Allah’s grace and His mercy upon you, and that Allah is all-kind, all-merciful.
20.transliteration: wa-law-lā faḍlu llāhi ʿalaykum wa-raḥmatuhū wa-ʾanna llāha raʾūfun raḥīmun

21.content: ۞ يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تَتَّبِعوا خُطُواتِ الشَّيطانِ ۚ وَمَن يَتَّبِع خُطُواتِ الشَّيطانِ فَإِنَّهُ يَأمُرُ بِالفَحشاءِ وَالمُنكَرِ ۚ وَلَولا فَضلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم وَرَحمَتُهُ ما زَكىٰ مِنكُم مِن أَحَدٍ أَبَدًا وَلٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ يُزَكّي مَن يَشاءُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَميعٌ عَليمٌ
21.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Do not follow in Satan’s steps. Whoever follows in Satan’s steps [should know that] he indeed prompts [you to commit] indecent acts and wrong. Were it not for Allah’s grace and His mercy upon you, not one of you would ever be pure. But Allah purifies whomever He wishes, and Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing.
21.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū lā tattabiʿū khuṭuwāti sh-shayṭāni wa-man yattabiʿ khuṭuwāti sh-shayṭāni fa-ʾinnahū yaʾmuru bi-l-faḥshāʾi wa-l-munkari wa-law-lā faḍlu llāhi ʿalaykum wa-raḥmatuhū mā zakā minkum min ʾaḥadin ʾabadan wa-lākinna llāha yuzakkī man yashāʾu wa-llāhu samīʿun ʿalīmun

22.content: وَلا يَأتَلِ أُولُو الفَضلِ مِنكُم وَالسَّعَةِ أَن يُؤتوا أُولِي القُربىٰ وَالمَساكينَ وَالمُهاجِرينَ في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ وَليَعفوا وَليَصفَحوا ۗ أَلا تُحِبّونَ أَن يَغفِرَ اللَّهُ لَكُم ۗ وَاللَّهُ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
22.translation_eng: Let the well-off and the opulent among you not vow1 not to give to the relatives and the needy, and to those who have migrated in the way of Allah, and let them excuse and forbear. Do you not love that Allah should forgive you? And Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.Or ‘Let the well-to-do and the opulent among you not fail to give … .’
22.transliteration: wa-lā yaʾtali ʾulū l-faḍli minkum wa-s-saʿati ʾan yuʾtū ʾulī l-qurbā wa-l-masākīna wa-l-muhājirīna fī sabīli llāhi wa-l-yaʿfū wa-l-yaṣfaḥū ʾa-lā tuḥibbūna ʾan yaghfira llāhu lakum wa-llāhu ghafūrun raḥīmun

23.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَرمونَ المُحصَناتِ الغافِلاتِ المُؤمِناتِ لُعِنوا فِي الدُّنيا وَالآخِرَةِ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
23.translation_eng: Indeed those who accuse honourable and unwary faithful women shall be cursed in this world and the Hereafter, and there shall be a great punishment for them
23.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna yarmūna l-muḥṣanāti l-ghāfilāti l-muʾmināti luʿinū fī d-dunyā wa-l-ʾākhirati wa-lahum ʿadhābun ʿaẓīmun

24.content: يَومَ تَشهَدُ عَلَيهِم أَلسِنَتُهُم وَأَيديهِم وَأَرجُلُهُم بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
24.translation_eng: on the day when witness shall be given against them by their tongues, their hands, and their feet concerning what they used to do.
24.transliteration: yawma tashhadū ʿalayhim ʾalsinatuhum wa-ʾaydīhim wa-ʾarjuluhum bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūna

25.content: يَومَئِذٍ يُوَفّيهِمُ اللَّهُ دينَهُمُ الحَقَّ وَيَعلَمونَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الحَقُّ المُبينُ
25.translation_eng: On that day Allah will pay them in full their due recompense, and they shall know that Allah is the Manifest Reality.
25.transliteration: yawmaʾidhin yuwaffīhimu llāhu dīnahumu l-ḥaqqa wa-yaʿlamūna ʾanna llāha huwa l-ḥaqqu l-mubīnu

26.content: الخَبيثاتُ لِلخَبيثينَ وَالخَبيثونَ لِلخَبيثاتِ ۖ وَالطَّيِّباتُ لِلطَّيِّبينَ وَالطَّيِّبونَ لِلطَّيِّباتِ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ مُبَرَّءونَ مِمّا يَقولونَ ۖ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَرِزقٌ كَريمٌ
26.translation_eng: Vicious women are for vicious men, and vicious men for vicious women. Good women are for good men, and good men for good women.1 These are absolved of what they say [about them].2 For them is forgiveness and a noble provision.Or, ‘Vicious words (or deeds) come from vicious persons, and vicious persons are worthy of vicious words (or deeds). Good words (or deeds) come from good people, and good people are worthy of good words (or deeds).’ According to this interpretation, this verse is similar in meaning to 17:84. This interpretation is also supported by the last part of the verse: ‘They are absolved of what they say [about them].’ However in accordance with the translation given above, the meaning of the verse will be similar to verse 24:3, at the beginning of this sūrah.That is, persons of good repute among the faithful stand legally absolved of any kind of allegations against them unless there is valid evidence to the contrary.
26.transliteration: al-khabīthātu li-l-khabīthīna wa-l-khabīthūna li-l-khabīthāti wa-ṭ-ṭayyibātu li-ṭ-ṭayyibīna wa-ṭ-ṭayyibūna li-ṭ-ṭayyibāti ʾulāʾika mubarraʾūna mimmā yaqūlūna lahum maghfiratun wa-rizqun karīmun

27.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تَدخُلوا بُيوتًا غَيرَ بُيوتِكُم حَتّىٰ تَستَأنِسوا وَتُسَلِّموا عَلىٰ أَهلِها ۚ ذٰلِكُم خَيرٌ لَكُم لَعَلَّكُم تَذَكَّرونَ
27.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Do not enter houses other than your own until you have announced [your arrival] and greeted their occupants. That is better for you. Maybe you will take admonition.
27.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū lā tadkhulū buyūtan ghayra buyūtikum ḥattā tastaʾnisū wa-tusallimū ʿalā ʾahlihā dhālikum khayrun lakum laʿallakum tadhakkarūna

28.content: فَإِن لَم تَجِدوا فيها أَحَدًا فَلا تَدخُلوها حَتّىٰ يُؤذَنَ لَكُم ۖ وَإِن قيلَ لَكُمُ ارجِعوا فَارجِعوا ۖ هُوَ أَزكىٰ لَكُم ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ عَليمٌ
28.translation_eng: But if you do not find anyone in them, do not enter them until you are given permission, and if you are told: ‘Turn back,’ then do turn back. That is more decent for you. And Allah knows best what you do.
28.transliteration: fa-ʾin lam tajidū fīhā ʾaḥadan fa-lā tadkhulūhā ḥattā yuʾdhana lakum wa-ʾin qīla lakumu rjiʿū fa-rjiʿū huwa ʾazkā lakum wa-llāhu bi-mā taʿmalūna ʿalīmun

29.content: لَيسَ عَلَيكُم جُناحٌ أَن تَدخُلوا بُيوتًا غَيرَ مَسكونَةٍ فيها مَتاعٌ لَكُم ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ ما تُبدونَ وَما تَكتُمونَ
29.translation_eng: There will be no sin upon you in entering [without announcing] uninhabited houses wherein you have goods belonging to you. And Allah knows whatever you disclose and whatever you conceal.
29.transliteration: laysa ʿalaykum junāḥun ʾan tadkhulū buyūtan ghayra maskūnatin fīhā matāʿun lakum wa-llāhu yaʿlamu mā tubdūna wa-mā taktumūna

30.content: قُل لِلمُؤمِنينَ يَغُضّوا مِن أَبصارِهِم وَيَحفَظوا فُروجَهُم ۚ ذٰلِكَ أَزكىٰ لَهُم ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبيرٌ بِما يَصنَعونَ
30.translation_eng: Tell the faithful men to cast down their looks and to guard their private parts. That is more decent for them. Allah is indeed well aware of what they do.
30.transliteration: qul li-l-muʾminīna yaghuḍḍū min ʾabṣārihim wa-yaḥfaẓū furūjahum dhālika ʾazkā lahum ʾinna llāha khabīrun bi-mā yaṣnaʿūna

31.content: وَقُل لِلمُؤمِناتِ يَغضُضنَ مِن أَبصارِهِنَّ وَيَحفَظنَ فُروجَهُنَّ وَلا يُبدينَ زينَتَهُنَّ إِلّا ما ظَهَرَ مِنها ۖ وَليَضرِبنَ بِخُمُرِهِنَّ عَلىٰ جُيوبِهِنَّ ۖ وَلا يُبدينَ زينَتَهُنَّ إِلّا لِبُعولَتِهِنَّ أَو آبائِهِنَّ أَو آباءِ بُعولَتِهِنَّ أَو أَبنائِهِنَّ أَو أَبناءِ بُعولَتِهِنَّ أَو إِخوانِهِنَّ أَو بَني إِخوانِهِنَّ أَو بَني أَخَواتِهِنَّ أَو نِسائِهِنَّ أَو ما مَلَكَت أَيمانُهُنَّ أَوِ التّابِعينَ غَيرِ أُولِي الإِربَةِ مِنَ الرِّجالِ أَوِ الطِّفلِ الَّذينَ لَم يَظهَروا عَلىٰ عَوراتِ النِّساءِ ۖ وَلا يَضرِبنَ بِأَرجُلِهِنَّ لِيُعلَمَ ما يُخفينَ مِن زينَتِهِنَّ ۚ وَتوبوا إِلَى اللَّهِ جَميعًا أَيُّهَ المُؤمِنونَ لَعَلَّكُم تُفلِحونَ
31.translation_eng: And tell the faithful women to cast down their looks and to guard their private parts, and not to display their charms, except for what is outward, and let them draw their scarfs over their bosoms, and not display their charms except to their husbands, or their fathers, or their husband’s fathers, or their sons, or their husband’s sons, or their brothers, or their brothers’ sons, or their sisters’ sons, or their women,1 or their slave girls, or male dependants lacking [sexual] desire, or children uninitiated to women’s parts.2 And let them not thump their feet to make known their hidden ornaments. Rally to Allah in repentance, O faithful, so that you may be felicitous.That is, Muslim women. Hence it is not lawful for Muslim women to expose their charms before non-Muslim women, who may possibly describe what they see to their men.That is, boys who have not reached the age of virility.
31.transliteration: wa-qul li-l-muʾmināti yaghḍuḍna min ʾabṣārihinna wa-yaḥfaẓna furūjahunna wa-lā yubdīna zīnatahunna ʾillā mā ẓahara minhā wa-l-yaḍribna bi-khumurihinna ʿalā juyūbihinna wa-lā yubdīna zīnatahunna ʾillā li-buʿūlatihinna ʾaw ʾābāʾihinna ʾaw ʾābāʾi buʿūlatihinna ʾaw ʾabnāʾihinna ʾaw ʾabnāʾi buʿūlatihinna ʾaw ʾikhwānihinna ʾaw banī ʾikhwānihinna ʾaw banī ʾakhawātihinna ʾaw nisāʾihinna ʾaw mā malakat ʾaymānuhunna ʾawi t-tābiʿīna ghayri ʾulī l-ʾirbati mina r-rijāli ʾawi ṭ-ṭifli lladhīna lam yaẓharū ʿalā ʿawrāti n-nisāʾi wa-lā yaḍribna bi-ʾarjulihinna li-yuʿlama mā yukhfīna min zīnatihinna wa-tūbū ʾilā llāhi jamīʿan ʾayyuha l-muʾminūna laʿallakum tufliḥūna

32.content: وَأَنكِحُوا الأَيامىٰ مِنكُم وَالصّالِحينَ مِن عِبادِكُم وَإِمائِكُم ۚ إِن يَكونوا فُقَراءَ يُغنِهِمُ اللَّهُ مِن فَضلِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ واسِعٌ عَليمٌ
32.translation_eng: Marry off those who are single among you and the upright1 among your male slaves and your female slaves. If they are poor, Allah will enrich them out of His grace, and Allah is all-bounteous, all-knowing.That is, those who are faithful, or honest and chaste.
32.transliteration: wa-ʾankiḥū l-ʾayāmā minkum wa-ṣ-ṣāliḥīna min ʿibādikum wa-ʾimāʾikum ʾin yakūnū fuqarāʾa yughnihimu llāhu min faḍlihī wa-llāhu wāsiʿun ʿalīmun

33.content: وَليَستَعفِفِ الَّذينَ لا يَجِدونَ نِكاحًا حَتّىٰ يُغنِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ مِن فَضلِهِ ۗ وَالَّذينَ يَبتَغونَ الكِتابَ مِمّا مَلَكَت أَيمانُكُم فَكاتِبوهُم إِن عَلِمتُم فيهِم خَيرًا ۖ وَآتوهُم مِن مالِ اللَّهِ الَّذي آتاكُم ۚ وَلا تُكرِهوا فَتَياتِكُم عَلَى البِغاءِ إِن أَرَدنَ تَحَصُّنًا لِتَبتَغوا عَرَضَ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۚ وَمَن يُكرِههُنَّ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ مِن بَعدِ إِكراهِهِنَّ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
33.translation_eng: Those who cannot afford marriage should be continent until Allah enriches them out of His grace. As for those who seek an emancipation deal from among your slaves, make such a deal with them if you know any good in them, and give them out of the wealth of Allah which He has given you. Do not compel your female slaves to prostitution when they desire to be chaste, seeking the transitory wares of the life of this world. Should anyone compel them, then after their compulsion Allah is indeed all-forgiving, all-merciful.
33.transliteration: wa-l-yastaʿfifi lladhīna lā yajidūna nikāḥan ḥattā yughniyahumu llāhu min faḍlihī wa-lladhīna yabtaghūna l-kitāba mimmā malakat ʾaymānukum fa-kātibūhum ʾin ʿalimtum fīhim khayran wa-ʾātūhum min māli llāhi lladhī ʾātākum wa-lā tukrihū fatayātikum ʿalā l-bighāʾi ʾin ʾaradna taḥaṣṣunan li-tabtaghū ʿaraḍa l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-man yukrihhunna fa-ʾinna llāha min baʿdi ʾikrāhihinna ghafūrun raḥīmun

34.content: وَلَقَد أَنزَلنا إِلَيكُم آياتٍ مُبَيِّناتٍ وَمَثَلًا مِنَ الَّذينَ خَلَوا مِن قَبلِكُم وَمَوعِظَةً لِلمُتَّقينَ
34.translation_eng: Certainly We have sent down to you manifest signs and a description of those who passed before you, and an advice for the Godwary.
34.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾanzalnā ʾilaykum ʾāyātin mubayyinātin wa-mathalan mina lladhīna khalaw min qablikum wa-mawʿiẓatan li-l-muttaqīna

35.content: ۞ اللَّهُ نورُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ مَثَلُ نورِهِ كَمِشكاةٍ فيها مِصباحٌ ۖ المِصباحُ في زُجاجَةٍ ۖ الزُّجاجَةُ كَأَنَّها كَوكَبٌ دُرِّيٌّ يوقَدُ مِن شَجَرَةٍ مُبارَكَةٍ زَيتونَةٍ لا شَرقِيَّةٍ وَلا غَربِيَّةٍ يَكادُ زَيتُها يُضيءُ وَلَو لَم تَمسَسهُ نارٌ ۚ نورٌ عَلىٰ نورٍ ۗ يَهدِي اللَّهُ لِنورِهِ مَن يَشاءُ ۚ وَيَضرِبُ اللَّهُ الأَمثالَ لِلنّاسِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَليمٌ
35.translation_eng: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The parable of His Light is a niche wherein is a lamp —the lamp is in a glass, the glass as it were a glittering star— lit from a blessed olive tree, neither eastern nor western, whose oil almost lights up, though fire should not touch it. Light upon light. Allah guides to His Light whomever He wishes. Allah draws parables for mankind, and Allah has knowledge of all things.
35.transliteration: allāhu nūru s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi mathalu nūrihī ka-mishkātin fīhā miṣbāḥun-i l-miṣbāḥu fī zujājatin-i z-zujājatu ka-ʾannahā kawkabun durriyyun yūqadu min shajaratin mubārakatin zaytūnatin lā sharqiyyatin wa-lā gharbiyyatin yakādu zaytuhā yuḍīʾu wa-law-lam tamsashu nārun nūrun ʿalā nūrin yahdī llāhu li-nūrihī man yashāʾu wa-yaḍribu llāhu l-ʾamthāla li-n-nāsi wa-llāhu bi-kulli shayʾin ʿalīmun

36.content: في بُيوتٍ أَذِنَ اللَّهُ أَن تُرفَعَ وَيُذكَرَ فيهَا اسمُهُ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ فيها بِالغُدُوِّ وَالآصالِ
36.translation_eng: In houses Allah has allowed to be raised and wherein His Name is celebrated, He is glorified therein, morning and evening,
36.transliteration: fī buyūtin ʾadhina llāhu ʾan turfaʿa wa-yudhkara fīhā smuhū yusabbiḥu lahū fīhā bi-l-ghuduwwi wa-l-ʾāṣāli

37.content: رِجالٌ لا تُلهيهِم تِجارَةٌ وَلا بَيعٌ عَن ذِكرِ اللَّهِ وَإِقامِ الصَّلاةِ وَإيتاءِ الزَّكاةِ ۙ يَخافونَ يَومًا تَتَقَلَّبُ فيهِ القُلوبُ وَالأَبصارُ
37.translation_eng: by men whom neither trading nor bargaining distracts from the remembrance of Allah, and the maintenance of prayer and the giving of zakāt. They are fearful of a day wherein the heart and the sight will be transformed,
37.transliteration: rijālun lā tulhīhim tijāratun wa-lā bayʿun ʿan dhikri llāhi wa-ʾiqāmi ṣ-ṣalāti wa-ʾītāʾi z-zakāti yakhāfūna yawman tataqallabu fīhi l-qulūbu wa-l-ʾabṣāru

38.content: لِيَجزِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ أَحسَنَ ما عَمِلوا وَيَزيدَهُم مِن فَضلِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَرزُقُ مَن يَشاءُ بِغَيرِ حِسابٍ
38.translation_eng: so that Allah may reward them by the best of what they have done, and enhance them out of His grace, and Allah provides for whomever He wishes without any reckoning.
38.transliteration: li-yajziyahumu llāhu ʾaḥsana mā ʿamilū wa-yazīdahum min faḍlihī wa-llāhu yarzuqu man yashāʾu bi-ghayri ḥisābin

39.content: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا أَعمالُهُم كَسَرابٍ بِقيعَةٍ يَحسَبُهُ الظَّمآنُ ماءً حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءَهُ لَم يَجِدهُ شَيئًا وَوَجَدَ اللَّهَ عِندَهُ فَوَفّاهُ حِسابَهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَريعُ الحِسابِ
39.translation_eng: As for the faithless, their works are like a mirage in a plain, which the thirsty man supposes to be water. When he comes to it, he finds it to be nothing; but there he finds Allah, who will pay him his full account, and Allah is swift at reckoning.
39.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kafarū ʾaʿmāluhum ka-sarābin bi-qīʿatin yaḥsabuhu ẓ-ẓamʾānu māʾan ḥattā ʾidhā jāʾahū lam yajidhu shayʾan wa-wajada llāha ʿindahū fa-waffāhu ḥisābahū wa-llāhu sarīʿu l-ḥisābi

40.content: أَو كَظُلُماتٍ في بَحرٍ لُجِّيٍّ يَغشاهُ مَوجٌ مِن فَوقِهِ مَوجٌ مِن فَوقِهِ سَحابٌ ۚ ظُلُماتٌ بَعضُها فَوقَ بَعضٍ إِذا أَخرَجَ يَدَهُ لَم يَكَد يَراها ۗ وَمَن لَم يَجعَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ نورًا فَما لَهُ مِن نورٍ
40.translation_eng: Or like the manifold darkness in a deep sea, covered by billow upon billow, overcast by clouds, manifold [layers of] darkness, one on top of another: when he brings out his hand, he can hardly see it, and one whom Allah has not granted any light has no light.
40.transliteration: ʾaw ka-ẓulumātin fī baḥrin lujjiyyin yaghshāhu mawjun min fawqihī mawjun min fawqihī saḥābun ẓulumātun baʿḍuhā fawqa baʿḍin ʾidhā ʾakhraja yadahū lam yakad yarāhā wa-man lam yajʿali llāhu lahū nūran fa-mā lahū min nūrin

41.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ مَن فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَالطَّيرُ صافّاتٍ ۖ كُلٌّ قَد عَلِمَ صَلاتَهُ وَتَسبيحَهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ بِما يَفعَلونَ
41.translation_eng: Have you not regarded that Allah is glorified by everyone in the heavens and the earth, and the birds spreading their wings. Each knows his prayer and glorification, and Allah knows best what they do.
41.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾanna llāha yusabbiḥu lahū man fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-ṭ-ṭayru ṣāffātin kullun qad ʿalima ṣalātahū wa-tasbīḥahū wa-llāhu ʿalīmun bi-mā yafʿalūna

42.content: وَلِلَّهِ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ المَصيرُ
42.translation_eng: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and toward Allah is the destination.
42.transliteration: wa-li-llāhi mulku s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-ʾilā llāhi l-maṣīru

43.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُزجي سَحابًا ثُمَّ يُؤَلِّفُ بَينَهُ ثُمَّ يَجعَلُهُ رُكامًا فَتَرَى الوَدقَ يَخرُجُ مِن خِلالِهِ وَيُنَزِّلُ مِنَ السَّماءِ مِن جِبالٍ فيها مِن بَرَدٍ فَيُصيبُ بِهِ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَصرِفُهُ عَن مَن يَشاءُ ۖ يَكادُ سَنا بَرقِهِ يَذهَبُ بِالأَبصارِ
43.translation_eng: Have you not regarded that Allah drives the clouds, then He composes them, then He piles them up, whereat you see the rain issuing from its midst? And He sends down from the sky hail, out of the mountains1 that are in it, and He strikes with it whomever He wishes, and turns it away from whomever He wishes. The brilliance of its lightening almost takes away the sight.A metaphorical reference to the clouds.
43.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾanna llāha yuzjī saḥāban thumma yuʾallifu baynahū thumma yajʿaluhū rukāman fa-tarā l-wadqa yakhruju min khilālihī wa-yunazzilu mina s-samāʾi min jibālin fīhā min baradin fa-yuṣību bihī man yashāʾu wa-yaṣrifuhū ʿan man yashāʾu yakādu sanā barqihī yadhhabu bi-l-ʾabṣāri

44.content: يُقَلِّبُ اللَّهُ اللَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَعِبرَةً لِأُولِي الأَبصارِ
44.translation_eng: Allah alternates the night and the day. There is indeed a moral in that for those who have insight.
44.transliteration: yuqallibu llāhu l-layla wa-n-nahāra ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʿibratan li-ʾulī l-ʾabṣāri

45.content: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَ كُلَّ دابَّةٍ مِن ماءٍ ۖ فَمِنهُم مَن يَمشي عَلىٰ بَطنِهِ وَمِنهُم مَن يَمشي عَلىٰ رِجلَينِ وَمِنهُم مَن يَمشي عَلىٰ أَربَعٍ ۚ يَخلُقُ اللَّهُ ما يَشاءُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
45.translation_eng: Allah created every animal from water. Among them are some that creep upon their bellies, and among them are some that walk on two feet, and among them are some that walk on four. Allah creates whatever He wishes. Indeed Allah has power over all things.
45.transliteration: wa-llāhu khalaqa kulla dābbatin min māʾin fa-minhum man yamshī ʿalā baṭnihī wa-minhum man yamshī ʿalā rijlayni wa-minhum man yamshī ʿalā ʾarbaʿin yakhluqu llāhu mā yashāʾu ʾinna llāha ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

46.content: لَقَد أَنزَلنا آياتٍ مُبَيِّناتٍ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَهدي مَن يَشاءُ إِلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
46.translation_eng: Certainly We have sent down manifest signs, and Allah guides whomever He wishes to a straight path.
46.transliteration: la-qad ʾanzalnā ʾāyātin mubayyinātin wa-llāhu yahdī man yashāʾu ʾilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

47.content: وَيَقولونَ آمَنّا بِاللَّهِ وَبِالرَّسولِ وَأَطَعنا ثُمَّ يَتَوَلّىٰ فَريقٌ مِنهُم مِن بَعدِ ذٰلِكَ ۚ وَما أُولٰئِكَ بِالمُؤمِنينَ
47.translation_eng: They say, ‘We have faith in Allah and His Apostle, and we obey.’ Then after that a part of them refuse to comply, and they do not have faith.
47.transliteration: wa-yaqūlūna ʾāmannā bi-llāhi wa-bi-r-rasūli wa-ʾaṭaʿnā thumma yatawallā farīqun minhum min baʿdi dhālika wa-mā ʾulāʾika bi-l-muʾminīna

48.content: وَإِذا دُعوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ لِيَحكُمَ بَينَهُم إِذا فَريقٌ مِنهُم مُعرِضونَ
48.translation_eng: When they are summoned to Allah and His Apostle that He may judge between them, behold, a part of them turn aside.
48.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā duʿū ʾilā llāhi wa-rasūlihī li-yaḥkuma baynahum ʾidhā farīqun minhum muʿriḍūna

49.content: وَإِن يَكُن لَهُمُ الحَقُّ يَأتوا إِلَيهِ مُذعِنينَ
49.translation_eng: But if justice be on their side, they come compliantly to him.
49.transliteration: wa-ʾin yakun lahumu l-ḥaqqu yaʾtū ʾilayhi mudhʿinīna

50.content: أَفي قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ أَمِ ارتابوا أَم يَخافونَ أَن يَحيفَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِم وَرَسولُهُ ۚ بَل أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الظّالِمونَ
50.translation_eng: Is there a sickness in their hearts? Or do they have doubts or fear that Allah and His Apostle will be unjust to them? Rather it is they who are the wrongdoers.
50.transliteration: ʾa-fī qulūbihim maraḍun ʾami rtābū ʾam yakhāfūna ʾan yaḥīfa llāhu ʿalayhim wa-rasūluhū bal ʾulāʾika humu ẓ-ẓālimūna

51.content: إِنَّما كانَ قَولَ المُؤمِنينَ إِذا دُعوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ لِيَحكُمَ بَينَهُم أَن يَقولوا سَمِعنا وَأَطَعنا ۚ وَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُفلِحونَ
51.translation_eng: All the response of the faithful, when they are summoned to Allah and His Apostle that He may judge between them, is to say, ‘We hear and obey.’ It is they who are the felicitous.
51.transliteration: ʾinnamā kāna qawla l-muʾminīna ʾidhā duʿū ʾilā llāhi wa-rasūlihī li-yaḥkuma baynahum ʾan yaqūlū samiʿnā wa-ʾaṭaʿnā wa-ʾulāʾika humu l-mufliḥūna

52.content: وَمَن يُطِعِ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ وَيَخشَ اللَّهَ وَيَتَّقهِ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الفائِزونَ
52.translation_eng: Whoever obeys Allah and His Apostle, and fears Allah and is wary of Him —it is they who will be the triumphant.
52.transliteration: wa-man yuṭiʿi llāha wa-rasūlahū wa-yakhsha llāha wa-yattaqhi fa-ʾulāʾika humu l-fāʾizūna

53.content: ۞ وَأَقسَموا بِاللَّهِ جَهدَ أَيمانِهِم لَئِن أَمَرتَهُم لَيَخرُجُنَّ ۖ قُل لا تُقسِموا ۖ طاعَةٌ مَعروفَةٌ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبيرٌ بِما تَعمَلونَ
53.translation_eng: They swear by Allah with solemn oaths that if you order them they will surely go forth. Say, ‘Do not swear! Honourable obedience [is all that is expected of you]. Allah is indeed well aware of what you do.’
53.transliteration: wa-ʾaqsamū bi-llāhi jahda ʾaymānihim la-ʾin ʾamartahum la-yakhrujunna qul lā tuqsimū ṭāʿatun maʿrūfatun ʾinna llāha khabīrun bi-mā taʿmalūna

54.content: قُل أَطيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطيعُوا الرَّسولَ ۖ فَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَإِنَّما عَلَيهِ ما حُمِّلَ وَعَلَيكُم ما حُمِّلتُم ۖ وَإِن تُطيعوهُ تَهتَدوا ۚ وَما عَلَى الرَّسولِ إِلَّا البَلاغُ المُبينُ
54.translation_eng: Say, ‘Obey Allah, and obey the Apostle.’ But if you turn your backs, [you should know that] he is only responsible for his burden and you are responsible for your burden, and if you obey him, you shall be guided, and the Apostle’s duty is only to communicate in clear terms.
54.transliteration: qul ʾaṭīʿū llāha wa-ʾaṭīʿū r-rasūla fa-ʾin tawallaw fa-ʾinnamā ʿalayhi mā ḥummila wa-ʿalaykum mā ḥummiltum wa-ʾin tuṭīʿūhu tahtadū wa-mā ʿalā r-rasūli ʾillā l-balāghu l-mubīnu

55.content: وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا مِنكُم وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ لَيَستَخلِفَنَّهُم فِي الأَرضِ كَمَا استَخلَفَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم وَلَيُمَكِّنَنَّ لَهُم دينَهُمُ الَّذِي ارتَضىٰ لَهُم وَلَيُبَدِّلَنَّهُم مِن بَعدِ خَوفِهِم أَمنًا ۚ يَعبُدونَني لا يُشرِكونَ بي شَيئًا ۚ وَمَن كَفَرَ بَعدَ ذٰلِكَ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الفاسِقونَ
55.translation_eng: Allah has promised those of you who have faith and do righteous deeds that He will surely make them successors in the earth, just as He made those who were before them successors, and He will surely establish for them their religion which He has approved for them, and that He will surely change their state to security after their fear, while they worship Me, not ascribing any partners to Me. And whoever is ungrateful after that —it is they who are the transgressors.
55.transliteration: waʿada llāhu lladhīna ʾāmanū minkum wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti la-yastakhlifannahum fī l-ʾarḍi ka-mā stakhlafa lladhīna min qablihim wa-la-yumakkinanna lahum dīnahumu lladhī rtaḍā lahum wa-la-yubaddilannahum min baʿdi khawfihim ʾamnan yaʿbudūnanī lā yushrikūna bī shayʾan wa-man kafara baʿda dhālika fa-ʾulāʾika humu l-fāsiqūna

56.content: وَأَقيمُوا الصَّلاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكاةَ وَأَطيعُوا الرَّسولَ لَعَلَّكُم تُرحَمونَ
56.translation_eng: Maintain the prayer and give the zakāt, and obey the Apostle so that you may receive [Allah’s] mercy.
56.transliteration: wa-ʾaqīmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-ʾātū z-zakāta wa-ʾaṭīʿū r-rasūla laʿallakum turḥamūna

57.content: لا تَحسَبَنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مُعجِزينَ فِي الأَرضِ ۚ وَمَأواهُمُ النّارُ ۖ وَلَبِئسَ المَصيرُ
57.translation_eng: Do not suppose that those who are faithless can thwart [Allah] on the earth. Their refuge shall be the Fire, and it is surely an evil destination.
57.transliteration: lā taḥsabanna lladhīna kafarū muʿjizīna fī l-ʾarḍi wa-maʾwāhumu n-nāru wa-la-biʾsa l-maṣīru

58.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لِيَستَأذِنكُمُ الَّذينَ مَلَكَت أَيمانُكُم وَالَّذينَ لَم يَبلُغُوا الحُلُمَ مِنكُم ثَلاثَ مَرّاتٍ ۚ مِن قَبلِ صَلاةِ الفَجرِ وَحينَ تَضَعونَ ثِيابَكُم مِنَ الظَّهيرَةِ وَمِن بَعدِ صَلاةِ العِشاءِ ۚ ثَلاثُ عَوراتٍ لَكُم ۚ لَيسَ عَلَيكُم وَلا عَلَيهِم جُناحٌ بَعدَهُنَّ ۚ طَوّافونَ عَلَيكُم بَعضُكُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الآياتِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
58.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Let your permission be sought by your slaves and those of you who have not reached puberty three times: before the dawn prayer, and when you put off your garments at noon, and after the night prayer. These are three times of privacy for you. Apart from these, it is not sinful of you or them to frequent one another [freely]. Thus does Allah clarify the signs for you, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
58.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū li-yastaʾdhinkumu lladhīna malakat ʾaymānukum wa-lladhīna lam yablughū l-ḥuluma minkum thalātha marrātin min qabli ṣalāti l-fajri wa-ḥīna taḍaʿūna thiyābakum mina ẓ-ẓahīrati wa-min baʿdi ṣalāti l-ʿishāʾi thalāthu ʿawrātin lakum laysa ʿalaykum wa-lā ʿalayhim junāḥun baʿdahunna ṭawwāfūna ʿalaykum baʿḍukum ʿalā baʿḍin ka-dhālika yubayyinu llāhu lakumu l-ʾāyāti wa-llāhu ʿalīmun ḥakīmun

59.content: وَإِذا بَلَغَ الأَطفالُ مِنكُمُ الحُلُمَ فَليَستَأذِنوا كَمَا استَأذَنَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُم آياتِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
59.translation_eng: When your children reach puberty, let them ask permission [at all times] just as those who asked permission before them. Thus does Allah clarify His signs for you, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
59.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā balagha l-ʾaṭfālu minkumu l-ḥuluma fa-l-yastaʾdhinū ka-mā staʾdhana lladhīna min qablihim ka-dhālika yubayyinu llāhu lakum ʾāyātihī wa-llāhu ʿalīmun ḥakīmun

60.content: وَالقَواعِدُ مِنَ النِّساءِ اللّاتي لا يَرجونَ نِكاحًا فَلَيسَ عَلَيهِنَّ جُناحٌ أَن يَضَعنَ ثِيابَهُنَّ غَيرَ مُتَبَرِّجاتٍ بِزينَةٍ ۖ وَأَن يَستَعفِفنَ خَيرٌ لَهُنَّ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَميعٌ عَليمٌ
60.translation_eng: As for women advanced in years who do not expect to marry, there will be no sin upon them if they put off their cloaks, without displaying their adornment. But it is better for them to be continent, and Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing.
60.transliteration: wa-l-qawāʿidu mina n-nisāʾi llātī lā yarjūna nikāḥan fa-laysa ʿalayhinna junāḥun ʾan yaḍaʿna thiyābahunna ghayra mutabarrijātin bi-zīnatin wa-ʾan yastaʿfifna khayrun lahunna wa-llāhu samīʿun ʿalīmun

61.content: لَيسَ عَلَى الأَعمىٰ حَرَجٌ وَلا عَلَى الأَعرَجِ حَرَجٌ وَلا عَلَى المَريضِ حَرَجٌ وَلا عَلىٰ أَنفُسِكُم أَن تَأكُلوا مِن بُيوتِكُم أَو بُيوتِ آبائِكُم أَو بُيوتِ أُمَّهاتِكُم أَو بُيوتِ إِخوانِكُم أَو بُيوتِ أَخَواتِكُم أَو بُيوتِ أَعمامِكُم أَو بُيوتِ عَمّاتِكُم أَو بُيوتِ أَخوالِكُم أَو بُيوتِ خالاتِكُم أَو ما مَلَكتُم مَفاتِحَهُ أَو صَديقِكُم ۚ لَيسَ عَلَيكُم جُناحٌ أَن تَأكُلوا جَميعًا أَو أَشتاتًا ۚ فَإِذا دَخَلتُم بُيوتًا فَسَلِّموا عَلىٰ أَنفُسِكُم تَحِيَّةً مِن عِندِ اللَّهِ مُبارَكَةً طَيِّبَةً ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الآياتِ لَعَلَّكُم تَعقِلونَ
61.translation_eng: There is no blame upon the blind, nor any blame upon the lame, nor any blame upon the sick, nor upon yourselves if you eat from your own houses, or your fathers’ houses, or your mothers’ houses, or your brothers’ houses, or your sisters’ houses, or the houses of your paternal uncles, or the houses of your paternal aunts, or the houses of your maternal uncles, or the houses of your maternal aunts, or those whose keys are in your possession, or those of your friends. There will be no blame on you whether you eat together or separately. So when you enter houses, greet yourselves1 with a salutation from Allah, blessed and good. Thus does Allah clarify His signs for you so that you may apply reason.Or ‘greet your folks.’
61.transliteration: laysa ʿalā l-ʾaʿmā ḥarajun wa-lā ʿalā l-ʾaʿraji ḥarajun wa-lā ʿalā l-marīḍi ḥarajun wa-lā ʿalā ʾanfusikum ʾan taʾkulū min buyūtikum ʾaw buyūti ʾābāʾikum ʾaw buyūti ʾummahātikum ʾaw buyūti ʾikhwānikum ʾaw buyūti ʾakhawātikum ʾaw buyūti ʾaʿmāmikum ʾaw buyūti ʿammātikum ʾaw buyūti ʾakhwālikum ʾaw buyūti khālātikum ʾaw mā malaktum mafātiḥahū ʾaw ṣadīqikum laysa ʿalaykum junāḥun ʾan taʾkulū jamīʿan ʾaw ʾashtātan fa-ʾidhā dakhaltum buyūtan fa-sallimū ʿalā ʾanfusikum taḥiyyatan min ʿindi llāhi mubārakatan ṭayyibatan ka-dhālika yubayyinu llāhu lakumu l-ʾāyāti laʿallakum taʿqilūna

62.content: إِنَّمَا المُؤمِنونَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ وَإِذا كانوا مَعَهُ عَلىٰ أَمرٍ جامِعٍ لَم يَذهَبوا حَتّىٰ يَستَأذِنوهُ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَستَأذِنونَكَ أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ يُؤمِنونَ بِاللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ ۚ فَإِذَا استَأذَنوكَ لِبَعضِ شَأنِهِم فَأذَن لِمَن شِئتَ مِنهُم وَاستَغفِر لَهُمُ اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
62.translation_eng: Indeed the faithful are those who have faith in Allah and His Apostle, and when they are with him in a collective affair, they do not leave until they have sought his permission. Indeed those who seek your permission —it is they who have faith in Allah and His Apostle. So when they seek your permission for some work of theirs, give permission to whomever of them you wish and plead with Allah to forgive them. Indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
62.transliteration: ʾinnamā l-muʾminūna lladhīna ʾāmanū bi-llāhi wa-rasūlihī wa-ʾidhā kānū maʿahū ʿalā ʾamrin jāmiʿin lam yadhhabū ḥattā yastaʾdhinūhu ʾinna lladhīna yastaʾdhinūnaka ʾulāʾika lladhīna yuʾminūna bi-llāhi wa-rasūlihī fa-ʾidhā staʾdhanūka li-baʿḍi shaʾnihim fa-ʾdhan li-man shiʾta minhum wa-staghfir lahumu llāha ʾinna llāha ghafūrun raḥīmun

63.content: لا تَجعَلوا دُعاءَ الرَّسولِ بَينَكُم كَدُعاءِ بَعضِكُم بَعضًا ۚ قَد يَعلَمُ اللَّهُ الَّذينَ يَتَسَلَّلونَ مِنكُم لِواذًا ۚ فَليَحذَرِ الَّذينَ يُخالِفونَ عَن أَمرِهِ أَن تُصيبَهُم فِتنَةٌ أَو يُصيبَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
63.translation_eng: Do not consider the Apostle’s summons amongst you to be like your summoning one another. Allah certainly knows those of you who slip away under cover. So let those who disobey his orders beware lest an ordeal should visit them or a painful punishment should befall them.
63.transliteration: lā tajʿalū duʿāʾa r-rasūli baynakum ka-duʿāʾi baʿḍikum baʿḍan qad yaʿlamu llāhu lladhīna yatasallalūna minkum liwādhan fa-l-yaḥdhari lladhīna yukhālifūna ʿan ʾamrihī ʾan tuṣībahum fitnatun ʾaw yuṣībahum ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

64.content: أَلا إِنَّ لِلَّهِ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ قَد يَعلَمُ ما أَنتُم عَلَيهِ وَيَومَ يُرجَعونَ إِلَيهِ فَيُنَبِّئُهُم بِما عَمِلوا ۗ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَليمٌ
64.translation_eng: Look! To Allah indeed belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. He certainly knows what you are up to, and the day they are brought back to Him He will inform them about what they have done, and Allah has knowledge of all things.
64.transliteration: ʾa-lā ʾinna li-llāhi mā fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi qad yaʿlamu mā ʾantum ʿalayhi wa-yawma yurjaʿūna ʾilayhi fa-yunabbiʾuhum bi-mā ʿamilū wa-llāhu bi-kulli shayʾin ʿalīmun

25.description: The surah proclaiming the Quran that God bestowed upon Muhammad to be, in its finality and totality, The Criterion of everlasting salvation for all humankind until the end of time. It takes its name from verse 1, which refers to the Quran as “al-Furqān” (lit. “the Distinguisher”, “the Separator” or “the Dierentiator”, i.e. a criterion for distinguishing between truth and falsehood). The surah starts with a denunciation of polytheism, then deals with the disbelievers” arguments against the Prophet, the Quran, and the Day of Judgement. It warns them of their fate, citing examples of earlier peoples. The surah describes the power and grace of God, and ends with the qualities of true believers in verse 63 .The surah is also known as: Discrimination, Salvation, The Dierentiator, The Standard.

1.content: تَبارَكَ الَّذي نَزَّلَ الفُرقانَ عَلىٰ عَبدِهِ لِيَكونَ لِلعالَمينَ نَذيرًا
1.translation_eng: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion to His servant that he may be a warner to all the nations.
1.transliteration: tabāraka lladhī nazzala l-furqāna ʿalā ʿabdihī li-yakūna li-l-ʿālamīna nadhīran-i

2.content: الَّذي لَهُ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَلَم يَتَّخِذ وَلَدًا وَلَم يَكُن لَهُ شَريكٌ فِي المُلكِ وَخَلَقَ كُلَّ شَيءٍ فَقَدَّرَهُ تَقديرًا
2.translation_eng: He, to whom belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and who did not take a son, nor has He any partner in sovereignty, and He created everything and determined it in a precise measure.
2.transliteration: alladhī lahū mulku s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-lam yattakhidh waladan wa-lam yakun lahū sharīkun fī l-mulki wa-khalaqa kulla shayʾin fa-qaddarahū taqdīran

3.content: وَاتَّخَذوا مِن دونِهِ آلِهَةً لا يَخلُقونَ شَيئًا وَهُم يُخلَقونَ وَلا يَملِكونَ لِأَنفُسِهِم ضَرًّا وَلا نَفعًا وَلا يَملِكونَ مَوتًا وَلا حَياةً وَلا نُشورًا
3.translation_eng: Yet they have taken gods besides Him who create nothing and have themselves been created, and who have no control over their own harm or benefit and have no control over [their own] death, or life, or resurrection.
3.transliteration: wa-ttakhadhū min dūnihī ʾālihatan lā yakhluqūna shayʾan wa-hum yukhlaqūna wa-lā yamlikūna li-ʾanfusihim ḍarran wa-lā nafʿan wa-lā yamlikūna mawtan wa-lā ḥayātan wa-lā nushūran

4.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إِن هٰذا إِلّا إِفكٌ افتَراهُ وَأَعانَهُ عَلَيهِ قَومٌ آخَرونَ ۖ فَقَد جاءوا ظُلمًا وَزورًا
4.translation_eng: The faithless say, ‘This is nothing but a lie that he has fabricated, and other people have abetted him in it.’ Thus they have certainly come out with wrongdoing and falsehood.
4.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna kafarū ʾin hādhā ʾillā ʾifkun-i ftarāhu wa-ʾaʿānahū ʿalayhi qawmun ʾākharūna fa-qad jāʾū ẓulman wa-zūran

5.content: وَقالوا أَساطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ اكتَتَبَها فَهِيَ تُملىٰ عَلَيهِ بُكرَةً وَأَصيلًا
5.translation_eng: They say, ‘He has taken down myths of the ancients, and they are dictated to him morning and evening.’
5.transliteration: wa-qālū ʾasāṭīru l-ʾawwalīna ktatabahā fa-hiya tumlā ʿalayhi bukratan wa-ʾaṣīlan

6.content: قُل أَنزَلَهُ الَّذي يَعلَمُ السِّرَّ فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ غَفورًا رَحيمًا
6.translation_eng: Say, ‘It has been sent down by Him who knows the hidden in the heavens and the earth. Indeed He is all-forgiving, all-merciful.’
6.transliteration: qul ʾanzalahu lladhī yaʿlamu s-sirra fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾinnahū kāna ghafūran raḥīman

7.content: وَقالوا مالِ هٰذَا الرَّسولِ يَأكُلُ الطَّعامَ وَيَمشي فِي الأَسواقِ ۙ لَولا أُنزِلَ إِلَيهِ مَلَكٌ فَيَكونَ مَعَهُ نَذيرًا
7.translation_eng: And they say, ‘What sort of apostle is this who eats food and walks in the marketplaces? Why has not an angel been sent down to him so as to be a warner along with him?’
7.transliteration: wa-qālū mā-li hādhā r-rasūli yaʾkulu ṭ-ṭaʿāma wa-yamshī fī l-ʾaswāqi law-lā ʾunzila ʾilayhi malakun fa-yakūna maʿahū nadhīran

8.content: أَو يُلقىٰ إِلَيهِ كَنزٌ أَو تَكونُ لَهُ جَنَّةٌ يَأكُلُ مِنها ۚ وَقالَ الظّالِمونَ إِن تَتَّبِعونَ إِلّا رَجُلًا مَسحورًا
8.translation_eng: Or, ‘[Why is not] a treasure thrown to him, or [why does] he [not] have a garden from which he may eat?’ And the wrongdoers say, ‘You are just following a bewitched man.’
8.transliteration: ʾaw yulqā ʾilayhi kanzun ʾaw takūnu lahū jannatun yaʾkulu minhā wa-qāla ẓ-ẓālimūna ʾin tattabiʿūna ʾillā rajulan masḥūran-i

9.content: انظُر كَيفَ ضَرَبوا لَكَ الأَمثالَ فَضَلّوا فَلا يَستَطيعونَ سَبيلًا
9.translation_eng: Look, how they draw comparisons for you; so they go astray, and cannot find the way.
9.transliteration: unẓur kayfa ḍarabū laka l-ʾamthāla fa-ḍallū fa-lā yastaṭīʿūna sabīlan

10.content: تَبارَكَ الَّذي إِن شاءَ جَعَلَ لَكَ خَيرًا مِن ذٰلِكَ جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ وَيَجعَل لَكَ قُصورًا
10.translation_eng: Blessed is He who will grant you better than that if He wishes —gardens with streams running in them, and He will make for you palaces.
10.transliteration: tabāraka lladhī ʾin shāʾa jaʿala laka khayran min dhālika jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru wa-yajʿal laka quṣūran

11.content: بَل كَذَّبوا بِالسّاعَةِ ۖ وَأَعتَدنا لِمَن كَذَّبَ بِالسّاعَةِ سَعيرًا
11.translation_eng: Rather they deny the Hour, and We have prepared a Blaze for those who deny the Hour.
11.transliteration: bal kadhdhabū bi-s-sāʿati wa-ʾaʿtadnā li-man kadhdhaba bi-s-sāʿati saʿīran

12.content: إِذا رَأَتهُم مِن مَكانٍ بَعيدٍ سَمِعوا لَها تَغَيُّظًا وَزَفيرًا
12.translation_eng: When it1 sights them from a distant place, they will hear it raging and roaring.That is, hell.
12.transliteration: ʾidhā raʾathum min makānin baʿīdin samiʿū lahā taghayyuẓan wa-zafīran

13.content: وَإِذا أُلقوا مِنها مَكانًا ضَيِّقًا مُقَرَّنينَ دَعَوا هُنالِكَ ثُبورًا
13.translation_eng: And when they are cast into a narrow place in it, bound together [in chains], they will pray for [their own] annihilation.1Cf. 43:77; 78:40.
13.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā ʾulqū minhā makānan ḍayyiqan muqarranīna daʿaw hunālika thubūran

14.content: لا تَدعُوا اليَومَ ثُبورًا واحِدًا وَادعوا ثُبورًا كَثيرًا
14.translation_eng: [They will be told:] ‘Do not pray for a single annihilation today, but pray for many annihilations!’
14.transliteration: lā tadʿū l-yawma thubūran wāḥidan wa-dʿū thubūran kathīran

15.content: قُل أَذٰلِكَ خَيرٌ أَم جَنَّةُ الخُلدِ الَّتي وُعِدَ المُتَّقونَ ۚ كانَت لَهُم جَزاءً وَمَصيرًا
15.translation_eng: Say, ‘Is that better, or the everlasting paradise promised to the Godwary, which will be their reward and destination?’
15.transliteration: qul ʾa-dhālika khayrun ʾam jannatu l-khuldi llatī wuʿida l-muttaqūna kānat lahum jazāʾan wa-maṣīran

16.content: لَهُم فيها ما يَشاءونَ خالِدينَ ۚ كانَ عَلىٰ رَبِّكَ وَعدًا مَسئولًا
16.translation_eng: There they will have whatever they wish, abiding [forever], a promise [much] besought, [binding] on your Lord.1Cf. 3:194: ‘Our Lord, grant us what You have promised us through Your apostles.’
16.transliteration: lahum fīhā mā yashāʾūna khālidīna kāna ʿalā rabbika waʿdan masʾūlan

17.content: وَيَومَ يَحشُرُهُم وَما يَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ فَيَقولُ أَأَنتُم أَضلَلتُم عِبادي هٰؤُلاءِ أَم هُم ضَلُّوا السَّبيلَ
17.translation_eng: On the day that He will muster them and those whom they worship besides Allah, He will say, ‘Was it you who led astray these servants of Mine, or did they themselves stray from the way?’
17.transliteration: wa-yawma yaḥshuruhum wa-mā yaʿbudūna min dūni llāhi fa-yaqūlu ʾa-ʾantum ʾaḍlaltum ʿibādī hāʾulāʾi ʾam hum ḍallū s-sabīla

18.content: قالوا سُبحانَكَ ما كانَ يَنبَغي لَنا أَن نَتَّخِذَ مِن دونِكَ مِن أَولِياءَ وَلٰكِن مَتَّعتَهُم وَآباءَهُم حَتّىٰ نَسُوا الذِّكرَ وَكانوا قَومًا بورًا
18.translation_eng: They will say, ‘Immaculate are You! It does not behoove us to take any guardians in Your stead! But You provided for them and their fathers until they forgot the Reminder, and they were a ruined lot.’
18.transliteration: qālū subḥānaka mā kāna yanbaghī lanā ʾan nattakhidha min dūnika min ʾawliyāʾa wa-lākin mattaʿtahum wa-ʾābāʾahum ḥattā nasū dh-dhikra wa-kānū qawman būran

19.content: فَقَد كَذَّبوكُم بِما تَقولونَ فَما تَستَطيعونَ صَرفًا وَلا نَصرًا ۚ وَمَن يَظلِم مِنكُم نُذِقهُ عَذابًا كَبيرًا
19.translation_eng: So they will certainly impugn you in what you say, and you will neither be able to circumvent [punishment] nor find help, and whoever of you does wrong, We shall make him taste a terrible punishment.
19.transliteration: fa-qad kadhdhabūkum bi-mā taqūlūna fa-mā tastaṭīʿūna ṣarfan wa-lā naṣran wa-man yaẓlim minkum nudhiqhu ʿadhāban kabīran

20.content: وَما أَرسَلنا قَبلَكَ مِنَ المُرسَلينَ إِلّا إِنَّهُم لَيَأكُلونَ الطَّعامَ وَيَمشونَ فِي الأَسواقِ ۗ وَجَعَلنا بَعضَكُم لِبَعضٍ فِتنَةً أَتَصبِرونَ ۗ وَكانَ رَبُّكَ بَصيرًا
20.translation_eng: We did not send any apostles before you but that they indeed ate food and walked in marketplaces. We have made you a trial for one another, [to see] if you will be patient, and your Lord is all-seeing.
20.transliteration: wa-mā ʾarsalnā qablaka mina l-mursalīna ʾillā ʾinnahum la-yaʾkulūna ṭ-ṭaʿāma wa-yamshūna fī l-ʾaswāqi wa-jaʿalnā baʿḍakum li-baʿḍin fitnatan ʾa-taṣbirūna wa-kāna rabbuka baṣīran

21.content: ۞ وَقالَ الَّذينَ لا يَرجونَ لِقاءَنا لَولا أُنزِلَ عَلَينَا المَلائِكَةُ أَو نَرىٰ رَبَّنا ۗ لَقَدِ استَكبَروا في أَنفُسِهِم وَعَتَوا عُتُوًّا كَبيرًا
21.translation_eng: Those who do not expect to encounter Us say, ‘Why have angels not been sent down to us, or why do we not see our Lord?’ Certainly they are full of arrogance within their souls and have become terribly defiant.
21.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna lā yarjūna liqāʾanā law-lā ʾunzila ʿalaynā l-malāʾikatu ʾaw narā rabbanā la-qadi stakbarū fī ʾanfusihim wa-ʿataw ʿutuwwan kabīran

22.content: يَومَ يَرَونَ المَلائِكَةَ لا بُشرىٰ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُجرِمينَ وَيَقولونَ حِجرًا مَحجورًا
22.translation_eng: The day when they see the angels, there will be no good news for the guilty that day, and they1 will say, ‘Keep off [from paradise]!’That is, the angels, who will say this to the faithless. According to another interpretation, during pre-Islamic days, whenever, during one of the holy months in which warfare was prohibited by custom, an Arab felt threatened by someone belonging to a belligerent tribe, he would say, Ḥijran maḥjūrā, thus telling the member of the hostile tribe to keep distance by appealing to the sanctity of the holy month. On this basis, it is the faithless who ask the angels to keep off.
22.transliteration: yawma yarawna l-malāʾikata lā bushrā yawmaʾidhin li-l-mujrimīna wa-yaqūlūna ḥijran maḥjūran

23.content: وَقَدِمنا إِلىٰ ما عَمِلوا مِن عَمَلٍ فَجَعَلناهُ هَباءً مَنثورًا
23.translation_eng: Then We shall attend to the works they have done and then turn them into scattered dust.
23.transliteration: wa-qadimnā ʾilā mā ʿamilū min ʿamalin fa-jaʿalnāhu habāʾan manthūran

24.content: أَصحابُ الجَنَّةِ يَومَئِذٍ خَيرٌ مُستَقَرًّا وَأَحسَنُ مَقيلًا
24.translation_eng: On that day the inhabitants of paradise will be in the best abode and an excellent resting place.
24.transliteration: ʾaṣḥābu l-jannati yawmaʾidhin khayrun mustaqarran wa-ʾaḥsanu maqīlan

25.content: وَيَومَ تَشَقَّقُ السَّماءُ بِالغَمامِ وَنُزِّلَ المَلائِكَةُ تَنزيلًا
25.translation_eng: The day when the sky with its clouds will split open, and the angels will be sent down [in a majestic] descent,
25.transliteration: wa-yawma tashaqqaqu s-samāʾu bi-l-ghamāmi wa-nuzzila l-malāʾikatu tanzīlan-i

26.content: المُلكُ يَومَئِذٍ الحَقُّ لِلرَّحمٰنِ ۚ وَكانَ يَومًا عَلَى الكافِرينَ عَسيرًا
26.translation_eng: on that day true sovereignty will belong to the All-beneficent, and it will be a hard day for the faithless.1Cf. 74:9.
26.transliteration: al-mulku yawmaʾidhin-i l-ḥaqqu li-r-raḥmāni wa-kāna yawman ʿalā l-kāfirīna ʿasīran

27.content: وَيَومَ يَعَضُّ الظّالِمُ عَلىٰ يَدَيهِ يَقولُ يا لَيتَنِي اتَّخَذتُ مَعَ الرَّسولِ سَبيلًا
27.translation_eng: A day when the wrongdoer will bite his hands, saying, ‘I wish I had followed the Apostle’s way!
27.transliteration: wa-yawma yaʿaḍḍu ẓ-ẓālimu ʿalā yadayhi yaqūlu yā-laytanī ttakhadhtu maʿa r-rasūli sabīlan

28.content: يا وَيلَتىٰ لَيتَني لَم أَتَّخِذ فُلانًا خَليلًا
28.translation_eng: Woe to me! I wish I had not taken so and so as a friend!
28.transliteration: yā-waylatā laytanī lam ʾattakhidh fulānan khalīlan

29.content: لَقَد أَضَلَّني عَنِ الذِّكرِ بَعدَ إِذ جاءَني ۗ وَكانَ الشَّيطانُ لِلإِنسانِ خَذولًا
29.translation_eng: Certainly he led me astray from the Reminder after it had come to me, and Satan is a deserter of man.’
29.transliteration: la-qad ʾaḍallanī ʿani dh-dhikri baʿda ʾidh jāʾanī wa-kāna sh-shayṭānu li-l-ʾinsāni khadhūlan

30.content: وَقالَ الرَّسولُ يا رَبِّ إِنَّ قَومِي اتَّخَذوا هٰذَا القُرآنَ مَهجورًا
30.translation_eng: And the Apostle will say, ‘O my Lord! Indeed my people consigned this Qurʾān to oblivion.’
30.transliteration: wa-qāla r-rasūlu yā-rabbi ʾinna qawmī ttakhadhū hādhā l-qurʾāna mahjūran

31.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ جَعَلنا لِكُلِّ نَبِيٍّ عَدُوًّا مِنَ المُجرِمينَ ۗ وَكَفىٰ بِرَبِّكَ هادِيًا وَنَصيرًا
31.translation_eng: That is how for every prophet We assigned an enemy from among the guilty, and your Lord suffices as helper and guide.
31.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika jaʿalnā li-kulli nabiyyin ʿaduwwan mina l-mujrimīna wa-kafā bi-rabbika hādiyan wa-naṣīran

32.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَولا نُزِّلَ عَلَيهِ القُرآنُ جُملَةً واحِدَةً ۚ كَذٰلِكَ لِنُثَبِّتَ بِهِ فُؤادَكَ ۖ وَرَتَّلناهُ تَرتيلًا
32.translation_eng: The faithless say, ‘Why has not the Qurʾān been sent down to him all at once?’ So it is, that We may strengthen your heart with it, and We have recited it [to you] in a measured tone.
32.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna kafarū law-lā nuzzila ʿalayhi l-qurʾānu jumlatan wāḥidatan ka-dhālika li-nuthabbita bihī fuʾādaka wa-rattalnāhu tartīlan

33.content: وَلا يَأتونَكَ بِمَثَلٍ إِلّا جِئناكَ بِالحَقِّ وَأَحسَنَ تَفسيرًا
33.translation_eng: They do not bring you any poser but that We bring you the truth [in reply to them] and the best exposition.
33.transliteration: wa-lā yaʾtūnaka bi-mathalin ʾillā jiʾnāka bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾaḥsana tafsīran-i

34.content: الَّذينَ يُحشَرونَ عَلىٰ وُجوهِهِم إِلىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُولٰئِكَ شَرٌّ مَكانًا وَأَضَلُّ سَبيلًا
34.translation_eng: Those who will be mustered on their faces toward hell, they are the worse situated and further astray from the [right] way.
34.transliteration: alladhīna yuḥsharūna ʿalā wujūhihim ʾilā jahannama ʾulāʾika sharrun makānan wa-ʾaḍallu sabīlan

35.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسَى الكِتابَ وَجَعَلنا مَعَهُ أَخاهُ هارونَ وَزيرًا
