35.translation_eng: Certainly We gave Moses the Book and We made Aaron, his brother, accompany him as a minister.
35.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā mūsā l-kitāba wa-jaʿalnā maʿahū ʾakhāhu hārūna wazīran

36.content: فَقُلنَا اذهَبا إِلَى القَومِ الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا فَدَمَّرناهُم تَدميرًا
36.translation_eng: Then We said, ‘Let the two of you go to the people who have denied Our signs.’ Then We destroyed them utterly.
36.transliteration: fa-qulnā dhhabā ʾilā l-qawmi lladhīna kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā fa-dammarnāhum tadmīran

37.content: وَقَومَ نوحٍ لَمّا كَذَّبُوا الرُّسُلَ أَغرَقناهُم وَجَعَلناهُم لِلنّاسِ آيَةً ۖ وَأَعتَدنا لِلظّالِمينَ عَذابًا أَليمًا
37.translation_eng: And Noah’s people, We drowned them when they impugned the apostles, and We made them a sign for mankind, and We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.
37.transliteration: wa-qawma nūḥin lammā kadhdhabū r-rusula ʾaghraqnāhum wa-jaʿalnāhum li-n-nāsi ʾāyatan wa-ʾaʿtadnā li-ẓ-ẓālimīna ʿadhāban ʾalīman

38.content: وَعادًا وَثَمودَ وَأَصحابَ الرَّسِّ وَقُرونًا بَينَ ذٰلِكَ كَثيرًا
38.translation_eng: And ʿĀd and Thamūd, and the inhabitants of Rass, and many generations between them.
38.transliteration: wa-ʿādan wa-thamūda wa-ʾaṣḥāba r-rassi wa-qurūnan bayna dhālika kathīran

39.content: وَكُلًّا ضَرَبنا لَهُ الأَمثالَ ۖ وَكُلًّا تَبَّرنا تَتبيرًا
39.translation_eng: For each of them We drew examples, and each We destroyed utterly.
39.transliteration: wa-kullan ḍarabnā lahu l-ʾamthāla wa-kullan tabbarnā tatbīran

40.content: وَلَقَد أَتَوا عَلَى القَريَةِ الَّتي أُمطِرَت مَطَرَ السَّوءِ ۚ أَفَلَم يَكونوا يَرَونَها ۚ بَل كانوا لا يَرجونَ نُشورًا
40.translation_eng: Certainly they must have passed the town on which an evil shower was rained. Have they not seen it? Rather they did not expect resurrection.
40.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾataw ʿalā l-qaryati llatī ʾumṭirat maṭara s-sawʾi ʾa-fa-lam yakūnū yarawnahā bal kānū lā yarjūna nushūran

41.content: وَإِذا رَأَوكَ إِن يَتَّخِذونَكَ إِلّا هُزُوًا أَهٰذَا الَّذي بَعَثَ اللَّهُ رَسولًا
41.translation_eng: When they see you they just take you in derision: ‘Is this the one whom Allah has sent as an apostle!?
41.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā raʾawka ʾin yattakhidhūnaka ʾillā huzuwan ʾa-hādhā lladhī baʿatha llāhu rasūlan

42.content: إِن كادَ لَيُضِلُّنا عَن آلِهَتِنا لَولا أَن صَبَرنا عَلَيها ۚ وَسَوفَ يَعلَمونَ حينَ يَرَونَ العَذابَ مَن أَضَلُّ سَبيلًا
42.translation_eng: Indeed he was about to lead us astray from our gods, had we not stood by them.’ Soon they will know, when they sight the punishment, who is further astray from the [right] way.
42.transliteration: ʾin kāda la-yuḍillunā ʿan ʾālihatinā law-lā ʾan ṣabarnā ʿalayhā wa-sawfa yaʿlamūna ḥīna yarawna l-ʿadhāba man ʾaḍallu sabīlan

43.content: أَرَأَيتَ مَنِ اتَّخَذَ إِلٰهَهُ هَواهُ أَفَأَنتَ تَكونُ عَلَيهِ وَكيلًا
43.translation_eng: Have you seen him who has taken his desire to be his god? Is it your duty to watch over him?
43.transliteration: ʾa-raʾayta mani ttakhadha ʾilāhahū hawāhu ʾa-fa-ʾanta takūnu ʿalayhi wakīlan

44.content: أَم تَحسَبُ أَنَّ أَكثَرَهُم يَسمَعونَ أَو يَعقِلونَ ۚ إِن هُم إِلّا كَالأَنعامِ ۖ بَل هُم أَضَلُّ سَبيلًا
44.translation_eng: Do you suppose that most of them listen or apply reason? They are just like cattle; rather they are further astray from the way.
44.transliteration: ʾam taḥsabu ʾanna ʾaktharahum yasmaʿūna ʾaw yaʿqilūna ʾin hum ʾillā ka-l-ʾanʿāmi bal hum ʾaḍallu sabīlan

45.content: أَلَم تَرَ إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيفَ مَدَّ الظِّلَّ وَلَو شاءَ لَجَعَلَهُ ساكِنًا ثُمَّ جَعَلنَا الشَّمسَ عَلَيهِ دَليلًا
45.translation_eng: Have you not regarded how your Lord spreads the twilight?1 (Had He wished He would have made it still.) Then We made the sun a beacon for it.This is in accordance with a tradition of al-Imam al-Bāqir (ʿa) in which ẓill is explained as the light during the hours between daybreak and sunrise (see Tafsīr al-Qummī). Or ‘extends the shadow.’
45.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾilā rabbika kayfa madda ẓ-ẓilla wa-law shāʾa la-jaʿalahū sākinan thumma jaʿalnā sh-shamsa ʿalayhi dalīlan

46.content: ثُمَّ قَبَضناهُ إِلَينا قَبضًا يَسيرًا
46.translation_eng: Then We retract it toward Ourselves, with a gentle retracting.
46.transliteration: thumma qabaḍnāhu ʾilaynā qabḍan yasīran

47.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ اللَّيلَ لِباسًا وَالنَّومَ سُباتًا وَجَعَلَ النَّهارَ نُشورًا
47.translation_eng: It is He who made for you the night as a covering and sleep for rest and He made the day a recall to life.
47.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī jaʿala lakumu l-layla libāsan wa-n-nawma subātan wa-jaʿala n-nahāra nushūran

48.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي أَرسَلَ الرِّياحَ بُشرًا بَينَ يَدَي رَحمَتِهِ ۚ وَأَنزَلنا مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً طَهورًا
48.translation_eng: And it is He who sends the winds as harbingers of His mercy, and We send down from the sky purifying water,
48.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī ʾarsala r-riyāḥa bushran bayna yaday raḥmatihī wa-ʾanzalnā mina s-samāʾi māʾan ṭahūran

49.content: لِنُحيِيَ بِهِ بَلدَةً مَيتًا وَنُسقِيَهُ مِمّا خَلَقنا أَنعامًا وَأَناسِيَّ كَثيرًا
49.translation_eng: with which We revive a dead country and provide water to many of the cattle and humans We have created.
49.transliteration: li-nuḥyiya bihī baldatan maytan wa-nusqiyahū mimmā khalaqnā ʾanʿāman wa-ʾanāsiyya kathīran

50.content: وَلَقَد صَرَّفناهُ بَينَهُم لِيَذَّكَّروا فَأَبىٰ أَكثَرُ النّاسِ إِلّا كُفورًا
50.translation_eng: Certainly We distribute it among them so that they may take admonition. But most people are only intent on ingratitude.
50.transliteration: wa-la-qad ṣarrafnāhu baynahum li-yadhdhakkarū fa-ʾabā ʾaktharu n-nāsi ʾillā kufūran

51.content: وَلَو شِئنا لَبَعَثنا في كُلِّ قَريَةٍ نَذيرًا
51.translation_eng: Had We wished, We would have sent a warner to every town.
51.transliteration: wa-law shiʾnā la-baʿathnā fī kulli qaryatin nadhīran

52.content: فَلا تُطِعِ الكافِرينَ وَجاهِدهُم بِهِ جِهادًا كَبيرًا
52.translation_eng: So do not obey the faithless, but wage against them a great jihād with it.1That is, with the help of the Qurʾān.
52.transliteration: fa-lā tuṭiʿi l-kāfirīna wa-jāhidhum bihī jihādan kabīran

53.content: ۞ وَهُوَ الَّذي مَرَجَ البَحرَينِ هٰذا عَذبٌ فُراتٌ وَهٰذا مِلحٌ أُجاجٌ وَجَعَلَ بَينَهُما بَرزَخًا وَحِجرًا مَحجورًا
53.translation_eng: It is He who merged the two seas: this one sweet and agreeable, and that one briny and bitter, and between the two He set a barrier and a forbidding hindrance.
53.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī maraja l-baḥrayni hādhā ʿadhbun furātun wa-hādhā milḥun ʾujājun wa-jaʿala baynahumā barzakhan wa-ḥijran maḥjūran

54.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي خَلَقَ مِنَ الماءِ بَشَرًا فَجَعَلَهُ نَسَبًا وَصِهرًا ۗ وَكانَ رَبُّكَ قَديرًا
54.translation_eng: It is He who created the human being from water, then invested him with ties of blood and marriage, and your Lord is all-powerful.
54.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī khalaqa mina l-māʾi basharan fa-jaʿalahū nasaban wa-ṣihran wa-kāna rabbuka qadīran

55.content: وَيَعبُدونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ما لا يَنفَعُهُم وَلا يَضُرُّهُم ۗ وَكانَ الكافِرُ عَلىٰ رَبِّهِ ظَهيرًا
55.translation_eng: They worship besides Allah that which neither brings them any benefit nor causes them any harm, and the faithless one is ever an abettor against his Lord.
55.transliteration: wa-yaʿbudūna min dūni llāhi mā lā yanfaʿuhum wa-lā yaḍurruhum wa-kāna l-kāfiru ʿalā rabbihī ẓahīran

56.content: وَما أَرسَلناكَ إِلّا مُبَشِّرًا وَنَذيرًا
56.translation_eng: We did not send you except as a bearer of good news and as a warner.
56.transliteration: wa-mā ʾarsalnāka ʾillā mubashshiran wa-nadhīran

57.content: قُل ما أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ إِلّا مَن شاءَ أَن يَتَّخِذَ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبيلًا
57.translation_eng: Say, ‘I do not ask you any reward for it, except that anyone who wishes should take the way to his Lord.’
57.transliteration: qul mā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi min ʾajrin ʾillā man shāʾa ʾan yattakhidha ʾilā rabbihī sabīlan

58.content: وَتَوَكَّل عَلَى الحَيِّ الَّذي لا يَموتُ وَسَبِّح بِحَمدِهِ ۚ وَكَفىٰ بِهِ بِذُنوبِ عِبادِهِ خَبيرًا
58.translation_eng: Put your trust in the Living One who does not die, and celebrate His praise. He suffices as one all-aware of the sins of His servants.
58.transliteration: wa-tawakkal ʿalā l-ḥayyi lladhī lā yamūtu wa-sabbiḥ bi-ḥamdihī wa-kafā bihī bi-dhunūbi ʿibādihī khabīran-i

59.content: الَّذي خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما في سِتَّةِ أَيّامٍ ثُمَّ استَوىٰ عَلَى العَرشِ ۚ الرَّحمٰنُ فَاسأَل بِهِ خَبيرًا
59.translation_eng: He, who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days, and then settled on the Throne, the All-beneficent; so ask someone who is well aware about Him.1Or, ‘about it,’ that is, about the creation of the heavens and the earth, or the meaning of the Throne.
59.transliteration: alladhī khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-mā baynahumā fī sittati ʾayyāmin thumma stawā ʿalā l-ʿarshi r-raḥmānu fa-sʾal bihī khabīran

60.content: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُمُ اسجُدوا لِلرَّحمٰنِ قالوا وَمَا الرَّحمٰنُ أَنَسجُدُ لِما تَأمُرُنا وَزادَهُم نُفورًا ۩
60.translation_eng: When they are told: ‘Prostrate yourselves before the All-beneficent,’ they say, ‘What is “the All-beneficent”? Shall we prostrate ourselves before whatever you bid us?’ And it increases their aversion.
60.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā qīla lahumu sjudū li-r-raḥmāni qālū wa-mā r-raḥmānu ʾa-nasjudu li-mā taʾmurunā wa-zādahum nufūran

61.content: تَبارَكَ الَّذي جَعَلَ فِي السَّماءِ بُروجًا وَجَعَلَ فيها سِراجًا وَقَمَرًا مُنيرًا
61.translation_eng: Blessed is He who appointed houses in the sky and set in it a lamp and a shining moon.
61.transliteration: tabāraka lladhī jaʿala fī s-samāʾi burūjan wa-jaʿala fīhā sirājan wa-qamaran munīran

62.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي جَعَلَ اللَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ خِلفَةً لِمَن أَرادَ أَن يَذَّكَّرَ أَو أَرادَ شُكورًا
62.translation_eng: It is He who made the night and the day alternate for one who desires to take admonition, or desires to give thanks.
62.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī jaʿala l-layla wa-n-nahāra khilfatan li-man ʾarāda ʾan yadhdhakkara ʾaw ʾarāda shukūran

63.content: وَعِبادُ الرَّحمٰنِ الَّذينَ يَمشونَ عَلَى الأَرضِ هَونًا وَإِذا خاطَبَهُمُ الجاهِلونَ قالوا سَلامًا
63.translation_eng: The servants of the All-beneficent are those who walk humbly on the earth, and when the ignorant address them, say, ‘Peace!’
63.transliteration: wa-ʿibādu r-raḥmāni lladhīna yamshūna ʿalā l-ʾarḍi hawnan wa-ʾidhā khāṭabahumu l-jāhilūna qālū salāman

64.content: وَالَّذينَ يَبيتونَ لِرَبِّهِم سُجَّدًا وَقِيامًا
64.translation_eng: Those who spend the night for their Lord, prostrating and standing [in worship].
64.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yabītūna li-rabbihim sujjadan wa-qiyāman

65.content: وَالَّذينَ يَقولونَ رَبَّنَا اصرِف عَنّا عَذابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذابَها كانَ غَرامًا
65.translation_eng: Those who say, ‘Our Lord! Turn away from us the punishment of hell. Indeed its punishment is enduring.
65.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yaqūlūna rabbanā ṣrif ʿannā ʿadhāba jahannama ʾinna ʿadhābahā kāna gharāman

66.content: إِنَّها ساءَت مُستَقَرًّا وَمُقامًا
66.translation_eng: Indeed it is an evil abode and place.’
66.transliteration: ʾinnahā sāʾat mustaqarran wa-muqāman

67.content: وَالَّذينَ إِذا أَنفَقوا لَم يُسرِفوا وَلَم يَقتُروا وَكانَ بَينَ ذٰلِكَ قَوامًا
67.translation_eng: Those who, when spending, are neither wasteful nor tightfisted, and moderation lies between these [extremes].
67.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ʾidhā ʾanfaqū lam yusrifū wa-lam yaqturū wa-kāna bayna dhālika qawāman

68.content: وَالَّذينَ لا يَدعونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلٰهًا آخَرَ وَلا يَقتُلونَ النَّفسَ الَّتي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلّا بِالحَقِّ وَلا يَزنونَ ۚ وَمَن يَفعَل ذٰلِكَ يَلقَ أَثامًا
68.translation_eng: Those who do not invoke another god besides Allah, and do not kill a soul [whose life] Allah has made inviolable, except with due cause, and do not commit fornication. (Whoever does that shall encounter its retribution,
68.transliteration: wa-lladhīna lā yadʿūna maʿa llāhi ʾilāhan ʾākhara wa-lā yaqtulūna n-nafsa llatī ḥarrama llāhu ʾillā bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-lā yaznūna wa-man yafʿal dhālika yalqa ʾathāman

69.content: يُضاعَف لَهُ العَذابُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ وَيَخلُد فيهِ مُهانًا
69.translation_eng: the punishment being doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection. In it he will abide in humiliation forever,
69.transliteration: yuḍāʿaf lahu l-ʿadhābu yawma l-qiyāmati wa-yakhlud fīhi muhānan

70.content: إِلّا مَن تابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صالِحًا فَأُولٰئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ اللَّهُ سَيِّئَاتِهِم حَسَناتٍ ۗ وَكانَ اللَّهُ غَفورًا رَحيمًا
70.translation_eng: excepting those who repent, attain faith, and act righteously. For such, Allah will replace their misdeeds with good deeds,1 and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.Or ‘their vices with virtues.’
70.transliteration: ʾillā man tāba wa-ʾāmana wa-ʿamila ʿamalan ṣāliḥan fa-ʾulāʾika yubaddilu llāhu sayyiʾātihim ḥasanātin wa-kāna llāhu ghafūran raḥīman

71.content: وَمَن تابَ وَعَمِلَ صالِحًا فَإِنَّهُ يَتوبُ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَتابًا
71.translation_eng: And whoever repents and acts righteously indeed turns to Allah with due penitence).
71.transliteration: wa-man tāba wa-ʿamila ṣāliḥan fa-ʾinnahū yatūbu ʾilā llāhi matāban

72.content: وَالَّذينَ لا يَشهَدونَ الزّورَ وَإِذا مَرّوا بِاللَّغوِ مَرّوا كِرامًا
72.translation_eng: Those who do not give false testimony,1 and when they come upon vain talk, pass by nobly.Or, ‘those who do not participate in humbug.’ That is, those who do not attend music parties or take part in senseless and sinful gatherings and amusements. (See Tafsīr al-Qummī, Manhaj al-Ṣādiqīn).
72.transliteration: wa-lladhīna lā yashhadūna z-zūra wa-ʾidhā marrū bi-l-laghwi marrū kirāman

73.content: وَالَّذينَ إِذا ذُكِّروا بِآياتِ رَبِّهِم لَم يَخِرّوا عَلَيها صُمًّا وَعُميانًا
73.translation_eng: Those who, when reminded of the signs of their Lord, do not turn a deaf ear and a blind eye to them.
73.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ʾidhā dhukkirū bi-ʾāyāti rabbihim lam yakhirrū ʿalayhā ṣumman wa-ʿumyānan

74.content: وَالَّذينَ يَقولونَ رَبَّنا هَب لَنا مِن أَزواجِنا وَذُرِّيّاتِنا قُرَّةَ أَعيُنٍ وَاجعَلنا لِلمُتَّقينَ إِمامًا
74.translation_eng: And those who say, ‘Our Lord! Grant us comfort in our spouses and descendants, and make us imams of the Godwary.’
74.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yaqūlūna rabbanā hab lanā min ʾazwājinā wa-dhurriyyātinā qurrata ʾaʿyunin wa-jʿalnā li-l-muttaqīna ʾimāman

75.content: أُولٰئِكَ يُجزَونَ الغُرفَةَ بِما صَبَروا وَيُلَقَّونَ فيها تَحِيَّةً وَسَلامًا
75.translation_eng: Those shall be rewarded with sublime abodes for their patience, and they shall be met there with greetings and ‘Peace,’
75.transliteration: ʾulāʾika yujzawna l-ghurfata bi-mā ṣabarū wa-yulaqqawna fīhā taḥiyyatan wa-salāman

76.content: خالِدينَ فيها ۚ حَسُنَت مُستَقَرًّا وَمُقامًا
76.translation_eng: to abide in them [forever], an excellent abode and place.
76.transliteration: khālidīna fīhā ḥasunat mustaqarran wa-muqāman

77.content: قُل ما يَعبَأُ بِكُم رَبّي لَولا دُعاؤُكُم ۖ فَقَد كَذَّبتُم فَسَوفَ يَكونُ لِزامًا
77.translation_eng: Say, ‘What store my Lord would set by you were it not for your supplication?1 But you impugned [me and my advice], so that will continue to haunt you.’Or ‘were it not for your invitation.’
77.transliteration: qul mā yaʿbaʾu bikum rabbī law-lā duʿāʾukum fa-qad kadhdhabtum fa-sawfa yakūnu lizāman

26.description: The surah that mentions the aimless meandering of unbelieving Poets in their creative eort to versify, and how their own actions belie their artistic messages, though it exempts from this censure poets who are believers and act with justice and righteousness. It takes its name from verse 224 . concerning the poets (shuʿarāʾ). The surah talks about the disbelievers who belittle the Quran, and gives examples of God’s power and grace in nature. It recounts several stories of earlier prophets, the reactions of their people, and punishments that alicted them, ending by confirming the divine origin of the Quran. It is not something brought down by the jinn, nor is it poetry.

1.translation_eng: Tā, Sīn, Mīm.

2.translation_eng: These are the signs of the Manifest Book.

3.content: لَعَلَّكَ باخِعٌ نَفسَكَ أَلّا يَكونوا مُؤمِنينَ
3.translation_eng: You are liable to imperil your life [out of distress] that they will not have faith.
3.transliteration: laʿallaka bākhiʿun nafsaka ʾallā yakūnū muʾminīna

4.content: إِن نَشَأ نُنَزِّل عَلَيهِم مِنَ السَّماءِ آيَةً فَظَلَّت أَعناقُهُم لَها خاضِعينَ
4.translation_eng: If We wish We will send down to them a sign from the sky before which their heads will remain bowed in humility.
4.transliteration: ʾin nashaʾ nunazzil ʿalayhim mina s-samāʾi ʾāyatan fa-ẓallat ʾaʿnāquhum lahā khāḍiʿīna

5.content: وَما يَأتيهِم مِن ذِكرٍ مِنَ الرَّحمٰنِ مُحدَثٍ إِلّا كانوا عَنهُ مُعرِضينَ
5.translation_eng: There would not come to them any new reminder from the All-beneficent but that they used to disregard it.
5.transliteration: wa-mā yaʾtīhim min dhikrin mina r-raḥmāni muḥdathin ʾillā kānū ʿanhu muʿriḍīna

6.content: فَقَد كَذَّبوا فَسَيَأتيهِم أَنباءُ ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
6.translation_eng: They have certainly denied [the truth], but soon there will come to them the news of what they have been deriding.
6.transliteration: fa-qad kadhdhabū fa-sa-yaʾtīhim ʾanbāʾu mā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

7.content: أَوَلَم يَرَوا إِلَى الأَرضِ كَم أَنبَتنا فيها مِن كُلِّ زَوجٍ كَريمٍ
7.translation_eng: Have they not regarded the earth, how many We have caused to grow in it of every splendid kind [of vegetation]?
7.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾilā l-ʾarḍi kam ʾanbatnā fīhā min kulli zawjin karīmin

8.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
8.translation_eng: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
8.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan wa-mā kāna ʾaktharuhum muʾminīna

9.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ العَزيزُ الرَّحيمُ
9.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
9.transliteration: wa-ʾinna rabbaka la-huwa l-ʿazīzu r-raḥīmu

10.content: وَإِذ نادىٰ رَبُّكَ موسىٰ أَنِ ائتِ القَومَ الظّالِمينَ
10.translation_eng: When your Lord called out to Moses: [saying,] ‘Go to the wrongdoing people,
10.transliteration: wa-ʾidh nādā rabbuka mūsā ʾani ʾti l-qawma ẓ-ẓālimīna

11.content: قَومَ فِرعَونَ ۚ أَلا يَتَّقونَ
11.translation_eng: the people of Pharaoh. Will they not be wary [of Allah]?’
11.transliteration: qawma firʿawna ʾa-lā yattaqūna

12.content: قالَ رَبِّ إِنّي أَخافُ أَن يُكَذِّبونِ
12.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! I fear they will impugn me,
12.transliteration: qāla rabbi ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʾan yukadhdhibūni

13.content: وَيَضيقُ صَدري وَلا يَنطَلِقُ لِساني فَأَرسِل إِلىٰ هارونَ
13.translation_eng: and I will become upset, and my tongue will fail me. So send [Your messenger] to Aaron.
13.transliteration: wa-yaḍīqu ṣadrī wa-lā yanṭaliqu lisānī fa-ʾarsil ʾilā hārūna

14.content: وَلَهُم عَلَيَّ ذَنبٌ فَأَخافُ أَن يَقتُلونِ
14.translation_eng: Also they have a charge against me, and I fear they will kill me.’
14.transliteration: wa-lahum ʿalayya dhanbun fa-ʾakhāfu ʾan yaqtulūni

15.content: قالَ كَلّا ۖ فَاذهَبا بِآياتِنا ۖ إِنّا مَعَكُم مُستَمِعونَ
15.translation_eng: He said, ‘Certainly not! Let the two of you go with Our signs: We will indeed be with you, hearing [everything].
15.transliteration: qāla kallā fa-dhhabā bi-ʾāyātinā ʾinnā maʿakum mustamiʿūna

16.content: فَأتِيا فِرعَونَ فَقولا إِنّا رَسولُ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
16.translation_eng: So approach Pharaoh and say, “We are indeed envoys of the Lord of the worlds
16.transliteration: fa-ʾtiyā firʿawna fa-qūlā ʾinnā rasūlu rabbi l-ʿālamīna

17.content: أَن أَرسِل مَعَنا بَني إِسرائيلَ
17.translation_eng: that you let the Children of Israel go with us.” ’
17.transliteration: ʾan ʾarsil maʿanā banī ʾisrāʾīla

18.content: قالَ أَلَم نُرَبِّكَ فينا وَليدًا وَلَبِثتَ فينا مِن عُمُرِكَ سِنينَ
18.translation_eng: He said, ‘Did we not rear you as a child among us, and did you not stay with us for years of your life?
18.transliteration: qāla ʾa-lam nurabbika fīnā walīdan wa-labithta fīnā min ʿumurika sinīna

19.content: وَفَعَلتَ فَعلَتَكَ الَّتي فَعَلتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ الكافِرينَ
19.translation_eng: Then you committed that deed of yours, and you are an ingrate.’
19.transliteration: wa-faʿalta faʿlataka llatī faʿalta wa-ʾanta mina l-kāfirīna

20.content: قالَ فَعَلتُها إِذًا وَأَنا مِنَ الضّالّينَ
20.translation_eng: He said, ‘I did that when I was astray.
20.transliteration: qāla faʿaltuhā ʾidhan wa-ʾana mina ḍ-ḍāllīna

21.content: فَفَرَرتُ مِنكُم لَمّا خِفتُكُم فَوَهَبَ لي رَبّي حُكمًا وَجَعَلَني مِنَ المُرسَلينَ
21.translation_eng: So I fled from you, as I was afraid of you. Then my Lord gave me judgement and made me one of the apostles.
21.transliteration: fa-farartu minkum lammā khiftukum fa-wahaba lī rabbī ḥukman wa-jaʿalanī mina l-mursalīna

22.content: وَتِلكَ نِعمَةٌ تَمُنُّها عَلَيَّ أَن عَبَّدتَ بَني إِسرائيلَ
22.translation_eng: As for that favour, you remind me of it reproachfully because you have enslaved the Children of Israel.’
22.transliteration: wa-tilka niʿmatun tamunnuhā ʿalayya ʾan ʿabbadta banī ʾisrāʾīla

23.content: قالَ فِرعَونُ وَما رَبُّ العالَمينَ
23.translation_eng: He said, ‘And what is “the Lord of all the worlds?” ’
23.transliteration: qāla firʿawnu wa-mā rabbu l-ʿālamīna

24.content: قالَ رَبُّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما ۖ إِن كُنتُم موقِنينَ
24.translation_eng: He said, ‘The Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, —should you have conviction.’
24.transliteration: qāla rabbu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā baynahumā ʾin kuntum mūqinīna

25.content: قالَ لِمَن حَولَهُ أَلا تَستَمِعونَ
25.translation_eng: He said to those who were around him, ‘Don’t you hear?!’
25.transliteration: qāla li-man ḥawlahū ʾa-lā tastamiʿūna

26.content: قالَ رَبُّكُم وَرَبُّ آبائِكُمُ الأَوَّلينَ
26.translation_eng: He said, ‘Your Lord, and the Lord of your forefathers!’
26.transliteration: qāla rabbukum wa-rabbu ʾābāʾikumu l-ʾawwalīna

27.content: قالَ إِنَّ رَسولَكُمُ الَّذي أُرسِلَ إِلَيكُم لَمَجنونٌ
27.translation_eng: He said, ‘Indeed your messenger, who has been sent to you, is surely crazy!’
27.transliteration: qāla ʾinna rasūlakumu lladhī ʾursila ʾilaykum la-majnūnun

28.content: قالَ رَبُّ المَشرِقِ وَالمَغرِبِ وَما بَينَهُما ۖ إِن كُنتُم تَعقِلونَ
28.translation_eng: He said, ‘The Lord of the east and the west and whatever is between them —should you apply reason.’
28.transliteration: qāla rabbu l-mashriqi wa-l-maghribi wa-mā baynahumā ʾin kuntum taʿqilūna

29.content: قالَ لَئِنِ اتَّخَذتَ إِلٰهًا غَيري لَأَجعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ المَسجونينَ
29.translation_eng: He said, ‘If you take up any god other than me, I will surely make you a prisoner!’
29.transliteration: qāla la-ʾini ttakhadhta ʾilāhan ghayrī la-ʾajʿalannaka mina l-masjūnīna

30.content: قالَ أَوَلَو جِئتُكَ بِشَيءٍ مُبينٍ
30.translation_eng: He said, ‘What if I bring you something manifest?’
30.transliteration: qāla ʾa-wa-law jiʾtuka bi-shayʾin mubīnin

31.content: قالَ فَأتِ بِهِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
31.translation_eng: He said, ‘Then bring it, should you be truthful.’
31.transliteration: qāla fa-ʾti bihī ʾin kunta mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

32.content: فَأَلقىٰ عَصاهُ فَإِذا هِيَ ثُعبانٌ مُبينٌ
32.translation_eng: Thereat he threw down his staff, and behold, it was a manifest python.
32.transliteration: fa-ʾalqā ʿaṣāhu fa-ʾidhā hiya thuʿbānun mubīnun

33.content: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذا هِيَ بَيضاءُ لِلنّاظِرينَ
33.translation_eng: Then he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to the onlookers.
33.transliteration: wa-nazaʿa yadahū fa-ʾidhā hiya bayḍāʾu li-n-nāẓirīna

34.content: قالَ لِلمَلَإِ حَولَهُ إِنَّ هٰذا لَساحِرٌ عَليمٌ
34.translation_eng: He said to the elite [who stood] around him, ‘This is indeed an expert magician
34.transliteration: qāla li-l-malaʾi ḥawlahū ʾinna hādhā la-sāḥirun ʿalīmun

35.content: يُريدُ أَن يُخرِجَكُم مِن أَرضِكُم بِسِحرِهِ فَماذا تَأمُرونَ
35.translation_eng: who seeks to expel you from your land with his magic. So what do you advise?’
35.transliteration: yurīdu ʾan yukhrijakum min ʾarḍikum bi-siḥrihī fa-mādhā taʾmurūna

36.content: قالوا أَرجِه وَأَخاهُ وَابعَث فِي المَدائِنِ حاشِرينَ
36.translation_eng: They said, ‘Put him and his brother off for a while, and send heralds to the cities
36.transliteration: qālū ʾarjih wa-ʾakhāhu wa-bʿath fī l-madāʾini ḥāshirīna

37.content: يَأتوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحّارٍ عَليمٍ
37.translation_eng: to bring you every expert magician.’
37.transliteration: yaʾtūka bi-kulli saḥḥārin ʿalīmin

38.content: فَجُمِعَ السَّحَرَةُ لِميقاتِ يَومٍ مَعلومٍ
38.translation_eng: So the magicians were gathered for the tryst of a known day,
38.transliteration: fa-jumiʿa s-saḥaratu li-mīqāti yawmin maʿlūmin

39.content: وَقيلَ لِلنّاسِ هَل أَنتُم مُجتَمِعونَ
39.translation_eng: and the people were told: ‘Will you gather?!’
39.transliteration: wa-qīla li-n-nāsi hal ʾantum mujtamiʿūna

40.content: لَعَلَّنا نَتَّبِعُ السَّحَرَةَ إِن كانوا هُمُ الغالِبينَ
40.translation_eng: ‘Maybe we will follow the magicians, should they be the victors!’
40.transliteration: laʿallanā nattabiʿu s-saḥarata ʾin kānū humu l-ghālibīna

41.content: فَلَمّا جاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قالوا لِفِرعَونَ أَئِنَّ لَنا لَأَجرًا إِن كُنّا نَحنُ الغالِبينَ
41.translation_eng: So when the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, ‘Shall we indeed have a reward if we were to be the victors?’
41.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾa s-saḥaratu qālū li-firʿawna ʾa-ʾinna lanā la-ʾajran ʾin kunnā naḥnu l-ghālibīna

42.content: قالَ نَعَم وَإِنَّكُم إِذًا لَمِنَ المُقَرَّبينَ
42.translation_eng: He said, ‘ Of course; and indeed you shall be among those near [to me].’
42.transliteration: qāla naʿam wa-ʾinnakum ʾidhan la-mina l-muqarrabīna

43.content: قالَ لَهُم موسىٰ أَلقوا ما أَنتُم مُلقونَ
43.translation_eng: Moses said to them, ‘Throw down what you have to throw!’
43.transliteration: qāla lahum mūsā ʾalqū mā ʾantum mulqūna

44.content: فَأَلقَوا حِبالَهُم وَعِصِيَّهُم وَقالوا بِعِزَّةِ فِرعَونَ إِنّا لَنَحنُ الغالِبونَ
44.translation_eng: So they threw down their sticks and ropes, and said, ‘By the might of Pharaoh, we shall surely be the victors!’
44.transliteration: fa-ʾalqaw ḥibālahum wa-ʿiṣiyyahum wa-qālū bi-ʿizzati firʿawna ʾinnā la-naḥnu l-ghālibūna

45.content: فَأَلقىٰ موسىٰ عَصاهُ فَإِذا هِيَ تَلقَفُ ما يَأفِكونَ
45.translation_eng: Thereat Moses threw down his staff, and behold, it was swallowing what they had faked.
45.transliteration: fa-ʾalqā mūsā ʿaṣāhu fa-ʾidhā hiya talqafu mā yaʾfikūna

46.content: فَأُلقِيَ السَّحَرَةُ ساجِدينَ
46.translation_eng: Thereat the magicians fell down prostrating.
46.transliteration: fa-ʾulqiya s-saḥaratu sājidīna

47.content: قالوا آمَنّا بِرَبِّ العالَمينَ
47.translation_eng: They said, ‘We believe in the Lord of all the worlds,
47.transliteration: qālū ʾāmannā bi-rabbi l-ʿālamīna

48.content: رَبِّ موسىٰ وَهارونَ
48.translation_eng: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.’
48.transliteration: rabbi mūsā wa-hārūna

49.content: قالَ آمَنتُم لَهُ قَبلَ أَن آذَنَ لَكُم ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبيرُكُمُ الَّذي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحرَ فَلَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيدِيَكُم وَأَرجُلَكُم مِن خِلافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُم أَجمَعينَ
49.translation_eng: He said, ‘Do you profess faith in Him before I permit you? He is indeed your chief who has taught you magic! Soon you will surely know! Surely I will cut off your hands and feet from opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all.’
49.transliteration: qāla ʾāmantum lahū qabla ʾan ʾādhana lakum ʾinnahū la-kabīrukumu lladhī ʿallamakumu s-siḥra fa-la sawfa taʿlamūna la-ʾuqaṭṭiʿanna ʾaydiyakum wa-ʾarjulakum min khilāfin wa-la-ʾuṣallibannakum ʾajmaʿīna

50.content: قالوا لا ضَيرَ ۖ إِنّا إِلىٰ رَبِّنا مُنقَلِبونَ
50.translation_eng: They said, ‘[There is] no harm [in that]! Indeed we shall return to our Lord.
50.transliteration: qālū lā ḍayra ʾinnā ʾilā rabbinā munqalibūna

51.content: إِنّا نَطمَعُ أَن يَغفِرَ لَنا رَبُّنا خَطايانا أَن كُنّا أَوَّلَ المُؤمِنينَ
51.translation_eng: Indeed we hope our Lord will forgive us our iniquities for being the first to believe.’
51.transliteration: ʾinnā naṭmaʿu ʾan yaghfira lanā rabbunā khaṭāyānā ʾan kunnā ʾawwala l-muʾminīna

52.content: ۞ وَأَوحَينا إِلىٰ موسىٰ أَن أَسرِ بِعِبادي إِنَّكُم مُتَّبَعونَ
52.translation_eng: Then We revealed to Moses, [saying], ‘Take My servants on a journey by night, for you will be pursued.’
52.transliteration: wa-ʾawḥaynā ʾilā mūsā ʾan ʾasri bi-ʿibādī ʾinnakum muttabaʿūna

53.content: فَأَرسَلَ فِرعَونُ فِي المَدائِنِ حاشِرينَ
53.translation_eng: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities,
53.transliteration: fa-ʾarsala firʿawnu fī l-madāʾini ḥāshirīna

54.content: إِنَّ هٰؤُلاءِ لَشِرذِمَةٌ قَليلونَ
54.translation_eng: [announcing:] ‘These1 are indeed a small gang.That is, the Israelites.
54.transliteration: ʾinna hāʾulāʾi la-shirdhimatun qalīlūna

55.content: وَإِنَّهُم لَنا لَغائِظونَ
55.translation_eng: They have surely aroused our wrath,
55.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahum lanā la-ghāʾiẓūna

56.content: وَإِنّا لَجَميعٌ حاذِرونَ
56.translation_eng: and indeed we are all on our guard.’1Or, ‘Surely we are all a well-armed host.’
56.transliteration: wa-ʾinnā la-jamīʿun ḥādhirūna

57.content: فَأَخرَجناهُم مِن جَنّاتٍ وَعُيونٍ
57.translation_eng: So We expelled them from gardens and springs,
57.transliteration: fa-ʾakhrajnāhum min jannātin wa-ʿuyūnin

58.content: وَكُنوزٍ وَمَقامٍ كَريمٍ
58.translation_eng: and [from] treasures and splendid places.
58.transliteration: wa-kunūzin wa-maqāmin karīmin

59.content: كَذٰلِكَ وَأَورَثناها بَني إِسرائيلَ
59.translation_eng: So it was; and We bequeathed them to the Children of Israel.
59.transliteration: ka-dhālika wa-ʾawrathnāhā banī ʾisrāʾīla

60.content: فَأَتبَعوهُم مُشرِقينَ
60.translation_eng: Then they pursued them at sunrise.
60.transliteration: fa-ʾatbaʿūhum mushriqīna

61.content: فَلَمّا تَراءَى الجَمعانِ قالَ أَصحابُ موسىٰ إِنّا لَمُدرَكونَ
61.translation_eng: When the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, ‘Indeed we have been caught up.’
61.transliteration: fa-lammā tarāʾa l-jamʿāni qāla ʾaṣḥābu mūsā ʾinnā la-mudrakūna

62.content: قالَ كَلّا ۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبّي سَيَهدينِ
62.translation_eng: He said, ‘Certainly not! Indeed my Lord is with me. He will guide me.’
62.transliteration: qāla kallā ʾinna maʿiya rabbī sa-yahdīni

63.content: فَأَوحَينا إِلىٰ موسىٰ أَنِ اضرِب بِعَصاكَ البَحرَ ۖ فَانفَلَقَ فَكانَ كُلُّ فِرقٍ كَالطَّودِ العَظيمِ
63.translation_eng: Thereupon We revealed to Moses: ‘Strike the sea with your staff!’ Whereupon it parted, and each part was as if it were a great mountain.
63.transliteration: fa-ʾawḥaynā ʾilā mūsā ʾani ḍrib bi-ʿaṣāka l-baḥra fa-nfalaqa fa-kāna kullu firqin ka-ṭ-ṭawdi l-ʿaẓīmi

64.content: وَأَزلَفنا ثَمَّ الآخَرينَ
64.translation_eng: There, We brought the others near.
64.transliteration: wa-ʾazlafnā thamma l-ʾākharīna

65.content: وَأَنجَينا موسىٰ وَمَن مَعَهُ أَجمَعينَ
65.translation_eng: And We delivered Moses and all those who were with him.
65.transliteration: wa-ʾanjaynā mūsā wa-man maʿahū ʾajmaʿīna

66.content: ثُمَّ أَغرَقنَا الآخَرينَ
66.translation_eng: Then We drowned the others.
66.transliteration: thumma ʾaghraqnā l-ʾākharīna

67.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
67.translation_eng: There is indeed a sign in that, but most of them do not have faith.
67.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan wa-mā kāna ʾaktharuhum muʾminīna

68.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ العَزيزُ الرَّحيمُ
68.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
68.transliteration: wa-ʾinna rabbaka la-huwa l-ʿazīzu r-raḥīmu

69.content: وَاتلُ عَلَيهِم نَبَأَ إِبراهيمَ
69.translation_eng: Relate to them the account of Abraham
69.transliteration: wa-tlu ʿalayhim nabaʾa ʾibrāhīma

70.content: إِذ قالَ لِأَبيهِ وَقَومِهِ ما تَعبُدونَ
70.translation_eng: when he said to his father and his people, ‘What is it that you are worshiping?!’
70.transliteration: ʾidh qāla li-ʾabīhi wa-qawmihī mā taʿbudūna

71.content: قالوا نَعبُدُ أَصنامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَها عاكِفينَ
71.translation_eng: They said, ‘We worship idols, and we will go on clinging to them.’
71.transliteration: qālū naʿbudu ʾaṣnāman fa-naẓallu lahā ʿākifīna

72.content: قالَ هَل يَسمَعونَكُم إِذ تَدعونَ
72.translation_eng: He said, ‘Do they hear you when you call them?
72.transliteration: qāla hal yasmaʿūnakum ʾidh tadʿūna

73.content: أَو يَنفَعونَكُم أَو يَضُرّونَ
73.translation_eng: Or do they bring you any benefit, or cause you any harm?’
73.transliteration: ʾaw yanfaʿūnakum ʾaw yaḍurrūna

74.content: قالوا بَل وَجَدنا آباءَنا كَذٰلِكَ يَفعَلونَ
74.translation_eng: They said, ‘Rather we found our fathers acting likewise.’
74.transliteration: qālū bal wajadnā ʾābāʾanā ka-dhālika yafʿalūna

75.content: قالَ أَفَرَأَيتُم ما كُنتُم تَعبُدونَ
75.translation_eng: He said, ‘Have you regarded what you have been worshipping,
75.transliteration: qāla ʾa-fa-raʾaytum mā kuntum taʿbudūna

76.content: أَنتُم وَآباؤُكُمُ الأَقدَمونَ
76.translation_eng: you and your ancestors?
76.transliteration: ʾantum wa-ʾābāʾukumu l-ʾaqdamūna

77.content: فَإِنَّهُم عَدُوٌّ لي إِلّا رَبَّ العالَمينَ
77.translation_eng: They are indeed hateful to me, but the Lord of all the worlds,
77.transliteration: fa-ʾinnahum ʿaduwwun lī ʾillā rabba l-ʿālamīna

78.content: الَّذي خَلَقَني فَهُوَ يَهدينِ
78.translation_eng: who created me, it is He who guides me,
78.transliteration: alladhī khalaqanī fa-huwa yahdīni

79.content: وَالَّذي هُوَ يُطعِمُني وَيَسقينِ
79.translation_eng: and provides me with food and drink,
79.transliteration: wa-lladhī huwa yuṭʿimunī wa-yasqīni

80.content: وَإِذا مَرِضتُ فَهُوَ يَشفينِ
80.translation_eng: and when I get sick, it is He who cures me;
80.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā mariḍtu fa-huwa yashfīni

81.content: وَالَّذي يُميتُني ثُمَّ يُحيينِ
81.translation_eng: who will make me die, then He will bring me to life,
81.transliteration: wa-lladhī yumītunī thumma yuḥyīni

82.content: وَالَّذي أَطمَعُ أَن يَغفِرَ لي خَطيئَتي يَومَ الدّينِ
82.translation_eng: and who, I hope, will forgive me my iniquities on the Day of Retribution.’1Or ‘the Day of Judgement.’
82.transliteration: wa-lladhī ʾaṭmaʿu ʾan yaghfira lī khaṭīʾatī yawma d-dīni

83.content: رَبِّ هَب لي حُكمًا وَأَلحِقني بِالصّالِحينَ
83.translation_eng: ‘My Lord! Grant me [unerring] judgement, and unite me with the Righteous.
83.transliteration: rabbi hab lī ḥukman wa-ʾalḥiqnī bi-ṣ-ṣāliḥīna

84.content: وَاجعَل لي لِسانَ صِدقٍ فِي الآخِرينَ
84.translation_eng: Confer on me a worthy repute among the posterity,
84.transliteration: wa-jʿal lī lisāna ṣidqin fī l-ʾākhirīna

85.content: وَاجعَلني مِن وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ النَّعيمِ
85.translation_eng: and make me one of the heirs to the paradise of bliss.
85.transliteration: wa-jʿalnī min warathati jannati n-naʿīmi

86.content: وَاغفِر لِأَبي إِنَّهُ كانَ مِنَ الضّالّينَ
86.translation_eng: Forgive my father, for he is one of those who are astray.
86.transliteration: wa-ghfir li-ʾabī ʾinnahū kāna mina ḍ-ḍāllīna

87.content: وَلا تُخزِني يَومَ يُبعَثونَ
87.translation_eng: Do not disgrace me on the day that they will be resurrected,
87.transliteration: wa-lā tukhzinī yawma yubʿathūna

88.content: يَومَ لا يَنفَعُ مالٌ وَلا بَنونَ
88.translation_eng: the day when neither wealth nor children will avail,
88.transliteration: yawma lā yanfaʿu mālun wa-lā banūna

89.content: إِلّا مَن أَتَى اللَّهَ بِقَلبٍ سَليمٍ
89.translation_eng: except him who comes to Allah with a sound heart,’1That is, a heart that is free from the love of the world.
89.transliteration: ʾillā man ʾatā llāha bi-qalbin salīmin

90.content: وَأُزلِفَتِ الجَنَّةُ لِلمُتَّقينَ
90.translation_eng: and paradise will be brought near for the Godwary,
90.transliteration: wa-ʾuzlifati l-jannatu li-l-muttaqīna

91.content: وَبُرِّزَتِ الجَحيمُ لِلغاوينَ
91.translation_eng: and hell will be brought into view for the perverse,
91.transliteration: wa-burrizati l-jaḥīmu li-l-ghāwīna

92.content: وَقيلَ لَهُم أَينَ ما كُنتُم تَعبُدونَ
92.translation_eng: and they shall be told: ‘Where is that which you used to worship
92.transliteration: wa-qīla lahum ʾayna mā kuntum taʿbudūna

93.content: مِن دونِ اللَّهِ هَل يَنصُرونَكُم أَو يَنتَصِرونَ
93.translation_eng: besides Allah? Do they help you, or do they help each other?’
93.transliteration: min dūni llāhi hal yanṣurūnakum ʾaw yantaṣirūna

94.content: فَكُبكِبوا فيها هُم وَالغاوونَ
94.translation_eng: Then they will be cast into it on their faces —they and the perverse,
94.transliteration: fa-kubkibū fīhā hum wa-l-ghāwūna

95.content: وَجُنودُ إِبليسَ أَجمَعونَ
95.translation_eng: and the hosts of Iblis all together.
95.transliteration: wa-junūdu ʾiblīsa ʾajmaʿūna

96.content: قالوا وَهُم فيها يَختَصِمونَ
96.translation_eng: They will say, as they wrangle in it [together],
96.transliteration: qālū wa-hum fīhā yakhtaṣimūna

97.content: تَاللَّهِ إِن كُنّا لَفي ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
97.translation_eng: ‘By Allah, we had indeed been in manifest error,
97.transliteration: ta-llāhi ʾin kunnā la-fī ḍalālin mubīnin

98.content: إِذ نُسَوّيكُم بِرَبِّ العالَمينَ
98.translation_eng: when we equated you with the Lord of all the worlds!
98.transliteration: ʾidh nusawwīkum bi-rabbi l-ʿālamīna

99.translation_eng: And no one led us astray except the guilty.

101.translation_eng: nor do we have any sympathetic friend.

102.content: فَلَو أَنَّ لَنا كَرَّةً فَنَكونَ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
102.translation_eng: Had there been another turn for us, we would be among the faithful.’
102.transliteration: fa-law ʾanna lanā karratan fa-nakūna mina l-muʾminīna

103.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
103.translation_eng: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
103.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan wa-mā kāna ʾaktharuhum muʾminīna

104.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.

105.translation_eng: The people of Noah impugned the apostles

106.content: إِذ قالَ لَهُم أَخوهُم نوحٌ أَلا تَتَّقونَ
106.translation_eng: when Noah, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not be wary [of Allah]?
106.transliteration: ʾidh qāla lahum ʾakhūhum nūḥun ʾa-lā tattaqūna

107.translation_eng: Indeed I am a trusted apostle [sent] to you.

108.translation_eng: So be wary of Allah and obey me.

109.content: وَما أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ ۖ إِن أَجرِيَ إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
109.translation_eng: I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward lies only with the Lord of all the worlds.
109.transliteration: wa-mā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi min ʾajrin ʾin ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā rabbi l-ʿālamīna

110.translation_eng: So be wary of Allah and obey me.’

111.translation_eng: They said, ‘Shall we believe in you, when it is the riffraff who follow you?’

112.content: قالَ وَما عِلمي بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
112.translation_eng: He said, ‘What do I know as to what they used to do?
112.transliteration: qāla wa-mā ʿilmī bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūna

113.content: إِن حِسابُهُم إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبّي ۖ لَو تَشعُرونَ
113.translation_eng: Their reckoning is only with my Lord, should you be aware.
113.transliteration: ʾin ḥisābuhum ʾillā ʿalā rabbī law tashʿurūna

114.translation_eng: I will not drive away the faithful.

115.translation_eng: I am just a manifest warner.’

116.content: قالوا لَئِن لَم تَنتَهِ يا نوحُ لَتَكونَنَّ مِنَ المَرجومينَ
116.translation_eng: They said, ‘Noah, if you do not relinquish, you will certainly be stoned [to death].’
116.transliteration: qālū la-ʾin lam tantahi yā-nūḥu la-takūnanna mina l-marjūmīna

117.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! Indeed my people have impugned me.

118.content: فَافتَح بَيني وَبَينَهُم فَتحًا وَنَجِّني وَمَن مَعِيَ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
118.translation_eng: So judge conclusively between me and them, and deliver me and the faithful who are with me.’
118.transliteration: fa-ftaḥ baynī wa-baynahum fatḥan wa-najjinī wa-man maʿiya mina l-muʾminīna

119.content: فَأَنجَيناهُ وَمَن مَعَهُ فِي الفُلكِ المَشحونِ
119.translation_eng: Thereupon We delivered him and those who were with him in the laden ark.
119.transliteration: fa-ʾanjaynāhu wa-man maʿahū fī l-fulki l-mashḥūni

121.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
121.translation_eng: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
121.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan wa-mā kāna ʾaktharuhum muʾminīna

122.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.

123.translation_eng: [The people of] ʿĀd impugned the apostles,

124.content: إِذ قالَ لَهُم أَخوهُم هودٌ أَلا تَتَّقونَ
124.translation_eng: when Hūd, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not be wary [of Allah]?
124.transliteration: ʾidh qāla lahum ʾakhūhum hūdun ʾa-lā tattaqūna

125.translation_eng: Indeed I am a trusted apostle [sent] to you.

126.translation_eng: So be wary of Allah and obey me.

127.content: وَما أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ ۖ إِن أَجرِيَ إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
127.translation_eng: I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward lies only with the Lord of all the worlds.
127.transliteration: wa-mā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi min ʾajrin ʾin ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā rabbi l-ʿālamīna

128.translation_eng: Do you futilely build a sign on every prominence?

129.translation_eng: You set up structures as if you will be immortal,

130.translation_eng: and when you seize [someone for punishment], you seize [him] like tyrants.

131.translation_eng: So be wary of Allah and obey me.

132.translation_eng: And be wary of Him who has provided you with what you know,

133.translation_eng: and aided you with sons and with cattle,

135.content: إِنّي أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
135.translation_eng: Indeed I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous day.’
135.transliteration: ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʿalaykum ʿadhāba yawmin ʿaẓīmin

136.content: قالوا سَواءٌ عَلَينا أَوَعَظتَ أَم لَم تَكُن مِنَ الواعِظينَ
136.translation_eng: They said, ‘It is the same to us whether you advise us or not.
136.transliteration: qālū sawāʾun ʿalaynā ʾa-waʿaẓta ʾam lam takun mina l-wāʿiẓīna

137.translation_eng: These are nothing but the traditions of the ancients,1Or, ‘This is nothing but a fabrication of the ancients,’ according to an alternate reading (khaluq, instead of khuluq).

138.translation_eng: and we will not be punished.’

139.content: فَكَذَّبوهُ فَأَهلَكناهُم ۗ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
139.translation_eng: So they impugned him, whereupon We destroyed them. There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
139.transliteration: fa-kadhdhabūhu fa-ʾahlaknāhum ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan wa-mā kāna ʾaktharuhum muʾminīna

140.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.

141.translation_eng: [The people of] Thamūd impugned the apostles

142.content: إِذ قالَ لَهُم أَخوهُم صالِحٌ أَلا تَتَّقونَ
142.translation_eng: when Ṣāliḥ, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not be wary [of Allah]?
142.transliteration: ʾidh qāla lahum ʾakhūhum ṣāliḥun ʾa-lā tattaqūna

143.translation_eng: Indeed I am a trusted apostle [sent] to you.

144.translation_eng: So be wary of Allah and obey me.

145.content: وَما أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ ۖ إِن أَجرِيَ إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
145.translation_eng: I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward lies only with the Lord of all the worlds.
145.transliteration: wa-mā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi min ʾajrin ʾin ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā rabbi l-ʿālamīna

146.translation_eng: Will you be left secure in that which is here

148.translation_eng: farms and date palms with dainty spathes?

149.translation_eng: And you hew houses out of the mountains skillfully.1Or, ‘exultantly.’

150.translation_eng: So be wary of Allah and obey me,

151.translation_eng: and do not obey the dictates of the profligate,

152.content: الَّذينَ يُفسِدونَ فِي الأَرضِ وَلا يُصلِحونَ
152.translation_eng: who cause corruption in the land and do not bring about reform.’
152.transliteration: alladhīna yufsidūna fī l-ʾarḍi wa-lā yuṣliḥūna

153.translation_eng: They said, ‘Indeed you are one of the bewitched.

154.content: ما أَنتَ إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُنا فَأتِ بِآيَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
154.translation_eng: You are just a human being like us. So bring us a sign, should you be truthful.’
154.transliteration: mā ʾanta ʾillā basharun mithlunā fa-ʾti bi-ʾāyatin ʾin kunta mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

155.content: قالَ هٰذِهِ ناقَةٌ لَها شِربٌ وَلَكُم شِربُ يَومٍ مَعلومٍ
155.translation_eng: He said, ‘This is a she-camel; she shall drink and you shall drink on known days.
155.transliteration: qāla hādhihī nāqatun lahā shirbun wa-lakum shirbu yawmin maʿlūmin

156.content: وَلا تَمَسّوها بِسوءٍ فَيَأخُذَكُم عَذابُ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
156.translation_eng: Do not cause her any harm, for then you shall be seized by the punishment of a terrible day.’
156.transliteration: wa-lā tamassūhā bi-sūʾin fa-yaʾkhudhakum ʿadhābu yawmin ʿaẓīmin

157.translation_eng: But they hamstrung her, whereupon they became regretful.

158.content: فَأَخَذَهُمُ العَذابُ ۗ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
158.translation_eng: So the punishment seized them. There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
158.transliteration: fa-ʾakhadhahumu l-ʿadhābu ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan wa-mā kāna ʾaktharuhum muʾminīna

159.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.

160.translation_eng: The people of Lot impugned the apostles

161.content: إِذ قالَ لَهُم أَخوهُم لوطٌ أَلا تَتَّقونَ
161.translation_eng: when Lot, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not be wary [of Allah]?
161.transliteration: ʾidh qāla lahum ʾakhūhum lūṭun ʾa-lā tattaqūna

162.translation_eng: Indeed I am a trusted apostle [sent] to you.

163.translation_eng: So be wary of Allah and obey me.

164.content: وَما أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ ۖ إِن أَجرِيَ إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
164.translation_eng: I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward lies only with the Lord of all the worlds.
164.transliteration: wa-mā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi min ʾajrin ʾin ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā rabbi l-ʿālamīna

165.translation_eng: What! Of all people do you come to males,

166.content: وَتَذَرونَ ما خَلَقَ لَكُم رَبُّكُم مِن أَزواجِكُم ۚ بَل أَنتُم قَومٌ عادونَ
166.translation_eng: abandoning your wives your Lord has created for you? Rather you are a transgressing lot.’
166.transliteration: wa-tadharūna mā khalaqa lakum rabbukum min ʾazwājikum bal ʾantum qawmun ʿādūna

167.content: قالوا لَئِن لَم تَنتَهِ يا لوطُ لَتَكونَنَّ مِنَ المُخرَجينَ
167.translation_eng: They said, ‘Lot, if you do not relinquish, you will surely be banished.’
167.transliteration: qālū la-ʾin lam tantahi yā-lūṭu la-takūnanna mina l-mukhrajīna

168.translation_eng: He said, ‘Indeed I detest your conduct.’

169.translation_eng: ‘My Lord! Deliver me and my family from what they do.’

170.translation_eng: So We delivered him and all his family,

171.translation_eng: except an old woman who remained behind.

173.content: وَأَمطَرنا عَلَيهِم مَطَرًا ۖ فَساءَ مَطَرُ المُنذَرينَ
173.translation_eng: and rained down upon them a rain [of stones]. Evil was the rain of those who were warned!
173.transliteration: wa-ʾamṭarnā ʿalayhim maṭaran fa-sāʾa maṭaru l-mundharīna

174.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
174.translation_eng: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
174.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan wa-mā kāna ʾaktharuhum muʾminīna

175.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.

176.translation_eng: The inhabitants of Aykah impugned the apostles,

177.content: إِذ قالَ لَهُم شُعَيبٌ أَلا تَتَّقونَ
177.translation_eng: when Shuʿayb said to them, ‘Will you not be wary [of Allah]?
177.transliteration: ʾidh qāla lahum shuʿaybun ʾa-lā tattaqūna

178.translation_eng: Indeed I am a trusted apostle [sent] to you.

179.translation_eng: So be wary of Allah and obey me.

180.content: وَما أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ ۖ إِن أَجرِيَ إِلّا عَلىٰ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
180.translation_eng: I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward lies only with the Lord of all the worlds.
180.transliteration: wa-mā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi min ʾajrin ʾin ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā rabbi l-ʿālamīna

181.content: ۞ أَوفُوا الكَيلَ وَلا تَكونوا مِنَ المُخسِرينَ
181.translation_eng: Observe fully the measure, and do not be of those who give short measure.
181.transliteration: ʾawfū l-kayla wa-lā takūnū mina l-mukhsirīna

183.content: وَلا تَبخَسُوا النّاسَ أَشياءَهُم وَلا تَعثَوا فِي الأَرضِ مُفسِدينَ
183.translation_eng: and do not cheat the people of their goods. Do not act wickedly on the earth, causing corruption.
183.transliteration: wa-lā tabkhasū n-nāsa ʾashyāʾahum wa-lā taʿthaw fī l-ʾarḍi mufsidīna

184.translation_eng: Be wary of Him who created you and the earlier generations.’

185.translation_eng: They said, ‘Indeed you are one of the bewitched.

186.content: وَما أَنتَ إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُنا وَإِن نَظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ الكاذِبينَ
186.translation_eng: You are just a human being like us, and we indeed consider you to be a liar.
186.transliteration: wa-mā ʾanta ʾillā basharun mithlunā wa-ʾin naẓunnuka la-mina l-kādhibīna

187.content: فَأَسقِط عَلَينا كِسَفًا مِنَ السَّماءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
187.translation_eng: Then make a fragment fall upon us from the sky, should you be truthful.’
187.transliteration: fa-ʾasqiṭ ʿalaynā kisafan mina s-samāʾi ʾin kunta mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

188.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord knows best what you are doing.’

189.content: فَكَذَّبوهُ فَأَخَذَهُم عَذابُ يَومِ الظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ عَذابَ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
189.translation_eng: So they impugned him, and then they were overtaken by the punishment of the day of the overshadowing cloud. It was indeed the punishment of a tremendous day.
189.transliteration: fa-kadhdhabūhu fa-ʾakhadhahum ʿadhābu yawmi ẓ-ẓullati ʾinnahū kāna ʿadhāba yawmin ʿaẓīmin

190.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَما كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُؤمِنينَ
190.translation_eng: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
190.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan wa-mā kāna ʾaktharuhum muʾminīna

191.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.

192.translation_eng: This is indeed [a Book] sent down by the Lord of all the worlds,

193.translation_eng: brought down by the Trustworthy Spirit

194.translation_eng: upon your heart (so that you may be one of the warners),

196.translation_eng: It is indeed [foretold] in the scriptures of the ancients.

197.content: أَوَلَم يَكُن لَهُم آيَةً أَن يَعلَمَهُ عُلَماءُ بَني إِسرائيلَ
197.translation_eng: Is it not a sign for them that the learned of the Children of Israel recognize it?
197.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yakun lahum ʾāyatan ʾan yaʿlamahū ʿulamāʾu banī ʾisrāʾīla

198.translation_eng: Had We sent it down upon some non-Arab

199.content: فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيهِم ما كانوا بِهِ مُؤمِنينَ
199.translation_eng: and had he recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.
199.transliteration: fa-qaraʾahū ʿalayhim mā kānū bihī muʾminīna

200.translation_eng: This is how We let it pass through the hearts of the guilty:

201.content: لا يُؤمِنونَ بِهِ حَتّىٰ يَرَوُا العَذابَ الأَليمَ
201.translation_eng: they do not believe in it until they sight the painful punishment.
201.transliteration: lā yuʾminūna bihī ḥattā yarawu l-ʿadhāba l-ʾalīma

202.translation_eng: It will overtake them suddenly while they are unaware.

203.translation_eng: Thereupon they will say, ‘Shall we be granted any respite?’

204.translation_eng: So do they seek to hasten on Our punishment?

205.translation_eng: Do you see, should We let them enjoy for some years,

206.translation_eng: then there comes to them what they have been promised,

207.content: ما أَغنىٰ عَنهُم ما كانوا يُمَتَّعونَ
207.translation_eng: of what avail to them will be that which they were given to enjoy?
207.transliteration: mā ʾaghnā ʿanhum mā kānū yumattaʿūna

208.content: وَما أَهلَكنا مِن قَريَةٍ إِلّا لَها مُنذِرونَ
208.translation_eng: We have not destroyed any town without its having warners,
208.transliteration: wa-mā ʾahlaknā min qaryatin ʾillā lahā mundhirūna

209.translation_eng: for the sake of admonition, and We were not unjust.

210.translation_eng: It1 has not been brought down by the devils.That is, the Qurʾān.

211.translation_eng: Neither does it behoove them, nor are they capable [of doing that].

212.translation_eng: Indeed they are kept at bay [even] from hearing it.

213.content: فَلا تَدعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلٰهًا آخَرَ فَتَكونَ مِنَ المُعَذَّبينَ
213.translation_eng: So do not invoke any god besides Allah, lest you should be among the punished.
213.transliteration: fa-lā tadʿu maʿa llāhi ʾilāhan ʾākhara fa-takūna mina l-muʿadhdhabīna

214.translation_eng: Warn the nearest of your kinsfolk,

215.content: وَاخفِض جَناحَكَ لِمَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
215.translation_eng: and lower your wing to the faithful who follow you.
215.transliteration: wa-khfiḍ janāḥaka li-mani ttabaʿaka mina l-muʾminīna

216.content: فَإِن عَصَوكَ فَقُل إِنّي بَريءٌ مِمّا تَعمَلونَ
216.translation_eng: But if they disobey you, say, ‘I am absolved of what you do.’
216.transliteration: fa-ʾin ʿaṣawka fa-qul ʾinnī barīʾun mimmā taʿmalūna

217.translation_eng: And put your trust in the All-mighty, the All-merciful,

218.translation_eng: who sees you when you stand [for prayer],

219.translation_eng: and your going about among those who prostrate.

220.translation_eng: Indeed He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.

221.content: هَل أُنَبِّئُكُم عَلىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ الشَّياطينُ
221.translation_eng: Should I inform you on whom the devils descend?
221.transliteration: hal ʾunabbiʾukum ʿalā man tanazzalu sh-shayāṭīnu

222.translation_eng: They descend on every sinful liar.

223.translation_eng: They eavesdrop, and most of them are liars.

224.translation_eng: As for the poets, [only] the perverse follow them.

225.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّهُم في كُلِّ وادٍ يَهيمونَ
225.translation_eng: Have you not regarded that they rove in every valley,
225.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾannahum fī kulli wādin yahīmūna

226.translation_eng: and that they say what they do not do?

227.content: إِلَّا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ وَذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ كَثيرًا وَانتَصَروا مِن بَعدِ ما ظُلِموا ۗ وَسَيَعلَمُ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبونَ
227.translation_eng: Barring those who have faith and do righteous deeds and remember Allah greatly, and aid each other after they have been wronged. And the wrongdoers will soon know at what goal they will end up.
227.transliteration: ʾillā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa-dhakarū llāha kathīran wa-ntaṣarū min baʿdi mā ẓulimū wa-sa-yaʿlamu lladhīna ẓalamū ʾayya munqalabin yanqalibūna

27.description: The surah that speaks of the Valley of The Ants, through which the hosts of the prophet Solomon were once marching, wherein God miraculously enabled Solomon to hear one of them as she warned the other to flee into their homes before being crushed—a miracle of audition and understanding for which Solomon thanked God profusely. It takes its name from the story of Solomon and the ant (naml), mentioned in verse 18 . The surah both opens and closes by describing the Quran as joyful news for the believers and a warning for others. It gives stories of past prophets and the destruction of the communities that disbelieved in them. Illustrations are given of the nature of God’s power, contrasted with the total lack of power of the “partners” they worship beside Him, and descriptions are given of the Day of Judgement for those who deny it.

1.content: طس ۚ تِلكَ آياتُ القُرآنِ وَكِتابٍ مُبينٍ
1.translation_eng: Ṭā, Sīn. These are the signs of the Qurʾān and a manifest Book,
1.transliteration: ṭ-s (ṭā sīn) tilka ʾāyātu l-qurʾāni wa-kitābin mubīnin

2.translation_eng: a guidance and good news for the faithful

3.content: الَّذينَ يُقيمونَ الصَّلاةَ وَيُؤتونَ الزَّكاةَ وَهُم بِالآخِرَةِ هُم يوقِنونَ
3.translation_eng: —those who maintain the prayer and pay the zakāt, and who are certain of the Hereafter.
3.transliteration: alladhīna yuqīmūna ṣ-ṣalāta wa-yuʾtūna z-zakāta wa-hum bi-l-ʾākhirati hum yūqinūna

4.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالآخِرَةِ زَيَّنّا لَهُم أَعمالَهُم فَهُم يَعمَهونَ
4.translation_eng: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds seem decorous to them, and so they are bewildered.
4.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-l-ʾākhirati zayyannā lahum ʾaʿmālahum fa-hum yaʿmahūna

5.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ لَهُم سوءُ العَذابِ وَهُم فِي الآخِرَةِ هُمُ الأَخسَرونَ
5.translation_eng: They are the ones for whom there is a terrible punishment, and they are the ones who will be the biggest losers in the Hereafter.
5.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna lahum sūʾu l-ʿadhābi wa-hum fī l-ʾākhirati humu l-ʾakhsarūna

6.content: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى القُرآنَ مِن لَدُن حَكيمٍ عَليمٍ
6.translation_eng: Indeed you receive the Qurʾān from One who is all-wise, all-knowing.
6.transliteration: wa-ʾinnaka la-tulaqqā l-qurʾāna min ladun ḥakīmin ʿalīmin

7.content: إِذ قالَ موسىٰ لِأَهلِهِ إِنّي آنَستُ نارًا سَآتيكُم مِنها بِخَبَرٍ أَو آتيكُم بِشِهابٍ قَبَسٍ لَعَلَّكُم تَصطَلونَ
7.translation_eng: When Moses said to his family, ‘Indeed I descry a fire! I will bring you some news from it, or bring you a firebrand so that you may warm yourselves.’
7.transliteration: ʾidh qāla mūsā li-ʾahlihī ʾinnī ʾānastu nāran sa-ʾātīkum minhā bi-khabarin ʾaw ʾātīkum bi-shihābin qabasin laʿallakum taṣṭalūna

8.content: فَلَمّا جاءَها نودِيَ أَن بورِكَ مَن فِي النّارِ وَمَن حَولَها وَسُبحانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
8.translation_eng: So when he came to it, he was called: ‘Blessed is He who is in the fire and who is [as well] around it, and immaculate is Allah, the Lord of all the worlds!’
8.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾahā nūdiya ʾan būrika man fī n-nāri wa-man ḥawlahā wa-subḥāna llāhi rabbi l-ʿālamīna

9.content: يا موسىٰ إِنَّهُ أَنَا اللَّهُ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
9.translation_eng: ‘O Moses! Indeed I am Allah, the All-mighty, the All-wise.’
9.transliteration: yā-mūsā ʾinnahū ʾana llāhu l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

10.content: وَأَلقِ عَصاكَ ۚ فَلَمّا رَآها تَهتَزُّ كَأَنَّها جانٌّ وَلّىٰ مُدبِرًا وَلَم يُعَقِّب ۚ يا موسىٰ لا تَخَف إِنّي لا يَخافُ لَدَيَّ المُرسَلونَ
10.translation_eng: ‘Throw down your staff!’ And when he saw it wriggling, as if it were a snake, he turned his back [to flee], without looking back. ‘O Moses! ‘Do not be afraid. Indeed the apostles are not afraid before Me,
10.transliteration: wa-ʾalqi ʿaṣāka fa-lammā raʾāhā tahtazzu ka-ʾannahā jānnun wallā mudbiran wa-lam yuʿaqqib yā-mūsā lā takhaf ʾinnī lā yakhāfu ladayya l-mursalūna

11.content: إِلّا مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسنًا بَعدَ سوءٍ فَإِنّي غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
11.translation_eng: barring someone who does wrong and then makes up with goodness for [his] fault, for indeed I am all-forgiving, all-merciful.’
11.transliteration: ʾillā man ẓalama thumma baddala ḥusnan baʿda sūʾin fa-ʾinnī ghafūrun raḥīmun

12.content: وَأَدخِل يَدَكَ في جَيبِكَ تَخرُج بَيضاءَ مِن غَيرِ سوءٍ ۖ في تِسعِ آياتٍ إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَقَومِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُم كانوا قَومًا فاسِقينَ
12.translation_eng: ‘Insert your hand into your bosom. It will emerge white, without any fault, —among nine signs for Pharaoh and his people. Indeed they are a transgressing lot.’
12.transliteration: wa-ʾadkhil yadaka fī jaybika takhruj bayḍāʾa min ghayri sūʾin fī tisʿi ʾāyātin ʾilā firʿawna wa-qawmihī ʾinnahum kānū qawman fāsiqīna

13.content: فَلَمّا جاءَتهُم آياتُنا مُبصِرَةً قالوا هٰذا سِحرٌ مُبينٌ
13.translation_eng: But when Our signs came to them, as eye-openers, they said, ‘This is plain magic.’
13.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾathum ʾāyātunā mubṣiratan qālū hādhā siḥrun mubīnun

14.content: وَجَحَدوا بِها وَاستَيقَنَتها أَنفُسُهُم ظُلمًا وَعُلُوًّا ۚ فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ المُفسِدينَ
14.translation_eng: They impugned them —though they were convinced in their hearts— wrongfully and defiantly. So observe how was the fate of the agents of corruption!
14.transliteration: wa-jaḥadū bihā wa-stayqanathā ʾanfusuhum ẓulman wa-ʿuluwwan fa-nẓur kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu l-mufsidīna

15.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا داوودَ وَسُلَيمانَ عِلمًا ۖ وَقالَا الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذي فَضَّلَنا عَلىٰ كَثيرٍ مِن عِبادِهِ المُؤمِنينَ
15.translation_eng: Certainly We gave David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, ‘All praise belongs to Allah, who granted us an advantage over many of His faithful servants.’
15.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā dāwūda wa-sulaymāna ʿilman wa-qālā l-ḥamdu li-llāhi lladhī faḍḍalanā ʿalā kathīrin min ʿibādihi l-muʾminīna

16.content: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيمانُ داوودَ ۖ وَقالَ يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ عُلِّمنا مَنطِقَ الطَّيرِ وَأوتينا مِن كُلِّ شَيءٍ ۖ إِنَّ هٰذا لَهُوَ الفَضلُ المُبينُ
16.translation_eng: Solomon inherited from David, and he said, ‘O people! We have been taught the speech of the birds, and we have been given out of everything. Indeed this is a manifest advantage.’
16.transliteration: wa-waritha sulaymānu dāwūda wa-qāla yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ʿullimnāmanṭiqa ṭ-ṭayri wa-ʾūtīnā min kulli shayʾin ʾinna hādhā la-huwa l-faḍlu l-mubīnu

17.content: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيمانَ جُنودُهُ مِنَ الجِنِّ وَالإِنسِ وَالطَّيرِ فَهُم يوزَعونَ
17.translation_eng: [Once] Solomon’s hosts were marched out for him, comprising jinn, humans, and birds, and they were held in check.
17.transliteration: wa-ḥushira li-sulaymāna junūduhū mina l-jinni wa-l-ʾinsi wa-ṭ-ṭayri fa-hum yūzaʿūna

18.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا أَتَوا عَلىٰ وادِ النَّملِ قالَت نَملَةٌ يا أَيُّهَا النَّملُ ادخُلوا مَساكِنَكُم لا يَحطِمَنَّكُم سُلَيمانُ وَجُنودُهُ وَهُم لا يَشعُرونَ
18.translation_eng: When they came to the Valley of Ants, an ant said, ‘O ants! Enter your dwellings, lest Solomon and his hosts should trample on you while they are unaware.’
18.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā ʾataw ʿalā wādi n-namli qālat namlatun yā-ʾayyuhā n-namlu dkhulū masākinakum lā yaḥṭimannakum sulaymānu wa-junūduhū wa-hum lā yashʿurūna

19.content: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضاحِكًا مِن قَولِها وَقالَ رَبِّ أَوزِعني أَن أَشكُرَ نِعمَتَكَ الَّتي أَنعَمتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلىٰ والِدَيَّ وَأَن أَعمَلَ صالِحًا تَرضاهُ وَأَدخِلني بِرَحمَتِكَ في عِبادِكَ الصّالِحينَ
19.translation_eng: Whereat he smiled, amused at its words, and he said, ‘My Lord! Inspire me to give thanks for Your blessing with which You have blessed me and my parents, and that I may do righteous deeds which may please You, and admit me, by Your mercy, among Your righteous servants.’
19.transliteration: fa-tabassama ḍāḥikan min qawlihā wa-qāla rabbi ʾawziʿnī ʾan ʾashkura niʿmataka llatī ʾanʿamta ʿalayya wa-ʿalā wālidayya wa-ʾan ʾaʿmala ṣāliḥan tarḍāhu wa-ʾadkhilnī bi-raḥmatika fī ʿibādika ṣ-ṣāliḥīna

20.content: وَتَفَقَّدَ الطَّيرَ فَقالَ ما لِيَ لا أَرَى الهُدهُدَ أَم كانَ مِنَ الغائِبينَ
20.translation_eng: [One day] he reviewed the birds, and said, ‘Why do I not see the hoopoe? Or is he absent?’
20.transliteration: wa-tafaqqada ṭ-ṭayra fa-qāla mā liya lā ʾarā l-hudhuda ʾam kāna mina l-ghāʾibīna

21.content: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُ عَذابًا شَديدًا أَو لَأَذبَحَنَّهُ أَو لَيَأتِيَنّي بِسُلطانٍ مُبينٍ
21.translation_eng: ‘I will surely punish him with a severe punishment, or I will surely behead him, unless he brings a clear-cut excuse.’
21.transliteration: la-ʾuʿadhdhibannahū ʿadhāban shadīdan ʾaw la-ʾadhbaḥannahū ʾaw la-yaʾtiyannī bi-sulṭānin mubīnin

22.content: فَمَكَثَ غَيرَ بَعيدٍ فَقالَ أَحَطتُ بِما لَم تُحِط بِهِ وَجِئتُكَ مِن سَبَإٍ بِنَبَإٍ يَقينٍ
22.translation_eng: He did not stay for long [before he turned up] and said, ‘I have alighted on something which you have not alighted on, and I have brought you from Sheba a definite report.
22.transliteration: fa-makatha ghayra baʿīdin fa-qāla ʾaḥaṭtu bi-mā lam tuḥiṭ bihī wa-jiʾtuka min sabaʾin bi-nabaʾin yaqīnin

23.content: إِنّي وَجَدتُ امرَأَةً تَملِكُهُم وَأوتِيَت مِن كُلِّ شَيءٍ وَلَها عَرشٌ عَظيمٌ
23.translation_eng: I found a woman ruling over them, and she has been given everything, and she has a great throne.
23.transliteration: ʾinnī wajadtu mraʾatan tamlikuhum wa-ʾūtiyat min kulli shayʾin wa-lahā ʿarshun ʿaẓīmun

24.content: وَجَدتُها وَقَومَها يَسجُدونَ لِلشَّمسِ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيطانُ أَعمالَهُم فَصَدَّهُم عَنِ السَّبيلِ فَهُم لا يَهتَدونَ
24.translation_eng: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah, and Satan has made their deeds seem decorous to them —thus he has barred them from the way [of Allah], so they are not guided—
24.transliteration: wajadtuhā wa-qawmahā yasjudūna li-sh-shamsi min dūni llāhi wa-zayyana lahumu sh-shayṭānu ʾaʿmālahum fa-ṣaddahum ʿani s-sabīli fa-hum lā yahtadūna

25.content: أَلّا يَسجُدوا لِلَّهِ الَّذي يُخرِجُ الخَبءَ فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَيَعلَمُ ما تُخفونَ وَما تُعلِنونَ
25.translation_eng: so that they do not prostrate themselves to Allah, who brings out the hidden in the heavens and the earth, and He knows whatever you hide and whatever you disclose.
25.transliteration: ʾallā yasjudū li-llāhi lladhī yukhriju l-khabʾa fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-yaʿlamu mā tukhfūna wa-mā tuʿlinūna

26.content: اللَّهُ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ رَبُّ العَرشِ العَظيمِ ۩
26.translation_eng: Allah—there is no god except Him— is the Lord of the Great Throne.’
26.transliteration: allāhu lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa rabbu l-ʿarshi l-ʿaẓīmi

27.content: ۞ قالَ سَنَنظُرُ أَصَدَقتَ أَم كُنتَ مِنَ الكاذِبينَ
27.translation_eng: He said, ‘We shall see whether you are truthful, or if you are one of the liars.’
27.transliteration: qāla sa-nanẓuru ʾa-ṣadaqta ʾam kunta mina l-kādhibīna

28.content: اذهَب بِكِتابي هٰذا فَأَلقِه إِلَيهِم ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنهُم فَانظُر ماذا يَرجِعونَ
28.translation_eng: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them. Then draw away from them and observe what [response] they return.’
28.transliteration: idhhab bi-kitābī hādhā fa-ʾalqih ʾilayhim thumma tawalla ʿanhum fa-nẓur mādhā yarjiʿūna

29.content: قالَت يا أَيُّهَا المَلَأُ إِنّي أُلقِيَ إِلَيَّ كِتابٌ كَريمٌ
29.translation_eng: She said, ‘O [members of the] elite! Indeed a noble letter has been delivered to me.
29.transliteration: qālat yā-ʾayyuhā l-malaʾu ʾinnī ʾulqiya ʾilayya kitābun karīmun

30.content: إِنَّهُ مِن سُلَيمانَ وَإِنَّهُ بِسمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحمٰنِ الرَّحيمِ
30.translation_eng: It is from Solomon, and it begins in the name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.
30.transliteration: ʾinnahū min sulaymāna wa-ʾinnahū bi-smi llāhi r-raḥmāni r-raḥīmi

31.content: أَلّا تَعلوا عَلَيَّ وَأتوني مُسلِمينَ
31.translation_eng: [It states,] “Do not defy me, and come to me in submission.” ’
31.transliteration: ʾallā taʿlū ʿalayya wa-ʾtūnī muslimīna

32.content: قالَت يا أَيُّهَا المَلَأُ أَفتوني في أَمري ما كُنتُ قاطِعَةً أَمرًا حَتّىٰ تَشهَدونِ
32.translation_eng: She said, ‘O [members of the] elite! Give me your opinion concerning my matter. I do not decide any matter until you are present.’
32.transliteration: qālat yā-ʾayyuhā l-malaʾu ʾaftūnī fī ʾamrī mā kuntu qāṭiʿatan ʾamran ḥattā tashhadūni

33.content: قالوا نَحنُ أُولو قُوَّةٍ وَأُولو بَأسٍ شَديدٍ وَالأَمرُ إِلَيكِ فَانظُري ماذا تَأمُرينَ
33.translation_eng: They said, ‘We are powerful and possess a great might. But it is up to you to command. So see what you will command.’
33.transliteration: qālū naḥnu ʾulū quwwatin wa-ʾulū baʾsin shadīdin wa-l-ʾamru ʾilayki fa-nẓurī mādhā taʾmurīna

34.content: قالَت إِنَّ المُلوكَ إِذا دَخَلوا قَريَةً أَفسَدوها وَجَعَلوا أَعِزَّةَ أَهلِها أَذِلَّةً ۖ وَكَذٰلِكَ يَفعَلونَ
34.translation_eng: She said, ‘Indeed when kings enter a town, they devastate it, and reduce the mightiest of its people to the most abased. That is how they act.
34.transliteration: qālat ʾinna l-mulūka ʾidhā dakhalū qaryatan ʾafsadūhā wa-jaʿalū ʾaʿizzata ʾahlihā ʾadhillatan wa-ka-dhālika yafʿalūna

35.content: وَإِنّي مُرسِلَةٌ إِلَيهِم بِهَدِيَّةٍ فَناظِرَةٌ بِمَ يَرجِعُ المُرسَلونَ
35.translation_eng: I will send them a gift, and I shall see what the envoys bring back.’
35.transliteration: wa-ʾinnī mursilatun ʾilayhim bi-hadiyyatin fa-nāẓiratun bi-ma yarjiʿu l-mursalūna

36.content: فَلَمّا جاءَ سُلَيمانَ قالَ أَتُمِدّونَنِ بِمالٍ فَما آتانِيَ اللَّهُ خَيرٌ مِمّا آتاكُم بَل أَنتُم بِهَدِيَّتِكُم تَفرَحونَ
36.translation_eng: So when he1 came to Solomon, he said, ‘Are you aiding me with wealth? What Allah has given me is better than what He has given you. Rather you are exultant over your gift!That is, the envoy.
36.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾa sulaymāna qāla ʾa-tumiddūnani bi-mālin fa-mā ʾātāniya llāhu khayrun mimmā ʾātākum bal ʾantum bi-hadiyyatikum tafraḥūna

37.content: ارجِع إِلَيهِم فَلَنَأتِيَنَّهُم بِجُنودٍ لا قِبَلَ لَهُم بِها وَلَنُخرِجَنَّهُم مِنها أَذِلَّةً وَهُم صاغِرونَ
37.translation_eng: Go back to them, for we will come at them with hosts which they cannot face, and we will expel them from it, abased, and they shall be degraded.’
37.transliteration: irjiʿ ʾilayhim fa-la-naʾtiyannahum bi-junūdin lā qibala lahum bihā wa-la-nukhrijannahum minhā ʾadhillatan wa-hum ṣāghirūna

38.content: قالَ يا أَيُّهَا المَلَأُ أَيُّكُم يَأتيني بِعَرشِها قَبلَ أَن يَأتوني مُسلِمينَ
38.translation_eng: He said, ‘O [members of the] elite! Which of you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?’
38.transliteration: qāla yā-ʾayyuhā l-malaʾu ʾayyukum yaʾtīnī bi-ʿarshihā qabla ʾan yaʾtūnī muslimīna

39.content: قالَ عِفريتٌ مِنَ الجِنِّ أَنا آتيكَ بِهِ قَبلَ أَن تَقومَ مِن مَقامِكَ ۖ وَإِنّي عَلَيهِ لَقَوِيٌّ أَمينٌ
39.translation_eng: An afreet1 from among the jinn said, ‘I will bring it to you before you rise from your place. Indeed I have the power for it and am trustworthy.’Ifrīt (noun): devil, demon, giant, rebel; (adj.) cunning, sly, wily, smart, mischievous, rebellious, defiant.
39.transliteration: qāla ʿifrītun mina l-jinni ʾana ʾātīka bihī qabla ʾan taqūma min maqāmika wa-ʾinnī ʿalayhi la-qawiyyun ʾamīnun

40.content: قالَ الَّذي عِندَهُ عِلمٌ مِنَ الكِتابِ أَنا آتيكَ بِهِ قَبلَ أَن يَرتَدَّ إِلَيكَ طَرفُكَ ۚ فَلَمّا رَآهُ مُستَقِرًّا عِندَهُ قالَ هٰذا مِن فَضلِ رَبّي لِيَبلُوَني أَأَشكُرُ أَم أَكفُرُ ۖ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّما يَشكُرُ لِنَفسِهِ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبّي غَنِيٌّ كَريمٌ
40.translation_eng: The one who had knowledge of the Book1 said, ‘I will bring it to you in the twinkling of an eye.’ So when he saw it set near him, he said, ‘This is by the grace of my Lord, to test me if I will give thanks or be ungrateful. And whoever gives thanks, gives thanks only for his own sake. And whoever is ungrateful [should know that] my Lord is indeed all-sufficient, all-generous.’He is said to have been Solomon’s vizier and successor, Āṣif ibn Barkhiyā.
40.transliteration: qāla lladhī ʿindahū ʿilmun mina l-kitābi ʾana ʾātīka bihī qabla ʾan yartadda ʾilayka ṭarfuka fa-lammā raʾāhu mustaqirran ʿindahū qāla hādhā min faḍli rabbī li-yabluwanī ʾa-ʾashkuru ʾam ʾakfuru wa-man shakara fa-ʾinnamā yashkuru li-nafsihī wa-man kafara fa-ʾinna rabbī ghaniyyun karīmun

41.content: قالَ نَكِّروا لَها عَرشَها نَنظُر أَتَهتَدي أَم تَكونُ مِنَ الَّذينَ لا يَهتَدونَ
41.translation_eng: He said, ‘Disguise her throne for her, so that we may see whether she is discerning or if she is one of the undiscerning ones.’
41.transliteration: qāla nakkirū lahā ʿarshahā nanẓur ʾa-tahtadī ʾam takūnu mina lladhīna lā yahtadūna

42.content: فَلَمّا جاءَت قيلَ أَهٰكَذا عَرشُكِ ۖ قالَت كَأَنَّهُ هُوَ ۚ وَأوتينَا العِلمَ مِن قَبلِها وَكُنّا مُسلِمينَ
42.translation_eng: So when she came, it was said [to her], ‘Is your throne like this one?’ She said, ‘It seems to be the same, and we were informed before it,1 and we had submitted.’That is, ‘we had knowledge of Solomon’s extraordinary authority even before we saw such feats and we had submitted to him.’
42.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾat qīla ʾa-hākadhā ʿarshuki qālat ka-ʾannahū huwa wa-ʾūtīnā l-ʿilma min qablihā wa-kunnā muslimīna

43.content: وَصَدَّها ما كانَت تَعبُدُ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّها كانَت مِن قَومٍ كافِرينَ
43.translation_eng: She had been barred [from the way of Allah] by what she used to worship besides Allah, for she belonged to a faithless people.
43.transliteration: wa-ṣaddahā mā kānat taʿbudu min dūni llāhi ʾinnahā kānat min qawmin kāfirīna

44.content: قيلَ لَهَا ادخُلِي الصَّرحَ ۖ فَلَمّا رَأَتهُ حَسِبَتهُ لُجَّةً وَكَشَفَت عَن ساقَيها ۚ قالَ إِنَّهُ صَرحٌ مُمَرَّدٌ مِن قَواريرَ ۗ قالَت رَبِّ إِنّي ظَلَمتُ نَفسي وَأَسلَمتُ مَعَ سُلَيمانَ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
44.translation_eng: It was said to her, ‘Enter the palace.’ So when she saw it, she supposed it to be a pool of water, and she bared her shanks. He said, ‘It is a palace paved with crystal.’ She said, ‘My Lord! Indeed I have wronged myself, and I submit with Solomon to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.’
44.transliteration: qīla lahā dkhulī ṣ-ṣarḥa fa-lammā raʾathu ḥasibathu lujjatan wa-kashafat ʿan sāqayhā qāla ʾinnahū ṣarḥun mumarradun min qawārīra qālat rabbi ʾinnī ẓalamtu nafsī wa-ʾaslamtu maʿa sulaymāna li-llāhi rabbi l-ʿālamīna

45.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا إِلىٰ ثَمودَ أَخاهُم صالِحًا أَنِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ فَإِذا هُم فَريقانِ يَختَصِمونَ
45.translation_eng: Certainly We sent to Thamūd Ṣāliḥ, their brother, [with the summons:] ‘Worship Allah!’ But thereat they became two groups contending with each other.
45.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā ʾilā thamūda ʾakhāhum ṣāliḥan ʾani ʿbudū llāha fa-ʾidhā hum farīqāni yakhtaṣimūna

46.content: قالَ يا قَومِ لِمَ تَستَعجِلونَ بِالسَّيِّئَةِ قَبلَ الحَسَنَةِ ۖ لَولا تَستَغفِرونَ اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُم تُرحَمونَ
46.translation_eng: He said, ‘O My people! Why do you press for evil sooner than for good? Why do you not plead to Allah for forgiveness so that you may receive His mercy?’
46.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi li-ma tastaʿjilūna bi-s-sayyiʾati qabla l-ḥasanati law-lā tastaghfirūna llāha laʿallakum turḥamūna

47.content: قالُوا اطَّيَّرنا بِكَ وَبِمَن مَعَكَ ۚ قالَ طائِرُكُم عِندَ اللَّهِ ۖ بَل أَنتُم قَومٌ تُفتَنونَ
47.translation_eng: They said, ‘We take for a bad omen you and those who are with you.’ He said, ‘Your bad omens are with Allah. Rather you are a people being tested.’
47.transliteration: qālū ṭṭayyarnā bika wa-bi-man maʿaka qāla ṭāʾirukum ʿinda llāhi bal ʾantum qawmun tuftanūna

48.content: وَكانَ فِي المَدينَةِ تِسعَةُ رَهطٍ يُفسِدونَ فِي الأَرضِ وَلا يُصلِحونَ
48.translation_eng: There were nine persons1 in the city who caused corruption in the land, and did not bring about any reform.Or ‘nine families’ (or gangs).
48.transliteration: wa-kāna fī l-madīnati tisʿatu rahṭin yufsidūna fī l-ʾarḍi wa-lā yuṣliḥūna

49.content: قالوا تَقاسَموا بِاللَّهِ لَنُبَيِّتَنَّهُ وَأَهلَهُ ثُمَّ لَنَقولَنَّ لِوَلِيِّهِ ما شَهِدنا مَهلِكَ أَهلِهِ وَإِنّا لَصادِقونَ
49.translation_eng: They said, ‘[Let us] swear together by Allah that we will attack him and his family by night. Then we will surely tell his heir that we were not present at the murder of his family and we indeed speak the truth.’
49.transliteration: qālū taqāsamū bi-llāhi la-nubayyitannahū wa-ʾahlahū thumma la-naqūlanna li-waliyyihī mā shahidnā mahlika ʾahlihī wa-ʾinnā la-ṣādiqūna

50.content: وَمَكَروا مَكرًا وَمَكَرنا مَكرًا وَهُم لا يَشعُرونَ
50.translation_eng: They devised a plot, and We [too] devised a plan, but they were not aware.
50.transliteration: wa-makarū makran wa-makarnā makran wa-hum lā yashʿurūna

51.content: فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ مَكرِهِم أَنّا دَمَّرناهُم وَقَومَهُم أَجمَعينَ
51.translation_eng: So observe how was the outcome of their plotting, as We destroyed them and all their people.
51.transliteration: fa-nẓur kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu makrihim ʾannā dammarnāhum wa-qawmahum ʾajmaʿīna

52.content: فَتِلكَ بُيوتُهُم خاوِيَةً بِما ظَلَموا ۗ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِقَومٍ يَعلَمونَ
52.translation_eng: So there lay their houses, fallen in ruin, because of their wrongdoing. There is indeed a sign in that for a people who have knowledge.
52.transliteration: fa-tilka buyūtuhum khāwiyatan bi-mā ẓalamū ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan li-qawmin yaʿlamūna

53.content: وَأَنجَينَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَكانوا يَتَّقونَ
53.translation_eng: And We delivered those who had faith and were Godwary.
53.transliteration: wa-ʾanjaynā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-kānū yattaqūna

54.content: وَلوطًا إِذ قالَ لِقَومِهِ أَتَأتونَ الفاحِشَةَ وَأَنتُم تُبصِرونَ
54.translation_eng: And Lot, when he said to his people, ‘What! Do you commit this indecency while you see [with your own eyes]?
54.transliteration: wa-lūṭan ʾidh qāla li-qawmihī ʾa-taʾtūna l-fāḥishata wa-ʾantum tubṣirūna

55.content: أَئِنَّكُم لَتَأتونَ الرِّجالَ شَهوَةً مِن دونِ النِّساءِ ۚ بَل أَنتُم قَومٌ تَجهَلونَ
55.translation_eng: Do you approach men with [sexual] desire instead of women?! Rather you are a senseless lot!’
55.transliteration: ʾa-ʾinnakum la-taʾtūna r-rijāla shahwatan min dūni n-nisāʾi bal ʾantum qawmun tajhalūna

56.content: ۞ فَما كانَ جَوابَ قَومِهِ إِلّا أَن قالوا أَخرِجوا آلَ لوطٍ مِن قَريَتِكُم ۖ إِنَّهُم أُناسٌ يَتَطَهَّرونَ
56.translation_eng: But the only answer of his people was that they said, ‘Expel Lot’s family from your town! They are indeed a puritanical lot.’
56.transliteration: fa-mā kāna jawāba qawmihī ʾillā ʾan qālū ʾakhrijū ʾāla lūṭin min qaryatikum ʾinnahum ʾunāsun yataṭahharūna

57.content: فَأَنجَيناهُ وَأَهلَهُ إِلَّا امرَأَتَهُ قَدَّرناها مِنَ الغابِرينَ
57.translation_eng: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife. We ordained her to be among those who remained behind.
57.transliteration: fa-ʾanjaynāhu wa-ʾahlahū ʾillā mraʾatahū qaddarnāhā mina l-ghābirīna

58.content: وَأَمطَرنا عَلَيهِم مَطَرًا ۖ فَساءَ مَطَرُ المُنذَرينَ
58.translation_eng: Then We poured down upon them a rain [of stones]. So evil was the rain of those who were warned!
58.transliteration: wa-ʾamṭarnā ʿalayhim maṭaran fa-sāʾa maṭaru l-mundharīna

59.content: قُلِ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ وَسَلامٌ عَلىٰ عِبادِهِ الَّذينَ اصطَفىٰ ۗ آللَّهُ خَيرٌ أَمّا يُشرِكونَ
59.translation_eng: Say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah, and Peace be to His servants whom He has chosen.’ Is Allah better, or the partners they ascribe [to Him]?
59.transliteration: quli l-ḥamdu li-llāhi wa-salāmun ʿalā ʿibādihi lladhīna ṣṭafā ʾāllāhu khayrun ʾammā yushrikūna

60.content: أَمَّن خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَنبَتنا بِهِ حَدائِقَ ذاتَ بَهجَةٍ ما كانَ لَكُم أَن تُنبِتوا شَجَرَها ۗ أَإِلٰهٌ مَعَ اللَّهِ ۚ بَل هُم قَومٌ يَعدِلونَ
60.translation_eng: Is He who created the heavens and the earth, and sends down for you water from the sky, whereby We grow delightful gardens, whose trees you could never cause to grow… ?1 What! Is there a god besides Allah? Rather they are a lot who equate [others with Allah].Ellipsis. The omitted phrase here and in the following verses (61-64) is ‘better or the partners they ascribe to Him.’
60.transliteration: ʾam-man khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-ʾanzala lakum mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-ʾanbatnā bihī ḥadāʾiqa dhāta bahjatin mā kāna lakum ʾan tunbitū shajarahā ʾa-ʾilāhun maʿa llāhi bal hum qawmun yaʿdilūna

61.content: أَمَّن جَعَلَ الأَرضَ قَرارًا وَجَعَلَ خِلالَها أَنهارًا وَجَعَلَ لَها رَواسِيَ وَجَعَلَ بَينَ البَحرَينِ حاجِزًا ۗ أَإِلٰهٌ مَعَ اللَّهِ ۚ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
61.translation_eng: Is He who made the earth an abode [for you], and made rivers [flowing] through it, and set firm mountains for it, and set a barrier between the two seas… ? What! Is there a god besides Allah? Rather most of them do not know.
61.transliteration: ʾam-man jaʿala l-ʾarḍa qarāran wa-jaʿala khilālahā ʾanhāran wa-jaʿala lahā rawāsiya wa-jaʿala bayna l-baḥrayni ḥājizan ʾa-ʾilāhun maʿa llāhi bal ʾaktharuhum lā yaʿlamūna

62.content: أَمَّن يُجيبُ المُضطَرَّ إِذا دَعاهُ وَيَكشِفُ السّوءَ وَيَجعَلُكُم خُلَفاءَ الأَرضِ ۗ أَإِلٰهٌ مَعَ اللَّهِ ۚ قَليلًا ما تَذَكَّرونَ
62.translation_eng: Is He who answers the call of the distressed [person] when he invokes Him and removes his distress, and makes you the earth’s successors… ? What! Is there a god besides Allah? Little is the admonition that you take.
62.transliteration: ʾam-man yujību l-muḍṭarra ʾidhā daʿāhu wa-yakshifu s-sūʾa wa-yajʿalukum khulafāʾa l-ʾarḍi ʾa-ʾilāhun maʿa llāhi qalīlan mā tadhakkarūna
