55.translation_eng: on the day when the punishment envelopes them, from above them and from under their feet, and He will say, ‘Taste what you used to do!’
55.transliteration: yawma yaghshāhumu l-ʿadhābu min fawqihim wa-min taḥti ʾarjulihim wa-yaqūlu dhūqū mā kuntum taʿmalūna

56.content: يا عِبادِيَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِنَّ أَرضي واسِعَةٌ فَإِيّايَ فَاعبُدونِ
56.translation_eng: O My servants who have faith! My earth is indeed vast. So worship [only] Me.
56.transliteration: yā-ʿibādiya lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾinna ʾarḍī wāsiʿatun fa-ʾiyyāya fa-ʿbudūni

57.content: كُلُّ نَفسٍ ذائِقَةُ المَوتِ ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَينا تُرجَعونَ
57.translation_eng: Every soul shall taste death. Then you shall be brought back to Us.
57.transliteration: kullu nafsin dhāʾiqatu l-mawti thumma ʾilaynā turjaʿūna

58.content: وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ لَنُبَوِّئَنَّهُم مِنَ الجَنَّةِ غُرَفًا تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ خالِدينَ فيها ۚ نِعمَ أَجرُ العامِلينَ
58.translation_eng: Those who have faith and do righteous deeds, We will surely settle them in lofty abodes of paradise with streams running in them, to remain in them [forever]. How excellent is the reward of the workers!
58.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti la-nubawwiʾannahum mina l-jannati ghurafan tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru khālidīna fīhā niʿma ʾajru l-ʿāmilīna

59.content: الَّذينَ صَبَروا وَعَلىٰ رَبِّهِم يَتَوَكَّلونَ
59.translation_eng: —Those who are patient and who put their trust in their Lord.
59.transliteration: alladhīna ṣabarū wa-ʿalā rabbihim yatawakkalūna

60.content: وَكَأَيِّن مِن دابَّةٍ لا تَحمِلُ رِزقَهَا اللَّهُ يَرزُقُها وَإِيّاكُم ۚ وَهُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
60.translation_eng: How many an animal there is that does not carry its own provision. Allah provides for it, and for you, and He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
60.transliteration: wa-ka-ʾayyin min dābbatin lā taḥmilu rizqahā llāhu yarzuquhā wa-ʾiyyākum wa-huwa s-samīʿu l-ʿalīmu

61.content: وَلَئِن سَأَلتَهُم مَن خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ لَيَقولُنَّ اللَّهُ ۖ فَأَنّىٰ يُؤفَكونَ
61.translation_eng: If you ask them, ‘Who created the heavens and the earth, and disposed the sun and the moon?’ They will surely say, ‘Allah.’ Then where do they stray?
61.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin saʾaltahum man khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-sakhkhara sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara la-yaqūlunna llāhu fa-ʾannā yuʾfakūna

62.content: اللَّهُ يَبسُطُ الرِّزقَ لِمَن يَشاءُ مِن عِبادِهِ وَيَقدِرُ لَهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَليمٌ
62.translation_eng: Allah expands the provision for whomever He wishes of His servants, and tightens it for him. Indeed Allah has knowledge of all things.
62.transliteration: allāhu yabsuṭu r-rizqa li-man yashāʾu min ʿibādihī wa-yaqdiru lahū ʾinna llāha bi-kulli shayʾin ʿalīmun

63.content: وَلَئِن سَأَلتَهُم مَن نَزَّلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَحيا بِهِ الأَرضَ مِن بَعدِ مَوتِها لَيَقولُنَّ اللَّهُ ۚ قُلِ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعقِلونَ
63.translation_eng: And if you ask them, ‘Who sends down water from the sky, with which He revives the earth after its death?’ They will surely say, ‘Allah.’ Say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah!’ But most of them do not apply reason.
63.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin saʾaltahum man nazzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-ʾaḥyā bihi l-ʾarḍa min baʿdi mawtihā la-yaqūlunna llāhu quli l-ḥamdu li-llāhi bal ʾaktharuhum lā yaʿqilūna

64.content: وَما هٰذِهِ الحَياةُ الدُّنيا إِلّا لَهوٌ وَلَعِبٌ ۚ وَإِنَّ الدّارَ الآخِرَةَ لَهِيَ الحَيَوانُ ۚ لَو كانوا يَعلَمونَ
64.translation_eng: The life of this world is nothing but diversion and play, but the abode of the Hereafter is indeed Life, had they known!
64.transliteration: wa-mā hādhihi l-ḥayātu d-dunyā ʾillā lahwun wa-laʿibun wa-ʾinna d-dāra l-ʾākhirata la-hiya l-ḥayawānu law kānū yaʿlamūna

65.content: فَإِذا رَكِبوا فِي الفُلكِ دَعَوُا اللَّهَ مُخلِصينَ لَهُ الدّينَ فَلَمّا نَجّاهُم إِلَى البَرِّ إِذا هُم يُشرِكونَ
65.translation_eng: When they board the ship, they invoke Allah putting exclusive faith in Him, but when He delivers them to land, behold, they ascribe partners [to Him],
65.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā rakibū fī l-fulki daʿawu llāha mukhliṣīna lahu d-dīna fa-lammā najjāhum ʾilā l-barri ʾidhā hum yushrikūna

66.content: لِيَكفُروا بِما آتَيناهُم وَلِيَتَمَتَّعوا ۖ فَسَوفَ يَعلَمونَ
66.translation_eng: being ungrateful for what We have given them! So let them enjoy. Soon they will know!
66.transliteration: li-yakfurū bi-mā ʾātaynāhum wa-li-yatamattaʿū fa-sawfa yaʿlamūna

67.content: أَوَلَم يَرَوا أَنّا جَعَلنا حَرَمًا آمِنًا وَيُتَخَطَّفُ النّاسُ مِن حَولِهِم ۚ أَفَبِالباطِلِ يُؤمِنونَ وَبِنِعمَةِ اللَّهِ يَكفُرونَ
67.translation_eng: Have they not seen that We have appointed a safe sanctuary,1 while the people are despoiled all around them? Would they then believe in falsehood and be ungrateful toward the blessing of Allah?That is, the city of Makkah.
67.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾannā jaʿalnā ḥaraman ʾāminan wa-yutakhaṭṭafu n-nāsu min ḥawlihim ʾa-fa-bi-l-bāṭili yuʾminūna wa-bi-niʿmati llāhi yakfurūna

68.content: وَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّنِ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَو كَذَّبَ بِالحَقِّ لَمّا جاءَهُ ۚ أَلَيسَ في جَهَنَّمَ مَثوًى لِلكافِرينَ
68.translation_eng: Who is a greater wrongdoer than him who fabricates a lie against Allah, or denies the truth when it comes to him? Is not the [final] abode of the faithless in hell?
68.transliteration: wa-man ʾaẓlamu mimmani ftarā ʿalā llāhi kadhiban ʾaw kadhdhaba bi-l-ḥaqqi lammā jāʾahū ʾa-laysa fī jahannama mathwan li-l-kāfirīna

69.content: وَالَّذينَ جاهَدوا فينا لَنَهدِيَنَّهُم سُبُلَنا ۚ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَمَعَ المُحسِنينَ
69.translation_eng: As for those who strive in Us, We shall surely guide them in Our ways, and Allah is indeed with the virtuous.
69.transliteration: wa-lladhīna jāhadū fīnā la-nahdiyannahum subulanā wa-ʾinna llāha la-maʿa l-muḥsinīna

30.description: The surah that mentions the defeat of The Byzantines and the divine promise of their forthcoming victory in several years—and in prophesying this, implying martial triumph for the Muslims over their idolatrous adversaries at the same time. The surah is occasioned by the celebration of the idol-worshipping opponents of the prophet at the new of the Byzantine defeat by the Persians, for they drew an analogy between themselves and the fire-worshipping Persians as defenders of polytheism in opposition to the monotheism of the Muslims and Byzantine Christians. It derives its name from verse 2 which mentions “Byzantium” (al-Rūm). The surah opens with a reference to the defeat of the Byzantines at the hands of the Persians (613–14 CE) in Syria, and the subsequent victory of the Byzantines in 624 CE. The surah urges people to reflect on the creation of themselves, the heavens and earth, and all God’s wonders. God’s power to give life to a barren land is repeated as an indication both of His ability to raise the dead and of His mercy to mankind. The disbelievers are warned to believe before it is too late; the Prophet is urged to persevere and to ignore the taunts of the disbelievers.The surah is also known as: Rome, The (East) Romans, The Greeks, The Roman Empire, The Romans.

1.translation_eng: Alif, Lām, Mīm.

2.translation_eng: Byzantium has been vanquished

3.content: في أَدنَى الأَرضِ وَهُم مِن بَعدِ غَلَبِهِم سَيَغلِبونَ
3.translation_eng: in a nearby territory, but following their defeat they will be victors
3.transliteration: fī ʾadnā l-ʾarḍi wa-hum min baʿdi ghalabihim sa-yaghlibūna

4.content: في بِضعِ سِنينَ ۗ لِلَّهِ الأَمرُ مِن قَبلُ وَمِن بَعدُ ۚ وَيَومَئِذٍ يَفرَحُ المُؤمِنونَ
4.translation_eng: in a few years. All command belongs to Allah, before and after, and on that day the faithful will rejoice
4.transliteration: fī biḍʿi sinīna li-llāhi l-ʾamru min qablu wa-min baʿdu wa-yawmaʾidhin yafraḥu l-muʾminūna

5.content: بِنَصرِ اللَّهِ ۚ يَنصُرُ مَن يَشاءُ ۖ وَهُوَ العَزيزُ الرَّحيمُ
5.translation_eng: at Allah’s help. He helps whomever He wishes, and He is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
5.transliteration: bi-naṣri llāhi yanṣuru man yashāʾu wa-huwa l-ʿazīzu r-raḥīmu

6.content: وَعدَ اللَّهِ ۖ لا يُخلِفُ اللَّهُ وَعدَهُ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
6.translation_eng: [This is] a promise of Allah: Allah does not break His promise, but most people do not know.
6.transliteration: waʿda llāhi lā yukhlifu llāhu waʿdahū wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūna

7.content: يَعلَمونَ ظاهِرًا مِنَ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا وَهُم عَنِ الآخِرَةِ هُم غافِلونَ
7.translation_eng: They know just an outward aspect of the life of the world, but they are oblivious of the Hereafter.
7.transliteration: yaʿlamūna ẓāhiran mina l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-hum ʿani l-ʾākhirati hum ghāfilūna

8.content: أَوَلَم يَتَفَكَّروا في أَنفُسِهِم ۗ ما خَلَقَ اللَّهُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما إِلّا بِالحَقِّ وَأَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۗ وَإِنَّ كَثيرًا مِنَ النّاسِ بِلِقاءِ رَبِّهِم لَكافِرونَ
8.translation_eng: Have they not reflected in their own souls? Allah did not create the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them except with reason and for a specified term. Indeed many of the people disbelieve in the encounter with their Lord.
8.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yatafakkarū fī ʾanfusihim mā khalaqa llāhu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-mā baynahumā ʾillā bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾajalin musamman wa-ʾinna kathīran mina n-nāsi bi-liqāʾi rabbihim la-kāfirūna

9.content: أَوَلَم يَسيروا فِي الأَرضِ فَيَنظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ كانوا أَشَدَّ مِنهُم قُوَّةً وَأَثارُوا الأَرضَ وَعَمَروها أَكثَرَ مِمّا عَمَروها وَجاءَتهُم رُسُلُهُم بِالبَيِّناتِ ۖ فَما كانَ اللَّهُ لِيَظلِمَهُم وَلٰكِن كانوا أَنفُسَهُم يَظلِمونَ
9.translation_eng: Have they not traveled in the land so that they may observe how was the fate of those who were before them? They were more powerful than them, and they plowed the earth and developed it more than they have developed it. Their apostles brought them manifest proofs. So it was not Allah who wronged them, but it was they who used to wrong themselves.
9.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yasīrū fī l-ʾarḍi fa-yanẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu lladhīna min qablihim kānū ʾashadda minhum quwwatan wa-ʾathārū l-ʾarḍa wa-ʿamarūhā ʾakthara mimmā ʿamarūhā wa-jāʾathum rusuluhum bi-l-bayyināti fa-mā kāna llāhu li-yaẓlimahum wa-lākin kānū ʾanfusahum yaẓlimūna

10.content: ثُمَّ كانَ عاقِبَةَ الَّذينَ أَساءُوا السّوأىٰ أَن كَذَّبوا بِآياتِ اللَّهِ وَكانوا بِها يَستَهزِئونَ
10.translation_eng: Then the fate of those who committed misdeeds was that they denied the signs of Allah and they used to deride them.
10.transliteration: thumma kāna ʿāqibata lladhīna ʾasāʾū s-sūʾā ʾan kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyāti llāhi wa-kānū bihā yastahziʾūna

11.content: اللَّهُ يَبدَأُ الخَلقَ ثُمَّ يُعيدُهُ ثُمَّ إِلَيهِ تُرجَعونَ
11.translation_eng: Allah originates the creation, then He will bring it back, then you will be brought back to Him.
11.transliteration: allāhu yabdaʾu l-khalqa thumma yuʿīduhū thumma ʾilayhi turjaʿūna

12.content: وَيَومَ تَقومُ السّاعَةُ يُبلِسُ المُجرِمونَ
12.translation_eng: And when the Hour sets in, the guilty will despair.
12.transliteration: wa-yawma taqūmu s-sāʿatu yublisu l-mujrimūna

13.content: وَلَم يَكُن لَهُم مِن شُرَكائِهِم شُفَعاءُ وَكانوا بِشُرَكائِهِم كافِرينَ
13.translation_eng: None of those whom they ascribed as partners [to Allah] will intercede for them, and they will disavow their partners.1Or ‘though they had been faithless for the sake of their partners [i.e. their false gods].’
13.transliteration: wa-lam yakun lahum min shurakāʾihim shufaʿāʾu wa-kānū bi-shurakāʾihim kāfirīna

14.content: وَيَومَ تَقومُ السّاعَةُ يَومَئِذٍ يَتَفَرَّقونَ
14.translation_eng: The day the Hour sets in, they will be divided on that day:
14.transliteration: wa-yawma taqūmu s-sāʿatu yawmaʾidhin yatafarraqūna

15.content: فَأَمَّا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ فَهُم في رَوضَةٍ يُحبَرونَ
15.translation_eng: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds, they shall be in a garden, rejoicing.
15.transliteration: fa-ʾammā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti fa-hum fī rawḍatin yuḥbarūna

16.content: وَأَمَّا الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَكَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا وَلِقاءِ الآخِرَةِ فَأُولٰئِكَ فِي العَذابِ مُحضَرونَ
16.translation_eng: But as for those who were faithless and denied Our signs and the encounter of the Hereafter, they will be brought to the punishment.
16.transliteration: wa-ʾammā lladhīna kafarū wa-kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā wa-liqāʾi l-ʾākhirati fa-ʾulāʾika fī l-ʿadhābi muḥḍarūna

17.content: فَسُبحانَ اللَّهِ حينَ تُمسونَ وَحينَ تُصبِحونَ
17.translation_eng: So glorify Allah when you enter evening and when you rise at dawn.
17.transliteration: fa-subḥāna llāhi ḥīna tumsūna wa-ḥīna tuṣbiḥūna

18.content: وَلَهُ الحَمدُ فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَعَشِيًّا وَحينَ تُظهِرونَ
18.translation_eng: To Him belongs all praise in the heavens and the earth, at nightfall and when you enter noontime.
18.transliteration: wa-lahu l-ḥamdu fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-ʿashiyyan wa-ḥīna tuẓhirūna

19.content: يُخرِجُ الحَيَّ مِنَ المَيِّتِ وَيُخرِجُ المَيِّتَ مِنَ الحَيِّ وَيُحيِي الأَرضَ بَعدَ مَوتِها ۚ وَكَذٰلِكَ تُخرَجونَ
19.translation_eng: He brings forth the living from the dead, and brings forth the dead from the living, and revives the earth after its death. Likewise you [too] shall be raised [from the dead].
19.transliteration: yukhriju l-ḥayya mina l-mayyiti wa-yukhriju l-mayyita mina l-ḥayyi wa-yuḥyi l-ʾarḍa baʿda mawtihā wa-ka-dhālika tukhrajūna

20.content: وَمِن آياتِهِ أَن خَلَقَكُم مِن تُرابٍ ثُمَّ إِذا أَنتُم بَشَرٌ تَنتَشِرونَ
20.translation_eng: Of His signs is that He created you from dust, then, behold, you are humans scattering [all over]!
20.transliteration: wa-min ʾāyātihī ʾan khalaqakum min turābin thumma ʾidhā ʾantum basharun tantashirūna

21.content: وَمِن آياتِهِ أَن خَلَقَ لَكُم مِن أَنفُسِكُم أَزواجًا لِتَسكُنوا إِلَيها وَجَعَلَ بَينَكُم مَوَدَّةً وَرَحمَةً ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَتَفَكَّرونَ
21.translation_eng: And of His signs is that He created for you mates from your own selves that you may take comfort in them, and He ordained affection and mercy between you. There are indeed signs in that for a people who reflect.
21.transliteration: wa-min ʾāyātihī ʾan khalaqa lakum min ʾanfusikum ʾazwājan li-taskunū ʾilayhā wa-jaʿala baynakum mawaddatan wa-raḥmatan ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yatafakkarūna

22.content: وَمِن آياتِهِ خَلقُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَاختِلافُ أَلسِنَتِكُم وَأَلوانِكُم ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِلعالِمينَ
22.translation_eng: Among His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the difference of your languages and colours. There are indeed signs in that for those who know.
22.transliteration: wa-min ʾāyātihī khalqu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-khtilāfu ʾalsinatikum wa-ʾalwānikum ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-l-ʿālimīna

23.content: وَمِن آياتِهِ مَنامُكُم بِاللَّيلِ وَالنَّهارِ وَابتِغاؤُكُم مِن فَضلِهِ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَسمَعونَ
23.translation_eng: And of His signs is your sleep by night and day, and your pursuit of His grace. There are indeed signs in that for a people who listen.
23.transliteration: wa-min ʾāyātihī manāmukum bi-l-layli wa-n-nahāri wa-btighāʾukum min faḍlihī ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yasmaʿūna

24.content: وَمِن آياتِهِ يُريكُمُ البَرقَ خَوفًا وَطَمَعًا وَيُنَزِّلُ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَيُحيي بِهِ الأَرضَ بَعدَ مَوتِها ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَعقِلونَ
24.translation_eng: And of His signs is that He shows you the lightning, arousing fear and hope, and He sends down water from the sky, and with it revives the earth after its death. There are indeed signs in that for a people who apply reason.
24.transliteration: wa-min ʾāyātihī yurīkumu l-barqa khawfan wa-ṭamaʿan wa-yunazzilu mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-yuḥyī bihi l-ʾarḍa baʿda mawtihā ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yaʿqilūna

25.content: وَمِن آياتِهِ أَن تَقومَ السَّماءُ وَالأَرضُ بِأَمرِهِ ۚ ثُمَّ إِذا دَعاكُم دَعوَةً مِنَ الأَرضِ إِذا أَنتُم تَخرُجونَ
25.translation_eng: And of His signs is that the sky and the earth stand by His command, and then, when He calls you forth from the earth, behold, you will come forth.
25.transliteration: wa-min ʾāyātihī ʾan taqūma s-samāʾu wa-l-ʾarḍu bi-ʾamrihī thumma ʾidhā daʿākum daʿwatan mina l-ʾarḍi ʾidhā ʾantum takhrujūna

26.content: وَلَهُ مَن فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ كُلٌّ لَهُ قانِتونَ
26.translation_eng: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. All are obedient to Him.
26.transliteration: wa-lahū man fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi kullun lahū qānitūna

27.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي يَبدَأُ الخَلقَ ثُمَّ يُعيدُهُ وَهُوَ أَهوَنُ عَلَيهِ ۚ وَلَهُ المَثَلُ الأَعلىٰ فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ وَهُوَ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
27.translation_eng: It is He who originates the creation, and then He will bring it back —and that is more simple for Him. His is the loftiest description in the heavens and the earth. And He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.
27.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī yabdaʾu l-khalqa thumma yuʿīduhū wa-huwa ʾahwanu ʿalayhi wa-lahu l-mathalu l-ʾaʿlā fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-huwa l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

28.content: ضَرَبَ لَكُم مَثَلًا مِن أَنفُسِكُم ۖ هَل لَكُم مِن ما مَلَكَت أَيمانُكُم مِن شُرَكاءَ في ما رَزَقناكُم فَأَنتُم فيهِ سَواءٌ تَخافونَهُم كَخيفَتِكُم أَنفُسَكُم ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ الآياتِ لِقَومٍ يَعقِلونَ
28.translation_eng: He draws for you an example from yourselves: Do you have among your slaves any partners [who may share] in what We have provided you, so that you are equal in its respect, and you revere them as you revere one another?1 Thus do We elaborate2 the signs for a people who apply reason.Or ‘revere your own folks.’Or ‘articulate.’
28.transliteration: ḍaraba lakum mathalan min ʾanfusikum hal lakum min mā malakat ʾaymānukum min shurakāʾa fī mā razaqnākum fa-ʾantum fīhi sawāʾun takhāfūnahum ka-khīfatikum ʾanfusakum ka-dhālika nufaṣṣilu l-ʾāyāti li-qawmin yaʿqilūna

29.content: بَلِ اتَّبَعَ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا أَهواءَهُم بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ ۖ فَمَن يَهدي مَن أَضَلَّ اللَّهُ ۖ وَما لَهُم مِن ناصِرينَ
29.translation_eng: Rather the wrongdoers follow their own desires without any knowledge. So who will guide those whom Allah has led astray? They will have no helpers.
29.transliteration: bali ttabaʿa lladhīna ẓalamū ʾahwāʾahum bi-ghayri ʿilmin fa-man yahdī man ʾaḍalla llāhu wa-mā lahum min nāṣirīna

30.content: فَأَقِم وَجهَكَ لِلدّينِ حَنيفًا ۚ فِطرَتَ اللَّهِ الَّتي فَطَرَ النّاسَ عَلَيها ۚ لا تَبديلَ لِخَلقِ اللَّهِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ الدّينُ القَيِّمُ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
30.translation_eng: So set your heart on the religion as a people of pure faith, the origination of Allah according to which He originated mankind (There is no altering Allah’s creation; that is the upright religion, but most people do not know.)
30.transliteration: fa-ʾaqim wajhaka li-d-dīni ḥanīfan fiṭrata llāhi llatī faṭara n-nāsa ʿalayhā lā tabdīla li-khalqi llāhi dhālika d-dīnu l-qayyimu wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūna

31.content: ۞ مُنيبينَ إِلَيهِ وَاتَّقوهُ وَأَقيمُوا الصَّلاةَ وَلا تَكونوا مِنَ المُشرِكينَ
31.translation_eng: —turning to Him in penitence, and be wary of Him, and maintain the prayer, and do not be among the polytheists
31.transliteration: munībīna ʾilayhi wa-ttaqūhu wa-ʾaqīmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-lā takūnū mina l-mushrikīna

32.content: مِنَ الَّذينَ فَرَّقوا دينَهُم وَكانوا شِيَعًا ۖ كُلُّ حِزبٍ بِما لَدَيهِم فَرِحونَ
32.translation_eng: —of those who split up their religion and became sects: each faction exulting in what it possessed.
32.transliteration: mina lladhīna farraqū dīnahum wa-kānū shiyaʿan kullu ḥizbin bi-mā ladayhim fariḥūna

33.content: وَإِذا مَسَّ النّاسَ ضُرٌّ دَعَوا رَبَّهُم مُنيبينَ إِلَيهِ ثُمَّ إِذا أَذاقَهُم مِنهُ رَحمَةً إِذا فَريقٌ مِنهُم بِرَبِّهِم يُشرِكونَ
33.translation_eng: When distress befalls people, they supplicate their Lord, turning to Him in penitence. Then, when He lets them taste His mercy, behold, a part of them ascribe partners to their Lord,
33.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā massa n-nāsa ḍurrun daʿaw rabbahum munībīna ʾilayhi thumma ʾidhā ʾadhāqahum minhu raḥmatan ʾidhā farīqun minhum bi-rabbihim yushrikūna

34.content: لِيَكفُروا بِما آتَيناهُم ۚ فَتَمَتَّعوا فَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ
34.translation_eng: being ungrateful toward what We have given them. So let them enjoy. Soon they will know!
34.transliteration: li-yakfurū bi-mā ʾātaynāhum fa-tamattaʿū fa-sawfa taʿlamūna

35.content: أَم أَنزَلنا عَلَيهِم سُلطانًا فَهُوَ يَتَكَلَّمُ بِما كانوا بِهِ يُشرِكونَ
35.translation_eng: Have We sent down to them any authority which might speak of what they associate with Him?
35.transliteration: ʾam ʾanzalnā ʿalayhim sulṭānan fa-huwa yatakallamu bi-mā kānū bihī yushrikūna

36.content: وَإِذا أَذَقنَا النّاسَ رَحمَةً فَرِحوا بِها ۖ وَإِن تُصِبهُم سَيِّئَةٌ بِما قَدَّمَت أَيديهِم إِذا هُم يَقنَطونَ
36.translation_eng: And when We let people taste [Our] mercy, they exult in it; but should an ill visit them because of what their hands have sent ahead, behold, they become despondent!
36.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā ʾadhaqnā n-nāsa raḥmatan fariḥū bihā wa-ʾin tuṣibhum sayyiʾatun bi-mā qaddamat ʾaydīhim ʾidhā hum yaqnaṭūna

37.content: أَوَلَم يَرَوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَبسُطُ الرِّزقَ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيَقدِرُ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
37.translation_eng: Do they not see that Allah expands the provision for whomever He wishes, and tightens it? There are indeed signs in that for a people who have faith.
37.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾanna llāha yabsuṭu r-rizqa li-man yashāʾu wa-yaqdiru ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yuʾminūna

38.content: فَآتِ ذَا القُربىٰ حَقَّهُ وَالمِسكينَ وَابنَ السَّبيلِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ خَيرٌ لِلَّذينَ يُريدونَ وَجهَ اللَّهِ ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُفلِحونَ
38.translation_eng: Give the relative his right, and the needy and the traveller [as well]. That is better for those who seek Allah’s pleasure, and it is they who are the felicitous.
38.transliteration: fa-ʾāti dhā l-qurbā ḥaqqahū wa-l-miskīna wa-bna s-sabīli dhālika khayrun li-lladhīna yurīdūna wajha llāhi wa-ʾulāʾika humu l-mufliḥūna

39.content: وَما آتَيتُم مِن رِبًا لِيَربُوَ في أَموالِ النّاسِ فَلا يَربو عِندَ اللَّهِ ۖ وَما آتَيتُم مِن زَكاةٍ تُريدونَ وَجهَ اللَّهِ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُضعِفونَ
39.translation_eng: That which you give in usury in order that it may increase people’s wealth does not increase with Allah. But what you pay as zakāt seeking Allah’s pleasure —it is they who will be given a manifold increase.
39.transliteration: wa-mā ʾātaytum min riban li-yarbuwa fī ʾamwāli n-nāsi fa-lā yarbū ʿinda llāhi wa-mā ʾātaytum min zakātin turīdūna wajha llāhi fa-ʾulāʾika humu l-muḍʿifūna

40.content: اللَّهُ الَّذي خَلَقَكُم ثُمَّ رَزَقَكُم ثُمَّ يُميتُكُم ثُمَّ يُحييكُم ۖ هَل مِن شُرَكائِكُم مَن يَفعَلُ مِن ذٰلِكُم مِن شَيءٍ ۚ سُبحانَهُ وَتَعالىٰ عَمّا يُشرِكونَ
40.translation_eng: It is Allah who created you and then He provided for you, then He makes you die, then He will bring you to life. Is there anyone among your partners who does anything of that kind? Immaculate is He and exalted above [having] any partners that they ascribe [to Him]!
40.transliteration: allāhu lladhī khalaqakum thumma razaqakum thumma yumītukum thumma yuḥyīkum hal min shurakāʾikum man yafʿalu min dhālikum min shayʾin subḥānahū wa-taʿālā ʿammā yushrikūna

41.content: ظَهَرَ الفَسادُ فِي البَرِّ وَالبَحرِ بِما كَسَبَت أَيدِي النّاسِ لِيُذيقَهُم بَعضَ الَّذي عَمِلوا لَعَلَّهُم يَرجِعونَ
41.translation_eng: Corruption has appeared in land and sea because of the doings of the people’s hands, that He may make them taste something of what they have done, so that they may come back.
41.transliteration: ẓahara l-fasādu fī l-barri wa-l-baḥri bi-mā kasabat ʾaydī n-nāsi li-yudhīqahum baʿḍa lladhī ʿamilū laʿallahum yarjiʿūna

42.content: قُل سيروا فِي الأَرضِ فَانظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلُ ۚ كانَ أَكثَرُهُم مُشرِكينَ
42.translation_eng: Say, ‘Travel over the land and then observe how was the fate of those who were before [you], most of whom were polytheists.’
42.transliteration: qul sīrū fī l-ʾarḍi fa-nẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu lladhīna min qablu kāna ʾaktharuhum mushrikīna

43.content: فَأَقِم وَجهَكَ لِلدّينِ القَيِّمِ مِن قَبلِ أَن يَأتِيَ يَومٌ لا مَرَدَّ لَهُ مِنَ اللَّهِ ۖ يَومَئِذٍ يَصَّدَّعونَ
43.translation_eng: So set your heart on the upright religion, before there comes a day irrevocable from Allah. On that day they shall be split [into various groups].1See 39:71, 73; 56:7-56.
43.transliteration: fa-ʾaqim wajhaka li-d-dīni l-qayyimi min qabli ʾan yaʾtiya yawmun lā maradda lahū mina llāhi yawmaʾidhin yaṣṣaddaʿūna

44.content: مَن كَفَرَ فَعَلَيهِ كُفرُهُ ۖ وَمَن عَمِلَ صالِحًا فَلِأَنفُسِهِم يَمهَدونَ
44.translation_eng: Whoever is faithless shall face the consequences of his faithlessness, and those who act righteously only prepare for their own souls,
44.transliteration: man kafara fa-ʿalayhi kufruhū wa-man ʿamila ṣāliḥan fa-li-ʾanfusihim yamhadūna

45.content: لِيَجزِيَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ مِن فَضلِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لا يُحِبُّ الكافِرينَ
45.translation_eng: that He may reward those who have faith and do righteous deeds out of His grace. Indeed He does not like the faithless.
45.transliteration: li-yajziya lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti min faḍlihī ʾinnahū lā yuḥibbu l-kāfirīna

46.content: وَمِن آياتِهِ أَن يُرسِلَ الرِّياحَ مُبَشِّراتٍ وَلِيُذيقَكُم مِن رَحمَتِهِ وَلِتَجرِيَ الفُلكُ بِأَمرِهِ وَلِتَبتَغوا مِن فَضلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
46.translation_eng: And of His signs is that He sends the winds as bearers of good news and to let you taste of His mercy, and that the ships may sail by His command, and that you may seek of His grace, and so that you may give [Him] thanks.
46.transliteration: wa-min ʾāyātihī ʾan yursila r-riyāḥa mubashshirātin wa-li-yudhīqakum min raḥmatihī wa-li-tajriya l-fulku bi-ʾamrihī wa-li-tabtaghū min faḍlihī wa-laʿallakum tashkurūna

47.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ رُسُلًا إِلىٰ قَومِهِم فَجاءوهُم بِالبَيِّناتِ فَانتَقَمنا مِنَ الَّذينَ أَجرَموا ۖ وَكانَ حَقًّا عَلَينا نَصرُ المُؤمِنينَ
47.translation_eng: Certainly We sent apostles to their people before you, and they brought them manifest proofs. Then We took vengeance upon those who were guilty, and it was a must for Us to help the faithful.
47.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā min qablika rusulan ʾilā qawmihim fa-jāʾūhum bi-l-bayyināti fa-ntaqamnā mina lladhīna ʾajramū wa-kāna ḥaqqan ʿalaynā naṣru l-muʾminīna

48.content: اللَّهُ الَّذي يُرسِلُ الرِّياحَ فَتُثيرُ سَحابًا فَيَبسُطُهُ فِي السَّماءِ كَيفَ يَشاءُ وَيَجعَلُهُ كِسَفًا فَتَرَى الوَدقَ يَخرُجُ مِن خِلالِهِ ۖ فَإِذا أَصابَ بِهِ مَن يَشاءُ مِن عِبادِهِ إِذا هُم يَستَبشِرونَ
48.translation_eng: It is Allah who sends the winds. Then they raise a cloud, then He spreads it as He wishes in the sky, and forms it into fragments, whereat you see the rain issuing from its midst. Then, when He strikes with it whomever of His servants that He wishes, behold, they rejoice;
48.transliteration: allāhu lladhī yursilu r-riyāḥa fa-tuthīru saḥāban fa-yabsuṭuhū fī s-samāʾi kayfa yashāʾu wa-yajʿaluhū kisafan fa-tarā l-wadqa yakhruju min khilālihī fa-ʾidhā ʾaṣāba bihī man yashāʾu min ʿibādihī ʾidhā hum yastabshirūna

49.content: وَإِن كانوا مِن قَبلِ أَن يُنَزَّلَ عَلَيهِم مِن قَبلِهِ لَمُبلِسينَ
49.translation_eng: and indeed they had, before it was sent down upon them, been despondent earlier.
49.transliteration: wa-ʾin kānū min qabli ʾan yunazzala ʿalayhim min qablihī la-mublisīna

50.content: فَانظُر إِلىٰ آثارِ رَحمَتِ اللَّهِ كَيفَ يُحيِي الأَرضَ بَعدَ مَوتِها ۚ إِنَّ ذٰلِكَ لَمُحيِي المَوتىٰ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
50.translation_eng: So observe the effects of Allah’s mercy: how He revives the earth after its death! Indeed He is the reviver of the dead, and He has power over all things.
50.transliteration: fa-nẓur ʾilā ʾāthāri raḥmati llāhi kayfa yuḥyi l-ʾarḍa baʿda mawtihā ʾinna dhālika la-muḥyi l-mawtā wa-huwa ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

51.content: وَلَئِن أَرسَلنا ريحًا فَرَأَوهُ مُصفَرًّا لَظَلّوا مِن بَعدِهِ يَكفُرونَ
51.translation_eng: And if We send a wind and they see it1 turn yellow, they will surely become ungrateful after that.2That is, their tillage, fields and orchards.That is, after they have been joyous on Allah’s reviving the dead earth and turning it green.
51.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin ʾarsalnā rīḥan fa-raʾawhu muṣfarran la-ẓallū min baʿdihī yakfurūna

52.content: فَإِنَّكَ لا تُسمِعُ المَوتىٰ وَلا تُسمِعُ الصُّمَّ الدُّعاءَ إِذا وَلَّوا مُدبِرينَ
52.translation_eng: Indeed you cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs [upon you],
52.transliteration: fa-ʾinnaka lā tusmiʿu l-mawtā wa-lā tusmiʿu ṣ-ṣumma d-duʿāʾa ʾidhā wallaw mudbirīna

53.content: وَما أَنتَ بِهادِ العُميِ عَن ضَلالَتِهِم ۖ إِن تُسمِعُ إِلّا مَن يُؤمِنُ بِآياتِنا فَهُم مُسلِمونَ
53.translation_eng: nor can you lead the blind out of their error. You can make hear only those who have faith in Our signs, and thus have submitted.
53.transliteration: wa-mā ʾanta bi-hādi l-ʿumyi ʿan ḍalālatihim ʾin tusmiʿu ʾillā man yuʾminu bi-ʾāyātinā fa-hum muslimūna

54.content: ۞ اللَّهُ الَّذي خَلَقَكُم مِن ضَعفٍ ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِن بَعدِ ضَعفٍ قُوَّةً ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِن بَعدِ قُوَّةٍ ضَعفًا وَشَيبَةً ۚ يَخلُقُ ما يَشاءُ ۖ وَهُوَ العَليمُ القَديرُ
54.translation_eng: It is Allah who created you from [a state of] weakness, then He gave you power after weakness. Then, after power, He ordained weakness and old age: He creates whatever He wishes, and He is the All-knowing, the All-powerful.
54.transliteration: allāhu lladhī khalaqakum min ḍaʿfin thumma jaʿala min baʿdi ḍaʿfin quwwatan thumma jaʿala min baʿdi quwwatin ḍaʿfan wa-shaybatan yakhluqu mā yashāʾu wa-huwa l-ʿalīmu l-qadīru

55.content: وَيَومَ تَقومُ السّاعَةُ يُقسِمُ المُجرِمونَ ما لَبِثوا غَيرَ ساعَةٍ ۚ كَذٰلِكَ كانوا يُؤفَكونَ
55.translation_eng: And on the day when the Hour sets in the guilty will swear that they had remained only for an hour. That is how they were used to lying [in the world].
55.transliteration: wa-yawma taqūmu s-sāʿatu yuqsimu l-mujrimūna mā labithū ghayra sāʿatin ka-dhālika kānū yuʾfakūna

56.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا العِلمَ وَالإيمانَ لَقَد لَبِثتُم في كِتابِ اللَّهِ إِلىٰ يَومِ البَعثِ ۖ فَهٰذا يَومُ البَعثِ وَلٰكِنَّكُم كُنتُم لا تَعلَمونَ
56.translation_eng: But those who were given knowledge and faith will say, ‘Certainly you remained in Allah’s Book1 until the Day of Resurrection. This is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not know.’That is, in the Preserved Tablet. Cf. 56:78.
56.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna ʾūtū l-ʿilma wa-l-ʾīmāna la-qad labithtum fī kitābi llāhi ʾilā yawmi l-baʿthi fa-hādhā yawmu l-baʿthi wa-lākinnakum kuntum lā taʿlamūna

57.content: فَيَومَئِذٍ لا يَنفَعُ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا مَعذِرَتُهُم وَلا هُم يُستَعتَبونَ
57.translation_eng: On that day the excuses of the wrongdoers will not benefit them, nor will they be asked to propitiate [Allah].
57.transliteration: fa-yawmaʾidhin lā yanfaʿu lladhīna ẓalamū maʿdhiratuhum wa-lā hum yustaʿtabūna

58.content: وَلَقَد ضَرَبنا لِلنّاسِ في هٰذَا القُرآنِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ ۚ وَلَئِن جِئتَهُم بِآيَةٍ لَيَقولَنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إِن أَنتُم إِلّا مُبطِلونَ
58.translation_eng: Certainly we have drawn for mankind in this Qurʾān every [kind of] parable. Indeed if you bring them a sign,1 the faithless will surely say, ‘You are nothing but fabricators!’That is, a miracle.
58.transliteration: wa-la-qad ḍarabnā li-n-nāsi fī hādhā l-qurʾāni min kulli mathalin wa-la-ʾin jiʾtahum bi-ʾāyatin la-yaqūlanna lladhīna kafarū ʾin ʾantum ʾillā mubṭilūna

59.content: كَذٰلِكَ يَطبَعُ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ قُلوبِ الَّذينَ لا يَعلَمونَ
59.translation_eng: Thus does Allah seal the hearts of those who do not know.
59.transliteration: ka-dhālika yaṭbaʿu llāhu ʿalā qulūbi lladhīna lā yaʿlamūna

60.content: فَاصبِر إِنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ ۖ وَلا يَستَخِفَّنَّكَ الَّذينَ لا يوقِنونَ
60.translation_eng: So be patient! Allah’s promise is indeed true. And do not let yourself be upset by those who have no conviction.
60.transliteration: fa-ṣbir ʾinna waʿda llāhi ḥaqqun wa-lā yastakhiffannaka lladhīna lā yūqinūna

31.description: The surah that mentions the judicious and poignant admonitions of Luqmān (whom some call Lokman, the Wise, a man of faith) as he spoke them to his beloved son. It is named after Luqmān, whose account is given in verse 12. The surah opens with a description of the believers, and it condemns those who attempt to lead others away from guidance. It extols God’s power and warns the disbelievers of the consequences of their actions. The Prophet is told not to be saddened by their disbelief.The surah is also known as: Lokman, Luqmaan, Luqman (The Wise).

1.translation_eng: Alif, Lām, Mīm.

2.translation_eng: These are the signs of the Definitive Book,

3.content: هُدًى وَرَحمَةً لِلمُحسِنينَ
3.translation_eng: a guidance and mercy for the virtuous,
3.transliteration: hudan wa-raḥmatan li-l-muḥsinīna

4.content: الَّذينَ يُقيمونَ الصَّلاةَ وَيُؤتونَ الزَّكاةَ وَهُم بِالآخِرَةِ هُم يوقِنونَ
4.translation_eng: who maintain the prayer, and pay the zakāt, and are certain of the Hereafter.
4.transliteration: alladhīna yuqīmūna ṣ-ṣalāta wa-yuʾtūna z-zakāta wa-hum bi-l-ʾākhirati hum yūqinūna

5.content: أُولٰئِكَ عَلىٰ هُدًى مِن رَبِّهِم ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُفلِحونَ
5.translation_eng: Those follow their Lord’s guidance, and it is they who are the felicitous.
5.transliteration: ʾulāʾika ʿalā hudan min rabbihim wa-ʾulāʾika humu l-mufliḥūna

6.content: وَمِنَ النّاسِ مَن يَشتَري لَهوَ الحَديثِ لِيُضِلَّ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ وَيَتَّخِذَها هُزُوًا ۚ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم عَذابٌ مُهينٌ
6.translation_eng: Among the people is he who buys diversionary talk that he may lead [people] astray from Allah’s way without any knowledge, and he takes it in derision. For such there is a humiliating punishment.
6.transliteration: wa-mina n-nāsi man yashtarī lahwa l-ḥadīthi li-yuḍilla ʿan sabīli llāhi bi-ghayri ʿilmin wa-yattakhidhahā huzuwan ʾulāʾika lahum ʿadhābun muhīnun

7.content: وَإِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِ آياتُنا وَلّىٰ مُستَكبِرًا كَأَن لَم يَسمَعها كَأَنَّ في أُذُنَيهِ وَقرًا ۖ فَبَشِّرهُ بِعَذابٍ أَليمٍ
7.translation_eng: And when Our signs are recited to him he turns away disdainfully as if he had not heard them [at all], as if there were a deafness in his ears. So inform him of a painful punishment.
7.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhi ʾāyātunā wallā mustakbiran ka-ʾan lam yasmaʿhā ka-ʾanna fī ʾudhunayhi waqran fa-bashshirhu bi-ʿadhābin ʾalīmin

8.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ لَهُم جَنّاتُ النَّعيمِ
8.translation_eng: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds, for them will be gardens of bliss,
8.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti lahum jannātu n-naʿīmi

9.content: خالِدينَ فيها ۖ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقًّا ۚ وَهُوَ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
9.translation_eng: to remain in them [forever] —a true promise of Allah, and He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.
9.transliteration: khālidīna fīhā waʿda llāhi ḥaqqan wa-huwa l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

10.content: خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ بِغَيرِ عَمَدٍ تَرَونَها ۖ وَأَلقىٰ فِي الأَرضِ رَواسِيَ أَن تَميدَ بِكُم وَبَثَّ فيها مِن كُلِّ دابَّةٍ ۚ وَأَنزَلنا مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَنبَتنا فيها مِن كُلِّ زَوجٍ كَريمٍ
10.translation_eng: He created the heavens without any pillars that you may see, and cast firm mountains in the earth lest it should shake with you, and He has scattered in it every kind of animal. And We sent down water from the sky and caused every splendid kind [of plant] to grow in it.
10.transliteration: khalaqa s-samāwāti bi-ghayri ʿamadin tarawnahā wa-ʾalqā fī l-ʾarḍi rawāsiya ʾan tamīda bikum wa-baththa fīhā min kulli dābbatin wa-ʾanzalnā mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-ʾanbatnā fīhā min kulli zawjin karīmin

11.content: هٰذا خَلقُ اللَّهِ فَأَروني ماذا خَلَقَ الَّذينَ مِن دونِهِ ۚ بَلِ الظّالِمونَ في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
11.translation_eng: This is the creation of Allah. Now show Me what others besides Him have created. Rather the wrongdoers are in manifest error!
11.transliteration: hādhā khalqu llāhi fa-ʾarūnī mādhā khalaqa lladhīna min dūnihī bali ẓ-ẓālimūna fī ḍalālin mubīnin

12.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا لُقمانَ الحِكمَةَ أَنِ اشكُر لِلَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَشكُر فَإِنَّما يَشكُرُ لِنَفسِهِ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَنِيٌّ حَميدٌ
12.translation_eng: Certainly We gave Luqman wisdom, saying, ‘Give thanks to Allah; and whoever gives thanks, gives thanks only for his own sake. And whoever is ungrateful, [let him know that] Allah is indeed all-sufficient, all-laudable.’
12.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā luqmāna l-ḥikmata ʾani shkur li-llāhi wa-man yashkur fa-ʾinnamā yashkuru li-nafsihī wa-man kafara fa-ʾinna llāha ghaniyyun ḥamīdun

13.content: وَإِذ قالَ لُقمانُ لِابنِهِ وَهُوَ يَعِظُهُ يا بُنَيَّ لا تُشرِك بِاللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّ الشِّركَ لَظُلمٌ عَظيمٌ
13.translation_eng: When Luqman said to his son, as he advised him: ‘O my son! Do not ascribe any partners to Allah. Polytheism is indeed a great injustice.’
13.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qāla luqmānu li-bnihī wa-huwa yaʿiẓuhū yā-bunayya lā tushrik bi-llāhi ʾinna sh-shirka la-ẓulmun ʿaẓīmun

14.content: وَوَصَّينَا الإِنسانَ بِوالِدَيهِ حَمَلَتهُ أُمُّهُ وَهنًا عَلىٰ وَهنٍ وَفِصالُهُ في عامَينِ أَنِ اشكُر لي وَلِوالِدَيكَ إِلَيَّ المَصيرُ
14.translation_eng: We have enjoined man concerning his parents: His mother carried him through weakness upon weakness, and his weaning takes two years. Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is the return.
14.transliteration: wa-waṣṣaynā l-ʾinsāna bi-wālidayhi ḥamalathu ʾummuhū wahnan ʿalā wahnin wa-fiṣāluhū fī ʿāmayni ʾani shkur lī wa-li-wālidayka ʾilayya l-maṣīru

15.content: وَإِن جاهَداكَ عَلىٰ أَن تُشرِكَ بي ما لَيسَ لَكَ بِهِ عِلمٌ فَلا تُطِعهُما ۖ وَصاحِبهُما فِي الدُّنيا مَعروفًا ۖ وَاتَّبِع سَبيلَ مَن أَنابَ إِلَيَّ ۚ ثُمَّ إِلَيَّ مَرجِعُكُم فَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
15.translation_eng: But if they urge you to ascribe to Me as partner that of which you have no knowledge, then do not obey them. Keep their company honourably in this world and follow the way of him who turns to Me penitently. Then to Me will be your return, whereat I will inform you concerning what you used to do.
15.transliteration: wa-ʾin jāhadāka ʿalā ʾan tushrika bī mā laysa laka bihī ʿilmun fa-lā tuṭiʿhumā wa-ṣāḥibhumā fī d-dunyā maʿrūfan wa-ttabiʿ sabīla man ʾanāba ʾilayya thumma ʾilayya marjiʿukum fa-ʾunabbiʾukum bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna

16.content: يا بُنَيَّ إِنَّها إِن تَكُ مِثقالَ حَبَّةٍ مِن خَردَلٍ فَتَكُن في صَخرَةٍ أَو فِي السَّماواتِ أَو فِي الأَرضِ يَأتِ بِهَا اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَطيفٌ خَبيرٌ
16.translation_eng: ‘O my son! Even if it should be the weight of a mustard seed, and [even though] it should be in a rock, or in the heavens, or in the earth, Allah will produce it. Indeed Allah is all-attentive, all-aware.
16.transliteration: yā-bunayya ʾinnahā ʾin taku mithqāla ḥabbatin min khardalin fa-takun fī ṣakhratin ʾaw fī s-samāwāti ʾaw fī l-ʾarḍi yaʾti bihā llāhu ʾinna llāha laṭīfun khabīrun

17.content: يا بُنَيَّ أَقِمِ الصَّلاةَ وَأمُر بِالمَعروفِ وَانهَ عَنِ المُنكَرِ وَاصبِر عَلىٰ ما أَصابَكَ ۖ إِنَّ ذٰلِكَ مِن عَزمِ الأُمورِ
17.translation_eng: O my son! Maintain the prayer and bid what is right and forbid what is wrong, and be patient through whatever may visit you. That is indeed the steadiest of courses.
17.transliteration: yā-bunayya ʾaqimi ṣ-ṣalāta wa-ʾmur bi-l-maʿrūfi wa-nha ʿani l-munkari wa-ṣbir ʿalā mā ʾaṣābaka ʾinna dhālika min ʿazmi l-ʾumūri

18.content: وَلا تُصَعِّر خَدَّكَ لِلنّاسِ وَلا تَمشِ فِي الأَرضِ مَرَحًا ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُختالٍ فَخورٍ
18.translation_eng: Do not turn your cheek disdainfully from the people, and do not walk exultantly on the earth. Indeed Allah does not like any swaggering braggart.
18.transliteration: wa-lā tuṣaʿʿir khaddaka li-n-nāsi wa-lā tamshi fī l-ʾarḍi maraḥan ʾinna llāha lā yuḥibbu kulla mukhtālin fakhūrin

19.content: وَاقصِد في مَشيِكَ وَاغضُض مِن صَوتِكَ ۚ إِنَّ أَنكَرَ الأَصواتِ لَصَوتُ الحَميرِ
19.translation_eng: Be modest in your bearing, and lower your voice. Indeed the ungainliest of voices is the donkey’s voice.’
19.transliteration: wa-qṣid fī mashyika wa-ghḍuḍ min ṣawtika ʾinna ʾankara l-ʾaṣwāti la-ṣawtu l-ḥamīri

20.content: أَلَم تَرَوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ سَخَّرَ لَكُم ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ وَأَسبَغَ عَلَيكُم نِعَمَهُ ظاهِرَةً وَباطِنَةً ۗ وَمِنَ النّاسِ مَن يُجادِلُ فِي اللَّهِ بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ وَلا هُدًى وَلا كِتابٍ مُنيرٍ
20.translation_eng: Do you not see that Allah has disposed for you whatever there is in the heavens and whatever there is in the earth and He has showered upon you His blessings, the outward and the inward? Yet among the people are those who dispute concerning Allah without any knowledge or guidance or an illuminating scripture.
20.transliteration: ʾa-lam taraw ʾanna llāha sakhkhara lakum mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi wa-ʾasbagha ʿalaykum niʿamahū ẓāhiratan wa-bāṭinatan wa-mina n-nāsi man yujādilu fī llāhi bi-ghayri ʿilmin wa-lā hudan wa-lā kitābin munīrin

21.content: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُمُ اتَّبِعوا ما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ قالوا بَل نَتَّبِعُ ما وَجَدنا عَلَيهِ آباءَنا ۚ أَوَلَو كانَ الشَّيطانُ يَدعوهُم إِلىٰ عَذابِ السَّعيرِ
21.translation_eng: When they are told, ‘Follow what Allah has sent down,’ they say, ‘We will rather follow what we found our fathers following.’ What! Even if Satan be calling them to the punishment of the Blaze?
21.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā qīla lahumu ttabiʿū mā ʾanzala llāhu qālū bal nattabiʿu mā wajadnā ʿalayhi ʾābāʾanā ʾa-wa-law kāna sh-shayṭānu yadʿūhum ʾilā ʿadhābi s-saʿīri

22.content: ۞ وَمَن يُسلِم وَجهَهُ إِلَى اللَّهِ وَهُوَ مُحسِنٌ فَقَدِ استَمسَكَ بِالعُروَةِ الوُثقىٰ ۗ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ عاقِبَةُ الأُمورِ
22.translation_eng: Whoever surrenders his heart to Allah and is virtuous, has certainly held fast to the firmest handle, and with Allah lies the outcome of all matters.
22.transliteration: wa-man yuslim wajhahū ʾilā llāhi wa-huwa muḥsinun fa-qadi stamsaka bi-l-ʿurwati l-wuthqā wa-ʾilā llāhi ʿāqibatu l-ʾumūri

23.content: وَمَن كَفَرَ فَلا يَحزُنكَ كُفرُهُ ۚ إِلَينا مَرجِعُهُم فَنُنَبِّئُهُم بِما عَمِلوا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
23.translation_eng: As for those who are faithless, let their faithlessness not grieve you. To Us will be their return, and We will inform them about what they have done. Indeed Allah knows best what is in the breasts.
23.transliteration: wa-man kafara fa-lā yaḥzunka kufruhū ʾilaynā marjiʿuhum fa-nunabbiʾuhum bi-mā ʿamilū ʾinna llāha ʿalīmun bi-dhāti ṣ-ṣudūri

24.content: نُمَتِّعُهُم قَليلًا ثُمَّ نَضطَرُّهُم إِلىٰ عَذابٍ غَليظٍ
24.translation_eng: We will provide for them for a short time, then We will shove them toward a harsh punishment.
24.transliteration: numattiʿuhum qalīlan thumma naḍṭarruhum ʾilā ʿadhābin ghalīẓin

25.content: وَلَئِن سَأَلتَهُم مَن خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ لَيَقولُنَّ اللَّهُ ۚ قُلِ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
25.translation_eng: If you ask them, ‘Who created the heavens and the earth?’ they will surely say, ‘Allah.’ Say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah!’ Yet most of them do not know.
25.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin saʾaltahum man khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa la-yaqūlunna llāhu quli l-ḥamdu li-llāhi bal ʾaktharuhum lā yaʿlamūna

26.content: لِلَّهِ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الغَنِيُّ الحَميدُ
26.translation_eng: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Indeed Allah is the All-sufficient, the All-laudable.
26.transliteration: li-llāhi mā fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾinna llāha huwa l-ghaniyyu l-ḥamīdu

27.content: وَلَو أَنَّما فِي الأَرضِ مِن شَجَرَةٍ أَقلامٌ وَالبَحرُ يَمُدُّهُ مِن بَعدِهِ سَبعَةُ أَبحُرٍ ما نَفِدَت كَلِماتُ اللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزيزٌ حَكيمٌ
27.translation_eng: If all the trees on the earth were pens, and the sea replenished with seven more seas [were ink], the words of Allah would not be spent. Indeed Allah is all-mighty, all-wise.
27.transliteration: wa-law ʾannamā fī l-ʾarḍi min shajaratin ʾaqlāmun wa-l-baḥru yamudduhū min baʿdihī sabʿatu ʾabḥurin mā nafidat kalimātu llāhi ʾinna llāha ʿazīzun ḥakīmun

28.content: ما خَلقُكُم وَلا بَعثُكُم إِلّا كَنَفسٍ واحِدَةٍ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَميعٌ بَصيرٌ
28.translation_eng: Your creation and your resurrection are not but as of a single soul. Indeed Allah is all-hearing, all-seeing.
28.transliteration: mā khalqukum wa-lā baʿthukum ʾillā ka-nafsin wāḥidatin ʾinna llāha samīʿun baṣīrun

29.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يولِجُ اللَّيلَ فِي النَّهارِ وَيولِجُ النَّهارَ فِي اللَّيلِ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ كُلٌّ يَجري إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ بِما تَعمَلونَ خَبيرٌ
29.translation_eng: Have you not regarded that Allah makes the night pass into the day and makes the day pass into the night; and He has disposed the sun and the moon, each moving for a specified term, and that Allah is well aware of what you do?
29.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾanna llāha yūliju l-layla fī n-nahāri wa-yūliju n-nahāra fī l-layli wa-sakhkhara sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara kullun yajrī ʾilā ʾajalin musamman wa-ʾanna llāha bi-mā taʿmalūna khabīrun

30.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الحَقُّ وَأَنَّ ما يَدعونَ مِن دونِهِ الباطِلُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ العَلِيُّ الكَبيرُ
30.translation_eng: That is because Allah is the Reality,1 and whatever they invoke besides Him is nullity,2 and because Allah is the All-exalted, the All-great.Or ‘That is because Allah is the Truth.’Or ‘what they invoke besides Him is falsehood.’
30.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾanna llāha huwa l-ḥaqqu wa-ʾanna mā yadʿūna min dūnihi l-bāṭilu wa-ʾanna llāha huwa l-ʿaliyyu l-kabīru

31.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ الفُلكَ تَجري فِي البَحرِ بِنِعمَتِ اللَّهِ لِيُرِيَكُم مِن آياتِهِ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِكُلِّ صَبّارٍ شَكورٍ
31.translation_eng: Have you not regarded that the ships sail at sea by Allah’s blessing, that He may show you some of His signs? There are indeed signs in that for every patient and grateful [servant].
31.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾanna l-fulka tajrī fī l-baḥri bi-niʿmati llāhi li-yuriyakum min ʾāyātihī ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-kulli ṣabbārin shakūrin

32.content: وَإِذا غَشِيَهُم مَوجٌ كَالظُّلَلِ دَعَوُا اللَّهَ مُخلِصينَ لَهُ الدّينَ فَلَمّا نَجّاهُم إِلَى البَرِّ فَمِنهُم مُقتَصِدٌ ۚ وَما يَجحَدُ بِآياتِنا إِلّا كُلُّ خَتّارٍ كَفورٍ
32.translation_eng: When waves cover them like awnings, they invoke Allah, putting exclusive faith in Him. But when He delivers them towards land, [only] some of them remain unswerving. And no one will impugn Our signs except an ungrateful traitor.
32.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā ghashiyahum mawjun ka-ẓ-ẓulali daʿawu llāha mukhliṣīna lahu d-dīna fa-lammā najjāhum ʾilā l-barri fa-minhum muqtaṣidun wa-mā yajḥadu bi-ʾāyātinā ʾillā kullu khattārin kafūrin

33.content: يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ اتَّقوا رَبَّكُم وَاخشَوا يَومًا لا يَجزي والِدٌ عَن وَلَدِهِ وَلا مَولودٌ هُوَ جازٍ عَن والِدِهِ شَيئًا ۚ إِنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ ۖ فَلا تَغُرَّنَّكُمُ الحَياةُ الدُّنيا وَلا يَغُرَّنَّكُم بِاللَّهِ الغَرورُ
33.translation_eng: O mankind! Be wary of your Lord and fear the day when a father shall not atone for his child, nor the child shall atone for its father in any wise. Indeed Allah’s promise is true. So do not let the life of the world deceive you, nor let the Deceiver1 deceive you concerning Allah.That is, Satan, or anything that diverts a human being from the path of Allah.
33.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ttaqū rabbakum wa-khshaw yawman lā yajzī wālidun ʿan waladihī wa-lā mawlūdun huwa jāzin ʿan wālidihī shayʾan ʾinna waʿda llāhi ḥaqqun fa-lā taghurrannakumu l-ḥayātu d-dunyā wa-lā yaghurrannakum bi-llāhi l-gharūru

34.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ عِندَهُ عِلمُ السّاعَةِ وَيُنَزِّلُ الغَيثَ وَيَعلَمُ ما فِي الأَرحامِ ۖ وَما تَدري نَفسٌ ماذا تَكسِبُ غَدًا ۖ وَما تَدري نَفسٌ بِأَيِّ أَرضٍ تَموتُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَليمٌ خَبيرٌ
34.translation_eng: Indeed the knowledge of the Hour is with Allah. He sends down the rain, and He knows what is in the wombs. No soul knows what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul knows in what land it will die. Indeed Allah is all-knowing, all-aware.
34.transliteration: ʾinna llāha ʿindahū ʿilmu s-sāʿati wa-yunazzilu l-ghaytha wa-yaʿlamu mā fī l-ʾarḥāmi wa-mā tadrī nafsun mādhā taksibu ghadan wa-mā tadrī nafsun bi-ʾayyi ʾarḍin tamūtu ʾinna llāha ʿalīmun khabīrun

32.description: The only surah beginning with the discrete Arabic letters Alif Lām Mīm that also contains a ayah which requires one who recites it to perform a Prostration of bowing down to the ground before God in worship at the mention of God’s revealed signs. It takes its name from verse 15 which mentions “prostration” (sajdah). The surah emphasized the truth of the Quran at the beginning, and the Prophet is urged at the end of the surah to pay no attention to the disbelievers who cannot see the significance of God’s signs.The surah is also known as: Bowing Down, Bowing down in Worship, The Adoration, Worship.

1.translation_eng: Alif, Lām, Mīm.

2.content: تَنزيلُ الكِتابِ لا رَيبَ فيهِ مِن رَبِّ العالَمينَ
2.translation_eng: The [gradual] sending down of the Book, there is no doubt in it, is from the Lord of all the worlds.
2.transliteration: tanzīlu l-kitābi lā rayba fīhi min rabbi l-ʿālamīna

3.content: أَم يَقولونَ افتَراهُ ۚ بَل هُوَ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكَ لِتُنذِرَ قَومًا ما أَتاهُم مِن نَذيرٍ مِن قَبلِكَ لَعَلَّهُم يَهتَدونَ
3.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘He has fabricated it’? Rather it is the truth from your Lord, that you may warn a people to whom there did not come any warner before you, so that they may be guided [to the right path].
3.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna ftarāhu bal huwa l-ḥaqqu min rabbika li-tundhira qawman mā ʾatāhum min nadhīrin min qablika laʿallahum yahtadūna

4.content: اللَّهُ الَّذي خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما في سِتَّةِ أَيّامٍ ثُمَّ استَوىٰ عَلَى العَرشِ ۖ ما لَكُم مِن دونِهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلا شَفيعٍ ۚ أَفَلا تَتَذَكَّرونَ
4.translation_eng: It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days,1 then He settled on the Throne. You do not have besides Him any guardian or intercessor. Will you not then take admonition?That is, in six periods of time. Cf. 57:4.
4.transliteration: allāhu lladhī khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-mā baynahumā fī sittati ʾayyāmin thumma stawā ʿalā l-ʿarshi mā lakum min dūnihī min waliyyin wa-lā shafīʿin ʾa-fa-lā tatadhakkarūna

5.content: يُدَبِّرُ الأَمرَ مِنَ السَّماءِ إِلَى الأَرضِ ثُمَّ يَعرُجُ إِلَيهِ في يَومٍ كانَ مِقدارُهُ أَلفَ سَنَةٍ مِمّا تَعُدّونَ
5.translation_eng: He directs the command1 from the heaven to the earth; then it ascends toward Him in a day2 whose span is a thousand years by your reckoning.Cf. 10:3, 31; 13:2.That is, in a period of time.
5.transliteration: yudabbiru l-ʾamra mina s-samāʾi ʾilā l-ʾarḍi thumma yaʿruju ʾilayhi fī yawmin kāna miqdāruhū ʾalfa sanatin mimmā taʿuddūna

6.content: ذٰلِكَ عالِمُ الغَيبِ وَالشَّهادَةِ العَزيزُ الرَّحيمُ
6.translation_eng: That is the Knower of the sensible and the Unseen, the All-mighty, the All-merciful,
6.transliteration: dhālika ʿālimu l-ghaybi wa-sh-shahādati l-ʿazīzu r-raḥīmu

7.content: الَّذي أَحسَنَ كُلَّ شَيءٍ خَلَقَهُ ۖ وَبَدَأَ خَلقَ الإِنسانِ مِن طينٍ
7.translation_eng: who perfected everything that He created, and commenced man’s creation from clay.
7.transliteration: alladhī ʾaḥsana kulla shayʾin khalaqahū wa-badaʾa khalqa l-ʾinsāni min ṭīnin

8.content: ثُمَّ جَعَلَ نَسلَهُ مِن سُلالَةٍ مِن ماءٍ مَهينٍ
8.translation_eng: Then He made his progeny from an extract of a base fluid.
8.transliteration: thumma jaʿala naslahū min sulālatin min māʾin mahīnin

9.content: ثُمَّ سَوّاهُ وَنَفَخَ فيهِ مِن روحِهِ ۖ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمعَ وَالأَبصارَ وَالأَفئِدَةَ ۚ قَليلًا ما تَشكُرونَ
9.translation_eng: Then He proportioned him and breathed into him of His Spirit, and made for you the hearing, the sight, and the hearts. Little do you thank.
9.transliteration: thumma sawwāhu wa-nafakha fīhi min rūḥihī wa-jaʿala lakumu s-samʿa wa-l-ʾabṣāra wa-l-ʾafʾidata qalīlan mā tashkurūna

10.content: وَقالوا أَإِذا ضَلَلنا فِي الأَرضِ أَإِنّا لَفي خَلقٍ جَديدٍ ۚ بَل هُم بِلِقاءِ رَبِّهِم كافِرونَ
10.translation_eng: They say, ‘When we have been lost in the dust,1 shall we be indeed created anew?’ Rather they disbelieve in the encounter with their Lord.That is, ‘Shall we be brought forth again after our bodies have decomposed and all traces of our physical remains have disappeared in the ground?’
10.transliteration: wa-qālū ʾa-ʾidhā ḍalalnā fī l-ʾarḍi ʾa-ʾinnā la-fī khalqin jadīdin bal hum bi-liqāʾi rabbihim kāfirūna

11.content: ۞ قُل يَتَوَفّاكُم مَلَكُ المَوتِ الَّذي وُكِّلَ بِكُم ثُمَّ إِلىٰ رَبِّكُم تُرجَعونَ
11.translation_eng: Say, ‘You will be taken away by the angel of death, who has been charged with you. Then you will be brought back to your Lord.’
11.transliteration: qul yatawaffākum malaku l-mawti lladhī wukkila bikum thumma ʾilā rabbikum turjaʿūna

12.content: وَلَو تَرىٰ إِذِ المُجرِمونَ ناكِسو رُءوسِهِم عِندَ رَبِّهِم رَبَّنا أَبصَرنا وَسَمِعنا فَارجِعنا نَعمَل صالِحًا إِنّا موقِنونَ
12.translation_eng: Were you to see when the guilty hang their heads before their Lord [confessing], ‘Our Lord! We have seen and heard. Send us back so that we may act righteously. Indeed we are [now] convinced.’
12.transliteration: wa-law tarā ʾidhi l-mujrimūna nākisū ruʾūsihim ʿinda rabbihim rabbanā ʾabṣarnā wa-samiʿnā fa-rjiʿnā naʿmal ṣāliḥan ʾinnā mūqinūna

13.content: وَلَو شِئنا لَآتَينا كُلَّ نَفسٍ هُداها وَلٰكِن حَقَّ القَولُ مِنّي لَأَملَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنَ الجِنَّةِ وَالنّاسِ أَجمَعينَ
13.translation_eng: Had We wished We would have given every soul its guidance, but My word became due [against the defiant]: ‘Surely I will fill hell with all the [guilty] jinn and humans.’1Cf. 7:18; 11:119; 38:85.
13.transliteration: wa-law shiʾnā la-ʾātaynā kulla nafsin hudāhā wa-lākin ḥaqqa l-qawlu minnī la-ʾamlaʾanna jahannama mina l-jinnati wa-n-nāsi ʾajmaʿīna

14.content: فَذوقوا بِما نَسيتُم لِقاءَ يَومِكُم هٰذا إِنّا نَسيناكُم ۖ وَذوقوا عَذابَ الخُلدِ بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
14.translation_eng: So taste [the punishment] for your having forgotten the encounter of this day of yours. We [too] have forgotten you. Taste the everlasting punishment because of what you used to do.
14.transliteration: fa-dhūqū bi-mā nasītum liqāʾa yawmikum hādhā ʾinnā nasīnākum wa-dhūqū ʿadhāba l-khuldi bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna

15.content: إِنَّما يُؤمِنُ بِآياتِنَا الَّذينَ إِذا ذُكِّروا بِها خَرّوا سُجَّدًا وَسَبَّحوا بِحَمدِ رَبِّهِم وَهُم لا يَستَكبِرونَ ۩
15.translation_eng: Only those believe in Our signs who, when they are reminded of them, fall down in prostration and celebrate the praise of their Lord, and they are not arrogant.
15.transliteration: ʾinnamā yuʾminu bi-ʾāyātinā lladhīna ʾidhā dhukkirū bihā kharrū sujjadan wa-sabbaḥū bi-ḥamdi rabbihim wa-hum lā yastakbirūna

16.content: تَتَجافىٰ جُنوبُهُم عَنِ المَضاجِعِ يَدعونَ رَبَّهُم خَوفًا وَطَمَعًا وَمِمّا رَزَقناهُم يُنفِقونَ
16.translation_eng: Their sides vacate their beds1 to supplicate their Lord in fear and hope, and they spend out of what We have provided them.That is, they abandon their beds at night and forgo the pleasure of sleep to worship their Lord in a state of fear and hope.
16.transliteration: tatajāfā junūbuhum ʿani l-maḍājiʿi yadʿūna rabbahum khawfan wa-ṭamaʿan wa-mimmā razaqnāhum yunfiqūna

17.content: فَلا تَعلَمُ نَفسٌ ما أُخفِيَ لَهُم مِن قُرَّةِ أَعيُنٍ جَزاءً بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
17.translation_eng: No one knows what has been kept hidden for them of comfort as a reward for what they used to do.
17.transliteration: fa-lā taʿlamu nafsun mā ʾukhfiya lahum min qurrati ʾaʿyunin jazāʾan bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūna

18.content: أَفَمَن كانَ مُؤمِنًا كَمَن كانَ فاسِقًا ۚ لا يَستَوونَ
18.translation_eng: Is someone who is faithful like someone who is a transgressor? They are not equal.
18.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man kāna muʾminan ka-man kāna fāsiqan lā yastawūna

19.content: أَمَّا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ فَلَهُم جَنّاتُ المَأوىٰ نُزُلًا بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
19.translation_eng: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds, for them are gardens of the Abode —a hospitality for what they used to do.
19.transliteration: ʾammā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti fa-lahum jannātu l-maʾwā nuzulan bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūna

20.content: وَأَمَّا الَّذينَ فَسَقوا فَمَأواهُمُ النّارُ ۖ كُلَّما أَرادوا أَن يَخرُجوا مِنها أُعيدوا فيها وَقيلَ لَهُم ذوقوا عَذابَ النّارِ الَّذي كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبونَ
20.translation_eng: As for those who have transgressed, their refuge is the Fire. Whenever they seek to leave it, they will be turned back into it, and they will be told: ‘Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny.’
20.transliteration: wa-ʾammā lladhīna fasaqū fa-maʾwāhumu n-nāru kullamā ʾarādū ʾan yakhrujū minhā ʾuʿīdū fīhā wa-qīla lahum dhūqū ʿadhāba n-nāri lladhī kuntum bihī tukadhdhibūna

21.content: وَلَنُذيقَنَّهُم مِنَ العَذابِ الأَدنىٰ دونَ العَذابِ الأَكبَرِ لَعَلَّهُم يَرجِعونَ
21.translation_eng: We shall surely make them taste the nearer punishment before the greater punishment,1 so that they may come back.2Or ‘this side of the greater punishment,’ or ‘aside from the greater punishment.’By ‘the nearer punishment’ is meant the afflictions and hardships the faithless may be made to suffer in the world with the purpose of bringing them back to Allah and in order to save them from the greater punishment of the Hereafter.
21.transliteration: wa-la-nudhīqannahum mina l-ʿadhābi l-ʾadnā dūna l-ʿadhābi l-ʾakbari laʿallahum yarjiʿūna

22.content: وَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِآياتِ رَبِّهِ ثُمَّ أَعرَضَ عَنها ۚ إِنّا مِنَ المُجرِمينَ مُنتَقِمونَ
22.translation_eng: Who is a greater wrongdoer than him who is reminded of his Lord’s signs, whereat he disregards them? Indeed We shall take vengeance upon the guilty.
22.transliteration: wa-man ʾaẓlamu mimman dhukkira bi-ʾāyāti rabbihī thumma ʾaʿraḍa ʿanhā ʾinnā mina l-mujrimīna muntaqimūna

23.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسَى الكِتابَ فَلا تَكُن في مِريَةٍ مِن لِقائِهِ ۖ وَجَعَلناهُ هُدًى لِبَني إِسرائيلَ
23.translation_eng: Certainly We gave Moses the Book, [declaring], ‘Do not be in doubt about the encounter with Him,’ and We made it a [source of] guidance for the Children of Israel.
23.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā mūsā l-kitāba fa-lā takun fī miryatin min liqāʾihī wa-jaʿalnāhu hudan li-banī ʾisrāʾīla

24.content: وَجَعَلنا مِنهُم أَئِمَّةً يَهدونَ بِأَمرِنا لَمّا صَبَروا ۖ وَكانوا بِآياتِنا يوقِنونَ
24.translation_eng: And amongst them We appointed imams to guide [the people] by Our command, when they had been patient and had conviction in Our signs.
24.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā minhum ʾaʾimmatan yahdūna bi-ʾamrinā lammā ṣabarū wa-kānū bi-ʾāyātinā yūqinūna

25.content: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَفصِلُ بَينَهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ فيما كانوا فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
25.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that about which they used to differ.
25.transliteration: ʾinna rabbaka huwa yafṣilu baynahum yawma l-qiyāmati fī-mā kānū fīhi yakhtalifūna

26.content: أَوَلَم يَهدِ لَهُم كَم أَهلَكنا مِن قَبلِهِم مِنَ القُرونِ يَمشونَ في مَساكِنِهِم ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ ۖ أَفَلا يَسمَعونَ
26.translation_eng: Does it not dawn upon them how many generations We have destroyed before them, amid [the ruins of] whose dwellings they walk? There are indeed signs in that. Will they not then listen?
26.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yahdi lahum kam ʾahlaknā min qablihim mina l-qurūni yamshūna fī masākinihim ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin ʾa-fa-lā yasmaʿūna

27.content: أَوَلَم يَرَوا أَنّا نَسوقُ الماءَ إِلَى الأَرضِ الجُرُزِ فَنُخرِجُ بِهِ زَرعًا تَأكُلُ مِنهُ أَنعامُهُم وَأَنفُسُهُم ۖ أَفَلا يُبصِرونَ
27.translation_eng: Do they not see that We carry water to the parched earth and with it We bring forth crops of which they eat, themselves and their cattle? Will they not then see?
27.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾannā nasūqu l-māʾa ʾilā l-ʾarḍi l-juruzi fa-nukhriju bihī zarʿan taʾkulu minhu ʾanʿāmuhum wa-ʾanfusuhum ʾa-fa-lā yubṣirūna

28.content: وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هٰذَا الفَتحُ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
28.translation_eng: And they say, ‘When will this judgement be, should you be truthful?’
28.transliteration: wa-yaqūlūna matā hādhā l-fatḥu ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

29.content: قُل يَومَ الفَتحِ لا يَنفَعُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إيمانُهُم وَلا هُم يُنظَرونَ
29.translation_eng: Say, ‘On the day of judgement their [newly found] faith shall not avail the faithless, nor will they be granted any respite.’
29.transliteration: qul yawma l-fatḥi lā yanfaʿu lladhīna kafarū ʾīmānuhum wa-lā hum yunẓarūna

30.content: فَأَعرِض عَنهُم وَانتَظِر إِنَّهُم مُنتَظِرونَ
30.translation_eng: So turn away from them, and wait. They too are waiting.
30.transliteration: fa-ʾaʿriḍ ʿanhum wa-ntaẓir ʾinnahum muntaẓirūna

33.description: The surah that mentions The Confederates of the unbelievers, who besieged Medina, with an overwhelming force, but whom God routed with winds and a sandstorm in what became known as the Battle of the Ditch (in reference to the digging of a wide trench around the city as a barrier to invasion, an unprecedented practice in Arabia) in AH 5/627 CE (verse 9 .). It takes its name from verse 20 which refers to the campaign of the “confederates” (aḥzāb) against the Prophet. The believers dug a ditch, which the disbelievers were unable to cross, and eventually the enemy retreated in disarray. This is mentioned in order to remind the believers of God’s goodness to them, so that they may obey the numerous instructions given in the surah, starting with the regulation of adoption and including proper conduct towards the Prophet, his Ahl al-Bayt and his wives. The hypocrites are warned to stop their bad behaviour.The surah is also known as: The Allied Troops, The Coalition, The Confederate Tribes, The Confederaters, The Federated Clans, The Joint Forces.

1.content: يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ اتَّقِ اللَّهَ وَلا تُطِعِ الكافِرينَ وَالمُنافِقينَ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كانَ عَليمًا حَكيمًا
1.translation_eng: O Prophet! Be wary of Allah and do not obey the faithless and the hypocrites. Indeed Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
1.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nabiyyu ttaqi llāha wa-lā tuṭiʿi l-kāfirīna wa-l-munāfiqīna ʾinna llāha kāna ʿalīman ḥakīman

2.content: وَاتَّبِع ما يوحىٰ إِلَيكَ مِن رَبِّكَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كانَ بِما تَعمَلونَ خَبيرًا
2.translation_eng: And follow that which is revealed to you from your Lord. Indeed Allah is well aware of what you do.
2.transliteration: wa-ttabiʿ mā yūḥā ʾilayka min rabbika ʾinna llāha kāna bi-mā taʿmalūna khabīran

3.content: وَتَوَكَّل عَلَى اللَّهِ ۚ وَكَفىٰ بِاللَّهِ وَكيلًا
3.translation_eng: And put your trust in Allah; Allah suffices as trustee.
3.transliteration: wa-tawakkal ʿalā llāhi wa-kafā bi-llāhi wakīlan

4.content: ما جَعَلَ اللَّهُ لِرَجُلٍ مِن قَلبَينِ في جَوفِهِ ۚ وَما جَعَلَ أَزواجَكُمُ اللّائي تُظاهِرونَ مِنهُنَّ أُمَّهاتِكُم ۚ وَما جَعَلَ أَدعِياءَكُم أَبناءَكُم ۚ ذٰلِكُم قَولُكُم بِأَفواهِكُم ۖ وَاللَّهُ يَقولُ الحَقَّ وَهُوَ يَهدِي السَّبيلَ
4.translation_eng: Allah has not put two hearts within any man, nor has He made your wives whom you repudiate by ẓihār1 your mothers, nor has he made your adopted sons your sons. These are mere utterances of your mouths. But Allah speaks the truth and He guides to the way.A kind of repudiation of the marital relationship among pre-Islamic Arabs which took place on a husband’s saying to his wife ‘Be as my mother’s back’ (ẓahr; hence the derivative ẓihār). Concerning the revocation of such a divorce and the atonement prescribed, see 58:1-4.
4.transliteration: mā jaʿala llāhu li-rajulin min qalbayni fī jawfihī wa-mā jaʿala ʾazwājakumu llāʾī tuẓāhirūna minhunna ʾummahātikum wa-mā jaʿala ʾadʿiyāʾakum ʾabnāʾakum dhālikum qawlukum bi-ʾafwāhikum wa-llāhu yaqūlu l-ḥaqqa wa-huwa yahdī s-sabīla

5.content: ادعوهُم لِآبائِهِم هُوَ أَقسَطُ عِندَ اللَّهِ ۚ فَإِن لَم تَعلَموا آباءَهُم فَإِخوانُكُم فِي الدّينِ وَمَواليكُم ۚ وَلَيسَ عَلَيكُم جُناحٌ فيما أَخطَأتُم بِهِ وَلٰكِن ما تَعَمَّدَت قُلوبُكُم ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ غَفورًا رَحيمًا
5.translation_eng: Call them after their fathers. That is more just with Allah. And if you do not know their fathers, then they are your brethren in the faith and your kinsmen. There will be no sin upon you for any mistake that you may make therein, barring what your hearts may premeditate. And Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
5.transliteration: udʿūhum li-ʾābāʾihim huwa ʾaqsaṭu ʿinda llāhi fa-ʾin lam taʿlamū ʾābāʾahum fa-ʾikhwānukum fī d-dīni wa-mawālīkum wa-laysa ʿalaykum junāḥun fī-mā ʾakhṭaʾtum bihī wa-lākin mā taʿammadat qulūbukum wa-kāna llāhu ghafūran raḥīman-i

6.content: النَّبِيُّ أَولىٰ بِالمُؤمِنينَ مِن أَنفُسِهِم ۖ وَأَزواجُهُ أُمَّهاتُهُم ۗ وَأُولُو الأَرحامِ بَعضُهُم أَولىٰ بِبَعضٍ في كِتابِ اللَّهِ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ وَالمُهاجِرينَ إِلّا أَن تَفعَلوا إِلىٰ أَولِيائِكُم مَعروفًا ۚ كانَ ذٰلِكَ فِي الكِتابِ مَسطورًا
6.translation_eng: The Prophet is closer to the faithful than their own souls,1 and his wives are their mothers. The blood relatives are more entitled to inherit from one another in the Book of Allah2 than the [other] faithful and Emigrants,3 barring any favour you may do your comrades.4 This has been written in the Book.Or ‘The Prophet has a greater right (or a greater authority) over the faithful than they have over their own selves.’That is, with respect to the right of inheritance.Or ‘The blood relations have a greater right to inherit from one another than the rest of the faithful and Emigrants.’That is, by making a bequest in their favour.
6.transliteration: an-nabiyyu ʾawlā bi-l-muʾminīna min ʾanfusihim wa-ʾazwājuhū ʾummahātuhum wa-ʾulū l-ʾarḥāmi baʿḍuhum ʾawlā bi-baʿḍin fī kitābi llāhi mina l-muʾminīna wa-l-muhājirīna ʾillā ʾan tafʿalū ʾilā ʾawliyāʾikum maʿrūfan kāna dhālika fī l-kitābi masṭūran

7.content: وَإِذ أَخَذنا مِنَ النَّبِيّينَ ميثاقَهُم وَمِنكَ وَمِن نوحٍ وَإِبراهيمَ وَموسىٰ وَعيسَى ابنِ مَريَمَ ۖ وَأَخَذنا مِنهُم ميثاقًا غَليظًا
7.translation_eng: [Recall] when We took a pledge from the prophets, and from you and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus son of Mary, and We took from them a solemn pledge,
7.transliteration: wa-ʾidh ʾakhadhnā mina n-nabiyyīna mīthāqahum wa-minka wa-min nūḥin wa-ʾibrāhīma wa-mūsā wa-ʿīsā bni maryama wa-ʾakhadhnā minhum mīthāqan ghalīẓan

8.content: لِيَسأَلَ الصّادِقينَ عَن صِدقِهِم ۚ وَأَعَدَّ لِلكافِرينَ عَذابًا أَليمًا
8.translation_eng: so that He may question the truthful concerning their truthfulness. And He has prepared for the faithless a painful punishment.
8.transliteration: li-yasʾala ṣ-ṣādiqīna ʿan ṣidqihim wa-ʾaʿadda li-l-kāfirīna ʿadhāban ʾalīman

9.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا اذكُروا نِعمَةَ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم إِذ جاءَتكُم جُنودٌ فَأَرسَلنا عَلَيهِم ريحًا وَجُنودًا لَم تَرَوها ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ بَصيرًا
9.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Remember Allah’s blessing upon you when the hosts came at you, and We sent against them a gale and hosts whom you did not see. And Allah sees best what you do.
9.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū dhkurū niʿmata llāhi ʿalaykum ʾidh jāʾatkum junūdun fa-ʾarsalnā ʿalayhim rīḥan wa-junūdan lam tarawhā wa-kāna llāhu bi-mā taʿmalūna baṣīran

10.content: إِذ جاءوكُم مِن فَوقِكُم وَمِن أَسفَلَ مِنكُم وَإِذ زاغَتِ الأَبصارُ وَبَلَغَتِ القُلوبُ الحَناجِرَ وَتَظُنّونَ بِاللَّهِ الظُّنونا
10.translation_eng: When they came at you from above and below you,1 and when the eyes rolled [with fear] and the hearts leapt to the throats, and you entertained misgivings about Allah,That is, from the higher side of the valley, to the east of Madinah, and from the lower side of it towards the west.
10.transliteration: ʾidh jāʾūkum min fawqikum wa-min ʾasfala minkum wa-ʾidh zāghati l-ʾabṣāru wa-balaghati l-qulūbu l-ḥanājira wa-taẓunnūna bi-llāhi ẓ-ẓunūna

11.content: هُنالِكَ ابتُلِيَ المُؤمِنونَ وَزُلزِلوا زِلزالًا شَديدًا
11.translation_eng: it was there that the faithful were tested and jolted with a severe agitation.
11.transliteration: hunālika btuliya l-muʾminūna wa-zulzilū zilzālan shadīdan

12.content: وَإِذ يَقولُ المُنافِقونَ وَالَّذينَ في قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ ما وَعَدَنَا اللَّهُ وَرَسولُهُ إِلّا غُرورًا
12.translation_eng: And when the hypocrites were saying, as well as those in whose hearts is a sickness, ‘Allah and His Apostle did not promise us [anything] except delusion.’
12.transliteration: wa-ʾidh yaqūlu l-munāfiqūna wa-lladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun mā waʿadanā llāhu wa-rasūluhū ʾillā ghurūran

13.content: وَإِذ قالَت طائِفَةٌ مِنهُم يا أَهلَ يَثرِبَ لا مُقامَ لَكُم فَارجِعوا ۚ وَيَستَأذِنُ فَريقٌ مِنهُمُ النَّبِيَّ يَقولونَ إِنَّ بُيوتَنا عَورَةٌ وَما هِيَ بِعَورَةٍ ۖ إِن يُريدونَ إِلّا فِرارًا
13.translation_eng: And when a group of them said, ‘O people of Yathrib! [This is] not a place for you,1 so go back!’2 And a group of them sought the Prophet’s permission, saying, ‘Our homes lie exposed3 [to the enemy],’ although they were not exposed. They only sought to flee.That is, there is no chance of your withstanding the army of the polytheists.That is, return to your earlier creed, or go back to your homes.Or ‘unprotected.’
13.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qālat ṭāʾifatun minhum yā-ʾahla yathriba lā muqāma lakum fa-rjiʿū wa-yastaʾdhinu farīqun minhumu n-nabiyya yaqūlūna ʾinna buyūtanā ʿawratun wa-mā hiya bi-ʿawratin ʾin yurīdūna ʾillā firāran

14.content: وَلَو دُخِلَت عَلَيهِم مِن أَقطارِها ثُمَّ سُئِلُوا الفِتنَةَ لَآتَوها وَما تَلَبَّثوا بِها إِلّا يَسيرًا
14.translation_eng: Had they been invaded from its flanks1 and had they been asked to apostatize, they would have done so with only a mild hesitation,That is, of the city Madīnah.
14.transliteration: wa-law dukhilat ʿalayhim min ʾaqṭārihā thumma suʾilū l-fitnata la-ʾātawhā wa-mā talabbathū bihā ʾillā yasīran

15.content: وَلَقَد كانوا عاهَدُوا اللَّهَ مِن قَبلُ لا يُوَلّونَ الأَدبارَ ۚ وَكانَ عَهدُ اللَّهِ مَسئولًا
15.translation_eng: though they had certainly pledged to Allah before that they would not turn their backs [to flee], and pledges given to Allah are accountable.
15.transliteration: wa-la-qad kānū ʿāhadū llāha min qablu lā yuwallūna l-ʾadbāra wa-kāna ʿahdu llāhi masʾūlan

16.content: قُل لَن يَنفَعَكُمُ الفِرارُ إِن فَرَرتُم مِنَ المَوتِ أَوِ القَتلِ وَإِذًا لا تُمَتَّعونَ إِلّا قَليلًا
16.translation_eng: Say, ‘Flight will not avail you should you flee from death or from being killed, and then you will be let to enjoy only for a little while.’
16.transliteration: qul lan yanfaʿakumu l-firāru ʾin farartum mina l-mawti ʾawi l-qatli wa-ʾidhan lā tumattaʿūna ʾillā qalīlan

17.content: قُل مَن ذَا الَّذي يَعصِمُكُم مِنَ اللَّهِ إِن أَرادَ بِكُم سوءًا أَو أَرادَ بِكُم رَحمَةً ۚ وَلا يَجِدونَ لَهُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ وَلِيًّا وَلا نَصيرًا
17.translation_eng: Say, ‘Who is it that can protect you from Allah should He desire to cause you ill, or desire to grant you mercy?’ They will not find for themselves any protector or helper besides Allah.
17.transliteration: qul man dhā lladhī yaʿṣimukum mina llāhi ʾin ʾarāda bikum sūʾan ʾaw ʾarāda bikum raḥmatan wa-lā yajidūna lahum min dūni llāhi waliyyan wa-lā naṣīran

18.content: ۞ قَد يَعلَمُ اللَّهُ المُعَوِّقينَ مِنكُم وَالقائِلينَ لِإِخوانِهِم هَلُمَّ إِلَينا ۖ وَلا يَأتونَ البَأسَ إِلّا قَليلًا
18.translation_eng: Allah knows those of you who discourage others, and those who say to their brethren, ‘Come to us!’ and they take little part in the battle,
18.transliteration: qad yaʿlamu llāhu l-muʿawwiqīna minkum wa-l-qāʾilīna li-ʾikhwānihim halumma ʾilaynā wa-lā yaʾtūna l-baʾsa ʾillā qalīlan

19.content: أَشِحَّةً عَلَيكُم ۖ فَإِذا جاءَ الخَوفُ رَأَيتَهُم يَنظُرونَ إِلَيكَ تَدورُ أَعيُنُهُم كَالَّذي يُغشىٰ عَلَيهِ مِنَ المَوتِ ۖ فَإِذا ذَهَبَ الخَوفُ سَلَقوكُم بِأَلسِنَةٍ حِدادٍ أَشِحَّةً عَلَى الخَيرِ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ لَم يُؤمِنوا فَأَحبَطَ اللَّهُ أَعمالَهُم ۚ وَكانَ ذٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسيرًا
19.translation_eng: grudging you [their help]. So when there is panic, you see them observing you, their eyes rolling, like someone fainting at death. Then, when the panic is over, they scald you with [their] sharp tongues in their greed for riches. They never have had faith. So Allah has made their works fail, and that is easy for Allah.
19.transliteration: ʾashiḥḥatan ʿalaykum fa-ʾidhā jāʾa l-khawfu raʾaytahum yanẓurūna ʾilayka tadūru ʾaʿyunuhum ka-lladhī yughshā ʿalayhi mina l-mawti fa-ʾidhā dhahaba l-khawfu salaqūkum bi-ʾalsinatin ḥidādin ʾashiḥḥatan ʿalā l-khayri ʾulāʾika lam yuʾminū fa-ʾaḥbaṭa llāhu ʾaʿmālahum wa-kāna dhālika ʿalā llāhi yasīran

20.content: يَحسَبونَ الأَحزابَ لَم يَذهَبوا ۖ وَإِن يَأتِ الأَحزابُ يَوَدّوا لَو أَنَّهُم بادونَ فِي الأَعرابِ يَسأَلونَ عَن أَنبائِكُم ۖ وَلَو كانوا فيكُم ما قاتَلوا إِلّا قَليلًا
20.translation_eng: They suppose the confederates have not left yet, and were the confederates to come [again], they would wish they were in the desert with the Bedouins asking about your news, and if they were with you they would fight but a little.
20.transliteration: yaḥsabūna l-ʾaḥzāba lam yadhhabū wa-ʾin yaʾti l-ʾaḥzābu yawaddū law ʾannahum bādūna fī l-ʾaʿrābi yasʾalūna ʿan ʾanbāʾikum wa-law kānū fīkum mā qātalū ʾillā qalīlan

21.content: لَقَد كانَ لَكُم في رَسولِ اللَّهِ أُسوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌ لِمَن كانَ يَرجُو اللَّهَ وَاليَومَ الآخِرَ وَذَكَرَ اللَّهَ كَثيرًا
21.translation_eng: In the Apostle of Allah there is certainly for you a good exemplar, for those who look forward to Allah and the Last Day, and remember Allah greatly.
21.transliteration: la-qad kāna lakum fī rasūli llāhi ʾuswatun ḥasanatun li-man kāna yarjū llāha wa-l-yawma l-ʾākhira wa-dhakara llāha kathīran

22.content: وَلَمّا رَأَى المُؤمِنونَ الأَحزابَ قالوا هٰذا ما وَعَدَنَا اللَّهُ وَرَسولُهُ وَصَدَقَ اللَّهُ وَرَسولُهُ ۚ وَما زادَهُم إِلّا إيمانًا وَتَسليمًا
22.translation_eng: But when the faithful saw the confederates, they said, ‘This is what Allah and His Apostle had promised us, and Allah and His Apostle were true.’ And it only increased them in faith and submission.
22.transliteration: wa-lammā raʾā l-muʾminūna l-ʾaḥzāba qālū hādhā mā waʿadanā llāhu wa-rasūluhū wa-ṣadaqa llāhu wa-rasūluhū wa-mā zādahum ʾillā ʾīmānan wa-taslīman

23.content: مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ رِجالٌ صَدَقوا ما عاهَدُوا اللَّهَ عَلَيهِ ۖ فَمِنهُم مَن قَضىٰ نَحبَهُ وَمِنهُم مَن يَنتَظِرُ ۖ وَما بَدَّلوا تَبديلًا
23.translation_eng: Among the faithful are men who fulfill what they have pledged to Allah. Of them are some who have fulfilled their pledge, and of them are some who still wait, and they have not changed in the least,
23.transliteration: mina l-muʾminīna rijālun ṣadaqū mā ʿāhadū llāha ʿalayhi fa-minhum man qaḍā naḥbahū wa-minhum man yantaẓiru wa-mā baddalū tabdīlan

24.content: لِيَجزِيَ اللَّهُ الصّادِقينَ بِصِدقِهِم وَيُعَذِّبَ المُنافِقينَ إِن شاءَ أَو يَتوبَ عَلَيهِم ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كانَ غَفورًا رَحيمًا
24.translation_eng: that Allah may reward the true for their truthfulness, and punish the hypocrites, if He wishes, or accept their repentance. Indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
24.transliteration: li-yajziya llāhu ṣ-ṣādiqīna bi-ṣidqihim wa-yuʿadhdhiba l-munāfiqīna ʾin shāʾa ʾaw yatūba ʿalayhim ʾinna llāha kāna ghafūran raḥīman

25.content: وَرَدَّ اللَّهُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِغَيظِهِم لَم يَنالوا خَيرًا ۚ وَكَفَى اللَّهُ المُؤمِنينَ القِتالَ ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ قَوِيًّا عَزيزًا
25.translation_eng: Allah sent back the faithless in their rage, without their attaining any advantage, and Allah spared the faithful of fighting, and Allah is all-strong, all-mighty.
25.transliteration: wa-radda llāhu lladhīna kafarū bi-ghayẓihim lam yanālū khayran wa-kafā llāhu l-muʾminīna l-qitāla wa-kāna llāhu qawiyyan ʿazīzan

26.content: وَأَنزَلَ الَّذينَ ظاهَروهُم مِن أَهلِ الكِتابِ مِن صَياصيهِم وَقَذَفَ في قُلوبِهِمُ الرُّعبَ فَريقًا تَقتُلونَ وَتَأسِرونَ فَريقًا
26.translation_eng: And He dragged down those who had backed them from among the People of the Book from their strongholds, and He cast terror into their hearts, [so that] you killed a part of them, and took captive [another] part of them.
26.transliteration: wa-ʾanzala lladhīna ẓāharūhum min ʾahli l-kitābi min ṣayāṣīhim wa-qadhafa fī qulūbihimu r-ruʿba farīqan taqtulūna wa-taʾsirūna farīqan

27.content: وَأَورَثَكُم أَرضَهُم وَدِيارَهُم وَأَموالَهُم وَأَرضًا لَم تَطَئوها ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرًا
27.translation_eng: And He bequeathed you their land, their houses and their possessions, and a territory you had not trodden, and Allah has power over all things.
27.transliteration: wa-ʾawrathakum ʾarḍahum wa-diyārahum wa-ʾamwālahum wa-ʾarḍan lam taṭaʾūhā wa-kāna llāhu ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīran

28.content: يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ قُل لِأَزواجِكَ إِن كُنتُنَّ تُرِدنَ الحَياةَ الدُّنيا وَزينَتَها فَتَعالَينَ أُمَتِّعكُنَّ وَأُسَرِّحكُنَّ سَراحًا جَميلًا
28.translation_eng: O Prophet! Say to your wives, ‘If you desire the life of the world and its glitter, come, I will provide for you and release you in a graceful manner.
28.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nabiyyu qul li-ʾazwājika ʾin kuntunna turidna l-ḥayāta d-dunyā wa-zīnatahā fa-taʿālayna ʾumattiʿkunna wa-ʾusarriḥkunna sarāḥan jamīlan

29.content: وَإِن كُنتُنَّ تُرِدنَ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ وَالدّارَ الآخِرَةَ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ أَعَدَّ لِلمُحسِناتِ مِنكُنَّ أَجرًا عَظيمًا
29.translation_eng: But if you desire Allah and His Apostle and the abode of the Hereafter, then Allah has indeed prepared for the virtuous among you a great reward.’
29.transliteration: wa-ʾin kuntunna turidna llāha wa-rasūlahū wa-d-dāra l-ʾākhirata fa-ʾinna llāha ʾaʿadda li-l-muḥsināti minkunna ʾajran ʿaẓīman

30.content: يا نِساءَ النَّبِيِّ مَن يَأتِ مِنكُنَّ بِفاحِشَةٍ مُبَيِّنَةٍ يُضاعَف لَهَا العَذابُ ضِعفَينِ ۚ وَكانَ ذٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسيرًا
30.translation_eng: O wives of the Prophet! Whoever of you commits a gross indecency, her punishment shall be doubled, and that is easy for Allah.
30.transliteration: yā-nisāʾa n-nabiyyi man yaʾti minkunna bi-fāḥishatin mubayyinatin yuḍāʿaf lahā l-ʿadhābu ḍiʿfayni wa-kāna dhālika ʿalā llāhi yasīran

31.content: ۞ وَمَن يَقنُت مِنكُنَّ لِلَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ وَتَعمَل صالِحًا نُؤتِها أَجرَها مَرَّتَينِ وَأَعتَدنا لَها رِزقًا كَريمًا
31.translation_eng: But whoever of you is obedient to Allah and His Apostle and acts righteously, We shall give her a twofold reward, and We hold a noble provision in store for her.
31.transliteration: wa-man yaqnut minkunna li-llāhi wa-rasūlihī wa-taʿmal ṣāliḥan nuʾtihā ʾajrahā marratayni wa-ʾaʿtadnā lahā rizqan karīman

32.content: يا نِساءَ النَّبِيِّ لَستُنَّ كَأَحَدٍ مِنَ النِّساءِ ۚ إِنِ اتَّقَيتُنَّ فَلا تَخضَعنَ بِالقَولِ فَيَطمَعَ الَّذي في قَلبِهِ مَرَضٌ وَقُلنَ قَولًا مَعروفًا
32.translation_eng: O wives of the Prophet! You are not like any other women: if you are wary [of Allah], then do not be complaisant in your speech, lest he in whose heart is a sickness should aspire, and speak honourable words.
32.transliteration: yā-nisāʾa n-nabiyyi lastunna ka-ʾaḥadin mina n-nisāʾi ʾini ttaqaytunna fa-lā takhḍaʿna bi-l-qawli fa-yaṭmaʿa lladhī fī qalbihī maraḍun wa-qulna qawlan maʿrūfan

33.content: وَقَرنَ في بُيوتِكُنَّ وَلا تَبَرَّجنَ تَبَرُّجَ الجاهِلِيَّةِ الأولىٰ ۖ وَأَقِمنَ الصَّلاةَ وَآتينَ الزَّكاةَ وَأَطِعنَ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ ۚ إِنَّما يُريدُ اللَّهُ لِيُذهِبَ عَنكُمُ الرِّجسَ أَهلَ البَيتِ وَيُطَهِّرَكُم تَطهيرًا
33.translation_eng: Stay in your houses and do not display your finery with the display of the former [days of] ignorance. Maintain the prayer and pay the zakāt and obey Allah and His Apostle.Indeed Allah desires to repel all impurity from you, O People of the Household, and purify you with a thorough purification.
33.transliteration: wa-qarna fī buyūtikunna wa-lā tabarrajna tabarruja l-jāhiliyyati l-ʾūlā wa-ʾaqimna ṣ-ṣalāta wa-ʾātīna z-zakāta wa-ʾaṭiʿna llāha wa-rasūlahū ʾinnamā yurīdu llāhu li-yudhhiba ʿankumu r-rijsa ʾahla l-bayti wa-yuṭahhirakum taṭhīran

34.content: وَاذكُرنَ ما يُتلىٰ في بُيوتِكُنَّ مِن آياتِ اللَّهِ وَالحِكمَةِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كانَ لَطيفًا خَبيرًا
