34.translation_eng: And remember what is recited in your homes of the signs of Allah and wisdom. Indeed Allah is all-attentive, all-aware.
34.transliteration: wa-dhkurna mā yutlā fī buyūtikunna min ʾāyāti llāhi wa-l-ḥikmati ʾinna llāha kāna laṭīfan khabīran

35.content: إِنَّ المُسلِمينَ وَالمُسلِماتِ وَالمُؤمِنينَ وَالمُؤمِناتِ وَالقانِتينَ وَالقانِتاتِ وَالصّادِقينَ وَالصّادِقاتِ وَالصّابِرينَ وَالصّابِراتِ وَالخاشِعينَ وَالخاشِعاتِ وَالمُتَصَدِّقينَ وَالمُتَصَدِّقاتِ وَالصّائِمينَ وَالصّائِماتِ وَالحافِظينَ فُروجَهُم وَالحافِظاتِ وَالذّاكِرينَ اللَّهَ كَثيرًا وَالذّاكِراتِ أَعَدَّ اللَّهُ لَهُم مَغفِرَةً وَأَجرًا عَظيمًا
35.translation_eng: Indeed the muslim men and the muslim women, the faithful men and the faithful women, the obedient men and the obedient women, the truthful men and the truthful women, the patient men and the patient women, the humble1 men and the humble women, the charitable men and the charitable women, the men who fast and the women who fast, the men who guard their private parts and the women who guard, the men who remember Allah greatly and the women who remember [Allah greatly] —Allah holds in store for them forgiveness and a great reward.That is, humble toward Allah.
35.transliteration: ʾinna l-muslimīna wa-l-muslimāti wa-l-muʾminīna wa-l-muʾmināti wa-l-qānitīna wa-l-qānitāti wa-ṣ-ṣādiqīna wa-ṣ-ṣādiqāti wa-ṣ-ṣābirīna wa-ṣ-ṣābirāti wa-l-khāshiʿīna wa-l-khāshiʿāti wa-l-mutaṣaddiqīna wa-l-mutaṣaddiqāti wa-ṣ-ṣāʾimīna wa-ṣ-ṣāʾimāti wa-l-ḥāfiẓīna furūjahum wa-l-ḥāfiẓāti wa-dh-dhākirīna llāha kathīran wa-dh-dhākirāti ʾaʿadda llāhu lahum maghfiratan wa-ʾajran ʿaẓīman

36.content: وَما كانَ لِمُؤمِنٍ وَلا مُؤمِنَةٍ إِذا قَضَى اللَّهُ وَرَسولُهُ أَمرًا أَن يَكونَ لَهُمُ الخِيَرَةُ مِن أَمرِهِم ۗ وَمَن يَعصِ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ فَقَد ضَلَّ ضَلالًا مُبينًا
36.translation_eng: A faithful man or woman may not, when Allah and His Apostle have decided on a matter, have any option in their matter, and whoever disobeys Allah and His Apostle has certainly strayed into manifest error.
36.transliteration: wa-mā kāna li-muʾminin wa-lā muʾminatin ʾidhā qaḍā llāhu wa-rasūluhū ʾamran ʾan yakūna lahumu l-khiyaratu min ʾamrihim wa-man yaʿṣi llāha wa-rasūlahū fa-qad ḍalla ḍalālan mubīnan

37.content: وَإِذ تَقولُ لِلَّذي أَنعَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِ وَأَنعَمتَ عَلَيهِ أَمسِك عَلَيكَ زَوجَكَ وَاتَّقِ اللَّهَ وَتُخفي في نَفسِكَ مَا اللَّهُ مُبديهِ وَتَخشَى النّاسَ وَاللَّهُ أَحَقُّ أَن تَخشاهُ ۖ فَلَمّا قَضىٰ زَيدٌ مِنها وَطَرًا زَوَّجناكَها لِكَي لا يَكونَ عَلَى المُؤمِنينَ حَرَجٌ في أَزواجِ أَدعِيائِهِم إِذا قَضَوا مِنهُنَّ وَطَرًا ۚ وَكانَ أَمرُ اللَّهِ مَفعولًا
37.translation_eng: When you said to him whom Allah had blessed, and whom you [too] had blessed, ‘Retain your wife for yourself, and be wary of Allah,’ and you had hidden in your heart what Allah was to divulge, and you feared the people though Allah is worthier that you should fear Him, so when Zayd had got through with her, We wedded her to you, so that there may be no blame on the faithful in respect of the wives of their adopted sons, when the latter have got through with them, and Allah’s command is bound to be fulfilled.
37.transliteration: wa-ʾidh taqūlu li-lladhī ʾanʿama llāhu ʿalayhi wa-ʾanʿamta ʿalayhi ʾamsik ʿalayka zawjaka wa-ttaqi llāha wa-tukhfī fī nafsika mā llāhu mubdīhi wa-takhshā n-nāsa wa-llāhu ʾaḥaqqu ʾan takhshāhu fa-lammā qaḍā zaydun minhā waṭaran zawwajnākahā li-kay lā yakūna ʿalā l-muʾminīna ḥarajun fī ʾazwāji ʾadʿiyāʾihim ʾidhā qaḍaw minhunna waṭaran wa-kāna ʾamru llāhi mafʿūlan

38.content: ما كانَ عَلَى النَّبِيِّ مِن حَرَجٍ فيما فَرَضَ اللَّهُ لَهُ ۖ سُنَّةَ اللَّهِ فِي الَّذينَ خَلَوا مِن قَبلُ ۚ وَكانَ أَمرُ اللَّهِ قَدَرًا مَقدورًا
38.translation_eng: There is no blame on the Prophet in respect of that which Allah has made lawful for him:1 Allah’s precedent with those who passed away earlier —and Allah’s commands are ordained by a precise ordaining—Or ‘prescribed for him.’
38.transliteration: mā kāna ʿalā n-nabiyyi min ḥarajin fī-mā faraḍa llāhu lahū sunnata llāhi fī lladhīna khalaw min qablu wa-kāna ʾamru llāhi qadaran maqdūran-i

39.content: الَّذينَ يُبَلِّغونَ رِسالاتِ اللَّهِ وَيَخشَونَهُ وَلا يَخشَونَ أَحَدًا إِلَّا اللَّهَ ۗ وَكَفىٰ بِاللَّهِ حَسيبًا
39.translation_eng: such as deliver the messages of Allah and fear Him, and fear no one except Allah, and Allah suffices as reckoner.
39.transliteration: alladhīna yuballighūna risālāti llāhi wa-yakhshawnahū wa-lā yakhshawna ʾaḥadan ʾillā llāha wa-kafā bi-llāhi ḥasīban

40.content: ما كانَ مُحَمَّدٌ أَبا أَحَدٍ مِن رِجالِكُم وَلٰكِن رَسولَ اللَّهِ وَخاتَمَ النَّبِيّينَ ۗ وَكانَ اللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَليمًا
40.translation_eng: Muhammad is not the father of any man among you, but he is the Apostle of Allah and the Seal of the Prophets, and Allah has knowledge of all things.
40.transliteration: mā kāna muḥammadun ʾabā ʾaḥadin min rijālikum wa-lākin rasūla llāhi wa-khātama n-nabiyyīna wa-kāna llāhu bi-kulli shayʾin ʿalīman

41.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا اذكُرُوا اللَّهَ ذِكرًا كَثيرًا
41.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Remember Allah with frequent remembrance,
41.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū dhkurū llāha dhikran kathīran

42.content: وَسَبِّحوهُ بُكرَةً وَأَصيلًا
42.translation_eng: and glorify Him morning and evening.
42.transliteration: wa-sabbiḥūhu bukratan wa-ʾaṣīlan

43.content: هُوَ الَّذي يُصَلّي عَلَيكُم وَمَلائِكَتُهُ لِيُخرِجَكُم مِنَ الظُّلُماتِ إِلَى النّورِ ۚ وَكانَ بِالمُؤمِنينَ رَحيمًا
43.translation_eng: It is He who blesses you, and so do His angels, that He may bring you out from darkness into light, and He is most merciful to the faithful.
43.transliteration: huwa lladhī yuṣallī ʿalaykum wa-malāʾikatuhū li-yukhrijakum mina ẓ-ẓulumāti ʾilā n-nūri wa-kāna bi-l-muʾminīna raḥīman

44.content: تَحِيَّتُهُم يَومَ يَلقَونَهُ سَلامٌ ۚ وَأَعَدَّ لَهُم أَجرًا كَريمًا
44.translation_eng: The day they encounter Him, their greeting will be, ‘Peace,’ and He holds in store for them a noble reward.
44.transliteration: taḥiyyatuhum yawma yalqawnahū salāmun wa-ʾaʿadda lahum ʾajran karīman

45.content: يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ إِنّا أَرسَلناكَ شاهِدًا وَمُبَشِّرًا وَنَذيرًا
45.translation_eng: O Prophet! Indeed We have sent you as a witness, as a bearer of good news and as a warner
45.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nabiyyu ʾinnā ʾarsalnāka shāhidan wa-mubashshiran wa-nadhīran

46.content: وَداعِيًا إِلَى اللَّهِ بِإِذنِهِ وَسِراجًا مُنيرًا
46.translation_eng: and as a summoner to Allah by His permission, and as a radiant lamp.
46.transliteration: wa-dāʿiyan ʾilā llāhi bi-ʾidhnihī wa-sirājan munīran

47.content: وَبَشِّرِ المُؤمِنينَ بِأَنَّ لَهُم مِنَ اللَّهِ فَضلًا كَبيرًا
47.translation_eng: Announce to the faithful the good news that there will be for them a great grace from Allah.
47.transliteration: wa-bashshiri l-muʾminīna bi-ʾanna lahum mina llāhi faḍlan kabīran

48.content: وَلا تُطِعِ الكافِرينَ وَالمُنافِقينَ وَدَع أَذاهُم وَتَوَكَّل عَلَى اللَّهِ ۚ وَكَفىٰ بِاللَّهِ وَكيلًا
48.translation_eng: And do not obey the faithless and the hypocrites, and disregard their torments, and put your trust in Allah, and Allah suffices as trustee.
48.transliteration: wa-lā tuṭiʿi l-kāfirīna wa-l-munāfiqīna wa-daʿ ʾadhāhum wa-tawakkal ʿalā llāhi wa-kafā bi-llāhi wakīlan

49.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِذا نَكَحتُمُ المُؤمِناتِ ثُمَّ طَلَّقتُموهُنَّ مِن قَبلِ أَن تَمَسّوهُنَّ فَما لَكُم عَلَيهِنَّ مِن عِدَّةٍ تَعتَدّونَها ۖ فَمَتِّعوهُنَّ وَسَرِّحوهُنَّ سَراحًا جَميلًا
49.translation_eng: O you who have faith! When you marry faithful women and then divorce them before you touch them, there shall be no period for you to reckon. But provide for them and release them in a graceful manner.
49.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾidhā nakaḥtumu l-muʾmināti thumma ṭallaqtumūhunna min qabli ʾan tamassūhunna fa-mā lakum ʿalayhinna min ʿiddatin taʿtaddūnahā fa-mattiʿūhunna wa-sarriḥūhunna sarāḥan jamīlan

50.content: يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ إِنّا أَحلَلنا لَكَ أَزواجَكَ اللّاتي آتَيتَ أُجورَهُنَّ وَما مَلَكَت يَمينُكَ مِمّا أَفاءَ اللَّهُ عَلَيكَ وَبَناتِ عَمِّكَ وَبَناتِ عَمّاتِكَ وَبَناتِ خالِكَ وَبَناتِ خالاتِكَ اللّاتي هاجَرنَ مَعَكَ وَامرَأَةً مُؤمِنَةً إِن وَهَبَت نَفسَها لِلنَّبِيِّ إِن أَرادَ النَّبِيُّ أَن يَستَنكِحَها خالِصَةً لَكَ مِن دونِ المُؤمِنينَ ۗ قَد عَلِمنا ما فَرَضنا عَلَيهِم في أَزواجِهِم وَما مَلَكَت أَيمانُهُم لِكَيلا يَكونَ عَلَيكَ حَرَجٌ ۗ وَكانَ اللَّهُ غَفورًا رَحيمًا
50.translation_eng: O Prophet! Indeed We have made lawful to you your wives whom you have given their dowries, and those whom your right hand owns,1 of those whom Allah gave you as spoils of war, and the daughters of your paternal uncle, and the daughters of your paternal aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncle, and the daughters of your maternal aunts who migrated with you, and a faithful woman if she offers herself to the Prophet and the Prophet desires to take her in marriage, (a privilege exclusively for you, not for [the rest of] the faithful; We know what We have made lawful for them with respect to their wives and those whom their right hands own so that there may be no blame on you,) and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.That is, slave women.
50.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nabiyyu ʾinnā ʾaḥlalnā laka ʾazwājaka llātī ʾātayta ʾujūrahunna wa-mā malakat yamīnuka mimmā ʾafāʾa llāhu ʿalayka wa-banāti ʿammika wa-banāti ʿammātika wa-banāti khālika wa-banāti khālātika llātī hājarna maʿaka wa-mraʾatan muʾminatan ʾin wahabat nafsahā li-n-nabiyyi ʾin ʾarāda n-nabiyyu ʾan yastankiḥahā khāliṣatan laka min dūni l-muʾminīna qad ʿalimnā mā faraḍnā ʿalayhim fī ʾazwājihim wa-mā malakat ʾaymānuhum li-kay-lā yakūna ʿalayka ḥarajun wa-kāna llāhu ghafūran raḥīman

51.content: ۞ تُرجي مَن تَشاءُ مِنهُنَّ وَتُؤوي إِلَيكَ مَن تَشاءُ ۖ وَمَنِ ابتَغَيتَ مِمَّن عَزَلتَ فَلا جُناحَ عَلَيكَ ۚ ذٰلِكَ أَدنىٰ أَن تَقَرَّ أَعيُنُهُنَّ وَلا يَحزَنَّ وَيَرضَينَ بِما آتَيتَهُنَّ كُلُّهُنَّ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ ما في قُلوبِكُم ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَليمًا حَليمًا
51.translation_eng: You may put off whichever of them you wish and consort with whichever of them you wish, and as for any whom you may seek [to consort with] from among those you have set aside [earlier], there is no sin upon you [in receiving her again]. That makes it likelier that they will be comforted and not feel unhappy, all of them being pleased with what you give them. Allah knows what is in your hearts, and Allah is all-knowing, all-forbearing.
51.transliteration: turjī man tashāʾu minhunna wa-tuʾwī ʾilayka man tashāʾu wa-mani btaghayta mimman ʿazalta fa-lā junāḥa ʿalayka dhālika ʾadnā ʾan taqarra ʾaʿyunuhunna wa-lā yaḥzanna wa-yarḍayna bi-mā ʾātaytahunna kulluhunna wa-llāhu yaʿlamu mā fī qulūbikum wa-kāna llāhu ʿalīman ḥalīman

52.content: لا يَحِلُّ لَكَ النِّساءُ مِن بَعدُ وَلا أَن تَبَدَّلَ بِهِنَّ مِن أَزواجٍ وَلَو أَعجَبَكَ حُسنُهُنَّ إِلّا ما مَلَكَت يَمينُكَ ۗ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ رَقيبًا
52.translation_eng: Beyond that, women are not lawful for you, nor that you should change them for other wives even though their beauty should impress you, except those whom your right hand owns. And Allah is watchful over all things.
52.transliteration: lā yaḥillu laka n-nisāʾu min baʿdu wa-lā ʾan tabaddala bihinna min ʾazwājin wa-law ʾaʿjabaka ḥusnuhunna ʾillā mā malakat yamīnuka wa-kāna llāhu ʿalā kulli shayʾin raqīban

53.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تَدخُلوا بُيوتَ النَّبِيِّ إِلّا أَن يُؤذَنَ لَكُم إِلىٰ طَعامٍ غَيرَ ناظِرينَ إِناهُ وَلٰكِن إِذا دُعيتُم فَادخُلوا فَإِذا طَعِمتُم فَانتَشِروا وَلا مُستَأنِسينَ لِحَديثٍ ۚ إِنَّ ذٰلِكُم كانَ يُؤذِي النَّبِيَّ فَيَستَحيي مِنكُم ۖ وَاللَّهُ لا يَستَحيي مِنَ الحَقِّ ۚ وَإِذا سَأَلتُموهُنَّ مَتاعًا فَاسأَلوهُنَّ مِن وَراءِ حِجابٍ ۚ ذٰلِكُم أَطهَرُ لِقُلوبِكُم وَقُلوبِهِنَّ ۚ وَما كانَ لَكُم أَن تُؤذوا رَسولَ اللَّهِ وَلا أَن تَنكِحوا أَزواجَهُ مِن بَعدِهِ أَبَدًا ۚ إِنَّ ذٰلِكُم كانَ عِندَ اللَّهِ عَظيمًا
53.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Do not enter the Prophet’s houses unless permission is granted you for a meal, without waiting for it to be readied. But enter when you are invited, and disperse when you have taken your meal, without settling down to chat. Indeed such conduct torments the Prophet, and he is ashamed of [asking] you [to leave]; but Allah is not ashamed of [expressing] the truth. And when you ask anything of [his] womenfolk, ask it from them from behind a curtain. That is more chaste for your hearts and their hearts. You may not torment the Apostle of Allah, nor may you ever marry his wives after him. Indeed that would be a grave [matter] with Allah.
53.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū lā tadkhulū buyūta n-nabiyyi ʾillā ʾan yuʾdhana lakum ʾilā ṭaʿāmin ghayra nāẓirīna ʾināhu wa-lākin ʾidhā duʿītum fa-dkhulū fa-ʾidhā ṭaʿimtum fa-ntashirū wa-lā mustaʾnisīna li-ḥadīthin ʾinna dhālikum kāna yuʾdhī n-nabiyya fa-yastaḥyī minkum wa-llāhu lā yastaḥyī mina l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾidhā saʾaltumūhunna matāʿan fa-sʾalūhunna min warāʾi ḥijābin dhālikum ʾaṭharu li-qulūbikum wa-qulūbihinna wa-mā kāna lakum ʾan tuʾdhū rasūla llāhi wa-lā ʾan tankiḥū ʾazwājahū min baʿdihī ʾabadan ʾinna dhālikum kāna ʿinda llāhi ʿaẓīman

54.content: إِن تُبدوا شَيئًا أَو تُخفوهُ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ كانَ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَليمًا
54.translation_eng: Whether you disclose anything or hide it, Allah indeed knows all things.
54.transliteration: ʾin tubdū shayʾan ʾaw tukhfūhu fa-ʾinna llāha kāna bi-kulli shayʾin ʿalīman

55.content: لا جُناحَ عَلَيهِنَّ في آبائِهِنَّ وَلا أَبنائِهِنَّ وَلا إِخوانِهِنَّ وَلا أَبناءِ إِخوانِهِنَّ وَلا أَبناءِ أَخَواتِهِنَّ وَلا نِسائِهِنَّ وَلا ما مَلَكَت أَيمانُهُنَّ ۗ وَاتَّقينَ اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كانَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ شَهيدًا
55.translation_eng: There is no sin on them1 [in socializing freely] with their fathers, or their sons, or their brothers, or their brothers’ sons, or the sons of their sisters, or their own womenfolk,2 or what their right hands own.3 Be wary of Allah. Indeed Allah is witness to all things.That is, the Prophet’s wives.That is, muslim women.That is, their female slaves.
55.transliteration: lā junāḥa ʿalayhinna fī ʾābāʾihinna wa-lā ʾabnāʾihinna wa-lā ʾikhwānihinna wa-lā ʾabnāʾi ʾikhwānihinna wa-lā ʾabnāʾi ʾakhawātihinna wa-lā nisāʾihinna wa-lā mā malakat ʾaymānuhunna wa-ttaqīna llāha ʾinna llāha kāna ʿalā kulli shayʾin shahīdan

56.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ وَمَلائِكَتَهُ يُصَلّونَ عَلَى النَّبِيِّ ۚ يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا صَلّوا عَلَيهِ وَسَلِّموا تَسليمًا
56.translation_eng: Indeed Allah and His angels bless the Prophet; O you who have faith! Invoke blessings on him and invoke Peace upon him in a worthy manner.
56.transliteration: ʾinna llāha wa-malāʾikatahū yuṣallūna ʿalā n-nabiyyi yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ṣallū ʿalayhi wa-sallimū taslīman

57.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يُؤذونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ لَعَنَهُمُ اللَّهُ فِي الدُّنيا وَالآخِرَةِ وَأَعَدَّ لَهُم عَذابًا مُهينًا
57.translation_eng: Indeed those who torment Allah and His Apostle are cursed by Allah in the world and the Hereafter, and He has prepared a humiliating punishment for them.
57.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna yuʾdhūna llāha wa-rasūlahū laʿanahumu llāhu fī d-dunyā wa-l-ʾākhirati wa-ʾaʿadda lahum ʿadhāban muhīnan

58.content: وَالَّذينَ يُؤذونَ المُؤمِنينَ وَالمُؤمِناتِ بِغَيرِ مَا اكتَسَبوا فَقَدِ احتَمَلوا بُهتانًا وَإِثمًا مُبينًا
58.translation_eng: Those who torment faithful men and women undeservedly, certainly bear the guilt of slander and flagrant sin.
58.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yuʾdhūna l-muʾminīna wa-l-muʾmināti bi-ghayri mā ktasabū fa-qadi ḥtamalū buhtānan wa-ʾithman mubīnan

59.content: يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ قُل لِأَزواجِكَ وَبَناتِكَ وَنِساءِ المُؤمِنينَ يُدنينَ عَلَيهِنَّ مِن جَلابيبِهِنَّ ۚ ذٰلِكَ أَدنىٰ أَن يُعرَفنَ فَلا يُؤذَينَ ۗ وَكانَ اللَّهُ غَفورًا رَحيمًا
59.translation_eng: O Prophet! Tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the faithful to draw closely over themselves their chadors [when going out]. That makes it likely for them to be recognized and not be troubled, and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
59.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nabiyyu qul li-ʾazwājika wa-banātika wa-nisāʾi l-muʾminīna yudnīna ʿalayhinna min jalābībihinna dhālika ʾadnā ʾan yuʿrafna fa-lā yuʾdhayna wa-kāna llāhu ghafūran raḥīman

60.content: ۞ لَئِن لَم يَنتَهِ المُنافِقونَ وَالَّذينَ في قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ وَالمُرجِفونَ فِي المَدينَةِ لَنُغرِيَنَّكَ بِهِم ثُمَّ لا يُجاوِرونَكَ فيها إِلّا قَليلًا
60.translation_eng: If the hypocrites do not relinquish and [also] those in whose hearts is a sickness, and the rumourmongers in the city [do not give up], We will surely urge you [to take action] against them, then they will not be your neighbours in it except for a little [while].
60.transliteration: la-ʾin lam yantahi l-munāfiqūna wa-lladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun wa-l-murjifūna fī l-madīnati la-nughriyannaka bihim thumma lā yujāwirūnaka fīhā ʾillā qalīlan

61.content: مَلعونينَ ۖ أَينَما ثُقِفوا أُخِذوا وَقُتِّلوا تَقتيلًا
61.translation_eng: Accursed, they will be seized wherever they are confronted and slain violently:
61.transliteration: malʿūnīna ʾaynamā thuqifū ʾukhidhū wa-quttilū taqtīlan

62.content: سُنَّةَ اللَّهِ فِي الَّذينَ خَلَوا مِن قَبلُ ۖ وَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّةِ اللَّهِ تَبديلًا
62.translation_eng: Allah’s precedent with those who passed away before, and you will never find any change in Allah’s precedent.
62.transliteration: sunnata llāhi fī lladhīna khalaw min qablu wa-lan tajida li-sunnati llāhi tabdīlan

63.content: يَسأَلُكَ النّاسُ عَنِ السّاعَةِ ۖ قُل إِنَّما عِلمُها عِندَ اللَّهِ ۚ وَما يُدريكَ لَعَلَّ السّاعَةَ تَكونُ قَريبًا
63.translation_eng: The people question you concerning the Hour. Say, ‘Its knowledge is only with Allah.’ What do you know, maybe the Hour is near.
63.transliteration: yasʾaluka n-nāsu ʿani s-sāʿati qul ʾinnamā ʿilmuhā ʿinda llāhi wa-mā yudrīka laʿalla s-sāʿata takūnu qarīban

64.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَعَنَ الكافِرينَ وَأَعَدَّ لَهُم سَعيرًا
64.translation_eng: Indeed Allah has cursed the faithless and prepared for them a blaze,
64.transliteration: ʾinna llāha laʿana l-kāfirīna wa-ʾaʿadda lahum saʿīran

65.content: خالِدينَ فيها أَبَدًا ۖ لا يَجِدونَ وَلِيًّا وَلا نَصيرًا
65.translation_eng: in which they will remain forever. They will not find any guardian or helper.
65.transliteration: khālidīna fīhā ʾabadan lā yajidūna waliyyan wa-lā naṣīran

66.content: يَومَ تُقَلَّبُ وُجوهُهُم فِي النّارِ يَقولونَ يا لَيتَنا أَطَعنَا اللَّهَ وَأَطَعنَا الرَّسولا
66.translation_eng: The day when their faces are turned about in the Fire, they will say, ‘We wish we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Apostle!’
66.transliteration: yawma tuqallabu wujūhuhum fī n-nāri yaqūlūna yā-laytanā ʾaṭaʿnā llāha wa-ʾaṭaʿnā r-rasūla

67.content: وَقالوا رَبَّنا إِنّا أَطَعنا سادَتَنا وَكُبَراءَنا فَأَضَلّونَا السَّبيلا
67.translation_eng: And they will say, ‘Our Lord! We obeyed our leaders and elders, and they led us astray from the way.’
67.transliteration: wa-qālū rabbanā ʾinnā ʾaṭaʿnā sādatanā wa-kubarāʾanā fa-ʾaḍallūnā s-sabīla

68.content: رَبَّنا آتِهِم ضِعفَينِ مِنَ العَذابِ وَالعَنهُم لَعنًا كَبيرًا
68.translation_eng: Our Lord! Give them a double punishment and curse them with a mighty curse.’
68.transliteration: rabbanā ʾātihim ḍiʿfayni mina l-ʿadhābi wa-lʿanhum laʿnan kabīran

69.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تَكونوا كَالَّذينَ آذَوا موسىٰ فَبَرَّأَهُ اللَّهُ مِمّا قالوا ۚ وَكانَ عِندَ اللَّهِ وَجيهًا
69.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Do not be like those who tormented Moses, whereat Allah absolved him of what they alleged, and he was distinguished in Allah’s sight.
69.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū lā takūnū ka-lladhīna ʾādhaw mūsā fa-barraʾahu llāhu mimmā qālū wa-kāna ʿinda llāhi wajīhan

70.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَقولوا قَولًا سَديدًا
70.translation_eng: O you who have faith! Be wary of Allah, and speak upright words.
70.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ttaqū llāha wa-qūlū qawlan sadīdan

71.content: يُصلِح لَكُم أَعمالَكُم وَيَغفِر لَكُم ذُنوبَكُم ۗ وَمَن يُطِعِ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ فَقَد فازَ فَوزًا عَظيمًا
71.translation_eng: He shall rectify your conduct for you and He shall forgive you your sins. Whoever obeys Allah and His Apostle has certainly achieved a great success.
71.transliteration: yuṣliḥ lakum ʾaʿmālakum wa-yaghfir lakum dhunūbakum wa-man yuṭiʿi llāha wa-rasūlahū fa-qad fāza fawzan ʿaẓīman

72.content: إِنّا عَرَضنَا الأَمانَةَ عَلَى السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَالجِبالِ فَأَبَينَ أَن يَحمِلنَها وَأَشفَقنَ مِنها وَحَمَلَهَا الإِنسانُ ۖ إِنَّهُ كانَ ظَلومًا جَهولًا
72.translation_eng: Indeed We presented the Trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to bear it, and were apprehensive of it; but man undertook it. Indeed he is most unfair and senseless.
72.transliteration: ʾinnā ʿaraḍnā l-ʾamānata ʿalā s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-l-jibāli fa-ʾabayna ʾan yaḥmilnahā wa-ʾashfaqna minhā wa-ḥamalahā l-ʾinsānu ʾinnahū kāna ẓalūman jahūlan

73.content: لِيُعَذِّبَ اللَّهُ المُنافِقينَ وَالمُنافِقاتِ وَالمُشرِكينَ وَالمُشرِكاتِ وَيَتوبَ اللَّهُ عَلَى المُؤمِنينَ وَالمُؤمِناتِ ۗ وَكانَ اللَّهُ غَفورًا رَحيمًا
73.translation_eng: Allah will surely punish the hypocrites, men and women, and the polytheists, men and women, and Allah will turn clemently to the faithful, men and women, and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
73.transliteration: li-yuʿadhdhiba llāhu l-munāfiqīna wa-l-munāfiqāti wa-l-mushrikīna wa-l-mushrikāti wa-yatūba llāhu ʿalā l-muʾminīna wa-l-muʾmināti wa-kāna llāhu ghafūran raḥīman

34.description: The surah that mentions the gracious dwelling place of the blessed people of Sheba in Yemen, whom God whelmed away for their rejection of God’s blessings and then punished them for their ingratitude. It is named after the account of Sheba (Saba) in verse 15 . The Prophet is first encouraged through references to David and Solomon and how God favoured them. The disbelievers of Mecca are warned through a description of the punishment that awaits them on the Day of Resurrection. Two references are made to their accusing the Prophet of madness (verse 8 and verse 46) and this charge is thoroughly refuted.The surah is also known as The City of Saba

1.content: الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذي لَهُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ وَلَهُ الحَمدُ فِي الآخِرَةِ ۚ وَهُوَ الحَكيمُ الخَبيرُ
1.translation_eng: All praise belongs to Allah to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. To Him belongs all praise in the Hereafter, and He is the All-wise, the All-aware.
1.transliteration: al-ḥamdu li-llāhi lladhī lahū mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi wa-lahu l-ḥamdu fī l-ʾākhirati wa-huwa l-ḥakīmu l-khabīru

2.content: يَعلَمُ ما يَلِجُ فِي الأَرضِ وَما يَخرُجُ مِنها وَما يَنزِلُ مِنَ السَّماءِ وَما يَعرُجُ فيها ۚ وَهُوَ الرَّحيمُ الغَفورُ
2.translation_eng: He knows whatever enters into the earth and whatever emerges from it, and whatever descends from the sky and whatever ascends into it, and He is the All-merciful, the All-forgiving.
2.transliteration: yaʿlamu mā yaliju fī l-ʾarḍi wa-mā yakhruju minhā wa-mā yanzilu mina s-samāʾi wa-mā yaʿruju fīhā wa-huwa r-raḥīmu l-ghafūru

3.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لا تَأتينَا السّاعَةُ ۖ قُل بَلىٰ وَرَبّي لَتَأتِيَنَّكُم عالِمِ الغَيبِ ۖ لا يَعزُبُ عَنهُ مِثقالُ ذَرَّةٍ فِي السَّماواتِ وَلا فِي الأَرضِ وَلا أَصغَرُ مِن ذٰلِكَ وَلا أَكبَرُ إِلّا في كِتابٍ مُبينٍ
3.translation_eng: The faithless say, ‘The Hour will not overtake us.’ Say, ‘Yes indeed, by my Lord, it will surely come to you.’ —The Knower of the Unseen, not [even] an atom’s weight escapes Him in the heavens or in the earth, nor [is there] anything smaller than that nor bigger, but it is in a manifest Book,
3.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna kafarū lā taʾtīnā s-sāʿatu qul balā wa-rabbī la-taʾtiyannakum ʿālimi l-ghaybi lā yaʿzubu ʿanhu mithqālu dharratin fī s-samāwāti wa-lā fī l-ʾarḍi wa-lā ʾaṣgharu min dhālika wa-lā ʾakbaru ʾillā fī kitābin mubīnin

4.content: لِيَجزِيَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَرِزقٌ كَريمٌ
4.translation_eng: that He may reward those who have faith and do righteous deeds. For such there will be forgiveness and a noble provision.
4.transliteration: li-yajziya lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti ʾulāʾika lahum maghfiratun wa-rizqun karīmun

5.content: وَالَّذينَ سَعَوا في آياتِنا مُعاجِزينَ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم عَذابٌ مِن رِجزٍ أَليمٌ
5.translation_eng: But those who contend with Our signs seeking to thwart [their purpose], for such is a painful punishment due to defilement.1That is, owing to their inward defilement. According to an alternate reading which makes alīm the attribute of rijz, the translation will be: ‘for such is the torment of a painful punishment.’
5.transliteration: wa-lladhīna saʿaw fī ʾāyātinā muʿājizīna ʾulāʾika lahum ʿadhābun min rijzin ʾalīmun

6.content: وَيَرَى الَّذينَ أوتُوا العِلمَ الَّذي أُنزِلَ إِلَيكَ مِن رَبِّكَ هُوَ الحَقَّ وَيَهدي إِلىٰ صِراطِ العَزيزِ الحَميدِ
6.translation_eng: Those who have been given knowledge see that what has been sent down to you from your Lord is the truth and [that] it guides to the path of the All-mighty, the All-laudable.
6.transliteration: wa-yarā lladhīna ʾūtū l-ʿilma lladhī ʾunzila ʾilayka min rabbika huwa l-ḥaqqa wa-yahdī ʾilā ṣirāṭi l-ʿazīzi l-ḥamīdi

7.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا هَل نَدُلُّكُم عَلىٰ رَجُلٍ يُنَبِّئُكُم إِذا مُزِّقتُم كُلَّ مُمَزَّقٍ إِنَّكُم لَفي خَلقٍ جَديدٍ
7.translation_eng: The faithless say, ‘Shall we show you a man who will inform you [that] when you have been totally rent to pieces you will indeed have a new creation?
7.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna kafarū hal nadullukum ʿalā rajulin yunabbiʾukum ʾidhā muzziqtum kulla mumazzaqin ʾinnakum la-fī khalqin jadīdin

8.content: أَفتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَم بِهِ جِنَّةٌ ۗ بَلِ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالآخِرَةِ فِي العَذابِ وَالضَّلالِ البَعيدِ
8.translation_eng: Has he fabricated a lie against Allah, or is there a madness in him?’ Rather those who do not believe in the Hereafter languish in punishment and extreme error.
8.transliteration: ʾa-ftarā ʿalā llāhi kadhiban ʾam bihī jinnatun bali lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-l-ʾākhirati fī l-ʿadhābi wa-ḍ-ḍalāli l-baʿīdi

9.content: أَفَلَم يَرَوا إِلىٰ ما بَينَ أَيديهِم وَما خَلفَهُم مِنَ السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ إِن نَشَأ نَخسِف بِهِمُ الأَرضَ أَو نُسقِط عَلَيهِم كِسَفًا مِنَ السَّماءِ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِكُلِّ عَبدٍ مُنيبٍ
9.translation_eng: Have they not regarded that which is before them and that which is behind them of the sky and the earth? If We like, We can make the earth swallow them, or let fall on them a fragment from the sky. There is indeed a sign in that for every penitent servant.
9.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lam yaraw ʾilā mā bayna ʾaydīhim wa-mā khalfahum mina s-samāʾi wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾin nashaʾ nakhsif bihimu l-ʾarḍa ʾaw nusqiṭ ʿalayhim kisafan mina s-samāʾi ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyatan li-kulli ʿabdin munībin

10.content: ۞ وَلَقَد آتَينا داوودَ مِنّا فَضلًا ۖ يا جِبالُ أَوِّبي مَعَهُ وَالطَّيرَ ۖ وَأَلَنّا لَهُ الحَديدَ
10.translation_eng: Certainly We gave David a grace from Us: ‘O mountains and birds, chime in with him!’1 And We made iron soft for him,Cf. 38:17-19.
10.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā dāwūda minnā faḍlan yā-jibālu ʾawwibī maʿahū wa-ṭ-ṭayra wa-ʾalannā lahu l-ḥadīda

11.content: أَنِ اعمَل سابِغاتٍ وَقَدِّر فِي السَّردِ ۖ وَاعمَلوا صالِحًا ۖ إِنّي بِما تَعمَلونَ بَصيرٌ
11.translation_eng: saying, ‘Make easy coats of mail, and keep the measure in arranging [the links], and act righteously. Indeed I see best what you do.’
11.transliteration: ʾani ʿmal sābighātin wa-qaddir fī s-sardi wa-ʿmalū ṣāliḥan ʾinnī bi-mā taʿmalūna baṣīrun

12.content: وَلِسُلَيمانَ الرّيحَ غُدُوُّها شَهرٌ وَرَواحُها شَهرٌ ۖ وَأَسَلنا لَهُ عَينَ القِطرِ ۖ وَمِنَ الجِنِّ مَن يَعمَلُ بَينَ يَدَيهِ بِإِذنِ رَبِّهِ ۖ وَمَن يَزِغ مِنهُم عَن أَمرِنا نُذِقهُ مِن عَذابِ السَّعيرِ
12.translation_eng: And for Solomon [We subjected] the wind: its morning course was a month’s journey and its evening course was a month’s journey. We made a fount of [molten] copper flow for him, and [We placed at his service] some of the jinn who would work for him by the permission of his Lord, and if any of them swerved from Our command, We would make him taste the punishment of the Blaze.
12.transliteration: wa-li-sulaymāna r-rīḥa ghuduwwuhā shahrun wa-rawāḥuhā shahrun wa-ʾasalnā lahū ʿayna l-qiṭri wa-mina l-jinni man yaʿmalu bayna yadayhi bi-ʾidhni rabbihī wa-man yazigh minhum ʿan ʾamrinā nudhiqhu min ʿadhābi s-saʿīri

13.content: يَعمَلونَ لَهُ ما يَشاءُ مِن مَحاريبَ وَتَماثيلَ وَجِفانٍ كَالجَوابِ وَقُدورٍ راسِياتٍ ۚ اعمَلوا آلَ داوودَ شُكرًا ۚ وَقَليلٌ مِن عِبادِيَ الشَّكورُ
13.translation_eng: They built for him as many temples as he wished, and figures, basins like cisterns, and caldrons fixed [in the ground]. ‘O House of David, observe thanksgiving, and few of My servants are grateful.’
13.transliteration: yaʿmalūna lahū mā yashāʾu min maḥārība wa-tamāthīla wa-jifānin ka-l-jawābi wa-qudūrin rāsiyātin-i ʿmalū ʾāla dāwūda shukran wa-qalīlun min ʿibādiya sh-shakūru

14.content: فَلَمّا قَضَينا عَلَيهِ المَوتَ ما دَلَّهُم عَلىٰ مَوتِهِ إِلّا دابَّةُ الأَرضِ تَأكُلُ مِنسَأَتَهُ ۖ فَلَمّا خَرَّ تَبَيَّنَتِ الجِنُّ أَن لَو كانوا يَعلَمونَ الغَيبَ ما لَبِثوا فِي العَذابِ المُهينِ
14.translation_eng: And when We decreed death for him, nothing apprised them of his death except a worm which gnawed away at his staff. And when he fell down the jinn realized that had they known the Unseen, they would not have remained in a humiliating torment.
14.transliteration: fa-lammā qaḍaynā ʿalayhi l-mawta mā dallahum ʿalā mawtihī ʾillā dābbatu l-ʾarḍi taʾkulu minsaʾatahū fa-lammā kharra tabayyanati l-jinnu ʾan law kānū yaʿlamūna l-ghayba mā labithū fī l-ʿadhābi l-muhīni

15.content: لَقَد كانَ لِسَبَإٍ في مَسكَنِهِم آيَةٌ ۖ جَنَّتانِ عَن يَمينٍ وَشِمالٍ ۖ كُلوا مِن رِزقِ رَبِّكُم وَاشكُروا لَهُ ۚ بَلدَةٌ طَيِّبَةٌ وَرَبٌّ غَفورٌ
15.translation_eng: There was certainly a sign for Sheba in their habitation: two gardens, to the right and to the left. ‘Eat of the provision of your Lord and give Him thanks: a good land and an all-forgiving Lord!’
15.transliteration: la-qad kāna li-sabaʾin fī maskanihim ʾāyatun jannatāni ʿan yamīnin wa-shimālin kulū min rizqi rabbikum wa-shkurū lahū baldatun ṭayyibatun wa-rabbun ghafūrun

16.content: فَأَعرَضوا فَأَرسَلنا عَلَيهِم سَيلَ العَرِمِ وَبَدَّلناهُم بِجَنَّتَيهِم جَنَّتَينِ ذَواتَي أُكُلٍ خَمطٍ وَأَثلٍ وَشَيءٍ مِن سِدرٍ قَليلٍ
16.translation_eng: But they disregarded [the path of Allah], so We unleashed upon them a violent flood and replaced their two gardens with two gardens bearing bitter fruit, tamarisk, and sparse lote trees.
16.transliteration: fa-ʾaʿraḍū fa-ʾarsalnā ʿalayhim sayla l-ʿarimi wa-baddalnāhum bi-jannatayhim jannatayni dhawātay ʾukulin khamṭin wa-ʾathlin wa-shayʾin min sidrin qalīlin

17.content: ذٰلِكَ جَزَيناهُم بِما كَفَروا ۖ وَهَل نُجازي إِلَّا الكَفورَ
17.translation_eng: We requited them with that for their ingratitude. Do We requite [so] anyone except ingrates?
17.transliteration: dhālika jazaynāhum bi-mā kafarū wa-hal nujāzī ʾillā l-kafūra

18.content: وَجَعَلنا بَينَهُم وَبَينَ القُرَى الَّتي بارَكنا فيها قُرًى ظاهِرَةً وَقَدَّرنا فيهَا السَّيرَ ۖ سيروا فيها لَيالِيَ وَأَيّامًا آمِنينَ
18.translation_eng: We had placed between them and the towns which We had blessed hamlets prominent [from the main route], and We had ordained the course through them: ‘Travel through them in safety, night and day.’
18.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā baynahum wa-bayna l-qurā llatī bāraknā fīhā quran ẓāhiratan wa-qaddarnā fīhā s-sayra sīrū fīhā layāliya wa-ʾayyāman ʾāminīna

19.content: فَقالوا رَبَّنا باعِد بَينَ أَسفارِنا وَظَلَموا أَنفُسَهُم فَجَعَلناهُم أَحاديثَ وَمَزَّقناهُم كُلَّ مُمَزَّقٍ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِكُلِّ صَبّارٍ شَكورٍ
19.translation_eng: But they said, ‘Our Lord! Make the stages between our journeys far apart,’ and they wronged themselves. So We turned them into folktales and caused them to disintegrate totally. There are indeed signs in that for every patient and grateful [servant].
19.transliteration: fa-qālū rabbanā bāʿid bayna ʾasfārinā wa-ẓalamū ʾanfusahum fa-jaʿalnāhum ʾaḥādītha wa-mazzaqnāhum kulla mumazzaqin ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-kulli ṣabbārin shakūrin

20.content: وَلَقَد صَدَّقَ عَلَيهِم إِبليسُ ظَنَّهُ فَاتَّبَعوهُ إِلّا فَريقًا مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
20.translation_eng: Certainly Iblis had his conjecture come true about them. So they followed him —all except a part of the faithful.
20.transliteration: wa-la-qad ṣaddaqa ʿalayhim ʾiblīsu ẓannahū fa-ttabaʿūhu ʾillā farīqan mina l-muʾminīna

21.content: وَما كانَ لَهُ عَلَيهِم مِن سُلطانٍ إِلّا لِنَعلَمَ مَن يُؤمِنُ بِالآخِرَةِ مِمَّن هُوَ مِنها في شَكٍّ ۗ وَرَبُّكَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ حَفيظٌ
21.translation_eng: He had no authority over them, but that We may ascertain those who believe in the Hereafter from those who are in doubt about it, and your Lord is watchful over all things.
21.transliteration: wa-mā kāna lahū ʿalayhim min sulṭānin ʾillā li-naʿlama man yuʾminu bi-l-ʾākhirati mimman huwa minhā fī shakkin wa-rabbuka ʿalā kulli shayʾin ḥafīẓun

22.content: قُلِ ادعُوا الَّذينَ زَعَمتُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ۖ لا يَملِكونَ مِثقالَ ذَرَّةٍ فِي السَّماواتِ وَلا فِي الأَرضِ وَما لَهُم فيهِما مِن شِركٍ وَما لَهُ مِنهُم مِن ظَهيرٍ
22.translation_eng: Say, ‘Invoke them whom you claim [to be gods] besides Allah! They do not control [even] an atom’s weight in the heavens or the earth, nor have they any share in [either of] them, nor is any of them1 His supporter.’That is, the gods worshipped by the polytheists.
22.transliteration: quli dʿū lladhīna zaʿamtum min dūni llāhi lā yamlikūna mithqāla dharratin fī s-samāwāti wa-lā fī l-ʾarḍi wa-mā lahum fīhimā min shirkin wa-mā lahū minhum min ẓahīrin

23.content: وَلا تَنفَعُ الشَّفاعَةُ عِندَهُ إِلّا لِمَن أَذِنَ لَهُ ۚ حَتّىٰ إِذا فُزِّعَ عَن قُلوبِهِم قالوا ماذا قالَ رَبُّكُم ۖ قالُوا الحَقَّ ۖ وَهُوَ العَلِيُّ الكَبيرُ
23.translation_eng: Intercession is of no avail with Him except for those whom He permits.1 When fear is lifted from their hearts, they say, ‘What did your Lord say?’ They say, ‘The truth, and He is the All-exalted, the All-great.’See Zamakhshari and Ṭabāṭabā’ī. Or ‘except of those whom He permits.’
23.transliteration: wa-lā tanfaʿu sh-shafāʿatu ʿindahū ʾillā li-man ʾadhina lahū ḥattā ʾidhā fuzziʿa ʿan qulūbihim qālū mādhā qāla rabbukum qālū l-ḥaqqa wa-huwa l-ʿaliyyu l-kabīru

24.content: ۞ قُل مَن يَرزُقُكُم مِنَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ قُلِ اللَّهُ ۖ وَإِنّا أَو إِيّاكُم لَعَلىٰ هُدًى أَو في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
24.translation_eng: Say, ‘Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?’ Say, ‘Allah! Indeed either we or you are rightly guided or in manifest error.’
24.transliteration: qul man yarzuqukum mina s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi quli llāhu wa-ʾinnā ʾaw ʾiyyākum la-ʿalā hudan ʾaw fī ḍalālin mubīnin

25.content: قُل لا تُسأَلونَ عَمّا أَجرَمنا وَلا نُسأَلُ عَمّا تَعمَلونَ
25.translation_eng: Say, ‘You will not be questioned about our guilt, nor shall we be questioned about what you do.’
25.transliteration: qul lā tusʾalūna ʿammā ʾajramnā wa-lā nusʾalu ʿammā taʿmalūna

26.content: قُل يَجمَعُ بَينَنا رَبُّنا ثُمَّ يَفتَحُ بَينَنا بِالحَقِّ وَهُوَ الفَتّاحُ العَليمُ
26.translation_eng: Say, ‘Our Lord will bring us together, then He will judge between us with justice, and He is the All-knowing Judge.’1Or, ‘the Judge, the All-knowing.’
26.transliteration: qul yajmaʿu baynanā rabbunā thumma yaftaḥu baynanā bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-huwa l-fattāḥu l-ʿalīmu

27.content: قُل أَرونِيَ الَّذينَ أَلحَقتُم بِهِ شُرَكاءَ ۖ كَلّا ۚ بَل هُوَ اللَّهُ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
27.translation_eng: Say, ‘Show me those whom you associate with Him as partners.’ No indeed! [They can never show any such partner]. Rather He is Allah, the All-mighty, the All-wise.
27.transliteration: qul ʾarūniya lladhīna ʾalḥaqtum bihī shurakāʾa kallā bal huwa llāhu l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

28.content: وَما أَرسَلناكَ إِلّا كافَّةً لِلنّاسِ بَشيرًا وَنَذيرًا وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
28.translation_eng: We did not send you except as a bearer of good news and warner to all mankind, but most people do not know.
28.transliteration: wa-mā ʾarsalnāka ʾillā kāffatan li-n-nāsi bashīran wa-nadhīran wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūna

29.content: وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هٰذَا الوَعدُ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
29.translation_eng: And they say, ‘When will this promise be fulfilled, should you be truthful?’
29.transliteration: wa-yaqūlūna matā hādhā l-waʿdu ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

30.content: قُل لَكُم ميعادُ يَومٍ لا تَستَأخِرونَ عَنهُ ساعَةً وَلا تَستَقدِمونَ
30.translation_eng: Say, ‘Your promised hour is a day that you shall neither defer nor advance by an hour.’
30.transliteration: qul lakum mīʿādu yawmin lā tastaʾkhirūna ʿanhu sāʿatan wa-lā tastaqdimūna

31.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَن نُؤمِنَ بِهٰذَا القُرآنِ وَلا بِالَّذي بَينَ يَدَيهِ ۗ وَلَو تَرىٰ إِذِ الظّالِمونَ مَوقوفونَ عِندَ رَبِّهِم يَرجِعُ بَعضُهُم إِلىٰ بَعضٍ القَولَ يَقولُ الَّذينَ استُضعِفوا لِلَّذينَ استَكبَروا لَولا أَنتُم لَكُنّا مُؤمِنينَ
31.translation_eng: The faithless say, ‘We will never believe in this Qurʾān, nor in what was [revealed] before it.’ But if you were to see when the wrongdoers are made to stop before their Lord casting the blame on one another. Those who were abased will say to those who were arrogant, ‘Had it not been for you, we would surely have been faithful.’
31.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna kafarū lan nuʾmina bi-hādhā l-qurʾāni wa-lā bi-lladhī bayna yadayhi wa-law tarā ʾidhi ẓ-ẓālimūna mawqūfūna ʿinda rabbihim yarjiʿu baʿḍuhum ʾilā baʿḍin-i l-qawla yaqūlu lladhīna stuḍʿifū li-lladhīna stakbarū law-lā ʾantum la-kunnā muʾminīna

32.content: قالَ الَّذينَ استَكبَروا لِلَّذينَ استُضعِفوا أَنَحنُ صَدَدناكُم عَنِ الهُدىٰ بَعدَ إِذ جاءَكُم ۖ بَل كُنتُم مُجرِمينَ
32.translation_eng: Those who were arrogant will say to those who were abased, ‘Did we keep you from guidance after it had come to you? No, you were guilty [yourselves].’
32.transliteration: qāla lladhīna stakbarū li-lladhīna stuḍʿifū ʾa-naḥnu ṣadadnākum ʿani l-hudā baʿda ʾidh jāʾakum bal kuntum mujrimīna

33.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ استُضعِفوا لِلَّذينَ استَكبَروا بَل مَكرُ اللَّيلِ وَالنَّهارِ إِذ تَأمُرونَنا أَن نَكفُرَ بِاللَّهِ وَنَجعَلَ لَهُ أَندادًا ۚ وَأَسَرُّوا النَّدامَةَ لَمّا رَأَوُا العَذابَ وَجَعَلنَا الأَغلالَ في أَعناقِ الَّذينَ كَفَروا ۚ هَل يُجزَونَ إِلّا ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
33.translation_eng: Those who were abased will say to those who were arrogant, ‘Rather [it was your] night and day plotting, when you prompted us to forswear Allah and to set up equals to Him.’ They will hide their remorse when they sight the punishment, and We will put iron collars around the necks of the faithless. Shall they be requited except for what they used to do?
33.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna stuḍʿifū li-lladhīna stakbarū bal makru l-layli wa-n-nahāri ʾidh taʾmurūnanā ʾan nakfura bi-llāhi wa-najʿala lahū ʾandādan wa-ʾasarrū n-nadāmata lammā raʾawu l-ʿadhāba wa-jaʿalnā l-ʾaghlāla fī ʾaʿnāqi lladhīna kafarū hal yujzawna ʾillā mā kānū yaʿmalūna

34.content: وَما أَرسَلنا في قَريَةٍ مِن نَذيرٍ إِلّا قالَ مُترَفوها إِنّا بِما أُرسِلتُم بِهِ كافِرونَ
34.translation_eng: We did not send a warner to any town without its affluent ones saying, ‘We indeed disbelieve in what you have been sent with.’
34.transliteration: wa-mā ʾarsalnā fī qaryatin min nadhīrin ʾillā qāla mutrafūhā ʾinnā bi-mā ʾursiltum bihī kāfirūna

35.content: وَقالوا نَحنُ أَكثَرُ أَموالًا وَأَولادًا وَما نَحنُ بِمُعَذَّبينَ
35.translation_eng: And they say, ‘We have greater wealth and more children, and we will not be punished!’
35.transliteration: wa-qālū naḥnu ʾaktharu ʾamwālan wa-ʾawlādan wa-mā naḥnu bi-muʿadhdhabīna

36.content: قُل إِنَّ رَبّي يَبسُطُ الرِّزقَ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيَقدِرُ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
36.translation_eng: Say, ‘Indeed my Lord expands the provision for whomever He wishes and He tightens it, but most people do not know.’
36.transliteration: qul ʾinna rabbī yabsuṭu r-rizqa li-man yashāʾu wa-yaqdiru wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūna

37.content: وَما أَموالُكُم وَلا أَولادُكُم بِالَّتي تُقَرِّبُكُم عِندَنا زُلفىٰ إِلّا مَن آمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صالِحًا فَأُولٰئِكَ لَهُم جَزاءُ الضِّعفِ بِما عَمِلوا وَهُم فِي الغُرُفاتِ آمِنونَ
37.translation_eng: It is not your wealth, nor your children, that will bring you close to Us in nearness, except those who have faith and act righteously. It is they for whom there will be a twofold reward for what they did, and they will be secure in lofty abodes.1Cf. 29:58; 39:20.
37.transliteration: wa-mā ʾamwālukum wa-lā ʾawlādukum bi-llatī tuqarribukum ʿindanā zulfā ʾillā man ʾāmana wa-ʿamila ṣāliḥan fa-ʾulāʾika lahum jazāʾu ḍ-ḍiʿfi bi-mā ʿamilū wa-hum fī l-ghurufāti ʾāminūna

38.content: وَالَّذينَ يَسعَونَ في آياتِنا مُعاجِزينَ أُولٰئِكَ فِي العَذابِ مُحضَرونَ
38.translation_eng: As for those who contend with Our signs seeking to thwart [their purpose], they will be brought to the punishment.
38.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yasʿawna fī ʾāyātinā muʿājizīna ʾulāʾika fī l-ʿadhābi muḥḍarūna

39.content: قُل إِنَّ رَبّي يَبسُطُ الرِّزقَ لِمَن يَشاءُ مِن عِبادِهِ وَيَقدِرُ لَهُ ۚ وَما أَنفَقتُم مِن شَيءٍ فَهُوَ يُخلِفُهُ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيرُ الرّازِقينَ
39.translation_eng: Say, ‘Indeed my Lord expands the provision for whomever of His servants that He wishes and tightens it, and He will repay whatever you may spend, and He is the best of providers.’
39.transliteration: qul ʾinna rabbī yabsuṭu r-rizqa li-man yashāʾu min ʿibādihī wa-yaqdiru lahū wa-mā ʾanfaqtum min shayʾin fa-huwa yukhlifuhū wa-huwa khayru r-rāziqīna

40.content: وَيَومَ يَحشُرُهُم جَميعًا ثُمَّ يَقولُ لِلمَلائِكَةِ أَهٰؤُلاءِ إِيّاكُم كانوا يَعبُدونَ
40.translation_eng: On the day He will muster them all together, then He will say to the angels, ‘Was it you that these used to worship?’
40.transliteration: wa-yawma yaḥshuruhum jamīʿan thumma yaqūlu li-l-malāʾikati ʾa-hāʾulāʾi ʾiyyākum kānū yaʿbudūna

41.content: قالوا سُبحانَكَ أَنتَ وَلِيُّنا مِن دونِهِم ۖ بَل كانوا يَعبُدونَ الجِنَّ ۖ أَكثَرُهُم بِهِم مُؤمِنونَ
41.translation_eng: They will say, ‘Immaculate are You! You are our intimate, not they! Rather they used to worship the jinn; most of them had faith in them.’
41.transliteration: qālū subḥānaka ʾanta waliyyunā min dūnihim bal kānū yaʿbudūna l-jinna ʾaktharuhum bihim muʾminūna

42.content: فَاليَومَ لا يَملِكُ بَعضُكُم لِبَعضٍ نَفعًا وَلا ضَرًّا وَنَقولُ لِلَّذينَ ظَلَموا ذوقوا عَذابَ النّارِ الَّتي كُنتُم بِها تُكَذِّبونَ
42.translation_eng: ‘Today you have no power to benefit or harm one another,’ and We shall say to those who did wrong, ‘Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny.’
42.transliteration: fa-l-yawma lā yamliku baʿḍukum li-baʿḍin nafʿan wa-lā ḍarran wa-naqūlu li-lladhīna ẓalamū dhūqū ʿadhāba n-nāri llatī kuntum bihā tukadhdhibūna

43.content: وَإِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم آياتُنا بَيِّناتٍ قالوا ما هٰذا إِلّا رَجُلٌ يُريدُ أَن يَصُدَّكُم عَمّا كانَ يَعبُدُ آباؤُكُم وَقالوا ما هٰذا إِلّا إِفكٌ مُفتَرًى ۚ وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لِلحَقِّ لَمّا جاءَهُم إِن هٰذا إِلّا سِحرٌ مُبينٌ
43.translation_eng: When Our manifest signs are recited to them, they say, ‘This is just a man who desires to keep you from what your fathers used to worship.’ And they say, ‘This is nothing but a fabricated lie.’ The faithless say of the truth when it comes to them: ‘This is nothing but plain magic.’
43.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhim ʾāyātunā bayyinātin qālū mā hādhā ʾillā rajulun yurīdu ʾan yaṣuddakum ʿammā kāna yaʿbudu ʾābāʾukum wa-qālū mā hādhā ʾillā ʾifkun muftaran wa-qāla lladhīna kafarū li-l-ḥaqqi lammā jāʾahum ʾin hādhā ʾillā siḥrun mubīnun

44.content: وَما آتَيناهُم مِن كُتُبٍ يَدرُسونَها ۖ وَما أَرسَلنا إِلَيهِم قَبلَكَ مِن نَذيرٍ
44.translation_eng: We did not give them1 any scriptures that they might have studied, nor did We send them any warner before you.2That is, the pre-Islamic Arabs.Cf. 36:6.
44.transliteration: wa-mā ʾātaynāhum min kutubin yadrusūnahā wa-mā ʾarsalnā ʾilayhim qablaka min nadhīrin

45.content: وَكَذَّبَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم وَما بَلَغوا مِعشارَ ما آتَيناهُم فَكَذَّبوا رُسُلي ۖ فَكَيفَ كانَ نَكيرِ
45.translation_eng: Those who were before them denied [the apostles], and these have not received one-tenth1 of what We had given them. But they denied My apostles, so how was My rebuttal!2Or ‘a thousandth.’Or ‘how was my requital.’
45.transliteration: wa-kadhdhaba lladhīna min qablihim wa-mā balaghū miʿshāra mā ʾātaynāhum fa-kadhdhabū rusulī fa-kayfa kāna nakīri

46.content: ۞ قُل إِنَّما أَعِظُكُم بِواحِدَةٍ ۖ أَن تَقوموا لِلَّهِ مَثنىٰ وَفُرادىٰ ثُمَّ تَتَفَكَّروا ۚ ما بِصاحِبِكُم مِن جِنَّةٍ ۚ إِن هُوَ إِلّا نَذيرٌ لَكُم بَينَ يَدَي عَذابٍ شَديدٍ
46.translation_eng: Say, ‘I give you just a single advice: that you rise up for Allah’s sake, in twos, or individually, and then reflect: there is no madness in your companion: he is just a warner to you before [the befalling of] a severe punishment.’
46.transliteration: qul ʾinnamā ʾaʿiẓukum bi-wāḥidatin ʾan taqūmū li-llāhi mathnā wa-furādā thumma tatafakkarū mā bi-ṣāḥibikum min jinnatin ʾin huwa ʾillā nadhīrun lakum bayna yaday ʿadhābin shadīdin

47.content: قُل ما سَأَلتُكُم مِن أَجرٍ فَهُوَ لَكُم ۖ إِن أَجرِيَ إِلّا عَلَى اللَّهِ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ شَهيدٌ
47.translation_eng: Say, ‘Whatever reward I may have asked you is for your own good. My [true] reward lies only with Allah, and He is witness to all things.’
47.transliteration: qul mā saʾaltukum min ʾajrin fa-huwa lakum ʾin ʾajriya ʾillā ʿalā llāhi wa-huwa ʿalā kulli shayʾin shahīdun

48.content: قُل إِنَّ رَبّي يَقذِفُ بِالحَقِّ عَلّامُ الغُيوبِ
48.translation_eng: Say, ‘Indeed my Lord hurls1 the truth. [He is] the knower of all that is Unseen.’Cf. 17:81; 21:18. Or ‘casts the Truth;’ i.e., into the hearts of His envoys.
48.transliteration: qul ʾinna rabbī yaqdhifu bi-l-ḥaqqi ʿallāmu l-ghuyūbi

49.content: قُل جاءَ الحَقُّ وَما يُبدِئُ الباطِلُ وَما يُعيدُ
49.translation_eng: Say, ‘The truth has come, and falsehood neither originates [anything] not does it restore [anything].’
49.transliteration: qul jāʾa l-ḥaqqu wa-mā yubdiʾu l-bāṭilu wa-mā yuʿīdu

50.content: قُل إِن ضَلَلتُ فَإِنَّما أَضِلُّ عَلىٰ نَفسي ۖ وَإِنِ اهتَدَيتُ فَبِما يوحي إِلَيَّ رَبّي ۚ إِنَّهُ سَميعٌ قَريبٌ
50.translation_eng: Say, ‘If I go astray, my going astray is only to my own harm, and if I am rightly guided that is because of what my Lord has revealed to me. Indeed He is all-hearing, nearmost.’
50.transliteration: qul ʾin ḍalaltu fa-ʾinnamā ʾaḍillu ʿalā nafsī wa-ʾini htadaytu fa-bi-mā yūḥī ʾilayya rabbī ʾinnahū samīʿun qarībun

51.content: وَلَو تَرىٰ إِذ فَزِعوا فَلا فَوتَ وَأُخِذوا مِن مَكانٍ قَريبٍ
51.translation_eng: Were you to see when they are stricken with terror, [and left] without an escape, and are seized from a close quarter.
51.transliteration: wa-law tarā ʾidh faziʿū fa-lā fawta wa-ʾukhidhū min makānin qarībin

52.content: وَقالوا آمَنّا بِهِ وَأَنّىٰ لَهُمُ التَّناوُشُ مِن مَكانٍ بَعيدٍ
52.translation_eng: They will say, ‘We believe in it [now].’ But how can they reach it from a far-off place,
52.transliteration: wa-qālū ʾāmannā bihī wa-ʾannā lahumu t-tanāwushu min makānin baʿīdin

53.content: وَقَد كَفَروا بِهِ مِن قَبلُ ۖ وَيَقذِفونَ بِالغَيبِ مِن مَكانٍ بَعيدٍ
53.translation_eng: when they have already disbelieved it earlier? They shoot at the invisible from a far-off place!
53.transliteration: wa-qad kafarū bihī min qablu wa-yaqdhifūna bi-l-ghaybi min makānin baʿīdin

54.content: وَحيلَ بَينَهُم وَبَينَ ما يَشتَهونَ كَما فُعِلَ بِأَشياعِهِم مِن قَبلُ ۚ إِنَّهُم كانوا في شَكٍّ مُريبٍ
54.translation_eng: A barrier will be set up between them and what they long for, just as was done formerly with their counterparts. Indeed they used to be in grave doubt.
54.transliteration: wa-ḥīla baynahum wa-bayna mā yashtahūna ka-mā fuʿila bi-ʾashyāʿihim min qablu ʾinnahum kānū fī shakkin murībin

35.description: The surah that opens with the praise of God as The Originator of the heavens and the earth. It takes its name from the word “fāṭir” (orginator), which occurs in verse 1. The surah airms God’s power and Creation and contrasts this with the powerlessness and uselessness of the “partners” set up by the idolaters. The surah warns the idolaters of their punishment and comforts the Prophet through mention of previous messengers who were also rejected as liars. The great rewards that await believers are described.The surah is also known as: Sole Originator, The Bringer into Being, The Creator.

1.content: الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ فاطِرِ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ جاعِلِ المَلائِكَةِ رُسُلًا أُولي أَجنِحَةٍ مَثنىٰ وَثُلاثَ وَرُباعَ ۚ يَزيدُ فِي الخَلقِ ما يَشاءُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
1.translation_eng: All praise belongs to Allah, originator of the heavens and the earth, maker of the angels [His] messengers, possessing wings, two, three or four [of them]. He adds to the creation whatever He wishes. Indeed Allah has power over all things.
1.transliteration: al-ḥamdu li-llāhi fāṭiri s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi jāʿili l-malāʾikati rusulan ʾulī ʾajniḥatin mathnā wa-thulātha wa-rubāʿa yazīdu fī l-khalqi mā yashāʾu ʾinna llāha ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

2.content: ما يَفتَحِ اللَّهُ لِلنّاسِ مِن رَحمَةٍ فَلا مُمسِكَ لَها ۖ وَما يُمسِك فَلا مُرسِلَ لَهُ مِن بَعدِهِ ۚ وَهُوَ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
2.translation_eng: Whatever mercy Allah unfolds for the people, no one can withhold it; and whatever He withholds no one can release it after Him,1 and He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.That is, after His withholding it. Or ‘no one can release it except Him.’
2.transliteration: mā yaftaḥi llāhu li-n-nāsi min raḥmatin fa-lā mumsika lahā wa-mā yumsik fa-lā mursila lahū min baʿdihī wa-huwa l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

3.content: يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ اذكُروا نِعمَتَ اللَّهِ عَلَيكُم ۚ هَل مِن خالِقٍ غَيرُ اللَّهِ يَرزُقُكُم مِنَ السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ ۖ فَأَنّىٰ تُؤفَكونَ
3.translation_eng: O mankind! Remember Allah’s blessing upon you! Is there any creator other than Allah who provides for you from the sky and the earth? There is no god except Him. So where do you stray?
3.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu dhkurū niʿmata llāhi ʿalaykum hal min khāliqin ghayru llāhi yarzuqukum mina s-samāʾi wa-l-ʾarḍi lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa fa-ʾannā tuʾfakūna

4.content: وَإِن يُكَذِّبوكَ فَقَد كُذِّبَت رُسُلٌ مِن قَبلِكَ ۚ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ تُرجَعُ الأُمورُ
4.translation_eng: If they impugn you, certainly [other] apostles were impugned before you, and all matters are returned to Allah.
4.transliteration: wa-ʾin yukadhdhibūka fa-qad kudhdhibat rusulun min qablika wa-ʾilā llāhi turjaʿu l-ʾumūru

5.content: يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ إِنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ ۖ فَلا تَغُرَّنَّكُمُ الحَياةُ الدُّنيا ۖ وَلا يَغُرَّنَّكُم بِاللَّهِ الغَرورُ
5.translation_eng: O mankind! Allah’s promise is indeed true. So do not let the life of the world deceive you, nor let the Deceiver deceive you concerning Allah.1Cf. 31:33.
5.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ʾinna waʿda llāhi ḥaqqun fa-lā taghurrannakumu l-ḥayātu d-dunyā wa-lā yaghurrannakum bi-llāhi l-gharūru

6.content: إِنَّ الشَّيطانَ لَكُم عَدُوٌّ فَاتَّخِذوهُ عَدُوًّا ۚ إِنَّما يَدعو حِزبَهُ لِيَكونوا مِن أَصحابِ السَّعيرِ
6.translation_eng: Satan is indeed your enemy, so treat him as an enemy. He only invites his confederates so that they may be among the inmates of the Blaze.
6.transliteration: ʾinna sh-shayṭāna lakum ʿaduwwun fa-ttakhidhūhu ʿaduwwan ʾinnamā yadʿū ḥizbahū li-yakūnū min ʾaṣḥābi s-saʿīri

7.content: الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَهُم عَذابٌ شَديدٌ ۖ وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَأَجرٌ كَبيرٌ
7.translation_eng: There is a severe punishment for the faithless, but for those who have faith and do righteous deeds there will be forgiveness and a great reward.
7.transliteration: alladhīna kafarū lahum ʿadhābun shadīdun wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti lahum maghfiratun wa-ʾajrun kabīrun

8.content: أَفَمَن زُيِّنَ لَهُ سوءُ عَمَلِهِ فَرَآهُ حَسَنًا ۖ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ يُضِلُّ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَهدي مَن يَشاءُ ۖ فَلا تَذهَب نَفسُكَ عَلَيهِم حَسَراتٍ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَليمٌ بِما يَصنَعونَ
8.translation_eng: Is someone the evil of whose conduct is presented as decorous to him, so he regards it as good… .1 Indeed Allah leads astray whomever He wishes, and guides whomever He wishes. So do not fret yourself to death regretting for them. Indeed Allah knows best what they do.Ellipsis. The phrase omitted is ‘like one who is truly virtuous?’
8.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man zuyyina lahū sūʾu ʿamalihī fa-raʾāhu ḥasanan fa-ʾinna llāha yuḍillu man yashāʾu wa-yahdī man yashāʾu fa-lā tadhhab nafsuka ʿalayhim ḥasarātin ʾinna llāha ʿalīmun bi-mā yaṣnaʿūna

9.content: وَاللَّهُ الَّذي أَرسَلَ الرِّياحَ فَتُثيرُ سَحابًا فَسُقناهُ إِلىٰ بَلَدٍ مَيِّتٍ فَأَحيَينا بِهِ الأَرضَ بَعدَ مَوتِها ۚ كَذٰلِكَ النُّشورُ
9.translation_eng: It is Allah who sends the winds and they raise a cloud; then We drive it toward a dead land and with it revive the earth after its death. Likewise will be the resurrection [of the dead].
9.transliteration: wa-llāhu lladhī ʾarsala r-riyāḥa fa-tuthīru saḥāban fa-suqnāhu ʾilā baladin mayyitin fa-ʾaḥyaynā bihi l-ʾarḍa baʿda mawtihā ka-dhālika n-nushūru

10.content: مَن كانَ يُريدُ العِزَّةَ فَلِلَّهِ العِزَّةُ جَميعًا ۚ إِلَيهِ يَصعَدُ الكَلِمُ الطَّيِّبُ وَالعَمَلُ الصّالِحُ يَرفَعُهُ ۚ وَالَّذينَ يَمكُرونَ السَّيِّئَاتِ لَهُم عَذابٌ شَديدٌ ۖ وَمَكرُ أُولٰئِكَ هُوَ يَبورُ
10.translation_eng: Whoever seeks honour1 [should know that] honour entirely belongs to Allah. To Him ascends the good word, and He elevates righteous conduct;2 as for those who devise evil schemes, there is a severe punishment for them, and their plotting shall come to naught.The word ʿizzah in Arabic has a composite meaning including the senses of honour, prestige, glory and might.Or ‘righteous conduct elevates it.’
10.transliteration: man kāna yurīdu l-ʿizzata fa-li-llāhi l-ʿizzatu jamīʿan ʾilayhi yaṣʿadu l-kalimu ṭ-ṭayyibu wa-l-ʿamalu ṣ-ṣāliḥu yarfaʿuhū wa-lladhīna yamkurūna s-sayyiʾāti lahum ʿadhābun shadīdun wa-makru ʾulāʾika huwa yabūru

11.content: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَكُم مِن تُرابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُطفَةٍ ثُمَّ جَعَلَكُم أَزواجًا ۚ وَما تَحمِلُ مِن أُنثىٰ وَلا تَضَعُ إِلّا بِعِلمِهِ ۚ وَما يُعَمَّرُ مِن مُعَمَّرٍ وَلا يُنقَصُ مِن عُمُرِهِ إِلّا في كِتابٍ ۚ إِنَّ ذٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسيرٌ
11.translation_eng: Allah created you from dust, then from a drop of [seminal] fluid, then He made you mates.1 No female conceives or delivers except with His knowledge, and no elderly person advances in years, nor is anything diminished of his life, but it is [recorded] in a Book. That is indeed easy for Allah.That is, male and female.
11.transliteration: wa-llāhu khalaqakum min turābin thumma min nuṭfatin thumma jaʿalakum ʾazwājan wa-mā taḥmilu min ʾunthā wa-lā taḍaʿu ʾillā bi-ʿilmihī wa-mā yuʿammaru min muʿammarin wa-lā yunqaṣu min ʿumurihī ʾillā fī kitābin ʾinna dhālika ʿalā llāhi yasīrun

12.content: وَما يَستَوِي البَحرانِ هٰذا عَذبٌ فُراتٌ سائِغٌ شَرابُهُ وَهٰذا مِلحٌ أُجاجٌ ۖ وَمِن كُلٍّ تَأكُلونَ لَحمًا طَرِيًّا وَتَستَخرِجونَ حِليَةً تَلبَسونَها ۖ وَتَرَى الفُلكَ فيهِ مَواخِرَ لِتَبتَغوا مِن فَضلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
12.translation_eng: Not alike are the two seas:1 this one sweet and agreeable, pleasant to drink, and that one briny and bitter, and from each you eat fresh meat and obtain ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through them, that you may seek of His grace, and so that you may give thanks.That is, the body of sweet water and the body of fresh water. The word baḥr, like yamm is used for a large river as well as for the sea (cf. 7:136, 20:78, 28:40, 51:40, where it is used for the Red Sea; and 20:39, 28:7, where it is used for the Nile).
12.transliteration: wa-mā yastawī l-baḥrāni hādhā ʿadhbun furātun sāʾighun sharābuhū wa-hādhā milḥun ʾujājun wa-min kullin taʾkulūna laḥman ṭariyyan wa-tastakhrijūna ḥilyatan talbasūnahā wa-tarā l-fulka fīhi mawākhira li-tabtaghū min faḍlihī wa-laʿallakum tashkurūna

13.content: يولِجُ اللَّيلَ فِي النَّهارِ وَيولِجُ النَّهارَ فِي اللَّيلِ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ كُلٌّ يَجري لِأَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۚ ذٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُم لَهُ المُلكُ ۚ وَالَّذينَ تَدعونَ مِن دونِهِ ما يَملِكونَ مِن قِطميرٍ
13.translation_eng: He makes the night pass into the day and makes the day pass into the night, and He has disposed the sun and the moon, each moving for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs all sovereignty. As for those whom you invoke besides Him, they do not control so much as the husk of a date stone.
13.transliteration: yūliju l-layla fī n-nahāri wa-yūliju n-nahāra fī l-layli wa-sakhkhara sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara kullun yajrī li-ʾajalin musamman dhālikumu llāhu rabbukum lahu l-mulku wa-lladhīna tadʿūna min dūnihī mā yamlikūna min qiṭmīrin

14.content: إِن تَدعوهُم لا يَسمَعوا دُعاءَكُم وَلَو سَمِعوا مَا استَجابوا لَكُم ۖ وَيَومَ القِيامَةِ يَكفُرونَ بِشِركِكُم ۚ وَلا يُنَبِّئُكَ مِثلُ خَبيرٍ
14.translation_eng: If you invoke them they will not hear your invocation, and even if they heard they cannot respond to you, and on the Day of Resurrection they will forswear your polytheism, and none can inform you like the One who is all-aware.
14.transliteration: ʾin tadʿūhum lā yasmaʿū duʿāʾakum wa-law samiʿū mā stajābū lakum wa-yawma l-qiyāmati yakfurūna bi-shirkikum wa-lā yunabbiʾuka mithlu khabīrin

15.content: ۞ يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ أَنتُمُ الفُقَراءُ إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ وَاللَّهُ هُوَ الغَنِيُّ الحَميدُ
15.translation_eng: O mankind! You are the ones who stand in need of Allah, and Allah—He is the All-sufficient, the All-laudable.
15.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ʾantumu l-fuqarāʾu ʾilā llāhi wa-llāhu huwa l-ghaniyyu l-ḥamīdu

16.content: إِن يَشَأ يُذهِبكُم وَيَأتِ بِخَلقٍ جَديدٍ
16.translation_eng: If He wishes, He will take you away, and bring about a new creation;
16.transliteration: ʾin yashaʾ yudhhibkum wa-yaʾti bi-khalqin jadīdin

17.content: وَما ذٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ بِعَزيزٍ
17.translation_eng: and that is not a hard thing for Allah.
17.transliteration: wa-mā dhālika ʿalā llāhi bi-ʿazīzin

18.content: وَلا تَزِرُ وازِرَةٌ وِزرَ أُخرىٰ ۚ وَإِن تَدعُ مُثقَلَةٌ إِلىٰ حِملِها لا يُحمَل مِنهُ شَيءٌ وَلَو كانَ ذا قُربىٰ ۗ إِنَّما تُنذِرُ الَّذينَ يَخشَونَ رَبَّهُم بِالغَيبِ وَأَقامُوا الصَّلاةَ ۚ وَمَن تَزَكّىٰ فَإِنَّما يَتَزَكّىٰ لِنَفسِهِ ۚ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ المَصيرُ
18.translation_eng: No bearer shall bear another’s burden, and should one heavily burdened call [another] to carry it, nothing of it will be carried, even if he were a near relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord in secret and maintain the prayer. Whoever purifies himself, purifies only for his own sake, and to Allah is the return.
18.transliteration: wa-lā taziru wāziratun wizra ʾukhrā wa-ʾin tadʿu muthqalatun ʾilā ḥimlihā lā yuḥmal minhu shayʾun wa-law kāna dhā qurbā ʾinnamā tundhiru lladhīna yakhshawna rabbahum bi-l-ghaybi wa-ʾaqāmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-man tazakkā fa-ʾinnamā yatazakkā li-nafsihī wa-ʾilā llāhi l-maṣīru

19.content: وَما يَستَوِي الأَعمىٰ وَالبَصيرُ
19.translation_eng: The blind one and the seer are not equal,
19.transliteration: wa-mā yastawī l-ʾaʿmā wa-l-baṣīru

20.content: وَلَا الظُّلُماتُ وَلَا النّورُ
20.translation_eng: nor darkness and light;
20.transliteration: wa-lā ẓ-ẓulumātu wa-lā n-nūru

21.content: وَلَا الظِّلُّ وَلَا الحَرورُ
21.translation_eng: nor shade and torrid heat;
21.transliteration: wa-lā ẓ-ẓillu wa-lā l-ḥarūru

22.content: وَما يَستَوِي الأَحياءُ وَلَا الأَمواتُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُسمِعُ مَن يَشاءُ ۖ وَما أَنتَ بِمُسمِعٍ مَن فِي القُبورِ
22.translation_eng: nor are the living equal to the dead. Indeed Allah makes whomever He wishes to hear, and you cannot make those who are in the graves hear.
22.transliteration: wa-mā yastawī l-ʾaḥyāʾu wa-lā l-ʾamwātu ʾinna llāha yusmiʿu man yashāʾu wa-mā ʾanta bi-musmiʿin man fī l-qubūri

23.content: إِن أَنتَ إِلّا نَذيرٌ
23.translation_eng: You are but a warner.
23.transliteration: ʾin ʾanta ʾillā nadhīrun

24.content: إِنّا أَرسَلناكَ بِالحَقِّ بَشيرًا وَنَذيرًا ۚ وَإِن مِن أُمَّةٍ إِلّا خَلا فيها نَذيرٌ
24.translation_eng: Indeed We have sent you with the truth as a bearer of good news and as a warner; and there is not a nation but a warner has passed in it.
24.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾarsalnāka bi-l-ḥaqqi bashīran wa-nadhīran wa-ʾin min ʾummatin ʾillā khalā fīhā nadhīrun

25.content: وَإِن يُكَذِّبوكَ فَقَد كَذَّبَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم جاءَتهُم رُسُلُهُم بِالبَيِّناتِ وَبِالزُّبُرِ وَبِالكِتابِ المُنيرِ
25.translation_eng: If they impugn you, those before them have impugned [likewise]: their apostles brought them manifest proofs, [holy] writs, and illuminating scriptures.
25.transliteration: wa-ʾin yukadhdhibūka fa-qad kadhdhaba lladhīna min qablihim jāʾathum rusuluhum bi-l-bayyināti wa-bi-z-zuburi wa-bi-l-kitābi l-munīri

26.content: ثُمَّ أَخَذتُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا ۖ فَكَيفَ كانَ نَكيرِ
26.translation_eng: Then I seized the faithless. So how was My rebuttal!
26.transliteration: thumma ʾakhadhtu lladhīna kafarū fa-kayfa kāna nakīri

27.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَأَخرَجنا بِهِ ثَمَراتٍ مُختَلِفًا أَلوانُها ۚ وَمِنَ الجِبالِ جُدَدٌ بيضٌ وَحُمرٌ مُختَلِفٌ أَلوانُها وَغَرابيبُ سودٌ
27.translation_eng: Have you not regarded that Allah sends down water from the sky, with which We produce fruits of diverse hues; and in the mountains are stripes white and red, of diverse hues, and [others] pitch black?
27.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾanna llāha ʾanzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-ʾakhrajnā bihī thamarātin mukhtalifan ʾalwānuhā wa-mina l-jibāli judadun bīḍun wa-ḥumrun mukhtalifun ʾalwānuhā wa-gharābību sūdun

28.content: وَمِنَ النّاسِ وَالدَّوابِّ وَالأَنعامِ مُختَلِفٌ أَلوانُهُ كَذٰلِكَ ۗ إِنَّما يَخشَى اللَّهَ مِن عِبادِهِ العُلَماءُ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزيزٌ غَفورٌ
28.translation_eng: And of humans and beasts and cattle there are likewise diverse hues. Only those of Allah’s servants having knowledge fear Him. Indeed Allah is all-mighty, all-forgiving.
28.transliteration: wa-mina n-nāsi wa-d-dawābbi wa-l-ʾanʿāmi mukhtalifun ʾalwānuhū ka-dhālika ʾinnamā yakhshā llāha min ʿibādihi l-ʿulamāʾu ʾinna llāha ʿazīzun ghafūrun

29.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَتلونَ كِتابَ اللَّهِ وَأَقامُوا الصَّلاةَ وَأَنفَقوا مِمّا رَزَقناهُم سِرًّا وَعَلانِيَةً يَرجونَ تِجارَةً لَن تَبورَ
29.translation_eng: Indeed those who recite the Book of Allah and maintain the prayer, and spend out of what We have provided them, secretly and openly, expect a commerce that will never go bankrupt,
29.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna yatlūna kitāba llāhi wa-ʾaqāmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-ʾanfaqū mimmā razaqnāhum sirran wa-ʿalāniyatan yarjūna tijāratan lan tabūra

30.content: لِيُوَفِّيَهُم أُجورَهُم وَيَزيدَهُم مِن فَضلِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ غَفورٌ شَكورٌ
30.translation_eng: so that He may pay them their reward in full and enhance them out of His grace. Indeed He is all-forgiving, all-appreciative.
30.transliteration: li-yuwaffiyahum ʾujūrahum wa-yazīdahum min faḍlihī ʾinnahū ghafūrun shakūrun

31.content: وَالَّذي أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ مِنَ الكِتابِ هُوَ الحَقُّ مُصَدِّقًا لِما بَينَ يَدَيهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِعِبادِهِ لَخَبيرٌ بَصيرٌ
31.translation_eng: That which We have revealed to you of the Book is the truth, confirming what was [revealed] before it. Indeed Allah is all-aware, all-seeing about His servants.
31.transliteration: wa-lladhī ʾawḥaynā ʾilayka mina l-kitābi huwa l-ḥaqqu muṣaddiqan li-mā bayna yadayhi ʾinna llāha bi-ʿibādihī la-khabīrun baṣīrun

32.content: ثُمَّ أَورَثنَا الكِتابَ الَّذينَ اصطَفَينا مِن عِبادِنا ۖ فَمِنهُم ظالِمٌ لِنَفسِهِ وَمِنهُم مُقتَصِدٌ وَمِنهُم سابِقٌ بِالخَيراتِ بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الفَضلُ الكَبيرُ
32.translation_eng: Then We made heirs to the Book1 those whom We chose from Our servants. Yet some of them are those who wrong themselves, and some of them are average, and some of them are those who take the lead in all the good works by Allah’s will. That is the greatest grace [of Allah]!That is, the Qurʾān.
32.transliteration: thumma ʾawrathnā l-kitāba lladhīna ṣṭafaynā min ʿibādinā fa-minhum ẓālimun li-nafsihī wa-minhum muqtaṣidun wa-minhum sābiqun bi-l-khayrāti bi-ʾidhni llāhi dhālika huwa l-faḍlu l-kabīru

33.content: جَنّاتُ عَدنٍ يَدخُلونَها يُحَلَّونَ فيها مِن أَساوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍ وَلُؤلُؤًا ۖ وَلِباسُهُم فيها حَريرٌ
33.translation_eng: Gardens of Eden, which they will enter, adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their garments therein will be of silk.
33.transliteration: jannātu ʿadnin yadkhulūnahā yuḥallawna fīhā min ʾasāwira min dhahabin wa-luʾluʾan wa-libāsuhum fīhā ḥarīrun

34.content: وَقالُوا الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذي أَذهَبَ عَنَّا الحَزَنَ ۖ إِنَّ رَبَّنا لَغَفورٌ شَكورٌ
34.translation_eng: They will say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah, who has removed all grief from us. Indeed Our Lord is all-forgiving, all-appreciative,
34.transliteration: wa-qālū l-ḥamdu li-llāhi lladhī ʾadhhaba ʿannā l-ḥazana ʾinna rabbanā la-ghafūrun shakūrun-i

35.content: الَّذي أَحَلَّنا دارَ المُقامَةِ مِن فَضلِهِ لا يَمَسُّنا فيها نَصَبٌ وَلا يَمَسُّنا فيها لُغوبٌ
35.translation_eng: who has settled us in the everlasting abode by His grace. In it we are untouched by toil, and untouched therein by fatigue.’
35.transliteration: alladhī ʾaḥallanā dāra l-muqāmati min faḍlihī lā yamassunā fīhā naṣabun wa-lā yamassunā fīhā lughūbun

36.content: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا لَهُم نارُ جَهَنَّمَ لا يُقضىٰ عَلَيهِم فَيَموتوا وَلا يُخَفَّفُ عَنهُم مِن عَذابِها ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نَجزي كُلَّ كَفورٍ
36.translation_eng: As for the faithless there is for them the fire of hell: they will neither be done away with so that they may die, nor shall its punishment be lightened for them. Thus do We requite every ingrate.
36.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kafarū lahum nāru jahannama lā yuqḍā ʿalayhim fa-yamūtū wa-lā yukhaffafu ʿanhum min ʿadhābihā ka-dhālika najzī kulla kafūrin

37.content: وَهُم يَصطَرِخونَ فيها رَبَّنا أَخرِجنا نَعمَل صالِحًا غَيرَ الَّذي كُنّا نَعمَلُ ۚ أَوَلَم نُعَمِّركُم ما يَتَذَكَّرُ فيهِ مَن تَذَكَّرَ وَجاءَكُمُ النَّذيرُ ۖ فَذوقوا فَما لِلظّالِمينَ مِن نَصيرٍ
37.translation_eng: They shall cry therein for help: ‘Our Lord! Bring us out, so that we may act righteously —different from what we used to do!’ ‘Did We not give you a life long enough that one who is heedful might take admonition? And [moreover] the warner had [also] come to you. Now taste [the consequence of your deeds], for the wrongdoers have no helper.’
37.transliteration: wa-hum yaṣṭarikhūna fīhā rabbanā ʾakhrijnā naʿmal ṣāliḥan ghayra lladhī kunnā naʿmalu ʾa-wa-lam nuʿammirkum mā yatadhakkaru fīhi man tadhakkara wa-jāʾakumu n-nadhīru fa-dhūqū fa-mā li-ẓ-ẓālimīna min naṣīrin

38.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ عالِمُ غَيبِ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
38.translation_eng: Indeed Allah is the knower of the Unseen of the heavens and the earth. Indeed He knows well what is in the breasts.
38.transliteration: ʾinna llāha ʿālimu ghaybi s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾinnahū ʿalīmun bi-dhāti ṣ-ṣudūri

39.content: هُوَ الَّذي جَعَلَكُم خَلائِفَ فِي الأَرضِ ۚ فَمَن كَفَرَ فَعَلَيهِ كُفرُهُ ۖ وَلا يَزيدُ الكافِرينَ كُفرُهُم عِندَ رَبِّهِم إِلّا مَقتًا ۖ وَلا يَزيدُ الكافِرينَ كُفرُهُم إِلّا خَسارًا
39.translation_eng: It is He who made you successors on the earth.1 So whoever is faithless, his unfaith is to his own detriment. And the unfaith of the faithless does not increase them with their Lord [in anything] except disfavour, and their unfaith increases the faithless in nothing except loss.That is, of the former peoples.
39.transliteration: huwa lladhī jaʿalakum khalāʾifa fī l-ʾarḍi fa-man kafara fa-ʿalayhi kufruhū wa-lā yazīdu l-kāfirīna kufruhum ʿinda rabbihim ʾillā maqtan wa-lā yazīdu l-kāfirīna kufruhum ʾillā khasāran

40.content: قُل أَرَأَيتُم شُرَكاءَكُمُ الَّذينَ تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ أَروني ماذا خَلَقوا مِنَ الأَرضِ أَم لَهُم شِركٌ فِي السَّماواتِ أَم آتَيناهُم كِتابًا فَهُم عَلىٰ بَيِّنَتٍ مِنهُ ۚ بَل إِن يَعِدُ الظّالِمونَ بَعضُهُم بَعضًا إِلّا غُرورًا
40.translation_eng: Say, ‘Tell me about your partners [you ascribe to Allah] whom you invoke besides Allah? Show me what [part] of the earth have they created. Do they have any share in the heavens?’ Have We given them a scripture so that they stand on a manifest proof thereof? Rather the wrongdoers do not promise one another [anything] except delusion.
40.transliteration: qul ʾa-raʾaytum shurakāʾakumu lladhīna tadʿūna min dūni llāhi ʾarūnī mādhā khalaqū mina l-ʾarḍi ʾam lahum shirkun fī s-samāwāti ʾam ʾātaynāhum kitāban fa-hum ʿalā bayyinatin minhu bal ʾin yaʿidu ẓ-ẓālimūna baʿḍuhum baʿḍan ʾillā ghurūran

41.content: ۞ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُمسِكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ أَن تَزولا ۚ وَلَئِن زالَتا إِن أَمسَكَهُما مِن أَحَدٍ مِن بَعدِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ حَليمًا غَفورًا
41.translation_eng: Indeed Allah sustains the heavens and the earth lest they should fall apart, and if they were to fall apart there is none who can sustain them except Him. Indeed He is all-forbearing, all-forgiving.
41.transliteration: ʾinna llāha yumsiku s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa ʾan tazūlā wa-la-ʾin zālatā ʾin ʾamsakahumā min ʾaḥadin min baʿdihī ʾinnahū kāna ḥalīman ghafūran

42.content: وَأَقسَموا بِاللَّهِ جَهدَ أَيمانِهِم لَئِن جاءَهُم نَذيرٌ لَيَكونُنَّ أَهدىٰ مِن إِحدَى الأُمَمِ ۖ فَلَمّا جاءَهُم نَذيرٌ ما زادَهُم إِلّا نُفورًا
42.translation_eng: And they1 swore by Allah with solemn oaths that if a warner were to come to them they would be better guided than any of the nations. But when a warner came to them it only increased them in aversion,That is, the idolaters of Arabia.
42.transliteration: wa-ʾaqsamū bi-llāhi jahda ʾaymānihim la-ʾin jāʾahum nadhīrun la-yakūnunna ʾahdā min ʾiḥdā l-ʾumami fa-lammā jāʾahum nadhīrun mā zādahum ʾillā nufūran-i

43.content: استِكبارًا فِي الأَرضِ وَمَكرَ السَّيِّئِ ۚ وَلا يَحيقُ المَكرُ السَّيِّئُ إِلّا بِأَهلِهِ ۚ فَهَل يَنظُرونَ إِلّا سُنَّتَ الأَوَّلينَ ۚ فَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّتِ اللَّهِ تَبديلًا ۖ وَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّتِ اللَّهِ تَحويلًا
43.translation_eng: acting arrogantly in the land and devising evil schemes; and evil schemes beset only their authors. So do they await anything except the precedent of the ancients? Yet you will never find any change in Allah’s precedent, and you will never find any revision in Allah’s precedent.
43.transliteration: istikbāran fī l-ʾarḍi wa-makra s-sayyiʾi wa-lā yaḥīqu l-makru s-sayyiʾu ʾillā bi-ʾahlihī fa-hal yanẓurūna ʾillā sunnata l-ʾawwalīna fa-lan tajida li-sunnati llāhi tabdīlan wa-lan tajida li-sunnati llāhi taḥwīlan

44.content: أَوَلَم يَسيروا فِي الأَرضِ فَيَنظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم وَكانوا أَشَدَّ مِنهُم قُوَّةً ۚ وَما كانَ اللَّهُ لِيُعجِزَهُ مِن شَيءٍ فِي السَّماواتِ وَلا فِي الأَرضِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ عَليمًا قَديرًا
44.translation_eng: Have they not traveled over the land so that they may observe how was the fate of those who were before them? They were more powerful than them, and Allah is not to be thwarted by anything in the heavens or on the earth. Indeed He is all-knowing, all-powerful.
44.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yasīrū fī l-ʾarḍi fa-yanẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu lladhīna min qablihim wa-kānū ʾashadda minhum quwwatan wa-mā kāna llāhu li-yuʿjizahū min shayʾin fī s-samāwāti wa-lā fī l-ʾarḍi ʾinnahū kāna ʿalīman qadīran

45.content: وَلَو يُؤاخِذُ اللَّهُ النّاسَ بِما كَسَبوا ما تَرَكَ عَلىٰ ظَهرِها مِن دابَّةٍ وَلٰكِن يُؤَخِّرُهُم إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۖ فَإِذا جاءَ أَجَلُهُم فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ كانَ بِعِبادِهِ بَصيرًا
45.translation_eng: Were Allah to take mankind to task because of what they have earned, He would not leave any living being on its back.1 But He respites them until a specified time, and when their time comes, Allah indeed sees best His servants.That is, on the surface of the earth.
45.transliteration: wa-law yuʾākhidhu llāhu n-nāsa bi-mā kasabū mā taraka ʿalā ẓahrihā min dābbatin wa-lākin yuʾakhkhiruhum ʾilā ʾajalin musamman fa-ʾidhā jāʾa ʾajaluhum fa-ʾinna llāha kāna bi-ʿibādihī baṣīran

36.description: The surah that opens with the discrete Arabic letters Yā Sīn. “Yā Sīn” (mentioned in verse 1) is one of the names of the Prophet. The surah emphasizes the divine source of the Quran and defends it from the charge of being poetry made by man (verse 5 . and verse 69 .). It warns of the fate of men who are stubborn and always mock God’s revelations. They are reminded of the punishment that befell earlier generations, and of God’s power as shown in His Creation. The end of the surah gives strong arguments for the reality of the Resurrection.The surah is also known as: Ya-Sin, Yaa Siin.

1.translation_eng: Yā Sīn!

2.translation_eng: By the Wise1 Qurʾān,Or ‘Definitive.’

3.content: إِنَّكَ لَمِنَ المُرسَلينَ
3.translation_eng: you are indeed one of the apostles,
3.transliteration: ʾinnaka la-mina l-mursalīna

4.content: عَلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
4.translation_eng: on a straight path.
4.transliteration: ʿalā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

5.content: تَنزيلَ العَزيزِ الرَّحيمِ
5.translation_eng: [It is a scripture] sent down gradually from the All-mighty, the All-merciful
5.transliteration: tanzīla l-ʿazīzi r-raḥīmi

6.content: لِتُنذِرَ قَومًا ما أُنذِرَ آباؤُهُم فَهُم غافِلونَ
6.translation_eng: that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned,1 so they are oblivious.Cf. 28:46; 32:3; 34:44.
6.transliteration: li-tundhira qawman mā ʾundhira ʾābāʾuhum fa-hum ghāfilūna

7.content: لَقَد حَقَّ القَولُ عَلىٰ أَكثَرِهِم فَهُم لا يُؤمِنونَ
7.translation_eng: The word has certainly become due against most of them, so they will not have faith.
7.transliteration: la-qad ḥaqqa l-qawlu ʿalā ʾaktharihim fa-hum lā yuʾminūna

8.content: إِنّا جَعَلنا في أَعناقِهِم أَغلالًا فَهِيَ إِلَى الأَذقانِ فَهُم مُقمَحونَ
8.translation_eng: Indeed We have put iron collars around their necks, which are up to the chins, so their heads are upturned.1That is, they dwell in a state of blindness, defiance and arrogance in regard to the God-sent guidance and truth.
8.transliteration: ʾinnā jaʿalnā fī ʾaʿnāqihim ʾaghlālan fa-hiya ʾilā l-ʾadhqāni fa-hum muqmaḥūna

9.content: وَجَعَلنا مِن بَينِ أَيديهِم سَدًّا وَمِن خَلفِهِم سَدًّا فَأَغشَيناهُم فَهُم لا يُبصِرونَ
9.translation_eng: And We have put a barrier before them and a barrier behind them, then We have blind-folded them, so they do not see.
9.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā min bayni ʾaydīhim saddan wa-min khalfihim saddan fa-ʾaghshaynāhum fa-hum lā yubṣirūna

10.content: وَسَواءٌ عَلَيهِم أَأَنذَرتَهُم أَم لَم تُنذِرهُم لا يُؤمِنونَ
10.translation_eng: It is the same to them whether you warn them or do not warn them, they will not have faith.
10.transliteration: wa-sawāʾun ʿalayhim ʾa-ʾandhartahum ʾam lam tundhirhum lā yuʾminūna

11.content: إِنَّما تُنذِرُ مَنِ اتَّبَعَ الذِّكرَ وَخَشِيَ الرَّحمٰنَ بِالغَيبِ ۖ فَبَشِّرهُ بِمَغفِرَةٍ وَأَجرٍ كَريمٍ
11.translation_eng: You can only warn someone who follows the Reminder1 and fears the All-beneficent in secret; so give him the good news of forgiveness and a noble reward.That is, the Qurʾān.
11.transliteration: ʾinnamā tundhiru mani ttabaʿa dh-dhikra wa-khashiya r-raḥmāna bi-l-ghaybi fa-bashshirhu bi-maghfiratin wa-ʾajrin karīmin

12.content: إِنّا نَحنُ نُحيِي المَوتىٰ وَنَكتُبُ ما قَدَّموا وَآثارَهُم ۚ وَكُلَّ شَيءٍ أَحصَيناهُ في إِمامٍ مُبينٍ
12.translation_eng: Indeed it is We who revive the dead and write what they have sent ahead1 and their effects [which they left behind],2 and We have figured everything in a manifest Imam.3That is, the deeds they have done.That is, the good or evil heritage and imprint they leave behind in the society in which they have lived, and which outlive them.Or, in a manifest book.
12.transliteration: ʾinnā naḥnu nuḥyi l-mawtā wa-naktubu mā qaddamū wa-ʾāthārahum wa-kulla shayʾin ʾaḥṣaynāhu fī ʾimāmin mubīnin

13.content: وَاضرِب لَهُم مَثَلًا أَصحابَ القَريَةِ إِذ جاءَهَا المُرسَلونَ
13.translation_eng: Cite for them the example of the inhabitants of the town when the apostles came to it.
13.transliteration: wa-ḍrib lahum mathalan ʾaṣḥāba l-qaryati ʾidh jāʾahā l-mursalūna

14.content: إِذ أَرسَلنا إِلَيهِمُ اثنَينِ فَكَذَّبوهُما فَعَزَّزنا بِثالِثٍ فَقالوا إِنّا إِلَيكُم مُرسَلونَ
14.translation_eng: When We sent to them two [apostles], they impugned both of them. Then We reinforced them with a third, and they said, ‘We have indeed been sent to you.’
14.transliteration: ʾidh ʾarsalnā ʾilayhimu thnayni fa-kadhdhabūhumā fa-ʿazzaznā bi-thālithin fa-qālū ʾinnā ʾilaykum mursalūna

15.content: قالوا ما أَنتُم إِلّا بَشَرٌ مِثلُنا وَما أَنزَلَ الرَّحمٰنُ مِن شَيءٍ إِن أَنتُم إِلّا تَكذِبونَ
15.translation_eng: They said, ‘You are nothing but humans like us, and the All-beneficent has not sent down anything, and you are only lying.’
15.transliteration: qālū mā ʾantum ʾillā basharun mithlunā wa-mā ʾanzala r-raḥmānu min shayʾin ʾin ʾantum ʾillā takdhibūna

16.content: قالوا رَبُّنا يَعلَمُ إِنّا إِلَيكُم لَمُرسَلونَ
16.translation_eng: They said, ‘Our Lord knows that we have indeed been sent to you,
16.transliteration: qālū rabbunā yaʿlamu ʾinnā ʾilaykum la-mursalūna

17.content: وَما عَلَينا إِلَّا البَلاغُ المُبينُ
17.translation_eng: and our duty is only to communicate in clear terms.’
17.transliteration: wa-mā ʿalaynā ʾillā l-balāghu l-mubīnu

18.content: قالوا إِنّا تَطَيَّرنا بِكُم ۖ لَئِن لَم تَنتَهوا لَنَرجُمَنَّكُم وَلَيَمَسَّنَّكُم مِنّا عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
18.translation_eng: They said, ‘Indeed we take you for a bad omen. If you do not relinquish we will stone you, and surely a painful punishment will visit you from us.’
18.transliteration: qālū ʾinnā taṭayyarnā bikum la-ʾin lam tantahū la-narjumannakum wa-la-yamassannakum minnā ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

19.content: قالوا طائِرُكُم مَعَكُم ۚ أَئِن ذُكِّرتُم ۚ بَل أَنتُم قَومٌ مُسرِفونَ
19.translation_eng: They said, ‘Your bad omens attend you. What! If you are admonished … .1 Rather you are a profligate lot.’Ellipsis. The phrase omitted is ‘do you take it for a bad omen?!’
19.transliteration: qālū ṭāʾirukum maʿakum ʾa-ʾin dhukkirtum bal ʾantum qawmun musrifūna

20.content: وَجاءَ مِن أَقصَى المَدينَةِ رَجُلٌ يَسعىٰ قالَ يا قَومِ اتَّبِعُوا المُرسَلينَ
20.translation_eng: There came a man from the city outskirts, hurrying. He said, ‘O my people! Follow the apostles!
20.transliteration: wa-jāʾa min ʾaqṣā l-madīnati rajulun yasʿā qāla yā-qawmi ttabiʿū l-mursalīna

21.content: اتَّبِعوا مَن لا يَسأَلُكُم أَجرًا وَهُم مُهتَدونَ
21.translation_eng: Follow them who do not ask you any reward and they are rightly guided.
21.transliteration: ittabiʿū man lā yasʾalukum ʾajran wa-hum muhtadūna

22.content: وَما لِيَ لا أَعبُدُ الَّذي فَطَرَني وَإِلَيهِ تُرجَعونَ
22.translation_eng: Why should I not worship Him who has originated me, and to whom you shall be brought back?
22.transliteration: wa-mā liya lā ʾaʿbudu lladhī faṭaranī wa-ʾilayhi turjaʿūna

23.content: أَأَتَّخِذُ مِن دونِهِ آلِهَةً إِن يُرِدنِ الرَّحمٰنُ بِضُرٍّ لا تُغنِ عَنّي شَفاعَتُهُم شَيئًا وَلا يُنقِذونِ
23.translation_eng: Shall I take gods besides Him? If the All-beneficent desired to cause me any distress their intercession will not avail me in any way, nor will they rescue me.
23.transliteration: ʾa-ʾattakhidhu min dūnihī ʾālihatan ʾin yuridni r-raḥmānu bi-ḍurrin lā tughni ʿannī shafāʿatuhum shayʾan wa-lā yunqidhūni

24.content: إِنّي إِذًا لَفي ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
24.translation_eng: Indeed then I would be in manifest error.
24.transliteration: ʾinnī ʾidhan la-fī ḍalālin mubīnin

25.content: إِنّي آمَنتُ بِرَبِّكُم فَاسمَعونِ
25.translation_eng: Indeed I have faith in your Lord, so listen to me.’
25.transliteration: ʾinnī ʾāmantu bi-rabbikum fa-smaʿūni

26.content: قيلَ ادخُلِ الجَنَّةَ ۖ قالَ يا لَيتَ قَومي يَعلَمونَ
26.translation_eng: He was told, ‘Enter paradise!’ He said, ‘Alas! Had my people only known
26.transliteration: qīla dkhuli l-jannata qāla yā-layta qawmī yaʿlamūna

27.content: بِما غَفَرَ لي رَبّي وَجَعَلَني مِنَ المُكرَمينَ
27.translation_eng: for what my Lord forgave me and made me one of the honoured ones!’
27.transliteration: bi-mā ghafara lī rabbī wa-jaʿalanī mina l-mukramīna
