28.content: ۞ وَما أَنزَلنا عَلىٰ قَومِهِ مِن بَعدِهِ مِن جُندٍ مِنَ السَّماءِ وَما كُنّا مُنزِلينَ
28.translation_eng: After him We did not send down on his people a host from the sky, nor We would have sent down.1Or ‘and what We used to send down [before];’ see Ṭabrisī, Fayḍ Kāshānī.
28.transliteration: wa-mā ʾanzalnā ʿalā qawmihī min baʿdihī min jundin mina s-samāʾi wa-mā kunnā munzilīna

29.content: إِن كانَت إِلّا صَيحَةً واحِدَةً فَإِذا هُم خامِدونَ
29.translation_eng: It was but a single Cry, and, behold, they were stilled [like burnt ashes]!
29.transliteration: ʾin kānat ʾillā ṣayḥatan wāḥidatan fa-ʾidhā hum khāmidūna

30.content: يا حَسرَةً عَلَى العِبادِ ۚ ما يَأتيهِم مِن رَسولٍ إِلّا كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
30.translation_eng: How regrettable of the servants! There did not come to them any apostle but that they used to deride him.
30.transliteration: yā-ḥasratan ʿalā l-ʿibādi mā yaʾtīhim min rasūlin ʾillā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

31.content: أَلَم يَرَوا كَم أَهلَكنا قَبلَهُم مِنَ القُرونِ أَنَّهُم إِلَيهِم لا يَرجِعونَ
31.translation_eng: Have they not regarded how many generations We have destroyed before them who will not come back to them?
31.transliteration: ʾa-lam yaraw kam ʾahlaknā qablahum mina l-qurūni ʾannahum ʾilayhim lā yarjiʿūna

32.content: وَإِن كُلٌّ لَمّا جَميعٌ لَدَينا مُحضَرونَ
32.translation_eng: And all of them will indeed be presented before Us.
32.transliteration: wa-ʾin kullun lammā jamīʿun ladaynā muḥḍarūna

33.content: وَآيَةٌ لَهُمُ الأَرضُ المَيتَةُ أَحيَيناها وَأَخرَجنا مِنها حَبًّا فَمِنهُ يَأكُلونَ
33.translation_eng: A sign for them is the dead earth, which We revive and out of it bring forth grain, so they eat of it.
33.transliteration: wa-ʾāyatun lahumu l-ʾarḍu l-maytatu ʾaḥyaynāhā wa-ʾakhrajnā minhā ḥabban fa-minhu yaʾkulūna

34.content: وَجَعَلنا فيها جَنّاتٍ مِن نَخيلٍ وَأَعنابٍ وَفَجَّرنا فيها مِنَ العُيونِ
34.translation_eng: And We make in it orchards of date palms and vines, and We cause springs to gush forth in it,
34.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā fīhā jannātin min nakhīlin wa-ʾaʿnābin wa-fajjarnā fīhā mina l-ʿuyūni

35.content: لِيَأكُلوا مِن ثَمَرِهِ وَما عَمِلَتهُ أَيديهِم ۖ أَفَلا يَشكُرونَ
35.translation_eng: so that they may eat of its fruit and what their hands have cultivated.1 Will they not then give thanks?Or ‘and their hands did not cultivate it.’ That is, it is We who produce the fruits, not their hands. Cf. 27:60 and 56:64.
35.transliteration: li-yaʾkulū min thamarihī wa-mā ʿamilathu ʾaydīhim ʾa-fa-lā yashkurūna

36.content: سُبحانَ الَّذي خَلَقَ الأَزواجَ كُلَّها مِمّا تُنبِتُ الأَرضُ وَمِن أَنفُسِهِم وَمِمّا لا يَعلَمونَ
36.translation_eng: Immaculate is He who has created all the kinds1 of what the earth grows, and of themselves, and of what they do not know.Or, ‘all the pairs.’
36.transliteration: subḥāna lladhī khalaqa l-ʾazwāja kullahā mimmā tunbitu l-ʾarḍu wa-min ʾanfusihim wa-mimmā lā yaʿlamūna

37.content: وَآيَةٌ لَهُمُ اللَّيلُ نَسلَخُ مِنهُ النَّهارَ فَإِذا هُم مُظلِمونَ
37.translation_eng: And a sign for them is the night, which We strip of daylight, and, behold, they find themselves in the dark!
37.transliteration: wa-ʾāyatun lahumu l-laylu naslakhu minhu n-nahāra fa-ʾidhā hum muẓlimūna

38.content: وَالشَّمسُ تَجري لِمُستَقَرٍّ لَها ۚ ذٰلِكَ تَقديرُ العَزيزِ العَليمِ
38.translation_eng: And the sun runs on to its place of rest:1 That is the ordaining of the All-mighty, the All-knowing.Or ‘it has no place of rest.’ This is in accordance with the alternate reading ‘lā mustaqarra lahā.’ Ṭabrisī in Majmaʿ al-Bayān narrates a tradition which ascribes the reading lā mustaqarra lahā to the Imams ʿAli b. al-Ḥusayn, Muḥammad al-Bāqir, and Jaʿfar al-Ṣādiq, as well as to a number of the early exegetes such as Ibn ʿAbbās, Ibn Masʿūd, ʿIkrimah, and ʿAṭāʾ b. Abī Rabāḥ. See Muʿjam al-Qirāʾāt al-Qurʾāniyyah, v, 208, for further sources of this reading. The reading li mustaqarrin lahā seems to have been suggested and reinforced by the popular astronomical notions of the age.
38.transliteration: wa-sh-shamsu tajrī li-mustaqarrin lahā dhālika taqdīru l-ʿazīzi l-ʿalīmi

39.content: وَالقَمَرَ قَدَّرناهُ مَنازِلَ حَتّىٰ عادَ كَالعُرجونِ القَديمِ
39.translation_eng: As for the moon, We have ordained its phases, until it becomes like an old palm leaf.
39.transliteration: wa-l-qamara qaddarnāhu manāzila ḥattā ʿāda ka-l-ʿurjūni l-qadīmi

40.content: لَا الشَّمسُ يَنبَغي لَها أَن تُدرِكَ القَمَرَ وَلَا اللَّيلُ سابِقُ النَّهارِ ۚ وَكُلٌّ في فَلَكٍ يَسبَحونَ
40.translation_eng: Neither it behooves the sun to overtake the moon, nor may the night outrun the day, and each swims in an orbit.
40.transliteration: lā sh-shamsu yanbaghī lahā ʾan tudrika l-qamara wa-lā l-laylu sābiqu n-nahāri wa-kullun fī falakin yasbaḥūna

41.content: وَآيَةٌ لَهُم أَنّا حَمَلنا ذُرِّيَّتَهُم فِي الفُلكِ المَشحونِ
41.translation_eng: A sign for them is that We carried their progeny in the laden ship,1That is, in the ark of Noah.
41.transliteration: wa-ʾāyatun lahum ʾannā ḥamalnā dhurriyyatahum fī l-fulki l-mashḥūni

42.content: وَخَلَقنا لَهُم مِن مِثلِهِ ما يَركَبونَ
42.translation_eng: and We have created for them what is similar to it, which they ride.1Or ‘board,’ that is, ships which are similar to their prototype, the ark of Noah; or, alternatively, the camel, which has been called ‘the ship of the desert,’ and other animals and means of transport.
42.transliteration: wa-khalaqnā lahum min mithlihī mā yarkabūna

43.content: وَإِن نَشَأ نُغرِقهُم فَلا صَريخَ لَهُم وَلا هُم يُنقَذونَ
43.translation_eng: And if We like We drown them, whereat they have no one to call for help, nor are they rescued
43.transliteration: wa-ʾin nashaʾ nughriqhum fa-lā ṣarīkha lahum wa-lā hum yunqadhūna

44.content: إِلّا رَحمَةً مِنّا وَمَتاعًا إِلىٰ حينٍ
44.translation_eng: ⎯except by a mercy from Us and for an enjoyment until some time.
44.transliteration: ʾillā raḥmatan minnā wa-matāʿan ʾilā ḥīnin

45.content: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُمُ اتَّقوا ما بَينَ أَيديكُم وَما خَلفَكُم لَعَلَّكُم تُرحَمونَ
45.translation_eng: And when they are told, ‘Beware of that which is before you and that which is behind you,1 so that you may receive [His] mercy.’2See 34:9.Ellipsis. The omitted clause is, ‘they turn away arrogantly.’
45.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā qīla lahumu ttaqū mā bayna ʾaydīkum wa-mā khalfakum laʿallakum turḥamūna

46.content: وَما تَأتيهِم مِن آيَةٍ مِن آياتِ رَبِّهِم إِلّا كانوا عَنها مُعرِضينَ
46.translation_eng: There did not come to them any sign from among the signs of their Lord but that they used to disregard it.
46.transliteration: wa-mā taʾtīhim min ʾāyatin min ʾāyāti rabbihim ʾillā kānū ʿanhā muʿriḍīna

47.content: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُم أَنفِقوا مِمّا رَزَقَكُمُ اللَّهُ قالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لِلَّذينَ آمَنوا أَنُطعِمُ مَن لَو يَشاءُ اللَّهُ أَطعَمَهُ إِن أَنتُم إِلّا في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
47.translation_eng: When they are told, ‘Spend out of what Allah has provided you,’ the faithless say to the faithful, ‘Shall we feed [someone] whom Allah would have fed, had He wished? You are only in manifest error.’
47.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā qīla lahum ʾanfiqū mimmā razaqakumu llāhu qāla lladhīna kafarū li-lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾa-nuṭʿimu man law yashāʾu llāhu ʾaṭʿamahū ʾin ʾantum ʾillā fī ḍalālin mubīnin

48.content: وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هٰذَا الوَعدُ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
48.translation_eng: And they say, ‘When will this promise be fulfilled, should you be truthful?’
48.transliteration: wa-yaqūlūna matā hādhā l-waʿdu ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

49.content: ما يَنظُرونَ إِلّا صَيحَةً واحِدَةً تَأخُذُهُم وَهُم يَخِصِّمونَ
49.translation_eng: They do not await but a single Cry that would seize them as they wrangle.
49.transliteration: mā yanẓurūna ʾillā ṣayḥatan wāḥidatan taʾkhudhuhum wa-hum yakhiṣṣimūna

50.content: فَلا يَستَطيعونَ تَوصِيَةً وَلا إِلىٰ أَهلِهِم يَرجِعونَ
50.translation_eng: Then they will not be able to make any will, nor will they return to their folks.
50.transliteration: fa-lā yastaṭīʿūna tawṣiyatan wa-lā ʾilā ʾahlihim yarjiʿūna

51.content: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصّورِ فَإِذا هُم مِنَ الأَجداثِ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِم يَنسِلونَ
51.translation_eng: And when the Trumpet is blown, behold, there they will be, scrambling from their graves towards their Lord!
51.transliteration: wa-nufikha fī ṣ-ṣūri fa-ʾidhā hum mina l-ʾajdāthi ʾilā rabbihim yansilūna

52.content: قالوا يا وَيلَنا مَن بَعَثَنا مِن مَرقَدِنا ۜ ۗ هٰذا ما وَعَدَ الرَّحمٰنُ وَصَدَقَ المُرسَلونَ
52.translation_eng: They will say, ‘Woe to us! Who raised us from our place of sleep?’ ‘This is what the All-beneficent had promised, and the apostles had spoken the truth!’
52.transliteration: qālū yā-waylanā man baʿathanā min marqadinā hādhā mā waʿada r-raḥmānu wa-ṣadaqa l-mursalūna

53.content: إِن كانَت إِلّا صَيحَةً واحِدَةً فَإِذا هُم جَميعٌ لَدَينا مُحضَرونَ
53.translation_eng: It will be but a single Cry, and, behold, they will all be presented before Us!
53.transliteration: ʾin kānat ʾillā ṣayḥatan wāḥidatan fa-ʾidhā hum jamīʿun ladaynā muḥḍarūna

54.content: فَاليَومَ لا تُظلَمُ نَفسٌ شَيئًا وَلا تُجزَونَ إِلّا ما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
54.translation_eng: ‘Today no soul will be wronged in the least, nor will you be requited except for what you used to do.’
54.transliteration: fa-l-yawma lā tuẓlamu nafsun shayʾan wa-lā tujzawna ʾillā mā kuntum taʿmalūna

55.content: إِنَّ أَصحابَ الجَنَّةِ اليَومَ في شُغُلٍ فاكِهونَ
55.translation_eng: Indeed today the inhabitants of paradise rejoice in their engagements
55.transliteration: ʾinna ʾaṣḥāba l-jannati l-yawma fī shughulin fākihūna

56.content: هُم وَأَزواجُهُم في ظِلالٍ عَلَى الأَرائِكِ مُتَّكِئونَ
56.translation_eng: —they and their mates, reclining on couches in the shades.
56.transliteration: hum wa-ʾazwājuhum fī ẓilālin ʿalā l-ʾarāʾiki muttakiʾūna

57.content: لَهُم فيها فاكِهَةٌ وَلَهُم ما يَدَّعونَ
57.translation_eng: There they have fruits and they have whatever they want.
57.transliteration: lahum fīhā fākihatun wa-lahum mā yaddaʿūna

58.content: سَلامٌ قَولًا مِن رَبٍّ رَحيمٍ
58.translation_eng: ‘Peace!’—a watchword from the all-merciful Lord.
58.transliteration: salāmun qawlan min rabbin raḥīmin

59.content: وَامتازُوا اليَومَ أَيُّهَا المُجرِمونَ
59.translation_eng: And ‘Get apart today, you guilty ones!’
59.transliteration: wa-mtāzū l-yawma ʾayyuhā l-mujrimūna

60.content: ۞ أَلَم أَعهَد إِلَيكُم يا بَني آدَمَ أَن لا تَعبُدُوا الشَّيطانَ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكُم عَدُوٌّ مُبينٌ
60.translation_eng: ‘Did I not exhort you, O children of Adam, saying, “Do not worship Satan. He is indeed your manifest enemy.
60.transliteration: ʾa-lam ʾaʿhad ʾilaykum yā-banī ʾādama ʾan lā taʿbudū sh-shayṭāna ʾinnahū lakum ʿaduwwun mubīnun

61.content: وَأَنِ اعبُدوني ۚ هٰذا صِراطٌ مُستَقيمٌ
61.translation_eng: Worship Me. That is a straight path”?
61.transliteration: wa-ʾani ʿbudūnī hādhā ṣirāṭun mustaqīmun

62.content: وَلَقَد أَضَلَّ مِنكُم جِبِلًّا كَثيرًا ۖ أَفَلَم تَكونوا تَعقِلونَ
62.translation_eng: Certainly he has led astray many of your generations. Did you not use to apply reason?
62.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾaḍalla minkum jibillan kathīran ʾa-fa-lam takūnū taʿqilūna

63.content: هٰذِهِ جَهَنَّمُ الَّتي كُنتُم توعَدونَ
63.translation_eng: This is the hell you had been promised!
63.transliteration: hādhihī jahannamu llatī kuntum tūʿadūna

64.content: اصلَوهَا اليَومَ بِما كُنتُم تَكفُرونَ
64.translation_eng: Enter it today, because of what you used to defy.
64.transliteration: iṣlawhā l-yawma bi-mā kuntum takfurūna

65.content: اليَومَ نَختِمُ عَلىٰ أَفواهِهِم وَتُكَلِّمُنا أَيديهِم وَتَشهَدُ أَرجُلُهُم بِما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
65.translation_eng: Today We shall seal their mouths, and their hands shall speak to Us, and their feet shall bear witness concerning what they used to earn.’
65.transliteration: al-yawma nakhtimu ʿalā ʾafwāhihim wa-tukallimunā ʾaydīhim wa-tashhadu ʾarjuluhum bi-mā kānū yaksibūna

66.content: وَلَو نَشاءُ لَطَمَسنا عَلىٰ أَعيُنِهِم فَاستَبَقُوا الصِّراطَ فَأَنّىٰ يُبصِرونَ
66.translation_eng: Had We wished We would have blotted out their eyes:1 then, were they to advance towards the path, how would have they seen?That is, the insight to see the course of true human felicity.
66.transliteration: wa-law nashāʾu la-ṭamasnā ʿalā ʾaʿyunihim fa-stabaqū ṣ-ṣirāṭa fa-ʾannā yubṣirūna

67.content: وَلَو نَشاءُ لَمَسَخناهُم عَلىٰ مَكانَتِهِم فَمَا استَطاعوا مُضِيًّا وَلا يَرجِعونَ
67.translation_eng: And had We wished We would have deformed them in their place;1 then they would have neither been able to go ahead nor to go back.2That is, brought them to a standstill with their deformed inner state.That is, they would have neither been able to move ahead to make spiritual progress, nor to return to their original state of unsullied God-given nature.
67.transliteration: wa-law nashāʾu la-masakhnāhum ʿalā makānatihim fa-mā staṭāʿū muḍiyyan wa-lā yarjiʿūna

68.content: وَمَن نُعَمِّرهُ نُنَكِّسهُ فِي الخَلقِ ۖ أَفَلا يَعقِلونَ
68.translation_eng: And whomever We give a long life, We cause him to regress in creation. Then will they not apply reason?
68.transliteration: wa-man nuʿammirhu nunakkishu fī l-khalqi ʾa-fa-lā yaʿqilūna

69.content: وَما عَلَّمناهُ الشِّعرَ وَما يَنبَغي لَهُ ۚ إِن هُوَ إِلّا ذِكرٌ وَقُرآنٌ مُبينٌ
69.translation_eng: We did not teach him poetry, nor does it behoove him. This is just a reminder and a manifest Qurʾān,
69.transliteration: wa-mā ʿallamnāhu sh-shiʿra wa-mā yanbaghī lahū ʾin huwa ʾillā dhikrun wa-qurʾānun mubīnun

70.content: لِيُنذِرَ مَن كانَ حَيًّا وَيَحِقَّ القَولُ عَلَى الكافِرينَ
70.translation_eng: so that anyone who is alive may be warned, and that the word may come due against the faithless.
70.transliteration: li-yundhira man kāna ḥayyan wa-yaḥiqqa l-qawlu ʿalā l-kāfirīna

71.content: أَوَلَم يَرَوا أَنّا خَلَقنا لَهُم مِمّا عَمِلَت أَيدينا أَنعامًا فَهُم لَها مالِكونَ
71.translation_eng: Have they not seen that We have created for them —of what Our hands have worked— cattle, so they have become their masters?
71.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾannā khalaqnā lahum mimmā ʿamilat ʾaydīnā ʾanʿāman fa-hum lahā mālikūna

72.content: وَذَلَّلناها لَهُم فَمِنها رَكوبُهُم وَمِنها يَأكُلونَ
72.translation_eng: And We made them tractable for them, so some of them make their mounts and some of them they eat.
72.transliteration: wa-dhallalnāhā lahum fa-minhā rakūbuhum wa-minhā yaʾkulūna

73.content: وَلَهُم فيها مَنافِعُ وَمَشارِبُ ۖ أَفَلا يَشكُرونَ
73.translation_eng: There are other benefits for them therein, and drinks.1 Will they not then give thanks?That is, milk and other drinks derived from it.
73.transliteration: wa-lahum fīhā manāfiʿu wa-mashāribu ʾa-fa-lā yashkurūna

74.content: وَاتَّخَذوا مِن دونِ اللَّهِ آلِهَةً لَعَلَّهُم يُنصَرونَ
74.translation_eng: They have taken gods besides Allah [hoping] that they might be helped.
74.transliteration: wa-ttakhadhū min dūni llāhi ʾālihatan laʿallahum yunṣarūna

75.content: لا يَستَطيعونَ نَصرَهُم وَهُم لَهُم جُندٌ مُحضَرونَ
75.translation_eng: [Yet] they cannot help them, while they [themselves] are ready warriors for them.1That is, while the idols are unable to offer the idolaters any kind of assistance, the idolaters are ready to fight for them and defend them.
75.transliteration: lā yastaṭīʿūna naṣrahum wa-hum lahum jundun muḥḍarūna

76.content: فَلا يَحزُنكَ قَولُهُم ۘ إِنّا نَعلَمُ ما يُسِرّونَ وَما يُعلِنونَ
76.translation_eng: So do not let their remarks grieve you. We indeed know whatever they hide and whatever they disclose.
76.transliteration: fa-lā yaḥzunka qawluhum ʾinnā naʿlamu mā yusirrūna wa-mā yuʿlinūna

77.content: أَوَلَم يَرَ الإِنسانُ أَنّا خَلَقناهُ مِن نُطفَةٍ فَإِذا هُوَ خَصيمٌ مُبينٌ
77.translation_eng: Does not man see that We created him from a drop of [seminal] fluid, and, behold, he is an open contender!?
77.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yara l-ʾinsānu ʾannā khalaqnāhu min nuṭfatin fa-ʾidhā huwa khaṣīmun mubīnun

78.content: وَضَرَبَ لَنا مَثَلًا وَنَسِيَ خَلقَهُ ۖ قالَ مَن يُحيِي العِظامَ وَهِيَ رَميمٌ
78.translation_eng: He draws comparisons for Us, and forgets his own creation. He says, ‘Who shall revive the bones when they have decayed?’
78.transliteration: wa-ḍaraba lanā mathalan wa-nasiya khalqahū qāla man yuḥyi l-ʿiẓāma wa-hiya ramīmun

79.content: قُل يُحييهَا الَّذي أَنشَأَها أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ خَلقٍ عَليمٌ
79.translation_eng: Say, ‘He will revive them who produced them the first time, and He has knowledge of all creation.
79.transliteration: qul yuḥyīhā lladhī ʾanshaʾahā ʾawwala marratin wa-huwa bi-kulli khalqin ʿalīmun-i

80.content: الَّذي جَعَلَ لَكُم مِنَ الشَّجَرِ الأَخضَرِ نارًا فَإِذا أَنتُم مِنهُ توقِدونَ
80.translation_eng: —He, who made for you fire out of the green tree, and, behold, you light fire from it!
80.transliteration: alladhī jaʿala lakum mina sh-shajari l-ʾakhḍari nāran fa-ʾidhā ʾantum minhu tūqidūna

81.content: أَوَلَيسَ الَّذي خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ بِقادِرٍ عَلىٰ أَن يَخلُقَ مِثلَهُم ۚ بَلىٰ وَهُوَ الخَلّاقُ العَليمُ
81.translation_eng: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? Yes indeed! He is the All-creator, the All-knowing.
81.transliteration: ʾa-wa-laysa lladhī khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa bi-qādirin ʿalā ʾan yakhluqa mithlahum balā wa-huwa l-khallāqu l-ʿalīmu

82.content: إِنَّما أَمرُهُ إِذا أَرادَ شَيئًا أَن يَقولَ لَهُ كُن فَيَكونُ
82.translation_eng: All His command, when He wills something, is to say to it ‘Be,’ and it is.
82.transliteration: ʾinnamā ʾamruhū ʾidhā ʾarāda shayʾan ʾan yaqūla lahū kun fa-yakūnu

83.content: فَسُبحانَ الَّذي بِيَدِهِ مَلَكوتُ كُلِّ شَيءٍ وَإِلَيهِ تُرجَعونَ
83.translation_eng: So immaculate is He in whose hand is the dominion of all things and to whom you shall be brought back.
83.transliteration: fa-subḥāna lladhī bi-yadihī malakūtu kulli shayʾin wa-ʾilayhi turjaʿūna

37.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by the angels arrayed before Him in devotional ranks, The Ranged Ones—thereafter, by other angels propelling the clouds, dispelling evil, and reciting God’s praise. It takes its name from verse 1, which refers to a gropu of angels as “those ranged (ṣāāt) in ranks”. The central point of this surah is the unity of God (verse 4 and verse 180 .) and the refutation of the pagan belief that the angels were daughters of God and worthy of worship. The angels themselves are quoted to refute this (verse 164 .). The prophethood of Muḥammad, is airmed, as is the Hereafter. There are two supporting sections: the scenes in the Hereafter (verse 19 .) and the stories of earlier prophets (verse 75 .).The surah is also known as: Devotional Ranks, Drawn Up In Ranks, Ranged in Order, Ranged in Rows, The Rangers, The Ranks, Those Ranged in Ranks, Those in Ranks, Who Stand Arrayed in Rows.

1.translation_eng: By the [angels] ranged in ranks,

2.translation_eng: by the ones who drive vigorously,1Or ‘hold back forcibly,’ or ‘scold severely.’ Said to refer to angels who drive the clouds, or hold back (or drive away) the eavesdropping devils, or to angels (or verses of the Qurʾān) that restrain people from sins.

3.content: فَالتّالِياتِ ذِكرًا
3.translation_eng: by the ones who recite the reminder:1That is, the faithful, or the angels, who recite the Qurʾān or the scriptures.
3.transliteration: fa-t-tāliyāti dhikran

4.content: إِنَّ إِلٰهَكُم لَواحِدٌ
4.translation_eng: indeed your God is certainly One,
4.transliteration: ʾinna ʾilāhakum la-wāḥidun

5.content: رَبُّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما وَرَبُّ المَشارِقِ
5.translation_eng: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and the Lord of the easts.1That is, the points of sunrise at the winter and summer solstices. Cf. 7:137; 55:17; 70:40.
5.transliteration: rabbu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā baynahumā wa-rabbu l-mashāriqi

6.content: إِنّا زَيَّنَّا السَّماءَ الدُّنيا بِزينَةٍ الكَواكِبِ
6.translation_eng: Indeed We have adorned the lowest heaven1 with the finery of the stars,2Or ‘the heaven of the earth,’ or ‘the nearest heaven.’Or ‘We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment, the stars.’
6.transliteration: ʾinnā zayyannā s-samāʾa d-dunyā bi-zīnatin-i l-kawākibi

7.content: وَحِفظًا مِن كُلِّ شَيطانٍ مارِدٍ
7.translation_eng: and to guard from any froward devil.
7.transliteration: wa-ḥifẓan min kulli shayṭānin māridin

8.content: لا يَسَّمَّعونَ إِلَى المَلَإِ الأَعلىٰ وَيُقذَفونَ مِن كُلِّ جانِبٍ
8.translation_eng: They do not eavesdrop on the Supernal Elite but are shot at from every side,
8.transliteration: lā yassammaʿūna ʾilā l-malaʾi l-ʾaʿlā wa-yuqdhafūna min kulli jānibin

9.content: دُحورًا ۖ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ واصِبٌ
9.translation_eng: to drive them away, and for them there is a constant mortification,
9.transliteration: duḥūran wa-lahum ʿadhābun wāṣibun

10.content: إِلّا مَن خَطِفَ الخَطفَةَ فَأَتبَعَهُ شِهابٌ ثاقِبٌ
10.translation_eng: except him who snatches a snatch,1 whereat there pursues him a piercing flame.2That is, of celestial intelligence. See Ṭabarī for several related traditions from the Prophet (ṣ).Cf. 15:17-18.
10.transliteration: ʾillā man khaṭifa l-khaṭfata fa-ʾatbaʿahū shihābun thāqibun

11.content: فَاستَفتِهِم أَهُم أَشَدُّ خَلقًا أَم مَن خَلَقنا ۚ إِنّا خَلَقناهُم مِن طينٍ لازِبٍ
11.translation_eng: Ask them, is their creation more prodigious1 or [that of other creatures] that We have created? Indeed We created them from a viscous clay.Or ‘more tough’ (or strong), or ‘more difficult.’ Cf. 79:27.
11.transliteration: fa-staftihim ʾa-hum ʾashaddu khalqan ʾam man khalaqnā ʾinnā khalaqnāhum min ṭīnin lāzibin

12.content: بَل عَجِبتَ وَيَسخَرونَ
12.translation_eng: Indeed you wonder, while they engage in ridicule,
12.transliteration: bal ʿajibta wa-yaskharūna

13.content: وَإِذا ذُكِّروا لا يَذكُرونَ
13.translation_eng: and [even] when admonished do not take admonition,
13.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā dhukkirū lā yadhkurūna

14.content: وَإِذا رَأَوا آيَةً يَستَسخِرونَ
14.translation_eng: and when they see a sign they make it an object of ridicule,
14.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā raʾaw ʾāyatan yastaskhirūna

15.content: وَقالوا إِن هٰذا إِلّا سِحرٌ مُبينٌ
15.translation_eng: and say, ‘This is nothing but plain magic!’
15.transliteration: wa-qālū ʾin hādhā ʾillā siḥrun mubīnun

16.content: أَإِذا مِتنا وَكُنّا تُرابًا وَعِظامًا أَإِنّا لَمَبعوثونَ
16.translation_eng: ‘What! When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we be resurrected?
16.transliteration: ʾa-ʾidhā mitnā wa-kunnā turāban wa-ʿiẓāman ʾa-ʾinnā la-mabʿūthūna

17.content: أَوَآباؤُنَا الأَوَّلونَ
17.translation_eng: And our forefathers too?!’
17.transliteration: ʾa-wa-ʾābāʾunā l-ʾawwalūna

18.content: قُل نَعَم وَأَنتُم داخِرونَ
18.translation_eng: Say, ‘Yes! And you will be utterly humble.’
18.transliteration: qul naʿam wa-ʾantum dākhirūna

19.content: فَإِنَّما هِيَ زَجرَةٌ واحِدَةٌ فَإِذا هُم يَنظُرونَ
19.translation_eng: It will be only a single shout and, behold, they will look on,
19.transliteration: fa-ʾinnamā hiya zajratun wāḥidatun fa-ʾidhā hum yanẓurūna

20.content: وَقالوا يا وَيلَنا هٰذا يَومُ الدّينِ
20.translation_eng: and say, ‘Woe to us! This is the Day of Retribution!’
20.transliteration: wa-qālū yā-waylanā hādhā yawmu d-dīni

21.content: هٰذا يَومُ الفَصلِ الَّذي كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبونَ
21.translation_eng: ‘This is the Day of Judgement that you used to deny!’
21.transliteration: hādhā yawmu l-faṣli lladhī kuntum bihī tukadhdhibūna

22.content: ۞ احشُرُوا الَّذينَ ظَلَموا وَأَزواجَهُم وَما كانوا يَعبُدونَ
22.translation_eng: ‘Muster the wrongdoers and their mates1 and what they used to worshipOr ‘their kind,’ or ‘their counterparts.’
22.transliteration: uḥshurū lladhīna ẓalamū wa-ʾazwājahum wa-mā kānū yaʿbudūna

23.content: مِن دونِ اللَّهِ فَاهدوهُم إِلىٰ صِراطِ الجَحيمِ
23.translation_eng: besides Allah, and show them the way to hell!
23.transliteration: min dūni llāhi fa-hdūhum ʾilā ṣirāṭi l-jaḥīmi

24.content: وَقِفوهُم ۖ إِنَّهُم مَسئولونَ
24.translation_eng: [But first] stop them! For they must be questioned.’
24.transliteration: wa-qifūhum ʾinnahum masʾūlūna

25.content: ما لَكُم لا تَناصَرونَ
25.translation_eng: ‘Why is it that you do not support1 one another [today]?’Or ‘help.’
25.transliteration: mā lakum lā tanāṣarūna

26.content: بَل هُمُ اليَومَ مُستَسلِمونَ
26.translation_eng: Rather today they are [meek and] submissive!
26.transliteration: bal humu l-yawma mustaslimūna

27.content: وَأَقبَلَ بَعضُهُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ يَتَساءَلونَ
27.translation_eng: Some of them will turn to others, questioning each other.
27.transliteration: wa-ʾaqbala baʿḍuhum ʿalā baʿḍin yatasāʾalūna

28.content: قالوا إِنَّكُم كُنتُم تَأتونَنا عَنِ اليَمينِ
28.translation_eng: They will say, ‘Indeed you used to accost us peremptorily.’1Or ‘obligingly.’
28.transliteration: qālū ʾinnakum kuntum taʾtūnanā ʿani l-yamīni

29.content: قالوا بَل لَم تَكونوا مُؤمِنينَ
29.translation_eng: They will answer, ‘Rather you [yourselves] had no faith.
29.transliteration: qālū bal lam takūnū muʾminīna

30.content: وَما كانَ لَنا عَلَيكُم مِن سُلطانٍ ۖ بَل كُنتُم قَومًا طاغينَ
30.translation_eng: We had no authority over you. Rather you [yourselves] were a rebellious lot.
30.transliteration: wa-mā kāna lanā ʿalaykum min sulṭānin bal kuntum qawman ṭāghīna

31.content: فَحَقَّ عَلَينا قَولُ رَبِّنا ۖ إِنّا لَذائِقونَ
31.translation_eng: So our Lord’s word became due against us that we shall indeed taste [the punishment].
31.transliteration: fa-ḥaqqa ʿalaynā qawlu rabbinā ʾinnā la-dhāʾiqūna

32.content: فَأَغوَيناكُم إِنّا كُنّا غاوينَ
32.translation_eng: So we perverted you, for we were perverse [ourselves].’
32.transliteration: fa-ʾaghwaynākum ʾinnā kunnā ghāwīna

33.content: فَإِنَّهُم يَومَئِذٍ فِي العَذابِ مُشتَرِكونَ
33.translation_eng: So that day they will share in the punishment.
33.transliteration: fa-ʾinnahum yawmaʾidhin fī l-ʿadhābi mushtarikūna

34.content: إِنّا كَذٰلِكَ نَفعَلُ بِالمُجرِمينَ
34.translation_eng: Indeed that is how We deal with the guilty.
34.transliteration: ʾinnā ka-dhālika nafʿalu bi-l-mujrimīna

35.content: إِنَّهُم كانوا إِذا قيلَ لَهُم لا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ يَستَكبِرونَ
35.translation_eng: Indeed it was they who, when they were told, ‘There is no god except Allah,’ used to be disdainful,
35.transliteration: ʾinnahum kānū ʾidhā qīla lahum lā ʾilāha ʾillā llāhu yastakbirūna

36.content: وَيَقولونَ أَئِنّا لَتارِكو آلِهَتِنا لِشاعِرٍ مَجنونٍ
36.translation_eng: and [they would] say, ‘Shall we abandon our gods for a crazy poet?’
36.transliteration: wa-yaqūlūna ʾa-ʾinnā la-tārikū ʾālihatinā li-shāʿirin majnūnin

37.content: بَل جاءَ بِالحَقِّ وَصَدَّقَ المُرسَلينَ
37.translation_eng: Rather he has brought [them] the truth, and confirmed the [earlier] apostles.
37.transliteration: bal jāʾa bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-ṣaddaqa l-mursalīna

38.content: إِنَّكُم لَذائِقُو العَذابِ الأَليمِ
38.translation_eng: Indeed you will taste the painful punishment,
38.transliteration: ʾinnakum la-dhāʾiqū l-ʿadhābi l-ʾalīmi

39.content: وَما تُجزَونَ إِلّا ما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
39.translation_eng: and you will be requited only for what you used to do
39.transliteration: wa-mā tujzawna ʾillā mā kuntum taʿmalūna

40.content: إِلّا عِبادَ اللَّهِ المُخلَصينَ
40.translation_eng: —[all] except Allah’s exclusive servants.
40.transliteration: ʾillā ʿibāda llāhi l-mukhlaṣīna

41.content: أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم رِزقٌ مَعلومٌ
41.translation_eng: For such there is a known1 provisionThat is, distinct and special.
41.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lahum rizqun maʿlūmun

42.content: فَواكِهُ ۖ وَهُم مُكرَمونَ
42.translation_eng: —fruits—and they will be held in honour,
42.transliteration: fawākihu wa-hum mukramūna

43.content: في جَنّاتِ النَّعيمِ
43.translation_eng: in the gardens of bliss,
43.transliteration: fī jannāti n-naʿīmi

44.content: عَلىٰ سُرُرٍ مُتَقابِلينَ
44.translation_eng: [reclining] on couches, facing one another,
44.transliteration: ʿalā sururin mutaqābilīna

45.content: يُطافُ عَلَيهِم بِكَأسٍ مِن مَعينٍ
45.translation_eng: served around with a cup from a clear fountain,
45.transliteration: yuṭāfu ʿalayhim bi-kaʾsin min maʿīnin

46.content: بَيضاءَ لَذَّةٍ لِلشّارِبينَ
46.translation_eng: snow-white, delicious to the drinkers,
46.transliteration: bayḍāʾa ladhdhatin li-sh-shāribīna

47.content: لا فيها غَولٌ وَلا هُم عَنها يُنزَفونَ
47.translation_eng: wherein there will be neither headache nor will it cause them stupefaction,
47.transliteration: lā fīhā ghawlun wa-lā hum ʿanhā yunzafūna

48.content: وَعِندَهُم قاصِراتُ الطَّرفِ عينٌ
48.translation_eng: and with them will be maidens of restrained glances with big [beautiful] eyes,
48.transliteration: wa-ʿindahum qāṣirātu ṭ-ṭarfi ʿīnun

49.content: كَأَنَّهُنَّ بَيضٌ مَكنونٌ
49.translation_eng: as if they were hidden1 ostrich eggs.That is, well reserved.
49.transliteration: ka-ʾannahunna bayḍun maknūnun

50.content: فَأَقبَلَ بَعضُهُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ يَتَساءَلونَ
50.translation_eng: Some of them will turn to others, questioning each other.
50.transliteration: fa-ʾaqbala baʿḍuhum ʿalā baʿḍin yatasāʾalūna

51.content: قالَ قائِلٌ مِنهُم إِنّي كانَ لي قَرينٌ
51.translation_eng: One of them will say, ‘Indeed I had a companion
51.transliteration: qāla qāʾilun minhum ʾinnī kāna lī qarīnun

52.content: يَقولُ أَإِنَّكَ لَمِنَ المُصَدِّقينَ
52.translation_eng: who used to say, “Are you really among those who affirm
52.transliteration: yaqūlu ʾa-ʾinnaka la-mina l-muṣaddiqīna

53.content: أَإِذا مِتنا وَكُنّا تُرابًا وَعِظامًا أَإِنّا لَمَدينونَ
53.translation_eng: [that] when we are dead and have become dust and bones, we shall indeed be brought to retribution?” ’
53.transliteration: ʾa-ʾidhā mitnā wa-kunnā turāban wa-ʿiẓāman ʾa-ʾinnā la-madīnūna

54.content: قالَ هَل أَنتُم مُطَّلِعونَ
54.translation_eng: He1 will say, ‘Will you have a look?’That is, one of his companions in paradise.
54.transliteration: qāla hal ʾantum muṭṭaliʿūna

55.content: فَاطَّلَعَ فَرَآهُ في سَواءِ الجَحيمِ
55.translation_eng: Then he will take a look and sight him in the middle of hell.
55.transliteration: fa-ṭṭalaʿa fa-raʾāhu fī sawāʾi l-jaḥīmi

56.content: قالَ تَاللَّهِ إِن كِدتَ لَتُردينِ
56.translation_eng: He will say, ‘By Allah, you had almost ruined me!
56.transliteration: qāla ta-llāhi ʾin kidta la-turdīni

57.content: وَلَولا نِعمَةُ رَبّي لَكُنتُ مِنَ المُحضَرينَ
57.translation_eng: And had it not been for my Lord’s blessing, I too would have been among the arraigned!’
57.transliteration: wa-law-lā niʿmatu rabbī la-kuntu mina l-muḥḍarīna

58.content: أَفَما نَحنُ بِمَيِّتينَ
58.translation_eng: ‘Is it [true] that we shall not die [anymore],
58.transliteration: ʾa-fa-mā naḥnu bi-mayyitīna

59.content: إِلّا مَوتَتَنَا الأولىٰ وَما نَحنُ بِمُعَذَّبينَ
59.translation_eng: aside from our first death, and that we shall not be punished?
59.transliteration: ʾillā mawtatanā l-ʾūlā wa-mā naḥnu bi-muʿadhdhabīna

60.content: إِنَّ هٰذا لَهُوَ الفَوزُ العَظيمُ
60.translation_eng: This is indeed the great success!
60.transliteration: ʾinna hādhā la-huwa l-fawzu l-ʿaẓīmu

61.content: لِمِثلِ هٰذا فَليَعمَلِ العامِلونَ
61.translation_eng: Let all the workers work for the like of this!’
61.transliteration: li-mithli hādhā fa-l-yaʿmali l-ʿāmilūna

62.content: أَذٰلِكَ خَيرٌ نُزُلًا أَم شَجَرَةُ الزَّقّومِ
62.translation_eng: Is this a better hospitality, or the Zaqqūm tree?
62.transliteration: ʾa-dhālika khayrun nuzulan ʾam shajaratu z-zaqqūmi

63.content: إِنّا جَعَلناها فِتنَةً لِلظّالِمينَ
63.translation_eng: Indeed We have made it a punishment for the wrongdoers.
63.transliteration: ʾinnā jaʿalnāhā fitnatan li-ẓ-ẓālimīna

64.content: إِنَّها شَجَرَةٌ تَخرُجُ في أَصلِ الجَحيمِ
64.translation_eng: Indeed it is a tree that emerges from the depths of hell.
64.transliteration: ʾinnahā shajaratun takhruju fī ʾaṣli l-jaḥīmi

65.content: طَلعُها كَأَنَّهُ رُءوسُ الشَّياطينِ
65.translation_eng: Its spathes are as if they were devils’ heads.1‘The devil’s head’ is either a purely imaginative metaphor, or a simile that likens the spathes of the Zaqqūm tree to that of an Arabian plant by this name, or to certain rocks to be found around the city of Makkah which were called ‘the devils’ heads’ because of their hideous appearance.
65.transliteration: ṭalʿuhā ka-ʾannahū ruʾūsu sh-shayāṭīni

66.content: فَإِنَّهُم لَآكِلونَ مِنها فَمالِئونَ مِنهَا البُطونَ
66.translation_eng: Indeed they will eat from it and gorge with it their bellies.
66.transliteration: fa-ʾinnahum la-ʾākilūna minhā fa-māliʾūna minhā l-buṭūna

67.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُم عَلَيها لَشَوبًا مِن حَميمٍ
67.translation_eng: Indeed, on top of that they will take a solution of scalding water.
67.transliteration: thumma ʾinna lahum ʿalayhā la-shawban min ḥamīmin

68.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّ مَرجِعَهُم لَإِلَى الجَحيمِ
68.translation_eng: Then indeed their retreat will be toward hell.
68.transliteration: thumma ʾinna marjiʿahum la-ʾilā l-jaḥīmi

69.content: إِنَّهُم أَلفَوا آباءَهُم ضالّينَ
69.translation_eng: Indeed they had found their fathers astray,
69.transliteration: ʾinnahum ʾalfaw ʾābāʾahum ḍāllīna

70.content: فَهُم عَلىٰ آثارِهِم يُهرَعونَ
70.translation_eng: yet they press on in their footsteps.
70.transliteration: fa-hum ʿalā ʾāthārihim yuhraʿūna

71.content: وَلَقَد ضَلَّ قَبلَهُم أَكثَرُ الأَوَّلينَ
71.translation_eng: Certainly most of the ancients went astray before them,
71.transliteration: wa-la-qad ḍalla qablahum ʾaktharu l-ʾawwalīna

72.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا فيهِم مُنذِرينَ
72.translation_eng: and certainly We had sent warners among them.
72.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā fīhim mundhirīna

73.content: فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ المُنذَرينَ
73.translation_eng: So observe how was the fate of those who were warned
73.transliteration: fa-nẓur kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu l-mundharīna

74.content: إِلّا عِبادَ اللَّهِ المُخلَصينَ
74.translation_eng: —[all] except Allah’s exclusive servants!
74.transliteration: ʾillā ʿibāda llāhi l-mukhlaṣīna

75.content: وَلَقَد نادانا نوحٌ فَلَنِعمَ المُجيبونَ
75.translation_eng: Certainly Noah called out to Us, and how well We responded!
75.transliteration: wa-la-qad nādānā nūḥun fa-la-niʿma l-mujībūna

76.content: وَنَجَّيناهُ وَأَهلَهُ مِنَ الكَربِ العَظيمِ
76.translation_eng: We delivered him and his family from the great agony,
76.transliteration: wa-najjaynāhu wa-ʾahlahū mina l-karbi l-ʿaẓīmi

77.content: وَجَعَلنا ذُرِّيَّتَهُ هُمُ الباقينَ
77.translation_eng: and made his descendants the survivors,
77.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā dhurriyyatahū humu l-bāqīna

78.content: وَتَرَكنا عَلَيهِ فِي الآخِرينَ
78.translation_eng: and left for him a good name among posterity:
78.transliteration: wa-taraknā ʿalayhi fī l-ʾākhirīna

79.content: سَلامٌ عَلىٰ نوحٍ فِي العالَمينَ
79.translation_eng: ‘Peace to Noah, throughout the nations!’
79.transliteration: salāmun ʿalā nūḥin fī l-ʿālamīna

80.content: إِنّا كَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي المُحسِنينَ
80.translation_eng: Thus indeed do We reward the virtuous.
80.transliteration: ʾinnā ka-dhālika najzī l-muḥsinīna

81.content: إِنَّهُ مِن عِبادِنَا المُؤمِنينَ
81.translation_eng: He is indeed one of Our faithful servants.
81.transliteration: ʾinnahū min ʿibādinā l-muʾminīna

82.content: ثُمَّ أَغرَقنَا الآخَرينَ
82.translation_eng: Then We drowned the others.
82.transliteration: thumma ʾaghraqnā l-ʾākharīna

83.content: ۞ وَإِنَّ مِن شيعَتِهِ لَإِبراهيمَ
83.translation_eng: Indeed Abraham was among his followers,
83.transliteration: wa-ʾinna min shīʿatihī la-ʾibrāhīma

84.content: إِذ جاءَ رَبَّهُ بِقَلبٍ سَليمٍ
84.translation_eng: when he came to his Lord with a sound heart,1Cf. 26:89.
84.transliteration: ʾidh jāʾa rabbahū bi-qalbin salīmin

85.content: إِذ قالَ لِأَبيهِ وَقَومِهِ ماذا تَعبُدونَ
85.translation_eng: when he said to his father and his people, ‘What is it that you are worshiping?
85.transliteration: ʾidh qāla li-ʾabīhi wa-qawmihī mādhā taʿbudūna

86.content: أَئِفكًا آلِهَةً دونَ اللَّهِ تُريدونَ
86.translation_eng: Is it a lie, gods other than Allah, that you desire?
86.transliteration: ʾa-ʾifkan ʾālihatan dūna llāhi turīdūna

87.content: فَما ظَنُّكُم بِرَبِّ العالَمينَ
87.translation_eng: Then what is your idea about the Lord of all the worlds?’
87.transliteration: fa-mā ẓannukum bi-rabbi l-ʿālamīna

88.content: فَنَظَرَ نَظرَةً فِي النُّجومِ
88.translation_eng: Then he made an observation of the stars1Or ‘threw a look at the stars.’
88.transliteration: fa-naẓara naẓratan fī n-nujūmi

89.content: فَقالَ إِنّي سَقيمٌ
89.translation_eng: and said, ‘Indeed I am sick!’
89.transliteration: fa-qāla ʾinnī saqīmun

90.content: فَتَوَلَّوا عَنهُ مُدبِرينَ
90.translation_eng: So they went away leaving him behind.
90.transliteration: fa-tawallaw ʿanhu mudbirīna

91.content: فَراغَ إِلىٰ آلِهَتِهِم فَقالَ أَلا تَأكُلونَ
91.translation_eng: Then he stole away to their gods and said, ‘Will you not eat?
91.transliteration: fa-rāgha ʾilā ʾālihatihim fa-qāla ʾa-lā taʾkulūna

92.content: ما لَكُم لا تَنطِقونَ
92.translation_eng: Why do you not speak?’
92.transliteration: mā lakum lā tanṭiqūna

93.content: فَراغَ عَلَيهِم ضَربًا بِاليَمينِ
93.translation_eng: Then he attacked them, striking forcefully.
93.transliteration: fa-rāgha ʿalayhim ḍarban bi-l-yamīni

94.content: فَأَقبَلوا إِلَيهِ يَزِفّونَ
94.translation_eng: They came running towards him.
94.transliteration: fa-ʾaqbalū ʾilayhi yaziffūna

95.content: قالَ أَتَعبُدونَ ما تَنحِتونَ
95.translation_eng: He said, ‘Do you worship what you have yourselves carved,
95.transliteration: qāla ʾa-taʿbudūna mā tanḥitūna

96.content: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَكُم وَما تَعمَلونَ
96.translation_eng: when Allah has created you and whatever you make?’
96.transliteration: wa-llāhu khalaqakum wa-mā taʿmalūna

97.content: قالُوا ابنوا لَهُ بُنيانًا فَأَلقوهُ فِي الجَحيمِ
97.translation_eng: They said, ‘Build a structure for him and cast him into a huge fire.’
97.transliteration: qālū bnū lahū bunyānan fa-ʾalqūhu fī l-jaḥīmi

98.content: فَأَرادوا بِهِ كَيدًا فَجَعَلناهُمُ الأَسفَلينَ
98.translation_eng: So they sought to outwit him, but We made them the lowermost.
98.transliteration: fa-ʾarādū bihī kaydan fa-jaʿalnāhumu l-ʾasfalīna

99.content: وَقالَ إِنّي ذاهِبٌ إِلىٰ رَبّي سَيَهدينِ
99.translation_eng: He said, ‘Indeed I am going toward my Lord, who will guide me.’
99.transliteration: wa-qāla ʾinnī dhāhibun ʾilā rabbī sa-yahdīni

100.translation_eng: ‘My Lord! Give me [an heir], one of the righteous.’

101.translation_eng: So We gave him the good news of a forbearing son.1That is, Ishmael, who was Abraham’s first born. That it was Ishmael to whom the following episode of the sacrifice pertains is also supported by the fact that verses pertaining to the birth of Isaac follow the account of Ishmael’s sacrifice.

102.content: فَلَمّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ السَّعيَ قالَ يا بُنَيَّ إِنّي أَرىٰ فِي المَنامِ أَنّي أَذبَحُكَ فَانظُر ماذا تَرىٰ ۚ قالَ يا أَبَتِ افعَل ما تُؤمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُني إِن شاءَ اللَّهُ مِنَ الصّابِرينَ
102.translation_eng: When he was old enough to assist in his endeavour, he said, ‘My son! I see in a dream that I am sacrificing you. See what you think.’ He said, ‘Father! Do whatever you have been commanded. If Allah wishes, you will find me to be patient.’
102.transliteration: fa-lammā balagha maʿahu s-saʿya qāla yā-bunayya ʾinnī ʾarā fī l-manāmi ʾannī ʾadhbaḥuka fa-nẓur mādhā tarā qāla yā-ʾabati fʿal mā tuʾmaru sa-tajidunī ʾin shāʾa llāhu mina ṣ-ṣābirīna

103.translation_eng: So when they had both submitted [to Allah’s will], and he had laid him down on his forehead,

104.translation_eng: We called out to him, ‘O Abraham!

105.content: قَد صَدَّقتَ الرُّؤيا ۚ إِنّا كَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي المُحسِنينَ
105.translation_eng: You have indeed fulfilled the vision!1 Thus indeed do We reward the virtuous!Or ‘dream.’
105.transliteration: qad ṣaddaqta r-ruʾyā ʾinnā ka-dhālika najzī l-muḥsinīna

106.translation_eng: This was indeed a manifest test.’

107.translation_eng: Then We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,

108.translation_eng: and left for him a good name in posterity:

110.translation_eng: Thus do We reward the virtuous.

111.translation_eng: He is indeed one of Our faithful servants.

112.translation_eng: And We gave him the good news of [the birth of] Isaac, a prophet, one of the righteous.

113.content: وَبارَكنا عَلَيهِ وَعَلىٰ إِسحاقَ ۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِما مُحسِنٌ وَظالِمٌ لِنَفسِهِ مُبينٌ
113.translation_eng: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among their descendants [some] are virtuous, and [some] who manifestly wrong themselves.
113.transliteration: wa-bāraknā ʿalayhi wa-ʿalā ʾisḥāqa wa-min dhurriyyatihimā muḥsinun wa-ẓālimun li-nafsihī mubīnun

114.translation_eng: Certainly We favoured Moses and Aaron,

115.translation_eng: and delivered them and their people from the great agony,

116.translation_eng: and We helped them so that they became the victors.

117.translation_eng: We gave them the illuminating scripture

118.translation_eng: and guided them to the straight path,

119.translation_eng: and left for them a good name in posterity.

121.translation_eng: Thus indeed do We reward the virtuous.

122.translation_eng: They are indeed among Our faithful servants.

123.translation_eng: And indeed Ilyās was one of the apostles,

124.translation_eng: when he said to his people, ‘Will you not be Godwary?

125.translation_eng: Do you invoke Baal and abandon the best of creators,

126.translation_eng: Allah, your Lord and Lord of your forefathers?’

127.translation_eng: But they impugned him. So they will indeed be arraigned [before Him]

129.translation_eng: We left for him a good name in posterity.

130.translation_eng: ‘Peace be to Ilyās!’1In accordance with an alternate reading (salāmun ʿalā Āl-i Yā Sīn), narrated from Nāfiʿ, Ibn ʿĀmir, Yaʿqūb, Ruways, al-Aʿraj, Shaybah, Zayd ibn ʿAlī and others (see Muʿjam al-Qirāʾāt al-Qurʾāniyyah, vol. 5, p. 246), the translation will be ‘Peace be upon the progeny of Yā Sīn’ (i.e. the Prophet, who is referred to as Yā Sīn in 36:1). Traditions narrated from Ibn ʿAbbās (al-Durr al-Manthūr, vol. 5, p. 286), Imam Jaʿfar al-Ṣādiq (Maʿānī al-Akhbār, p. 122) and Imam ʿAlī ibn Mūsā al-Riḍā (ʿUyūn Akhbār al-Riḍā, vol. 1, p.237) also support this reading.

131.translation_eng: Thus indeed do We reward the virtuous.

132.translation_eng: He is indeed one of Our faithful servants.

133.translation_eng: And indeed Lot was one of the apostles,

134.translation_eng: when We delivered him and all his family,

135.translation_eng: except an old woman among those who remained behind.

137.translation_eng: And indeed you pass by them at dawn

138.translation_eng: and at night. So do you not apply reason?

139.translation_eng: And indeed Jonah was one of the apostles,

140.translation_eng: when he absconded toward the laden ship.

141.translation_eng: Then he drew lots with them and he was the one to be refuted.

142.translation_eng: Then the fish swallowed him while he was blameworthy.

143.translation_eng: And had he not been one of those who celebrate Allah’s glory,

144.content: لَلَبِثَ في بَطنِهِ إِلىٰ يَومِ يُبعَثونَ
144.translation_eng: he would have surely remained in its belly till the day they will be resurrected.
144.transliteration: la-labitha fī baṭnihī ʾilā yawmi yubʿathūna

145.translation_eng: Then We cast him on a bare shore, and he was sick.

146.translation_eng: So We made a gourd plant grow above him.

147.content: وَأَرسَلناهُ إِلىٰ مِائَةِ أَلفٍ أَو يَزيدونَ
147.translation_eng: We sent him to a [community of] hundred thousand or more,
147.transliteration: wa-ʾarsalnāhu ʾilā miʾati ʾalfin ʾaw yazīdūna

148.translation_eng: and they believed [in him]. So We provided for them for a while.

149.translation_eng: Ask them, are daughters to be for your Lord while sons are to be for them?1Cf. 6:100; 16:57; 17:40; 43:16; 52:39.

150.content: أَم خَلَقنَا المَلائِكَةَ إِناثًا وَهُم شاهِدونَ
150.translation_eng: Did We create the angels females while they were present?1Or ‘while they were witnesses.’
150.transliteration: ʾam khalaqnā l-malāʾikata ʾināthan wa-hum shāhidūna

151.translation_eng: Look! It is indeed out of their mendacity that they say,

152.translation_eng: ‘Allah has begotten,’ and they indeed speak a falsehood.

153.translation_eng: Has he preferred daughters to sons?

154.translation_eng: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?

155.translation_eng: Will you not then take admonition?

156.translation_eng: Do you have a manifest authority?1That is, in support of what they assert.

157.translation_eng: Then produce your scripture, should you be truthful.

158.content: وَجَعَلوا بَينَهُ وَبَينَ الجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا ۚ وَلَقَد عَلِمَتِ الجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُم لَمُحضَرونَ
158.translation_eng: And they have set up a kinship between Him and the jinn, while the jinn certainly know that they will indeed be presented [before Him].
158.transliteration: wa-jaʿalū baynahū wa-bayna l-jinnati nasaban wa-la-qad ʿalimati l-jinnatu ʾinnahum la-muḥḍarūna

159.translation_eng: Clear is Allah of whatever they allege [about Him],

161.translation_eng: Indeed you and what you worship

163.translation_eng: except someone who is bound for hell.

164.content: وَما مِنّا إِلّا لَهُ مَقامٌ مَعلومٌ
164.translation_eng: ‘There is none among us but has a known place.1Verses 164-166 quote the words of the angels referred to in verse 1.
164.transliteration: wa-mā minnā ʾillā lahū maqāmun maʿlūmun

165.translation_eng: Indeed it is we who are the ranged ones .

166.translation_eng: Indeed it is we who are those who celebrate Allah’s glory.’

167.translation_eng: Indeed they1 used to say,That is, the pagans of Makkah.

168.content: لَو أَنَّ عِندَنا ذِكرًا مِنَ الأَوَّلينَ
168.translation_eng: ‘Had we possessed a reminder from the ancients,
168.transliteration: law ʾanna ʿindanā dhikran mina l-ʾawwalīna

169.translation_eng: we would surely have been Allah’s exclusive servants.’

170.translation_eng: But they disbelieved it [when it came to them]. Soon they will know.

171.translation_eng: Certainly Our decree has gone beforehand in favour of Our servants, the apostles,

172.translation_eng: that they will indeed receive [Allah’s] help,

173.translation_eng: and indeed Our hosts will be the victors.

174.translation_eng: So leave them alone for a while,

175.translation_eng: and watch them; soon they will see [the truth of the matter].

176.translation_eng: Do they seek to hasten Our punishment?

177.content: فَإِذا نَزَلَ بِساحَتِهِم فَساءَ صَباحُ المُنذَرينَ
177.translation_eng: But when it descends in their courtyard it will be a dismal dawn for those who had been warned.
177.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā nazala bi-sāḥatihim fa-sāʾa ṣabāḥu l-mundharīna

178.translation_eng: So leave them alone for a while,

179.translation_eng: and watch; soon they will see.

180.content: سُبحانَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ العِزَّةِ عَمّا يَصِفونَ
180.translation_eng: Clear is your Lord, the Lord of Might, of whatever they allege [concerning Him].
180.transliteration: subḥāna rabbika rabbi l-ʿizzati ʿammā yaṣifūna

182.translation_eng: All praise belongs to Allah, Lord of all the worlds.

38.description: The surah that opens with the single discrete Arabic letter Ṣād. It takes its name from the letter Ṣād, as mentioned in verse 1. This surah mentions previous prophets in support and encouragement for Muḥammad, and makes a clear link between the arrogance displayed by the disbelievers of Mecca, previous generations, and Iblis, the original rebel. The first and last verses assert the truth and nobility of the Quran.The surah is also known as: Saad.

1.translation_eng: Ṣād. By the Qurʾān bearing the Reminder!1Ellipsis: the omitted phrase is ‘you are indeed one of the apostles, on a straight path.’ Cf. 36:3.

2.content: بَلِ الَّذينَ كَفَروا في عِزَّةٍ وَشِقاقٍ
2.translation_eng: Yet the faithless dwell in conceit and defiance.
2.transliteration: bali lladhīna kafarū fī ʿizzatin wa-shiqāqin

3.content: كَم أَهلَكنا مِن قَبلِهِم مِن قَرنٍ فَنادَوا وَلاتَ حينَ مَناصٍ
3.translation_eng: How many a generation We have destroyed before them! They cried out [for help], but it was no more the time for escape.
3.transliteration: kam ʾahlaknā min qablihim min qarnin fa-nādaw wa-lāta ḥīna manāṣin

4.content: وَعَجِبوا أَن جاءَهُم مُنذِرٌ مِنهُم ۖ وَقالَ الكافِرونَ هٰذا ساحِرٌ كَذّابٌ
4.translation_eng: They consider it odd that there should come to them a warner from among themselves, and the faithless say, ‘This is a magician, a mendacious liar.’
4.transliteration: wa-ʿajibū ʾan jāʾahum mundhirun minhum wa-qāla l-kāfirūna hādhā sāḥirun kadhdhābun

5.content: أَجَعَلَ الآلِهَةَ إِلٰهًا واحِدًا ۖ إِنَّ هٰذا لَشَيءٌ عُجابٌ
5.translation_eng: ‘Has he reduced the gods to one god? This is indeed an odd thing!’
5.transliteration: ʾa-jaʿala l-ʾālihata ʾilāhan wāḥidan ʾinna hādhā la-shayʾun ʿujābun

6.content: وَانطَلَقَ المَلَأُ مِنهُم أَنِ امشوا وَاصبِروا عَلىٰ آلِهَتِكُم ۖ إِنَّ هٰذا لَشَيءٌ يُرادُ
6.translation_eng: Their elite go about [urging others]: ‘Go and stand by your gods! This is indeed the desirable thing [to do].
6.transliteration: wa-nṭalaqa l-malaʾu minhum ʾani mshū wa-ṣbirū ʿalā ʾālihatikum ʾinna hādhā la-shayʾun yurādu

7.content: ما سَمِعنا بِهٰذا فِي المِلَّةِ الآخِرَةِ إِن هٰذا إِلَّا اختِلاقٌ
7.translation_eng: We did not hear of this in the latter-day creed.1 This is nothing but a fabrication.That is, in the polytheistic creed prevalent in pre-Islamic Arabia.
7.transliteration: mā samiʿnā bi-hādhā fī l-millati l-ʾākhirati ʾin hādhā ʾillā khtilāqun

8.content: أَأُنزِلَ عَلَيهِ الذِّكرُ مِن بَينِنا ۚ بَل هُم في شَكٍّ مِن ذِكري ۖ بَل لَمّا يَذوقوا عَذابِ
8.translation_eng: Has the reminder been sent down to him out of [all of] us?’ Rather they are in doubt concerning My reminder. Rather they have not yet tasted My punishment.
8.transliteration: ʾa-ʾunzila ʿalayhi dh-dhikru min bayninā bal hum fī shakkin min dhikrī bal lammā yadhūqū ʿadhābi

9.content: أَم عِندَهُم خَزائِنُ رَحمَةِ رَبِّكَ العَزيزِ الوَهّابِ
9.translation_eng: Do they possess the treasuries of the mercy of your Lord, the All-mighty, the All-munificent?
9.transliteration: ʾam ʿindahum khazāʾinu raḥmati rabbika l-ʿazīzi l-wahhābi

10.content: أَم لَهُم مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما ۖ فَليَرتَقوا فِي الأَسبابِ
10.translation_eng: Do they own the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them? [If so,] let them ascend [to the higher spheres] by the means1 [of ascension].Or ‘let them ascend by the contrivances.’ Or ‘let them ascend by the ladder,’ or ‘let them ascend into the heavens.’
10.transliteration: ʾam lahum mulku s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā baynahumā fa-l-yartaqū fī l-ʾasbābi

11.content: جُندٌ ما هُنالِكَ مَهزومٌ مِنَ الأَحزابِ
11.translation_eng: [They are but] a routed host out there, from among the factions.1A prophesy of the defeat of the Makkan army at Badr (see Ṭabarī and Ṭabrisī). Or ‘from among the confederates,’ that is, of Satan (cf. 35:6, 58:19).
11.transliteration: jundun mā hunālika mahzūmun mina l-ʾaḥzābi

12.content: كَذَّبَت قَبلَهُم قَومُ نوحٍ وَعادٌ وَفِرعَونُ ذُو الأَوتادِ
12.translation_eng: Before them Noah’s people impugned [their apostle] and [so did the people of] ʿĀd, and Pharaoh, the Impaler1 [of his victims],Lit.: ‘the one of stakes.’ According to several traditions, Pharaoh used to torture and execute his victims by piercing their bodies with stakes, or awtād (see Biḥār al-anwār, vol. 13, p. 136, from ʿIlal al-Sharāyiʿ, p. 161; vol. 71, p. 13; vol. 75, p. 403). Hence the epithet ‘dhiʾl-awtād,’ which occurs twice in the Qurʾān with reference to Pharaoh, refers to him as one who used to impale his victims. Other alternate explanations have been suggested for this epithet by the commentators, but they are not convincing.
12.transliteration: kadhdhabat qablahum qawmu nūḥin wa-ʿādun wa-firʿawnu dhū l-ʾawtādi

13.content: وَثَمودُ وَقَومُ لوطٍ وَأَصحابُ الأَيكَةِ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ الأَحزابُ
13.translation_eng: and Thamūd, and the people of Lot, and the inhabitants of Aykah:1 those were the factions.Cf. 15:78.
13.transliteration: wa-thamūdu wa-qawmu lūṭin wa-ʾaṣḥābu l-ʾaykati ʾulāʾika l-ʾaḥzābu

14.content: إِن كُلٌّ إِلّا كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقابِ
14.translation_eng: Each of them did not but impugn the apostles; so My retribution became due [against them].
14.transliteration: ʾin kullun ʾillā kadhdhaba r-rusula fa-ḥaqqa ʿiqābi

15.content: وَما يَنظُرُ هٰؤُلاءِ إِلّا صَيحَةً واحِدَةً ما لَها مِن فَواقٍ
15.translation_eng: These1 do not await but a single Cry which will not grant any respite.That is, the pagans of Makkah.
15.transliteration: wa-mā yanẓuru hāʾulāʾi ʾillā ṣayḥatan wāḥidatan mā lahā min fawāqin

16.content: وَقالوا رَبَّنا عَجِّل لَنا قِطَّنا قَبلَ يَومِ الحِسابِ
16.translation_eng: They say, ‘Our Lord! Hasten on for us our share1 before the Day of Reckoning.’That is, ‘our share of punishment,’ said mockingly.
16.transliteration: wa-qālū rabbanā ʿajjil lanā qiṭṭanā qabla yawmi l-ḥisābi

17.content: اصبِر عَلىٰ ما يَقولونَ وَاذكُر عَبدَنا داوودَ ذَا الأَيدِ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوّابٌ
17.translation_eng: Be patient over what they say, and remember Our servant, David, [the man] of strength. Indeed he was a penitent [soul].
17.transliteration: iṣbir ʿalā mā yaqūlūna wa-dhkur ʿabdanā dāwūda dhā l-ʾaydi ʾinnahū ʾawwābun

18.content: إِنّا سَخَّرنَا الجِبالَ مَعَهُ يُسَبِّحنَ بِالعَشِيِّ وَالإِشراقِ
18.translation_eng: Indeed We disposed the mountains to glorify [Allah] with him at evening and dawn,
18.transliteration: ʾinnā sakhkharnā l-jibāla maʿahū yusabbiḥna bi-l-ʿashiyyi wa-l-ʾishrāqi

19.content: وَالطَّيرَ مَحشورَةً ۖ كُلٌّ لَهُ أَوّابٌ
19.translation_eng: and the birds [as well], mustered [in flocks], all echoing him [in a chorus].
19.transliteration: wa-ṭ-ṭayra maḥshūratan kullun lahū ʾawwābun

20.content: وَشَدَدنا مُلكَهُ وَآتَيناهُ الحِكمَةَ وَفَصلَ الخِطابِ
20.translation_eng: We made his kingdom firm and gave him wisdom and conclusive speech.
20.transliteration: wa-shaddadnā mulkahū wa-ʾātaynāhu l-ḥikmata wa-faṣla l-khiṭābi

21.content: ۞ وَهَل أَتاكَ نَبَأُ الخَصمِ إِذ تَسَوَّرُوا المِحرابَ
21.translation_eng: Has there not come to you the account of the contenders, when they scaled the wall into the sanctuary?1Or ‘sanctum.’
21.transliteration: wa-hal ʾatāka nabaʾu l-khaṣmi ʾidh tasawwarū l-miḥrāba

22.content: إِذ دَخَلوا عَلىٰ داوودَ فَفَزِعَ مِنهُم ۖ قالوا لا تَخَف ۖ خَصمانِ بَغىٰ بَعضُنا عَلىٰ بَعضٍ فَاحكُم بَينَنا بِالحَقِّ وَلا تُشطِط وَاهدِنا إِلىٰ سَواءِ الصِّراطِ
22.translation_eng: When they entered into the presence of David, he was alarmed by them. They said, ‘Do not be afraid. [We are only] two contenders: one of us has bullied the other. So judge justly between us, and do not exceed [the bounds of justice], and show us the right path.’
22.transliteration: ʾidh dakhalū ʿalā dāwūda fa-faziʿa minhum qālū lā takhaf khaṣmāni baghā baʿḍunā ʿalā baʿḍin fa-ḥkum baynanā bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-lā tushṭiṭ wa-hdinā ʾilā sawāʾi ṣ-ṣirāṭi

23.content: إِنَّ هٰذا أَخي لَهُ تِسعٌ وَتِسعونَ نَعجَةً وَلِيَ نَعجَةٌ واحِدَةٌ فَقالَ أَكفِلنيها وَعَزَّني فِي الخِطابِ
23.translation_eng: ‘Indeed this brother of mine has ninety-nine ewes, while I have only a single ewe, and [yet] he says, ‘Commit it to my care,’ and he browbeats me in speech.’
23.transliteration: ʾinna hādhā ʾakhī lahū tisʿun wa-tisʿūna naʿjatan wa-liya naʿjatun wāḥidatun fa-qāla ʾakfilnīhā wa-ʿazzanī fī l-khitābi

24.content: قالَ لَقَد ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤالِ نَعجَتِكَ إِلىٰ نِعاجِهِ ۖ وَإِنَّ كَثيرًا مِنَ الخُلَطاءِ لَيَبغي بَعضُهُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ إِلَّا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ وَقَليلٌ ما هُم ۗ وَظَنَّ داوودُ أَنَّما فَتَنّاهُ فَاستَغفَرَ رَبَّهُ وَخَرَّ راكِعًا وَأَنابَ ۩
24.translation_eng: He said, ‘He has certainly wronged you by asking your ewe in addition to his ewes, and indeed many partners bully one another, except such as have faith and do righteous deeds, and few are they.’ Then David knew that We had indeed tested him, whereat he pleaded with his Lord for forgiveness, and fell down prostrate and repented.
24.transliteration: qāla la-qad ẓalamaka bi-suʾāli naʿjatika ʾilā niʿājihī wa-ʾinna kathīran mina l-khulaṭāʾi la-yabghī baʿḍuhum ʿalā baʿḍin ʾillā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa-qalīlun mā hum wa-ẓanna dāwūdu ʾannamā fatannāhu fa-staghfara rabbahū wa-kharra rākiʿan wa-ʾanāba

25.content: فَغَفَرنا لَهُ ذٰلِكَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنا لَزُلفىٰ وَحُسنَ مَآبٍ
25.translation_eng: So We forgave him that and indeed he has [a station of] nearness with Us and a good destination.
25.transliteration: fa-ghafarnā lahū dhālika wa-ʾinna lahū ʿindanā la-zulfā wa-ḥusna maʾābin

26.content: يا داوودُ إِنّا جَعَلناكَ خَليفَةً فِي الأَرضِ فَاحكُم بَينَ النّاسِ بِالحَقِّ وَلا تَتَّبِعِ الهَوىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَضِلّونَ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ لَهُم عَذابٌ شَديدٌ بِما نَسوا يَومَ الحِسابِ
26.translation_eng: ‘O David! Indeed We have made you a vicegerent on the earth. So judge between people with justice, and do not follow desire, or it will lead you astray from the way of Allah. Indeed those who stray from the way of Allah —there is a severe punishment for them because of their forgetting the Day of Reckoning.’
26.transliteration: yā-dāwūdu ʾinnā jaʿalnāka khalīfatan fī l-ʾarḍi fa-ḥkum bayna n-nāsi bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-lā tattabiʿi l-hawā fa-yuḍillaka ʿan sabīli llāhi ʾinna lladhīna yaḍillūna ʿan sabīli llāhi lahum ʿadhābun shadīdun bi-mā nasū yawma l-ḥisābi

27.content: وَما خَلَقنَا السَّماءَ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما باطِلًا ۚ ذٰلِكَ ظَنُّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا ۚ فَوَيلٌ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا مِنَ النّارِ
27.translation_eng: We did not create the sky and the earth and whatever is between them in vain. That is a conjecture of the faithless. So woe to the faithless for the Fire!
27.transliteration: wa-mā khalaqnā s-samāʾa wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-mā baynahumā bāṭilan dhālika ẓannu lladhīna kafarū fa-waylun li-lladhīna kafarū mina n-nāri

28.content: أَم نَجعَلُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ كَالمُفسِدينَ فِي الأَرضِ أَم نَجعَلُ المُتَّقينَ كَالفُجّارِ
28.translation_eng: Shall We treat those who have faith and do righteous deeds like those who cause corruption on the earth? Shall We treat the Godwary like the vicious?
28.transliteration: ʾam najʿalu lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti ka-l-mufsidīna fī l-ʾarḍi ʾam najʿalu l-muttaqīna ka-l-fujjāri

29.content: كِتابٌ أَنزَلناهُ إِلَيكَ مُبارَكٌ لِيَدَّبَّروا آياتِهِ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُولُو الأَلبابِ
29.translation_eng: [It is] a blessed Book that We have sent down to you, so that they may contemplate its signs, and that those who possess intellect may take admonition.
29.transliteration: kitābun ʾanzalnāhu ʾilayka mubārakun li-yaddabbarū ʾāyātihī wa-li-yatadhakkara ʾulū l-ʾalbābi

30.content: وَوَهَبنا لِداوودَ سُلَيمانَ ۚ نِعمَ العَبدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوّابٌ
30.translation_eng: And to David We gave Solomon —what an excellent servant! Indeed he was a penitent [soul].
30.transliteration: wa-wahabnā li-dāwūda sulaymāna niʿma l-ʿabdu ʾinnahū ʾawwābun

31.content: إِذ عُرِضَ عَلَيهِ بِالعَشِيِّ الصّافِناتُ الجِيادُ
31.translation_eng: When one evening there were displayed before him prancing steeds,
31.transliteration: ʾidh ʿuriḍa ʿalayhi bi-l-ʿashiyyi ṣ-ṣāfinātu l-jiyādu

32.content: فَقالَ إِنّي أَحبَبتُ حُبَّ الخَيرِ عَن ذِكرِ رَبّي حَتّىٰ تَوارَت بِالحِجابِ
32.translation_eng: he said, ‘Indeed I have preferred the love of [worldly] niceties to the remembrance of my Lord until [the sun] disappeared behind the [night’s] veil.’
32.transliteration: fa-qāla ʾinnī ʾaḥbabtu ḥubba l-khayri ʿan dhikri rabbī ḥattā tawārat bi-l-ḥijābi

33.content: رُدّوها عَلَيَّ ۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسحًا بِالسّوقِ وَالأَعناقِ
33.translation_eng: ‘Bring it1 back for me!’ Then he [and others] began to wipe [their] legs and necks.Or ‘them.’ The pronoun may be taken as referring to the sun or to the horses. However, most exegetes have taken it as referring to the sun and its setting. While Solomon was engaged in viewing the horses, the sun set, and the time of the afternoon prayer (supererogatory or obligatory) elapsed. According to a tradition narrated from al-Imām al-Ṣādiq (ʿa), when Solomon noticed that the sun had set, he called out to the angels to bring it back so that he could offer the afternoon prayer. Also, according to this tradition, the wiping of legs and necks mentioned in the verse refers to the performance of ablution (wuḍūʾ) before the prayer by Solomon and his men as prescribed in their Law. (Biḥār, vol. 14, p. 101; vol. 82, p. 341).
33.transliteration: ruddūhā ʿalayya fa-ṭafiqa masḥan bi-s-sūqi wa-l-ʾaʿnāqi

34.content: وَلَقَد فَتَنّا سُلَيمانَ وَأَلقَينا عَلىٰ كُرسِيِّهِ جَسَدًا ثُمَّ أَنابَ
34.translation_eng: Certainly We tried Solomon, and cast a [lifeless] body on his throne. Thereupon he was penitent.
34.transliteration: wa-la-qad fatannā sulaymāna wa-ʾalqaynā ʿalā kursiyyihī jasadan thumma ʾanāba

35.content: قالَ رَبِّ اغفِر لي وَهَب لي مُلكًا لا يَنبَغي لِأَحَدٍ مِن بَعدي ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الوَهّابُ
35.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! Forgive me, and grant me a kingdom that does not befit anyone except me.1 Indeed You are the All-munificent.’Cf. 35:41. Or ‘a kingdom that will not befit anyone after me.’
35.transliteration: qāla rabbi ghfir lī wa-hab lī mulkan lā yanbaghī li-ʾaḥadin min baʿdī ʾinnaka ʾanta l-wahhābu

36.content: فَسَخَّرنا لَهُ الرّيحَ تَجري بِأَمرِهِ رُخاءً حَيثُ أَصابَ
36.translation_eng: So We disposed the wind for him, blowing softly by his command wherever he intended,
36.transliteration: fa-sakhkharnā lahu r-rīḥa tajrī bi-ʾamrihī rukhāʾan ḥaythu ʾaṣāba

37.content: وَالشَّياطينَ كُلَّ بَنّاءٍ وَغَوّاصٍ
37.translation_eng: and the devils [as well as], every builder and diver,
37.transliteration: wa-sh-shayāṭīna kulla bannāʾin wa-ghawwāṣin

38.content: وَآخَرينَ مُقَرَّنينَ فِي الأَصفادِ
38.translation_eng: and others [too] bound together in chains.
38.transliteration: wa-ʾākharīna muqarranīna fī l-ʾaṣfādi

39.content: هٰذا عَطاؤُنا فَامنُن أَو أَمسِك بِغَيرِ حِسابٍ
39.translation_eng: ‘This is Our bounty: so give away or withhold, without any reckoning.’
39.transliteration: hādhā ʿaṭāʾunā fa-mnun ʾaw ʾamsik bi-ghayri ḥisābin

40.content: وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنا لَزُلفىٰ وَحُسنَ مَآبٍ
40.translation_eng: Indeed he has [a station of] nearness with Us and a good destination.
40.transliteration: wa-ʾinna lahū ʿindanā la-zulfā wa-ḥusna maʾābin

41.content: وَاذكُر عَبدَنا أَيّوبَ إِذ نادىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنّي مَسَّنِيَ الشَّيطانُ بِنُصبٍ وَعَذابٍ
41.translation_eng: And remember Our servant Job [in the Qurʾān]. When he called out to his Lord, ‘The devil has visited on me hardship and torment,’
41.transliteration: wa-dhkur ʿabdanā ʾayyūba ʾidh nādā rabbahū ʾannī massaniya sh-shayṭānu bi-nuṣbin wa-ʿadhābin-i

42.content: اركُض بِرِجلِكَ ۖ هٰذا مُغتَسَلٌ بارِدٌ وَشَرابٌ
42.translation_eng: [We told him:] ‘Stamp your foot on the ground; this [ensuing spring] is a cooling bath and drink.’
42.transliteration: urkuḍ bi-rijlika hādhā mughtasalun bāridun wa-sharābun

43.content: وَوَهَبنا لَهُ أَهلَهُ وَمِثلَهُم مَعَهُم رَحمَةً مِنّا وَذِكرىٰ لِأُولِي الأَلبابِ
43.translation_eng: And We gave [back] his family to him along with others like them, as a mercy from Us and an admonition for those who possess intellect.
43.transliteration: wa-wahabnā lahū ʾahlahū wa-mithlahum maʿahum raḥmatan minnā wa-dhikrā li-ʾulī l-ʾalbābi

44.content: وَخُذ بِيَدِكَ ضِغثًا فَاضرِب بِهِ وَلا تَحنَث ۗ إِنّا وَجَدناهُ صابِرًا ۚ نِعمَ العَبدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوّابٌ
44.translation_eng: [We told him:] ‘Take a faggot in your hand and then strike [your wife] with it, but do not break [your] oath.’ Indeed We found him to be patient. What an excellent servant! Indeed he was a penitent [soul].
44.transliteration: wa-khudh bi-yadika ḍighthan fa-ḍrib bihī wa-lā taḥnath ʾinnā wajadnāhu ṣābiran niʿma l-ʿabdu ʾinnahū ʾawwābun

45.content: وَاذكُر عِبادَنا إِبراهيمَ وَإِسحاقَ وَيَعقوبَ أُولِي الأَيدي وَالأَبصارِ
45.translation_eng: And remember Our servants Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of strength and insight.
45.transliteration: wa-dhkur ʿibādanā ʾibrāhīma wa-ʾisḥāqa wa-yaʿqūba ʾulī l-ʾaydī wa-l-ʾabṣāri

46.content: إِنّا أَخلَصناهُم بِخالِصَةٍ ذِكرَى الدّارِ
46.translation_eng: Indeed We purified them with the exclusiveness of the remembrance of the abode [of the Hereafter].
46.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾakhlaṣnāhum bi-khāliṣatin dhikrā d-dāri

47.content: وَإِنَّهُم عِندَنا لَمِنَ المُصطَفَينَ الأَخيارِ
47.translation_eng: Indeed with Us they are surely among the elect of the best.
47.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahum ʿindanā la-mina l-muṣṭafayna l-ʾakhyāri

48.content: وَاذكُر إِسماعيلَ وَاليَسَعَ وَذَا الكِفلِ ۖ وَكُلٌّ مِنَ الأَخيارِ
48.translation_eng: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhu’l-Kifl —each [of whom was] among the elect.
48.transliteration: wa-dhkur ʾismāʿīla wa-l-yasaʿa wa-dhā l-kifli wa-kullun mina l-ʾakhyāri

49.content: هٰذا ذِكرٌ ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلمُتَّقينَ لَحُسنَ مَآبٍ
49.translation_eng: This is a reminder, and indeed the Godwary have a good destination
49.transliteration: hādhā dhikrun wa-ʾinna li-l-muttaqīna la-ḥusna maʾābin

50.content: جَنّاتِ عَدنٍ مُفَتَّحَةً لَهُمُ الأَبوابُ
50.translation_eng: —the Gardens of Eden, whose gates are flung open for them.
50.transliteration: jannāti ʿadnin mufattaḥatan lahumu l-ʾabwābu

51.content: مُتَّكِئينَ فيها يَدعونَ فيها بِفاكِهَةٍ كَثيرَةٍ وَشَرابٍ
51.translation_eng: Reclining therein [on couches], therein they ask for abundant fruits and drinks,
51.transliteration: muttakiʾīna fīhā yadʿūna fīhā bi-fākihatin kathīratin wa-sharābin

52.content: ۞ وَعِندَهُم قاصِراتُ الطَّرفِ أَترابٌ
52.translation_eng: and with them will be maidens of restrained glances of a like age.
52.transliteration: wa-ʿindahum qāṣirātu ṭ-ṭarfi ʾatrābun

53.content: هٰذا ما توعَدونَ لِيَومِ الحِسابِ
53.translation_eng: This is what you are promised on the Day of Reckoning.
53.transliteration: hādhā mā tūʿadūna li-yawmi l-ḥisābi

54.content: إِنَّ هٰذا لَرِزقُنا ما لَهُ مِن نَفادٍ
54.translation_eng: This is indeed Our provision, which will never be exhausted.
54.transliteration: ʾinna hādhā la-rizqunā mā lahū min nafādin

55.content: هٰذا ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلطّاغينَ لَشَرَّ مَآبٍ
55.translation_eng: This [is for the righteous], and as for the rebellious there will surely be a bad destination
55.transliteration: hādhā wa-ʾinna li-ṭ-ṭāghīna la-sharra maʾābin

56.content: جَهَنَّمَ يَصلَونَها فَبِئسَ المِهادُ
56.translation_eng: —hell, which they shall enter, an evil resting place.
56.transliteration: jahannama yaṣlawnahā fa-biʾsa l-mihādu

57.content: هٰذا فَليَذوقوهُ حَميمٌ وَغَسّاقٌ
57.translation_eng: This; let them taste it: scalding water and pus,
57.transliteration: hādhā fa-l-yadhūqūhu ḥamīmun wa-ghassāqun

58.content: وَآخَرُ مِن شَكلِهِ أَزواجٌ
58.translation_eng: and other kinds [of torments] resembling it.
58.transliteration: wa-ʾākharu min shaklihī ʾazwājun

59.content: هٰذا فَوجٌ مُقتَحِمٌ مَعَكُم ۖ لا مَرحَبًا بِهِم ۚ إِنَّهُم صالُو النّارِ
59.translation_eng: ‘This is a group plunging [into hell] along with you.’1 ‘May wretchedness be their lot! They will indeed enter the Fire.’2Said by the angels to leaders of the faithless concerning their followers.Said by the leaders of the faithless concerning their followers.
59.transliteration: hādhā fawjun muqtaḥimun maʿakum lā marḥaban bihim ʾinnahum ṣālū n-nāri

60.content: قالوا بَل أَنتُم لا مَرحَبًا بِكُم ۖ أَنتُم قَدَّمتُموهُ لَنا ۖ فَبِئسَ القَرارُ
60.translation_eng: They1 say, ‘Rather, may wretchedness be your lot! You prepared this [hell] for us. What an evil abode!’That is, the followers, who respond to the unfriendly welcome of their leaders.
60.transliteration: qālū bal ʾantum lā marḥaban bikum ʾantum qaddamtumūhu lanā fa-biʾsa l-qarāru

61.content: قالوا رَبَّنا مَن قَدَّمَ لَنا هٰذا فَزِدهُ عَذابًا ضِعفًا فِي النّارِ
61.translation_eng: They say, ‘Our Lord! Whoever has prepared this for us, double his punishment in the Fire!’
61.transliteration: qālū rabbanā man qaddama lanā hādhā fa-zidhu ʿadhāban ḍiʿfan fī n-nāri

62.content: وَقالوا ما لَنا لا نَرىٰ رِجالًا كُنّا نَعُدُّهُم مِنَ الأَشرارِ
62.translation_eng: And they say, ‘What is the matter with us that we do not see [here] men whom we used to count among the bad ones?
62.transliteration: wa-qālū mā lanā lā narā rijālan kunnā naʿudduhum mina l-ʾashrāri

63.content: أَتَّخَذناهُم سِخرِيًّا أَم زاغَت عَنهُمُ الأَبصارُ
63.translation_eng: Did we ridicule them [unduly in the world], or do [our] eyes miss them [here]?’
63.transliteration: ʾa-ttakhadhnāhum sikhriyyan ʾam zāghat ʿanhumu l-ʾabṣāru

64.content: إِنَّ ذٰلِكَ لَحَقٌّ تَخاصُمُ أَهلِ النّارِ
64.translation_eng: That is indeed a truth: the contentions of the inmates of the Fire.
64.transliteration: ʾinna dhālika la-ḥaqqun takhāṣumu ʾahli n-nāri

65.content: قُل إِنَّما أَنا مُنذِرٌ ۖ وَما مِن إِلٰهٍ إِلَّا اللَّهُ الواحِدُ القَهّارُ
65.translation_eng: Say, ‘I am just a warner, and there is no god except Allah, the One, the All-paramount,
65.transliteration: qul ʾinnamā ʾana mundhirun wa-mā min ʾilāhin ʾillā llāhu l-wāḥidu l-qahhāru

66.content: رَبُّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُمَا العَزيزُ الغَفّارُ
66.translation_eng: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the All-mighty, the All-forgiver.’
66.transliteration: rabbu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā baynahumā l-ʿazīzu l-ghaffāru

67.content: قُل هُوَ نَبَأٌ عَظيمٌ
67.translation_eng: Say, ‘It is a great prophesy,
67.transliteration: qul huwa nabaʾun ʿaẓīmun

68.content: أَنتُم عَنهُ مُعرِضونَ
68.translation_eng: of which you are disregardful.
68.transliteration: ʾantum ʿanhu muʿriḍūna

69.content: ما كانَ لِيَ مِن عِلمٍ بِالمَلَإِ الأَعلىٰ إِذ يَختَصِمونَ
69.translation_eng: I have no knowledge of the Supernal Elite when they contend.
69.transliteration: mā kāna liya min ʿilmin bi-l-malaʾi l-ʾaʿlā ʾidh yakhtaṣimūna

70.content: إِن يوحىٰ إِلَيَّ إِلّا أَنَّما أَنا نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
70.translation_eng: All that is revealed to me is that I am just a manifest warner.’
70.transliteration: ʾin yūḥā ʾilayya ʾillā ʾannamā ʾana nadhīrun mubīnun

71.content: إِذ قالَ رَبُّكَ لِلمَلائِكَةِ إِنّي خالِقٌ بَشَرًا مِن طينٍ
71.translation_eng: When your Lord said to the angels, ‘Indeed I am about to create a human being out of clay.
71.transliteration: ʾidh qāla rabbuka li-l-malāʾikati ʾinnī khāliqun basharan min ṭīnin

72.content: فَإِذا سَوَّيتُهُ وَنَفَختُ فيهِ مِن روحي فَقَعوا لَهُ ساجِدينَ
72.translation_eng: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My spirit, then fall down in prostration before him.’
72.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā sawwaytuhū wa-nafakhtu fīhi min rūḥī fa-qaʿū lahū sājidīna

73.content: فَسَجَدَ المَلائِكَةُ كُلُّهُم أَجمَعونَ
73.translation_eng: Thereat the angels prostrated, all of them together,
73.transliteration: fa-sajada l-malāʾikatu kulluhum ʾajmaʿūna

74.content: إِلّا إِبليسَ استَكبَرَ وَكانَ مِنَ الكافِرينَ
74.translation_eng: but not Iblis; he acted arrogantly and he was one of the faithless.
74.transliteration: ʾillā ʾiblīsa stakbara wa-kāna mina l-kāfirīna

75.content: قالَ يا إِبليسُ ما مَنَعَكَ أَن تَسجُدَ لِما خَلَقتُ بِيَدَيَّ ۖ أَستَكبَرتَ أَم كُنتَ مِنَ العالينَ
75.translation_eng: He said, ‘O Iblis! What keeps you from prostrating before that which I have created with My [own] two hands? Are you arrogant, or are you [one] of the exalted ones?’
75.transliteration: qāla yā-ʾiblīsu mā manaʿaka ʾan tasjuda li-mā khalaqtu bi-yadayya ʾa-stakbarta ʾam kunta mina l-ʿālīna

76.content: قالَ أَنا خَيرٌ مِنهُ ۖ خَلَقتَني مِن نارٍ وَخَلَقتَهُ مِن طينٍ
76.translation_eng: ‘I am better than him,’ he said. ‘You created me from fire and You created him from clay.’
76.transliteration: qāla ʾana khayrun minhu khalaqtanī min nārin wa-khalaqtahū min ṭīnin

77.content: قالَ فَاخرُج مِنها فَإِنَّكَ رَجيمٌ
77.translation_eng: He said, ‘Begone hence, for you are indeed an outcast,
77.transliteration: qāla fa-khruj minhā fa-ʾinnaka rajīmun

78.content: وَإِنَّ عَلَيكَ لَعنَتي إِلىٰ يَومِ الدّينِ
78.translation_eng: and indeed My curse will be on you till the Day of Retribution.’
78.transliteration: wa-ʾinna ʿalayka laʿnatī ʾilā yawmi d-dīni

79.content: قالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرني إِلىٰ يَومِ يُبعَثونَ
79.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord! Respite me till the day they will be resurrected.’
79.transliteration: qāla rabbi fa-ʾanẓirnī ʾilā yawmi yubʿathūna

80.content: قالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ المُنظَرينَ
80.translation_eng: Said He, ‘You are indeed among the reprieved
80.transliteration: qāla fa-ʾinnaka mina l-munẓarīna

81.content: إِلىٰ يَومِ الوَقتِ المَعلومِ
81.translation_eng: until the day of the known time.’
81.transliteration: ʾilā yawmi l-waqti l-maʿlūmi

82.content: قالَ فَبِعِزَّتِكَ لَأُغوِيَنَّهُم أَجمَعينَ
82.translation_eng: He said, ‘By Your might, I will surely pervert them,
82.transliteration: qāla fa-bi-ʿizzatika la-ʾughwiyannahum ʾajmaʿīna

83.content: إِلّا عِبادَكَ مِنهُمُ المُخلَصينَ
83.translation_eng: except Your exclusive servants among them.’
83.transliteration: ʾillā ʿibādaka minhumu l-mukhlaṣīna

84.content: قالَ فَالحَقُّ وَالحَقَّ أَقولُ
84.translation_eng: He said, ‘The truth is that —and I speak the truth—
84.transliteration: qāla fa-l-ḥaqqu wa-l-ḥaqqa ʾaqūlu

85.content: لَأَملَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكَ وَمِمَّن تَبِعَكَ مِنهُم أَجمَعينَ
85.translation_eng: I will surely fill hell with you and all of those who follow you.’1Cf. 7:18; 11:119; 32:13.
85.transliteration: la-ʾamlaʾanna jahannama minka wa-mimman tabiʿaka minhum ʾajmaʿīna

86.content: قُل ما أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ مِن أَجرٍ وَما أَنا مِنَ المُتَكَلِّفينَ
86.translation_eng: Say, ‘I do not ask you any reward for it, and I am no impostor.1Or ‘nor am I one of those who impose themselves [upon others].’
86.transliteration: qul mā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi min ʾajrin wa-mā ʾana mina l-mutakallifīna

87.content: إِن هُوَ إِلّا ذِكرٌ لِلعالَمينَ
87.translation_eng: It is just a reminder for all the nations,
87.transliteration: ʾin huwa ʾillā dhikrun li-l-ʿālamīna

88.content: وَلَتَعلَمُنَّ نَبَأَهُ بَعدَ حينٍ
88.translation_eng: and you will surely learn its tidings in due time.’
88.transliteration: wa-la-taʿlamunna nabaʾahū baʿda ḥīnin

39.description: The surah that mentions The Throngs of the unbelievers who shall be driven to Hell in the Hereafter, and the companies of the God-fearing who shall be ushered to Paradise in honour. It takes its name from verse 71 and verse 73 in which the word “throngs” (zumar) occurs. The main focus of the surah is the contrast between those who follow the true faith, and those who ascribe partners to God. The surah emphasizes that people are free to choose whether to believe or disbelieve (verse 41), but urges them in the strongest possible terms to turn to the right path while there is still time to repent (verse 53 .).The surah is also known as: The Companies, The Crowds, The Multitudes, The Small Groups.

1.content: تَنزيلُ الكِتابِ مِنَ اللَّهِ العَزيزِ الحَكيمِ
1.translation_eng: The [gradual] sending down of the Book is from Allah, the All-mighty, the All-wise.
1.transliteration: tanzīlu l-kitābi mina llāhi l-ʿazīzi l-ḥakīmi

2.content: إِنّا أَنزَلنا إِلَيكَ الكِتابَ بِالحَقِّ فَاعبُدِ اللَّهَ مُخلِصًا لَهُ الدّينَ
2.translation_eng: Indeed We have sent down the Book to you with the truth; so worship Allah, putting exclusive faith1 in Him.Or ‘pure faith.’
2.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾanzalnā ʾilayka l-kitāba bi-l-ḥaqqi fa-ʿbudi llāha mukhliṣan lahu d-dīna

3.content: أَلا لِلَّهِ الدّينُ الخالِصُ ۚ وَالَّذينَ اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِهِ أَولِياءَ ما نَعبُدُهُم إِلّا لِيُقَرِّبونا إِلَى اللَّهِ زُلفىٰ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَحكُمُ بَينَهُم في ما هُم فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدي مَن هُوَ كاذِبٌ كَفّارٌ
3.translation_eng: Look! [Only] exclusive faith is worthy of Allah, and those who take guardians besides Him [claiming,] ‘We only worship them so that they may bring us near to Allah,’ Allah will indeed judge between them concerning that about which they differ. Indeed Allah does not guide someone who is a liar and an ingrate.
3.transliteration: ʾa-lā li-llāhi d-dīnu l-khāliṣu wa-lladhīna ttakhadhū min dūnihī ʾawliyāʾa mā naʿbuduhum ʾillā li-yuqarribūnā ʾilā llāhi zulfā ʾinna llāha yaḥkumu baynahum fī mā hum fīhi yakhtalifūna ʾinna llāha lā yahdī man huwa kādhibun kaffārun

4.content: لَو أَرادَ اللَّهُ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًا لَاصطَفىٰ مِمّا يَخلُقُ ما يَشاءُ ۚ سُبحانَهُ ۖ هُوَ اللَّهُ الواحِدُ القَهّارُ
4.translation_eng: Had Allah intended to take a son, He could have chosen from those He has created whatever He wished. Immaculate is He! He is Allah, the One, the All-paramount.
4.transliteration: law ʾarāda llāhu ʾan yattakhidha waladan la-ṣṭafā mimmā yakhluqu mā yashāʾu subḥānahū huwa llāhu l-wāḥidu l-qahhāru

5.content: خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ بِالحَقِّ ۖ يُكَوِّرُ اللَّيلَ عَلَى النَّهارِ وَيُكَوِّرُ النَّهارَ عَلَى اللَّيلِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ الشَّمسَ وَالقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّ يَجري لِأَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۗ أَلا هُوَ العَزيزُ الغَفّارُ
5.translation_eng: He created the heavens and the earth with reason. He winds the night over the day, and winds the day over the night, and He has disposed the sun and the moon, each moving for a specified term.1 Look! He is the All-mighty, the All-forgiver!Or ‘until a specified time.’
5.transliteration: khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa bi-l-ḥaqqi yukawwiru l-layla ʿalā n-nahāri wa-yukawwiru n-nahāra ʿalā l-layli wa-sakhkhara sh-shamsa wa-l-qamara kullun yajrī li-ʾajalin musamman ʾa-lā huwa l-ʿazīzu l-ghaffāru

6.content: خَلَقَكُم مِن نَفسٍ واحِدَةٍ ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِنها زَوجَها وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِنَ الأَنعامِ ثَمانِيَةَ أَزواجٍ ۚ يَخلُقُكُم في بُطونِ أُمَّهاتِكُم خَلقًا مِن بَعدِ خَلقٍ في ظُلُماتٍ ثَلاثٍ ۚ ذٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُم لَهُ المُلكُ ۖ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ ۖ فَأَنّىٰ تُصرَفونَ
6.translation_eng: He created you from a single soul, then made from it its mate, and He has sent down for you eight mates of the cattle.1 He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, in a threefold darkness. That is Allah, your Lord! To Him belongs all sovereignty. There is no god except Him. Then where are you being led away?Cf. 6:143.
6.transliteration: khalaqakum min nafsin wāḥidatin thumma jaʿala minhā zawjahā wa-ʾanzala lakum mina l-ʾanʿāmi thamāniyata ʾazwājin yakhluqukum fī buṭūni ʾummahātikum khalqan min baʿdi khalqin fī ẓulumātin thalāthin dhālikumu llāhu rabbukum lahu l-mulku lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa fa-ʾannā tuṣrafūna

7.content: إِن تَكفُروا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَنِيٌّ عَنكُم ۖ وَلا يَرضىٰ لِعِبادِهِ الكُفرَ ۖ وَإِن تَشكُروا يَرضَهُ لَكُم ۗ وَلا تَزِرُ وازِرَةٌ وِزرَ أُخرىٰ ۗ ثُمَّ إِلىٰ رَبِّكُم مَرجِعُكُم فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
7.translation_eng: If you are ungrateful,1 indeed Allah has no need of you, though He does not approve ingratitude for His servants; and if you give thanks He approves that for you. No bearer shall bear another’s burden; then to your Lord will be your return, whereat He will inform you concerning what you used to do. Indeed He knows best what is in the breasts.Or ‘faithless.’
7.transliteration: ʾin takfurū fa-ʾinna llāha ghaniyyun ʿankum wa-lā yarḍā li-ʿibādihi l-kufra wa-ʾin tashkurū yarḍahu lakum wa-lā taziru wāziratun wizra ʾukhrā thumma ʾilā rabbikum marjiʿukum fa-yunabbiʾukum bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna ʾinnahū ʿalīmun bi-dhāti ṣ-ṣudūri

8.content: ۞ وَإِذا مَسَّ الإِنسانَ ضُرٌّ دَعا رَبَّهُ مُنيبًا إِلَيهِ ثُمَّ إِذا خَوَّلَهُ نِعمَةً مِنهُ نَسِيَ ما كانَ يَدعو إِلَيهِ مِن قَبلُ وَجَعَلَ لِلَّهِ أَندادًا لِيُضِلَّ عَن سَبيلِهِ ۚ قُل تَمَتَّع بِكُفرِكَ قَليلًا ۖ إِنَّكَ مِن أَصحابِ النّارِ
8.translation_eng: When distress befalls man, he supplicates his Lord, turning to Him penitently. Then, when He grants him a blessing from Himself, he forgets that for which he had supplicated Him before,1 and sets up equals to Allah that he may lead [people] astray from His way. Say, ‘Revel in your ingratitude2 for a while. Indeed you are among the inmates of the Fire.’Cf. 6:41.Or ‘faithlessness.’
8.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā massa l-ʾinsāna ḍurrun daʿā rabbahū munīban ʾilayhi thumma ʾidhā khawwalahū niʿmatan minhu nasiya mā kāna yadʿū ʾilayhi min qablu wa-jaʿala li-llāhi ʾandādan li-yuḍilla ʿan sabīlihī qul tamattaʿ bi-kufrika qalīlan ʾinnaka min ʾaṣḥābi n-nāri
