9.content: أَمَّن هُوَ قانِتٌ آناءَ اللَّيلِ ساجِدًا وَقائِمًا يَحذَرُ الآخِرَةَ وَيَرجو رَحمَةَ رَبِّهِ ۗ قُل هَل يَستَوِي الَّذينَ يَعلَمونَ وَالَّذينَ لا يَعلَمونَ ۗ إِنَّما يَتَذَكَّرُ أُولُو الأَلبابِ
9.translation_eng: Is he who supplicates1 in the watches of the night, prostrating and standing, apprehensive of the Hereafter and expecting the mercy of his Lord … ?2 Say, ‘Are those who know equal to those who do not know?’ Only those who possess intellect take admonition.Or ‘is obedient.’Ellipsis. The omitted phrase is, ‘like someone who is not such?’
9.transliteration: ʾam-man huwa qānitun ʾānāʾa l-layli sājidan wa-qāʾiman yaḥdharu l-ʾākhirata wa-yarjū raḥmata rabbihī qul hal yastawī lladhīna yaʿlamūna wa-lladhīna lā yaʿlamūna ʾinnamā yatadhakkaru ʾulū l-ʾalbābi

10.content: قُل يا عِبادِ الَّذينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقوا رَبَّكُم ۚ لِلَّذينَ أَحسَنوا في هٰذِهِ الدُّنيا حَسَنَةٌ ۗ وَأَرضُ اللَّهِ واسِعَةٌ ۗ إِنَّما يُوَفَّى الصّابِرونَ أَجرَهُم بِغَيرِ حِسابٍ
10.translation_eng: Say, ‘[Allah declares:] “O My servants who have faith! Be wary of your Lord. For those who do good in this world there will be a good [reward], and Allah’s earth is vast. Indeed the patient will be paid in full their reward without any reckoning.” ’
10.transliteration: qul yā-ʿibādi lladhīna ʾāmanū ttaqū rabbakum li-lladhīna ʾaḥsanū fī hādhihi d-dunyā ḥasanatun wa-ʾarḍu llāhi wāsiʿatun ʾinnamā yuwaffā ṣ-ṣābirūna ʾajrahum bi-ghayri ḥisābin

11.content: قُل إِنّي أُمِرتُ أَن أَعبُدَ اللَّهَ مُخلِصًا لَهُ الدّينَ
11.translation_eng: Say, ‘Indeed I have been commanded to worship Allah with exclusive faith in Him,
11.transliteration: qul ʾinnī ʾumirtu ʾan ʾaʿbuda llāha mukhliṣan lahu d-dīna

12.content: وَأُمِرتُ لِأَن أَكونَ أَوَّلَ المُسلِمينَ
12.translation_eng: and I have been commanded to be the first of those who submit [to Him].’
12.transliteration: wa-ʾumirtu li-ʾan ʾakūna ʾawwala l-muslimīna

13.content: قُل إِنّي أَخافُ إِن عَصَيتُ رَبّي عَذابَ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
13.translation_eng: Say, ‘Indeed, should I disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a tremendous day.’
13.transliteration: qul ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʾin ʿaṣaytu rabbī ʿadhāba yawmin ʿaẓīmin

14.content: قُلِ اللَّهَ أَعبُدُ مُخلِصًا لَهُ ديني
14.translation_eng: Say, ‘[Only] Allah do I worship, putting my exclusive faith in Him.
14.transliteration: quli llāha ʾaʿbudu mukhliṣan lahū dīnī

15.content: فَاعبُدوا ما شِئتُم مِن دونِهِ ۗ قُل إِنَّ الخاسِرينَ الَّذينَ خَسِروا أَنفُسَهُم وَأَهليهِم يَومَ القِيامَةِ ۗ أَلا ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الخُسرانُ المُبينُ
15.translation_eng: You worship whatever you wish besides Him.’ Say, ‘Indeed the losers are those who ruin themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection.’ Look! That is a manifest loss!
15.transliteration: fa-ʿbudū mā shiʾtum min dūnihī qul ʾinna l-khāsirīna lladhīna khasirū ʾanfusahum wa-ʾahlīhim yawma l-qiyāmati ʾa-lā dhālika huwa l-khusrānu l-mubīnu

16.content: لَهُم مِن فَوقِهِم ظُلَلٌ مِنَ النّارِ وَمِن تَحتِهِم ظُلَلٌ ۚ ذٰلِكَ يُخَوِّفُ اللَّهُ بِهِ عِبادَهُ ۚ يا عِبادِ فَاتَّقونِ
16.translation_eng: There will be canopies of fire above them, and [similar] canopies beneath them. With that Allah deters His servants. So, My servants, be wary of Me!
16.transliteration: lahum min fawqihim ẓulalun mina n-nāri wa-min taḥtihim ẓulalun dhālika yukhawwifu llāhu bihī ʿibādahū yā-ʿibādi fa-ttaqūni

17.content: وَالَّذينَ اجتَنَبُوا الطّاغوتَ أَن يَعبُدوها وَأَنابوا إِلَى اللَّهِ لَهُمُ البُشرىٰ ۚ فَبَشِّر عِبادِ
17.translation_eng: As for those who stay clear of the worship of the Rebel and turn penitently to Allah, there is good news for them. So give good news to My servants
17.transliteration: wa-lladhīna jtanabū ṭ-ṭāghūta ʾan yaʿbudūhā wa-ʾanābū ʾilā llāhi lahumu l-bushrā fa-bashshir ʿibādi

18.content: الَّذينَ يَستَمِعونَ القَولَ فَيَتَّبِعونَ أَحسَنَهُ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ هَداهُمُ اللَّهُ ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ هُم أُولُو الأَلبابِ
18.translation_eng: who listen to the word [of Allah] and follow the best [sense] of it. They are the ones whom Allah has guided, and it is they who possess intellect.
18.transliteration: alladhīna yastamiʿūna l-qawla fa-yattabiʿūna ʾaḥsanahū ʾulāʾika lladhīna hadāhumu llāhu wa-ʾulāʾika hum ʾulū l-ʾalbābi

19.content: أَفَمَن حَقَّ عَلَيهِ كَلِمَةُ العَذابِ أَفَأَنتَ تُنقِذُ مَن فِي النّارِ
19.translation_eng: Can he against whom the word of punishment has become due?1 Can you rescue someone who is in the Fire?Ellipsis; the omitted phrase is, ‘escape his punishment?’
19.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man ḥaqqa ʿalayhi kalimatu l-ʿadhābi ʾa-fa ʾanta tunqidhu man fī n-nāri

20.content: لٰكِنِ الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا رَبَّهُم لَهُم غُرَفٌ مِن فَوقِها غُرَفٌ مَبنِيَّةٌ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ ۖ وَعدَ اللَّهِ ۖ لا يُخلِفُ اللَّهُ الميعادَ
20.translation_eng: But as for those who are wary of their Lord, for them there will be lofty abodes with [other] lofty abodes built above them, with streams running beneath them —a promise of Allah. Allah does not break His promise.
20.transliteration: lākini lladhīna ttaqaw rabbahum lahum ghurafun min fawqihā ghurafun mabniyyatun tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru waʿda llāhi lā yukhlifu llāhu l-mīʿāda

21.content: أَلَم تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً فَسَلَكَهُ يَنابيعَ فِي الأَرضِ ثُمَّ يُخرِجُ بِهِ زَرعًا مُختَلِفًا أَلوانُهُ ثُمَّ يَهيجُ فَتَراهُ مُصفَرًّا ثُمَّ يَجعَلُهُ حُطامًا ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَذِكرىٰ لِأُولِي الأَلبابِ
21.translation_eng: Have you not seen that Allah sends down water from the sky, then He conducts it through the ground as springs. Then with it He brings forth crops of diverse hues. Then they wither and you see them turn yellow. Then He turns them into chaff. There is indeed an admonition in that for those who possess intellect.
21.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾanna llāha ʾanzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan fa-salakahū yanābīʿa fī l-ʾarḍi thumma yukhriju bihī zarʿan mukhtalifan ʾalwānuhū thumma yahīju fa-tarāhu muṣfarran thumma yajʿaluhū ḥuṭāman ʾinna fī dhālika la-dhikrā li-ʾulī l-ʾalbābi

22.content: أَفَمَن شَرَحَ اللَّهُ صَدرَهُ لِلإِسلامِ فَهُوَ عَلىٰ نورٍ مِن رَبِّهِ ۚ فَوَيلٌ لِلقاسِيَةِ قُلوبُهُم مِن ذِكرِ اللَّهِ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
22.translation_eng: Is someone whose breast Allah has opened to Islam so that he follows a light from His Lord?1 So woe to those whose hearts have been hardened to the remembrance of Allah. They are in manifest error.Ellipsis. The omitted phrase is, ‘like someone who is not such?’
22.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man sharaḥa llāhu ṣadrahū li-l-ʾislāmi fa-huwa ʿalā nūrin min rabbihī fa-waylun li-l-qāsiyati qulūbuhum min dhikri llāhi ʾulāʾika fī ḍalālin mubīnin-i

23.content: اللَّهُ نَزَّلَ أَحسَنَ الحَديثِ كِتابًا مُتَشابِهًا مَثانِيَ تَقشَعِرُّ مِنهُ جُلودُ الَّذينَ يَخشَونَ رَبَّهُم ثُمَّ تَلينُ جُلودُهُم وَقُلوبُهُم إِلىٰ ذِكرِ اللَّهِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ هُدَى اللَّهِ يَهدي بِهِ مَن يَشاءُ ۚ وَمَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن هادٍ
23.translation_eng: Allah has sent down the best of discourses, a scripture [composed] of similar1 motifs, whereat quiver the skins of those who fear their Lord, then their skins and hearts soften to Allah’s remembrance. That is Allah’s guidance, by which He guides whomever He wishes; and whomever Allah leads astray, has no guide.Or ‘parallel motifs.’
23.transliteration: allāhu nazzala ʾaḥsana l-ḥadīthi kitāban mutashābihan mathāniya taqshaʿirru minhu julūdu lladhīna yakhshawna rabbahum thumma talīnu julūduhum wa-qulūbuhum ʾilā dhikri llāhi dhālika hudā llāhi yahdī bihī man yashāʾu wa-man yuḍlili llāhu fa-mā lahū min hādin

24.content: أَفَمَن يَتَّقي بِوَجهِهِ سوءَ العَذابِ يَومَ القِيامَةِ ۚ وَقيلَ لِلظّالِمينَ ذوقوا ما كُنتُم تَكسِبونَ
24.translation_eng: What! Is someone who fends off with his face the terrible punishment [meted out to him] on the Day of Resurrection?1 And the wrongdoers will be told, ‘Taste what you used to earn.’Ellipsis. The omitted phrase is, ‘like someone who is secure from any kind of punishment?’
24.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man yattaqī bi-wajhihī sūʾa l-ʿadhābi yawma l-qiyāmati wa-qīla li-ẓ-ẓālimīna dhūqū mā kuntum taksibūna

25.content: كَذَّبَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم فَأَتاهُمُ العَذابُ مِن حَيثُ لا يَشعُرونَ
25.translation_eng: Those who were before them impugned [the apostles], whereat the punishment overtook them whence they were not aware.
25.transliteration: kadhdhaba lladhīna min qablihim fa-ʾatāhumu l-ʿadhābu min ḥaythu lā yashʿurūna

26.content: فَأَذاقَهُمُ اللَّهُ الخِزيَ فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۖ وَلَعَذابُ الآخِرَةِ أَكبَرُ ۚ لَو كانوا يَعلَمونَ
26.translation_eng: So Allah made them taste disgrace in the life of the world, and the punishment of the Hereafter will surely be greater, had they known.
26.transliteration: fa-ʾadhāqahumu llāhu l-khizya fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-la-ʿadhābu l-ʾākhirati ʾakbaru law kānū yaʿlamūna

27.content: وَلَقَد ضَرَبنا لِلنّاسِ في هٰذَا القُرآنِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍ لَعَلَّهُم يَتَذَكَّرونَ
27.translation_eng: Certainly we have drawn for mankind in this Qurʾān every [kind of] example, so that they may take admonition
27.transliteration: wa-la-qad ḍarabnā li-n-nāsi fī hādhā l-qurʾāni min kulli mathalin laʿallahum yatadhakkarūna

28.content: قُرآنًا عَرَبِيًّا غَيرَ ذي عِوَجٍ لَعَلَّهُم يَتَّقونَ
28.translation_eng: —an Arabic Qurʾān, without any deviousness, so that they may be Godwary.
28.transliteration: qurʾānan ʿarabiyyan ghayra dhī ʿiwajin laʿallahum yattaqūna

29.content: ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا رَجُلًا فيهِ شُرَكاءُ مُتَشاكِسونَ وَرَجُلًا سَلَمًا لِرَجُلٍ هَل يَستَوِيانِ مَثَلًا ۚ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
29.translation_eng: Allah draws an example: a man jointly owned by several contending masters, and a man belonging entirely to one man: are the two equal in comparison?1 All praise belongs to Allah! But most of them do not know.The parable compares the polytheist with the monotheist. The worshipper of multiple deities is likened to a slave trying to please several masters.
29.transliteration: ḍaraba llāhu mathalan rajulan fīhi shurakāʾu mutashākisūna wa-rajulan salaman li-rajulin hal yastawiyāni mathalan-i l-ḥamdu li-llāhi bal ʾaktharuhum lā yaʿlamūna

30.content: إِنَّكَ مَيِّتٌ وَإِنَّهُم مَيِّتونَ
30.translation_eng: You will indeed die, and they [too] will die indeed.
30.transliteration: ʾinnaka mayyitun wa-ʾinnahum mayyitūna

31.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ عِندَ رَبِّكُم تَختَصِمونَ
31.translation_eng: Then on the Day of Resurrection you will indeed contend before your Lord.
31.transliteration: thumma ʾinnakum yawma l-qiyāmati ʿinda rabbikum takhtaṣimūna

32.content: ۞ فَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّن كَذَبَ عَلَى اللَّهِ وَكَذَّبَ بِالصِّدقِ إِذ جاءَهُ ۚ أَلَيسَ في جَهَنَّمَ مَثوًى لِلكافِرينَ
32.translation_eng: So who is a greater wrongdoer than him who attributes a falsehood to Allah, and denies the truth when it reaches him? Is not the [final] abode of the faithless in hell?
32.transliteration: fa-man ʾaẓlamu mimman kadhaba ʿalā llāhi wa-kadhdhaba bi-ṣ-ṣidqi ʾidh jāʾahū ʾa-laysa fī jahannama mathwan li-l-kāfirīna

33.content: وَالَّذي جاءَ بِالصِّدقِ وَصَدَّقَ بِهِ ۙ أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُتَّقونَ
33.translation_eng: He who brings the truth and he who confirms it —it is they who are the Godwary.
33.transliteration: wa-lladhī jāʾa bi-ṣ-ṣidqi wa-ṣaddaqa bihī ʾulāʾika humu l-muttaqūna

34.content: لَهُم ما يَشاءونَ عِندَ رَبِّهِم ۚ ذٰلِكَ جَزاءُ المُحسِنينَ
34.translation_eng: They will have whatever they wish near their Lord. That is the reward of the virtuous,
34.transliteration: lahum mā yashāʾūna ʿinda rabbihim dhālika jazāʾu l-muḥsinīna

35.content: لِيُكَفِّرَ اللَّهُ عَنهُم أَسوَأَ الَّذي عَمِلوا وَيَجزِيَهُم أَجرَهُم بِأَحسَنِ الَّذي كانوا يَعمَلونَ
35.translation_eng: so that Allah may absolve them of the worst of what they did, and pay them their reward by the best of what they used to do.
35.transliteration: li-yukaffira llāhu ʿanhum ʾaswaʾa lladhī ʿamilū wa-yajziyahum ʾajrahum bi-ʾaḥsani lladhī kānū yaʿmalūna

36.content: أَلَيسَ اللَّهُ بِكافٍ عَبدَهُ ۖ وَيُخَوِّفونَكَ بِالَّذينَ مِن دونِهِ ۚ وَمَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن هادٍ
36.translation_eng: Does not Allah suffice [to defend] His servant? They1 would frighten you of others than Him. Yet whomever Allah leads astray, has no guide,That is, the idolaters, who threatened the Prophet with the vengeance of their gods.
36.transliteration: ʾa-laysa llāhu bi-kāfin ʿabdahū wa-yukhawwifūnaka bi-lladhīna min dūnihī wa-man yuḍlili llāhu fa-mā lahū min hādin

37.content: وَمَن يَهدِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن مُضِلٍّ ۗ أَلَيسَ اللَّهُ بِعَزيزٍ ذِي انتِقامٍ
37.translation_eng: and whomever Allah guides, there is no one who can lead him astray. Is not Allah an all-mighty avenger?
37.transliteration: wa-man yahdi llāhu fa-mā lahū min muḍillin ʾa-laysa llāhu bi-ʿazīzin dhī ntiqāmin

38.content: وَلَئِن سَأَلتَهُم مَن خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ لَيَقولُنَّ اللَّهُ ۚ قُل أَفَرَأَيتُم ما تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ إِن أَرادَنِيَ اللَّهُ بِضُرٍّ هَل هُنَّ كاشِفاتُ ضُرِّهِ أَو أَرادَني بِرَحمَةٍ هَل هُنَّ مُمسِكاتُ رَحمَتِهِ ۚ قُل حَسبِيَ اللَّهُ ۖ عَلَيهِ يَتَوَكَّلُ المُتَوَكِّلونَ
38.translation_eng: If you ask them, ‘Who created the heavens and the earth?’ they will surely say, ‘Allah.’ Say, ‘Have you considered what you invoke besides Allah? Should Allah desire some distress for me, can they remove the distress visited by Him? Or should He desire some mercy for me, can they withhold His mercy?’ Say, ‘Allah is sufficient for me. In Him let all the trusting put their trust.’
38.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin saʾaltahum man khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa la-yaqūlunna llāhu qul ʾa-fa-raʾaytum mā tadʿūna min dūni llāhi ʾin ʾarādaniya llāhu bi-ḍurrin hal hunna kāshifātu ḍurrihī ʾaw ʾarādanī bi-raḥmatin hal hunna mumsikātu raḥmatihī qul ḥasbiya llāhu ʿalayhi yatawakkalu l-mutawakkilūna

39.content: قُل يا قَومِ اعمَلوا عَلىٰ مَكانَتِكُم إِنّي عامِلٌ ۖ فَسَوفَ تَعلَمونَ
39.translation_eng: Say, ‘O my people! Act according to your ability. I too am acting. Soon you will know
39.transliteration: qul yā-qawmi ʿmalū ʿalā makānatikum ʾinnī ʿāmilun fa-sawfa taʿlamūna

40.content: مَن يَأتيهِ عَذابٌ يُخزيهِ وَيَحِلُّ عَلَيهِ عَذابٌ مُقيمٌ
40.translation_eng: who will be overtaken by a punishment that will disgrace him, and on whom a lasting punishment will descend.’
40.transliteration: man yaʾtīhi ʿadhābun yukhzīhi wa-yaḥillu ʿalayhi ʿadhābun muqīmun

41.content: إِنّا أَنزَلنا عَلَيكَ الكِتابَ لِلنّاسِ بِالحَقِّ ۖ فَمَنِ اهتَدىٰ فَلِنَفسِهِ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّما يَضِلُّ عَلَيها ۖ وَما أَنتَ عَلَيهِم بِوَكيلٍ
41.translation_eng: Indeed We have sent down the Book to you for [the deliverance of] mankind with the truth. So whoever is guided is guided for his own sake, and whoever goes astray, goes astray to his own detriment, and it is not your duty to watch over them.
41.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾanzalnā ʿalayka l-kitāba li-n-nāsi bi-l-ḥaqqi fa-mani htadā fa-li-nafsihī wa-man ḍalla fa-ʾinnamā yaḍillu ʿalayhā wa-mā ʾanta ʿalayhim bi-wakīlin-i

42.content: اللَّهُ يَتَوَفَّى الأَنفُسَ حينَ مَوتِها وَالَّتي لَم تَمُت في مَنامِها ۖ فَيُمسِكُ الَّتي قَضىٰ عَلَيهَا المَوتَ وَيُرسِلُ الأُخرىٰ إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَتَفَكَّرونَ
42.translation_eng: Allah takes the souls at the time of their death, and those who have not died in their sleep. Then He retains those for whom He has ordained death and releases the others until a specified time. There are indeed signs in that for a people who reflect.
42.transliteration: allāhu yatawaffā l-ʾanfusa ḥīna mawtihā wa-llatī lam tamut fī manāmihā fa-yumsiku llatī qaḍā ʿalayhā l-mawta wa-yursilu l-ʾukhrā ʾilā ʾajalin musamman ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yatafakkarūna

43.content: أَمِ اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِ اللَّهِ شُفَعاءَ ۚ قُل أَوَلَو كانوا لا يَملِكونَ شَيئًا وَلا يَعقِلونَ
43.translation_eng: Have they taken intercessors besides Allah? Say, ‘What! Even though they have no control over anything and cannot apply reason?!’
43.transliteration: ʾami ttakhadhū min dūni llāhī shufaʿāʾa qul ʾa-wa-law kānū lā yamlikūna shayʾan wa-lā yaʿqilūna

44.content: قُل لِلَّهِ الشَّفاعَةُ جَميعًا ۖ لَهُ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَيهِ تُرجَعونَ
44.translation_eng: Say, ‘All intercession rests with Allah. To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth; then you will be brought back to Him.’
44.transliteration: qul li-llāhi sh-shafāʿatu jamīʿan lahū mulku s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi thumma ʾilayhi turjaʿūna

45.content: وَإِذا ذُكِرَ اللَّهُ وَحدَهُ اشمَأَزَّت قُلوبُ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالآخِرَةِ ۖ وَإِذا ذُكِرَ الَّذينَ مِن دونِهِ إِذا هُم يَستَبشِرونَ
45.translation_eng: When Allah is mentioned alone, [thereat] shrink away the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter, but when others are mentioned besides Him, behold, they rejoice!
45.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā dhukira llāhu waḥdahu shmaʾazzat qulūbu lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-l-ʾākhirati wa-ʾidhā dhukira lladhīna min dūnihī ʾidhā hum yastabshirūna

46.content: قُلِ اللَّهُمَّ فاطِرَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ عالِمَ الغَيبِ وَالشَّهادَةِ أَنتَ تَحكُمُ بَينَ عِبادِكَ في ما كانوا فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
46.translation_eng: Say, ‘O Allah! Originator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the sensible and the Unseen, You will judge between Your servants concerning that about which they used to differ.’
46.transliteration: quli llāhumma fāṭira s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi ʿālima l-ghaybi wa-sh-shahādati ʾanta taḥkumu bayna ʿibādika fī mā kānū fīhi yakhtalifūna

47.content: وَلَو أَنَّ لِلَّذينَ ظَلَموا ما فِي الأَرضِ جَميعًا وَمِثلَهُ مَعَهُ لَافتَدَوا بِهِ مِن سوءِ العَذابِ يَومَ القِيامَةِ ۚ وَبَدا لَهُم مِنَ اللَّهِ ما لَم يَكونوا يَحتَسِبونَ
47.translation_eng: Even if the wrongdoers possessed all that is on the earth, and as much of it besides, they would surely offer it to redeem themselves with it from a terrible punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and there will appear to them from Allah what they had never reckoned.
47.transliteration: wa-law ʾanna li-lladhīna ẓalamū mā fī l-ʾarḍi jamīʿan wa-mithlahū maʿahū la-ftadaw bihī min sūʾi l-ʿadhābi yawma l-qiyāmati wa-badā lahum mina llāhi mā lam yakūnū yaḥtasibūna

48.content: وَبَدا لَهُم سَيِّئَاتُ ما كَسَبوا وَحاقَ بِهِم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
48.translation_eng: The evils of what they had earned will appear to them, and they will be besieged by what they used to deride.
48.transliteration: wa-badā lahum sayyiʾātu mā kasabū wa-ḥāqa bihim mā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

49.content: فَإِذا مَسَّ الإِنسانَ ضُرٌّ دَعانا ثُمَّ إِذا خَوَّلناهُ نِعمَةً مِنّا قالَ إِنَّما أوتيتُهُ عَلىٰ عِلمٍ ۚ بَل هِيَ فِتنَةٌ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
49.translation_eng: When distress befalls man, he supplicates Us. Then, when We grant him a blessing from Us, he says, ‘I was given it by virtue of [my] knowledge.’ Rather it is a test, but most of them do not know.
49.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā massa l-ʾinsāna ḍurrun daʿānā thumma ʾidhā khawwalnāhu niʿmatan minnā qāla ʾinnamā ʾūtītuhū ʿalā ʿilmin bal hiya fitnatun wa-lākinna ʾaktharahum lā yaʿlamūna

50.content: قَد قالَهَا الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم فَما أَغنىٰ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
50.translation_eng: Those who were before them [also] said that, but what they used to earn did not avail them.
50.transliteration: qad qālahā lladhīna min qablihim fa-mā ʾaghnā ʿanhum mā kānū yaksibūna

51.content: فَأَصابَهُم سَيِّئَاتُ ما كَسَبوا ۚ وَالَّذينَ ظَلَموا مِن هٰؤُلاءِ سَيُصيبُهُم سَيِّئَاتُ ما كَسَبوا وَما هُم بِمُعجِزينَ
51.translation_eng: So the evils of what they had earned visited them, and as for the wrongdoers among these, the evils of what they earn shall be visited on them and they will not thwart [Allah’s might].
51.transliteration: fa-ʾaṣābahum sayyiʾātu mā kasabū wa-lladhīna ẓalamū min hāʾulāʾi sa-yuṣībuhum sayyiʾātu mā kasabū wa-mā hum bi-muʿjizīna

52.content: أَوَلَم يَعلَموا أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَبسُطُ الرِّزقَ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيَقدِرُ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يُؤمِنونَ
52.translation_eng: Do they not know that Allah expands the provision for whomever He wishes and tightens it [for whomever He wishes]? There are indeed signs in that for a people who have faith.
52.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaʿlamū ʾanna llāha yabsuṭu r-rizqa li-man yashāʾu wa-yaqdiru ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yuʾminūna

53.content: ۞ قُل يا عِبادِيَ الَّذينَ أَسرَفوا عَلىٰ أَنفُسِهِم لا تَقنَطوا مِن رَحمَةِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَغفِرُ الذُّنوبَ جَميعًا ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الغَفورُ الرَّحيمُ
53.translation_eng: Say [that Allah declares,] ‘O My servants who have committed excesses against their own souls, do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed Allah will forgive all sins. Indeed He is the All-forgiving, the All-merciful.
53.transliteration: qul yā-ʿibādiya lladhīna ʾasrafū ʿalā ʾanfusihim lā taqnaṭū min raḥmati llāhi ʾinna llāha yaghfiru dh-dhunūba jamīʿan ʾinnahū huwa l-ghafūru r-raḥīmu

54.content: وَأَنيبوا إِلىٰ رَبِّكُم وَأَسلِموا لَهُ مِن قَبلِ أَن يَأتِيَكُمُ العَذابُ ثُمَّ لا تُنصَرونَ
54.translation_eng: Turn penitently to Him and submit to Him before the punishment overtakes you, whereupon you will not be helped.
54.transliteration: wa-ʾanībū ʾilā rabbikum wa-ʾaslimū lahū min qabli ʾan yaʾtiyakumu l-ʿadhābu thumma lā tunṣarūna

55.content: وَاتَّبِعوا أَحسَنَ ما أُنزِلَ إِلَيكُم مِن رَبِّكُم مِن قَبلِ أَن يَأتِيَكُمُ العَذابُ بَغتَةً وَأَنتُم لا تَشعُرونَ
55.translation_eng: And follow the best of what has been sent down to you from your Lord, before the punishment overtakes you suddenly while you are unaware.’
55.transliteration: wa-ttabiʿū ʾaḥsana mā ʾunzila ʾilaykum min rabbikum min qabli ʾan yaʾtiyakumu l-ʿadhābu baghtatan wa-ʾantum lā tashʿurūna

56.content: أَن تَقولَ نَفسٌ يا حَسرَتا عَلىٰ ما فَرَّطتُ في جَنبِ اللَّهِ وَإِن كُنتُ لَمِنَ السّاخِرينَ
56.translation_eng: Lest anyone should say, ‘Alas for my negligence in the vicinage of Allah! Indeed I was among those who ridiculed.’
56.transliteration: ʾan taqūla nafsun yā-ḥasratā ʿalā mā farraṭtu fī janbi llāhi wa-ʾin kuntu la-mina s-sākhirīna

57.content: أَو تَقولَ لَو أَنَّ اللَّهَ هَداني لَكُنتُ مِنَ المُتَّقينَ
57.translation_eng: Or say, ‘Had Allah guided me I would have surely been among the Godwary!’
57.transliteration: ʾaw taqūla law ʾanna llāha hadānī la-kuntu mina l-muttaqīna

58.content: أَو تَقولَ حينَ تَرَى العَذابَ لَو أَنَّ لي كَرَّةً فَأَكونَ مِنَ المُحسِنينَ
58.translation_eng: Or say, when he sights the punishment, ‘If only there had been a second chance for me I would be among the virtuous!’
58.transliteration: ʾaw taqūla ḥīna tarā l-ʿadhāba law ʾanna lī karratan fa-ʾakūna mina l-muḥsinīna

59.content: بَلىٰ قَد جاءَتكَ آياتي فَكَذَّبتَ بِها وَاستَكبَرتَ وَكُنتَ مِنَ الكافِرينَ
59.translation_eng: ‘Yes, My signs certainly came to you, but you denied them and acted arrogantly and you were among the faithless.’
59.transliteration: balā qad jāʾatka ʾāyātī fa-kadhdhabta bihā wa-stakbarta wa-kunta mina l-kāfirīna

60.content: وَيَومَ القِيامَةِ تَرَى الَّذينَ كَذَبوا عَلَى اللَّهِ وُجوهُهُم مُسوَدَّةٌ ۚ أَلَيسَ في جَهَنَّمَ مَثوًى لِلمُتَكَبِّرينَ
60.translation_eng: On the Day of Resurrection you will see those who attributed lies to Allah with their faces blackened. Is not the [final] abode of the arrogant in hell?
60.transliteration: wa-yawma l-qiyāmati tarā lladhīna kadhabū ʿalā llāhi wujūhuhum muswaddatun ʾa-laysa fī jahannama mathwan li-l-mutakabbirīna

61.content: وَيُنَجِّي اللَّهُ الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا بِمَفازَتِهِم لا يَمَسُّهُمُ السّوءُ وَلا هُم يَحزَنونَ
61.translation_eng: Allah will deliver those who were Godwary with their salvation. No ill shall touch them, nor will they grieve.
61.transliteration: wa-yunajjī llāhu lladhīna ttaqaw bi-mafāzatihim lā yamassuhumu s-sūʾu wa-lā hum yaḥzanūna

62.content: اللَّهُ خالِقُ كُلِّ شَيءٍ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ وَكيلٌ
62.translation_eng: Allah is creator of all things, and He watches over all things.
62.transliteration: allāhu khāliqu kulli shayʾin wa-huwa ʿalā kulli shayʾin wakīlun

63.content: لَهُ مَقاليدُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۗ وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا بِآياتِ اللَّهِ أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الخاسِرونَ
63.translation_eng: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth, and those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah —it is they who are the losers.
63.transliteration: lahū maqālīdu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-lladhīna kafarū bi-ʾāyāti llāhi ʾulāʾika humu l-khāsirūna

64.content: قُل أَفَغَيرَ اللَّهِ تَأمُرونّي أَعبُدُ أَيُّهَا الجاهِلونَ
64.translation_eng: Say, ‘Will you, then, bid me to worship other than Allah, O you senseless ones?!’
64.transliteration: qul ʾa-fa-ghayra llāhi taʾmurūnnī ʾaʿbudu ʾayyuhā l-jāhilūna

65.content: وَلَقَد أوحِيَ إِلَيكَ وَإِلَى الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِكَ لَئِن أَشرَكتَ لَيَحبَطَنَّ عَمَلُكَ وَلَتَكونَنَّ مِنَ الخاسِرينَ
65.translation_eng: Certainly it has been revealed to you and to those [who have been] before you: ‘If you ascribe a partner to Allah your works shall fail and you shall surely be among the losers.
65.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾūḥiya ʾilayka wa-ʾilā lladhīna min qablika la-ʾin ʾashrakta la-yaḥbaṭanna ʿamaluka wa-la-takūnanna mina l-khāsirīna

66.content: بَلِ اللَّهَ فَاعبُد وَكُن مِنَ الشّاكِرينَ
66.translation_eng: Rather, worship Allah, and be among the grateful!’
66.transliteration: bali llāha fa-ʿbud wa-kun mina sh-shākirīna

67.content: وَما قَدَرُوا اللَّهَ حَقَّ قَدرِهِ وَالأَرضُ جَميعًا قَبضَتُهُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ وَالسَّماواتُ مَطوِيّاتٌ بِيَمينِهِ ۚ سُبحانَهُ وَتَعالىٰ عَمّا يُشرِكونَ
67.translation_eng: They do not regard Allah with the regard due to Him, yet the entire earth will be in His fist on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens, scrolled, in His right hand. Immaculate is He and exalted above [having] any partners that they ascribe [to Him].
67.transliteration: wa-mā qadarū llāha ḥaqqa qadrihī wa-l-ʾarḍu jamīʿan qabḍatuhū yawma l-qiyāmati wa-s-samāwātu maṭwiyyātun bi-yamīnihī subḥānahū wa-taʿālā ʿammā yushrikūna

68.content: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصّورِ فَصَعِقَ مَن فِي السَّماواتِ وَمَن فِي الأَرضِ إِلّا مَن شاءَ اللَّهُ ۖ ثُمَّ نُفِخَ فيهِ أُخرىٰ فَإِذا هُم قِيامٌ يَنظُرونَ
68.translation_eng: And the Trumpet will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens will swoon and whoever is on the earth, except whomever Allah wishes. Then it will be blown a second time, behold, they will rise up, looking on!
68.transliteration: wa-nufikha fī ṣ-ṣūri fa-ṣaʿiqa man fī s-samāwāti wa-man fī l-ʾarḍi ʾillā man shāʾa llāhu thumma nufikha fīhi ʾukhrā fa-ʾidhā hum qiyāmun yanẓurūna

69.content: وَأَشرَقَتِ الأَرضُ بِنورِ رَبِّها وَوُضِعَ الكِتابُ وَجِيءَ بِالنَّبِيّينَ وَالشُّهَداءِ وَقُضِيَ بَينَهُم بِالحَقِّ وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
69.translation_eng: And the earth will glow with the light of her Lord, and the Book1 will be set up, and the prophets and the martyrs2 will be brought, and judgment will be made between them with justice, and they will not be wronged.That is, the record of the people’s deeds.Or ‘the witnesses.’
69.transliteration: wa-ʾashraqati l-ʾarḍu bi-n-nūri rabbihā wa-wuḍiʿa l-kitābu wa-jīʾa bi-n-nabiyyīna wa-sh-shuhadāʾi wa-quḍiya baynahum bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-hum lā yuẓlamūna

70.content: وَوُفِّيَت كُلُّ نَفسٍ ما عَمِلَت وَهُوَ أَعلَمُ بِما يَفعَلونَ
70.translation_eng: Every soul will be recompensed fully for what it has done, and He is best aware of what they do.
70.transliteration: wa-wuffiyat kullu nafsin mā ʿamilat wa-huwa ʾaʿlamu bi-mā yafʿalūna

71.content: وَسيقَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا إِلىٰ جَهَنَّمَ زُمَرًا ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءوها فُتِحَت أَبوابُها وَقالَ لَهُم خَزَنَتُها أَلَم يَأتِكُم رُسُلٌ مِنكُم يَتلونَ عَلَيكُم آياتِ رَبِّكُم وَيُنذِرونَكُم لِقاءَ يَومِكُم هٰذا ۚ قالوا بَلىٰ وَلٰكِن حَقَّت كَلِمَةُ العَذابِ عَلَى الكافِرينَ
71.translation_eng: The faithless will be driven to hell in throngs. When they reach it, and its gates are opened, its keepers will say to them, ‘Did there not come to you [any] apostles from among yourselves, reciting to you the signs of your Lord and warning you of the encounter of this day of yours?’ They will say, ‘Yes, but the word of punishment became due against the faithless.’
71.transliteration: wa-sīqa lladhīna kafarū ʾilā jahannama zumaran ḥattā ʾidhā jāʾūhā futiḥat ʾabwābuhā wa-qāla lahum khazanatuhā ʾa-lam yaʾtikum rusulun minkum yatlūna ʿalaykum ʾāyāti rabbikum wa-yundhirūnakum liqāʾa yawmikum hādhā qālū balā wa-lākin ḥaqqat kalimatu l-ʿadhābi ʿalā l-kāfirīna

72.content: قيلَ ادخُلوا أَبوابَ جَهَنَّمَ خالِدينَ فيها ۖ فَبِئسَ مَثوَى المُتَكَبِّرينَ
72.translation_eng: It will be said, ‘Enter the gates of hell to remain in it [forever]. Evil is the [ultimate] abode of the arrogant.’
72.transliteration: qīla dkhulū ʾabwāba jahannama khālidīna fīhā fa-biʾsa mathwā l-mutakabbirīna

73.content: وَسيقَ الَّذينَ اتَّقَوا رَبَّهُم إِلَى الجَنَّةِ زُمَرًا ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءوها وَفُتِحَت أَبوابُها وَقالَ لَهُم خَزَنَتُها سَلامٌ عَلَيكُم طِبتُم فَادخُلوها خالِدينَ
73.translation_eng: Those who are wary of their Lord will be led to paradise in throngs. When they reach it, and its gates are opened, its keepers will say to them, ‘Peace be to you! You are welcome!1 Enter it to remain [forever].’Or ‘You are excellent!’ Or ‘You have been pure.’
73.transliteration: wa-sīqa lladhīna ttaqaw rabbahum ʾilā l-jannati zumaran ḥattā ʾidhā jāʾūhā wa-futiḥat ʾabwābuhā wa-qāla lahum khazanatuhā salāmun ʿalaykum ṭibtum fa-dkhulūhā khālidīna

74.content: وَقالُوا الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذي صَدَقَنا وَعدَهُ وَأَورَثَنَا الأَرضَ نَتَبَوَّأُ مِنَ الجَنَّةِ حَيثُ نَشاءُ ۖ فَنِعمَ أَجرُ العامِلينَ
74.translation_eng: They will say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah, who has fulfilled His promise to us and made us heirs to the earth, that we may settle in paradise wherever we may wish!’ How excellent is the reward of the workers [of righteousness]!
74.transliteration: wa-qālū l-ḥamdu li-llāhi lladhī ṣadaqanā waʿdahū wa-ʾawrathanā l-ʾarḍa natabawwaʾu mina l-jannati ḥaythu nashāʾu fa-niʿma ʾajru l-ʿāmilīna

75.content: وَتَرَى المَلائِكَةَ حافّينَ مِن حَولِ العَرشِ يُسَبِّحونَ بِحَمدِ رَبِّهِم ۖ وَقُضِيَ بَينَهُم بِالحَقِّ وَقيلَ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
75.translation_eng: And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne, celebrating the praise of their Lord, and judgment will be made between them with justice, and it will be said, ‘All praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds!’
75.transliteration: wa-tarā l-malāʾikata ḥāffīna min ḥawli l-ʿarshi yusabbiḥūna bi-ḥamdi rabbihim wa-quḍiya baynahum bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-qīla l-ḥamdu li-llāhi rabbi l-ʿālamīna

40.description: The surah that describes the Divine Being as the one and only God, who is The Forgiver of Sin, the Acceptor of Repentance, but also the Severe in Punishment. It takes its name from the phrase “forgiver of sins” (ghāfir al-dhanb) which occurs in verse 3. A surah with two recurring themes: disputing God’s truth (verse 4, verse 35 and verse 69) and calling upon Him (verse 14 and verse 49 .). In the opening verses God is described as the Forgiver, and the Accepter of repentance, yet severe in punishment, and this dual aspect is exemplified in the surah. The central section of the surah deals with the story of Pharaoh and Moses (verse 23 .): the destruction of one and victory of the other are stated in verse 45 and verse 51. The Prophet is, in his turn, urged to be steadfast and to ignore the taunts of the disbelievers (verse 55 and verse 77).The surah is also known as: Forgiving, The Believer, The Forgiving (God), The Forgiving One.

1.translation_eng: Ḥā, Mīm:

2.content: تَنزيلُ الكِتابِ مِنَ اللَّهِ العَزيزِ العَليمِ
2.translation_eng: The [gradual] sending down of the Book is from Allah, the All-mighty, the All-knowing,
2.transliteration: tanzīlu l-kitābi mina llāhi l-ʿazīzi l-ʿalīmi

3.content: غافِرِ الذَّنبِ وَقابِلِ التَّوبِ شَديدِ العِقابِ ذِي الطَّولِ ۖ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ ۖ إِلَيهِ المَصيرُ
3.translation_eng: forgiver of sins and acceptor of repentance, severe in retribution, [yet] all-bountiful, there is no god except Him, [and] toward Him is the destination.
3.transliteration: ghāfiri dh-dhanbi wa-qābili t-tawbi shadīdi l-ʿiqābi dhī ṭ-ṭawli lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa ʾilayhi l-maṣīru

4.content: ما يُجادِلُ في آياتِ اللَّهِ إِلَّا الَّذينَ كَفَروا فَلا يَغرُركَ تَقَلُّبُهُم فِي البِلادِ
4.translation_eng: No one disputes the signs of Allah except the faithless. So do not be misled by their bustle in the towns.
4.transliteration: mā yujādilu fī ʾāyāti llāhi ʾillā lladhīna kafarū fa-lā yaghrurka taqallubuhum fī l-bilādi

5.content: كَذَّبَت قَبلَهُم قَومُ نوحٍ وَالأَحزابُ مِن بَعدِهِم ۖ وَهَمَّت كُلُّ أُمَّةٍ بِرَسولِهِم لِيَأخُذوهُ ۖ وَجادَلوا بِالباطِلِ لِيُدحِضوا بِهِ الحَقَّ فَأَخَذتُهُم ۖ فَكَيفَ كانَ عِقابِ
5.translation_eng: The people of Noah denied before them and the [heathen] factions [who came] after them. Every nation attempted to lay hands on their apostle, and disputed erroneously to refute the truth. Then I seized them; so how was My retribution?!
5.transliteration: kadhdhabat qablahum qawmu nūḥin wa-l-ʾaḥzābu min baʿdihim wa-hammat kullu ʾummatin bi-rasūlihim li-yaʾkhudhūhu wa-jādalū bi-l-bāṭili li-yudḥiḍū bihi l-ḥaqqa fa-ʾakhadhtuhum fa-kayfa kāna ʿiqābi

6.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ حَقَّت كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ عَلَى الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَنَّهُم أَصحابُ النّارِ
6.translation_eng: That is how the word of your Lord became due concerning the faithless, that they shall be inmates of the Fire.
6.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika ḥaqqat kalimatu rabbika ʿalā lladhīna kafarū ʾannahum ʾaṣḥābu n-nāri

7.content: الَّذينَ يَحمِلونَ العَرشَ وَمَن حَولَهُ يُسَبِّحونَ بِحَمدِ رَبِّهِم وَيُؤمِنونَ بِهِ وَيَستَغفِرونَ لِلَّذينَ آمَنوا رَبَّنا وَسِعتَ كُلَّ شَيءٍ رَحمَةً وَعِلمًا فَاغفِر لِلَّذينَ تابوا وَاتَّبَعوا سَبيلَكَ وَقِهِم عَذابَ الجَحيمِ
7.translation_eng: Those who bear the Throne, and those around it, celebrate the praise of their Lord and have faith in Him, and they plead for forgiveness for the faithful: ‘Our Lord! You comprehend all things in mercy and knowledge. So forgive those who repent and follow Your way and save them from the punishment of hell.
7.transliteration: alladhīna yaḥmilūna l-ʿarsha wa-man ḥawlahū yusabbiḥūna bi-ḥamdi rabbihim wa-yuʾminūna bihī wa-yastaghfirūna li-lladhīna ʾāmanū rabbanā wasiʿta kulla shayʾin raḥmatan wa-ʿilman fa-ghfir li-lladhīna tābū wa-ttabaʿū sabīlaka wa-qihim ʿadhāba l-jaḥīmi

8.content: رَبَّنا وَأَدخِلهُم جَنّاتِ عَدنٍ الَّتي وَعَدتَهُم وَمَن صَلَحَ مِن آبائِهِم وَأَزواجِهِم وَذُرِّيّاتِهِم ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
8.translation_eng: Our Lord! Admit them into the Gardens of Eden, which You have promised them, along with whoever is righteous among their forebears, their spouses and their descendants.1 Indeed You are the All-mighty, the All-wise.Cf. 13:23.
8.transliteration: rabbanā wa-ʾadkhilhum jannāti ʿadnin-i llatī waʿadtahum wa-man ṣalaḥa min ʾābāʾihim wa-ʾazwājihim wa-dhurriyyātihim ʾinnaka ʾanta l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

9.content: وَقِهِمُ السَّيِّئَاتِ ۚ وَمَن تَقِ السَّيِّئَاتِ يَومَئِذٍ فَقَد رَحِمتَهُ ۚ وَذٰلِكَ هُوَ الفَوزُ العَظيمُ
9.translation_eng: Save them from the ills; and whomever You save from the ills that day,1 You will have had mercy upon him, and that is the great success.’That is, the day of judgement.
9.transliteration: wa-qihimu s-sayyiʾāti wa-man taqi s-sayyiʾāti yawmaʾidhin fa-qad raḥimtahū wa-dhālika huwa l-fawzu l-ʿaẓīmu

10.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا يُنادَونَ لَمَقتُ اللَّهِ أَكبَرُ مِن مَقتِكُم أَنفُسَكُم إِذ تُدعَونَ إِلَى الإيمانِ فَتَكفُرونَ
10.translation_eng: Indeed it will be proclaimed to the faithless: ‘Surely Allah’s outrage [towards you] is greater than your outrage towards yourselves, as you were invited to faith, but you disbelieved.’
10.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna kafarū yunādawna la-maqtu llāhi ʾakbaru min maqtikum ʾanfusakum ʾidh tudʿawna ʾilā l-ʾīmāni fa-takfurūna

11.content: قالوا رَبَّنا أَمَتَّنَا اثنَتَينِ وَأَحيَيتَنَا اثنَتَينِ فَاعتَرَفنا بِذُنوبِنا فَهَل إِلىٰ خُروجٍ مِن سَبيلٍ
11.translation_eng: They will say, ‘Our Lord! Twice did You make us die, and twice did You give us life. We admit our sins. Is there any way out [from this plight]?’
11.transliteration: qālū rabbanā ʾamattanā thnatayni wa-ʾaḥyaytanā thnatayni fa-ʿtarafnā bi-dhunūbinā fa-hal ʾilā khurūjin min sabīlin

12.content: ذٰلِكُم بِأَنَّهُ إِذا دُعِيَ اللَّهُ وَحدَهُ كَفَرتُم ۖ وَإِن يُشرَك بِهِ تُؤمِنوا ۚ فَالحُكمُ لِلَّهِ العَلِيِّ الكَبيرِ
12.translation_eng: This [plight of yours] is because, when Allah was invoked alone, you would disbelieve, but if partners were ascribed to Him you would believe. So the judgment belongs to Allah, the All-exalted, the All-great.’
12.transliteration: dhālikum bi-ʾannahū ʾidhā duʿiya llāhu waḥdahū kafartum wa-ʾin yushrak bihī tuʾminū fa-l-ḥukmu li-llāhi l-ʿaliyyi l-kabīri

13.content: هُوَ الَّذي يُريكُم آياتِهِ وَيُنَزِّلُ لَكُم مِنَ السَّماءِ رِزقًا ۚ وَما يَتَذَكَّرُ إِلّا مَن يُنيبُ
13.translation_eng: It is He who shows you His signs and sends down for you provision from the sky. Yet no one takes admonition except him who returns penitently [to Allah].
13.transliteration: huwa lladhī yurīkum ʾāyātihī wa-yunazzilu lakum mina s-samāʾi rizqan wa-mā yatadhakkaru ʾillā man yunību

14.content: فَادعُوا اللَّهَ مُخلِصينَ لَهُ الدّينَ وَلَو كَرِهَ الكافِرونَ
14.translation_eng: So supplicate Allah, putting exclusive faith in Him, though the faithless should be averse.
14.transliteration: fa-dʿū llāha mukhliṣīna lahu d-dīna wa-law kariha l-kāfirūna

15.content: رَفيعُ الدَّرَجاتِ ذُو العَرشِ يُلقِي الرّوحَ مِن أَمرِهِ عَلىٰ مَن يَشاءُ مِن عِبادِهِ لِيُنذِرَ يَومَ التَّلاقِ
15.translation_eng: Raiser of ranks, Lord of the Throne, He casts the Spirit of His command upon whomever of His servants that He wishes, that he may warn [people] of the Day of Encounter.
15.transliteration: rafīʿu d-darajāti dhū l-ʿarshi yulqī r-rūḥa min ʾamrihī ʿalā man yashāʾu min ʿibādihī li-yundhira yawma t-talāqi

16.content: يَومَ هُم بارِزونَ ۖ لا يَخفىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ مِنهُم شَيءٌ ۚ لِمَنِ المُلكُ اليَومَ ۖ لِلَّهِ الواحِدِ القَهّارِ
16.translation_eng: The day when they will emerge [from their graves], nothing about them will be hidden from Allah. ‘To whom does the sovereignty belong today?’ ‘To Allah, the One, the All-paramount!’
16.transliteration: yawma hum bārizūna lā yakhfā ʿalā llāhi minhum shayʾun li-mani l-mulku l-yawma li-llāhi l-wāḥidi l-qahhāri

17.content: اليَومَ تُجزىٰ كُلُّ نَفسٍ بِما كَسَبَت ۚ لا ظُلمَ اليَومَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَريعُ الحِسابِ
17.translation_eng: ‘Today every soul shall be requited for what it has earned. There will be no injustice today. Indeed Allah is swift at reckoning.’
17.transliteration: al-yawma tujzā kullu nafsin bi-mā kasabat lā ẓulma l-yawma ʾinna llāha sarīʿu l-ḥisābi

18.content: وَأَنذِرهُم يَومَ الآزِفَةِ إِذِ القُلوبُ لَدَى الحَناجِرِ كاظِمينَ ۚ ما لِلظّالِمينَ مِن حَميمٍ وَلا شَفيعٍ يُطاعُ
18.translation_eng: Warn them of the Imminent Day1 when the hearts will be at the throats, choking with suppressed agony, [and] the wrongdoers will have no sympathizer, nor any intercessor who might be heard.Cf. ‘the Imminent [Hour]’ (53:57).
18.transliteration: wa-ʾandhirhum yawma l-ʾāzifati ʾidhi l-qulūbu ladā l-ḥanājiri kāẓimīna mā li-ẓ-ẓālimīna min ḥamīmin wa-lā shafīʿin yuṭāʿu

19.content: يَعلَمُ خائِنَةَ الأَعيُنِ وَما تُخفِي الصُّدورُ
19.translation_eng: He knows the treachery of the eyes,1 and what the breasts hide.That is, the sins committed with the eyes.
19.transliteration: yaʿlamu khāʾinata l-ʾaʿyuni wa-mā tukhfī ṣ-ṣudūru

20.content: وَاللَّهُ يَقضي بِالحَقِّ ۖ وَالَّذينَ يَدعونَ مِن دونِهِ لا يَقضونَ بِشَيءٍ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ السَّميعُ البَصيرُ
20.translation_eng: Allah judges with justice,1 while those whom they invoke besides Him do not judge by anything. Indeed it is Allah who is the All-hearing, the All-seeing.Or ‘judges justly.’
20.transliteration: wa-llāhu yaqḍī bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-lladhīna yadʿūna min dūnihī lā yaqḍūna bi-shayʾin ʾinna llāha huwa s-samīʿu l-baṣīru

21.content: ۞ أَوَلَم يَسيروا فِي الأَرضِ فَيَنظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ الَّذينَ كانوا مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ كانوا هُم أَشَدَّ مِنهُم قُوَّةً وَآثارًا فِي الأَرضِ فَأَخَذَهُمُ اللَّهُ بِذُنوبِهِم وَما كانَ لَهُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن واقٍ
21.translation_eng: Have they not traveled over the land so that they may observe how was the fate of those who were before them? They were greater than them in might and with respect to the effects [they left] in the land. But then Allah seized them for their sins, and they had no defender against Allah[’s punishment].
21.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yasīrū fī l-ʾarḍi fa-yanẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu lladhīna kānū min qablihim kānū hum ʾashadda minhum quwwatan wa-ʾāthāran fī l-ʾarḍi fa-ʾakhadhahumu llāhu bi-dhunūbihim wa-mā kāna lahum mina llāhi min wāqin

22.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُم كانَت تَأتيهِم رُسُلُهُم بِالبَيِّناتِ فَكَفَروا فَأَخَذَهُمُ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ قَوِيٌّ شَديدُ العِقابِ
22.translation_eng: That was because their apostles used to bring them manifest proofs, but they defied [them]. So Allah seized them. Indeed He is all-strong, severe in retribution.
22.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahum kānat taʾtīhim rusuluhum bi-l-bayyināti fa-kafarū fa-ʾakhadhahumu llāhu ʾinnahū qawiyyun shadīdu l-ʿiqābi

23.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا موسىٰ بِآياتِنا وَسُلطانٍ مُبينٍ
23.translation_eng: Certainly We sent Moses with Our signs and a manifest authority
23.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā mūsā bi-ʾāyātinā wa-sulṭānin mubīnin

24.content: إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَهامانَ وَقارونَ فَقالوا ساحِرٌ كَذّابٌ
24.translation_eng: to Pharaoh, Hāmān and Korah, but they said, ‘A magician, a mendacious liar.’
24.transliteration: ʾilā firʿawna wa-hāmāna wa-qārūna fa-qālū sāḥirun kadhdhābun

25.content: فَلَمّا جاءَهُم بِالحَقِّ مِن عِندِنا قالُوا اقتُلوا أَبناءَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا مَعَهُ وَاستَحيوا نِساءَهُم ۚ وَما كَيدُ الكافِرينَ إِلّا في ضَلالٍ
25.translation_eng: So when he brought them the truth from Us, they said, ‘Kill the sons of the faithful who are with him, and spare their women.’ But the stratagems1 of the faithless only go awry.Or ‘the guile of the faithless.’
25.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾahum bi-l-ḥaqqi min ʿindinā qālū qtulū ʾabnāʾa lladhīna ʾāmanū maʿahū wa-staḥyū nisāʾahum wa-mā kaydu l-kāfirīna ʾillā fī ḍalālin

26.content: وَقالَ فِرعَونُ ذَروني أَقتُل موسىٰ وَليَدعُ رَبَّهُ ۖ إِنّي أَخافُ أَن يُبَدِّلَ دينَكُم أَو أَن يُظهِرَ فِي الأَرضِ الفَسادَ
26.translation_eng: And Pharaoh said, ‘Let me slay Moses, and let him invoke his Lord. Indeed I fear that he will change your religion, or bring forth corruption in the land.’
26.transliteration: wa-qāla firʿawnu dharūnī ʾaqtul mūsā wa-l-yadʿu rabbahū ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʾan yubaddila dīnakum ʾaw ʾan yuẓhira fī l-ʾarḍi l-fasāda

27.content: وَقالَ موسىٰ إِنّي عُذتُ بِرَبّي وَرَبِّكُم مِن كُلِّ مُتَكَبِّرٍ لا يُؤمِنُ بِيَومِ الحِسابِ
27.translation_eng: Moses said, ‘Indeed I seek the protection of my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning.’
27.transliteration: wa-qāla mūsā ʾinnī ʿudhtu bi-rabbī wa-rabbikum min kulli mutakabbirin lā yuʾminu bi-yawmi l-ḥisābi

28.content: وَقالَ رَجُلٌ مُؤمِنٌ مِن آلِ فِرعَونَ يَكتُمُ إيمانَهُ أَتَقتُلونَ رَجُلًا أَن يَقولَ رَبِّيَ اللَّهُ وَقَد جاءَكُم بِالبَيِّناتِ مِن رَبِّكُم ۖ وَإِن يَكُ كاذِبًا فَعَلَيهِ كَذِبُهُ ۖ وَإِن يَكُ صادِقًا يُصِبكُم بَعضُ الَّذي يَعِدُكُم ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدي مَن هُوَ مُسرِفٌ كَذّابٌ
28.translation_eng: Said a man of faith from Pharaoh’s clan, who concealed his faith, ‘Will you kill a man for saying, “My Lord is Allah,” while he has already brought you manifest proofs from your Lord? Should he be lying, his falsehood will be to his own detriment; but if he is truthful, there shall visit you some of what he promises you. Indeed Allah does not guide someone who is a profligate, a liar.
28.transliteration: wa-qāla rajulun muʾminun min ʾāli firʿawna yaktumu ʾīmānahū ʾa-taqtulūna rajulan ʾan yaqūla rabbiya llāhu wa-qad jāʾakum bi-l-bayyināti min rabbikum wa-ʾin yaku kādhiban fa-ʿalayhi kadhibuhū wa-ʾin yaku ṣādiqan yuṣibkum baʿḍu lladhī yaʿidukum ʾinna llāha lā yahdī man huwa musrifun kadhdhābun

29.content: يا قَومِ لَكُمُ المُلكُ اليَومَ ظاهِرينَ فِي الأَرضِ فَمَن يَنصُرُنا مِن بَأسِ اللَّهِ إِن جاءَنا ۚ قالَ فِرعَونُ ما أُريكُم إِلّا ما أَرىٰ وَما أَهديكُم إِلّا سَبيلَ الرَّشادِ
29.translation_eng: O my people! Today sovereignty belongs to you,1 and you are dominant in the land. But who will save us from Allah’s punishment should it overtake us?’ Pharaoh said, ‘I just point out to you what I see [to be advisable for you], and I guide you only to the way of rectitude.’Or ‘Today the kingdom is yours.’
29.transliteration: yā-qawmi lakumu l-mulku l-yawma ẓāhirīna fī l-ʾarḍi fa-man yanṣurunā min baʾsi llāhi ʾin jāʾanā qāla firʿawnu mā ʾurīkum ʾillā mā ʾarā wa-mā ʾahdīkum ʾillā sabīla r-rashādi

30.content: وَقالَ الَّذي آمَنَ يا قَومِ إِنّي أَخافُ عَلَيكُم مِثلَ يَومِ الأَحزابِ
30.translation_eng: And he who had faith said, ‘O my people! Indeed I fear for you [a day] like the day of the [heathen] factions;
30.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhī ʾāmana yā-qawmi ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʿalaykum mithla yawmi l-ʾaḥzābi

31.content: مِثلَ دَأبِ قَومِ نوحٍ وَعادٍ وَثَمودَ وَالَّذينَ مِن بَعدِهِم ۚ وَمَا اللَّهُ يُريدُ ظُلمًا لِلعِبادِ
31.translation_eng: like the case of the people of Noah, of ʿĀd and Thamūd, and those who were after them, and Allah does not desire any wrong for [His] servants.
31.transliteration: mithla daʾbi qawmi nūḥin wa-ʿādin wa-thamūda wa-lladhīna min baʿdihim wa-mā llāhu yurīdu ẓulman li-l-ʿibādi

32.content: وَيا قَومِ إِنّي أَخافُ عَلَيكُم يَومَ التَّنادِ
32.translation_eng: O my people! Indeed I fear for you a day of mutual distress calls,
32.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʿalaykum yawma t-tanādi

33.content: يَومَ تُوَلّونَ مُدبِرينَ ما لَكُم مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن عاصِمٍ ۗ وَمَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن هادٍ
33.translation_eng: a day when you will turn back [to flee], not having anyone to protect you from Allah, and whomever Allah leads astray has no guide.
33.transliteration: yawma tuwallūna mudbirīna mā lakum mina llāhi min ʿāṣimin wa-man yuḍlili llāhu fa-mā lahū min hādin

34.content: وَلَقَد جاءَكُم يوسُفُ مِن قَبلُ بِالبَيِّناتِ فَما زِلتُم في شَكٍّ مِمّا جاءَكُم بِهِ ۖ حَتّىٰ إِذا هَلَكَ قُلتُم لَن يَبعَثَ اللَّهُ مِن بَعدِهِ رَسولًا ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَن هُوَ مُسرِفٌ مُرتابٌ
34.translation_eng: Certainly Joseph brought you manifest proofs earlier, but you continued to remain in doubt concerning what he had brought you. When he died, you said, “Allah will never send any apostle after him.” That is how Allah leads astray those who are profligate, skeptical.
34.transliteration: wa-la-qad jāʾakum yūsufu min qablu bi-l-bayyināti fa-mā ziltum fī shakkin mimmā jāʾakum bihī ḥattā ʾidhā halaka qultum lan yabʿatha llāhu min baʿdihī rasūlan ka-dhālika yuḍillu llāhu man huwa musrifun murtābun-i

35.content: الَّذينَ يُجادِلونَ في آياتِ اللَّهِ بِغَيرِ سُلطانٍ أَتاهُم ۖ كَبُرَ مَقتًا عِندَ اللَّهِ وَعِندَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يَطبَعُ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ قَلبِ مُتَكَبِّرٍ جَبّارٍ
35.translation_eng: Those who dispute the signs of Allah without any authority that may have come to them —[that is] greatly outrageous to Allah and to those who have faith. That is how Allah seals the heart of every arrogant tyrant.’
35.transliteration: alladhīna yujādilūna fī ʾāyāti llāhi bi-ghayri sulṭānin ʾatāhum kabura maqtan ʿinda llāhi wa-ʿinda lladhīna ʾāmanū ka-dhālika yaṭbaʿu llāhu ʿalā kulli qalbi mutakabbirin jabbārin

36.content: وَقالَ فِرعَونُ يا هامانُ ابنِ لي صَرحًا لَعَلّي أَبلُغُ الأَسبابَ
36.translation_eng: And Pharaoh said, ‘O Hāmān! Build me a tower so that I may reach the routes1Or ‘the means.’
36.transliteration: wa-qāla firʿawnu yā-hāmānu bni lī ṣarḥan laʿallī ʾablughu l-ʾasbāba

37.content: أَسبابَ السَّماواتِ فَأَطَّلِعَ إِلىٰ إِلٰهِ موسىٰ وَإِنّي لَأَظُنُّهُ كاذِبًا ۚ وَكَذٰلِكَ زُيِّنَ لِفِرعَونَ سوءُ عَمَلِهِ وَصُدَّ عَنِ السَّبيلِ ۚ وَما كَيدُ فِرعَونَ إِلّا في تَبابٍ
37.translation_eng: —the routes of the heavens— and take a look at the God of Moses, and indeed I consider him a liar.’ To Pharaoh was thus presented as decorous the evil of his conduct, and he was kept from the way [of Allah], and Pharaoh’s stratagems1 only led him into ruin.Or ‘Pharaoh’s guile.’
37.transliteration: ʾasbāba s-samāwāti fa-ʾaṭṭaliʿa ʾilā ʾilāhi mūsā wa-ʾinnī la-ʾaẓunnuhū kādhiban wa-ka-dhālika zuyyina li-firʿawna sūʾu ʿamalihī wa-ṣudda ʿani s-sabīli wa-mā kaydu firʿawna ʾillā fī tabābin

38.content: وَقالَ الَّذي آمَنَ يا قَومِ اتَّبِعونِ أَهدِكُم سَبيلَ الرَّشادِ
38.translation_eng: And he who had faith said, ‘O my people! Follow me, I will guide you to the way of rectitude.
38.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhī ʾāmana yā-qawmi ttabiʿūni ʾahdikum sabīla r-rashādi

39.content: يا قَومِ إِنَّما هٰذِهِ الحَياةُ الدُّنيا مَتاعٌ وَإِنَّ الآخِرَةَ هِيَ دارُ القَرارِ
39.translation_eng: O my people! This life of the world is only a [passing] enjoyment, and indeed the Hereafter is the abiding home.
39.transliteration: yā-qawmi ʾinnamā hādhihi l-ḥayātu d-dunyā matāʿun wa-ʾinna l-ʾākhirata hiya dāru l-qarāri

40.content: مَن عَمِلَ سَيِّئَةً فَلا يُجزىٰ إِلّا مِثلَها ۖ وَمَن عَمِلَ صالِحًا مِن ذَكَرٍ أَو أُنثىٰ وَهُوَ مُؤمِنٌ فَأُولٰئِكَ يَدخُلونَ الجَنَّةَ يُرزَقونَ فيها بِغَيرِ حِسابٍ
40.translation_eng: Whoever commits a misdeed shall not be requited except with its like, but whoever acts righteously, whether male or female, should he be faithful —such shall enter paradise, provided therein without any reckoning.
40.transliteration: man ʿamila sayyiʾatan fa-lā yujzā ʾillā mithlahā wa-man ʿamila ṣāliḥan min dhakarin ʾaw ʾunthā wa-huwa muʾminun fa-ʾulāʾika yadkhulūna l-jannata yurzaqūna fīhā bi-ghayri ḥisābin

41.content: ۞ وَيا قَومِ ما لي أَدعوكُم إِلَى النَّجاةِ وَتَدعونَني إِلَى النّارِ
41.translation_eng: O my people! [Think,] what makes me invite you to deliverance while you invite me toward the Fire?
41.transliteration: wa-yā-qawmi mā lī ʾadʿūkum ʾilā n-najāti wa-tadʿūnanī ʾilā n-nāri

42.content: تَدعونَني لِأَكفُرَ بِاللَّهِ وَأُشرِكَ بِهِ ما لَيسَ لي بِهِ عِلمٌ وَأَنا أَدعوكُم إِلَى العَزيزِ الغَفّارِ
42.translation_eng: You invite me to defy Allah and to ascribe to Him partners of which I have no knowledge, while I call you to the All-mighty, the All-forgiver.
42.transliteration: tadʿūnanī li-ʾakfura bi-llāhi wa-ʾushrika bihī mā laysa lī bihī ʿilmun wa-ʾana ʾadʿūkum ʾilā l-ʿazīzi l-ghaffāri

43.content: لا جَرَمَ أَنَّما تَدعونَني إِلَيهِ لَيسَ لَهُ دَعوَةٌ فِي الدُّنيا وَلا فِي الآخِرَةِ وَأَنَّ مَرَدَّنا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَأَنَّ المُسرِفينَ هُم أَصحابُ النّارِ
43.translation_eng: Undoubtedly, that to which you invite me has no invitation in the world nor in the Hereafter, and indeed our return will be to Allah, and indeed it is the profligates who will be inmates of the Fire.
43.transliteration: lā jarama ʾannamā tadʿūnanī ʾilayhi laysa lahū daʿwatun fī d-dunyā wa-lā fī l-ʾākhirati wa-ʾanna maraddanā ʾilā llāhi wa-ʾanna l-musrifīna hum ʾaṣḥābu n-nāri

44.content: فَسَتَذكُرونَ ما أَقولُ لَكُم ۚ وَأُفَوِّضُ أَمري إِلَى اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بَصيرٌ بِالعِبادِ
44.translation_eng: Soon you will remember what I tell you, and I entrust my affair to Allah. Indeed Allah sees best the servants.’
44.transliteration: fa-sa-tadhkurūna mā ʾaqūlu lakum wa-ʾufawwiḍu ʾamrī ʾilā llāhi ʾinna llāha baṣīrun bi-l-ʿibādi

45.content: فَوَقاهُ اللَّهُ سَيِّئَاتِ ما مَكَروا ۖ وَحاقَ بِآلِ فِرعَونَ سوءُ العَذابِ
45.translation_eng: Then Allah saved him from their evil schemes, while a terrible punishment besieged Pharaoh’s clan:
45.transliteration: fa-waqāhu llāhu sayyiʾāti mā makarū wa-ḥāqa bi-ʾāli firʿawna sūʾu l-ʿadhābi

46.content: النّارُ يُعرَضونَ عَلَيها غُدُوًّا وَعَشِيًّا ۖ وَيَومَ تَقومُ السّاعَةُ أَدخِلوا آلَ فِرعَونَ أَشَدَّ العَذابِ
46.translation_eng: the Fire, to which they are exposed morning and evening. And on the day when the Hour sets in Pharaoh’s clan will enter the severest punishment.
46.transliteration: an-nāru yuʿraḍūna ʿalayhā ghuduwwan wa-ʿashiyyan wa-yawma taqūmu s-sāʿatu ʾadkhilū ʾāla firʿawna ʾashadda l-ʿadhābi

47.content: وَإِذ يَتَحاجّونَ فِي النّارِ فَيَقولُ الضُّعَفاءُ لِلَّذينَ استَكبَروا إِنّا كُنّا لَكُم تَبَعًا فَهَل أَنتُم مُغنونَ عَنّا نَصيبًا مِنَ النّارِ
47.translation_eng: When they argue in the Fire, the weak will say to those who were arrogant, ‘Indeed we used to follow you; so will you avail us against any portion of the Fire?’
47.transliteration: wa-ʾidh yataḥājjūna fī n-nāri fa-yaqūlu ḍ-ḍuʿafāʾu li-lladhīna stakbarū ʾinnā kunnā lakum tabaʿan fa-hal ʾantum mughnūna ʿannā naṣīban mina n-nāri

48.content: قالَ الَّذينَ استَكبَروا إِنّا كُلٌّ فيها إِنَّ اللَّهَ قَد حَكَمَ بَينَ العِبادِ
48.translation_eng: Those who were arrogant will say, ‘Indeed we are all [together] in it. Indeed Allah has judged between [His] servants.’
48.transliteration: qāla lladhīna stakbarū ʾinnā kullun fīhā ʾinna llāha qad ḥakama bayna l-ʿibādi

49.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ فِي النّارِ لِخَزَنَةِ جَهَنَّمَ ادعوا رَبَّكُم يُخَفِّف عَنّا يَومًا مِنَ العَذابِ
49.translation_eng: Those in the Fire will say to the keepers of hell, ‘Supplicate your Lord to lighten for us [at least] a day’s punishment.’
49.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna fī n-nāri li-khazanati jahannama dʿū rabbakum yukhaffif ʿannā yawman mina l-ʿadhābi

50.content: قالوا أَوَلَم تَكُ تَأتيكُم رُسُلُكُم بِالبَيِّناتِ ۖ قالوا بَلىٰ ۚ قالوا فَادعوا ۗ وَما دُعاءُ الكافِرينَ إِلّا في ضَلالٍ
50.translation_eng: They will say, ‘Did not your apostles use to bring you manifest proofs?’ They will say, ‘Yes.’ They will say, ‘Then supplicate [Him] yourselves.’ But the supplications of the faithless only go awry.
50.transliteration: qālū ʾa-wa-lam taku taʾtīkum rusulukum bi-l-bayyināti qālū balā qālū fa-dʿū wa-mā duʿāʾu l-kāfirīna ʾillā fī ḍalālin

51.content: إِنّا لَنَنصُرُ رُسُلَنا وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا وَيَومَ يَقومُ الأَشهادُ
51.translation_eng: Indeed We shall help Our apostles and those who have faith in the life of the world and on the day when the witnesses rise up
51.transliteration: ʾinnā la-nanṣuru rusulanā wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-yawma yaqūmu l-ʾashhādu

52.content: يَومَ لا يَنفَعُ الظّالِمينَ مَعذِرَتُهُم ۖ وَلَهُمُ اللَّعنَةُ وَلَهُم سوءُ الدّارِ
52.translation_eng: —the day when the excuses of the wrongdoers will not benefit them, and the curse will lie on them, and for them will be the ills of the [ultimate] abode.
52.transliteration: yawma lā yanfaʿu ẓ-ẓālimīna maʿdhiratuhum wa-lahumu l-laʿnatu wa-lahum sūʾu d-dāri

53.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسَى الهُدىٰ وَأَورَثنا بَني إِسرائيلَ الكِتابَ
53.translation_eng: Certainly We gave Moses the guidance and We made the Children of Israel heirs to the Book,
53.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā mūsā l-hudā wa-ʾawrathnā banī ʾisrāʾīla l-kitāba

54.content: هُدًى وَذِكرىٰ لِأُولِي الأَلبابِ
54.translation_eng: as a guidance and an admonition for those who possess intellect.
54.transliteration: hudan wa-dhikrā li-ʾulī l-ʾalbābi

55.content: فَاصبِر إِنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَاستَغفِر لِذَنبِكَ وَسَبِّح بِحَمدِ رَبِّكَ بِالعَشِيِّ وَالإِبكارِ
55.translation_eng: So be patient! Allah’s promise is indeed true. And plead for [Allah’s] forgiveness for your sin, and celebrate the praise of your Lord morning and evening.
55.transliteration: fa-ṣbir ʾinna waʿda llāhi ḥaqqun wa-staghfir li-dhanbika wa-sabbiḥ bi-ḥamdi rabbika bi-l-ʿashiyyi wa-l-ʾibkāri

56.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يُجادِلونَ في آياتِ اللَّهِ بِغَيرِ سُلطانٍ أَتاهُم ۙ إِن في صُدورِهِم إِلّا كِبرٌ ما هُم بِبالِغيهِ ۚ فَاستَعِذ بِاللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّميعُ البَصيرُ
56.translation_eng: Indeed those who dispute the signs of Allah without any authority that may have come to them —there is only vanity in their breasts, which they will never satisfy. So seek the protection of Allah; indeed He is the All-hearing, the All-seeing.
56.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna yujādilūna fī ʾāyāti llāhi bi-ghayri sulṭānin ʾatāhum ʾin fī ṣudūrihim ʾillā kibrun mā hum bi-bālighīhi fa-staʿidh bi-llāhi ʾinnahū huwa s-samīʿu l-baṣīru

57.content: لَخَلقُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ أَكبَرُ مِن خَلقِ النّاسِ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
57.translation_eng: Surely the creation of the heavens and the earth is more prodigious than the creation of mankind,1 but most people do not know.Cf. 37:11, 79:27.
57.transliteration: la-khalqu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾakbaru min khalqi n-nāsi wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūna

58.content: وَما يَستَوِي الأَعمىٰ وَالبَصيرُ وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ وَلَا المُسيءُ ۚ قَليلًا ما تَتَذَكَّرونَ
58.translation_eng: The blind one and the seer are not equal, neither are those who have faith and do righteous deeds and the evildoing. Little is the admonition that you take!
58.transliteration: wa-mā yastawī l-ʾaʿmā wa-l-baṣīru wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa-lā l-musīʾu qalīlan mā tatadhakkarūna

59.content: إِنَّ السّاعَةَ لَآتِيَةٌ لا رَيبَ فيها وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يُؤمِنونَ
59.translation_eng: Indeed the Hour is bound to come; there is no doubt in it. But most people do not believe.
59.transliteration: ʾinna s-sāʿata la-ʾātiyatun lā rayba fīhā wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yuʾminūna

60.content: وَقالَ رَبُّكُمُ ادعوني أَستَجِب لَكُم ۚ إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَستَكبِرونَ عَن عِبادَتي سَيَدخُلونَ جَهَنَّمَ داخِرينَ
60.translation_eng: Your Lord has said, ‘Call Me, and I will hear you!’ Indeed those who are disdainful of My worship will enter hell in utter humility.
60.transliteration: wa-qāla rabbukumu dʿūnī ʾastajib lakum ʾinna lladhīna yastakbirūna ʿan ʿibādatī sa-yadkhulūna jahannama dākhirīna

61.content: اللَّهُ الَّذي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ اللَّيلَ لِتَسكُنوا فيهِ وَالنَّهارَ مُبصِرًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَذو فَضلٍ عَلَى النّاسِ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَشكُرونَ
61.translation_eng: It is Allah who made the night for you, that you may rest in it, and the day to provide visibility. Indeed Allah is gracious to mankind, but most people do not give thanks.
61.transliteration: allāhu lladhī jaʿala lakumu l-layla li-taskunū fīhi wa-n-nahāra mubṣiran ʾinna llāha la-dhū faḍlin ʿalā n-nāsi wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yashkurūna

62.content: ذٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُم خالِقُ كُلِّ شَيءٍ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ ۖ فَأَنّىٰ تُؤفَكونَ
62.translation_eng: That is Allah, your Lord, the creator of all things, there is no god except Him. Then where do you stray?
62.transliteration: dhālikumu llāhu rabbukum khāliqu kulli shayʾin lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa fa-ʾannā tuʾfakūna

63.content: كَذٰلِكَ يُؤفَكُ الَّذينَ كانوا بِآياتِ اللَّهِ يَجحَدونَ
63.translation_eng: Thus are made to stray those who are used to impugning the signs of Allah.
63.transliteration: ka-dhālika yuʾfaku lladhīna kānū bi-ʾāyāti llāhi yajḥadūna

64.content: اللَّهُ الَّذي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الأَرضَ قَرارًا وَالسَّماءَ بِناءً وَصَوَّرَكُم فَأَحسَنَ صُوَرَكُم وَرَزَقَكُم مِنَ الطَّيِّباتِ ۚ ذٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبُّكُم ۖ فَتَبارَكَ اللَّهُ رَبُّ العالَمينَ
64.translation_eng: It is Allah who made the earth an abode for you, and the sky a canopy, and He formed you and perfected your forms, and provided you with all the good things. That is Allah, your Lord! Blessed is Allah, Lord of all the worlds!
64.transliteration: allāhu lladhī jaʿala lakumu l-ʾarḍa qarāran wa-s-samāʾa bināʾan wa-ṣawwarakum fa-ʾaḥsana ṣuwarakum wa-razaqakum mina ṭ-ṭayyibāti dhālikumu llāhu rabbukum fa-tabāraka llāhu rabbu l-ʿālamīna

65.content: هُوَ الحَيُّ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ فَادعوهُ مُخلِصينَ لَهُ الدّينَ ۗ الحَمدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
65.translation_eng: He is the Living One, there is no god except Him. So supplicate Him, putting exclusive faith in Him. All praise belongs to Allah, Lord of all the worlds.
65.transliteration: huwa l-ḥayyu lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa fa-dʿūhu mukhliṣīna lahu d-dīna l-ḥamdu li-llāhi rabbi l-ʿālamīna

66.content: ۞ قُل إِنّي نُهيتُ أَن أَعبُدَ الَّذينَ تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ لَمّا جاءَنِيَ البَيِّناتُ مِن رَبّي وَأُمِرتُ أَن أُسلِمَ لِرَبِّ العالَمينَ
66.translation_eng: Say, ‘I have been forbidden to worship those whom you invoke besides Allah, since there have come to me manifest proofs from my Lord, and I have been commanded to submit to the Lord of all the worlds.
66.transliteration: qul ʾinnī nuhītu ʾan ʾaʿbuda lladhīna tadʿūna min dūni llāhi lammā jāʾaniya l-bayyinātu min rabbī wa-ʾumirtu ʾan ʾuslima li-rabbi l-ʿālamīna

67.content: هُوَ الَّذي خَلَقَكُم مِن تُرابٍ ثُمَّ مِن نُطفَةٍ ثُمَّ مِن عَلَقَةٍ ثُمَّ يُخرِجُكُم طِفلًا ثُمَّ لِتَبلُغوا أَشُدَّكُم ثُمَّ لِتَكونوا شُيوخًا ۚ وَمِنكُم مَن يُتَوَفّىٰ مِن قَبلُ ۖ وَلِتَبلُغوا أَجَلًا مُسَمًّى وَلَعَلَّكُم تَعقِلونَ
67.translation_eng: It is He who created you from dust, then from a drop of [seminal] fluid, then from a clinging mass, then He brings you forth as infants, then [He nourishes you] so that you may come of age, then that you may become aged —though there are some of you who die earlier— and that you may complete a specified term, and so that you may apply reason.
67.transliteration: huwa lladhī khalaqakum min turābin thumma min nuṭfatin thumma min ʿalaqatin thumma yukhrijukum ṭiflan thumma li-tablughū ʾashuddakum thumma li-takūnū shuyūkhan wa-minkum man yutawaffā min qablu wa-li-tablughū ʾajalan musamman wa-laʿallakum taʿqilūna

68.content: هُوَ الَّذي يُحيي وَيُميتُ ۖ فَإِذا قَضىٰ أَمرًا فَإِنَّما يَقولُ لَهُ كُن فَيَكونُ
68.translation_eng: It is He who gives life and brings death. So when He decides on a matter, He just says to it, ‘Be!’ and it is.
68.transliteration: huwa lladhī yuḥyī wa-yumītu fa-ʾidhā qaḍā ʾamran fa-ʾinnamā yaqūlu lahū kun fa-yakūnu

69.content: أَلَم تَرَ إِلَى الَّذينَ يُجادِلونَ في آياتِ اللَّهِ أَنّىٰ يُصرَفونَ
69.translation_eng: Have you not regarded those who dispute the signs of Allah, where they are being led away [from Allah’s way]?
69.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara ʾilā lladhīna yujādilūna fī ʾāyāti llāhi ʾannā yuṣrafūna

70.content: الَّذينَ كَذَّبوا بِالكِتابِ وَبِما أَرسَلنا بِهِ رُسُلَنا ۖ فَسَوفَ يَعلَمونَ
70.translation_eng: —Those who deny the Book and what we have sent with Our apostles. Soon they will know
70.transliteration: alladhīna kadhdhabū bi-l-kitābi wa-bi-mā ʾarsalnā bihī rusulanā fa-sawfa yaʿlamūna

71.content: إِذِ الأَغلالُ في أَعناقِهِم وَالسَّلاسِلُ يُسحَبونَ
71.translation_eng: when, [with] iron collars around their necks and chains, they are dragged
71.transliteration: ʾidhi l-ʾaghlālu fī ʾaʿnāqihim wa-s-salāsilu yusḥabūna

72.content: فِي الحَميمِ ثُمَّ فِي النّارِ يُسجَرونَ
72.translation_eng: into scalding waters and then set aflame in the Fire.
72.transliteration: fī l-ḥamīmi thumma fī n-nāri yusjarūna

73.content: ثُمَّ قيلَ لَهُم أَينَ ما كُنتُم تُشرِكونَ
73.translation_eng: Then they will be told, ‘Where are those you used to take as partners
73.transliteration: thumma qīla lahum ʾayna mā kuntum tushrikūna

74.content: مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ۖ قالوا ضَلّوا عَنّا بَل لَم نَكُن نَدعو مِن قَبلُ شَيئًا ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ الكافِرينَ
74.translation_eng: besides Allah?’ They will say, ‘They have forsaken us. Rather, we did not invoke anything before.’ That is how Allah leads astray the faithless.
74.transliteration: min dūni llāhi qālū ḍallū ʿannā bal lam nakun nadʿū min qablu shayʾan ka-dhālika yuḍillu llāhu l-kāfirīna

75.content: ذٰلِكُم بِما كُنتُم تَفرَحونَ فِي الأَرضِ بِغَيرِ الحَقِّ وَبِما كُنتُم تَمرَحونَ
75.translation_eng: ‘That is because you used to exult unduly on the earth and because you used to walk exultantly.’
75.transliteration: dhālikum bi-mā kuntum tafraḥūna fī l-ʾarḍi bi-ghayri l-ḥaqqi wa-bi-mā kuntum tamraḥūna

76.content: ادخُلوا أَبوابَ جَهَنَّمَ خالِدينَ فيها ۖ فَبِئسَ مَثوَى المُتَكَبِّرينَ
76.translation_eng: Enter the gates of hell, to remain in it [forever].’ Evil is the [final] abode of the arrogant.
76.transliteration: udkhulū ʾabwāba jahannama khālidīna fīhā fa-biʾsa mathwā l-mutakabbirīna

77.content: فَاصبِر إِنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ ۚ فَإِمّا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعضَ الَّذي نَعِدُهُم أَو نَتَوَفَّيَنَّكَ فَإِلَينا يُرجَعونَ
77.translation_eng: So be patient! Allah’s promise is indeed true. Whether We show you a part of what We promise them, or take you away [before that], [in any case] they will be brought back to Us.
77.transliteration: fa-ṣbir ʾinna waʿda llāhi ḥaqqun fa-ʾimmā nuriyannaka baʿḍa lladhī naʿiduhum ʾaw natawaffayannaka fa-ʾilaynā yurjaʿūna

78.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا رُسُلًا مِن قَبلِكَ مِنهُم مَن قَصَصنا عَلَيكَ وَمِنهُم مَن لَم نَقصُص عَلَيكَ ۗ وَما كانَ لِرَسولٍ أَن يَأتِيَ بِآيَةٍ إِلّا بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ ۚ فَإِذا جاءَ أَمرُ اللَّهِ قُضِيَ بِالحَقِّ وَخَسِرَ هُنالِكَ المُبطِلونَ
78.translation_eng: Certainly We have sent apostles before you. Of them are those We have recounted to you, and of them are those We have not recounted to you. An apostle may not bring any sign except by Allah’s permission. Hence when Allah’s edict comes, judgment is made with justice, and it is thence that the falsifiers become losers.
78.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā rusulan min qablika minhum man qaṣaṣnā ʿalayka wa-minhum man lam naqṣuṣ ʿalayka wa-mā kāna li-rasūlin ʾan yaʾtiya bi-ʾāyatin ʾillā bi-ʾidhni llāhi fa-ʾidhā jāʾa ʾamru llāhi quḍiya bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-khasira hunālika l-mubṭilūna

79.content: اللَّهُ الَّذي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الأَنعامَ لِتَركَبوا مِنها وَمِنها تَأكُلونَ
79.translation_eng: It is Allah who created the cattle for you that you may ride some of them, and some of them you eat;
79.transliteration: allāhu lladhī jaʿala lakumu l-ʾanʿāma li-tarkabū minhā wa-minhā taʾkulūna

80.content: وَلَكُم فيها مَنافِعُ وَلِتَبلُغوا عَلَيها حاجَةً في صُدورِكُم وَعَلَيها وَعَلَى الفُلكِ تُحمَلونَ
80.translation_eng: and there are [numerous] uses in them for you, and that over them1 you may satisfy any need that is in your breasts, and you are carried on them and on ships.That is, by riding them or by using them as beasts of burden.
80.transliteration: wa-lakum fīhā manāfiʿu wa-li-tablughū ʿalayhā ḥājatan fī ṣudūrikum wa-ʿalayhā wa-ʿalā l-fulki tuḥmalūna

81.content: وَيُريكُم آياتِهِ فَأَيَّ آياتِ اللَّهِ تُنكِرونَ
81.translation_eng: He shows you His signs. So which of the signs of Allah do you deny?
81.transliteration: wa-yurīkum ʾāyātihī fa-ʾayya ʾāyāti llāhi tunkirūna

82.content: أَفَلَم يَسيروا فِي الأَرضِ فَيَنظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ كانوا أَكثَرَ مِنهُم وَأَشَدَّ قُوَّةً وَآثارًا فِي الأَرضِ فَما أَغنىٰ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
82.translation_eng: Have they not travelled over the land so that they may observe how was the fate of those who were before them? They were more numerous than them and were greater [than them] in power and with respect to the effects [they left] in the land. But what they used to earn did not avail them.
82.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lam yasīrū fī l-ʾarḍi fa-yanẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu lladhīna min qablihim kānū ʾakthara minhum wa-ʾashadda quwwatan wa-ʾāthāran fī l-ʾarḍi fa-mā ʾaghnā ʿanhum mā kānū yaksibūna

83.content: فَلَمّا جاءَتهُم رُسُلُهُم بِالبَيِّناتِ فَرِحوا بِما عِندَهُم مِنَ العِلمِ وَحاقَ بِهِم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
83.translation_eng: When their apostles brought them manifest proofs, they exulted in the knowledge they possessed, and they were besieged by what they used to deride.
83.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾathum rusuluhum bi-l-bayyināti fariḥū bi-mā ʿindahum mina l-ʿilmi wa-ḥāqa bihim mā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

84.content: فَلَمّا رَأَوا بَأسَنا قالوا آمَنّا بِاللَّهِ وَحدَهُ وَكَفَرنا بِما كُنّا بِهِ مُشرِكينَ
84.translation_eng: Then, when they sighted Our punishment, they said, ‘We believe in Allah alone, and disavow what we used to take as His partners.’
84.transliteration: fa-lammā raʾaw baʾsanā qālū ʾāmannā bi-llāhi waḥdahū wa-kafarnā bi-mā kunnā bihī mushrikīna

85.content: فَلَم يَكُ يَنفَعُهُم إيمانُهُم لَمّا رَأَوا بَأسَنا ۖ سُنَّتَ اللَّهِ الَّتي قَد خَلَت في عِبادِهِ ۖ وَخَسِرَ هُنالِكَ الكافِرونَ
85.translation_eng: But their faith was of no benefit to them when they sighted Our punishment —Allah’s precedent which has passed among His servants, and it is thence that the faithless will be losers.
85.transliteration: fa-lam yaku yanfaʿuhum ʾīmānuhum lammā raʾaw baʾsanā sunnata llāhi llatī qad khalat fī ʿibādihī wa-khasira hunālika l-kāfirūna

41.description: The surah that describes the Quran as Elaborated Heavenly revelation for those who would give it heed. It takes its name from the word “elaborated” (fuṣṣilat) in verse 3 and again in verse 44. The surah deals with the obduracy of the disbelievers, the truthfulness of the Quran, the unity of God, and the inevitability of Resurrection. The surah makes several references to the senses (verse 5, verse 20 . and verse 44) which the disbelievers shut o from perceiving the Truth in this world, and which will then testify against their “owners” on the Day of Resurrection, and it describes the arrogance displayed by people when all is well, contrasted with their humility and despair when diiculties strike (verse 49 .).The surah is also known as: (Signs) Spelled Out, (Verses) Made Distinct, Adoration, Clearly Spelled Out, Distinguished, Made Plain, Revelations Well Expounded, The Lucidly Distinct, The Well-Explained.

1.translation_eng: Ḥā, Mīm:

2.translation_eng: A [gradually] sent down [revelation] from the All-beneficent, the All-merciful,

3.content: كِتابٌ فُصِّلَت آياتُهُ قُرآنًا عَرَبِيًّا لِقَومٍ يَعلَمونَ
3.translation_eng: [this is] a Book whose signs have been elaborated, an Arabic Qurʾān, for a people who have knowledge,
3.transliteration: kitābun fuṣṣilat ʾāyātuhū qurʾānan ʿarabiyyan li-qawmin yaʿlamūna

4.content: بَشيرًا وَنَذيرًا فَأَعرَضَ أَكثَرُهُم فَهُم لا يَسمَعونَ
4.translation_eng: a bearer of good news and a warner. But most of them turn away [from it], [and] so they do not listen.
4.transliteration: bashīran wa-nadhīran fa-ʾaʿraḍa ʾaktharuhum fa-hum lā yasmaʿūna

5.content: وَقالوا قُلوبُنا في أَكِنَّةٍ مِمّا تَدعونا إِلَيهِ وَفي آذانِنا وَقرٌ وَمِن بَينِنا وَبَينِكَ حِجابٌ فَاعمَل إِنَّنا عامِلونَ
5.translation_eng: They say, ‘Our hearts are in veils [which shut them off] from what you invite us to, and there is a deafness in our ears, and there is a curtain between us and you. So act [as your faith requires]; we too are acting [according to our own].’
5.transliteration: wa-qālū qulūbunā fī ʾakinnatin mimmā tadʿūnā ʾilayhi wa-fī ʾādhāninā waqrun wa-min bayninā wa-baynika ḥijābun fa-ʿmal ʾinnanā ʿāmilūna

6.content: قُل إِنَّما أَنا بَشَرٌ مِثلُكُم يوحىٰ إِلَيَّ أَنَّما إِلٰهُكُم إِلٰهٌ واحِدٌ فَاستَقيموا إِلَيهِ وَاستَغفِروهُ ۗ وَوَيلٌ لِلمُشرِكينَ
6.translation_eng: Say, ‘I am just a human being like you. It has been revealed to me that your God is the One God. So be steadfast toward Him and plead to Him for forgiveness.’ And woe to the polytheists
6.transliteration: qul ʾinnamā ʾana basharun mithlukum yūḥā ʾilayya ʾannamā ʾilāhukum ʾilāhun wāḥidun fa-staqīmū ʾilayhi wa-staghfirūhu wa-waylun li-l-mushrikīna

7.content: الَّذينَ لا يُؤتونَ الزَّكاةَ وَهُم بِالآخِرَةِ هُم كافِرونَ
7.translation_eng: —those who do not pay the zakāt and disbelieve in the Hereafter.
7.transliteration: alladhīna lā yuʾtūna z-zakāta wa-hum bi-l-ʾākhirati hum kāfirūna

8.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ لَهُم أَجرٌ غَيرُ مَمنونٍ
8.translation_eng: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds, there will be an everlasting reward for them.
8.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti lahum ʾajrun ghayru mamnūnin

9.content: ۞ قُل أَئِنَّكُم لَتَكفُرونَ بِالَّذي خَلَقَ الأَرضَ في يَومَينِ وَتَجعَلونَ لَهُ أَندادًا ۚ ذٰلِكَ رَبُّ العالَمينَ
9.translation_eng: Say, ‘Do you really disbelieve in Him who created the earth in two days,1 and ascribe partners to Him? That is the Lord of all the worlds!’That is, in two epochs of time.
9.transliteration: qul ʾa-ʾinnakum la-takfurūna bi-lladhī khalaqa l-ʾarḍa fī yawmayni wa-tajʿalūna lahū ʾandādan dhālika rabbu l-ʿālamīna

10.content: وَجَعَلَ فيها رَواسِيَ مِن فَوقِها وَبارَكَ فيها وَقَدَّرَ فيها أَقواتَها في أَربَعَةِ أَيّامٍ سَواءً لِلسّائِلينَ
10.translation_eng: He set in it firm mountains [rising] above it, and blessed it and ordained therein its [various] means of sustenance in four days, alike for all the seekers [of the means of sustenance].
10.transliteration: wa-jaʿala fīhā rawāsiya min fawqihā wa-bāraka fīhā wa-qaddara fīhā ʾaqwātahā fī ʾarbaʿati ʾayyāmin sawāʾan li-s-sāʾilīna

11.content: ثُمَّ استَوىٰ إِلَى السَّماءِ وَهِيَ دُخانٌ فَقالَ لَها وَلِلأَرضِ ائتِيا طَوعًا أَو كَرهًا قالَتا أَتَينا طائِعينَ
11.translation_eng: Then He turned to the heaven, and it was smoke, and He said to it and to the earth, ‘Come! Willingly or unwillingly!’ They said, ‘We come heartily.’
11.transliteration: thumma stawā ʾilā s-samāʾi wa-hiya dukhānun fa-qāla lahā wa-li-l-ʾarḍi ʾtiyā ṭawʿan ʾaw karhan qālatā ʾataynā ṭāʾiʿīna

12.content: فَقَضاهُنَّ سَبعَ سَماواتٍ في يَومَينِ وَأَوحىٰ في كُلِّ سَماءٍ أَمرَها ۚ وَزَيَّنَّا السَّماءَ الدُّنيا بِمَصابيحَ وَحِفظًا ۚ ذٰلِكَ تَقديرُ العَزيزِ العَليمِ
12.translation_eng: Then He set them up as seven heavens in two days, and revealed in each heaven its ordinance.1 We have adorned the lowest heaven with lamps, and guarded them.2 That is the ordaining of the All-mighty, the All-knowing.Or ‘law.’Cf. 37:6-7; 67:5.
12.transliteration: fa-qaḍāhunna sabʿa samāwātin fī yawmayni wa-ʾawḥā fī kulli samāʾin ʾamrahā wa-zayyannā s-samāʾa d-dunyā bi-maṣābīḥa wa-ḥifẓan dhālika taqdīru l-ʿazīzi l-ʿalīmi

13.content: فَإِن أَعرَضوا فَقُل أَنذَرتُكُم صاعِقَةً مِثلَ صاعِقَةِ عادٍ وَثَمودَ
13.translation_eng: But if they turn away, say, ‘I warn you of a thunderbolt, like the thunderbolt of ʿĀd and Thamūd.’
13.transliteration: fa-ʾin ʾaʿraḍū fa-qul ʾandhartukum ṣāʿiqatan mithla ṣāʿiqati ʿādin wa-thamūda

14.content: إِذ جاءَتهُمُ الرُّسُلُ مِن بَينِ أَيديهِم وَمِن خَلفِهِم أَلّا تَعبُدوا إِلَّا اللَّهَ ۖ قالوا لَو شاءَ رَبُّنا لَأَنزَلَ مَلائِكَةً فَإِنّا بِما أُرسِلتُم بِهِ كافِرونَ
14.translation_eng: When the apostles came to them, before them and in their own time,1 saying, ‘Worship no one except Allah!’ They said, ‘Had our Lord wished, He would certainly have sent down angels [to us]. We indeed disbelieve in what you have been sent with.’That is, during the times of their forefathers and in their own time. Or ‘from their front and behind,’ that is, from all sides.
14.transliteration: ʾidh jāʾathumu r-rusulu min bayni ʾaydīhim wa-min khalfihim ʾallā taʿbudū ʾillā llāha qālū law shāʾa rabbunā la-ʾanzala malāʾikatan fa-ʾinnā bi-mā ʾursiltum bihī kāfirūna

15.content: فَأَمّا عادٌ فَاستَكبَروا فِي الأَرضِ بِغَيرِ الحَقِّ وَقالوا مَن أَشَدُّ مِنّا قُوَّةً ۖ أَوَلَم يَرَوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ الَّذي خَلَقَهُم هُوَ أَشَدُّ مِنهُم قُوَّةً ۖ وَكانوا بِآياتِنا يَجحَدونَ
15.translation_eng: As for [the people of] ʿĀd, they acted arrogantly in the earth unduly, and they said, ‘Who is more powerful than us?’ Did they not see that Allah, who created them, is more powerful than them? They used to impugn Our signs;
15.transliteration: fa-ʾammā ʿādun fa-stakbarū fī l-ʾarḍi bi-ghayri l-ḥaqqi wa-qālū man ʾashaddu minnā quwwatan ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾanna llāha lladhī khalaqahum huwa ʾashaddu minhum quwwatan wa-kānū bi-ʾāyātinā yajḥadūna

16.content: فَأَرسَلنا عَلَيهِم ريحًا صَرصَرًا في أَيّامٍ نَحِساتٍ لِنُذيقَهُم عَذابَ الخِزيِ فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۖ وَلَعَذابُ الآخِرَةِ أَخزىٰ ۖ وَهُم لا يُنصَرونَ
16.translation_eng: so We unleashed upon them an icy gale during ill-fated days, that We might make them taste the punishment of disgrace in the life of the world. Yet the punishment of the Hereafter is surely more disgraceful, and they will not be helped.
16.transliteration: fa-ʾarsalnā ʿalayhim rīḥan ṣarṣaran fī ʾayyāmin naḥisātin li-nudhīqahum ʿadhāba l-khizyi fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-la-ʿadhābu l-ʾākhirati ʾakhzā wa-hum lā yunṣarūna

17.content: وَأَمّا ثَمودُ فَهَدَيناهُم فَاستَحَبُّوا العَمىٰ عَلَى الهُدىٰ فَأَخَذَتهُم صاعِقَةُ العَذابِ الهونِ بِما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
17.translation_eng: As for [the people of] Thamūd, We guided them, but they preferred blindness to guidance. So the bolt of a humiliating punishment seized them because of what they used to earn.
17.transliteration: wa-ʾammā thamūdu fa-hadaynāhum fa-staḥabbū l-ʿamā ʿalā l-hudā fa-ʾakhadhathum ṣāʿiqatu l-ʿadhābi l-hūni bi-mā kānū yaksibūna

18.content: وَنَجَّينَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَكانوا يَتَّقونَ
18.translation_eng: And We delivered those who had faith and were Godwary.
18.transliteration: wa-najjaynā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-kānū yattaqūna

19.content: وَيَومَ يُحشَرُ أَعداءُ اللَّهِ إِلَى النّارِ فَهُم يوزَعونَ
19.translation_eng: The day when the enemies of Allah are marched out toward the Fire, and they shall be held in check.
19.transliteration: wa-yawma yuḥsharu ʾaʿdāʾu llāhi ʾilā n-nāri fa-hum yūzaʿūna

20.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا ما جاءوها شَهِدَ عَلَيهِم سَمعُهُم وَأَبصارُهُم وَجُلودُهُم بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
20.translation_eng: When they come to it, their hearing will bear witness against them and their sight and their skins concerning what they used to do.
20.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā mā jāʾūhā shahida ʿalayhim samʿuhum wa-ʾabṣāruhum wa-julūduhum bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūna

21.content: وَقالوا لِجُلودِهِم لِمَ شَهِدتُم عَلَينا ۖ قالوا أَنطَقَنَا اللَّهُ الَّذي أَنطَقَ كُلَّ شَيءٍ وَهُوَ خَلَقَكُم أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ وَإِلَيهِ تُرجَعونَ
21.translation_eng: They will say to their skins, ‘Why did you bear witness against us?’ They will say, ‘We were given speech by Allah, who gave speech to all things. He created you the first time, and to Him you are being brought back.
21.transliteration: wa-qālū li-julūdihim li-ma shahidtum ʿalaynā qālū ʾanṭaqanā llāhu lladhī ʾanṭaqa kulla shayʾin wa-huwa khalaqakum ʾawwala marratin wa-ʾilayhi turjaʿūna

22.content: وَما كُنتُم تَستَتِرونَ أَن يَشهَدَ عَلَيكُم سَمعُكُم وَلا أَبصارُكُم وَلا جُلودُكُم وَلٰكِن ظَنَنتُم أَنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَعلَمُ كَثيرًا مِمّا تَعمَلونَ
22.translation_eng: You did not use to conceal yourselves lest your hearing should bear witness against you, or [for that matter] your sight, or your skin, but you thought that Allah did not know most of what you did.
22.transliteration: wa-mā kuntum tastatirūna ʾan yashhada ʿalaykum samʿukum wa-lā ʾabṣārukum wa-lā julūdukum wa-lākin ẓanantum ʾanna llāha lā yaʿlamu kathīran mimmā taʿmalūna

23.content: وَذٰلِكُم ظَنُّكُمُ الَّذي ظَنَنتُم بِرَبِّكُم أَرداكُم فَأَصبَحتُم مِنَ الخاسِرينَ
23.translation_eng: That misjudgment that you entertained about your Lord ruined you. So you became losers.’
23.transliteration: wa-dhālikum ẓannukumu lladhī ẓanantum bi-rabbikum ʾardākum fa-ʾaṣbaḥtum mina l-khāsirīna

24.content: فَإِن يَصبِروا فَالنّارُ مَثوًى لَهُم ۖ وَإِن يَستَعتِبوا فَما هُم مِنَ المُعتَبينَ
24.translation_eng: Should they be patient, the Fire is their abode; and should they seek to propitiate, they will not be redeemed.
24.transliteration: fa-ʾin yaṣbirū fa-n-nāru mathwan lahum wa-ʾin yastaʿtibū fa-mā hum mina l-muʿtabīna

25.content: ۞ وَقَيَّضنا لَهُم قُرَناءَ فَزَيَّنوا لَهُم ما بَينَ أَيديهِم وَما خَلفَهُم وَحَقَّ عَلَيهِمُ القَولُ في أُمَمٍ قَد خَلَت مِن قَبلِهِم مِنَ الجِنِّ وَالإِنسِ ۖ إِنَّهُم كانوا خاسِرينَ
25.translation_eng: We have assigned them companions who make to seem decorous to them whatever is before them1 and whatever is behind them,2 and the word became due against them,3 as it did against the nations that passed away before them of jinn and humans. They were indeed losers.That is, their conduct in the life of the world.That is, concerning the Hereafter, or the legacy they leave behind.Cf. 7:18; 11:119; 17:16; 23:27; 27:82; 28:63; 32:13; 36:7, 70; 38:85/a>; 41:25; 46:18.
25.transliteration: wa-qayyaḍnā lahum quranāʾa fa-zayyanū lahum mā bayna ʾaydīhim wa-mā khalfahum wa-ḥaqqa ʿalayhimu l-qawlu fī ʾumamin qad khalat min qablihim mina l-jinni wa-l-ʾinsi ʾinnahum kānū khāsirīna

26.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لا تَسمَعوا لِهٰذَا القُرآنِ وَالغَوا فيهِ لَعَلَّكُم تَغلِبونَ
26.translation_eng: The faithless say, ‘Do not listen to this Qurʾān and hoot it down so that you may prevail [over the Apostle].’
26.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna kafarū lā tasmaʿū li-hādhā l-qurʾāni wa-lghaw fīhi laʿallakum taghlibūna

27.content: فَلَنُذيقَنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا عَذابًا شَديدًا وَلَنَجزِيَنَّهُم أَسوَأَ الَّذي كانوا يَعمَلونَ
27.translation_eng: We will surely make the faithless taste a severe punishment, and We will surely requite them by the worst of what they used to do.
