27.transliteration: fa-la-nudhīqanna lladhīna kafarū ʿadhāban shadīdan wa-la-najziyannahum ʾaswaʾa lladhī kānū yaʿmalūna

28.content: ذٰلِكَ جَزاءُ أَعداءِ اللَّهِ النّارُ ۖ لَهُم فيها دارُ الخُلدِ ۖ جَزاءً بِما كانوا بِآياتِنا يَجحَدونَ
28.translation_eng: That is the requital of the enemies of Allah —the Fire! In it they will have an everlasting abode, as a requital for their impugning Our signs.
28.transliteration: dhālika jazāʾu ʾaʿdāʾi llāhi n-nāru lahum fīhā dāru l-khuldi jazāʾan bi-mā kānū bi-ʾāyātinā yajḥadūna

29.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا رَبَّنا أَرِنَا اللَّذَينِ أَضَلّانا مِنَ الجِنِّ وَالإِنسِ نَجعَلهُما تَحتَ أَقدامِنا لِيَكونا مِنَ الأَسفَلينَ
29.translation_eng: The faithless will say, ‘Our Lord! Show us those who led us astray from among jinn and humans so that we may trample them under our feet, so that they may be among the lowermost!’
29.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna kafarū rabbanā ʾarinā lladhayni ʾaḍallānā mina l-jinni wa-l-ʾinsi najʿalhumā taḥta ʾaqdāminā li-yakūnā mina l-ʾasfalīna

30.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ قالوا رَبُّنَا اللَّهُ ثُمَّ استَقاموا تَتَنَزَّلُ عَلَيهِمُ المَلائِكَةُ أَلّا تَخافوا وَلا تَحزَنوا وَأَبشِروا بِالجَنَّةِ الَّتي كُنتُم توعَدونَ
30.translation_eng: Indeed those who say, ‘Our Lord is Allah!’ and then remain steadfast, the angels descend upon them, [saying,] ‘Do not fear, nor be grieved! Receive the good news of the paradise which you have been promised.
30.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna qālū rabbunā llāhu thumma staqāmū tatanazzalu ʿalayhimu l-malāʾikatu ʾallā takhāfū wa-lā taḥzanū wa-ʾabshirū bi-l-jannati llatī kuntum tūʿadūna

31.content: نَحنُ أَولِياؤُكُم فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا وَفِي الآخِرَةِ ۖ وَلَكُم فيها ما تَشتَهي أَنفُسُكُم وَلَكُم فيها ما تَدَّعونَ
31.translation_eng: We are your friends in the life of this world and in the Hereafter, and you will have in it whatever your souls desire, and you will have in it whatever you ask for,
31.transliteration: naḥnu ʾawliyāʾukum fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-fī l-ʾākhirati wa-lakum fīhā mā tashtahī ʾanfusukum wa-lakum fīhā mā taddaʿūna

32.content: نُزُلًا مِن غَفورٍ رَحيمٍ
32.translation_eng: as a hospitality from One all-forgiving, all-merciful.’
32.transliteration: nuzulan min ghafūrin raḥīmin

33.content: وَمَن أَحسَنُ قَولًا مِمَّن دَعا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَعَمِلَ صالِحًا وَقالَ إِنَّني مِنَ المُسلِمينَ
33.translation_eng: Who has a better call than him who summons to Allah and acts righteously and says, ‘Indeed I am one of the muslims’?
33.transliteration: wa-man ʾaḥsanu qawlan mimman daʿā ʾilā llāhi wa-ʿamila ṣāliḥan wa-qāla ʾinnanī mina l-muslimīna

34.content: وَلا تَستَوِي الحَسَنَةُ وَلَا السَّيِّئَةُ ۚ ادفَع بِالَّتي هِيَ أَحسَنُ فَإِذَا الَّذي بَينَكَ وَبَينَهُ عَداوَةٌ كَأَنَّهُ وَلِيٌّ حَميمٌ
34.translation_eng: Good and evil [conduct] are not equal.1 Repel [evil] with what is best. [If you do so,] behold, he between whom and you was enmity, will be as though he were a sympathetic friend.Or ‘virtue and vice are not equal.’
34.transliteration: wa-lā tastawī l-ḥasanatu wa-lā s-sayyiʾatu dfaʿ bi-llatī hiya ʾaḥsanu fa-ʾidhā lladhī baynaka wa-baynahū ʿadāwatun ka-ʾannahū waliyyun ḥamīmun

35.content: وَما يُلَقّاها إِلَّا الَّذينَ صَبَروا وَما يُلَقّاها إِلّا ذو حَظٍّ عَظيمٍ
35.translation_eng: But none is granted it except those who are patient, and none is granted it except the greatly endowed.
35.transliteration: wa-mā yulaqqāhā ʾillā lladhīna ṣabarū wa-mā yulaqqāhā ʾillā dhū ḥaẓẓin ʿaẓīmin

36.content: وَإِمّا يَنزَغَنَّكَ مِنَ الشَّيطانِ نَزغٌ فَاستَعِذ بِاللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
36.translation_eng: Should a temptation from Satan disturb you, seek the protection of Allah. Indeed He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
36.transliteration: wa-ʾimmā yanzaghannaka mina sh-shayṭāni nazghun fa-staʿidh bi-llāhi ʾinnahū huwa s-samīʿu l-ʿalīmu

37.content: وَمِن آياتِهِ اللَّيلُ وَالنَّهارُ وَالشَّمسُ وَالقَمَرُ ۚ لا تَسجُدوا لِلشَّمسِ وَلا لِلقَمَرِ وَاسجُدوا لِلَّهِ الَّذي خَلَقَهُنَّ إِن كُنتُم إِيّاهُ تَعبُدونَ
37.translation_eng: Among His signs are the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. Do not prostrate to the sun, nor to the moon, but prostrate to Allah who created them, if it is Him that you worship.
37.transliteration: wa-min ʾāyātihi l-laylu wa-n-nahāru wa-sh-shamsu wa-l-qamaru lā tasjudū li-sh-shamsi wa-lā li-l-qamari wa-sjudū li-llāhi lladhī khalaqahunna ʾin kuntum ʾiyyāhu taʿbudūna

38.content: فَإِنِ استَكبَروا فَالَّذينَ عِندَ رَبِّكَ يُسَبِّحونَ لَهُ بِاللَّيلِ وَالنَّهارِ وَهُم لا يَسأَمونَ ۩
38.translation_eng: But if they disdain [the worship of Allah], those who are near your Lord glorify Him night and day, and they are not wearied.
38.transliteration: fa-ʾini stakbarū fa-lladhīna ʿinda rabbika yusabbiḥūna lahū bi-l-layli wa-n-nahāri wa-hum lā yasʾamūna

39.content: وَمِن آياتِهِ أَنَّكَ تَرَى الأَرضَ خاشِعَةً فَإِذا أَنزَلنا عَلَيهَا الماءَ اهتَزَّت وَرَبَت ۚ إِنَّ الَّذي أَحياها لَمُحيِي المَوتىٰ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
39.translation_eng: Among His signs is that you see the earth desolate; but when We send down water upon it, it stirs and swells. Indeed He who revives it is the reviver of the dead. Indeed He has power over all things.
39.transliteration: wa-min ʾāyātihī ʾannaka tarā l-ʾarḍa khāshiʿatan fa-ʾidhā ʾanzalnā ʿalayhā l-māʾa htazzat wa-rabat ʾinna lladhī ʾaḥyāhā la-muḥyi l-mawtā ʾinnahū ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

40.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يُلحِدونَ في آياتِنا لا يَخفَونَ عَلَينا ۗ أَفَمَن يُلقىٰ فِي النّارِ خَيرٌ أَم مَن يَأتي آمِنًا يَومَ القِيامَةِ ۚ اعمَلوا ما شِئتُم ۖ إِنَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ بَصيرٌ
40.translation_eng: Indeed those who commit sacrilege in Our signs are not hidden from Us. Is someone who is cast in the Fire better off, or someone who arrives safely on the Day of Resurrection? Act as you wish; indeed He sees best what you do.
40.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna yulḥidūna fī ʾāyātinā lā yakhfawna ʿalaynā ʾa-fa-man yulqā fī n-nāri khayrun ʾam man yaʾtī ʾāminan yawma l-qiyāmati ʿmalū mā shiʾtum ʾinnahū bi-mā taʿmalūna baṣīrun

41.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِالذِّكرِ لَمّا جاءَهُم ۖ وَإِنَّهُ لَكِتابٌ عَزيزٌ
41.translation_eng: Indeed those who defy the Reminder when it comes to them… .1 Indeed it is an august Book:Ellipsis. The phrase omitted, considering the context, is, ‘will face a severe punishment.’
41.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna kafarū bi-dh-dhikri lammā jāʾahum wa-ʾinnahū la-kitābun ʿazīzun

42.content: لا يَأتيهِ الباطِلُ مِن بَينِ يَدَيهِ وَلا مِن خَلفِهِ ۖ تَنزيلٌ مِن حَكيمٍ حَميدٍ
42.translation_eng: falsehood cannot approach it, from before it nor from behind it, a [gradually] sent down [revelation] from One all-wise, all-laudable.
42.transliteration: lā yaʾtīhi l-bāṭilu min bayni yadayhi wa-lā min khalfihī tanzīlun min ḥakīmin ḥamīdin

43.content: ما يُقالُ لَكَ إِلّا ما قَد قيلَ لِلرُّسُلِ مِن قَبلِكَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذو مَغفِرَةٍ وَذو عِقابٍ أَليمٍ
43.translation_eng: Nothing is said to you except what has already been said [earlier] to the apostles before you. Indeed your Lord is forgiving and One who metes out a painful retribution.
43.transliteration: mā yuqālu laka ʾillā mā qad qīla li-r-rusuli min qablika ʾinna rabbaka la-dhū maghfiratin wa-dhū ʿiqābin ʾalīmin

44.content: وَلَو جَعَلناهُ قُرآنًا أَعجَمِيًّا لَقالوا لَولا فُصِّلَت آياتُهُ ۖ أَأَعجَمِيٌّ وَعَرَبِيٌّ ۗ قُل هُوَ لِلَّذينَ آمَنوا هُدًى وَشِفاءٌ ۖ وَالَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ في آذانِهِم وَقرٌ وَهُوَ عَلَيهِم عَمًى ۚ أُولٰئِكَ يُنادَونَ مِن مَكانٍ بَعيدٍ
44.translation_eng: Had We made it a non-Arabic1 Qurʾān, they2 would have surely said, ‘Why have not its signs been articulated?’ ‘What! A non-Arabian [scripture]3 and an Arabian [prophet]!?’ Say, ‘For those who have faith, it is a guidance and healing; but as for those who are faithless, there is a deafness in their ears and it is lost to their sight.’ They are [as if they were] called from a distant place.Or ‘a barbaric Qurʾān;’ that is, in a language other than articulate literary Arabic.That is, the Arabs.Or ‘a barbaric scripture.’
44.transliteration: wa-law jaʿalnāhu qurʾānan ʾaʿjamiyyan la-qālū law-lā fuṣṣilat ʾāyātuhū ʾa-aʿjamiyyun wa-ʿarabiyyun qul huwa li-lladhīna ʾāmanū hudan wa-shifāʾun wa-lladhīna lā yuʾminūna fī ʾādhānihim waqrun wa-huwa ʿalayhim ʿaman ʾulāʾika yunādawna min makānin baʿīdin

45.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسَى الكِتابَ فَاختُلِفَ فيهِ ۗ وَلَولا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَت مِن رَبِّكَ لَقُضِيَ بَينَهُم ۚ وَإِنَّهُم لَفي شَكٍّ مِنهُ مُريبٍ
45.translation_eng: Certainly We gave Moses the Book, but differences arose about it; and were it not for a prior decree of your Lord, judgement would have been made between them, for they are indeed in grave doubt concerning it.
45.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā mūsā l-kitāba fa-khtulifa fīhi wa-law-lā kalimatun sabaqat min rabbika la-quḍiya baynahum wa-ʾinnahum la-fī shakkin minhu murībin

46.content: مَن عَمِلَ صالِحًا فَلِنَفسِهِ ۖ وَمَن أَساءَ فَعَلَيها ۗ وَما رَبُّكَ بِظَلّامٍ لِلعَبيدِ
46.translation_eng: Whoever acts righteously, it is for his own soul, and whoever does evil, it is to its detriment, and your Lord is not tyrannical to the servants.
46.transliteration: man ʿamila ṣāliḥan fa-li-nafsihī wa-man ʾasāʾa fa-ʿalayhā wa-mā rabbuka bi-ẓallāmin li-l-ʿabīdi

47.content: ۞ إِلَيهِ يُرَدُّ عِلمُ السّاعَةِ ۚ وَما تَخرُجُ مِن ثَمَراتٍ مِن أَكمامِها وَما تَحمِلُ مِن أُنثىٰ وَلا تَضَعُ إِلّا بِعِلمِهِ ۚ وَيَومَ يُناديهِم أَينَ شُرَكائي قالوا آذَنّاكَ ما مِنّا مِن شَهيدٍ
47.translation_eng: On Him devolves the knowledge of the Hour, and no fruit emerges from its covering and no female conceives or delivers except with His knowledge. On the day when He will call out to them, ‘Where are My partners?’ They will say, ‘We have apprised You that there is no witness amongst us.’
47.transliteration: ʾilayhi yuraddu ʿilmu s-sāʿati wa-mā takhruju min thamarātin min ʾakmāmihā wa-mā taḥmilu min ʾunthā wa-lā taḍaʿu ʾillā bi-ʿilmihī wa-yawma yunādīhim ʾayna shurakāʾī qālū ʾādhannāka mā minnā min shahīdin

48.content: وَضَلَّ عَنهُم ما كانوا يَدعونَ مِن قَبلُ ۖ وَظَنّوا ما لَهُم مِن مَحيصٍ
48.translation_eng: What they used to invoke before has forsaken them, and they know there is no escape for them.
48.transliteration: wa-ḍalla ʿanhum mā kānū yadʿūna min qablu wa-ẓannū mā lahum min maḥīṣin

49.content: لا يَسأَمُ الإِنسانُ مِن دُعاءِ الخَيرِ وَإِن مَسَّهُ الشَّرُّ فَيَئوسٌ قَنوطٌ
49.translation_eng: Man is never wearied of supplicating for good, and should any ill befall him, he becomes hopeless, despondent.
49.transliteration: lā yasʾamu l-ʾinsānu min duʿāʾi l-khayri wa-ʾin massahu sh-sharru fa-yaʾūsun qanūṭun

50.content: وَلَئِن أَذَقناهُ رَحمَةً مِنّا مِن بَعدِ ضَرّاءَ مَسَّتهُ لَيَقولَنَّ هٰذا لي وَما أَظُنُّ السّاعَةَ قائِمَةً وَلَئِن رُجِعتُ إِلىٰ رَبّي إِنَّ لي عِندَهُ لَلحُسنىٰ ۚ فَلَنُنَبِّئَنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا بِما عَمِلوا وَلَنُذيقَنَّهُم مِن عَذابٍ غَليظٍ
50.translation_eng: And if We let him have a taste of Our mercy after distress has befallen him, he will surely say, ‘This is my due! I do not think the Hour will ever set in, and in case I am returned to my Lord, I will indeed have the best [reward] with Him.’ But We will surely inform the faithless about what they have done, and will surely make them taste a harsh punishment.
50.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin ʾadhaqnāhu raḥmatan minnā min baʿdi ḍarrāʾa massathu la-yaqūlanna hādhā lī wa-mā ʾaẓunnu s-sāʿata qāʾimatan wa-la-ʾin rujiʿtu ʾilā rabbī ʾinna lī ʿindahū la-l-ḥusnā fa-la-nunabbiʾanna lladhīna kafarū bi-mā ʿamilū wa-la-nudhīqannahum min ʿadhābin ghalīẓin

51.content: وَإِذا أَنعَمنا عَلَى الإِنسانِ أَعرَضَ وَنَأىٰ بِجانِبِهِ وَإِذا مَسَّهُ الشَّرُّ فَذو دُعاءٍ عَريضٍ
51.translation_eng: When We bless man, he is disregardful and turns aside; but when an ill befalls him, he makes protracted supplications.
51.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā ʾanʿamnā ʿalā l-ʾinsāni ʾaʿraḍa wa-naʾā bi-jānibihī wa-ʾidhā massahu sh-sharru fa-dhū duʿāʾin ʿarīḍin

52.content: قُل أَرَأَيتُم إِن كانَ مِن عِندِ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ كَفَرتُم بِهِ مَن أَضَلُّ مِمَّن هُوَ في شِقاقٍ بَعيدٍ
52.translation_eng: Say, ‘Tell me, if it is from Allah and you disbelieve in it, who will be more astray than someone who is in extreme defiance.’
52.transliteration: qul ʾa-raʾaytum ʾin kāna min ʿindi llāhi thumma kafartum bihī man ʾaḍallu mimman huwa fī shiqāqin baʿīdin

53.content: سَنُريهِم آياتِنا فِي الآفاقِ وَفي أَنفُسِهِم حَتّىٰ يَتَبَيَّنَ لَهُم أَنَّهُ الحَقُّ ۗ أَوَلَم يَكفِ بِرَبِّكَ أَنَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ شَهيدٌ
53.translation_eng: Soon We shall show them Our signs in the horizons and in their own souls until it becomes clear to them that He is the Real.1 Is it not sufficient that your Lord is witness to all things?Or ‘until it becomes clear to them that it [i.e. the Qurʾān, or Islam] (or he) [i.e. the Apostle] is the truth.’
53.transliteration: sa-nurīhim ʾāyātinā fī l-ʾāfāqi wa-fī ʾanfusihim ḥattā yatabayyana lahum ʾannahu l-ḥaqqu ʾa-wa-lam yakfi bi-rabbika ʾannahū ʿalā kulli shayʾin shahīdun

54.content: أَلا إِنَّهُم في مِريَةٍ مِن لِقاءِ رَبِّهِم ۗ أَلا إِنَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ مُحيطٌ
54.translation_eng: Look! They are indeed in doubt about the encounter with their Lord! Look! He indeed comprehends all things!
54.transliteration: ʾa-lā ʾinnahum fī miryatin min liqāʾi rabbihim ʾa-lā ʾinnahū bi-kulli shayʾin muḥīṭun

42.description: The surah that mentions mutual Consultation among the believers as the godly means by which to conduct their aairs and as a virtuous sign that they will gain the reward of God in the Hereafter. It takes its name from verse 38 concerning “counsel” (shūrā). The surah discusses man’s habit of creating division and disharmony in matters of religion, and God’s all-prevailing power, wisdom, and final decision. The unity of religion is stressed (verse 13) as is the continuity of the prophets (verse 3). The Prophet is reminded that he cannot compel people to believe, that they will be judged according to their deeds, and that he is only there to deliver the message. The nature of revelation is described in verse 51 .The surah is also known as: The Counsel.

1.translation_eng: Ḥā, Mīm,

2.translation_eng: ʿAyn, Sīn, Qāf.

3.content: كَذٰلِكَ يوحي إِلَيكَ وَإِلَى الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِكَ اللَّهُ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
3.translation_eng: Thus does He reveal to youand to those who were before you,Allah, the All-mighty, the All-wise:
3.transliteration: ka-dhālika yūḥī ʾilayka wa-ʾilā lladhīna min qablika llāhu l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

4.content: لَهُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ ۖ وَهُوَ العَلِيُّ العَظيمُ
4.translation_eng: to Him belongs whatever is in the heavensand whatever is in the earth,and He is the All-exalted, the All-supreme.
4.transliteration: lahū mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi wa-huwa l-ʿaliyyu l-ʿaẓīmu

5.content: تَكادُ السَّماواتُ يَتَفَطَّرنَ مِن فَوقِهِنَّ ۚ وَالمَلائِكَةُ يُسَبِّحونَ بِحَمدِ رَبِّهِم وَيَستَغفِرونَ لِمَن فِي الأَرضِ ۗ أَلا إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الغَفورُ الرَّحيمُ
5.translation_eng: The heavens are about to be rent apartfrom above them,while the angels celebrate the praise of their Lordand plead for forgiveness for those on the earth.Look! Allah is indeed the All-forgiving, the All-merciful!
5.transliteration: takādu s-samāwātu yatafaṭṭarna min fawqihinna wa-l-malāʾikatu yusabbiḥūna bi-ḥamdi rabbihim wa-yastaghfirūna li-man fī l-ʾarḍi ʾa-lā ʾinna llāha huwa l-ghafūru r-raḥīmu

6.content: وَالَّذينَ اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِهِ أَولِياءَ اللَّهُ حَفيظٌ عَلَيهِم وَما أَنتَ عَلَيهِم بِوَكيلٍ
6.translation_eng: As for those who have taken guardians besides Him,Allah is watchful over them,and it is not your duty to watch over them.
6.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ttakhadhū min dūnihī ʾawliyāʾa llāhu ḥafīẓun ʿalayhim wa-mā ʾanta ʿalayhim bi-wakīlin

7.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ قُرآنًا عَرَبِيًّا لِتُنذِرَ أُمَّ القُرىٰ وَمَن حَولَها وَتُنذِرَ يَومَ الجَمعِ لا رَيبَ فيهِ ۚ فَريقٌ فِي الجَنَّةِ وَفَريقٌ فِي السَّعيرِ
7.translation_eng: Thus have We revealed to you an Arabic Qurʾānthat you may warn[the people of] the Mother of the Towns1and those around it,and warn [them] of the Day of Gathering,2in which there is no doubt,[whereupon] a part [of mankind] will be in paradiseand a part will be in the Blaze.That is, the city of Makkah.Cf. 64:9.
7.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika ʾawḥaynā ʾilayka qurʾānan ʿarabiyyan li-tundhira ʾumma l-qurā wa-man ḥawlahā wa-tundhira yawma l-jamʿi lā rayba fīhi farīqun fī l-jannati wa-farīqun fī s-saʿīri

8.content: وَلَو شاءَ اللَّهُ لَجَعَلَهُم أُمَّةً واحِدَةً وَلٰكِن يُدخِلُ مَن يَشاءُ في رَحمَتِهِ ۚ وَالظّالِمونَ ما لَهُم مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلا نَصيرٍ
8.translation_eng: Had Allah wished,He would have surely made them one community;but He admits whomever He wishesinto His mercy,and the wrongdoersdo not have any guardian or helper.
8.transliteration: wa-law shāʾa llāhu la-jaʿalahum ʾummatan wāḥidatan wa-lākin yudkhilu man yashāʾu fī raḥmatihī wa-ẓ-ẓālimūna mā lahum min waliyyin wa-lā naṣīrin

9.content: أَمِ اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِهِ أَولِياءَ ۖ فَاللَّهُ هُوَ الوَلِيُّ وَهُوَ يُحيِي المَوتىٰ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
9.translation_eng: Have they taken guardians besides Him?[Say,] ‘It is Allah who is the Guardian,and He revives the dead,and He has power over all things.
9.transliteration: ʾami ttakhadhū min dūnihī ʾawliyāʾa fa-llāhu huwa l-waliyyu wa-huwa yuḥyi l-mawtā wa-huwa ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

10.content: وَمَا اختَلَفتُم فيهِ مِن شَيءٍ فَحُكمُهُ إِلَى اللَّهِ ۚ ذٰلِكُمُ اللَّهُ رَبّي عَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلتُ وَإِلَيهِ أُنيبُ
10.translation_eng: Whatever thing you may differ about,its judgement is with Allah.That is Allah, my Lord.In Him I have put my trust,and to Him I turn penitently.
10.transliteration: wa-mā khtalaftum fīhi min shayʾin fa-ḥukmuhū ʾilā llāhi dhālikumu llāhu rabbī ʿalayhi tawakkaltu wa-ʾilayhi ʾunību

11.content: فاطِرُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِن أَنفُسِكُم أَزواجًا وَمِنَ الأَنعامِ أَزواجًا ۖ يَذرَؤُكُم فيهِ ۚ لَيسَ كَمِثلِهِ شَيءٌ ۖ وَهُوَ السَّميعُ البَصيرُ
11.translation_eng: The originator of the heavens and the earth,He made for you mates from your own selves,and mates of the cattle,by which means He multiplies you.Nothing is like Him,1and He is the All-hearing, the All-seeing.In case the kāf in ka-mithlihī is not taken as redundant, the meaning will be, ‘There is nothing like His likeness.’
11.transliteration: fāṭiru s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi jaʿala lakum min ʾanfusikum ʾazwājan wa-mina l-ʾanʿāmi ʾazwājan yadhraʾukum fīhi laysa ka-mithlihī shayʾun wa-huwa s-samīʿu l-baṣīru

12.content: لَهُ مَقاليدُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ يَبسُطُ الرِّزقَ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيَقدِرُ ۚ إِنَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَليمٌ
12.translation_eng: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth:He expands the provisionfor whomever He wishes,and tightens it [for whomever He wishes].Indeed He has knowledge of all things.’
12.transliteration: lahū maqālīdu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi yabsuṭu r-rizqa li-man yashāʾu wa-yaqdiru ʾinnahū bi-kulli shayʾin ʿalīmun

13.content: ۞ شَرَعَ لَكُم مِنَ الدّينِ ما وَصّىٰ بِهِ نوحًا وَالَّذي أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ وَما وَصَّينا بِهِ إِبراهيمَ وَموسىٰ وَعيسىٰ ۖ أَن أَقيمُوا الدّينَ وَلا تَتَفَرَّقوا فيهِ ۚ كَبُرَ عَلَى المُشرِكينَ ما تَدعوهُم إِلَيهِ ۚ اللَّهُ يَجتَبي إِلَيهِ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَهدي إِلَيهِ مَن يُنيبُ
13.translation_eng: He has prescribed for you the religionwhich He had enjoined upon Noahand which We have [also] revealed to you,and which We had enjoined upon Abraham,Moses and Jesus,declaring, ‘Maintain the religion,and do not be divided in it.’Hard on the polytheistsis that to which you summon them.Allah chooses for it1 whomever He wishesand He guides to it2 whomever returns penitently.Or ‘for Himself.’Or ‘to Himself.’
13.transliteration: sharaʿa lakum mina d-dīni mā waṣṣā bihī nūḥan wa-lladhī ʾawḥaynā ʾilayka wa-mā waṣṣaynā bihī ʾibrāhīma wa-mūsā wa-ʿīsā ʾan ʾaqīmū d-dīna wa-lā tatafarraqū fīhi kabura ʿalā l-mushrikīna mā tadʿūhum ʾilayhi llāhu yajtabī ʾilayhi man yashāʾu wa-yahdī ʾilayhi man yunību

14.content: وَما تَفَرَّقوا إِلّا مِن بَعدِ ما جاءَهُمُ العِلمُ بَغيًا بَينَهُم ۚ وَلَولا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَت مِن رَبِّكَ إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى لَقُضِيَ بَينَهُم ۚ وَإِنَّ الَّذينَ أورِثُوا الكِتابَ مِن بَعدِهِم لَفي شَكٍّ مِنهُ مُريبٍ
14.translation_eng: They did not divide [into sects]except after the knowledge had come to them,out of envy among themselves;and were it not for a prior decree of your Lord[granting them reprieve] until a specified time,decision would have been made between them.Indeed those who were made heirs to the Bookafter themare surely in grave doubt concerning it.
14.transliteration: wa-mā tafarraqū ʾillā min baʿdi mā jāʾahumu l-ʿilmu baghyan baynahum wa-law-lā kalimatun sabaqat min rabbika ʾilā ʾajalin musamman la-quḍiya baynahum wa-ʾinna lladhīna ʾūrithū l-kitāba min baʿdihim la-fī shakkin minhu murībin

15.content: فَلِذٰلِكَ فَادعُ ۖ وَاستَقِم كَما أُمِرتَ ۖ وَلا تَتَّبِع أَهواءَهُم ۖ وَقُل آمَنتُ بِما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ مِن كِتابٍ ۖ وَأُمِرتُ لِأَعدِلَ بَينَكُمُ ۖ اللَّهُ رَبُّنا وَرَبُّكُم ۖ لَنا أَعمالُنا وَلَكُم أَعمالُكُم ۖ لا حُجَّةَ بَينَنا وَبَينَكُمُ ۖ اللَّهُ يَجمَعُ بَينَنا ۖ وَإِلَيهِ المَصيرُ
15.translation_eng: So summon to this [unity of religion],and be steadfast, just as you have been commanded,and do not follow their desires,and say,‘I believe in whatever Book Allah has sent down.I have been commanded to do justice among you.Allah is our Lord and your Lord.Our deeds belong to usand your deeds belong to you.There is no argument between us and you.Allah will bring us togetherand toward Him is the destination.’
15.transliteration: fa-li-dhālika fa-dʿu wa-staqim ka-mā ʾumirta wa-lā tattabiʿ ʾahwāʾahum wa-qul ʾāmantu bi-mā ʾanzala llāhu min kitābin wa-ʾumirtu li-ʾaʿdila baynakumu llāhu rabbunā wa-rabbukum lanā ʾaʿmālunā wa-lakum ʾaʿmālukum lā ḥujjata baynanā wa-baynakumu llāhu yajmaʿu baynanā wa-ʾilayhi l-maṣīru

16.content: وَالَّذينَ يُحاجّونَ فِي اللَّهِ مِن بَعدِ مَا استُجيبَ لَهُ حُجَّتُهُم داحِضَةٌ عِندَ رَبِّهِم وَعَلَيهِم غَضَبٌ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ شَديدٌ
16.translation_eng: Those who argue concerning Allah,after His call has been answered,their argument stands refuted with their Lord,and upon them shall be [His] wrath,and there is a severe punishment for them.
16.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yuḥājjūna fī llāhi min baʿdi mā stujība lahū ḥujjatuhum dāḥiḍatun ʿinda rabbihim wa-ʿalayhim ghaḍabun wa-lahum ʿadhābun shadīdun-i

17.content: اللَّهُ الَّذي أَنزَلَ الكِتابَ بِالحَقِّ وَالميزانَ ۗ وَما يُدريكَ لَعَلَّ السّاعَةَ قَريبٌ
17.translation_eng: It is Allah who has sent down the Bookwith the truthand [He has sent down] the Balance.What do you know—maybe the Hour is near!
17.transliteration: allāhu lladhī ʾanzala l-kitāba bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-l-mīzāna wa-mā yudrīka laʿalla s-sāʿata qarībun

18.content: يَستَعجِلُ بِهَا الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِها ۖ وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا مُشفِقونَ مِنها وَيَعلَمونَ أَنَّهَا الحَقُّ ۗ أَلا إِنَّ الَّذينَ يُمارونَ فِي السّاعَةِ لَفي ضَلالٍ بَعيدٍ
18.translation_eng: Those who do not believe in it ask [you] to hasten it,but those who have faith are apprehensive of it,and know that it is true.Look! Indeed those who are in doubt about the Hour1are surely in extreme error!Or ‘dispute the Hour.’
18.transliteration: yastaʿjilu bihā lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bihā wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū mushfiqūna minhā wa-yaʿlamūna ʾannahā l-ḥaqqu ʾa-lā ʾinna lladhīna yumārūna fī s-sāʿati la-fī ḍalālin baʿīdin-i

19.content: اللَّهُ لَطيفٌ بِعِبادِهِ يَرزُقُ مَن يَشاءُ ۖ وَهُوَ القَوِيُّ العَزيزُ
19.translation_eng: Allah is all-attentive to His servants.He provides for whomever He wishes,and He is the All-strong, the All-mighty.
19.transliteration: allāhu laṭīfun bi-ʿibādihī yarzuqu man yashāʾu wa-huwa l-qawiyyu l-ʿazīzu

20.content: مَن كانَ يُريدُ حَرثَ الآخِرَةِ نَزِد لَهُ في حَرثِهِ ۖ وَمَن كانَ يُريدُ حَرثَ الدُّنيا نُؤتِهِ مِنها وَما لَهُ فِي الآخِرَةِ مِن نَصيبٍ
20.translation_eng: Whoever desires the tillage of the Hereafter,We will enhance for him his tillage,and whoever desires the tillage of the world,We will give it to him,but he will have no share in the Hereafter.
20.transliteration: man kāna yurīdu ḥartha l-ʾākhirati nazid lahū fī ḥarthihī wa-man kāna yurīdu ḥartha d-dunyā nuʾtihī minhā wa-mā lahū fī l-ʾākhirati min naṣībin

21.content: أَم لَهُم شُرَكاءُ شَرَعوا لَهُم مِنَ الدّينِ ما لَم يَأذَن بِهِ اللَّهُ ۚ وَلَولا كَلِمَةُ الفَصلِ لَقُضِيَ بَينَهُم ۗ وَإِنَّ الظّالِمينَ لَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
21.translation_eng: Do they have partners [besides Allah]who have ordained for them a religionwhich has not been permitted by Allah?Had it not been for the conclusive word,1decision would have been made between them.For the wrongdoers there is indeeda painful punishment.Or ‘the final word.’ That is, Allah’s promise to provide the faithless and to grant them a respite before retribution. See 2:36, 126; 9:68-69; 15:3; 31:23-24.
21.transliteration: ʾam lahum shurakāʾu sharaʿū lahum mina d-dīni mā lam yaʾdhan bihi llāhu wa-law-lā kalimatu l-faṣli la-quḍiya baynahum wa-ʾinna ẓ-ẓālimīna lahum ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

22.content: تَرَى الظّالِمينَ مُشفِقينَ مِمّا كَسَبوا وَهُوَ واقِعٌ بِهِم ۗ وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ في رَوضاتِ الجَنّاتِ ۖ لَهُم ما يَشاءونَ عِندَ رَبِّهِم ۚ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الفَضلُ الكَبيرُ
22.translation_eng: You will see the wrongdoersapprehensive because of what they have earned,while it is about to befall them;but those who have faith and do righteous deedswill be in the gardens of paradise:they will have whatever they wish near their Lord.That is the greatest grace.
22.transliteration: tarā ẓ-ẓālimīna mushfiqīna mimmā kasabū wa-huwa wāqiʿun bihim wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti fī rawḍāti l-jannāti lahum mā yashāʾūna ʿinda rabbihim dhālika huwa l-faḍlu l-kabīru

23.content: ذٰلِكَ الَّذي يُبَشِّرُ اللَّهُ عِبادَهُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ ۗ قُل لا أَسأَلُكُم عَلَيهِ أَجرًا إِلَّا المَوَدَّةَ فِي القُربىٰ ۗ وَمَن يَقتَرِف حَسَنَةً نَزِد لَهُ فيها حُسنًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ شَكورٌ
23.translation_eng: That is the good news Allah givesto His servants who have faithand do righteous deeds!Say, ‘I do not ask you any reward for itexcept love of [my] relatives.’Whoever performs a good deed,We shall enhance for him its goodness.Indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-appreciative.
23.transliteration: dhālika lladhī yubashshiru llāhu ʿibādahu lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti qul lā ʾasʾalukum ʿalayhi ʾajran ʾillā l-mawaddata fī l-qurbā wa-man yaqtarif ḥasanatan nazid lahū fīhā ḥusnan ʾinna llāha ghafūrun shakūrun

24.content: أَم يَقولونَ افتَرىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا ۖ فَإِن يَشَإِ اللَّهُ يَختِم عَلىٰ قَلبِكَ ۗ وَيَمحُ اللَّهُ الباطِلَ وَيُحِقُّ الحَقَّ بِكَلِماتِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
24.translation_eng: Do they say,‘He has fabricated a lie against Allah’?If so, should Allah wishHe would set a seal on your heart,and Allah will efface the falsehoodand confirm the truth with His words.Indeed He knows well what is in the breasts.
24.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna ftarā ʿalā llāhi kadhiban fa-ʾin yashaʾi llāhu yakhtim ʿalā qalbika wa-yamḥu llāhu l-bāṭila wa-yuḥiqqu l-ḥaqqa bi-kalimātihī ʾinnahū ʿalīmun bi-dhāti ṣ-ṣudūri

25.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي يَقبَلُ التَّوبَةَ عَن عِبادِهِ وَيَعفو عَنِ السَّيِّئَاتِ وَيَعلَمُ ما تَفعَلونَ
25.translation_eng: It is He who accepts the repentanceof His servants,and excuses their misdeedsand knows what you do.
25.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī yaqbalu t-tawbata ʿan ʿibādihī wa-yaʿfū ʿani s-sayyiʾāti wa-yaʿlamu mā tafʿalūna

26.content: وَيَستَجيبُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ وَيَزيدُهُم مِن فَضلِهِ ۚ وَالكافِرونَ لَهُم عَذابٌ شَديدٌ
26.translation_eng: And He answers those who have faithand do righteous deedsand enhances them out of His grace.But as for the faithless,there is a severe punishment for them.
26.transliteration: wa-yastajību lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa-yazīduhum min faḍlihī wa-l-kāfirūna lahum ʿadhābun shadīdun

27.content: ۞ وَلَو بَسَطَ اللَّهُ الرِّزقَ لِعِبادِهِ لَبَغَوا فِي الأَرضِ وَلٰكِن يُنَزِّلُ بِقَدَرٍ ما يَشاءُ ۚ إِنَّهُ بِعِبادِهِ خَبيرٌ بَصيرٌ
27.translation_eng: Were Allah to expand the provision for His servants,they would surely create havoc on the earth.But He sends down in a [precise] measurewhatever He wishes.Indeed He is all-aware, all-seeing about His servants.
27.transliteration: wa-law basaṭa llāhu r-rizqa li-ʿibādihī la-baghaw fī l-ʾarḍi wa-lākin yunazzilu bi-qadarin mā yashāʾu ʾinnahū bi-ʿibādihī khabīrun baṣīrun

28.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي يُنَزِّلُ الغَيثَ مِن بَعدِ ما قَنَطوا وَيَنشُرُ رَحمَتَهُ ۚ وَهُوَ الوَلِيُّ الحَميدُ
28.translation_eng: It is He who sends down the rainafter they have been despondent,and unfolds His mercy,and He is the Guardian, the All-laudable.
28.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī yunazzilu l-ghaytha min baʿdi mā qanaṭū wa-yanshuru raḥmatahū wa-huwa l-waliyyu l-ḥamīdu

29.content: وَمِن آياتِهِ خَلقُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَثَّ فيهِما مِن دابَّةٍ ۚ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ جَمعِهِم إِذا يَشاءُ قَديرٌ
29.translation_eng: Among His signs is the creation of the heavensand the earthand whatever creatures He has scattered in them,and He is able to gather them whenever He wishes.
29.transliteration: wa-min ʾāyātihī khalqu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā baththa fīhimā min dābbatin wa-huwa ʿalā jamʿihim ʾidhā yashāʾu qadīrun

30.content: وَما أَصابَكُم مِن مُصيبَةٍ فَبِما كَسَبَت أَيديكُم وَيَعفو عَن كَثيرٍ
30.translation_eng: Whatever affliction that may visit youis because of what your hands have earned,and He excuses many [an offense].
30.transliteration: wa-mā ʾaṣābakum min muṣībatin fa-bi-mā kasabat ʾaydīkum wa-yaʿfū ʿan kathīrin

31.content: وَما أَنتُم بِمُعجِزينَ فِي الأَرضِ ۖ وَما لَكُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلا نَصيرٍ
31.translation_eng: You cannot thwart [Allah] on the earth,and you do not have besides Allahany guardian or helper.
31.transliteration: wa-mā ʾantum bi-muʿjizīna fī l-ʾarḍi wa-mā lakum min dūni llāhi min waliyyin wa-lā naṣīrin

32.content: وَمِن آياتِهِ الجَوارِ فِي البَحرِ كَالأَعلامِ
32.translation_eng: Among His signs are the ships [that run] on the sea[appearing] like landmarks.
32.transliteration: wa-min ʾāyātihi l-jawāri fī l-baḥri ka-l-ʾaʿlāmi

33.content: إِن يَشَأ يُسكِنِ الرّيحَ فَيَظلَلنَ رَواكِدَ عَلىٰ ظَهرِهِ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِكُلِّ صَبّارٍ شَكورٍ
33.translation_eng: If He wishes He stills the wind,whereat they remain standstillon its surface.There are indeed signs in thatfor every patient and grateful [servant].
33.transliteration: ʾin yashaʾ yuskini r-rīḥa fa-yaẓlalna rawākida ʿalā ẓahrihī ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-kulli ṣabbārin shakūrin

34.content: أَو يوبِقهُنَّ بِما كَسَبوا وَيَعفُ عَن كَثيرٍ
34.translation_eng: Or He wrecks thembecause of what they have earned,and He excuses many [an offense].
34.transliteration: ʾaw yūbiqhunna bi-mā kasabū wa-yaʿfu ʿan kathīrin

35.content: وَيَعلَمَ الَّذينَ يُجادِلونَ في آياتِنا ما لَهُم مِن مَحيصٍ
35.translation_eng: Let those who dispute Our signs knowthat there is no escape for them.
35.transliteration: wa-yaʿlama lladhīna yujādilūna fī ʾāyātinā mā lahum min maḥīṣin

36.content: فَما أوتيتُم مِن شَيءٍ فَمَتاعُ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۖ وَما عِندَ اللَّهِ خَيرٌ وَأَبقىٰ لِلَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَلىٰ رَبِّهِم يَتَوَكَّلونَ
36.translation_eng: Whatever you have been givenare the wares of the life of this world,but what is with Allah is betterand more lastingfor those who have faithand who put their trust in their Lord.
36.transliteration: fa-mā ʾūtītum min shayʾin fa-matāʿu l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-mā ʿinda llāhi khayrun wa-ʾabqā li-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿalā rabbihim yatawakkalūna

37.content: وَالَّذينَ يَجتَنِبونَ كَبائِرَ الإِثمِ وَالفَواحِشَ وَإِذا ما غَضِبوا هُم يَغفِرونَ
37.translation_eng: —Those who avoid major sinsand indecencies,and forgive when angered;
37.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yajtanibūna kabāʾira l-ʾithmi wa-l-fawāḥisha wa-ʾidhā mā ghaḍibū hum yaghfirūna

38.content: وَالَّذينَ استَجابوا لِرَبِّهِم وَأَقامُوا الصَّلاةَ وَأَمرُهُم شورىٰ بَينَهُم وَمِمّا رَزَقناهُم يُنفِقونَ
38.translation_eng: those who answer their Lord,maintain the prayer,and their affairs are by counsel among themselves,and they spend out of what We have provided them with;
38.transliteration: wa-lladhīna stajābū li-rabbihim wa-ʾaqāmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-ʾamruhum shūrā baynahum wa-mimmā razaqnāhum yunfiqūna

39.content: وَالَّذينَ إِذا أَصابَهُمُ البَغيُ هُم يَنتَصِرونَ
39.translation_eng: those who, when visited by aggression,come to each other’s aid.
39.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ʾidhā ʾaṣābahumu l-baghyu hum yantaṣirūna

40.content: وَجَزاءُ سَيِّئَةٍ سَيِّئَةٌ مِثلُها ۖ فَمَن عَفا وَأَصلَحَ فَأَجرُهُ عَلَى اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لا يُحِبُّ الظّالِمينَ
40.translation_eng: The requital of evil is an evil like it.So whoever excuses and conciliates,his reward lies with Allah.Indeed He does not like the wrongdoers.
40.transliteration: wa-jazāʾu sayyiʾatin sayyiʾatun mithluhā fa-man ʿafā wa-ʾaṣlaḥa fa-ʾajruhū ʿalā llāhi ʾinnahū lā yuḥibbu ẓ-ẓālimīna

41.content: وَلَمَنِ انتَصَرَ بَعدَ ظُلمِهِ فَأُولٰئِكَ ما عَلَيهِم مِن سَبيلٍ
41.translation_eng: As for those who retaliate after being wronged,there is no blame upon them.
41.transliteration: wa-la-mani ntaṣara baʿda ẓulmihī fa-ʾulāʾika mā ʿalayhim min sabīlin

42.content: إِنَّمَا السَّبيلُ عَلَى الَّذينَ يَظلِمونَ النّاسَ وَيَبغونَ فِي الأَرضِ بِغَيرِ الحَقِّ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
42.translation_eng: The blame lies only upon those whowrong the peopleand commit aggression in the land unduly.For such there is a painful punishment.
42.transliteration: ʾinnamā s-sabīlu ʿalā lladhīna yaẓlimūna n-nāsa wa-yabghūna fī l-ʾarḍi bi-ghayri l-ḥaqqi ʾulāʾika lahum ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

43.content: وَلَمَن صَبَرَ وَغَفَرَ إِنَّ ذٰلِكَ لَمِن عَزمِ الأُمورِ
43.translation_eng: As for him who endures patiently and forgives—that is indeed the steadiest of courses.
43.transliteration: wa-la-man ṣabara wa-ghafara ʾinna dhālika la-min ʿazmi l-ʾumūri

44.content: وَمَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن وَلِيٍّ مِن بَعدِهِ ۗ وَتَرَى الظّالِمينَ لَمّا رَأَوُا العَذابَ يَقولونَ هَل إِلىٰ مَرَدٍّ مِن سَبيلٍ
44.translation_eng: Whomever Allah leads astrayhas no guardian apart from Him.You will see the wrongdoers,when they sight the punishment,saying, ‘Is there any way for a retreat?’
44.transliteration: wa-man yuḍlili llāhu fa-mā lahū min waliyyin min baʿdihī wa-tarā ẓ-ẓālimīna lammā raʾawu l-ʿadhāba yaqūlūna hal ʾilā maraddin min sabīlin

45.content: وَتَراهُم يُعرَضونَ عَلَيها خاشِعينَ مِنَ الذُّلِّ يَنظُرونَ مِن طَرفٍ خَفِيٍّ ۗ وَقالَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِنَّ الخاسِرينَ الَّذينَ خَسِروا أَنفُسَهُم وَأَهليهِم يَومَ القِيامَةِ ۗ أَلا إِنَّ الظّالِمينَ في عَذابٍ مُقيمٍ
45.translation_eng: You will see them being exposed to it,humbled by abasement,looking askance secretly.And the faithful will say,‘Indeed the losers are thosewho have ruined themselves and their familieson the Day of Resurrection.Look!The wrongdoers are indeed in lasting punishment.
45.transliteration: wa-tarāhum yuʿraḍūna ʿalayhā khāshiʿīna mina dh-dhulli yanẓurūna min ṭarfin khafiyyin wa-qāla lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾinna l-khāsirīna lladhīna khasirū ʾanfusahum wa-ʾahlīhim yawma l-qiyāmati ʾa-lā ʾinna ẓ-ẓālimīna fī ʿadhābin muqīmin

46.content: وَما كانَ لَهُم مِن أَولِياءَ يَنصُرونَهُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ ۗ وَمَن يُضلِلِ اللَّهُ فَما لَهُ مِن سَبيلٍ
46.translation_eng: They have no guardians to help thembesides Allah.Whomever Allah leads astrayhas no way out.’
46.transliteration: wa-mā kāna lahum min ʾawliyāʾa yanṣurūnahum min dūni llāhi wa-man yuḍlili llāhu fa-mā lahū min sabīlin-i

47.content: استَجيبوا لِرَبِّكُم مِن قَبلِ أَن يَأتِيَ يَومٌ لا مَرَدَّ لَهُ مِنَ اللَّهِ ۚ ما لَكُم مِن مَلجَإٍ يَومَئِذٍ وَما لَكُم مِن نَكيرٍ
47.translation_eng: Answer your Lordbefore there comes a dayfor which there is no revoking from Allah.On that day you will have no refuge,neither will you have [any chance for] denial.
47.transliteration: istajībū li-rabbikum min qabli ʾan yaʾtiya yawmun lā maradda lahū mina llāhi mā lakum min maljaʾin yawmaʾidhin wa-mā lakum min nakīrin

48.content: فَإِن أَعرَضوا فَما أَرسَلناكَ عَلَيهِم حَفيظًا ۖ إِن عَلَيكَ إِلَّا البَلاغُ ۗ وَإِنّا إِذا أَذَقنَا الإِنسانَ مِنّا رَحمَةً فَرِحَ بِها ۖ وَإِن تُصِبهُم سَيِّئَةٌ بِما قَدَّمَت أَيديهِم فَإِنَّ الإِنسانَ كَفورٌ
48.translation_eng: But if they disregard [your warnings],We have not sent you as a keeper over them.Your duty is only to communicate.Indeed when We let man taste Our mercy,he exults in it;but should an ill visit thembecause of what their hands have sent ahead,then man is indeed very ungrateful.
48.transliteration: fa-ʾin ʾaʿraḍū fa-mā ʾarsalnāka ʿalayhim ḥafīẓan ʾin ʿalayka ʾillā l-balāghu wa-ʾinnā ʾidhā ʾadhaqnā l-ʾinsāna minnā raḥmatan fariḥa bihā wa-ʾin tuṣibhum sayyiʾatun bi-mā qaddamat ʾaydīhim fa-ʾinna l-ʾinsāna kafūrun

49.content: لِلَّهِ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ يَخلُقُ ما يَشاءُ ۚ يَهَبُ لِمَن يَشاءُ إِناثًا وَيَهَبُ لِمَن يَشاءُ الذُّكورَ
49.translation_eng: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavensand the earth.He creates whatever He wishes;He gives females to whomever He wishes,and gives males to whomever He wishes,
49.transliteration: li-llāhi mulku s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi yakhluqu mā yashāʾu yahabu li-man yashāʾu ʾināthan wa-yahabu li-man yashāʾu dh-dhukūra

50.content: أَو يُزَوِّجُهُم ذُكرانًا وَإِناثًا ۖ وَيَجعَلُ مَن يَشاءُ عَقيمًا ۚ إِنَّهُ عَليمٌ قَديرٌ
50.translation_eng: or He combines them males and females,and makes sterile whomever He wishes.Indeed He is all-knowing, all-powerful.
50.transliteration: ʾaw yuzawwijuhum dhukrānan wa-ʾināthan wa-yajʿalu man yashāʾu ʿaqīman ʾinnahū ʿalīmun qadīrun

51.content: ۞ وَما كانَ لِبَشَرٍ أَن يُكَلِّمَهُ اللَّهُ إِلّا وَحيًا أَو مِن وَراءِ حِجابٍ أَو يُرسِلَ رَسولًا فَيوحِيَ بِإِذنِهِ ما يَشاءُ ۚ إِنَّهُ عَلِيٌّ حَكيمٌ
51.translation_eng: It is not [possible] for any humanthat Allah should speak to him1except through revelationor from behind a curtain,2or send a messenger3 who reveals by His permissionwhatever He wishes.Indeed He is all-exalted, all-wise.Or ‘it does not behoove any human that Allah should speak to him.’As from a tree, as in the case of Moses (ʿa).That is, an angel.
51.transliteration: wa-mā kāna li-basharin ʾan yukallimahu llāhu ʾillā waḥyan ʾaw min warāʾi ḥijābin ʾaw yursila rasūlan fa-yūḥiya bi-ʾidhnihī mā yashāʾu ʾinnahū ʿaliyyun ḥakīmun

52.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ أَوحَينا إِلَيكَ روحًا مِن أَمرِنا ۚ ما كُنتَ تَدري مَا الكِتابُ وَلَا الإيمانُ وَلٰكِن جَعَلناهُ نورًا نَهدي بِهِ مَن نَشاءُ مِن عِبادِنا ۚ وَإِنَّكَ لَتَهدي إِلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
52.translation_eng: Thus have We revealed to youthe Spirit of Our dispensation.You did not know what the Book is,nor what is faith;but We made it a lightthat We may guide by its meanswhomever We wish of Our servants.And indeed you guide to a straight path,
52.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika ʾawḥaynā ʾilayka rūḥan min ʾamrinā mā kunta tadrī mā l-kitābu wa-lā l-ʾīmānu wa-lākin jaʿalnāhu nūran nahdī bihī man nashāʾu min ʿibādinā wa-ʾinnaka la-tahdī ʾilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

53.content: صِراطِ اللَّهِ الَّذي لَهُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ ۗ أَلا إِلَى اللَّهِ تَصيرُ الأُمورُ
53.translation_eng: the path of Allah,to whom belongs whatever is in the heavensand whatever is in the earth.Look! To Allah do all matters return!
53.transliteration: ṣirāṭi llāhi lladhī lahū mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi ʾa-lā ʾilā llāhi taṣīru l-ʾumūru

43.description: The surah that mentions the Ornaments of solid gold, and other precious commodities and appointments, which God would have granted in this life to all the unbelievers—had it not been that this would have driven humankind to unite in godlessness—for the trinkets of life are the true hearts” desire of the ungodly. Yet fleeting are all the things of this world, and far finer and everlasting the joy of Paradise for the believers; and that is their true hearts” desire. It takes its name from the word “ornaments” (zukhruf) in verse 35, and alluded to again in verse 53: in both instances God is refuting the claim of the disbelievers that a true prophet would be rich. The fact that the angels are not God’s daughters but His obedient servants is emphasized again and again (verse 15 . and verse 60). Similarly, the idea that Jesus could be the son of God is clearly denied (verse 57 .).The surah is also known as: Golden Ornaments, Luxury, Ornaments of Gold, The Gold Adornments, The Gold Ornaments.

1.translation_eng: Ḥā, Mīm.

2.translation_eng: By the Manifest Book:

3.content: إِنّا جَعَلناهُ قُرآنًا عَرَبِيًّا لَعَلَّكُم تَعقِلونَ
3.translation_eng: We have made it an Arabic Qurʾānso that you may apply reason,
3.transliteration: ʾinnā jaʿalnāhu qurʾānan ʿarabiyyan laʿallakum taʿqilūna

4.content: وَإِنَّهُ في أُمِّ الكِتابِ لَدَينا لَعَلِيٌّ حَكيمٌ
4.translation_eng: and indeed it is with Us in the Mother Book[and it is] surely sublime and wise.
4.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahū fī ʾummi l-kitābi ladaynā la-ʿaliyyun ḥakīmun

5.content: أَفَنَضرِبُ عَنكُمُ الذِّكرَ صَفحًا أَن كُنتُم قَومًا مُسرِفينَ
5.translation_eng: Shall We withhold the Reminder from youunconcernedly,because you are a profligate lot?
5.transliteration: ʾa-fa-naḍribu ʿankumu dh-dhikra ṣafḥan ʾan kuntum qawman musrifīna

6.content: وَكَم أَرسَلنا مِن نَبِيٍّ فِي الأَوَّلينَ
6.translation_eng: How many a prophet We have sentto the ancients!
6.transliteration: wa-kam ʾarsalnā min nabiyyin fī l-ʾawwalīna

7.content: وَما يَأتيهِم مِن نَبِيٍّ إِلّا كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
7.translation_eng: There did not come to them any prophetbut that they used to deride him.
7.transliteration: wa-mā yaʾtīhim min nabiyyin ʾillā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

8.content: فَأَهلَكنا أَشَدَّ مِنهُم بَطشًا وَمَضىٰ مَثَلُ الأَوَّلينَ
8.translation_eng: So We destroyed those who were stronger than these,1and the example of the ancients has passed.That is, the Arab polytheists.
8.transliteration: fa-ʾahlaknā ʾashadda minhum baṭshan wa-maḍā mathalu l-ʾawwalīna

9.content: وَلَئِن سَأَلتَهُم مَن خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ لَيَقولُنَّ خَلَقَهُنَّ العَزيزُ العَليمُ
9.translation_eng: If you ask them,‘Who created the heavens and the earth?’they will surely say,‘The All-mighty, the All-knowing created them.’
9.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin saʾaltahum man khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa la-yaqūlunna khalaqahunna l-ʿazīzu l-ʿalīmu

10.content: الَّذي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الأَرضَ مَهدًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم فيها سُبُلًا لَعَلَّكُم تَهتَدونَ
10.translation_eng: He, who made the earth a cradle for youand made in it ways for you,so that you may be guided [to your destinations],
10.transliteration: alladhī jaʿala lakumu l-ʾarḍa mahdan wa-jaʿala lakum fīhā subulan laʿallakum tahtadūna

11.content: وَالَّذي نَزَّلَ مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً بِقَدَرٍ فَأَنشَرنا بِهِ بَلدَةً مَيتًا ۚ كَذٰلِكَ تُخرَجونَ
11.translation_eng: and who sent down water from the skyin a measured manner,and We revived with it a dead country.(Likewise you [too] shall be raised [from the dead].)
11.transliteration: wa-lladhī nazzala mina s-samāʾi māʾan bi-qadarin fa-ʾansharnā bihī baldatan maytan ka-dhālika tukhrajūna

12.content: وَالَّذي خَلَقَ الأَزواجَ كُلَّها وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِنَ الفُلكِ وَالأَنعامِ ما تَركَبونَ
12.translation_eng: And who created all the kinds1and made for you the shipsand the cattlesuch as you ride,Or, ‘all the pairs.’
12.transliteration: wa-lladhī khalaqa l-ʾazwāja kullahā wa-jaʿala lakum mina l-fulki wa-l-ʾanʿāmi mā tarkabūna

13.content: لِتَستَووا عَلىٰ ظُهورِهِ ثُمَّ تَذكُروا نِعمَةَ رَبِّكُم إِذَا استَوَيتُم عَلَيهِ وَتَقولوا سُبحانَ الَّذي سَخَّرَ لَنا هٰذا وَما كُنّا لَهُ مُقرِنينَ
13.translation_eng: that you may sit on their backs,then remember the blessing of your Lordwhen you are settled on them,and say,‘Immaculate is Hewho has disposed this for us,and we [by ourselves] were no match for it.
13.transliteration: li-tastawū ʿalā ẓuhūrihī thumma tadhkurū niʿmata rabbikum ʾidhā stawaytum ʿalayhi wa-taqūlū subḥāna lladhī sakhkhara lanā hādhā wa-mā kunnā lahū muqrinīna

14.content: وَإِنّا إِلىٰ رَبِّنا لَمُنقَلِبونَ
14.translation_eng: Indeed we shall return to our Lord.’
14.transliteration: wa-ʾinnā ʾilā rabbinā la-munqalibūna

15.content: وَجَعَلوا لَهُ مِن عِبادِهِ جُزءًا ۚ إِنَّ الإِنسانَ لَكَفورٌ مُبينٌ
15.translation_eng: They ascribe to Himoffspring1 from among His servants!Man is indeed a manifest ingrate.Lit.: ‘They assign to Him a portion from among His servants.’
15.transliteration: wa-jaʿalū lahū min ʿibādihī juzʾan ʾinna l-ʾinsāna la-kafūrun mubīnun

16.content: أَمِ اتَّخَذَ مِمّا يَخلُقُ بَناتٍ وَأَصفاكُم بِالبَنينَ
16.translation_eng: Did He adopt daughters from what He createswhile He preferred you with sons?
16.transliteration: ʾami ttakhadha mimmā yakhluqu banātin wa-ʾaṣfākum bi-l-banīna

17.content: وَإِذا بُشِّرَ أَحَدُهُم بِما ضَرَبَ لِلرَّحمٰنِ مَثَلًا ظَلَّ وَجهُهُ مُسوَدًّا وَهُوَ كَظيمٌ
17.translation_eng: When one of them is brought the newsof what he ascribes to the All-beneficent,his face becomes darkened1and he chokes with suppressed agony, [and says]That is, when he is brought the news of the birth of a daughter.
17.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā bushshira ʾaḥaduhum bi-mā ḍaraba li-r-raḥmāni mathalan ẓalla wajhuhū muswaddan wa-huwa kaẓīmun

18.content: أَوَمَن يُنَشَّأُ فِي الحِليَةِ وَهُوَ فِي الخِصامِ غَيرُ مُبينٍ
18.translation_eng: ‘What! One who is brought up amid ornamentsand is inconspicuous in contests?’
18.transliteration: ʾa-wa-man yunashshaʾu fī l-ḥilyati wa-huwa fī l-khiṣāmi ghayru mubīnin

19.content: وَجَعَلُوا المَلائِكَةَ الَّذينَ هُم عِبادُ الرَّحمٰنِ إِناثًا ۚ أَشَهِدوا خَلقَهُم ۚ سَتُكتَبُ شَهادَتُهُم وَيُسأَلونَ
19.translation_eng: And they have made the angels—who are servants of the All-beneficent—females.Were they witness to their creation?Their testimony will be written downand they shall be questioned.
19.transliteration: wa-jaʿalū l-malāʾikata lladhīna hum ʿibādu r-raḥmāni ʾināthan ʾa-shahidū khalqahum sa-tuktabu shahādatuhum wa-yusʾalūna

20.content: وَقالوا لَو شاءَ الرَّحمٰنُ ما عَبَدناهُم ۗ ما لَهُم بِذٰلِكَ مِن عِلمٍ ۖ إِن هُم إِلّا يَخرُصونَ
20.translation_eng: They say, ‘Had the All-beneficent wished,we would not have worshipped them.’1They do not have any knowledge of that,and they do nothing but surmise.That is, the gods worshiped by the polytheists. Cf. 16:35.
20.transliteration: wa-qālū law shāʾa r-raḥmānu mā ʿabadnāhum mā lahum bi-dhālika min ʿilmin ʾin hum ʾillā yakhruṣūna

21.content: أَم آتَيناهُم كِتابًا مِن قَبلِهِ فَهُم بِهِ مُستَمسِكونَ
21.translation_eng: Did We give them a Book before this,so that they are holding fast to it?
21.transliteration: ʾam ʾātaynāhum kitāban min qablihī fa-hum bihī mustamsikūna

22.content: بَل قالوا إِنّا وَجَدنا آباءَنا عَلىٰ أُمَّةٍ وَإِنّا عَلىٰ آثارِهِم مُهتَدونَ
22.translation_eng: Rather they say, ‘We found our fathersfollowing a creed,and we are indeed guided in their footsteps.’
22.transliteration: bal qālū ʾinnā wajadnā ʾābāʾanā ʿalā ʾummatin wa-ʾinnā ʿalā ʾāthārihim muhtadūna

23.content: وَكَذٰلِكَ ما أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ في قَريَةٍ مِن نَذيرٍ إِلّا قالَ مُترَفوها إِنّا وَجَدنا آباءَنا عَلىٰ أُمَّةٍ وَإِنّا عَلىٰ آثارِهِم مُقتَدونَ
23.translation_eng: And so it has been that We did not sendany warner to a town before you,without its affluent ones saying,‘We found our fathers following a creedand we are indeed following in their footsteps.’
23.transliteration: wa-ka-dhālika mā ʾarsalnā min qablika fī qaryatin min nadhīrin ʾillā qāla mutrafūhā ʾinnā wajadnā ʾābāʾanā ʿalā ʾummatin wa-ʾinnā ʿalā ʾāthārihim muqtadūna

24.content: ۞ قالَ أَوَلَو جِئتُكُم بِأَهدىٰ مِمّا وَجَدتُم عَلَيهِ آباءَكُم ۖ قالوا إِنّا بِما أُرسِلتُم بِهِ كافِرونَ
24.translation_eng: He would say, ‘What! Even if I bring youa better guidance than what you foundyour fathers following?!’They would say,‘We indeed disbelieve in what you are sent with.’
24.transliteration: qāla ʾa-wa-law jiʾtukum bi-ʾahdā mimmā wajadtum ʿalayhi ʾābāʾakum qālū ʾinnā bi-mā ʾursiltum bihī kāfirūna

25.content: فَانتَقَمنا مِنهُم ۖ فَانظُر كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ المُكَذِّبينَ
25.translation_eng: Thereupon We took vengeance on them;so observe how was the fate of the deniers.
25.transliteration: fa-ntaqamnā minhum fa-nẓur kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu l-mukadhdhibīna

26.content: وَإِذ قالَ إِبراهيمُ لِأَبيهِ وَقَومِهِ إِنَّني بَراءٌ مِمّا تَعبُدونَ
26.translation_eng: When Abraham said to his father and his people,‘I repudiate what you worship,
26.transliteration: wa-ʾidh qāla ʾibrāhīmu li-ʾabīhi wa-qawmihī ʾinnanī barāʾun mimmā taʿbudūna

27.content: إِلَّا الَّذي فَطَرَني فَإِنَّهُ سَيَهدينِ
27.translation_eng: excepting Him who originated me;indeed He will guide me.’
27.transliteration: ʾillā lladhī faṭaranī fa-ʾinnahū sa-yahdīni

28.content: وَجَعَلَها كَلِمَةً باقِيَةً في عَقِبِهِ لَعَلَّهُم يَرجِعونَ
28.translation_eng: And He made it1 a lasting wordamong his posterityso that they may come back [to the right path].That is, the word of tawḥīd, ‘There is no god except Allah,’ the monotheistic creed of Abraham, or, in accordance with the traditions of the Imams Muḥammad al-Bāqir and Jaʿfar al-Ṣādiq (ʿa) Abraham’s imamate (cf. 2:124; Tafsīr al-Ṣāfī, Majmaʿ al-Bayān).
28.transliteration: wa-jaʿalahā kalimatan bāqiyatan fī ʿaqibihī laʿallahum yarjiʿūna

29.content: بَل مَتَّعتُ هٰؤُلاءِ وَآباءَهُم حَتّىٰ جاءَهُمُ الحَقُّ وَرَسولٌ مُبينٌ
29.translation_eng: Rather I provided for these1 and their fathersuntil there came to them the truthand a manifest apostle.That is, the Arabs.
29.transliteration: bal mattaʿtu hāʾulāʾi wa-ʾābāʾahum ḥattā jāʾahumu l-ḥaqqu wa-rasūlun mubīnun

30.content: وَلَمّا جاءَهُمُ الحَقُّ قالوا هٰذا سِحرٌ وَإِنّا بِهِ كافِرونَ
30.translation_eng: But when the truth came to them, they said,‘This is magic, and we indeed disbelieve in it.’
30.transliteration: wa-lammā jāʾahumu l-ḥaqqu qālū hādhā siḥrun wa-ʾinnā bihī kāfirūna

31.content: وَقالوا لَولا نُزِّلَ هٰذَا القُرآنُ عَلىٰ رَجُلٍ مِنَ القَريَتَينِ عَظيمٍ
31.translation_eng: And they said, ‘Why was not this Qurʾān sent downto some great man from the two cities?’1That is, Makkah and Madinah, which were the two major towns of Arabia at that time.
31.transliteration: wa-qālū law-lā nuzzila hādhā l-qurʾānu ʿalā rajulin mina l-qaryatayni ʿaẓīmin

32.content: أَهُم يَقسِمونَ رَحمَتَ رَبِّكَ ۚ نَحنُ قَسَمنا بَينَهُم مَعيشَتَهُم فِي الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۚ وَرَفَعنا بَعضَهُم فَوقَ بَعضٍ دَرَجاتٍ لِيَتَّخِذَ بَعضُهُم بَعضًا سُخرِيًّا ۗ وَرَحمَتُ رَبِّكَ خَيرٌ مِمّا يَجمَعونَ
32.translation_eng: Is it they who dispense the mercy of your Lord?It is We who have dispensed among themtheir livelihood in the present life,and raised some of them above others in rank,so that some may take others into service,and your Lord’s mercy is better than what they amass.
32.transliteration: ʾa-hum yaqsimūna raḥmata rabbika naḥnu qasamnā baynahum maʿīshatahum fī l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-rafaʿnā baʿḍahum fawqa baʿḍin darajātin li-yattakhidha baʿḍuhum baʿḍan sukhriyyan wa-raḥmatu rabbika khayrun mimmā yajmaʿūna

33.content: وَلَولا أَن يَكونَ النّاسُ أُمَّةً واحِدَةً لَجَعَلنا لِمَن يَكفُرُ بِالرَّحمٰنِ لِبُيوتِهِم سُقُفًا مِن فِضَّةٍ وَمَعارِجَ عَلَيها يَظهَرونَ
33.translation_eng: Were it not [for the danger] that mankind would beone community,1We would have surely madefor those who defy the All-beneficent,silver roofs for their housesand [silver] stairways by which they ascend;That is, a monolithic community of people without faith.
33.transliteration: wa-law-lā ʾan yakūna n-nāsu ʾummatan wāḥidatan la-jaʿalnā li-man yakfuru bi-r-raḥmāni li-buyūtihim suqufan min fiḍḍatin wa-maʿārija ʿalayhā yaẓharūna

34.content: وَلِبُيوتِهِم أَبوابًا وَسُرُرًا عَلَيها يَتَّكِئونَ
34.translation_eng: and [silver] doors for their housesand [silver] couches on which they recline;
34.transliteration: wa-li-buyūtihim ʾabwāban wa-sururan ʿalayhā yattakiʾūna

35.content: وَزُخرُفًا ۚ وَإِن كُلُّ ذٰلِكَ لَمّا مَتاعُ الحَياةِ الدُّنيا ۚ وَالآخِرَةُ عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلمُتَّقينَ
35.translation_eng: and ornaments of gold;1yet all that would be nothing butthe wares of the life of this world,and the Hereafter near your Lord is for the Godwary.Or ‘houses embellished with gold.’
35.transliteration: wa-zukhrufan wa-ʾin kullu dhālika lammā matāʿu l-ḥayāti d-dunyā wa-l-ʾākhiratu ʿinda rabbika li-l-muttaqīna

36.content: وَمَن يَعشُ عَن ذِكرِ الرَّحمٰنِ نُقَيِّض لَهُ شَيطانًا فَهُوَ لَهُ قَرينٌ
36.translation_eng: Whoever turns a blind eye to1the remembrance of the All-beneficent,We assign him a devilwho remains his companion.Or ‘whoever shuns.’
36.transliteration: wa-man yaʿshu ʿan dhikri r-raḥmāni nuqayyiḍ lahū shayṭānan fa-huwa lahū qarīnun

37.content: وَإِنَّهُم لَيَصُدّونَهُم عَنِ السَّبيلِ وَيَحسَبونَ أَنَّهُم مُهتَدونَ
37.translation_eng: Indeed they1 bar them from the waywhile they suppose that they are [rightly] guided.That is, the devils.
37.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahum la-yaṣuddūnahum ʿani s-sabīli wa-yaḥsabūna ʾannahum muhtadūna

38.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا جاءَنا قالَ يا لَيتَ بَيني وَبَينَكَ بُعدَ المَشرِقَينِ فَبِئسَ القَرينُ
38.translation_eng: When he comes to Us, he will say,‘I wish there had been between me and youthe distance between east and west!What an evil companion [are you]!’
38.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā jāʾanā qāla yā-layta baynī wa-baynaka buʿda l-mashriqayni fa-biʾsa l-qarīnu

39.content: وَلَن يَنفَعَكُمُ اليَومَ إِذ ظَلَمتُم أَنَّكُم فِي العَذابِ مُشتَرِكونَ
39.translation_eng: ‘Today that1 will be of no avail to you.As you did wrong,so will you share in the punishment.’That is, ‘your desire to keep away from your evil companion.’
39.transliteration: wa-lan yanfaʿakumu l-yawma ʾidh ẓalamtum ʾannakum fī l-ʿadhābi mushtarikūna

40.content: أَفَأَنتَ تُسمِعُ الصُّمَّ أَو تَهدِي العُميَ وَمَن كانَ في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
40.translation_eng: Can you, then, make the deaf hearor guide the blindand someone who is in manifest error?
40.transliteration: ʾa-fa-ʾanta tusmiʿu ṣ-ṣumma ʾaw tahdī l-ʿumya wa-man kāna fī ḍalālin mubīnin

41.content: فَإِمّا نَذهَبَنَّ بِكَ فَإِنّا مِنهُم مُنتَقِمونَ
41.translation_eng: Either We shall take you away—for We will indeed take vengeance on them—
41.transliteration: fa-ʾimmā nadhhabanna bika fa-ʾinnā minhum muntaqimūna

42.content: أَو نُرِيَنَّكَ الَّذي وَعَدناهُم فَإِنّا عَلَيهِم مُقتَدِرونَ
42.translation_eng: or We shall show you what We have promised them,for indeed We hold them in Our power.
42.transliteration: ʾaw nuriyannaka lladhī waʿadnāhum fa-ʾinnā ʿalayhim muqtadirūna

43.content: فَاستَمسِك بِالَّذي أوحِيَ إِلَيكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
43.translation_eng: So hold fast to what has been revealed to you.Indeed you are on a straight path.
43.transliteration: fa-stamsik bi-lladhī ʾūḥiya ʾilayka ʾinnaka ʿalā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

44.content: وَإِنَّهُ لَذِكرٌ لَكَ وَلِقَومِكَ ۖ وَسَوفَ تُسأَلونَ
44.translation_eng: Indeed it is a reminder for you and for your people,and soon you will be questioned.
44.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahū la-dhikrun laka wa-li-qawmika wa-sawfa tusʾalūna

45.content: وَاسأَل مَن أَرسَلنا مِن قَبلِكَ مِن رُسُلِنا أَجَعَلنا مِن دونِ الرَّحمٰنِ آلِهَةً يُعبَدونَ
45.translation_eng: Askthose of Our apostles We have sent before you:1Did We set up any gods besides the All-beneficentto be worshipped?That is, during the cosmic journey of the Prophet (see 17:1, 53:8-18).
45.transliteration: wa-sʾal man ʾarsalnā min qablika min rusulinā ʾa-jaʿalnā min dūni r-raḥmāni ʾālihatan yuʿbadūna

46.content: وَلَقَد أَرسَلنا موسىٰ بِآياتِنا إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ وَمَلَئِهِ فَقالَ إِنّي رَسولُ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
46.translation_eng: Certainly We sent Moses with Our signsto Pharaoh and his elite.He said, ‘I am indeed an apostleof the Lord of all the worlds.’
46.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾarsalnā mūsā bi-ʾāyātinā ʾilā firʿawna wa-malaʾihī fa-qāla ʾinnī rasūlu rabbi l-ʿālamīna

47.content: فَلَمّا جاءَهُم بِآياتِنا إِذا هُم مِنها يَضحَكونَ
47.translation_eng: But when he brought them Our signs,behold, they laughed at them.
47.transliteration: fa-lammā jāʾahum bi-ʾāyātinā ʾidhā hum minhā yaḍḥakūna

48.content: وَما نُريهِم مِن آيَةٍ إِلّا هِيَ أَكبَرُ مِن أُختِها ۖ وَأَخَذناهُم بِالعَذابِ لَعَلَّهُم يَرجِعونَ
48.translation_eng: And We did not show them a signbut it was greater than the other,and We seized them with punishmentso that they might come back.
48.transliteration: wa-mā nurīhim min ʾāyatin ʾillā hiya ʾakbaru min ʾukhtihā wa-ʾakhadhnāhum bi-l-ʿadhābi laʿallahum yarjiʿūna

49.content: وَقالوا يا أَيُّهَ السّاحِرُ ادعُ لَنا رَبَّكَ بِما عَهِدَ عِندَكَ إِنَّنا لَمُهتَدونَ
49.translation_eng: They would say, ‘O magician!Invoke your Lord for usby the covenant He has made with you.We will indeed be guided.’
49.transliteration: wa-qālū yā-ʾayyuha s-sāḥiru dʿu lanā rabbaka bi-mā ʿahida ʿindaka ʾinnanā la-muhtadūna

50.content: فَلَمّا كَشَفنا عَنهُمُ العَذابَ إِذا هُم يَنكُثونَ
50.translation_eng: But when We lifted the punishment from them,behold, they would break their pledge.
50.transliteration: fa-lammā kashafnā ʿanhumu l-ʿadhāba ʾidhā hum yankuthūna

51.content: وَنادىٰ فِرعَونُ في قَومِهِ قالَ يا قَومِ أَلَيسَ لي مُلكُ مِصرَ وَهٰذِهِ الأَنهارُ تَجري مِن تَحتي ۖ أَفَلا تُبصِرونَ
51.translation_eng: And Pharaoh proclaimed amongst his people.He said, ‘O my people!Does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to meand these rivers that run at my feet?Do you not perceive?
51.transliteration: wa-nādā firʿawnu fī qawmihī qāla yā-qawmi ʾa-laysa lī mulku miṣra wa-hādhihi l-ʾanhāru tajrī min taḥtī ʾa-fa-lā tubṣirūna

52.content: أَم أَنا خَيرٌ مِن هٰذَا الَّذي هُوَ مَهينٌ وَلا يَكادُ يُبينُ
52.translation_eng: Am I not better than this humble1 onewho cannot even speak clearly?Or ‘vile.’
52.transliteration: ʾam ʾana khayrun min hādhā lladhī huwa mahīnun wa-lā yakādu yubīnu

53.content: فَلَولا أُلقِيَ عَلَيهِ أَسوِرَةٌ مِن ذَهَبٍ أَو جاءَ مَعَهُ المَلائِكَةُ مُقتَرِنينَ
53.translation_eng: Why have no bracelets of gold been cast upon him,nor have the angels come with him as escorts?’
53.transliteration: fa-law-lā ʾulqiya ʿalayhi ʾaswiratun min dhahabin ʾaw jāʾa maʿahu l-malāʾikatu muqtarinīna

54.content: فَاستَخَفَّ قَومَهُ فَأَطاعوهُ ۚ إِنَّهُم كانوا قَومًا فاسِقينَ
54.translation_eng: So he misled his people and they obeyed him.Indeed they were a transgressing lot.
54.transliteration: fa-stakhaffa qawmahū fa-ʾaṭāʿūhu ʾinnahum kānū qawman fāsiqīna

55.content: فَلَمّا آسَفونَا انتَقَمنا مِنهُم فَأَغرَقناهُم أَجمَعينَ
55.translation_eng: So when they roused Our wrath,We took vengeance on themand drowned them all.
55.transliteration: fa-lammā ʾāsafūnā ntaqamnā minhum fa-ʾaghraqnāhum ʾajmaʿīna

56.content: فَجَعَلناهُم سَلَفًا وَمَثَلًا لِلآخِرينَ
56.translation_eng: Thus We made them the vanguard1and an example for posterity.That is, of those who enter hell.
56.transliteration: fa-jaʿalnāhum salafan wa-mathalan li-l-ʾākhirīna

57.content: ۞ وَلَمّا ضُرِبَ ابنُ مَريَمَ مَثَلًا إِذا قَومُكَ مِنهُ يَصِدّونَ
57.translation_eng: When the Son of Mary was cited as an example,behold, your people raise an outcry.1Or ‘laughed at it.’ (Maʿānī al-akhbār, p. 220) Or ‘turn away,’ in accordance with an alternate reading (yaṣuddūn instead of yaṣiddūn) narrated from many authorities. (Muʿjam al-Qirāʾāt al-Qurʾāniyyah, vol. 6, p. 121).
57.transliteration: wa-lammā ḍuriba bnu maryama mathalan ʾidhā qawmuka minhu yaṣiddūna

58.content: وَقالوا أَآلِهَتُنا خَيرٌ أَم هُوَ ۚ ما ضَرَبوهُ لَكَ إِلّا جَدَلًا ۚ بَل هُم قَومٌ خَصِمونَ
58.translation_eng: They say, ‘Are our gods better or he?’They only cite him to you for the sake of contention.Rather they are a contentious lot.
58.transliteration: wa-qālū ʾa-ʾālihatunā khayrun ʾam huwa mā ḍarabūhu laka ʾillā jadalan bal hum qawmun khaṣimūna

59.content: إِن هُوَ إِلّا عَبدٌ أَنعَمنا عَلَيهِ وَجَعَلناهُ مَثَلًا لِبَني إِسرائيلَ
59.translation_eng: He was just a servant whom We had blessedand made an exemplar for the Children of Israel.
59.transliteration: ʾin huwa ʾillā ʿabdun ʾanʿamnā ʿalayhi wa-jaʿalnāhu mathalan li-banī ʾisrāʾīla

60.content: وَلَو نَشاءُ لَجَعَلنا مِنكُم مَلائِكَةً فِي الأَرضِ يَخلُفونَ
60.translation_eng: Had We wished We would have set in your steadangels to be [your] successors on the earth.
60.transliteration: wa-law nashāʾu la-jaʿalnā minkum malāʾikatan fī l-ʾarḍi yakhlufūna

61.content: وَإِنَّهُ لَعِلمٌ لِلسّاعَةِ فَلا تَمتَرُنَّ بِها وَاتَّبِعونِ ۚ هٰذا صِراطٌ مُستَقيمٌ
61.translation_eng: Indeed he1 is a portent of the Hour;so do not doubt it and follow Me.This is a straight path.That is, Jesus (ʿa), or ʿAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib (ʿa), in accordance with traditions narrated from the Prophet (ṣ) and Imam Jaʿfar al-Ṣādiq (ʿa). (Tafsīr al-Burhān).
61.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahū la-ʿilmun li-s-sāʿati fa-lā tamtarunna bihā wa-ttabiʿūni hādhā ṣirāṭun mustaqīmun

62.content: وَلا يَصُدَّنَّكُمُ الشَّيطانُ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكُم عَدُوٌّ مُبينٌ
62.translation_eng: Do not let Satan bar you [from the way of Allah].Indeed he is your manifest enemy.
62.transliteration: wa-lā yaṣuddannakumu sh-shayṭānu ʾinnahū lakum ʿaduwwun mubīnun

63.content: وَلَمّا جاءَ عيسىٰ بِالبَيِّناتِ قالَ قَد جِئتُكُم بِالحِكمَةِ وَلِأُبَيِّنَ لَكُم بَعضَ الَّذي تَختَلِفونَ فيهِ ۖ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطيعونِ
63.translation_eng: When Jesus brought the manifest proofs,he said, ‘I have certainly brought you wisdom,and [I have come] to make clear to yousome of the things that you differ about.So be wary of Allah and obey me.
63.transliteration: wa-lammā jāʾa ʿīsā bi-l-bayyināti qāla qad jiʾtukum bi-l-ḥikmati wa-li-ʾubayyina lakum baʿḍa lladhī takhtalifūna fīhi fa-ttaqū llāha wa-ʾaṭīʿūni

64.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ رَبّي وَرَبُّكُم فَاعبُدوهُ ۚ هٰذا صِراطٌ مُستَقيمٌ
64.translation_eng: Indeed Allah is my Lord and your Lord;so worship Him.This is a straight path.’
64.transliteration: ʾinna llāha huwa rabbī wa-rabbukum fa-ʿbudūhu hādhā ṣirāṭun mustaqīmun

65.content: فَاختَلَفَ الأَحزابُ مِن بَينِهِم ۖ فَوَيلٌ لِلَّذينَ ظَلَموا مِن عَذابِ يَومٍ أَليمٍ
65.translation_eng: But the factions differed among themselves.So woe to the wrongdoersfor the punishment of a painful day.
65.transliteration: fa-khtalafa l-ʾaḥzābu min baynihim fa-waylun li-lladhīna ẓalamū min ʿadhābi yawmin ʾalīmin

66.content: هَل يَنظُرونَ إِلَّا السّاعَةَ أَن تَأتِيَهُم بَغتَةً وَهُم لا يَشعُرونَ
66.translation_eng: Do they await anything but that the Hourshould overtake them suddenly,while they are unaware?
66.transliteration: hal yanẓurūna ʾillā s-sāʿata ʾan taʾtiyahum baghtatan wa-hum lā yashʿurūna

67.content: الأَخِلّاءُ يَومَئِذٍ بَعضُهُم لِبَعضٍ عَدُوٌّ إِلَّا المُتَّقينَ
67.translation_eng: On that day, friends will be one another’s enemies,except for the Godwary.
67.transliteration: al-ʾakhillāʾu yawmaʾidhin baʿḍuhum li-baʿḍin ʿaduwwun ʾillā l-muttaqīna

68.content: يا عِبادِ لا خَوفٌ عَلَيكُمُ اليَومَ وَلا أَنتُم تَحزَنونَ
68.translation_eng: [They will be told,] ‘O My servants!Today you will have no fear,nor will you grieve.
68.transliteration: yā-ʿibādi lā khawfun ʿalaykumu l-yawma wa-lā ʾantum taḥzanūna

69.content: الَّذينَ آمَنوا بِآياتِنا وَكانوا مُسلِمينَ
69.translation_eng: Those who believed in Our signsand had been muslims.
69.transliteration: alladhīna ʾāmanū bi-ʾāyātinā wa-kānū muslimīna

70.content: ادخُلُوا الجَنَّةَ أَنتُم وَأَزواجُكُم تُحبَرونَ
70.translation_eng: Enter paradise, you and your spouses,rejoicing’
70.transliteration: udkhulū l-jannata ʾantum wa-ʾazwājukum tuḥbarūna

71.content: يُطافُ عَلَيهِم بِصِحافٍ مِن ذَهَبٍ وَأَكوابٍ ۖ وَفيها ما تَشتَهيهِ الأَنفُسُ وَتَلَذُّ الأَعيُنُ ۖ وَأَنتُم فيها خالِدونَ
71.translation_eng: (they will be served aroundwith golden dishes and goblets,and therein1 will be whatever the souls desireand eyes delight in)‘and you will remain in it [forever].That is, in paradise.
71.transliteration: yuṭāfu ʿalayhim bi-ṣiḥāfin min dhahabin wa-ʾakwābin wa-fīhā mā tashtahīhi l-ʾanfusu wa-taladhdhu l-ʾaʿyunu wa-ʾantum fīhā khālidūna

72.content: وَتِلكَ الجَنَّةُ الَّتي أورِثتُموها بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
72.translation_eng: That is the paradise you have been given to inheritfor what you used to do.
72.transliteration: wa-tilka l-jannatu llatī ʾūrithtumūhā bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna

73.content: لَكُم فيها فاكِهَةٌ كَثيرَةٌ مِنها تَأكُلونَ
73.translation_eng: Therein are abundant fruits for youfrom which you will eat.’
73.transliteration: lakum fīhā fākihatun kathīratun minhā taʾkulūna

74.content: إِنَّ المُجرِمينَ في عَذابِ جَهَنَّمَ خالِدونَ
74.translation_eng: Indeed the guiltywill remain [forever] in the punishment of hell.
74.transliteration: ʾinna l-mujrimīna fī ʿadhābi jahannama khālidūna

75.content: لا يُفَتَّرُ عَنهُم وَهُم فيهِ مُبلِسونَ
75.translation_eng: It will not be lightened for themand they will be despondent in it.
75.transliteration: lā yufattaru ʿanhum wa-hum fīhi mublisūna

76.content: وَما ظَلَمناهُم وَلٰكِن كانوا هُمُ الظّالِمينَ
76.translation_eng: We did not wrong them,but they themselves were wrongdoers.
76.transliteration: wa-mā ẓalamnāhum wa-lākin kānū humu ẓ-ẓālimīna

77.content: وَنادَوا يا مالِكُ لِيَقضِ عَلَينا رَبُّكَ ۖ قالَ إِنَّكُم ماكِثونَ
77.translation_eng: They will call out, ‘O Mālik!1Let your Lord finish us off!’He will say, ‘Indeed you will stay on.’The name of the angel in charge of hell.
77.transliteration: wa-nādaw yā-māliku li-yaqḍi ʿalaynā rabbuka qāla ʾinnakum mākithūna

78.content: لَقَد جِئناكُم بِالحَقِّ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَكُم لِلحَقِّ كارِهونَ
78.translation_eng: ‘We certainly brought you the truth,but most of you were averse to the truth.’
78.transliteration: la-qad jiʾnākum bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-lākinna ʾaktharakum li-l-ḥaqqi kārihūna

79.content: أَم أَبرَموا أَمرًا فَإِنّا مُبرِمونَ
79.translation_eng: Have they settled on some [devious] plan?Indeed We too are settling [on Our plans].
79.transliteration: ʾam ʾabramū ʾamran fa-ʾinnā mubrimūna

80.content: أَم يَحسَبونَ أَنّا لا نَسمَعُ سِرَّهُم وَنَجواهُم ۚ بَلىٰ وَرُسُلُنا لَدَيهِم يَكتُبونَ
80.translation_eng: Do they suppose that We do not heartheir secret thoughts and their secret talks?Yes indeed!And with them are Our messengers, writing down.
80.transliteration: ʾam yaḥsabūna ʾannā lā nasmaʿu sirrahum wa-najwāhum balā wa-rusulunā ladayhim yaktubūna

81.content: قُل إِن كانَ لِلرَّحمٰنِ وَلَدٌ فَأَنا أَوَّلُ العابِدينَ
81.translation_eng: Say, ‘If the All-beneficent had a son,I would have been the first to worship [him].’
81.transliteration: qul ʾin kāna li-r-raḥmāni waladun fa-ʾana ʾawwalu l-ʿābidīna

82.content: سُبحانَ رَبِّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ رَبِّ العَرشِ عَمّا يَصِفونَ
82.translation_eng: Clear is the Lord of the heavens and the earth,the Lord of the Throne,of whatever they allege [concerning Him]!
82.transliteration: subḥāna rabbi s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi rabbi l-ʿarshi ʿammā yaṣifūna

83.content: فَذَرهُم يَخوضوا وَيَلعَبوا حَتّىٰ يُلاقوا يَومَهُمُ الَّذي يوعَدونَ
83.translation_eng: So leave them to gossip and playuntil they encounter their daywhich they are promised.
83.transliteration: fa-dharhum yakhūḍū wa-yalʿabū ḥattā yulāqū yawmahumu lladhī yūʿadūna

84.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي فِي السَّماءِ إِلٰهٌ وَفِي الأَرضِ إِلٰهٌ ۚ وَهُوَ الحَكيمُ العَليمُ
84.translation_eng: It is He who is God in the sky,and God on the earth;and He is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing.
84.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī fī s-samāʾi ʾilāhun wa-fī l-ʾarḍi ʾilāhun wa-huwa l-ḥakīmu l-ʿalīmu

85.content: وَتَبارَكَ الَّذي لَهُ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما وَعِندَهُ عِلمُ السّاعَةِ وَإِلَيهِ تُرجَعونَ
85.translation_eng: Blessed is Heto whom belongs the kingdom of the heavensand the earthand whatever is between them,and with Him is the knowledge of the Hour,and to Him you will be brought back.
85.transliteration: wa-tabāraka lladhī lahū mulku s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā baynahumā wa-ʿindahū ʿilmu s-sāʿati wa-ʾilayhi turjaʿūna

86.content: وَلا يَملِكُ الَّذينَ يَدعونَ مِن دونِهِ الشَّفاعَةَ إِلّا مَن شَهِدَ بِالحَقِّ وَهُم يَعلَمونَ
86.translation_eng: Those whom they invoke besides Him have no powerof intercession,except those who are witness to the truthand who know [for whom to intercede].
86.transliteration: wa-lā yamliku lladhīna yadʿūna min dūnihi sh-shafāʿata ʾillā man shahida bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-hum yaʿlamūna

87.content: وَلَئِن سَأَلتَهُم مَن خَلَقَهُم لَيَقولُنَّ اللَّهُ ۖ فَأَنّىٰ يُؤفَكونَ
87.translation_eng: If you ask them,‘Who created them?’they will surely say, ‘Allah.’Then where do they stray?
87.transliteration: wa-la-ʾin saʾaltahum man khalaqahum la-yaqūlunna llāhu fa-ʾannā yuʾfakūna

88.content: وَقيلِهِ يا رَبِّ إِنَّ هٰؤُلاءِ قَومٌ لا يُؤمِنونَ
88.translation_eng: And his1 plaint: ‘My Lord!Indeed these are a people who will not have faith!’That is, of the Apostle of Allah (ṣ).
88.transliteration: wa-qīlihī yā-rabbi ʾinna hāʾulāʾi qawmun lā yuʾminūna

89.content: فَاصفَح عَنهُم وَقُل سَلامٌ ۚ فَسَوفَ يَعلَمونَ
89.translation_eng: So disregard them, and say, ‘Peace!’Soon they will know.
89.transliteration: fa-ṣfaḥ ʿanhum wa-qul salāmun fa-sawfa yaʿlamūna

44.description: The surah that mentions a divine portent of an evil destiny that will come in the appearance of something unknown called the Smoke. It manifests in the sky and enveils the unbelievers on the earth, until they cry in vain to God that they shall believe in the Quran and its Messenger of only He delivers them from this torment. It takes its name from the “smoke” (dukhān) mentioned in verse 10. The surah highlights the mercy that is the Quran, addresses the obduracy of the powerful and wealthy oppressors, and draws comparisons between the people of Pharaoh, Tubbaʾ, and the Meccans. The people of Paradise will enjoy heavenly bliss while those who were mighty in this world will suer the torments of Hell.The surah is also known as: Mist.

1.translation_eng: Ḥā, Mīm.

2.translation_eng: By the Manifest Book!

3.content: إِنّا أَنزَلناهُ في لَيلَةٍ مُبارَكَةٍ ۚ إِنّا كُنّا مُنذِرينَ
3.translation_eng: Indeed We sent it down on a blessed night,and indeed We have been warning [mankind].
3.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾanzalnāhu fī laylatin mubārakatin ʾinnā kunnā mundhirīna

4.content: فيها يُفرَقُ كُلُّ أَمرٍ حَكيمٍ
4.translation_eng: Every definitive matter is resolved in it,1That is, on the Night of Ordainment. See 97:1-5.
4.transliteration: fīhā yufraqu kullu ʾamrin ḥakīmin

5.content: أَمرًا مِن عِندِنا ۚ إِنّا كُنّا مُرسِلينَ
5.translation_eng: as an ordinance1 from Us.Indeed We have been sending [apostles],Or ‘edict.’
5.transliteration: ʾamran min ʿindinā ʾinnā kunnā mursilīna

6.content: رَحمَةً مِن رَبِّكَ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
6.translation_eng: as a mercy from your Lord—indeed He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing—
6.transliteration: raḥmatan min rabbika ʾinnahū huwa s-samīʿu l-ʿalīmu

7.content: رَبِّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُما ۖ إِن كُنتُم موقِنينَ
7.translation_eng: the Lord of the heavens and the earth,and whatever is between them,should you have conviction.
7.transliteration: rabbi s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā baynahumā ʾin kuntum mūqinīna

8.content: لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ يُحيي وَيُميتُ ۖ رَبُّكُم وَرَبُّ آبائِكُمُ الأَوَّلينَ
8.translation_eng: There is no god except Him:He gives life and brings death,your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.
8.transliteration: lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa yuḥyī wa-yumītu rabbukum wa-rabbu ʾābāʾikumu l-ʾawwalīna

9.content: بَل هُم في شَكٍّ يَلعَبونَ
9.translation_eng: Rather they play around in doubt.
9.transliteration: bal hum fī shakkin yalʿabūna

10.content: فَارتَقِب يَومَ تَأتِي السَّماءُ بِدُخانٍ مُبينٍ
10.translation_eng: So watch out for the daywhen the sky brings on a manifest smoke,
10.transliteration: fa-rtaqib yawma taʾtī s-samāʾu bi-dukhānin mubīnin

11.content: يَغشَى النّاسَ ۖ هٰذا عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
11.translation_eng: enveloping the people.[They will cry out:] ‘This is a painful punishment.
11.transliteration: yaghshā n-nāsa hādhā ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

12.content: رَبَّنَا اكشِف عَنَّا العَذابَ إِنّا مُؤمِنونَ
12.translation_eng: Our Lord! Remove from us this punishment.Indeed we have believed!’
12.transliteration: rabbanā kshif ʿannā l-ʿadhāba ʾinnā muʾminūna

13.content: أَنّىٰ لَهُمُ الذِّكرىٰ وَقَد جاءَهُم رَسولٌ مُبينٌ
13.translation_eng: What will the admonition avail them,when a manifest apostle had already come to them,
13.transliteration: ʾannā lahumu dh-dhikrā wa-qad jāʾahum rasūlun mubīnun

14.content: ثُمَّ تَوَلَّوا عَنهُ وَقالوا مُعَلَّمٌ مَجنونٌ
14.translation_eng: but they turned away from him,and said, ‘A tutored madman?’
14.transliteration: thumma tawallaw ʿanhu wa-qālū muʿallamun majnūnun

15.content: إِنّا كاشِفُو العَذابِ قَليلًا ۚ إِنَّكُم عائِدونَ
15.translation_eng: Indeed We will withdraw the punishment a little;but you will indeed revert [to your earlier ways].
15.transliteration: ʾinnā kāshifū l-ʿadhābi qalīlan ʾinnakum ʿāʾidūna

16.content: يَومَ نَبطِشُ البَطشَةَ الكُبرىٰ إِنّا مُنتَقِمونَ
16.translation_eng: The day We shall strike with the most terrible striking,We will indeed take vengeance [on them].
16.transliteration: yawma nabṭishu l-baṭshata l-kubrā ʾinnā muntaqimūna

17.content: ۞ وَلَقَد فَتَنّا قَبلَهُم قَومَ فِرعَونَ وَجاءَهُم رَسولٌ كَريمٌ
17.translation_eng: Certainly We triedthe people of Pharaoh before them,when a noble apostle came to them,
17.transliteration: wa-la-qad fatannā qablahum qawma firʿawna wa-jāʾahum rasūlun karīmun

18.content: أَن أَدّوا إِلَيَّ عِبادَ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنّي لَكُم رَسولٌ أَمينٌ
18.translation_eng: [saying,] ‘Give over the servants of Allah1 to me;indeed I am a trusted apostle [sent] to you.That is, the Israelites.
18.transliteration: ʾan ʾaddū ʾilayya ʿibāda llāhi ʾinnī lakum rasūlun ʾamīnun

19.content: وَأَن لا تَعلوا عَلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنّي آتيكُم بِسُلطانٍ مُبينٍ
19.translation_eng: Do not defy Allah.Indeed I bring you a manifest authority.
19.transliteration: wa-ʾan lā taʿlū ʿalā llāhi ʾinnī ʾātīkum bi-sulṭānin mubīnin

20.content: وَإِنّي عُذتُ بِرَبّي وَرَبِّكُم أَن تَرجُمونِ
20.translation_eng: I seek the protection of my Lord and your Lord,lest you should stone me.
20.transliteration: wa-ʾinnī ʿudhtu bi-rabbī wa-rabbikum ʾan tarjumūni

21.content: وَإِن لَم تُؤمِنوا لي فَاعتَزِلونِ
21.translation_eng: And if you do not believe me,keep out of my way.’
21.transliteration: wa-ʾin lam tuʾminū lī fa-ʿtazilūni

22.content: فَدَعا رَبَّهُ أَنَّ هٰؤُلاءِ قَومٌ مُجرِمونَ
22.translation_eng: Then he invoked his Lord, [saying,]‘These are indeed a guilty lot.’
22.transliteration: fa-daʿā rabbahū ʾanna hāʾulāʾi qawmun mujrimūna

23.content: فَأَسرِ بِعِبادي لَيلًا إِنَّكُم مُتَّبَعونَ
23.translation_eng: [Allah told him,] ‘Set out with My servants by night;for you will indeed be pursued.
23.transliteration: fa-ʾasri bi-ʿibādī laylan ʾinnakum muttabaʿūna

24.content: وَاترُكِ البَحرَ رَهوًا ۖ إِنَّهُم جُندٌ مُغرَقونَ
24.translation_eng: And leave the sea calmly;they will indeed be a drowned host.’
24.transliteration: wa-truki l-baḥra rahwan ʾinnahum jundun mughraqūna

25.content: كَم تَرَكوا مِن جَنّاتٍ وَعُيونٍ
25.translation_eng: How many gardens and springs did they leave behind!
25.transliteration: kam tarakū min jannātin wa-ʿuyūnin

26.content: وَزُروعٍ وَمَقامٍ كَريمٍ
26.translation_eng: Fields and splendid places,
26.transliteration: wa-zurūʿin wa-maqāmin karīmin

27.content: وَنَعمَةٍ كانوا فيها فاكِهينَ
27.translation_eng: and the bounties wherein they rejoiced!
27.transliteration: wa-naʿmatin kānū fīhā fākihīna

28.content: كَذٰلِكَ ۖ وَأَورَثناها قَومًا آخَرينَ
28.translation_eng: So it was;and We bequeathed them to another people.
28.transliteration: ka-dhālika wa-ʾawrathnāhā qawman ʾākharīna

29.content: فَما بَكَت عَلَيهِمُ السَّماءُ وَالأَرضُ وَما كانوا مُنظَرينَ
29.translation_eng: So neither the sky wept for them,nor the earth;nor were they granted any respite.
29.transliteration: fa-mā bakat ʿalayhimu s-samāʾu wa-l-ʾarḍu wa-mā kānū munẓarīna

30.content: وَلَقَد نَجَّينا بَني إِسرائيلَ مِنَ العَذابِ المُهينِ
30.translation_eng: Certainly We delivered the Children of Israelfrom a humiliating torment,
30.transliteration: wa-la-qad najjaynā banī ʾisrāʾīla mina l-ʿadhābi l-muhīni

31.content: مِن فِرعَونَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ عالِيًا مِنَ المُسرِفينَ
31.translation_eng: from Pharaoh.Indeed he was a tyrant among the profligates.
31.transliteration: min firʿawna ʾinnahū kāna ʿāliyan mina l-musrifīna

32.content: وَلَقَدِ اختَرناهُم عَلىٰ عِلمٍ عَلَى العالَمينَ
32.translation_eng: Certainly We chose them knowinglyabove all the nations.
32.transliteration: wa-la-qadi khtarnāhum ʿalā ʿilmin ʿalā l-ʿālamīna

33.content: وَآتَيناهُم مِنَ الآياتِ ما فيهِ بَلاءٌ مُبينٌ
33.translation_eng: And We gave them some signsin which there was a manifest test.
33.transliteration: wa-ʾātaynāhum mina l-ʾāyāti mā fīhi balāʾun mubīnun

34.content: إِنَّ هٰؤُلاءِ لَيَقولونَ
34.translation_eng: Indeed these ones say,
34.transliteration: ʾinna hāʾulāʾi la-yaqūlūna

35.content: إِن هِيَ إِلّا مَوتَتُنَا الأولىٰ وَما نَحنُ بِمُنشَرينَ
35.translation_eng: ‘It will be just our first death,and we shall not be resurrected.
35.transliteration: ʾin hiya ʾillā mawtatunā l-ʾūlā wa-mā naḥnu bi-munsharīna

36.content: فَأتوا بِآبائِنا إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
36.translation_eng: Bring our fathers back [to life],should you be truthful.’
36.transliteration: fa-ʾtū bi-ʾābāʾinā ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

37.content: أَهُم خَيرٌ أَم قَومُ تُبَّعٍ وَالَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ أَهلَكناهُم ۖ إِنَّهُم كانوا مُجرِمينَ
37.translation_eng: Are they better, or the people of Tubbaʿ,1and those who were before them?We destroyed them;indeed they were guilty.Name of a Yemenite king. Tubbaʿ is said to be the title of a dynasty of Yemenite kings (like pharaoh, caesar and khaqan).
37.transliteration: ʾa-hum khayrun ʾam qawmu tubbaʿin wa-lladhīna min qablihim ʾahlaknāhum ʾinnahum kānū mujrimīna

38.content: وَما خَلَقنَا السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما لاعِبينَ
38.translation_eng: We did not create the heavens and the earthand whatever is between them for play.
38.transliteration: wa-mā khalaqnā s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-mā baynahumā lāʿibīna

39.content: ما خَلَقناهُما إِلّا بِالحَقِّ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
39.translation_eng: We did not create them except with reason;but most of them do not know.
39.transliteration: mā khalaqnāhumā ʾillā bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-lākinna ʾaktharahum lā yaʿlamūna

40.content: إِنَّ يَومَ الفَصلِ ميقاتُهُم أَجمَعينَ
40.translation_eng: Indeed the Day of Judgementis the tryst for them all,
40.transliteration: ʾinna yawma l-faṣli mīqātuhum ʾajmaʿīna

41.content: يَومَ لا يُغني مَولًى عَن مَولًى شَيئًا وَلا هُم يُنصَرونَ
41.translation_eng: the daywhen a friend will not avail a friend in any way,nor will they be helped,
41.transliteration: yawma lā yughnī mawlan ʿan mawlan shayʾan wa-lā hum yunṣarūna

42.content: إِلّا مَن رَحِمَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ العَزيزُ الرَّحيمُ
42.translation_eng: except for him on whom Allah has mercy.Indeed He is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
42.transliteration: ʾillā man raḥima llāhu ʾinnahū huwa l-ʿazīzu r-raḥīmu

43.content: إِنَّ شَجَرَتَ الزَّقّومِ
43.translation_eng: Indeed the tree of Zaqqūm
43.transliteration: ʾinna shajarata z-zaqqūmi

44.content: طَعامُ الأَثيمِ
44.translation_eng: will be the food of the sinful.
44.transliteration: ṭaʿāmu l-ʾathīmi

45.content: كَالمُهلِ يَغلي فِي البُطونِ
45.translation_eng: Like molten copper it will boil in the bellies,
45.transliteration: ka-l-muhli yaghlī fī l-buṭūni

46.content: كَغَليِ الحَميمِ
46.translation_eng: boiling like boiling water.
46.transliteration: ka-ghalyi l-ḥamīmi

47.content: خُذوهُ فَاعتِلوهُ إِلىٰ سَواءِ الجَحيمِ
47.translation_eng: ‘Seize himand drag him to the middle of hell,
47.transliteration: khudhūhu fa-ʿtilūhu ʾilā sawāʾi l-jaḥīmi

48.content: ثُمَّ صُبّوا فَوقَ رَأسِهِ مِن عَذابِ الحَميمِ
48.translation_eng: then pour over his headthe punishment of boiling water.’
48.transliteration: thumma ṣubbū fawqa raʾsihī min ʿadhābi l-ḥamīmi

49.content: ذُق إِنَّكَ أَنتَ العَزيزُ الكَريمُ
49.translation_eng: ‘Taste!Indeed you are the [self-styled] mighty and noble!
49.transliteration: dhuq ʾinnaka ʾanta l-ʿazīzu l-karīmu

50.content: إِنَّ هٰذا ما كُنتُم بِهِ تَمتَرونَ
50.translation_eng: This is indeed what you used to doubt!’
50.transliteration: ʾinna hādhā mā kuntum bihī tamtarūna

51.content: إِنَّ المُتَّقينَ في مَقامٍ أَمينٍ
51.translation_eng: Indeed the Godwary will be in a secure place,
51.transliteration: ʾinna l-muttaqīna fī maqāmin ʾamīnin

52.content: في جَنّاتٍ وَعُيونٍ
52.translation_eng: amid gardens and springs,
