52.transliteration: fī jannātin wa-ʿuyūnin

53.content: يَلبَسونَ مِن سُندُسٍ وَإِستَبرَقٍ مُتَقابِلينَ
53.translation_eng: dressed in fine silk and brocade,sitting face to face.
53.transliteration: yalbasūna min sundusin wa-ʾistabraqin mutaqābilīna

54.content: كَذٰلِكَ وَزَوَّجناهُم بِحورٍ عينٍ
54.translation_eng: So shall it be,and We shall wed them to black-eyed houris.
54.transliteration: ka-dhālika wa-zawwajnāhum bi-ḥūrin ʿīnin

55.content: يَدعونَ فيها بِكُلِّ فاكِهَةٍ آمِنينَ
55.translation_eng: There they will call for every fruit, in safety.
55.transliteration: yadʿūna fīhā bi-kulli fākihatin ʾāminīna

56.content: لا يَذوقونَ فيهَا المَوتَ إِلَّا المَوتَةَ الأولىٰ ۖ وَوَقاهُم عَذابَ الجَحيمِ
56.translation_eng: There they will not taste deathexcept the first death,and He will save them from the punishment of hell
56.transliteration: lā yadhūqūna fīhā l-mawta ʾillā l-mawtata l-ʾūlā wa-waqāhum ʿadhāba l-jaḥīmi

57.content: فَضلًا مِن رَبِّكَ ۚ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الفَوزُ العَظيمُ
57.translation_eng: —a grace from your Lord.That is the great success.
57.transliteration: faḍlan min rabbika dhālika huwa l-fawzu l-ʿaẓīmu

58.content: فَإِنَّما يَسَّرناهُ بِلِسانِكَ لَعَلَّهُم يَتَذَكَّرونَ
58.translation_eng: Indeed We have made it simple in your language,so that they may take admonition.
58.transliteration: fa-ʾinnamā yassarnāhu bi-lisānika laʿallahum yatadhakkarūna

59.content: فَارتَقِب إِنَّهُم مُرتَقِبونَ
59.translation_eng: So wait!Indeed they [too] are waiting.
59.transliteration: fa-rtaqib ʾinnahum murtaqibūna

45.description: The surah that mentions The Kneeling of every community around the brink of Hellfire on the Day of Doom in wait of its divine judgment. It takes its name from the word “kneeling” (jāthiyah) in verse 28. The surah addresses some of the arguments put forward by those sceptical of the truthfulness of the Quran. Emphasis is placed on the signs of God’s existence discernible in nature, and on the painful punishment that awaits the doubters on the Day of Judgement. The misguided arrogance of the disbelievers (verse 8 and verse 31) is contrasted with God’s true greatness (verse 37); references to God’s wisdom and majesty open and close the surah.The surah is also known as: Bowing the Knee, Crouching, Hobbling, The Kneeling, The Kneeling Down.

1.translation_eng: Ḥā, Mīm.

2.content: تَنزيلُ الكِتابِ مِنَ اللَّهِ العَزيزِ الحَكيمِ
2.translation_eng: The [gradual] sending down of the Book is from Allah,the All-mighty, All-wise.
2.transliteration: tanzīlu l-kitābi mina llāhi l-ʿazīzi l-ḥakīmi

3.content: إِنَّ فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ لَآياتٍ لِلمُؤمِنينَ
3.translation_eng: Indeed in the heavens and the earth there are signsfor the faithful.
3.transliteration: ʾinna fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi la-ʾāyātin li-l-muʾminīna

4.content: وَفي خَلقِكُم وَما يَبُثُّ مِن دابَّةٍ آياتٌ لِقَومٍ يوقِنونَ
4.translation_eng: And in your creation [too],and whatever animals that He scatters abroad,there are signs for a people who have certainty.
4.transliteration: wa-fī khalqikum wa-mā yabuththu min dābbatin ʾāyātun li-qawmin yūqinūna

5.content: وَاختِلافِ اللَّيلِ وَالنَّهارِ وَما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ مِنَ السَّماءِ مِن رِزقٍ فَأَحيا بِهِ الأَرضَ بَعدَ مَوتِها وَتَصريفِ الرِّياحِ آياتٌ لِقَومٍ يَعقِلونَ
5.translation_eng: And in the alternation of night and dayand what Allah sends down from the skyof [His] provisionwith which He revives the earth after its death,and in the changing of the windsthere are signs for a people who apply reason.
5.transliteration: wa-khtilāfi l-layli wa-n-nahāri wa-mā ʾanzala llāhu mina s-samāʾi min rizqin fa-ʾaḥyā bihi l-ʾarḍa baʿda mawtihā wa-taṣrīfi r-riyāḥi ʾāyātun li-qawmin yaʿqilūna

6.content: تِلكَ آياتُ اللَّهِ نَتلوها عَلَيكَ بِالحَقِّ ۖ فَبِأَيِّ حَديثٍ بَعدَ اللَّهِ وَآياتِهِ يُؤمِنونَ
6.translation_eng: These are the signs of Allahthat We recite for you in truth.So what discoursewill they believe after Allah and His signs?
6.transliteration: tilka ʾāyātu llāhi natlūhā ʿalayka bi-l-ḥaqqi fa-bi-ʾayyi ḥadīthin baʿda llāhi wa-ʾāyātihī yuʾminūna

7.content: وَيلٌ لِكُلِّ أَفّاكٍ أَثيمٍ
7.translation_eng: Woe to every sinful liar,
7.transliteration: waylun li-kulli ʾaffākin ʾathīmin

8.content: يَسمَعُ آياتِ اللَّهِ تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِ ثُمَّ يُصِرُّ مُستَكبِرًا كَأَن لَم يَسمَعها ۖ فَبَشِّرهُ بِعَذابٍ أَليمٍ
8.translation_eng: who hears the signs of Allah being recited to him,yet persists disdainfully,as if he had not heard them.So inform him of a painful punishment.
8.transliteration: yasmaʿu ʾāyāti llāhi tutlā ʿalayhi thumma yuṣirru mustakbiran ka-ʾan lam yasmaʿhā fa-bashshirhu bi-ʿadhābin ʾalīmin

9.content: وَإِذا عَلِمَ مِن آياتِنا شَيئًا اتَّخَذَها هُزُوًا ۚ أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم عَذابٌ مُهينٌ
9.translation_eng: Should he learn anything about Our signs,he takes them in derision.For such there is a humiliating punishment.
9.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā ʿalima min ʾāyātinā shayʾan-i ttakhadhahā huzuwan ʾulāʾika lahum ʿadhābun muhīnun

10.content: مِن وَرائِهِم جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَلا يُغني عَنهُم ما كَسَبوا شَيئًا وَلا مَا اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِ اللَّهِ أَولِياءَ ۖ وَلَهُم عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
10.translation_eng: Ahead of them is helland what they have earned will not avail them in any way,nor what they had taken as guardians besides Allah,and there is a great punishment for them.
10.transliteration: min warāʾihim jahannamu wa-lā yughnī ʿanhum mā kasabū shayʾan wa-lā mā ttakhadhū min dūni llāhi ʾawliyāʾa wa-lahum ʿadhābun ʿaẓīmun

11.content: هٰذا هُدًى ۖ وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا بِآياتِ رَبِّهِم لَهُم عَذابٌ مِن رِجزٍ أَليمٌ
11.translation_eng: This is a guidance,and as for those who defy the signs of their Lord,for them is a painful punishment due to defilement.1Cf. 34:5.
11.transliteration: hādhā hudan wa-lladhīna kafarū bi-ʾāyāti rabbihim lahum ʿadhābun min rijzin ʾalīmun-i

12.content: ۞ اللَّهُ الَّذي سَخَّرَ لَكُمُ البَحرَ لِتَجرِيَ الفُلكُ فيهِ بِأَمرِهِ وَلِتَبتَغوا مِن فَضلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
12.translation_eng: It is Allah who disposed the sea for you[r benefit]so that the ships may sail in it by His command,and that you may seek of His grace,and that you may give thanks.
12.transliteration: allāhu lladhī sakhkhara lakumu l-baḥra li-tajriya l-fulku fīhi bi-ʾamrihī wa-li tabtaghū min faḍlihī wa-laʿallakum tashkurūna

13.content: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُم ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ جَميعًا مِنهُ ۚ إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَتَفَكَّرونَ
13.translation_eng: And He has disposed for you[r benefit]whatever is in the heavensand whatever is on the earth;all is from Him.There are indeed signs in thatfor a people who reflect.
13.transliteration: wa-sakhkhara lakum mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi jamīʿan minhu ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʾāyātin li-qawmin yatafakkarūna

14.content: قُل لِلَّذينَ آمَنوا يَغفِروا لِلَّذينَ لا يَرجونَ أَيّامَ اللَّهِ لِيَجزِيَ قَومًا بِما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
14.translation_eng: Say to the faithfulto forgive those who do not expect Allah’s days,that He may [Himself] requite a peoplefor what they used to earn.
14.transliteration: qul li-lladhīna ʾāmanū yaghfirū li-lladhīna lā yarjūna ʾayyāma llāhi li-yajziya qawman bi-mā kānū yaksibūna

15.content: مَن عَمِلَ صالِحًا فَلِنَفسِهِ ۖ وَمَن أَساءَ فَعَلَيها ۖ ثُمَّ إِلىٰ رَبِّكُم تُرجَعونَ
15.translation_eng: Whoever acts righteously, it is for his own soul,and whoever does evil, it is to its own detriment,then you will be brought back to your Lord.
15.transliteration: man ʿamila ṣāliḥan fa-li-nafsihī wa-man ʾasāʾa fa-ʿalayhā thumma ʾilā rabbikum turjaʿūna

16.content: وَلَقَد آتَينا بَني إِسرائيلَ الكِتابَ وَالحُكمَ وَالنُّبُوَّةَ وَرَزَقناهُم مِنَ الطَّيِّباتِ وَفَضَّلناهُم عَلَى العالَمينَ
16.translation_eng: Certainly We gave the Children of Israel the Book,judgement and prophethoodand We provided them with all the good things,and We gave them an advantage over all the nations,
16.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾātaynā banī ʾisrāʾīla l-kitāba wa-l-ḥukma wa-n-nubuwwata wa-razaqnāhum mina ṭ-ṭayyibāti wa-faḍḍalnāhum ʿalā l-ʿālamīna

17.content: وَآتَيناهُم بَيِّناتٍ مِنَ الأَمرِ ۖ فَمَا اختَلَفوا إِلّا مِن بَعدِ ما جاءَهُمُ العِلمُ بَغيًا بَينَهُم ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقضي بَينَهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ فيما كانوا فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
17.translation_eng: and We gave them manifest precepts.But they did not differexcept after knowledge had come to them,out of envy among themselves.Indeed your Lord will judge between themon the Day of Resurrectionconcerning that about which they used to differ.
17.transliteration: wa-ʾātaynāhum bayyinātin mina l-ʾamri fa-mā khtalafū ʾillā min baʿdi mā jāʾahumu l-ʿilmu baghyan baynahum ʾinna rabbaka yaqḍī baynahum yawma l-qiyāmati fī-mā kānū fīhi yakhtalifūna

18.content: ثُمَّ جَعَلناكَ عَلىٰ شَريعَةٍ مِنَ الأَمرِ فَاتَّبِعها وَلا تَتَّبِع أَهواءَ الَّذينَ لا يَعلَمونَ
18.translation_eng: Then We set you upon a clear course of the Law;so follow it,and do not follow the desires of thosewho do not know.
18.transliteration: thumma jaʿalnāka ʿalā sharīʿatin mina l-ʾamri fa-ttabiʿhā wa-lā tattabiʿ ʾahwāʾa lladhīna lā yaʿlamūna

19.content: إِنَّهُم لَن يُغنوا عَنكَ مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيئًا ۚ وَإِنَّ الظّالِمينَ بَعضُهُم أَولِياءُ بَعضٍ ۖ وَاللَّهُ وَلِيُّ المُتَّقينَ
19.translation_eng: Indeed they will not avail youin any way against Allah.Indeed the wrongdoers are allies of one another,but Allah is the guardian1 of the Godwary.Or ‘ally.’
19.transliteration: ʾinnahum lan yughnū ʿanka mina llāhi shayʾan wa-ʾinna ẓ-ẓālimīna baʿḍuhum ʾawliyāʾu baʿḍin wa-llāhu waliyyu l-muttaqīna

20.content: هٰذا بَصائِرُ لِلنّاسِ وَهُدًى وَرَحمَةٌ لِقَومٍ يوقِنونَ
20.translation_eng: These are eye-openers for mankind,and guidance and mercyfor a people who have certainty.
20.transliteration: hādhā baṣāʾiru li-n-nāsi wa-hudan wa-raḥmatun li-qawmin yūqinūna

21.content: أَم حَسِبَ الَّذينَ اجتَرَحُوا السَّيِّئَاتِ أَن نَجعَلَهُم كَالَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ سَواءً مَحياهُم وَمَماتُهُم ۚ ساءَ ما يَحكُمونَ
21.translation_eng: Do those who have perpetrated misdeeds supposethat We shall treat them as those who have faithand do righteous deeds,their life and death being equal?Evil is the judgement that they make!
21.transliteration: ʾam ḥasiba lladhīna jtaraḥū s-sayyiʾāti ʾan najʿalahum ka-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti sawāʾan maḥyāhum wa-mamātuhum sāʾa mā yaḥkumūna

22.content: وَخَلَقَ اللَّهُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ بِالحَقِّ وَلِتُجزىٰ كُلُّ نَفسٍ بِما كَسَبَت وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
22.translation_eng: Allah created the heavens and the earthwith reason,so that every soul may be requitedfor what it has earned,and they will not be wronged.
22.transliteration: wa-khalaqa llāhu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-li-tujzā kullu nafsin bi-mā kasabat wa-hum lā yuẓlamūna

23.content: أَفَرَأَيتَ مَنِ اتَّخَذَ إِلٰهَهُ هَواهُ وَأَضَلَّهُ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ عِلمٍ وَخَتَمَ عَلىٰ سَمعِهِ وَقَلبِهِ وَجَعَلَ عَلىٰ بَصَرِهِ غِشاوَةً فَمَن يَهديهِ مِن بَعدِ اللَّهِ ۚ أَفَلا تَذَكَّرونَ
23.translation_eng: Have you seen him who has takenhis desire to be his godand whom Allah has led astray knowingly,and set a seal upon his hearing and his heart,and put a blindfold on his sight?So who will guide him after Allah?Will you not then take admonition?
23.transliteration: ʾa-fa-raʾayta mani ttakhadha ʾilāhahū hawāhu wa-ʾaḍallahu llāhu ʿalā ʿilmin wa-khatama ʿalā samʿihī wa-qalbihī wa-jaʿala ʿalā baṣarihī ghishāwatan fa-man yahdīhi min baʿdi llāhi ʾa-fa-lā tadhakkarūna

24.content: وَقالوا ما هِيَ إِلّا حَياتُنَا الدُّنيا نَموتُ وَنَحيا وَما يُهلِكُنا إِلَّا الدَّهرُ ۚ وَما لَهُم بِذٰلِكَ مِن عِلمٍ ۖ إِن هُم إِلّا يَظُنّونَ
24.translation_eng: They say,‘There is nothing but the life of this world:we live and we die,and nothing but time destroys us.’But they do not have any knowledge of that,and they only make conjectures.
24.transliteration: wa-qālū mā hiya ʾillā ḥayātunā d-dunyā namūtu wa-naḥyā wa-mā yuhlikunā ʾillā d-dahru wa-mā lahum bi-dhālika min ʿilmin ʾin hum ʾillā yaẓunnūna

25.content: وَإِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم آياتُنا بَيِّناتٍ ما كانَ حُجَّتَهُم إِلّا أَن قالُوا ائتوا بِآبائِنا إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
25.translation_eng: And when Our manifest signs are recited to them,their only argument is to say,‘Bring our fathers back [to life],should you be truthful.’
25.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhim ʾāyātunā bayyinātin mā kāna ḥujjatahum ʾillā ʾan qālū ʾtū bi-ʾābāʾinā ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

26.content: قُلِ اللَّهُ يُحييكُم ثُمَّ يُميتُكُم ثُمَّ يَجمَعُكُم إِلىٰ يَومِ القِيامَةِ لا رَيبَ فيهِ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَ النّاسِ لا يَعلَمونَ
26.translation_eng: Say, ‘It is Allah who gives you life,then He makes you die.Then He will gather youon the Day of Resurrection,in which there is no doubt.But most people do not know.’
26.transliteration: quli llāhu yuḥyīkum thumma yumītukum thumma yajmaʿukum ʾilā yawmi l-qiyāmati lā rayba fīhi wa-lākinna ʾakthara n-nāsi lā yaʿlamūna

27.content: وَلِلَّهِ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ وَيَومَ تَقومُ السّاعَةُ يَومَئِذٍ يَخسَرُ المُبطِلونَ
27.translation_eng: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavensand the earth,and when the Hour sets in,the falsifiers will be losers on that day.
27.transliteration: wa-li-llāhi mulku s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-yawma taqūmu s-sāʿatu yawmaʾidhin yakhsaru l-mubṭilūna

28.content: وَتَرىٰ كُلَّ أُمَّةٍ جاثِيَةً ۚ كُلُّ أُمَّةٍ تُدعىٰ إِلىٰ كِتابِهَا اليَومَ تُجزَونَ ما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
28.translation_eng: And you will see every nation fallen on its knees.Every nation will be summoned to its book:‘Today you will be requited forwhat you used to do.
28.transliteration: wa-tarā kulla ʾummatin jāthiyatan kullu ʾummatin tudʿā ʾilā kitābihā l-yawma tujzawna mā kuntum taʿmalūna

29.content: هٰذا كِتابُنا يَنطِقُ عَلَيكُم بِالحَقِّ ۚ إِنّا كُنّا نَستَنسِخُ ما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
29.translation_eng: This is Our book, which speaks truly against you.Indeed We used to record what you used to do.’
29.transliteration: hādhā kitābunā yanṭiqu ʿalaykum bi-l-ḥaqqi ʾinnā kunnā nastansikhu mā kuntum taʿmalūna

30.content: فَأَمَّا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ فَيُدخِلُهُم رَبُّهُم في رَحمَتِهِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الفَوزُ المُبينُ
30.translation_eng: As for those who have faithand do righteous deeds,their Lord will admit them into His mercy.That is the manifest success!
30.transliteration: fa-ʾammā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti fa-yudkhiluhum rabbuhum fī raḥmatihī dhālika huwa l-fawzu l-mubīnu

31.content: وَأَمَّا الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَفَلَم تَكُن آياتي تُتلىٰ عَلَيكُم فَاستَكبَرتُم وَكُنتُم قَومًا مُجرِمينَ
31.translation_eng: But as for the faithless, [they will be asked,]‘Were not My signs recited to you?But you were disdainful,and you were a guilty lot.
31.transliteration: wa-ʾammā lladhīna kafarū ʾa-fa-lam takun ʾāyātī tutlā ʿalaykum fa-stakbartum wa-kuntum qawman mujrimīna

32.content: وَإِذا قيلَ إِنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَالسّاعَةُ لا رَيبَ فيها قُلتُم ما نَدري مَا السّاعَةُ إِن نَظُنُّ إِلّا ظَنًّا وَما نَحنُ بِمُستَيقِنينَ
32.translation_eng: And when it was said,“Allah’s promise is indeed true,and there is no doubt about the Hour,”you said, “We do not know what the Hour is.We know nothing beyond conjectures,and we do not possess any certainty.” ’
32.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā qīla ʾinna waʿda llāhi ḥaqqun wa-s-sāʿatu lā rayba fīhā qultum mā nadrī mā s-sāʿatu ʾin naẓunnu ʾillā ẓannan wa-mā naḥnu bi-mustayqinīna

33.content: وَبَدا لَهُم سَيِّئَاتُ ما عَمِلوا وَحاقَ بِهِم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
33.translation_eng: The evils of what they had done will appear to them,and they will be besiegedby what they used to deride.
33.transliteration: wa-badā lahum sayyiʾātu mā ʿamilū wa-ḥāqa bihim mā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

34.content: وَقيلَ اليَومَ نَنساكُم كَما نَسيتُم لِقاءَ يَومِكُم هٰذا وَمَأواكُمُ النّارُ وَما لَكُم مِن ناصِرينَ
34.translation_eng: And it will be said, ‘Today We will forget you,just as you forgot the encounter of this day of yours.The Fire will be your abode,and you will not have any helpers.
34.transliteration: wa-qīla l-yawma nansākum ka-mā nasītum liqāʾa yawmikum hādhā wa-maʾwākumu n-nāru wa-mā lakum min nāṣirīna

35.content: ذٰلِكُم بِأَنَّكُمُ اتَّخَذتُم آياتِ اللَّهِ هُزُوًا وَغَرَّتكُمُ الحَياةُ الدُّنيا ۚ فَاليَومَ لا يُخرَجونَ مِنها وَلا هُم يُستَعتَبونَ
35.translation_eng: That is because you took the signs of Allahin derision,and the life of the world had deceived you.’So today they will not be brought out of it,nor will they be asked to propitiate [Allah].
35.transliteration: dhālikum bi-ʾannakumu ttakhadhtum ʾāyāti llāhi huzuwan wa-gharratkumu l-ḥayātu d-dunyā fa-l-yawma lā yukhrajūna minhā wa-lā hum yustaʿtabūna

36.content: فَلِلَّهِ الحَمدُ رَبِّ السَّماواتِ وَرَبِّ الأَرضِ رَبِّ العالَمينَ
36.translation_eng: So all praise belongs to Allah,the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth,the Lord of all the worlds.
36.transliteration: fa-li-llāhi l-ḥamdu rabbi s-samāwāti wa-rabbi l-ʾarḍi rabbi l-ʿālamīna

37.content: وَلَهُ الكِبرِياءُ فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ وَهُوَ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
37.translation_eng: To Him belongs all supremacy in the heavensand the earth,and He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.
37.transliteration: wa-lahu l-kibriyāʾu fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-huwa l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

46.description: The surah that mentions the fatal lesion of the ancient people of ʿĀd who dwelled in the dune valley of Aḥqāf, whose prophet warned them to give up idolatry and worship only God, but to no avail. It takes its name from verse 21, where Aḥqāf is mentioned. It reflects one of the major themes of this surah: the inescapable punishment that awaits those who deny the truth and the Resurrection. Emphasis is placed on the fact that communities more established than the Meccans” have been destroyed, and that even the jinn believe in the Quran before the disbelievers of Mecca do. Finally, the Prophet is encouraged to be steadfast and await God’s judgement on the disbelievers.The surah is also known as: The Dune Valleys of al-Ahqaf, The Dunes, The Sand Dunes, The Sandy Plains, Winding Sand-tracts.

1.translation_eng: Ḥā, Mīm.

2.content: تَنزيلُ الكِتابِ مِنَ اللَّهِ العَزيزِ الحَكيمِ
2.translation_eng: The [gradual] sending down of the Book is from Allah,the All-mighty, the All-wise.
2.transliteration: tanzīlu l-kitābi mina llāhi l-ʿazīzi l-ḥakīmi

3.content: ما خَلَقنَا السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما إِلّا بِالحَقِّ وَأَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۚ وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا عَمّا أُنذِروا مُعرِضونَ
3.translation_eng: We did not create the heavens and the earthand whatever is between themexcept with reason and for a specified term.Yet the faithlessare disregardful of what they are warned.
3.transliteration: mā khalaqnā s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-mā baynahumā ʾillā bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾajalin musamman wa-lladhīna kafarū ʿammā ʾundhirū muʿriḍūna

4.content: قُل أَرَأَيتُم ما تَدعونَ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ أَروني ماذا خَلَقوا مِنَ الأَرضِ أَم لَهُم شِركٌ فِي السَّماواتِ ۖ ائتوني بِكِتابٍ مِن قَبلِ هٰذا أَو أَثارَةٍ مِن عِلمٍ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
4.translation_eng: Say, ‘Tell me aboutwhat you invoke besides Allah.Show mewhat [part] of the earth have they created.Do they have any share in the heavens?Bring me a scripture [revealed] before this,or some vestige of [divine] knowledge,should you be truthful.’
4.transliteration: qul ʾa-raʾaytum mā tadʿūna min dūni llāhi ʾarūnī mādhā khalaqū mina l-ʾarḍi ʾam lahum shirkun fī s-samāwāti ʾtūnī bi-kitābin min qabli hādhā ʾaw ʾathāratin min ʿilmin ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

5.content: وَمَن أَضَلُّ مِمَّن يَدعو مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مَن لا يَستَجيبُ لَهُ إِلىٰ يَومِ القِيامَةِ وَهُم عَن دُعائِهِم غافِلونَ
5.translation_eng: Who is more astray than him who invokesbesides Allahsuch as would not respond to himuntil the Day of Resurrection,and who are oblivious of their invocation?
5.transliteration: wa-man ʾaḍallu mimman yadʿū min dūni llāhi man lā yastajību lahū ʾilā yawmi l-qiyāmati wa-hum ʿan duʿāʾihim ghāfilūna

6.content: وَإِذا حُشِرَ النّاسُ كانوا لَهُم أَعداءً وَكانوا بِعِبادَتِهِم كافِرينَ
6.translation_eng: When mankind are mustered [on Judgement’s Day]they will be their enemies,and they will disavow their worship.
6.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā ḥushira n-nāsu kānū lahum ʾaʿdāʾan wa-kānū bi-ʿibādatihim kāfirīna

7.content: وَإِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِم آياتُنا بَيِّناتٍ قالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لِلحَقِّ لَمّا جاءَهُم هٰذا سِحرٌ مُبينٌ
7.translation_eng: When Our manifest signs are recited to them,the faithless say of the truth when it comes to them:‘This is plain magic.’
7.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhim ʾāyātunā bayyinātin qāla lladhīna kafarū li-l-ḥaqqi lammā jāʾahum hādhā ṣiḥrun mubīnun

8.content: أَم يَقولونَ افتَراهُ ۖ قُل إِنِ افتَرَيتُهُ فَلا تَملِكونَ لي مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيئًا ۖ هُوَ أَعلَمُ بِما تُفيضونَ فيهِ ۖ كَفىٰ بِهِ شَهيدًا بَيني وَبَينَكُم ۖ وَهُوَ الغَفورُ الرَّحيمُ
8.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘He has fabricated it?’Say, ‘Should I have fabricated it,you would not avail me anything against Allah.He best knows what you gossip concerning it.He suffices as a witness between me and you,and He is the All-forgiving, the All-merciful.’
8.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna ftarāhu qul ʾini ftaraytuhū fa-lā tamlikūna lī mina llāhi shayʾan huwa ʾaʿlamu bi-mā tufīḍūna fīhi kafā bihī shahīdan baynī wa-baynakum wa-huwa l-ghafūru r-raḥīmu

9.content: قُل ما كُنتُ بِدعًا مِنَ الرُّسُلِ وَما أَدري ما يُفعَلُ بي وَلا بِكُم ۖ إِن أَتَّبِعُ إِلّا ما يوحىٰ إِلَيَّ وَما أَنا إِلّا نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
9.translation_eng: Say, ‘I am not a novelty among the apostles,nor do I know what will be done with me,or with you.I just follow whatever is revealed to me,and I am just a manifest warner.’
9.transliteration: qul mā kuntu bidʿan mina r-rusuli wa-mā ʾadrī mā yufʿalu bī wa-lā bikum ʾin ʾattabiʿu ʾillā mā yūḥā ʾilayya wa-mā ʾana ʾillā nadhīrun mubīnun

10.content: قُل أَرَأَيتُم إِن كانَ مِن عِندِ اللَّهِ وَكَفَرتُم بِهِ وَشَهِدَ شاهِدٌ مِن بَني إِسرائيلَ عَلىٰ مِثلِهِ فَآمَنَ وَاستَكبَرتُم ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدِي القَومَ الظّالِمينَ
10.translation_eng: Say, ‘Tell me, if it is from Allahand you disbelieve in it,and a witness from the Children of Israel has testifiedto its likeand believed [in it],while you are disdainful [of it]?’1Indeed Allah does not guide the wrongdoing lot.Ellipsis; the omitted phrase is, ‘who will be more astray than him who is in extreme defiance.’ See 41:52.
10.transliteration: qul ʾa-raʾaytum ʾin kāna min ʿindi llāhi wa-kafartum bihī wa-shahida shāhidun min banī ʾisrāʾīla ʿalā mithlihī fa-ʾāmana wa-stakbartum ʾinna llāha lā yahdī l-qawma ẓ-ẓālimīna

11.content: وَقالَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لِلَّذينَ آمَنوا لَو كانَ خَيرًا ما سَبَقونا إِلَيهِ ۚ وَإِذ لَم يَهتَدوا بِهِ فَسَيَقولونَ هٰذا إِفكٌ قَديمٌ
11.translation_eng: The faithless say about the faithful,‘Had it been [anything] good,they would not have taken the lead over ustoward [accepting] it.’And since they could not find the way to it,they will say, ‘It is an ancient lie.’
11.transliteration: wa-qāla lladhīna kafarū li-lladhīna ʾāmanū law kāna khayran mā sabaqūnā ʾilayhi wa-ʾidh lam yahtadū bihī fa-sa-yaqūlūna hādhā ʾifkun qadīmun

12.content: وَمِن قَبلِهِ كِتابُ موسىٰ إِمامًا وَرَحمَةً ۚ وَهٰذا كِتابٌ مُصَدِّقٌ لِسانًا عَرَبِيًّا لِيُنذِرَ الَّذينَ ظَلَموا وَبُشرىٰ لِلمُحسِنينَ
12.translation_eng: Yet before it the Book of Moseswas a guide and a mercy,and this is a Book which confirms it,in the Arabic language,to warn those who do wrong,and is a [bearer of] good news for the virtuous.
12.transliteration: wa-min qablihī kitābu mūsā ʾimāman wa-raḥmatan wa-hādhā kitābun muṣaddiqun lisānan ʿarabiyyan li-yundhira lladhīna ẓalamū wa-bushrā li-l-muḥsinīna

13.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ قالوا رَبُّنَا اللَّهُ ثُمَّ استَقاموا فَلا خَوفٌ عَلَيهِم وَلا هُم يَحزَنونَ
13.translation_eng: Indeed those who say, ‘Our Lord is Allah,’and then remain steadfast,they will have no fear,nor will they grieve.
13.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna qālū rabbunā llāhu thumma staqāmū fa-lā khawfun ʿalayhim wa-lā hum yaḥzanūna

14.content: أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ الجَنَّةِ خالِدينَ فيها جَزاءً بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
14.translation_eng: They shall be the inhabitants of paradise,remaining in it [forever]—a reward for what they used to do.
14.transliteration: ʾulāʾika ʾaṣḥābu l-jannati khālidīna fīhā jazāʾan bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūna

15.content: وَوَصَّينَا الإِنسانَ بِوالِدَيهِ إِحسانًا ۖ حَمَلَتهُ أُمُّهُ كُرهًا وَوَضَعَتهُ كُرهًا ۖ وَحَملُهُ وَفِصالُهُ ثَلاثونَ شَهرًا ۚ حَتّىٰ إِذا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ وَبَلَغَ أَربَعينَ سَنَةً قالَ رَبِّ أَوزِعني أَن أَشكُرَ نِعمَتَكَ الَّتي أَنعَمتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلىٰ والِدَيَّ وَأَن أَعمَلَ صالِحًا تَرضاهُ وَأَصلِح لي في ذُرِّيَّتي ۖ إِنّي تُبتُ إِلَيكَ وَإِنّي مِنَ المُسلِمينَ
15.translation_eng: We have enjoined man to be kind to his parents.His mother has carried him in travail,and bore him in travail,and his gestation and weaning take thirty months.When he comes of ageand reaches forty years,he says, ‘My Lord!Inspire me to give thanks for Your blessingwith which You have blessed meand my parents,and that I may do righteous deedswhich may please You,and invest my descendants with righteousness.Indeed I have turned to you in penitence,and I am one of the muslims.’
15.transliteration: wa-waṣṣaynā l-ʾinsāna bi-wālidayhi ʾiḥsānan ḥamalathu ʾummuhū kurhan wa-waḍaʿathu kurhan wa-ḥamluhū wa-fiṣāluhū thalāthūna shahran ḥattā ʾidhā balagha ʾashuddahū wa-balagha ʾarbaʿīna sanatan qāla rabbi ʾawziʿnī ʾan ʾashkura niʿmataka llatī ʾanʿamta ʿalayya wa-ʿalā wālidayya wa-ʾan ʾaʿmala ṣāliḥan tarḍāhu wa-ʾaṣliḥ lī fī dhurriyyatī ʾinnī tubtu ʾilayka wa-ʾinnī mina l-muslimīna

16.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ نَتَقَبَّلُ عَنهُم أَحسَنَ ما عَمِلوا وَنَتَجاوَزُ عَن سَيِّئَاتِهِم في أَصحابِ الجَنَّةِ ۖ وَعدَ الصِّدقِ الَّذي كانوا يوعَدونَ
16.translation_eng: Such are the ones from whom We acceptthe best of what they do,and overlook their misdeeds,[who will be] among the inhabitants of paradise—a true promise which they had been given.
16.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna nataqabbalu ʿanhum ʾaḥsana mā ʿamilū wa-natajāwazu ʿan sayyiʾātihim fī ʾaṣḥābi l-jannati waʿda ṣ-ṣidqi lladhī kānū yūʿadūna

17.content: وَالَّذي قالَ لِوالِدَيهِ أُفٍّ لَكُما أَتَعِدانِني أَن أُخرَجَ وَقَد خَلَتِ القُرونُ مِن قَبلي وَهُما يَستَغيثانِ اللَّهَ وَيلَكَ آمِن إِنَّ وَعدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ فَيَقولُ ما هٰذا إِلّا أَساطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ
17.translation_eng: As for him who says to his parents,‘Fie on you!Do you promise methat I shall be raised [from the dead]when generations have passed away before me?’And they invoke Allah’s help[and say]: ‘Woe to you!Believe! Indeed Allah’s promise is true.’But he says,‘These are nothing but myths of the ancients.’
17.transliteration: wa-lladhī qāla li-wālidayhi ʾuffin lakumā ʾa-taʿidāninī ʾan ʾukhraja wa-qad khalati l-qurūnu min qablī wa-humā yastaghīthāni llāha waylaka ʾāmin ʾinna waʿda llāhi ḥaqqun fa-yaqūlu mā hādhā ʾillā ʾasāṭīru l-ʾawwalīna

18.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ حَقَّ عَلَيهِمُ القَولُ في أُمَمٍ قَد خَلَت مِن قَبلِهِم مِنَ الجِنِّ وَالإِنسِ ۖ إِنَّهُم كانوا خاسِرينَ
18.translation_eng: Such are the ones against whom the word became dueconcerning the nationsthat have passed away before themof jinn and humans.They were indeed the losers.
18.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna ḥaqqa ʿalayhimu l-qawlu fī ʾumamin qad khalat min qablihim mina l-jinni wa-l-ʾinsi ʾinnahum kānū khāsirīna

19.content: وَلِكُلٍّ دَرَجاتٌ مِمّا عَمِلوا ۖ وَلِيُوَفِّيَهُم أَعمالَهُم وَهُم لا يُظلَمونَ
19.translation_eng: For each [person] there will be degrees [of merit]pertaining to what he has done,that He may recompense them fully for their works,and they will not be wronged.
19.transliteration: wa-li-kullin darajātun mimmā ʿamilū wa-li-yuwaffiyahum ʾaʿmālahum wa-hum lā yuẓlamūna

20.content: وَيَومَ يُعرَضُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا عَلَى النّارِ أَذهَبتُم طَيِّباتِكُم في حَياتِكُمُ الدُّنيا وَاستَمتَعتُم بِها فَاليَومَ تُجزَونَ عَذابَ الهونِ بِما كُنتُم تَستَكبِرونَ فِي الأَرضِ بِغَيرِ الحَقِّ وَبِما كُنتُم تَفسُقونَ
20.translation_eng: The day when the faithless are exposedto the Fire, [they will be told,]‘You have exhausted your good thingsin the life of the worldand enjoyed them.So today you will be requitedwith a humiliating punishmentfor your acting arrogantly in the earthunduly,and because you used to transgress.’
20.transliteration: wa-yawma yuʿraḍu lladhīna kafarū ʿalā n-nāri ʾadhhabtum ṭayyibātikum fī ḥayātikumu d-dunyā wa-stamtaʿtum bihā fa-l-yawma tujzawna ʿadhāba l-hūni bi-mā kuntum tastakbirūna fī l-ʾarḍi bi-ghayri l-ḥaqqi wa-bi-mā kuntum tafsuqūna

21.content: ۞ وَاذكُر أَخا عادٍ إِذ أَنذَرَ قَومَهُ بِالأَحقافِ وَقَد خَلَتِ النُّذُرُ مِن بَينِ يَدَيهِ وَمِن خَلفِهِ أَلّا تَعبُدوا إِلَّا اللَّهَ إِنّي أَخافُ عَلَيكُم عَذابَ يَومٍ عَظيمٍ
21.translation_eng: And mention [Hūd] the brother of ʿĀd,when he warned his people at Aḥqāf—and warners have passed awaybefore and after him—saying, ‘Do not worship anyone but Allah.Indeed I fear for you the punishmentof a tremendous day.’
21.transliteration: wa-dhkur ʾakhā ʿādin ʾidh ʾandhara qawmahū bi-l-ʾaḥqāfi wa-qad khalati n-nudhuru min bayni yadayhi wa-min khalfihī ʾallā taʿbudū ʾillā llāha ʾinnī ʾakhāfu ʿalaykum ʿadhāba yawmin ʿaẓīmin

22.content: قالوا أَجِئتَنا لِتَأفِكَنا عَن آلِهَتِنا فَأتِنا بِما تَعِدُنا إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصّادِقينَ
22.translation_eng: They said,‘Have you come to turn us away from our gods?Then bring us what you threaten us with,should you be truthful.
22.transliteration: qālū ʾa-jiʾtanā li-taʾfikanā ʿan ʾālihatinā fa-ʾtinā bi-mā taʿidunā ʾin kunta mina ṣ-ṣādiqīna

23.content: قالَ إِنَّمَا العِلمُ عِندَ اللَّهِ وَأُبَلِّغُكُم ما أُرسِلتُ بِهِ وَلٰكِنّي أَراكُم قَومًا تَجهَلونَ
23.translation_eng: He said,‘The knowledge is with Allah alone.I communicate to you what I have been sent with.But I see that you are a senseless lot.’
23.transliteration: qāla ʾinnamā l-ʿilmu ʿinda llāhi wa-ʾuballighukum mā ʾursiltu bihī wa-lākinnī ʾarākum qawman tajhalūna

24.content: فَلَمّا رَأَوهُ عارِضًا مُستَقبِلَ أَودِيَتِهِم قالوا هٰذا عارِضٌ مُمطِرُنا ۚ بَل هُوَ مَا استَعجَلتُم بِهِ ۖ ريحٌ فيها عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
24.translation_eng: When they saw it as a cloudadvancing toward their valleys,they said, ‘This cloud brings us rain.’‘Rather it is what you sought to hasten:a hurricane carrying a painful punishment,
24.transliteration: fa-lammā raʾawhu ʿāriḍan mustaqbila ʾawdiyatihim qālū hādhā ʿāriḍun mumṭirunā bal huwa mā staʿjaltum bihī rīhun fīhā ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

25.content: تُدَمِّرُ كُلَّ شَيءٍ بِأَمرِ رَبِّها فَأَصبَحوا لا يُرىٰ إِلّا مَساكِنُهُم ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي القَومَ المُجرِمينَ
25.translation_eng: destroying everything by its Lord’s command.’So they became such that nothing could be seenexcept their dwellings.Thus do We requite the guilty lot.
25.transliteration: tudammiru kulla shayʾin bi-ʾamri rabbihā fa-ʾaṣbaḥū lā yurā ʾillā masākinuhum ka-dhālika najzī l-qawma l-mujrimīna

26.content: وَلَقَد مَكَّنّاهُم فيما إِن مَكَّنّاكُم فيهِ وَجَعَلنا لَهُم سَمعًا وَأَبصارًا وَأَفئِدَةً فَما أَغنىٰ عَنهُم سَمعُهُم وَلا أَبصارُهُم وَلا أَفئِدَتُهُم مِن شَيءٍ إِذ كانوا يَجحَدونَ بِآياتِ اللَّهِ وَحاقَ بِهِم ما كانوا بِهِ يَستَهزِئونَ
26.translation_eng: Certainly We had granted them powerin respects that We have not granted you,and We had vested them with hearing and sightand hearts.But neither their hearing availed themnor did their sight,nor their hearts, in any waywhen they used to impugn the signs of Allah.So they were besiegedby what they used to deride.
26.transliteration: wa-la-qad makkannāhum fī-mā ʾin makkannākum fīhi wa-jaʿalnā lahum samʿan wa-ʾabṣāran wa-ʾafʾidatan fa-mā ʾaghnā ʿanhum samʿuhum wa-lā ʾabṣāruhum wa-lā ʾafʾidatuhum min shayʾin ʾidh kānū yajḥadūna bi-ʾāyāti llāhi wa-ḥāqa bihim mā kānū bihī yastahziʾūna

27.content: وَلَقَد أَهلَكنا ما حَولَكُم مِنَ القُرىٰ وَصَرَّفنَا الآياتِ لَعَلَّهُم يَرجِعونَ
27.translation_eng: Certainly We destroyed towns that were around you,and We have paraphrased the signsso that they may come back.
27.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾahlaknā mā ḥawlakum mina l-qurā wa-ṣarrafnā l-ʾāyāti laʿallahum yarjiʿūna

28.content: فَلَولا نَصَرَهُمُ الَّذينَ اتَّخَذوا مِن دونِ اللَّهِ قُربانًا آلِهَةً ۖ بَل ضَلّوا عَنهُم ۚ وَذٰلِكَ إِفكُهُم وَما كانوا يَفتَرونَ
28.translation_eng: So why did not those [false gods] helpthem whom they had taken, besides Allah,as gods, as means of nearness [to Him]?Rather they forsook them;and that was their lieand what they used to fabricate.
28.transliteration: fa-law-lā naṣarahumu lladhīna ttakhadhū min dūni llāhi qurbānan ʾālihatan bal ḍallū ʿanhum wa-dhālika ʾifkuhum wa-mā kānū yaftarūna

29.content: وَإِذ صَرَفنا إِلَيكَ نَفَرًا مِنَ الجِنِّ يَستَمِعونَ القُرآنَ فَلَمّا حَضَروهُ قالوا أَنصِتوا ۖ فَلَمّا قُضِيَ وَلَّوا إِلىٰ قَومِهِم مُنذِرينَ
29.translation_eng: When We dispatched toward you a team of jinnlistening to the Qurʾān,when they were in its presence,they said, ‘Be silent!’When it was finished, they went back to their peopleas warners.
29.transliteration: wa-ʾidh ṣarafnā ʾilayka nafaran mina l-jinni yastamiʿūna l-qurʾāna fa-lammā ḥaḍarūhu qālū ʾanṣitū fa-lammā quḍiya wallaw ʾilā qawmihim mundhirīna

30.content: قالوا يا قَومَنا إِنّا سَمِعنا كِتابًا أُنزِلَ مِن بَعدِ موسىٰ مُصَدِّقًا لِما بَينَ يَدَيهِ يَهدي إِلَى الحَقِّ وَإِلىٰ طَريقٍ مُستَقيمٍ
30.translation_eng: They said, ‘O our people!Indeed we have heard a Bookwhich has been sent down after Moses,confirming what was before it.It guides to the truthand to a straight path.
30.transliteration: qālū yā-qawmanā ʾinnā samiʿnā kitāban ʾunzila min baʿdi mūsā muṣaddiqan li-mā bayna yadayhi yahdī ʾilā l-ḥaqqi wa-ʾilā ṭarīqin mustaqīmin

31.content: يا قَومَنا أَجيبوا داعِيَ اللَّهِ وَآمِنوا بِهِ يَغفِر لَكُم مِن ذُنوبِكُم وَيُجِركُم مِن عَذابٍ أَليمٍ
31.translation_eng: O our people!Respond to Allah’s summonerand have faith in Him.He will forgive you some of your sinsand shelter you from a painful punishment.’
31.transliteration: yā-qawmanā ʾajībū dāʿiya llāhi wa-ʾāminū bihī yaghfir lakum min dhunūbikum wa-yujirkum min ʿadhābin ʾalīmin

32.content: وَمَن لا يُجِب داعِيَ اللَّهِ فَلَيسَ بِمُعجِزٍ فِي الأَرضِ وَلَيسَ لَهُ مِن دونِهِ أَولِياءُ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
32.translation_eng: Those who do not respond to Allah’s summonercannot thwart [Allah] on the earth,and they will not find any protectors besides Him.They are in manifest error.
32.transliteration: wa-man lā yujib dāʿiya llāhi fa-laysa bi-muʿjizin fī l-ʾarḍi wa-laysa lahū min dūnihī ʾawliyāʾu ʾulāʾika fī ḍalālin mubīnin

33.content: أَوَلَم يَرَوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ الَّذي خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَلَم يَعيَ بِخَلقِهِنَّ بِقادِرٍ عَلىٰ أَن يُحيِيَ المَوتىٰ ۚ بَلىٰ إِنَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
33.translation_eng: Do they not see that Allah,who created the heavens and the earthand [who] was not exhausted by their creation,is able to revive the dead?Yes, indeed He has power over all things.
33.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾanna llāha lladhī khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-lam yaʿya bi-khalqihinna bi-qādirin ʿalā ʾan yuḥyiya l-mawtā balā ʾinnahū ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

34.content: وَيَومَ يُعرَضُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا عَلَى النّارِ أَلَيسَ هٰذا بِالحَقِّ ۖ قالوا بَلىٰ وَرَبِّنا ۚ قالَ فَذوقُوا العَذابَ بِما كُنتُم تَكفُرونَ
34.translation_eng: The day when the faithless are exposedto the Fire,[He will say,] ‘Is this not a fact?’They will say, ‘Yes, by our Lord!’He will say, ‘So taste the punishmentbecause of what you used to disbelieve.’
34.transliteration: wa-yawma yuʿraḍu lladhīna kafarū ʿalā n-nāri ʾa-laysa hādhā bi-l-ḥaqqi qālū balā wa-rabbinā qāla fa-dhūqū l-ʿadhāba bi-mā kuntum takfurūna

35.content: فَاصبِر كَما صَبَرَ أُولُو العَزمِ مِنَ الرُّسُلِ وَلا تَستَعجِل لَهُم ۚ كَأَنَّهُم يَومَ يَرَونَ ما يوعَدونَ لَم يَلبَثوا إِلّا ساعَةً مِن نَهارٍ ۚ بَلاغٌ ۚ فَهَل يُهلَكُ إِلَّا القَومُ الفاسِقونَ
35.translation_eng: So be patientjust as the resolute among the apostles were patient,and do not seek to hasten [the punishment]for them.The day when they seewhat they are promised, [it will be]as though they had remained only an hour of a day.This is a proclamation.So shall anyone be destroyedexcept the transgressing lot?
35.transliteration: fa-ṣbir ka-mā ṣabara ʾulū l-ʿazmi mina r-rusuli wa-lā tastaʿjil lahum ka-ʾannahum yawma yarawna mā yūʿadūna lam yalbathū ʾillā sāʿatan min nahārin balāghun fa-hal yuhlaku ʾillā l-qawmu l-fāsiqūna

47.description: The surah that declares that God absolves of misdeeds, and sets right the intellects, of those who work righteousness and who believe in all that God has sent down upon His final Messenger to humankind, Muḥammad. It takes its name from verse 2, where the name of the Prophet occurs. The surah deals with issues of war, those who try to prevent conversion to Islam and the carrying out of God’s commands, and the fate of the hypocrites. It specifically mentions the iniquity of those who expelled the Prophet from Mecca, it describes the futility of the disbelievers’ attempts to oppose God and His Prophet, and it urges the Muslims to obey God in all matters, lest their good deeds come to nothing on the Day of Judgement like those of the disbelievers and hypocrites.The surah is also known as: Mohammad, Muhammad (the Prophet).

1.content: الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَصَدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ أَضَلَّ أَعمالَهُم
1.translation_eng: Those who are [themselves] faithlessand bar [others] from the way of Allah—He has made their works go awry.
1.transliteration: alladhīna kafarū wa-ṣaddū ʿan sabīli llāhi ʾaḍalla ʾaʿmālahum

2.content: وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ وَآمَنوا بِما نُزِّلَ عَلىٰ مُحَمَّدٍ وَهُوَ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّهِم ۙ كَفَّرَ عَنهُم سَيِّئَاتِهِم وَأَصلَحَ بالَهُم
2.translation_eng: But those who have faith and do righteous deedsand believe in what has been sent downto Muhammad —and it is the truth from their Lord—He shall absolve them of their misdeedsand set right their affairs.
2.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa-ʾāmanū bi-mā nuzzila ʿalā muḥammadin wa-huwa l-ḥaqqu min rabbihim kaffara ʿanhum sayyiʾātihim wa-ʾaṣlaḥa bālahum

3.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَرُوا اتَّبَعُوا الباطِلَ وَأَنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنُوا اتَّبَعُوا الحَقَّ مِن رَبِّهِم ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يَضرِبُ اللَّهُ لِلنّاسِ أَمثالَهُم
3.translation_eng: That is because the faithlessfollow falsehood,and because the faithful follow the truthfrom their Lord.That is how Allah draws comparisons for mankind.
3.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾanna lladhīna kafarū ttabaʿū l-bāṭila wa-ʾanna lladhīna ʾāmanū ttabaʿū l-ḥaqqa min rabbihim ka-dhālika yaḍribu llāhu li-n-nāsi ʾamthālahum

4.content: فَإِذا لَقيتُمُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا فَضَربَ الرِّقابِ حَتّىٰ إِذا أَثخَنتُموهُم فَشُدُّوا الوَثاقَ فَإِمّا مَنًّا بَعدُ وَإِمّا فِداءً حَتّىٰ تَضَعَ الحَربُ أَوزارَها ۚ ذٰلِكَ وَلَو يَشاءُ اللَّهُ لَانتَصَرَ مِنهُم وَلٰكِن لِيَبلُوَ بَعضَكُم بِبَعضٍ ۗ وَالَّذينَ قُتِلوا في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ فَلَن يُضِلَّ أَعمالَهُم
4.translation_eng: When you meet the faithless in battle,strike their necks.When you have thoroughly decimated them,bind the captives firmly.Thereafter either oblige them [by setting them free]or take ransomtill the war lays down its burdens.That [is Allah’s ordinance],and had Allah wishedHe could have taken vengeance on them,1but that He may test some of you by means of others.As for those who were slain in the way of Allah,He will not let their works go awry.That is, without your mediation.
4.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā laqītumu lladhīna kafarū fa-ḍarba r-riqābi ḥattā ʾidhā ʾathkhantumūhum fa-shuddū l-wathāqa fa-ʾimmā mannan baʿdu wa-ʾimmā fidāʾan ḥattā taḍaʿa l-ḥarbu ʾawzārahā dhālika wa-law yashāʾu llāhu la-ntaṣara minhum wa-lākin li-yabluwa baʿḍakum bi-baʿḍin wa-lladhīna qutilū fī sabīli llāhi fa-lan yuḍilla ʾaʿmālahum

5.content: سَيَهديهِم وَيُصلِحُ بالَهُم
5.translation_eng: He will guide them and set right their affairs,
5.transliteration: sa-yahdīhim wa-yuṣliḥu bālahum

6.content: وَيُدخِلُهُمُ الجَنَّةَ عَرَّفَها لَهُم
6.translation_eng: and admit them into paradisewith which He has acquainted them.
6.transliteration: wa-yudkhiluhumu l-jannata ʿarrafahā lahum

7.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِن تَنصُرُوا اللَّهَ يَنصُركُم وَيُثَبِّت أَقدامَكُم
7.translation_eng: O you who have faith!If you help Allah, He will help youand make your feet steady.
7.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾin tanṣurū llāha yanṣurkum wa-yuthabbit ʾaqdāmakum

8.content: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا فَتَعسًا لَهُم وَأَضَلَّ أَعمالَهُم
8.translation_eng: As for the faithless,their lot will be to fall [into ruin],1and He will make their works go awry.Or ‘their lot will be wretchedness.’
8.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kafarū fa-taʿsan lahum wa-ʾaḍalla ʾaʿmālahum

9.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُم كَرِهوا ما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ فَأَحبَطَ أَعمالَهُم
9.translation_eng: That is because they loathedwhat Allah has sent down,so He made their works fail.
9.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahum karihū mā ʾanzala llāhu fa-ʾaḥbaṭa ʾaʿmālahum

10.content: ۞ أَفَلَم يَسيروا فِي الأَرضِ فَيَنظُروا كَيفَ كانَ عاقِبَةُ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم ۚ دَمَّرَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِم ۖ وَلِلكافِرينَ أَمثالُها
10.translation_eng: Have they not travelled over the landso that they may observehow was the fate of those who were before them?Allah destroyed them,and a similar [fate] awaits the faithless.
10.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lam yasīrū fī l-ʾarḍi fa-yanẓurū kayfa kāna ʿāqibatu lladhīna min qablihim dammara llāhu ʿalayhim wa-li-l-kāfirīna ʾamthāluhā

11.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ مَولَى الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَأَنَّ الكافِرينَ لا مَولىٰ لَهُم
11.translation_eng: That is because Allah is the protector of the faithful,and because the faithless have no protector.
11.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾanna llāha mawlā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʾanna l-kāfirīna lā mawlā lahum

12.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُدخِلُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ ۖ وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا يَتَمَتَّعونَ وَيَأكُلونَ كَما تَأكُلُ الأَنعامُ وَالنّارُ مَثوًى لَهُم
12.translation_eng: Indeed Allah will admit those who have faithand do righteous deedsinto gardens with streams running in them.As for the faithless, they enjoy and eatjust like the cattle eat,and the Fire will be their [final] abode.
12.transliteration: ʾinna llāha yudkhilu lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru wa-lladhīna kafarū yatamattaʿūna wa-yaʾkulūna ka-mā taʾkulu l-ʾanʿāmu wa-n-nāru mathwan lahum

13.content: وَكَأَيِّن مِن قَريَةٍ هِيَ أَشَدُّ قُوَّةً مِن قَريَتِكَ الَّتي أَخرَجَتكَ أَهلَكناهُم فَلا ناصِرَ لَهُم
13.translation_eng: How many a town there has beenwhich was more powerful than your townwhich expelled you,which We have destroyed,and they had no helper.
13.transliteration: wa-ka-ʾayyin min qaryatin hiya ʾashaddu quwwatan min qaryatika llatī ʾakhrajatka ʾahlaknāhum fa-lā nāṣira lahum

14.content: أَفَمَن كانَ عَلىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِن رَبِّهِ كَمَن زُيِّنَ لَهُ سوءُ عَمَلِهِ وَاتَّبَعوا أَهواءَهُم
14.translation_eng: Is he who stands on a manifest proof from his Lordlike someoneto whom the evil of his conduct is made to seem decorous,and who follow their desires?
14.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man kāna ʿalā bayyinatin min rabbihī ka-man zuyyina lahū sūʾu ʿamalihī wa-ttabaʿū ʾahwāʾahum

15.content: مَثَلُ الجَنَّةِ الَّتي وُعِدَ المُتَّقونَ ۖ فيها أَنهارٌ مِن ماءٍ غَيرِ آسِنٍ وَأَنهارٌ مِن لَبَنٍ لَم يَتَغَيَّر طَعمُهُ وَأَنهارٌ مِن خَمرٍ لَذَّةٍ لِلشّارِبينَ وَأَنهارٌ مِن عَسَلٍ مُصَفًّى ۖ وَلَهُم فيها مِن كُلِّ الثَّمَراتِ وَمَغفِرَةٌ مِن رَبِّهِم ۖ كَمَن هُوَ خالِدٌ فِي النّارِ وَسُقوا ماءً حَميمًا فَقَطَّعَ أَمعاءَهُم
15.translation_eng: A description of the paradisepromised to the Godwary:therein are streams of unstaling water,and streams of milk unchanging in flavour,and streams of wine delicious to the drinkers,and streams of purified honey;there will be for them every kind of fruit in it,and forgiveness from their Lord.[Are such ones] like those who abide in the Fireand are given to drink boiling waterwhich cuts up their bowels?
15.transliteration: mathalu l-jannati llatī wuʿida l-muttaqūna fīhā ʾanhārun min māʾin ghayri ʾāsinin wa-ʾanhārun min labanin lam yataghayyar ṭaʿmuhū wa-ʾanhārun min khamrin ladhdhatin li-sh-shāribīna wa-ʾanhārun min ʿasalin muṣaffan wa-lahum fīhā min kulli th-thamarāti wa-maghfiratun min rabbihim ka-man huwa khālidun fī n-nāri wa-suqū māʾan ḥamīman fa-qaṭṭaʿa ʾamʿāʾahum

16.content: وَمِنهُم مَن يَستَمِعُ إِلَيكَ حَتّىٰ إِذا خَرَجوا مِن عِندِكَ قالوا لِلَّذينَ أوتُوا العِلمَ ماذا قالَ آنِفًا ۚ أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ طَبَعَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم وَاتَّبَعوا أَهواءَهُم
16.translation_eng: There are some among themwho prick up their ears at you.But when they go out from your presence,they say to those who have been given knowledge,‘What did he say just now?’They are the oneson whose hearts Allah has set a seal,and they follow their own desires.
16.transliteration: wa-minhum man yastamiʿu ʾilayka ḥattā ʾidhā kharajū min ʿindika qālū li-lladhīna ʾūtū l-ʿilma mādhā qāla ʾānifan ʾulāʾika lladhīna ṭabaʿa llāhu ʿalā qulūbihim wa-ttabaʿū ʾahwāʾahum

17.content: وَالَّذينَ اهتَدَوا زادَهُم هُدًى وَآتاهُم تَقواهُم
17.translation_eng: As for those who are [rightly] guided,He enhances their guidance,and invests them with their Godwariness.
17.transliteration: wa-lladhīna htadaw zādahum hudan wa-ʾātāhum taqwāhum

18.content: فَهَل يَنظُرونَ إِلَّا السّاعَةَ أَن تَأتِيَهُم بَغتَةً ۖ فَقَد جاءَ أَشراطُها ۚ فَأَنّىٰ لَهُم إِذا جاءَتهُم ذِكراهُم
18.translation_eng: Do they await anything except that the Hourshould overtake them suddenly?Certainly its portents have come.Of what avail to themwill their admonition be when it overtakes them?
18.transliteration: fa-hal yanẓurūna ʾillā s-sāʿata ʾan taʾtiyahum baghtatan fa-qad jāʾa ʾashrāṭuhā fa-ʾannā lahum ʾidhā jāʾathum dhikrāhum

19.content: فَاعلَم أَنَّهُ لا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَاستَغفِر لِذَنبِكَ وَلِلمُؤمِنينَ وَالمُؤمِناتِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ مُتَقَلَّبَكُم وَمَثواكُم
19.translation_eng: Know that there is no god except Allah,and plead [to Allah] for forgiveness of your sinand for the faithful, men and women.Allah knows your itineraryand your [final] abode.
19.transliteration: fa-ʿlam ʾannahū lā ʾilāha ʾillā llāhu wa-staghfir li-dhanbika wa-li-l-muʾminīna wa-l-muʾmināti wa-llāhu yaʿlamu mutaqallabakum wa-mathwākum

20.content: وَيَقولُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا لَولا نُزِّلَت سورَةٌ ۖ فَإِذا أُنزِلَت سورَةٌ مُحكَمَةٌ وَذُكِرَ فيهَا القِتالُ ۙ رَأَيتَ الَّذينَ في قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ يَنظُرونَ إِلَيكَ نَظَرَ المَغشِيِّ عَلَيهِ مِنَ المَوتِ ۖ فَأَولىٰ لَهُم
20.translation_eng: The faithful say,‘If only a sūrah were sent down!’But when a definitive sūrah is sent downand war is mentioned in it,you see those in whose hearts is a sickness1looking upon youwith the look of someone fainting at death.So woe to them!That is, the hypocrites.
20.transliteration: wa-yaqūlu lladhīna ʾāmanū law-lā nuzzilat sūratun fa-ʾidhā ʾunzilat sūratun muḥkamatun wa-dhukira fīhā l-qitālu raʾayta lladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun yanẓurūna ʾilayka naẓara l-maghshiyyi ʿalayhi mina l-mawti fa-ʾawlā lahum

21.content: طاعَةٌ وَقَولٌ مَعروفٌ ۚ فَإِذا عَزَمَ الأَمرُ فَلَو صَدَقُوا اللَّهَ لَكانَ خَيرًا لَهُم
21.translation_eng: Obedience and upright speech … .1So when the matter has been resolved upon,if they remain true to Allahthat will surely be better for them.Ellipsis; the omitted phrase is ‘are all that is expected of you.’
21.transliteration: ṭāʿatun wa-qawlun maʿrūfun fa-ʾidhā ʿazama l-ʾamru fa-law ṣadaqū llāha la-kāna khayran lahum

22.content: فَهَل عَسَيتُم إِن تَوَلَّيتُم أَن تُفسِدوا فِي الأَرضِ وَتُقَطِّعوا أَرحامَكُم
22.translation_eng: May it not be that if you were to wield authorityyou would cause corruption in the landand ill-treat your blood relations?
22.transliteration: fa-hal ʿasaytum ʾin tawallaytum ʾan tufsidū fī l-ʾarḍi wa-tuqaṭṭiʿū ʾarḥāmakum

23.content: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ لَعَنَهُمُ اللَّهُ فَأَصَمَّهُم وَأَعمىٰ أَبصارَهُم
23.translation_eng: They are the ones whom Allah has cursed,so He made them deaf, and blinded their sight.
23.transliteration: ʾulāʾika lladhīna laʿanahumu llāhu fa-ʾaṣammahum wa-ʾaʿmā ʾabṣārahum

24.content: أَفَلا يَتَدَبَّرونَ القُرآنَ أَم عَلىٰ قُلوبٍ أَقفالُها
24.translation_eng: Do they not contemplate the Qurʾān,or are there locks on the hearts?
24.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lā yatadabbarūna l-qurʾāna ʾam ʿalā qulūbin ʾaqfāluhā

25.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ ارتَدّوا عَلىٰ أَدبارِهِم مِن بَعدِ ما تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الهُدَى ۙ الشَّيطانُ سَوَّلَ لَهُم وَأَملىٰ لَهُم
25.translation_eng: Indeed those who turned their backsafter the guidance had become clear to them,it was Satan who had seduced them,and he had given them [far-flung] hopes.1Or ‘and He [i.e. Allah] gave them respite.’
25.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna rtaddū ʿalā ʾadbārihim min baʿdi mā tabayyana lahumu l-hudā sh-shayṭānu sawwala lahum wa-ʾamlā lahum

26.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُم قالوا لِلَّذينَ كَرِهوا ما نَزَّلَ اللَّهُ سَنُطيعُكُم في بَعضِ الأَمرِ ۖ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ إِسرارَهُم
26.translation_eng: That is because they saidto those who loathed what Allah had sent down:‘We shall obey you in some matters,’and Allah knows their secret dealings.
26.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahum qālū li-lladhīna karihū mā nazzala llāhu sa-nuṭīʿukum fī baʿḍi l-ʾamri wa-llāhu yaʿlamu ʾisrārahum

27.content: فَكَيفَ إِذا تَوَفَّتهُمُ المَلائِكَةُ يَضرِبونَ وُجوهَهُم وَأَدبارَهُم
27.translation_eng: But how will it be [with them]when the angels take them away,striking their faces and their backs?!
27.transliteration: fa-kayfa ʾidhā tawaffathumu l-malāʾikatu yaḍribūna wujūhahum wa-ʾadbārahum

28.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمُ اتَّبَعوا ما أَسخَطَ اللَّهَ وَكَرِهوا رِضوانَهُ فَأَحبَطَ أَعمالَهُم
28.translation_eng: That, because they pursued what displeased Allah,and loathed His pleasure.So He has made their works fail.
28.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahumu ttabaʿū mā ʾaskhaṭa llāha wa-karihū riḍwānahū fa-ʾaḥbaṭa ʾaʿmālahum

29.content: أَم حَسِبَ الَّذينَ في قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ أَن لَن يُخرِجَ اللَّهُ أَضغانَهُم
29.translation_eng: Do those in whose hearts is a sickness supposethat Allah will not expose their spite?
29.transliteration: ʾam ḥasiba lladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun ʾan lan yukhrija llāhu ʾaḍghānahum

30.content: وَلَو نَشاءُ لَأَرَيناكَهُم فَلَعَرَفتَهُم بِسيماهُم ۚ وَلَتَعرِفَنَّهُم في لَحنِ القَولِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ أَعمالَكُم
30.translation_eng: If We wish, We will show them1 to youso that you recognize them by their mark.Yet you will recognize them by their tone of speech,and Allah knows your deeds.That is, the hypocrites.
30.transliteration: wa-law nashāʾu la-ʾaraynākahum fa-la-ʿaraftahum bi-sīmāhum wa-la-taʿrifannahum fī laḥni l-qawli wa-llāhu yaʿlamu ʾaʿmālakum

31.content: وَلَنَبلُوَنَّكُم حَتّىٰ نَعلَمَ المُجاهِدينَ مِنكُم وَالصّابِرينَ وَنَبلُوَ أَخبارَكُم
31.translation_eng: We will surely test youuntil We ascertain those of you who wage jihādand those who are steadfast,and We shall appraise your record.
31.transliteration: wa-la-nabluwannakum ḥattā naʿlama l-mujāhidīna minkum wa-ṣ-ṣābirīna wa-nabluwa ʾakhbārakum

32.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَصَدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَشاقُّوا الرَّسولَ مِن بَعدِ ما تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الهُدىٰ لَن يَضُرُّوا اللَّهَ شَيئًا وَسَيُحبِطُ أَعمالَهُم
32.translation_eng: Indeed those who are faithlessand bar from the way of Allahand defy the Apostleafter guidance has become clear to them,will not hurt Allah in the least,and He shall make their works fail.
32.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna kafarū wa-ṣaddū ʿan sabīli llāhi wa-shāqqū r-rasūla min baʿdi mā tabayyana lahumu l-hudā lan yaḍurrū llāha shayʾan wa-sa-yuḥbiṭu ʾaʿmālahum

33.content: ۞ يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا أَطيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطيعُوا الرَّسولَ وَلا تُبطِلوا أَعمالَكُم
33.translation_eng: O you who have faith!Obey Allah and obey the Apostle,and do not render your works void.
33.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾaṭīʿū llāha wa-ʾaṭīʿū r-rasūla wa-lā tubṭilū ʾaʿmālakum

34.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَصَدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ ماتوا وَهُم كُفّارٌ فَلَن يَغفِرَ اللَّهُ لَهُم
34.translation_eng: Indeed those who are faithlessand bar from the way of Allahand then die faithless,Allah will never forgive them.
34.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna kafarū wa-ṣaddū ʿan sabīli llāhi thumma mātū wa-hum kuffārun fa-lan yaghfira llāhu lahum

35.content: فَلا تَهِنوا وَتَدعوا إِلَى السَّلمِ وَأَنتُمُ الأَعلَونَ وَاللَّهُ مَعَكُم وَلَن يَتِرَكُم أَعمالَكُم
35.translation_eng: So do not slacken and [do not] call for peacewhen you have the upper handand Allah is with you,and He will not stint [the reward of] your works.
35.transliteration: fa-lā tahinū wa-tadʿū ʾilā s-salmi wa-ʾantumu l-ʾaʿlawna wa-llāhu maʿakum wa-lan yatirakum ʾaʿmālakum

36.content: إِنَّمَا الحَياةُ الدُّنيا لَعِبٌ وَلَهوٌ ۚ وَإِن تُؤمِنوا وَتَتَّقوا يُؤتِكُم أُجورَكُم وَلا يَسأَلكُم أَموالَكُم
36.translation_eng: The life of the world is just play and diversion,but if you are faithful and Godwary,He will give you your rewards,and will not ask your wealth [in return] from you.
36.transliteration: ʾinnamā l-ḥayātu d-dunyā laʿibun wa-lahwun wa-ʾin tuʾminū wa-tattaqū yuʾtikum ʾujūrakum wa-lā yasʾalkum ʾamwālakum

37.content: إِن يَسأَلكُموها فَيُحفِكُم تَبخَلوا وَيُخرِج أَضغانَكُم
37.translation_eng: Should He ask it from you, and press you,you will be stingy, and He will expose your spite.
37.transliteration: ʾin yasʾalkumūhā fa-yuḥfikum tabkhalū wa-yukhrij ʾaḍghānakum

38.content: ها أَنتُم هٰؤُلاءِ تُدعَونَ لِتُنفِقوا في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ فَمِنكُم مَن يَبخَلُ ۖ وَمَن يَبخَل فَإِنَّما يَبخَلُ عَن نَفسِهِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ الغَنِيُّ وَأَنتُمُ الفُقَراءُ ۚ وَإِن تَتَوَلَّوا يَستَبدِل قَومًا غَيرَكُم ثُمَّ لا يَكونوا أَمثالَكُم
38.translation_eng: Ah! There you are,being invited to spend in the way of Allah;yet among you there are those who are stingy;and whoever is stingy is stingy only to himself.Allah is the All-sufficient, and you are all-needy,and if you turn awayHe will replace you with another people,and they will not be like you.
38.transliteration: hā-ʾantum hāʾulāʾi tudʿawna li-tunfiqū fī sabīli llāhi fa-minkum man yabkhalu wa-man yabkhal fa-ʾinnamā yabkhalu ʿan nafsihī wa-llāhu l-ghaniyyu wa-ʾantumu l-fuqarāʾu wa-ʾin tatawallaw yastabdil qawman ghayrakum thumma lā yakūnū ʾamthālakum

48.description: The surah that opens by acclaiming the manifest Victory or Triumph of peace that God accorded His Prophet in the truce he agreed to with the Meccans at a place called Ḥudaybiyyah. It takes its name from verse 1 wherein “victory” (fatḥ) is mentioned. The surah makes reference to the occasion when the Prophet had a vision that he and his followers would be performing pilgrimage to Mecca (verse 27). They set out, but the Meccans decided to bar them at Ḥudaybiyyah from reaching the town and sent emissaries to have discussions with the Prophet. In the end the Prophet signed a treaty that he and the believers would not enter Mecca that year, but would do so the next year. Seeing the long-term significance of this treaty, in the interests of peace he agreed to a truce often years during which time, if any Meccan went over to his side, he would return him to the Meccans, but if any of his people went over to the Meccans, they would not return them. Throughout the surah the Prophet is assured that this treaty that God has given him is a great breakthrough (verse 1., verse 18 . and verse 27). The believers are reassured that their self-restraint and obedience to the Prophet were inspired by God (verse 4 . and verse 24 .). The surah condemns both the hypocrites in Medina (verse 6) and the idolaters of Mecca (verse 6 and verse 26) and closes by praising the believers (verse 29).The surah is also known as: Conquest, The Manifest Triumph, Triumph.

1.translation_eng: Indeed We have inaugurated for you a clear victory,1Or ‘Indeed We have initiated for you a clear breakthrough.’

2.content: لِيَغفِرَ لَكَ اللَّهُ ما تَقَدَّمَ مِن ذَنبِكَ وَما تَأَخَّرَ وَيُتِمَّ نِعمَتَهُ عَلَيكَ وَيَهدِيَكَ صِراطًا مُستَقيمًا
2.translation_eng: that Allah may forgive youwhat is past of your sin and what is to come,and that He may perfect His blessing upon youand guide you on a straight path,
2.transliteration: li-yaghfira laka llāhu mā taqaddama min dhanbika wa-mā taʾakhkhara wa-yutimma niʿmatahū ʿalayka wa-yahdiyaka ṣirāṭan mustaqīman

3.content: وَيَنصُرَكَ اللَّهُ نَصرًا عَزيزًا
3.translation_eng: and Allah will help you with a mighty help.
3.transliteration: wa-yanṣuraka llāhu naṣran ʿazīzan

4.content: هُوَ الَّذي أَنزَلَ السَّكينَةَ في قُلوبِ المُؤمِنينَ لِيَزدادوا إيمانًا مَعَ إيمانِهِم ۗ وَلِلَّهِ جُنودُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَليمًا حَكيمًا
4.translation_eng: It is He who sent down composureinto the hearts of the faithfulthat they might enhance their faith.To Allah belong the hosts of the heavens and the earth,and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
4.transliteration: huwa lladhī ʾanzala s-sakīnata fī qulūbi l-muʾminīna li-yazdādū ʾīmānan maʿa ʾīmānihim wa-li-llāhi junūdu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-kāna llāhu ʿalīman ḥakīman

5.content: لِيُدخِلَ المُؤمِنينَ وَالمُؤمِناتِ جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ خالِدينَ فيها وَيُكَفِّرَ عَنهُم سَيِّئَاتِهِم ۚ وَكانَ ذٰلِكَ عِندَ اللَّهِ فَوزًا عَظيمًا
5.translation_eng: That He may admit the faithful, men and women,into gardens with streams running in them,to remain in them [forever],and that He may absolve them of their misdeeds.That is a great success with Allah.
5.transliteration: li-yudkhila l-muʾminīna wa-l-muʾmināti jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru khālidīna fīhā wa-yukaffira ʿanhum sayyiʾātihim wa-kāna dhālika ʿinda llāhi fawzan ʿaẓīman

6.content: وَيُعَذِّبَ المُنافِقينَ وَالمُنافِقاتِ وَالمُشرِكينَ وَالمُشرِكاتِ الظّانّينَ بِاللَّهِ ظَنَّ السَّوءِ ۚ عَلَيهِم دائِرَةُ السَّوءِ ۖ وَغَضِبَ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِم وَلَعَنَهُم وَأَعَدَّ لَهُم جَهَنَّمَ ۖ وَساءَت مَصيرًا
6.translation_eng: That He may punish the hypocrites, men and women,and the polytheists, men and women,who entertain a bad opinion of Allah.For them shall be an adverse turn of fortune:Allah is wrathful with themand He has cursed them,and prepared for them hell,and it is an evil destination.
6.transliteration: wa-yuʿadhdhiba l-munāfiqīna wa-l-munāfiqāti wa-l-mushrikīna wa-l-mushrikāti ẓ-ẓānnīna bi-llāhi ẓanna s-sawʾi ʿalayhim dāʾiratu s-sawʾi wa-ghaḍiba llāhu ʿalayhim wa-laʿanahum wa-ʾaʿadda lahum jahannama wa-sāʾat maṣīran

7.content: وَلِلَّهِ جُنودُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَزيزًا حَكيمًا
7.translation_eng: To Allah belong the hosts of the heavensand the earth,and Allah is all-mighty, all-wise.
7.transliteration: wa-li-llāhi junūdu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-kāna llāhu ʿazīzan ḥakīman

8.content: إِنّا أَرسَلناكَ شاهِدًا وَمُبَشِّرًا وَنَذيرًا
8.translation_eng: Indeed We have sent you as a witness,and as a bearer of good news and warner,
8.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾarsalnāka shāhidan wa-mubashshiran wa-nadhīran

9.content: لِتُؤمِنوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ وَتُعَزِّروهُ وَتُوَقِّروهُ وَتُسَبِّحوهُ بُكرَةً وَأَصيلًا
9.translation_eng: that you may have faith in Allah and His Apostle,and that you may support him and revere him,and that you may glorify Him morningand evening.
9.transliteration: li-tuʾminū bi-llāhi wa-rasūlihī wa-tuʿazzirūhu wa-tuwaqqirūhu wa-tusabbiḥūhu bukratan wa-ʾaṣīlan

10.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يُبايِعونَكَ إِنَّما يُبايِعونَ اللَّهَ يَدُ اللَّهِ فَوقَ أَيديهِم ۚ فَمَن نَكَثَ فَإِنَّما يَنكُثُ عَلىٰ نَفسِهِ ۖ وَمَن أَوفىٰ بِما عاهَدَ عَلَيهُ اللَّهَ فَسَيُؤتيهِ أَجرًا عَظيمًا
10.translation_eng: Indeed those who swear allegiance to you,swear allegiance only to Allah:the hand of Allah is above their hands.So whosoever breaks his oath,breaks it only to his own detriment,and whoever fulfillsthe covenant he has made with Allah,He will give him a great reward.
10.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna yubāyiʿūnaka ʾinnamā yubāyiʿūna llāha yadu llāhi fawqa ʾaydīhim fa-man nakatha fa-ʾinnamā yankuthu ʿalā nafsihī wa-man ʾawfā bi-mā ʿāhada ʿalayhu llāha fa-sa-yuʾtīhi ʾajran ʿaẓīman

11.content: سَيَقولُ لَكَ المُخَلَّفونَ مِنَ الأَعرابِ شَغَلَتنا أَموالُنا وَأَهلونا فَاستَغفِر لَنا ۚ يَقولونَ بِأَلسِنَتِهِم ما لَيسَ في قُلوبِهِم ۚ قُل فَمَن يَملِكُ لَكُم مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيئًا إِن أَرادَ بِكُم ضَرًّا أَو أَرادَ بِكُم نَفعًا ۚ بَل كانَ اللَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ خَبيرًا
11.translation_eng: The Bedouins who were left behind will tell you,‘Our possessions and our families kept us occupied.So plead [to Allah] for our forgiveness!’They say with their tongueswhat is not in their hearts.Say, ‘Who can be of any avail to you against Allah,should He desire to cause you harmor desire to bring you benefit?Rather Allah is well aware of what you do.’
11.transliteration: sa-yaqūlu laka l-mukhallafūna mina l-ʾaʿrābi shaghalatnā ʾamwālunā wa-ʾahlūnā fa-staghfir lanā yaqūlūna bi-ʾalsinatihim mā laysa fī qulūbihim qul fa-man yamliku lakum mina llāhi shayʾan ʾin ʾarāda bikum ḍarran ʾaw ʾarāda bikum nafʿan bal kāna llāhu bi-mā taʿmalūna khabīran

12.content: بَل ظَنَنتُم أَن لَن يَنقَلِبَ الرَّسولُ وَالمُؤمِنونَ إِلىٰ أَهليهِم أَبَدًا وَزُيِّنَ ذٰلِكَ في قُلوبِكُم وَظَنَنتُم ظَنَّ السَّوءِ وَكُنتُم قَومًا بورًا
12.translation_eng: Rather you thoughtthat the Apostle and the faithful will not returnto their folk ever,and that was made to seem decorous to your hearts,and you entertained evil thoughts,and you were a ruined lot.
12.transliteration: bal ẓanantum ʾan lan yanqaliba r-rasūlu wa-l-muʾminūna ʾilā ʾahlīhim ʾabadan wa-zuyyina dhālika fī qulūbikum wa-ẓanantum ẓanna s-sawʾi wa-kuntum qawman būran

13.content: وَمَن لَم يُؤمِن بِاللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ فَإِنّا أَعتَدنا لِلكافِرينَ سَعيرًا
13.translation_eng: As for those who have no faith in Allahand His Apostle,We have prepared a blaze for the faithless.
13.transliteration: wa-man lam yuʾmin bi-llāhi wa-rasūlihī fa-ʾinnā ʾaʿtadnā li-l-kāfirīna saʿīran

14.content: وَلِلَّهِ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ يَغفِرُ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشاءُ ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ غَفورًا رَحيمًا
14.translation_eng: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavensand the earth:He forgives whomever He wishes,and punishes whomever He wishes,and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
14.transliteration: wa-li-llāhi mulku s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi yaghfiru li-man yashāʾu wa-yuʿadhdhibu man yashāʾu wa-kāna llāhu ghafūran raḥīman

15.content: سَيَقولُ المُخَلَّفونَ إِذَا انطَلَقتُم إِلىٰ مَغانِمَ لِتَأخُذوها ذَرونا نَتَّبِعكُم ۖ يُريدونَ أَن يُبَدِّلوا كَلامَ اللَّهِ ۚ قُل لَن تَتَّبِعونا كَذٰلِكُم قالَ اللَّهُ مِن قَبلُ ۖ فَسَيَقولونَ بَل تَحسُدونَنا ۚ بَل كانوا لا يَفقَهونَ إِلّا قَليلًا
15.translation_eng: Those who were left to stay behind will say,when you set out to capture booty:‘Let us follow you.’They desire to change the word of Allah.Say, ‘You shall never follow us!Thus has Allah said beforehand.’Then they will say, ‘You are envious of us.’Rather they do not understand but a little.
15.transliteration: sa-yaqūlu l-mukhallafūna ʾidhā nṭalaqtum ʾilā maghānima li-taʾkhudhūhā dharūnā nattabiʿkum yurīdūna ʾan yubaddilū kalāma llāhi qul lan tattabiʿūnā ka-dhālikum qāla llāhu min qablu fa-sa-yaqūlūna bal taḥsudūnanā bal kānū lā yafqahūna ʾillā qalīlan

16.content: قُل لِلمُخَلَّفينَ مِنَ الأَعرابِ سَتُدعَونَ إِلىٰ قَومٍ أُولي بَأسٍ شَديدٍ تُقاتِلونَهُم أَو يُسلِمونَ ۖ فَإِن تُطيعوا يُؤتِكُمُ اللَّهُ أَجرًا حَسَنًا ۖ وَإِن تَتَوَلَّوا كَما تَوَلَّيتُم مِن قَبلُ يُعَذِّبكُم عَذابًا أَليمًا
16.translation_eng: Say to the Bedouins who were left to stay behind,‘You will be called against a peopleof a great might:they will embrace Islam, or you will fight them.So if you obey, Allah will give you a good reward;but if you turn away like you turned away before,He will punish you with a painful punishment.’
16.transliteration: qul li-l-mukhallafīna mina l-ʾaʿrābi sa-tudʿawna ʾilā qawmin ʾulī baʾsin shadīdin tuqātilūnahum ʾaw yuslimūna fa-ʾin tuṭīʿū yuʾtikumu llāhu ʾajran ḥasanan wa-ʾin tatawallaw ka-mā tawallaytum min qablu yuʿadhdhibkum ʿadhāban ʾalīman

17.content: لَيسَ عَلَى الأَعمىٰ حَرَجٌ وَلا عَلَى الأَعرَجِ حَرَجٌ وَلا عَلَى المَريضِ حَرَجٌ ۗ وَمَن يُطِعِ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ يُدخِلهُ جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ ۖ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّ يُعَذِّبهُ عَذابًا أَليمًا
17.translation_eng: There is no blame on the blind,nor is there any blame on the lame,nor is there blame on the sick;and whoever obeys Allah and His Apostle,He will admit him into gardenswith streams running in them,and whoever refuses to comply,He will punish him with a painful punishment.
17.transliteration: laysa ʿalā l-ʾaʿmā ḥarajun wa-lā ʿalā l-ʾaʿraji ḥarajun wa-lā ʿalā l-marīḍi ḥarajun wa-man yuṭiʿi llāha wa-rasūlahū yudkhilhu jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru wa-man yatawalla yuʿadhdhibhu ʿadhāban ʾalīman

18.content: ۞ لَقَد رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنِ المُؤمِنينَ إِذ يُبايِعونَكَ تَحتَ الشَّجَرَةِ فَعَلِمَ ما في قُلوبِهِم فَأَنزَلَ السَّكينَةَ عَلَيهِم وَأَثابَهُم فَتحًا قَريبًا
18.translation_eng: Allah was certainly pleased with the faithfulwhen they swore allegiance to you under the tree.He knew what was in their hearts,so He sent down composure on them,and requited them with a victory near at hand
18.transliteration: la-qad raḍiya llāhu ʿani l-muʾminīna ʾidh yubāyiʿūnaka taḥta sh-shajarati fa-ʿalima mā fī qulūbihim fa-ʾanzala s-sakīnata ʿalayhim wa-ʾathābahum fatḥan qarīban

19.content: وَمَغانِمَ كَثيرَةً يَأخُذونَها ۗ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَزيزًا حَكيمًا
19.translation_eng: and abundant spoils that they will capture,and Allah is all-mighty, all-wise.
19.transliteration: wa-maghānima kathīratan yaʾkhudhūnahā wa-kāna llāhu ʿazīzan ḥakīman

20.content: وَعَدَكُمُ اللَّهُ مَغانِمَ كَثيرَةً تَأخُذونَها فَعَجَّلَ لَكُم هٰذِهِ وَكَفَّ أَيدِيَ النّاسِ عَنكُم وَلِتَكونَ آيَةً لِلمُؤمِنينَ وَيَهدِيَكُم صِراطًا مُستَقيمًا
20.translation_eng: Allah has promised you abundant spoilswhich you will capture.He has expedited this one for you,and withheld men’s hands from you,so that it may be a sign for the faithful,and that He may guide you to a straight path.
20.transliteration: waʿadakumu llāhu maghānima kathīratan taʾkhudhūnahā fa-ʿajjala lakum hādhihī wa-kaffa ʾaydiya n-nāsi ʿankum wa-li-takūna ʾāyatan li-l-muʾminīna wa-yahdiyakum ṣirāṭan mustaqīman

21.content: وَأُخرىٰ لَم تَقدِروا عَلَيها قَد أَحاطَ اللَّهُ بِها ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرًا
21.translation_eng: And other [spoils]which you have not yet captured:Allah has comprehended them,and Allah has power over all things.
21.transliteration: wa-ʾukhrā lam taqdirū ʿalayhā qad ʾaḥāṭa llāhu bihā wa-kāna llāhu ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīran

22.content: وَلَو قاتَلَكُمُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَوَلَّوُا الأَدبارَ ثُمَّ لا يَجِدونَ وَلِيًّا وَلا نَصيرًا
22.translation_eng: If the faithless fight you,they will turn their backs [to flee].Then they will not find any protector or helper.
22.transliteration: wa-law qātalakumu lladhīna kafarū la-wallawu l-ʾadbāra thumma lā yajidūna waliyyan wa-lā naṣīran

23.content: سُنَّةَ اللَّهِ الَّتي قَد خَلَت مِن قَبلُ ۖ وَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّةِ اللَّهِ تَبديلًا
23.translation_eng: [It is] Allah’s precedent that has passed before,and you will never find in Allah’s precedentany change.
23.transliteration: sunnata llāhi llatī qad khalat min qablu wa-lan tajida li-sunnati llāhi tabdīlan

24.content: وَهُوَ الَّذي كَفَّ أَيدِيَهُم عَنكُم وَأَيدِيَكُم عَنهُم بِبَطنِ مَكَّةَ مِن بَعدِ أَن أَظفَرَكُم عَلَيهِم ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ بَصيرًا
24.translation_eng: It is He who withheld their hands from you,and your hands from them,in the valley of Makkah,after He had given you victory over them,and Allah sees best what you do.
24.transliteration: wa-huwa lladhī kaffa ʾaydiyahum ʿankum wa-ʾaydiyakum ʿanhum bi-baṭni makkata min baʿdi ʾan ʾaẓfarakum ʿalayhim wa-kāna llāhu bi-mā taʿmalūna baṣīran

25.content: هُمُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَصَدّوكُم عَنِ المَسجِدِ الحَرامِ وَالهَديَ مَعكوفًا أَن يَبلُغَ مَحِلَّهُ ۚ وَلَولا رِجالٌ مُؤمِنونَ وَنِساءٌ مُؤمِناتٌ لَم تَعلَموهُم أَن تَطَئوهُم فَتُصيبَكُم مِنهُم مَعَرَّةٌ بِغَيرِ عِلمٍ ۖ لِيُدخِلَ اللَّهُ في رَحمَتِهِ مَن يَشاءُ ۚ لَو تَزَيَّلوا لَعَذَّبنَا الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِنهُم عَذابًا أَليمًا
25.translation_eng: They are the ones who disbelievedand barred you from the Sacred Mosque,and kept the offering from reaching its destination.And were it not for [certain] faithful menand faithful women,whom you did not know—lest you should trample them,and thus blame for [killing] them should fall on youunawares;1 [He held you back]so that Allah may admit into His mercywhomever He wishes.And had they been separate,We would have surely punished the faithlessamong themwith a painful punishment.Ellipsis; the omitted phrase is ‘We would have given you a free hand against them.’
25.transliteration: humu lladhīna kafarū wa-ṣaddūkum ʿani l-masjidi l-ḥarāmi wa-l-hadya maʿkūfan ʾan yablugha maḥillahū wa-law-lā rijālun muʾminūna wa-nisāʾun muʾminātun lam taʿlamūhum ʾan taṭʾūhum fa-tuṣībakum minhum maʿarratun bi-ghayri ʿilmin li-yudkhila llāhu fī raḥmatihī man yashāʾu law tazayyalū la-ʾadhdhabnā lladhīna kafarū minhum ʿadhāban ʾalīman

26.content: إِذ جَعَلَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا في قُلوبِهِمُ الحَمِيَّةَ حَمِيَّةَ الجاهِلِيَّةِ فَأَنزَلَ اللَّهُ سَكينَتَهُ عَلىٰ رَسولِهِ وَعَلَى المُؤمِنينَ وَأَلزَمَهُم كَلِمَةَ التَّقوىٰ وَكانوا أَحَقَّ بِها وَأَهلَها ۚ وَكانَ اللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَليمًا
26.translation_eng: When the faithless nourishedbigotry in their hearts,the bigotry of pagan ignorance,Allah sent down His composureupon His Apostle and upon the faithful,and made them abide by the word of Godwariness,for they were the worthiest of it and deserved it,and Allah has knowledge of all things.
26.transliteration: ʾidh jaʿala lladhīna kafarū fī qulūbihimu l-ḥamiyyata ḥamiyyata l-jāhiliyyati fa-ʾanzala llāhu sakīnatahū ʿalā rasūlihī wa-ʿalā l-muʾminīna wa-ʾalzamahum kalimata t-taqwā wa-kānū ʾaḥaqqa bihā wa-ʾahlahā wa-kāna llāhu bi-kulli shayʾin ʿalīman

27.content: لَقَد صَدَقَ اللَّهُ رَسولَهُ الرُّؤيا بِالحَقِّ ۖ لَتَدخُلُنَّ المَسجِدَ الحَرامَ إِن شاءَ اللَّهُ آمِنينَ مُحَلِّقينَ رُءوسَكُم وَمُقَصِّرينَ لا تَخافونَ ۖ فَعَلِمَ ما لَم تَعلَموا فَجَعَلَ مِن دونِ ذٰلِكَ فَتحًا قَريبًا
27.translation_eng: Certainly Allah has fulfilled His Apostle’s visionin all truth:You will surely enter the Sacred Mosque,God willing,in safety,with your heads shaven or hair cropped,without any fear.So He knew what you did not know,and He assigned [you] besides thata victory near at hand.
27.transliteration: la-qad ṣadaqa llāhu rasūlahu r-ruʾyā bi-l-ḥaqqi la-tadkhulunna l-masjida l-ḥarāma ʾin shāʾa llāhu ʾāminīna muḥalliqīna ruʾūsakum wa-muqaṣṣirīna lā takhāfūna fa-ʿalima mā lam taʿlamū fa-jaʿala min dūni dhālika fatḥan qarīban

28.content: هُوَ الَّذي أَرسَلَ رَسولَهُ بِالهُدىٰ وَدينِ الحَقِّ لِيُظهِرَهُ عَلَى الدّينِ كُلِّهِ ۚ وَكَفىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهيدًا
28.translation_eng: It is He who has sent His Apostle with guidanceand the true religion,that He may make it prevail over all religions,and Allah suffices as witness.
28.transliteration: huwa lladhī ʾarsala rasūlahū bi-l-hudā wa-dīni l-ḥaqqi li-yuẓhirahū ʿalā d-dīni kullihī wa-kafā bi-llāhi shahīdan

29.content: مُحَمَّدٌ رَسولُ اللَّهِ ۚ وَالَّذينَ مَعَهُ أَشِدّاءُ عَلَى الكُفّارِ رُحَماءُ بَينَهُم ۖ تَراهُم رُكَّعًا سُجَّدًا يَبتَغونَ فَضلًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِضوانًا ۖ سيماهُم في وُجوهِهِم مِن أَثَرِ السُّجودِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ مَثَلُهُم فِي التَّوراةِ ۚ وَمَثَلُهُم فِي الإِنجيلِ كَزَرعٍ أَخرَجَ شَطأَهُ فَآزَرَهُ فَاستَغلَظَ فَاستَوىٰ عَلىٰ سوقِهِ يُعجِبُ الزُّرّاعَ لِيَغيظَ بِهِمُ الكُفّارَ ۗ وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ مِنهُم مَغفِرَةً وَأَجرًا عَظيمًا
29.translation_eng: Muhammad, the Apostle of Allah,and those who are with himare hard against the faithlessand merciful amongst themselves.You see them bowing and prostrating [in worship],seeking Allah’s grace and [His] pleasure.Their mark is [visible] on their faces,from the effect of prostration.Such is their description in the Torahand their description in the Evangel.Like a tillagethat sends out its shoots and builds them up,and they grow stoutand settle on their stalks,impressing the sowers,so that He may enrage the faithless by them.Allah has promised thoseof them who have faith and do righteous deedsforgiveness and a great reward.
29.transliteration: muḥammadun rasūlu llāhi wa-lladhīna maʿahū ʾashiddāʾu ʿalā l-kuffāri ruḥamāʾu baynahum tarāhum rukkaʿan sujjadan yabtaghūna faḍlan mina llāhi wa-riḍwānan sīmāhum fī wujūhihim min ʾathari s-sujūdi dhālika mathaluhum fī t-tawrāti wa-mathaluhum fī l-ʾinjīli ka-zarʿin ʾakhraja shaṭʾahū fa-ʾāzarahū fa-staghlaẓa fa-stawā ʿalā sūqihī yuʿjibu z-zurrāʿa li-yaghīẓa bihimu l-kuffāra waʿada llāhu lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti minhum maghfiratan wa-ʾajran ʿaẓīman

49.description: The surah that criticized as ill-mannered and uncouth those who would stand behind the Apartments of the Prophet’s wives and call him forth for discourse with raised voices. It takes its name from the word “apartments” (ḥujurāt) in verse 4. The surah guides the believers on how to behave with proper respect towards their leader (verse 1 .), and with mutual respect and trust towards each other (verse 9 .). It stresses the unity of mankind and God’s intention that people should live together in harmony (verse 13). It criticizes the desert Arabs for their presumptuous attitude to their faith and to God (verse 14 .).The surah is also known as: The (Inner) Apartments, The Chambers, The Inner Apartments, The Private Quarters, The Private Rooms.

1.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تُقَدِّموا بَينَ يَدَيِ اللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَميعٌ عَليمٌ
1.translation_eng: O you who have faith!Do not venture ahead of Allah and His Apostle,and be wary of Allah.Indeed Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing.
1.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū lā tuqaddimū bayna yadayi llāhi wa-rasūlihī wa-ttaqū llāha ʾinna llāha samīʿun ʿalīmun

2.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تَرفَعوا أَصواتَكُم فَوقَ صَوتِ النَّبِيِّ وَلا تَجهَروا لَهُ بِالقَولِ كَجَهرِ بَعضِكُم لِبَعضٍ أَن تَحبَطَ أَعمالُكُم وَأَنتُم لا تَشعُرونَ
2.translation_eng: O you who have faith!Do not raise your voicesabove the voice of the Prophet,and do not speak aloud to himas you shout to one another,lest your works should failwithout your being aware.
2.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū lā tarfaʿū ʾaṣwātakum fawqa ṣawti n-nabiyyi wa-lā tajharū lahū bi-l-qawli ka-jahri baʿḍikum li-baʿḍin ʾan taḥbaṭa ʾaʿmālukum wa-ʾantum lā tashʿurūna

3.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَغُضّونَ أَصواتَهُم عِندَ رَسولِ اللَّهِ أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ امتَحَنَ اللَّهُ قُلوبَهُم لِلتَّقوىٰ ۚ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَأَجرٌ عَظيمٌ
3.translation_eng: Indeed those who lower their voicesin the presence of the Apostle of Allah—they are the ones whose hearts Allah has testedfor Godwariness.For them will be forgiveness and a great reward.
3.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna yaghuḍḍūna ʾaṣwātahum ʿinda rasūli llāhi ʾulāʾika lladhīna mtaḥana llāhu qulūbahum li-t-taqwā lahum maghfiratun wa-ʾajrun ʿaẓīmun

4.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يُنادونَكَ مِن وَراءِ الحُجُراتِ أَكثَرُهُم لا يَعقِلونَ
4.translation_eng: Indeed those who call youfrom behind the apartments,most of them do not apply reason.
4.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna yunādūnaka min warāʾi l-ḥujurāti ʾaktharuhum lā yaʿqilūna

5.content: وَلَو أَنَّهُم صَبَروا حَتّىٰ تَخرُجَ إِلَيهِم لَكانَ خَيرًا لَهُم ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
5.translation_eng: Had they been patient until you came out for them,it would have been better for them,and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
5.transliteration: wa-law ʾannahum ṣabarū ḥattā takhruja ʾilayhim la-kāna khayran lahum wa-llāhu ghafūrun raḥīmun

6.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِن جاءَكُم فاسِقٌ بِنَبَإٍ فَتَبَيَّنوا أَن تُصيبوا قَومًا بِجَهالَةٍ فَتُصبِحوا عَلىٰ ما فَعَلتُم نادِمينَ
6.translation_eng: O you who have faith!If a profligate [person] should bring you some news,verify it,lest you should visit [harm] on some peopleout of ignorance,and then become regretful for what you have done.
6.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾin jāʾakum fāsiqun bi-nabaʾin fa-tabayyanū ʾan tuṣībū qawman bi-jahālatin fa-tuṣbiḥū ʿalā mā faʿaltum nādimīna

7.content: وَاعلَموا أَنَّ فيكُم رَسولَ اللَّهِ ۚ لَو يُطيعُكُم في كَثيرٍ مِنَ الأَمرِ لَعَنِتُّم وَلٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ حَبَّبَ إِلَيكُمُ الإيمانَ وَزَيَّنَهُ في قُلوبِكُم وَكَرَّهَ إِلَيكُمُ الكُفرَ وَالفُسوقَ وَالعِصيانَ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الرّاشِدونَ
7.translation_eng: Know that the Apostle of Allah is among you.Should he obey you in many matters,you would surely suffer.But Allah has endeared faith to youand made it appealing in your hearts,and He has made hateful to youfaithlessness, transgression and disobedience.It is such who are the right-minded
7.transliteration: wa-ʿlamū ʾanna fīkum rasūla llāhi law yuṭīʿukum fī kathīrin mina l-ʾamri la-ʿanittum wa-lākinna llāha ḥabbaba ʾilaykumu l-ʾīmāna wa-zayyanahū fī qulūbikum wa-karraha ʾilaykumu l-kufra wa-l-fusūqa wa-l-ʿiṣyāna ʾulāʾika humu r-rāshidūna

8.content: فَضلًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَنِعمَةً ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ حَكيمٌ
8.translation_eng: —a grace and blessing from Allah,and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
8.transliteration: faḍlan mina llāhi wa-niʿmatan wa-llāhu ʿalīmun ḥakīmun

9.content: وَإِن طائِفَتانِ مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ اقتَتَلوا فَأَصلِحوا بَينَهُما ۖ فَإِن بَغَت إِحداهُما عَلَى الأُخرىٰ فَقاتِلُوا الَّتي تَبغي حَتّىٰ تَفيءَ إِلىٰ أَمرِ اللَّهِ ۚ فَإِن فاءَت فَأَصلِحوا بَينَهُما بِالعَدلِ وَأَقسِطوا ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ المُقسِطينَ
9.translation_eng: If two groups of the faithful fight one another,make peace between them.But if one party of them aggresses against the other,fight the one which aggressesuntil it returns to Allah’s ordinance.Then, if it returns,make peace between them fairly,and do justice.Indeed Allah loves the just.
9.transliteration: wa-ʾin ṭāʾifatāni mina l-muʾminīna qtatalū fa-ʾaṣliḥū baynahumā fa-ʾin baghat ʾiḥdāhumā ʿalā l-ʾukhrā fa-qātilū llatī tabghī ḥattā tafīʾa ʾilā ʾamri llāhi fa-ʾin fāʾat fa-ʾaṣliḥū baynahumā bi-l-ʿadli wa-ʾaqsiṭū ʾinna llāha yuḥibbu l-muqsiṭīna

10.content: إِنَّمَا المُؤمِنونَ إِخوَةٌ فَأَصلِحوا بَينَ أَخَوَيكُم ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُم تُرحَمونَ
10.translation_eng: The faithful are indeed brothers.Therefore make peace between your brothersand be wary of Allah,so that you may receive [His] mercy.
10.transliteration: ʾinnamā l-muʾminūna ʾikhwatun fa-ʾaṣliḥū bayna ʾakhawaykum wa-ttaqū llāha laʿallakum turḥamūna

11.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا يَسخَر قَومٌ مِن قَومٍ عَسىٰ أَن يَكونوا خَيرًا مِنهُم وَلا نِساءٌ مِن نِساءٍ عَسىٰ أَن يَكُنَّ خَيرًا مِنهُنَّ ۖ وَلا تَلمِزوا أَنفُسَكُم وَلا تَنابَزوا بِالأَلقابِ ۖ بِئسَ الِاسمُ الفُسوقُ بَعدَ الإيمانِ ۚ وَمَن لَم يَتُب فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الظّالِمونَ
11.translation_eng: O you who have faith!Let not any people ridicule another people:it may be that they are better than they are;nor let women [ridicule] women:it may be that they are better than they are.And do not defame one another,nor insult one another by [calling] nicknames.How evil are profane names subsequent to faith!And whoever is not penitent—such are the wrongdoers.
11.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū lā yaskhar qawmun min qawmin ʿasā ʾan yakūnū khayran minhum wa-lā nisāʾun min nisāʾin ʿasā ʾan yakunna khayran minhunna wa-lā talmizū ʾanfusakum wa-lā tanābazū bi-l-ʾalqābi biʾsa l-ʾismu l-fusūqu baʿda l-ʾīmāni wa-man lam yatub fa-ʾulāʾika humu ẓ-ẓālimūna

12.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا اجتَنِبوا كَثيرًا مِنَ الظَّنِّ إِنَّ بَعضَ الظَّنِّ إِثمٌ ۖ وَلا تَجَسَّسوا وَلا يَغتَب بَعضُكُم بَعضًا ۚ أَيُحِبُّ أَحَدُكُم أَن يَأكُلَ لَحمَ أَخيهِ مَيتًا فَكَرِهتُموهُ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ تَوّابٌ رَحيمٌ
12.translation_eng: O you who have faith!Avoid much suspicion.Indeed some suspicions are sins.And do not spy onor backbite one another.Will any of you loveto eat the flesh of his dead brother?You would hate it.And be wary of Allah;indeed Allah is all-clement, all-merciful.
12.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū jtanibū kathīran mina ẓ-ẓanni ʾinna baʿḍa ẓ-ẓanni ʾithmun wa-lā tajassasū wa-lā yaghtab baʿḍukum baʿḍan ʾa-yuḥibbu ʾaḥadukum ʾan yaʾkula laḥma ʾakhīhi maytan fa-karihtumūhu wa-ttaqū llāha ʾinna llāha tawwābun raḥīmun

13.content: يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ إِنّا خَلَقناكُم مِن ذَكَرٍ وَأُنثىٰ وَجَعَلناكُم شُعوبًا وَقَبائِلَ لِتَعارَفوا ۚ إِنَّ أَكرَمَكُم عِندَ اللَّهِ أَتقاكُم ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَليمٌ خَبيرٌ
