13.translation_eng: O mankind!Indeed We created you from a male and a female,and made you nations and tribesthat you may identify yourselves with one another.Indeed the noblest1 of youin the sight of Allahis the most Godwary among you.Indeed Allah is all-knowing, all-aware.Or ‘the most honoured.’
13.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nāsu ʾinnā khalaqnākum min dhakarin wa-ʾunthā wa-jaʿalnākum shuʿūban wa-qabāʾila li-taʿārafū ʾinna ʾakramakum ʿinda llāhi ʾatqākum ʾinna llāha ʿalīmun khabīrun

14.content: ۞ قالَتِ الأَعرابُ آمَنّا ۖ قُل لَم تُؤمِنوا وَلٰكِن قولوا أَسلَمنا وَلَمّا يَدخُلِ الإيمانُ في قُلوبِكُم ۖ وَإِن تُطيعُوا اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ لا يَلِتكُم مِن أَعمالِكُم شَيئًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
14.translation_eng: The Bedouins say, ‘We have faith.’Say, ‘You do not have faith yet;rather say, “We have embraced Islam,”1for faith has not yet entered into your hearts.Yet if you obey Allah and His Apostle,He will not stint anything of [the reward of] your works.Indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.’Or ‘We have submitted.’
14.transliteration: qālati l-ʾaʿrābu ʾāmannā qul lam tuʾminū wa-lākin qūlū ʾaslamnā wa-lammā yadkhuli l-ʾīmānu fī qulūbikum wa-ʾin tuṭīʿū llāha wa-rasūlahū lā yalitkum min ʾaʿmālikum shayʾan ʾinna llāha ghafūrun raḥīmun

15.content: إِنَّمَا المُؤمِنونَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ ثُمَّ لَم يَرتابوا وَجاهَدوا بِأَموالِهِم وَأَنفُسِهِم في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الصّادِقونَ
15.translation_eng: The faithful are only those who have attained faithin Allah and His Apostleand then have never doubted,and who wage jihād with their possessionsand their personsin the way of Allah.It is they who are the truthful.1Or ‘the sincere.’
15.transliteration: ʾinnamā l-muʾminūna lladhīna ʾāmanū bi-llāhi wa-rasūlihī thumma lam yartābū wa-jāhadū bi-ʾamwālihim wa-ʾanfusihim fī sabīli llāhi ʾulāʾika humu ṣ-ṣādiqūna

16.content: قُل أَتُعَلِّمونَ اللَّهَ بِدينِكُم وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَليمٌ
16.translation_eng: Say, ‘Will you inform Allah about your faithwhile Allah knows whatever there is in the heavensand whatever there is in the earth,and Allah has knowledge of all things?’
16.transliteration: qul ʾa-tuʿallimūna llāha bi-dīnikum wa-llāhu yaʿlamu mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi wa-llāhu bi-kulli shayʾin ʿalīmun

17.content: يَمُنّونَ عَلَيكَ أَن أَسلَموا ۖ قُل لا تَمُنّوا عَلَيَّ إِسلامَكُم ۖ بَلِ اللَّهُ يَمُنُّ عَلَيكُم أَن هَداكُم لِلإيمانِ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
17.translation_eng: They count it as a favour to youthat they have embraced Islam.Say, ‘Do not count it as a favour to meyour embracing of Islam.Rather it is Allah who has done you a favourin that He has guided you to faith,should you be truthful.1That is, should you be sincere in your claim of having embraced Islam.
17.transliteration: yamunnūna ʿalayka ʾan ʾaslamū qul lā tamunnū ʿalayya ʾislāmakum bali llāhu yamunnu ʿalaykum ʾan hadākum li-l-ʾīmāni ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

18.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعلَمُ غَيبَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بَصيرٌ بِما تَعمَلونَ
18.translation_eng: Indeed Allah knows the Unseen of the heavensand the earth,and Allah sees best what you do.’
18.transliteration: ʾinna llāha yaʿlamu ghayba s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-llāhu baṣīrun bi-mā taʿmalūna

50.description: The surah that opens with the single discrete Arabic letter Qāf. It deals predominantly with the Resurrection and the Day of Judgement. Reference is made to previous generations of disbelievers (verse 12 .), both to warn the disbelievers in Mecca and to reassure the Prophet. Creation is cited as an indication of God’s ability to bring the dead to life again (verse 3 .), and emphasis is placed on the powerlessness of man on the Day of Resurrection (verse 20). The surah both opens and closes with mention of the Quran.

1.translation_eng: Qāf.By the glorious Qurʾān.

2.content: بَل عَجِبوا أَن جاءَهُم مُنذِرٌ مِنهُم فَقالَ الكافِرونَ هٰذا شَيءٌ عَجيبٌ
2.translation_eng: Rather they consider it oddthat a warner should have come to themfrom among themselves.So the faithless say, ‘This is an odd thing.
2.transliteration: bal ʿajibū ʾan jāʾahum mundhirun minhum fa-qāla l-kāfirūna hādhā shayʾun ʿajībun

3.content: أَإِذا مِتنا وَكُنّا تُرابًا ۖ ذٰلِكَ رَجعٌ بَعيدٌ
3.translation_eng: What! When we are deadand have become dust [shall we be raised again]?That is a far-fetched return!’
3.transliteration: ʾa-ʾidhā mitnā wa-kunnā turāban dhālika rajʿun baʿīdun

4.content: قَد عَلِمنا ما تَنقُصُ الأَرضُ مِنهُم ۖ وَعِندَنا كِتابٌ حَفيظٌ
4.translation_eng: We know what the earth diminishes from them,1and with Us is a preserving Book.That is, from their bodies when they disintegrate after death.
4.transliteration: qad ʿalimnā mā tanquṣu l-ʾarḍu minhum wa-ʿindanā kitābun ḥafīẓun

5.content: بَل كَذَّبوا بِالحَقِّ لَمّا جاءَهُم فَهُم في أَمرٍ مَريجٍ
5.translation_eng: Rather they denied the truth when it came to them;so they are now in a perplexed state of affairs.
5.transliteration: bal kadhdhabū bi-l-ḥaqqi lammā jāʾahum fa-hum fī ʾamrin marījin

6.content: أَفَلَم يَنظُروا إِلَى السَّماءِ فَوقَهُم كَيفَ بَنَيناها وَزَيَّنّاها وَما لَها مِن فُروجٍ
6.translation_eng: Have they not then observed the sky above them,how We have built it and adorned it,and that there are no cracks in it?
6.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lam yanẓurū ʾilā s-samāʾi fawqahum kayfa banaynāhā wa-zayyannāhā wa-mā lahā min furūjin

7.content: وَالأَرضَ مَدَدناها وَأَلقَينا فيها رَواسِيَ وَأَنبَتنا فيها مِن كُلِّ زَوجٍ بَهيجٍ
7.translation_eng: And We spread out the earth,and cast in it firm mountains,and caused every delightful kind to grow in it.
7.transliteration: wa-l-ʾarḍa madadnāhā wa-ʾalqaynā fīhā rawāsiya wa-ʾanbatnā fīhā min kulli zawjin bahījin

8.content: تَبصِرَةً وَذِكرىٰ لِكُلِّ عَبدٍ مُنيبٍ
8.translation_eng: [In this there is] an insight and admonitionfor every penitent servant.
8.transliteration: tabṣiratan wa-dhikrā li-kulli ʿabdin munībin

9.content: وَنَزَّلنا مِنَ السَّماءِ ماءً مُبارَكًا فَأَنبَتنا بِهِ جَنّاتٍ وَحَبَّ الحَصيدِ
9.translation_eng: And We send down from the sky salubrious water,with which We grow gardensand the grain which is harvested,
9.transliteration: wa-nazzalnā mina s-samāʾi māʾan mubārakan fa-ʾanbatnā bihī jannātin wa-ḥabba l-ḥaṣīdi

10.content: وَالنَّخلَ باسِقاتٍ لَها طَلعٌ نَضيدٌ
10.translation_eng: and tall date palms with regularly set spathes,
10.transliteration: wa-n-nakhla bāsiqātin lahā ṭalʿun naḍīdun

11.content: رِزقًا لِلعِبادِ ۖ وَأَحيَينا بِهِ بَلدَةً مَيتًا ۚ كَذٰلِكَ الخُروجُ
11.translation_eng: as a provision for servants;and with it We revive a dead country.Likewise will be the rising [from the dead].
11.transliteration: rizqan li-l-ʿibādi wa-ʾaḥyaynā bihī baldatan maytan ka-dhālika l-khurūju

12.content: كَذَّبَت قَبلَهُم قَومُ نوحٍ وَأَصحابُ الرَّسِّ وَثَمودُ
12.translation_eng: The people of Noah denied before them,and [so did] the inhabitants of Rass1 and Thamūd,See 25:38.
12.transliteration: kadhdhabat qablahum qawmu nūḥin wa-ʾaṣḥābu r-rassi wa-thamūdu

13.content: وَعادٌ وَفِرعَونُ وَإِخوانُ لوطٍ
13.translation_eng: and ʿĀd, Pharaoh, and the brethren of Lot,
13.transliteration: wa-ʿādun wa-firʿawnu wa-ʾikhwānu lūṭin

14.content: وَأَصحابُ الأَيكَةِ وَقَومُ تُبَّعٍ ۚ كُلٌّ كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعيدِ
14.translation_eng: and the inhabitants of Aykahand the people of Tubbaʿ.1Each [of them] impugned the apostles,and so My threat became due [against them].Cf. 44:37.
14.transliteration: wa-ʾaṣhābu l-ʾaykati wa-qawmu tubbaʿin kullun kadhdhaba r-rusula fa-ḥaqqa waʿīdi

15.content: أَفَعَيينا بِالخَلقِ الأَوَّلِ ۚ بَل هُم في لَبسٍ مِن خَلقٍ جَديدٍ
15.translation_eng: Were We exhausted by the first creation?Rather they are in doubt about a new creation.
15.transliteration: ʾa-fa-ʿayīnā bi-l-khalqi l-ʾawwali bal hum fī labsin min khalqin jadīdin

16.content: وَلَقَد خَلَقنَا الإِنسانَ وَنَعلَمُ ما تُوَسوِسُ بِهِ نَفسُهُ ۖ وَنَحنُ أَقرَبُ إِلَيهِ مِن حَبلِ الوَريدِ
16.translation_eng: Certainly We have created manand We know to what his soul tempts him,and We are nearer to himthan his jugular vein.
16.transliteration: wa-la-qad khalaqnā l-ʾinsāna wa-naʿlamu mā tuwaswisu bihī nafsuhū wa-naḥnu ʾaqrabu ʾilayhi min ḥabli l-warīdi

17.content: إِذ يَتَلَقَّى المُتَلَقِّيانِ عَنِ اليَمينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمالِ قَعيدٌ
17.translation_eng: When the twin recorders record [his deeds],seated on the right hand and on the left:
17.transliteration: ʾidh yatalaqqā l-mutalaqqiyāni ʿani l-yamīni wa-ʿani sh-shimāli qaʿīdun

18.content: ما يَلفِظُ مِن قَولٍ إِلّا لَدَيهِ رَقيبٌ عَتيدٌ
18.translation_eng: he says no wordbut that there is a ready observer beside him.
18.transliteration: mā yalfiẓu min qawlin ʾillā ladayhi raqībun ʿatīdun

19.content: وَجاءَت سَكرَةُ المَوتِ بِالحَقِّ ۖ ذٰلِكَ ما كُنتَ مِنهُ تَحيدُ
19.translation_eng: Then the agony of death brings the truth:1‘This is what you used to shun!’Or ‘when the agony of death arrives with the truth.’
19.transliteration: wa-jāʾat sakratu l-mawti bi-l-ḥaqqi dhālika mā kunta minhu taḥīdu

20.content: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصّورِ ۚ ذٰلِكَ يَومُ الوَعيدِ
20.translation_eng: Then the Trumpet will be blown:‘This is the promised day.’
20.transliteration: wa-nufikha fī ṣ-ṣūri dhālika yawmu l-waʿīdi

21.content: وَجاءَت كُلُّ نَفسٍ مَعَها سائِقٌ وَشَهيدٌ
21.translation_eng: Then every soul will comeaccompanied by a driver and a witness:
21.transliteration: wa-jāʾat kullu nafsin maʿahā sāʾiqun wa-shahīdun

22.content: لَقَد كُنتَ في غَفلَةٍ مِن هٰذا فَكَشَفنا عَنكَ غِطاءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ اليَومَ حَديدٌ
22.translation_eng: ‘You were certainly oblivious of this.We have removed your veil from you,and so your sight is acute today.’
22.transliteration: la-qad kunta fī ghaflatin min hādhā fa-kashafnā ʿanka ghiṭāʾaka fa-baṣaruka l-yawma ḥadīdun

23.content: وَقالَ قَرينُهُ هٰذا ما لَدَيَّ عَتيدٌ
23.translation_eng: Then his companion will say,‘This is what is ready with me [of testimony].’
23.transliteration: wa-qāla qarīnuhū hādhā mā ladayya ʿatīdun

24.content: أَلقِيا في جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفّارٍ عَنيدٍ
24.translation_eng: ‘The two of you cast every obdurate ingrate into hell,
24.transliteration: ʾalqiyā fī jahannama kulla kaffārin ʿanīdin

25.content: مَنّاعٍ لِلخَيرِ مُعتَدٍ مُريبٍ
25.translation_eng: [every] hinderer of all good,1transgressor, and skeptic,Or ‘grudging giver.’
25.transliteration: mannāʿin li-l-khayri muʿtadin murībin-i

26.content: الَّذي جَعَلَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلٰهًا آخَرَ فَأَلقِياهُ فِي العَذابِ الشَّديدِ
26.translation_eng: who has set up another god along with Allah!So the two of you cast himinto the severe punishment.’
26.transliteration: alladhī jaʿala maʿa llāhi ʾilāhan ʾākhara fa-ʾalqiyāhu fī l-ʿadhābi sh-shadīdi

27.content: ۞ قالَ قَرينُهُ رَبَّنا ما أَطغَيتُهُ وَلٰكِن كانَ في ضَلالٍ بَعيدٍ
27.translation_eng: His companion1 will say, ‘Our Lord!I did not make him a rebel,but he [himself] was in extreme error.’That is, Satan.
27.transliteration: qāla qarīnuhū rabbanā mā ʾaṭghaytuhū wa-lākin kāna fī ḍalālin baʿīdin

28.content: قالَ لا تَختَصِموا لَدَيَّ وَقَد قَدَّمتُ إِلَيكُم بِالوَعيدِ
28.translation_eng: He will say, ‘Do not wrangle in My presence,for I had already warned you in advance.
28.transliteration: qāla lā takhtaṣimū ladayya wa-qad qaddamtu ʾilaykum bi-l-waʿīdi

29.content: ما يُبَدَّلُ القَولُ لَدَيَّ وَما أَنا بِظَلّامٍ لِلعَبيدِ
29.translation_eng: The word [of judgement] is unalterable with Me,and I am not tyrannical to the servants.’
29.transliteration: mā yubaddalu l-qawlu ladayya wa-mā ʾana bi-ẓallāmin li-l-ʿabīdi

30.content: يَومَ نَقولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ امتَلَأتِ وَتَقولُ هَل مِن مَزيدٍ
30.translation_eng: The day when We shall say to hell,‘Are you full?’It will say, ‘Is there any more?’
30.transliteration: yawma naqūlu li-jahannama hali mtalaʾti wa-taqūlu hal min mazīdin

31.content: وَأُزلِفَتِ الجَنَّةُ لِلمُتَّقينَ غَيرَ بَعيدٍ
31.translation_eng: And paradise will be brought near for the Godwary,not distant [any more]:
31.transliteration: wa-ʾuzlifati l-jannatu li-l-muttaqīna ghayra baʿīdin

32.content: هٰذا ما توعَدونَ لِكُلِّ أَوّابٍ حَفيظٍ
32.translation_eng: ‘This is what you were promised.[It is] for every penitent and dutiful [servant]
32.transliteration: hādhā mā tūʿadūna li-kulli ʾawwābin ḥafīẓin

33.content: مَن خَشِيَ الرَّحمٰنَ بِالغَيبِ وَجاءَ بِقَلبٍ مُنيبٍ
33.translation_eng: who fears the All-beneficent in secretand comes with a penitent heart.
33.transliteration: man khashiya r-raḥmāna bi-l-ghaybi wa-jāʾa bi-qalbin munībin-i

34.content: ادخُلوها بِسَلامٍ ۖ ذٰلِكَ يَومُ الخُلودِ
34.translation_eng: Enter it in peace!This is the day of immortality.’
34.transliteration: udkhulūhā bi-salāmin dhālika yawmu l-khulūdi

35.content: لَهُم ما يَشاءونَ فيها وَلَدَينا مَزيدٌ
35.translation_eng: There they will have whatever they wish,and with Us there is yet more.
35.transliteration: lahum mā yashāʾūna fīhā wa-ladaynā mazīdun

36.content: وَكَم أَهلَكنا قَبلَهُم مِن قَرنٍ هُم أَشَدُّ مِنهُم بَطشًا فَنَقَّبوا فِي البِلادِ هَل مِن مَحيصٍ
36.translation_eng: How many generations We have destroyed before them,who were stronger than these,insomuch that they ransacked the towns?!Is there any escape [from Allah’s punishment]?
36.transliteration: wa-kam ʾahlaknā qablahum min qarnin hum ʾashaddu minhum baṭshan fa-naqqabū fī l-bilādi hal min maḥīṣin

37.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَذِكرىٰ لِمَن كانَ لَهُ قَلبٌ أَو أَلقَى السَّمعَ وَهُوَ شَهيدٌ
37.translation_eng: There is indeed an admonition in thatfor one who has a heart,or gives ear, being attentive.
37.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-dhikrā li-man kāna lahū qalbun ʾaw ʾalqā s-samʿa wa-huwa shahīdun

38.content: وَلَقَد خَلَقنَا السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ وَما بَينَهُما في سِتَّةِ أَيّامٍ وَما مَسَّنا مِن لُغوبٍ
38.translation_eng: Certainly We created the heavens and the earth,and whatever is between them,in six days,and any fatigue did not touch Us.
38.transliteration: wa-la-qad khalaqnā s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa wa-mā baynahumā fī sittati ʾayyāmin wa-mā massanā min lughūbin

39.content: فَاصبِر عَلىٰ ما يَقولونَ وَسَبِّح بِحَمدِ رَبِّكَ قَبلَ طُلوعِ الشَّمسِ وَقَبلَ الغُروبِ
39.translation_eng: So be patient over what they say,and celebrate the praise of your Lordbefore the rising of the sunand before the sunset,
39.transliteration: fa-ṣbir ʿalā mā yaqūlūna wa-sabbiḥ bi-ḥamdi rabbika qabla ṭulūʿi sh-shamsi wa-qabla l-ghurūbi

40.content: وَمِنَ اللَّيلِ فَسَبِّحهُ وَأَدبارَ السُّجودِ
40.translation_eng: and glorify Him through part of the nightand after the prostrations.
40.transliteration: wa-mina l-layli fa-sabbiḥhu wa-ʾadbāra s-sujūdi

41.content: وَاستَمِع يَومَ يُنادِ المُنادِ مِن مَكانٍ قَريبٍ
41.translation_eng: And be on the alert for the daywhen the caller calls from a close quarter,
41.transliteration: wa-stamiʿ yawma yunādi l-munādi min makānin qarībin

42.content: يَومَ يَسمَعونَ الصَّيحَةَ بِالحَقِّ ۚ ذٰلِكَ يَومُ الخُروجِ
42.translation_eng: the day when they hear the Cry in all truth.That is the day of rising [from the dead].
42.transliteration: yawma yasmaʿūna ṣ-ṣayḥata bi-l-ḥaqqi dhālika yawmu l-khurūji

43.content: إِنّا نَحنُ نُحيي وَنُميتُ وَإِلَينَا المَصيرُ
43.translation_eng: Indeed it is We who give life and bring death,and toward Us is the destination.
43.transliteration: ʾinnā naḥnu nuḥyī wa-numītu wa-ʾilaynā l-maṣīru

44.content: يَومَ تَشَقَّقُ الأَرضُ عَنهُم سِراعًا ۚ ذٰلِكَ حَشرٌ عَلَينا يَسيرٌ
44.translation_eng: The day the earth is split open for [disentombing] them,[they will come out] hastening.That mustering1 is easy for Us [to carry out].Or ‘resurrection.’
44.transliteration: yawma tashaqqaqu l-ʾarḍu ʿanhum sirāʿan dhālika ḥashrun ʿalaynā yasīrun

45.content: نَحنُ أَعلَمُ بِما يَقولونَ ۖ وَما أَنتَ عَلَيهِم بِجَبّارٍ ۖ فَذَكِّر بِالقُرآنِ مَن يَخافُ وَعيدِ
45.translation_eng: We know best what they say,and you are not to be a tyrant over them.So admonish by the Qurʾān him who fears My threat.
45.transliteration: naḥnu ʾaʿlamu bi-mā yaqūlūna wa-mā ʾanta ʿalayhim bi-jabbārin fa-dhakkir bi-l-qurʾāni man yakhāfu waʿīdi

51.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by The Scattering winds that stream far and wide bearing the rain clouds of His mercy. It takes its name from verse 1, which mentions the “scatterers” (dhāriyāt). The surah gives several signs of nature as proof of the Resurrection, among them the scattering winds. The disbelievers are reminded of the fate that befell previous rebellious generations and the Prophet is urged to carry on reminding.The surah is also known as: Scattering (Winds), The Dispersers, The Dispersing, The Scattering Winds, The Winds, The Winds That Scatter, Winnowing (Winds).

1.translation_eng: By the scattering [winds]that scatter [the clouds];

2.translation_eng: by the [rain] bearing [clouds]laden [with water];

3.content: فَالجارِياتِ يُسرًا
3.translation_eng: by [the ships] which move gently [on the sea];
3.transliteration: fa-l-jāriyāti yusran

4.content: فَالمُقَسِّماتِ أَمرًا
4.translation_eng: by [the angels] who dispense [livelihood]by [His] command:
4.transliteration: fa-l-muqassimāti ʾamran

5.content: إِنَّما توعَدونَ لَصادِقٌ
5.translation_eng: indeed what you are promised is true,
5.transliteration: ʾinnamā tūʿadūna la-ṣādiqun

6.content: وَإِنَّ الدّينَ لَواقِعٌ
6.translation_eng: and indeed the retribution1 will surely come to pass!Or ‘judgement.’
6.transliteration: wa-ʾinna d-dīna la-wāqiʿun

7.content: وَالسَّماءِ ذاتِ الحُبُكِ
7.translation_eng: By the sky full of adornment [with stars],1Or, ‘By the heaven full of tracks’ (or pathways).
7.transliteration: wa-s-samāʾi dhāti l-ḥubuki

8.content: إِنَّكُم لَفي قَولٍ مُختَلِفٍ
8.translation_eng: indeed you are of different opinions!
8.transliteration: ʾinnakum la-fī qawlin mukhtalifin

9.content: يُؤفَكُ عَنهُ مَن أُفِكَ
9.translation_eng: He is turned away from it1who has been turned away [from the truth].That is, from the Qurʾān. Or ‘from him,’ that is, from the Apostle of Allah.
9.transliteration: yuʾfaku ʿanhu man ʾufika

10.content: قُتِلَ الخَرّاصونَ
10.translation_eng: Perish the liars,
10.transliteration: qutila-l-kharrāṣūna

11.content: الَّذينَ هُم في غَمرَةٍ ساهونَ
11.translation_eng: who are heedless in a stupor!
11.transliteration: alladhīna hum fī ghamratin sāhūna

12.content: يَسأَلونَ أَيّانَ يَومُ الدّينِ
12.translation_eng: They ask, ‘When will be the Day of Retribution?’
12.transliteration: yasʾalūna ʾayyāna yawmu d-dīni

13.content: يَومَ هُم عَلَى النّارِ يُفتَنونَ
13.translation_eng: It is the day when they will be tormented in the Fire,
13.transliteration: yawma hum ʿalā n-nāri yuftanūna

14.content: ذوقوا فِتنَتَكُم هٰذَا الَّذي كُنتُم بِهِ تَستَعجِلونَ
14.translation_eng: [and will be told]: ‘Taste your torment.This is what you used to hasten.’
14.transliteration: dhūqū fitnatakum hādhā lladhī kuntum bihī tastaʿjilūna

15.content: إِنَّ المُتَّقينَ في جَنّاتٍ وَعُيونٍ
15.translation_eng: Indeed the Godwary will be amid gardensand springs,
15.transliteration: ʾinna l-muttaqīna fī jannātin wa-ʿuyūnin

16.content: آخِذينَ ما آتاهُم رَبُّهُم ۚ إِنَّهُم كانوا قَبلَ ذٰلِكَ مُحسِنينَ
16.translation_eng: receiving what their Lord has given them,for they had been virtuous aforetime.
16.transliteration: ʾākhidhīna mā ʾātāhum rabbuhum ʾinnahum kānū qabla dhālika muḥsinīna

17.content: كانوا قَليلًا مِنَ اللَّيلِ ما يَهجَعونَ
17.translation_eng: They used to sleep a little during the night,
17.transliteration: kānū qalīlan mina l-layli mā yahjaʿūna

18.content: وَبِالأَسحارِ هُم يَستَغفِرونَ
18.translation_eng: and at dawns they would plead for forgiveness,
18.transliteration: wa-bi-l-ʾasḥāri hum yastaghfirūna

19.content: وَفي أَموالِهِم حَقٌّ لِلسّائِلِ وَالمَحرومِ
19.translation_eng: and there was a share in their wealthfor the beggar and the deprived.
19.transliteration: wa-fī ʾamwālihim ḥaqqun li-s-sāʾili wa-l-maḥrūmi

20.content: وَفِي الأَرضِ آياتٌ لِلموقِنينَ
20.translation_eng: In the earth are signs for those who have conviction,
20.transliteration: wa-fī l-ʾarḍi ʾāyātun li-l-mūqinīna

21.content: وَفي أَنفُسِكُم ۚ أَفَلا تُبصِرونَ
21.translation_eng: and in your souls [as well].Will you not then perceive?
21.transliteration: wa-fī ʾanfusikum ʾa-fa-lā tubṣirūna

22.content: وَفِي السَّماءِ رِزقُكُم وَما توعَدونَ
22.translation_eng: And in the sky is your provisionand what you are promised.
22.transliteration: wa-fī s-samāʾi rizqukum wa-mā tūʿadūna

23.content: فَوَرَبِّ السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ مِثلَ ما أَنَّكُم تَنطِقونَ
23.translation_eng: By the Lord of the sky and the earth,it is indeed the truth,just as [it is a fact that] you speak.
23.transliteration: fa-wa-rabbi s-samāʾi wa-l-ʾarḍi ʾinnahū la-ḥaqqun mithla mā ʾannakum tanṭiqūna

24.content: هَل أَتاكَ حَديثُ ضَيفِ إِبراهيمَ المُكرَمينَ
24.translation_eng: Did you receive the storyof Abraham’s honoured guests?
24.transliteration: hal ʾatāka ḥadīthu ḍayfi ʾibrāhīma l-mukramīna

25.content: إِذ دَخَلوا عَلَيهِ فَقالوا سَلامًا ۖ قالَ سَلامٌ قَومٌ مُنكَرونَ
25.translation_eng: When they entered into his presence,they said, ‘Peace!’‘Peace!’ He answered,‘[You are] an unfamiliar folk.’1Cf. 15:62.
25.transliteration: ʾidh dakhalū ʿalayhi fa-qālū salāman qāla salāmun qawmun munkarūna

26.content: فَراغَ إِلىٰ أَهلِهِ فَجاءَ بِعِجلٍ سَمينٍ
26.translation_eng: Then he retired to his familyand brought a fat [roasted] calf,
26.transliteration: fa-rāgha ʾilā ʾahlihī fa-jāʾa bi-ʿijlin samīnin

27.content: فَقَرَّبَهُ إِلَيهِم قالَ أَلا تَأكُلونَ
27.translation_eng: and put it near them.He said, ‘Will you not eat?’
27.transliteration: fa-qarrabahū ʾilayhim qāla ʾa-lā taʾkulūna

28.content: فَأَوجَسَ مِنهُم خيفَةً ۖ قالوا لا تَخَف ۖ وَبَشَّروهُ بِغُلامٍ عَليمٍ
28.translation_eng: Then he felt a fear of them.They said, ‘Do not be afraid!’and they gave him the good news of a wise son.1See 11:69-73 and 15:51-60 for parallel descriptions of the episode of Abraham’s guests.
28.transliteration: fa-ʾawjasa minhum khīfatan qālū lā takhaf wa-bashsharūhu bi-ghulāmin ʿalīmin

29.content: فَأَقبَلَتِ امرَأَتُهُ في صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّت وَجهَها وَقالَت عَجوزٌ عَقيمٌ
29.translation_eng: Then his wife came forward crying [with joy].She beat her face,and said, ‘A barren old woman!’
29.transliteration: fa-ʾaqbalati mraʾatuhū fī ṣarratin fa-ṣakkat wajhahā wa-qālat ʿajūzun ʿaqīmun

30.content: قالوا كَذٰلِكِ قالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الحَكيمُ العَليمُ
30.translation_eng: They said, ‘So has your Lord said.Indeed He is the All-wise, the All-knowing.’
30.transliteration: qālū ka-dhāliki qāla rabbuki ʾinnahū huwa l-ḥakīmu l-ʿalīmu

31.content: ۞ قالَ فَما خَطبُكُم أَيُّهَا المُرسَلونَ
31.translation_eng: He said,‘O messengers, what is now your errand?’
31.transliteration: qāla fa-mā khaṭbukum ʾayyuhā l-mursalūna

32.content: قالوا إِنّا أُرسِلنا إِلىٰ قَومٍ مُجرِمينَ
32.translation_eng: They said,‘We have been sent toward a guilty people,
32.transliteration: qālū ʾinnā ʾursilnā ʾilā qawmin mujrimīna

33.content: لِنُرسِلَ عَلَيهِم حِجارَةً مِن طينٍ
33.translation_eng: that We may rain upon them stones of clay,
33.transliteration: li-nursila ʿalayhim ḥijāratan min ṭīnin

34.content: مُسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلمُسرِفينَ
34.translation_eng: marked with your Lord for the profligate.
34.transliteration: musawwamatan ʿinda rabbika li-l-musrifīna

35.content: فَأَخرَجنا مَن كانَ فيها مِنَ المُؤمِنينَ
35.translation_eng: So We picked out those who were in itof the faithful,
35.transliteration: fa-ʾakhrajnā man kāna fīhā mina l-muʾminīna

36.content: فَما وَجَدنا فيها غَيرَ بَيتٍ مِنَ المُسلِمينَ
36.translation_eng: but We did not find thereother than one house of muslims,
36.transliteration: fa-mā wajadnā fīhā ghayra baytin mina l-muslimīna

37.content: وَتَرَكنا فيها آيَةً لِلَّذينَ يَخافونَ العَذابَ الأَليمَ
37.translation_eng: and We have left therein a signfor those who fear a painful punishment.’
37.transliteration: wa-taraknā fīhā ʾāyatan li-lladhīna yakhāfūna l-ʿadhāba l-ʾalīma

38.content: وَفي موسىٰ إِذ أَرسَلناهُ إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ بِسُلطانٍ مُبينٍ
38.translation_eng: And in Moses [too there is a sign]when We sent him to Pharaohwith a manifest authority.
38.transliteration: wa-fī mūsā ʾidh ʾarsalnāhu ʾilā firʿawna bi-sulṭānin mubīnin

39.content: فَتَوَلّىٰ بِرُكنِهِ وَقالَ ساحِرٌ أَو مَجنونٌ
39.translation_eng: But he turned away assured of his might,and said, ‘A magician or a crazy man!’
39.transliteration: fa-tawallā bi-ruknihī wa-qāla sāḥirun ʾaw majnūnun

40.content: فَأَخَذناهُ وَجُنودَهُ فَنَبَذناهُم فِي اليَمِّ وَهُوَ مُليمٌ
40.translation_eng: So We seized him and his hosts,and cast them into the sea,while he was blameworthy.
40.transliteration: fa-ʾakhadhnāhu wa-junūdahū fa-nabadhnāhum fī l-yammi wa-huwa mulīmun

41.content: وَفي عادٍ إِذ أَرسَلنا عَلَيهِمُ الرّيحَ العَقيمَ
41.translation_eng: And in ʿĀd when We unleashed upon thema barren wind.
41.transliteration: wa-fī ʿādin ʾidh ʾarsalnā ʿalayhimu r-rīḥa l-ʿaqīma

42.content: ما تَذَرُ مِن شَيءٍ أَتَت عَلَيهِ إِلّا جَعَلَتهُ كَالرَّميمِ
42.translation_eng: It left nothing that it came uponwithout making it like decayed bones.
42.transliteration: mā tadharu min shayʾin ʾatat ʿalayhi ʾillā jaʿalathu ka-r-ramīmi

43.content: وَفي ثَمودَ إِذ قيلَ لَهُم تَمَتَّعوا حَتّىٰ حينٍ
43.translation_eng: And in Thamūd, when they were told,‘Enjoy for a while.’
43.transliteration: wa-fī thamūda ʾidh qīla lahum tamattaʿū ḥattā ḥīnin

44.content: فَعَتَوا عَن أَمرِ رَبِّهِم فَأَخَذَتهُمُ الصّاعِقَةُ وَهُم يَنظُرونَ
44.translation_eng: Then they defied the command of their Lord;so the thunderbolt seized themas they looked on.
44.transliteration: fa-ʿataw ʿan ʾamri rabbihim fa-ʾakhadhathumu ṣ-ṣāʿiqatu wa-hum yanẓurūna

45.content: فَمَا استَطاعوا مِن قِيامٍ وَما كانوا مُنتَصِرينَ
45.translation_eng: So they were neither able to rise up,nor to come to one another’s aid.1Or ‘nor to guard themselves (from the punishment).’
45.transliteration: fa-mā staṭāʿū min qiyāmin wa-mā kānū muntaṣirīna

46.content: وَقَومَ نوحٍ مِن قَبلُ ۖ إِنَّهُم كانوا قَومًا فاسِقينَ
46.translation_eng: And the people of Noah aforetime.Indeed they were a transgressing lot.
46.transliteration: wa-qawma nūḥin min qablu ʾinnahum kānū qawman fāsiqīna

47.content: وَالسَّماءَ بَنَيناها بِأَيدٍ وَإِنّا لَموسِعونَ
47.translation_eng: We have built the sky with might,and indeed it is We who are its expanders.1Or ‘indeed it is We who are expanding it.’
47.transliteration: wa-s-samāʾa banaynāhā bi-ʾaydin wa-ʾinnā la-mūsiʿūna

48.content: وَالأَرضَ فَرَشناها فَنِعمَ الماهِدونَ
48.translation_eng: And the earth We have spread it out,so how excellent spreaders We have been!
48.transliteration: wa-l-ʾarḍa farashnāhā fa-niʿma l-māhidūna

49.content: وَمِن كُلِّ شَيءٍ خَلَقنا زَوجَينِ لَعَلَّكُم تَذَكَّرونَ
49.translation_eng: In all things We have created pairsso that you may take admonition.
49.transliteration: wa-min kulli shayʾin khalaqnā zawjayni laʿallakum tadhakkarūna

50.content: فَفِرّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنّي لَكُم مِنهُ نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
50.translation_eng: [Say,] ‘So flee toward Allah.Indeed I am a manifest warner to you from Him.
50.transliteration: fa-firrū ʾilā llāhi ʾinnī lakum minhu nadhīrun mubīnun

51.content: وَلا تَجعَلوا مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلٰهًا آخَرَ ۖ إِنّي لَكُم مِنهُ نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
51.translation_eng: Do not set up another god besides Allah.Indeed I am a manifest warner to you from Him.’
51.transliteration: wa-lā tajʿalū maʿa llāhi ʾilāhan ʾākhara ʾinnī lakum minhu nadhīrun mubīnun

52.content: كَذٰلِكَ ما أَتَى الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم مِن رَسولٍ إِلّا قالوا ساحِرٌ أَو مَجنونٌ
52.translation_eng: So it wasthat there did not come to those who were before themany apostlebut they said, ‘A magician,’ or ‘A crazy man!’
52.transliteration: ka-dhālika mā ʾatā lladhīna min qablihim min rasūlin ʾillā qālū sāḥirun ʾaw majnūnun

53.content: أَتَواصَوا بِهِ ۚ بَل هُم قَومٌ طاغونَ
53.translation_eng: Did they enjoin this upon one another?!Rather they were a rebellious lot.
53.transliteration: ʾa-tawāṣaw bihī bal hum qawmun ṭāghūna

54.content: فَتَوَلَّ عَنهُم فَما أَنتَ بِمَلومٍ
54.translation_eng: So turn away from them,for you will not be blameworthy.
54.transliteration: fa-tawalla ʿanhum fa-mā ʾanta bi-malūmin

55.content: وَذَكِّر فَإِنَّ الذِّكرىٰ تَنفَعُ المُؤمِنينَ
55.translation_eng: And admonish,for admonition indeed benefits the faithful.
55.transliteration: wa-dhakkir fa-ʾinna dh-dhikrā tanfaʿu l-muʾminīna

56.content: وَما خَلَقتُ الجِنَّ وَالإِنسَ إِلّا لِيَعبُدونِ
56.translation_eng: I did not create the jinn and the humansexcept that they may worship Me.
56.transliteration: wa-mā khalaqtu l-jinna wa-l-ʾinsa ʾillā li-yaʿbudūni

57.content: ما أُريدُ مِنهُم مِن رِزقٍ وَما أُريدُ أَن يُطعِمونِ
57.translation_eng: I desire no provision from them,nor do I desire that they should feed Me.
57.transliteration: mā ʾurīdu minhum min rizqin wa-mā ʾurīdu ʾan yuṭʿimūni

58.content: إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الرَّزّاقُ ذُو القُوَّةِ المَتينُ
58.translation_eng: Indeed it is Allah who is the All-provider,Powerful, All-strong.
58.transliteration: ʾinna llāha huwa r-razzāqu dhū l-quwwati l-matīnu

59.content: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذينَ ظَلَموا ذَنوبًا مِثلَ ذَنوبِ أَصحابِهِم فَلا يَستَعجِلونِ
59.translation_eng: Indeed the lot of those who do wrong [now]will be like the lot of their [earlier] counterparts.So let them not ask Me to hasten on [that fate].
59.transliteration: fa-ʾinna li-lladhīna ẓalamū dhanūban mithla dhanūbi ʾaṣḥābihim fa-lā yastaʿjilūni

60.content: فَوَيلٌ لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن يَومِهِمُ الَّذي يوعَدونَ
60.translation_eng: Woe to the faithlessfor the day they are promised!
60.transliteration: fa-waylun li-lladhīna kafarū min yawmihimu lladhī yūʿadūna

52.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by The Mount of Sinai, where the Torah was revealed to Moses. It takes its name from “the mount” (ṭūr) mentioned in verse 1. The surah which addresses many of the arguments put to the Prophet by the disbelievers of Mecca (verse 29 .). The bliss that will be enjoyed by the believers is contrasted to the torments of Hell, and the Prophet is urged to bide his time, to continue to deliver his message, and to wait with confidence for God’s judgement. God swears by, among other things, Mount Sinai, that the Day of Judgement is inevitable.The surah is also known as: Mount Tur, The Mountain.

1.translation_eng: By the Mount [Sinai],

2.translation_eng: by the Book inscribed

3.content: في رَقٍّ مَنشورٍ
3.translation_eng: on an unrolled parchment;
3.transliteration: fī raqqin manshūrin

4.content: وَالبَيتِ المَعمورِ
4.translation_eng: by the House greatly frequented;1The Holy Kaʿbah, or its counterpart, in the fourth (or the seventh) heaven, frequented by the angels.
4.transliteration: wa-l-bayti l-maʿmūri

5.content: وَالسَّقفِ المَرفوعِ
5.translation_eng: by the vault raised high,
5.transliteration: wa-s-saqfi l-marfūʿi

6.content: وَالبَحرِ المَسجورِ
6.translation_eng: by the surging sea:1Or ‘the sea set afire.’
6.transliteration: wa-l-baḥri l-masjūri

7.content: إِنَّ عَذابَ رَبِّكَ لَواقِعٌ
7.translation_eng: indeed your Lord’s punishment will surely befall.
7.transliteration: ʾinna ʿadhāba rabbika la-wāqiʿun

8.content: ما لَهُ مِن دافِعٍ
8.translation_eng: There is none who can avert it.
8.transliteration: mā lahū min dāfiʿin

9.content: يَومَ تَمورُ السَّماءُ مَورًا
9.translation_eng: On the day when the sky whirls violently,
9.transliteration: yawma tamūru s-samāʾu mawran

10.content: وَتَسيرُ الجِبالُ سَيرًا
10.translation_eng: and the mountains move with an awful motion:
10.transliteration: wa-tasīru l-jibālu sayran

11.content: فَوَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
11.translation_eng: woe to the deniers on that day
11.transliteration: fa-waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

12.content: الَّذينَ هُم في خَوضٍ يَلعَبونَ
12.translation_eng: —those who play around in vain talk,
12.transliteration: alladhīna hum fī khawḍin yalʿabūna

13.content: يَومَ يُدَعّونَ إِلىٰ نارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا
13.translation_eng: the day when they will be shovedtoward the fire of hellforcibly,
13.transliteration: yawma yudaʿʿūna ʾilā n-nāri jahannama daʿʿan

14.content: هٰذِهِ النّارُ الَّتي كُنتُم بِها تُكَذِّبونَ
14.translation_eng: [and told:] ‘This is the Fire whichyou used to deny!’
14.transliteration: hādhihi n-nāru llatī kuntum bihā tukadhdhibūna

15.content: أَفَسِحرٌ هٰذا أَم أَنتُم لا تُبصِرونَ
15.translation_eng: Is this then magic,or is it you who do not perceive?
15.transliteration: ʾa-fa-siḥrun hādhā ʾam ʾantum lā tubṣirūna

16.content: اصلَوها فَاصبِروا أَو لا تَصبِروا سَواءٌ عَلَيكُم ۖ إِنَّما تُجزَونَ ما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
16.translation_eng: ‘Enter it,and whether you are patient or impatientit will be the same for you.You are only being requitedfor what you used to do.’
16.transliteration: iṣlawhā fa-ṣbirū ʾaw lā taṣbirū sawāʾun ʿalaykum ʾinnamā tujzawna mā kuntum taʿmalūna

17.content: إِنَّ المُتَّقينَ في جَنّاتٍ وَنَعيمٍ
17.translation_eng: Indeed the Godwary will be amid gardensand bliss,
17.transliteration: ʾinna l-muttaqīna fī jannātin wa-naʿīmin

18.content: فاكِهينَ بِما آتاهُم رَبُّهُم وَوَقاهُم رَبُّهُم عَذابَ الجَحيمِ
18.translation_eng: rejoicing because of what their Lord has given them,and that their Lord has saved themfrom the punishment of hell.
18.transliteration: fākihīna bi-mā ʾātāhum rabbuhum wa-waqāhum rabbuhum ʿadhāba l-jaḥīmi

19.content: كُلوا وَاشرَبوا هَنيئًا بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
19.translation_eng: [They will be told:] ‘Enjoy your food and drink,[as a reward] for what you used to do.’
19.transliteration: kulū wa-shrabū hanīʾan bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna

20.content: مُتَّكِئينَ عَلىٰ سُرُرٍ مَصفوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجناهُم بِحورٍ عينٍ
20.translation_eng: They will be reclining on arrayed couches,and We will wed them to big-eyed houris.
20.transliteration: muttakiʾīna ʿalā sururin maṣfūfatin wa-zawwajnāhum bi-ḥūrin ʿīnin

21.content: وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا وَاتَّبَعَتهُم ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإيمانٍ أَلحَقنا بِهِم ذُرِّيَّتَهُم وَما أَلَتناهُم مِن عَمَلِهِم مِن شَيءٍ ۚ كُلُّ امرِئٍ بِما كَسَبَ رَهينٌ
21.translation_eng: The faithfuland their descendants who followed them in faith—We will make their descendants join them,and We will not stintanything from [the reward of] their deeds.Every man is a hostage to what he has earned.
21.transliteration: wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ttabaʿathum dhurriyyatuhum bi-ʾīmānin ʾalḥaqnā bihim dhurriyyatahum wa-mā ʾalatnāhum min ʿamalihim min shayʾin kullu mriʾin bi-mā kasaba rahīnun

22.content: وَأَمدَدناهُم بِفاكِهَةٍ وَلَحمٍ مِمّا يَشتَهونَ
22.translation_eng: We will provide them with fruits and meat,such as they desire.
22.transliteration: wa-ʾamdadnāhum bi-fākihatin wa-laḥmin mimmā yashtahūna

23.content: يَتَنازَعونَ فيها كَأسًا لا لَغوٌ فيها وَلا تَأثيمٌ
23.translation_eng: There they will pass from hand to hand a cupwherein there will be neither any vain talknor sinful speech.
23.transliteration: yatanāzaʿūna fīhā kaʾsan lā laghwun fīhā wa-lā taʾthīmun

24.content: ۞ وَيَطوفُ عَلَيهِم غِلمانٌ لَهُم كَأَنَّهُم لُؤلُؤٌ مَكنونٌ
24.translation_eng: They will be waited upon by youths, their own,as if they were guarded pearls.
24.transliteration: wa-yaṭūfu ʿalayhim ghilmānun lahum ka-ʾannahum luʾluʾun maknūnun

25.content: وَأَقبَلَ بَعضُهُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ يَتَساءَلونَ
25.translation_eng: They will turn to one another,questioning each other.
25.transliteration: wa-ʾaqbala baʿḍuhum ʿalā baʿḍin yatasāʾalūna

26.content: قالوا إِنّا كُنّا قَبلُ في أَهلِنا مُشفِقينَ
26.translation_eng: They will say, ‘Indeed, aforetime, we used to beapprehensive about our families.
26.transliteration: qālū ʾinnā kunnā qablu fī ʾahlinā mushfiqīna

27.content: فَمَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَينا وَوَقانا عَذابَ السَّمومِ
27.translation_eng: But Allah showed us favourand He saved usfrom the punishment of the [infernal] miasma;
27.transliteration: fa-manna llāhu ʿalaynā wa-waqānā ʿadhāba s-samūmi

28.content: إِنّا كُنّا مِن قَبلُ نَدعوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ البَرُّ الرَّحيمُ
28.translation_eng: indeed we used to supplicate Him aforetime.Indeed He is the All-benign, the All-merciful.’
28.transliteration: ʾinnā kunnā min qablu nadʿūhu ʾinnahū huwa l-barru r-raḥīmu

29.content: فَذَكِّر فَما أَنتَ بِنِعمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكاهِنٍ وَلا مَجنونٍ
29.translation_eng: So admonish.By your Lord’s blessing, you are not a soothsayer,nor mad.
29.transliteration: fa-dhakkir fa-mā ʾanta bi-niʿmati rabbika bi-kāhinin wa-lā majnūnin

30.content: أَم يَقولونَ شاعِرٌ نَتَرَبَّصُ بِهِ رَيبَ المَنونِ
30.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘[He is] a poet,for whom we await a fatal accident’?
30.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna shāʿirun natarabbaṣu bihī rayba l-manūni

31.content: قُل تَرَبَّصوا فَإِنّي مَعَكُم مِنَ المُتَرَبِّصينَ
31.translation_eng: Say, ‘Wait!I too am waiting along with you.’
31.transliteration: qul tarabbaṣū fa-ʾinnī maʿakum mina l-mutarabbiṣīna

32.content: أَم تَأمُرُهُم أَحلامُهُم بِهٰذا ۚ أَم هُم قَومٌ طاغونَ
32.translation_eng: Is it their intellect which prompts themto [say] this,or are they a rebellious lot?
32.transliteration: ʾam taʿmuruhum ʾaḥlāmuhum bi-hādhā ʾam hum qawmun ṭāghūna

33.content: أَم يَقولونَ تَقَوَّلَهُ ۚ بَل لا يُؤمِنونَ
33.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘He has improvised it [himself]?’Rather they have no faith!
33.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna taqawwalahū bal lā yuʾminūna

34.content: فَليَأتوا بِحَديثٍ مِثلِهِ إِن كانوا صادِقينَ
34.translation_eng: Let them bring a discourse like it,if they are truthful.
34.transliteration: fa-l-yaʾtū bi-ḥadīthin mithlihī ʾin kānū ṣādiqīna

35.content: أَم خُلِقوا مِن غَيرِ شَيءٍ أَم هُمُ الخالِقونَ
35.translation_eng: Were they created from nothing?Or are they [their own] creators?
35.transliteration: ʾam khuliqū min ghayri shayʾin ʾam humu l-khāliqūna

36.content: أَم خَلَقُوا السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ ۚ بَل لا يوقِنونَ
36.translation_eng: Did they create the heavens and the earth?Rather they have no certainty!
36.transliteration: ʾam khalaqū s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa bal lā yūqinūna

37.content: أَم عِندَهُم خَزائِنُ رَبِّكَ أَم هُمُ المُصَيطِرونَ
37.translation_eng: Do they possess the treasuries of your Lord?Or are they the controllers [of their dispensation]?
37.transliteration: ʾam ʿindahum khazāʾinu rabbika ʾam humu l-muṣayṭirūna

38.content: أَم لَهُم سُلَّمٌ يَستَمِعونَ فيهِ ۖ فَليَأتِ مُستَمِعُهُم بِسُلطانٍ مُبينٍ
38.translation_eng: Do they have a ladder [leading up to heaven]whereby they eavesdrop?1If so let their eavesdropper producea manifest authority.That is, on the conversation of the angels.
38.transliteration: ʾam lahum sullamun yastamiʿūna fīhi fa-l-yaʾti mustamiʿuhum bi-sulṭānin mubīnin

39.content: أَم لَهُ البَناتُ وَلَكُمُ البَنونَ
39.transliteration: ʾam lahu l-banātu wa-lakumu l-banūna

40.content: أَم تَسأَلُهُم أَجرًا فَهُم مِن مَغرَمٍ مُثقَلونَ
40.translation_eng: Do you ask them for a reward,so that they are weighed down with debt?
40.transliteration: ʾam tasʾaluhum ʾajran fa-hum min maghramin muthqalūna

41.content: أَم عِندَهُمُ الغَيبُ فَهُم يَكتُبونَ
41.translation_eng: Do they have [access to] the Unseen,which they write down?
41.transliteration: ʾam ʿindahumu l-ghaybu fa-hum yaktubūna

42.content: أَم يُريدونَ كَيدًا ۖ فَالَّذينَ كَفَروا هُمُ المَكيدونَ
42.translation_eng: Do they seek to outmaneuver [Allah]?But it is the faithlesswho are the outmaneuvered ones!
42.transliteration: ʾam yurīdūna kaydan fa-lladhīna kafarū humu l-makīdūna

43.content: أَم لَهُم إِلٰهٌ غَيرُ اللَّهِ ۚ سُبحانَ اللَّهِ عَمّا يُشرِكونَ
43.translation_eng: Do they have any god other than Allah?Clear is Allahof any partners that they may ascribe [to Him]!
43.transliteration: ʾam lahum ʾilāhun ghayru llāhi subḥāna llāhi ʿammā yushrikūna

44.content: وَإِن يَرَوا كِسفًا مِنَ السَّماءِ ساقِطًا يَقولوا سَحابٌ مَركومٌ
44.translation_eng: Were they to seea fragment falling from the sky,they would say, ‘A cumulous cloud.’
44.transliteration: wa-ʾin yaraw kisfan mina s-samāʾi sāqiṭan yaqūlū saḥābun markūmun

45.content: فَذَرهُم حَتّىٰ يُلاقوا يَومَهُمُ الَّذي فيهِ يُصعَقونَ
45.translation_eng: So leave them until they encounter their dayon which they will be thunderstruck;
45.transliteration: fa-dharhum ḥattā yulāqū yawmahumu lladhī fīhi yuṣʿaqūna

46.content: يَومَ لا يُغني عَنهُم كَيدُهُم شَيئًا وَلا هُم يُنصَرونَ
46.translation_eng: the day when their guile will not avail themin any way,nor will they be helped.
46.transliteration: yawma lā yughnī ʿanhum kayduhum shayʾan wa-lā hum yunṣarūna

47.content: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذينَ ظَلَموا عَذابًا دونَ ذٰلِكَ وَلٰكِنَّ أَكثَرَهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
47.translation_eng: Indeed for those who do wrong,there is a punishment besides that,but most of them do not know.
47.transliteration: wa-ʾinna li-lladhīna ẓalamū ʿadhāban dūna dhālika wa-lākinna ʾaktharahum lā yaʿlamūna

48.content: وَاصبِر لِحُكمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعيُنِنا ۖ وَسَبِّح بِحَمدِ رَبِّكَ حينَ تَقومُ
48.translation_eng: So submit patiently to the judgement of your Lord,for indeed you fare before Our eyes.And celebrate the praise of your Lordwhen you rise [at dawn],
48.transliteration: wa-ṣbir li-ḥukmi rabbika fa-ʾinnaka bi-ʾaʿyuninā wa-sabbiḥ bi-ḥamdi rabbika ḥīna taqūmu

49.content: وَمِنَ اللَّيلِ فَسَبِّحهُ وَإِدبارَ النُّجومِ
49.translation_eng: and also glorify Him during the nightand at the receding of the stars.
49.transliteration: wa-mina l-layli fa-sabbiḥhu wa-ʾidbāra n-nujūmi

53.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by every one of The Stars, as they descend and disappear beneath the horizon, that Muhammad is indeed God’s awaited Messenger. It takes its name from verse 1, which mentions “the stars” (najm). The surah confirms the divine source of the Prophet’s message and refers to his ascension to heaven during the Night Journey (verse 1 .). The surah refutes the claims of the disbelievers about the goddesses and the angels (verse 19 .), and lists several truths about God’s power. It closes with a warning of the imminent Day of Judgement.The surah is also known as: The Pleiades.

1.translation_eng: By the star when it sets:1Or ‘falls.’

2.translation_eng: your companion1 has neither gone astray,nor gone amiss.That is, the Apostle of Allah.

3.content: وَما يَنطِقُ عَنِ الهَوىٰ
3.translation_eng: Nor does he speak out of [his own] desire:
3.transliteration: wa-mā yanṭiqu ʿani l-hawā

4.content: إِن هُوَ إِلّا وَحيٌ يوحىٰ
4.translation_eng: it is just a revelation that is revealed [to him],
4.transliteration: ʾin huwa ʾillā waḥyun yūḥā

5.content: عَلَّمَهُ شَديدُ القُوىٰ
5.translation_eng: taught him by One of great powers,
5.transliteration: ʿallamahū shadīdu l-quwā

6.content: ذو مِرَّةٍ فَاستَوىٰ
6.translation_eng: possessed of sound judgement.1He2 settled,3Or ‘possessed of strength.’That is, the Apostle of Allah (ṣ); or the Angel Gabriel, according to some commentators.Or ‘stood upright.’
6.transliteration: dhū mirratin fa-stawā

7.content: وَهُوَ بِالأُفُقِ الأَعلىٰ
7.translation_eng: while he was on the highest horizon.
7.transliteration: wa-huwa bi-l-ʾufuqi l-ʾaʿlā

8.content: ثُمَّ دَنا فَتَدَلّىٰ
8.translation_eng: Then he drew nearer and nearer
8.transliteration: thumma danā fa-tadallā

9.content: فَكانَ قابَ قَوسَينِ أَو أَدنىٰ
9.translation_eng: until he was within two bows’ length or even nearer,
9.transliteration: fa-kāna qāba qawsayni ʾaw ʾadnā

10.content: فَأَوحىٰ إِلىٰ عَبدِهِ ما أَوحىٰ
10.translation_eng: whereat He revealed to His servantwhatever He revealed.
10.transliteration: fa-ʾawḥā ʾilā ʿabdihī mā ʾawḥā

11.content: ما كَذَبَ الفُؤادُ ما رَأىٰ
11.translation_eng: The heart did not deny what it saw.
11.transliteration: mā kadhaba l-fuʾādu mā raʾā

12.content: أَفَتُمارونَهُ عَلىٰ ما يَرىٰ
12.translation_eng: Will you then dispute with him about what he saw?!
12.transliteration: ʾa-fa-tumārūnahū ʿalā mā yarā

13.content: وَلَقَد رَآهُ نَزلَةً أُخرىٰ
13.translation_eng: Certainly he saw it1 yet another time,Or ‘them.’ To explain, the object of the pronoun hū is specified in verse 18, ‘Certainly he saw some of the greatest signs of his Lord.’ This interpretation is also supported by a tradition of Imam ʿAli b. Mūsā al-Riḍā (ʿa) cited in the Uṣūl al-Kāfī, vol. 1, p. 95, ḥadīth 2.
13.transliteration: wa-la-qad raʾāhu nazlatan ʾukhrā

14.content: عِندَ سِدرَةِ المُنتَهىٰ
14.translation_eng: by the Lote Tree of the Ultimate Boundary,
14.transliteration: ʿinda sidrati l-muntahā

15.content: عِندَها جَنَّةُ المَأوىٰ
15.translation_eng: near which is the Garden of the Abode,
15.transliteration: ʿindahā jannatu l-maʾwā

16.content: إِذ يَغشَى السِّدرَةَ ما يَغشىٰ
16.translation_eng: when there covered the Lote Tree what covered it.
16.transliteration: ʾidh yaghshā s-sidrata mā yaghshā

17.content: ما زاغَ البَصَرُ وَما طَغىٰ
17.translation_eng: The gaze did not swerve,nor did it overstep the bounds.
17.transliteration: mā zāgha l-baṣaru wa-mā ṭaghā

18.content: لَقَد رَأىٰ مِن آياتِ رَبِّهِ الكُبرىٰ
18.translation_eng: Certainly he sawsome of the greatest signs of his Lord.
18.transliteration: la-qad raʾā min ʾāyāti rabbihi l-kubrā

19.content: أَفَرَأَيتُمُ اللّاتَ وَالعُزّىٰ
19.translation_eng: Have you considered Lāt and ʿUzzā?
19.transliteration: ʾa-fa-raʾaytumu l-lāta wa-l-ʿuzzā

20.content: وَمَناةَ الثّالِثَةَ الأُخرىٰ
20.translation_eng: and Manāt, the third one?
20.transliteration: wa-manāta th-thālithata l-ʾukhrā

21.content: أَلَكُمُ الذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ الأُنثىٰ
21.translation_eng: Are you to have males and He females?
21.transliteration: ʾa-lakumu dh-dhakaru wa-lahu l-ʾunthā

22.content: تِلكَ إِذًا قِسمَةٌ ضيزىٰ
22.translation_eng: That, then, will be an unfair division!
22.transliteration: tilka ʾidhan qismatun ḍīzā

23.content: إِن هِيَ إِلّا أَسماءٌ سَمَّيتُموها أَنتُم وَآباؤُكُم ما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ بِها مِن سُلطانٍ ۚ إِن يَتَّبِعونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَما تَهوَى الأَنفُسُ ۖ وَلَقَد جاءَهُم مِن رَبِّهِمُ الهُدىٰ
23.translation_eng: These are but names which you have coined—you and your fathers—for which Allah has not sent down any authority.They follow nothing but conjecturesand the desires of the [lower] soul,while there has already come to themthe guidance from their Lord.
23.transliteration: ʾin hiya ʾillā ʾasmāʾun sammaytumūhā ʾantum wa-ʾābāʾukum mā ʾanzala llāhu bihā min sulṭānin ʾin yattabiʿūna ʾillā ẓ-ẓanna wa-mā tahwā l-ʾanfusu wa-la-qad jāʾahum min rabbihimu l-hudā

24.content: أَم لِلإِنسانِ ما تَمَنّىٰ
24.translation_eng: Shall man have whatever he yearns for?
24.transliteration: ʾam li-l-ʾinsāni mā tamannā

25.content: فَلِلَّهِ الآخِرَةُ وَالأولىٰ
25.translation_eng: Yet to Allah belong this world and the Hereafter.
25.transliteration: fa-li-llāhi l-ʾākhiratu wa-l-ʾūlā

26.content: ۞ وَكَم مِن مَلَكٍ فِي السَّماواتِ لا تُغني شَفاعَتُهُم شَيئًا إِلّا مِن بَعدِ أَن يَأذَنَ اللَّهُ لِمَن يَشاءُ وَيَرضىٰ
26.translation_eng: How many an angel there is in the heavenswhose intercession is of no avail in any wayexcept after Allah grants permissionto whomever He wishes and approves of!
26.transliteration: wa-kam min malakin fī s-samāwāti lā tughnī shafāʿatuhum shayʾan ʾillā min baʿdi ʾan yaʾdhana llāhu li-man yashāʾu wa-yarḍā

27.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ لا يُؤمِنونَ بِالآخِرَةِ لَيُسَمّونَ المَلائِكَةَ تَسمِيَةَ الأُنثىٰ
27.translation_eng: Indeed those who do not believe in the Hereaftergive female names to the angels.
27.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna lā yuʾminūna bi-l-ʾākhirati la-yusammūna l-malāʾikata tasmiyata l-ʾunthā

28.content: وَما لَهُم بِهِ مِن عِلمٍ ۖ إِن يَتَّبِعونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ ۖ وَإِنَّ الظَّنَّ لا يُغني مِنَ الحَقِّ شَيئًا
28.translation_eng: They do not have any knowledge of that.They follow nothing but conjectures,and indeed conjecture is no substitute for the truth.
28.transliteration: wa-mā lahum bihī min ʿilmin ʾin yattabiʿūna ʾillā ẓ-ẓanna wa-ʾinna ẓ-ẓanna lā yughnī mina l-ḥaqqi shayʾan

29.content: فَأَعرِض عَن مَن تَوَلّىٰ عَن ذِكرِنا وَلَم يُرِد إِلَّا الحَياةَ الدُّنيا
29.translation_eng: So avoid those who turn away from Our remembranceand desire nothing but the life of the world.
29.transliteration: fa-ʾaʿriḍ ʿan man tawallā ʿan dhikrinā wa-lam yurid ʾillā l-ḥayāta d-dunyā

30.content: ذٰلِكَ مَبلَغُهُم مِنَ العِلمِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعلَمُ بِمَنِ اهتَدىٰ
30.translation_eng: That is the ultimate reach of their knowledge.Indeed your Lord knows bestthose who stray from His way,and He knows best those who are [rightly] guided.
30.transliteration: dhālika mablaghuhum mina l-ʿilmi ʾinna rabbaka huwa ʾaʿlamu bi-man ḍalla ʿan sabīlihī wa-huwa ʾaʿlamu bi-mani htadā

31.content: وَلِلَّهِ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ لِيَجزِيَ الَّذينَ أَساءوا بِما عَمِلوا وَيَجزِيَ الَّذينَ أَحسَنوا بِالحُسنَى
31.translation_eng: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavensand whatever is in the earth,that He may requite those who do evilfor what they have done,and reward those who do goodwith the best [of rewards].
31.transliteration: wa-li-llāhi mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi li-yajziya lladhīna ʾasāʾū bi-mā ʿamilū wa-yajziya lladhīna ʾaḥsanū bi-l-ḥusnā

32.content: الَّذينَ يَجتَنِبونَ كَبائِرَ الإِثمِ وَالفَواحِشَ إِلَّا اللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ واسِعُ المَغفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعلَمُ بِكُم إِذ أَنشَأَكُم مِنَ الأَرضِ وَإِذ أَنتُم أَجِنَّةٌ في بُطونِ أُمَّهاتِكُم ۖ فَلا تُزَكّوا أَنفُسَكُم ۖ هُوَ أَعلَمُ بِمَنِ اتَّقىٰ
32.translation_eng: Those who avoid major sinsand indecencies,excepting [minor and occasional] lapses.Indeed your Lord is expansive in [His] forgiveness.He knows you bestsince [the time] He produced you from the earth,and since you were fetusesin the bellies of your mothers.So do not flaunt your piety:He knows best those who are Godwary.
32.transliteration: alladhīna yajtanibūna kabāʾira l-ʾithmi wa-l-fawāḥisha ʾillā l-lamama ʾinna rabbaka wāsiʿu l-maghfirati huwa ʾaʿlamu bikum ʾidh ʾanshaʾakum mina l-ʾarḍi wa-ʾidh ʾantum ʾajinnatun fī buṭūni ʾummahātikum fa-lā tuzakkū ʾanfusakum huwa ʾaʿlamu bi-mani ttaqā

33.content: أَفَرَأَيتَ الَّذي تَوَلّىٰ
33.translation_eng: Did you see him who turned away,
33.transliteration: ʾa-fa-raʾayta lladhī tawallā

34.content: وَأَعطىٰ قَليلًا وَأَكدىٰ
34.translation_eng: gave a little and held off?
34.transliteration: wa-ʾaʿṭā qalīlan wa-ʾakdā

35.content: أَعِندَهُ عِلمُ الغَيبِ فَهُوَ يَرىٰ
35.translation_eng: Does he have the knowledge of the Unseenso that he sees?
35.transliteration: ʾa-ʿindahū ʿilmu l-ghaybi fa-huwa yarā

36.content: أَم لَم يُنَبَّأ بِما في صُحُفِ موسىٰ
36.translation_eng: Has he not been informed of what isin the scriptures of Moses,
36.transliteration: ʾam lam yunabbaʾ bi-mā fī ṣuḥufi mūsā

37.content: وَإِبراهيمَ الَّذي وَفّىٰ
37.translation_eng: and of Abraham, who fulfilled [his summons]:
37.transliteration: wa-ʾibrāhīma lladhī waffā

38.content: أَلّا تَزِرُ وازِرَةٌ وِزرَ أُخرىٰ
38.translation_eng: that no bearer shall bear another’s burden,
38.transliteration: ʾallā taziru wāziratun wizra ʾukhrā

39.content: وَأَن لَيسَ لِلإِنسانِ إِلّا ما سَعىٰ
39.translation_eng: and that nothing belongs to manexcept what he strives for,
39.transliteration: wa-ʾan laysa li-l-ʾinsāni ʾillā mā saʿā

40.content: وَأَنَّ سَعيَهُ سَوفَ يُرىٰ
40.translation_eng: and that he will soon be shown his endeavour,
40.transliteration: wa-ʾanna saʿyahū sawfa yurā

41.content: ثُمَّ يُجزاهُ الجَزاءَ الأَوفىٰ
41.translation_eng: then he will be rewarded for itwith the fullest reward;
41.transliteration: thumma yujzāhu l-jazāʾa l-ʾawfā

42.content: وَأَنَّ إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ المُنتَهىٰ
42.translation_eng: and that the terminus is toward your Lord,
42.transliteration: wa-ʾanna ʾilā rabbika l-muntahā

43.content: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَضحَكَ وَأَبكىٰ
43.translation_eng: and that it is He who makes [men] laugh,and makes [them] weep,
43.transliteration: wa-ʾannahū huwa ʾaḍḥaka wa-ʾabkā

44.content: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَماتَ وَأَحيا
44.translation_eng: and that it is He who brings death and gives life,
44.transliteration: wa-ʾannahū huwa ʾamāta wa-ʾaḥyā

45.content: وَأَنَّهُ خَلَقَ الزَّوجَينِ الذَّكَرَ وَالأُنثىٰ
45.translation_eng: and that it is He who created the mates,1the male and the female,Or ‘the sexes.’
45.transliteration: wa-ʾannahū khalaqa z-zawjayni dh-dhakara wa-l-ʾunthā

46.content: مِن نُطفَةٍ إِذا تُمنىٰ
46.translation_eng: from a drop of [seminal] fluid when emitted;
46.transliteration: min nuṭfatin ʾidhā tumnā

47.content: وَأَنَّ عَلَيهِ النَّشأَةَ الأُخرىٰ
47.translation_eng: and that with Him lies the second genesis,
47.transliteration: wa-ʾanna ʿalayhi n-nashʾata l-ʾukhrā

48.content: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَغنىٰ وَأَقنىٰ
48.translation_eng: and that it is He who enriches and grants possessions,
48.transliteration: wa-ʾannahū huwa ʾaghnā wa-ʾaqnā

49.content: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ رَبُّ الشِّعرىٰ
49.translation_eng: and that it is He who is the Lord of Sirius;
49.transliteration: wa-ʾannahū huwa rabbu sh-shiʿrā

50.content: وَأَنَّهُ أَهلَكَ عادًا الأولىٰ
50.translation_eng: and that it is He who destroyed the former ʿĀd,
50.transliteration: wa-ʾannahū ʾahlaka ʿādan-i l-ʾūlā

51.content: وَثَمودَ فَما أَبقىٰ
51.translation_eng: and Thamud,sparing none [of them];
51.transliteration: wa-thamūda fa-mā ʾabqā

52.content: وَقَومَ نوحٍ مِن قَبلُ ۖ إِنَّهُم كانوا هُم أَظلَمَ وَأَطغىٰ
52.translation_eng: and the people of Noah before that;indeed they were more unjust and rebellious;
52.transliteration: wa-qawma nūḥin min qablu ʾinnahum kānū hum ʾaẓlama wa-ʾaṭghā

53.content: وَالمُؤتَفِكَةَ أَهوىٰ
53.translation_eng: and He overthrew the town that was overturned,1That is, Sodom. Elsewhere mentioned as plural; see 9:70, 69:9.
53.transliteration: wa-l-muʾtafikata ʾahwā

54.content: فَغَشّاها ما غَشّىٰ
54.translation_eng: covering it with what covered it.
54.transliteration: fa-ghashshāhā mā ghashshā

55.content: فَبِأَيِّ آلاءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمارىٰ
55.translation_eng: Then which of the bounties of your Lordwill you dispute?
55.transliteration: fa-bi-ʾayyi ʾālāʾi rabbika tatamārā

56.content: هٰذا نَذيرٌ مِنَ النُّذُرِ الأولىٰ
56.translation_eng: This is a warner,[in the tradition] of the warners of old.
56.transliteration: hādhā nadhīrun mina n-nudhuri l-ʾūlā

57.content: أَزِفَتِ الآزِفَةُ
57.translation_eng: The Imminent [Hour] is near at hand.
57.transliteration: ʾazifati l-ʾāzifatu

58.content: لَيسَ لَها مِن دونِ اللَّهِ كاشِفَةٌ
58.translation_eng: There is none that may unveil it besides Allah.
58.transliteration: laysa lahā min dūni llāhi kāshifatun

59.content: أَفَمِن هٰذَا الحَديثِ تَعجَبونَ
59.translation_eng: Do you then wonder at this discourse,
59.transliteration: ʾa-fa-min hādhā l-ḥadīthi taʿjabūna

60.content: وَتَضحَكونَ وَلا تَبكونَ
60.translation_eng: and laugh and not weep,
60.transliteration: wa-taḍḥakūna wa-lā tabkūna

61.content: وَأَنتُم سامِدونَ
61.translation_eng: while you remain heedless?!
61.transliteration: wa-ʾantum sāmidūna

62.content: فَاسجُدوا لِلَّهِ وَاعبُدوا ۩
62.translation_eng: So prostrate yourselves to Allah and worship Him!
62.transliteration: fa-sjudū li-llāhi wa-ʿbudū

54.description: The surah that opens with the unnerving, cataclysmic sign of the end of the world coming and The Moon having split apart. It takes its name from verse 1 which mentions “the moon” (qamar), that here serves as a reference to the Day of Resurrection. The surah deals mainly with the punishment dealt out to previous generations of disbelievers. These are presented as a warning to the disbelievers of Mecca, with the refrain “is there anyone who will be admonished?” running throughout the surah. Finally the treatment of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgement is contrasted to the everlasting bliss the believers will enjoy.

1.translation_eng: The Hour has drawn nearand the moon is split.

2.content: وَإِن يَرَوا آيَةً يُعرِضوا وَيَقولوا سِحرٌ مُستَمِرٌّ
2.translation_eng: If they see a sign, they turn away,and say, ‘An incessant1 magic!’Or ‘powerful.’
2.transliteration: wa-ʾin yaraw ʾāyatan yuʿriḍū wa-yaqūlū siḥrun mustamirrun

3.content: وَكَذَّبوا وَاتَّبَعوا أَهواءَهُم ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمرٍ مُستَقِرٌّ
3.translation_eng: They denied, and followed their own desires,and every matter has a setting [appropriate to it].
3.transliteration: wa-kadhdhabū wa-ttabaʿū ʾahwāʾahum wa-kullu ʾamrin mustaqirrun

4.content: وَلَقَد جاءَهُم مِنَ الأَنباءِ ما فيهِ مُزدَجَرٌ
4.translation_eng: There have already come to them reportscontaining admonishment,
4.transliteration: wa-la-qad jāʾahum mina l-ʾanbāʾi mā fīhi muzdajarun

5.content: حِكمَةٌ بالِغَةٌ ۖ فَما تُغنِ النُّذُرُ
5.translation_eng: [and representing] far-reaching wisdom;but warnings are of no avail!
5.transliteration: ḥikmatun bālighatun fa-mā tughni n-nudhuru

6.content: فَتَوَلَّ عَنهُم ۘ يَومَ يَدعُ الدّاعِ إِلىٰ شَيءٍ نُكُرٍ
6.translation_eng: So turn away from them!The day when the Caller calls to a dire thing,
6.transliteration: fa-tawalla ʿanhum yawma yadʿu d-dāʿi ʾilā shayʾin nukurin

7.content: خُشَّعًا أَبصارُهُم يَخرُجونَ مِنَ الأَجداثِ كَأَنَّهُم جَرادٌ مُنتَشِرٌ
7.translation_eng: with a humbled look [in their eyes],they will emerge from the gravesas if they were scattered locusts,
7.transliteration: khushshaʿan ʾabṣāruhum yakhrujūna mina l-ʾajdāthi ka-ʾannahum jarādun muntashirun

8.content: مُهطِعينَ إِلَى الدّاعِ ۖ يَقولُ الكافِرونَ هٰذا يَومٌ عَسِرٌ
8.translation_eng: scrambling toward the summoner.The faithless will say, ‘This is a hard day!’
8.transliteration: muhṭiʿīna ʾilā d-dāʿi yaqūlu l-kāfirūna hādhā yawmun ʿasirun

9.content: ۞ كَذَّبَت قَبلَهُم قَومُ نوحٍ فَكَذَّبوا عَبدَنا وَقالوا مَجنونٌ وَازدُجِرَ
9.translation_eng: The people of Noah impugned before them.So they impugned Our servant and said,‘A crazy man,’ and he was reviled.1Or ‘he was proscribed,’ or ‘he was ostracized.’
9.transliteration: kadhdhabat qablahum qawmu nūḥin fa-kadhdhabū ʿabdanā wa-qālū majnūnun wa-zdujira

10.content: فَدَعا رَبَّهُ أَنّي مَغلوبٌ فَانتَصِر
10.translation_eng: Thereat he invoked his Lord,[saying,] ‘I have been overcome, so help [me].’
10.transliteration: fa-daʿā rabbahū ʾannī maghlūbun fa-ntaṣir

11.content: فَفَتَحنا أَبوابَ السَّماءِ بِماءٍ مُنهَمِرٍ
11.translation_eng: Then We opened the gates of the skywith pouring waters,
11.transliteration: fa-fataḥnā ʾabwāba s-samāʾi bi-māʾin munhamirin

12.content: وَفَجَّرنَا الأَرضَ عُيونًا فَالتَقَى الماءُ عَلىٰ أَمرٍ قَد قُدِرَ
12.translation_eng: and We made the earth burst forth with springs,and the waters met for a preordained purpose.
12.transliteration: wa-fajjarnā l-ʾarḍa ʿuyūnan fa-ltaqā l-māʾu ʿalā ʾamrin qad qudira

13.content: وَحَمَلناهُ عَلىٰ ذاتِ أَلواحٍ وَدُسُرٍ
13.translation_eng: We bore himon a vessel made of planks and nails,
13.transliteration: wa-ḥamalnāhu ʿalā dhāti ʾalwāḥin wa-dusurin

14.content: تَجري بِأَعيُنِنا جَزاءً لِمَن كانَ كُفِرَ
14.translation_eng: which sailed [over the flood waters] in Our sight,as a retribution for him who was repudiated.
14.transliteration: tajrī bi-ʾaʿyuninā jazāʾan li-man kāna kufira

15.content: وَلَقَد تَرَكناها آيَةً فَهَل مِن مُدَّكِرٍ
15.translation_eng: Certainly We have left it as a sign;so is there anyone who will be admonished?
15.transliteration: wa-la-qad taraknāhā ʾāyatan fa-hal min muddakirin

16.content: فَكَيفَ كانَ عَذابي وَنُذُرِ
16.translation_eng: So how were My punishment and My warnings?
16.transliteration: fa-kayfa kāna ʿadhābī wa-nudhuri

17.content: وَلَقَد يَسَّرنَا القُرآنَ لِلذِّكرِ فَهَل مِن مُدَّكِرٍ
17.translation_eng: Certainly We have made the Qurʾān simplefor the sake of admonishment.So is there anyone who will be admonished?
17.transliteration: wa-la-qad yassarnā l-qurʾāna li-dh-dhikri fa-hal min muddakirin

18.content: كَذَّبَت عادٌ فَكَيفَ كانَ عَذابي وَنُذُرِ
18.translation_eng: [The people of] ʿĀd impugned [their apostle].So how were My punishment and My warnings?
18.transliteration: kadhdhabat ʿādun fa-kayfa kāna ʿadhābī wa-nudhuri

19.content: إِنّا أَرسَلنا عَلَيهِم ريحًا صَرصَرًا في يَومِ نَحسٍ مُستَمِرٍّ
19.translation_eng: Indeed We unleashed upon them an icy galeon an incessantly ill-fated day,
19.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾarsalnā ʿalayhim rīḥan ṣarṣaran fī yawmi naḥsin mustamirrin

20.content: تَنزِعُ النّاسَ كَأَنَّهُم أَعجازُ نَخلٍ مُنقَعِرٍ
20.translation_eng: knocking down peopleas if they were trunks of uprooted palm trees.
20.transliteration: tanziʿu n-nāsa ka-ʾannahum ʾaʿjāzu nakhlin munqaʿirin

21.content: فَكَيفَ كانَ عَذابي وَنُذُرِ
21.translation_eng: So how were My punishment and My warnings?!
21.transliteration: fa-kayfa kāna ʿadhābī wa-nudhuri

22.content: وَلَقَد يَسَّرنَا القُرآنَ لِلذِّكرِ فَهَل مِن مُدَّكِرٍ
22.translation_eng: Certainly We have made the Qurʾān simplefor the sake of admonishment.So is there anyone who will be admonished?
22.transliteration: wa-la-qad yassarnā l-qurʾāna li-dh-dhikri fa-hal min muddakirin

23.content: كَذَّبَت ثَمودُ بِالنُّذُرِ
23.translation_eng: [The people of] Thamūd denied the warnings,
23.transliteration: kadhdhabat thamūdu bi-n-nudhuri

24.content: فَقالوا أَبَشَرًا مِنّا واحِدًا نَتَّبِعُهُ إِنّا إِذًا لَفي ضَلالٍ وَسُعُرٍ
24.translation_eng: and they said,‘Are we to follow a lone human from ourselves?!Indeed then we would be in error and madness.’
24.transliteration: fa-qālū ʾa-basharan minnā wāḥidan nattabiʿuhū ʾinnā ʾidhan la-fī ḍalālin wa-suʿurin

25.content: أَأُلقِيَ الذِّكرُ عَلَيهِ مِن بَينِنا بَل هُوَ كَذّابٌ أَشِرٌ
25.translation_eng: ‘Has the Reminder been cast upon himfrom among us?Rather he is a self-conceited1 liar.’Or ‘insolent.’
25.transliteration: ʾa-ʾulqiya dh-dhikru ʿalayhi min bayninā bal huwa kadhdhābun ʾashirun

26.content: سَيَعلَمونَ غَدًا مَنِ الكَذّابُ الأَشِرُ
26.translation_eng: ‘Tomorrow they will knowwho is a self-conceited liar.
26.transliteration: sa-yaʿlamūna ghadan mani l-kadhdhābu l-ʾashiru

27.content: إِنّا مُرسِلُو النّاقَةِ فِتنَةً لَهُم فَارتَقِبهُم وَاصطَبِر
27.translation_eng: We are sending the She-camelas a trial for them;so watch them and be steadfast.
27.transliteration: ʾinnā mursilū n-nāqati fitnatan lahum fa-rtaqibhum wa-ṣṭabir

28.content: وَنَبِّئهُم أَنَّ الماءَ قِسمَةٌ بَينَهُم ۖ كُلُّ شِربٍ مُحتَضَرٌ
28.translation_eng: Inform themthat the water is to be dispensed between them;every drinking will be attended.’
28.transliteration: wa-nabbiʾhum ʾanna l-māʾa qismatun baynahum kullu shirbin muḥtaḍarun

29.content: فَنادَوا صاحِبَهُم فَتَعاطىٰ فَعَقَرَ
29.translation_eng: But they called their companion,and he took [a knife] and hamstrung [her].
29.transliteration: fa-nādaw ṣāḥibahum fa-taʿāṭā fa-ʿaqara

30.content: فَكَيفَ كانَ عَذابي وَنُذُرِ
30.translation_eng: So how were My punishment and My warnings?!
30.transliteration: fa-kayfa kāna ʿadhābī wa-nudhuri

31.content: إِنّا أَرسَلنا عَلَيهِم صَيحَةً واحِدَةً فَكانوا كَهَشيمِ المُحتَظِرِ
31.translation_eng: We sent against them a single Cry,and they became like the dry sticks of a corral builder.
31.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾarsalnā ʿalayhim ṣayḥatan wāḥidatan fa-kānū ka-hashīmi l-muḥtaẓiri

32.content: وَلَقَد يَسَّرنَا القُرآنَ لِلذِّكرِ فَهَل مِن مُدَّكِرٍ
32.translation_eng: Certainly We have made the Qurʾān simplefor the sake of admonishment.So is there anyone who will be admonished?
32.transliteration: wa-la-qad yassarnā l-qurʾāna li-dh-dhikri fa-hal min muddakirin

33.content: كَذَّبَت قَومُ لوطٍ بِالنُّذُرِ
33.translation_eng: And the people of Lot denied the warnings.
33.transliteration: kadhdhabat qawmu lūṭin bi-n-nudhuri

34.content: إِنّا أَرسَلنا عَلَيهِم حاصِبًا إِلّا آلَ لوطٍ ۖ نَجَّيناهُم بِسَحَرٍ
34.translation_eng: We unleashed a rain of stones upon them,excepting the family of Lot,whom We delivered at dawn,
34.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾarsalnā ʿalayhim ḥāṣiban ʾillā ʾāla lūṭin najjaynāhum bi-saḥarin

35.content: نِعمَةً مِن عِندِنا ۚ كَذٰلِكَ نَجزي مَن شَكَرَ
35.translation_eng: as a blessing from Us.Thus do We reward those who give thanks.
35.transliteration: niʿmatan min ʿindinā ka-dhālika najzī man shakara

36.content: وَلَقَد أَنذَرَهُم بَطشَتَنا فَتَمارَوا بِالنُّذُرِ
36.translation_eng: He had certainly warned them of Our punishment,but they disputed the warnings.
36.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾandharahum baṭshatanā fa-tamāraw bi-n-nudhuri

37.content: وَلَقَد راوَدوهُ عَن ضَيفِهِ فَطَمَسنا أَعيُنَهُم فَذوقوا عَذابي وَنُذُرِ
37.translation_eng: Certainly they even solicited of him his guests,whereat We blotted out their eyes, [saying,]‘Taste My punishment and My warnings!’
37.transliteration: wa-la-qad rāwadūhu ʿan ḍayfihī fa-ṭamasnā ʾaʿyunahum fa-dhūqū ʿadhābī wa-nudhuri

38.content: وَلَقَد صَبَّحَهُم بُكرَةً عَذابٌ مُستَقِرٌّ
38.translation_eng: Certainly early at dawn there visited theman abiding punishment:
38.transliteration: wa-la-qad ṣabbaḥahum bukratan ʿadhābun mustaqirrun

39.content: فَذوقوا عَذابي وَنُذُرِ
39.translation_eng: ‘Taste My punishment and My warnings!’
39.transliteration: fa-dhūqū ʿadhābī wa-nudhuri

40.content: وَلَقَد يَسَّرنَا القُرآنَ لِلذِّكرِ فَهَل مِن مُدَّكِرٍ
40.translation_eng: Certainly We have made the Qurʾān simplefor the sake of admonishment.So is there anyone who will be admonished?
40.transliteration: wa-la-qad yassarnā l-qurʾāna li-dh-dhikri fa-hal min muddakirin

41.content: وَلَقَد جاءَ آلَ فِرعَونَ النُّذُرُ
41.translation_eng: Certainly the warnings came to Pharaoh’s clan
41.transliteration: wa-la-qad jāʾa ʾāla firʿawna n-nudhuru

42.content: كَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا كُلِّها فَأَخَذناهُم أَخذَ عَزيزٍ مُقتَدِرٍ
42.translation_eng: who denied all of Our signs.So We seized them with the seizingof One [who is] all-mighty, Omnipotent.
42.transliteration: kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā kullihā fa-ʾakhadhnāhum ʾakhdha ʿazīzin muqtadirin

43.content: أَكُفّارُكُم خَيرٌ مِن أُولٰئِكُم أَم لَكُم بَراءَةٌ فِي الزُّبُرِ
43.translation_eng: Are your faithless better than those,or have you [been granted] some immunityin the scriptures?
43.transliteration: ʾa-kuffārukum khayrun min ʾulāʾikum ʾam lakum barāʾatun fī z-zuburi

44.content: أَم يَقولونَ نَحنُ جَميعٌ مُنتَصِرٌ
44.translation_eng: Do they say, ‘We are a confederate league’?
44.transliteration: ʾam yaqūlūna naḥnu jamīʿun muntaṣirun

45.content: سَيُهزَمُ الجَمعُ وَيُوَلّونَ الدُّبُرَ
45.translation_eng: The league will be routedand turn its back [to flee].
45.transliteration: sa-yuhzamu l-jamʿu wa-yuwallūna d-dubura

46.content: بَلِ السّاعَةُ مَوعِدُهُم وَالسّاعَةُ أَدهىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
46.translation_eng: Rather the Hour is their tryst;and the Hour will be most calamitous and bitter.
46.transliteration: bali s-sāʿatu mawʿiduhum wa-s-sāʿatu ʾadhā wa-ʾamarru

47.content: إِنَّ المُجرِمينَ في ضَلالٍ وَسُعُرٍ
47.translation_eng: Indeed the guilty are in error and madness.
47.transliteration: ʾinna l-mujrimīna fī ḍalālin wa-suʿurin

48.content: يَومَ يُسحَبونَ فِي النّارِ عَلىٰ وُجوهِهِم ذوقوا مَسَّ سَقَرَ
48.translation_eng: The day when they are dragged into the Fireon their faces,[it will be said to them,] ‘Taste the touch of hell!’
48.transliteration: yawma yusḥabūna fī n-nāri ʿalā wujūhihim dhūqū massa saqara

49.content: إِنّا كُلَّ شَيءٍ خَلَقناهُ بِقَدَرٍ
49.translation_eng: Indeed We have created everything in a measure,
49.transliteration: ʾinnā kulla shayʾin khalaqnāhu bi-qadarin

50.content: وَما أَمرُنا إِلّا واحِدَةٌ كَلَمحٍ بِالبَصَرِ
50.translation_eng: and Our command is but a single [word],like the twinkling of an eye.
50.transliteration: wa-mā ʾamrunā ʾillā wāḥidatun ka-lamḥin bi-l-baṣari

51.content: وَلَقَد أَهلَكنا أَشياعَكُم فَهَل مِن مُدَّكِرٍ
51.translation_eng: Certainly We have destroyed your likes.So is there anyone who will be admonished?
51.transliteration: wa-la-qad ʾahlaknā ʾashyāʿakum fa-hal min muddakirin

52.content: وَكُلُّ شَيءٍ فَعَلوهُ فِي الزُّبُرِ
52.translation_eng: Everything they have done is in the books,
52.transliteration: wa-kullu shayʾin faʿalūhu fī z-zuburi

53.content: وَكُلُّ صَغيرٍ وَكَبيرٍ مُستَطَرٌ
53.translation_eng: and everything big and small,is committed to writing.
53.transliteration: wa-kullu ṣaghīrin wa-kabīrin mustaṭarun

54.content: إِنَّ المُتَّقينَ في جَنّاتٍ وَنَهَرٍ
54.translation_eng: Indeed the Godwarywill be amid gardens and streams,
54.transliteration: ʾinna l-muttaqīna fī jannātin wa-naharin

55.content: في مَقعَدِ صِدقٍ عِندَ مَليكٍ مُقتَدِرٍ
55.translation_eng: in the abode of truthfulness1with an omnipotent King.Or ‘in a worthy abode.’
55.transliteration: fī maqʿadi ṣidqin ʿinda malīkin muqtadirin

55.description: The surah that crowns the Quran and opens with the chant of a single word proclaiming one of God’s most beautiful names, The All-Beneficent. It takes its name from verse 1 which mentions “the All-beneficent” (al-raḥmān). The surah highlights Gods wonders in this world, describes the end of the world, and paints an evocative picture of the delights of Paradise. Hell is briefly contrasted (verse 43 .) with the joys that await the righteous. The surah is characterized by the refrain “So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?” which runs throughout. The surah divides mankind and jinn into three classes: the disbelievers (verse 41 .), the best of believers (verse 46 .), and the ordinary believers (verse 62 .).The surah is also known as: (God) Most Gracious, The All-Merciful, The Beneficent, The Lord of Mercy, The Merciful, The Mercy-giving, The Most Gracious.

1.translation_eng: The All-beneficent

2.translation_eng: has taught the Qurʾān.

3.content: خَلَقَ الإِنسانَ
3.translation_eng: He created man,
3.transliteration: khalaqa l-ʾinsāna

4.content: عَلَّمَهُ البَيانَ
4.translation_eng: [and] taught him articulate speech.
4.transliteration: ʿallamahu l-bayāna

5.content: الشَّمسُ وَالقَمَرُ بِحُسبانٍ
5.translation_eng: The sun and the moon are [disposed] calculatedly,
5.transliteration: ash-shamsu wa-l-qamaru bi-ḥusbānin

6.content: وَالنَّجمُ وَالشَّجَرُ يَسجُدانِ
6.translation_eng: and the herb and the tree prostrate [to Allah].
6.transliteration: wa-n-najmu wa-sh-shajaru yasjudāni

7.content: وَالسَّماءَ رَفَعَها وَوَضَعَ الميزانَ
7.translation_eng: He raised the sky and set up the balance,
7.transliteration: wa-s-samāʾa rafaʿahā wa-waḍaʿa l-mīzāna

8.content: أَلّا تَطغَوا فِي الميزانِ
8.translation_eng: declaring, ‘Do not infringe the balance!
8.transliteration: ʾallā taṭghaw fī l-mīzāni

9.content: وَأَقيمُوا الوَزنَ بِالقِسطِ وَلا تُخسِرُوا الميزانَ
9.translation_eng: Maintain the weights with justice,and do not shorten the balance!’
9.transliteration: wa-ʾaqīmū l-wazna bi-l-qisṭi wa-lā tukhsirū l-mīzāna

10.content: وَالأَرضَ وَضَعَها لِلأَنامِ
10.translation_eng: And the earth, He laid it out for mankind.
10.transliteration: wa-l-ʾarḍa waḍaʿahā li-l-ʾanāmi

11.content: فيها فاكِهَةٌ وَالنَّخلُ ذاتُ الأَكمامِ
11.translation_eng: In it are fruits and date-palms with sheaths,
11.transliteration: fīhā fākihatun wa-n-nakhlu dhātu l-ʾakmāmi

12.content: وَالحَبُّ ذُو العَصفِ وَالرَّيحانُ
12.translation_eng: grain with husk, and fragrant herbs.
12.transliteration: wa-l-ḥabbu dhū l-ʿaṣfi wa-r-rayḥānu

13.content: فَبِأَيِّ آلاءِ رَبِّكُما تُكَذِّبانِ
13.translation_eng: So which of your Lord’s bountieswill you both1 deny?That is, the jinn and humans. The pronoun ‘you’ and the adjective ‘your’ are both dual in the Arabic.
13.transliteration: fa-bi-ʾayyi ʾālāʾi rabbikumā tukadhdhibāni

14.content: خَلَقَ الإِنسانَ مِن صَلصالٍ كَالفَخّارِ
14.translation_eng: He created manout of dry clay,1 like the potter’s,Cf. 15:26, 28, 33.
14.transliteration: khalaqa l-ʾinsāna min ṣalṣālin ka-l-fakhkhāri

15.content: وَخَلَقَ الجانَّ مِن مارِجٍ مِن نارٍ
15.translation_eng: and created the jinn out of a flame of a fire.
15.transliteration: wa-khalaqa l-jānna min mārijin min nārin

16.content: فَبِأَيِّ آلاءِ رَبِّكُما تُكَذِّبانِ
16.translation_eng: So which of your Lord’s bountieswill you both deny?
16.transliteration: fa-bi-ʾayyi ʾālāʾi rabbikumā tukadhdhibāni

17.content: رَبُّ المَشرِقَينِ وَرَبُّ المَغرِبَينِ
17.translation_eng: Lord of the two easts,and Lord of the two wests!1That is, the points of sunrise and sunset at the winter and summer solstices.
17.transliteration: rabbu l-mashriqayni wa-rabbu l-maghribayni

18.content: فَبِأَيِّ آلاءِ رَبِّكُما تُكَذِّبانِ
18.translation_eng: So which of your Lord’s bountieswill you both deny?

56.description: The surah that opens by naming the occurrence of the end of time with the title, The Imminent; for all who deny that it is coming will never belie it when finally it happens. It takes its name from verse 1, which mentions “the Imminent Hour” (al-wāqiʿah) i.e., the Day og Resurrection. The surah whose central message is stated in its opening verses: the Day of Judgement is inevitable and it will sort people into the humiliated and the richly rewarded. As in the previous surah, people are divided into three classes: those brought near to God (the best of the believers), those on the right (the ordinary believers), and those on the left (the disbelievers). Ample proof is given of God’s power and consequently His ability to bring about the Resurrection (verse 57 .).The surah is also known as That Which is Coming, The Indisputable Event, The Inevitable, The Inevitable Event, The Occurrence, The Terror

16.translation_eng: reclining on them, face to face.
16.transliteration: muttakiʾīna ʿalayhā mutaqābilīna

17.content: يَطوفُ عَلَيهِم وِلدانٌ مُخَلَّدونَ
17.translation_eng: They will be waited upon by immortal youths,
17.transliteration: yaṭūfu ʿalayhim wildānun mukhalladūna

18.content: بِأَكوابٍ وَأَباريقَ وَكَأسٍ مِن مَعينٍ
18.translation_eng: with goblets and ewersand a cup of a clear wine,1Or ‘flowing wine.’
18.transliteration: bi-ʾakwābin wa-ʾabārīqa wa-kaʾsin min maʿīnin

19.content: لا يُصَدَّعونَ عَنها وَلا يُنزِفونَ
19.translation_eng: which neither causes them headachenor stupefaction,
19.transliteration: lā yuṣaddaʿūna ʿanhā wa-lā yunzifūna

20.content: وَفاكِهَةٍ مِمّا يَتَخَيَّرونَ
20.translation_eng: and such fruits as they prefer
20.transliteration: wa-fākihatin mimmā yatakhayyarūna

21.content: وَلَحمِ طَيرٍ مِمّا يَشتَهونَ
21.translation_eng: and such flesh of fowls as they desire,
21.transliteration: wa-laḥmi ṭayrin mimmā yashtahūna

22.content: وَحورٌ عينٌ
22.translation_eng: and big-eyed houris
22.transliteration: wa-ḥūrun ʿīnun

23.content: كَأَمثالِ اللُّؤلُؤِ المَكنونِ
23.translation_eng: like guarded pearls,
23.transliteration: ka-ʾamthāli l-luʾluʾi l-maknūni

24.content: جَزاءً بِما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
24.translation_eng: a reward for what they used to do.
24.transliteration: jazāʾan bi-mā kānū yaʿmalūna

25.content: لا يَسمَعونَ فيها لَغوًا وَلا تَأثيمًا
25.translation_eng: They will not hear thereinany vain talk or sinful speech,
25.transliteration: lā yasmaʿūna fīhā laghwan wa-lā taʾthīman

26.content: إِلّا قيلًا سَلامًا سَلامًا
26.translation_eng: but only the watchword, ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’
26.transliteration: ʾillā qīlan salāman salāman

27.content: وَأَصحابُ اليَمينِ ما أَصحابُ اليَمينِ
27.translation_eng: And the People of the Right Hand—what are the People of the Right Hand?
27.transliteration: wa-ʾaṣhābu l-yamīni mā ʾaṣhābu l-yamīni

28.content: في سِدرٍ مَخضودٍ
28.translation_eng: Amid thornless lote trees
28.transliteration: fī sidrin makhḍūdin

29.content: وَطَلحٍ مَنضودٍ
29.translation_eng: and clustered spathes1This is according to the reading wa ṭalʿin manḍūd (instead of wa ṭalḥin manḍūd, meaning ‘and clustered plantains’) narrated from Imam ʿAlī and Imam Jaʿfar al-Ṣādiq (ʿa) and Ibn ʿAbbās. (Muʿjam, al-Kashshāf).
29.transliteration: wa-ṭalḥin manḍūdin

30.content: وَظِلٍّ مَمدودٍ
30.translation_eng: and extended shade,1Or ‘twilight;’ see the note at 25:45.
30.transliteration: wa-ẓillin mamdūdin

31.content: وَماءٍ مَسكوبٍ
31.translation_eng: and ever-flowing water
31.transliteration: wa-māʾin maskūbin

32.content: وَفاكِهَةٍ كَثيرَةٍ
32.translation_eng: and abundant fruits,
32.transliteration: wa-fākihatin kathīratin

33.content: لا مَقطوعَةٍ وَلا مَمنوعَةٍ
33.translation_eng: neither inaccessible, nor forbidden,
33.transliteration: lā maqṭūʿatin wa-lā mamnūʿatin

34.content: وَفُرُشٍ مَرفوعَةٍ
34.translation_eng: and noble spouses.
34.transliteration: wa-furushin marfūʿatin

35.content: إِنّا أَنشَأناهُنَّ إِنشاءً
35.translation_eng: We have created them with a special creation,
35.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾanshaʾnāhunna ʾinshāʾan

36.content: فَجَعَلناهُنَّ أَبكارًا
36.translation_eng: and made them virgins,
36.transliteration: fa-jaʿalnāhunna ʾabkāran

37.content: عُرُبًا أَترابًا
37.translation_eng: loving, of a like age,
37.transliteration: ʿuruban ʾatrāban

38.content: لِأَصحابِ اليَمينِ
38.translation_eng: for the People of the Right Hand.
38.transliteration: li-ʾaṣḥābi l-yamīni

39.content: ثُلَّةٌ مِنَ الأَوَّلينَ
39.translation_eng: A multitude from the former [generations]
39.transliteration: thullatun mina l-ʾawwalīna

40.content: وَثُلَّةٌ مِنَ الآخِرينَ
40.translation_eng: and a multitude from the latter [ones].
40.transliteration: wa-thullatun mina l-ʾākhirīna

41.content: وَأَصحابُ الشِّمالِ ما أَصحابُ الشِّمالِ
41.translation_eng: And the People of the Left Hand—what are the People of the Left Hand?
41.transliteration: wa-ʾaṣḥābu sh-shimāli mā ʾaṣḥābu sh-shimāli

42.content: في سَمومٍ وَحَميمٍ
42.translation_eng: Amid infernal miasma and boiling water
42.transliteration: fī samūmin wa-ḥamīmin

43.content: وَظِلٍّ مِن يَحمومٍ
43.translation_eng: and the shadow of a dense black smoke,
43.transliteration: wa-ẓillin min yaḥmūmin

44.content: لا بارِدٍ وَلا كَريمٍ
44.translation_eng: neither cool nor beneficial.1Cf. 77:30-31.
44.transliteration: lā bāridin wa-lā karīmin

45.content: إِنَّهُم كانوا قَبلَ ذٰلِكَ مُترَفينَ
45.translation_eng: Indeed they had been affluent before this,
45.transliteration: ʾinnahum kānū qabla dhālika mutrafīna

46.content: وَكانوا يُصِرّونَ عَلَى الحِنثِ العَظيمِ
46.translation_eng: and they used to persist in the great sin.1That is, shirk. Cf. 31:13.
46.transliteration: wa-kānū yuṣirrūna ʿalā l-ḥinthi l-ʿaẓīmi

47.content: وَكانوا يَقولونَ أَئِذا مِتنا وَكُنّا تُرابًا وَعِظامًا أَإِنّا لَمَبعوثونَ
47.translation_eng: And they used to say,‘What! When we are dead and become dustand bones,shall we be resurrected?
47.transliteration: wa-kānū yaqūlūna ʾa-ʾidhā mitnā wa-kunnā turāban wa-ʿiẓāman ʾa-ʾinnā la-mabʿūthūna

48.content: أَوَآباؤُنَا الأَوَّلونَ
48.translation_eng: And our forefathers too?’
48.transliteration: ʾa-wa-ʾābāʾunā l-ʾawwalūna

49.content: قُل إِنَّ الأَوَّلينَ وَالآخِرينَ
49.translation_eng: Say, ‘Indeed the former and latter generations
49.transliteration: qul ʾinna l-ʾawwalīna wa-l-ʾākhirīna

50.content: لَمَجموعونَ إِلىٰ ميقاتِ يَومٍ مَعلومٍ
50.translation_eng: will all be gatheredfor the tryst of a known day.
50.transliteration: la-majmūʿūna ʾilā mīqāti yawmin maʿlūmin

51.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُم أَيُّهَا الضّالّونَ المُكَذِّبونَ
51.translation_eng: Then indeed,you, astray deniers,
51.transliteration: thumma ʾinnakum ʾayyuhā ḍ-ḍāllūna l-mukadhdhibūna

52.content: لَآكِلونَ مِن شَجَرٍ مِن زَقّومٍ
52.translation_eng: will surely eat from the Zaqqūm tree
52.transliteration: la-ʾākilūna min shajarin min zaqqūmin

53.content: فَمالِئونَ مِنهَا البُطونَ
53.translation_eng: and stuff your bellies with it,
53.transliteration: fa-māliʾūna minhā l-buṭūna

54.content: فَشارِبونَ عَلَيهِ مِنَ الحَميمِ
54.translation_eng: and drink boiling water on top of it,
54.transliteration: fa-shāribūna ʿalayhi mina l-ḥamīmi

55.content: فَشارِبونَ شُربَ الهيمِ
55.translation_eng: drinking like thirsty camels.’
55.transliteration: fa-shāribūna shurba l-hīmi

56.content: هٰذا نُزُلُهُم يَومَ الدّينِ
56.translation_eng: Such will be the hospitality they receiveon the Day of Retribution.1Or ‘the Day of Judgement.’
56.transliteration: hādhā nuzuluhum yawma d-dīni

57.content: نَحنُ خَلَقناكُم فَلَولا تُصَدِّقونَ
57.translation_eng: We created you.Then why do you not acknowledge it?
57.transliteration: naḥnu khalaqnākum fa-law-lā tuṣaddiqūna

58.content: أَفَرَأَيتُم ما تُمنونَ
58.translation_eng: Have you considered the sperm that you emit?
58.transliteration: ʾa-fa-raʾaytum mā tumnūna

59.content: أَأَنتُم تَخلُقونَهُ أَم نَحنُ الخالِقونَ
59.translation_eng: Is it you who create it,or are We the creator?
59.transliteration: ʾa-ʾantum takhluqūnahū ʾam naḥnu l-khāliqūna

60.content: نَحنُ قَدَّرنا بَينَكُمُ المَوتَ وَما نَحنُ بِمَسبوقينَ
60.translation_eng: We have ordained death among you,and We are not to be outmaneuvered
