11.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā raʾaw tijāratan ʾaw lahwan-i nfaḍḍū ʾilayhā wa-tarakūka qāʾiman qul mā ʿinda llāhi khayrun mina l-lahwi wa-mina t-tijārati wa-llāhu khayru r-rāziqīna

63.description: The surah that declares that God bears witness that the false profession of faith by The Hypocrites is uttered only as a screen to hide their duplicity. It takes its name from its main topic, “the hypocrites” (munāfiqūn). The surah warns the believers about the treachery of the hypocrites and describes their behaviour in some detail. A specific occasion on which the hypocrites tried to stop anyone donating money to believers is described (verse 7 .) and God calls on the Muslims to compensate for this by giving more of their own funds to the needy (verse 9 .).

1.content: إِذا جاءَكَ المُنافِقونَ قالوا نَشهَدُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسولُ اللَّهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسولُهُ وَاللَّهُ يَشهَدُ إِنَّ المُنافِقينَ لَكاذِبونَ
1.translation_eng: When the hypocrites come to youthey say, ‘We bear witnessthat you are indeed the apostle of Allah.’Allah knows that you are indeed His Apostle,and Allah bears witness thatthe hypocrites are indeed liars.
1.transliteration: ʾidhā jāʾaka l-munāfiqūna qālū nashhadu ʾinnaka la-rasūlu llāhi wa-llāhu yaʿlamu ʾinnaka la-rasūluhū wa-llāhu yashhadu ʾinna l-munāfiqīna la-kādhibūna

2.content: اتَّخَذوا أَيمانَهُم جُنَّةً فَصَدّوا عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُم ساءَ ما كانوا يَعمَلونَ
2.translation_eng: They make a shield of their oaths,and bar from the way of Allah.Evil indeed is what they used to do.
2.transliteration: ittakhadhū ʾaymānahum junnatan fa-ṣaddū ʿan sabīli llāhi ʾinnahum sāʾa mā kānū yaʿmalūna

3.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُم آمَنوا ثُمَّ كَفَروا فَطُبِعَ عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم فَهُم لا يَفقَهونَ
3.translation_eng: That is because they believed and then disbelieved,so their hearts were sealed.Hence they do not understand.
3.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahum ʾāmanū thumma kafarū fa-ṭubiʿa ʿalā qulūbihim fa-hum lā yafqahūna

4.content: ۞ وَإِذا رَأَيتَهُم تُعجِبُكَ أَجسامُهُم ۖ وَإِن يَقولوا تَسمَع لِقَولِهِم ۖ كَأَنَّهُم خُشُبٌ مُسَنَّدَةٌ ۖ يَحسَبونَ كُلَّ صَيحَةٍ عَلَيهِم ۚ هُمُ العَدُوُّ فَاحذَرهُم ۚ قاتَلَهُمُ اللَّهُ ۖ أَنّىٰ يُؤفَكونَ
4.translation_eng: When you see them, their bodies impress you,and if they speak, you listen to their speech.Yet they are like dry logs set reclining [against a wall].They suppose every cry is directed against them.They are the enemy, so beware of them.May Allah assail them, where do they stray?!
4.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā raʾaytahum tuʿjibuka ʾajsāmuhum wa-ʾin yaqūlū tasmaʿ li-qawlihim ka-ʾannahum khushubun musannadatun yaḥsabūna kulla ṣayḥatin ʿalayhim humu l-ʿaduwwu fa-ḥdharhum qātalahumu llāhu ʾannā yuʾfakūna

5.content: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُم تَعالَوا يَستَغفِر لَكُم رَسولُ اللَّهِ لَوَّوا رُءوسَهُم وَرَأَيتَهُم يَصُدّونَ وَهُم مُستَكبِرونَ
5.translation_eng: When they are told, ‘Come,that Allah’s Apostle may plead for forgiveness for you,’they twist their heads,and you see them turn away while they are disdainful.
5.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā qīla lahum taʿālaw yastaghfir lakum rasūlu llāhi lawwaw ruʾūsahum wa-raʾaytahum yaṣuddūna wa-hum mustakbirūna

6.content: سَواءٌ عَلَيهِم أَستَغفَرتَ لَهُم أَم لَم تَستَغفِر لَهُم لَن يَغفِرَ اللَّهُ لَهُم ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يَهدِي القَومَ الفاسِقينَ
6.translation_eng: It is the same for themwhether you plead for forgiveness for them,or do not plead for forgiveness for them:Allah will never forgive them.Indeed Allah does not guide the transgressing lot.
6.transliteration: sawāʾun ʿalayhim ʾa-staghfarta lahum ʾam lam tastaghfir lahum lan yaghfira llāhu lahum ʾinna llāha lā yahdī l-qawma l-fāsiqīna

7.content: هُمُ الَّذينَ يَقولونَ لا تُنفِقوا عَلىٰ مَن عِندَ رَسولِ اللَّهِ حَتّىٰ يَنفَضّوا ۗ وَلِلَّهِ خَزائِنُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَلٰكِنَّ المُنافِقينَ لا يَفقَهونَ
7.translation_eng: They are the ones who say, ‘Do not spendon those who are with the Apostle of Allahuntil they scatter off.’Yet to Allah belong the treasuries of the heavensand the earth,but the hypocrites do not understand.
7.transliteration: humu lladhīna yaqūlūna lā tunfiqū ʿalā man ʿinda rasūli llāhi ḥattā yanfaḍḍū wa-li-llāhi khazāʾinu s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-lākinna l-munāfiqīna lā yafqahūna

8.content: يَقولونَ لَئِن رَجَعنا إِلَى المَدينَةِ لَيُخرِجَنَّ الأَعَزُّ مِنهَا الأَذَلَّ ۚ وَلِلَّهِ العِزَّةُ وَلِرَسولِهِ وَلِلمُؤمِنينَ وَلٰكِنَّ المُنافِقينَ لا يَعلَمونَ
8.translation_eng: They say, ‘When we return to the city,the mighty will surely expel the abased from it.’1Yet all might belongs to Allah and His Apostle,and the faithful,but the hypocrites do not know.Or, ‘the mighty will surely expel the weak from it.’
8.transliteration: yaqūlūna la-ʾin rajaʿnā ʾilā l-madīnati la-yukhrijanna l-ʾaʿazzu minhā l-ʾadhalla wa-li-llāhi l-ʿizzatu wa-li-rasūlihī wa-li-l-muʾminīna wa-lākinna l-munāfiqīna lā yaʿlamūna

9.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تُلهِكُم أَموالُكُم وَلا أَولادُكُم عَن ذِكرِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَفعَل ذٰلِكَ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الخاسِرونَ
9.translation_eng: O you who have faith!Do not let your possessions and children distract youfrom the remembrance of Allah,and whoever does that—it is they who are the losers.
9.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū lā tulhikum ʾamwālukum wa-lā ʾawlādukum ʿan dhikri llāhi wa-man yafʿal dhālika fa-ʾulāʾika humu l-khāsirūna

10.content: وَأَنفِقوا مِن ما رَزَقناكُم مِن قَبلِ أَن يَأتِيَ أَحَدَكُمُ المَوتُ فَيَقولَ رَبِّ لَولا أَخَّرتَني إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ قَريبٍ فَأَصَّدَّقَ وَأَكُن مِنَ الصّالِحينَ
10.translation_eng: Spend from what We have provided youbefore death comes to any of you,whereat he will say, ‘My Lord,why did You not respite me for a short timeso that I might have given charityand become one of the righteous!’
10.transliteration: wa-ʾanfiqū min mā razaqnākum min qabli ʾan yaʾtiya ʾaḥadakumu l-mawtu fa-yaqūla rabbi law-lā ʾakhkhartanī ʾilā ʾajalin qarībin fa-ʾaṣṣaddaqa wa-ʾakun mina ṣ-ṣāliḥīna

11.content: وَلَن يُؤَخِّرَ اللَّهُ نَفسًا إِذا جاءَ أَجَلُها ۚ وَاللَّهُ خَبيرٌ بِما تَعمَلونَ
11.translation_eng: But Allah shall never respite a soulwhen its time has come,and Allah is well aware of what you do.
11.transliteration: wa-lan yuʾakhkhira llāhu nafsan ʾidhā jāʾa ʾajaluhā wa-llāhu khabīrun bi-mā taʿmalūna

64.description: The surah that calls the Day of Judgement the day of Dispossession. For those who abandon faith and choose to disbelieve shall lose Paradise and be thrown into Hellfire, cheated forever from felicity by their own souls and their leaders. Those who believe, however, shall gain Paradise against all the attempts of the unbelievers to distract them in the world from faith and goodness, guided away from Hellfire by God and His messengers. It takes its name from “they day of dispossession” (yawm al-taghābun) mentioned in verse 9. The surah opens with a description of God’s power, wisdom, and knowledge (verse 1 .). The disbelievers are reminded of the end of those who disbelieved before them (verse 5 .), and their denial of the Resurrection is strongly refuted (verse 7). The believers are urged to be wary but forgiving of the enemies they may have within their own families (verse 14 .) and warned to remain steadfast and to spend in God’s cause (verse 8 . and verse 16 .).The surah is also known as: Cheating, Common Loss and Gain, Exposition, Haggling, Mutual Fraud, Mutual Neglect, Profit and Loss, The Day of Mutual Loss and Gain, The Mutual Loss and Gain.

1.content: يُسَبِّحُ لِلَّهِ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَما فِي الأَرضِ ۖ لَهُ المُلكُ وَلَهُ الحَمدُ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
1.translation_eng: Whatever there is in the heavens glorifies Allahand whatever there is in the earth.To Him belongs all sovereigntyand to Him belongs all praise,and He has power over all things.
1.transliteration: yusabbiḥu li-llāhi mā fī s-samāwāti wa-mā fī l-ʾarḍi lahu l-mulku wa-lahu l-ḥamdu wa-huwa ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

2.content: هُوَ الَّذي خَلَقَكُم فَمِنكُم كافِرٌ وَمِنكُم مُؤمِنٌ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ بَصيرٌ
2.translation_eng: It is He who created you.Then some of you are faithlessand some of you are faithful,and Allah sees best what you do.
2.transliteration: huwa lladhī khalaqakum fa-minkum kāfirun wa-minkum muʾminun wa-llāhu bi-mā taʿmalūna baṣīrun

3.content: خَلَقَ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضَ بِالحَقِّ وَصَوَّرَكُم فَأَحسَنَ صُوَرَكُم ۖ وَإِلَيهِ المَصيرُ
3.translation_eng: He created the heavens and the earthwith reason,and He formed you and perfected your forms,and toward Him is the destination.
3.transliteration: khalaqa s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍa bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-ṣawwarakum fa-ʾaḥsana ṣuwarakum wa-ʾilayhi l-maṣīru

4.content: يَعلَمُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَيَعلَمُ ما تُسِرّونَ وَما تُعلِنونَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
4.translation_eng: He knows whatever there is in the heavens and the earth,and He knows whatever you hideand whatever you disclose,and Allah knows best what is in the breasts.
4.transliteration: yaʿlamu mā fī s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-yaʿlamu mā tusirrūna wa-mā tuʿlinūna wa-llāhu ʿalīmun bi-dhāti ṣ-ṣudūri

5.content: أَلَم يَأتِكُم نَبَأُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن قَبلُ فَذاقوا وَبالَ أَمرِهِم وَلَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
5.translation_eng: Has there not come to you the accountof those who were faithless before?They tasted the evil consequences of their conduct,and there is a painful punishment for them.
5.transliteration: ʾa-lam yaʾtikum nabaʾu lladhīna kafarū min qablu fa-dhāqū wabāla ʾamrihim wa-lahum ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

6.content: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُ كانَت تَأتيهِم رُسُلُهُم بِالبَيِّناتِ فَقالوا أَبَشَرٌ يَهدونَنا فَكَفَروا وَتَوَلَّوا ۚ وَاستَغنَى اللَّهُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَنِيٌّ حَميدٌ
6.translation_eng: That was because their apostles used to bring themmanifest proofs,but they said, ‘Shall humans be our guides?!’So they disbelieved and turned away,and Allah was in no need [of their faith]and Allah is all-sufficient, all-laudable.
6.transliteration: dhālika bi-ʾannahū kānat taʾtīhim rusuluhum bi-l-bayyināti fa-qālū ʾa-basharun yahdūnanā fa-kafarū wa-tawallaw wa-staghnā llāhu wa-llāhu ghaniyyun ḥamīdun

7.content: زَعَمَ الَّذينَ كَفَروا أَن لَن يُبعَثوا ۚ قُل بَلىٰ وَرَبّي لَتُبعَثُنَّ ثُمَّ لَتُنَبَّؤُنَّ بِما عَمِلتُم ۚ وَذٰلِكَ عَلَى اللَّهِ يَسيرٌ
7.translation_eng: The faithless claim that they will not be resurrected.Say, ‘Yes, by my Lord,you will surely be resurrected;then you will surely be informed of what you did,and that is easy for Allah.’
7.transliteration: zaʿama lladhīna kafarū ʾan lan yubʿathū qul balā wa-rabbī la-tubʿathunna thumma la-tunabbaʾunna bi-mā ʿamiltum wa-dhālika ʿalā llāhi yasīrun

8.content: فَآمِنوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسولِهِ وَالنّورِ الَّذي أَنزَلنا ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِما تَعمَلونَ خَبيرٌ
8.translation_eng: So have faith in Allah and His Apostleand the light which We have sent down,and Allah is well aware of what you do.
8.transliteration: fa-ʾāminū bi-llāhi wa-rasūlihī wa-n-nūri lladhī ʾanzalnā wa-llāhu bi-mā taʿmalūna khabīrun

9.content: يَومَ يَجمَعُكُم لِيَومِ الجَمعِ ۖ ذٰلِكَ يَومُ التَّغابُنِ ۗ وَمَن يُؤمِن بِاللَّهِ وَيَعمَل صالِحًا يُكَفِّر عَنهُ سَيِّئَاتِهِ وَيُدخِلهُ جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ خالِدينَ فيها أَبَدًا ۚ ذٰلِكَ الفَوزُ العَظيمُ
9.translation_eng: The day when He will gather youfor the Day of Gathering,that will be a day of dispossession.1And whoever has faith in Allah and acts righteously,He shall absolve him of his misdeedsand admit him into gardenswith streams running in them,to remain in them forever.That is the great success.That is, the day on which the faithless will find themselves dispossessed of their place in paradise and find that their pursuit of ephemeral gains has landed them in hell. The faithful will settle in their places in paradise, happy to have been saved from occupying what would have been their place in hell if they did not have faith in Allah and had not performed righteous deeds.
9.transliteration: yawma yajmaʿukum li-yawmi l-jamʿi dhālika yawmu t-taghābuni wa-man yuʾmin bi-llāhi wa-yaʿmal ṣāliḥan yukaffir ʿanhu sayyiʾātihī wa-yudkhilhu jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru khālidīna fīhā ʾabadan dhālika l-fawzu l-ʿaẓīmu

10.content: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا وَكَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ النّارِ خالِدينَ فيها ۖ وَبِئسَ المَصيرُ
10.translation_eng: But as for those who are faithless and deny Our signs,—they shall be the inmates of the Fire,to remain in it [forever],and it is an evil destination.
10.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kafarū wa-kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā ʾulāʾika ʾaṣḥābu n-nāri khālidīna fīhā wa-biʾsa l-maṣīru

11.content: ما أَصابَ مِن مُصيبَةٍ إِلّا بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ ۗ وَمَن يُؤمِن بِاللَّهِ يَهدِ قَلبَهُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عَليمٌ
11.translation_eng: No affliction visits [anyone] except by Allah’s leave.Whoever has faith in Allah,He guides his heart,and Allah has knowledge of all things.
11.transliteration: mā ʾaṣāba min muṣībatin ʾillā bi-ʾidhni llāhi wa-man yuʾmin bi-llāhi yahdi qalbahū wa-llāhu bi-kulli shayʾin ʿalīmun

12.content: وَأَطيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطيعُوا الرَّسولَ ۚ فَإِن تَوَلَّيتُم فَإِنَّما عَلىٰ رَسولِنَا البَلاغُ المُبينُ
12.translation_eng: Obey Allah and obey the Apostle;but if you turn away,then Our Apostle’s duty is onlyto communicate in clear terms.
12.transliteration: wa-ʾaṭīʿū llāha wa-ʾaṭīʿū r-rasūla fa-ʾin tawallaytum fa-ʾinnamā ʿalā rasūlinā l-balāghu l-mubīnu

13.content: اللَّهُ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ ۚ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَليَتَوَكَّلِ المُؤمِنونَ
13.translation_eng: Allah—there is no god except Him—in Allah let all the faithful put their trust.
13.transliteration: allāhu lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa wa-ʿalā llāhi fa-l-yatawakkali l-muʾminūna

14.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا إِنَّ مِن أَزواجِكُم وَأَولادِكُم عَدُوًّا لَكُم فَاحذَروهُم ۚ وَإِن تَعفوا وَتَصفَحوا وَتَغفِروا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
14.translation_eng: O you who have faith!Indeed among your spouses and childrenyou have enemies;so beware of them.And if you excuse, forbear and forgive,then Allah is indeed all-forgiving, all-merciful.
14.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾinna min ʾazwājikum wa-ʾawlādikum ʿaduwwan lakum fa-ḥdharūhum wa-ʾin taʿfū wa-taṣfaḥū wa-taghfirū fa-ʾinna llāha ghafūrun raḥīmun

15.content: إِنَّما أَموالُكُم وَأَولادُكُم فِتنَةٌ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عِندَهُ أَجرٌ عَظيمٌ
15.translation_eng: Rather your possessions and children are a trial,and Allah—with Him is a great reward!
15.transliteration: ʾinnamā ʾamwālukum wa-ʾawlādukum fitnatun wa-llāhu ʿindahū ʾajrun ʿaẓīmun

16.content: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ مَا استَطَعتُم وَاسمَعوا وَأَطيعوا وَأَنفِقوا خَيرًا لِأَنفُسِكُم ۗ وَمَن يوقَ شُحَّ نَفسِهِ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُفلِحونَ
16.translation_eng: So be wary of Allah, as far as you can,and listen and obey,and spend [in the way of Allah];that is better for yourselves.Those who are saved from their own greed—it is they who are the felicitous.
16.transliteration: fa-ttaqū llāha mā staṭaʿtum wa-smaʿū wa-ʾaṭīʿū wa-ʾanfiqū khayran li-ʾanfusikum wa-man yūqa shuḥḥa nafsihī fa-ʾulāʾika humu l-mufliḥūna

17.content: إِن تُقرِضُوا اللَّهَ قَرضًا حَسَنًا يُضاعِفهُ لَكُم وَيَغفِر لَكُم ۚ وَاللَّهُ شَكورٌ حَليمٌ
17.translation_eng: If you lend Allah a good loan,He shall multiply it for you and forgive you,and Allah is all-appreciative, all-forbearing,
17.transliteration: ʾin tuqriḍū llāha qarḍan ḥasanan yuḍāʿifhu lakum wa-yaghfir lakum wa-llāhu shakūrun ḥalīmun

18.content: عالِمُ الغَيبِ وَالشَّهادَةِ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
18.translation_eng: Knower of the sensible and the Unseen,the All-mighty, the All-wise.
18.transliteration: ʿālimu l-ghaybi wa-ṣ-ṣahādati l-ʿazīzu l-ḥakīmu

65.description: The surah that issues the lawful procedures by which one may Divorce and that calls for fair parting between believers if marriage is to end, in accordance with what is right and within God’s prescribed limits, while promising ease and deliverance for the truly God-fearing who undergo this trauma. It takes its name from verse 1 . concerning “divorce” (ṭalāq). The surah strongly urges people to observe God’s regulations and guidance. To reinforce this they are reminded of the fate of earlier disobedient peoples and the rewards of the obedient. God’s power and knowledge are emphasized at the end (verse 12).

1.content: يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ إِذا طَلَّقتُمُ النِّساءَ فَطَلِّقوهُنَّ لِعِدَّتِهِنَّ وَأَحصُوا العِدَّةَ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ رَبَّكُم ۖ لا تُخرِجوهُنَّ مِن بُيوتِهِنَّ وَلا يَخرُجنَ إِلّا أَن يَأتينَ بِفاحِشَةٍ مُبَيِّنَةٍ ۚ وَتِلكَ حُدودُ اللَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَتَعَدَّ حُدودَ اللَّهِ فَقَد ظَلَمَ نَفسَهُ ۚ لا تَدري لَعَلَّ اللَّهَ يُحدِثُ بَعدَ ذٰلِكَ أَمرًا
1.translation_eng: O Prophet!When you1 divorce women,divorce them at [the conclusion of] their term2and calculate the term,and be wary of Allah, your Lord.Do not turn them out from their houses,nor shall they go out,unless they commit a gross3 indecency.4These are Allah’s bounds,and whoever transgresses the bounds of Allahcertainly wrongs himself.You never knowmaybe Allah will bring off something new later on.That is, Muslim men.See 2:227-233, 33:49.Or ‘proven,’ according to an alternative reading (mubayyanah, instead of mubayyinah.)That is, adultery, lesbianism, theft of revilement of the husband and his family. (See Tafsīr al-Ṣāfī, Ṭabarī).
1.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nabiyyu ʾidhā ṭallaqtumu n-nisāʾa fa-ṭalliqūhunna li-ʿiddatihinna wa-ʾaḥṣū l-ʿiddata wa-ttaqū llāha rabbakum lā tukhrijūhunna min buyūtihinna wa-lā yakhrujna ʾillā ʾan yaʾtīna bi-fāḥishatin mubayyinatin wa-tilka ḥudūdu llāhi wa-man yataʿadda ḥudūda llāhi fa-qad ẓalama nafsahū lā tadrī laʿalla llāha yuḥdithu baʿda dhālika ʾamran

2.content: فَإِذا بَلَغنَ أَجَلَهُنَّ فَأَمسِكوهُنَّ بِمَعروفٍ أَو فارِقوهُنَّ بِمَعروفٍ وَأَشهِدوا ذَوَي عَدلٍ مِنكُم وَأَقيمُوا الشَّهادَةَ لِلَّهِ ۚ ذٰلِكُم يوعَظُ بِهِ مَن كانَ يُؤمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَاليَومِ الآخِرِ ۚ وَمَن يَتَّقِ اللَّهَ يَجعَل لَهُ مَخرَجًا
2.translation_eng: Then, when they have completed their term,either retain them honourablyor separate from them honourably,and take the witness of two fair menfrom among yourselves,and bear witness for the sake of Allah.To [comply with] this is advisedwhoever believes in Allahand the Last Day.And whoever is wary of Allah,He shall make a way out for him,
2.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā balaghna ʾajalahunna fa-ʾamsikūhunna bi-maʿrūfin ʾaw fāriqūhunna bi-maʿrūfin wa-ʾashhidū dhaway ʿadlin minkum wa-ʾaqīmū sh-shahādata li-llāhi dhālikum yūʿaẓu bihī man kāna yuʾminu bi-llāhi wa-l-yawmi l-ʾākhiri wa-man yattaqi llāha yajʿal lahū makhrajan

3.content: وَيَرزُقهُ مِن حَيثُ لا يَحتَسِبُ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَكَّل عَلَى اللَّهِ فَهُوَ حَسبُهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بالِغُ أَمرِهِ ۚ قَد جَعَلَ اللَّهُ لِكُلِّ شَيءٍ قَدرًا
3.translation_eng: and provide for himfrom whence he does not reckon.And whoever puts his trust in Allah,He will suffice him.Indeed Allah carries through His command.Certainly Allah has set a measure for everything.
3.transliteration: wa-yarzuqhu min ḥaythu lā yaḥtasibu wa-man yatawakkal ʿalā llāhi fa-huwa ḥasbuhū ʾinna llāha bālighu ʾamrihī qad jaʿala llāhu li-kulli shayʾin qadran

4.content: وَاللّائي يَئِسنَ مِنَ المَحيضِ مِن نِسائِكُم إِنِ ارتَبتُم فَعِدَّتُهُنَّ ثَلاثَةُ أَشهُرٍ وَاللّائي لَم يَحِضنَ ۚ وَأُولاتُ الأَحمالِ أَجَلُهُنَّ أَن يَضَعنَ حَملَهُنَّ ۚ وَمَن يَتَّقِ اللَّهَ يَجعَل لَهُ مِن أَمرِهِ يُسرًا
4.translation_eng: As for thoseof your wives who do not hope to have menses,should you have any doubts,their term shall be three months,and for those [as well] who have not yet had menses.As for those who are pregnant,their term shall be until they deliver.And whoever is wary of Allah,He shall grant him ease in his affairs.
4.transliteration: wa-llāʾī yaʾisna mina l-maḥīḍi min nisāʾikum ʾini rtabtum fa-ʿiddatuhunna thalāthatu ʾashhurin wa-llāʾī lam yaḥiḍna wa-ʾulātu l-ʾaḥmāli ʾajaluhunna ʾan yaḍaʿna ḥamlahunna wa-man yattaqi llāha yajʿal lahū min ʾamrihī yusran

5.content: ذٰلِكَ أَمرُ اللَّهِ أَنزَلَهُ إِلَيكُم ۚ وَمَن يَتَّقِ اللَّهَ يُكَفِّر عَنهُ سَيِّئَاتِهِ وَيُعظِم لَهُ أَجرًا
5.translation_eng: That is the ordinance of Allahwhich He has sent down to you,and whoever is wary of Allah,He shall absolve him of his misdeedsand give him a great reward.
5.transliteration: dhālika ʾamru llāhi ʾanzalahū ʾilaykum wa-man yattaqi llāha yukaffir ʿanhu sayyiʾātihī wa-yuʿẓim lahū ʾajran

6.content: أَسكِنوهُنَّ مِن حَيثُ سَكَنتُم مِن وُجدِكُم وَلا تُضارّوهُنَّ لِتُضَيِّقوا عَلَيهِنَّ ۚ وَإِن كُنَّ أُولاتِ حَملٍ فَأَنفِقوا عَلَيهِنَّ حَتّىٰ يَضَعنَ حَملَهُنَّ ۚ فَإِن أَرضَعنَ لَكُم فَآتوهُنَّ أُجورَهُنَّ ۖ وَأتَمِروا بَينَكُم بِمَعروفٍ ۖ وَإِن تَعاسَرتُم فَسَتُرضِعُ لَهُ أُخرىٰ
6.translation_eng: House them where you live,1in accordance with your means,and do not harass them to put them in straits,and should they be pregnant,maintain them until they deliver.Then, if they suckle [the baby] for you,give them their wagesand consult together honourably;but if you make things difficult for each other,then another woman will suckle [the baby] for him.2That is, the divorcée in her waiting period (ʿiddah).That is, the father will arrange for a wet nurse to suckle the infant.
6.transliteration: ʾaskinūhunna min ḥaythu sakantum min wujdikum wa-lā tuḍārrūhunna li-tuḍayyiqū ʿalayhinna wa-ʾin kunna ʾulāti ḥamlin fa-ʾanfiqū ʿalayhinna ḥattā yaḍaʿna ḥamlahunna fa-ʾin ʾarḍaʿna lakum fa-ʾātūhunna ʾujūrahunna wa-ʾtamirū baynakum bi-maʿrūfin wa-ʾin taʿāsartum fa-sa-turḍiʿu lahū ʾukhrā

7.content: لِيُنفِق ذو سَعَةٍ مِن سَعَتِهِ ۖ وَمَن قُدِرَ عَلَيهِ رِزقُهُ فَليُنفِق مِمّا آتاهُ اللَّهُ ۚ لا يُكَلِّفُ اللَّهُ نَفسًا إِلّا ما آتاها ۚ سَيَجعَلُ اللَّهُ بَعدَ عُسرٍ يُسرًا
7.translation_eng: Let the affluent man spend out of his affluence,and let he whose provision has been tightenedspend out of what Allah has given him.Allah does not task any soulexcept [according to] what He has given it.Allah will bring about ease after hardship.
7.transliteration: li-yunfiq dhū saʿatin min saʿatihī wa-man qudira ʿalayhi rizquhū fa-l-yunfiq mimmā ʾātāhu llāhu lā yukallifu llāhu nafsan ʾillā mā ʾātāhā sa-yajʿalu llāhu baʿda ʿusrin yusran

8.content: وَكَأَيِّن مِن قَريَةٍ عَتَت عَن أَمرِ رَبِّها وَرُسُلِهِ فَحاسَبناها حِسابًا شَديدًا وَعَذَّبناها عَذابًا نُكرًا
8.translation_eng: How many a town defied the command of its Lordand His apostles,then We called it to a severe accountand punished it with a dire punishment.
8.transliteration: wa-ka-ʾayyin min qaryatin ʿatat ʿan ʾamri rabbihā wa-rusulihī fa-ḥāsabnāhā ḥisāban shadīdan wa-ʿadhdhabnāhā ʿadhāban nukran

9.content: فَذاقَت وَبالَ أَمرِها وَكانَ عاقِبَةُ أَمرِها خُسرًا
9.translation_eng: So it tasted the evil consequences of its conduct,and the outcome of its conduct was ruin.
9.transliteration: fa-dhāqat wabāla ʾamrihā wa-kāna ʿāqibatu ʾamrihā khusran

10.content: أَعَدَّ اللَّهُ لَهُم عَذابًا شَديدًا ۖ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ يا أُولِي الأَلبابِ الَّذينَ آمَنوا ۚ قَد أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ إِلَيكُم ذِكرًا
10.translation_eng: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment.So be wary of Allah,O you who possess intellect and have faith!Allah has already sent down to you a reminder,
10.transliteration: ʾaʿadda llāhu lahum ʿadhāban shadīdan fa-ttaqū llāha yā-ʾulī l-ʾalbābi lladhīna ʾāmanū qad ʾanzala llāhu ʾilaykum dhikran

11.content: رَسولًا يَتلو عَلَيكُم آياتِ اللَّهِ مُبَيِّناتٍ لِيُخرِجَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ مِنَ الظُّلُماتِ إِلَى النّورِ ۚ وَمَن يُؤمِن بِاللَّهِ وَيَعمَل صالِحًا يُدخِلهُ جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ خالِدينَ فيها أَبَدًا ۖ قَد أَحسَنَ اللَّهُ لَهُ رِزقًا
11.translation_eng: an apostlereciting to you the manifest signs of Allahthat He may bring out those who have faithand do righteous deedsfrom darkness into light.And whoever has faith in Allahand does righteous deeds,He shall admit him into gardenswith streams running in them,to remain in them forever.Allah has certainly granted him an excellent provision.
11.transliteration: rasūlan yatlū ʿalaykum ʾāyāti llāhi mubayyinātin li-yukhrija lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti mina ẓ-ẓulumāti ʾilā n-nūri wa-man yuʾmin bi-llāhi wa-yaʿmal ṣāliḥan yudkhilhu jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru khālidīna fīhā ʾabadan qad ʾaḥsana llāhu lahū rizqan-i

12.content: اللَّهُ الَّذي خَلَقَ سَبعَ سَماواتٍ وَمِنَ الأَرضِ مِثلَهُنَّ يَتَنَزَّلُ الأَمرُ بَينَهُنَّ لِتَعلَموا أَنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ قَد أَحاطَ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ عِلمًا
12.translation_eng: It is Allah who has created seven heavens,and of the earth [a number] similar to them.The command gradually descends through them,that you may knowthat Allah has power over all things,and that Allah comprehends all things in knowledge.
12.transliteration: allāhu lladhī khalaqa sabʿa samāwātin wa-mina l-ʾarḍi mithlahunna yatanazzalu l-ʾamru baynahunna li-taʿlamū ʾanna llāha ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun wa-ʾanna llāha qad ʾaḥāṭa bi-kulli shayʾin ʿilman

66.description: The surah that opens with admonishing the Prophet against The Forbidding or prohibition of something he once imposed on himself for the purpose of not oending his wives, though God had made it lawful for him. Named after the phrase “why do you forbid” (li mā tuḥrimu) in verse 1. It mentions two of the Prophet’s wives, namely Ḥafṣah and ʿĀyishah, for an incident when a confidence was betrayed (verse 3 .) and urges all believers to submit themselves to God and to guard themselves and their families against Hellfire (verse 6). The surah closes by giving examples of believing and disbelieving women (verse 10 .).The surah is also known as: Holding (something) to be Forbidden, The Prohibition.

1.content: يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ لِمَ تُحَرِّمُ ما أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ لَكَ ۖ تَبتَغي مَرضاتَ أَزواجِكَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
1.translation_eng: O Prophet! Why do you prohibit [yourself]what Allah has made lawful for you,seeking to please your wives?And Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
1.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nabiyyu li-ma tuḥarrimu mā ʾaḥalla llāhu laka tabtaghī marḍāta ʾazwājika wa-llāhu ghafūrun raḥīmun

2.content: قَد فَرَضَ اللَّهُ لَكُم تَحِلَّةَ أَيمانِكُم ۚ وَاللَّهُ مَولاكُم ۖ وَهُوَ العَليمُ الحَكيمُ
2.translation_eng: Allah has certainly made lawful for youthe dissolution of your oaths,1and Allah is your masterand He is the All-knowing, the All-wise.See 2:225, 5:89. Concerning emphasis on keeping oaths, see 16:91-94.
2.transliteration: qad faraḍa llāhu lakum taḥillata ʾaymānikum wa-llāhu mawlākum wa-huwa l-ʿalīmu l-ḥakīmu

3.content: وَإِذ أَسَرَّ النَّبِيُّ إِلىٰ بَعضِ أَزواجِهِ حَديثًا فَلَمّا نَبَّأَت بِهِ وَأَظهَرَهُ اللَّهُ عَلَيهِ عَرَّفَ بَعضَهُ وَأَعرَضَ عَن بَعضٍ ۖ فَلَمّا نَبَّأَها بِهِ قالَت مَن أَنبَأَكَ هٰذا ۖ قالَ نَبَّأَنِيَ العَليمُ الخَبيرُ
3.translation_eng: When the Prophet confided to one of his wivesa matter,but when she divulged it,and Allah apprised him about it,he announced [to her] part of itand disregarded part of it.So when he told her about it,she said, ‘Who informed you about it?’He said,‘The All-knowing and the All-aware informed me.’
3.transliteration: wa-ʾidh ʾasarra n-nabiyyu ʾilā baʿḍi ʾazwājihī ḥadīthan fa-lammā nabbaʾat bihī wa-ʾaẓharahu llāhu ʿalayhi ʿarrafa baʿḍahū wa-ʾaʿraḍa ʿan baʿḍin fa-lammā nabbaʾahā bihī qālat man ʾanbaʾaka hādhā qāla nabbaʾaniya l-ʿalīmu l-khabīru

4.content: إِن تَتوبا إِلَى اللَّهِ فَقَد صَغَت قُلوبُكُما ۖ وَإِن تَظاهَرا عَلَيهِ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ مَولاهُ وَجِبريلُ وَصالِحُ المُؤمِنينَ ۖ وَالمَلائِكَةُ بَعدَ ذٰلِكَ ظَهيرٌ
4.translation_eng: If the two of you1 repent to Allah …2for your hearts have certainly swerved,and if you back each other against him,then [know that] Allah is indeed his guardian,and Gabriel, the righteous among the faithful,and, thereafter, the angels are his supporters.That is, Ḥafṣah and ʿĀyishah, two of the Prophet’s wives.Ellipsis. The omitted phrase is, ‘it will be better for you.’
4.transliteration: ʾin tatūbā ʾilā llāhi fa-qad ṣaghat qulūbukumā wa-ʾin taẓāharā ʿalayhi fa-ʾinna llāha huwa mawlāhu wa-jibrīlu wa-ṣāliḥu l-muʾminīna wa-l-malāʾikatu baʿda dhālika ẓahīrun

5.content: عَسىٰ رَبُّهُ إِن طَلَّقَكُنَّ أَن يُبدِلَهُ أَزواجًا خَيرًا مِنكُنَّ مُسلِماتٍ مُؤمِناتٍ قانِتاتٍ تائِباتٍ عابِداتٍ سائِحاتٍ ثَيِّباتٍ وَأَبكارًا
5.translation_eng: It may be that if he divorces youhis Lord will give him, in [your] stead, wivesbetter than you:[such as are] muslim, faithful, obedient,penitent, devout and given to fasting,virgins and non-virgins.
5.transliteration: ʿasā rabbuhū ʾin ṭallaqakunna ʾan yubdilahū ʾazwājan khayran minkunna muslimātin muʾminātin qānitātin tāʾibātin ʿābidātin sāʾiḥātin thayyibātin wa-ʾabkāran

6.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا قوا أَنفُسَكُم وَأَهليكُم نارًا وَقودُهَا النّاسُ وَالحِجارَةُ عَلَيها مَلائِكَةٌ غِلاظٌ شِدادٌ لا يَعصونَ اللَّهَ ما أَمَرَهُم وَيَفعَلونَ ما يُؤمَرونَ
6.translation_eng: O you who have faith!Save yourselves and your families from a Firewhose fuel is people and stones,over which are [assigned] angels, severe and mighty,who do not disobeywhatever Allah has commanded them,and carry out what they are commanded.
6.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū qū ʾanfusakum wa-ʾahlīkum nāran waqūduhā n-nāsu wa-l-ḥijāratu ʿalayhā malāʾikatun ghilāẓun shidādun lā yaʿṣūna llāha mā ʾamarahum wa-yafʿalūna mā yuʾmarūna

7.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ كَفَروا لا تَعتَذِرُوا اليَومَ ۖ إِنَّما تُجزَونَ ما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
7.translation_eng: [They will call out to the faithless:] ‘O faithless ones!Do not make any excuses today.You are only being requitedfor what you used to do.’
7.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna kafarū lā taʿtadhirū l-yawma ʾinnamā tujzawna mā kuntum taʿmalūna

8.content: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا توبوا إِلَى اللَّهِ تَوبَةً نَصوحًا عَسىٰ رَبُّكُم أَن يُكَفِّرَ عَنكُم سَيِّئَاتِكُم وَيُدخِلَكُم جَنّاتٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ يَومَ لا يُخزِي اللَّهُ النَّبِيَّ وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا مَعَهُ ۖ نورُهُم يَسعىٰ بَينَ أَيديهِم وَبِأَيمانِهِم يَقولونَ رَبَّنا أَتمِم لَنا نورَنا وَاغفِر لَنا ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
8.translation_eng: O you who have faith!Repent to Allah with sincere repentance!Maybe your Lordwill absolve you of your misdeedsand admit you into gardenswith streams running in them,on the daywhen Allah will not let the Prophet downand the faithful who are with him.Their light will move swiftly before themand on their right.They will say, ‘Our Lord!Perfect our light for us, and forgive us!Indeed You have power over all things.’
8.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā lladhīna ʾāmanū tūbū ʾilā llāhi tawbatan naṣūḥan ʿasā rabbukum ʾan yukaffira ʿankum sayyiʾātikum wa-yudkhilakum jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru yawma lā yukhzī llāhu n-nabiyya wa-lladhīna ʾāmanū maʿahū nūruhum yasʿā bayna ʾaydīhim wa-bi-ʾaymānihim yaqūlūna rabbanā ʾatmim lanā nūranā wa-ghfir lanā ʾinnaka ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun

9.content: يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ جاهِدِ الكُفّارَ وَالمُنافِقينَ وَاغلُظ عَلَيهِم ۚ وَمَأواهُم جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئسَ المَصيرُ
9.translation_eng: O Prophet!Wage jihād against the faithless and the hypocrites,and be severe with them.Their refuge shall be hell,and it is an evil destination.
9.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nabiyyu jāhidi l-kuffāra wa-l-munāfiqīna wa-ghluẓ ʿalayhim wa-maʾwāhum jahannamu wa-biʾsa l-maṣīru

10.content: ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا لِلَّذينَ كَفَرُوا امرَأَتَ نوحٍ وَامرَأَتَ لوطٍ ۖ كانَتا تَحتَ عَبدَينِ مِن عِبادِنا صالِحَينِ فَخانَتاهُما فَلَم يُغنِيا عَنهُما مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيئًا وَقيلَ ادخُلَا النّارَ مَعَ الدّاخِلينَ
10.translation_eng: Allah draws an example for the faithless:the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot.They wereunder two of our righteous servants,yet they betrayed them.So they1 did not avail them2 in any way against Allah,and it was said [to them],‘Enter the Fire, along with those who enter [it].’That is, Noah and Lot.That is, the wives.
10.transliteration: ḍaraba llāhu mathalan li-lladhīna kafarū mraʾata nūḥin wa-mraʾata lūṭin kānatā taḥta ʿabdayni min ʿibādinā ṣāliḥayni fa-khānatāhumā fa-lam yughniyā ʿanhumā mina llāhi shayʾan wa-qīla dkhulā n-nāra maʿa d-dākhilīna

11.content: وَضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا لِلَّذينَ آمَنُوا امرَأَتَ فِرعَونَ إِذ قالَت رَبِّ ابنِ لي عِندَكَ بَيتًا فِي الجَنَّةِ وَنَجِّني مِن فِرعَونَ وَعَمَلِهِ وَنَجِّني مِنَ القَومِ الظّالِمينَ
11.translation_eng: Allah draws an[other] examplefor those who have faith:the wife of Pharaoh, when she said,‘My Lord! Build me a home near You in paradise,and deliver me from Pharaoh and his conduct,and deliver me from the wrongdoing lot.’
11.transliteration: wa-ḍaraba llāhu mathalan li-lladhīna ʾāmanū mraʾata firʿawna ʾidh qālat rabbi bni lī ʿindaka baytan fī l-jannati wa-najjinī min firʿawna wa-ʿamalihī wa-najjinī mina l-qawmi ẓ-ẓālimīna

12.content: وَمَريَمَ ابنَتَ عِمرانَ الَّتي أَحصَنَت فَرجَها فَنَفَخنا فيهِ مِن روحِنا وَصَدَّقَت بِكَلِماتِ رَبِّها وَكُتُبِهِ وَكانَت مِنَ القانِتينَ
12.translation_eng: And Mary, daughter of Imran,who guarded the chastity of her womb,so We breathed into it of Our spirit.She confirmed the words of her Lordand His Books,and she was one of the obedient.
12.transliteration: wa-maryama bnata ʿimrāna llatī ʾaḥṣanat farjahā fa-nafakhnā fīhi min rūḥinā wa-ṣaddaqat bi-kalimāti rabbihā wa-kutubihī wa-kānat mina l-qānitīna

67.description: The surah that opens with the statement “Blessed is He in whose hands is all sovereignty”. It takes its name from Divine sovereignty (mulk) mentioned in verse 1. The surah challenges the disbelievers with declarations of God’s total power over them, and everything else, in this world and the next. It describes the regret the disbelievers will express on the Day of Resurrection (verse 9 . and verse 27).The surah is also known as: Control, The Dominion, The Kingdom.

1.content: تَبارَكَ الَّذي بِيَدِهِ المُلكُ وَهُوَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
1.translation_eng: Blessed is He in whose hands is all sovereignty,and He has power over all things.
1.transliteration: tabāraka lladhī bi-yadihi l-mulku wa-huwa ʿalā kulli shayʾin qadīrun-i

2.content: الَّذي خَلَقَ المَوتَ وَالحَياةَ لِيَبلُوَكُم أَيُّكُم أَحسَنُ عَمَلًا ۚ وَهُوَ العَزيزُ الغَفورُ
2.translation_eng: He, who created death and lifethat He may test you [to see]which of you is best in conduct.And He is the All-mighty, the All-forgiving.
2.transliteration: alladhī khalaqa l-mawta wa-l-ḥayāta li-yabluwakum ʾayyukum ʾaḥsanu ʿamalan wa-huwa l-ʿazīzu l-ghafūru

3.content: الَّذي خَلَقَ سَبعَ سَماواتٍ طِباقًا ۖ ما تَرىٰ في خَلقِ الرَّحمٰنِ مِن تَفاوُتٍ ۖ فَارجِعِ البَصَرَ هَل تَرىٰ مِن فُطورٍ
3.translation_eng: He created seven heavens in layers.You do not seeany discordance in the creation of the All-beneficent.Look again!Do you see any flaw?
3.transliteration: alladhī khalaqa sabʿa samāwātin ṭibāqan mā tarā fī khalqi r-raḥmāni min tafāwutin fa-rjiʿi l-baṣara hal tarā min fuṭūrin

4.content: ثُمَّ ارجِعِ البَصَرَ كَرَّتَينِ يَنقَلِب إِلَيكَ البَصَرُ خاسِئًا وَهُوَ حَسيرٌ
4.translation_eng: Look again, once more.Your look will return to youhumbled and weary.
4.transliteration: thumma rjiʿi l-baṣara karratayni yanqalib ʾilayka l-baṣaru khāsiʾan wa-huwa ḥasīrun

5.content: وَلَقَد زَيَّنَّا السَّماءَ الدُّنيا بِمَصابيحَ وَجَعَلناها رُجومًا لِلشَّياطينِ ۖ وَأَعتَدنا لَهُم عَذابَ السَّعيرِ
5.translation_eng: We have certainly adorned the lowest heavenwith lamps,and made them missiles against the devils,and We have prepared for thempunishment of the Blaze.
5.transliteration: wa-la-qad zayyannā s-samāʾa d-dunyā bi-maṣābīḥa wa-jaʿalnāhā rujūman li-sh-shayāṭīni wa-ʾaʿtadnā lahum ʿadhāba s-saʿīri

6.content: وَلِلَّذينَ كَفَروا بِرَبِّهِم عَذابُ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ وَبِئسَ المَصيرُ
6.translation_eng: For those who defy their Lordis the punishment of hell,and it is an evil destination.
6.transliteration: wa-li-lladhīna kafarū bi-rabbihim ʿadhābu jahannama wa-biʾsa l-maṣīru

7.content: إِذا أُلقوا فيها سَمِعوا لَها شَهيقًا وَهِيَ تَفورُ
7.translation_eng: When they are thrown in it,they hear it blaring, as it seethes,
7.transliteration: ʾidhā ʾulqū fīhā samiʿū lahā shahīqan wa-hiya tafūru

8.content: تَكادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ الغَيظِ ۖ كُلَّما أُلقِيَ فيها فَوجٌ سَأَلَهُم خَزَنَتُها أَلَم يَأتِكُم نَذيرٌ
8.translation_eng: almost exploding with rage.Whenever a group is thrown in it,its keepers will ask them,‘Did there not come to you any warner?’
8.transliteration: takādu tamayyazu mina l-ghayẓi kullamā ʾulqiya fīhā fawjun saʾalahum khazanatuhā ʾa-lam yaʾtikum nadhīrun

9.content: قالوا بَلىٰ قَد جاءَنا نَذيرٌ فَكَذَّبنا وَقُلنا ما نَزَّلَ اللَّهُ مِن شَيءٍ إِن أَنتُم إِلّا في ضَلالٍ كَبيرٍ
9.translation_eng: They will say, ‘Yes, a warner did come to us,but we impugned [him] and said,‘Allah did not send down anything;you are only in great error.’
9.transliteration: qālū balā qad jāʾanā nadhīrun fa-kadhdhabnā wa-qulnā mā nazzala llāhu min shayʾin ʾin ʾantum ʾillā fī ḍalālin kabīrin

10.content: وَقالوا لَو كُنّا نَسمَعُ أَو نَعقِلُ ما كُنّا في أَصحابِ السَّعيرِ
10.translation_eng: And they will say,‘Had we listened or applied reason,we would not have been among inmates of the Blaze.’
10.transliteration: wa-qālū law kunnā nasmaʿu ʾaw naʿqilu mā kunnā fī ʾaṣḥābi s-saʿīri

11.content: فَاعتَرَفوا بِذَنبِهِم فَسُحقًا لِأَصحابِ السَّعيرِ
11.translation_eng: Thus they will admit their sin.So away with the inmates of the Blaze!
11.transliteration: fa-ʿtarafū bi-dhanbihim fa-suḥqan li-ʾaṣḥābi s-saʿīri

12.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَخشَونَ رَبَّهُم بِالغَيبِ لَهُم مَغفِرَةٌ وَأَجرٌ كَبيرٌ
12.translation_eng: Indeed for those who fear their Lord in secretthere will be forgiveness and a great reward.
12.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna yakhshawna rabbahum bi-l-ghaybi lahum maghfiratun wa-ʾajrun kabīrun

13.content: وَأَسِرّوا قَولَكُم أَوِ اجهَروا بِهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ عَليمٌ بِذاتِ الصُّدورِ
13.translation_eng: Speak secretly, or do so loudly,indeed He knows well what is in the breasts.
13.transliteration: wa-ʾasirrū qawlakum ʾawi jharū bihī ʾinnahū ʿalīmun bi-dhāti ṣ-ṣudūri

14.content: أَلا يَعلَمُ مَن خَلَقَ وَهُوَ اللَّطيفُ الخَبيرُ
14.translation_eng: Would He who has created not know?And He is the All-attentive, the All-aware.
14.transliteration: ʾa-lā yaʿlamu man khalaqa wa-huwa l-laṭīfu l-khabīru

15.content: هُوَ الَّذي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الأَرضَ ذَلولًا فَامشوا في مَناكِبِها وَكُلوا مِن رِزقِهِ ۖ وَإِلَيهِ النُّشورُ
15.translation_eng: It is He who made the earth tractable for you;so walk on its flanksand eat of His provision,and towards Him is the resurrection.
15.transliteration: huwa lladhī jaʿala lakumu l-ʾarḍa dhalūlan fa-mshū fī manākibihā wa-kulū min rizqihī wa-ʾilayhi n-nushūru

16.content: أَأَمِنتُم مَن فِي السَّماءِ أَن يَخسِفَ بِكُمُ الأَرضَ فَإِذا هِيَ تَمورُ
16.translation_eng: Are you secure that He who is in the skywill not make the earth swallow youwhile it quakes?
16.transliteration: ʾa-ʾamintum man fī s-samāʾi ʾan yakhsifa bikumu l-ʾarḍa fa-ʾidhā hiya tamūru

17.content: أَم أَمِنتُم مَن فِي السَّماءِ أَن يُرسِلَ عَلَيكُم حاصِبًا ۖ فَسَتَعلَمونَ كَيفَ نَذيرِ
17.translation_eng: Are you secure that He who is in the skywill not unleash upon you a rain of stones?Soon you will know how My warning has been!
17.transliteration: ʾam-ʾamintum man fī s-samāʾi ʾan yursila ʿalaykum ḥāṣiban fa-sa-taʿlamūna kayfa nadhīri

18.content: وَلَقَد كَذَّبَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم فَكَيفَ كانَ نَكيرِ
18.translation_eng: Certainly those who were before them had denied;but then how was My rebuttal!1Or, ‘how was My requital.’
18.transliteration: wa-la-qad kadhdhaba lladhīna min qablihim fa-kayfa kāna nakīri

19.content: أَوَلَم يَرَوا إِلَى الطَّيرِ فَوقَهُم صافّاتٍ وَيَقبِضنَ ۚ ما يُمسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا الرَّحمٰنُ ۚ إِنَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيءٍ بَصيرٌ
19.translation_eng: Have they not regarded the birds above themspreading and closing their wings?No one sustains them except the All-beneficent.Indeed He sees best all things.
19.transliteration: ʾa-wa-lam yaraw ʾilā ṭ-ṭayri fawqahum ṣāffātin wa-yaqbiḍna mā yumsikuhunna ʾillā r-raḥmānu ʾinnahū bi-kulli shayʾin baṣīrun

20.content: أَمَّن هٰذَا الَّذي هُوَ جُندٌ لَكُم يَنصُرُكُم مِن دونِ الرَّحمٰنِ ۚ إِنِ الكافِرونَ إِلّا في غُرورٍ
20.translation_eng: Who is it that is your hostwho may help you, besides the All-beneficent?The faithless only dwell in delusion.
20.transliteration: ʾam-man hādhā lladhī huwa jundun lakum yanṣurukum min dūni r-raḥmāni ʾini l-kāfirūna ʾillā fī ghurūrin

21.content: أَمَّن هٰذَا الَّذي يَرزُقُكُم إِن أَمسَكَ رِزقَهُ ۚ بَل لَجّوا في عُتُوٍّ وَنُفورٍ
21.translation_eng: Who is it that may provide for youif He withholds His provision?Rather they persist in defiance and aversion.
21.transliteration: ʾam-man hādhā lladhī yarzuqukum ʾin ʾamsaka rizqahū bal lajjū fī ʿutuwwin wa-nufūrin

22.content: أَفَمَن يَمشي مُكِبًّا عَلىٰ وَجهِهِ أَهدىٰ أَمَّن يَمشي سَوِيًّا عَلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
22.translation_eng: Is he who walks prone on his face better guided,or he who walks uprighton a straight path?
22.transliteration: ʾa-fa-man yamshī mukibban ʿalā wajhihī ʾahdā ʾam-man yamshī sawiyyan ʿalā ṣirāṭin mustaqīmin

23.content: قُل هُوَ الَّذي أَنشَأَكُم وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمعَ وَالأَبصارَ وَالأَفئِدَةَ ۖ قَليلًا ما تَشكُرونَ
23.translation_eng: Say, ‘It is He who created you,and made for you hearing, eyesight, and hearts.Little do you thank.’
23.transliteration: qul huwa lladhī ʾanshaʾakum wa-jaʿala lakumu s-samʿa wa-l-ʾabṣāra wa-l-ʾafʾidata qalīlan mā tashkurūna

24.content: قُل هُوَ الَّذي ذَرَأَكُم فِي الأَرضِ وَإِلَيهِ تُحشَرونَ
24.translation_eng: Say, ‘It is He who created you on the earth,and toward Him you will be mustered.’
24.transliteration: qul huwa lladhī dharaʾakum fī l-ʾarḍi wa-ʾilayhi tuḥsharūna

25.content: وَيَقولونَ مَتىٰ هٰذَا الوَعدُ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
25.translation_eng: They say, ‘When will this promise be fulfilled,should you be truthful?’
25.transliteration: wa-yaqūlūna matā hādhā l-waʿdu ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīna

26.content: قُل إِنَّمَا العِلمُ عِندَ اللَّهِ وَإِنَّما أَنا نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
26.translation_eng: Say, ‘Its knowledge is only with Allah;I am only a manifest warner.’
26.transliteration: qul ʾinnamā l-ʿilmu ʿinda llāhi wa-ʾinnamā ʾana nadhīrun mubīnun

27.content: فَلَمّا رَأَوهُ زُلفَةً سيئَت وُجوهُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَقيلَ هٰذَا الَّذي كُنتُم بِهِ تَدَّعونَ
27.translation_eng: When they see it brought near,the countenances of the faithless will be distorted,and [they will be] told, ‘This is what you asked for!’
27.transliteration: fa-lammā raʾawhu zulfatan sīʾat wujūhu lladhīna kafarū wa-qīla hādhā lladhī kuntum bihī taddaʿūna

28.content: قُل أَرَأَيتُم إِن أَهلَكَنِيَ اللَّهُ وَمَن مَعِيَ أَو رَحِمَنا فَمَن يُجيرُ الكافِرينَ مِن عَذابٍ أَليمٍ
28.translation_eng: Say, ‘Tell me,whether Allah destroys me and those with me,or He has mercy on us,who will shelter the faithlessfrom a painful punishment?’
28.transliteration: qul ʾa-raʾaytum ʾin ʾahlakaniya llāhu wa-man maʿiya ʾaw raḥimanā fa-man yujīru l-kāfirīna min ʿadhābin ʾalīmin

29.content: قُل هُوَ الرَّحمٰنُ آمَنّا بِهِ وَعَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلنا ۖ فَسَتَعلَمونَ مَن هُوَ في ضَلالٍ مُبينٍ
29.translation_eng: Say, ‘He is the All-beneficent;we have faith in Him, and in Him do we trust.Soon you will knowwho is in manifest error.’
29.transliteration: qul huwa r-raḥmānu ʾāmannā bihī wa-ʿalayhi tawakkalnā fa-sa-taʿlamūna man huwa fī ḍalālin mubīnin

30.content: قُل أَرَأَيتُم إِن أَصبَحَ ماؤُكُم غَورًا فَمَن يَأتيكُم بِماءٍ مَعينٍ
30.translation_eng: Say, ‘Tell me,should your water sink down [into the ground],who will bring you running water?’
30.transliteration: qul ʾa-raʾaytum ʾin ʾaṣbaḥa māʾukum ghawran fa-man yaʾtīkum bi-māʾin maʿīnin

68.description: The surah that opens with the single discrete Arabic letter Nūn and the oath of the Divine One swearing by the instrument of The Pen, as well as all knowledge that people are able to preserve and communicate thereby. It takes its name from “the pen” (al-qalam) mentioned in verse 1. The surah deals with the accusation that Muhammad was not God’s Messenger but merely mad (verse 2 .). The arrogance of those who assume that, because they have some of the good things in this life, they can reject the Revelation, is rebutted (verse 10 .). Examples are given of those who came to regret their arrogance (verse 17 .). The Prophet is urged to remain steadfast (verse 48 .).

1.translation_eng: Nūn.By the Pen and what they write:

2.translation_eng: you are not, by your Lord’s blessing, crazy,

3.content: وَإِنَّ لَكَ لَأَجرًا غَيرَ مَمنونٍ
3.translation_eng: and yours indeed will be an everlasting reward,
3.transliteration: wa-ʾinna laka la-ʾajran ghayra mamnūnin

4.content: وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظيمٍ
4.translation_eng: and indeed you possess a great character.
4.transliteration: wa-ʾinnaka la-ʿalā khuluqin ʿaẓīmin

5.content: فَسَتُبصِرُ وَيُبصِرونَ
5.translation_eng: You will see and they will see,
5.transliteration: fa-sa-tubṣiru wa-yubṣirūna

6.content: بِأَييِكُمُ المَفتونُ
6.translation_eng: which one of you is crazy.
6.transliteration: bi-ʾayyikumu l-maftūnu

7.content: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعلَمُ بِالمُهتَدينَ
7.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord knows bestthose who stray from His way,and He knows best those who are guided.
7.transliteration: ʾinna rabbaka huwa ʾaʿlamu bi-man ḍalla ʿan sabīlihī wa-huwa ʾaʿlamu bi-l-muhtadīna

8.content: فَلا تُطِعِ المُكَذِّبينَ
8.translation_eng: So do not obey the deniers,
8.transliteration: fa-lā tuṭiʿi l-mukadhdhibīna

9.content: وَدّوا لَو تُدهِنُ فَيُدهِنونَ
9.translation_eng: who are eager that you should be pliable,so that they may be pliable [towards you].
9.transliteration: waddū law tudhinu fa-yudhinūna

10.content: وَلا تُطِع كُلَّ حَلّافٍ مَهينٍ
10.translation_eng: And do not obey any vile swearer,
10.transliteration: wa-lā tuṭiʿ kulla ḥallāfin mahīnin

11.content: هَمّازٍ مَشّاءٍ بِنَميمٍ
11.translation_eng: scandal-monger, talebearer,
11.transliteration: hammāzin mashshāʾin bi-namīmin

12.content: مَنّاعٍ لِلخَيرِ مُعتَدٍ أَثيمٍ
12.translation_eng: hinderer of all good, sinful transgressor,
12.transliteration: mannāʿin li-l-khayri muʿtadin ʾathīmin

13.content: عُتُلٍّ بَعدَ ذٰلِكَ زَنيمٍ
13.translation_eng: callous and, on top of that, baseborn,
13.transliteration: ʿutullin baʿda dhālika zanīmin

14.content: أَن كانَ ذا مالٍ وَبَنينَ
14.translation_eng: —[only] because he has wealth and children.
14.transliteration: ʾan kāna dhā mālin wa-banīna

15.content: إِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِ آياتُنا قالَ أَساطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ
15.translation_eng: When Our signs are recited to him,he says, ‘Myths of the ancients!’
15.transliteration: ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhi ʾāyātunā qāla ʾasāṭīru l-ʾawwalīna

16.content: سَنَسِمُهُ عَلَى الخُرطومِ
16.translation_eng: Soon We shall brand him on the snout.
16.transliteration: sa-nasimuhū ʿalā l-khurṭūmi

17.content: إِنّا بَلَوناهُم كَما بَلَونا أَصحابَ الجَنَّةِ إِذ أَقسَموا لَيَصرِمُنَّها مُصبِحينَ
17.translation_eng: Indeed we have tested them1just as We tested the People of the Gardenwhen they vowed they would gather its fruitat dawn,That is, the people of Makkah, through famine and hunger.
17.transliteration: ʾinnā balawnāhum ka-mā balawnā ʾaṣḥāba l-jannati ʾidh ʾaqsamū la-yaṣrimunnahā muṣbiḥīna

18.content: وَلا يَستَثنونَ
18.translation_eng: and they did not make any exception.1That is, for Allah’s will, by saying, for instance, ‘God willing.’ See 18:24.
18.transliteration: wa-lā yastathnūna

19.content: فَطافَ عَلَيها طائِفٌ مِن رَبِّكَ وَهُم نائِمونَ
19.translation_eng: Then a visitation from your Lord visited it1while they were asleep.That is, the garden.
19.transliteration: fa-ṭāfa ʿalayhā ṭāʾifun min rabbika wa-hum nāʾimūna

20.content: فَأَصبَحَت كَالصَّريمِ
20.translation_eng: So by the dawn it was like a harvested field.1Or ‘like a sand dune,’ or ‘like a gloomy night,’ or ‘like black ashes.’
20.transliteration: fa-ʾaṣbaḥat ka-ṣ-ṣarīmi

21.content: فَتَنادَوا مُصبِحينَ
21.translation_eng: At dawn they called out to one another,
21.transliteration: fa-tanādaw muṣbiḥīna

22.content: أَنِ اغدوا عَلىٰ حَرثِكُم إِن كُنتُم صارِمينَ
22.translation_eng: ‘Get off early to your fieldif you have to gather [the fruits].’
22.transliteration: ʾani ghdū ʿalā ḥarthikum ʾin kuntum ṣārimīna

23.content: فَانطَلَقوا وَهُم يَتَخافَتونَ
23.translation_eng: So off they went, murmuring to one another:
23.transliteration: fa-nṭalaqū wa-hum yatakhāfatūna

24.content: أَن لا يَدخُلَنَّهَا اليَومَ عَلَيكُم مِسكينٌ
24.translation_eng: ‘Today no needy man shall come to you in it.’
24.transliteration: ʾan lā yadkhulannahā l-yawma ʿalaykum miskīnun

25.content: وَغَدَوا عَلىٰ حَردٍ قادِرينَ
25.translation_eng: They set out early morning,[considering themselves] able to grudge.
25.transliteration: wa-ghadaw ʿalā ḥardin qādirīna

26.content: فَلَمّا رَأَوها قالوا إِنّا لَضالّونَ
26.translation_eng: But when they saw it, they said,‘We have indeed lost our way!’
26.transliteration: fa-lammā raʾawhā qālū ʾinnā la-ḍāllūna

27.content: بَل نَحنُ مَحرومونَ
27.translation_eng: ‘No, we are deprived!’
27.transliteration: bal naḥnu maḥrūmūna

28.content: قالَ أَوسَطُهُم أَلَم أَقُل لَكُم لَولا تُسَبِّحونَ
28.translation_eng: The most moderate among them said,‘Did I not tell you,“Why do you not glorify [Allah]?” ’
28.transliteration: qāla ʾawsaṭuhum ʾa-lam ʾaqul lakum law-lā tusabbiḥūna

29.content: قالوا سُبحانَ رَبِّنا إِنّا كُنّا ظالِمينَ
29.translation_eng: They said, ‘Immaculate is our Lord!We have indeed been wrongdoers!’
29.transliteration: qālū subḥāna rabbinā ʾinnā kunnā ẓālimīna

30.content: فَأَقبَلَ بَعضُهُم عَلىٰ بَعضٍ يَتَلاوَمونَ
30.translation_eng: Then they turned to one another,blaming each other.
30.transliteration: fa-ʾaqbala baʿḍuhum ʿalā baʿḍin yatalāwamūna

31.content: قالوا يا وَيلَنا إِنّا كُنّا طاغينَ
31.translation_eng: They said, ‘Woe to us!Indeed we have been rebellious.
31.transliteration: qālū yā-waylanā ʾinnā kunnā ṭāghīna

32.content: عَسىٰ رَبُّنا أَن يُبدِلَنا خَيرًا مِنها إِنّا إِلىٰ رَبِّنا راغِبونَ
32.translation_eng: Maybe our Lord will give us a better one in its place.Indeed we turn earnestly to our Lord.’
32.transliteration: ʿasā rabbunā ʾan yubdilanā khayran minhā ʾinnā ʾilā rabbinā rāghibūna

33.content: كَذٰلِكَ العَذابُ ۖ وَلَعَذابُ الآخِرَةِ أَكبَرُ ۚ لَو كانوا يَعلَمونَ
33.translation_eng: Such was the punishment;and the punishment of the Hereafter is surely greater,had they known.
33.transliteration: ka-dhālika l-ʿadhābu wa-la-ʿadhābu l-ʾākhirati ʾakbaru law kānū yaʿlamūna

34.content: إِنَّ لِلمُتَّقينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِم جَنّاتِ النَّعيمِ
34.translation_eng: Indeed for the Godwarythere will be gardens of bliss near their Lord.
34.transliteration: ʾinna li-l-muttaqīna ʿinda rabbihim jannāti n-naʿīmi

35.content: أَفَنَجعَلُ المُسلِمينَ كَالمُجرِمينَ
35.translation_eng: Shall We, then, treat those who submit [to Us]as [We treat] the guilty?
35.transliteration: ʾa-fa-najʿalu l-muslimīna ka-l-mujrimīna

36.content: ما لَكُم كَيفَ تَحكُمونَ
36.translation_eng: What is the matter with you? How do you judge!
36.transliteration: mā lakum kayfa taḥkumūna

37.content: أَم لَكُم كِتابٌ فيهِ تَدرُسونَ
37.translation_eng: Do you possess a scripture in which you read
37.transliteration: ʾam lakum kitābun fīhi tadrusūna

38.content: إِنَّ لَكُم فيهِ لَما تَخَيَّرونَ
38.translation_eng: that you shall indeed have in it1whatever you would like?That is, in the next world.
38.transliteration: ʾinna lakum fīhi la-mā takhayyarūna

39.content: أَم لَكُم أَيمانٌ عَلَينا بالِغَةٌ إِلىٰ يَومِ القِيامَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُم لَما تَحكُمونَ
39.translation_eng: Do you have a pledge binding on Usuntil the Day of Resurrection,that you shall indeed have whatever you decide?
39.transliteration: ʾam lakum ʾaymānun ʿalaynā bālighatun ʾilā yawmi l-qiyāmati ʾinna lakum la-mā taḥkumūna

40.content: سَلهُم أَيُّهُم بِذٰلِكَ زَعيمٌ
40.translation_eng: Ask them, which of them will aver [any of] that!
40.transliteration: salhum ʾayyuhum bi-dhālika zaʿīmun

41.content: أَم لَهُم شُرَكاءُ فَليَأتوا بِشُرَكائِهِم إِن كانوا صادِقينَ
41.translation_eng: Do they have any partners [they ascribe to Allah]?Then let them produce their partners,if they are truthful.
41.transliteration: ʾam lahum shurakāʾu fa-l-yaʾtū bi-shurakāʾihim ʾin kānū ṣādiqīna

42.content: يَومَ يُكشَفُ عَن ساقٍ وَيُدعَونَ إِلَى السُّجودِ فَلا يَستَطيعونَ
42.translation_eng: The day when the catastrophe occurs,1and they are summoned to prostrate themselves,they will not be able [to do it].Literally, ‘when the shank is uncovered,’ an idiom implying the occurrence of a calamity, or a disclosure and denouement.
42.transliteration: yawma yukshafu ʿan sāqin wa-yudʿawna ʾilā s-sujūdi fa-lā yastaṭīʿūna

43.content: خاشِعَةً أَبصارُهُم تَرهَقُهُم ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَد كانوا يُدعَونَ إِلَى السُّجودِ وَهُم سالِمونَ
43.translation_eng: With a humbled look [in their eyes],they will be overcast by abasement.Certainly they were summoned to prostrate themselveswhile they were yet sound.
43.transliteration: khāshiʿatan ʾabṣāruhum tarhaquhum dhillatun wa-qad kānū yudʿawna ʾilā s-sujūdi wa-hum sālimūna

44.content: فَذَرني وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهٰذَا الحَديثِ ۖ سَنَستَدرِجُهُم مِن حَيثُ لا يَعلَمونَ
44.translation_eng: So leave Me with those who deny this discourse.We will draw them imperceptibly [into ruin],whence they do not know.
44.transliteration: fa-dharnī wa-man yukadhdhibu bi-hādhā l-ḥadīthi sa-nastadrijuhum min haythu lā yaʿlamūna

45.content: وَأُملي لَهُم ۚ إِنَّ كَيدي مَتينٌ
45.translation_eng: I will grant them respite,for My devising is indeed sure.
45.transliteration: wa-ʾumlī lahum ʾinna kaydī matīnun

46.content: أَم تَسأَلُهُم أَجرًا فَهُم مِن مَغرَمٍ مُثقَلونَ
46.translation_eng: Do you ask them for a reward,so that they are weighed down with debt?
46.transliteration: ʾam tasʾaluhum ʾajran fa-hum min maghramin muthqalūna

47.content: أَم عِندَهُمُ الغَيبُ فَهُم يَكتُبونَ
47.translation_eng: Do they possess [access to] the Unseenso that they write it down?
47.transliteration: ʾam ʿindahumu l-ghaybu fa-hum yaktubūna

48.content: فَاصبِر لِحُكمِ رَبِّكَ وَلا تَكُن كَصاحِبِ الحوتِ إِذ نادىٰ وَهُوَ مَكظومٌ
48.translation_eng: So submit patiently to the judgement of your Lord,and do not be like the Man of the Fish1who called out as he choked with grief.That is, Jonah. See 21:87.
48.transliteration: fa-ṣbir li-ḥukmi rabbika wa-lā takun ka-ṣāḥibi l-ḥūti ʾidh nādā wa-huwa makẓūmun

49.content: لَولا أَن تَدارَكَهُ نِعمَةٌ مِن رَبِّهِ لَنُبِذَ بِالعَراءِ وَهُوَ مَذمومٌ
49.translation_eng: Had it not been for a blessing that came to his rescuefrom his Lord,he would surely have been cast on a bare shorewhile he were blameworthy.
49.transliteration: law-lā ʾan tadārakahū niʿmatun min rabbihī la-nubidha bi-l-ʿarāʾi wa-huwa madhmūmun

50.content: فَاجتَباهُ رَبُّهُ فَجَعَلَهُ مِنَ الصّالِحينَ
50.translation_eng: So his Lord chose himand made him one of the righteous.
50.transliteration: fa-jtabāhu rabbuhū fa-jaʿalahū mina ṣ-ṣāliḥīna

51.content: وَإِن يَكادُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا لَيُزلِقونَكَ بِأَبصارِهِم لَمّا سَمِعُوا الذِّكرَ وَيَقولونَ إِنَّهُ لَمَجنونٌ
51.translation_eng: Indeed the faithless almost devour youwith their eyeswhen they hear the Reminder,and they say, ‘He is indeed crazy.’
51.transliteration: wa-ʾin yakādu lladhīna kafarū la-yuzliqūnaka bi-ʾabṣārihim lammā samiʿū dh-dhikra wa-yaqūlūna ʾinnahū la-majnūnun

52.content: وَما هُوَ إِلّا ذِكرٌ لِلعالَمينَ
52.translation_eng: Yet it is just a reminder for all the nations.
52.transliteration: wa-mā huwa ʾillā dhikrun li-l-ʿālamīna

69.description: The surah that opens by proclaiming one of the names of the Day of Resurrection, The Inevitable reality or hour, so named because in the matter of truth shall forever be decided then and all truth shall prevail regarding every aair. It takes its name from the Inevitable or Besieger (al-Ḥāqqah) mentioned in verse 1. The surah describes punishment in this life (verse 4 .) and the next (verse 13 .). The bliss to be enjoyed by the believers is eloquently contrasted with the torments of hell (verse 19 .). From verse 38 onwards, God airms the Truth of the Quran and the Prophet.The surah is also known as: Reality, The Catastrophe, The Concrete Reality, The Indubitable, The Inevitable Hour, The Inevitable Reality, The Sure Occurrence, The Sure Reality, The Undeniable.

1.translation_eng: The Besieger!1Or ‘the Inevitable.’ That is, the Day of Resurrection.

2.translation_eng: What is the Besieger?!

3.content: وَما أَدراكَ مَا الحاقَّةُ
3.translation_eng: What will show you what is the Besieger?!
3.transliteration: wa-mā ʾadrāka mā l-ḥāqqatu

4.content: كَذَّبَت ثَمودُ وَعادٌ بِالقارِعَةِ
4.translation_eng: Thamūd and ʿĀd denied the Catastrophe.
4.transliteration: kadhdhabat thamūdu wa-ʿādun bi-l-qāriʿati

5.content: فَأَمّا ثَمودُ فَأُهلِكوا بِالطّاغِيَةِ
5.translation_eng: As for Thamūd, they were destroyed by the Cry.
5.transliteration: fa-ʾammā thamūdu fa-ʾuhlikū bi-ṭ-ṭāghiyati

6.content: وَأَمّا عادٌ فَأُهلِكوا بِريحٍ صَرصَرٍ عاتِيَةٍ
6.translation_eng: And as for ʿĀd,they were destroyed by a fierce icy gale,
6.transliteration: wa-ʾammā ʿādun fa-ʾuhlikū bi-rīḥin ṣarṣarin ʿātiyatin

7.content: سَخَّرَها عَلَيهِم سَبعَ لَيالٍ وَثَمانِيَةَ أَيّامٍ حُسومًا فَتَرَى القَومَ فيها صَرعىٰ كَأَنَّهُم أَعجازُ نَخلٍ خاوِيَةٍ
7.translation_eng: which He disposed against themfor seven grueling1 nights and eight days,so that you could have seen the peoplelying about therein prostrateas if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.Or ‘successive.’
7.transliteration: sakhkharahā ʿalayhim sabʿa layālin wa-thamāniyata ʾayyāmin ḥusūman fa-tarā l-qawma fīhā ṣarʿā ka-ʾannahum ʾaʿjāzu nakhlin khāwiyatin

8.content: فَهَل تَرىٰ لَهُم مِن باقِيَةٍ
8.translation_eng: So do you see any trace of them?
8.transliteration: fa-hal tarā lahum min bāqiyatin

9.content: وَجاءَ فِرعَونُ وَمَن قَبلَهُ وَالمُؤتَفِكاتُ بِالخاطِئَةِ
9.translation_eng: Then brought Pharaoh and those who were before him,and the towns that were overturned,iniquity.
9.transliteration: wa-jāʾa firʾawnu wa-man qablahū wa-l-muʾtafikātu bi-l-khāṭiʾati

10.content: فَعَصَوا رَسولَ رَبِّهِم فَأَخَذَهُم أَخذَةً رابِيَةً
10.translation_eng: Then they disobeyed the apostle of their Lord,so He seized them with a terrible seizing.
10.transliteration: fa-ʿaṣaw rasūla rabbihim fa-ʾakhadhahum ʾakhdhatan rābiyatan

11.content: إِنّا لَمّا طَغَى الماءُ حَمَلناكُم فِي الجارِيَةِ
11.translation_eng: Indeed when the Flood rose high,We carried you in a floating ark,
11.transliteration: ʾinnā lammā ṭaghā l-māʾu ḥamalnākum fī l-jāriyati

12.content: لِنَجعَلَها لَكُم تَذكِرَةً وَتَعِيَها أُذُنٌ واعِيَةٌ
12.translation_eng: that We might make it a reminder for you,and that receptive ears might remember it.
12.transliteration: li-najʿalahā lakum tadhkiratan wa-taʿiyahā ʾudhunun wāʿiyatun

13.content: فَإِذا نُفِخَ فِي الصّورِ نَفخَةٌ واحِدَةٌ
13.translation_eng: When the Trumpet is blown with a single blast
13.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā nufikha fī ṣ-ṣūri nafkhatun wāḥidatun

14.content: وَحُمِلَتِ الأَرضُ وَالجِبالُ فَدُكَّتا دَكَّةً واحِدَةً
14.translation_eng: and the earth and the mountains are liftedand levelled with a single leveling,1Or ‘crumbled with a single crumbling.’
14.transliteration: wa-ḥumilati l-ʾarḍu wa-l-jibālu fa-dukkatā dakkatan wāḥidatan

15.content: فَيَومَئِذٍ وَقَعَتِ الواقِعَةُ
15.translation_eng: then, on that day, will the Imminent [Hour] befall1Cf. 56:1-6.
15.transliteration: fa-yawmaʾidhin waqaʿati l-wāqiʿatu

16.content: وَانشَقَّتِ السَّماءُ فَهِيَ يَومَئِذٍ واهِيَةٌ
16.translation_eng: and the sky will be split open—for it will be frail that day—
16.transliteration: wa-nshaqqati s-samāʾu fa-hiya yawmaʾidhin wāhiyatun

17.content: وَالمَلَكُ عَلىٰ أَرجائِها ۚ وَيَحمِلُ عَرشَ رَبِّكَ فَوقَهُم يَومَئِذٍ ثَمانِيَةٌ
17.translation_eng: and the angels will be all over it,and the Throne of your Lord will be bornethat day by eight [angels].
17.transliteration: wa-l-malaku ʿalā ʾarjāʾihā wa-yaḥmilu ʿarsha rabbika fawqahum yawmaʾidhin thamāniyatun

18.content: يَومَئِذٍ تُعرَضونَ لا تَخفىٰ مِنكُم خافِيَةٌ
18.translation_eng: That day you will be exposed:none of your secrets will remain hidden.
18.transliteration: yawmaʾidhin tuʿraḍūna lā takhfā minkum khāfiyatun

19.content: فَأَمّا مَن أوتِيَ كِتابَهُ بِيَمينِهِ فَيَقولُ هاؤُمُ اقرَءوا كِتابِيَه
19.translation_eng: As for him who is given his book in his right hand,he will say, ‘Here, take and read my book!
19.transliteration: fa-ʾammā man ʾūtiya kitābahū bi-yamīnihī fa-yaqūlu hāʾumu qraʾū kitābiyah

20.content: إِنّي ظَنَنتُ أَنّي مُلاقٍ حِسابِيَه
20.translation_eng: Indeed I knew that I shall encounter my account.’
20.transliteration: ʾinnī ẓanantu ʾannī mulāqin ḥisābiyah

21.content: فَهُوَ في عيشَةٍ راضِيَةٍ
21.translation_eng: So he will have a pleasant life,
21.transliteration: fa-huwa fī ʿīshatin rāḍiyatin

22.content: في جَنَّةٍ عالِيَةٍ
22.translation_eng: in an elevated garden,
22.transliteration: fī jannatin ʿāliyatin

23.content: قُطوفُها دانِيَةٌ
23.translation_eng: whose clusters [of fruits] will be within easy reach.
23.transliteration: quṭūfuhā dāniyatun

24.content: كُلوا وَاشرَبوا هَنيئًا بِما أَسلَفتُم فِي الأَيّامِ الخالِيَةِ
24.translation_eng: [He will be told]: ‘Enjoy your food and drink,for what you had sent in advance in past days.’
24.transliteration: kulū wa-shrabū hanīʾan bi-mā ʾaslaftum fī l-ʾayyāmi l-khāliyati

25.content: وَأَمّا مَن أوتِيَ كِتابَهُ بِشِمالِهِ فَيَقولُ يا لَيتَني لَم أوتَ كِتابِيَه
25.translation_eng: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand,he will say, ‘I wish I had not been given my book,
25.transliteration: wa-ʾammā man ʾūtiya kitābahū bi-shimālihī fa-yaqūlu yā-laytanī lam ʾūta kitābiyah

26.content: وَلَم أَدرِ ما حِسابِيَه
26.translation_eng: nor had I ever known what my account is!
26.transliteration: wa-lam ʾadri mā ḥisābiyah

27.content: يا لَيتَها كانَتِ القاضِيَةَ
27.translation_eng: I wish death had been the end of it all!
27.transliteration: yā-laytahā kānati l-qāḍiyata

28.content: ما أَغنىٰ عَنّي مالِيَه ۜ
28.translation_eng: My wealth did not avail me.
28.transliteration: mā ʾaghnā ʿannī māliyah

29.content: هَلَكَ عَنّي سُلطانِيَه
29.translation_eng: My authority has departed from me.’
29.transliteration: halaka ʿannī sulṭāniyah

30.content: خُذوهُ فَغُلّوهُ
30.translation_eng: [The angels will be told:] ‘Seize him, and fetter him!
30.transliteration: khudhūhu fa-ghullūhu

31.content: ثُمَّ الجَحيمَ صَلّوهُ
31.translation_eng: Then put him into hell.
31.transliteration: thumma l-jaḥīma ṣallūhu

32.content: ثُمَّ في سِلسِلَةٍ ذَرعُها سَبعونَ ذِراعًا فَاسلُكوهُ
32.translation_eng: Then, in a chain whose length is seventy cubits,bind him.
32.transliteration: thumma fī silsilatin dharʿuhā sabʿūna dhirāʿan fa-slukūhu

33.content: إِنَّهُ كانَ لا يُؤمِنُ بِاللَّهِ العَظيمِ
33.translation_eng: Indeed he had no faith in Allah, the All-supreme,
33.transliteration: ʾinnahū kāna lā yuʾminu bi-llāhi l-ʿaẓīmi

34.content: وَلا يَحُضُّ عَلىٰ طَعامِ المِسكينِ
34.translation_eng: and he did not urge the feeding of the needy,
34.transliteration: wa-lā yaḥuḍḍu ʿalā ṭaʿāmi l-miskīni

35.content: فَلَيسَ لَهُ اليَومَ هاهُنا حَميمٌ
35.translation_eng: so he has no friend here today,
35.transliteration: fa-laysa lahu l-yawma hāhunā ḥamīmun

36.content: وَلا طَعامٌ إِلّا مِن غِسلينٍ
36.translation_eng: nor any food except pus,
36.transliteration: wa-lā ṭaʿāmun ʾillā min ghislīnin

37.content: لا يَأكُلُهُ إِلَّا الخاطِئونَ
37.translation_eng: which no one shall eat except the iniquitous.’
37.transliteration: lā yaʾkuluhū ʾillā l-khāṭiʾūna

38.content: فَلا أُقسِمُ بِما تُبصِرونَ
38.translation_eng: I swear by what you see
38.transliteration: fa-lā ʾuqsimu bi-mā tubṣirūna

39.content: وَما لا تُبصِرونَ
39.translation_eng: and what you do not see:
39.transliteration: wa-mā lā tubṣirūna

40.content: إِنَّهُ لَقَولُ رَسولٍ كَريمٍ
40.translation_eng: it is indeed the speech of a noble apostle,
40.transliteration: ʾinnahū la-qawlu rasūlin karīmin

41.content: وَما هُوَ بِقَولِ شاعِرٍ ۚ قَليلًا ما تُؤمِنونَ
41.translation_eng: and it is not the speech of a poet.Little is the faith that you have!
41.transliteration: wa-mā huwa bi-qawli shāʿirin qalīlan mā tuʾminūna

42.content: وَلا بِقَولِ كاهِنٍ ۚ قَليلًا ما تَذَكَّرونَ
42.translation_eng: Nor is it the speech of a soothsayer.Little is the admonition that you take!
42.transliteration: wa-lā bi-qawli kāhinin qalīlan mā tadhakkarūna

43.content: تَنزيلٌ مِن رَبِّ العالَمينَ
43.translation_eng: Gradually sent down from the Lord of all the worlds.
43.transliteration: tanzīlun min rabbi l-ʿālamīna

44.content: وَلَو تَقَوَّلَ عَلَينا بَعضَ الأَقاويلِ
44.translation_eng: Had he faked any sayings in Our name,
44.transliteration: wa-law taqawwala ʿalaynā baʿḍa l-ʾaqāwīli

45.content: لَأَخَذنا مِنهُ بِاليَمينِ
45.translation_eng: We would have surely seized him by the right hand
45.transliteration: la-ʾakhadhnā minhu bi-l-yamīni

46.content: ثُمَّ لَقَطَعنا مِنهُ الوَتينَ
46.translation_eng: and then cut off his aorta,
46.transliteration: thumma la-qaṭaʿnā minhu l-watīna

47.content: فَما مِنكُم مِن أَحَدٍ عَنهُ حاجِزينَ
47.translation_eng: and none of you could have held Us off from him.
47.transliteration: fa-mā minkum min ʾaḥadin ʿanhu ḥājizīna

48.content: وَإِنَّهُ لَتَذكِرَةٌ لِلمُتَّقينَ
48.translation_eng: Indeed it is a reminder for the Godwary.
48.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahū la-tadhkiratun li-l-muttaqīna

49.content: وَإِنّا لَنَعلَمُ أَنَّ مِنكُم مُكَذِّبينَ
49.translation_eng: Indeed We knowthat there are some among you who deny [it].
49.transliteration: wa-ʾinnā la-naʿlamu ʾanna minkum mukadhdhibīna

50.content: وَإِنَّهُ لَحَسرَةٌ عَلَى الكافِرينَ
50.translation_eng: And indeed it will be a [matter of] regretfor the faithless.
50.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahū la-ḥasratun ʿalā l-kāfirīna

51.content: وَإِنَّهُ لَحَقُّ اليَقينِ
51.translation_eng: It is indeed certain truth.
51.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahū la-ḥaqqu l-yaqīni

52.content: فَسَبِّح بِاسمِ رَبِّكَ العَظيمِ
52.translation_eng: So celebrate the Name of your Lord, the All-supreme.
52.transliteration: fa-sabbiḥ bi-smi rabbika l-ʿaẓīmi

70.description: The surah that proclaims God to be the Lord of the heavenly ascents, Lofty Stations, the points of rising from which the angels ascend to God. It takes is named after the phrase “of lofty stations” (dhi al-maʿārij) in verse 3. The surah describes the Day of Judgement (verse 8 .). One of the opponents of the Prophet challenged him to hasten the punishment they had been threatened with (verse 1), so the foolishness of the disbelievers in denying the Resurrection (verse 6) is exposed (verse 36 .). The people who will be granted the Garden are described (verse 22 .).The surah is also known as: Elevations, Staircases Upward, The Ascending Steps, The Heavenly Ascents, The Ladders, The Stairways, The Steps, The Ways of Ascent.

1.translation_eng: An asker asked for a punishment bound to befall

2.translation_eng: —which none can avert from the faithless—1Or ‘bound to befall the faithless—which none can avert—from Allah…’

3.content: مِنَ اللَّهِ ذِي المَعارِجِ
3.translation_eng: from Allah, Lord of the lofty stations.
3.transliteration: mina llāhi dhī l-maʿāriji

4.content: تَعرُجُ المَلائِكَةُ وَالرّوحُ إِلَيهِ في يَومٍ كانَ مِقدارُهُ خَمسينَ أَلفَ سَنَةٍ
4.translation_eng: The angels and the Spirit ascend to Himin a day whose span isfifty thousand years.
4.transliteration: taʿruju l-malāʾikatu wa-r-rūḥu ʾilayhi fī yawmin kāna miqdāruhū khamsīna ʾalfa sanatin

5.content: فَاصبِر صَبرًا جَميلًا
5.translation_eng: So be patient, with a patience that is graceful.
5.transliteration: fa-ṣbir ṣabran jamīlan

6.content: إِنَّهُم يَرَونَهُ بَعيدًا
6.translation_eng: Indeed they see it to be far off,
6.transliteration: ʾinnahum yarawnahū baʿīdan

7.content: وَنَراهُ قَريبًا
7.translation_eng: and We see it to be near.
7.transliteration: wa-narāhu qarīban

8.content: يَومَ تَكونُ السَّماءُ كَالمُهلِ
8.translation_eng: The day when the sky will be like molten copper,
8.transliteration: yawma takūnu s-samāʾu ka-l-muhli

9.content: وَتَكونُ الجِبالُ كَالعِهنِ
9.translation_eng: and the mountains like [tufts of] dyed wool,
9.transliteration: wa-takūnu l-jibālu ka-l-ʿihni

10.content: وَلا يَسأَلُ حَميمٌ حَميمًا
10.translation_eng: and no friend will inquireabout [the welfare of his] friend,
10.transliteration: wa-lā yasʾalu ḥamīmun ḥamīman

11.content: يُبَصَّرونَهُم ۚ يَوَدُّ المُجرِمُ لَو يَفتَدي مِن عَذابِ يَومِئِذٍ بِبَنيهِ
11.translation_eng: [though] they will be placed within each other’s sight.The guilty one will wish he could ransom himselffrom the punishment of that dayat the price of his children,
11.transliteration: yubaṣṣarūnahum yawaddu l-mujrimu law yaftadī min ʿadhābi yawmiʾidhin bi-banīhi

12.content: وَصاحِبَتِهِ وَأَخيهِ
12.translation_eng: his spouse and his brother,
12.transliteration: wa-ṣāḥibatihī wa-ʾakhīhi

13.content: وَفَصيلَتِهِ الَّتي تُؤويهِ
13.translation_eng: his kin which had sheltered him
13.transliteration: wa-faṣīlatihi llatī tuʾwīhi

14.content: وَمَن فِي الأَرضِ جَميعًا ثُمَّ يُنجيهِ
14.translation_eng: and all those who are upon the earth,if that might deliver him.
14.transliteration: wa-man fī l-ʾarḍi jamīʿan thumma yunjīhi

15.content: كَلّا ۖ إِنَّها لَظىٰ
15.translation_eng: Never! Indeed it is a blazing fire,
15.transliteration: kallā ʾinnahā laẓā

16.content: نَزّاعَةً لِلشَّوىٰ
16.translation_eng: which strips away the scalp.
16.transliteration: nazzāʿatan li-sh-shawā

17.content: تَدعو مَن أَدبَرَ وَتَوَلّىٰ
17.translation_eng: It invites him who has turned back [from the truth]and forsaken [it],
17.transliteration: tadʿū man ʾadbara wa-tawallā

18.content: وَجَمَعَ فَأَوعىٰ
18.translation_eng: amassing [wealth] and hoarding [it].
18.transliteration: wa-jamaʿa fa-ʾawʿā

19.content: ۞ إِنَّ الإِنسانَ خُلِقَ هَلوعًا
19.translation_eng: Indeed man has been created covetous:
19.transliteration: ʾinna l-ʾinsāna khuliqa halūʿan

20.content: إِذا مَسَّهُ الشَّرُّ جَزوعًا
20.translation_eng: anxious when an ill befalls him
20.transliteration: ʾidhā massahu sh-sharru jazūʿan

21.content: وَإِذا مَسَّهُ الخَيرُ مَنوعًا
21.translation_eng: and grudging when good comes his way
21.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā massahu l-khayru manūʿan

22.content: إِلَّا المُصَلّينَ
22.translation_eng: —[all are such] except the prayerful,
22.transliteration: ʾillā l-muṣallīna

23.content: الَّذينَ هُم عَلىٰ صَلاتِهِم دائِمونَ
23.translation_eng: those who are persevering in their prayers
23.transliteration: alladhīna hum ʿalā ṣalātihim dāʾimūna

24.content: وَالَّذينَ في أَموالِهِم حَقٌّ مَعلومٌ
24.translation_eng: and in whose wealth there is a known right
24.transliteration: wa-lladhīna fī ʾamwālihim ḥaqqun maʿlūmun

25.content: لِلسّائِلِ وَالمَحرومِ
25.translation_eng: for the beggar and the deprived,
25.transliteration: li-s-sāʾili wa-l-maḥrūmi

26.content: وَالَّذينَ يُصَدِّقونَ بِيَومِ الدّينِ
26.translation_eng: and who affirm the Day of Retribution,
26.transliteration: wa-lladhīna yuṣaddiqūna bi-yawmi d-dīni

27.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم مِن عَذابِ رَبِّهِم مُشفِقونَ
27.translation_eng: and those who areapprehensive of the punishment of their Lord
27.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum min ʿadhābi rabbihim mushfiqūna

28.content: إِنَّ عَذابَ رَبِّهِم غَيرُ مَأمونٍ
28.translation_eng: (there is indeedno security from the punishment of their Lord)
28.transliteration: ʾinna ʿadhāba rabbihim ghayru maʾmūnin

29.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم لِفُروجِهِم حافِظونَ
29.translation_eng: and those who guard their private parts
29.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum li-furūjihim ḥāfiẓūna

30.content: إِلّا عَلىٰ أَزواجِهِم أَو ما مَلَكَت أَيمانُهُم فَإِنَّهُم غَيرُ مَلومينَ
30.translation_eng: (except from their spouses and their slave women,for then they are not blameworthy;
30.transliteration: illā ʿalā ʾazwājihim ʾaw mā malakat ʾaymānuhum fa-ʾinnahum ghayru malūmīna

31.content: فَمَنِ ابتَغىٰ وَراءَ ذٰلِكَ فَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ العادونَ
31.translation_eng: but whoever seeks beyond that—it is they who are the transgressors)
31.transliteration: fa-mani btaghā warāʾa dhālika fa-ʾulāʾika humu l-ʿādūna

32.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم لِأَماناتِهِم وَعَهدِهِم راعونَ
32.translation_eng: and those who keep their trusts and covenants,
32.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum li-ʾamānātihim wa-ʿahdihim rāʿūna

33.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم بِشَهاداتِهِم قائِمونَ
33.translation_eng: and those who are observant of their testimonies,
33.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum bi-shahādātihim qāʾimūna

34.content: وَالَّذينَ هُم عَلىٰ صَلاتِهِم يُحافِظونَ
34.translation_eng: and those who are watchful of their prayers.
34.transliteration: wa-lladhīna hum ʿalā ṣalātihim yuḥāfiẓūna

35.content: أُولٰئِكَ في جَنّاتٍ مُكرَمونَ
35.translation_eng: They will be in gardens, held in honour.
35.transliteration: ʾulāʾika fī jannātin mukramūna

36.content: فَمالِ الَّذينَ كَفَروا قِبَلَكَ مُهطِعينَ
36.translation_eng: What is the matter with the faithlessthat they scramble toward you
36.transliteration: fa-mā-li lladhīna kafarū qibalaka muhṭiʿīna

37.content: عَنِ اليَمينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمالِ عِزينَ
37.translation_eng: from the left and the right in batches?
37.transliteration: ʿani l-yamīni wa-ʿani sh-shimāli ʿizīna

38.content: أَيَطمَعُ كُلُّ امرِئٍ مِنهُم أَن يُدخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعيمٍ
38.translation_eng: Does each man among them hopeto enter the garden of bliss?
38.transliteration: ʾa-yaṭmaʿu kullu mriʾin minhum ʾan yudkhala jannata naʿīmin

39.content: كَلّا ۖ إِنّا خَلَقناهُم مِمّا يَعلَمونَ
39.translation_eng: Never!Indeed We created them from what they know.1That is, from a drop of sperm.
39.transliteration: kallā ʾinnā khalaqnāhum mimmā yaʿlamūna

40.content: فَلا أُقسِمُ بِرَبِّ المَشارِقِ وَالمَغارِبِ إِنّا لَقادِرونَ
40.translation_eng: So I swear by the Lord of the easts and the weststhat We are able
40.transliteration: fa-lā ʾuqsimu bi-rabbi l-mashāriqi wa-l-maghāribi ʾinnā la-qādirūna

41.content: عَلىٰ أَن نُبَدِّلَ خَيرًا مِنهُم وَما نَحنُ بِمَسبوقينَ
41.translation_eng: to replace them by [others] better than themand We are not to be outmaneuvered.
41.transliteration: ʿalā ʾan nubaddila khayran minhum wa-mā naḥnu bi-masbūqīna

42.content: فَذَرهُم يَخوضوا وَيَلعَبوا حَتّىٰ يُلاقوا يَومَهُمُ الَّذي يوعَدونَ
42.translation_eng: So leave them to gossip and playuntil they encounter their day,which they are promised:
42.transliteration: fa-dharhum yakhūḍū wa-yalʿabū ḥattā yulāqū yawmahumu lladhī yūʿadūna

43.content: يَومَ يَخرُجونَ مِنَ الأَجداثِ سِراعًا كَأَنَّهُم إِلىٰ نُصُبٍ يوفِضونَ
43.translation_eng: the day when they emerge from the graves,hastening,as if racing toward a target,
43.transliteration: yawma yakhrujūna mina l-ʾajdāthi sirāʿan ka-ʾannahum ʾilā nuṣubin yūfiḍūna

44.content: خاشِعَةً أَبصارُهُم تَرهَقُهُم ذِلَّةٌ ۚ ذٰلِكَ اليَومُ الَّذي كانوا يوعَدونَ
44.translation_eng: with a humbled look [in their eyes],overcast by abasement.That is the day they had been promised.
44.transliteration: khāshiʿatan ʾabṣāruhum tarhaquhum dhillatun dhālika l-yawmu lladhī kānū yūʿadūna

71.description: That surah that opens with the story of the ancient Prophet Noah, the unrelenting Messenger of Resolve, and his obstinately unbelieving people. It is named after Noah (Nūḥ) whose account is related in the surah and further gives details of the life of Noah before the Flood, to encourage the Prophet and warn the disbelievers.

1.content: إِنّا أَرسَلنا نوحًا إِلىٰ قَومِهِ أَن أَنذِر قَومَكَ مِن قَبلِ أَن يَأتِيَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
1.translation_eng: Indeed We sent Noah to his people,[saying,] ‘Warn your peoplebefore a painful punishment overtakes them.’
1.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾarsalnā nūḥan ʾilā qawmihī ʾan ʾandhir qawmaka min qabli ʾan yaʾtiyahum ʿadhābun ʾalīmun

2.content: قالَ يا قَومِ إِنّي لَكُم نَذيرٌ مُبينٌ
2.translation_eng: He said, ‘O my people!Indeed I am a manifest warner to you.
2.transliteration: qāla yā-qawmi ʾinnī lakum nadhīrun mubīnun

3.content: أَنِ اعبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَاتَّقوهُ وَأَطيعونِ
3.translation_eng: Worship Allah and be wary of Him,and obey me,
3.transliteration: ʾani ʿbudū llāha wa-ttaqūhu wa-ʾaṭīʿūni

4.content: يَغفِر لَكُم مِن ذُنوبِكُم وَيُؤَخِّركُم إِلىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ اللَّهِ إِذا جاءَ لا يُؤَخَّرُ ۖ لَو كُنتُم تَعلَمونَ
4.translation_eng: that He may forgive you some of your sinsand respite you until a specified time.Indeed when Allah’s [appointed] time comes,it cannot be deferred,should you know.’
4.transliteration: yaghfir lakum min dhunūbikum wa-yuʾakhkhirkum ʾilā ʾajalin musamman ʾinna ʾajala llāhi ʾidhā jāʾa lā yuʾakhkharu law kuntum taʿlamūna

5.content: قالَ رَبِّ إِنّي دَعَوتُ قَومي لَيلًا وَنَهارًا
5.translation_eng: He said, ‘My Lord!Indeed I have summoned my people night and day
5.transliteration: qāla rabbi ʾinnī daʿawtu qawmī laylan wa-nahāran

6.content: فَلَم يَزِدهُم دُعائي إِلّا فِرارًا
6.translation_eng: but my summons only increases their evasion.
6.transliteration: fa-lam yazidhum duʿāʾī ʾillā firāran

7.content: وَإِنّي كُلَّما دَعَوتُهُم لِتَغفِرَ لَهُم جَعَلوا أَصابِعَهُم في آذانِهِم وَاستَغشَوا ثِيابَهُم وَأَصَرّوا وَاستَكبَرُوا استِكبارًا
7.translation_eng: Indeed whenever I have summoned them,so that You might forgive them,they would put their fingers into their earsand draw their cloaks over their heads,and they were persistent [in their unfaith],and disdainful in [their] arrogance.
7.transliteration: wa-ʾinnī kullamā daʿawtuhum li-taghfira lahum jaʿalū ʾaṣābiʿahum fī ʾādhānihim wa-staghshaw thiyābahum wa-ʾaṣarrū wa-stakbarū stikbāran

8.content: ثُمَّ إِنّي دَعَوتُهُم جِهارًا
8.translation_eng: Again I summoned them aloud,
8.transliteration: thumma ʾinnī daʿawtuhum jihāran

9.content: ثُمَّ إِنّي أَعلَنتُ لَهُم وَأَسرَرتُ لَهُم إِسرارًا
9.translation_eng: and again appealed to them publiclyand confided with them privately,
9.transliteration: thumma ʾinnī ʾaʿlantu lahum wa-ʾasrartu lahum ʾisrāran

10.content: فَقُلتُ استَغفِروا رَبَّكُم إِنَّهُ كانَ غَفّارًا
10.translation_eng: telling [them]: “Plead to your Lord for forgiveness.Indeed He is all-forgiver.
10.transliteration: fa-qultu staghfirū rabbakum ʾinnahū kāna ghaffāran

11.content: يُرسِلِ السَّماءَ عَلَيكُم مِدرارًا
11.translation_eng: He will send for you abundant rains from the sky,
11.transliteration: yursili s-samāʾa ʿalaykum midrāran

12.content: وَيُمدِدكُم بِأَموالٍ وَبَنينَ وَيَجعَل لَكُم جَنّاتٍ وَيَجعَل لَكُم أَنهارًا
12.translation_eng: and aid you with wealth and sons,and provide you with gardensand provide you with streams.
12.transliteration: wa-yumdidkum bi-ʾamwālin wa-banīna wa-yajʿal lakum jannātin wa-yajʿal lakum ʾanhāran

13.content: ما لَكُم لا تَرجونَ لِلَّهِ وَقارًا
13.translation_eng: What is the matter with youthat you do not look upon Allah with veneration,
13.transliteration: mā lakum lā tarjūna li-llāhi waqāran

14.content: وَقَد خَلَقَكُم أَطوارًا
14.translation_eng: though He has created you in [various] stages?
14.transliteration: wa-qad khalaqakum ʾaṭwāran

15.content: أَلَم تَرَوا كَيفَ خَلَقَ اللَّهُ سَبعَ سَماواتٍ طِباقًا
15.translation_eng: Have you not seen how Allah has createdseven heavens in layers,
15.transliteration: ʾa-lam taraw kayfa khalaqa llāhu sabʿa samāwātin ṭibāqan

16.content: وَجَعَلَ القَمَرَ فيهِنَّ نورًا وَجَعَلَ الشَّمسَ سِراجًا
16.translation_eng: and has made therein the moon for a light,and the sun for a lamp?
16.transliteration: wa-jaʿala l-qamara fīhinna nūran wa-jaʿala sh-shamsa sirājan

17.content: وَاللَّهُ أَنبَتَكُم مِنَ الأَرضِ نَباتًا
17.translation_eng: Allah made you grow from the earth,with a [vegetable] growth.
17.transliteration: wa-llāhu ʾanbatakum mina l-ʾarḍi nabātan

18.content: ثُمَّ يُعيدُكُم فيها وَيُخرِجُكُم إِخراجًا
18.translation_eng: Then He makes you return to it,and He will bring you forth [without fail].
18.transliteration: thumma yuʿīdukum fīhā wa-yukhrijukum ʾikhrājan

19.content: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الأَرضَ بِساطًا
19.translation_eng: Allah has made the earth a vast expanse for you
19.transliteration: wa-llāhu jaʿala lakumu l-ʾarḍa bisāṭan

20.content: لِتَسلُكوا مِنها سُبُلًا فِجاجًا
20.translation_eng: so that you may travel over its spacious ways.” ’
20.transliteration: li-taslukū minhā subulan fijājan

21.content: قالَ نوحٌ رَبِّ إِنَّهُم عَصَوني وَاتَّبَعوا مَن لَم يَزِدهُ مالُهُ وَوَلَدُهُ إِلّا خَسارًا
21.translation_eng: Noah said, ‘My Lord!They have disobeyed me,following someonewhose wealth and children only add to his loss,
