21.transliteration: qāla nūḥun rabbi ʾinnahum ʿaṣawnī wa-ttabaʿū man lam yazidhu māluhū wa-waladuhū ʾillā khasāran

22.content: وَمَكَروا مَكرًا كُبّارًا
22.translation_eng: and they have devised an outrageous plot.
22.transliteration: wa-makarū makran kubbāran

23.content: وَقالوا لا تَذَرُنَّ آلِهَتَكُم وَلا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلا سُواعًا وَلا يَغوثَ وَيَعوقَ وَنَسرًا
23.translation_eng: They say, “Do not abandon your gods.Do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwā,nor Yaghūth, Yaʿūq and Nasr,”1Names of Babylonian gods worshipped by the polytheists.
23.transliteration: wa-qālū lā tadharunna ʾālihatakum wa-lā tadharunna waddan wa-lā suwāʿan wa-lā yaghūtha wa-yaʿūqa wa-nasran

24.content: وَقَد أَضَلّوا كَثيرًا ۖ وَلا تَزِدِ الظّالِمينَ إِلّا ضَلالًا
24.translation_eng: and already they have led many astray.Do not increase the wrongdoers in anything but error.’
24.transliteration: wa-qad ʾaḍallū kathīran wa-lā tazidi ẓ-ẓālimīna ʾillā ḍalālan

25.content: مِمّا خَطيئَاتِهِم أُغرِقوا فَأُدخِلوا نارًا فَلَم يَجِدوا لَهُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ أَنصارًا
25.translation_eng: They were drowned because of their iniquities,then made to enter a Fire,and they did not find for themselvesany helpers besides Allah.
25.transliteration: mimmā khaṭīʾātihim ʾughriqū fa-ʾudkhilū nāran fa-lam yajidū lahum min dūni llāhi ʾanṣāran

26.content: وَقالَ نوحٌ رَبِّ لا تَذَر عَلَى الأَرضِ مِنَ الكافِرينَ دَيّارًا
26.translation_eng: And Noah said, ‘My Lord!‘Do not leave on the earthany inhabitant from among the faithless.
26.transliteration: wa-qāla nūḥun rabbi lā tadhar ʿalā l-ʾarḍi mina l-kāfirīna dayyāran

27.content: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرهُم يُضِلّوا عِبادَكَ وَلا يَلِدوا إِلّا فاجِرًا كَفّارًا
27.translation_eng: If You leave them, they will lead astray Your servantsand will not beget except vicious ingrates.
27.transliteration: ʾinnaka ʾin tadharhum yuḍillū ʿibādaka wa-lā yalidū ʾillā fājiran kaffāran

28.content: رَبِّ اغفِر لي وَلِوالِدَيَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيتِيَ مُؤمِنًا وَلِلمُؤمِنينَ وَالمُؤمِناتِ وَلا تَزِدِ الظّالِمينَ إِلّا تَبارًا
28.translation_eng: My Lord! Forgive me and my parents,and whoever enters my house in faith,and the faithful men and women,and do not increase the wrongdoers in anythingexcept ruin.’
28.transliteration: rabbi ghfir lī wa-li-wālidayya wa-li-man dakhala baytiya muʾminan wa-li-l-muʾminīna wa-l-muʾmināti wa-lā tazidi ẓ-ẓālimīna ʾillā tabāran

72.description: The surah that opens with the revelation that a group of The Jinn listened to the Prophet reciting the Quran, believed in it, and so admonished their own race. It is names after the jinn-kind, whose account is given in its first part. The surah begins with the account of what a group of jinn said when they overheard a recitation of the Quran and realized its truth (verse 1 .). This is a lesson to the Meccan Arabs, who are also told that the Prophet can help them only by delivering the Message—God is the All Powerful One (verse 16 .). The disbelievers are threatened with what they will meet on the Day of Judgement (verse 23 ).The surah is also known as: Jinn-kind, Sprites, The Jinn's, The Spirits.

1.content: قُل أوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ استَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِنَ الجِنِّ فَقالوا إِنّا سَمِعنا قُرآنًا عَجَبًا
1.translation_eng: Say, ‘It has been revealed to methat a team of the jinn listened [to the Qurʾān].’and they said, “Indeed we heard a wounderful qurʾān,1Or ‘recital.’
1.transliteration: qul ʾūḥiya ʾilayya ʾannahu stamaʿa nafarun mina l-jinni fa-qālū ʾinnā samiʿnā qurʾānan ʿajaban

2.content: يَهدي إِلَى الرُّشدِ فَآمَنّا بِهِ ۖ وَلَن نُشرِكَ بِرَبِّنا أَحَدًا
2.translation_eng: which guides to rectitude.Hence we have believed in itand we will never ascribe any partner to our Lord.
2.transliteration: yahdī ʾilā r-rushdi fa-ʾāmannā bihī wa-lan nushrika bi-rabbinā ʾaḥadan

3.content: وَأَنَّهُ تَعالىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنا مَا اتَّخَذَ صاحِبَةً وَلا وَلَدًا
3.translation_eng: Exalted be the majesty of our Lord,He has taken neither any spouse nor son.
3.transliteration: wa-ʾannahū taʿālā jaddu rabbinā mā ttakhadha ṣāḥibatan wa-lā waladan

4.content: وَأَنَّهُ كانَ يَقولُ سَفيهُنا عَلَى اللَّهِ شَطَطًا
4.translation_eng: Indeed the foolish ones among us used to utteratrocious lies concerning Allah.
4.transliteration: wa-ʾannahū kāna yaqūlu safīhunā ʿalā llāhi shaṭaṭan

5.content: وَأَنّا ظَنَنّا أَن لَن تَقولَ الإِنسُ وَالجِنُّ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا
5.translation_eng: Indeed we thoughtthat humans and jinn would never utterany falsehood concerning Allah.
5.transliteration: wa-ʾannā ẓanannā ʾan lan taqūla l-ʾinsu wa-l-jinnu ʿalā llāhi kadhiban

6.content: وَأَنَّهُ كانَ رِجالٌ مِنَ الإِنسِ يَعوذونَ بِرِجالٍ مِنَ الجِنِّ فَزادوهُم رَهَقًا
6.translation_eng: Indeed some persons from the humanswould seek the protection of some persons from the jinn,thus only adding to their rebellion.
6.transliteration: wa-ʾannahū kāna rijālun mina l-ʾinsi yaʿūdhūna bi-rijālin mina l-jinni fa-zādūhum rahaqan

7.content: وَأَنَّهُم ظَنّوا كَما ظَنَنتُم أَن لَن يَبعَثَ اللَّهُ أَحَدًا
7.translation_eng: They1 thought, just as you think,that Allah will not raise anyone from the dead.That is, the humans who invoked the protection of jinns.
7.transliteration: wa-ʾannahum ẓannū ka-mā ẓanantum ʾan lan yabʿatha llāhu ʾaḥadan

8.content: وَأَنّا لَمَسنَا السَّماءَ فَوَجَدناها مُلِئَت حَرَسًا شَديدًا وَشُهُبًا
8.translation_eng: Indeed We made for the heavenand found itfull of mighty sentries and flames.1Or ‘meteors.’
8.transliteration: wa-ʾannā lamasnā s-samāʾa fa-wajadnāhā muliʾat ḥarasan shadīdan wa-shuhuban

9.content: وَأَنّا كُنّا نَقعُدُ مِنها مَقاعِدَ لِلسَّمعِ ۖ فَمَن يَستَمِعِ الآنَ يَجِد لَهُ شِهابًا رَصَدًا
9.translation_eng: We used to sit in its positions to eavesdrop,but anyone listening nowfinds a flame waiting for him.
9.transliteration: wa-ʾannā kunnā naqʿudu minhā maqāʿida li-s-samʿi fa-man yastamiʿi l-ʾāna yajid lahū shihāban raṣadan

10.content: وَأَنّا لا نَدري أَشَرٌّ أُريدَ بِمَن فِي الأَرضِ أَم أَرادَ بِهِم رَبُّهُم رَشَدًا
10.translation_eng: We do not know whether ill is intendedfor those who are in the earth,or whether their Lord intends good for them.
10.transliteration: wa-ʾannā lā nadrī ʾa-sharrun ʾurīda bi-man fī l-ʾarḍi ʾam ʾarāda bihim rabbuhum rashadan

11.content: وَأَنّا مِنَّا الصّالِحونَ وَمِنّا دونَ ذٰلِكَ ۖ كُنّا طَرائِقَ قِدَدًا
11.translation_eng: Among us some are righteousand some of us are otherwise:we are multifarious sects.
11.transliteration: wa-ʾannā minnā ṣ-ṣāliḥūna wa-minnā dūna dhālika kunnā ṭarāʾiqa qidadan

12.content: وَأَنّا ظَنَنّا أَن لَن نُعجِزَ اللَّهَ فِي الأَرضِ وَلَن نُعجِزَهُ هَرَبًا
12.translation_eng: We know that we cannot thwart Allahon the earth,nor can we thwart Him by fleeing.
12.transliteration: wa-ʾannā ẓanannā ʾan lan nuʿjiza llāha fī l-ʾarḍi wa-lan nuʿjizahū haraban

13.content: وَأَنّا لَمّا سَمِعنَا الهُدىٰ آمَنّا بِهِ ۖ فَمَن يُؤمِن بِرَبِّهِ فَلا يَخافُ بَخسًا وَلا رَهَقًا
13.translation_eng: When we heard the [message of] guidance,we believed in it.Whoever that has faith in his Lordshall neither fear any detraction nor oppression.
13.transliteration: wa-ʾannā lammā samiʿnā l-hudā ʾāmannā bihī fa-man yuʾmin bi-rabbihī fa-lā yakhāfu bakhsan wa-lā rahaqan

14.content: وَأَنّا مِنَّا المُسلِمونَ وَمِنَّا القاسِطونَ ۖ فَمَن أَسلَمَ فَأُولٰئِكَ تَحَرَّوا رَشَدًا
14.translation_eng: Among us some are muslimsand some of us are perverse.1Yet those who submit [to Allah]—it is they who pursue rectitude.Or ‘unjust.’
14.transliteration: wa-ʾannā minnā l-muslimūna wa-minnā l-qāsiṭūna fa-man ʾaslama fa-ʾulāʾika taḥarraw rashadan

15.content: وَأَمَّا القاسِطونَ فَكانوا لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا
15.translation_eng: As for the perverse,they will be firewood for hell.” ’
15.transliteration: wa-ʾammā l-qāsiṭūna fa-kānū li-jahannama ḥaṭaban

16.content: وَأَن لَوِ استَقاموا عَلَى الطَّريقَةِ لَأَسقَيناهُم ماءً غَدَقًا
16.translation_eng: If they are steadfast on the path [of Allah],We shall provide them with abundant water,
16.transliteration: wa-ʾallawi staqāmū ʿalā ṭ-ṭarīqati la-ʾasqaynāhum māʾan ghadaqan

17.content: لِنَفتِنَهُم فيهِ ۚ وَمَن يُعرِض عَن ذِكرِ رَبِّهِ يَسلُكهُ عَذابًا صَعَدًا
17.translation_eng: so that We may test them therein,and whoever turns awayfrom the remembrance of his Lord,He will let him into an escalating punishment.
17.transliteration: li-naftinahum fīhi wa-man yuʿriḍ ʿan dhikri rabbihī yaslukhu ʿadhāban ṣaʿadan

18.content: وَأَنَّ المَساجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلا تَدعوا مَعَ اللَّهِ أَحَدًا
18.translation_eng: The places of worship belong to Allah,so do not invoke anyone along with Allah.
18.transliteration: wa-ʾanna l-masājida li-llāhi fa-lā tadʿū maʿa llāhi ʾaḥadan

19.content: وَأَنَّهُ لَمّا قامَ عَبدُ اللَّهِ يَدعوهُ كادوا يَكونونَ عَلَيهِ لِبَدًا
19.translation_eng: When the servant of Allah1 rose to pray to Him,they almost crowded around him.That is, the Prophet.
19.transliteration: wa-ʾannahū lammā qāma ʿabdu llāhi yadʿūhu kādū yakūnūna ʿalayhi libadan

20.content: قُل إِنَّما أَدعو رَبّي وَلا أُشرِكُ بِهِ أَحَدًا
20.translation_eng: Say, ‘I pray only to my Lord,and I do not ascribe any partner to Him.’
20.transliteration: qul ʾinnamā ʾadʿū rabbī wa-lā ʾushriku bihī ʾaḥadan

21.content: قُل إِنّي لا أَملِكُ لَكُم ضَرًّا وَلا رَشَدًا
21.translation_eng: Say, ‘I have no power to bring you any harmor good [of my own accord].’
21.transliteration: qul ʾinnī lā ʾamliku lakum ḍarran wa-lā rashadan

22.content: قُل إِنّي لَن يُجيرَني مِنَ اللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَن أَجِدَ مِن دونِهِ مُلتَحَدًا
22.translation_eng: Say, ‘Neither can anyone shelter me from Allah,nor can I find any refuge besides Him.
22.transliteration: qul ʾinnī lan yujīranī mina llāhi ʾaḥadun wa-lan ʾajida min dūnihī multaḥadan

23.content: إِلّا بَلاغًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِسالاتِهِ ۚ وَمَن يَعصِ اللَّهَ وَرَسولَهُ فَإِنَّ لَهُ نارَ جَهَنَّمَ خالِدينَ فيها أَبَدًا
23.translation_eng: [I have no duty] except to transmit from Allah,and [to communicate] His messages;and whoever disobeys Allah and His apostle,indeed there will be for him the fire of hell,to remain in it forever.’
23.transliteration: ʾillā balāghan mina llāhi wa-risālātihī wa-man yaʿṣi llāha wa-rasūlahū fa-ʾinna lahū nāra jahannama khālidīna fīhā ʾabadan

24.content: حَتّىٰ إِذا رَأَوا ما يوعَدونَ فَسَيَعلَمونَ مَن أَضعَفُ ناصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا
24.translation_eng: When they see what they are promised,they will then know who is weaker in supportersand fewer in numbers.
24.transliteration: ḥattā ʾidhā raʾaw mā yūʿadūna fa-sa-yaʿlamūna man ʾaḍʿafu nāṣiran wa-ʾaqallu ʿadadan

25.content: قُل إِن أَدري أَقَريبٌ ما توعَدونَ أَم يَجعَلُ لَهُ رَبّي أَمَدًا
25.translation_eng: Say, ‘I do not know if what you are promised is near,or if my Lord has set a term for it.’
25.transliteration: qul ʾin ʾadrī ʾa-qarībun mā tūʿadūna ʾam yajʿalu lahū rabbī ʾamadan

26.content: عالِمُ الغَيبِ فَلا يُظهِرُ عَلىٰ غَيبِهِ أَحَدًا
26.translation_eng: Knower of the Unseen,He does not disclose His Unseen to anyone,
26.transliteration: ʿālimu l-ghaybi fa-lā yuẓhiru ʿalā ghaybihī ʾaḥadan

27.content: إِلّا مَنِ ارتَضىٰ مِن رَسولٍ فَإِنَّهُ يَسلُكُ مِن بَينِ يَدَيهِ وَمِن خَلفِهِ رَصَدًا
27.translation_eng: except to an apostle He approves of.Then He dispatchesa sentinel before and behind him
27.transliteration: ʾillā mani rtaḍā min rasūlin fa-ʾinnahū yasluku min bayni yadayhi wa-min khalfihī raṣadan

28.content: لِيَعلَمَ أَن قَد أَبلَغوا رِسالاتِ رَبِّهِم وَأَحاطَ بِما لَدَيهِم وَأَحصىٰ كُلَّ شَيءٍ عَدَدًا
28.translation_eng: so that He may ascertainthat they have communicatedthe messages of their Lord,and He comprehends all that is with them,and He keeps count of all things.
28.transliteration: li-yaʿlama ʾan qad ʾablaghū risālāti rabbihim wa-ʾaḥāṭa bi-mā ladayhim wa-ʾaḥṣā kulla shayʾin ʿadadan

73.description: The surah that opens by addressing the mantled Prophet as the Enwrapped Messenger. It takes its name from the word “wrapped in mantle” (muzzammil) in verse 1. The surah describes how God relaxed the early regime of devotion first imposed on the Prophet (verse 1 .) to prepare him for the weighty message. The Prophet is urged to be patient (verse 10 .), told of the punishment that awaits the disbelievers in Hell (verse 12 .), and reminded of the punishment that befell Pharaoh in this life (verse 15 .).The surah is also known as: Bundled up, Enfolded, Folded in Garments, The Enwrapped Messenger, The Enwrapped One, The Mantled One, Wrapped in Mantle.

1.translation_eng: O you wrapped up in your mantle!

2.translation_eng: Stand vigil through the night, except a little,

3.content: نِصفَهُ أَوِ انقُص مِنهُ قَليلًا
3.translation_eng: a half, or reduce a little from that
3.transliteration: niṣfahū ʾawi nquṣ minhu qalīlan

4.content: أَو زِد عَلَيهِ وَرَتِّلِ القُرآنَ تَرتيلًا
4.translation_eng: or add to it,and recite the Qurʾān in a measured tone.
4.transliteration: ʾaw zid ʿalayhi wa-rattili l-qurʾāna tartīlan

5.content: إِنّا سَنُلقي عَلَيكَ قَولًا ثَقيلًا
5.translation_eng: Indeed soon We shall cast on you a weighty word.
5.transliteration: ʾinnā sa-nulqī ʿalayka qawlan thaqīlan

6.content: إِنَّ ناشِئَةَ اللَّيلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطئًا وَأَقوَمُ قيلًا
6.translation_eng: Indeed the watch of the night is firmer in treadand more upright in respect to speech,
6.transliteration: ʾinna nāshiʾata l-layli hiya ʾashaddu waṭʾan wa-ʾaqwamu qīlan

7.content: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي النَّهارِ سَبحًا طَويلًا
7.translation_eng: for indeed during the day you havedrawn-out engagements.
7.transliteration: ʾinna laka fī n-nahāri sabḥan ṭawīlan

8.content: وَاذكُرِ اسمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّل إِلَيهِ تَبتيلًا
8.translation_eng: So celebrate the Name of your Lordand dedicate yourself to Him with total dedication.1Or ‘supplicate with your forefinger pointed towards heaven’ (see al-Tafsīr al-Burhān for traditions relating to tabattul).
8.transliteration: wa-dhkuri sma rabbika wa-tabattal ʾilayhi tabtīlan

9.content: رَبُّ المَشرِقِ وَالمَغرِبِ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ فَاتَّخِذهُ وَكيلًا
9.translation_eng: Lord of the east and the west,there is no god except Him,so take Him for your trustee,
9.transliteration: rabbu l-mashriqi wa-l-maghribi lā ʾilāha ʾillā huwa fa-ttakhidhhu wakīlan

10.content: وَاصبِر عَلىٰ ما يَقولونَ وَاهجُرهُم هَجرًا جَميلًا
10.translation_eng: and be patient over what they say,and keep away from them in a graceful manner.
10.transliteration: wa-sbir ʿalā mā yaqūlūna wa-hjurhum hajran jamīlan

11.content: وَذَرني وَالمُكَذِّبينَ أُولِي النَّعمَةِ وَمَهِّلهُم قَليلًا
11.translation_eng: Leave Me [to deal] with the deniers, the opulent,and give them a little respite.
11.transliteration: wa-dharnī wa-l-mukadhdhibīna ʾulī n-naʿmati wa-mahhilhum qalīlan

12.content: إِنَّ لَدَينا أَنكالًا وَجَحيمًا
12.translation_eng: Indeed with Us are heavy fetters and a fierce fire,
12.transliteration: ʾinna ladaynā ʾankālan wa-jaḥīman

13.content: وَطَعامًا ذا غُصَّةٍ وَعَذابًا أَليمًا
13.translation_eng: and a food that chokes [those who gulp it],and a painful punishment [prepared for]
13.transliteration: wa-ṭaʿāman dhā ghuṣṣatin wa-ʿadhāban ʾalīman

14.content: يَومَ تَرجُفُ الأَرضُ وَالجِبالُ وَكانَتِ الجِبالُ كَثيبًا مَهيلًا
14.translation_eng: the day when the earth and the mountains will quake,and the mountains will be like dunes of shifting sand.
14.transliteration: yawma tarjufu l-ʾarḍu wa-l-jibālu wa-kānati l-jibālu kathīban mahīlan

15.content: إِنّا أَرسَلنا إِلَيكُم رَسولًا شاهِدًا عَلَيكُم كَما أَرسَلنا إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ رَسولًا
15.translation_eng: Indeed We have sent to you an apostle,to be a witness to you,just as We sent an apostle to Pharaoh.
15.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾarsalnā ʾilaykum rasūlan shāhidan ʿalaykum ka-mā ʾarsalnā ʾilā firʿawna rasūlan

16.content: فَعَصىٰ فِرعَونُ الرَّسولَ فَأَخَذناهُ أَخذًا وَبيلًا
16.translation_eng: But Pharaoh disobeyed the apostle;so We seized him with a terrible seizing.
16.transliteration: fa-ʿaṣā firʿawnu r-rasūla fa-ʾakhadhnāhu ʾakhdhan wabīlan

17.content: فَكَيفَ تَتَّقونَ إِن كَفَرتُم يَومًا يَجعَلُ الوِلدانَ شيبًا
17.translation_eng: So, if you disbelieve, how will you avoid the daywhich will make children white-headed,
17.transliteration: fa-kayfa tattaqūna ʾin kafartum yawman yajʿalu l-wildāna shīban-i

18.content: السَّماءُ مُنفَطِرٌ بِهِ ۚ كانَ وَعدُهُ مَفعولًا
18.translation_eng: and wherein the sky will be rent apart?His promise is bound to be fulfilled.
18.transliteration: as-samāʾu munfaṭirun bihī kāna waʿduhū mafʿūlan

19.content: إِنَّ هٰذِهِ تَذكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَن شاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبيلًا
19.translation_eng: This is indeed a reminder.So let anyone who wishes take the way toward his Lord.
19.transliteration: ʾinna hādhihī tadhkiratun fa-man shāʾa ttakhadha ʾilā rabbihī sabīlan

20.content: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقومُ أَدنىٰ مِن ثُلُثَيِ اللَّيلِ وَنِصفَهُ وَثُلُثَهُ وَطائِفَةٌ مِنَ الَّذينَ مَعَكَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ اللَّيلَ وَالنَّهارَ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَن تُحصوهُ فَتابَ عَلَيكُم ۖ فَاقرَءوا ما تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ القُرآنِ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكونُ مِنكُم مَرضىٰ ۙ وَآخَرونَ يَضرِبونَ فِي الأَرضِ يَبتَغونَ مِن فَضلِ اللَّهِ ۙ وَآخَرونَ يُقاتِلونَ في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ فَاقرَءوا ما تَيَسَّرَ مِنهُ ۚ وَأَقيمُوا الصَّلاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكاةَ وَأَقرِضُوا اللَّهَ قَرضًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَما تُقَدِّموا لِأَنفُسِكُم مِن خَيرٍ تَجِدوهُ عِندَ اللَّهِ هُوَ خَيرًا وَأَعظَمَ أَجرًا ۚ وَاستَغفِرُوا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
20.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord knowsthat you stand vigil nearly two thirds of the night—or [at times] a half or a third of it—along with a group of those who are with you.Allah measures the night and the day.He knows that you cannot calculate it [exactly],and so He was lenient toward you.So recite as much of the Qurʾān as is feasible.He knows that some of you will be sick,while others will travel in the landseeking Allah’s grace,and yet others will fight in the way of Allah.So recite as much of it as is feasible,and maintain the prayer and pay the zakātand lend Allah a good loan.Whatever good you send ahead for your soulsyou will find it with Allah [in a form]that is better and greater with respect to reward.And plead to Allah for forgiveness;indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
20.transliteration: ʾinna rabbaka yaʿlamu ʾannaka taqūmu ʾadnā min thuluthayi l-layli wa-niṣfahū wa-thuluthahū wa-ṭāʾifatun mina lladhīna maʿaka wa-llāhu yuqaddiru l-layla wa-n-nahāra ʿalima ʾan lan tuḥṣūhu fa-tāba ʿalaykum fa-qraʾū mā tayassara mina l-qurʾāni ʿalima ʾan sa-yakūnu minkum marḍā wa-ʾākharūna yaḍribūna fī l-ʾarḍi yabtaghūna min faḍli llāhi wa-ʾākharūna yuqātilūna fī sabīli llāhi fa-qraʾū mā tayassara minhu wa-ʾaqīmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-ʾātū z-zakāta wa-ʾaqriḍū llāha qarḍan ḥasanan wa-mā tuqaddimū li-ʾanfusikum min khayrin tajidūhu ʿinda llāhi huwa khayran wa-ʾaʿẓama ʾajran wa-staghfirū llāha ʾinna llāha ghafūrun raḥīmun

74.description: The surah that opens by addressing the enwrapped Prophet as the Shrouded Messenger. It takes its name from the word “wrapped in mantle” (muddaththir) in verse 1. The first verses of this surah (verse 1 .) were revealed after one of the Prophets first encounter with the Angel of Revelation in the Cave of Ḥirāʾ. The surah goes on, in a section from a later period, to remind the obstinate disbelievers of their fate on the Day of Judgement (verse 8 .) and a specific opponent of the Prophet is singled out (verse 11 .). The end of the surah (verse 39 .) exposes the foolishness of the disbelievers” attitude to the Revelation and the Day of Resurrection.The surah is also known as: The Cloaked One, The Enfolded, The Enfolded One, The Enveloped, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Mantled Messenger, Wrapped in his Cloak.

1.translation_eng: O you wrapped up in your mantle!

2.translation_eng: Rise up and warn!

3.content: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّر
3.translation_eng: Magnify your Lord,
3.transliteration: wa-rabbaka fa-kabbir

4.content: وَثِيابَكَ فَطَهِّر
4.translation_eng: and purify your cloak,
4.transliteration: wa-thiyābaka fa-ṭahhir

5.content: وَالرُّجزَ فَاهجُر
5.translation_eng: and keep away from all impurity!
5.transliteration: wa-r-rujza fa-hjur

6.content: وَلا تَمنُن تَستَكثِرُ
6.translation_eng: Do not grant a favour seeking a greater gain,
6.transliteration: wa-lā tamnun tastakthiru

7.content: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَاصبِر
7.translation_eng: and be patient for the sake of your Lord.
7.transliteration: wa-li-rabbika fa-ṣbir

8.content: فَإِذا نُقِرَ فِي النّاقورِ
8.translation_eng: When the Trumpet will be sounded,
8.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā nuqira fī n-nāqūri

9.content: فَذٰلِكَ يَومَئِذٍ يَومٌ عَسيرٌ
9.translation_eng: that day will be a day of hardship,
9.transliteration: fa-dhālika yawmaʾidhin yawmun ʿasīrun

10.content: عَلَى الكافِرينَ غَيرُ يَسيرٍ
10.translation_eng: not at all easy for the faithless.
10.transliteration: ʿalā l-kāfirīna ghayru yasīrin

11.content: ذَرني وَمَن خَلَقتُ وَحيدًا
11.translation_eng: Leave Me [to deal] with him whom I created alone,
11.transliteration: dharnī wa-man khalaqtu waḥīdan

12.content: وَجَعَلتُ لَهُ مالًا مَمدودًا
12.translation_eng: and then furnished him with extensive means,
12.transliteration: wa-jaʿaltu lahū mālan mamdūdan

13.content: وَبَنينَ شُهودًا
13.translation_eng: and [gave him] sons to be at his side,
13.transliteration: wa-banīna shuhūdan

14.content: وَمَهَّدتُ لَهُ تَمهيدًا
14.translation_eng: and facilitated [all matters] for him.
14.transliteration: wa-mahhadtu lahū tamhīdan

15.content: ثُمَّ يَطمَعُ أَن أَزيدَ
15.translation_eng: Still he is eager that I should give him more.
15.transliteration: thumma yaṭmaʿu ʾan ʾazīda

16.content: كَلّا ۖ إِنَّهُ كانَ لِآياتِنا عَنيدًا
16.translation_eng: No indeed! He is an obstinate opponent of Our signs.
16.transliteration: kallā ʾinnahū kāna li-ʾāyātinā ʿanīdan

17.content: سَأُرهِقُهُ صَعودًا
17.translation_eng: Soon I will overwhelm him with hardship.
17.transliteration: sa-ʾurhiquhū ṣaʿūdan

18.content: إِنَّهُ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ
18.translation_eng: Indeed he reflected and decided.
18.transliteration: ʾinnahū fakkara wa-qaddara

19.content: فَقُتِلَ كَيفَ قَدَّرَ
19.translation_eng: Perish he, how he decided!
19.transliteration: fa-qutila kayfa qaddara

20.content: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيفَ قَدَّرَ
20.translation_eng: Again, perish he, how he decided!
20.transliteration: thumma qutila kayfa qaddara

21.content: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ
21.translation_eng: Then he looked;
21.transliteration: thumma naẓara

22.content: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ
22.translation_eng: then he frowned and scowled.
22.transliteration: thumma ʿabasa wa-basara

23.content: ثُمَّ أَدبَرَ وَاستَكبَرَ
23.translation_eng: Then he went away disdainfully,
23.transliteration: thumma ʾadbara wa-stakbara

24.content: فَقالَ إِن هٰذا إِلّا سِحرٌ يُؤثَرُ
24.translation_eng: saying, ‘It1 is nothing but magic handed down.2That is, the Qurʾān.That is, from the magicians of old. Or ‘traditional magic.’
24.transliteration: fa-qāla ʾin hādhā ʾillā siḥrun yuʾtharu

25.content: إِن هٰذا إِلّا قَولُ البَشَرِ
25.translation_eng: It is nothing but the speech of a human being.’
25.transliteration: ʾin hādhā ʾillā qawlu l-bashari

26.content: سَأُصليهِ سَقَرَ
26.translation_eng: Soon I shall cast him into Saqar.1Saqar is another name for hell or a part of it.
26.transliteration: sa-ʾuṣlīhi saqara

27.content: وَما أَدراكَ ما سَقَرُ
27.translation_eng: And what will show you what is Saqar?
27.transliteration: wa-mā ʾadrāka mā saqaru

28.content: لا تُبقي وَلا تَذَرُ
28.translation_eng: It neither spares nor leaves [anything].
28.transliteration: lā tubqī wa-lā tadharu

29.content: لَوّاحَةٌ لِلبَشَرِ
29.translation_eng: It burns the skin.
29.transliteration: lawwāḥatun li-l-bashari

30.content: عَلَيها تِسعَةَ عَشَرَ
30.translation_eng: There are nineteen [keepers] over it.
30.transliteration: ʿalayhā tisʿata ʿashara

31.content: وَما جَعَلنا أَصحابَ النّارِ إِلّا مَلائِكَةً ۙ وَما جَعَلنا عِدَّتَهُم إِلّا فِتنَةً لِلَّذينَ كَفَروا لِيَستَيقِنَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتابَ وَيَزدادَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا إيمانًا ۙ وَلا يَرتابَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتابَ وَالمُؤمِنونَ ۙ وَلِيَقولَ الَّذينَ في قُلوبِهِم مَرَضٌ وَالكافِرونَ ماذا أَرادَ اللَّهُ بِهٰذا مَثَلًا ۚ كَذٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَن يَشاءُ وَيَهدي مَن يَشاءُ ۚ وَما يَعلَمُ جُنودَ رَبِّكَ إِلّا هُوَ ۚ وَما هِيَ إِلّا ذِكرىٰ لِلبَشَرِ
31.translation_eng: We have assigned only angels as keepers of the Fire,and We have made their numbermerely a stumbling block for the faithless,and that those given the Book may be reassured,and the faithful may increase in [their] faith,and that those given the Book may not doubtand the faithful [as well],and that those in whose hearts is a sickness may say,and the faithless [along with them],‘What did Allah mean by this description?’Thus does Allah lead astray whomever He wishes,and guides whomever He wishes.No one knows the hosts of your Lord except Him,and it1 is just an admonition for all humans.That is, the statement that there are nineteen wardens in charge of hell.
31.transliteration: wa-mā jaʿalnā ʾaṣḥāba n-nāri ʾillā malāʾikatan wa-mā jaʿalnā ʿiddatahum ʾillā fitnatan li-lladhīna kafarū li-yastayqina lladhīna ʾūtū l-kitāba wa-yazdāda lladhīna ʾāmanū ʾīmānan wa-lā yartāba lladhīna ʾūtū l-kitāba wa-l-muʾminūna wa-li-yaqūla lladhīna fī qulūbihim maraḍun wa-l-kāfirūna mādhā ʾarāda llāhu bi-hādhā mathalan ka-dhālika yuḍillu llāhu man yashāʾu wa-yahdī man yashāʾu wa-mā yaʿlamu junūda rabbika ʾillā huwa wa-mā hiya ʾillā dhikrā li-l-bashari

32.content: كَلّا وَالقَمَرِ
32.translation_eng: No indeed!By the Moon!
32.transliteration: kallā wa-l-qamari

33.content: وَاللَّيلِ إِذ أَدبَرَ
33.translation_eng: By the night when it recedes!
33.transliteration: wa-l-layli ʾidh ʾadbara

34.content: وَالصُّبحِ إِذا أَسفَرَ
34.translation_eng: By the dawn when it brightens!
34.transliteration: wa-ṣ-ṣubḥi ʾidhā ʾasfara

35.content: إِنَّها لَإِحدَى الكُبَرِ
35.translation_eng: Indeed it is one of the greatest [signs]
35.transliteration: ʾinnahā la-ʾiḥdā l-kubari

36.content: نَذيرًا لِلبَشَرِ
36.translation_eng: —a warner to all humans,
36.transliteration: nadhīran li-l-bashari

37.content: لِمَن شاءَ مِنكُم أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَو يَتَأَخَّرَ
37.translation_eng: [alike] for those of you who like to advance aheadand those who would linger behind.
37.transliteration: li-man shāʾa minkum ʾan yataqaddama ʾaw yataʾakhkhara

38.content: كُلُّ نَفسٍ بِما كَسَبَت رَهينَةٌ
38.translation_eng: Every soul is hostage to what it has earned,
38.transliteration: kullu nafsin bi-mā kasabat rahīnatun

39.content: إِلّا أَصحابَ اليَمينِ
39.translation_eng: except the People of the Right Hand.
39.transliteration: ʾillā ʾaṣḥāba l-yamīni

40.content: في جَنّاتٍ يَتَساءَلونَ
40.translation_eng: [They will be] in gardens, questioning
40.transliteration: fī jannātin yatasāʾalūna

41.content: عَنِ المُجرِمينَ
41.translation_eng: concerning the guilty:
41.transliteration: ʿani l-mujrimīna

42.content: ما سَلَكَكُم في سَقَرَ
42.translation_eng: ‘What drew you into Hell?’
42.transliteration: mā salakakum fī saqara

43.content: قالوا لَم نَكُ مِنَ المُصَلّينَ
43.translation_eng: They will answer,‘We were not among those who prayed.1Or ‘We were not among followers of the leaders (or forerunners, mentioned in 56:10).’ (See Tafsīr al-Qummī, Tafsīr Furāt al-Kūfī, al-Kāfī, i, 484, ‘’Kitāb al-Ḥujjah,” bāb 108 (bāb fīhi nukat wa nutaf min al-tanzīl fī al-wilāyah), no. 38.
43.transliteration: qālū lam naku mina l-muṣallīna

44.content: وَلَم نَكُ نُطعِمُ المِسكينَ
44.translation_eng: Nor did we feed the poor.
44.transliteration: wa-lam naku nuṭʿimu l-miskīna

45.content: وَكُنّا نَخوضُ مَعَ الخائِضينَ
45.translation_eng: We used to gossip along with the gossipers,
45.transliteration: wa-kunnā nakhūḍu maʿa l-khāʾiḍīna

46.content: وَكُنّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَومِ الدّينِ
46.translation_eng: and we used to deny the Day of Retribution,1Or ‘the Day of Judgement.’
46.transliteration: wa-kunnā nukadhdhibu bi-yawmi d-dīni

47.content: حَتّىٰ أَتانَا اليَقينُ
47.translation_eng: until death came to us.’
47.transliteration: ḥattā ʾatānā l-yaqīnu

48.content: فَما تَنفَعُهُم شَفاعَةُ الشّافِعينَ
48.translation_eng: So the intercession of the intercessors will not avail them.
48.transliteration: fa-mā tanfaʿuhum shafāʿatu sh-shāfiʿīna

49.content: فَما لَهُم عَنِ التَّذكِرَةِ مُعرِضينَ
49.translation_eng: What is the matter with themthat they evade the Reminder
49.transliteration: fa-mā lahum ʿani t-tadhkirati muʿriḍīna

50.content: كَأَنَّهُم حُمُرٌ مُستَنفِرَةٌ
50.translation_eng: as if they were terrified asses
50.transliteration: ka-ʾannahum ḥumurun mustanfiratun

51.content: فَرَّت مِن قَسوَرَةٍ
51.translation_eng: fleeing from a lion?
51.transliteration: farrat min qaswaratin

52.content: بَل يُريدُ كُلُّ امرِئٍ مِنهُم أَن يُؤتىٰ صُحُفًا مُنَشَّرَةً
52.translation_eng: Rather everyone of them desiresto be given unrolled scriptures [from Allah].
52.transliteration: bal yurīdu kullu mriʾin minhum ʾan yuʾtā ṣuḥufan munashsharatan

53.content: كَلّا ۖ بَل لا يَخافونَ الآخِرَةَ
53.translation_eng: No indeed!Rather they do not fear the Hereafter.
53.transliteration: kallā bal lā yakhāfūna l-ʾākhirata

54.content: كَلّا إِنَّهُ تَذكِرَةٌ
54.translation_eng: No indeed!It is indeed a reminder.
54.transliteration: kallā ʾinnahū tadhkiratun

55.content: فَمَن شاءَ ذَكَرَهُ
55.translation_eng: So let anyone who wishes remember it.
55.transliteration: fa-man shāʾa dhakarahū

56.content: وَما يَذكُرونَ إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ أَهلُ التَّقوىٰ وَأَهلُ المَغفِرَةِ
56.translation_eng: And they will not remember unless Allah wishes.He is worthy of [your] being wary [of Him]and He is worthy to forgive.
56.transliteration: wa-mā yadhkurūna ʾillā ʾan yashāʾa llāhu huwa ʾahlu t-taqwā wa-ʾahlu l-maghfirati

75.description: The surah that opens with the emphatic oath of the Divine One swearing by the looming day of Resurrection. It takes its name from verse 1, which mentions the Day of Resurrection. The surah dealing with the Day of Resurrection and man’s denial of that Day. God’s power is convincingly described in several vignettes (verse 3 ., verse 26 . and verse 34 .). The third paragraph instructs the Prophet on appropriate reception of the revelation (verse 16 .), and thereby serves to emphasize that the Quran is indeed God’s word.The surah is also known as: Day of Resurrection, The Rising.

1.translation_eng: I swear by the Day of Resurrection!

2.translation_eng: And I swear by the self-blaming soul!

3.content: أَيَحسَبُ الإِنسانُ أَلَّن نَجمَعَ عِظامَهُ
3.translation_eng: Does man supposethat We shall not put together his bones?
3.transliteration: ʾa-yaḥsabu l-ʾinsānu ʾal-lan najmaʿa ʿiẓāmahū

4.content: بَلىٰ قادِرينَ عَلىٰ أَن نُسَوِّيَ بَنانَهُ
4.translation_eng: Yes indeed,We are able to proportion [even] his fingertips!
4.transliteration: balā qādirīna ʿalā ʾan nusawwiya banānahū

5.content: بَل يُريدُ الإِنسانُ لِيَفجُرَ أَمامَهُ
5.translation_eng: Rather man desires to go on living viciously.
5.transliteration: bal yurīdu l-ʾinsānu li-yafjura ʾamāmahū

6.content: يَسأَلُ أَيّانَ يَومُ القِيامَةِ
6.translation_eng: He asks, ‘When is this day of resurrection?!’
6.transliteration: yasʾalu ʾayyāna yawmu l-qiyāmati

7.content: فَإِذا بَرِقَ البَصَرُ
7.translation_eng: But when the eyes are dazzled,
7.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā bariqa l-baṣaru

8.content: وَخَسَفَ القَمَرُ
8.translation_eng: and the moon is eclipsed,
8.transliteration: wa-khasafa l-qamaru

9.content: وَجُمِعَ الشَّمسُ وَالقَمَرُ
9.translation_eng: and the sun and the moon are brought together,
9.transliteration: wa-jumiʿa sh-shamsu wa-l-qamaru

10.content: يَقولُ الإِنسانُ يَومَئِذٍ أَينَ المَفَرُّ
10.translation_eng: that day man will say,‘Where is the escape?’
10.transliteration: yaqūlu l-ʾinsānu yawmaʾidhin ʾayna l-mafarru

11.content: كَلّا لا وَزَرَ
11.translation_eng: No indeed! There is no refuge!
11.transliteration: kallā lā wazara

12.content: إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ يَومَئِذٍ المُستَقَرُّ
12.translation_eng: That day the abode will be toward your Lord.
12.transliteration: ʾilā rabbika yawmaʾidhin-i l-mustaqarru

13.content: يُنَبَّأُ الإِنسانُ يَومَئِذٍ بِما قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
13.translation_eng: That day man will be informedabout what he has sent ahead and left behind.
13.transliteration: yunabbaʾu l-ʾinsānu yawmaʾidhin bi-mā qaddama wa-ʾakhkhara

14.content: بَلِ الإِنسانُ عَلىٰ نَفسِهِ بَصيرَةٌ
14.translation_eng: Rather man is a witness to himself,
14.transliteration: bali l-ʾinsānu ʿalā nafsihī baṣīratun

15.content: وَلَو أَلقىٰ مَعاذيرَهُ
15.translation_eng: though he should offer his excuses.
15.transliteration: wa-law ʾalqā maʿādhīrahū

16.content: لا تُحَرِّك بِهِ لِسانَكَ لِتَعجَلَ بِهِ
16.translation_eng: Do not move your tongue with it to hasten it.
16.transliteration: lā tuḥarrik bihī lisānaka li-taʿjala bihī

17.content: إِنَّ عَلَينا جَمعَهُ وَقُرآنَهُ
17.translation_eng: Indeed it is up to Us to put it togetherand to recite it.
17.transliteration: ʾinna ʿalaynā jamʿahū wa-qurʾānahū

18.content: فَإِذا قَرَأناهُ فَاتَّبِع قُرآنَهُ
18.translation_eng: And when We have recited it, follow its recitation.
18.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā qaraʾnāhu fa-ttabiʿ qurʾānahū

19.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَينا بَيانَهُ
19.translation_eng: Then, its exposition indeed [also] lies with Us.
19.transliteration: thumma ʾinna ʿalaynā bayānahū

20.content: كَلّا بَل تُحِبّونَ العاجِلَةَ
20.translation_eng: No Indeed! Rather you love this transitory life
20.transliteration: kallā bal tuḥibbūna l-ʿājilata

21.content: وَتَذَرونَ الآخِرَةَ
21.translation_eng: and forsake the Hereafter.
21.transliteration: wa-tadharūna l-ʾākhirata

22.content: وُجوهٌ يَومَئِذٍ ناضِرَةٌ
22.translation_eng: Some faces will be fresh on that day,
22.transliteration: wujūhun yawmaʾidhin nāḍiratun

23.content: إِلىٰ رَبِّها ناظِرَةٌ
23.translation_eng: looking at their Lord,
23.transliteration: ʾilā rabbihā nāẓiratun

24.content: وَوُجوهٌ يَومَئِذٍ باسِرَةٌ
24.translation_eng: and some faces will be scowling on that day,
24.transliteration: wa-wujūhun yawmaʾidhin bāsiratun

25.content: تَظُنُّ أَن يُفعَلَ بِها فاقِرَةٌ
25.translation_eng: knowing that they will be dealt outa punishment breaking the spine.
25.transliteration: taẓunnu ʾan yufʿala bihā fāqiratun

26.content: كَلّا إِذا بَلَغَتِ التَّراقِيَ
26.translation_eng: No indeed!When the soul reaches up to the collar bones,
26.transliteration: kallā ʾidhā balaghati t-tarāqiya

27.content: وَقيلَ مَن ۜ راقٍ
27.translation_eng: and it is said, ‘Who will take him up?’1That is, by the angels of mercy and the angels of wrath present at the side of the dying person, as to which of them will take charge of him. Or those who are present by the side of the dying person say, ‘Where is the medicine man?’
27.transliteration: wa-qīla man rāqin

28.content: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ الفِراقُ
28.translation_eng: and he knows that it is the [time of] parting,
28.transliteration: wa-ẓanna ʾannahu l-firāqu

29.content: وَالتَفَّتِ السّاقُ بِالسّاقِ
29.translation_eng: and each shank clasps the other shank,1An idiom suggesting a time of great hardship, or, metaphorically, death throes.
29.transliteration: wa-ltaffati s-sāqu bi-s-sāqi

30.content: إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ يَومَئِذٍ المَساقُ
30.translation_eng: that day he shall be driven toward your Lord.
30.transliteration: ʾilā rabbika yawmaʾidhin-i l-masāqu

31.content: فَلا صَدَّقَ وَلا صَلّىٰ
31.translation_eng: He neither confirmed [the truth], nor prayed,
31.transliteration: fa-lā ṣaddaqa wa-lā ṣallā

32.content: وَلٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلّىٰ
32.translation_eng: but denied [it] and turned away,
32.transliteration: wa-lākin kadhdhaba wa-tawallā

33.content: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلىٰ أَهلِهِ يَتَمَطّىٰ
33.translation_eng: and went swaggering to his family.
33.transliteration: thumma dhahaba ʾilā ʾahlihī yatamaṭṭā

34.content: أَولىٰ لَكَ فَأَولىٰ
34.translation_eng: So woe to you! Woe to you!
34.transliteration: ʾawlā laka fa-ʾawlā

35.content: ثُمَّ أَولىٰ لَكَ فَأَولىٰ
35.translation_eng: Again, woe to you! Woe to you!
35.transliteration: thumma ʾawlā laka fa-ʾawlā

36.content: أَيَحسَبُ الإِنسانُ أَن يُترَكَ سُدًى
36.translation_eng: Does man supposethat he would be abandoned to futility?
36.transliteration: ʾa-yaḥsabu l-ʾinsānu ʾan yutraka sudan

37.content: أَلَم يَكُ نُطفَةً مِن مَنِيٍّ يُمنىٰ
37.translation_eng: Was he not a drop of emitted semen?
37.transliteration: ʾa-lam yaku nuṭfatan min maniyyin yumnā

38.content: ثُمَّ كانَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقَ فَسَوّىٰ
38.translation_eng: Then he became a clinging mass;then He created [him] and proportioned [him],
38.transliteration: thumma kāna ʿalaqatan fa-khalaqa fa-sawwā

39.content: فَجَعَلَ مِنهُ الزَّوجَينِ الذَّكَرَ وَالأُنثىٰ
39.translation_eng: and made of him the two sexes,the male and the female.
39.transliteration: fa-jaʿala minhu z-zawjayni dh-dhakara wa-l-ʾunthā

40.content: أَلَيسَ ذٰلِكَ بِقادِرٍ عَلىٰ أَن يُحيِيَ المَوتىٰ
40.translation_eng: Is not such a one ableto revive the dead?
40.transliteration: ʾa-laysa dhālika bi-qādirin ʿalā ʾan yuḥyiya l-mawtā

76.description: The surah that opens with a question posed to arrogant Man about his utter nothingness before God brought him into existence. It takes its name from the word “man” (al-insān) mentioned in verse 1. The surah speaks of how man is tested (verse 2 .) and what the results will be for the evildoers (verse 4) and for the righteous (verse 5 .). The Prophet is urged to persevere in his devotion and to bear with patience (verse 23 .).The surah is also known as: Every (Man).

1.content: هَل أَتىٰ عَلَى الإِنسانِ حينٌ مِنَ الدَّهرِ لَم يَكُن شَيئًا مَذكورًا
1.translation_eng: Has there been for man a period of timewhen he was not anything worthy of mention?
1.transliteration: hal ʾatā ʿalā l-ʾinsāni ḥīnun mina d-dahri lam yakun shayʾan madhkūran

2.content: إِنّا خَلَقنَا الإِنسانَ مِن نُطفَةٍ أَمشاجٍ نَبتَليهِ فَجَعَلناهُ سَميعًا بَصيرًا
2.translation_eng: Indeed We created manfrom the drop of a mixed fluid1so that We may test him.So We made him endowed with hearing and sight.That is, from the mixing of sperm and ovum.
2.transliteration: ʾinnā khalaqnā l-ʾinsāna min nuṭfatin ʾamshājin nabtalīhi fa-jaʿalnāhu samīʿan baṣīran

3.content: إِنّا هَدَيناهُ السَّبيلَ إِمّا شاكِرًا وَإِمّا كَفورًا
3.translation_eng: Indeed We have guided him to the way,be he grateful or ungrateful.
3.transliteration: ʾinnā hadaynāhu s-sabīla ʾimmā shākiran wa-ʾimmā kafūran

4.content: إِنّا أَعتَدنا لِلكافِرينَ سَلاسِلَ وَأَغلالًا وَسَعيرًا
4.translation_eng: Indeed We have prepared for the faithlesschains, iron collars, and a blaze.
4.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾaʿtadnā li-l-kāfirīna salāsila wa-ʾaghlālan wa-saʿīran

5.content: إِنَّ الأَبرارَ يَشرَبونَ مِن كَأسٍ كانَ مِزاجُها كافورًا
5.translation_eng: Indeed the pious will drink from a cupseasoned with Kāfūr,1Lit., camphor.
5.transliteration: ʾinna l-ʾabrāra yashrabūna min kaʾsin kāna mizājuhā kāfūran

6.content: عَينًا يَشرَبُ بِها عِبادُ اللَّهِ يُفَجِّرونَها تَفجيرًا
6.translation_eng: a spring where the servants of Allah drink,which they make to gush forth as they please.
6.transliteration: ʿaynan yashrabu bihā ʿibādu llāhi yufajjirūnahā tafjīran

7.content: يوفونَ بِالنَّذرِ وَيَخافونَ يَومًا كانَ شَرُّهُ مُستَطيرًا
7.translation_eng: They fulfill their vowsand fear a daywhose ill will be widespread.
7.transliteration: yūfūna bi-n-nadhri wa-yakhāfūna yawman kāna sharruhū mustaṭīran

8.content: وَيُطعِمونَ الطَّعامَ عَلىٰ حُبِّهِ مِسكينًا وَيَتيمًا وَأَسيرًا
8.translation_eng: They give food, for the love of Him,to the needy, the orphan and the prisoner,
8.transliteration: wa-yuṭʿimūna ṭ-ṭaʿāma ʿalā ḥubbihī miskīnan wa-yatīman wa-ʾasīran

9.content: إِنَّما نُطعِمُكُم لِوَجهِ اللَّهِ لا نُريدُ مِنكُم جَزاءً وَلا شُكورًا
9.translation_eng: [saying,] ‘We feed you only for the sake of Allah.We do not want any reward from younor any thanks.
9.transliteration: ʾinnamā nuṭʿimukum li-wajhi llāhi lā nurīdu minkum jazāʾan wa-lā shukūran

10.content: إِنّا نَخافُ مِن رَبِّنا يَومًا عَبوسًا قَمطَريرًا
10.translation_eng: Indeed we fear from our Lord a day,frowning and fateful.’
10.transliteration: ʾinnā nakhāfu min rabbinā yawman ʿabūsan qamṭarīran

11.content: فَوَقاهُمُ اللَّهُ شَرَّ ذٰلِكَ اليَومِ وَلَقّاهُم نَضرَةً وَسُرورًا
11.translation_eng: So Allah saved them from the ills of that day,and granted them freshness and joy.
11.transliteration: fa-waqāhumu llāhu sharra dhālika l-yawmi wa-laqqāhum naḍratan wa-surūran

12.content: وَجَزاهُم بِما صَبَروا جَنَّةً وَحَريرًا
12.translation_eng: And He rewarded them for their patiencewith a garden and [garments of] silk,
12.transliteration: wa-jazāhum bi-mā ṣabarū jannatan wa-ḥarīran

13.content: مُتَّكِئينَ فيها عَلَى الأَرائِكِ ۖ لا يَرَونَ فيها شَمسًا وَلا زَمهَريرًا
13.translation_eng: reclining therein on couches.They will find in it neither any [scorching] sun,nor any [biting] cold.
13.transliteration: muttakiʾīna fīhā ʿalā l-ʾarāʾiki lā yarawna fīhā shamsan wa-lā zamharīran

14.content: وَدانِيَةً عَلَيهِم ظِلالُها وَذُلِّلَت قُطوفُها تَذليلًا
14.translation_eng: Its shades will be close over themand its clusters [of fruits] will be hanging low.
14.transliteration: wa-dāniyatan ʿalayhim ẓilāluhā wa-dhullilat quṭūfuhā tadhlīlan

15.content: وَيُطافُ عَلَيهِم بِآنِيَةٍ مِن فِضَّةٍ وَأَكوابٍ كانَت قَواريرا
15.translation_eng: They will be served around with vessels of silverand goblets of crystal
15.transliteration: wa-yuṭāfu ʿalayhim bi-ʾāniyatin min fiḍḍatin wa-ʾakwābin kānat qawārīra

16.content: قَواريرَ مِن فِضَّةٍ قَدَّروها تَقديرًا
16.translation_eng: —crystal of silver—1[from] which they dispense in a precise measure.According to Tafsīr al-Qummī, vol. 2, p. 399, the silver will be transparent.
16.transliteration: qawārīra min fiḍḍatin qaddarūhā taqdīran

17.content: وَيُسقَونَ فيها كَأسًا كانَ مِزاجُها زَنجَبيلًا
17.translation_eng: They will be served therein with a cup of a drinkseasoned with Zanjabīl,1Lit., ginger.
17.transliteration: wa-yusqawna fīhā kaʾsan kāna mizājuhā zanjabīlan

18.content: عَينًا فيها تُسَمّىٰ سَلسَبيلًا
18.translation_eng: a spring in it, named Salsabīl.
18.transliteration: ʿaynan fīhā tusammā salsabīlan

19.content: ۞ وَيَطوفُ عَلَيهِم وِلدانٌ مُخَلَّدونَ إِذا رَأَيتَهُم حَسِبتَهُم لُؤلُؤًا مَنثورًا
19.translation_eng: They will be waited upon by immortal youths,whom, when you see them,you will suppose them to be scattered pearls.
19.transliteration: wa-yaṭūfu ʿalayhim wildānun mukhalladūna ʾidhā raʾaytahum ḥasibtahum luʾluʾan manthūran

20.content: وَإِذا رَأَيتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيتَ نَعيمًا وَمُلكًا كَبيرًا
20.translation_eng: As you look,you will see there bliss and a great kingdom.
20.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā raʾayta thamma raʾayta naʿīman wa-mulkan kabīran

21.content: عالِيَهُم ثِيابُ سُندُسٍ خُضرٌ وَإِستَبرَقٌ ۖ وَحُلّوا أَساوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٍ وَسَقاهُم رَبُّهُم شَرابًا طَهورًا
21.translation_eng: Upon them will be cloaks of green silkand brocadeand they will be adorned with bracelets of silver.Their Lord will give them to drink a pure drink.
21.transliteration: ʿāliyahum thiyābu sundusin khuḍrun wa-ʾistabraqun wa-ḥullū ʾasāwira min fiḍḍatin wa-saqāhum rabbuhum sharāban ṭahūran

22.content: إِنَّ هٰذا كانَ لَكُم جَزاءً وَكانَ سَعيُكُم مَشكورًا
22.translation_eng: [They will be told]: ‘This is indeed your reward,and your endeavour has been well-appreciated.’
22.transliteration: ʾinna hādhā kāna lakum jazāʾan wa-kāna saʿyukum mashkūran

23.content: إِنّا نَحنُ نَزَّلنا عَلَيكَ القُرآنَ تَنزيلًا
23.translation_eng: Indeed We have sent down to you the Qurʾānin a gradual descent.
23.transliteration: ʾinnā naḥnu nazzalnā ʿalayka l-qurʾāna tanzīlan

24.content: فَاصبِر لِحُكمِ رَبِّكَ وَلا تُطِع مِنهُم آثِمًا أَو كَفورًا
24.translation_eng: So submit patiently to the judgement of your Lord,and do not obey any sinner or ingrate among them,
24.transliteration: fa-ṣbir li-ḥukmi rabbika wa-lā tuṭiʿ minhum ʾāthiman ʾaw kafūran

25.content: وَاذكُرِ اسمَ رَبِّكَ بُكرَةً وَأَصيلًا
25.translation_eng: and celebrate the Name of your Lordmorning and evening,
25.transliteration: wa-dhkuri sma rabbika bukratan wa-ʾaṣīlan

26.content: وَمِنَ اللَّيلِ فَاسجُد لَهُ وَسَبِّحهُ لَيلًا طَويلًا
26.translation_eng: and worship Him for a watch of the nightand glorify Him the night long.
26.transliteration: wa-mina l-layli fa-sjud lahū wa-sabbiḥhu laylan ṭawīlan

27.content: إِنَّ هٰؤُلاءِ يُحِبّونَ العاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرونَ وَراءَهُم يَومًا ثَقيلًا
27.translation_eng: Indeed they love this transitory life,and disregard a weighty day ahead of them.
27.transliteration: ʾinna hāʾulāʾi yuḥibbūna l-ʿājilata wa-yadharūna warāʾahum yawman thaqīlan

28.content: نَحنُ خَلَقناهُم وَشَدَدنا أَسرَهُم ۖ وَإِذا شِئنا بَدَّلنا أَمثالَهُم تَبديلًا
28.translation_eng: We created them and made their joints firm,and whenever We likeWe will replace them with others like them.
28.transliteration: naḥnu khalaqnāhum wa-shadadnā ʾasrahum wa-ʾidhā shiʾnā baddalnā ʾamthālahum tabdīlan

29.content: إِنَّ هٰذِهِ تَذكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَن شاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبيلًا
29.translation_eng: This is indeed a reminder.So let anyone who wishes take the way toward his Lord.
29.transliteration: ʾinna hādhihī tadhkiratun fa-man shāʾa ttakhadha ʾilā rabbihī sabīlan

30.content: وَما تَشاءونَ إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كانَ عَليمًا حَكيمًا
30.translation_eng: But you do not wishunless it is wished by Allah.Indeed Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
30.transliteration: wa-mā tashāʾūna ʾillā ʾan yashāʾa llāhu ʾinna llāha kāna ʿalīman ḥakīman

31.content: يُدخِلُ مَن يَشاءُ في رَحمَتِهِ ۚ وَالظّالِمينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُم عَذابًا أَليمًا
31.translation_eng: He admits whomever He wishes into His mercy,and as for the wrongdoers,He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
31.transliteration: yudkhilu man yashāʾu fī raḥmatihī wa-ẓ-ẓālimīna ʾaʿadda lahum ʿadhāban ʾalīman

77.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by the Emissaries as those sent forth in succession. It takes its name from the “emissaries” (mursalāt) mentioned in verse 1. The surah describes the Day of Decision: its inevitability, arguments for its coming, and the events that will presage the Judgement, as well as the fates of believers and disbelievers.The surah is also known as: (Winds) Sent Forth, The Loosed Ones, Those Sent Forth, Those Sent Forth in Succession, Those That Are Sent Forth.

1.translation_eng: By the successive emissaries,

2.translation_eng: by the raging hurricanes,

3.content: وَالنّاشِراتِ نَشرًا
3.translation_eng: by the sweeping spreaders,
3.transliteration: wa-n-nāshirāti nashran

4.content: فَالفارِقاتِ فَرقًا
4.translation_eng: by the decisive separators,
4.transliteration: fa-l-fāriqāti farqan

5.content: فَالمُلقِياتِ ذِكرًا
5.translation_eng: by the inspirers of remembrance,
5.transliteration: fa-l-mulqiyāti dhikran

6.content: عُذرًا أَو نُذرًا
6.translation_eng: to excuse or to warn:
6.transliteration: ʿudhran ʾaw nudhran

7.content: إِنَّما توعَدونَ لَواقِعٌ
7.translation_eng: indeed what you are promised will surely befall.
7.transliteration: ʾinnamā tūʿadūna la-wāqiʿun

8.content: فَإِذَا النُّجومُ طُمِسَت
8.translation_eng: So when the stars are blotted out,
8.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā n-nujūmu ṭumisat

9.content: وَإِذَا السَّماءُ فُرِجَت
9.translation_eng: and when the sky is split,
9.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā s-samāʾu furijat

10.content: وَإِذَا الجِبالُ نُسِفَت
10.translation_eng: and when the mountains are scattered1 [like dust],Or ‘blown away.’
10.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā l-jibālu nusifat

11.content: وَإِذَا الرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَت
11.translation_eng: and when the time is set for the apostles [to witness]
11.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā r-rusulu ʾuqqitat

12.content: لِأَيِّ يَومٍ أُجِّلَت
12.translation_eng: —for what day has [all] that been set [to occur]?
12.transliteration: li-ʾayyi yawmin ʾujjilat

13.content: لِيَومِ الفَصلِ
13.translation_eng: For the Day of Judgement!
13.transliteration: li-yawmi l-faṣli

14.content: وَما أَدراكَ ما يَومُ الفَصلِ
14.translation_eng: And what will show you what is the Day of Judgement!
14.transliteration: wa-mā ʾadrāka mā yawmu l-faṣli

15.content: وَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
15.translation_eng: Woe to the deniers on that day!
15.transliteration: waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

16.content: أَلَم نُهلِكِ الأَوَّلينَ
16.translation_eng: Did We not destroy the ancients,
16.transliteration: ʾa-lam nuhliki l-ʾawwalīna

17.content: ثُمَّ نُتبِعُهُمُ الآخِرينَ
17.translation_eng: [and] then made the latter ones follow them?
17.transliteration: thumma nutbiʿuhumu l-ʾākhirīna

18.content: كَذٰلِكَ نَفعَلُ بِالمُجرِمينَ
18.translation_eng: That is how We deal with the guilty.
18.transliteration: ka-dhālika nafʿalu bi-l-mujrimīna

19.content: وَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
19.translation_eng: Woe to the deniers on that day!
19.transliteration: waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

20.content: أَلَم نَخلُقكُم مِن ماءٍ مَهينٍ
20.translation_eng: Have We not created you from a base fluid,
20.transliteration: ʾa-lam nakhluqkum min māʾin mahīnin

21.content: فَجَعَلناهُ في قَرارٍ مَكينٍ
21.translation_eng: [and] then lodged it in a secure abode
21.transliteration: fa-jaʿalnāhu fī qarārin makīnin

22.content: إِلىٰ قَدَرٍ مَعلومٍ
22.translation_eng: until a known span [of time]?
22.transliteration: ʾilā qadarin maʿlūmin

23.content: فَقَدَرنا فَنِعمَ القادِرونَ
23.translation_eng: Then We designed;so how excellent designers We are!
23.transliteration: fa-qadarnā fa-niʿma l-qādirūna

24.content: وَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
24.translation_eng: Woe to the deniers on that day!
24.transliteration: waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

25.content: أَلَم نَجعَلِ الأَرضَ كِفاتًا
25.translation_eng: Have We not made the earth a receptacle
25.transliteration: ʾa-lam najʿali l-ʾarḍa kifātan

26.content: أَحياءً وَأَمواتًا
26.translation_eng: for the living and the dead,
26.transliteration: ʾaḥyāʾan wa-ʾamwātan

27.content: وَجَعَلنا فيها رَواسِيَ شامِخاتٍ وَأَسقَيناكُم ماءً فُراتًا
27.translation_eng: and set in it lofty [and] firm mountains,and given you agreeable water to drink?
27.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā fīhā rawāsiya shāmikhātin wa-ʾasqaynākum māʾan furātan

28.content: وَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
28.translation_eng: Woe to the deniers on that day!
28.transliteration: waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

29.content: انطَلِقوا إِلىٰ ما كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبونَ
29.translation_eng: [They will be told]:‘Get off toward what you used to deny!
29.transliteration: inṭaliqū ʾilā mā kuntum bihī tukadhdhibūna

30.content: انطَلِقوا إِلىٰ ظِلٍّ ذي ثَلاثِ شُعَبٍ
30.translation_eng: Get off toward the triple-forked shadow,
30.transliteration: inṭaliqū ʾilā ẓillin dhī thalāthi shuʿabin

31.content: لا ظَليلٍ وَلا يُغني مِنَ اللَّهَبِ
31.translation_eng: which is neither shadynor is of any avail against the flame.
31.transliteration: lā ẓalīlin wa-lā yughnī mina l-lahabi

32.content: إِنَّها تَرمي بِشَرَرٍ كَالقَصرِ
32.translation_eng: Indeed it throws up sparks [huge] like palaces,1Or ‘like castles,’ or ‘like the trunks (of huge trees).’
32.transliteration: ʾinnahā tarmī bi-shararin ka-l-qaṣri

33.content: كَأَنَّهُ جِمالَتٌ صُفرٌ
33.translation_eng: [bright] as if they were yellow camels.
33.transliteration: ka-ʾannahū jimālatun ṣufrun

34.content: وَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
34.translation_eng: Woe to the deniers on that day!
34.transliteration: waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

35.content: هٰذا يَومُ لا يَنطِقونَ
35.translation_eng: This is a day wherein they will not speak,
35.transliteration: hādhā yawmu lā yanṭiqūna

36.content: وَلا يُؤذَنُ لَهُم فَيَعتَذِرونَ
36.translation_eng: nor will they be permitted to offer excuses.
36.transliteration: wa-lā yuʾdhanu lahum fa-yaʿtadhirūna

37.content: وَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
37.translation_eng: Woe to the deniers on that day!
37.transliteration: waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

38.content: هٰذا يَومُ الفَصلِ ۖ جَمَعناكُم وَالأَوَّلينَ
38.translation_eng: ‘This is the Day of Judgement.We have brought together you and the ancients.
38.transliteration: hādhā yawmu l-faṣli jamaʿnākum wa-l-ʾawwalīna

39.content: فَإِن كانَ لَكُم كَيدٌ فَكيدونِ
39.translation_eng: If you have any stratagems [left],try out your stratagems against Me!’
39.transliteration: fa-ʾin kāna lakum kaydun fa-kīdūni

40.content: وَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
40.translation_eng: Woe to the deniers on that day!
40.transliteration: waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

41.content: إِنَّ المُتَّقينَ في ظِلالٍ وَعُيونٍ
41.translation_eng: Indeed the Godwary will be amid shades and springs,
41.transliteration: ʾinna l-muttaqīna fī ẓilālin wa-ʿuyūnin

42.content: وَفَواكِهَ مِمّا يَشتَهونَ
42.translation_eng: and fruits, such as they desire.
42.transliteration: wa-fawākiha mimmā yashtahūna

43.content: كُلوا وَاشرَبوا هَنيئًا بِما كُنتُم تَعمَلونَ
43.translation_eng: [They will be told:] ‘Enjoy your food and drink,[as a reward] for what you used to do.’
43.transliteration: kulū wa-shrabū hanīʾan bi-mā kuntum taʿmalūna

44.content: إِنّا كَذٰلِكَ نَجزِي المُحسِنينَ
44.translation_eng: Thus indeed do We reward the virtuous.
44.transliteration: ʾinnā ka-dhālika najzī l-muḥsinīna

45.content: وَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
45.translation_eng: Woe to the deniers on that day!
45.transliteration: waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

46.content: كُلوا وَتَمَتَّعوا قَليلًا إِنَّكُم مُجرِمونَ
46.translation_eng: ‘Eat and enjoy a little!You are indeed guilty.’
46.transliteration: kulū wa-tamattaʿū qalīlan ʾinnakum mujrimūna

47.content: وَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
47.translation_eng: Woe to the deniers on that day!
47.transliteration: waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

48.content: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُمُ اركَعوا لا يَركَعونَ
48.translation_eng: When they are told, ‘Bow down,’they do not bow down!
48.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā qīla lahumu rkaʿū lā yarkaʿūna

49.content: وَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
49.translation_eng: Woe to the deniers on that day!
49.transliteration: waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

50.content: فَبِأَيِّ حَديثٍ بَعدَهُ يُؤمِنونَ
50.translation_eng: So what discourse will they believe after this?
50.transliteration: fa-bi-ʾayyi ḥadīthin baʿdahū yuʾminūna

78.description: The surah that mentions The [Great] Tiding of the coming of the Day og Judgment, the truth of which people yet dispute. It takes its name from the expression “the great tiding” (al-nabaʾ al-ʿaẓīm). The disbelievers often asked incredulously about the Resurrection. This surah gives evidence of God’s power, then explains what will happen on the Day of Resurrection, and the respective fates of believers and disbelievers.The surah is also known as: The Announcement, The Great News, The Important News, The News.

1.translation_eng: What is it about which they question each other?!

2.translation_eng: [Is it] about the great tiding,

3.content: الَّذي هُم فيهِ مُختَلِفونَ
3.translation_eng: the one about which they differ?
3.transliteration: alladhī hum fīhi mukhtalifūna

4.content: كَلّا سَيَعلَمونَ
4.translation_eng: No indeed! They will soon know!
4.transliteration: kallā sa-yaʿlamūna

5.content: ثُمَّ كَلّا سَيَعلَمونَ
5.translation_eng: Again, no indeed! They will soon know!
5.transliteration: thumma kallā sa-yaʿlamūna

6.content: أَلَم نَجعَلِ الأَرضَ مِهادًا
6.translation_eng: Did We not make the earth a resting place?
6.transliteration: ʾa-lam najʿali l-ʾarḍa mihādan

7.content: وَالجِبالَ أَوتادًا
7.translation_eng: and the mountains stakes?
7.transliteration: wa-l-jibāla ʾawtādan

8.content: وَخَلَقناكُم أَزواجًا
8.translation_eng: and create you in pairs?1Or ‘as sexes.’
8.transliteration: wa-khalaqnākum ʾazwājan

9.content: وَجَعَلنا نَومَكُم سُباتًا
9.translation_eng: and make your sleep for rest?
9.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā nawmakum subātan

10.content: وَجَعَلنَا اللَّيلَ لِباسًا
10.translation_eng: and make the night a covering?
10.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā l-layla libāsan

11.content: وَجَعَلنَا النَّهارَ مَعاشًا
11.translation_eng: and make the day for livelihood?
11.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā n-nahāra maʿāshan

12.content: وَبَنَينا فَوقَكُم سَبعًا شِدادًا
12.translation_eng: and build above you the seven mighty heavens?
12.transliteration: wa-banaynā fawqakum sabʿan shidādan

13.content: وَجَعَلنا سِراجًا وَهّاجًا
13.translation_eng: and make [the sun for] a radiant lamp?
13.transliteration: wa-jaʿalnā sirājan wahhājan

14.content: وَأَنزَلنا مِنَ المُعصِراتِ ماءً ثَجّاجًا
14.translation_eng: and send down water pouring from the rain-clouds,
14.transliteration: wa-ʾanzalnā mina l-muʿṣirāti māʾan thajjājan

15.content: لِنُخرِجَ بِهِ حَبًّا وَنَباتًا
15.translation_eng: that with it We may bring forth grains and plants,
15.transliteration: li-nukhrija bihī ḥabban wa-nabātan

16.content: وَجَنّاتٍ أَلفافًا
16.translation_eng: and luxuriant gardens?
16.transliteration: wa-jannātin ʾalfāfan

17.content: إِنَّ يَومَ الفَصلِ كانَ ميقاتًا
17.translation_eng: Indeed the Day of Judgement is the tryst,
17.transliteration: ʾinna yawma l-faṣli kāna mīqātan

18.content: يَومَ يُنفَخُ فِي الصّورِ فَتَأتونَ أَفواجًا
18.translation_eng: the day the Trumpet will be blown,and you will come in groups,
18.transliteration: yawma yunfakhu fī ṣ-ṣūri fa-taʾtūna ʾafwājan

19.content: وَفُتِحَتِ السَّماءُ فَكانَت أَبوابًا
19.translation_eng: and the sky will be openedand become gates,
19.transliteration: wa-futiḥati s-samāʾu fa-kānat ʾabwāban

20.content: وَسُيِّرَتِ الجِبالُ فَكانَت سَرابًا
20.translation_eng: and the mountains will be set movingand become a mirage.
20.transliteration: wa-suyyirati l-jibālu fa-kānat sarāban

21.content: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كانَت مِرصادًا
21.translation_eng: Indeed hell is an ambush,
21.transliteration: ʾinna jahannama kānat mirṣādan

22.content: لِلطّاغينَ مَآبًا
22.translation_eng: a resort for the rebels,
22.transliteration: li-ṭ-ṭāghīna maʾāban

23.content: لابِثينَ فيها أَحقابًا
23.translation_eng: to reside therein for ages,
23.transliteration: lābithīna fīhā ʾaḥqāban

24.content: لا يَذوقونَ فيها بَردًا وَلا شَرابًا
24.translation_eng: tasting in it neither any coolness nor drink,
24.transliteration: lā yadhūqūna fīhā bardan wa-lā sharāban

25.content: إِلّا حَميمًا وَغَسّاقًا
25.translation_eng: except boiling water and pus
25.transliteration: ʾillā hamīman wa-ghassāqan

26.content: جَزاءً وِفاقًا
26.translation_eng: —a fitting requital.
26.transliteration: jazāʾan wifāqan

27.content: إِنَّهُم كانوا لا يَرجونَ حِسابًا
27.translation_eng: Indeed they did not expect any reckoning,
27.transliteration: ʾinnahum kānū lā yarjūna ḥisāban

28.content: وَكَذَّبوا بِآياتِنا كِذّابًا
28.translation_eng: and they denied Our signs mendaciously,
28.transliteration: wa-kadhdhabū bi-ʾāyātinā kidhdhāban

29.content: وَكُلَّ شَيءٍ أَحصَيناهُ كِتابًا
29.translation_eng: and We have figured everything in a Book.
29.transliteration: wa-kulla shayʾin ʾaḥṣaynāhu kitāban

30.content: فَذوقوا فَلَن نَزيدَكُم إِلّا عَذابًا
30.translation_eng: So [now] taste!We shall increase you in nothing but punishment!
30.transliteration: fa-dhūqū fa-lan nazīdakum ʾillā ʿadhāban

31.content: إِنَّ لِلمُتَّقينَ مَفازًا
31.translation_eng: Indeed a triumph awaits the Godwary:
31.transliteration: ʾinna li-l-muttaqīna mafāzan

32.content: حَدائِقَ وَأَعنابًا
32.translation_eng: gardens and vineyards,
32.transliteration: ḥadāʾiqa wa-ʾaʿnāban

33.content: وَكَواعِبَ أَترابًا
33.translation_eng: and buxom maidens of a like age,
33.transliteration: wa-kawāʿiba ʾatrāban

34.content: وَكَأسًا دِهاقًا
34.translation_eng: and brimming cups.
34.transliteration: wa-kaʾsan dihāqan

35.content: لا يَسمَعونَ فيها لَغوًا وَلا كِذّابًا
35.translation_eng: Therein they shall hear neither vain talk nor lies
35.transliteration: lā yasmaʿūna fīhā laghwan wa-lā kidhdhāban

36.content: جَزاءً مِن رَبِّكَ عَطاءً حِسابًا
36.translation_eng: —a reward from your Lord,a bounty sufficing,1Or ‘abounding,’ or ‘well-deserved,’ or ‘well-earned.’
36.transliteration: jazāʾan min rabbika ʿaṭāʾan ḥisāban

37.content: رَبِّ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَما بَينَهُمَا الرَّحمٰنِ ۖ لا يَملِكونَ مِنهُ خِطابًا
37.translation_eng: the Lord of the heavens and the earthand whatever is between them,the All-beneficent,whom they will not be able to address
37.transliteration: rabbi s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā baynahumā r-raḥmāni lā yamlikūna minhu khiṭāban

38.content: يَومَ يَقومُ الرّوحُ وَالمَلائِكَةُ صَفًّا ۖ لا يَتَكَلَّمونَ إِلّا مَن أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحمٰنُ وَقالَ صَوابًا
38.translation_eng: on the daywhen the Spirit and the angels standin an array.None shall speakexcept whom the All-beneficent permitsand who says what is right.
38.transliteration: yawma yaqūmu r-rūḥu wa-l-malāʾikatu ṣaffan lā yatakallamūna ʾillā man ʾadhina lahu r-raḥmānu wa-qāla ṣawāban

39.content: ذٰلِكَ اليَومُ الحَقُّ ۖ فَمَن شاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلىٰ رَبِّهِ مَآبًا
39.translation_eng: That is the day of truth.So let anyone who wishes take resort with his Lord.
39.transliteration: dhālika l-yawmu l-ḥaqqu fa-man shāʾa ttakhadha ʾilā rabbihī maʾāban

40.content: إِنّا أَنذَرناكُم عَذابًا قَريبًا يَومَ يَنظُرُ المَرءُ ما قَدَّمَت يَداهُ وَيَقولُ الكافِرُ يا لَيتَني كُنتُ تُرابًا
40.translation_eng: Indeed We have warned youof a punishment near at hand—the day when a person will observe1what his hands have sent aheadand the faithless one will say,‘I wish I were dust!’Or ‘consider.’
40.transliteration: ʾinnā ʾandharnākum ʿadhāban qarīban yawma yanẓuru l-marʾu mā qaddamat yadāhu wa-yaqūlu l-kāfiru yā-laytanī kuntu turāban

79.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by The Wresters, the angelic pullers, who shall harshly wrest out the souls of the unbelievers at their appointed time of death. It takes its name from “the wresters” (al-nāziʿāt) mentioned in verse 1. The main theme of the surah is the possibility and inevitability of the Resurrection, its results, and its timing. The story of Moses and Pharaoh acts as encouragement to the Prophet and a warning to the disbelievers.The surah is also known as: (Soul-)Snatchers, Extractors, The Angelic Pullers, The Forceful Chargers, The Pluckers, The Soul-Snatchers, Those That Rise, Those Who Pull and Withdraw, Those Who Tear Out.

1.translation_eng: By those [angels] who wrest [the soul] violently,

2.translation_eng: by those who draw [it] out gently,

3.content: وَالسّابِحاتِ سَبحًا
3.translation_eng: by those who swim smoothly,
3.transliteration: wa-s-sābiḥāti sabḥan

4.content: فَالسّابِقاتِ سَبقًا
4.translation_eng: by those who take the lead, racing,
4.transliteration: fa-s-sābiqāti sabqan

5.content: فَالمُدَبِّراتِ أَمرًا
5.translation_eng: by those who direct the affairs [of creatures]:
5.transliteration: fa-l-mudabbirāti ʾamran

6.content: يَومَ تَرجُفُ الرّاجِفَةُ
6.translation_eng: the day when the Quaker quakes
6.transliteration: yawma tarjufu r-rājifatu

7.content: تَتبَعُهَا الرّادِفَةُ
7.translation_eng: and is followed by the Successor,1Apparently, ‘the Quaker’ and ‘the Successor’ refer to the first and the second blasts of the Trumpet sounded by Isrāfīl on the Day of Resurrection. Cf. 39:68; 73:14.
7.transliteration: tatbaʿuhā r-rādifatu

8.content: قُلوبٌ يَومَئِذٍ واجِفَةٌ
8.translation_eng: hearts will be trembling on that day,
8.transliteration: qulūbun yawmaʾidhin wājifatun

9.content: أَبصارُها خاشِعَةٌ
9.translation_eng: bearing a humbled look.
9.transliteration: ʾabṣāruhā khāshiʿatun

10.content: يَقولونَ أَإِنّا لَمَردودونَ فِي الحافِرَةِ
10.translation_eng: They will say,‘Are we being returned to our earlier state?
10.transliteration: yaqūlūna ʾa-ʾinnā la-mardūdūna fī l-ḥāfirati

11.content: أَإِذا كُنّا عِظامًا نَخِرَةً
11.translation_eng: What, when we have been decayed bones?!’
11.transliteration: ʾa-ʾidhā kunnā ʿiẓāman nakhiratan

12.content: قالوا تِلكَ إِذًا كَرَّةٌ خاسِرَةٌ
12.translation_eng: They will say, ‘This, then, is a ruinous return!’
12.transliteration: qālū tilka ʾidhan karratun khāsiratun

13.content: فَإِنَّما هِيَ زَجرَةٌ واحِدَةٌ
13.translation_eng: Yet it will be only a single shout,
13.transliteration: fa-ʾinnamā hiya zajratun wāḥidatun

14.content: فَإِذا هُم بِالسّاهِرَةِ
14.translation_eng: and behold, they will be awake.
14.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā hum bi-s-sāhirati

15.content: هَل أَتاكَ حَديثُ موسىٰ
15.translation_eng: Did you receive the story of Moses,
15.transliteration: hal ʾatāka ḥadīthu mūsā

16.content: إِذ ناداهُ رَبُّهُ بِالوادِ المُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
16.translation_eng: when his Lord called out to himin the holy valley of Ṭuwā?
16.transliteration: ʾidh nādāhu rabbuhū bi-l-wādi l-muqaddasi ṭuwan-i

17.content: اذهَب إِلىٰ فِرعَونَ إِنَّهُ طَغىٰ
17.translation_eng: [And said,] ‘Go to Pharaoh,for indeed he has rebelled,
17.transliteration: idhhab ʾilā firʿawna ʾinnahū ṭaghā

18.content: فَقُل هَل لَكَ إِلىٰ أَن تَزَكّىٰ
18.translation_eng: and say, “Would you purify yourself?
18.transliteration: fa-qul hal laka ʾilā ʾan tazakkā

19.content: وَأَهدِيَكَ إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخشىٰ
19.translation_eng: I will guide you to your Lord,that you may fear [Him]?” ’
19.transliteration: wa-ʾahdiyaka ʾilā rabbika fa-takhshā

20.content: فَأَراهُ الآيَةَ الكُبرىٰ
20.translation_eng: Then he showed him the greatest sign.
20.transliteration: fa-ʾarāhu l-ʾāyata l-kubrā

21.content: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصىٰ
21.translation_eng: But he denied, and disobeyed.
21.transliteration: fa-kadhdhaba wa-ʿaṣā

22.content: ثُمَّ أَدبَرَ يَسعىٰ
22.translation_eng: Then he turned back, walking swiftly,
22.transliteration: thumma ʾadbara yasʿā

23.content: فَحَشَرَ فَنادىٰ
23.translation_eng: and mustered [the people] and proclaimed,
23.transliteration: fa-ḥashara fa-nādā

24.content: فَقالَ أَنا رَبُّكُمُ الأَعلىٰ
24.translation_eng: saying, ‘I am your exalted lord!’
24.transliteration: fa-qāla ʾana rabbukumu l-ʾaʿlā

25.content: فَأَخَذَهُ اللَّهُ نَكالَ الآخِرَةِ وَالأولىٰ
25.translation_eng: So Allah seized himwith the punishment of this life and the Hereafter.
25.transliteration: fa-ʾakhadhahu llāhu nakāla l-ʾākhirati wa-l-ʾūlā

26.content: إِنَّ في ذٰلِكَ لَعِبرَةً لِمَن يَخشىٰ
26.translation_eng: There is indeed a moral in that for someone who fears!
26.transliteration: ʾinna fī dhālika la-ʿibratan li-man yakhshā

27.content: أَأَنتُم أَشَدُّ خَلقًا أَمِ السَّماءُ ۚ بَناها
27.translation_eng: Is it you whose creation is more prodigiousor the sky which He has built?
27.transliteration: ʾa-ʾantum ʾashaddu khalqan ʾami s-samāʾu banāhā

28.content: رَفَعَ سَمكَها فَسَوّاها
28.translation_eng: He raised its vault, and fashioned it,
28.transliteration: rafaʿa samkahā fa-sawwāhā

29.content: وَأَغطَشَ لَيلَها وَأَخرَجَ ضُحاها
29.translation_eng: and darkened its night,and brought forth its day;
29.transliteration: wa-ʾaghṭasha laylahā wa-ʾakhraja ḍuḥāhā

30.content: وَالأَرضَ بَعدَ ذٰلِكَ دَحاها
30.translation_eng: and after that He spread out the earth,
30.transliteration: wa-l-ʾarḍa baʿda dhālika daḥāhā

31.content: أَخرَجَ مِنها ماءَها وَمَرعاها
31.translation_eng: and brought forth from it its water and pastures,
31.transliteration: ʾakhraja minhā māʾahā wa-marʿāhā

32.content: وَالجِبالَ أَرساها
32.translation_eng: and set firm the mountains,
32.transliteration: wa-l-jibāla ʾarsāhā

33.content: مَتاعًا لَكُم وَلِأَنعامِكُم
33.translation_eng: as a [place of] sustenance for youand your livestock.
33.transliteration: matāʿan lakum wa-li-ʾanʿāmikum

34.content: فَإِذا جاءَتِ الطّامَّةُ الكُبرىٰ
34.translation_eng: When the Greatest Catastrophe befalls,
34.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā jāʾati ṭ-ṭāmmatu l-kubrā

35.content: يَومَ يَتَذَكَّرُ الإِنسانُ ما سَعىٰ
35.translation_eng: the day when man will remember his endeavours,
35.transliteration: yawma yatadhakkaru l-ʾinsānu mā saʿā

36.content: وَبُرِّزَتِ الجَحيمُ لِمَن يَرىٰ
36.translation_eng: and hell is brought into view for one who sees,
36.transliteration: wa-burrizati l-jaḥīmu li-man yarā

37.content: فَأَمّا مَن طَغىٰ
37.translation_eng: as for him who was rebellious
37.transliteration: fa-ʾammā man ṭaghā

38.content: وَآثَرَ الحَياةَ الدُّنيا
38.translation_eng: and preferred the life of this world,
38.transliteration: wa-ʾāthara l-ḥayāta d-dunyā

39.content: فَإِنَّ الجَحيمَ هِيَ المَأوىٰ
39.translation_eng: his refuge will indeed be hell.
39.transliteration: fa-ʾinna l-jaḥīma hiya l-maʾwā

40.content: وَأَمّا مَن خافَ مَقامَ رَبِّهِ وَنَهَى النَّفسَ عَنِ الهَوىٰ
40.translation_eng: But as for him who is awed to stand before his Lordand forbids the soul from [following] desire,
40.transliteration: wa-ʾammā man khāfa maqāma rabbihī wa-nahā n-nafsa ʿani l-hawā

41.content: فَإِنَّ الجَنَّةَ هِيَ المَأوىٰ
41.translation_eng: his refuge will indeed be paradise.
41.transliteration: fa-ʾinna l-jannata hiya l-maʾwā

42.content: يَسأَلونَكَ عَنِ السّاعَةِ أَيّانَ مُرساها
42.translation_eng: They ask you concerning the Hour,“When will it set in,
42.transliteration: yasʾalūnaka ʿani s-sāʿati ʾayyāna mursāhā

43.content: فيمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكراها
43.translation_eng: considering your frequent mention of it?”
43.transliteration: fī-ma ʾanta min dhikrāhā

44.content: إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهاها
44.translation_eng: Its outcome is with your Lord.
44.transliteration: ʾilā rabbika muntahāhā

45.content: إِنَّما أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن يَخشاها
45.translation_eng: You are only a warner for those who fear it.
45.transliteration: ʾinnamā ʾanta mundhiru man yakhshāhā

46.content: كَأَنَّهُم يَومَ يَرَونَها لَم يَلبَثوا إِلّا عَشِيَّةً أَو ضُحاها
46.translation_eng: The day they see it, it shall be as ifthey had not stayed [in the world]except for an evening or forenoon.
46.transliteration: ka-ʾannahum yawma yarawnahā lam yalbathū ʾillā ʿashiyyatan ʾaw ḍuḥāhā

80.description: The surah that opens with admonishing the Prophet and refers to him as He [who] Frowned and turned away. While the Prophet was speaking to some unbelieving nobles of Quraysh, hoping to convert them, a blind Muslim man came up to learn from him, but in his eagerness to attract the disbelievers to Islam, the Prophet frowned at him. The Prophet is then reproached and told not to concern himself with the disbelievers. It takes its name from the word “he frowned” (ʿabasa) in verse 1. The surah also deals with the condemnation of man’s ingratitude: man becomes self-satisfied and forgets his origin and his final return to God.The surah is also known as: He Made a Wry Face, He Who Frowned.

1.translation_eng: He frowned and turned away

2.translation_eng: when the blind man approached him.

3.content: وَما يُدريكَ لَعَلَّهُ يَزَّكّىٰ
3.translation_eng: And how do you know,maybe he would purify himself,
3.transliteration: wa-mā yudrīka laʿallahū yazzakkā

4.content: أَو يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ الذِّكرىٰ
4.translation_eng: or take admonition,and the admonition would benefit him!
4.transliteration: ʾaw yadhdhakkaru fa-tanfaʿahu dh-dhikrā

5.content: أَمّا مَنِ استَغنىٰ
5.translation_eng: But as for someone who is self-complacent,
5.transliteration: ʾammā mani staghnā

6.content: فَأَنتَ لَهُ تَصَدّىٰ
6.translation_eng: you attend to him,
6.transliteration: fa-ʾanta lahū taṣaddā

7.content: وَما عَلَيكَ أَلّا يَزَّكّىٰ
7.translation_eng: though you are not liableif he does not purify himself.
7.transliteration: wa-mā ʿalayka ʾallā yazzakkā

8.content: وَأَمّا مَن جاءَكَ يَسعىٰ
8.translation_eng: But he who comes hurrying to you,
8.transliteration: wa-ʾammā man jāʾaka yasʿā

9.content: وَهُوَ يَخشىٰ
9.translation_eng: while he fears [Allah],
9.transliteration: wa-huwa yakhshā

10.content: فَأَنتَ عَنهُ تَلَهّىٰ
10.translation_eng: you are neglectful of him.
10.transliteration: fa-ʾanta ʿanhu talahhā

11.content: كَلّا إِنَّها تَذكِرَةٌ
11.translation_eng: No indeed! These [verses of the Qurʾān] are a reminder
11.transliteration: kallā ʾinnahā tadhkiratun

12.content: فَمَن شاءَ ذَكَرَهُ
12.translation_eng: —so let anyone who wishes remember it—
12.transliteration: fa-man shāʾa dhakarahū

13.content: في صُحُفٍ مُكَرَّمَةٍ
13.translation_eng: in honoured scriptures,
13.transliteration: fī ṣuḥufin mukarramatin

14.content: مَرفوعَةٍ مُطَهَّرَةٍ
14.translation_eng: exalted and purified,
14.transliteration: marfūʿatin muṭahharatin

15.content: بِأَيدي سَفَرَةٍ
15.translation_eng: in the hands of envoys,1Or ‘scribes.’
15.transliteration: bi-ʾaydī safaratin

16.content: كِرامٍ بَرَرَةٍ
16.translation_eng: noble and pious.
16.transliteration: kirāmin bararatin

17.content: قُتِلَ الإِنسانُ ما أَكفَرَهُ
17.translation_eng: Perish man! How ungrateful is he!
17.transliteration: qutila l-ʾinsānu mā ʾakfarahū

18.content: مِن أَيِّ شَيءٍ خَلَقَهُ
18.translation_eng: From what has He created him?
18.transliteration: min ʾayyi shayʾin khalaqahū

19.content: مِن نُطفَةٍ خَلَقَهُ فَقَدَّرَهُ
19.translation_eng: He has created him from a drop of [seminal] fluid,and then proportioned him.
19.transliteration: min nuṭfatin khalaqahū fa-qaddarahū

20.content: ثُمَّ السَّبيلَ يَسَّرَهُ
20.translation_eng: Then He made the way easy for him;
20.transliteration: thumma s-sabīla yassarahū

21.content: ثُمَّ أَماتَهُ فَأَقبَرَهُ
21.translation_eng: then He made him die and buried him;
21.transliteration: thumma ʾamātahū fa-ʾaqbarahū

22.content: ثُمَّ إِذا شاءَ أَنشَرَهُ
22.translation_eng: and then, when He wished, resurrected him.
22.transliteration: thumma ʾidhā shāʾa ʾansharahū

23.content: كَلّا لَمّا يَقضِ ما أَمَرَهُ
23.translation_eng: No indeed! He has not yet carried outwhat He had commanded him.
23.transliteration: kallā lammā yaqḍi mā ʾamarahū

24.content: فَليَنظُرِ الإِنسانُ إِلىٰ طَعامِهِ
24.translation_eng: So let man observe1 his food:Or ‘consider.’
24.transliteration: fa-l-yanẓuri l-ʾinsānu ʾilā ṭaʿāmihī

25.content: أَنّا صَبَبنَا الماءَ صَبًّا
25.translation_eng: We poured down water plenteously,
25.transliteration: ʾannā ṣababnā l-māʾa ṣabban

26.content: ثُمَّ شَقَقنَا الأَرضَ شَقًّا
26.translation_eng: then We split the earth into fissures
26.transliteration: thumma shaqqaqnā l-ʾarḍa shaqqan

27.content: فَأَنبَتنا فيها حَبًّا
27.translation_eng: and made the grain grow in it,
27.transliteration: fa-ʾanbatnā fīhā ḥabban

28.content: وَعِنَبًا وَقَضبًا
28.translation_eng: and vines and vegetables,
28.transliteration: wa-ʿinaban wa-qaḍban

29.content: وَزَيتونًا وَنَخلًا
29.translation_eng: olives and date palms,
29.transliteration: wa-zaytūnan wa-nakhlan

30.content: وَحَدائِقَ غُلبًا
30.translation_eng: and densely-planted gardens,
30.transliteration: wa-ḥadāʾiqa ghulban

31.content: وَفاكِهَةً وَأَبًّا
31.translation_eng: fruits and pastures,
31.transliteration: wa-fākihatan wa-ʾabban

32.content: مَتاعًا لَكُم وَلِأَنعامِكُم
32.translation_eng: as a sustenance for you and your livestock.
32.transliteration: matāʿan lakum wa-li-ʾanʿāmikum

33.content: فَإِذا جاءَتِ الصّاخَّةُ
33.translation_eng: So when the deafening Cry comes
33.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā jāʾati ṣ-ṣākhkhatu

34.content: يَومَ يَفِرُّ المَرءُ مِن أَخيهِ
34.translation_eng: —the day when a man will evade his brother,
34.transliteration: yawma yafirru l-marʾu min ʾakhīhi

35.content: وَأُمِّهِ وَأَبيهِ
35.translation_eng: his mother and his father,
35.transliteration: wa-ʾummihī wa-ʾabīhi

36.content: وَصاحِبَتِهِ وَبَنيهِ
36.translation_eng: his spouse and his sons—
36.transliteration: wa-ṣāḥibatihī wa-banīhi

37.content: لِكُلِّ امرِئٍ مِنهُم يَومَئِذٍ شَأنٌ يُغنيهِ
37.translation_eng: that day each of them will havea task to keep him preoccupied.
37.transliteration: li-kulli mriʾin minhum yawmaʾidhin shaʾnun yughnīhi

38.content: وُجوهٌ يَومَئِذٍ مُسفِرَةٌ
38.translation_eng: That day some faces will be bright,
38.transliteration: wujūhun yawmaʾidhin musfiratun

39.content: ضاحِكَةٌ مُستَبشِرَةٌ
39.translation_eng: laughing and joyous.
39.transliteration: ḍāḥikatun mustabshiratun

40.content: وَوُجوهٌ يَومَئِذٍ عَلَيها غَبَرَةٌ
40.translation_eng: And some faces on that daywill be covered with dust,
40.transliteration: wa-wujūhun yawmaʾidhin ʿalayhā ghabaratun

41.content: تَرهَقُها قَتَرَةٌ
41.translation_eng: overcast with gloom.
41.transliteration: tarhaquhā qataratun

42.content: أُولٰئِكَ هُمُ الكَفَرَةُ الفَجَرَةُ
42.translation_eng: It is they who are the faithless, the vicious.1Or ‘vicious ingrates.’
42.transliteration: ʾulāʾika humu l-kafaratu l-fajaratu

81.description: The surah that opens with a riveting description of The Winding Up of the sun at the end of earthly life and the dawn of eternity. It takes its name from “the winding up”, “the enfolding” or “the darkening” (takwīr) of the sun as mentioned in verse 1. The surah stress the fact that people will be confronted by their deeds on Judgement Day, asserting the truth of the Quran, and calling people to the right path. It opens with a powerful description of events on that Day.The surah is also known as: Shrouded in Darkness, The Cessation, The Compacting, The Darkening, The Enfolding, The Folding up, Wrapping Things Up.

1.translation_eng: When the sun is wound up,1Or ‘turns dark.’

2.translation_eng: when the stars scatter,1Or ‘fall down.’

3.content: وَإِذَا الجِبالُ سُيِّرَت
3.translation_eng: when the mountains are set moving,
3.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā l-jibālu suyyirat

4.content: وَإِذَا العِشارُ عُطِّلَت
4.translation_eng: when the pregnant camels are neglected,
4.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā l-ʿishāru ʿuṭṭilat

5.content: وَإِذَا الوُحوشُ حُشِرَت
5.translation_eng: when the wild beasts are mustered,
5.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā l-wuḥūshu ḥushirat

6.content: وَإِذَا البِحارُ سُجِّرَت
6.translation_eng: when the seas are set afire,
6.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā l-biḥāru sujjirat

7.content: وَإِذَا النُّفوسُ زُوِّجَت
7.translation_eng: when the souls are assorted,1That is, separated into different groups according to their character; cf. 56:7; 37:22. Or ‘mated;’ cf. 52:20.
7.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā n-nufūsu zuwwijat

8.content: وَإِذَا المَوءودَةُ سُئِلَت
8.translation_eng: when the girl buried-alive will be asked
8.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā l-mawʾūdatu suʾilat

9.content: بِأَيِّ ذَنبٍ قُتِلَت
9.translation_eng: for what sin she was killed.
9.transliteration: bi-ʾayyi dhanbin qutilat

10.content: وَإِذَا الصُّحُفُ نُشِرَت
10.translation_eng: When the records [of deeds] are unfolded,
10.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā ṣ-ṣuḥufu nushirat

11.content: وَإِذَا السَّماءُ كُشِطَت
11.translation_eng: when the sky is stripped off,
11.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā s-samāʾu kushiṭat

12.content: وَإِذَا الجَحيمُ سُعِّرَت
12.translation_eng: when hell is set ablaze,
12.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā l-jaḥīmu suʿʿirat

13.content: وَإِذَا الجَنَّةُ أُزلِفَت
13.translation_eng: when paradise is brought near,
13.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā l-jannatu ʾuzlifat

14.content: عَلِمَت نَفسٌ ما أَحضَرَت
14.translation_eng: then a soul shall know what it has readied [for itself].
14.transliteration: ʿalimat nafsun mā ʾaḥḍarat

15.content: فَلا أُقسِمُ بِالخُنَّسِ
15.translation_eng: So I swear by the stars that return,
15.transliteration: fa-lā ʾuqsimu bi-l-khunnasi

16.content: الجَوارِ الكُنَّسِ
16.translation_eng: the planets that hide,
16.transliteration: al-jawāri l-kunnasi

17.content: وَاللَّيلِ إِذا عَسعَسَ
17.translation_eng: by the night as it approaches,
17.transliteration: wa-l-layli ʾidhā ʿasʿasa

18.content: وَالصُّبحِ إِذا تَنَفَّسَ
18.translation_eng: by the dawn as it breathes,
18.transliteration: wa-ṣ-ṣubḥi ʾidhā tanaffasa

19.content: إِنَّهُ لَقَولُ رَسولٍ كَريمٍ
19.translation_eng: it is indeed the speech of a noble apostle,1Cf. 69:40.
19.transliteration: ʾinnahū la-qawlu rasūlin karīmin

20.content: ذي قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِي العَرشِ مَكينٍ
20.translation_eng: powerful and eminent with the Lord of the Throne,
20.transliteration: dhī quwwatin ʿinda dhī l-ʿarshi makīnin

21.content: مُطاعٍ ثَمَّ أَمينٍ
21.translation_eng: one who is heard and trustworthy as well.
21.transliteration: muṭāʿin thamma ʾamīnin

22.content: وَما صاحِبُكُم بِمَجنونٍ
22.translation_eng: Your companion is not crazy:
22.transliteration: wa-mā ṣāḥibukum bi-majnūnin

23.content: وَلَقَد رَآهُ بِالأُفُقِ المُبينِ
23.translation_eng: certainly he saw him on the manifest horizon,
23.transliteration: wa-la-qad raʾāhu bi-l-ʾufuqi l-mubīni

24.content: وَما هُوَ عَلَى الغَيبِ بِضَنينٍ
24.translation_eng: and he is not miserly concerning the Unseen.
24.transliteration: wa-mā huwa ʿalā l-ghaybi bi-ḍanīnin

25.content: وَما هُوَ بِقَولِ شَيطانٍ رَجيمٍ
25.translation_eng: And it is not the speech of an outcast Satan.
