25.transliteration: wa-mā huwa bi-qawli shayṭānin rajīmin

26.content: فَأَينَ تَذهَبونَ
26.translation_eng: So where are you going?
26.transliteration: fa-ʾayna tadhhabūna

27.content: إِن هُوَ إِلّا ذِكرٌ لِلعالَمينَ
27.translation_eng: It is just a reminder for all the nations,
27.transliteration: ʾin huwa ʾillā dhikrun li-l-ʿālamīna

28.content: لِمَن شاءَ مِنكُم أَن يَستَقيمَ
28.translation_eng: for those of you who wish to be steadfast;1Or ‘for those of you who wish to walk straight.’
28.transliteration: li-man shāʾa minkum ʾan yastaqīma

29.content: وَما تَشاءونَ إِلّا أَن يَشاءَ اللَّهُ رَبُّ العالَمينَ
29.translation_eng: but you do not wishunless it is wished by Allah,the Lord of all the worlds.
29.transliteration: wa-mā tashāʾūna ʾillā ʾan yashāʾa llāhu rabbu l-ʿālamīna

82.description: The surah that opens with a riveting description of The Rending open of the sky at the onset of the Day of Resurrection and assets that every human is being watched by angels and shall stand accountable before God in the Hereafter. It takes its name from “the renting” or “torn apart” (infiṭār) of the sky mentioned in verse 1. The surah deals with man’s ingratitude and his failure to concede that the Day of Judgement will come.The surah is also known as: Bursting Apart, Cleft Asunder, The Cataclysm, The Cleaving Asunder, The Splitting, Torn Apart.

1.translation_eng: When the sky is rent apart,

2.translation_eng: when the stars are scattered,

3.content: وَإِذَا البِحارُ فُجِّرَت
3.translation_eng: when the seas are merged,
3.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā l-biḥāru fujjirat

4.content: وَإِذَا القُبورُ بُعثِرَت
4.translation_eng: when the graves are overturned,
4.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā l-qubūru buʿthirat

5.content: عَلِمَت نَفسٌ ما قَدَّمَت وَأَخَّرَت
5.translation_eng: then a soul shall know what it has sentahead and left behind.
5.transliteration: ʿalimat nafsun mā qaddamat wa-ʾakhkharat

6.content: يا أَيُّهَا الإِنسانُ ما غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ الكَريمِ
6.translation_eng: O man!What has deceived you about your generous1 Lord,Or ‘noble.’
6.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā l-ʾinsānu mā gharraka bi-rabbika l-karīmi

7.content: الَّذي خَلَقَكَ فَسَوّاكَ فَعَدَلَكَ
7.translation_eng: who created you and proportioned you,and gave you an upright nature,
7.transliteration: alladhī khalaqaka fa-sawwāka fa-ʿadalaka

8.content: في أَيِّ صورَةٍ ما شاءَ رَكَّبَكَ
8.translation_eng: and composed you in any form that He wished?
8.transliteration: fī ʾayyi ṣūratin mā shāʾa rakkabaka

9.content: كَلّا بَل تُكَذِّبونَ بِالدّينِ
9.translation_eng: No indeed! Rather you deny the Retribution.
9.transliteration: kallā bal tukadhdhibūna bi-d-dīni

10.content: وَإِنَّ عَلَيكُم لَحافِظينَ
10.translation_eng: Indeed, there are over you watchers,
10.transliteration: wa-ʾinna ʿalaykum la-ḥāfiẓīna

11.content: كِرامًا كاتِبينَ
11.translation_eng: noble writers
11.transliteration: kirāman kātibīna

12.content: يَعلَمونَ ما تَفعَلونَ
12.translation_eng: who know whatever you do.
12.transliteration: yaʿlamūna mā tafʿalūna

13.content: إِنَّ الأَبرارَ لَفي نَعيمٍ
13.translation_eng: Indeed the pious shall be amid bliss,
13.transliteration: ʾinna l-ʾabrāra la-fī naʿīmin

14.content: وَإِنَّ الفُجّارَ لَفي جَحيمٍ
14.translation_eng: and indeed the vicious shall be in hell
14.transliteration: wa-ʾinna l-fujjāra la-fī jaḥīmin

15.content: يَصلَونَها يَومَ الدّينِ
15.translation_eng: entering it on the Day of Retribution,1Or ‘the Day of Judgement.’
15.transliteration: yaṣlawnahā yawma d-dīni

16.content: وَما هُم عَنها بِغائِبينَ
16.translation_eng: and they shall not be absent from it.
16.transliteration: wa-mā hum ʿanhā bi-ghāʾibīna

17.content: وَما أَدراكَ ما يَومُ الدّينِ
17.translation_eng: And what will show youwhat is the Day of Retribution?
17.transliteration: wa-mā ʾadrāka mā yawmu d-dīni

18.content: ثُمَّ ما أَدراكَ ما يَومُ الدّينِ
18.translation_eng: Again, what will showyou what is the Day of Retribution?
18.transliteration: thumma mā ʾadrāka mā yawmu d-dīni

19.content: يَومَ لا تَملِكُ نَفسٌ لِنَفسٍ شَيئًا ۖ وَالأَمرُ يَومَئِذٍ لِلَّهِ
19.translation_eng: It is a daywhen no soul will be of any avail to another souland all command that day will belong to Allah.
19.transliteration: yawma lā tamliku nafsun li-nafsin shayʾan wa-l-ʾamru yawmaʾidhin li-llāhi

83.description: The surah that opens with a dire divine warning of a debasing punishment awaiting in the Hereafter for those who practice cheating as a norm in commerce, and whom is calls The Defrauders because they insist on receiving a full amount in return for the partial measure that they themselves give. It takes its name from verse 1, which condemns the tradesmen who cheat customers by using short weights and measures (muṭaifūn). It appears that the practice of cheating have been prevalent in Mecca, and is strongly condemned here and elsewhere in the Quran (e.g. 11: 84 .; 7: 85).The surah is also known as: The Cheats, The Dealing in Fraud, The Defrauders, The Stinters, The Unjust, Those who Give Short Measure.

1.translation_eng: Woe to the defrauders who use short measures,

2.content: الَّذينَ إِذَا اكتالوا عَلَى النّاسِ يَستَوفونَ
2.translation_eng: who, when they measure [a commodity bought]from the people,take the full measure,
2.transliteration: alladhīna ʾidhā ktālū ʿalā n-nāsi yastawfūna

3.content: وَإِذا كالوهُم أَو وَزَنوهُم يُخسِرونَ
3.translation_eng: but diminish when they measure or weigh for them.
3.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā kālūhum ʾaw wazanūhum yukhsirūna

4.content: أَلا يَظُنُّ أُولٰئِكَ أَنَّهُم مَبعوثونَ
4.translation_eng: Do they not know that they will be resurrected
4.transliteration: ʾa-lā yaẓunnu ʾulāʾika ʾannahum mabʿūthūna

5.content: لِيَومٍ عَظيمٍ
5.translation_eng: on a tremendous day,
5.transliteration: li-yawmin ʿaẓīmin

6.content: يَومَ يَقومُ النّاسُ لِرَبِّ العالَمينَ
6.translation_eng: a day when mankind will standbefore the Lord of all the worlds?
6.transliteration: yawma yaqūmu n-nāsu li-rabbi l-ʿālamīna

7.content: كَلّا إِنَّ كِتابَ الفُجّارِ لَفي سِجّينٍ
7.translation_eng: No indeed! The record of the vicious is indeed in Sijjīn.
7.transliteration: kallā ʾinna kitāba l-fujjāri la-fī sijjīnin

8.content: وَما أَدراكَ ما سِجّينٌ
8.translation_eng: And what will show you what is Sijjīn?
8.transliteration: wa-mā ʾadrāka mā sijjīnun

9.content: كِتابٌ مَرقومٌ
9.translation_eng: It is a written record.
9.transliteration: kitābun marqūmun

10.content: وَيلٌ يَومَئِذٍ لِلمُكَذِّبينَ
10.translation_eng: Woe to the deniers on that day,
10.transliteration: waylun yawmaʾidhin li-l-mukadhdhibīna

11.content: الَّذينَ يُكَذِّبونَ بِيَومِ الدّينِ
11.translation_eng: who deny the Day of Retribution;
11.transliteration: alladhīna yukadhdhibūna bi-yawmi d-dīni

12.content: وَما يُكَذِّبُ بِهِ إِلّا كُلُّ مُعتَدٍ أَثيمٍ
12.translation_eng: and none denies it except every sinful transgressor.
12.transliteration: wa-mā yukadhdhibu bihī ʾillā kullu muʿtadin ʾathīmin

13.content: إِذا تُتلىٰ عَلَيهِ آياتُنا قالَ أَساطيرُ الأَوَّلينَ
13.translation_eng: When Our signs are recited to him,he says, ‘Myths of the ancients!’
13.transliteration: ʾidhā tutlā ʿalayhi ʾāyātunā qāla ʾasāṭīru l-ʾawwalīna

14.content: كَلّا ۖ بَل ۜ رانَ عَلىٰ قُلوبِهِم ما كانوا يَكسِبونَ
14.translation_eng: No indeed! Rather their hearts have been sullied1by what they have been earning.Or ‘overcast.’
14.transliteration: kallā bal rāna ʿalā qulūbihim mā kānū yaksibūna

15.content: كَلّا إِنَّهُم عَن رَبِّهِم يَومَئِذٍ لَمَحجوبونَ
15.translation_eng: No indeed!They will be alienated from their Lord on that day.
15.transliteration: kallā ʾinnahum ʿan rabbihim yawmaʾidhin la-maḥjūbūna

16.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُم لَصالُو الجَحيمِ
16.translation_eng: Then they will indeed enter hell,
16.transliteration: thumma ʾinnahum la-ṣālū l-jaḥīmi

17.content: ثُمَّ يُقالُ هٰذَا الَّذي كُنتُم بِهِ تُكَذِّبونَ
17.translation_eng: then told,‘This is what you used to deny!’
17.transliteration: thumma yuqālu hādhā lladhī kuntum bihī tukadhdhibūna

18.content: كَلّا إِنَّ كِتابَ الأَبرارِ لَفي عِلِّيّينَ
18.translation_eng: No indeed!The record of the pious is indeed in Illīyūn.
18.transliteration: kallā ʾinna kitāba l-ʾabrāri la-fī ʿilliyyīna

19.content: وَما أَدراكَ ما عِلِّيّونَ
19.translation_eng: And what will show you what is Illīyūn?
19.transliteration: wa-mā ʾadrāka mā ʿilliyyūna

20.content: كِتابٌ مَرقومٌ
20.translation_eng: It is a written record,
20.transliteration: kitābun marqūmun

21.content: يَشهَدُهُ المُقَرَّبونَ
21.translation_eng: witnessed by those brought near [to Allah].
21.transliteration: yashhaduhu l-muqarrabūna

22.content: إِنَّ الأَبرارَ لَفي نَعيمٍ
22.translation_eng: Indeed the pious shall be amid bliss,
22.transliteration: ʾinna l-ʾabrāra la-fī naʿīmin

23.content: عَلَى الأَرائِكِ يَنظُرونَ
23.translation_eng: observing, [as they recline] on couches.
23.transliteration: ʿalā l-ʾarāʾiki yanẓurūna

24.content: تَعرِفُ في وُجوهِهِم نَضرَةَ النَّعيمِ
24.translation_eng: You will perceive in their faces the freshness of bliss
24.transliteration: taʿrifu fī wujūhihim naḍrata n-naʿīmi

25.content: يُسقَونَ مِن رَحيقٍ مَختومٍ
25.translation_eng: as they are served with a sealed wine,
25.transliteration: yusqawna min raḥīqin makhtūmin

26.content: خِتامُهُ مِسكٌ ۚ وَفي ذٰلِكَ فَليَتَنافَسِ المُتَنافِسونَ
26.translation_eng: whose seal is musk—for such let the viers vie—
26.transliteration: khitāmuhū miskun wa-fī dhālika fa-l-yatanāfasi l-mutanāfisūna

27.content: وَمِزاجُهُ مِن تَسنيمٍ
27.translation_eng: and whose seasoning is from Tasnīm,
27.transliteration: wa-mizājuhū min tasnīmin

28.content: عَينًا يَشرَبُ بِهَا المُقَرَّبونَ
28.translation_eng: a spring where those brought near [to Allah] drink.
28.transliteration: ʿaynan yashrabu bihā l-muqarrabūna

29.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ أَجرَموا كانوا مِنَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا يَضحَكونَ
29.translation_eng: Indeed the guiltyused to laugh at the faithful,
29.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾajramū kānū mina lladhīna ʾāmanū yaḍḥakūna

30.content: وَإِذا مَرّوا بِهِم يَتَغامَزونَ
30.translation_eng: and when they passed themby they would wink at each other,
30.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā marrū bihim yataghāmazūna

31.content: وَإِذَا انقَلَبوا إِلىٰ أَهلِهِمُ انقَلَبوا فَكِهينَ
31.translation_eng: and when they returned to their folksthey would return rejoicing,
31.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā nqalabū ʾilā ʾahlihimu nqalabū fakihīna

32.content: وَإِذا رَأَوهُم قالوا إِنَّ هٰؤُلاءِ لَضالّونَ
32.translation_eng: and when they saw themthey would say,‘Indeed those are the astray!’
32.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā raʾawhum qālū ʾinna hāʾulāʾi la-ḍāllūna

33.content: وَما أُرسِلوا عَلَيهِم حافِظينَ
33.translation_eng: Though they were not sent to watch over them.
33.transliteration: wa-mā ʾursilū ʿalayhim ḥāfizīna

34.content: فَاليَومَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا مِنَ الكُفّارِ يَضحَكونَ
34.translation_eng: So today the faithfulwill laugh at the faithless,
34.transliteration: fa-l-yawma lladhīna ʾāmanū mina l-kuffāri yaḍḥakūna

35.content: عَلَى الأَرائِكِ يَنظُرونَ
35.translation_eng: observing from couches:
35.transliteration: ʿalā l-ʾarāʾiki yanẓurūna

36.content: هَل ثُوِّبَ الكُفّارُ ما كانوا يَفعَلونَ
36.translation_eng: Have the faithless been requitedfor what they used to do?
36.transliteration: hal thuwwiba l-kuffāru mā kānū yafʿalūna

84.description: The surah that opens with a riveting description of The Splitting of the sky and the levelling of the earth as a sign of the commencement of the Day of Resurrection. It is named after the “splitting open” (inshiqāq) of the sky mentioned in verse 1. The surah deals with the inevitability of man’s meeting with his Lord on the Day of Judgement. The obedience of the sky and earth is contrasted with the disobedience of the disbelievers. The reaction of the believers and of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgement is described.The surah is also known as: Bursting Asunder, Ripped Apart, Splitting Open, The Bursting, The Cleaving, The Rending, The Rending Asunder.

1.translation_eng: When the sky is split open

2.translation_eng: and gives ear to its Lord as it should.

3.content: وَإِذَا الأَرضُ مُدَّت
3.translation_eng: When the earth is spread out
3.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā l-ʾarḍu muddat

4.content: وَأَلقَت ما فيها وَتَخَلَّت
4.translation_eng: and throws out what is in it, emptying itself,
4.transliteration: wa-ʾalqat mā fīhā wa-takhallat

5.content: وَأَذِنَت لِرَبِّها وَحُقَّت
5.translation_eng: and gives ear to its Lord as it should.
5.transliteration: wa-ʾadhinat li-rabbihā wa-ḥuqqat

6.content: يا أَيُّهَا الإِنسانُ إِنَّكَ كادِحٌ إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدحًا فَمُلاقيهِ
6.translation_eng: O man!You are labouring toward your Lord laboriously,and you will encounter Him.
6.transliteration: yā-ʾayyuhā l-ʾinsānu ʾinnaka kādiḥun ʾilā rabbika kadḥan fa-mulāqīhi

7.content: فَأَمّا مَن أوتِيَ كِتابَهُ بِيَمينِهِ
7.translation_eng: Then as for him who is given his recordin his right hand,
7.transliteration: fa-ʾammā man ʾūtiya kitābahū bi-yamīnihī

8.content: فَسَوفَ يُحاسَبُ حِسابًا يَسيرًا
8.translation_eng: he shall soon receive an easy reckoning,
8.transliteration: fa-sawfa yuḥāsabu ḥisāban yasīran

9.content: وَيَنقَلِبُ إِلىٰ أَهلِهِ مَسرورًا
9.translation_eng: and he will return to his folks joyfully.
9.transliteration: wa-yanqalibu ʾilā ʾahlihī masrūran

10.content: وَأَمّا مَن أوتِيَ كِتابَهُ وَراءَ ظَهرِهِ
10.translation_eng: But as for him who is given his recordfrom behind his back,
10.transliteration: wa-ʾammā man ʾūtiya kitābahū warāʾa ẓahrihī

11.content: فَسَوفَ يَدعو ثُبورًا
11.translation_eng: he will pray for annihilation,1Cf. 25:13-14, 78:40.
11.transliteration: fa-sawfa yadʿū thubūran

12.content: وَيَصلىٰ سَعيرًا
12.translation_eng: and he will enter the Blaze.
12.transliteration: wa-yaṣlā saʿīran

13.content: إِنَّهُ كانَ في أَهلِهِ مَسرورًا
13.translation_eng: Indeed he used to be joyful among his folk,
13.transliteration: ʾinnahū kāna fī ʾahlihī masrūran

14.content: إِنَّهُ ظَنَّ أَن لَن يَحورَ
14.translation_eng: and indeed he thought he would never return.
14.transliteration: ʾinnahū ẓanna ʾan lan yaḥūra

15.content: بَلىٰ إِنَّ رَبَّهُ كانَ بِهِ بَصيرًا
15.translation_eng: Yes indeed, his Lord sees him best.
15.transliteration: balā ʾinna rabbahū kāna bihī baṣīran

16.content: فَلا أُقسِمُ بِالشَّفَقِ
16.translation_eng: So I swear by the evening glow,
16.transliteration: fa-lā ʾuqsimu bi-sh-shafaqi

17.content: وَاللَّيلِ وَما وَسَقَ
17.translation_eng: by the night and what it is fraught with,
17.transliteration: wa-l-layli wa-mā wasaqa

18.content: وَالقَمَرِ إِذَا اتَّسَقَ
18.translation_eng: by the moon when it blooms full:
18.transliteration: wa-l-qamari ʾidhā ttasaqa

19.content: لَتَركَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَن طَبَقٍ
19.translation_eng: you will surely fare from stage to stage.
19.transliteration: la-tarkabunna ṭabaqan ʿan ṭabaqin

20.content: فَما لَهُم لا يُؤمِنونَ
20.translation_eng: So what is the matter with themthat they will not believe?
20.transliteration: fa-mā lahum lā yuʾminūna

21.content: وَإِذا قُرِئَ عَلَيهِمُ القُرآنُ لا يَسجُدونَ ۩
21.translation_eng: And when the Qurʾān is recited to themthey will not prostrate?
21.transliteration: wa-ʾidhā quriʾa ʿalayhimu l-qurʾānu lā yasjudūna

22.content: بَلِ الَّذينَ كَفَروا يُكَذِّبونَ
22.translation_eng: Rather the faithless deny,
22.transliteration: bali lladhīna kafarū yukadhdhibūna

23.content: وَاللَّهُ أَعلَمُ بِما يوعونَ
23.translation_eng: and Allah knows best what they keep to themselves.
23.transliteration: wa-llāhu ʾaʿlamu bi-mā yūʿūna

24.content: فَبَشِّرهُم بِعَذابٍ أَليمٍ
24.translation_eng: So warn them of a painful punishment,
24.transliteration: fa-bashshirhum bi-ʿadhābin ʾalīmin

25.content: إِلَّا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ لَهُم أَجرٌ غَيرُ مَمنونٍ
25.translation_eng: except such as are faithfuland do righteous deeds:there will be an everlasting reward for them.
25.transliteration: ʾillā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti lahum ʾajrun ghayru mamnūnin

85.description: The surah that opens with a three-part oath of the Divine One, who swears by the sky studded with The Houses, by the assurance that the Day of Resurrection shall come, and by His Own Universal Witness, which beholds all, that the believers shall have their reward, and the unbelievers their punishment, in the Hereafter. It takes is name from “the houses” (burūj) mentioned in verse 1, normally understood in conjunction to the constellations. The surah strengthened the heart of the Prophet Muhammad and his followers by referring to the fate of those who tortured earlier believers. The title expresses God’s power over the whole universe, from the stars in the sky to the evildoers referred to in this surah. Indeed, His all-encompassing power is a recurring theme throughout the surah.The surah is also known as: Signs of the Zodiac, The Constellations, The Houses of the Zodiac, The Towering Constellations, Zodiacal Signs.

1.translation_eng: By the sky with its houses,

2.translation_eng: by the Promised Day,

3.content: وَشاهِدٍ وَمَشهودٍ
3.translation_eng: by the Witness1 and the Witnessed:2That is the Prophet (ṣ); cf. 2:143; 4:41; 16:89; 33:45.That is, the Day of Judgement; cf. 11:103.
3.transliteration: wa-shāhidin wa-mashhūdin

4.content: قُتِلَ أَصحابُ الأُخدودِ
4.translation_eng: perish the Men of the Ditch!
4.transliteration: qutila ʾaṣḥābu l-ʾukhdūdi

5.content: النّارِ ذاتِ الوَقودِ
5.translation_eng: The fire, abounding in fuel,
5.transliteration: an-nāri dhāti l-waqūdi

6.content: إِذ هُم عَلَيها قُعودٌ
6.translation_eng: above which they sat
6.transliteration: ʾidh hum ʿalayhā quʿūdun

7.content: وَهُم عَلىٰ ما يَفعَلونَ بِالمُؤمِنينَ شُهودٌ
7.translation_eng: as they were themselveswitnesses to what they did to the faithful.
7.transliteration: wa-hum ʿalā mā yafʿalūna bi-l-muʾminīna shuhūdun

8.content: وَما نَقَموا مِنهُم إِلّا أَن يُؤمِنوا بِاللَّهِ العَزيزِ الحَميدِ
8.translation_eng: They were vindictive towards them onlybecause they had faith in Allah,the All-mighty, the All-laudable,
8.transliteration: wa-mā naqamū minhum ʾillā ʾan yuʾminū bi-llāhi l-ʿazīzi l-ḥamīdi

9.content: الَّذي لَهُ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ شَهيدٌ
9.translation_eng: to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavensand the earth,and Allah is witness to all things.
9.transliteration: alladhī lahū mulku s-samāwāti wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-llāhu ʿalā kulli shayʾin shahīdun

10.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ فَتَنُوا المُؤمِنينَ وَالمُؤمِناتِ ثُمَّ لَم يَتوبوا فَلَهُم عَذابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُم عَذابُ الحَريقِ
10.translation_eng: Indeed those who persecutethe faithful men and women,and then do not repent,for them there is the punishment of hell,and for them there is the punishment of burning.
10.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna fatanū l-muʾminīna wa-l-muʾmināti thumma lam yatūbū fa-lahum ʿadhābu jahannama wa-lahum ʿadhābu l-ḥarīqi

11.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ لَهُم جَنّاتٌ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ ۚ ذٰلِكَ الفَوزُ الكَبيرُ
11.translation_eng: Indeed those who have faith and do righteous deeds,—for them will be gardenswith streams running in them.That is the supreme success.
11.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti lahum jannātun tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru dhālika l-fawzu l-kabīru

12.content: إِنَّ بَطشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَديدٌ
12.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord’s striking is severe.
12.transliteration: ʾinna baṭsha rabbika la-shadīdun

13.content: إِنَّهُ هُوَ يُبدِئُ وَيُعيدُ
13.translation_eng: It is indeed He who originates and brings back again,
13.transliteration: ʾinnahū huwa yubdiʾu wa-yuʿīdu

14.content: وَهُوَ الغَفورُ الوَدودُ
14.translation_eng: and He is the All-forgiving, the All-affectionate,
14.transliteration: wa-huwa l-ghafūru l-wadūdu

15.content: ذُو العَرشِ المَجيدُ
15.translation_eng: Lord of the Throne, the All-glorious,1Or ‘Lord of the Glorious Throne,’ in accordance with an alternate reading.
15.transliteration: dhū-l-ʿarshi l-majīdu

16.content: فَعّالٌ لِما يُريدُ
16.translation_eng: doer of what He desires.
16.transliteration: faʿʿālun li-mā yurīdu

17.content: هَل أَتاكَ حَديثُ الجُنودِ
17.translation_eng: Did you receive the story of the hosts
17.transliteration: hal ʾatāka ḥadīthu l-junūdi

18.content: فِرعَونَ وَثَمودَ
18.translation_eng: of Pharaoh and Thamūd?
18.transliteration: firʿawna wa-thamūda

19.content: بَلِ الَّذينَ كَفَروا في تَكذيبٍ
19.translation_eng: Rather the faithless dwell in denial,
19.transliteration: bali lladhīna kafarū fī takdhībin

20.content: وَاللَّهُ مِن وَرائِهِم مُحيطٌ
20.translation_eng: and Allah besieges them from all around.
20.transliteration: wa-llāhu min warāʾihim muḥīṭun

21.content: بَل هُوَ قُرآنٌ مَجيدٌ
21.translation_eng: Rather it is a glorious Qurʾān,
21.transliteration: bal huwa qurʾānun majīdun

22.content: في لَوحٍ مَحفوظٍ
22.translation_eng: in a preserved tablet.
22.transliteration: fī lawḥin maḥfūẓin

86.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by the sky of the world and The Nightly Visitor so called because it comes by night and leaves by day. It takes its name from verse 1 which mentions “the night-comer” or “nightly visitor” (ṭāriq). The surah focuses on a series of examples of things coming out: the piercing night-star, spurting semen, the baby that bursts out of the womb, and plants that sprout out of the ground. All of these are used to illustrate resurrection from the grave.The surah is also known as: The Night Star, The Night-Comer, The Night-Visitant, The Nightcomer, The Nightly Visitant, The Piercing Star.

1.translation_eng: By the sky,by the nightly visitor,

2.translation_eng: (and what will show you what is the nightly visitor?

3.content: النَّجمُ الثّاقِبُ
3.translation_eng: It is the brilliant star):
3.transliteration: an-najmu th-thāqibu

4.content: إِن كُلُّ نَفسٍ لَمّا عَلَيها حافِظٌ
4.translation_eng: there is a guard1 over every soul.Or ‘watcher.’
4.transliteration: ʾin kullu nafsin lammā ʿalayhā ḥāfiẓun

5.content: فَليَنظُرِ الإِنسانُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ
5.translation_eng: So let man consider from what he was created.
5.transliteration: fa-l-yanẓuri l-ʾinsānu mimma khuliqa

6.content: خُلِقَ مِن ماءٍ دافِقٍ
6.translation_eng: He was created from an effusing fluid
6.transliteration: khuliqa min māʾin dāfiqin

7.content: يَخرُجُ مِن بَينِ الصُّلبِ وَالتَّرائِبِ
7.translation_eng: which issues from between the loinsand the breast-bones.
7.transliteration: yakhruju min bayni ṣ-ṣulbi wa-t-tarāʾibi

8.content: إِنَّهُ عَلىٰ رَجعِهِ لَقادِرٌ
8.translation_eng: Indeed He is able to bring him back [after death],
8.transliteration: ʾinnahū ʿalā rajʿihī la-qādirun

9.content: يَومَ تُبلَى السَّرائِرُ
9.translation_eng: on the day when the secrets are examined,
9.transliteration: yawma tublā s-sarāʾiru

10.content: فَما لَهُ مِن قُوَّةٍ وَلا ناصِرٍ
10.translation_eng: and he shall have neither power nor helper.
10.transliteration: fa-mā lahū min quwwatin wa-lā nāṣirin

11.content: وَالسَّماءِ ذاتِ الرَّجعِ
11.translation_eng: By the resurgent sky,1Or ‘by the sky endowed with rains.’
11.transliteration: wa-s-samāʾi dhāti r-rajʿi

12.content: وَالأَرضِ ذاتِ الصَّدعِ
12.translation_eng: by the furrowed earth:
12.transliteration: wa-l-ʾarḍi dhāti ṣ-ṣadʿi

13.content: إِنَّهُ لَقَولٌ فَصلٌ
13.translation_eng: it is indeed a decisive word,
13.transliteration: ʾinnahū la-qawlun faṣlun

14.content: وَما هُوَ بِالهَزلِ
14.translation_eng: and it is not a jest.
14.transliteration: wa-mā huwa bi-l-hazli

15.content: إِنَّهُم يَكيدونَ كَيدًا
15.translation_eng: Indeed they are devising a stratagem,
15.transliteration: ʾinnahum yakīdūna kaydan

16.content: وَأَكيدُ كَيدًا
16.translation_eng: and I [too] am devising a plan.
16.transliteration: wa-ʾakīdu kaydan

17.content: فَمَهِّلِ الكافِرينَ أَمهِلهُم رُوَيدًا
17.translation_eng: So respite the faithless;give them a gentle respite.
17.transliteration: fa-mahhili l-kāfirīna ʾamhilhum ruwaydan

87.description: The surah that opens with the command to highly exalt God, the Divine One who is The Most Exalted, far above all that is unworthy that people wrongly attribute to Him. It is named after “the Most Exalted” (al-aʿlā), mentioned in verse 1. The surah reassures the Prophet Muhammad that God will help him and urging him to continue with his mission. The temporary nature of this world is highlighted through mention of the short life of green pasture (cf. verse 10:24 and verse 18: 45).The surah is also known as: Glory to Lord in the Highest, The Highest, The Most High.

1.translation_eng: Celebrate the Name of your Lord, the Most Exalted,

2.translation_eng: who created and proportioned,

3.content: وَالَّذي قَدَّرَ فَهَدىٰ
3.translation_eng: who determined and guided,
3.transliteration: wa-lladhī qaddara fa-hadā

4.content: وَالَّذي أَخرَجَ المَرعىٰ
4.translation_eng: who brought forth the pasture,
4.transliteration: wa-lladhī ʾakhraja l-marʿā

5.content: فَجَعَلَهُ غُثاءً أَحوىٰ
5.translation_eng: then turned it into a black scum.
5.transliteration: fa-jaʿalahū ghuthāʾan ʾaḥwā

6.content: سَنُقرِئُكَ فَلا تَنسىٰ
6.translation_eng: We shall have you recite [the Qurʾān],then you will not forget [any of it]
6.transliteration: sa-nuqriʾuka fa-lā tansā

7.content: إِلّا ما شاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ يَعلَمُ الجَهرَ وَما يَخفىٰ
7.translation_eng: except what Allah may wish.Indeed He knows the overt and what is hidden.
7.transliteration: ʾillā mā shāʾa llāhu ʾinnahū yaʿlamu l-jahra wa-mā yakhfā

8.content: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِليُسرىٰ
8.translation_eng: We shall smooth your way to [preach] the easiest [canon].
8.transliteration: wa-nuyassiruka li-l-yusrā

9.content: فَذَكِّر إِن نَفَعَتِ الذِّكرىٰ
9.translation_eng: So admonish, for admonition is indeed beneficial:
9.transliteration: fa-dhakkir ʾin nafaʿati dh-dhikrā

10.content: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَن يَخشىٰ
10.translation_eng: he who fears will take admonition,
10.transliteration: sa-yadhdhakkaru man yakhshā

11.content: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا الأَشقَى
11.translation_eng: and the most wretched will shun it
11.transliteration: wa-yatajannabuhā l-ʾashqā

12.content: الَّذي يَصلَى النّارَ الكُبرىٰ
12.translation_eng: —he who will enter the Great Fire,
12.transliteration: alladhī yaṣlā n-nāra l-kubrā

13.content: ثُمَّ لا يَموتُ فيها وَلا يَحيىٰ
13.translation_eng: then neither live in it, nor die.
13.transliteration: thumma lā yamūtu fīhā wa-lā yaḥyā

14.content: قَد أَفلَحَ مَن تَزَكّىٰ
14.translation_eng: Felicitous is he who purifies himself,
14.transliteration: qad ʾaflaḥa man tazakkā

15.content: وَذَكَرَ اسمَ رَبِّهِ فَصَلّىٰ
15.translation_eng: celebrates the Name of his Lord, and prays.
15.transliteration: wa-dhakara sma rabbihī fa-ṣallā

16.content: بَل تُؤثِرونَ الحَياةَ الدُّنيا
16.translation_eng: Rather you prefer the life of this world,
16.transliteration: bal tuʾthirūna l-ḥayāta d-dunyā

17.content: وَالآخِرَةُ خَيرٌ وَأَبقىٰ
17.translation_eng: while the Hereafter is better and more lasting.
17.transliteration: wa-l-ʾākhiratu khayrun wa-ʾabqā

18.content: إِنَّ هٰذا لَفِي الصُّحُفِ الأولىٰ
18.translation_eng: This is indeed in the former scriptures,
18.transliteration: ʾinna hādhā la-fī ṣ-ṣuḥufi l-ʾūlā

19.content: صُحُفِ إِبراهيمَ وَموسىٰ
19.translation_eng: the scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
19.transliteration: ṣuḥufi ʾibrāhīma wa-mūsā

88.description: The surah that opens with the edifying question regarding human awareness of the coming of a sure cataclysmic event it calls The Enveloper. It takes its name from “the enveloper” (al-ghāshiyah) mentioned in verse 1. The surah serves to warn the disbelievers, encourage the Prophet Muhammad and the believers, and absolve him of responsibility for the disbelievers.The surah is also known as: The Overpowering, The Overwhelmer, The Overwhelming, The Overwhelming Event, The Pall, The Whelming.

1.translation_eng: Did you receive the account of the Enveloper?

2.translation_eng: Some faces on that day will be humbled,

3.content: عامِلَةٌ ناصِبَةٌ
3.translation_eng: wrought-up and weary:
3.transliteration: ʿāmilatun nāṣibatun

4.content: تَصلىٰ نارًا حامِيَةً
4.translation_eng: they will enter a scorching fire,
4.transliteration: taṣlā nāran ḥāmiyatan

5.content: تُسقىٰ مِن عَينٍ آنِيَةٍ
5.translation_eng: and made to drink from a boiling spring.
5.transliteration: tusqā min ʿaynin ʾāniyatin

6.content: لَيسَ لَهُم طَعامٌ إِلّا مِن ضَريعٍ
6.translation_eng: They will have no food except cactus,
6.transliteration: laysa lahum ṭaʿāmun ʾillā min ḍarīʿin

7.content: لا يُسمِنُ وَلا يُغني مِن جوعٍ
7.translation_eng: neither nourishing,nor availing against hunger.
7.transliteration: lā yusminu wa-lā yughnī min jūʿin

8.content: وُجوهٌ يَومَئِذٍ ناعِمَةٌ
8.translation_eng: Some faces on that day will be joyous,
8.transliteration: wujūhun yawmaʾidhin nāʿimatun

9.content: لِسَعيِها راضِيَةٌ
9.translation_eng: pleased with their endeavour;
9.transliteration: li-saʿyihā rāḍiyatun

10.content: في جَنَّةٍ عالِيَةٍ
10.translation_eng: in a lofty paradise,
10.transliteration: fī jannatin ʿāliyatin

11.content: لا تَسمَعُ فيها لاغِيَةً
11.translation_eng: wherein they will not hear any vain talk.
11.transliteration: lā tasmaʿu fīhā lāghiyatan

12.content: فيها عَينٌ جارِيَةٌ
12.translation_eng: In it there is a flowing spring
12.transliteration: fīhā ʿaynun jāriyatun

13.content: فيها سُرُرٌ مَرفوعَةٌ
13.translation_eng: and in it there are raised couches,
13.transliteration: fīhā sururun marfūʿatun

14.content: وَأَكوابٌ مَوضوعَةٌ
14.translation_eng: and goblets set,
14.transliteration: wa-ʾakwābun mawḍūʿatun

15.content: وَنَمارِقُ مَصفوفَةٌ
15.translation_eng: and cushions laid out in an array,
15.transliteration: wa-namāriqu maṣfūfatun

16.content: وَزَرابِيُّ مَبثوثَةٌ
16.translation_eng: and carpets spread out.
16.transliteration: wa-zarābiyyu mabthūthatun

17.content: أَفَلا يَنظُرونَ إِلَى الإِبِلِ كَيفَ خُلِقَت
17.translation_eng: Do they not observe1 the camel,[to see] how she has been created?Or ‘consider.’
17.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lā yanẓurūna ʾilā l-ʾibili kayfa khuliqat

18.content: وَإِلَى السَّماءِ كَيفَ رُفِعَت
18.translation_eng: and the sky, how it has been raised?
18.transliteration: wa-ʾilā s-samāʾi kayfa rufiʿat

19.content: وَإِلَى الجِبالِ كَيفَ نُصِبَت
19.translation_eng: and the mountains, how they have been set?
19.transliteration: wa-ʾilā l-jibāli kayfa nuṣibat

20.content: وَإِلَى الأَرضِ كَيفَ سُطِحَت
20.translation_eng: and the earth, how it has been surfaced?
20.transliteration: wa-ʾilā l-ʾarḍi kayfa suṭiḥat

21.content: فَذَكِّر إِنَّما أَنتَ مُذَكِّرٌ
21.translation_eng: So admonish—for you are only an admonisher,
21.transliteration: fa-dhakkir ʾinnamā ʾanta mudhakkirun

22.content: لَستَ عَلَيهِم بِمُصَيطِرٍ
22.translation_eng: and not a taskmaster over them—
22.transliteration: lasta ʿalayhim bi-muṣayṭirin

23.content: إِلّا مَن تَوَلّىٰ وَكَفَرَ
23.translation_eng: except him who turns back and disbelieves.
23.transliteration: ʾillā man tawallā wa-kafara

24.content: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ اللَّهُ العَذابَ الأَكبَرَ
24.translation_eng: Him Allah will punish with the greatest punishment.
24.transliteration: fa-yuʿadhdhibuhu llāhu l-ʿadhāba l-ʾakbara

25.content: إِنَّ إِلَينا إِيابَهُم
25.translation_eng: Indeed to Us will be their return.
25.transliteration: ʾinna ʾilaynā ʾiyābahum

26.content: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَينا حِسابَهُم
26.translation_eng: Then, indeed, their reckoning will lie with Us.
26.transliteration: thumma ʾinna ʿalaynā ḥisābahum

89.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by The Dawn, and other natural occurrences and sacred designations, as a means of categorical airmation to mankind that God shall, indeed, hold all people accountable. It is names after “the dawn” (al-fajr) mentioned in verse 1. A surah in which God emphasizes that the tyrants of the Prophet’s time will be like those He dealt with in the past. The surah compares the destiny of the ungrateful with that of the souls at peace.The surah is also known as: The Daybreak.

1.translation_eng: By the Dawn,1Interpreted as the month of Muḥarram, which marks the beginning of the year. (Ṭabarī, Taʾrīkh, ii, 390, from Ibn ʿAbbās)

2.translation_eng: by the ten nights,

3.content: وَالشَّفعِ وَالوَترِ
3.translation_eng: by the Even and the Odd,
3.transliteration: wa-sh-shafʿi wa-l-watri

4.content: وَاللَّيلِ إِذا يَسرِ
4.translation_eng: by the night when it departs!
4.transliteration: wa-l-layli ʾidhā yasri

5.content: هَل في ذٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِذي حِجرٍ
5.translation_eng: Is there an oath in that for one possessing intellect?
5.transliteration: hal fī dhālika qasamun li-dhī ḥijrin

6.content: أَلَم تَرَ كَيفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعادٍ
6.translation_eng: Have you not regardedhow your Lord dealt with [the people of] ʿĀd,
6.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara kayfa faʿala rabbuka bi-ʿādin

7.content: إِرَمَ ذاتِ العِمادِ
7.translation_eng: [and] Iram, [the city] of the pillars,
7.transliteration: ʾirama dhāti l-ʿimādi

8.content: الَّتي لَم يُخلَق مِثلُها فِي البِلادِ
8.translation_eng: the like of which was not created among cities,
8.transliteration: allatī lam yukhlaq mithluhā fī l-bilādi

9.content: وَثَمودَ الَّذينَ جابُوا الصَّخرَ بِالوادِ
9.translation_eng: and [the people of] Thamūd,who hollowed out the rocks in the valley,
9.transliteration: wa-thamūda lladhīna jābū ṣ-ṣakhra bi-l-wādi

10.content: وَفِرعَونَ ذِي الأَوتادِ
10.translation_eng: and Pharaoh, the impaler,1See the note at 38:12.
10.transliteration: wa-firʿawna dhī l-ʾawtādi

11.content: الَّذينَ طَغَوا فِي البِلادِ
11.translation_eng: —those who rebelled [against Allah] in their cities
11.transliteration: alladhīna ṭaghaw fī l-bilādi

12.content: فَأَكثَروا فيهَا الفَسادَ
12.translation_eng: and caused much corruption in them,
12.transliteration: fa-ʾaktharū fīhā l-fasāda

13.content: فَصَبَّ عَلَيهِم رَبُّكَ سَوطَ عَذابٍ
13.translation_eng: so your Lord poured on themlashes of punishment.
13.transliteration: fa-ṣabba ʿalayhim rabbuka sawṭa ʿadhābin

14.content: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِالمِرصادِ
14.translation_eng: Indeed your Lord is in ambush.
14.transliteration: ʾinna rabbaka la-bi-l-mirṣādi

15.content: فَأَمَّا الإِنسانُ إِذا مَا ابتَلاهُ رَبُّهُ فَأَكرَمَهُ وَنَعَّمَهُ فَيَقولُ رَبّي أَكرَمَنِ
15.translation_eng: As for man, whenever his Lord tests himand grants him honour and blesses him,he says, ‘My Lord has honoured me.’
15.transliteration: fa-ʾammā l-ʾinsānu ʾidhā mā btalāhu rabbuhū fa-ʾakramahū wa-naʿʿamahū fa-yaqūlu rabbī ʾakramani

16.content: وَأَمّا إِذا مَا ابتَلاهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيهِ رِزقَهُ فَيَقولُ رَبّي أَهانَنِ
16.translation_eng: But when He tests himand tightens for him his provision,he says, ‘My Lord has humiliated me.’
16.transliteration: wa-ʾammā ʾidhā mā btalāhu fa-qadara ʿalayhi rizqahū fa-yaqūlu rabbī ʾahānani

17.content: كَلّا ۖ بَل لا تُكرِمونَ اليَتيمَ
17.translation_eng: No indeed!Rather you do not honour the orphan,
17.transliteration: kallā bal lā tukrimūna l-yatīma

18.content: وَلا تَحاضّونَ عَلىٰ طَعامِ المِسكينِ
18.translation_eng: and do not urge the feeding of the needy,
18.transliteration: wa-lā taḥāḍḍūna ʿalā ṭaʿāmi l-miskīni

19.content: وَتَأكُلونَ التُّراثَ أَكلًا لَمًّا
19.translation_eng: and you eat the inheritance rapaciously,
19.transliteration: wa-taʾkulūna t-turātha ʾaklan lamman

20.content: وَتُحِبّونَ المالَ حُبًّا جَمًّا
20.translation_eng: and you love wealth with much fondness.
20.transliteration: wa-tuḥibbūna l-māla ḥubban jamman

21.content: كَلّا إِذا دُكَّتِ الأَرضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
21.translation_eng: No indeed!When the earth is levelled1 to a plain,Or ‘crumbled into fragments.’
21.transliteration: kallā ʾidhā dukkati l-ʾarḍu dakkan dakkan

22.content: وَجاءَ رَبُّكَ وَالمَلَكُ صَفًّا صَفًّا
22.translation_eng: and your Lord and the angels arrive in ranks,
22.transliteration: wa-jāʾa rabbuka wa-l-malaku ṣaffan ṣaffan

23.content: وَجِيءَ يَومَئِذٍ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَومَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ الإِنسانُ وَأَنّىٰ لَهُ الذِّكرىٰ
23.translation_eng: the day when hell is brought [near],on that day man will take admonitionbut what will the admonition avail him?
23.transliteration: wa-jīʾa yawmaʾidhin bi-jahannama yawmaʾidhin yatadhakkaru l-ʾinsānu wa-ʾannā lahu dh-dhikrā

24.content: يَقولُ يا لَيتَني قَدَّمتُ لِحَياتي
24.translation_eng: He will say, ‘Alas, had I sent ahead for my life!’
24.transliteration: yaqūlu yā-laytanī qaddamtu li-ḥayātī

25.content: فَيَومَئِذٍ لا يُعَذِّبُ عَذابَهُ أَحَدٌ
25.translation_eng: On that day none shall punish as He punishes,
25.transliteration: fa-yawmaʾidhin lā yuʿadhdhibu ʿadhābahū ʾaḥadun

26.content: وَلا يوثِقُ وَثاقَهُ أَحَدٌ
26.translation_eng: and none shall bind as He binds.
26.transliteration: wa-lā yūthiqu wathāqahū ʾaḥadun

27.content: يا أَيَّتُهَا النَّفسُ المُطمَئِنَّةُ
27.translation_eng: ‘O soul at peace!
27.transliteration: yā-ʾayyatuhā n-nafsu l-muṭmaʾinnatu

28.content: ارجِعي إِلىٰ رَبِّكِ راضِيَةً مَرضِيَّةً
28.translation_eng: Return to your Lord, pleased, pleasing!
28.transliteration: irjiʿī ʾilā rabbiki rāḍiyatan marḍiyyatan

29.content: فَادخُلي في عِبادي
29.translation_eng: Then enter among My servants!
29.transliteration: fa-dkhulī fī ʿibādī

30.content: وَادخُلي جَنَّتي
30.translation_eng: And enter My paradise!’
30.transliteration: wa-dkhulī jannatī

90.description: The surah that opens with the emphatic oath of the Divine One swearing by The City, that mankind us under the absolute power and watchfulness of God. It takes its name after the “city” or “town” (balad) mentioned in verse 1. The essential point of this surah is that man is created to work and be judged. He should therefore seek to do good deeds rather than indulge in arrogance and wastefulness.The surah is also known as: (This) Countryside, The Earth, The Land, The Town.

1.translation_eng: I swear by this town,

2.translation_eng: as you reside in this town;

3.content: وَوالِدٍ وَما وَلَدَ
3.translation_eng: by the father and him whom he begot:
3.transliteration: wa-wālidin wa-mā walada

4.content: لَقَد خَلَقنَا الإِنسانَ في كَبَدٍ
4.translation_eng: certainly We created man in travail.
4.transliteration: la-qad khalaqnā l-ʾinsāna fī kabadin

5.content: أَيَحسَبُ أَن لَن يَقدِرَ عَلَيهِ أَحَدٌ
5.translation_eng: Does he supposethat no one will ever have power over him?
5.transliteration: ʾa-yaḥsabu ʾan lan yaqdira ʿalayhi ʾaḥadun

6.content: يَقولُ أَهلَكتُ مالًا لُبَدًا
6.translation_eng: He says, ‘I have squandered immense wealth.’
6.transliteration: yaqūlu ʾahlaktu mālan lubadan

7.content: أَيَحسَبُ أَن لَم يَرَهُ أَحَدٌ
7.translation_eng: Does he suppose that no one sees him?
7.transliteration: ʾa-yaḥsabu ʾan lam yarahū ʾaḥadun

8.content: أَلَم نَجعَل لَهُ عَينَينِ
8.translation_eng: Have We not made for him two eyes,
8.transliteration: ʾa-lam najʿal lahū ʿaynayni

9.content: وَلِسانًا وَشَفَتَينِ
9.translation_eng: a tongue, and two lips,
9.transliteration: wa-lisānan wa-shafatayni

10.content: وَهَدَيناهُ النَّجدَينِ
10.translation_eng: and shown him the two paths [of good and evil]?
10.transliteration: wa-hadaynāhu n-najdayni

11.content: فَلَا اقتَحَمَ العَقَبَةَ
11.translation_eng: Yet he has not embarked upon the uphill task.
11.transliteration: fa-lā qtaḥama l-ʿaqabata

12.content: وَما أَدراكَ مَا العَقَبَةُ
12.translation_eng: And what will show you what is the uphill task?
12.transliteration: wa-mā ʾadrāka mā l-ʿaqabatu

13.content: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ
13.translation_eng: [It is] the freeing of a slave,
13.transliteration: fakku raqabatin

14.content: أَو إِطعامٌ في يَومٍ ذي مَسغَبَةٍ
14.translation_eng: or feeding [the needy] on a day of starvation,
14.transliteration: ʾaw ʾiṭʿāmun fī yawmin dhī masghabatin

15.content: يَتيمًا ذا مَقرَبَةٍ
15.translation_eng: or an orphan among relatives,
15.transliteration: yatīman dhā maqrabatin

16.content: أَو مِسكينًا ذا مَترَبَةٍ
16.translation_eng: or a needy man in desolation,
16.transliteration: ʾaw miskīnan dhā matrabatin

17.content: ثُمَّ كانَ مِنَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَتَواصَوا بِالصَّبرِ وَتَواصَوا بِالمَرحَمَةِ
17.translation_eng: while being one of those who have faithand who enjoin one another to patience,and enjoin one another to compassion.
17.transliteration: thumma kāna mina lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-tawāṣaw bi-ṣ-ṣabri wa-tawāṣaw bi-l-marḥamati

18.content: أُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ المَيمَنَةِ
18.translation_eng: They are the People of the Right Hand.
18.transliteration: ʾulāʾika ʾaṣḥābu l-maymanati

19.content: وَالَّذينَ كَفَروا بِآياتِنا هُم أَصحابُ المَشأَمَةِ
19.translation_eng: But those who defy Our signs,they are the People of the Left Hand.
19.transliteration: wa-lladhīna kafarū bi-ʾāyātinā hum ʾaṣḥābu l-mashʾamati

20.content: عَلَيهِم نارٌ مُؤصَدَةٌ
20.translation_eng: [Imposed] upon them will be a closed Fire.
20.transliteration: ʿalayhim nārun muʾṣadatun

91.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by The Sun as it shines out with morning’s radiance. It is named after “the sun” (al-shams), mentioned in verse 1. The central theme of the surah touch upon purifying or corrupting the soul, with the tribe of Thamūd given as an example of corruption.The surah is also known as: Sol.

1.translation_eng: By the sun and her forenoon splendour,

2.translation_eng: by the moon when he follows her,

3.content: وَالنَّهارِ إِذا جَلّاها
3.translation_eng: by the day when it reveals her,
3.transliteration: wa-n-nahāri ʾidhā jallāhā

4.content: وَاللَّيلِ إِذا يَغشاها
4.translation_eng: by the night when it covers her,
4.transliteration: wa-l-layli ʾidhā yaghshāhā

5.content: وَالسَّماءِ وَما بَناها
5.translation_eng: by the sky and Him who built it,
5.transliteration: wa-s-samāʾi wa-mā banāhā

6.content: وَالأَرضِ وَما طَحاها
6.translation_eng: by the earth and Him who spread it,
6.transliteration: wa-l-ʾarḍi wa-mā ṭaḥāhā

7.content: وَنَفسٍ وَما سَوّاها
7.translation_eng: by the soul and Him who fashioned it,
7.transliteration: wa-nafsin wa-mā sawwāhā

8.content: فَأَلهَمَها فُجورَها وَتَقواها
8.translation_eng: and inspired it with[discernment between] its virtues and vices:
8.transliteration: fa-ʾalhamahā fujūrahā wa-taqwāhā

9.content: قَد أَفلَحَ مَن زَكّاها
9.translation_eng: one who purifies it is felicitous,
9.transliteration: qad ʾaflaḥa man zakkāhā

10.content: وَقَد خابَ مَن دَسّاها
10.translation_eng: and one who betrays it fails.
10.transliteration: wa-qad khāba man dassāhā

11.content: كَذَّبَت ثَمودُ بِطَغواها
11.translation_eng: The [people of] Thamūd denied [Allah’s signs]out of their rebellion,
11.transliteration: kadhdhabat thamūdu bi-ṭaghwāhā

12.content: إِذِ انبَعَثَ أَشقاها
12.translation_eng: when the most wretched of them rose up.
12.transliteration: ʾidhi nbaʿatha ʾashqāhā

13.content: فَقالَ لَهُم رَسولُ اللَّهِ ناقَةَ اللَّهِ وَسُقياها
13.translation_eng: But then the apostle of Allah said to them,‘Let Allah’s she-camel drink!’
13.transliteration: fa-qāla lahum rasūlu llāhi nāqata llāhi wa-suqyāhā

14.content: فَكَذَّبوهُ فَعَقَروها فَدَمدَمَ عَلَيهِم رَبُّهُم بِذَنبِهِم فَسَوّاها
14.translation_eng: But they impugned him and then hamstrung her,so their Lord took them unawares by night1because of their sin,and levelled it.2Or ‘destroyed them,’ or ‘crushed them,’ or ‘brought down His punishment (or wrath) upon them.’That is, razed their city to the ground.
14.transliteration: fa-kadhdhabūhu fa-ʿaqarūhā fa-damdama ʿalayhim rabbuhum bi-dhanbihim fa-sawwāhā

15.content: وَلا يَخافُ عُقباها
15.translation_eng: And He does not fear its outcome.
15.transliteration: wa-lā yakhāfu ʿuqbāhā

92.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by the whelming of The Night that swathes the world in darkness. It is named after “the night” (al-layl), mentioned in verse 1. The surah shows the consequences of the paths people choose and emphasizing God’s guidance and warning.

1.translation_eng: By the night when it envelops,

2.translation_eng: by the day when it brightens,

3.content: وَما خَلَقَ الذَّكَرَ وَالأُنثىٰ
3.translation_eng: by Him who created the male and the female:
3.transliteration: wa-mā khalaqa dh-dhakara wa-l-ʾunthā

4.content: إِنَّ سَعيَكُم لَشَتّىٰ
4.translation_eng: your endeavours are indeed unlike.
4.transliteration: ʾinna saʿyakum la-shattā

5.content: فَأَمّا مَن أَعطىٰ وَاتَّقىٰ
5.translation_eng: As for him who gives and is Godwary
5.transliteration: fa-ʾammā man ʾaʿṭā wa-ttaqā

6.content: وَصَدَّقَ بِالحُسنىٰ
6.translation_eng: and confirms the best promise,
6.transliteration: wa-ṣaddaqa bi-l-ḥusnā

7.content: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِليُسرىٰ
7.translation_eng: We shall surely ease him into facility.
7.transliteration: fa-sa-nuyassiruhū li-l-yusrā

8.content: وَأَمّا مَن بَخِلَ وَاستَغنىٰ
8.translation_eng: But as for him who is stingyand self-complacent,
8.transliteration: wa-ʾammā man bakhila wa-staghnā

9.content: وَكَذَّبَ بِالحُسنىٰ
9.translation_eng: and denies the best promise,
9.transliteration: wa-kadhdhaba bi-l-ḥusnā

10.content: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلعُسرىٰ
10.translation_eng: We shall surely ease him into hardship.
10.transliteration: fa-sa-nuyassiruhū li-l-ʿusrā

11.content: وَما يُغني عَنهُ مالُهُ إِذا تَرَدّىٰ
11.translation_eng: His wealth shall not avail him when he perishes.
11.transliteration: wa-mā yughnī ʿanhu māluhū ʾidhā taraddā

12.content: إِنَّ عَلَينا لَلهُدىٰ
12.translation_eng: Indeed with Us rests guidance,
12.transliteration: ʾinna ʿalaynā la-l-hudā

13.content: وَإِنَّ لَنا لَلآخِرَةَ وَالأولىٰ
13.translation_eng: and indeed to Us belong the world and the Hereafter.
13.transliteration: wa-ʾinnā lanā la-l-ʾākhirata wa-l-ʾūlā

14.content: فَأَنذَرتُكُم نارًا تَلَظّىٰ
14.translation_eng: So I warn you of a blazing fire,
14.transliteration: fa-ʾandhartukum nāran talaẓẓā

15.content: لا يَصلاها إِلَّا الأَشقَى
15.translation_eng: which none shall enter except the most wretched
15.transliteration: lā yaṣlāhā ʾillā l-ʾashqā

16.content: الَّذي كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلّىٰ
16.translation_eng: —he who denies and turns back.
16.transliteration: alladhī kadhdhaba wa-tawallā

17.content: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا الأَتقَى
17.translation_eng: The Godwary shall be spared it
17.transliteration: wa-sa-yujannabuhā l-ʾatqā

18.content: الَّذي يُؤتي مالَهُ يَتَزَكّىٰ
18.translation_eng: —he who gives his wealth to purify himself
18.transliteration: alladhī yuʾtī mālahū yatazakkā

19.content: وَما لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُ مِن نِعمَةٍ تُجزىٰ
19.translation_eng: and does not expect any reward from anyone,
19.transliteration: wa-mā li-ʾaḥadin ʿindahū min niʿmatin tujzā

20.content: إِلَّا ابتِغاءَ وَجهِ رَبِّهِ الأَعلىٰ
20.translation_eng: but seeks only the pleasure of his Lord,the Most Exalted,
20.transliteration: ʾillā btighāʾa wajhi rabbihi l-ʾaʿlā

21.content: وَلَسَوفَ يَرضىٰ
21.translation_eng: and, surely, soon he will be well-pleased.
21.transliteration: wa-la-sawfa yarḍā

93.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by the The Morning Brightness and the night when all falls still. It is named after “the morning brightness” (ḍūḥā), mentioned in verse 1. The surah is an address to the Prophet Muhammad, to reassure him, when he had not received revelation for some time, that his Lord had not forsaken him.The surah is also known as: Daylight, Early Hours of Morning, Morning Bright, Morning Light, The Forenoon, The Glorious Morning Light, The Morning.

1.translation_eng: By the morning brightness,

2.translation_eng: by the night when it is calm!

3.content: ما وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَما قَلىٰ
3.translation_eng: Your Lord has neither forsaken younor is He displeased with you,
3.transliteration: mā waddaʿaka rabbuka wa-mā qalā

4.content: وَلَلآخِرَةُ خَيرٌ لَكَ مِنَ الأولىٰ
4.translation_eng: and the Hereafter shall be better for you than the world.
4.transliteration: wa-la-l-ʾākhiratu khayrun laka mina l-ʾūlā

5.content: وَلَسَوفَ يُعطيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرضىٰ
5.translation_eng: Soon your Lord will give you [that with which]you will be pleased.
5.transliteration: wa-la-sawfa yuʿṭīka rabbuka fa-tarḍā

6.content: أَلَم يَجِدكَ يَتيمًا فَآوىٰ
6.translation_eng: Did He not find you an orphan, and shelter you?
6.transliteration: ʾa-lam yajidka yatīman fa-ʾāwā

7.content: وَوَجَدَكَ ضالًّا فَهَدىٰ
7.translation_eng: Did He not find you astray, and guide you?
7.transliteration: wa-wajadaka ḍāllan fa-hadā

8.content: وَوَجَدَكَ عائِلًا فَأَغنىٰ
8.translation_eng: Did He not find you needy, and enrich you?
8.transliteration: wa-wajadaka ʿāʾilan fa-ʾaghnā

9.content: فَأَمَّا اليَتيمَ فَلا تَقهَر
9.translation_eng: So, as for the orphan, do not oppress him;
9.transliteration: fa-ʾammā l-yatīma fa-lā taqhar

10.content: وَأَمَّا السّائِلَ فَلا تَنهَر
10.translation_eng: and as for the beggar, do not chide him;
10.transliteration: wa-ʾammā s-sāʾila fa-lā tanhar

11.content: وَأَمّا بِنِعمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّث
11.translation_eng: and as for your Lord’s blessing,proclaim it!
11.transliteration: wa-ʾammā bi-niʿmati rabbika fa-ḥaddith

94.description: The surah that opens with a reassurance to the Prophet Muhammad that his divine appointment to receive God’s revelation has been nothing less than the Opening of the breast to sacred wisdom and guidance, and that thereby he has been honoured for all time, made well-able to bear the mantle of prophethood, and that ultimately and inevitably he shall be eased unto success. It is named “opening” after the phrase “did We not open” (a lam nashraḥ) in verse 1. The surah is a continuation of the reassurance and encouragement given in the previous surah.The surah is also known as: Broadened Breast, Comfort, Consolation, Relief, The Expanding, The Expansion, The Opening Up, The Opening of The Heart, The Opening-Up of the Heart.

1.translation_eng: Did We not open your breast for you

2.translation_eng: and relieve you of your burden

3.content: الَّذي أَنقَضَ ظَهرَكَ
3.translation_eng: which [almost] broke your back?
3.transliteration: alladhī ʾanqaḍa ẓahraka

4.content: وَرَفَعنا لَكَ ذِكرَكَ
4.translation_eng: Did We not exalt your name?
4.transliteration: wa-rafaʿnā laka dhikraka

5.content: فَإِنَّ مَعَ العُسرِ يُسرًا
5.translation_eng: Indeed ease accompanies hardship.
5.transliteration: fa-ʾinna maʿa l-ʿusri yusran

6.content: إِنَّ مَعَ العُسرِ يُسرًا
6.translation_eng: Indeed ease accompanies hardship.
6.transliteration: ʾinna maʿa l-ʿusri yusran

7.content: فَإِذا فَرَغتَ فَانصَب
7.translation_eng: So when you are done, appoint,1Or ‘when you are finished [with prayer], exert yourself [in supplicating to Allah].’
7.transliteration: fa-ʾidhā faraghta fa-nṣab

8.content: وَإِلىٰ رَبِّكَ فَارغَب
8.translation_eng: and turn eagerly to your Lord.
8.transliteration: wa-ʾilā rabbika fa-rghab

95.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by The Fig and the olive, and other signs, representing the Holy Land in which God revealed the Evangel, the Torah, and the Quran, and thereby guided all mankind. It is named after “the fig” (al-tīn) mentioned in verse 1. The surah questions how man can deny the Judgement, and emphasizing the importance of faith and good deeds.The surah is also known as: The Figtree.

1.translation_eng: By the fig and the olive,

2.translation_eng: by Mount Sinai,

3.content: وَهٰذَا البَلَدِ الأَمينِ
3.translation_eng: by this secure town:1That is, the holy city of Makkah.
3.transliteration: wa-hādhā l-baladi l-ʾamīni

4.content: لَقَد خَلَقنَا الإِنسانَ في أَحسَنِ تَقويمٍ
4.translation_eng: We certainly created manin the best of forms;
4.transliteration: la-qad khalaqnā l-ʾinsāna fī ʾaḥsani taqwīmin

5.content: ثُمَّ رَدَدناهُ أَسفَلَ سافِلينَ
5.translation_eng: then We relegated him to the lowest of the low,
5.transliteration: thumma radadnāhu ʾasfala sāfilīna

6.content: إِلَّا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ فَلَهُم أَجرٌ غَيرُ مَمنونٍ
6.translation_eng: except those who have faith and do righteous deeds.There will be an everlasting reward for them.
6.transliteration: ʾillā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti fa-lahum ʾajrun ghayru mamnūnin

7.content: فَما يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعدُ بِالدّينِ
7.translation_eng: So what makes you deny the Retribution?
7.transliteration: fa-mā yukadhdhibuka baʿdu bi-d-dīni

8.content: أَلَيسَ اللَّهُ بِأَحكَمِ الحاكِمينَ
8.translation_eng: Is not Allah the fairest of all judges?
8.transliteration: ʾa-laysa llāhu bi-ʾaḥkami l-ḥākimīna

96.description: The surah that contains the first revealed verses of the Quran, reminding the human being of The Clinging Mass, a stage that reflects the miracle of human creation in the womb of the mother. The surah is also known by the first Quranic instruction: Read. It is named after “the clining mass” (ʿalaq) mentioned in verse 2. The first five verses are known to be the first revelation of the Quran when the Prophet Muhammad was instructed to read. The second part came later to show that man transgresses when he becomes self-satisfied.The surah is also known as: Clots of Blood, Proclaim, Read, Recite, The Blood-clot, The Clinging Clot, The Clinging Form, The Clot, The Embryo.

1.translation_eng: Read in the Name of your Lord who created;

2.translation_eng: created man from a clinging mass.

3.content: اقرَأ وَرَبُّكَ الأَكرَمُ
3.translation_eng: Read, and your Lord is the most generous,
3.transliteration: iqraʾ wa-rabbuka l-ʾakramu

4.content: الَّذي عَلَّمَ بِالقَلَمِ
4.translation_eng: who taught by the pen,
4.transliteration: alladhī ʿallama bi-l-qalami

5.content: عَلَّمَ الإِنسانَ ما لَم يَعلَم
5.translation_eng: taught man what he did not know.
5.transliteration: ʿallama l-ʾinsāna mā lam yaʿlam

6.content: كَلّا إِنَّ الإِنسانَ لَيَطغىٰ
6.translation_eng: Indeed man becomes rebellious
6.transliteration: kallā ʾinna l-ʾinsāna la-yaṭghā

7.content: أَن رَآهُ استَغنىٰ
7.translation_eng: when he considers himself without need.
7.transliteration: ʾan raʾāhu staghnā

8.content: إِنَّ إِلىٰ رَبِّكَ الرُّجعىٰ
8.translation_eng: Indeed to your Lord is the return.
8.transliteration: ʾinna ʾilā rabbika r-rujʿā

9.content: أَرَأَيتَ الَّذي يَنهىٰ
9.translation_eng: Tell me, he who forbids
9.transliteration: ʾa-raʾayta lladhī yanhā

10.content: عَبدًا إِذا صَلّىٰ
10.translation_eng: a servant when he prays,
10.transliteration: ʿabdan ʾidhā ṣallā

11.content: أَرَأَيتَ إِن كانَ عَلَى الهُدىٰ
11.translation_eng: tell me, should he be on [true] guidance,
11.transliteration: ʾa-raʾayta ʾin kāna ʿalā l-hudā

12.content: أَو أَمَرَ بِالتَّقوىٰ
12.translation_eng: or bid [others] to Godwariness,
12.transliteration: ʾaw ʾamara bi-t-taqwā

13.content: أَرَأَيتَ إِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلّىٰ
13.translation_eng: tell me, should he call him a liar and turn away
13.transliteration: ʾa-raʾayta ʾin kadhdhaba wa-tawallā

14.content: أَلَم يَعلَم بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَرىٰ
14.translation_eng: —does he not know that Allah sees?
14.transliteration: ʾa-lam yaʿlam bi-ʾanna llāha yarā

15.content: كَلّا لَئِن لَم يَنتَهِ لَنَسفَعًا بِالنّاصِيَةِ
15.translation_eng: No indeed! If he does not stop,We shall seize him by the forelock,
15.transliteration: kallā la-ʾin lam yantahi la-nasfaʿan bi-n-nāṣiyati

16.content: ناصِيَةٍ كاذِبَةٍ خاطِئَةٍ
16.translation_eng: a lying, sinful forelock!
16.transliteration: nāṣiyatin kādhibatin khāṭiʾatin

17.content: فَليَدعُ نادِيَهُ
17.translation_eng: Then let him call out his gang!
17.transliteration: fa-l-yadʿu nādiyahū

18.content: سَنَدعُ الزَّبانِيَةَ
18.translation_eng: We [too] shall call the keepers of hell.
18.transliteration: sa-nadʿu z-zabāniyata

19.content: كَلّا لا تُطِعهُ وَاسجُد وَاقتَرِب ۩
19.translation_eng: No indeed! Do not obey him,but prostrate and draw near [to Allah]!
19.transliteration: kallā lā tuṭiʿhu wa-sjud wa-qtarib

97.description: The surah that mentions the moment in which God first revealed the Quran, calling it The Ordainment. It is named after the phrase “the night of ordainment” (laylay al-qadr), mentioned in verse 1. The surah celebrates the night when the first revelation of the Quran was sent down.The surah is also known as: Determination, Honour, Power, The Glory, The Night of Empowering Decree, The Night of Glory, The Night of Power.

1.translation_eng: Indeed We sent it1 downon the Night of Ordainment.That is, the Qurʾān. See 44:2-5.

2.translation_eng: What will show youwhat is the Night of Ordainment?

3.content: لَيلَةُ القَدرِ خَيرٌ مِن أَلفِ شَهرٍ
3.translation_eng: The Night of Ordainmentis better than a thousand months.
3.transliteration: laylatu l-qadri khayrun min ʾalfi shahrin

4.content: تَنَزَّلُ المَلائِكَةُ وَالرّوحُ فيها بِإِذنِ رَبِّهِم مِن كُلِّ أَمرٍ
4.translation_eng: In it the angels and the Spirit descend,by the leave of their Lord,with every command.
4.transliteration: tanazzalu l-malāʾikatu wa-r-rūḥu fīhā bi-ʾidhni rabbihim min kulli ʾamrin

5.content: سَلامٌ هِيَ حَتّىٰ مَطلَعِ الفَجرِ
5.translation_eng: It is peaceful until the rising of the dawn.
5.transliteration: salāmun hiya ḥattā maṭlaʿi l-fajri

98.description: The surah that mentions the advent of the message of the Quran and its Messenger as The Proof of a decisive revelation for both the disputing People of the Scripture and the unbelievers unlettered in God’s word. It is named after “the proof” (al-bayyinah) mentioned in verse 1 and verse 4. The surah spells out the basic tenets of faith, and contrasts the Fire of Hell with the lasting bliss that will be enjoyed by the faithful.The surah is also known as: The Clear Evidence, The Clear Proof, The Clear Sign, The Evidence.

1.content: لَم يَكُنِ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن أَهلِ الكِتابِ وَالمُشرِكينَ مُنفَكّينَ حَتّىٰ تَأتِيَهُمُ البَيِّنَةُ
1.translation_eng: The faithlessfrom among the People of the Bookand the polytheistswere not set apartuntil the proof had come to them:
1.transliteration: lam yakuni lladhīna kafarū min ʾahli l-kitābi wa-l-mushrikīna munfakkīna ḥattā taʾtiyahumu l-bayyinatu

2.content: رَسولٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ يَتلو صُحُفًا مُطَهَّرَةً
2.translation_eng: an apostle from Allahreciting impeccable scriptures,
2.transliteration: rasūlun mina llāhi yatlū ṣuḥufan muṭahharatan

3.content: فيها كُتُبٌ قَيِّمَةٌ
3.translation_eng: wherein are upright writings.
3.transliteration: fīhā kutubun qayyimatun

4.content: وَما تَفَرَّقَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتابَ إِلّا مِن بَعدِ ما جاءَتهُمُ البَيِّنَةُ
4.translation_eng: And those who were given the Book did not divide,except after the proof had come to them.
4.transliteration: wa-mā tafarraqa lladhīna ʾūtū l-kitāba ʾillā min baʿdi mā jāʾathumu l-bayyinatu

5.content: وَما أُمِروا إِلّا لِيَعبُدُوا اللَّهَ مُخلِصينَ لَهُ الدّينَ حُنَفاءَ وَيُقيمُوا الصَّلاةَ وَيُؤتُوا الزَّكاةَ ۚ وَذٰلِكَ دينُ القَيِّمَةِ
5.translation_eng: Yet they were not commanded except to worship Allah,dedicating their faith to Himas men of pure faith,and to maintain the prayer and pay the zakāt.That is the upright religion.
5.transliteration: wa-mā ʾumirū ʾillā li-yaʿbudū llāha mukhliṣīna lahu d-dīna ḥunafāʾa wa-yuqīmū ṣ-ṣalāta wa-yuʾtū z-zakāta wa-dhālika dīnu l-qayyimati

6.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن أَهلِ الكِتابِ وَالمُشرِكينَ في نارِ جَهَنَّمَ خالِدينَ فيها ۚ أُولٰئِكَ هُم شَرُّ البَرِيَّةِ
6.translation_eng: Indeed the faithlessfrom among the People of the Bookand the polytheistswill be in the fire of hell,to remain in it [forever].It is they who are the worst of creatures.
6.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna kafarū min ʾahli l-kitābi wa-l-mushrikīna fī nāri jahannama khālidīna fīhā ʾulāʾika hum sharru l-bariyyati

7.content: إِنَّ الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ أُولٰئِكَ هُم خَيرُ البَرِيَّةِ
7.translation_eng: Indeed those who have faith and do righteous deeds—it is they who are the best of creatures.
7.transliteration: ʾinna lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti ʾulāʾika hum khayru l-bariyyati

8.content: جَزاؤُهُم عِندَ رَبِّهِم جَنّاتُ عَدنٍ تَجري مِن تَحتِهَا الأَنهارُ خالِدينَ فيها أَبَدًا ۖ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنهُم وَرَضوا عَنهُ ۚ ذٰلِكَ لِمَن خَشِيَ رَبَّهُ
8.translation_eng: Their reward, near their Lord,is the Gardens of Eden,with streams running in them,to remain in them forever.Allah is pleased with them,and they are pleased with Him.That is for those who fear their Lord.
8.transliteration: jazāʾuhum ʿinda rabbihim jannātu ʿadnin tajrī min taḥtihā l-ʾanhāru khālidīna fīhā ʾabadan raḍiya llāhu ʿanhum wa-raḍū ʿanhu dhālika li-man khashiya rabbahū

99.description: The surah that opens with the mention of The Quake of the earth in utter destruction at the end of the world. It takes its name from “the quake” (al-zalzalah) mentioned in verse 1. The surah deals with scenes from the Day of Judgement.The surah is also known as: The Convulsion, The Earthquake, The Quaking, The Shaking, The Shock.

1.translation_eng: When the earth is rocked with a terrible quake

2.translation_eng: and the earth discharges her burdens,

3.content: وَقالَ الإِنسانُ ما لَها
3.translation_eng: and man says, ‘What is the matter with her?’
3.transliteration: wa-qāla l-ʾinsānu mā lahā

4.content: يَومَئِذٍ تُحَدِّثُ أَخبارَها
4.translation_eng: On that day she will relate her chronicles
4.transliteration: yawmaʾidhin tuḥaddithu ʾakhbārahā

5.content: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوحىٰ لَها
5.translation_eng: for her Lord will have inspired her.
5.transliteration: bi-ʾanna rabbaka ʾawḥā lahā

6.content: يَومَئِذٍ يَصدُرُ النّاسُ أَشتاتًا لِيُرَوا أَعمالَهُم
6.translation_eng: On that day, mankind will issue forth in various groups1to be shown their deeds.Or ‘separate groups.’
6.transliteration: yawmaʾidhin yaṣduru n-nāsu ʾashtātan li-yuraw ʾaʿmālahum

7.content: فَمَن يَعمَل مِثقالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيرًا يَرَهُ
7.translation_eng: So whoever does an atom’s weight of goodwill see it,
7.transliteration: fa-man yaʿmal mithqāla dharratin khayran yarahū

8.content: وَمَن يَعمَل مِثقالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ
8.translation_eng: and whoever does an atom’s weight of evilwill see it.
8.transliteration: wa-man yaʿmal mithqāla dharratin sharran yarahū

100.description: The surah that opens with the mention of galloping war steeds that it calls The Chargers, whose very hoofs strike sparks upon the rocky earth as they carry their riders furiously into the midst of the fray life. It takes its name from “the chargers” (al-ʿadiyāt) mentioned in verse 1. The surah touch upon Gods swearing by the warhorses He has subjected to man’s use that man is ungrateful and misguided.The surah is also known as: Snorting Steeds, The Charging Mares, The Charging Steeds, The War Steeds, Those That Run, Those Who Run.

1.translation_eng: By the snorting chargers,

2.translation_eng: by the strikers of sparks [with their hoofs],

3.content: فَالمُغيراتِ صُبحًا
3.translation_eng: by the raiders at dawn,
3.transliteration: fa-l-mughīrāti ṣubḥan

4.content: فَأَثَرنَ بِهِ نَقعًا
4.translation_eng: raising therein a trail of dust,
4.transliteration: fa-ʾatharna bihī naqʿan

5.content: فَوَسَطنَ بِهِ جَمعًا
5.translation_eng: and cleaving therein a host!
5.transliteration: fa-wasaṭna bihī jamʿan

6.content: إِنَّ الإِنسانَ لِرَبِّهِ لَكَنودٌ
6.translation_eng: Indeed man is ungrateful to his Lord,
6.transliteration: ʾinna l-ʾinsāna li-rabbihī la-kanūdun

7.content: وَإِنَّهُ عَلىٰ ذٰلِكَ لَشَهيدٌ
7.translation_eng: and indeed he is [himself] witness to that!
7.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahū ʿalā dhālika la-shahīdun

8.content: وَإِنَّهُ لِحُبِّ الخَيرِ لَشَديدٌ
8.translation_eng: He is indeed avid in the love of wealth.
8.transliteration: wa-ʾinnahū li-ḥubbi l-khayri la-shadīdun

9.content: ۞ أَفَلا يَعلَمُ إِذا بُعثِرَ ما فِي القُبورِ
9.translation_eng: Does he not know,when what is in the graves is turned over,
9.transliteration: ʾa-fa-lā yaʿlamu ʾidhā buʿthira mā fī l-qubūri

10.content: وَحُصِّلَ ما فِي الصُّدورِ
10.translation_eng: and what is in the breasts is divulged,
10.transliteration: wa-ḥuṣṣila mā fī ṣ-ṣudūri

11.content: إِنَّ رَبَّهُم بِهِم يَومَئِذٍ لَخَبيرٌ
11.translation_eng: indeed their Lordwill be best aware of them on that day?
11.transliteration: ʾinna rabbahum bihim yawmaʾidhin la-khabīrun

101.description: The surah that opens with this single world, al-Qāriʿah, meaning The Catastrophe, for that is the repeated sound that shall resound through all the earth as it is being pulverized in the cataclysm at the end of time, levelled utterly for the Resurrection Day and the ultimate Judgment of every human soul. It takes its name from “the catastrophe” (al-qāriʿah) mentioned in verse 1 . The surah gives some scenes from the Resurrection and Judgement.The surah is also known as: The Calamity, The Clatterer, The Crashing Blow, The Day of Noise and Clamour, The Disaster, The Great Calamity, The Great Pounding, The Smiter, The Stunning (Blow).

1.translation_eng: The Catastrophe!

2.translation_eng: What is the Catastrophe?

3.content: وَما أَدراكَ مَا القارِعَةُ
3.translation_eng: What will show you what is the Catastrophe?
3.transliteration: wa-mā ʾadrāka mā l-qāriʿatu

4.content: يَومَ يَكونُ النّاسُ كَالفَراشِ المَبثوثِ
4.translation_eng: The day mankind will belike scattered moths,
4.transliteration: yawma yakūnu n-nāsu ka-l-farāshi l-mabthūthi

5.content: وَتَكونُ الجِبالُ كَالعِهنِ المَنفوشِ
5.translation_eng: and the mountains will belike carded wool.
5.transliteration: wa-takūnu l-jibālu ka-l-ʿihni l-manfūshi

6.content: فَأَمّا مَن ثَقُلَت مَوازينُهُ
6.translation_eng: As for him whose deeds weigh heavy in the scales,
6.transliteration: fa-ʾammā man thaqulat mawāzīnuhū

7.content: فَهُوَ في عيشَةٍ راضِيَةٍ
7.translation_eng: he will have a pleasing life.
7.transliteration: fa-huwa fī ʿīshatin rāḍiyatin

8.content: وَأَمّا مَن خَفَّت مَوازينُهُ
8.translation_eng: But as for him whose deeds weigh light in the scales,
8.transliteration: wa-ʾammā man khaffat mawāzīnuhū

9.content: فَأُمُّهُ هاوِيَةٌ
9.translation_eng: his home will be the Abyss.
9.transliteration: fa-ʾummuhū hāwiyatun

10.content: وَما أَدراكَ ما هِيَه
10.translation_eng: And what will show you what it is?
10.transliteration: wa-mā ʾadrāka mā hiyah

11.content: نارٌ حامِيَةٌ
11.translation_eng: It is a scorching fire!
11.transliteration: nārun ḥāmiyatun

102.description: The surah that opens with the mention of the Rivalry as mentioned in verse 1 . The surah criticizes man’s preoccupation with worldly wealth and stresses that he will be brought to account on the Day of Resurrection.The surah is also known as: Competition, Competition for Gain, Plenitude, Striving for More, The Piling Up, Vying for More and More, Worldly Abundance, Worldly Gains.

1.translation_eng: Rivalry [and vainglory] distracted you

2.translation_eng: until you visited [even] the graves.

3.content: كَلّا سَوفَ تَعلَمونَ
3.translation_eng: No indeed!Soon you will know!
3.transliteration: kallā sawfa taʿlamūna

4.content: ثُمَّ كَلّا سَوفَ تَعلَمونَ
4.translation_eng: Again, no indeed!Soon you will know!
4.transliteration: thumma kallā sawfa taʿlamūna

5.content: كَلّا لَو تَعلَمونَ عِلمَ اليَقينِ
5.translation_eng: No indeed!Were you to know with certain knowledge,
5.transliteration: kallā law taʿlamūna ʿilma l-yaqīni

6.content: لَتَرَوُنَّ الجَحيمَ
6.translation_eng: you would surely see hell.
6.transliteration: la-tarawunna l-jaḥīma

7.content: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّها عَينَ اليَقينِ
7.translation_eng: Again, you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.
7.transliteration: thumma la-tarawunnahā ʿayna l-yaqīni

8.content: ثُمَّ لَتُسأَلُنَّ يَومَئِذٍ عَنِ النَّعيمِ
8.translation_eng: Then, that day, you will surely be questionedconcerning the blessing.
8.transliteration: thumma la-tusʾalunna yawmaʾidhin ʿani n-naʿīmi

103.description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by the decline of Time and humankind’s absolute loss of every single thing but righteousness, truth, patience, and faith. It takes its name from the phrase “by time” (wal- ʿāṣr) as mentioned in verse 1. The surah shows the way to salvation. The image of a declining day suggests the stage in the day, or in life, when only a short while is left for those wishing to make up for lost time.The surah is also known as: Afternoon, The Decline of Time, The Declining Day, The Epoch, The Late Afternoon, Time and Age, Time through the Ages.

1.translation_eng: By Time!

2.translation_eng: Indeed man is in loss,

3.content: إِلَّا الَّذينَ آمَنوا وَعَمِلُوا الصّالِحاتِ وَتَواصَوا بِالحَقِّ وَتَواصَوا بِالصَّبرِ
3.translation_eng: except those who have faithand do righteous deeds,and enjoin one another to [follow] the truth,and enjoin one another to patience.
3.transliteration: ʾillā lladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū ṣ-ṣāliḥāti wa-tawāṣaw bi-l-ḥaqqi wa-tawāṣaw bi-ṣ-ṣabri

104.description: The surah that opens with a threat of impending aliction and grief to The Scandal-monger or the slanderous reviler, one who, in greediness of wealth and acclaim, defames others. It takes its name from “the slanderer” (humazah) mentioned in verse 1. The surah condemns the greedy backbiter and gives a description of Hell.The surah is also known as: The Backbiter, The Gossipmonger, The Slanderer, The Slanderous Reviler.

1.translation_eng: Woe to every scandal-monger and slanderer,

2.translation_eng: who amasses wealth and counts it over.

3.content: يَحسَبُ أَنَّ مالَهُ أَخلَدَهُ
3.translation_eng: He supposes his wealth will make him immortal!
3.transliteration: yaḥsabu ʾanna mālahū ʾakhladahū

4.content: كَلّا ۖ لَيُنبَذَنَّ فِي الحُطَمَةِ
4.translation_eng: No indeed! He will surely be cast into the Crusher.
4.transliteration: kallā la-yunbadhanna fī l-ḥuṭamati

5.content: وَما أَدراكَ مَا الحُطَمَةُ
5.translation_eng: And what will show you what is the Crusher?
5.transliteration: wa-mā ʾadrāka mā l-ḥuṭamatu

6.content: نارُ اللَّهِ الموقَدَةُ
6.translation_eng: [It is] the fire of Allah, set ablaze,
6.transliteration: nāru llāhi l-mūqadatu

7.content: الَّتي تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى الأَفئِدَةِ
7.translation_eng: which will overspread the hearts.
7.transliteration: allatī taṭṭaliʿu ʿalā l-ʾafʾidati

8.content: إِنَّها عَلَيهِم مُؤصَدَةٌ
8.translation_eng: Indeed it will close in upon them
8.transliteration: ʾinnahā ʿalayhim muʾṣadatun

9.content: في عَمَدٍ مُمَدَّدَةٍ
9.translation_eng: in outstretched columns.
9.transliteration: fī ʿamadin mumaddadatin

105.description: The surah that tells of the destruction of the armed force that came to be known as the company of The Elephant, after the animal they intended to use to destroy the Kaʿbah, in the generation before the advent of Islam. This surah is a reference to events that happened in 570 CE, the year of the Prophet Muḥammads birth. It takes its name from “the elephant” (al-fīl) mentioned in verse 2, which refers to the force dispatched by Abrahah (a Christian ruler of Yemen) to Mecca, that is “the men of the elephant” (aṣḥāb al-fīl). The destruction of this army is cited here to encourage the believers and warn the disbelievers.

1.content: أَلَم تَرَ كَيفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصحابِ الفيلِ
1.translation_eng: Have you not regarded how your Lorddealt with the Men of the Elephant?
1.transliteration: ʾa-lam tara kayfa faʿala rabbuka bi-ʾaṣḥābi l-fīli

2.translation_eng: Did He not make their stratagems go awry,

3.content: وَأَرسَلَ عَلَيهِم طَيرًا أَبابيلَ
3.translation_eng: and send against them flocks of birds
3.transliteration: wa-ʾarsala ʿalayhim ṭayran ʾabābīla

4.content: تَرميهِم بِحِجارَةٍ مِن سِجّيلٍ
4.translation_eng: pelting them with stones of shale,
4.transliteration: tarmīhim bi-ḥijāratin min sijjīlin

5.content: فَجَعَلَهُم كَعَصفٍ مَأكولٍ
5.translation_eng: thus making them like chewed-up straw?
5.transliteration: fa-jaʿalahum ka-ʿaṣfin maʾkūlin

106.description: The surah that admonishes the first recipients of the Quran, the Meccan tribe of Quraysh, to give thanks to the One God alone who had long bequeathed to them, in their desert surroundings, abundant provision and security. It takes its name from verse 1, which mentions the Quraysh, the tribe to which the Prophet Muḥammad belonged.The surah is also known as: Koraish, The Quraish, The Quraish (Custodians of the Ka’ba), The Tribe of Quraysh.

1.translation_eng: [In gratitude] for solidarity1 among the Quraysh,That is, the team spirit and concord amongst clans of the tribe of Quraysh, who conducted the trade caravans between Yemen and Syria in summer and winter.

2.translation_eng: their solidarity during winter and summer journeys,

3.content: فَليَعبُدوا رَبَّ هٰذَا البَيتِ
3.translation_eng: let them worship the Lord of this House,
3.transliteration: fa-l-yaʿbudū rabba hādhā l-bayti

4.content: الَّذي أَطعَمَهُم مِن جوعٍ وَآمَنَهُم مِن خَوفٍ
4.translation_eng: who has fed them [and saved them] from hunger,and secured them from fear.
4.transliteration: alladhī ʾaṭʿamahum min jūʿin wa-ʾāmanahum min khawfin

107.description: The surah that chastises as irreligious and mean all those who withhold from the helpless and needy of the most basic forms of Aid. It takes its name from verse 7, in which “the aid” (al-māʿūn) occurs. The surah describes some characteristics of a person who denies the Judgement.The surah is also known as: Alms, Almsgiving, Charity, Common Kindnesses, Helping Others, Needs, Neighbourly Needs, The Neighbourly Assistance, Things of Common Use.

1.translation_eng: Did you see him who denies the Retribution?

2.translation_eng: That is the one who drives away the orphan,

3.content: وَلا يَحُضُّ عَلىٰ طَعامِ المِسكينِ
3.translation_eng: and does not urge the feeding of the needy.
3.transliteration: wa-lā yaḥuḍḍu ʿalā ṭaʿāmi l-miskīni

4.content: فَوَيلٌ لِلمُصَلّينَ
4.translation_eng: Woe to them who pray,
4.transliteration: fa-waylun li-l-muṣallīna

5.content: الَّذينَ هُم عَن صَلاتِهِم ساهونَ
5.translation_eng: —those who are heedless of their prayers,
5.transliteration: alladhīna hum ʿan ṣalātihim sāhūna

6.content: الَّذينَ هُم يُراءونَ
6.translation_eng: those who show off
6.transliteration: alladhīna hum yurāʾūna

7.content: وَيَمنَعونَ الماعونَ
7.translation_eng: but deny aid.
7.transliteration: wa-yamnaʿūna l-māʿūna

108.description: The surah that informs the Prophet Muḥammad that God has gifted him with Abundance goodness in this life and far greater resplendence in the Hereafter—for which he is instructed to ever show gratitude and charitable generosity. It takes its name from “the abundance” (al-kawthar) mentioned in verse 1. The surah comes to reassure the Prophet Muḥammad and as a retort to his enemy.The surah is also known as: Abundant Goodness, Plenty, Pre-eminence, The Great Abundance.

1.translation_eng: Indeed We have given you abundance.

2.translation_eng: So pray to your Lord,and sacrifice [the sacrificial camel].1Or ‘raise your hands.’ According to this interpretation, the phrase refers to the raising of the hands to the ears during prayers.

3.content: إِنَّ شانِئَكَ هُوَ الأَبتَرُ
3.translation_eng: Indeed it is your enemy who is without posterity.
3.transliteration: ʾinnā shāniʾaka huwa l-ʾabtaru

109.description: The surah that instructs the Prophet Muḥammad to inform The Faithless that the worship of false deities and the worship of One God are not, and can never be, compatible. It takes its name from “the faithless” (al-kāfirūn) mentioned in verse 1. The surah tells about some of the idolaters that suggested to the Prophet as a compromise that he should worship their gods for a year and they should worship his for a year. This was the reply.The surah is also known as: The Disbelievers, The Rejecters, The Unbelievers, Those who reject Faith.

1.translation_eng: Say, ‘O faithless ones!

2.translation_eng: I do not worship what you worship,

3.content: وَلا أَنتُم عابِدونَ ما أَعبُدُ
3.translation_eng: nor do you worship what I worship;
3.transliteration: wa-lā ʾantum ʿābidūna mā ʾaʿbudu

4.content: وَلا أَنا عابِدٌ ما عَبَدتُم
4.translation_eng: nor will I worship what you have worshiped
4.transliteration: wa-lā ʾana ʿābidun mā ʿabadtum

5.content: وَلا أَنتُم عابِدونَ ما أَعبُدُ
5.translation_eng: nor will you worship what I worship.
5.transliteration: wa-lā ʾantum ʿābidūna mā ʾaʿbudu

6.content: لَكُم دينُكُم وَلِيَ دينِ
6.translation_eng: To you your religion, and to me my religion.’
6.transliteration: lakum dīnukum wa-liya dīni

110.description: The surah that informs the Prophet Muḥammad that The Help of God is imminent in the liberation of Mecca from idolatry, in the throngs whose hearts God will open to Islam, and in the approach of his own passing to the mercy of God. It takes its name from verse 1, in which the phrase “naṣr Allah” (meaning “Allah’s help”) occurs.The surah is also known as: (Divine) Support, The Ultimate Victory.

1.translation_eng: When Allah’s help comes with victory,

2.content: وَرَأَيتَ النّاسَ يَدخُلونَ في دينِ اللَّهِ أَفواجًا
2.translation_eng: and you see the peopleentering Allah’s religion in throngs,
2.transliteration: wa-raʾayta n-nāsa yadkhulūna fī dīni llāhi ʾafwājan

3.content: فَسَبِّح بِحَمدِ رَبِّكَ وَاستَغفِرهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ كانَ تَوّابًا
3.translation_eng: then celebrate the praise of your Lord,and plead to Him for forgiveness.Indeed He is all-clement.
3.transliteration: fa-sabbiḥ bi-ḥamdi rabbika wa-staghfirhu ʾinnahū kāna tawwāban

111.description: The surah that mentions the Palm Fibre rope that in Hellfire shall be twisted around the neck of the wife of the Prophet’s uncle, who bitterly opposed Islam; for she took great pride in wearing an ostentatious necklace she became known for and would slip by night to strew thorns and prickly plants in the Prophet’s path to injure his feet. It takes its name from verse 5 in which the phrase “ḥablun min masad” (meaning “a rope of palm fibre”) occurs.The surah is also known as: Abu Lahab, Fibre, Perish, The Flame, The Palm-Fibre Rope.

1.translation_eng: Perish the hands of Abu Lahab, and perish he!

2.content: ما أَغنىٰ عَنهُ مالُهُ وَما كَسَبَ
2.translation_eng: Neither his wealth availed him,nor what he had earned.
2.transliteration: mā ʾaghnā ʿanhu māluhū wa-mā kasaba

3.content: سَيَصلىٰ نارًا ذاتَ لَهَبٍ
3.translation_eng: Soon he will enter the blazing fire,
3.transliteration: sa-yaṣlā nāran dhāta lahabin

4.content: وَامرَأَتُهُ حَمّالَةَ الحَطَبِ
4.translation_eng: and his wife [too], the firewood carrier,1Or ‘the informer.’
4.transliteration: wa-mraʾatuhū ḥammālata l-ḥaṭabi

5.content: في جيدِها حَبلٌ مِن مَسَدٍ
5.translation_eng: with a rope of palm fibre around her neck.
5.transliteration: fī jīdihā ḥablun min masadin

112.description: The surah whose six elements of belief constitute pure sincerity of faith or Monotheism, wherein a believer airms God’s divinity, Oneness, and eternality, and negates in relation to Him any ospring, ancestry, or likeness. It negates any kind of anthropomorphism that may compromise pure monotheism. It is unusual in having as its title a term not mentioned in the body of the surah. The word “Ikhlas” conveys the meaning of sincerity in one’s religion and total dedication to the One true God.The surah is also known as: Divine Unity, Oneness, Pure Faith, Pure Sincerity, Pure Truth, Purity (of Faith), Sincere Religion, Sincerity, The Purity of Faith, Unity.

1.translation_eng: Say, ‘He is Allah, the One.

2.translation_eng: Allah is the All-embracing.

3.content: لَم يَلِد وَلَم يولَد
3.translation_eng: He neither begat, nor was begotten,
3.transliteration: lam yalid wa-lam yūlad

4.content: وَلَم يَكُن لَهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
4.translation_eng: nor has He any equal.’
4.transliteration: wa-lam yakun lahū kufuwan ʾaḥadun

113.description: The surah that opens with the mention of God as the Lord of The Daybreak and that teaches one to seek refuge in Him from the evil in creation and from all who envy the blessings of God in others. It takes its name from “the daybreak” (al-falaq) mentioned in verse 1. The surah is used as an invocation against evil.The surah is also known as: The Dawn, The Rising Day.

1.translation_eng: Say, ‘I seek the protection of the Lord of the daybreak

2.translation_eng: from the evil of what He has created,

3.content: وَمِن شَرِّ غاسِقٍ إِذا وَقَبَ
3.translation_eng: and from the evil of the dark night when it settles,
3.transliteration: wa-min sharri ghāsiqin ʾidhā waqaba

4.content: وَمِن شَرِّ النَّفّاثاتِ فِي العُقَدِ
4.translation_eng: and from the evil of the witches who blow on knots,
4.transliteration: wa-min sharri n-naffāthāti fī l-ʿuqadi

5.content: وَمِن شَرِّ حاسِدٍ إِذا حَسَدَ
5.translation_eng: and from the evil of the envious one when he envies.’
5.transliteration: wa-min sharri ḥāsidin ʾidhā ḥasada

114.description: The surah that opens with the mention of God as the Lord of Humans and teaches one to seek refuge in Him from the whisperings of Satan and those of evil jinn and people. It takes its name from the word “people” or “mankind” (al-nās) which recurs throughout the surah. This is another surah commonly used as an invocation against evil.The surah is also known as: All People, Humankind, Mankind, People, The Men.

1.translation_eng: Say, ‘I seek the protection of the Lord of humans,

2.translation_eng: Sovereign of humans,

3.content: إِلٰهِ النّاسِ
3.translation_eng: God of humans,
3.transliteration: ʾilāhi n-nāsi

4.content: مِن شَرِّ الوَسواسِ الخَنّاسِ
4.translation_eng: from the evil of the sneaky tempter
4.transliteration: min sharri l-waswāsi l-khannāsi

5.content: الَّذي يُوَسوِسُ في صُدورِ النّاسِ
5.translation_eng: who puts temptations into the breasts of humans,
5.transliteration: alladhī yuwaswisu fī ṣudūri n-nāsi

6.content: مِنَ الجِنَّةِ وَالنّاسِ
6.translation_eng: from among the jinn and humans.’
6.transliteration: mina l-jinnati wa-n-nāsi
